review_body: Was to stay here from 2nd May til the 8th.That’s obviously didn’t happen.... nor has the refund that was promised on more than one occasion.Firstly on the 2nd April and again on 28th April as well as that stated on their website. As yet I’ve not received a reply to my latest email ( nothing new there)but was informed on 6th May that ‘ no transactions’ are taking place. I’ve asked for clarification of this and why, after a month of promises and procrastination, this is the situation I find myself in.I have had no reply and so... as you can imagine, I’m extremely upset and disappointed over my treatment.

I really can't say enough great things about AH. The location is wonderful being on the UWS, near the Natural History Museum and Central Park (plus you're away from the insanity of Times Square), with easy access on the 2/3. The staff is always friendly and helpful, such good value for the money.

Competitively priced (but you must account for "urban fee" added to room rate) and fantastic location for visiting the UWS. Room decor is metallic/wood minimalist which is nice if you don't like fustiness. One problem: no towel racks in the bathroom! Very pleasant ambience in common areas and live music on the weekends. Sorry I have less need to visit UWS these days.

We have stayed at the Arthouse Hotel on two previous visits and were looking forward to a graduation celebration stay in mid May. Our daughter's graduation was cancelled and the island of Kauai where we live has put in place a strict 14 day self quarantine for anyone, visitor or resident, flying in from anywhere. I am so impressed by the customer service I received from Maggie Zambrano, front office manager at Arthouse Hotel. After I reached out explaining our situation, she contacted me and offered me either a gift certificate or a full refund for two prepaid room reservations. This is a hotel who values their guests and trusts that good customer relations are what instill loyalty and the desire to return to this already fabulous hotel when we are next in NYC. Fabulous location close to Central Park and the subway stop and large rooms with wood floors and great views from the higher floors. We love the the rooms with outdoor decks that face the Hudson. Thank you, Arthouse Hotel! We will return someday.

We were supposed to stay at the Arthouse last week right when the Covid-19 craziness happened and had to cancel our trip at the last minute. They were amazing and super responsive, they called me back within the hour and ended up crediting the full amount of the reservation (that had been prepaid) once i could send proof of the canceled flights Because of how they handled this unprecedented issue, i will for sure stay here when we can finally take our trip. Unlike our hotel that we were supposed to stay at in Philly that was rude and unflexible.

Rooms and lobby were extremely comfortable and nicely laid out, the lobby especially with both conversation groupings and more private spaces. My only reservation was finding the lobby engaged in a private function one night so that it was not available to paying hotel guests.

We traveled to NYC for a family celebration. We selected this hotel because of the location. The service was great. The room was really clean and smelled like bleach which was a good thing because we were there in the midst of the coronavirus. The bed was a bit soft for our comfort. The decor was modern in the rooms, the metal cabinets for the storage bedside table kept opening.I could stay here again but only for the discounted rate.

This hotel You will love. The staff is very friendly, rooms are bigger than is normal in New York and Metro only two blocks away. The lobby bar is a laid back area and the neighborhood is upscale near Natural History Museum. The bed in the room is superthick and comfortable.Highly recommended!

I recently stayed at Arthouse (for the 4th time due to comfort, cleanliness, and location) in order to attend a teacher training at Columbia. The night before training started, we were informed that training was moving online due to COVID-19. I found a group of teachers at the hotel and informed the staff of our situation. Eduardo jumped into action and found us a spot to gather in the lobby. He graciously provided us with bottles of water, little gift boxes of chocolate, and continuous customer service throughout our 3 day stay. Having this level of service during a stressful time allowed the other teachers and I to relax and continue our learning and collaboration. Thank you Arthouse, and especially Eduardo, for your thoughtfulness during a stressful time.

Firstly I should say, this is an excellent hotel in a great location.But - and it's a huge "but" - they impose a $44 "resort tax" per night on departure. This is a disgraceful commercial practice designed to make the headline room rate look lower in price comparison websites. It's deception. I have seen the "excuses" given on other traveler reviews from the property but they don't wash. In my nice room, with a comfortable bed, the only "extras" I got was a Kuerig coffee machine (standard in all US hotel rooms) and two small bottles of low cost mineral water.When I challenged the charge on check out, the receptionist was downright rude. "Didn't you check this when you signed our conditions on check in". Well of course I didn't - who does? A page of small print after a transatlantic flight when I was dog-tired - no. And in any case, what are my options at that point? Reject it and don't get checked in.And to have it referred to as a "resort tax" is the final insult. Sandals and Disney run "resorts" - this is just a hotel, no more.Sort this out Arthouse - you're a good hotel, you can afford to raise your published prices by $40 and still win business.

Stayed in a room that was a "courtyard" which really meant it overlooked the HVAC. The fan in the room kicked on at night and woke me up every time and I am a very heavy sleeper. The room itself was fine big by NYC standards the bed was great but the HVAC....I turned the heat off bc I couldn't take it anymore!

My wife and I were looking for a hotel on upper west side where our son lives. We found this hotel and we will return. It is nice. Our very big room was really empty of furniture and that seemed quite odd. Just 1 comfortable chair. But a big empty floor space where a sofa would have been great.My wife checked and found that there are a few room with more furniture. Next time.

The staff is always welcoming and helpful. The hotel is centrally located on the west side. The rooms are functional and clean. There's always something lively going on in the lobby bar. There is a restaurant directly connected to the hotel with no need to go outside if the weather is bad.

We have booked a British Airways / Iberia package that "include" flight + hotel. When arriving at the hotel, we are told there is a mandatory urban fee of $39 + taxes per room per night!! Watch out for hidden ABUSIVE cost! This is over 50% of the hotel rate British Airways is paying per room!

Due to unexpected death and funeral, booked on Wednesday, but funeral plans changed, cancelled on Thursday. Left voicemail and email seeking waiver of cancellation fee. NEVER GOT A RESPONSE. Charged full rate.

I canceled my room and they said I would be refunded, and they never refunded my card. For that - I don’t recommend booking here. I called and spoke with customer service twice, both times, they said I would be refunded. I canceled two weeks in advance.

Room was tiny. Barely enough space to turn around. We were Charged $40 a day for an “urban fee”. Upon inquiry as to what it was for, clerk said all hotels charge it- seriously? An urban fee? Never again.

I booked the penthouse over 3 months in advance however the hotel called and indicated it was unavailable due to a HVAC issue. Though disappointed, they offered 50% off my rate, free breakfast and waived some fees in addition to a bottle of bubbly and late check out. Very good service and nice hotel in the Upper West Side. I still plan to stay in the penthouse on my next visit and will return in the summer.

Nice place but undisclosed urban fee makes it less of a deal than you think. The additional $39 you find out about upon check in (which by then what are you going to do?) is a shock. Two bottles of water and coffee (a $8 value) are covered by this fee as described in their bill. Still a good hotel but wish they were more honest about the price.

Second time staying here. Absolutely fantastic location, and the staff is incredibly helpful and pleasant.Happy with everything. The beds are to die for. Now I'm just filling space because this HAS TO BE at least 200 characters. Whew. I made it.

We stayed Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights, as the hotel is close to our grandchildren. We came back Saturday night an tried to have a drink in the bar and were told that it as being closed for "private function” and had to leave. When I took offense at the issue and said we were staying in the hotel and did not want to move I was told they would call security and remove us so we left. This is no way to treat a paying guest, just horrible and arrogant behavior so they can just make more money. If they want to have a private function they should have it in a private space and not in the public bar in the lobby, you all should find a better hotel than this one.

Felt at home the moment I walked into the lobby. Everyone was polite and helpful, but also in a casual (not snooty) way. bed was large and comfortable, larger than the last NY boutique hotel I stayed in. The elevators were fairly quite (another bonus). I did not try room service, but the bar was good.

Great time to travel to NYC and great prices on hotels! We always meet friends in the city for a couple of nights to enjoy museums and music and theater, and the Arthouse is in a perfect location for walking to venues or catching the 1 train.

This hotel was okay, it was beautiful from the outside and but was average on the inside. The staff was nice but they need to upgrade everything and add mini fridges and microwaves. Because of this it’s hard to save money on snacks. You can’t even refrigerate left overs or drinks.

I've stayed at Arthouse several times so its obviously a favorite of mine. To be fair I've never stayed in one of the smaller rooms, only the Junior suite with two queens to accommodate myself, husband and college age daughter so I don't know how the smaller rooms are. Its a fun and pleasing hotel to stay in. The piano bar is my favorite with great bar staff and in the mornings turns into a coffee house bakery. So perfect. Its very easy to hop on the red line from here, to take you downtown or up to Columbia. Its a very nice relatively quiet neighborhood with great restaurants and close to Central Park. Can't beat this hotel.

I'm writing this sat in the lobby/bar area which has a wonderful atmosphere. We didn't spend much time down here but the music sounded great.We requested a low level room as my Auntie who I am travelling erith can't use elevators. This wasn't a problem and we got a room on the second floor. The only downside to this was the noise of the street outside and obviously we could hear the music from the lobby bar at night. I just whacked on headphones and it was fine but be prepared if you wanted a lower level room that New York really is the city that never sleeps even in the quieter area of the upper west side.The actual room was lovely, spacious with plenty of storage. The coffee provided wasn't very nice but we grabbed some of our own from CVS across the street (very handy) and managed to trick the machine into just giving us hot water. The coffee tea and condiments were refreshed daily as we're the soaps and two bottles of water which were well received by us. The beds were huge we had a deluxe double double and the comfiest beds I've ever slept on which was great after long days exploring the city.The bathroom was a little unconventional with no storage or surfaces and the world's biggest yet shallowest sink but we got used to it. The shower was lovely and spacious. We did have some issues with plumbing when we arrived, we had no hot water and a blocked toilet but this was qui kly fixed with no fuss while we were out. The staff were all friendly and welcoming. Location for us was brilliant, The Upper West Side is alot quieter and you feel a lot less like a tourist. That said its miles away form the majority of attractions. We walked everywhere and generally had a 40 minute walk to anything. We were glad we didn't stay in Times Square far too busy for us!I could stop this review down to 4 stars and if I'd written this review at the start of our stay I probably would have but we quickly felt at home and any issues really were dealt with well. Other nit picky things were completely out of hotels control so 5 stars we'll deserved!Would definitely stay again and reccomend to others.

We used to stay in NYLO every time we came to visit our daughter in Upper west side. She had since moved. We recently came to upper west side again and decided to revisit the hotel, now called Art house. Nothing has changed but everything grew older and falling apart. Shower temperature adjustment are impossible and can burn you in 30 second. Door lock doesn't function and fire alarm sound early in the morning.

We visited the arthouse hotel over new year ! On arrival we were surprised to recieve a complimentary drink , a very nice touch especially with such a warm and welcoming lounge bar area! We loved loved loved the holiday movie theme! Our room was spacious with the most comfortable bed we have ever had the pleasure of sleeping in!Reception staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay but our favourite thing was the bar service , each night of our stay we stopped for a drink or two at the bar after a day of exploring the city , Chris was the friendliest bartender we have ever come across, he was always happy and nothing was too much for him. We enjoyed many a great conversation with him and he really made our stay !

Firstly, let me say how lovely the hotel is. It is recently refurbished, really quirky and the rooms are lovely. It’s in a really lovely part of town, only a couple of blocks away from NYC. The staff are really lovely too, and the cocktails are great (but quite pricey!). We had a really lovely stay over Valentines.My only issue here was communication. I booked via BA executive club, and booked a penthouse suite, but the room that was reserved for us was a king room. There were no penthouse suites left, and the manager Maggie dealt with the issue as best she could by offering me compensation which was much appreciated- she is a real asset to the hotel. I think the error was made by BA, not the hotel, however, this was frustrating as I had emailed a couple of times before staying and had no response. Also, I was unaware of the daily culture charge when I booked. This was wavered due to the room mix up but I would have been very angry to have had over 40 dollars charge each day added on top of what I’d already paid. All of this could be resolved by having better communication with third parties, so that there are no surprises!

Had such a wonderful stay here over valentine's weekend for our honeymoon. The staff were all very friendly and gave us vouchers for the most amazing freshly baked French/american pastries and coffee every morning. Our bed was so comfy, if it wasn't for the fact that we were so excited to see New York, I'm sure we would have stayed in bed all day. The bar/lobby area had a nice buzz to it, with live music most nights. I would definitely recommend this hotel for couples. Thank you for a wonderful stay, we will be back!

This hotel is outstanding—-front desk, housekeeping, bellmen—could not ask for friendlier or more professional staff. Have stayed here multiple times under old management and will continue to stay with the new!

I stayed at the Arthouse in the the fall for a business trip. (Writing this now bc I'm going back next week and realized that I never gave them their due.) All of the basics were there--super clean room, cute amenities, comfy bed--but even more important was how kind the staff was. Nothing forced. Just easygoing manners with obvious desires to help. It it definitely did not feel like a chain hotel. Plus the cafe in the lobby serves the most delicious chocolate-almond croissants. Yum!!

I stayed at this hotel for business and it was great. The room was large for a NYC hotel and the furnishings comfortable. The staff was amazing. I met the room maid Neri on my way to the elevator my first morning. she asked if I had a cold and I said my throat was just dry. I had a vaporizer and she left me extra water bottles to run the vaporizer. when she found out I drank decaf coffee and tea she left extra of those. The rest of the staff were just as friendly and helpful. I highly recommend the hotel. It is at 77th and Broadway. Easy walking distance to Zabars, the American Museum of Natural History, and the MTA.

Arthouse hotel is very well located. In addition to being close to two subway stations, the hotel is in a region that, in addition to having many options for restaurants and snacks, commerce, is quiet and reasonably quiet, by New York standards.The service is excellent. We register the receptionist Jessie, who treated us in an extremely friendly and competent manner. We will be back certainly.

Fantastic hotel located in the heart of the Upper West Side. Really good vibe, slightly hip. Definitely not your average chain hotel. Compact rooms but not terribly small. We got some very decent Winter rates, so good value

We used the Arthouse Hotel as our central location for visiting the 9/11 Memorial, going out to interesting dinners and seeing a play on Sunday. It was a truly comfortable, serene weekend. Our friends had been here before so we relied on their judgment. We enthusiastically agreed with their assessment!

We stayed 4 nights and enjoyed every moment. Room was big and very quiet (4th floor), though it was dark but not an issue as out all day. The beds are amazing, so comfortable.Bar and lounge area downstairs is inviting, live music most nights and lots of places to sit and enjoy your time. Close to metro and some good cafes nearby.We were concerned about hotel being pet friendly, but rooms were very clean and no evidence of pets. We only saw one small dog the whole time.Thanks for a great stay, we’ll be back!

The room was spacious, quiet and clean. The bed was very comfortable. Check in and out was a breeze. Although crowded the lobby was living room like, not at all a sterile hotel lobby. What made our experience exceptional was the kindness and friendliness of the staff whether it be in the lobby, the elevators or the hallways. The breakfast pastries, I understand a recent addition were superb!

The Arthouse has a cool vibe. The place has live music at nights. Place is clean; rooms comfortable and decent size. It will be my go to place in New York. The price is right too; definitely a terrific value.

Had a wonderful stay. My room was a deluxe double double. Clean, modern and near Levain Bakery and Natural History museum on New York's Upper West Side. Super convenient and easy to take the subway, walk or Uber. Great restos there as well.

We loved our stay at Arthouse. We would gladly trade Uber and cab fares to avoid the hustle and bustle of Midtown and the UWS is one of our favorite areas to stay. Small boutique hotel with kind staff, very comfortable rooms, and a bakery with delicious kosher pastries in the lobby.

I started coming here when it was On The Ave,It is very convenient to subways or taxis. near park.Great food nearby. Rooms are well kept & staff is great. Bar in lobby for convenience also serves coffee & baked goods in the morninga new plus.

Why am I giving this hotel 5 stars when I haven't crossed its threshold yet? I booked a reservation through a third party for this hotel for a visit to NYC next week, but I ran into a good deal of obfuscation around the total charges. I phoned the hotel reservation line and then the front desk seeking clarification. When that didn't produce an answer, although both people were very polite, I emailed the General Manager. I received a response a couple of days later that answered my questions and she apologized for the inconvenience. I think the hotel realizes that third party reservation companies tend to mislead customers and they obviously want to serve their guests better. Everyone makes mistakes, and problems arise, but it's the way someone or a company responds to that mistake or problem that is the measure of integrity. This hotel clearly has it in spades, and I can't wait to stay there next week.

I loved staying at the Arthouse hotel. The location is great, and I found that it was an overall great value. The staff was very attentive and the common areas were well maintained and felt like places you wanted to hang out at. Would highly recommend it!

My husband and I were extremely pleased with the service and cleanliness of the hotel. The location was perfect and we will absolutely be coming back very soon! I highly recommend staying at this hotel!

Friendly and helpful staff in this boutique hotel ... Warm atmosphere in the lobby where guests can work and socialize.Great cafe open from 7 a.m. Fabulous beds and excellent quality linens. Rooms werethe perfect temperature and I was happy to be able to open the window and let some fresh air in.

I had a great experience booking a room at the Arthouse Hotel New York City because of Rosa.She is extremely efficient, nice and helpful. I had a lot of questions, as one does when they want to make sure they have a nice hotel room and stay.It is because of staff like Rosa that makes booking hotel rooms a nice experience.Thank you!
user_name:
Candice2121
New York City, New York

review_body: My first stay at this hotel in early December was delightful. The rooms were extremely simple but perfect. The lobby, bar, and places to relax were beautiful. I was so happy during my first stay that I talked three friends into joining me for another stay at this hotel so that we could go to a show at the Triad Theater. Both times that I stayed, the people who stood out in service were the valets and the waitresses at the bar in the lobby. I wish that I could remember everyone's name. Last week our valet Orlando was exceptional for both arrival and departure. I asked him how he retrieved our car so quickly. He said he likes to anticipate the needs of the guests -- he was prepared!

Thank you for such a welcoming stay. The room was very cozy and it gave me a NY feeling. The food, the drinks, the room the ambiance of the hotel felt great! We will be back for sure the next time we are in NY.

Good location and friendly staff. The hotel is clean and has many amenities. It is located close to restaurants, movie theaters, the subway and buses. It is an easy walk to the Museum of Natural History and a bus ride through Central Park to the Met.

Great location, lots of good walking nearby. Love the hotel bar and food. On my third day there I realized the towels left for me were stained, that was unfortunate. Other than that, great stay and would stay again.

No room service, water was freezing in shower, kept having to call down to have someone fix it. My friend was staying in another room and his cell phone broke so he asked reception to call my room, they refused and would only leave me a message which I missed and therefore missed an important meeting. Demanded to take $50 per night deposit for my room for incidentals but couldn’t charge breakfast to my room as they said they weren’t part of the hotel and no room service anyway? If you want a late check out thags $50 too! Horrible

Arthouse was suggested hotel for wedding guests since it was convenient to church and Central Park reception venue. Room was small but adequate. Very quiet. Service at hotel desk, restaurant, and housekeeping were all excellent. Only downside was limited hot water in the shower.

This is a unique hotel in a great location but at my third stay of the year my initially advertised rate on Expedia of $129.99 finalized at $197.42 through taxes and an “Urban Fee” of $39 for a basket of miscellanies including internet, coffee maker, and cleaning. Make sure you ask what the real price is when you reserve.

This hotel was the Nylo. It is far better under new ownership. The interior has been refurbished and the staff is much more accommodating and friendly. The rooms are clean and well appointed. Great location if you want to be on the Upper West Side.

We've stayed at the Arthouse on many occasions in the last few years and they have never disappointed. The location is perfect for us. The rooms are clean and bright. The staff is always helpful and personable. The Arthouse is a great value!

Hotel was in a great location to museums, subways, restaurants. Great atmosphere. Able to get to a show. Staff friendly and helpful and Patis bakery was very nice and so convenient. Would recommend to family and they are also Dog friendly.

I came for a 3 day weekend with some friends. We struggled to find a centrally located hotel with reasonable prices but the Arthouse came through for us. It was easy to find and located near a subway stop. The staff was really nice and helpful. The bar in the lobby was very cute and had a great selection. The room itself was nice overall - I do wish the bed had been a bit cozier. Overall we had a great stay and we'll definitely be back!

The Arthouse hotel was a great property. I loved the rooms and the decor. The mattress was EXTREMELY comfortable. We had the loft with terrace and the room was very spacious for a NYC boutique hotel. I really enjoyed the lobby bar and the staff was friendly. Another bonus, Serafina does room service. It was a great experience. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quiet weekend on the upper west side.

I really enjoyed the atmosphere and experience of this hotel. Comfortable room and great location. Just a few blocks from central park and the Met. adjoining restaurant as well as bar/coffee car. Will definitely stay here again.

Everything was very nice at the Arthouse, just need to have more hot water. Stayed at the Arthouse for a wedding, staff were friendly and helpful, bar and lounge were nice, just sad to have to take a shower with barely lukewarm water.

My husband and I went to NY for a concert at the Beacon theatre! Art house hotel has a great video be, location can’t be beat and friendly staff! The room was a corner room with a Broadway view! Comfortable bed and very clean! This is our new go to hotel!

We totally enjoyed our stay at the Arthouse Hotel. It is super-convenient for a visit to the Natural History Museum. We also rented a car for a trip north of NYC and there are several rental car places very close to the hotel. Highly recommend!!

I stayed at this hotel this past weekend. I stayed in the terrace suite. The room was beautiful, large and clean. Every single staff member we came into contact with was friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will be returning soon:)

Highly recommended, great vibe, great staff, beautiful rooms. amazing value for money! spent 2 nights, great live music, great company will definitely return, close to subway and other transport, great neighborhood

This boutique hotel has everything- cozy, great live music nightly, short walk to the subway and central park as well as Natural Museum of History. Great restaurants nearby too. Beds are the most comfortable I have ever had- and it is SO quiet. Nice oasis!

A great deal on the Upper West Side of NYC -- close to Central Park, upper Broadway, and of course Central Park. Rooms aren't huge but well laid out, great beds, functional desk, and nice bathrooms with good accessories. All-wood floors make it feel very Nordic; some people might not like that.
user_name:
Ann S
New York City, New York

review_body: I continue to book my stays at the Arthouse Hotel because of their ongoing willingness to make my stays comfortable and accommodating my needs. I love the neighborhood location and feel safe at all times.

Lovely hotel. Ideal for our purposes. Lovely welcome. Helpful friendly staff from start to finish. Clean well appointed room very comfortable bed! Quiet overnight.... always a plus! Lovely lounge and bar area for a coffee or drink and live music(singer) with piano in the evening. Patis breakfast in bar area (pastry and coffee) great start to day.... lovely staff. Very handy situation for getting about.... easy walk to Central Park and subway for going further up or downtown. Would highly recommend.

We loved the retro/metro sleek design of the room with the basic style cabinets and stainless steel sink. It was all we needed for our NYC getaway. We took a subway from Grand Central and it was a quick walk to the hotel.

Excellent property. Location is very convenient and close to subway stop, market, and restaurants. Serafina restaurant is great. Pastry and coffee downstairs is wonderful. Lobby is very warm and inviting.

These guys extened the best hospitality I have ever enjoyed at a hotel. The heater was not working the first night so the next night they removed my urban fee from my bill and the called 3 times throughout the day to ensure we were comfortable and offered to send us up wine for an issue that any other hotel would probably look right past after the first complaint.Very satisfied.Also thanks Eduardo at the Bell Stand!

Great location, great staff. Urban fee suxsHate the daily fee ... a suprise as I checked out. WIll never use Groupon againThis is not the way to suprise guests. Just give the room price and include all fees

Left a lot to be desired. The hot water didn’t get hot, the TV didn’t get reception and the hotel employees I spoke to on the phone didn’t give a F when it came to hospitality. Full disclosure, the hotel sent a bottle of wine to make it right, which was nice.

Love the staff!! Clean rooms, they always know my name. Asking for a fridge is a good idea, a microwave would be nice. Comfortable bedding, always enjoy my stay always come back!! Close to central park and zabars!!

I wrote to the hotel earlier saying I would be arriving late (in reply to a promotional email where they tried to upsell to a larger room.) I arrived late and got provbably the worst room in the hotel, facing the street on the second floor, above the restaurant. The room was really noisy, and I couldn't sleep. I asked to change the next day and the staff were very friendly and helpful. I got a room on a higher floor that was better situated but hadn't been updated in a while. The floor had paint stains and it was just tired looking and had no view (I could partially see a redbrick wall across). A large portion of the window (and natural light) was blocked by a large TV placed in the sill and the bed was very high. I was warned it was a disabled friendly room so the bathroom was larger than usual but the fittings were not great. My colleagues and friends who were in the same hotel and had booked the same category of rooms under the same promotion had both much nicer rooms, probably because they got there earlier. I stayed for 7 nights and didn't feel I could ask for a third room change so I just spent as little time in the room as possible.

Just before Christmas we stayed for 4 nights and had a wonderful time. The staff were helpful and the location perfect for what we wanted. The atmosphere was lovely. We've already recommended it to others.

Nice looking hotel, swanky. However, the female at check-in wasn't all that friendly, nor was the bartender and it took a long time to get a drink. When we asked for extra pillows, it seemed like it was a problem. Also, there is no room service. The person who handled out luggage was very polite.

Great hotel! Have stayed here more than once and it does not disappoint ! Smooth check ins and out.. clean rooms.. beautifully decorated especially around the holidays . Serafina’s is incredible to dine at.. highly recommend!

Everything went smooth, check-in and check out was easy, room was great with all the amenities you’d expect. Comfortable and clean bed. Great location with convenient car and bar downstairs. Would definitely recommend and stay here again.

Best beds. Best neighborhood. Zabars! Excellent lobby ( don't laugh...I promise you'll spend time there) with very cool bar. I always enjoy my stay here. If you can, spring for the big room with terrace. It's a wonderful space!

Accommodations, location and staff are excellent. Joanne of management was most accommodating even when I had a special request where timing was of the essence. I was extremely pleased with what she accomplished in a short time. Thank you

They made my day. I left a pair of leather gloves in the car to the airport. They were particularly special because they were a gift from my son when he did a semester abroad. Fortunately, I had gone to the airport in the car that Orlando got for me. (It was only $1 more than an Uber and it was there). I was sickened to find that I had lost my gloves. After the self deprecation passed, I called the hotel. Sparing you all the back and forth that had to ensue, I will be getting my gloves back! Shout out to Lisa Ann, Orlando, Gustavo and the other staff at the Arthouse! Additionally, I had a fabulous well lit room. The bar is cozy and welcoming. Fun neighborhood. I had been there before but had not stayed at the hotel. I will make it my go to now...

The rooms are clean and have the basics. The staff is super friendly. If you can get a street or avenue facing room that’s best! The lounge is a great place to hang out. I’ve come back to stay many times! Don’t forget to tip the cleaning staff, and also the bartender for your free drink!

The staff, and overall experience provided at ArtHouse is fantastic. Sincere, clean, convenient, and a wonderful experience. The beds are very comfortable and the lounge area provides a tranquil spot to visit with friends while enjoying a nice cocktail.

The Arthouse is a fantastic boutique hotel on the upper west side. Everyone is treated like “family.” Staff is beyond excellent. Rooms are clean and efficient and very nice for a stay in NYC where one does not generally spend much time in the room. Beds are extremely comfortable for a great night’s sleep. The staff is one of the best group of hotel employees we have ever been around. They call you by name and treat you more ch better than just another hotel guest. The hotel bar is fantastic with friendly bartenders. Also Patis, a coffee/ pastry shop in the hotel bar area in the mornings and early afternoon cannot be beat and is extremely convenient. The hotel is convenient to museums, restaurants, the subway and Central Park! It is the one and only place we will stay in NYC! We highly recommend it!!

It’s pretty great and if you secure a deal on price (I managed to get a Black Friday deal) it’ll be as cheap as some of the more rugged hotels in the area. I’ve stayed all over Manhattan and this is one of the best places I’ve enjoyed.

No room service or fridge in room. Poor customer service. Would not recommend. Lobby is cute, but room is lacking. Bathroom seems like a jail cell with the stainless steel sink. There is a button on the phone for the Serafina restaurant, but they do not have room service. Pointless. If you want a hotel that has proper service for guests go elsewhere.
user_name:
CakeFeTish
New York City, New York

review_body: Well appointed, comfortable rooms with an attentive and friendly staff, this is one of our favorite uptown hotels in NYC. The lobby is beautiful as is the bar and the live entertainment adds an element of class to the entire experience. A great place to stay.
user_name:
Steve C
Sayville, New York, United States

review_body: Loved this hotel. Stayed for first time and were lucky to have a perfect weather weekend in January. The rooms are a decent size for NYC, The decor is simple, rooms are very clean and the beds are extremely comfortable, with great bed linens. Lobby bar is fun, with some happy hour drink specials (and welcome drink). Surrounding area has nice shopping, good restaurants, and hotel is located just a few blocks from the Beacon Theater, the reason for our visit. Pleasant, helpful and courteous staff, from front desk to housekeeping. A really nice experience.

Great stay! The room was clean and comfortable. The management is extremely responsive. I particularly like the comfort and atmosphere of the lobby. I will definitely be back when I come to NYC for the next business meeting!

Back to NYC, this time finding a new "go-to" Hotel Upper West Side. (Last experience at Hudson so disaappointed).Thrilled to experience this hotel. Wonderfully friendly staff, awesome lobby bar, Rooms are so satisfying. Location - food, entertainment, great neighborhood. A Terrific Value, i look forward to my next visit.

We were recommended to this hotel as we were attending a show at The Beacon Theatre. Location was excellent with it being a short walk to theatre. Wonderful lobby with entertainment at night and coffe shop for breakfast.

We stayed as family for New Year's Eve and it was a memorable week. The hotel location is very good, on Broadway, near 2 metro stations either on 72nd or 79th street. The rooms are acceptable in size and beds were comfortable. Cleaning should be improved, particularly in the bathroom where the side of the wash-basin was not clean. Staff was absolutely friendly and helpful and exceeded our expectations. as examples, we forgot our slippers and got a pair of them in 10 minutes. One day my daughter had a problem with the vending machine but she immediately got a free soda as compensation from the receptionist (and of curse she was surprised and happy!). Breakfast was acceptable in the small bar "Pastis", even though selections are limited. On a negative note, we were not informed that Pastis is closed on Saturdays, but once again the staff corrected the small mistake by offering an upgrade in the "Serafina" restaurant, which was actually delicious!So overall we will remember our stay in NYC for a long time and will consider Arthouse Hotel again in future. And warm thanks to the Reception staff!

We stayed at this property years ago and it is even better than we remember. The lobby is updated and welcoming. The coffee and pastries in the morning were excellent. The location is great with many great dining and shopping options, as well as convenient subway locations! The Natural History Museum is within walking!

This is a great little hotel in a great neighborhood on the upper west side...nice rooms and super comfortable bed. Nice little lobby bar and great restaurants and bars nearby. Would definitely come back and stay here again.

The customer service at this hotel is simply exceptional, and George the bellman is a perfect example. After bringing our belongings to our small, original room, he said, " this is not going to work from you," and promptly went down to the front desk and changed our room to a much larger one (at not additional cost). The front desk also kept in touch with us by text message asking if there was anything they could do to make our stay better. I could go on and on bust all I can say is SIMPLY EXCEPTIONAL. We will be back as we travel here often. Thank you!

wanted to love... but just a few tipsour room was really spacious bath too. please bigger towels and a soap dish.the locker style dresser and side tables are a nuisance. please dresser with drawers so much better.

The doorman, Orlando, saw our excitement and made sure he contributed to making our stay at Arthouse 10x’s better. He remembered our faces and had a very warm aura about him. When we returned from a broadway show, we were surprised to see a bottle of wine and two wine glasses from Orlando. The lady at the front desk was also pleasant and very inviting. We had an awesome experience at Arthouse! If you have the chance to stay here, you won’t regret it!

We’ve stayed many places and live in New York. This is a great location, dog friendly hotel with a really nice bartender named Steve and great wine list. We win this room for a donation to the New York yankees foundation. We come back to our room after dinner to discover a smoke smell. Clearly someone was smoking in our room while we were out. We don’t smoke. Call the front desk. They say they will send someone up. No one comes for a half hour. We call again. Someone comes and says well there is something. It’s probably just coming through your vent (it’s coming from the bathroom not the vent in the bedroom. ) so nothing is done. Don’t come here if you have asthma. They clearly don’t care as nothing was done. Wouldn’t recommend to a non smoker. Too bad.
user_name:
RebekahS28
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel was in the right location for us and the price was great, although the urdan fee of 39.00 per night was a surprise. The lobby was great to meet people and do some work. We had an issue with our room and the front desk wasn't too helpful. They were suppose to move us but couldn't get us a room till late in the day which we couldn't stay around till then. The next day they moved us at 5pm.... We then needed to add two nights and the front desk told us to do it online and we would just stay in our room. We did that and when we told the front desk they said we were going to have to move - we waited 20 minutes for a manager who then figured out a way to keep us in our room. Lots of aggravation.

Enjoyed our stay at the ArtHouse. Rooms are small, but that’s NY! But really plenty of room for the two of us. Loved the “living room” feel of the lobby. Bar did not have a great assortment but was ok.

First time in the city. Room was clean and comfortable. Taxes & service charges were a little excessive. I got to see what we were there for and enjoyed the experience. Breakfast in the restaurant could have been better.

This hotel is just perfect with clean, well-appointed rooms, pleasant staff, tasty complimentary breakfast and terrific neighborhood. We had a splendid trip and Arthouse Hotel made NYC even more special than ever.

My father lives in Manhattan. We live in Maryland. We visit him frequently and need a place to stay. We have stayed in several hotels in the area. We have found that this is the best choice for the value. Newer building, great décor, modern accessories, great location, great service. It has become our go to spot. So glad to have found this gem!

Very beautiful hotel with a wonderful, patient and courteous staff. The rooms are fabulous! Very clean and quite roomy, especially for NYC. The beds were extremely comfortable, but in their handicapped rooms, the beds need to be lower .
user_location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
user_name:
Duane M
Washington, District of Columbia, United States

review_body: We spent three night at the Arthouse. Great room, clean and comfortable bed. Quiet for a NYC hotel. Great staff. TV reception was sketchy at times but not a big deal for us. Convenient to two subway stations.

We were in NYC for New Year's week. The hotel was convenient if you want to stay near central park. A bit expensive over New Year's Eve, but nice enough. Was a bit apprehensive to stay in a place that allowed dogs, but the hotel was clean and tidy. The beds were comfortable. Bathroom and shower are small but adequate.

We had a week-long stay. Plus side: very comfortable bed, impeccably clean place, quiet upstairs, common rooms to read in or meet friends downstairs, friendly staff. On the minus side: we had a room with (technically) a beautiful view of the Upper West Side that we couldn't appreciate -- the blinds (actually window warmers) didn't work -- they were either warped or simply did not function. Eventually, we were given another room but then there wasn't adequate lighting -- no lights above the bed or over the armchair. I hope the hotel fixes these things, which would make for an even better time.

A few days after checking out, I realized that I accidentally left an envelope with some cash in the room. I though it might have been gone by now, but surprised to find it out that they had it!!! Amazing security!

Excellent hotel with great atmosphere. Amazing bar in the evening with tasty happy hour and brilliant Cafe in the morning with awesome pastries and coffee. Wonderful and friendly people. Great place to stay in New York.

Very cozy, artsie and in good area. The staff was very nice e and helpful.Do a weekend getaway and stay here for a reasonable price . I was surprised you could get a room this good on a big holiday weekend.

very clean nice hotel, conveniently located near Central Park, broadway, museums. Excellent coffee shop in lobby, and occasional entertainment in lobby area in the evening. Friendly staff and an excellent restaurant in the hotel.

We stayed at the Arthouse between Christmas and New Year, staff were great and checked in on us regularly to see if they could help, location perfect for central park, the history museum and subway just a couple of blocks away, would happily recommend.

Just come back after staying for New Year 2019.The hotel is nice, well appointed and has a cool atmosphere. The reception, bar area is chic and has a good selection of (overpriced) drinks in the bar. A draft beer costs around $8-9 (£6 for about 3/4 pint) Wine by the glass is more.Rooms are good for the advertised rate and some have spectacular views across the city. It’s Easy to access as it’s a relatively short walk north up broadway from 72nd on the red line. So all is going well..so far and 2 days in and we are thinking this is all very nice and we’re enjoying our stay, then day 3, some things go missing from our room. We reported it to the reception, to Charlie who is billed as Head of Security, who suggested they would open a report on it and investigate.After chasing an answer down we were told the items in question weren’t in our room and they had done as much as was possible. So we told them that the items had be taken from the room, one could deduce therefore they wouldn’t be in the room on investigation. No further action was forthcoming despite asking three different staff...some of who should not be in customer service at all. We brits can be a bit funny admittedly, but at least we know how to be polite. Perhaps a bit of training is in order?Our stay was going downhill fast, with some of the items having significant personal value and they were not on display either.Finally, to add insult to injury, on departure, a wonderful $450 worth of Urban Tax slapped onto our bill. This ‘made up’ tax is causing havoc across the cities hotels apparently, as it’s basically money for old rope. We were told this tax pays for the hotel amenities including the WiFi! We paid it, gritted our teeth and left New York with a really bitter taste after having such a lovely time. Hotel manager said she would address our issues but that’s a load of nonsense. Almost 48hours later and we are now a distant memory for the hotel staff. Be very aware of some of these issues when booking. Your room rate is not the final rate you will pay! Your belongings may not be secure so make sure they are locked up if you leave them in your room.

We do not think we can stay anywhere else after 2 leisure/personal stays at The Arthouse Hotel. Cannot write anything negative because the staff and accommodations are everything we could hope for at an affordable rate that meets our budget. Love ❤️

The Room WasToo Small for the price , N0 Tub, 2 foot Square foot STANDING ROOM, room for one person only. elevators not working properly, long wait time for service in Serifina restaurant, unknowledgable and argumentative front desk staff, manager only accessible Thru Text Message, no-one Addressed Our DIiscomforts. Will not return to hotel.

Stayed for 7 nights over Christmas. Accommodated our requirements without issue. Helped with travel needs esp early time departure on final day. Fun bar and lobby area.Room ok, very comfortable king bed. Be no vet to have drawed rather than doored bedside storage. Would recommend to like-minded friends!

The is more of a boutique hotel, not your regular high st chain hotel,cant fault the staff, but rooms very small, cramped, hot. quirky vibe in the bar. not really for families with young children. the location is very good, in the heart of upper west side.

This is a review of the hotel's IT and customer service. I tried to book a night's stay for a family member and never got a confirmation email or initial credit card charge. I assumed the transaction didn't go through, so booked elsewhere. A few days later, I got an email asking me to review the hotel, and it looks like I got charged despite never having gotten confirmation or checking in. I have yet to receive word on a refund despite having emailed and called.

Great hotel, staff were so friendly and helpful. The restaurant was lovely and the bar cosy and welcoming with a pianist most evenings. Really easy to get around and a short walk to central park. Highly recommend

I highly recommend the Art House for its charm and value. The rooms are very comfortable and the location is convenient to subways, shops and restaurants. We enjoyed the lounge after dinner and the coffee and pastries in the morning.
user_name:
Karen C
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel was booked by my travel planner, not wanting the typical package holiday with a standard hotel he found us this modern and edgy hotel that gave this a thumbs up from me! After reading reviews it looked great, it was clean, modern and close to a subway! Simple and effective! Upon arrival we were greeted by wonderful staff members who were kind and polite and couldn’t do enough for us! This continued throughout the whole week we stayed there and every member of staff were a dream! We encountered a few problems (through no fault of the hotel) such as the alarm battery running low and the safe battery being low and the staff were so quick to sort these out for us within 5 minutes they came to our room and sorted out the problems! We were so grateful! The rooms were clean and tidy and kept to a high standard! The towels were replaced every day and I was very impressed with the room! There wasn’t much of a view out the window however this did not matter at all as we didn’t book the hotel to spend all our time in and a view was not a priority. There was lots of space in the room and bathroom and the beds were large and comfy! I cannot pick fault with the room at all! The bar downstairs had a great vibe every night with amazing bar staff who knew the ins and outs of every cocktail and were able to make me a bespoke cocktail based on drinks I enjoy - it was amazing! The bar had different entertainment on some nights such as an open mic night and a comedy night! Great vibes throughout! The restaurant next door (although we didn’t try) you could order a take out pizza and then eat it in the bar of the hotel! Overall an amazing stay in this hotel and when I return to New York I will be using this hotel again as it was a 10/10 experience! Great service and fantastic staff! Thank you for a lovely stay!

Stayed at Arthouse Hotel over the Christmas period for a very special birthday treat with my husband. Loved the style and quirky-ness of the hotel, bar and rooms - everything you needed for a stay in the big apple. The reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is due to the lack of knowledge the staff had about their restaurants and bakery. I emailed the hotel before our visit for some help booking a table for Christmas dinner and never got a response. In some cases we were given incorrect to formation which was frustrating. The bar is expensive outside of happy hour (3-7pm) and it was a nice place to hang out.

We were taken by the comfort of the lobby and the great live piano and upright bass combo that was entertaining everyone. The staff was super and very proactive with our every need. We had a great room on the 14th floor that had a big balcony. Where in NYC can you get a balcony? The decor in the room was artsy and funky and the bed was amazing. Make sure you save some relaxation time to hang out in the lobby when you visit. We will definately be back the next time we stay in New York!

I’ve stayed her on numerous occasions and for the money it can’t be beat. I ask for an upgrade when I check in because we like to be on the broadway side.The rooms are funky, not my fav decor by any means, but It’s not my house so who cares. They have a gym and roof terraces. Front desk staff are efficient but boring- not exactly piles of smiles or chatty. Very accommodating behind the scenes. Free drinks upon check in at the sunken lounge. Again boring staff, but I guess they get the job done. They seem asleep and non plussed. Room service is very fast. Rooms are clean, beds are pretty comfortable but the pillows suck ( but I bring my own anyway - always no matter where I stay ). It’s a very relaxed chill place and that’s why I return. Pets are allowed and it’s also so nice to see them hanging out there. I walk to get Starbucks in the morning. They area two minute walk away and they open at 5am. Lots of restaurants, The Beacon, and The Natural History Museum.

The only negative about thus hotel is the small size of the rooms. Bedding and bathroom are great. Hotel is well maintained and well managed, and the connecting restaurant offers good value. This is a return visit and I would stay again.

When we're in NYC, instead of staying downtown, with all the noise and tourists, we always stay at Arthouse. It's near the subway, buses, supermarkets, stores, and other useful places. The staff is very helpful, the hotel lobby is people-friendly, and the rooms are super clean and well appointed. Not a fancy place, but a down-to-earth, semi-upscale hotel.
user_name:
mendelsohn
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The Arthouse Hotel is in a great location on the Upper West Side. We have stayed here a few times. Staff is friendly and helpful. Room is decorated like a loft in the city. This time we did not have a view and couldn't change rooms - disappointing. But we will come again as we always enjoy.
user_name:
Barbara I
Fair Lawn, United States

review_body: If you are interested in great view discuss it with the hotel as some rooms are facing back of other building.Take advantage of the life music in the lobby. Amazing experience at an affordable price. I am very particular about my mattress and it was unbelievably comfortable. Small convenience store located right over the street.

Great location on the Westside. The hotel is on a side street although it says its on Broadway. Nice place! Conveniently located in a real neighborhood. The hotel was buzzing in a good way. Close to the Beacon Theatre.

Correct but a little overpriced, not really a art style as drawing are fake ones and the same in all rooms. Standard decoration. Issues with curtains not managed in time. I had to come 3 times at the guests office to got a solution...

we stayed in this area because we were going to a concert at Beacon Theater. We looked at several options but ended up at Arthouse. We were really happy with the vibe of the hotel, the entertainment in the lobby, bar scene and service! We would recommend this hotel to all our friends!

Room felt “cold” and uninviting. The sink area in the bathroom was so tiny, I had nowhere to put my toiletries. The room felt like it wasn’t thoroughly cleaned. Really dislike the dimly lit hallways. Not my choice of place to stay, but good location.

Lobby and front desk was nice. Delicious bakery in lobby for breakfast. Bathroom was not clean, unable to shower. Overall was a mediocre hotel stay. Not sure I would recommend, although many of my friends have had a great experience. Maybe it was a fluke.

We stayed at the ArtHouse Hotel on December 19th. The kind person checking us in (Ramona) was able to upgrade us to a larger room. If it hadn't been the coldest day of the year, we could have enjoyed going out on the terrace - oh well! The room was clean, bed was comfortable and the shower great. The location was convenient to go both uptown or downtown. And the parking was only $25 for 24 hours with a special valet parking offer. We were totally pleased!

The rooms are comfortable but minuscule; they are overpriced ridiculously, but this is so for most NY hotels; the breakfast is a joke - one piece of pastry and a coffee in a paper cup; the bed is far too soft - make sure not to drown

This was my first visit to the Arthouse, a welcome upbeat change from other boutique hotels on the Upper West Side. While the rooms are minimally appointed (with the basics), the lobby is warm and welcoming with a lobby bar that doubles as a morning pastry and coffee shop and lots of spaces to spread out and work or socialize. The evening I was there the piano was decorated and a jazz band had the place swinging with guests and locals.

Very nice boutique hotel, cozy bar, clean and neat rooms. Excellent location for the Beacon Theater and museums. Very nice staff. Overall nice experience, would come back. Furnishings were sparse and looked like kindergarten lockers but it was cute and clean. Had robes and slippers. Nothing extravagant but the staff was lovely and we enjoyed our short stay.
user_name:
Liana C
Far Hills, New Jersey

review_body: I love the location of this hotel. I like the vibe of it. The staff is friendly and helpful. But, watch out for the bartenders who don't give you back correct change. If it happens once it's an accident. If it keeps happening, it's a plan. I mentioned it to the manager on duty, and later in an email to the GM, whom I have yet to hear from.

Talk about Location Location Location... 77th & Broadway is the Upper West Side which is a very homey local neighborhood. You have a million places you can walk to including shops and restaurants. You are also 1.5 short blocks from a local 1 train and 4 short blocks from a 2/3 express train. On the express trains in under 3 minutes (yes three) you can be in the middle of Times Square.  The hotel is constantly being updated (but you will never see or hear any construction) and it feels like your living in NYC when you are there. We have stayed about 100 nights over the years at this hotel and its our home when in NYC. The staff is amazing to say the least and the hotel has some great roomy rooms. The lobby always has something going on (live music or a theme for the season) and its just a place you want to be. There are also a few great restaurants within the hotel. If you want a local and real non touristy NYC experience but can be in the middle of it all in just a few minutes this is HANDS DOWN YOUR HOTEL!

Great feel upon entering the lobby, friendly and efficient staff. Perfect location, easy access to subway and buses, and surrounded by great restaurants and cafes. Walking distance to Natural History Museum, the NY Historical Museum and Lincoln Center.

Really enjoyed our stay at the Art House. The room was very comfortable, the location was great, the price was terrific and the lobby scene has a very cool vibe.Would recommend this highly to anyone visiting the city.

I have a reservation set at the Arthouse Hotel this week that I've been looking forward to for over a month. Unfortunately, my husband needs an emergency endoscopy on the same day we made the reservation. I was shocked to find out the Arthouse Hotel wanted to charge me $250 (about the same price I paid for the room in the first place) to modify my reservation for a different night at the same or less value. I know similar hotels in the area are able to accommodate such requests. I'm disappointed and genuinely surprised they couldn't understand and allow me to move my reservation to another day. Still a beautiful hotel.

The rooms were similar to other hotels that cater to 20-30 year old travelers. Loud bar in the evenings that is in a smaller lobby, Can't carry on a conversation in the lobby anytime after 7pm. The room was younger feeling also, with no drawers, some cubby holes in the closet and some covered cubbies in the main part of the room. The doors on the cubbies were metal, with ventilation slots that reminded me of High School lockers, in bright colors. The closet is open to the entry hall, without doors.That is the look, and I'm not being critical of the look, but it's not our style.

Have stayed at this hotel many times. It is always good overall. Nice breakfast cafe at lobby bar which is also a good meeting place. Staff at desk are not the friendliest but generally responsive. Hotel hallways need work.

Fourth time staying at the Arthouse Hotel. The staff is attentive, the rooms are clean and modern - very spacious, especially by New York standards. The location is extremely convenient. I will definitely be back.

Out of the way location for theater and museums. Close to neighborhood shopping and casual restaurants. Good vibe in the lobby, nice staff. Very slow elevators, plain room, great mattress and shower. HVAC was fine.

Even though we requested an early arrival and there was "no problem" response, our room was not ready and offered upgrade "suite." The hotel was very dark, the room's two windows looked into a building, the desk light did not work (but on the "bright" side, engineer was summoned and it was fixed by the time we returned from dinner). The TV did not work but again, response was quick and apparently the cleaning people tripped the wires, needed reconnect. The beds were absolutely wonderful and the doorman was wonderful. Staff very friendly.

Great location. Wonderful hotel. Awesome amenities. Staff were very professional. We’ll be back!Loved the lobby area, bar, music & next door restaurant Easy access with great surrounding retail. Thank you!

They need 200 characters so here I go. Overpriced Overpriced Overpriced Overpriced Overpriced Overpriced Overpriced Overpriced Overpriced and the rooms are no frills and mediocre furniture. Truly unimpressed and when you add in the NYC gauging for the holidays, this place was highway robbery. Oh did I mention it was overpriced?

Great location, upper west side. Fun vibe in the lobby for coffee/drinks. Near Central Park and easy to get to the subway. Perfect for solos, couples and families. Overall great hotel! There are many restaurants very close.

We came in for our daughter’s birthday and was looking for a fun nicely appointed hotel.The Art House really covered all the bases...Hotel staff were wonderful and very accommodating.The rooms were reasonable and very clean and nicely decorated.The lobby was wonderful with a pastry, coffee and lunch options during the day. At night this turns into a very nice bar service with live music some nights.So if want a fun environment this is your place!!!We really enjoyed our stay!!!

I wish I had been told that a superior king room means a dark airless room facing an air shaft - if I knew there was a chance of getting a room like this I would never have booked. That should be made clear in the description. I called ahead and asked for a light upper floor. When we arrived yesterday we were given the darkest room I’d ever stayed in on the fifth floor. We were told the hotel is fully booked and all king superior rooms are as awful as this. But yesterday the person at the front desk did say we should be able to change rooms today. When I asked this morning the person at the front desk said no - we can’t change. This is it. She said all the ‘superior’ rooms are like this in this hotel. Our room is truly a tomb. A cave. A dungeon. You can’t tell what time of day it is outside - it’s always dark. View of a wall and some windows. The bed is okay. The room is clean. Only one chair. I will never stay here again. Too much money to pay for a room this awful - plus the ridiculous resort fee. This is a great location - I used to live two blocks away- but there are better options in the neighborhood.

Room was clean and very comfortable by NYC standards. Service and staff was great, Staff was very accommodating. Ambiance was welcoming and warm. Would definitely recommend and do a return trip to the arthouse!!

beds too high. safe too low. needs 1 more chair to sit in, for a guest or to get dressed. we were told about these problems so i brought very little money and no jewlery. and a stepstole that i used everytime.

A great find! Good upper west side location, convenient to Beacon Theater and Lincoln Center, nice rooms, excellent staff, and reasonable rates for Manhattan. A good Italian restaurant in the same building.

I stayed at this hotel 9 years ago for work and was back in NY this time with my family. This was our 4th hotel for our stay in New York and was the best of them all. It hasn’t changed too much in the 9 years, except the name (used to be On the Ave) and they’ve tastefully renovated the lobby and the room interiors. (I guess that is quite a change, but just saying it was always lovely).All very classic and in keeping with the Upper West Side location. It’s the sort of place that attracts a well healed set (we spotted a movie star) and why wouldn’t it. It’s a great location, not too busy, really interesting places to visit, close to Central Park, the Subway, Beacon Theatre, etc.We loved staying there, it’s pricey, so check out the deals before you book in. But putting cost to one side, when we make it over to NYC from Melbourne next time, we’d return without hesitation. It just puts the icing on the whole NY experience.

Typical of NYC hotels, this hotel is expensive. But that's ok because it is NYC. What is not ok is for brownish water to come out of the tap on the day we were checking out. We informed the hotel and was told by a staff at the front desk that there was "an emergency" and to just let the tap run for a few minutes and it would be alright. We let it run for more than 10 minutes and the water was still brownish. Because of that, we decided not to shower before we checked out. How could something as basic as clear (visually clean that is) water not be provided by a hotel that charges USD400 per night? This is unfathomable.

Great choice on the UWS. We really like the bar, which has live music on weekends. Room decor is minimalist industrial chic (no towel racks or makeup mirror). Price is competitive but there’s a hefty "urban fee" for internet and water.

This is a fun and easy place to stay. Nothing over complicated in decor or details. The hotel is convienienly located near the Subway and there are plenty of things to do in the area at night, as well as places to eat. The staff is pleasant, it's clean, and feels comfortable- like you're staying with friends.

Stayed at this lovely hotel 27th November for four nights, absolutely beautiful hotel, really comfy beds, really good shower. Extremely clean and cosy room. Staff were very good, it was my husbands 50th birthday and the staff kindly decorated our room with banners and balloons whilst we were out so lovely surprise to return to! Would definitely stay again, perfect location, thanks Arthouse for a lovely stay .

We enjoyed our corner junior suite on the 15th floor, very spacious and windows all around to see the beautiful views from our room. The balcony was an extra delight, drinking my morning coffee overlooking the Hudson River. I love love the parquet floors, tile in the bathroom and the shower was great. Our king bed was very comfy.

Convenient location on the upper west side. Great lounge and piano bar, but I was billed 3x for my stay and still working to get credit applied. You need to review your folio at checkout and them watch your credit card for extra or duplicate charges.

It is convenient. Easy to be there. Uncomplicated. Very Nice staff. Just a good experience. Not fancy...but .....really pleasing. One observation.....elevators are a bit slow......but really....does it matter?

I always stayed at the hotel under the past ownership. It is as bright, chic, clean, and fun.I was told I got a “quiet” room. I looked at a brick wall. The thermostat didn’t work, half of the lights were out, and well, not much else worked.The decor and hallways are depressing. Fake wallpaper to make it look like exposed brick?Sad that this hotel has changed.

I have stayed at Arthouse many times and will be back again. Accommodations are modern, clean, and spare, and the lobby is warm and intimate. Amenities are basic but always well done. Love this place.

Fantastic family friendly hotel central to all tourist attractions. Would recommend this warm welcoming hotel and staff happy to help. Wish we could have stayed longer. Lost of local shops from groceries to souvenirs

We stayed at the Arthouse Hotel for 4 nights over Thanksgiving. The hotel was excellent from start to finish. All the staff were very friendly and welcoming. We were upgraded on arrival however the room was small and quite dark as we only had a view of another building. This didn’t bother us because we were out all day until bed time. The bed was very soft and comfortable however just a bit too high. Shower was brilliant, very hot and powerful. Room was cleaned everyday. The hotel was in the ideal location for us. It was handy for everything we wanted to do but away from the noise of Times Square. We walked to and from the hotel most days but the subway is only 2 blocks away. We were going to get the subway and AirTrain to the airport when we were travelling home however the weather was bad that day and the concierge arranged a car to the airport for us. We would definitely visit the Arthouse again.

Our room was spacious and sparse but a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was a nice size but the shower was horrible! I could never get the proper temperature! The most disappointing was an email asking if I would like an upgrade .

We went for family vacation over Thanksgiving holiday & would definitely go back to the Arthouse - great location in just a couple blocks from Central Park, the subway, many restaurants. Lots to do & see but away from midtown/downtown mayhem (but quick subway ride away)

The room was clean and comfortable. Loved the terrace. Good wine selection andentertainment on the Friday night we were there. Only complaint is the choices and qualityof food can definitely use some attention. We will return.

The Arthouse surpasses all expectations of hotel stays. It is physically comforting as well as mentally. The employees welcome you as the best of friends and the environment envelopes your senses. We don’t stay anywhere else while in nyc.

Great visit. Great location. Very nice staff. Water provided daily. Quiet. Nice lobbyRestaurant available. Delivery or pick up food easy to do. Able to check in extra early for small fee. Totally worth it after the red eye flight from the west coast. Small gym was adequate. Central Park a few blocks away. Metro station 2 blocks away. Many restaurants nearby. Rooms very clean. Only one day the bathroom floor was not swept but overall very clean. Safe area. Convenient nearby markets, coffee shops, drug stores. I traveled with my daughter for the Thanksgiving holiday. Fortunate to have good weather. Please see the rest of my review

Good location at the top of Broadway near to the subway and Central Park. Lovely foyer and bar, rooms were really good, staff were excellent. Really helpful and friendly.the 2 restaurants attached to the hotel were top notch especially Red Farm the Chinese one. Really relaxed atmosphere.

Spent a night at the Arthouse Hotel while attending a concert at a nearby venue, and could not have been more pleased. The location is perfect—steps from anything one could possibly want. The staff was wonderful—very thoughtful and accommodating. Lobby area is beautifully decorated. Our room was cozy—quite modern, clean and exceedingly quiet. Didn’t have time to visit the bar or the other amenities, but hope to get the opportunity to do so when we return. Recommend highly.

After a bunch of different disappointing NY hotel experiences, this place really stood out. Reception and bell staff were friendly and helpful and flexible with check-in time. Lobby was spacious and a comfortable atmosphere with live music at night. The rooms were functional and clean. It felt more like a boutique than a huge corporate hotel.

We had a great time staying at Arthouse Hotel. The staff is very friendly and the piano bar is awesome , very happy atmosphere the moment you walk in the Hotel Lobby was filled with beautiful music. Thank you Arthouse
user_name:
Designerbrazil
New York City, New York

review_body: First room was pretty small, but we were moved to a corner for the next two nights, which made a big difference. It would be nice to have a fridge in the room, but not a huge deal. Fun vibe, good location, nice staff. Definitely will return.

Small bathroom, not here for entertainment but great bed & restaurant/bar attached. I’d definitely stay here again but might push for larger room if available. Staff was very friendly and great views if you get a terrace.

Heater was noisy, hot and cold water blending did not work. Lock was broken when checking in outlets were dirty and chipped. In general maintenence stopped at ground floor. Price was high. So unless you need to be in this location skip this hotel.

Over a 2-day stay during a conference, I had an unexpected great hotel experience. The location couldn't have been better, room was modern & comfortable, and the staff was outstanding. Every member of the team that I interacted with was friendly, helpful and happy. Jessie at the front desk and Leny and Orlando at the valet station went out of their way to make things easy for me. Got me checked in early so I could make my meetings and had my luggage & car ready when I returned so I could get out of the city to beat the rush.

The location of the hotel was great, the restaurant provided great service and food. Delivery of food was much need in our case, will recommend to family and friends. I like having the bar in easy access. All staff member were amazing.

neighborhood hotel and staff are very professional and helpful. always try to make you feel like home. Great neighborhood amenities and easy access to west side subways and bus system and getting across town in 79 st bus

Very nice hotel on the UWS. Had a nice vibe verses the larger hotels. Nice that Sarafina Restaurant is right in the building. Also very close to the 79th Street Subway Station. Staff was very friendly.

Rude, Unprofessional, disgusting, and totally unhelpful!!!!!!!On Tuesday, 11/19/19, I was staying with my friend at the Arthouse Hotel and we checked out on Wednesday, 11/20/19.Unfortunately, I thought I had left my watch in the room and when trying to call the hotel that evening, I was only met with rude, unprofessional behavior. After being on hold for more than twenty minutes,I was transferred to "security" and spoke to an individual named “Barry”, who continuously refused to give me his name and hung up on me.I did call back and talked to the manager, who didn't seem very concerned of the way I was treated.I requested the General Manager's name so I could further persue the possibility of retrieving my watch.It was a blessing that we did find my watch and I didn't have to be subjected to any further rudeness.My partner nor I will never stay at this hotel again and strongly recommend that people find a different hotel where guests are treated with respect.Totally disgusting!!!!!

They were not honest with me about anything . They know me and yet would not help me with anything . I am still shaking from the way they told me three different things about my reservation , I felt ridiculed as I know the staff well

In New York City where there are countless styles and themes of boutique hotels to choose from, The Arthouse lives up to its name. The lobby is truly gorgeous. When have you ever sat in a cozy library that blends seamlessly with a swanky speakeasy? The rooms were funny--the furniture pieces reminded us of an elementary school art class with lockers and cubby slots--not luxury style but kept with the theme and we were definitely comfortable and slept well. Oh, and the towels were nice, which is a small detail, but sometimes overlooked in NYC.

I wanted to stay on the UWS for convenience purposes and this seemed like the best option based on reviews. I was mostly satisfied. It had an unbelievably comfortable bed, good location, and the lobby bar (when not packed for private events) was nice. The gym was very small and one of the treadmills was unstable but you could get in a decent workout. Something that caused a lot of elevator congestion at times is the fact that their staff have to use the same elevators as guests to get their cleaning supplies from floor to floor which I found odd. The urban fee is a bit ridiculous. Maybe in the summer when you can enjoy the terrace, but $39 for wifi, a small gym, and a free glass of wine seemed excessive to me. That said, if I needed to be in the area I would stay here again as it is the best option in the neighborhood in my opinion.
user_name:
yankeetravels27
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location - Serafina restaurant, outstanding - the menu for breakfast very good and food tasty. The dinner menu was best and I sat at the bar and ate - the staff was very friendly. Lobby bar - not my favorite.

If you like big lobbies and impersonal hotels, go somewhere else. Arthouse is like home. the lobby is divided into a small living room area, a friendly bar and table area and seating around a piano. The downstairs staff is friendly and remembers people. "Welcome back" Jessie, at the front desk, is the best. Whatever you need, she helps. She remembers what you like, if you have been there before. Se is a can-do person.

Just got back from a NYC trip today and stayed at Arthouse for the weekend. Wanted to thank the staff who were especially helpful and welcoming. Maggie at the front desk was absolutely wonderful! Thank you Maggie.George, we wanted to thank you also for having us and for being so helpful. Wonderful meeting you both. Thank you Jonny, Ramona and Jose!

We stayed here 2 nights for our daughter's wedding in Central Park. The rooms are smallish, and the price is a bit high for us- but standard for NYC and the area of town. Bed was very comfortable, room very clean. What I found most pleasing was the helpfulness of the staff. We needed a wheelchair for one of our guests and the lady at the desk had it set up without any hassles. They took items to the room in the flurry of walking out the door to the wedding and assisted us with forgotten items as well. Aside from that, the hotel is in a nice quiet part of town, and seems to be a local hangout at the bar downstairs. Nice restaurant attached to hotel. Very convenient. We walked to Central park and there is a metro station nearby.

good moment at the art house hotel : nice room with beautiful view (loft terrace), beautiful loby, hotel well located (close to central Park, Subway…). It has to be said, however the ventilation is very Noisy

Close to Central Park and practical to commute to midtown via CitiBike (for me), Good concept with the friendly bar with live music.
