The quick morning coffee shop option is very good (whether you are in Jewish pastries, or not) Only caveat is the room doors which slam automatically and that wakes you up (especially when jet lagged like me traveling from Europe)

The front desk wanted to charge a fee for checking-in two hours early. The heat in the room did not work; when I entered the room, it was 62 degrees. While building maintenance eventually fixed it, the room should have not been given in the first place. The iron left black stains on dress shirt.

A superb and welcoming staff. Location on the UWS outstanding. Views, comfort and quiet. Very reasonably priced. Visit NYC often and would not stay anywhere else. December, June and October the very best months to visit.

Stayed for one night for biz - great neighborhood feel in lovely UWS. Great location for museums, shopping and Central Park walks! Room is fairly basic, but contemporary touches and bed is heavenly! My new fave in NYC!

We stayed at the Arthouse Hotel in October, it was okay. The rooms were very small and dark, especially as our blind was broken in our room, it couldn’t be fixed by the hotel staff, we were told the company would have to fix it, but no one came out during our stay. The rooms were kept clean and the staff were friendly. We were woken very early by the lorries cleaning drains. The cost of drinks in the bar was very expensive and the service not always great. It seems for the size of the hotel, that there wasn’t enough lifts as they were very busy. I think if your charging urban taxes, that all facilities should in full working order. We won’t stay here again, as it was too noisy, too busy and the room facilities weren’t great, ie needs updating and little things like hooks in the bathroom.

Our room at the Arthouse Hotel was clean and comfortable, and the hotel's location is close to the subway, CitiBike docks and bike paths, Central Park, and coffee and bagel shops such as Irving Farm, Zabar's, and Bagel and Co. Moreover, the lobby at Arthouse offers a relaxed meeting and work area in addition to its own coffee and quick bites bar.

With easy access to nearby subway and good location, Arthouse is a fine choice, particularly with nicely decorated and spotless rooms. The staff is helpful and the bar is a congenial meeting place. Local restaurants are close by.

Great hotel on the Upper West side! I have stayed here many times, it's got a cool NYC vibe. The lobby area and bar is like a super sized living room, elegant and an enjoyable place to hang out and have a glass of wine, entertainment going on from time to time too. The staff are awesome...Vivic, Carlos, Ramona,Tasha, Lenny, Orlando, George, Bobby, Danny, Alberto, Eduardo, Jose, and Steve at the bar too! Rooms are clean and beds super comfy. Can't say enough about the staff and how great they are, the locations is perfect, close to subway, Central Park, Museum of Natural History and easy access to all of what NYC offers. I have never been disappointed, I stay here all the time while visiting NYC!

The welcome I received from Ramona and her colleagues upon arrival last week was so warm and sincere. This hotel remembers their returning guests and it makes all the difference. Orlando and Lenny are the friendliest doormen. The hotel has such a chilled vibe, that the moment you walk through the door, even after a lonnnnggg day in the city you start feeling relaxed. I have been a guest through the hotel's different identities - On the Avenue, NYLO, and now Arthouse. It's my home away from home in Manhattan. Just stay the way you are guys.

Conveniently located to a variety of shopping and restaurants, great rooms, felt safe and cozy as solo traveler. Three blocks from Central Park. Staff is friendly and helpful. It was my second stay and I'll definitely return.

Has everything you need. It is clean and very comfortable and good for one-two guests. Bathroom is small as is overall room. Restaurants available and entertainment (live music). Only lacks special amenities like bath robe, slippers, high quality products.

This hotel does not have customer friendly policies and at every turn staff are trying to rip you off.A different approach in policy and training is required.If I pay for breakfast give me breakfast.I did not get the room I paid for.

We've been coming to this hotel in this super location for the past five years on our annual trip to NYC. Even though the name has changed, we still find it comfortable, welcoming, clean and in a great location. The staff is friendly, professional and pro-active. (checking on our in-room coffee, suggesting a town car to the airport.) We'll be back (sorry Arnold)

We greatly enjoyed our stay at Arthouse and would stay there again. Although the room was small, it was up-dated and had everything we needed. The staff is very friendly. There is a vibrant bar scene in the lobby, but the room was nice and quiet all night long.

Clean and comfortable room, friendly and helpful staff, pleasant lobby bar and lounge. Style is hip and modern. We were upgraded to a larger room when we checked in which was very nice. There is a good restaurant adjacent to the hotel and many others in the neighborhood.

Fabulous location near Central Park and close to LeVain and Daily provisions for foodie eats and treats. My daughter and I and are 2 fur babies enjoyed true hospitality at Arthouse and that is why we’ll be back.

I love the Upper West Side in the 70's. I booked the Arthouse, as my go-to staple on my frequent visits, the Beacon, was sold out. The Arthouse is good, but not quite as good. Staff are very helpful and accommodating. Valet parking went well. The room was small even for New York. Perhaps had I gotten a Queen or two Doubles instead of a King, I would have had more room. So while there was a desk chair, there was no room for an easy chair in what's supposed to be a Superior room, and it was difficult to maneuver around the room. There's a safe, but it's located down at the floor level next to the bed, so you have to bend down on hands and knees to operate it. There was a closet, so why not put it there where you could reach it? No recycling bin in the room for plastic or paper. No toilet paper dispenser, just a roll on a hook or knob. No grab bar in the shower. The bathroom did have lots of room for toiletries and stuff. Lighting in the room was very good. The lobby is spacious with lots of sitting areas and a bar. The hotel slaps on a resort fee of $39 a day that they call an "Urban Fee," that includes simple things like water and internet access. I mean, come on! Note: I had the address on Broadway and was driving around looking for the entrance, but they don't tell you the entrance and valet parking are actually on 77th Street, not Broadway.
user_name:
lifeisforlearning
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Wonderful location, wonderful hotel-super clean and friendly, professional staff. Would stay here again when visiting NYC. We walked to see the taping of: Live Kelly and Ryan and then we walked to Timesquare to see Broadway plays and Central Park

This hotel is located near Beacon theater and very close to a subway station. There are excellent restaurants in area including those associated with hotel. The front desk is patient and helpful especially Johnny

This was my second time at the Arthouse. We loved it! My daughter and granddaughter stayed too. The staff was excellent at accommodating young families! We booked directly through the hotel and they upgraded us upon arrival for no additional charge.

We booked a deluxe king room with Broadway View and when we came to the room the curtain couldn't be moved, so we were staying in a pitch black room with no view at all. The hotel offered us to move the next day to another room, which we accepted. Unfortunately we had to wait until 6.30 pm until this move was finally done. We are regular guests in this hotel for nearly 15 years and experienced a lot of changes, not all for the best. The rooms need a renovation, especially the bath rooms. We still like the hotel for its location on the UWS and for the staff working there for many years and it is always good to meet them and be recognized as a long term guest. Although there are a few new people working there who should be a bit more friendly and guest oriented, especially to frequent guests.

Stayed here for business and was really happy with the whole experience. Artfully designed space, comfortable and clean rooms. The free drinks on check in was a nice touch. And the cocktails were excellent.

I requested a quiet room from the gruff desk person and got placed in a room on the 2nd floor by the dumpsters, which I heard at 1am and 5am. Also, when I tried calling to get help with a noisy mechanical problem above my bathroom, no one picked up in my several attempts, and then finally someone picked up and hung up on me! I finally had to get out of bed and visit the front desk for help. I did get a terrific engineer (kudos to this guy!) to who came and fixed the problem. So, after a terrible night of interrupted sleep, another gruff desk person did not ask me how my stay was, nor did she thank me for choosing their hotel. The room was fine, nothing special. A lumpy soft bed and no options for dim light to read at your bedside. Just all bright lights on or off. Not restful! I would not stay here again, despite the excellent location.

Over the last two years, I've stayed at the Arthouse (formerly NYLO) about 10 times. The beds are very comfy. The rooms are clean and quiet. The upscale design is pleasant and functional. The staff are very helpful and kind. The location is perfect for me. The neighborhood is great. Easy access to subways. Walking distance to many good point of interest. The price is reasonable for the value in Manhattan.BTW, you can request a mini-frig for you room as they are not standard.Typical of Manhattan hotels is the lack of view unless you pay for it. If you do, the higher the floor, the quieter the room.Mille Feuille, across the street on Broadway, is my breakfast stop for a perfect croissant and excellent latte.

good, but not great. It was convenient and clean. Great espresso downstairs! Room is good for sleeping, but not lounging during day. The room is too small to have a guest, because no seating!I would come back only if convenient . The hotel staff were very nice and accommodating

This is our second time in Art House. The location is great, the rooms are small but this time we have a king size luxury, and we were happy.The only problem we had ,was the room wasn't ready at five o'clock in the evening.

Spent three nights here for marathon weekend. Perfect location for walking to Central Park and lots of museums and restaurants. And the hotel has fantastic spaces in the lobby to meet friends for a drink or bite to eat.

This was a quick business trip- this place is trying so hard to be hip but I felt like high end ikea- lamps were laughable - the “wheels” on the bed also laughable-the resortfee was not laughable,and seems poor business relations. I came back early and wanted to sit in the well advertised lounge- and it was closed for a private party- perhaps my resort fee should be refunded for my lounge fee? Not a keeper given the many options

we arrived late at night and were given what I would call a poor room, on the second floor. hotel was full but we were moved the next day. Great room - go for a room ending in 30. nice and relaxed hotel and in a great location - no where near as manic as the major tourist spots but within easy reach. The road 'Amsterdam' is perfect for bars and restaurants

I had booked this hotel purely on the basis that it was a stone's throw from the finishing line of the NYC Marathon, which I was running it. In that sense, it was fantastic location. If that wasn't a factor, I would have found it quite basic. Its a unusual place in the sense that its just rooms and a lobby then a few third-party food outlets - felt more like an Airbnb than a Manhattan hotel. I rarely saw staff, which isn't a bad thing. That said, it served its purpose well. ProsThe room was a nice size, clean and the bed was very comfortable. Location. Right on Broadway and close to plenty of restaurants, a CVS pharmacyConsBasic amenities. TV was an old non-smart SD TV with limited channelsNo Mini barBasic bathroom, uninspiring low pressure shower

I come to NYC twice a year to attend a conference near Columbia and always try and stay at the Arthouse (formerly Nylo) hotel.The rooms are clean, client and the beds are particularly comfy (v.high thread count sheets) not to mention the clean lines of industrial style rooms- polished concrete floors and stainless steel slick fixtures means less likelihood of an allergic reaction from my sensitive nose!The hotel lounge and bar is a wonderful place to work, meet friends or just people watch. The library is very welcoming and there are free computers for guests to use. Serafina restaurant is also connected to the hotel so excellent Italian food is accessible without going outside!Definitely recommended!

I really like the Arthouse Hotel. It’s a great location and adjacent restaurants are worth trying. Staff was friendly and accommodating. The only reasons I don’t rate the hotel as excellent is that the bed was too soft for my needs, and there are no towel hooks in the bathroom. I would definitely recommend this hotel. It’s a great value in Manhattan.

Reminded me of a european boutique. Clean, bed comfortable shower perfect. Kosher restaurant downstairs adequate breakfast menu. Becomes a bar scene at night. Central location...can’t beat it! Try and get a room facing the river and at least the 14th floor.

I recommend the Penthouse of the hotel. It's spacious and great for a family with kids. The balcony view was really nice, part of the Hudson river is apparent. Location is really good if you like the UWS, you forget that you're staying in a hotel as soon as you leave the hotel. The staff were really nice and were always asking us if we needed anything or any assistance. It was nice that there were several elevators, we rarely waited for more than 2 minutes for the elevator. Only concern was the cleanliness, I think the hotel needs to put more effort in their cleaning service especially in sweeping the floor and couch. But overall as a family we enjoyed our stay very much and recommend the hotel as it's family friendly and in a great neighborhood with so many attractions within walking distance and subway is just 2 blocks away.

Warm welcome, very good location close to the subway and very Nice lobby/ bar. The room was ok but the air conditionning very noisy and the door of the room let some light in but overall a good place to see NY within a quiet neighbourood.

The hotel is very nice and also the neighbourhood, just few minutes walk from the subway 79 Street station and maybe 10 minutes walk from Central Park and the Natural history museum. Our room had wooden floor and was very clean, we would like to thank nice Mrs Mira. All the staff of the hotel was very kind and helpful. We enjoyed the offer with breakfast included, the breakfast was also very good. I suggest this hotel

We had a wonderful experience staying at Arthouse. The location is great with lots of attractions and restaurants within walking distance- the only Banksy in Manhattan is just a couple blocks away, walk to the river, walk to Central Park, walk to the Natural History Museum. There’s a subway stop just a couple blocks away too. The rooms are clean, quiet, and comfortable. The staff is nice and very accommodating. Would definitely stay here again. Thank you!

Stayed at the Art House on West 77th Street, NY. Friendly staff. nice lobby and bar area. If the location works for you, an ideal place to stay. Good restaurants are right there and close to the park so you can walk there.

bad serviceroom not cleanedcoffee machine not workingbathroom smellyelevator jammed with staff at rush hourreplacement coffee machine requested but did not arrive even hours laterone person behind reception desk -- long lines for checkin and check out

Nice room lovely bed clean and well furnished. View was nice and facilities were good. The only fault I found was the lighting was poor for reading. Lounge and bar very comfortable with helpful staff. Water pressure was poor along with power of electricity but think this was more to blame with Americas poor investment in there infrastructure. Overall well enjoyed stay and would recommend to anybody. Plenty to see and do location central and excellent for getting to all main attractions. Close to Central Park and history museum.

Like any NYC hotel, the rooms are small, but they're very clean, modern, and quiet. The rooftop lounge was exactly as pictured, and the location of the hotel is perfectly situated near Columbia University and a short cab ride to Times Square, etc. It's a lovely walk if you're fit.

Great price and a superb hotel. Beats the pants off Hilton, Marriot etc. I will definitely be returning here on my next trips to the big apple. Great service and the Italian restaurant on site is also excellent.

Nice size rooms, clean, fun bar just out of the way. I was there twice in October and am very comfortable there. Great comfortable bed and pillows. Quiet. Restaurant next door is very good.I recommend it.

The hotel is situated near Central Park, the natural history museum and a subway station. There are shops and good restaurants nearby. Upper West side is a lot quieter than mid-town but is still fairly noisy so you will hear some traffic but that is more about the city that never sleeps than the hotel.

Location is close by to restaurants and a drug store. Bottles of water always provided along with a coffee maker and coffee. I loved the balcony and could see the Hudson from there. Staff was happy and accomodating.

This is the second time my wife and I have been to this hotel. We enjoyed our stay and plan to be back again! We enjoyed the excellent customer service, hotel beds, location and price point of the hotel.

Loved this hotel - its perfect ! Great room , bed , location to the subway and lots going on around but not too busy as the east side . Staff were lovely and helpful and all were so nice to my children and me.

Returned home today after spending 4 nights in this lovely hotel. Staying here was a 40th birthday surprise for my husband, I did email ahead to let the hotel know this and as a good will gesture for his birthday they upgraded us to a bigger room with a great view. The bed was massive and so comfortable, there was plenty of storage, the bathroom was a good size with a nice hot, powerful shower. we had a coffee machine, bottles of water, a safe an iron, ironing board and a hairdryer in the room. The decor of the hotel downstairs was beautiful and modern. All the staff we encountered were helpful and polite, especially the gentleman who took our bags on our last day (didn't catch his name) and booked us a private transfer to the airport when he found out we were planning on taking the subway and airtrain. The housekeeping was very good, came back every night to a spotless, made up room. One of the best things about this hotel is its location, lots of shops, restaurants and take outs close by. Close to Central Park and the number 1 subway line is 2 blocks away which after a long day of walking, walking and more walking is a relief.Thank you Arthouse Hotel for a great stay.

This hotel had a friendly informal vibe that suggested the West Village of yesteryear more than uptown today. The staff was eager to please and followed up on making sure you were happy with your room, etc. You can easily walk to almost anywhere you might want to go. I definitely plan to stay there again.

This is our first time staying at Arthouse Hotel (formerly NYLO and On the Ave). We always stay on the Upper West Side when we are in NYC because of the proximity to terrific restaurants and easily accessible transportation, and because we love this area of the city. Previously, we stayed at the Lucerne Hotel, 2 blocks away, but decided to try something more modern. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We had booked the Standard Queen, but received an offer to upgrade to various rooms. We upgraded to Standard King, which gave us a slight bit more room. We were very happy with the room and the window looked out over 77th St. The bed was quite comfortable and the amenities in the room were very nice and clean. Loved having the large shower in the bathroom. The laminate/wood floor in the room was great...not crazy about having carpet, since carpet can be difficult to keep clean. There are terrific restaurants and food markets very close by, like Zabar's, Citerella, and Fairway. The closest subway stop is only 2 blocks away. Everything is within walking distance of this hotel. Hotel rooms in NYC are expensive, but given the location and hotel amenities and staff, it was worth it.

Great choice for an upper westside experience. The hotel was walking distance to many great restaurants and shopping, close to the subway too! Rooms were nicely decorated, clean and had a very comfortable bed. A nice touch is the text from the front desk asking if everything is satisfactory.

We love this hotel!!Although it has change it’s name from Nylo to Arthouse, this hotel is as charming as ever!We chose it to celebrate our wedding aniversary.Beside is wonderful localization, close to everything including the Central Park, the staff is kind, simpatetic and friendly.Special remarke to Jessie who made every effort to turn our experience into something amazing and unforgettable.

We had better booked a superior King and found it very tight quarters. There was one tall, very narrow window, and hence the room was dark. It was hard to imagine what a standard room would be like by comparison. We didn't get to find out, however, as we were then very kindly offered an ADA compliant room (my husband used a walker) at a very reduced rate. The ADA room was great!The hotel is trendy, and the staff are super. The breakfast/lunch offerings in the lobby are expensive but excellent. The proximity to two decent restaurants is Handy.There are some odd bits, however, such as no place to hang the towels in the bathroom, cabinets for clothes that have no backs on them so that things fall out the back, and inconvenient placement of some lights.I would go back but would want to make sure about the configuration of the room first.

I have praised Arthouse before for its clean, stylish and light-filled rooms, its chic, polished and functional bathrooms (with good water pressure!), comfy beds, charming, cozy lobby (with bar) and above all, it's wonderful staff. Arthouse is great in so many ways, including its UWS location away from the fray yet with easy access to everything. However, this hotel’s staff is truly the "ace up its sleeve." I want particularly to thank front-desk staffers Jessie, Ramona, Carlos and Eloy who I have come to know over these past 4-5 years, for always being helpful, kind, warm and willing to answer and address any question I might have and for making me feel “at home”. Their sense of service is impeccable. Whenever I have had a particular room request, they always do their utmost to accommodate me. I also want to give a shout-out to Linasia and Amado for sending treats to my room during my last few stays in February and March 2019, when my mother was in a hospital nearby post-brain surgery, and I often got back to my room late at night. Their kindness and consideration were a comfort at an extremely difficult time. Credit must also be given to people working “behind the scenes”, so thank you Tasha in Customer Service for working to keep me in the same room when I suddenly had to extend my stay last winter and the hotel was jam-packed. And kudos to Rosa Carr, Reservations Manager, for ALWAYS being helpful, answering questions promptly and thoroughly. Also, if you are traveling with a dog, rest-assured that Arthouse is a welcoming place for your four-legged bestie! I have been a loyal guest at this hotel for a number of years, for the above-mentioned reasons, but in particular thanks to the hotel’s wonderful staff. As great as the Arthouse's “physical” qualities are –– the rooms, the ultra-comfy beds, the 16th floor balcony bar, the home-away-from-home lobby – in the end it’s above all the staff that keeps me coming back. PS Broadway View Deluxe and NY Studios with Terrace are among my favorites, generally affordable (for NY), spacious, bathing in light with great views.

My wife and I both very much enjoyed the hotel. Bed and pillows very comfortable. Room was nice and quiet. Staff was very helpful. Location is very convenient to all UWS goings-on. Pastry place in lobby (Patis) has excellent coffee and pastry.

My boyfriend and I stayed here during our 4 day trip to NYC. The hotel is amazing! Located about a 40 minute walk, or 20 minute subway ride to Times Square, the hotel is the perfect balance between peace and quiet for sleeping, and close enough to fully be in the heart of NYC.The closest subway station is a 3 minute walk away and you can use the Downtown The Bronx line 1 to Times Square, and the Uptown South Ferry line to return to the hotel.The hotel itself is very well looked after - the house keeping team make your room spotless each day - and the decor is unique and inviting. We arrived at midnight on our first day and even at that time of night, the staff were full of energy and more than helpful and friendly.I would highly recommend the Arthouse Hotel and if I am ever lucky enough to visit NYC again, I would definitely return.Thanks for a great stay!

I loved the cozy bar area, and the overall look of the hotel. The staff was super friendly and accommodating! texting us during our trip to make sure everything was going well and if we needed anything. The bed was SO COMFORTABLE! Slept just as good as we did at home. The rooms are small but fun decor and it is New York and I wasn't visiting to hang out in the hotel room:) They also have a terrace on the 16th floor if you want to sit outside!

I stayed for a week at this hotel. There is a nice lobby both for working on a laptop or having a drink. Good restaurants and services nearby (appreciated the agreement with Pure Yoga next door). Room was spacious, comfortable, and clean.

We stayed here on recommendation from son, who lives in neighborhood. We found Arthouse to be welcoming, with people, who offered to help in any way. The lobby is quite attractive and comfortable, with ample seating arrangements for many groups. I'd call it cozy. While there, we checked out the Hotel Belleclaire, which were $100 more/night. IMHO, Arthouse was better for the difference. Another important consideration: quiet neighborhood, with minimal street noise= good night's sleep. We were on the 10th floor. Enjoyed nice live jazz music one night. This is a restful and lovely little hotel.

I received a text 5 minutes after I arrived in my room asking "How is everything with your room". During my stay, everyone I dealt with was friendly and eager to please. The room was spotless. When I travel, I always ask for a quiet room, and sometimes get a very noisy one. Here, the room was very quiet. Excellent location. Two short blocks from a subway station on the #1 line. I never waited more than 5 minutes for the train. Took 10 minutes to get to Columbia University (116 St.)

Great location, awesome staff at the front desk, and clean rooms. Cool modern touch in the rooms and comfy lounge spaces! Beds were super comfortable with crisp sheets. Would definitely stay here again.Nearby restaurants were extremely convenient.

The lobby smells of smoke 24 hours a day. The staff is a gruff and unhelpful. Chris at the bar is the only redeeming person that works at this establishment. Everyone else is so unhelpful. Showers are lukewarm. Rooms are mediocre. I think this was my fourth or fifth time to stay there and the service has progressively gotten worse. I won’t be returning.

I come to NYC for work at least 12 times a year and always stay here. Consistently excellent rooms, service and the best neighborhood. Also enjoying the new pastry shop for breakfast in the morning in the lobby.

We were there every year for a week (when it was on-the-ave and NYLO)....this time the last time was very bad!!! They changed only the name and the attitude....didn't change anything in the building....What was changed from previous visits:Bad cleaning. Smell of garbage in the elevator. Bad service from reception. Toilet broken...and more and more...the arthouse is a scam!!!

Great place, great location on UWS right in the middle of a properly lived in area of NYC. The reception staff was cold at the approach with the typical NYC "don't push me mate, I will get to you when finished with what I am dealing with" sort of standard NYC; once gone through that barbed wire they were very nice and thorough in explaining how the place worked.The room was very nice with very good view over rooftops and reaching to the shining Hudson River and New Jersey. It is true that we paid extra for an upgrade and were on the 14th floor but equally the room was spacious, the bed extremely comfortable and we had a terrace too. I am not sure what would have been like without the upgrade as room are on lower floors. The staff at the bar in the lounge area was friendly and cocktails were professionally mixed and served. No comment on breakfast as we decided to opt out of it as the area has fantastic offer of local early morning food providers. The porter was very effective and he booked for us a very comfortable rise to JFK for our flight back home. All in all good value for money.

We had a great stay at Arthouse. The hotel staff were so helpful. At first our room was a bit smaller than the pictures, but they upgraded us to a much better view and size on the 12th floor! Comfy bed, big shower, great view. Surprisingly good amount of storage for the space, as well. The hotel staff also offered us a car to the airport at a flat rate, a little cheaper and more convenient than an uber or taxi.

Very clean, quiet, totally secure hotel, especially for septuagenarians concerned about touring around the Big Apple.. Excellent upper west side location, two blocks from # 1 subway line that leads to most important sights. Entire hotel staff was attentive, helpful from doormen to front desk to cleaning staff. We were especially impressed that the hotel offers complete benefits for its staff which leads, in our opinion, to a very positive attitude towards hotel guests. Ramona at the front desk was extremely helpful to us on multiple occasions.

below standard. Overpriced. Did not meet requests of guests. Dangerous gym and very inadequate. No amenities . Very poor security. Practically no doorman available when needed. Poor bar service.The lobby looked like a basement which was unkept and had poor lighting.

The hotel is very lovely from an aesthetic perspective and is in a nice location. The room was nicely furnished and had what one would need. However, for the price of the room - a junior suite with balcony-I expected higher quality sound proofing. My room was near an elevator and I could hear it every single time it went up/down...all hours except from 2am-6am. I thought it was a nearby subway station, but no... After staying here for two nights, we went to the JW Marriott. Finally we could get a good night's rest. Very unfortunate, as the Arthouse is a lovely-looking hotel. I wonder what can be done about the noise. Also, I had to request three times that the sofa bed be made up.

The Arthouse is centrally located and the staff is beyond helpful. The hallways to the room are quite dark with colourful pictures, however, the rooms are bright and inviting and the bed is comfortable. The lobby has many different smaller rooms/areas and a bar, where you can just tuck in making it a perfect setting for sitting and sharing. It has lots of unique eateries in the neighborhood.

Nice hotel. Something must have been going on in NY on the specific date we were there. Room definitely not worth $500 a night. Staff were great. Very friendly and welcoming. Room was clean beds comfortable. Bathroom very small and furniture kinda worn out. Great location.

The staff was extremely courteous and accommodating. The rooms were decent and clean. I was upgraded for a relatively small fee and will certainly return when traveling to the area. The hotel lobby was a great place to unwind while coming to and from the rooms.

This was my wife's first visit to NYC, so I did not want to launch her into the middle of the scrum of Midtown. A friend recommended Arthouse and we could not have been more satisfied. The UWS is a quiet neighborhood. The hotel is very clean,and the staff friendly and attentive. The City is quickly available as the subway is only two blocks, but many local attractions within easy walking distance. We will definitely stay here again.

I have stayed there 3x now each with a different size room. One had a small terrace. Another an anteroom with throne-like chairs, a big tv and desk, and another more typical small room. They were all clean and fun and relatively quiet. The front desk was always accommodating to my need NOT to be near an elevator, and the 2 free welcome drink tickets helped ease the jitters from a bumpy flight! I love the location.

I got a great deal through HotelTonight and was delighted by my check-in experience. The front desk gave me a “welcome drink” ticket and took care of sending up my suitcase while I settled into the cozy lobby lounge. The bar tender mixed up the most delicious manhattan with brandy cherries while I relaxed on the comfy couches. Cindy was so kind and pet-friendly to my two small dogs who snuggled up on my foot-rest. I was so happy to find that Hugo had upgraded my room to a double deluxe that I actually decided to extend my stay another night. Jessi gave me another drink ticket and I enjoyed my complimentary martini serenaded by a singer playing the cool red piano. The Arthouse selection of art isn’t really my taste but so it goes in hotels! The rooms are sparse on amenities: no mini bar but Keurig and water bottles are included in the “Urban fee” of $40. Overall very accommodating, they even brought a mini-fridge to my room upon request! Conveniently located between the East River and Central Park, in a great neighborhood near top museums and restaurants. I would definitely stay here again for the outstanding hospitality!
user_name:
tara2888
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here last weekend, picked the hotel because of the location (which was great). We were very satisfied with the room (king bed with a view). We were very satisfied with house keeping, our room was cleaned very well each day. We were extremely displeased with the customer service of the front desk. We showed up to drop off our bags (around 12pm) knowing check in wasn’t until 4. This process took longer than expected, and the lady at the desk seemed annoyed that we showed up early. We were told we would get a call if our room was ready before 4pm and went along with our day. We came back to the hotel right at 4pm (never received that call) and a different woman stopped us before we could get to the desk. She very rudely tried to tell us we had not paid for our room/ our credit card info wasn’t right. She never asked our name or verified who we were. We were obviously very confused because we had already paid and we started to pull up of confirmation on our phone and she switched stories, obviously back tracking and said their system was down and we might not be checked in. We explained we had already checked in and dropped our bags, she looked really confused. Then we asked her to look up our account since she still hadn’t asked our name or any other information. Once she looked us up it was obvious she had bombarded the wrong people, we had checked in/paid. We were given no apology for her rude demeanor/ accusation. I’m still blown away with the way she stormed up to us before we got to desk without knowing who we were. This left a bad impression on us throughout the rest of the stay. The rest of the hotel staff we encountered were just as off putting. This hotel is too expensive to be treated so rudely. While we loved the location we will probably stay elsewhere next time.

Arthouse was a great place to stay while I attended a conference in Manhattan. The front desk staff and housekeeping staff were friendly and helpful. The room was clean and spacious, and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel bar was also very pleasant. The location was great, with easy access to the subway, and a lot of nice restaurants nearby. I would definitely consider staying there again.

Our main reason for staying at the Arthouse Hotel is the location on the UWS: a neighbourhood full of subtle charm and no hassle. The hotel is beautiful, the location convenient, and the staff super helpful and friendly. Will always be coming back to this place!

This is a nice, clean boutique hotel, with little by way of amenities beyond a convenient location. Be warned though: This place is very noisy. Most rooms face a street with a firehouse across - with commensurate late night alarms. And the hallways are super noisy, in part because of very loud door mechanical for the rooms, which means lots of late night banging as people go in and out.

The hotel used to be the NYLO but has since changed to Arthouse. We have been coming here every year for the past 9 years for our annual family visit. Everything seems mostly the same since the change. Reception used to be able to provide a list of suggested restaurants in the area but apparently no longer. Please get with it as this information is important to out if town visitors. The rio s are modest but comfortable, but onesie replace the lumpy pillows as that does not make for a comfortable nights rest. Otherwise, we were very happy with our stay. Being one of the few hotels located on the upper west side where our family lives, we will continue to cone here for our annual visits to New York....but PLEASE do something about those pillows!!!!

Rude vallet. Garage lost our car keys and lied for over an hour about it until finally we went into the garage to see what was going on. They never found the keys and didn’t seem to care. Only bright spot was manager.

The whole team is consistently rude and shows zero care for guests . Rooms are small and decorated in a cold way that I don’t like it the main problem is the bad attitude you get whenever you dare asking anything from any staff member.

I have to say that the hotel is lovely and well situated in the grand scheme of things. The subway is two blocks down or five up which is minutes away. The bar is always busy and is set in pleasant surroundings. The only down side is the the urban tax which is attached to the hotel, although many practise this. The staff are pleasant and helpful, but I would like to thank Wynona and George. These two always went out of there way to help and always took time to chat and give advice on the city.

My daughter lives in NYC and we come to NY quite often for both business and for visiting her so I have plenty of experience with fantastic hotels in Manhatten. As my daughter recently moved to the UWS we decided to try the Arthouse for the first and LAST time. The location is great, rooms quite reasonable although quite basic but the hotel seems to foster an attitude by its staff towards guests as if they are doing me a favor letting me stay there instead of welcoming me as a $400 per night paying guest. The staff members are all simply rude - from beginning to end. Upon arrival, no one really is available to help with luggage at reception no one even tried to smile or be basically polite. We called downstairs to ask for help making a reservation in the restaurant that is in the lobby and were told " here is the number call them yourselves", I asked for an explanation for charges on my bill and was simply refused an answer, room was not cleaned one day and when we complained the housekeeping staff member literality screamed at my wife for daring to complain, and on and on all week long. It really feels likes management has offered the team training of how to mistreat guests.I have news for you Arthouse management - there are plenty of good alternatives in NYC!

I have stayed here 5 or 6 times. It could be a great for the money but it falls short in certain areas. The good is that it is in a great location.....W77 and Broadway with lots of restaurants and delis around open late. Central Park is only 3 blocks away and the West Side local is one block away. The West Side express is only 5 blocks away. The rooms are very clean, the beds are comfortable and the lobby area is quite nice. The price is also very reasonable for NYC. There is also an Equinox Gym only 1 block away. You can buy a day pass there if you are not an Equinox member. The negative is that while housekeeping and staff in general are very pleasant and efficient front desk staff is consistently sub par. Too often front desk staff have been unhelpful and below what I experience in other hotels. Twice now I have asked for quiet rooms only to be placed next to the elevator. Both times my room was changed so there were other rooms available. It seems like just laziness or a lack of willingness to accommodate guests. One gentleman in particular stands out as being very poor and I have been checked in by him a few times in the past year. It is an unfortunate welcome or lack of welcome to an otherwise nice hotel. I usually book a Superior King room or above. I have noticed that the Superior King rooms vary in size which is odd. Usually hotel rooms in the same category are pretty similar in size. I will likely stay here again because of the pluses. However I now anticipate a sub par check in experience and a lack of certainty of what size room I will get since there does not appear to be consistency. You should also know that you need to go above the King Superior class room to get an armchair in your room although many of the King Superiors do have room for them. It’s overall a good hotel with an often unpleasant check in experience.

We spent three nights here in late September and really enjoyed ourselves. The hotel is conveniently located and has an abundance of amenities for a smallish hotel. We'll definitely return the next time we visit NYC.

Excellent staff. Restaurant at location was very good. Bed was great. My only complaint was that I wish the art on the upper floors were a better quality. If there were beautiful posters it would have been better than the work hanging.

The Arthouse hotel is in a great location: close to Central Park and numerous attractions on the Upper West Side. The staff is very friendly and helpful. There is an excellent restaurant next door. The room was clean, and the furnishings are adequate. Free internet was a nice bonus. This is our favorite place to stay when we visit New York.

We had a great time at Arthouse Hotel, this was mine and my sister's first trip to NYC and Arthouse Hotel accommodated our stay perfectly.The concierge kindly upgraded our room to a twin room without charge which allowed us a little more space during our stay.Beds were super comfy, the blinds were blackout and the air con kept the room to a perfect temp. All of the staff at Arthouse that we encountered were super lovely, from concierge to the porters, maintenance and bar staff. Cannot recommend enough!Concierge granted us an extra hour to check out and the front of house were very helpful with our check out and mountains of luggage!

Poor service throughout the stay. Check-in was extremely long wait, required multiple trips to front desk. They could not accommodate early check-in, then later sent us to room that was not turned-over (trash everywhere, dirty bed, etc.). Front desk personnel were consistently rude and unhelpful throughout two day stay. They directed us to the wrong location for pre-wedding party, resulting in awkward encounters. Room itself was mediocre; fake brick wallpaper everywhere was laughable, cleanliness was ok, security good. Service alone would have me look elsewhere in the future.

I found that the employees are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great location and subway is close by to get around. Makes it easy to get around the city. We ate at two of the restaurants in the hotel both where very good. The rooms where clean and the bed was comfortable.

Great location, large room, quiet, timely housekeeping services. We love the Upper West Side! Great shopping and dining.The bar/lobby area is beautiful with a really good vibe. Would definitely stay here again.

Will not recommend this hotel. the room had only one chair, no mini fridge, no drawers, only two small night stands with shelves, one luggage rack. We overheard a couple (two adult females) after opening the door to their room say, "WOW it's a very tiny room".

Lived in NYC for 20-years, 20-years ago! Hotel located in my old neighborhood and Arthouse does it justice! A little funky, well maintained, excellent service and great location to Upper West Side sights, Central Park and subway line up/down Manhattan!

A flying visit to NYC en route to California and we stayed here. Loved it. Great hotel in a great location with friendly and knowledgeable staff. An oasis of stylish calm in the busy city, would stay here again.

Chic & sophisticated in Upper West / Manhattan. Highly recommend hotel as great neighborhood hideaway with multiple restaurant options, great service, and intimate décor. Telling all my family and friends.

The Upper West Side is a favorite destination for me. (In this case, Broadway and 77th Street.) For years I went to the same UWS hotel--which I still like, but it has not changed its decor or vibe in the last ten years. The Arthouse, on the other hand, is a revelation--it feels and looks trendy and cozy at the same time.The lobby has two levels with a softly lit bar on the street level that offers a fun place for a quick drink or for a long night of lively conversation with friends. The bar also features a red baby grand piano with music representative of an old Manhattan supper club. Don't get me wrong, the music is current, but not at all intrusive. I could actually hear my companions talk.The check-in area, which is small, is on the second level of the lobby. Also located there is a very big lounge area with a fireplace, overstuffed chairs and sofas--even a table set up for chess.The rooms are very comfortable, very clean, and the decor is loft-worthy. I had a king room and my companions had a doubles suite. Excellent beds, toiletries, and linens. The rooms and halls actually have original art (hence the name Arthouse) which makes the hotel feel more like an apartment than a sterile cookie-cutter hotel. Our rooms had street views with lots of light. I do, however, think a rug underneath the beds woulds soften the hard surface floors.The staff is courteous and friendly and gave us vouchers for a free drink and a bottle of wine for each room. Very, very nice touches--thank you.I came on a slightly less expensive day, so the prices were not too bad considering it is NYC. On other days, the hotel can be very expensive so flexibility will save you some money.The check-in procedure was all right, but I wasn't happy when I was told if I wanted an early check-in it would be an extra $50.00. I travel to NYC about four times a year and never heard of this practice. The other issue, which is why I gave only a 4-star vs. a 5-star, is the "resort fee". Come on! I think the fee was about $40-45.00 extra per room. Please stop with this nonsense and just tell us how much the room costs. Don't hide the real price behind a resort fee. I know this is a trend in the hotel business, but it has to stop. Maybe the Arthouse can lead the way. Just tell us how much the room really costs and let your guests decide if your hotel and location are worth the price.I think it is worth the price and plan to return with my husband very soon.Side note: I wasn't impressed with the breakfast at Serafina (an adjacent restaurant) The service was awful and their "basket of breads" was a croissant or toast--not both. There is a Starbuck's around the corner as an alternative. Please note that I used to like Serafina for lunch and dinner--maybe this time was just a fluke.

We have returned from a week at the Arthouse Hotel. We stayed in a loft room with a terrace which was added luxury to allow us to sit outside at the end of the day listening to the bustle from the street below. The bed was super comfortable and service was friendly and professional. The location is perfect - 10 minutes walk to Central Park, 3 minutes to the subway and 5 minutes to a range of great eateries.

I would strongly advise against booking with this hotel. They have a policy of charging fees at checkout that are not advertised at the time of booking. This is not a small amount of money. We were charged well in excess of $100. They charged my credit card automatically, despite my objecting for services we did not use and refused to refund me in full. When I asked for evidence that I had consented to the charges I was given a form relating to a different room signed by another couple in our party. They could not find a form I had signed. I asked the receptionist to show me where on my confirmation I had been told about the charges. She couldn't. A quick internet search reveals this is a frowned-upon practice employed by some unscrupulous hotels to avoid paying tax. If this isn't enough to put you off I would describe the hotel as roomier than a travelodge but more dated. There's nowhere to hang a towel after you've used it, the sockets in the rooms spark when you plug anything in, the lighting is inconvenient and insufficent. Actually the whole hotel is dark. I think it's supposed to be atmospheric but is actually gloomy. There was nowhere in the whole building I could find to apply make-up where I could see what I was doing. Just not a good experience. Go somewhere else.

We visited NYC for the first time in October with our 10 month old and couldn’t be happier with our decision to stay at Arthouse Hotel. It was a perfect location and they were so accommodating! Special thanks to Eduardo for all his help! We will definitely be back!

We LOVED Art House!! Had a smallish issue with room upgrade but the Manager Lisanne Ali, and evening shift front desk folks Hugo and Tasha quickly took care of the problem! It's a great place to stay on the Upper Westside which is a lovely neighborhood and so close to Central Park, Museum of Natural History and Metropolitan Museum of Art. Loved walking all over the City.. I LOVE NYC!

We always enjoy staying at this hotel when in NYC. Upper West Side location. Close to Subway. Fun bar in the lobby. Highly recomend when staying on the Upper West Side. Bed very comfortable. We brought our dog!

This is the type of business that gives New York a bad name. Knowing I booked a refundable room, when I needed to cancel almost 2 MONTHS IN ADVANCE they refused to give the refund. Dispicable.Do not expect to be treated fairly in any way by this establishment.

Great location, comfortable rooms. Pleasant staff. Quick and convenient response to all requests. Convenient and nice restaurant Serafina on the ground floor. 15 min to central park and to Metropolitan Opera

Nice clean hotel located on Broadway, close to the subway 1,2 and 3. Central park is three blocks from here. Room was small and they charge a major urban fee per night. There is a compact gym and a two small rooftop terraces.

Went there for a business trip. The original block booking included tiny double beds (although the reservation was for a standard queen). Called down to the front desk and they said "we don't guarantee bed sized". Got an email that night asking for any comment on my stay and I explained the situation and my disappointment. They upgraded me to a king the next day! Excellent service!

This was my 4th visit to this location. It’s not perfect, but the rooms are big for NYC and the location on the UWS near Central Park can’t be beat. Overall it’s good. Nice and clean. There were a few let downs this visit though. One night for 3-4 calls I couldn’t get anyone to answer the phone at the front desk. The next night I asked for my laundry to be brought up. I fell asleep and woke up 2 hours later and it had never been delivered. I called and told them I would just get it the next day. Upon returning to my room around midnight the next day, my laundry was hanging on my doorknob and had been there all day. Luckily no one had stolen my $200 dress shirt after it being there all day. The elevators are an issue. They are small and slow, and at all times only one side was working. The workers use the same elevators so you are always sharing with housekeeping and maintenance or waiting for the next available to come because it is full. I spent more time on the stairs than I did riding an elevator. Get a high floor. Just about every night there is a party or reception in the lobby with loud music. Sounds like I am being crabby, this is overall a good hotel and I will return. Hopefully things will be tuned up before my next visit.

Great hotel, great price, great people. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. Front desk staff (you know who you are, if you're reading this) deliver outstanding service. Hotel is quiet when you need it to be, and livelt when you don't. Kudos!

Excellent boutique hotel. Attentive staff. Beautiful lobby decor. Room itself had some strange furniture (lockers instead of cupboard), and no fridge. But otherwise an excellent experience, about a 40 minute walk for Times Square.

This was my first visit since the name change from NYLO. Basic hotel remains the same, with superb front desk personnel. Beds are extremely comfortable. However, storage/cabinetry in the bedroom is extremely basic and there is minimal shelving in the bathroom for toiletries, especially for my wife. But the fact that the rooms are so quiet keeps me coming back. You would think you are the only one on the floor. The lobby bar was much more accommodating, although service was a bit lean. Having the Serafina Restaurant attached is a definite positive!

Checked in after booking on Hotels Tonight and get told about an “Urban Fee”- $39 for the gym, WiFi, and a welcome drink. “Well what if I don’t want any of those, besides shouldn’t WiFi be included in this day and age?” I ask. I’m told I have no choice. The welcome drink coupon only works for their cheap wine selection FYI. Showers take forever to get warm. Bar as well as front desk staff completely unfriendly. Will never stay here again nor will I recommend to anyone.

We love the Arthouse Hotel on the UWS of NYC. The location is great, the rooms are cool and the place is hopping. The addition of the cafe and outdoor seating along 77th Street is a bonus during good weather. We always enjoy staying there and look forward to our next visit.

Great hotel, great location, but very expensive! Was charged extra's that we didnt use. The bar was too cold to sit comfortly, because of the airco too high. The bar was changed every morning into a kosher bakery where we had the greatest breakfast ever! I forgot something in our room, about which I tried to contact the hotel ( 3x mail and a phonecall) , but no reaction at all! That's not good...

Art house hotel is fantastic.This is a great place to stay in the city. It has an open air bar and a great feel about it, a great vibe. They have a really nice restaurant, but the location is fantastic. We found the staff to be extremely helpful and polite. We could not believe how comfortable the bed was!

Hotel was fine and location was good. Room was clean and well serviced.My two night stay in New York was marred by hidden taxes, I returned home to find charges on my credit card when I was told on departure my bill was zero.After numerous unanswered emails, I eventually received a copy of account to find I’d been charged $98 for hidden taxes. $39 Urban fee per night for the room then taxes which were taxed again.This was a two day stop over before boarding a cruise, Been there done it ripped off and felt robbed.I’m now convinced that USA is top of my list of places to avoid.

I love the the Arthouse formerly  NYLO hotel on Broadway. The first time I stayed there I was at a relatively disturbing time in my life and I must have left my phone in the lobby 4 or 5 times-   the first time I went down to embarrassingly recuperate it. The next 3 or 4 times they phoned and once even brought it back.....  Grinning The reason I left the phone was that the lobby is Soooooo comfortable and homey - the bar was a garage or maybe even a stable the building is old enough...  Now a convivial place for a drink  -- the lobby has cozy couches in corners and a giant chess game - a  couple of computers - books books "fireplace" But special thanks to the security person I called and  Lisanne the manager who sat in my room with me when I called down after clumsily hitting my head on the tub. and arranged for me to check out a little later than usual All is well I am hardheaded but it was nice to know someone was there even in a hotel half way around the world from where I live.!!And I ll be back later this week !!Thanks guys Merrily

This boutique hotel is a gem. Our room was spacious and charming and the staff delightful. It is close to subway stations, lots of restaurants and Central Park is only a couple of blocks away. We arrived early and the lady at the front desk worked her magic so that we could check in. We were given a chit for a welcome drink in the bar which was appreciated after a long day on our feet. We have found our new home away from home in NYC.

The hotel is in an great location in the UWS. Close to subway, CVS and other shops. The room we stay in was big and spacious however no fridge, microwave and only these containers to put clothes in. The bathroom had no space to put your own toiletries eventhough it was big enough to have more shelving. There was issues with the hot water but didn’t think to complain. The staff are somewhat helpful, if they are in a good mood. All other times they ignore or don’t really make you feel welcome. The bar staff are hot and cold - one night sat at the bar and was waiting around 5-10mins to be served - and you couldn’t miss us - the staff did not make eye contact and didn’t even look our way and we were the only patrons at the bar on one side of it. In the end we walked out without getting drinks. Great way to look after paying guests. Then we asked the front desk to book a taxi to the airport the next day. We get downstairs noting that a cab was there but got told that another car was the hotel car. We realised that this was an Uber and asked who ordered this and paying for it. To which it was advise that we would be paying $75USD. we could have gotten a flat rate of $52USD in the cab. Don’t fall for this scam from the hotel. We have put in a complaint. Then one night - in front of guests including me - a hotel manager and other staff member had a very heated discussion in the lobby and near the piano with a man about a bus. This should have been taken to a private room away from hotel guests. Very unprofessional way to deal with a very upset angry man that had issues with your hotel in the first place. Great place but watch out for he hidden agendas.

I stay here all the time for family reasons but still recommend the stay for persons on somewhat of a budget and able to use the subway to get around New York. 2 Blocks for the 1 train, and every imaginable good food store in the city. Great restaurants including Red Farm!

great location, excellent and personaI service given especially by Ms Jessie. Some problems with the water system which was fixed the next morning. The hotel took resposibility, and we were compensated for the inconvenience. The restaurant served excellent food. As mentioned before, we were not aware that the price of the room changes every night. We spent more money than we planned to apend.

We have loved staying here in the past few years but regrettably will have to find another place to stay when in the City. The beds are just too high for us to feel safe.We also had called the hotel multiple times to assure the room we had requested.When we doublechecked on the day prior to our arrival, we were told there were no such notes on our record. Very disappointed in this.Cleaning staff and bell staff and others throughout the hotel are personable and helpful. Special kudos to Jose!

So nice to find an affordable hotel in this part of town. One that is really nice! I will stay here again whenever I'm in town for business which takes me to the UWS. There is parking within a block of the hotel and the restaurant which is connected to the hotel is superb! This was my 2nd stay but won't be the last!

The first room we were given was minute and the second was right over the entrance and the noise of cleaning truck began at 6 a.m. and was unbearable. The sink was inconvenient and other small amenities were no longer available. There were extra unforeseen charges as well. The attitude of the staff was surly and ungracious. I have been to this hotel a number of times previously but I will not return.

Loved the hotel. Everything I expected. Very helpful and friendly staff. Rooms were great. Upgraded room on second night to a bigger room with city view. Planning a trip to come back in October and will definitely be staying at the Arthouse!!

Small rooms (like many in New York but still not so nice), staff was generally unpleasant and busy doing their own thing. They are big steps in the entrance and not always someone to help pick up luggage or operate elevator.

A hotel where everything works just as it should and you don't have to think twice. In a great neighborhood, quiet and central. Fabulous bakery in lobby that converts to a bar each evening. Also nice to have a 24hr CVS just across the street.

I keep coming back to the hotel because the location is perfect for me, the staff knows me now and I get excellent service. I feel very welcome at the hotel. I love the loft rooms with terraces because they are roomy and afford me a view of the river. Since most of my stays are at least a week, I like having a larger space to live in.

Arthouse earlier called Nylo is a nice boutique hotel in the heart of NY. The staff are very courteous and they help to make the stay comfortable. Serafina breakfast is also a great experience. All in all a great experience.

We spent the weekend at Arthouse for both work and to celebrate a birthday. The business center was very helpful and Jessie treated us like family and made our birthday extra special. I was very pleased with my stay at Arthouse.

Always been one of my favourite hotels in NYC, despite changing ownership/names three times since I started staying there. Rooms are comfortable (and not a bad size), bar area and staff generally pretty good. Neighbourhood more relaxed then the hustle and bustle of the the Times Square side of Manhattan, with good restaurants and plenty to do.The room we had (423) was dark and had no view or access to sunlight (wouldn't recommend this room!). Have stayed at the hotel over 10 times, never any records of previous guests and if they expect guests to be loyal, they should recognise them in return.

Great lobby scene night and day.Love the bed and pillows...the rest of the room is below average.Plastic furniture in the room was low class quality.But, overall, the room was horrible simple and quiet. We like quiet in NYC

Regular business and social visits to NYC. Have stayed in dozens of hotels. For last 5 years all my stays have been Arthouse (formerly) NYLO. Great value, love the neighbouirhood, away from tourist bustle, clean rooms, etc.

For many years we have regularly come to Manhattan for both business and pleasure. Our daughter moved to Manhattan 15 years ago then to the Upper West Side 4 years ago. That is when we discovered the Arthouse, formerly the NYLO and we loved it!  When our daughter decided to be married in the Conservatory Gardens with a reception at the Loab Boathouse in Central Park, one of the guest services staff at the desk suggested we think about the Arthouse for our out of town guests which turned out to be one of the best suggestions through the wedding planning process. We chose the Arthouse as the hotel for our family and friends because of its convenience to Central Park (the wedding venue) as well as its easy access restaurants, museums, and shops, without the chaos of other parts of the city. Yet there is easy access to other parts of the city by walking or subway. And it is in a relatively quiet area of the city with schools and residential neighborhoods all around. There is also a great bar in the hotel lobby area which is converted to a bakery coffee shop/ cafe named Patis during the early part of the day which has the best bagel you will ever eat!  Some of our guests had rarely or never been to NYC so they were a bit nervous about the experience. We created gift bags for the guests which included maps and guides to the city provided by the Arthouse which the desk staff graciously pressed to guests upon their arrival. That certainly increased their comfort level as well as the fact that the decor of the lobby area is warm and inviting. We also arranged a drop in on the event before the wedding which included appetizers from 2 selected Arthouse caterers and drinks from the Arthouse bar. It was held in the library which is an area off the bar. Everything was perfect that evening. We used the loft suite for the bride to get ready the next day which also worked out perfectly.  From the moment we began the planning with the sales team to the event coordinator to the guest service staff to the bell hop staff to the custodial staff to the bartenders to the various managers of the Arthouse our experience and that of our guests could not have been more perfect. Whether you are coming for an overnight or a week, for business or pleasure, we are convinced it is the best place in the city to stay, home away from home!

Nice blend of the new and old. Comfortable and clean rooms and easily accessible to Broadway for transportation. Cordial staff and the doormen were so helpful. Workout room definitely average. Tucked away on a quiet street, low noise unless the firehall receives a call. Enjoyed are stay very much.

When you have been travelling for in excess of 12 hours. You’ve negotiated a strange railway system and alien subways dragged your bags across Manhattan and emerged into a New York downpour. You arrive at your Hotel soaked and exhausted all you want is a welcome smile and some kindness. We arrived at the ArtHouse after such a journey. Whilst we were rescued at the front door by a welcoming porter who took my bag and guided us to reception the receptionist couldn’t have given a flying fig. All we got from her was an abrupt “ all I want is your Id and credit card”. Wow! Clearly not a graduate of the New York charm school. She then took my card put it through a machine with no conversation or explanation , handed us a key and told us where the lifts were. The room a Superior king was exceptionally comfortable and clean. On the 8th floor at the rear it was also quiet. The room was a good size and had a good range of toiletries and a nice coffee machine. The room was serviced daily and replenished. It’s a very welcome place to relax at the end of an exhausting day in NYC. Unfortunately a lift broke down on Friday evening and still wasn’t repaired when we left on Wednesday. This did present a delay when wanting to get to and from the room. We did try the stairs but were very surprised to find they are a storage area for house keeping and of all sorts of things. Clearly different rules for fire exits in the USA. As in the UK they have to be kept clear. I had a coffee and a pastry one morning in the bar. Which becomes Patis Bakery during the morning. It was delicious but quite pricey at over $10 for coffee and a pastry. We can highly recommend the bagel shop round the corner on Amsterdam called the Bagel Stop. Doesn’t look much from the outside but the bagels are delicious. On Sunday the queue was up the street! We did also eat in Serafina one evening. My meal was lovely but again over priced. We ate at the State Bar and Grill in the Empire State and had 3 courses for comparatively less, and it was 100 x better. But to be fair this is not part of the hotel and so is not reflected in my star rating. Overall The ArtHouse is a clean and a very comfortable place to stay in New York in a quiet location. It has a trendy feel and is very pleasant. But it is impersonal, we stayed 5 nights and I don’t think anyone noticed us. I would recommend as long as you moderate your expectations and think of it more as a very up market Hilton Express or similar you be on the right lines.

This hotel has the best bed I've ever slept in. I am extremely fussy when it comes to mattress quality and sleep quality at a hotel. The Arthouse really delivered on both fronts. Rooms are a decent size (we had a king), it's in a great location, the bar is fun and well served (but they do need to fix the horrible flickering lights above the bar - several people agreed that they couldn't sit there because it was making them feel ill). Next for restaurant Serafina is good for breakfast and the dimsum restaurant Red Farm is pricey but superb. Both are part of the hotel block. One complaint on pillows: they were too soft and had no structure so bunched up. I brought my own pillow but my husband was uncomfortable at times. They didn't have any other types of pillows. Thoroughly recommend the hotel. Great staff and immaculate.

Excellent accomodations and friendly staff. We were also able to check in early. Great location! Lots of food options around. We travelled with our baby and had a great experience. We were recommended an upgrade from our basic room to have more space for the baby to crawl around and it worked out well.

Wedding contract not followed. Checked in late. Two of four elevators broken. Told us the room was ready when it wasn’t. Didn’t hand out gift bags to guest. Bar Closed early when I had 30 plus people ready to drink. Was approved in contract!!! Staff was not aware of our morning after breakfast and gave us hard time. I could go on. They messed up a lot. And we’re rude in the process.
user_name:
klwjr10
New York City, New York

review_body: Staff very helpful, 30 mins walk to Times Square but subway 5 mins away, felt very safe, even at night. Would stay again. We pre booked our tickets with Attractions Direct.. Theatre ticket ( fab seats ) and Explorer ticket .. definitely worth doing.

We adored this hotel! It's hard to decide where to stay in New York as there are so many options, and it's a pricey city, but this hotel is so completely worth the money and more. The lobby is beautifully decorated with a great bar and live music each night. The rooms are a great size, decorated in a very modern way and the beds are SO comfortable! The location of the hotel is great - very near to central park and nice places to eat or drink. The Levain bakery is really nearby and does the best cookies we've ever tasted. We loved it here, and would love to come back! We will definitely be recommending here to any of our friends that go.

Love staying here! The service was awesome and the room was great. The bed was very comfortable! The terrace bar was lovely. The bar was fun. We will definitely stay here again next time we mvisit our daughter.

Great location, wonderful staff. Very friendly, attentive and accommodating. Special shout out to Margaret Zambrano who went above and beyond in making our stay great! We have resolved to get back to NY at least once a year. This is our second year and I have no reason to stay anywhere else.

We were in NYC for a family Bar Mitzvah and a block of rooms was reserved at the Arthouse.We were very disappointed- the room was tiny, dingy,poorly-lit and old. The only places to put clothes were in crates or on shelves that looked dirty. The bathroom was tiny, with virtually no place to put toiletries. We paid a lot of money for this room and would never stay there again.

Starting with the good: you are in a highly prized area of the upper West side, striking distance from many amazing restaurants and Central Park etc. Sorry to say it’s downhill fast after that. What seems like it should be a luxury hotel in a great area quickly faded into something much less for us. Some of the most flagrant customer service oversights included (but are in no way limited to);1. Having a massive leak wake us up around 4:30 AM and getting a seriously zero response from the hotel staff. We had to take care of using our trash can to prevent water leaking all over our hotel room and using all our towels to keep our room from flooding. The hotel didn’t even follow up with us in the following days on the issue and see if we were ok, additionally we had to call several times to get more towels the following day and explain why we had no dry towels left in our room. 2. ‘Connie Wang” is allegedly the hotel GM and emails you a boiler plate message to reach out personally should you need anything. To say the least, I reached out and never heard back, not even a “she’s away right now” message. When you open yourself to your guests to be at their service it is essential to follow through. I’m thoroughly unimpressed by the lack of follow through here. If there is or ever was a Connie Wang General Manager of Arthouse Hotel I assure you she made every effort NOT to make herself available to me in my time of urgent need and distress. Expect nothing. 3. I find if extremely insulting that on my very last night of a 7 night stay, you decide to deliver a “welcome note” and complimentary bottle of red Spanish wine. Wow. Really? All I want is to have my room leak addressed and to speak with the Gm and my last night what should have been in my room from when I first walked in is sitting there? Amazing. Would not recommend staying here unless you get a killer price or you just don’t care about sub par service for $300-400 per night. Connie Wang, if you’re seeing this, yes, I want to speak with you, still. That is all.

I liked the hotel--mainly the staff was lovely. What I didn't like were the fees--I don't know what I got for the fees. Also, one of the elevators wasn't working so I had to wait a long time for the elevator. It's an old hotel, but it is charming. I'd probably stay there again, though I think it's expensive for what you get--but New York is very expensive.

Hotel was very nice, lovely to be out of the hustle and bustle, Staff very welcoming and helpful. Very close to the subway and bus routes, resturant attached to hotlel very nice too. Only downside is the Urban Charge $44 dollars per night you receive on checkout, not quite sure what you get for this..but do believe most hotels in New York charge this, All in all a great place to stay in New York...

Great location. Clean, fresh room. I would prefer a bit more natural light, but that is a factor of the windows facing other buildings, etc. Overall enjoyable stay. I would definitely stay here again.

It served its purpose for us but nothing much more. It was a clean room, really good location. We loved the piano player in the lobby in the evening. But we didn’t feel it was something really special. I’m not sure I would run back.

The service here went above and beyond. The room was small but well appointed. Very clean and comfortable. The noise level was even low which is incredible for NYC. Would definitely stay here again. Very much recommend.

Super clean and functional room. WIFI was fast and reliable. Very courteous staff. I felt welcomed right when I arrived. Really close to the #1 at 79th Street so getting around is convenient. I highly recommend the Arthouse!

There are rooms with views and quietier rooms in the back whatever your preference. I've stayed twice and cant bit the price, location and very comfortable beds. Its modern, feels secure and they were very accomodating.

I will come back here again. The entire hotel has a great vibe and is up-to-date, very clean and friendly. The whole first floor is dedicated to the comfort of all their guests with a permanent chess table, multiple seating areas, a computer with internet access, and a bar/patisserie,

This hotel has it all! Great style, amenities and service. Location is wonderful and I will stay here again and again. Any needs or concerns were quickly handled, nothing serious, just more towels , light bulb went out in shower and it was quickly replaced ,,staff friendly and helpful. NIce amenities too!

The Arthouse Hotel is a sparkling surprise with the famous Central Park in the background. This hotel greets you with a friendly bar through which you could access the reception desk with courteous and friendly staff, Serafina, one of the most popular restaurants of New York is accessible through the hotel's side door. The room was exceptionally clean and equipped by a user friendly safe. A hub subway station is also nearby where tourists could hop into number 1 train and explore the many attractions of NYC such as Broadway theater district, the Greenwich Village and the Highland Park. Also this hotel is one of the very few that is dog friendly with a moderate $40 per night extra charge. And because of its proximity to the Central Park (2 street corners away), when peace and distance from the madding crowd is desired, this is definitely the hotel to stay.
user_name:
Rogelio Ramos G
New York City, New York

review_body: Excellent location. Wonderful service. Courteous staff and responsive to our needs. A compact, boutique hotel that is very well situated on the Upper West Side. It serves as an excellent launching point for exploring Central Park, museums, and the like.

We were going to a concert at the United Palace and wanted a hotel in upper Manhattan. Decided on The Arthouse and wasn’t disappointed. I booked early and got a very good rate. However, once you get the bill, there are quite a lot of fees and then tacking on valet parking. NY is expensive so I was expecting it. Loved the ambiance of the hotel. It’s not a huge chain hotel and that was the charm. It had an eclectic décor. Modern yet funky. The bar area was great with a garage door that was up since the weather was so nice. You were inside yet outside. Our room was on the 11th floor overlooking Broadway. Room was small, but that was expected too. Surprisingly little street noise. There was a Keurig so you get some coffee before you started your day. No issue with Wifi. They have a nice outdoor terrace on the 14th? Floor. We took advantage of that in the evening when we got back to the hotel. Very nice place to have a cocktail. I can’t tell you a time when every employee of a hotel greeted you and asked how is your stay, but they did at The Arthouse. Even texted me a few times to ask how everything was. Very friendly staff. They have a restaurant connected to the hotel, Serafina. We ate there one night. Had a great Bolognese. Also, had breakfast (average) there before we checked out. Convenient.
