They deliver to your room at the hotel, but not for breakfast. Lots of dining options in the area, though. Very close to the Met which we went to see an exhibit. Loved The Arthouse!

We have stayed here previously, and like the location and atmosphere of the hotel. The lobby is nice and we liked the bar area, which had good live music on the weekend. The hotel is a little expensive for what you get but we were satisfied with the room and the service. We were frustrated with the daily $40 "urban fee", which is added on to the regular room rate. It's not exactly hidden when reserving a room on line, but it's deceptive, none the less.

Great boutique hotel just a few blocks from Central Park. They have excellent staff - very friendly and helpful. Rooms are nice and fabulous bar and lounge area. Very "chill" location with lots of shops and restaurants close by. Much quieter than downtown or Times Square.

The hotel is centrally located and even though it's right across from a fire station we were not unduly disturbed. The room accommodations were excellent and the staff was friendly and very helpful. Dinner at Serafina's was the BEST pasta I've ever had. Loved the artwork in the rooms and the peaceful neutral colors throughout.

We have been coming here for years. Just always exceeds our expectations. The staff listens. They are on point and care about how to make your stay the best. We are never disappointed and will be back soo!

Nice large rooms, very clean, staff is very friendly, cosy bar, nice neighbourhood, great terrasses on the roofWe certainly come back! The Serafina restaurant was very classy, we went there twice, the food was very good.

We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Arthouse Hotel and cannot recommend this hotel enough. Really lovely area, great hotel and amazing staff! Free welcome drink for the adults and lovely chocolates for the kids.During our 2nd night there was a battery issue with the smoke alarm in our room (1.30am) but the staff responded immediately and although they were unable to resolve the issue we were quickly accommodated in a nearby room for the rest of the night and then upgraded to a suite the following night as a gesture of goodwill.Rooms were immaculate, staff were exceptional, providing lots of useful information about the area and points of interest. Nice bar area to relax after a long day and the attached restaurant had the most amazing breakfasts!Will definitely return on our next visit to NYC. Thank you x

Booked an ADA Junior Suite Two Queens room for elderly grandparents (~90 yrs old). When we arrived, the check in tried to book us into a similar but non accessible room saying only that we "received an upgrade". Had I not been there for check in, they would have been in real trouble - getting a straight answer that we had indeed booked an accessible room and that they were trying to put us in a non accessible room was like pulling teeth. No one was able to help except for one very busy manager. After a very long minute wait, she sent us to a room we wouldn't be staying in to wait for the new room, that is a tough trip for an elderly couple who just wants to get settled after a long day of travel (we checked in 5-6 hours after normal check in time, so our room not being ready is not ok). We were stranded in a room they wouldn't be staying in and an hour later we were moved to the right room but only after several calls to pressure them to move us. The new ADA room had beds that were way too high for an accessible room / elderly person, the bathroom had no hot water, and the bathroom was like a skating rink after a shower with no bars to navigate out of the room for those who are not in a wheel chair -- this created a very dangerous situation. The room was on the 2nd floor and had only one chair even though a the jr. suite picture on the website had 2 chairs and a desk and said that the units are only located on the 14-16th floors - I feel we didn't even get what we booked, but I can't be sure because this was not explained. To top it off, one of the jr. employees at the front desk said something to the effect of "I know it must be hard travelling with family this age" which is really condescending - It's hard travelling when the hotel doesn't provide what it advertises. At the outset before most of the other issues were even experienced the manager offered $100 off of the room. At the end, she explained that she would see what else she could do and correspond with me over email. Days later and no one emailed me except for an automated feedback form. When I submitted this review to the feedback form, the hotel's response came from a no-reply email address to which I couldn't reply! It's 2019, allow your customers to reply to your emails.

Loved the location close to Central Park and century 21 :) and was very impressed with the sweet welcome gift and drink voucher. Bed was super comfortable. Room was spacious compared to many micro hotel rooms in nyc.

Very cozy and comfortable hotel, would stay here again. We got stuck in the elevator when it stopped working between floors and staff were quick to help us out and make sure we were safe. Great lounge/bar in the evening with excellent music that becomes a decent coffee and bake shop in the morning.

Stayed for one night while dropping my daughter off at Columbia... great location with easy access to both Central and Riverside Parks. Very convenient to restaurants, stores and the subway. Staff was incredibly welcoming and responsive. My room was very quiet and the bed extremely comfortable. My only complaint was the lack of a mini-fridge and/or water bottles.

Really pleased with the location of the hotel - perfect spot in Upper West Side. Close to the subway & with reasonable bars, cafes locally. Personally, I'd recommend Levain Bakery just round the corner for breakfast. Rooms are small, but were good for a base for our stay in New York. Roof top area a lot smaller then shown (and not a bar). A few problems with the bill - took two attempts to get incorrect items removed.

don't plan on spending any time in your room other than sleeping because of how small it wasbathroom reminiscent of airplane bathroomminimalist furnishing... room was clean our room faced small inner court and was quiet no chair to sit on

Too much went wrong on my visit. Air conditioning did not work our room. Two of the four elevators were broken making up and down painfully slow. The gym was small. That said great location and funky.

Our stay at the Arthouse Hotel was fantastic! Rooms were super clean and comfortable; hotel staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. Location is perfect - plenty of restaurants and shops within short walking distance. Will be staying here again!

We travel a decent amount to different places and this is our favorite place to stay! We love the hotel! It is in a great location in nyc and very safe! It’s got a really cool bar/lounge area where you could easily enjoy yourself without ever leaving the hotel. The staff is great and the beds are the most comfortable that we’ve ever slept in! In fact, my wife was unzipping the mattress covers to see if we could purchase the same brand for our house! (Sadly, the mattresses are made exclusively for this hotel)!

A great find for business travel in NYC. A safe and slightly funky vibe. My room was much bigger then I expected and I loved sitting at the bar with its garage door open to the street having a glass of wine waiting for my niece to arrive. Staff is nice and very helpful! I’ll come here again.

Great, attractive hotel convenient to everything: the subway, Central Park, museums, restaurants, shopping and, importantly, Levain Bakery. The staff was extraordinarily helpful. The room was clean and comfortable.

I enjoyed staying at the Arthouse hotel. The staff were very nice and the location was excellent. I would choose this hotel again for my next visit to New York. I shared a room with my aunty and we both had our own very comfortable roomy bed.
user_name:
lsar699717
Hoek van Holland, The Netherlands

review_body: Rooms are fine with all necassary infrastructure, but not very large. Staff is friendly and supporitve. You are forces to sign for an urna fee whne ariving. We later found out that there are some "perks" e.g in the neighbourhood, but you didn´t get the information from the staff - very poor!!! The Urban fee plus tax is really relevant for your budget! We were confronted with an urban fee of 34 $ per room and a Sales tax(8,875%) and a City tax(5,875%) . we overall paid 633,- $ on top for two rooms and 8 nights!

Great location, more than comfortable room. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. I highly recommend the loft with terrace and river view. Only thing that kept our stay from being perfect was the lack of breakfast room service.

Interesting boutique hotel at 77th and Broadway. Pluses: Great location, especially if you're a walker. Close to subway. Restaurants on site. Helpful staff. Comfortable beds. Pretty quiet. Lots of television channels. Minuses: hard to get hot water hot enough; sinks are poorly designed; rooms slightly cramped; slow elevators; hard to turn on shower without getting wet;always tell your Lyft/Uber/taxi that front of hotel/pickup is on 77th, not Broadway; sometimes music in lobby was too loud.

Very nice view from our Terrace. Located in a safe area with lots of Restaurants and shopping around. Only issue was the Slow Elevator service. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Clean Room had no issues.

I always enjoy my stay here, I’ve been multiple times and will continue to make the Arthouse my “go to” place when staying in the city. The staff are both friendly and professional. I love the atmosphere of the hotel and the Serafina being next door is an added plus. The bar is an amazing place to relax and meet new people as well. Highly recommend the Arthouse!

Eclectic hotel, friendly staff, welcome cocktail, nice touches, modern decor. Stand-up comedy routines in the lounge for something different. Direct access to Serafina restaurant - yummy Italian fare.

I liked the hotel the first time we stayed, so I returned for a second visit. The location was perfect for our purposes and the property has a cool industrial aesthetic; not fancy, but it works. On our last visit, bed linens were clearly dirty, I found trash from the prior guest in the room. ugh. Front desk was extremely apologetic and refunded me $50, which is peanuts relative to the cost of a hotel room in New York City. While the token gesture was appreciated, it seemed a little limp. The small hotel bar opens to the sidewalk in warm weather, which is cute and European. I was issued a "complimentary welcome beverage" coupon to use at the bar, but was not told to tell the bartender FIRST when I ordered that I wanted to "pay" this way. Only a limited selection of drinks are available for use with the ticket. Based on what I wanted to drink, the bartender suggested a wine that I ended up having to pay $15 or so for the glass. He told me that I had to tell him before ordering that I had a beverage coupon. Who knew? Convenient to have family-friendly Serafina restaurant in the lobby. Terrific access to public transportation, Central Park, restaurants and more.

We have been coming to the Art house hotel for the past couple of years and have nothing but an amazing experience. Ramona, Lisanne, Joanna, and the rest of the staff have always gone out of there way for us to truly enjoy each and every trip we take to NY. For us there is no other place we would rather stay when we are in NY. We look forward to our next visit!

We have been staying at this hotel for 8 years, and I love it! Friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms that have been recently updated, and I love the bath products! The new cocktail bar/morning coffee bar in the lobby is a fantastic added convenience and has great atmosphere. This hotel is in a perfect location - close to transportation and Central Park, and the neighborhood is full of things to do, but it's QUIET at night and safe to walk around. I love it!

Stayed at this hotel last year during my trip to NYC in December of 2018 for the Christmas holidays. When we first arrived there was valet to park our car, they also helped us with our luggage and brought it to the front desk. The front desk staff were amazing and very kind. They have a restaurant attached to the hotel which has good food. We took advantage of this one night after being out exploring all day. The room was awesome. Had a small window with a tiny view however, we were out for majority of the day. The bathroom was super nice and clean with a roomy shower. The king bed was super comfy! The room overall was very clean and even the cleaning staff were very friendly and accommodating. They had a candy theme going on when we stayed and had these fun tasty drinks at the hotel bar. I loved everything about this hotel and would definitely stay at it again if I came back to NYC!

The entire staff at the Arthouse pitched in to make our daughter's wedding weekend a dream come true. From before we checked in until our departure, everyone went out of their way to be helpful and courteous. The accommodations were well appointed and the vibe was warm and welcoming. Kudos to them all!

I will definitely be staying at the Arthouse again! The staff was great! Very concerned about our stay! Even the security guy was awesome. He waiting with us outside at 5am while we waited for our UBER driver. So friendly!

Great neighborhood! And, we got Exactly what we needed: 2 rooms separated by a door with a shared bathroom. We were there for 4 nights. So, if we had rented 2 separate rooms, that would have cost us at least $1,360 Additional. **It was almost impossible to get a 2 room suite with 2 separate rooms from this hotel. Their reservations staff was in Florida; and they have no idea what any of the rooms look like. Also, all of the suites have different floor plans. So, getting a suite with 2 rooms separated by a door required more than a dozen phone calls. Apparently, no one had cleaned under the sofa bed for a long time. But, the rest of the suite was very clean.

The staff, the rooms , value and location made this a must stay for me next time I come to New York. Such a lovely stay with service that is unsurpassed. Thank you Hugo and Johanna. Next time I am in town this is where I am staying.

If you're looking for a nice hotel near the subway, in a clean/safe neighborhood, the Arthouse Hotel is THE place to go. I was there for a week and from the moment my Uber dropped me off at the curb, the service was superb. Wynona at the front desk is so kind and accommodating. The entire staff from the bellmen, front desk, hospitality staff were excellent. I will definitely stay here in the future when visiting New York. The hotel is also located near a lot of great restaurants and minutes from the subway. It's 2 blocks(ish) away from Central Park as well.

We spend a week in New York and stayed at the Arthouse hotel.The room was small but clean, the beds comfortable. Was missing a proper place to sit.Some noise could be heard from the next door bedroom.Staff was friendly.Near the metro station and only a couple blocks from Central park.Would definitely consider it again for our next trip in New York.

Very clean, friendly staff, and cute enough of a hotel...all at a reasonable price and in a pretty good location. If for some reason you need to do things on the UWS, this is a great choice. And even if you're just a tourist looking to see the entire city, the location is still great as it's right next to the 1, very near Central and Riverside Parks, lots of cafes, etc.
user_name:
dhh1980
New York City, New York

review_body: The room was spacious for two people (not always the case in NYC); the location was great; the staff was friendly and helpful (also not always the case in NYC); the bar area with live music was a plus.

We had a lovely stay at the Arthouse. Rooms are very clean and uniquely appointed. Free cocktail upon arrival. Great location. Plenty of great shopping and restaurants. Close to the Beacon theater. Lincoln Center. Central Park. Columbus circle.

Second time to stay at this Upper West Side property. Great rates for Manhattan hotels. Great location near Central Park, Beacon Theater and subway lines. Cool public areas on ground floor make it an excellent place to hang out during down time.

This property is in a good location, central park is two blocks away as is the subway. The room was large for a nyc hotel and clean. The only issue was the hot water for the shower, took at least 5 minutes to get hot and then made a water hammer sound when the handle was turned all the way to the hot side. This was very loud and vibrated throughout the floor.

The Arthouse was a welcome respite from long, sticky days of exploring the city. it s walking distance to Central Park, the Natural History Museum and a Subway stop that can take you anywhere else. I traveled here with my 2 teenage sons and the hotel was a hip, boutique experience. We stayed in a Queen suite that had plenty of room for the 3 of us. I enjoyed cocktails in the lounge and my sons enjoyed the breakfast from Serafina. The staff was very friendly and courteous. We would definitely stay here again.

We had a well positive accomodation for our days in NY.Staff was kind and carefull. The rooms were clean and pretty much comfortable.Moreover the Hotel has a good strategic location with subway and important site closed to it.

Great location and a great hotel. Everyone was very helpful. Loved the terrace off of the room. The place was clean and airy and very comfortable. It was a wonderful place to stay since I was travelling by myself. Easy to get to the subway and explore.

we will do the same choice in next time. Good place to stay and easy do go anywhere. All of we asked, the professionals try to do the best and fast. Excelent experience. Our choose was a room with a view for the river. Fantastic sunset in the summer.

Great experience overall. I treated my mom there for an early birthday present and we very much enjoyed our time there! The room was cute and a great size. Dinner was delish at the hotels Italian restaurant. Last but certainly not least, Jessie at the front desk went above and beyond to help make our experience wonderful and special!

We appreciated the daily cleaning of the room. The hotel is located in a strategic position near subway line 1, almost 15 minutes to Time Square. Bed is very confortable. Considering the position and hotels pricing in Manhattan, Arthouse is the best combination between quality and price.

Stayed there for a night, were welcomed like return guests, and enjoyed the welcome drinks in the nice bar downstairs - cool groove, open to the street. Room was small but it has all one needs for a good night, and we loved the fact that there were no carpets - less dust and fewer chances for bugs and allergens. Great mattress and soft sheets. So we are going back! Highly recommended

I have stayed at this hotel for many years, through three different names -- On The Ave, NYLO New York, and now Arthouse. It is a comfortable hotel with a good restaurant (Serafina) adjacent to it. The bar scene in the hotel is lively. The location is terrific.

We spent one night at the hotel. The room was small, but very nicely appointed, and had a lovely view. Upon checking out, my husband left one of his shirts in the closet in the room. I contacted the hotel the very next morning, and was referred to housekeeping where I had to leave a voicemail. I am writing this review 8 days later, and after numerous phone calls and emails, no one has gotten back to me. I even said that someone from my family could pick the shirt up. Disappointed at the inattentiveness of the staff.

I booked for one night as part of a wedding group. They lost my reservation not once, not twice, but 3 times. The third time I had to stand at the desk for over an hour checking in while they looked for it. Yes, I had confirmation numbers.Then charged me for a "spa" fee that was not supposed to be on there and I'm still waiting for that back 6 weeks later. They also charged me for an "incidentals fee" which also should not have been charged since they put through the final bill after I checked out and had not charged any incidentals. Never have I seen such ineptness or inability to fix the problems.

The hotel is perfectly located between AMSTERDAM AV and Broadway. On Amsterdam there is a lots of goods restaurants. The museum MET and Guggenheim at less 30min bus and Time Square at less 20 min metro. There is also a really nice bar in the hotel and they give you a welcome drink. Definitely a great hotel.

This hotel was wonderful, near transportation and Central Park. It was quiet, clean, safe and a nice bathroom. The vibe was fun, good energy and a great bar. The staff was excellent- they upgraded my room and we had a beautiful view

Hotel location and room were ok although aircon was rather noisy, Staff were friendly. Not particularly good value. My strong objection is that although our rooms were prepaid, our conformation email stated that there was an additional 'Resort Fee' of over $44pd (total $134.25 for three nights). This was allegedly for things like 'Use of Gym, Telephone in room (but not calls), Wifi, Room Safe' etc. I said that I did not wish to use any of these 'facilities' and would not therefore be paying their resort fee. They said I had no option. Spoiled an otherwise pleasant stay...

Great location and nice friendly staff. Not really a fan of NYC, but had to stay a night and finally have a positive experience in the city. Everyone working there took time to talk to us and offer help. Wish I could have stayed another night. Proximity to Central Park and the museums was also a plus. Definitely got that ‘boutique’ hotel feel from Arthouse Hotel and enjoyed the stay.

$1100 for 3 Nights in one of the terrace rooms. Not the best of views but decent. Much smaller room than expected. The bathroom is incredibly cramped and the walls are hardly soundproof. The bed was very comfortable though, probably the best thing about the room honestly.There were some instances of lovely guest service and others where they seemed bothered to have to deal with me asking a question or ordering delivery. Actually, the more I consider it, the more I realize that it probably wasn't worth it. Even with its close proximity to Central Park and a 24-Hour CVS across the street, there's certainly better options. If you have your heart set on a room with a view, skip Arthouse.Also, they did not have a fridge in the room. Seems like common sense especially given how hot NY was during the stay, but nope.

Room was ready. Floors not vacuumed. Previous guests underwear in couch, shower not cleaned, stains on white comforters. Beds were comfortable. Larger than most in NY. Had to ask for ice bucket; none in room. Shower bugs living on ceiling. Vents dirty. Location OK. Doormen nice and helpful. Front desk personnel nice and eager to help. Cleanliness is an issue for hotel. So much potential; needs thorough CLEANING.

Great property, was my seventh stay. Had the junior suite. Love the lobby, staff and location. Struggled with pull out bed but a perfect space for three. The king bed was fabulous. Two TVs and small balcony. Also great for couple and a child.

Smooth and friendly check-in, clean room with outstanding view of the Hudson and beautiful rooftops of the upper west side buildings. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was not huge, but was well-designed with shelves for storage of toiletries. The lobby area has a wine bar/lounge that fits into the sidewalk seating and restaurant vibe of the area. If you’re lucky enough to stay on a day when Arthouse events are happening, you’ll get an extra treat. The only note I have is that the furniture needs to be re-thought and replaced with more comfortable and useful pieces. The high-concept design is nice, however, in the lighting fixtures and drapery.

We stayed here for 3 nights on a recommendation from friends. We found it really conveniently located, a few blocks from Central Park and the natural history museum. We used uber and cabs to get around which wasn’t that expensive to get to anywhere in Manhattan. We even walked from Times Square one evening.The hotel itself is quite trendy, with a cute little rooftop bar. We had some small issues that needed to be chased to get a resolution, but when the air con broke in our room on the hottest day of the year, they were incredibly efficient at finding us an alternative room, so acted promptly when it was important. I would certainly stay here again

Perfect location, 5 minute walk from the Park, and easily walkable to whatever else you need. Rooms are large (for NY) and clean, and the beds are SO comfy, I came home to my own bed and wished to be back in the hotel. That never happens. Also when I had an issue with the first room (too noisy for me based on location), they were able to switch me to a perfect one for what I wanted, no problem. Special thank you to the lovely Ramona, who really listened to what I wanted, and found the perfect room for me. All the staff was incredibly outgoing, helpful and friendly, though.

Stayed here for 3 nights and loved it . Rooms clean and spacious . Location great for subway and also walking distance to Central Park . Staff pleasant and welcoming . Definitely return to this great hotel .

Very nice hotel- close to so many attractions. Great coffee shops, cafes and restaurants nearby. Nice staff. Comfortable bed- room a bit small. Bartender was great! I would definitely stay here again. Only negative- the woman who checked us in didn't tell us about any of the amenities i.e. rooftop bar and how to get there as well as the $50 per day charge that would be refunded at the end of the stay.

Close to where we wanted to be. Great place to stay. Nice lounge and bar in the evening. The room was small, but just what we needed. Clean room and comfortable bed. Coffee maker for the morning. Would stay again and would recommend.

its a nice hotel. in a very nice area. we liked tthe room a lot. the bed (king size bed) was very comfortable. the staff were very helpful. overall we recommend that hotel and we hope to get back sometime.

Great lobby and art collection!! Cozy nooks to relax in and easy vibe. Staff very nice. Lots of shops and restaurants very close by and an easy going neighborhood. Bus and subway close by too. Happy to recommend this small hotel
user_name:
Roselyn A
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: "Urban Fees" tacked on an extra $50 per night. They tried to explain that this was similar to a resort fee when you visit an actual resort. But there were no extras. No entertainment. Nothing exclusive to guests. Extra fees were a blatant rip off.

Love this hotel. This was my second stay and I am still very pleased with the rooms, service, and overall experience. Plan to stay again when I am in NYC. I am from NYC and know how bad and dismissive hotels and hotel staff can be; this place is great all around

Room was super clean, excellent view, balcony could have been more inviting to enjoy-placement of chairs etc. Staff was super friendly and accommodating, easy check in and out, location was perfect, within min of driving,
user_name:
nlambr836225
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great location, accommodating hotel staff, and clean rooms with wood floors. The bed is excellent. Live jazz singer on Friday nights. The lobby is very inviting. We always stay at the Arthouse Hotel location when coming to New York City.

Always friendly and helpful, love the location and the upper floor rooms with terrace are special. Lots of great restaurants and things to do within walking distance. Public transportation two blocks walk and bus stop on the corner. Great place to stay in NY

The room was comfy and a fun alternative to my typical marriot stay. The hotel felt upscale but still homey and friendly. I got 2 free drink tickets and enjoyed my evening listening to the AMAZING live music. I ate in the restaurant in the hotel which was convenient since a huge storm and flood warning hit right as I started eating and I didn’t have to go outside at all. I’ll be booking here again next time I’m in NYC and recommending it to my colleagues

Beware hotel is charging a $39 urban fee on top of the price you can see on hotel booking platforms. Justified by free wifi, a bottle of water and free long distance calls (as if noone had a cell....)Nice surprise once you check-in!

I was very satisfied. The room was large & well appointed. The bed was super comfy. I had a small deck + nice view of the Hudson River. Staff was friendly and helpful. Location was perfect for me. Only drawback was water pressure in shower kind of weak. Otherwise I super pleased with my Arthouse experience.

We LOVED the atmosphere at Arthouse. The music was incredible, the ambience was great. Love hanging and drinking a glass of wine while doing some work. Loved that I could run in Central Park or spin or do yoga on the same block. We thoroughly enjoyed it.

Our second stay at the Arthouse. Both times we paid for suites with balconies. So worth it. We drank morning coffee and afternoon drinks on the balcony enjoying views of the Hudson River and Central Park. We also had great service, a big thanks to both Connie and Jessie at front desk. They made our stay even better.

A beautiful hotel, we loved the location, close to the subway. Nice and clean.The room was spacious, with very comfortable beds, the seats were also very comfy.A large bathroom with a small bath, great tv with loads of channels,We loved the outdoor terrace on the 16th floor, found this great at night instead of sitting in your room. All staff were very friendly and nothing was a bother. The bar and foyer area, was great to sit at, beautiful decor. I don’t think people realise how easy it is to get the subway into town from here, a gem of a spot. Lots of nearby coffee/ pastry shops, 24 hour CVS straight over the street. We would definitely stay here again.My only down side is the New York taxes, as a Brit were not used to that, could’ve had a weekend at centre parcs for the $$$ but that still doesn’t detract from a fantastic stay in New York, helped mostly by our Hotel choice and it’s location.

What a gem! We enjoyed everything about this hotel... excellent staff and service, clean clean clean AND fantastic location for our weekend getaway. Walking distance to subway, Central Park, Columbus Circle, great restaurants...

This is my second time staying at the Arthouse Hotel and I have never had a better hotel experience . All of the staff members from the front desk to the front door , to house keeping are so nice and helpful. The rooms are a decent size and always clean. It is a perfect location, located on the upper west side near trains and buses and walkable to a lot of great New York sites. I have recommend to any friend traveling to New York to stay at the Arthouse after my experiences there.

We enjoyed our stay at Arthouse. It is clean with a great mix of classic and modern touches. The hotel was in a great location for the wedding events we were attending and for accessing Central Park, but would be a jaunt from midtown or lower Manhattan.

The hotel is a very nice place and in a great location. Close to the center and yet quietly located. The staff is very friendly and to be found. The rooms have everything you need. The beds are very comfortable.

We always stay here. The location is great--near the subway and crosstown bus. The rooms are modern and not the usual cramped dreary Tom's in many NYC hotels that are reasonably priced. The service is great. Everyone is so pleasant.

Wow! A great hotel, the location is spot on with easy access to the subway, central park and Broadway.Very clean and modern, a nice bar area and staff that go out of their way to help you.Located well for shops, bars, cafes and restaurants.

The Arthouse Hotel was a pleasant respite away from the hustle and bustle of Midtown. Located on the Upper West Side, it is only blocks from Central Park and the subway station. They feature nicely re-done, clean rooms, a friendly staff, a coffee bar in the morning and alcohol bar in the afternoons & evenings. I felt so comfortable just relaxing in the lounge! I will definitely go there again. Thank you Tasha and Jessie for making our final day/night in New York so special - hope to see you again soon.

Loved this hotel. Centrally located and close to the American Museum of Natural History. It is charming and rooms aren't cookie cutter. Upper west side is underrated! Only complaint would be that it had mold along the tile grout which you could smell every time in the bathroom.

From start to finish the art house Hotel is pure comfort. A chic spot with boutique vibes and a great location. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay (particularly the most comfortable bed we've ever slept in)! Would definitely recommend.

Everything was excellent, friendly staff great service good location. Room had a wonderful view. They were a little slow with the check in process, but floor manager provided us with an extra drink voucher for the inconvenience. Would definitely recommend and we do plan on staying again before the end of summer

Just returned from a great week at the Arthouse hotel with partner and two young children. Great location in upper west side - ideally located for Central Park with plenty places to eat and drink nearby. Only a couple of minutes walk from subway which is definitely the quickest way to travel round New York. Ate twice at the restaurant that is attached to hotel and both times food very tasty. Hotel itself was great, lobby and bar area nice place to sit and relax as was the terrace on the 16th floor (great views). Room was immaculate and had everything you could need. It was cleaned to a high standard every day. The staff were all very welcoming and great with the kids - would definitely recommend

I will begin by admitting I have limited experience with NYC lodging. Typically, I am a loyal Marriott guy, but decided to try something different on this visit. The Arthouse is stylish, wonderfully located near Central Park (as well as other terrific places) and benefits from incredible customer service. Specifically, I would like to mention and genuinely thank Hugo from the front desk. From the time I checked in, Hugo was a fantastic resource to me. His kindness, professionalism and genuine interest in my comfort and NYC experience represents a level of customer care that is far too rare these days. Customer service is a difference maker for me and the kindness I was provided during my stay will have me coming back to the Arthouse for sure. Also want to share how great the guys who man the Arthouse Bar are.... great personalities, fun to chat with and excellent mixologists. The bar is quaint, but these guys make it so much fun to start your evening or wrap it up. Be sure to take your drinks up to the 16th floor terrace - great place to enjoy a cocktail. Also, much thanks to Wynae for her kindness at the front desk. Quality hotel and wonderful people!

At under $200, it's a good value. Rooms are consistently good, quiet and clean. Great neighborhood - parks, restaurants, museums, shopping. Convenient to subway and theater district. Rooms have safes, bottled water and coffee machine.

My stay at Arthouse was amazing! The location was perfect. The lobby and bar area were beautiful. My room was clean and comfortable. The staff were super friendly, helpful and accommodating. I will definitely stay at Arthouse again.

I arrived at the hotel and was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was great...the decor....lobby bar....the room! The staff at the front desk were exceptional. They were very personable and remembered me throughout my stay. The lobby and bar are both a comfortable, quaint venue. The bar also had someone playing the piano for most of the night. It is a very relaxing atmosphere. I had an amazing suite with 2 balconies, one overlooking the Hudson. I highly recommend this hotel for both business and pleasure. Maria V., the Director of Rooms was exceptionally helpful when I ran into a situation and did everything to rectify it. This is a true Gem located in the heart of the Upper West Side!!!!

Hotel is comfortable and stylish. Staff capable and friendly. Lobby , bar and area that can open to outside is stylish and good place to relax. Room clean but NO closet or clothing storage , just a tiny niche with curtain . Location good for us and access to Central Park, ny historic society, museum of natural history. Their booking procedures are deceptive in that the total you see is not the real total since a worthless “ urban fee” gets added in at checkout. We were delayed at checkin by guest complaining about this . If it weren’t for this would give it 3 1/2 * for where it is and the lobby and bar.

Exceptionally friendly staff and locals at the bar give this place a very comfortable vibe. Casual but trendy decor makes this the kind of place you want to come back to after a day at work in the City. This is quintessentially the Upper West Side.

If you’re looking for a cozy and convenient place to stay on the Upper West Side, I highly recommend this hotel. The rooms are lovely and quiet, the bathroom is spacious, and there are great dining options on site!

An amazing location on the upper west side of Manhattan - a fantastic location that is 5 minutes walk from Central Park and two handy subway stations (72nd and 79th). The hotel has great staff who are always on hand to help. We loved our room - ridiculously comfy bed and powerful shower. We were staying here with friends and we made great use of the bar and the rooftop bar. There are also loads of fantastic restaurants and bakeries as well as a 24 hour CVS (like Boots but with beer) across the road. We loved it and when we come back we will stay here again.

This hotel is the only place we would ever consider staying at. Easy access to some great sites, and the staff is very kind. We always have a ride available should we need to catch a ride. The rooms are very clean and spacious for a NYC hotel. We Love It

The room was clean and the bed was comfortable The location was great, but there were other options in the neighborhood for lessThe penthouse suite was disappointing and the croissants across the street were amazing compared to the cold dry croissants at serafina

The Art House Hotel offers a fun, welcoming visit as you explore the city!! It was our second visit to the hotel and we enjoyed even more than the first!! It was the 4th of July and we enjoyed a wonderful holiday visit!!! The adjoining restaurants and the lobby bar are fantastic as well as the staff!! The entertainment in the lobby was fantastic as well!! If you happen to get a good deal don’t hesitate...book your stay...you won’t be disappointed!!!

Lost my reservation twice, even after confirmation night before with confirmation number. Charged me security fee even after tally at end showed no incidentals. Plus fee charged for spa though wedding guests not supposed to be charged that fee, which had been brought up at check in. Still waiting for refunds on fees not supposed to be charged. Is this even legal?

I travel to NYC at least once a year and ALWAYS stay at Arthouse. Room 1604 is my new favorite! River view, large room, private balcony, large hotel patio with views, bar & live music several times a week, convenient UWS location - what more could you ask?

I had an event to attend at the Met, and this location made for a beautiful and easy walk across the park to that destination. I really loved seeing real art in the lobby. Note throughout the hotel would have been welcome. Staff were friendly. Room was spacious for NYC. Bathroom was as well. Amenities were lovely—soap smelled lovely. My only criticism, and this goes for nearly every hotel I have ever stayed, please allow for more light in the bathroom and a magnifying mirror. We are not all under 50! All in all I would recommend this hotel for its location, room and accessible price. I would stay again.

I would have put 3 but given that I have to write so much to get my comments accepted have made it a 2z. The place is tired and so are the staff. The location is fantastic - smarten up you guys. This ised to be New York’s beat kept secret

I like the combination of features in this hotel, I like its location on the Upper West Side it feels like its in a neighborhood instead of in midtown in the middle of tourists. The hotel bar with lobby entertainment several days a week combined with Serafinas Italian food next door can make a nice evening without even going out. The room decor is cutting edge and the bedding is luxurious. Will definitely stay there again this was probably my sixth or seventh time.

The hotel is located in a good area, close to Central Park and the Subway. The room was nice, but there are clearly problems with the plumbing. The wasn’t hot and each morning, between 05:30 and 06:30 there was rattling from the pipes in the bathroom, probably as loud as a bus driving past. Needless to say the whole family was up after this. Thankfully we were on UK time, so it didn’t ruin the holiday, but really should have complained.
user_name:
Rod3000
New York City, New York

review_body: Arthouse is in a great location. The rooms are well priced for NYC and the staff is friendly and helpful. There is a fun lobby with a bakery during the day and a bar at night. Definitely recommend Arthouse!

Great location & fairly priced hotel with bar in lobby & attached restaurant with nearby subway stop & area restaurants. Good lounge area with dapperly art, access to street sitting & comfortable sitting.
A+ for location, staff friendliness, ease of check-in, cleanlinessB+ for room size. Adequate for a single but would be cramped for 2 people sharing the roomOverall, a great hotel in a good location.

Situated in a great location within walking distance of many super restaurants, subway station, and central park . Clean and safe neighborhood with a drugstore across the street. Bell staff were top notch as well as the front desk manager . Manhattan has a whole is pricey ,

This was a great choice for our stay in New York. The location was perfect, staff was very accommodating, super clean rooms, and a free drink at the bar! The modern decor was a nice change from your average hotel room.

The new owners of the hotel have been adding new amenities in the lobby including coffee and pastry services in the morning, and live music in the evenings. I had a wonderful experience this trip because of Hugo at he front desk, he was helpful, courteous and patient with my request.

The room was small as per New York, but clean and decorated nicely. Roomy bathroom. Enjoyed the 2 complimentary glasses of Wine on the house in the bar area where the "Garage style" door opened wide to enjoy the lovely evening. Everyone was friendly and the service was good.

From the moment we walked through the doors we were impressed by Art House. Jesse gave us the best check in service, went above and beyond to call us when our room was ready much earlier than the advertised check in time. The rooms were modern, clean, and mansion size (respective to NYC hotels). Upper west side was a little out of the way for us but I would stay here again in a second. See you soon!

coming here now for nearly 25 years says more than all reviews together. this Hotel is situated in the heart of Manhattan / UWS. my special thanks are going to the lovely and competent General Manager Mrs. Connie Wang , who gives you the most wonderful stay, To Jessie from the Front Desk who gives you the best welcome with her beautiful Smile and to George and Orlando the most amazing Gentleman Doormen in Town.thank You the all of them. No One ever hesitate to give you your best stay ever.You will never forget the View of the Sunrises and Sunsets from the Rooms . already booked for the next Year

Carlos Vidot and his staff were awesome for my weeklong stay! The cleaning staff did full turndown service everyday without asking. Bartenders were great and happy hour prices were awesome in addition to the free drink tickets received at check-in. The morning/daytime coffee and baked good options were also fantastic. Thanks for a great stay and I’m looking forward to coming back again soon!

I stayed here for a week because of work and my experience was great. Everyone is so nice and polite and they even let me do a late checkout! Jessie was so nice and I will definitely come back. Located on Mid Manhattan.

I left a blazer in the room. I wrote the hotel. They checked immediately and found it. They have a third party contractor who picks up the items from the hotel forwards it to you. (Ileftmystuff.com). Great idea. Fewer people hanging out at the bar at night. But they did have a comedian one night.

Convenient to upper west side neighborhoods. Clean, comfortable bed and room. Right on Broadway. Sixteenth floor balcony was comfortable and a nice place to sit and enjoy the complimentary Chardonnay.
user_name:
John F
Memphis, Tennessee, United States

review_body: Nice bar and lobby, far better than the room itself. Bathroom was quite dirty and beat up. Overall room furniture and decor is 'cheap'. I got a terrace view room, with no view - looks right into building across the street.
user_name:
BPN1970
New York City, New York

review_body: Around the Corner nice places to eat and drink and 10 minutes away from central park and other nice places. Free Wi-fi Good Rooms and the size is enough, bed is perfect :)Nice and helpfull Peoplegood Service

This hotel made my stay in New York an awesome one. Conveniently located, with amazingly helpful staff, clean rooms, and a great atmosphere. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Manhattan! It is located around so many great dining experiences and so close to some great New York attractions, with just a quick subway ride!

Although I liked the bar area and the vibe,I have the following complaints from my stay, having paid around $1600 for 3 nights: - I raised these with the hotel but haven't heard back yet- very basic room with storage fittings more accustomed to a youth hostel- Bedroom was very noisy from traffic - this is avoidable with sound proofing- rooftop bar was inaccessible for 2 nights during my stay despite this being advertised- Reception unable to print documents for me, again not what is expected for customers paying this rate- hotel was consistently short staffed - hotel lost 2 items of my luggage I'd have delivered - it wasn't recorded as having being signed for by the hotel. Took 3 hours to find and I eventually had to search through all the parcel room to find it- there is a 30 minutes session on computers at the business centre - it shuts down and erases all data after 30 minutes without warning you at the start - this is really frustrating when you're working on a document and it gets deleted then you have to wait for the computer to restart- the restaurant is very basic, I was particularly disappointed with the tastless and overpriced breakfast consisting of eggs and potatoes only, as well as the choices available- bar served the worst gin and tonic I've had tried - it was undrinkable and I had to leave it- No tv guide/menu making it difficult to find a channel especially for international customers- dated bedroom radio stereo designed for iphones that haven't been made for years, incompatible with any new phone- nowhere in the bedroom to make tea, only a coffee machine relying upon single use plastics- reception staff helpful in person but on the phone they just connect you without even listening to the query properly

The hotel is renovated with modern, updated furnishings. Its location is ideal for sightseeing and its accessibility to the subway system. A wide variety of restaurants are readily available; and the lobby bar has coffee / pastries in the morning, complementing the night life beverages and music. Some rooms (double queens) were spacious, but the King Standard room was cramped.

Very nice location with a modern decoration and a very cloud bed. Is close to everything in Manhattan they have a roof balcony to see the skyline sunset very romantic. Staff was very nice. Select highest floor.

I recently stayed at the Arthouse Hotel and discovered I was charged $100.00 for incidentals for each of my 4 night stay, of which I did not accrue $1.00 in incidental charges. I have been trying for a week to get an answer from the hotel why I was charged $398.68 over my room charges and I have not received an answer from them. I finally went to my bank today to dispute the charges and to get the money put back into my account. Unless you like to have money stolen from you, avoid the Arthouse Hotel at all costs.

This is a wonderful place to stay on the Upper West Side. It is close enough to walk to Central Park and not far from the subway. The rooms are larger than most, nicely decorated and very clean. The beds were extremely comfortable. It was also quiet and the staff was very helpful.

Spent 8 nights. Staff friendly. We were made very welcome by Vivek who did his best to meet our individual needs. Both Vivek and Jessie prevented us checking out early by mistake, so thank you both very much. Our room was very large and quiet with lots of storage space. Bed very comfortable and the room was clean.

Would definitely go again and recommend to others :) great for all who want to stay in a more quiet area, close to Central Park, lots of Cafés and shops nearby and two subway stations (one with express stop). Hotel itself has a nice bar (with free welcome drinks ;)) and a restaurant (which isn‘t that cheap, but food was alright). Also the room had the biggest bed ever, was no problem sleeping with two people in it.

My BFF and her BF live in different locations on the UWS and this was the perfect location to visit her and to check out NYU (which we didn't like) while we were in town. We were audience members on the Greg Gutfeld Show- awesome!

Service wasn’t very friendly of helpful. Free cocktails weren’t cocktails. Basic rooms and they weren’t very clean. Small bed for american standards. Location is good.. only 2 min walk to subway and 6 min walk to central park

A definite A+ in my book, will put it on my bucket list of places to return to. The atmosphere is friendly and staff very accommodating. Neighborhood was beautiful and very convenient to subway, theaters, restaurants and just about anyplace you want to go in NYC.

There was no hot water, and no intention on fixing it. I have been staying at this hotel for 10 years, and it was great. Now, they changed the name, the management, and with this change, the quality went with it. We asked them to fix the water problem and the only person working in the front desk was extremely rude and acted as if it was my fault that I did not like showering in cold water.

We had a pleasant stay, room is small. Good location if you are visiting that part of town. Staff friendly, parking was expensive, Bed was very comfortable, Lobby is a fun space. Convenient restaurant attached to the lobby

Very much recommend The Arthouse. Staff are friendly, everything is clean, bed is comfy, loved the terrace on the 16th floor. Only slight negative was the bathroom door didn’t fit very well so we had to shoulder barge it open.

Beautiful boutique hotel on the corner of Broadway and W. 77th St. Centrally located for all events related to the wedding. We had a terrific stay! The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. We will certainly return to this little gem on the Upper West side of Manhattan in the future.

We stayed for five nights and we had a great time at this very neat and well kept hotel. Great location for a morning workout in Central Park and also for all the shopping you need (or not) within short distances. Spotless housekeeping. Nice staff eager to make a good impression. We had a room with a terrace and that is a great asset.

A gem on Upper West Side. Great location. Friendly staff. Well appointed room. Always upgrade as basic room very small. Bar is bustling at night. Room comes with bottles of spring water and passes for 2 drinks at bar.

This is our 2nd visit to New York the first time we were not far from Time Square and as 1st time visitors then fell into the Time Square trap.Thankfully 2nd time we found this gem of a hotel. Saw things we didnt see the 1st time around.Walking distance to Central Park which is an amazing place. Street food market on a Sunday with an abundance of different foods, easy access to the subway, a great base.Now to the hotel. Friendly welcome and a much needed welcome drink. Check in and out quick and efficient. Rooms were clean and a good size for what we needed. My only complaint (and this is tongue in cheek time ) the beds are far too comfortable made it difficult to get out of it on a morning but after a hard day sightseeing was welcome. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

What a nice place to stay at for a business meeting! The rooms were furnished fashionable and the whole hotel as a whole. I really liked the paintings and the signature bed. I was pleasantly surprised that there was an iron and an iron board in my room. The staff was very helpful.

The hotel was fine, we were on our honeymoon so very disappointed by the tiny room (not clear from photos online), rude front desk staff and poor value for money. The morning staff at the bakery/bar on Friday however were lovely!

It's hard to find a lovely boutique hotel in NYC without paying a fortune. The Arthouse is centrally located on the upper west side, off Broadway, close to buses and line 1, close to Central Park. The front desk service was great. I was in a lovely king room overlooking the courtyard. Rooms are soundproofed so it was quiet. The bar downstairs is hopping and serves nice glasses of wine for welcome drinks. Great restaurants in the area incl. Zabar's up the street. A gem of a find.

My favorite place to stay on the Upper Westside, the best residential neighborhood in NYC. I usually reserve the Broadway Deluxe rooms which are spacious and comfortable. The staff is extremely accommodating. I want to give a special shout out to Jessie at reception. She always greets me with a warm smile and does her best to make my visit a wonderful experience.
user_name:
ithacabound1
San Miguel de Allende, Mexico

review_body: Very good location. Comfy beds and pillows gave us excellents sleeps. Very helpful and nice staff was there to help in any occation. Hotel even organized our return to the airport, excellent cab and its driver.

This is a nice hotel with most of the amenities you need. Lots of different rooms, ours was at the end of the hall, but had some noisy AC systems nearby. We did have a balcony which was a change. I'd stay here again, because it's close to where I need to be

Beds and rooms are very comfortable. Great space not like most NYC hotels. The vibe is really nice, funky and artsy with live music from Wednesdays. Mostly older grownups stayed during my visit. Its four blocks from Central Park, museums, subway and great restaurants. Staff is really nice and helpful. Would definitely recommend.

Love the Upper West Side location of ArtHouse and the cool vibe in the lobby. Rooms are average sized, though bathroom is extra tiny. They really ought to rethink the daily 'Urban fee" of $35 added to the bill.

The location was great for upper west side. Lobby and bar area great for meeting friends and family. Rooms are like a dorm room. Lighting was bad. No drawers to put anything in. Staff very friendly and helpful.

We really enjoyed to be close to Central Park and we walked along the Hudson River Greenway every day to go downtown. It was wonderful and a different way to experience New York. We went over to New Jersey by commuter boat and went to sojo spa club one day, went on a guided rib boat tour along Hudson River and under Brooklynbridge and to the Statue of Liberty. It was so much fun and we loved getting back to our hotel in the evening to the comfortable bed and tv to just chill before sleeping. And oh how we slept, like to princesses, the bed and the temperature was the best. I recommend this hotel! And also read that the rooms were small, me and my friend thought they were spacious and yes the window was smallish but that doesn’t matter to me.And upper west side felt like a home away from home. Loved going out in the morning to Irving farm coffee shop on 79th street and see how New York started to wake up.

The NYLO (Arthouse) is in a great location. We enjoyed dinner at Red Farm and breakfast a couple of days at Sarafina. It's walkable to many places. We will be back! I would recommend the Broadway View Deluxe King room. That's what we usually get. Last time we were there we had a smaller room, I did not care for it so go for the Deluxe or better if you can if there are two of you.

Great hotel for a family wedding. Easy to connect and lots of great restaurants in the area. The music on friday in the loung was amazing. Recommend having the coffee bar open on weekend mornings. Staff and service was excellent.

Nice boutique-type hotel in great location. Room #606 was small but comfy, clean and quiet. Loved the bed! Good airflow without being overly noisy, temp control was perfect. Check in was easy and rep was helpful. Nice bar - small but unique and welcoming. Great hang-out area near the bar. Had live music on Friday night (trio) - no charge. Good price for NYC. We paid $304 on a Fri night in June, before taxes and fees. Make sure you are clear on the restrictions for the free drink. We goofed and ended up missing out.

Traveled to NY for a family wedding, so most of family and guests stayed at Arthouse. Interesting hotel rooms, all were different on our floor. Only issue was lack of wifi availability in rooms. Lots of things to see, do and eat in the immediate neighborhood. Also working with an outside reservation agency made it difficult to get questions answered ahead of time about the hotel. New York city taxes are always a shock! We all had a good time there.

Our rate was solid for New York, a value. We got what we paid for which is a econo hotel experience. Staff was curt and non-helpful. Tried to charge us to get into the room early - we passed. Room was basic, non-attractive, soaps and accouterments were basic at best. There were numerous hairs in the bathroom. Nothing special and no reason other than price to return.

Great hotel in an ideal location. The bar/lounge was a huge plus. The entire staff was extremely courteous and accommodating. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. No my preferred hotel in NYC. Will be back soon!

Room was large 340 sq. ft. with view of Broadway. Short subway ride to theater district and short walk to Lincoln Center and Central Park. Very courteous staff . This will now be our go to hotel on the Upper West Side.

Going back many years this has always been a great place to stay in NYC. Many times I would stay overnight when having a very late business meeting even though I live on Long Island. And since retiring I have returned just to enjoy a night in the city. Everyone is excellent, rooms clean, and just an all around wonderful place to stay.

The ArtHouse Hotel is in a great location and the staff is friendly and helpful. Jessie,imparticular went out of her way to accommodate us... She anticipated our needs and went above and beyond. We think Jessie deserves a raise!!!! Thank you for making our stay peaceful.

Location: Well situated on 78th and Broadway. So you’re close to many shops and restaurants, 2 blocks from the subway, and near Central Park. But you’re out of the mad hustle and bustle of midtown, which is a 5 minute subway ride away.Check-in / out and staff: Were quick and efficient. But I was sent an upgrade offer which I accepted. Received an email back that told me I’d be advised of whether they could accommodate it when I arrived at reception. Well no mention of it was made, we were tired,and decided not to bring it up. But why bother making your guests an offer if you don’t follow up?Room: Comfortable enough, with a coffee maker, good selection of TV channels, a safe and sufficient storage. I had requested a fridge be in the room, it wasn’t. However a call to reception and it arrived 5 minutes later. The room was quiet for Manhattan that is! Niggles? Well the basin didn’t drain very well, the shower pressure is not great, and the aircon sounded like a jumbo jet landing whenever it came on.Breakfast: Pastries and coffee are available in the lobby bat at a price. The attached restaurant also serves a full breakfast which is seriously overpriced given the quality of the food.Wi-Fi: Was great, good stability and speed.Value: Fair enough, though they have adopted the new fashion of an additional hefty daily fee that provides you with all the services you used to get for nothing!

Even I didn't liked their extra day fee for wifi, a beverage and something else... it was ok. Little room woth no view, but comfy and good staff. The bar is nice and also the lobby. It is just a couple streets away from central park.

We LOVED the Arthouse Hotel! Excellent service, clean rooms, fantastic location. Outstanding!! I would highly recommend it. We will stay here again! I especially loved the location to the subway, and the quiet area when coming home for the night.

Rooms were quite spacious for NY. Great bar with fun atmosphere. Walking distance to Central Park, Lincoln Center, Museum Mile, etc.The service could have been a bit more consistent with more front desk and bell staff.

Great location. Staff was wonderful. Wish I had prepaid the valet parking as would have saved money. Highly recommend if you are staying up the upper west side. Bar downstairs is very nice, but forgot to use my free drink tickets.

lovely little room, comfy bed, helpful, and pleasant staff, amazing location. I come here every year for a quick get a away and they never disappoint. Check out the roof top lounge. Looking forward to next time!

We received outstanding service at ArtHouse Hotel and found all of the staff to be friendly and helpful. In particular, Jessie was our MVP as we needed to extend our stay for two extra days! She was very professional, warm, and really made our experience amazing. The staff at Arthouse is fabulous and you will enjoy your stay. The convenience to the 1 subway stop at 79th street (or the 1/2/3 at 72nd) is also a huge plus for getting around the city.We stayed in both the 10th floor Broadway side king bed room & the 7th floor W 77th view room with two beds. The Broadway side has a more picturesque view. The W 77th two-bed room has more space. Both are excellent rooms & I would recommend either to visitors.
user_name:
Wanderer60080136707
New York City, New York

review_body: I'm staying at the Arthouse Hotel again this week. This is my fourth or fifth visit this year. The last was April 9-10, and I had a wonderful time, thanks in large part to Jessie at the front desk. I've been coming here for years, and Jessie always remembers me, greets me with a smile, and goes above and beyond to make my stay pleasant and comfortable. In general, all the staff are friendly and welcoming.The location is ideal, with the subway just two blocks away, and Zabars, good restaurants, and book stores in the neighborhood, plus a short walk to Central Park. If you're heading to the theatre, it's a quick trip by subway, and the walk back to the hotel is nice after a show.

ARTHOUSE Hotel staff were incredibly professional and accommodating, especially Jessie and Maggie. The room is spacious and contemporary. Located on the Upper West Side, lots of excellent restaurants, coffee shops ( including their own Serafina) Walk to Midtown or take the subway at 72 Nd. A great stay, we will return !

Be aware of the scam and tricks they play on you. We are charged 3 times for an early check in fee. In total $180. We requested to pay the early check in fee at the time of check in on a different card and they took advantage of the clerical process to change me the fee once on the card we used to pay the fee and twice on the card used to make the reservation. I've called and they have resolved nothing as of today.

The location and interior vibe outweigh for me a decision to choose elsewhere...But be forewarned the noise level is New York extreme. Also fabulous beds and linens. Love being able to step outside into a real neighborhood. Including a great rare & used bookstore - a neighborhood Saturday and Sunday market - great juice joint - a million little places to wine & dine. So easy to grab an Uber or a cab and get anywhere.

I love everything about this hotel, the location, the staff, the general ambience, the size of the rooms, the everything. If you can stretch to it, go for a room with a balcony- staying in New York and being able to afford a room with the space to spread out is pretty unusual. I will always come back to this hotel when in NYC

Myself and my husband have just returned from a 5 night stay in New York, staying at the Arthouse. The location of the Arthouse is great, being on upper west 77th street, close to bars and restaurants and walking distance of Central Park and the national history museum. The hotel lobby is nice and the guys and the door are friendly, but unfortunately that stops at the door. The staff at the check in desk did not make an effort to make us feel welcome. A credit card was taken even though we’d paid for our room, the lady assured us the room tax had been paid and nothing would be charged to the card, however this was not the case, each day a random amount would be taken out, when querying this we were told is was the ‘urban tax’ which we were not informed about at check in, apparently this is for the use of the hotels amenities, even though they didn’t inform of us of any of these. I would think the staff should have to inform you at check in about the ‘urban tax’ and what its for and where these facilities are, especially considering we were told nothing would be charged to our card. Moving on we found our room 820, we had no help with our bags, the 3 guys we passed just watched us. The room was very dark with no natural light at all, both windows were facing buildings. We couldn't see the sky at all. This upset me as I’d emailed the hotel twice, once on booking it back in October 2018 then again closer to our arrival date. I’d mentioned it’s was our belated honeymoon due to my mum passing and we would really appreciate a room with a nice view, so as you can imagine I was shocked to see they hadn’t even given a second thought about our experience at this hotel or even trying to make it that bit more special. There are lots of hotels in this area, for me it’s the customer service that sets them apart, unfortunately the Arthouse is lacking a great deal in this. I would not recommend this hotel, as I said before there are abundance’s of hotels in this area.
user_name:
Vicki B
Greater Manchester, United Kingdom

review_body: Great little hotel on NYC's Upper West Side. Right off Broadway. Nice bar in lobby. Rooms aren't large but are comfortable. Clean, comfortable beds and just a block or two from two different subway stops.

very service minded anf friendly staff; room cleaning ladies and desk people ( among them my friend Ramona who satisfied my requests over the many stays i made in this hotel); serafina attached italian restaurant has improved over the years

We've stayed at Arthouse many times. The hotel is in a great location and surrounded by a safe neighborhood as well as fantastic restaurants. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms are clean (some are really beautiful depending on the room type you pick). I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable place to explore the city.

On frequent visits to New York, I always stay at the Arthouse Hotel. I appreciate the location and the quality of the rooms, but most of all, I appreciate the friendly staff, especially Jessie on the front desk. Each time we greet each other as friends and she and her collegues do all they can to make my visit pleasant. Would not think of staying anywhere else.

Room was quite large, great bed, good bathroom, useful table and chair for working on the computer. Surprisingly no armchair and no minibar. My room was very quiet. Manhattan hotel prices take my breath away but my comparison with other hotels, Arthouse is good value for money I guess. Nice bar downstairs with pleasant music at times (piano or piano/singer).

Would recommend, but beware the staff was incredibly ageist. Check-in and check-out were incredibly uncomfortable, despite having paid for my room in full in advance. Me and my husband were younger than most of the clientele and it seemed to put off the staff.

This is a great hotel to stay in in New York. It's location, in easy walking distance to bars and restaurants and being slightly away from the main tourist ghetto, makes it a must for the a NYC explorer.My stay in the hotel was made even better by the amazing hospitality and warm friendly assistance given to me by the staff, in particular, Jessie on reception who went out of her way to help with a change I needed to my reservation. Thank you !

Loved my stay at the Arthouse for work in May. The rooms are huge compared to most NY hotels and the beds are super comfortable. The location is great and the area surrounding is quiet with easy access to Central Park. Will definitely be staying here again for future trips.

Usually do Christmas in New York...like May even more..will do May again next year...Arthouse for sure did lots of walking in neighborhood...nice to see people who live in New York rather than all tourist

Would recommend to all. Great place to stay. Very convenient location.Does need Amaro digestivo's at bar. :) Most comfortable beds I've had in a long time.The front desk: check in and check out process was most efficient and pleasant.

The Arthouse Hotel was such a delightful surprise! I frequently stay in lower manhattan but had reason to stay uptown and was trying to find a nice, clean hotel at a decent price - I found it! We needed two rooms for 1 night, and then unexpectedly stayed a second night, so we ended up with 2 different rooms, so I got to see 4 different rooms. They were all very spacious and the modern minimalist decor (which was very attractive) and wood floors (no carpet! Yay!) added to the feel of openness. The rooms were spotlessly clean. The lobby area is really attractive and inviting with several different spaces to be, good art and big open doors. They also give you a welcome drink coupon for wine and it was really nice to sit by the piano with a glass of prosecco. And really, I can’t say enough about the staff. Everyone was exceptionally nice! We were greeted every time we came in, the bell staff was friendly and chatted with us. And the front desk staff went over and above helping us when I found a problem with my reservation made by an online booking company. The woman at the desk made lots of calls to get it resolved for us. My elderly mother was traveling with us and she said her only “suggestions” for the hotel were to add some extra hooks in the bathroom near to the shower and add some additional lights to the rooms. All in all, I really loved my stay at this hotel and will definitely be back!

The service was helpful and friendly. Our room was modern and very comfortable. The location of the hotel is amazing. Right in the heart of the upper west side and justa short walk from the Museum of Natural History,, The Beacon Theatre and Central Park. The only negatives, there was no fridge in our room and although there was an iron, no ironing board. Would gladly stay there again

We have been to New York several times and this was our first time we stayed at the Arthouse Hotel and have to say it is now our new favourite. The hotel is located on the upper west side in a quiet residential location away from all the noise and crowds you will encounter downtown. Until you have been in downtown New York walking in shoulder to shoulder crowds all day sight seeing will you appreciate the peace and quite to walk around the Arthouse area. We stayed in a Studio terrace room and it was spectacular, no road noise or noise from adjoining rooms, beds were super comfortable and the terrace was nice to sit out and have a drink. Central Park is only four blocks away for a relaxing walk, metro station is only two blocks away and numerous restaurants within easy walking distance. There are some great restaurants within a block of the hotel such as Serafina, Red Farm, Chirping Chicken and Crave Fish Bar. The entire staff were very friendly, customer focused and helpful in every way. Highly recommend and we will be staying here again on our next trip.

For over $500 this hotel room was a great disappointment. Tiny,and in the back of the hotel overlooking another tall building. No daylight came in, which was good for sleeping in I suppose. But way too expensive for a motel experience.

The rocky start was with regards to booking and arrival. Booking was done through their website and, for whatever reason, an email confirmation isn't automatically sent. It took a few phone calls to get it worked out. Just an unexpected annoyance. Upon arrival things went fine at check in. We were very early so left our bags with the staff. They asked if we would like the sleeper sofa made up and we said yes. We arrived back at the room at 10pm, ready to hit the hay. The sofa bed was unmade- no bedding in the room. The friendly staff brought the necessary pieces over the course of 45 minutes (things were being laundered is what they said). It would have been great if they had had the task done for our arrival.Now the good things:-room size was great for Manhattan. We had a junior suite.-all of the staff were friendly and they did go out of their way to make us feel welcome.-comfortable lobby/ lounge space-quiet rooms for hallway noise/ neighbor noise.-fantastic location with plenty to walk to and nearby subway stopsI would stay here again in the future.

The hotel was awesome. From the time we arrived we were treated great by all the staff. Rooms were very spacious and clean. Beds were comfy. I would definitely stay here again as it was close enough to all attractions but far away enough to not hear the loud nightly noises.

The description of the Arthouse Hotel said new and renovated. That is accurate. It was very well done, clean and safe. Serafina's is a very nice restaurant and so convenient. The help went out of their way to be helpful. I would definitely return to this hotel on my next visit.

Unpleasant experience. The hotel is super cool but has paper-thin walls, so it was impossible to sleep. Both the street down below and the hotel customers are very loud.hotel receptionist are not helpful.I took the hotel car to go to the airport and it was a scam. The driver could not provide me with a receipt, his credit card reader didn't work, and he had not much change. So I lost $80

Really pleased by this charming hotel. Felt like Europe walking in w lovely Fragrance Staff very nice. Got in early so got room at 2pm which wS spotless. Heat on since weird May weather. Heat excellent for night! Complimentary water for coffee. Quick trip but loved location for my purposes seeing friend upper west and walking thru park to upper east. Will definitely stay there again. Priced right.

We had a fabulous time. The staff was courteous and helpful. We really enjoyed the location. It had wonderful places to eat, shop and a few blocks form Central Park. The lobby area had several areas to sit, have a drink and relax.

Jessie at the hotel front desk was excellent. She was warm, friendly and was very helpful. I also enjoyed the art work. The location was convenient and close to public transport. It was very nice to find to be welcomed with a wine bottle in our room.

This was my second time at the NYLO, which is now called the Arthouse. Everything was great. The staff was so kind and the location was perfect. We were attending an institute at Columbia, so great location to head up to Columbia as well as travel downtown for some fun!

Great for couples, not great for families. Staff was mostly friendly, but we did encounter a bit of rudeness from the front counter when we asked about our welcome drinks and informed them that we did not get the coupons.

As first timers to New York and having done a great deal of research we settled on the Arthouse largely due to its location away from the madness of Time Square - an excellent decision as the Arthouse is in a lovely neighbourhood with lots of cool places to eat - reasonably priced - and nice shops close by, whilst also being close to a few different subway lines and still within (long, but not unpleasant) walking distance from midtown.We thought the hotel was great!The staff were super helpful and friendly and the few small issues we had were sorted out instantly (being that (1) it didn't instantly show up that we had paid in advance, (2) there was no TV remote in the room initially and (3) once, randomly, our bathroom door lock got stuck). On all three occasions the desk staff and also the handy man were polite and more than happy to help us.The room was nicely clean and we were lucky in that when we arrived, having booked the smallest and most basic room option, Jessie on the front desk saw that a much larger room usually reserved for wheelchair users was free and allocated that to us as it wasnt booked up. This was great as it gave us a very spacious room and bathroom. Jessie also sent us a bottle of wine up to the room free of charge.The bed was the comfiest hotel bed I have ever slept on, with lovely soft sheets and nice pillows. All were changed during the duration of our stay too, which was lovely.The cocktails at the bar downstairs were also well made and delicious.The few things that I would say - more in the hope that Arthouse read this an consider these points - than as real criticisms:(1) The lobby is super cool and clearly recently renovated, but the room (that we had - cant speak for others) could do with a bit of an update to bring it up to the standard of the lobby. The decor seemed slightly older and there were a few things that could have done with attention, such as the shower control being loose and wobbly and a mark on one wall behind a bedside table where someone had clearly dropped something like red wine and stained the paint.(2) The air con system was very loud and a little intrusive for me as a light sleeper.(3) The bar staff were not that quick on the uptake. There was more than one occasion where we would have bought drinks had the staff come up to us, but after waiting for upto 10 minutes we decided to go out instead.We would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to explore nyc, but also escape the busy-ness at the end of the day.Thanks for a great trip, Arthouse!

Excellent but pricey. I have family in the neighborhood and would like to stay here more often, but calculated it at over $30 an hour for my brief Mother’s Day stay. The accommodations, service and location are great—A shame it’s not more affordable for returning grandmothers. Room very quiet.
