I don’t know why their ratings hotel at four stars front desk is rude the rooms very small, no frig and they don’t have room service most of the items in room were not operable and the restaurants Sarafinas service was horrible and they were rude as well. Do not stay here it’s a rip off.

We were allocated this hotel as part of our cruise package and can't really say that we were blown away.It is very basic and had it not been for our faulty TV- where we were given a room change- we would have been in a box room. The second room whilst better in layout still had a sort of children's bedroom feel to it with the furniture and the bathroom was a bit too metallic, sterile and clinical for my liking. The walls are also either very thin or the doors are too heavy as loud slamming could be heard from the early hours which was highly irritating.The staff are the highlight but could be a bit hit and miss.Free cocktail with the resort fee was a massive plus with a great bar and bartender, however upon arrival to our room the bottled water had been opened and sipped from so we had to call down and request new bottles. Whilst they apologised (and upon checking out very graciously removed most of our resort fee) it was a bit of a rooky error on the part of house keeping as they had quite clearly been consumed from. Just not really what i've come to expect from a 4 star hotel experience.I've also not been to a 4star hotel where a fridge was not already in the room so that was a bit strange, especially given the ice machine was broken so we had to keep requesting ice from the bar in the lobby.All in all I would say you probably get what you pay for.

A bonus to staying here is the variety of places to hangout on the first floor. Instead of a vast empty lobby there’s an intimate bar with that opens onto the sidewalk in good weather and several cozy spaces with chairs, sofas, tables, bookcases for reading, doing work, chatting. There’s even a baby grand piano—red!

Greeted by very courteous staff. Car valet available. George bellhop, was wonderful and offered assistance with anything and everything upon arrival and delivery to the room. Received courtesy welcome drink coupon for use at pleasing lounge in lobby area. Live music offered few nights a week and comfortable seating throughout first floor. Restaurant adjacent to property with access from lobby. Beds were not too comfortable. Both myself and family member had complaints upon awakening to each other each morning and we were there for 6 days. Fresh crisp clean linens and towels. Refrigerator was delivered to room by request and no additional charge to room. Pet friendly but no indication that pets were there. Smelled clean. No carpeting in room. Saw crumbs and possible mice dropping in corner of room near headboard. Fan was loud for heating /cooling. HAd to turn up TV when it kicked on.

We stayed for one night, and will be sure to stay again when in the city. Well appointed room, which was a bit larger than other boutique hotels we have stayed at in the city. But, what stood out was the staff! Exceptional all around, from the front desk (who sent us a complimentary bottle of wine and chocolates to celebrate a birthday) to housekeeping, front door and bar staff. Excellent stay, wonderful location.

Great value, located centrally to the Upper West Side; our favorite 'hood. Jessie was helpful in getting us and early check-in (well worth the $50 after the Redeye from Reno). Easy walk to shops, museums including Natural History and the New York Historical Society (often overlooked) and just blocks from Central Park, Lincoln Center, and Columbus Circle. They are happy to mind your luggage for the day if you must fly out late. Great bar and live music.

I had stayed there 3-4 times in the fall before the name change and it was a great place to use for a visit. loved the lobby area and it was a great spot to mingle and the linkage to Seraphina and the other restaurant provided for a good experience without having to go out and wander. will definitely go again to see what changed with the re-branding.
user_name:
JoeL3168
New York City, New York

review_body: For $400, I did not expect a room with windows so close to a brick wall that there is zero natural light in the room. Seriously: No. Light. I’m not sure this is even legal. Doorway to bathroom is bizarrely narrow, not much wider than my shoulders. Toilet touches bathtub, ick. I’m in NYC a couple times a month, so this is not culture shock. Just a “room” that should be part of the hallway instead. Doormen are very pleasant and eager to help. Front desk is nothing special. Very sorry we booked here, especially since we could stay elsewhere in the city for about $300-$350/night (I just checked). But room is non-refundable, so we are stuck here. I would not recommend the hotel even at a lower price.
Very nice hotel only the noice of the slamming doors of the rooms is very loud.Very friendly staff and a very nice accomodation. We enjoyed our welcome drink and a nice bottle of wine as a surprise..

4th time in NYC..1st time at Arthouse. Lovely,clean and spacious rooms. Comfy beds and lovely shower rooms. Bit far out of the main area so cabs or subway needed! Only niggle is that the hotel took money off my debit card without telling me why and wont return any emails. Never happened at any other NY hotel so not sure I would recommend hotel on this point alone.

My first visit since the change from the NYLO name brought no change in the excellent service. Despite some issues during checking in ( both my cards were declined twice, but this was swiftly remedied by a senior staff member's intervention ) , the stay was very good. Vivek and Eduardo can handle any of your service, luggage or car needs and for someone like me who tends to sleep late, an afternoon request for room service never was an issue ( unlike some hotels where it seems this is rarely possible and sometimes only clean towels are offered ). The location of this hotel cannot be beat, as it is a quiet and safe neighborhood but only a short cab or subway ride away from anywhere you would like to visit ( The Met, Central Park, eateries and bookstores ) . April weather brought the usual showers but only one day saw rain for the duration. Booking via the hotel's own website always seems to bring the best rates and the "standby upgrade" is a great option - I upgraded to a king room for $80 for the whole 5 nights, well worth it for the extra space. I will most certainly return to this hotel on my next visit to New York !

WOW what can we say about The Arthouse Hotel,AMAZING !!! from start to finish we stayed for 5 nights 2 adults and 2 children on arrival we were greeted by Hugo on reception what a lovely man,helped with everything booking in everything went smoothly no queuing perfect after an 8 hour flight then 3 hours at customs, 1 hour waiting for a cab so we couldn't wait to get in our room which we did very quickly.Then waiting for us was a bottle of fizz and chocolates for the kids such a nice touch.Room was beautiful,clean all the amenities that we need and 2 queen size beds plenty big enough for us.Location perfect for families close to Central Park 10min walk Natural History Museum 10min walk.Its a family orientated neighbourhood.Play parks 2mins from hotel away from the hustle and bustle but everything is close on the subway.Our last night we had another surprise a bottle of red wine for us.I cant express enough what a lovely friendly family hotel this is plus the bar is very nice with a good selection of gins .Thank you Arthouse if we do come back to New York we will definitely be staying here again.Thank you it was a pleasure.Zoe

I was booked in Art Hotel in New York City on 77 street and Broadway. The lady at the front desk, Jessie, was very cordial and professional. She made my check in process very easy and treated me very nicely. I wish other people would be like her. I enjoyed staying at this hotel.my compliment to Jessie.Thanks.

Modern, very clean room. Large sized washroom. Excellent amenities. Complimentary refrigerator provided. Wi-fi is easy to use and is effective. Staff are knowledgable and pleasant to deal with. Free drinks upon arrival.

Awesome location on New York's upper West Side. Quiet side of Central Park and a short walk to the historical Beacon Theater. Rooms are funky, modern and large for NYC. Hotel restaurant also offers excellent meal choices.

This is my go to spot when I come to NY. Minor complaint— could use a full length mirror in every room. Some have, some don’t. Not ideal when 2 people are dressing to go out. The comfy bed makes up for any shortfalls.

We stayed at the hotel for a week and everything was perfect! The staff, the room and the atmosphere! Ramona especially, helped us with all the problems we had and made our stay even better, but so did the rest of the staff. It was a great week and we are definitely coming back!

On one side, location is great if you look for the non too touristic area and the hotel has been renovated. On the other hand, we were staying in a deluxe deluxe queen room (a couple with 2 kids) but the picture on their internet site is extremely misleading. Indeed, our room was large, with three windows... on a wall, meaning extremely dark with absolute no view. We stayed 12 nights, we had no discount and they apparently could not find any solution to move us to another upstairs room despite two requests or still on the 4th floor on the street (so extremely noisy as there is a FDNY house + some pavement reconstruction...). So between being able to sleep at night and be in the dark all time, you have to choose, so be careful!!! Also, the floor cleaning was never done, we again had to request it (vaccum cleaning). What they do on a daily basis is the bed (comfortable) and changing the towels + the shampoo... no bathroom cleaing (shower) neither (hair...). In the end, the bill was about 5800 USD for these 12 nights which reprensents a real budget for us with no special consideration (except 1 drink out of 12 nights and no choice of the drink! quite niggardly) to say the least. I know it's difficult to find a good hotel in NYC as the ratio quality/price is extremely difficult to find... Not sure I will recommand that hotel. As said, very mixed feelings... A thank you was only when you tip, even not when I was given the bill which was already directly debited on my credit card the last day.

I stayed here one night to experience the Upper West Side. Location is probably the only good part of this hotel. Customer service not very good, they try to charge you extra for every little item. The lobby was lovely, rooms not so much. Felt like a dorm room and the bathroom was as small as can be. For this price, I can stay elsewhere and get a better room along with better customer service.

My room was a queen junior suite, spacious and beautifully appointed, large bathroom and shower, soooo comfortable, linens dreamy.. I will return many times as my children live in Manhattan. Neighborhood and location are top rate!

This is my second stay in the Arthouse Hotel (formerly NYLO) and I have enjoyed both. The hotel is small by NY standards but has good amenities on site (cocktail bar, restaurant, work out room) and nearby (CVS across the street - lots of shops and restaruants). The staff is very nice and accomodating. Rooms are big for NYC. Rooms are clean and well maintained.

This is such a beautiful hotel, perfect location, and most importantly, the staff are excellent. Everyone is incredibly professional, friendly, and helpful - especially Eduardo! I can’t wait to return!

Great hotel in an amazing location. You are just a short stroll from awesome restaurants and bars. Very close to the Subway. The bar in the hotel is nice. Staff very friendly. Rooms are a good size, clean, quiet with a comfy bed. Would stay here again!

The Arthouse Hotel stands heads above other hotels for its service. From Jessie at the front desk-to the housecleaning staff-to the concierge-the staff were only too happy to extend a helping hand and a smile. Thank you for your hospitality and for making our stay truly memorable.

Went to NYC for business, place was clean, organized and fun. Great atmosphere and service. Very accommodating and friendly.I would book this location again, 100%!I appreciated the furniture, design and layout. The washroom is very important to me and this place was clean and up to my standards. Automatically a win in my books.

first room had terrible noise in the bathroom wall (loosened pipes?). We were moved the next morning to a very nice room and greatly enjoyed the rest of our 7 night stay. Bed was comfortable, undisturbed sleep once we were moved.

I love area - great place to stay in NYC! Close to Central Park, you can easily start a day with run or walk! Plenty of good restaurants just next door. Our room was a good size for 2 people. Highly recommended

Really lovely hotel, comfortable and clean, the room staff were really on the. ball. Beds were very comfortable too! Great location near to the Park. Definitely recommend this beautiful hotel in New York.

I had an issue with the room I booked over the phone - didn't know it's a single bed and I was travelling with my family. Manager Camille was outstanding in assisting me with upgrading my room. She was kind and very helpful and resolved this issue for me in no time. Best of all she recommended this amazin =g little restaurant Tesla that my family enjoyed very much. Will definitely be back.

Upon checkout we didn’t know where we would leave our bags. JESSIE was not only super hospitable and friendly but she advised us that they had a complimentary bags storage service. That was such a relief! We were so impressed that we booked another night.❤️She is such a great asset to the hotel!

Ill be back to the Arthouse Hotel again!! Our stay at The Arthouse Hotel was great. Started off with the valet who was waiting at curbside and assisted with our bags. We then went inside and checked in, within minutes and we were on our way to enjoy Manhattan. Our room was ready when we returned back to the hotel. The rooms are very clean and modern, no carpet, hardwood floors!! We had a great view of the city from the 10th floor. The beds were very comfortable. We had a queen junior suite. It was nice to have a separate relaxing area with its own couch and TV. I didn't notice any type of noise issues from other rooms or outside. When we returned to our room the front office manager (Kamilla), provided us with a complimentary bottle of wine and a box of chocolates. Kamilla assisted me with changing our reservation date, and contacting Hotels.com to waive the non refundable room rate. She is very professional and went out of her way to help solve my reservation issues. An absolute class act. To end the trip I called down to have my car ready from the valet and as I came down to check out my car was waiting for me in front of the hotel. So if your looking for a great hotel with a great staff close to central park and great restaurants this is the one. And its for a great price

Very nice hotel, great area. I had a room on the 4th floor, from what I understand the 5th floor is residents, I heard a lot of running around at night, was very annoying, other than that great hotel, great restaurants quite area.

Will return to the Arthouse Hotel. The location is convenient and quiet. Staff are friendly and knowledgeable. Rooms are clean and modern. Valet parking and the parking rate was very reasonable for NYC. Enjoyed my time there.

I took my daughter to NYC on spring break for college tours. The Arthouse Hotel was centrally located for our tours. The room was spacious, the staff was very nice, and the lobby bar was wonderful. I don't usually stay at the same place twice when i visit NYC but I will make an exception for the Arthouse.

We stayed for 5 days at Arthouse Hotel and we couldn't have asked for a better place. The location is fantastic, close to Central Park and to 2 subway stations and there are several great restaurants to eat right by the hotel.The rooms are very clean and modern, the bed is very comfortable, I wish the window was a little bit larger to have more natural light, but it's ok. The bathroom has also a large space and is neat.Finally, the staff was really nice to us and in the end of our trip, we asked for a late check out that would be a little longer than the usual (we asked to leave at 3pm and usually the late check out is at 1pm) and the manager kindly approved it, which was great for us, so we could enjoy the day and have a quick shower before heading to the airport.
user_name:
Alessandra S
Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

review_body: Rooms are nicely appointed. There is a lounge in the lobby with live music and it’s a good value we had one of the lower priced rooms which was fine. The staff was friendly and efficient. One of the elevators was out when we were there but that happens

The lounge and piano player was very nice. Room was pricey 425 per night for 2 people in a very small room.... but it is NYC. Near zabars, and the natural history museum. Also near Blossom vegan restaurant. Walking distance to Columbia university and barnard college.

We come to the ArtHouse few times in a year. We all always get the best service from Ramona Bechan. She always welcomes us with a big smile, and she makes the best for us. She is very professional, kind and warm. Ramona makes our stay the best we can have. Thank you so much!

Love the location on the upper west side, close to metro and Central Park. Attached restaurant very good, bar area in lobby lively and friendly. Only gripe was the room...size is not an issue, just the available storage options. Need some hooks, shelves, something...and a light in the hallway or closet would be helpful. Minor quibbles. Bed was comfortable enough and housekeeping staff very accommodating. Would probably stay here again.

Cozy hotel in UWS. Minutes to American Museum of Natural History and Central Park, 2 blocks from the 1, 2, 3, subway lines as well as A, C, B, and D subway lines. Excellent restaurants surround the hotel. Service was excellent, room were cozy (read: small), but large by NYC standards. Beds were super comfortable, great night sleep. We had a blast with 2 tweens for 3 nights and 4 days.

Extremely quiet if you request a high floor and a room ending in 01. Beds were new as were sheets and duvet. No room service from the bar at night. Liked Seraphina and loved it being right off the lobbyPut us in close proximity to the people we were visiting on Central Park West

From the moment we pull up in front of the Arthouse Hotel, we are greeted warmly by Alberto and Edwardo as they take our bags out of the taxi. Then the smiles we receive at the front desk from Jessie and Ramona -- we are where we belong. Everything about the hotel is first rate. We have been staying at the property for many years, and we will continue to return for many years to come!

Very comfortable, secure hotel on the upper west side. Warm greetings by the doorman and the front desk and I immediately felt safe and welcomed. The room decor is very unusual; not the usual hotelfurniture but it had lights and plugs for my Laptop and iPhone.

Came to NY in April to celebrate a birthday in style and comfort - Arthouse was our first choice to stay and the rate was great as we booked directly with the hotel.We were warmly greeted by Lawrence and checked in with a wait for an available room (we arrived way early). It gave us a chance to relax in the cozy lounge and relapse from our journey to New York.Thanks to Jessie, we secured a super room with a view on the 7th floor which really made our stay.The room was gorgeous and the bed was over the top comfortable. Since I has leaked the birthday date upon check-in, Jessie surprised us with cheers and treats that were delivered to our room - totallly unexpected and so very thoughtful.This is the kind of hotel that goes the extra mile to make you feel special and specially taked care of - we will be repeat customers to Arthouse whenever we come to New York.It is a very special place to stay. If you haven’t been here yet, you should book here.

This boutique hotel offers a great location for dining and Upper Central Park strolls and NYC shopping. The subway is close by and there was not shortage of cute bistros, cafes, bars just a block away.

The Arthouse is the big comfy couch everyone rushes to sit in. However, as in any environment, it's the people that give the comfortable feel. The front line - the front desk employees - are without a doubt the most helpful, welcoming people I've encountered and as you are exposed to more employees, you notice the trend - every one has the same demeanor - welcoming - caring - helpful. What a tribute to a business, happy employees make happy guests. There's is no better than the Arthouse.

Very comfortable stay, close to good restaurants and activities. Great neighborhood. Everyone seems friendly and helpful.The adjoining restaurant was convenient but too pricey for what they offered. Better to eat elsewhere

We stayed one night to celebrate my son's 16th birthday. Reservation confirmation stated two queen-sized beds which are actually full-sized beds. Several people have mentioned this is their reviews but Manager does not address why they are advertised as queen but are actually full. Should be listed correctly on website. Front desk tried to explain that queens are a double? And twin is a full? Huh??!! After complaining, my husband asked about extra drink tickets and they were granted. Thankfully, we had a pull out sofa in our room which my son slept on, as two adults would not fit comfortably in a double bed. Unfortunately, there were no sheets available in the room for the pull out. I went down to the lobby about 9:30 pm to request a set. I was told someone would bring them up. After waiting about 40 minutes or so without the sheets arriving, I called downstairs and someone came right up with them. I believe my first request was forgotten. We chose this hotel specifically due to the advertised queen beds but felt deceived. Hotel lobby, bar and seating areas are very nice! But no cream or sugar in room for coffee pods and no coffee available in lobby so we had to go out. We were also sent an email to request an upgrade but was told it was not available upon check in. Valet was very good.

This hotel is located in a great Upper West Side location and is sandwiched between Maison Kayser on Broadway and Lavain on Amsterdam. Need I say more? The rooms are big enough and the bathroom is full sized for NYC. Little detail like reading lights attached to the bed headboard and a magnifying mirror in the bathroom add to the rooms comfort. The lobby is welcoming and there is entertainment on many nights during the week. Lots of good restaurants in the area including Red Farm.. if you stay make sure you eat at least one meal at Red Farm. In good weather it is an easy walk to Lincoln Center, the Museum of Natural History, the Metropolitan etc... and Central Park. As for those croissants at Maison Keyser and fabulous cookies at Lavain... you will do a lot of walking in NY, treat yourself.

It was lovely to see that the pictures on the website didn't exaggerate. This is a beautiful hotel with lovely staff and live music downstairs in the atmospheric bar a couple of times a week. Did not disappoint.

I have stayed at the Arthouse Hotel many times. I like that it is on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, away from the tourist crowds and in an established New York neighborhood. The hotel has good rooms with excellent beds. The hotel has a slightly youthful, hip vibe, but not too much so for those of us who are older. The staff are always very helpful and make you feel at home. I have had good experiences with several of them, and Jessie was very warm and helpful during my most recent stay.

I have never wanted to visit the same hotel twice, simply because I have never felt like a hotel has ever warranted my return. That was until I stayed at the Arthouse Hotel. The staff, from the doorman to the general staff were absolutely wonderful, in every sense of the word. Even so, I wish to dedicate the bulk of the review to the man who single-handly made my trip memorable: the doorman, Orlando. From the moment my family stepped onto the curb from our car, he gracefully helped us with our luggage, acting not just as the doorman, but as the concierge. His kind attitude was infectious, and as my family was checked in, he kindly waited to guide us through the intricate system of elevators. Once we arrived at our room, we were actually left shocked at the small size of the bedroom; the wall was at most two feet from the end of the bed. My mother and I quickly called down to the lobby to ensure that this was the right room. We don't typically fuss; when they assured us this was our room, we shrugged and went to help Orlando unload. At no point did we complain, and yet, soon after he had left, Orlando called back, offering us a new room, much larger than the first. His kindness and generosity made our entire trip fantastic! Even beyond us, his skillfulness and expertise seemed to resonate with each guest, as he made sure everyone felt welcome.

Great location, staff and associates are exceptional.Rooms are very clean and the caretakers of the rooms, are superb.Loved the waiting areas and the pub (bar) area.Many exceptional restaurants in easy walking distance.

The hotel is in a great location: less than 2 minutes from the metro, 5 minutes from the Natural History Museum and Central Park, 20-25 minutes walk from Time Square. The rooms are clean and the bed is very comfortable. The bathroom is small but functional. In front of the hotel there is a supermarket. The area, although central, is much less chaotic than Downtown and the night is well rested. In the evening, the hotel offers musical entertainment in the lobby until midnight with the bar always open. Agreement with the hotel (no need to go out, you can access it directly) there is the Serafina restaurant (Italian-American) that offers good food even if the staff is not always up to the food, in our opinion.The only problem you could find is the heating which, if set on the automatic, at night tends to start every 5 minutes making a lot of noise. Our suggestion is to turn it off in the evening as soon as you return to your room and you won't have any problems: the room will remain warm all night without annoying noises.Overall the hotel has met our expectations and we would definitely recommend it.

This hotel was recently and wonderfully updated. Staff was great from doorman to housekeeping and everyone between. Great location for us for a memorial event for a colleague of my wife. Moreover within walking distance to Central Park and several outstanding museums (American Museum of History, Metropolitan Museum of Art, Guggenheim). Good restaurants near, great bar in the hotel with Friday night live music.

I highly recommend this hotel. The location was fantastic as well. Very easy to get to the park and the subway stop was only two blocks away. Plenty of restaurants and convenience stores in the neighborhood.

We stayed here to attend a concert down the street at the Beacon theatre and it's a hopping, friendly location with such easy access. A bubbling lobby and bar full of activity was pleasant and joyful. The rooms were ok - I do enjoy real drawers and some more closet space - this was a bit compact for us. There were balconies which is nice, but considering it was March and still cold, we didn't use them, but an added bonus. We did have a noisy neighbor check in on our last night, that didn't seem to care what was happening next door, they were on their balcony until early am hours when we were trying to sleep to catch our early morning flight. We did call down to the front desk, but it did still continue, so I'd decide if you are looking for a quieter room (although this hotel is pretty happening and full of life and social activity), maybe a room without a balcony, but otherwise the staff were very helpful.

The location of the hotel is great. The staff is very nice and helpful. Our room was nice and big which was very convenient as we stayed there with 2 babies but it was not well maintained. The bed lights were not working. The shower-head was broken.The room was not well maintained. The bed lights didn’t work. The color of the bath tub was scratched. The bath tab was clogged and the coffee machine didn’t work and they were fixed after we reported to the front desk. The shower-head was loose and fell off the wall every time we took a shower. Overall things were fixed quickly after we reported on them but it looked like the room needs some refresh and maintenance.

We had a great weekend at Arthouse. The location is convenient to some great restaurants and attractions. We were super impressed by the friendly and accommodating front desk staff. Thanks to Lisanne, Vivek and manager Ramona for going the extra mile for us to make our departure easier. We will certainly be back.

A fantastic hotel in a quiet, friendly area of upper west side. The staff are very helpful, the rooms are a very good size and always kept clean and tidy. We stayed for 5 nights on the 10th floor. Next time I return to the city I will rebook with this hotel. My only thing I wish they did was room service, sometimes it’s nice to eat and drink in the comfort of your room after a long day exploring the city.

We paid a little extra for a larger room, because we were there 4 nights, and it was worth it. The room was huge! The bathroom was huge! It was very clean, the bed was very comfortable, and the shower was great. If you're looking to stay on the Upper West Side, this is it!

We have stayed at the Arthouse, formerly the NYLO many times and have always been delighted. Our stay this time, the first time under the new name, was simply outstanding!My lead contact at the hotel was Jesse and she was, and is, a jewel. As this was a birthday celebration for my significant other I had asked for some “special” extras to make her day all the better. Jesse delivered in spades. From a room upgraded to a bottle of wine she made sure our stay was memorable. Even more importantly to me, my lady is a lover of flowers, and Jesse made sure that my special order bouquet was in the room and displayed lovingly. A shout out to Poises on Amsterdam Ave for putting it together and making sure it was delivered for our arrival.But back to the Arthouse. If you are looking for an eclectic hotel with charm and style this is your place. The service is top notch and the rooms are stylish. Bravo Arthouse, a change in name only and very possibly an upgrade in service! To sum it up, great staff, great location and a great place to stay on the West side.

Arthouse hotel is in a nice location, close to the American Museum of Natural History, the central park and some good restaurants. The staff was friendly. In fact, we had booked a non refundable room and we had to reschedule our visit to the next weekend. They accommodated our request without requesting any fees.The hotel itself has a nice lobby. The room we stayed in though was rather dated. It had a tiny shower, the furniture in the room was pretty old and there was no mini fridge.If you are going there by your card, there is a parking garage right near the hotel on the same street. I did Valet parking but I regret doing it. They charged me $69 a night for a mid size SUV claiming that it was an oversized vehicle. We also had to wait about 20 minutes to get our car back after checking out.In general, I think it is a decent hotel without a super high price.

Hotel is in an excellent location for subway entrance and Natural History Museum. Plenty of restaurants and cafes in the area. The Serafina restaurant in the hotel has large portions and excellent food.

Arthouse (formerly NYLO-NYC) is a comfortable place to stay on the Upper West Side. Great location for the museums and Central Park and an easy walk to two Metro stations, putting the entire city within reach. The lobby bar is a great spot to grab a cocktail or a glass of wine and features live music on the weekend. Possibly my strongest recommendation is that this was a second stay at the hotel (I was there at roughly the same time of year in 2018, when it was still a NYLO property); despite all of the hotel options, I chose to return to Arthouse.

Excellent staff and accommodations. I’ll echo the others regarding the “urban fee”. Stayed for five nights, so that’s $35 per night urban fee, plus taxes on the urban fee, which comes to a $200 markup on the room- essentially paying for nearly an extra night. Have stayed at similar boutique hotels - The Giraffe, Library Hotel - no such fees. The rationale that it covers “free” WiFi doesn’t hold up anymore.

The rooms are clean and well decorated. The lobby is cozy and fun. There's a full bar and occasional live music, a sitting area with computer center and comfy chairs. It was crowded when I was there because I think the bar attracts people besides the guests.

Very cool hotel where my wife and I have stayed twice. Rooms are large enough (for NYC) and very clean. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The location is ideal: very near Central Park, and just up the road from Lincoln Center. My ONLY complaint--and a meager, first-world one at that!--is that there was no ice on our floor. But otherwise well worth every penny! I highly recommend staying here!

Girls trip 3/31/19-4/3/19. Wonderful stay from start to finish. Great customer service by everyone at this hotel. Clean and decent sized room, especially for NY! We were on the 6th floor and didn't hear much noise from outside. Make sure you find Christopher & Henry at the bar, they are wonderful and we will definitely be back to see them!

A one-of-a-kind charming hotel,with a lively active lobby, bar, and entertainment lounge with guest artists each evening. Rooms are terrific. Beds super comfortable. Staff are friendly and helpful.An informal air but a professional to the core. Highly recommended.

It was good but not great. the location is convenient. It is 3 blocks from the 77th street entrance to Central Park, which was important to us a s runners. It was walking distance to great restaurants near Lincoln center - we dined at Leopard Des Artistes and Bolud Sud.the lobby is spacious with a nice common area and the bar is friendly with a good bartender. They fell down in two areas. The check in desk is in the back left and not in view of either the sitting area or the front door. There is no welcoming presence beyond the doorman when you arrive or when you are in the lobby early. There is also no coffee station in the lobby for early risers, almost all major hotel brands do this today as does NYLO in Dallas. Secondly, we were offered an upgrade by email for two queen beds in a Junior suite, but when we arrived it wasn't available. Don't offer a promotion and then not fulfill it. An un-necessary disappointment is created. We were promised a cot so that our son could join us on the second night. Front desk and house keeping promised us that it would arrive. We checked in at the desk again before we left for dinner and were again reassured. But, when we returned at midnight there was a voice message that the cot could not go into the room because it was a fire hazard so we were forced to all share the King sized bed. There is an opportunity to be funky and high service like the new Radisson Red concept hotels. NYLO missed it.

Terrific stay at the Arthouse hotel for 2 adults and one child. We arrived and were greeted by the valet and Jessie at the desk. Upon seeing all of the bags we had--and knowing we needed a crib--Jessie offered up a room upgrade--for a modest cost. We were upgraded to a penthouse with two rooms and two terraces. It was terrific space for any hotel--amazing for NYC. Beds were amazingly comfortable--rooms very updated--lobby spaces all very hip and welcoming at the same time. The lobby restaurant was very good--although a little pricey for the offerrings. Only complaint--they did not have real glasses in the room--and only 2 tiny plastic cups provided each day--for such a nice accommodation this seemed odd and took away from the general wow factor.

Best stat to date! Each stay reminds us why this is our home away from home. The staff, amenities, view and location. We have been coming for many years! And feels like our home away from home each time! Thank you

The room was nice. Clean and modern. Hotel over all was good. Bartender that night was great. I paid extra for a king bed with broadway view and was a little dissapointed. As a new yorker i expected more.
user_name:
gjromann1
New York City, New York

review_body: Close to Central Park. Decent sized rooms for NYC. Close to subway. The Red Lion Chinese restaurant was really really good - even for solo dinners. Only one running machine working in the gym and no working water fountain, no towels etc. Didn't matter too much cos no-one else using it, but would have been nicer to have access to water. Staff friendly.

Arthouse is wonderfully located for anything you want to do in NYC - close to all transportation and parks, museums, theater. Hotel is clean, nice rooms (not great) and good staff. Any problems you may have will be dealt with quickly.

This hotel is located in a fantastic neighborhood. Great restaurants, quaint atmosphere. Warm and welcoming. Short walk to the subway and less hectic than midtown. Worth then short subway ride. If you hit it right they have some economical room specials.

We were courteously greeted by the valet staff who was very helpful and kind mannered. The front receptionist initiated an early check-in as we requested and was warm and friendly. We were informed that we'd receive a call when the room was available and our bags (which were securely checked in) would be in the room upon our arrival later on. We spent the day in the city and arrived later than anticipated - were tired and wanted to cozy up in our room. We checked at the front and were informed our bags were not in the room and could carry them up ourselves OR have the bellhop bring them up. Since we were so tired we asked if the bellhop could bring up the bags (though we were upset that they were not there as previously informed). The bellhop brought up our bags, we thanked him kindly and bid him farewell, he did not reply to our farewell but instead stood at the door waiting for a tip. We did not think it was appropriate to expect a tip for bringing luggage that SHOULD HAVE been in the room to start with. The fact that the bellhop expected a tip for merely doing his job and did not wish as a goodnight back when he did not receive a tip was of poor taste. The following night, we again arrived to the hotel late and tired after a full day in the city; we requested our "complimentary drinks" which were tasteless and seemed to have been made with low quality alcohol. As far as the room is concerned, the bathroom shower had mold and did not reflect the appearance of a place that keeps up with cleaning routines. On our check-out day, the housekeeper DEMANDED that we take off the "do not disturb sign" off the door knob so that she could clean as soon as we left the room and did not have to wait until later on to do so. We felt rushed and unattended. We were not impressed which was a shame because we were referred by a friend who stayed at this hotel some years back. I would not stay there again nor would I recommend this hotel.

Thanks to Jessie we stayed at the arthouse hotel and feel very welcome!!!!She was so friendly and understanding and she made our vacation complete The room was clean and the view incredibly We recommend the hotel and enjoy all the area aroundVery easy to go to any place you like

I felt so welcomed as soon as I arrived, I was given a Complimentary drink as soon as I checked in. The room was spacious and very clean. The staff was by far my favorite of all, each time my friends and I were going out, I was eager to see which friendly face was at the door. Thank you so much to Orlando and Alberto for all of your recommendations and sharing laughs with us. Definitely sending all my friends from Miami to Arthouse.

Beautiful hotel, and friendly staff. Orlando and Alberto were very helpful and knowledgeable.. they gave great recommendations and were on point with directions/transportation. Enjoyed our 5 night stay at the Arthouse, will definitely be coming back.

We stayed in the Arthouse hotel for 5 nights and would highly recommend this hotel. Upon arrival check in was friendly and pleasant. The hotel gave us complimentary drinks tokens for the bar which was a nice touch. The hotel lobby looks fantastic and was a great place to have a drink at the end of a long days sightseeing.Our rooms were clean and tidy and regularly cleaned each day. Enough space for the two of us and all our cases. The bed in our room was the highest I have ever slept on in any hotel but was extremely comfortable so not a problem.All the staff from check in to the bar were friendly and attentive and seemed to want to make you feel welcome.The area around the hotel was pleasant and had plenty of restaurants and bars within walking distance. Transport links are very close on 79th St so no problems getting about to the usual tourist destinations.All in all a wonderful stay in New York and a hotel I would highly recommend.

At Check in Carlos V. was very accommodating, he was able to upgrade from Loft to Penthouse and ended up leaving a bottle of Chardonnay in our room to celebrate our trip. The staff was friendly and paid attention to detail. Upon entering the Penthouse we noticed the room was cut off to separate the living area from the bedroom. We wanted more of an open room concept so management changed the room type back to loft with terrace and we were very happy. They even saved us money by offering street parking, letting us know the best places to park.

Beds are yummy...pillows are fluffy...service (by Jessie and staff) was nothing short of excellent! Upon check in Jessie assisted in helping coordinate our rooms so we were close together. Her recommendation of Red Barn for dinner was spot on!

My stay was very nice thanks to the warm and very attentive guest liaison Jessie, who got me an an affordable early check-in/upgrade to a penthouse with more space, natural light and a view to the Hudson. She was a true angel after a long red eye flight.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Arthouse Hotel. It had a very welcoming ambience, was in a great location for us. Very clean and comfortable. The staff was quite welcoming and uniformly offered help if we needed anything. We'll stay there on our next trip to NYC.

While it's advisable to stay on a top floor due to noise, the hotel is in a great location and all of the staff is very accommodating. The beds are some of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever experienced. Ramona was especially helpful and kind.

For the amount you pay and the size of the the king room just way too small. I think I bumped into myself twice while in the room. Location not too bad but way over priced. Next year we will be looking for a different hotel.

Conveniently located near the family we visit, and very pleasant ambience. Caveat: they charge a $35 "urban fee" - for "water and wifi" - just another hidden cost to figure into the bottom line room charge.

The best in the upper west side. Cozy warm and so friendly. Rooms are always fresh clean and well equipped. Beds are beyond sleep worthy. Get a room with a balcony and the stay is complete. Orlando the doorman runs to Amsterdam to get you a taxi- BEST Everyone you come into contact with is wanting to help!

We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and had a great time. The room was spacious and comfy, and a good coffee machine too.The staff were nice, although we didn’t receive the warmest service which could maybe be an area to improve to be even better and higher quality.The only downside for us was the ‘resort tax’ which was added on at the end, at $35 a night it is a lot extra than you expect, when you’re already paying a fair amount. It should be included in the nightly price. Overall a good stay though, in a great location 30 mins walk from Times Square or 10 mins on the subway.

This is a Upper Westside in a perfect location with a wonderful caring staff. For example upon checking I meet Vivek at the front desk who was able to accommodate my wife and I with a beautiful room with an excellent view of Broadway. This is my favorite hotel when I stay in New York.

I have stayed at this hotel through many of its' iterations from On The Ave to NYLO to now, The Arthouse. The front desk staff is very helpful, espcially Jessie. I got upgraded which is always a delight. Highly recommend for a stay in my old UWS neighborhood. All staff was attentive and gracious.

I found the property to be a great value for location, cleanliness, price. I will look to stay again on my next trip to NYC. Even the restaurant downstairs was friendly and good food. CVS across the street, shopping galore just a few feet from the front door.

This is the second time we stay at this hotel and once again it was a true pleasure. A perfect location close to great restaurants, shopping and many neighborhood amenities; and just far enough away from the crowds, noise and madness. Walking distance from the Lincoln Center, the Met, the Museum of Natural History and many others.There are not many hotels on the UWS but this is in my opinion the best place to stay in the area if not in all of Manhattan. Clean, modern and well maintained, friendly staff, very well run and the perfect goldilocks size.The staff is genuinely friendly and not on the make like other NY hotels. No hotel restaurant but a great bar and lobby lounge. There is a Serafina restaurant attached if you need it but don't waste your time - there are many many great neighborhood restaurants all around that have much better food and service.Highly recommended.

as soon as the friendly doorman opened the door for us, we knew we'd found the perfect intimate boutique hotel. Everyone greeted us with friendliness and smiles, even the bartender working the lobby bar gave us a friendly nod. Our check-in went smoothly (they even gave us a room next to our friends) and gave us tickets for free cocktails at the bar. The bar, by the way, had comfortable seating areas where we usually ended up sitting after a long day's walking. Our room was a nice size, large enough to spread a yoga mat, and came with free water and a coffee maker. Because we did not use the maid service, on the second day of our stay the front desk called to see if we needed anything. We mentioned a few items and the housekeeping staff brought it up immediately. The hotel's location was perfect. Quiet in our room, bustling downstairs and within steps to incredible restaurants and the Beacon Theatre! Our stay could not have been more perfect. And, the gym was definitely adequate if you wanted a workout.

I always love staying at this property because of the personal, neighborhood feel of the hotel. Really enjoy the staff who are incredibly friendly and helpful, especially Alberto, who was a pleasure to speak with.

Everything about this gem of a hotel was terrific. The check-in process was smooth. Our room was ready and beautiful. We were even given a complimentary bottle of wine from the valet. Every staff member was more than courteous. The bar is this great little secret. The location is central to everything on the UWS. We will be back

This is a lovely hotel located in a wonderful, family oriented neighborhood. The customer service was terrific, and there are lots of great places to walk to for eating and shopping. We appreciated the opportunity to upgrade our room and get additional amenities.

Fun place, close to many food places. Bar area was very pleasant and relaxing. The service was excellent and very informative. Took a while to get room ready with promise to call me, but after several hours I had to call to see if ready.

Great location with cozy bar area and super customer service. Enjoyed the music in the lobby Thursday through Friday night. Hotel staff was quick to offer help with any issue. Look forward to another stay!

Everyone at the hotel was extremely friendly. Check-in and check-out were easy and efficient. The bar and lobby area are nicely laid out and a great place to sit in the morning or have a drink at the end of the night.We booked a standard King room which was a decent size by Manhattan standards. Decor was fitting with the "Art Hotel" theme - modern, but nicely done. Bathroom was tight, but again well designed.Continental breakfast at the Serafina restaurant was a bit disappointing (but balanced out by good service) - but there are plenty of good coffee shops and bakeries nearby to grab your own breakfast.We will definitely stay at the Arthouse the next time we're looking to sat on the UWS.

I must say this was the best stay by far! I travel a great deal and stay at many hotels! Hands down Arthouse is awesome especially because of Jessie! Jessie is the best by far! She was extremely accommodating and made me feel right at home! I give Jessie 10 stars! Thank you Jessie!!!!!

I stayed at the Arthouse Hotel for one night on a business trip in the winter. Had a great stay - the lobby has a great vibe, the staff are friendly and helpful, and the beds are extremely comfortable. The rooms are huge for NYC! The best part of the stay was live music and a complimentary drink in the lobby. It's a great place to socialize with co-workers and friends before hitting they hay. The only small problem I had was the walls are a little thin and it's easy to hear what happens in the hallway. Luckily most people who stay here don't party late, so it's not a huge problem. Highly recommend and I'll for sure be staying here again.

Excellent. Highly recommended for business and tourism trips. Staff friendly and helpful. General manager accommodating to guests. She is working on interesting events for the hotel. Dining could be improved

The Arthouse Hotel (formerly NYLO) is conveniently located on the UWS and is busy and bustling! Rooms are relatively large for NYC and are well laid out with large bathrooms. Good for a family!Lobby is large and active.

Excellent location to escape the maddening mid city crowds. Easy access north & south on 1,2 3 subway lines + buses. Comfortable environs. Friendly, helpful staff. Love the neighborhood to dine & or simply walk. Short distance to Central Park & Museum of Natural History. Stayed their several times when it was the NYLO. Was told that new upgrades coming as the ArtHouse Hotel.

Pleasant staff, clean hotel, excellent service with doormen he was very pleasant and helpful getting my car and bags. What a great experience. Safety and security of this place was exceptional! I Will be back soon!

Wonderful hotel, wonderful staff and great location. Jessie is an amazing ambassador for the hotel who greets hotel guests at the front desk with warmth, knowledge and graciousness. i would suggest to hotel management that it either eliminate the so-called urban fee or simply raise the room rates and delete reference to the name. This is an off-putting charge that includes a few bottles of water, internet and gym and Upper West Side area amenities. Not marketing at its best.

From drinks at the Arthouse bar, going to a show at the Beacon Theater, walking through Central Park, Frick Museum, and brunch at The Wright, our stay could not have been better! Every one of those activities was within walking distance. A special shout out to George for making us feel so welcome! Super friendly and fun to chat with!!! (Jose, too!)

Great location. Nice room. Nice lobby and bar. Good atmosphere. They need to eliminate the resort fee or urban fee that they add on after the room charges and just combine it into the room charges. It put a bad taste in my mouth. It makes you feel like you're being ripped off. They could put a microwave and a fridge in your room and that might make the fee a little more palatable.

This is a small very nice hotel at a great location. Close to lots of shops and restaurants and the subway. I stayed in one of the smaller rooms with a queen sized bed and it was very comfortable and quiet. Staff was friendly and knowledgable. I'll definitely stay here again.

I had to book this hotel last-minute due to weather-related travel delays, and I got lucky with a low promotional room rate. It's a cute boutique hotel with clean, but small, rooms, a good bar. The attached restaurant has an authentic Italian menu. Location within NYC was convenient for me - I had to attend a meeting in the upper west side. It's in a good neighbourhood and most tourist attractions are easily accessible by transit or walking distance.

Stay here frequently, great hotel for the price, perfect location, quite, clean, nice downstairs lounge, friendly staff. Convent to uptown museums , minutes to Central Park. Away from all the noise and lights of Times Square. Two blocks south of the subway .

the experience was good. the time for breaksfast (still 1030) in not very confortable. There is many people ussually in the lobby. Bat in general the staff is very nice people, spccially in the front desk, room service and botones also

For the very first time I got to NYLO, down from the lobby/ reception, the vibe has been overwhelming. I hope to check back real soon. What a nice place to be, I'm definitely coming back with my family and friends during Christmas because they'll all be around by then. Keep it up

What an experience! A wonderful stay from beginning to end. Upon check in, Hugo found out that it was my birthday and made it his mission in life to ensure that it was the best birthday ever. He even had wine sent up to the room while we were out so it was waiting for us when we got back! The room was beautiful, the staff was attentive, and the details were killer. Comfortable bed, and even nicer pillows. I will definitely be back.

Loved the vibe in the lobby and our doormen were fantastic. It is in a transition and will only get better. The rooms are clean and the bed was comfortable. No room service or mini bar. I kind of like those things.
user_name:
rickjewett206
San Miguel de Allende, Mexico

review_body: I had a meeting near Columbia and this was a good location. The subway was very close. Thankfully it wasn’t loud in the hallways which you can get in Manhattan. There are some nice restaurants and it is near the Beacon Theater.

Arthouse Hotel looks much better on line than in person - only the lobby has been updated. Rooms are outdated. My shower stall was shaky and the hot water took a good five minutes after turning the shower on. Hate wasting the water but dislike cold showers more. That said, lobby is cool and the staff is friendly. Betting with room updates it will be a much more comfortable stay.

Our stay at the Arthouse Hotel was great. The location is fantastic-a fun, convenient and safe neighborhood. The staff was friendly and available-from desk clerk, and bartenders to maintenance and housekeepers. The common rooms are very comfortable.

What a great surprise.i was snowed in and the art house was recommended...very cool vibe and excellent accommodation.I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and used the bar and restaurant as I had little time...great service and I will be back with the wife for sure.

The entire hotel's staff was spectacular.They took care of any request quickly, always with a smile. They made it easy to be there.Facilities were mostly great. Could use more towels in room without asking. Nice, well stocked bar, but no food / apps available until after 5 pm. However, I don't get the connection to the restaurant, Serafina, other than proximity. We had a breakfast package deal.. could have gotten better - friendlier service at the food cart at the corner.

We chose this hotel for the location. It was a ten minutes drive to the port of Manhattan Cruise Terminal which was great because we were leaving for a two weeks cruise the next morning. The personnel was very nice when we arrived and they gave us coupons for drinks at the bar. The rooms were tiny but the beds were comfortable. We went to Central Park because it was near the hotel.

The room was small and had someone else's hair in the shower, first impression. I paid in full before arriving only to find out that multiple taxes and fees would be added before I left. The valet parking is convenient and reasonably priced but they have an "in-out" penalty which quickly added up if I decided I wanted to use the car at any point. It's a nice area with subways a short walk away. CVS pharmacy is right across the street And the hotel has a nice bar and restaurant attached that are open late. Computer and printer access was nice as well for printing tickets to Broadway shows. Overall it was just okay. Safe bet if you're okay with spending.
user_name:
JaytuShea
New York City, New York

review_body: Overall a good stay. The urban resort fee is a joke, why not just include it in the room rate. The fee includes a free drink but the conditions are narrow and limited. Serafina is convient and a good option for breakfast or a pizza but dinner is pricey for the quality.

Ramona, the concierge at the front desk was very helpful and made my stay here very pleasant.If I need a hotel in the area again, I'll be sure to return because of her excellent service!!She was able to get me an early check-in and assist with some of those hidden fees that are sometimes associated with staying in Manhattan.

Loved this Hotel! Boutique experience without boutique pricing. Very safe neighborhood, excellent location - a quick walk to the subway to be anywhere you want in the city. Staff very helpful and the willing to go above and beyond. Being attached to Serafina Upper West (who will DELIVER TO YOUR ROOM!) is excellent. Get the omelette for breakfast - best I've ever had & the Margherita pizza for dinner; wonderful! Can't wait to go back!

What a find! This is a great hotel with a fun bar in the lobby. There was live music on Friday night and the bartenders are entertaining. The check in was smooth. It is a safe place, as you need a key to get to the upper floors. The rooms are small, but it is New York! The rooms have everything you would need. The rooms were relatively quiet and the beds were super comfortable too. The locationis perfect, away from the busy tourist scene, but close enough to walk to many attractions. We walked to Broadway, Times Square and the shops on 5th Avenue.

This is a perfect location for those visiting the Upper West Side. It's in the heart of everything UWS. Also there is an awesome bar (and bartenders) in the lobby for a drink or two before heading out for the evening. Lots of people and good energy at the bar and in the lobby. Rooms are ok at normal rates. However I've found that in January and February the rates go way down and for those prices this hotel is a fantastic value.

We had a great time at the hotel. Spotless clean and staff very attentive and well informed. The bar is a plus and we always were given great advice for any of our enquiries. Location wise the place is just minutes from everything that matters!

Jessie checked me in/out of the hotel and made sure my stay was satisfactory. I am a musician and sometimes I have a hard time at other hotels because of my large instrument, but not this one. I recommend staying at the Arthouse hotel, especially of you are a musician!

We had a 5 night stay and had a deluxe double double room. The check in staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was a good size for New York and comfortable beds, everything you need, the only slight issue was it would have been nice to have a bit more hanging space for 3 adults sharing. However, plenty of cupboard space, ironing board, coffee capsule machine etc.We asked for more coffee tea and milk (being Brits we like our tea!) the hotel reception was very obliging with this and even followed up with a room call to see if we had everything we needed.Checking out Jessie was very efficient and helpful and Eduardo arranged for us a cab to the airport and sorted storage until we were ready to depart.Upper West side is a great area to stay with loads of choice to eat - a must for breakfast is Sarabeth’s and Viande cafe diner is also excellent for breakfast.Jacobs pickles is an experience and a must for the best cookies ever is the Levain Bakery just round the corner from the hotel.Really pleased with this hotel and would highly recommend.

I hesitate to write this review because I don't want this hotel to be booked when I come to town again!But here goes, Arthouse is a fabulous place to stay in the upper west side.Friendliest staff! Super comfy beds. Great lounge area. Cool vibe. It's my go to place to stay in NYCLove the neighborhood..It's just the best

Very cozy and Artistcally decorated. A place to come back to.I had recommended your boutiquehideaway to five more in my family-All of us enjoyed our stay.Our experience both for breakfast and brunch were also enjoyable.

Stayed here with my GF and another couple. Hotel has a lovely reception area, room was a little small and outdated, certainly plenty to improve upon when it comes to the layout of the rooms. Half the lights didn't work, room itself was dark, sink a little impractical. Cleanliness, I can't complain about it was clean and always made.Reception had music, a great sitting relaxing area, other services such as the gym and roof we didn't have the time to use sadly.For the price and what you get it is pretty fair.Location is great.

I stayed here and was blown away by the wonderful service. The hotel is immaculate. The rooms are nicely appointed. A lovely boutique hotel. I will return! Special thanks to The doorman, Alberto. His kindness to this harried traveler will not be forgotten.

If you’re headed to NYC for a few days you may want to give this place a try. This was our second trip. It’s a small boutique hotel away from the hustle and bustle of time square. The bar is very quaint and a fun place e to sit and relax after a day out. The room was large enough, clean, small bathroom and comfortable. The cleaners came in early. One one day at 8:30, which I thought was really early. However I’d rather have that than too late! Very close by is the famous Lavain cookie shop. We walked to Central Park. This is a great find for NYC and a midrange hotel.

If you’re looking for a decently priced hotel that isn’t your typical conference-type boring place, this is it! Great bar/lounge with wood and brick decor. Rooms are large by NYC standards, modern and spare, and very clean. Comfy bed and great water pressure in the shower. Best of all, it’s within walking distance to so many great places, and only a few blocks to the subway. Tip: if you love great coffee, go to Irving Farm just two blocks away.

Comfortable, clean hotel with great customer service. Staff is friendly and helpful. Convenient location with easy access to subway, interesting restaurants and stores. Good jazz in the lounge the night we were there.

Hotel exceeded my expectations. It was very clean, quieter and comfortable. As someone with bad allergies, I was especially pleased to find the only hotel I’ve ever stayed in in the USA that did not have rugs! So much cleaner! My only complaint is I wish they had room service.
user_name:
Paradise55753669260
West New York, New Jersey

review_body: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Arthouse Hotel, check-in was easy, we had a 2 Queen Suite which was very comfortable.Very clean and quiet, housekeeping came daily.Would definitely stay here again and recommend this place.A great find in NYC...

Rooms are very spacious and clean. Staff is amazingly hospitable, friendly and helpful. From Viver attending the front desk to Jose greeting us and making sure we were comfortable. Convenient to subway, great restaurants and fun! Stay here every year.

Really enjoyed my all too brief stay here. The room was chic and spacious, esp spacious for Manhattan, and the location just off Broadway was ideal. Surprisingly quiet room; stylish bar; good breakfast options nearby. My one gripe was the cost of parking: $69 for 24h. But then this is NYC...

The hotel is well located, has a boutique feel to it but staff is sometimes not up to the task. We had reserved a room for three via their own website but there was only one double bed. We had to discuss a bit to get an extra bed. Heating was not working and after freezing for a couple of days (this was February) they moved us to a new room.

Stayed here recently on business. Room was nondescript, Manhattan small, but with a very comfortable bed. The writing desk was a bit too modest in dimensions for a person over 6 feet tall. The room was on the quiet side compared to other Manhattan hotels I've endured over the decades. The sitting area in the lobby was bright, inviting, and a mix of old and new Manhattan in terms of both lighting and decor. The staff was uniformly gracious and attentive. Many restaurant and convenience store choices nearby.

Every so often one comes across the perfect hotel in this city. If you have any reason to be in this part of NYC you cannot go wrong staying at the Arthouse Hotel. My stay was for business and the project I was working on was only a block away. There is a parking garage, also a block from the hotel, so I never needed my car. The area is full of good places to eat and there is a 24 Hour CVS right across the street from the hotel!

I made reservations to two CONNECTING ROOMS. Upon arrival we were told that the connecting rooms were sold out. This is unacceptable, putting our children in one room across the hall and my husband and I in another room. We felt uncomfortable sleeping.Additionally, They do not advertise the room rate properly. There is a $35.00 charge plus tax, for the use of water/coffee and parks. This is MANDATORY even if you do not want it, so it should be included in the advertised price of the room, not transparent. It is a hidden charge for no good reason.

The Arthouse is a very nice hotel. There is a restaurant and a bar on site, as well as a sitting area in the lobby. We appreciated the quiet of the 12th floor; we had to get started early in the morning, and were able to get to sleep with no problem.

From the moment we entered the lobby we knew it would be for us, a hubbub of noise and a cosy bar! The room was plenty big enough and had everything you could want, except the windows faced a brick wall! Curiously, the bed was about three feet off the ground, but neither of us fell out of bed so no harm done!

My daughter and I had a reservation for a one night stay at the Arthouse. We had worked all weekend to pack up her apartment and arrived at the hotel three hours before check-in completely exhausted. From the second we exited our Uber, we had an excellent experience. We were greeted by a friendly doorman who immediately relieved us of our heavy bags and directed us to the front desk. Vivek ( I hope I’m spelling this right) greeted us warmly and quickly got us into a room early. As there was a small fee for early check in, he compromised and gave us a beautiful suite. The suite was beautifully appointed including a pretty view of the Hudson from our private balcony. Later that evening we used our complimentary drink tickets to relax in their charming bar. I could go on and on! Suffice it to say I have finally found my favorite hotel in NYC and am looking forward to coming back in the fall!!

Excellent location in NYC. Great restaurants nearby. Subway and bus access to museums and other attractions. Safe neighborhood. Easy walking to Central Park, Riverside Park and the Museum of Natural History.

We tried to contact accounting several times. They never returned our calls. We needed to find out how our valet package was not honored when we checked out. We had made reservations online and paid for this package, yet it did not show up on their desk computer. We just gave up.Be very careful that you are receiving exactly what you paid for.

My favorite NYC hotel. Friendly helpful staff ! Always enjoyable.. I have stayed at his hotel about a dozen times. I love the neighborhood, great museums and resturants. I would highly recommend this charming hotel.

Great location on the Upper West Side, close to the park and museums, comfortable room and bed, cool lobby and bar, excellent service. Jazz singer in the bar on Friday, but very quiet in the room. The guest services manager left me a sweet treat because it was my birthday. Would definitely stay here again!

Very nice place to stay. The desk staff were helpful. The room was clean and well furnished. The neighborhood is very friendly. Very close to subway stops. There a many good restaurants in the area and Central Park is just a couple of blocks away.

Our check in was quick and easy thanks to Jessie. Location is great with great access to subway. We really enjoyed the live entertainment in the lobby. This our 4th stay here and we will be back again!

Great location, great hotel. Staff extremely helpful and friendly (thanks Jessie!). Very comfortable bed. Great little lobby/bar/lounge area. Perfect for couples looking to spend some quality time in New York.

I have stayed there 3 different times. I like the neighborhood and restaurants and shops close by(avoid Serafina, however). I usually stay in a room with a terrace— it works for me. Rooms are neat, with laminate floors.

Wonderful welcome.Jesse at the reception is professional, welcoming,accomodating!It is a real pleasure to be welcomed this way !Having a restaurant in the hotel is very practical.the location is amazing if you like the upper westside.

The staff makes the Arthouse Hotel. Everyone working there is professional, kind and courteous eager to help make your stay pleasurable. A shout out to Jessie at the front desk who made our stay special. Thank you Arthouse Hotel!

Stayed here recently, was the first time I stayed in the upper west side of NYC and thought it was a nice place. We checked in late so I can't say how the bar was or anything like that, but the room was fairly large for NYC, it easily fit a king size bed in it. The bathroom was small, but nice. It had your basic shower. sink and toilet. The bed was comfortable and all-in-all thought it had good value. there is a subway nearby, the 1 train is on 79th, a short walk away which can take you directly into Times Square. The surrounding area was very nice with plenty of places to eat and other amenities.. I'd stay here again.

Ramona who answers the phones is the sweetest angel in the world! She bent over backwards to accommodate my needs and I am sure the help she provided isn't even in her job description but she recognized how important this was to me and took the time herself to help me. The hotel was busy and I'm sure phones ringing off the hook but she made me feel so important and like my 1 measly room request mattered. I haven't even visited the property yet but she has already made me fall in love with the hotel. THIS is service!!! She has a heart for hospitality and I think should be recognized for it. You are lucky to have her on your team- she is a huge asset in my opinion. Thank you for your hospitality and kindness, Ramona! You are a gem!!

This is a nice hotel. It seems reasonably priced by NYC standards. The room was small. The bed was good. The adjoining restaurant (private) was pricey for the quality of food. The hotel is close to Broadway Bvd and could be a bit noisy at night.

The Arthouse is a boutique hotel that I have been staying in on trips back to NYC for years. I started staying when it was ON THE AVE. New owners same charm. Rooms are modern & bathrooms are good size. Only complaints are shower drain does not drain well something they cannot seem to fix. Location is excellent for restaurants of any type as well as CVS across the street Museums and park all in walking distance. Subways are easy. Front staff especially Hugo very helpful & knowledgeable.

check in was very late rooms not ready on time, no maid service the second day , very busy fire dept across the street, sirens all night, not enough towels, poor water pressure, room was very drafty, cold when we arrived took hours to warm up , the remote had an unknown substance on it, ewww

We stayed in this hotel for work and everything was fine, in a good position clean and quite. Ramona from the reception is amazing, gentle and she is kindly available to help you in everything, Brava Ramona and hope to came back soon!

Great location, fantastic restaurants and bars in the vicinity, amazing employees from front desk to doormen, cleaning rooms and very comfortable bed. We asked for a corner room 2 weekends in a row they are very spacious.

Had a wonderful stay at Arthouse Hotel this past weekend! Even though I arrived before check-in, Jessie was able to help me get into my room and was extremely courteous and thorough in explaining the amenities of the hotel. The room had all the basic amenities and was comfortable; but the bed was particularly notable. I always feel like hotel pillows are terrible, even at the 4+ star hotels. These pillows were great. I didn't want to get up! Will definitely be staying here again.

Room was great, clean, large with 6 windows overlooking Broadway . We had our year old grandson with us so we upgraded to a jr, suite, well worth the extra charge. Enjoy the lobby with your welcome drink

We were welcomed by the friendly valet when we arrived and again at the front desk when we check-in. Having made this reservation several months ago, I was happily surprised when we were upgraded to a top floor corner suite. This was a special weekend I had arranged for my wife and I, so it was very much appreciated. The main lobby is a very mixed and eclectic decor, with casual living spaces with couches and games, and a very inviting and comfortable bar for pre and post dinner drinks. On Friday night, there was live music as well. Note you will be charged an extra $35 urban fee on top of your room charge to cover additional items and services including 2 drinks at the bar, 2 water bottles and coffee in the room, and wi-fi service. Overall, this was a great stay and we hope to be back again for a future NYC adventure.

Very nice upscale hotel in a great location. Two blocks from subway or bus. Short walk to many shops, restaurants, coffee shops, etc. We have stayed here on two different trips and will most likely stay here again when we return. The Jr. Suites are nice and roomy.

This is a very good place to sleep if you want to be on the Upper West Side and want a reasonably priced, clean place. The rooms look like they were decorated from Ikea (maybe the kids' section) and are small. The lobby bar is noisy. The staff is incredibly unhelpful. (Don't expect help with your luggage--even dragging your suitcase up the steps to the lobby and asking the front desk a simple question can take 15 minutes). But it's clean, well located, and reasonably priced.

Arthouse is a great combination of funk & elegance. We love the lobby and the bar. An intersection of business and pleasure. The layout really lends itself to business and leisure travel. Great location!

Great hotel with super staff. Jessie at front desk was warm and welcoming and made sure we were taken care of. Close to metro and shops nearby. Rooms are modern and clean. Bar in lobby is nice and doors open to street when warmer

First of all I was greeted by the most amazing bellman including Danny who helped me to room and unpack and was so kind to my puppy and I!!! Then Jessie helped me check in with such ease!! There was a room ready right away and they were so helpful if I needed anything. I ended up staying 5 nights as I really enjoyed the location and the ammenties! Maggie the Front Desk Manager was amazing!!!!!!! She helped me stay in a comfortable room and made sure that I had everything I needed. The lobby music was great and the clean atmosphere was great! This is a great hotel for families as well! Super Bowl Sunday was awesome here! Tons of community and fun!! I give this hotel 10 stars!! I set it up like my apartment and it felt so cozy!

Extremely impressed with the room the staff and the pricing. The beds and bedding were ultra comfortable. I have already recommend the Arthouse to friends and I plan on coming back in the summer. The location was perfect also.

An unexpected problem arose after a visit in September 2018 which was exacerbated by confusion over the price of a new booking made directly with the hotel website (price comparisons not including city tax, etc.). This led to an email exchange which directly addressed the issues and completely resolved them. On arrival things were not as expected but helpful staff (notably Maggie Zambrano) coped extremely well with a very tired jet lagged traveller and again completely resolved any issues that I had.

Great location, well-appointed and comfortable rooms and the BEST SERVICE of any hotel we have stayed in in NYC. We visit the city often and this has become our Go-To hotel. Near subways, Central Park, Riverside Drive parks, excellent restaurants and museums.

I have been staying here for over 10 years and its become my home away from home. This time there was a slight challenge with my room and the fabulous Jessie at the front desk, without missing a beat, stepped in and helped get everything sorted within moments. She could not have been more lovely, helpful and kind. She knew it was my birthday week and helped to make it extra special. I own my own business so I know how challenging it can be to find great people-this hotel has a great person in Jessie! Thank you Jessie!

I’m really glad I booked here. The property is very neatly kept and wellMaintained. The room was very comfortable and everybody I came in contact with who worked there was very professional and friendly. I’d stay here again in a heartbeat. We definitely itely had a very nice stay here and I’d highly recommend it.

We stayed at the Arthouse for three weeks to spend time with our new granddaughter who lives nearby. The hotel was just what we needed for our visit. The management and staff worked, very pleasantly, to give us a reasonable rate and to make a couple changes to our scheduled stay as the need came up. The rooms were modern and comfortable, the bar and lobby area was buzzing and had corners and furniture arrangements great for long chats with friends ( and a baby!), and the location is in a trendy fun area with great coffee shops, restaurants, and stores— and Central Park— within walking distance. Maybe the highlight of our stay was Edmund the doorman, who seemed to be working all hours and who greeted us with a huge smile every time we arrived and wished us well every time we left, making us feel very at home. The “urban fee” charged nightly seems excessive and we sometimes had to track down caffeinated coffee for our Keurig. Overall our stay was very enjoyable and we recommend it highly.

Wonderful stay, great location, pleasant staff, beautiful lobby and bar, nicely renovated rooms! Typically small NYC room but really nicely decorated and appointed. Great value. Will definitely be back!
