The lobby is perfect: divided in 4, it has a bar in the center of one of the halves, with tables on one side and couches and chairs on the other. We all received a chit for a free drink upon arrival: very pleasant on a cold winter's evening. The other half of the lobby has a well-lit space for reading, chatting, or working on computers, and the reception area. The reception people know the whole area, and helped us get a Metrocard and find the right bus to take us across Central Park to the Metropolitan Museum of Art. They also helped me find an affordable coat on the upper west side! The beds are super-comfortable. I'm not nuts about ultra-modern decor, but in this hotel it is not pushed too far. Overall, a good experience.

The location is great; easy access to 1 train to get anywhere in the city, or up to Columbia Teacher's College. Nice neighborhood and many choices of restaurants in the area. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Front desk is always helpful.

Great location if you need to be on the upper West side, CVS across the street , Soul cycle and Yoga next door. Great salad bar and Juice bard close by. , Staff was wonderful, easy check in. The Italian restaurant was delicious. Bartender funny and makes great drinks. Great public space to sit play games , work, meet clients. 1 block from the subway.

The hotel has rebranded but the amazing staff is still there. The welcome received from Ramona and Tasha for all, and especially returning guests is simply divine. Yes they really care, and want your stay and experience to be enjoyable. The vibe remains cozy, feel at home.Love coming back each time.

Still a great neighborhood hotel - rooms are small, bathrooms very small! Everything clean! Subway very convenient as are great local restaurants and services. One of the best upper west side restaurants is located near the property - Red Farm! One best feature of this hotel is a keurig coffee pot in each room

This hotel is so ideally located, you can't go wrong. It has an artsy jazzy vibe, cool decor, and anything you could want nearby.I was here 5 years ago, when it is was under a different name. It was a smoother operation then, the bar was amazing. Where did bartender Charles go?! But, I still rate it highly because even with average bar service, it is still a great place.

Everything was great in the Arthouse Hotel, from the kind reception fo Jessie up to the room and the lively bar and its live music. Location is perfect, two short blocks to the subway, and quite near to the Central Park and restaurants and bars in Amsterdam, Broadway and Columbus. I will go back

The hotel was very clean, uncluttered, with unique furniture. Two restaurants, attached were convenient for drinks and food choices. We were very pleased with all aspects of our stay.Would recommend to friends and family.

My wife and I recently got married in Central Park and so one of the main reasons we chose to stay here was due to the close proximity of the hotel to this location. However, we found there were so many more reasons why this is such a great hotel! The staff were all really friendly, helpful, responsive and polite. Our room was comfortable, clean and spacious. The hotel is within very close walking distance to several subway stations which made getting around really quick and easy. Despite the hotel being located in a busy area, we found that outside noise was not an issue and so had a very quiet stay. The interior of the hotel looks great and the onsite bar was really good too. Heaps of reasons why we would happily stay here again and in fact we are looking forward to planning a return trip!

the room is small and the bath not nice its very cold look some night the water wasnt hot . also there is no loyalty program.the staff is nice and welcome and the lobby is very welcome and nice. need for renovation

It was a great experience all around. Really friendly staff, very cool hip hotel. The rooms were beautiful and the location was just perfect for us.We would absolutely stay here again on our next trip to New York

The hotel was centrally located and truly has that classic boutique feel and charm. The front desk and bell staff were very knowledgeable or the area and extremely accommodating in assisting with finding places to eat or tour. In addition, I must give a shout out to the entire bar staff - specifically; Henry, Christopher, Christian and Ben (in no particular order) as they were outstanding! I just wished that the bar didn't open at 3PM though!. The room could have been bigger; however, I had a room with a terrace that was large - which could be the reason that the inside quarters seemed a little cramped. I will definitely return when the weather warms up to enjoy the terrace and will likely request the same room!
user_name:
L7644ZHtonyb
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: flew into nyc for a few days to visit our son. happened upon arthouse on the internet. turns out, family members of ours who live in the upper west side, spend time there, to relax and have a drink.The staff went beyond being courteous. When we changed our desired room requirements, not only were they accommodating, we were offered a free upgrade.Trendy and homey at the same time.
user_name:
Jeffrey E
w. bloomfield, United States

review_body: Even though under new management we didn’t feel that anything suffered. In fact staff seemed friendlier! Really love this hotel. The only disappointment was that the Serafina restaurant in the lobby no longer serves full breakfast - only continental. Not as convenient.

Beautiful space in a great neighborhood. Everything was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. Will definitely return next time we visit the city. Extremely pleased with all aspects of our stay!

Recently stayed here. Great location, clean, updated, and a real value. Edmond was particularly gracious and helpful!!! Will definitely stay again and will recommend Arthouse to any of my friends or colleagues headed to Manhattan. Many nice restaurants within walking distance.

This hotel has a lot of character. The lobby area has a bar with lots of couches and comfortable seating. You get a welcome drink upon arrival. The rooms are small but modern and clean. Having the Serafina restaurant adjacent is nice for late dinners and take out. The first night we got take out desserts and sat in the lobby bar listening to live music and having our complimentary drinks and dessert.

Best location! Quiet and away from the hustle and bustle! Made me remember why I love NYC. hotel was comfortable. Room was huge. Best sleep in a long time! cool and hip too - Good food next door at Serafinos. My daughter got sick and it was great having a CVS close by too! We will stay here again.

We stayed at the Arthouse for a Mother/Daughter trip to NYC to see "To Kill A Mockingbird" - which was excellent by the way. The hotel was perfect for our purposes. The location was convenient and the hotel itself was perfect.

We stayed for four cold January nights. All of the staff-front desk, hops, bartenders, maintenance, housekeeping-were just lovely! They made you feel like you and your business were important to them. The small bar and lounge area were cozy and a classy place to relax after long hours of NYC walking. The room was just what we needed. We were impressed with the storage options and cleanliness. There wasn’t a whole lot of space, but who needs a dance floor in a NY hotel room? The bed was incredibly comfortable. One lightbulb was out in our shower, but we weren’t bothered to report it. It was fixed the next day anyway. We were happy to walk around town from there. We walked to Central Park, the Metropolitan Museum of Art and several bars/restaurants through safe neighborhoods. It was a short and easy two blocks to the subway and always easy to find a cab.

We stayed there one night in January, 2019. We had stayed here years earlier when it was the NYLO hotel.It's conveniently located at 77th and Broadway. The reason for our trip was to attend the Metropolitan Opera. It's an easy walk to Lincoln Center. It's also just two blocks from the subway at 79th if you are attending a Broadway show in the 40's.The room was not large but plenty large enough for the two of us. It was quiet and the desk staff is friendly and helpful. We didn't eat in the restaurant, so I can't comment on it.

We are staying at the Arthouse for a 4 day trip, booked thru Expedia and I am so glad we decided to come back. This was On the Ave before I think, a few years ago and the rebrand and refurb is lovely. Most importantly the team are friendly and efficient. Rooms are excellent for NY, good use of space (we are on 9th floor). The lobby area with bar is very comfy, and buzzy in the evenings. Location is great for the park and museum. Takes 20 mins to walk to Times Sq, subways are really close. Handy having the Serafina restaurant attached, but we haven't used this yet this trip. Very happy with everything!

If you want to stay in a real NYC neighborhood with a terrific, welcoming staff (especially Jessie at the front desk!), this is the place! Makes you feel like you're really living in the city during your stay, instead of just passing through the tourist grinder.

Was visiting Columbia University with my daughter and the Arthouse was the perfect location. Great amenities, clean room. Room was very quiet which can be difficult in a City location and excellent/friendly staff

Nice hotel, nice lobby, good location and nice staff. Viver gave us free tickets to the Lincoln theater. Bed was extremely comfortable. Clean rooms. Pay attention to the urban fee before booking. Is 35 dollar each and was not communicated by booking.com when we booked the room.

Location was great. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Lots of restaurants near by and it has a restaurant accessible from the hotel. It is easily within walking distance of Central Park and also Times Square was not all that far away. Bar was busy during the evening and it has a nice atmosphere about it.

If you want a NYC hotel that is modern but cozy, located on the Upper West Side near lots of great restaurants and bars, with friendly staff and excellent service, look no further than Arthouse, which used to be NYLO. I stay here on all my upper west side trips and love it. I especially like the warm, fun lobby bar. And to get to Serafina you just walk through a door in the lobby, which is convenient. Great value for the price.

I’m a NY local and had to find a place to stay for a bit. My stay here was great. I love the decor and the ambiance throughout the entire hotel, especially in the lobby. Cleanliness was great too, smelled good and bathrooms were clean. Felt very comfortable throughout my stay. Staff was great too. One of my favorite things about it is location. It’s a quiet but also busy neighborhood. Not Time Square but still great architecture and easy to get around. Great local spots around the area too. Highly recommend.

Have stayed at the Hotel Belleclaire many times (across the street) and recently tried the NYLO/ArtHouse. A funky vibe in the lobby. Friendly and welcoming staff. Fun bar and lobby seating area. Comfortable room and fantastic location with amazing restaurants nearby and easy walk to Lincoln Center and Central Park. My only complaint is the Urban Fee which is not charged by some other similar nearby hotels (including the Belleclaire). Kind of sneaky since it isn't included in the room rate and you really don't get much for the $40+ per night (including tax) that is charged. Makes comparison pricing difficult.

My husband and I recently spend one night here and had a good stay. We came up to NYC to watch a show and to hang out with family traveling from overseas. We got a very good deal on this room and had somewhat low expectations. However, when we arrived, we were impressed with the hotel lobby and its lively atmosphere. We arrived early so our room was not ready. But we were able to leave our bags. About an hour later, they called us notifying us that our room was ready. Very impressed. To compare, our family had to wait in the lobby for more than 3 hours to check into a nearby 5 star property. The room itself was simple yet spacious. For NYC this is a very big hotel room. The toiletries were great quality. I would easily rate this a 3/3.5 star property.As a Gold expedia member, I had a VIP gift which was two free drinks. The free drinks were somewhat underwhelming. The wine I had was sadly terrible and my husband's beer tasted like water. We did not finish our drinks and left. We wanted to order top shelf drinks there but felt like the bartender was not attentive and decided to take our business elsewhere. After all, this is NYC and bars were plentiful.It was an overall good stay. The location is in a quiet area near museum and central park which was what we loved. Considering how much we paid, we would definitely return to this hotel again.

When I arrived, there was only one person attending the registration desk and it took 20 minutes to check in. I had reserved the penthouse due to the advertised amenities. The living area was plain but ok. The bedroom was small with minimal furnishings for clothes, etc. From the bedroom at a distance was a partial view to the Hudson River.The balcony was not great and not as expected. In looking at other alternatives, there seems to be rooms with better views with balconies than the penthouse,The vibe was good but the bar closes early on the weekends.Improved furnishings and better photos of the rooms and views would help.The property has a lot of potential ut needs attention to the details. It could be great but not yet

Hotel is great location with plenty to do at this location. Lobby is welcoming and small bar is comfortable. Price is great for NYC. Staff is always helpful and friendly Only down side is that you stopped serving breakfast at the hotel

Stayed at the Arthouse during a family weekend event. The rooms are small and irregularly shaped which does not hinder the visit and speaks to the hotel’s charm. The lobby is aromatically soothing and sophisticated, the bar is lively enough, and good food abounds from Serafina. Wish Serafina would deliver earlier in the morning w some of there baked goods and fabulous scrambled eggs !

A quiet, comfortable room with no view. My only complaint is the bathroom was freezing. But the shower was strong and hot, and everything else was really pleasant. The lounge areas were good for meeting up with people. NYC taxes are crazy high, so there was a little sticker shock checking out, but that's the case with any NYC hotel.

I enjoyed my stay at the Arthouse Hotel. The beds were comfy and the rooms were quiet. That said, a few of my towels were stained when I arrived but had been folded like they were clean. In addition, there is no one in the lobby directing guests to the front desk; this can be a little chaotic because there is also a bar in the lobby.Overall, it was a pleasant stay.

Amazing location, stayed here for 4 nights last December 29th to Jan 3. Walking distance to the subway and a 15 min walk to hit Central Park. Great amenities and love the high-beds and mini living room - simple yet cozy and clean. Awesome bar/cafe downstairs where we celebrated the strike of 12 last New Year's eve!

Lovely hotel on Upper West Side. Stayed here for 2 nights in January 2019. Standard king size room provided plenty of space for the two of us. Bed was extremely comfortable and shower was good. Plenty of lighting with nice reading lights on besides. Only problem was when heat went on in middle of night was loud enough to wake me up. We lowered temperature on 2nd night was no longer a problem.

Excellent location and value; comfortable and welcoming lobby, responsive staff. We would definitely stay here again. Close to subway, Central Park, museums, shops and restaurants. Great restaurant on sight.

This hotel is great. The lobby and the bar area, plus a few other areas to take a seat and relax, are all very cozy and inviting. Our room was spectacular and spacious. We had a suite on the 14th floor with a terrace (unfortunately it is January) If I were to come back, I would ask for a higher floor because the view is somewhat blocked by some sort of overhang and that was disappointing. I feel the value cannot be beat.

I've stayed at the NYLO, now Arthouse, Hotel on numerous occasions. The location is great - close to the subway, just off Broadway, near tons of restaurants and shops. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The lobby is very cool, too! I checked in very late on my most recent stay and I was warmly greeted despite the late hour. This is my "go to" NY hotel.

Quick overnight. Having serafina downstairs made life easy. Also the bar was a hip happening place nice to sit for a few minutes and enjoy the music. Liked the vibe and despite being on the second floor and across the street from a firehouse surprisingly quiet!
user_name:
peter m
New York City, New York

review_body: Efficient check in and out. Charming hotel, room clean. Good security which, as a solo traveler, made me feel comfortable. Lobby area inviting and lively during happy hour. Nice neighborhood, residential. Close to Lincoln Center, severalmuseums, Zabars. I will stay there again.

My room felt like a dorm room at college. Very tiny, no fridge, microwave or other such items. I was there for a week but didn't spend too much time there. No view what so ever. All I saw was brick walls on both sides. I was on the 11th floor. Bed was comfortable enough and my room was pretty quite room 1120. Went to the bar one night and sat at a table for 20 minutes and no one came over to take an order and finally left. The restaurant attached is very good. The hotel provides a coffee machine and water free of charge in room only. Wifi was dependable. Gym is very tiny. The location though is very good and easy to walk many places.

We spent the weekend in Manhattan, seeing Broadway shows and Jerry Seinfeld at the Beacon Theatre. This hotel is a perfect hotel for the Beacon Theatre, with an exceptionally helpful staff...especially Edmond, who steered us towards wonderful local restaurants and sights. Room is small but perfectly functional and the ambience of the lobby is warm and inviting. We will definitely return.

Somehow I lucked out and got a room with a terrace. Best view ever! Floor to ceiling windows everywhere! Space Galore! I LOVE this property! Great location, quiet, two blocks from the train, and a yummy restaurant downstairs, the convenience of CVS literally right across the street. Fun, colorful storage cubes and lots of closet space. I couldn't ask for more, amd can't wait to go back!

good hotel, good location, bustling lobby, restaurants next door, accessible without going outside. Quiet room, comfortable bed. Did not like the $35 charge for basically a couple of water bottles and wireless connectivity, but it's NYC on NYE

The Arthouse Hotel was a pleasant surprise! There is a very nice lobby/bar area with jazz music on Friday and Saturday nights. Given a free drink coupon! The reception staff is excellent. Cordial, polite and patient. The building and rooms are undergoing renovation but overall, quite acceptable. We found our room clean with modern furniture and decor. Close to the subway station at 79th.

New year trip to New York, I have issues with elevators my original reservations were on the 6 floor. I asked for a lower floor room the front desk had no issues changing our room out on one of the busiest time of the year.

I booked this hotel yesterday after hours of research for a special trip this October. In the booking notes I asked if we could have a cot in the room for our one year old. The Reservations Manager emailed this morning to say they don't provide cots and that we would need to provide our own (we are flying in from the UK). This is beyond disappointing for a 4 star hotel and not at all clear in their marketing. They claim to "welcome children of all ages." In my reply to the Reservations Manager I asked her to amend this to "welcomes children of all ages who will not roll out of a bed." Confusingly, I've since searched words like 'cot' and 'crib' in the guest reviews and there's lots of negative experiences, but it does in fact look like some guests have had cots added to their rooms?! What a shambles, and it's really put a downer on our plans to stay in what looks like a lovely hotel.

Needs some better upkeep and attention. Not sure if growing pains with new ownership. Our room had tiny chards of glass that I stepped in with my socks. It was cleaned up when I notified them but still. And no call from management aplogizing. Also, very stingy on towels for no apparant reason. Refolded towels that were placed in the tub for replacement. The cabinets for clothes were hard to open and odd decor (lockers instead of logical drawers).

This hotel is in a great location if you are looking to get out of the extremely touristy areas within the city. The rooms are very large compared to others with plenty of storage space. The staff was extremely helpful and accommodating as they let us check in much earlier than the allotted time. The only negative I have to say is in regards to the fitness center. There was one “working” treadmill that did not work great and was very unsteady and off balance. That being said, I will continue to stay at this hotel in the future!

We stayed at the Arthouse hotel over the Christmas/New Years holidays. Our room was beautiful and spacious, especially by NYC standards. We had a double queen bed room. The location was perfect with less than a 2 min walk to the subway, close to Central Park, and the Natural History museum. The only complaint that we had is that staff seemed to use walkie talkies to communicate with each other and would walk down the hallway speaking on the devices, sometimes in the middle of the night. This was very disruptive and perhaps the staff could be more thoughtful about turning down the volume on their devices and also not speaking loudly into them while in the hallway. The receptionist at the front desk was lovely. She greeted us warmly when we arrived and also gave our young daughter's a lovely treat.
user_name:
aggupta
New York City, New York

review_body: What a gorgeous hotel! We loved it and our Junior Suite was perfect size for the 4 of us! I loved the location and cant wait to come back! The only small issue I had was there is no microwave or fridge in the room which was a huge inconvenience when traveling with a toddler. I suggest Nylo look into this as I have read this issue in other reviews as well! Other than that it was The BEST!

Stayed here for a week over Christmas. Loved every minute of it. The art house made us so welcome and all the staff we encountered were great. The bed in my room was soooo comfortable. Would def recommend this hotel to all.

I keep coming back to this hotel because of the great location on the Upper West Side, easy walk to many attractions like the Museum of Natural History, Central Park, Riverside, Subway and so much more! The ambiance of the hotel is a comfortable, yet a casual elegance, the lobby bar has a great atmosphere where you can catch live music a couple of times a week, not to mention the best bartenders in NYC- Ben, Chris, Henri and Christoper! The front desk staff, Carlos, Vivic, Ramona, Tasha, Armando are friendly, helpful and treat every guest with exceptional service. The doormen and bellman, Orlando, Alberto, George, Henry, Edmond, Edwardo, Danny, Jose are the best in the city, always willing to assist with anything you need. I know all these people because I keep coming back to the Arthouse where I feel very much at home! Thank you Arthouse Hotel for making my stay another enjoyable one, see you again in June 2019!

Big rooms, great location, great service, can’t wait to go back - we brought our toddler and puppy and had an amazing experience - easily the nicest dog friendly hotel I’ve stayed at. Close to the park and great restaurants. One of the best hotel experiences I’ve had in NYC
user_name:
nortonky
New York City, New York

review_body: We found it to be a well located hotelThe lobby had great ambience,NYLO provided prompt and efficient serviceWe selected and received a quiet room ... away from elevatorsThe room was small, clean and compact.

Really comfortable and "hip" vibe of this hotel. It has a fun bar in the lobby, a great place to meet friends. The rooms are a bit small/crowded, but overall a great value for the location. Close to lots of great restaurants, bars, shopping and the subway.

We stayed in a junior suite and the space was great. Staff was helpful and housekeeping was always expeditious . Loved our stay! Subway is two blocks away and two blocks from the park. Bookstores, restaurants and coffee shops all close by-but of course all those are by many places in the city

This is such a great location to central park, on the redline subway and nat history muesum is so close. the rooms are newly renovated and so comfortable. I found all the staff from the doorman, reception, the bar and housekeeping so very friendly and helpful. Definitely love to go back and stay. Oh one more thing - it is dog friendly, so you must love dogs to stay here.

I went to the hotel's website last night to look at making a reservation for later this year. It was late and I did not book it, but was going to come back to it today. I received an email from the hotel at 6:30 this morning saying that they had noticed I was on the site and they wanted to offer me 15% off if I would complete the booking. I clicked on the email - two minutes after receiving it - and received the message that there were no rooms available. I tried again, same thing. I went to the hotel's website and saw that there are rooms available for the nights we wanted. I called and first was told that I was probably on a third party website, no. Then the person said that because so many people were probably sent the email, that the rate was no longer available - two minutes after the email? When I mentioned she didn't even try to ask me for the dates and ask how she could help me, she hung up on me! Not a good intro to your hotel. I am a New Yorker and am looking to bring my son here for his first visit. Apparently we will be staying somewhere else.

I have stayed at NYLO at least five times with my staff over the last three years and I love staying at this hotel. The rooms are incredibly comfortable and clean. The lounge space is inviting and, hip and friendly. But most importantly the staff from the person who greats you at when you arrive with your car to the reception at the front desk treat you like family. There a a number of great restaurants, fitness studios and locals that make staying a this hotel feel like its a destination spot in and of itself. I often insist on staying at this hotel when travelling to Gotham. You almost feel like you might run into Bruce Wayne at this hotel.

We stayed here just last Christmas. Superb location with easy access to subway (on W79th St). My wife loved it as across the street you find convenient store, pharmacy and Marshall's plus a number of restaurants. Central Park is within walking distance. The room is of a good size not too small considering this is NYC. We're traveling with our 8 year-old. A rollaway bed was wheeled in after our request FOC and can be placed at the foot of the existing bed with no problem. The window could hardly be opened and the view from our room was another building wall but that was not a problem as we were out and about all day and only return to sleep. A spacious sitting/working area in the lobby with 30 minutes complimentary use of their computer and printer - very convenient in case you need to print something. The work area also has a power sockets for you to plug in your laptop. Almost everything was thought of with the design. What I like very much is that there are more than enough power outlets in the room to plug your appliances. We could charge at the same time our 2 iPhones, 1 iPad, 2 Powerbank chargers, 2 battery chargers for our cameras, my electrical toothbrush and a hairdryer. It was great. The only drawback would be that one evening, the cooking smell was so much on our 8th floor that we could smell this throughout the corridor. Upon reporting this to the Guest Service, we were told that there was a tenant cooking on that floor. They did send someone to spray the corridor with the air refresher though.

I stayed in the Arthouse Hotel in late December 2018 with my wife. We checked in on a Friday night, which was an interesting experience as there is live (and good) music on Fridays that unfortunately is directly facing the check in desk. The energy was great in the bar/lounge but we had to basically speak right into the front desk staff's ear to be heard. That said, once checked in, our room was easy to find, was a great size for NYC, exceptionally comfortable bed and nice bathroom with decent water pressure in the shower (no tub). It was also very quiet throughout our stay and the free drink provided at check in went to good use on our second evening when the bar/lounge was not quite so action packed. The staff are all friendly, efficient and approachable.The hotel is a very short walk to Central Park and in fact we walked everywhere we went on this particular trip. The theatre district is reachable within 30 minutes by foot as is Times Square etc... Loads of choice for restaurants in the area to choose from - recommend both Red Barn and Serafina, two places we enjoyed.The gym was really the only disappointment. Not only is is shoebox sized, but two of three treadmills were out of service.If I could give the hotel 4.5/5 I would do so and would definitely stay here again.

This hotel was a complete surprise seeing how we weren't exactly sure what to expect. The place is very posh & bougie !!! The atmosphere is super cool, the room we had was extremely spacious and the location was PERFECT for us. We enjoyed being a little ways away from Times Square but close enough to everything that it worked out well. The staff was overboard on being helpful and attentive. This will be our hotel of choice anytime we travel to NY. Thank you Arthouse !!!

The new named hotel, which was once NYLO is cozy and has great views from the penthouse. Such a quieter neighborhood with access to everything I needed in walking distance. Very clean and very accommodating. Be patient they do not move at a very fast pace. I was very pleased with the room. Oh my goodness the bed was so comfortable! Great resturant attached with basic simple food.

I've stayed here several times under the NYLO name. The property needs to be updated and is showing wear. Two main issues I have are our room was right outside the elevator and it was very loud. you can hear everyone coming and going. I would make sure you don't get a room near the elevator. It was a bit disappointing because we were there five nights and you would think the staff would have put us in a better room. The housekeeping was very poor. Out of 5 nights there were 3 days we did not get any towels and had to call down. The first time it took well over an hour to get the towels and when I went to the front desk I was told there was nothing that could be done until someone from housekeeping was available to deliver towels. Not sure why that takes an hour. Plus having this happen 3 out of 5 nights seems like poor QC. The lobby is very warm and the bar is nice to hang. Again, you can't beat the location, close to the subway, food, the park and its great if you like the UWS. Rooms are small, even for NYC, and the room we had did not have a dresser. The "urban" fee is $35 which is basically a way to charge more for the room. The internet is ok and the gym is a joke, three of the five treadmills and elliptical trainers were broken and there's enough room for one person to use the very small weight set. The place has potential and once its updated i'd consider.

Walking in to the wonderfully and eclectically furnished hotel lobby at the Arthouse (formerly known as NYLO) I had this instinctive feeling that staying at this hotel was going to be most memorable, which it most certainly was! Right after a congenial Arthouse manager processed my check in, I went to my assigned hotel room, opened the door and walked through what has to be one of my most favorite NYC hotel rooms that I ever stayed at to date. In particular, this hotel suite was artistically designed using soft paint colors, lightly stained sanded wood floors juxtaposed with modern classical elements, such as Scandinavian furniture that together evokes an overall lasting sentiment of total relaxation. The suite itself included: a very large bedroom with a king sized ultra comfortable bed, huge flat screen TV and long writer’s desk; a living room with a floral print couch, white leather chair, varnished wood desk and a well appreciated, very good coffee maker; a bathroom with a white porcelain sink and glass encased smartly designed shower that easily allows two people to shower together and two spectacular terraces whereby one faced easterly and the other, westerly with a lovely view of the Henry Hudson River. For the entire duration of my stay I felt incredibly peaceful and content Arthouse is an exceptionally well run hotel whereby their entire hotel staff pay extra special attention to what perhaps all hotel patrons desire, which is to be treated as if they are “very important people”. The staff here could not be any more accommodating even if they wanted to because they all perform their jobs in such an outstanding manner. I want to mention Edmond, who is a bell captain and who always provided any assistance if need with the most cheerful friendly attitude. I very much enjoyed spending time in hotel lobby that has an excellent Italian restaurant, Serafina, an inviting two sided drinking bar that serves a variety of special red and white wines by the glass as well as excellent mixed cocktails and beers, several sitting/reading/rooms (one is a state-of-the-art business center) furnished with a myriad of couches, chairs, lamps and wood or glass coffee tables. Arthouse is located on the Upper West side at 77th and Broadway in a terrific Manhattan location and I highly recommend it to anyone coming to visit NYC. It has such a wonderful positive energy throughout the entire hotel that when you depart you will feel completely recharged. Personally speaking, I would love to live here but I can settle for revisiting as often as I can afford to. Thanks again to the entire Arthouse (NYLO) family, specifically, Carlos, Tasha, Vivek and Rebecca for making my entire stay so incredibly and throughly enjoyable. Jeff M.
user_name:
jeffmeck7
New York City, New York

review_body: What a find, great area with heaps of restaurants, shops etc. and close to the Beacon Theatre.They have overnight valet parking for $50.A complimentary welcome drink.Cool bar and library. In room coffee maker and safe box, comfy beds.Would return and recommend. Pet friendly too.

I hope nothing changes with the new name. It is an excellent place to stay and affordable. It is secure and staff is very pleasant. It is much quieter than the midtown hotels yet still convenient to everything NYC has to offer!

I booked the hotel when it was called the NYLO I was looking for a hotel that was not a big chain or a tall skyscraper in midtown Manhattan. I was looking for a reasonable price, though this was booked as part of a package with Expedia. This I felt was the best hotel which was closest to our requirements.First impressions were that it almost looked like a English pub, on the left as you enter the small lobby is the bar, on the right some comfy chairs with a couple of computer desks for limited customer use, 30 mins max.The check in was fine and we had a deluxe king size corner room on the 8th floor. It was a good size with a tv and bedside tables. The TV had approximately 60 channels which is not big by USA standards, no uk football on it, just thought I would mention that. The bathroom has a bath with shower and small basin, it did feel cold in the mornings The heating can come on the night if it gets chilly and we did not seem to be able to change the temp control.There is wardrobe with some hangers provided and a few cupboards to put clothes in. The bed base was shiny hence the mattress easily slid on it, so we had to keep pushing it back.The staff were helpful if needed and the bar was atmospheric but when the main door to the hotel entrance was opened on occasions you got a chill wind. There is a 24 hour CVS across the road which you can get pharmacy items plus soft drinks and beers. Turning right out of the hotel a walk of two minutes to the end of the block and you come into Amsterdam Avenue, which takes you to midtown, in the first block you come to a small coffee and bakery shop and a dunkin doughnuts and a restaurant called TESSA, which I reviewed, and some bars as well.The hotel just a few minutes walk from metro stations, red route 1, which takes you downtown to battery park via World Trade Centre and Lincoln Centre and the intersection for Columbus Circle, up town is to the Bronx.You can walk to Central Park within 30 mins, 25 mins to Lincoln Centre and 10 mins to The Natural History Museum.Generally the hotel is in a quiet area, but the fire station is in the same road as the hotel so obviously on occasions you do the fire engines. On this point the soundproof in our room was not great.In conclusion the stay was enjoyable and a different experience from a midtown hotel and hopefully the little extra info I provided will be useful. Oh yeas and Irvine Farm Coffee House is nearby, which I will review and a liquor store and Katzs deli is close to.

Staff are friendly and helpful, but our room had a number of minor faults which were eventually sorted. Décor is dark throughout. Well located for Subway (Line 1) and shops, eateries, etc. Watch out for additional 'Amenities' charges on top of room rates.

Awesome hotel for a great price in uptown west NYC. Found this place while planning a trip with my daughter to NYC the weekend before Christmas 2018. It is a 3 minute walk to the Beacon Theater, a 10 minute walk to the American Museum of Natural History and Central Park. Cab ride to Time Square/Rockefeller center area averaged $9-$10. The hotel itself was overall excellent. The doormen where nice quick to hold the door and assist guests as they walked in. The initial feel when my daughter and I walked in was, "This place is pretty cool". There is a business lounge area as soon as you walk in that is spacious with a modern look. Upon checking in, the service was good. The front desk clerk was kind and accommodating. The overall cleanliness was great .Only cleanliness issue, which wasn't a big deal at all, the mirrors behind the front desk looked like they could use some cleaning or replacing. I couldn't tell if it was spotty or if the mirror finish was coming off. (I'm nit picking here). The room we got had an awesome view of Broadway and for NYC standards, the size of the room was pretty good. (The majority of my stays in NYC, the rooms have been SMALLL...) Our room had a king size bed that was super comfortable. The furniture and fixtures in both the bedroom and bathroom were modern. My daughter and I thought the overall look was cool. The hotel didn't have old smelly carpets like I feel I run into from time to time in hotels. The Bar and lounge has a cool feel too, with a big red piano and plenty of places to sit and relax. The bartender, Christian, was great! Personable and had lots of tips and suggestions when I asked and didn't make me feel like I was annoying him. My first trip to that bar, the bartender that day was not so good... I never caught his name, because he spent the majority of his time complaining to a coworker, about his bosses and/or coworkers. But Christian turned my experience around when he took over for the afternoon shift that Sunday. Overall, LOVE the hotel. The look, the feel, the staff, the value and most importantly... The bed... Safe Travels!!

First I’ll start by saying the hotel itself is very cute and in a great location. They offer a free drink when you arrive and the rooms are nice. Handling issues, however, is not their forte. My boyfriend and I checked in fine and then went out to explore. We get back around midnight to realize our room keys weren’t working. I go downstairs to inform them and they ask me if I’m sure I’m using my key for the correct room because the system says I am in a diffeeent room. I show them the key holder they gave me that morning with the room key that says I’m in room 503 (where all of our belongings already are). Then, they tell me they made a mistake and I have to move to another room, with ZERO explanation or compensation. It’s extremely late at night, we are wanting to go to bed and you’re making us get all of our belongings and move them somewhere else? Not to mention a DOWNGRADED ROOM. Then in the morning we ask to speak to the manager. She comes out and tells us she’s aware of what happened and we won’t have to pay the $40 hotel fee and next time we come we will get a free upgrade. I found that funny — we already didn’t have to pay the hotel fee because we are Expedia VIP gold members (we were told at check in), and in order to receive a free upgrade you’re telling me I need to pay to stay here another night? THANKS FOR NOTHING. You get 2 stars and they are solely for the appearance of the hotel.

This is a great Hotel. Super large rooms that are newly decorated. Would definitely stay here again. Great location and the bar area downstairs is so cool!!! Close to central park and the staff was very friendly.

This was a tough trip to make. We had to be in this vicinity...where I have never stayed. After dealing with some very stressful issues, I needed a good rest. ArtHouse was perfect. My room was the quietest I have ever experienced in NYC. It couldn’t have been lovelier.

As before when I stayed at the NYLO I was totally satisfied with the hotel - Room was perfect great view, SUPER comfortable beds.BUT and best of all you not only have a room to sleep in but the lobby is like your own separate living room. comfortable - warm - friendly ........... Early riser or late to bed. Actually the NYLO the atmosphere of the NYLO is more like a cozy ski lodge than a city hotel.

Roomiest rooms in the city, great location-beautiful walk through Central Park to museums and Madison Ave, great customer service, and Henry the bartender made our stay enjoyable and memorable. Avoid the hotel restaurant if you can. Everything but the restaurant was great.

Drafty, unsealed windows - you could feel the freezing air blowing everywhere in the room and the heating unit couldn't keep up. We had to stay fully dressed at night to keep warm. There is no kitchen, so no room service, and you have to leave the hotel for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Hit or miss at the lobby bar as it wasn't staffed full time. Most of the time there wasn't even a front door attendant to greet you. Not to mention the elevators and entire 10th floor stunk of weed. Overall, an awful experience.

The rooms had very comfortable beds with nice linens. The bathrooms were nicely appointed . The staff was friendly and helpful. Cool, eclectic lobby and bar area. Conveniently located to public transportation. We really enjoyed our stay here.

We’ve stayed in this hotel since its beginning as OTA, so we go back through a number of brandings...Absolutely adore this hotel, balcony rooms with fantastic views, ours always of the Hudson. And this time, absolutely fantastic help and service from two fabulous doormen, Edmund and Henry!Can’t wait til our next visit!

While the remodel was nice, the lobby and hotel bar were lovely, the majority of the staff was extremely rude. One of the front desk staff even got condescending with us when were checking out. It ensured that regardless of cleanliness and location, my party will never be returning.

1st time coming to NYC and I really enjoyed staying on the upper west side. Close to time square and a yoga studio right beside (pure yoga; amazing if you are a daily practitioner and yoga is a must for where ever you travel- as is the case for me)Clean, albeit cosy room, at what I feel is a fair NYC price not cheap but not 5 stars.Very friendly receptionists, doormen and bell services! Danny was a real delight to chat with and super helpful on our way out.I would stay here again. 2 nights at most.

Long term user of the property. Prices go up, value goes down. Rooms overwhelmed with deodorizer chemical smells - just less and less reason not to stay elsewhere — and next trip I will stay elsewhere.

My husband and i always stay here while in NYC which is often. Perfect location away from all the craziness. Red farm is an amazing restaurant around the corner. The staff are friendly and helpful. Nice bar in hotel and nice sitting area in the lobby.

We came here when it was the NYLO, and based on past experiences had high expectations.Apparently they've been bought by another organization and change the name to the arthouse. So things don't seem to be it's up to Snuff as they were before.We came during Christmas two years ago and they had the entire downstairs brightly decorated for the holiday and really put us in the Christmas spirit. Next time, while the lobby is kind of inviting, there were no accommodations made for anything to elevate the holiday feeling. But there was an overpowering fragrance that they pumped through the entire downstairs area that would make your eyes bleed. We don't know if this was cover something up, or to just innocently make the downstairs smell good. But whatever, X overpowering and not wanted.Otherwise hotels isclean, rooms although typically small we're plesantly equipped.We're still thinking on whether we'd come back or not, depends on what the rate is next time we look.

If you are staying in the Upper West Side, This is the place to stay. The rooms are extremely clean and comfortable, the beds are really comfortable, there is ample storage, and the staff is very nice and helpful. And the location is excellent! Fantastic value for the money!

A bit of a splurge, but a beautiful place. Lobby bar with jazz nights, sumptuous lobby lounge area, great staff at the front desk. Rooms are nicely appointed and stylish. Very handy to subway (two blocks away) if you're coming in via Newark/Penn Station.

First impression of the Arthouse hotel is really good. Got a bit of a jazzy antique feel about it and it’s very welcoming. The staff were pretty nice and could do what they had to do. When you asked questions regarding any general enquires, most didn’t really know much or guessed. It’s close to the subway and easy to get downtown for Times Square or Madison square garden. The rooms are really small and quite cramped when two people are staying together. But they are nice and cleaned daily to a high standard which is the main thing I worry about. I’d say you could probably stay a lot closer to Times Square for cheaper room and added urban fee.

Stayed here for a few nights in October when it was named “NYLO”. The lobby, bar, and lounge area gives a great first impression with its olden day glamour and comfort. The red piano and velvet lounge chairs are a nice touch. The location is great, upper west side close to Central Park and a quiet area. Our room was a good size, especially by NYC standards and was quite comfortable but we didn’t have a view, typical brick wall outside our window. Voucher for a free drink at the bar given on arrival. “Complementary” bottled water restocked in the room each day. Like everywhere in Manhattan, there’s an extra urban tax that’s charged each night that isn’t included in the room rate which typically accounts for stuff like bottled water and wifi. The odd part was that the urban tax charged was different each night, though when totalled it averaged out to be around what was quoted. Small terrace seemed like a decent spot to lounge, though we didn’t really use the area. Staff was mediocre, not overly helpful or knowledgeable but I don’t expect much help when in NY. Overall we enjoyed our stay and I would come back, but only if I found a deal for a good room rate.

Pros:-Location (close to Central Park, Museum of Natural History, Levains Bakery, red line subway, & Marshalls)-Nice door man & convenient, luxury airport transfer-Free drink tickets upon arrival-Beautiful and cozy bar area & lounge areas. Definitely 10/10-2 complimentary bottles of water daily-decent amount of space in the King room-closet with space to hang and compartments -very comfortable bed & pillows!Cons:-Had to pay for airport transfer and the front desk people knew nothing about the transfers or how to contact those people-Bar is only open 3pm-midnight. Tried to use our drink tickets 5 min before close and they wouldn't let us get anything (and were rude) so they actually close before midnight!-Told them we were on our honeymoon and 1st trip to NYC and we had a TERRIBLE view. (switched to a different hotel with an amazing view)-Bedside table outlets/lamp does not work. -Little attached lamp on bed frame does not work.-AC didn't work (thank goodness it was winter)-bathtub was stopped up one day.-adjoining restaurant was overpriced and mediocre In conclusion, I don't think I will stay here again.

The room was lovely, very comfortable. Really nice bed!The hotel was very glamorous. Nice lobby with bar & beautiful seating areas.The front staff were unhelpful however. I asked for directions & advice on travelling to sights but received little help. Don’t expect any advice/help in anything outside of the hotel.

The Arthouse Hotel New York City (Nylo Hotel) is basically nice, but when staying there I unfortunately felt all the time being somehow cheated. Nothing serious, but small things here and there all the time.Firstly, the room pricing is made complex and confusing, probably on purpose. A room has a price, but extras, taxes and fees are not quoted. They list some of the extras, taxes and fees, but say that there may be more. After I had made the reservation (directly in hotel) I asked the hotel to confirm the total price of my stay, but they chose not to reply. When checking in I asked to confirm the total price of my stay, but I only got a list of the room prices, and a statement that an “urban fee” will be applied, but nothing else. When checking out the reception handed out to me 7 pages of printout without any explanation. It appeared that the hotel had charged to my credit card a sum, which in addition to the room charges included the following items: Sales tax, City tax, Urban fee, Urban fee sales tax, Urban fee city tax, Javits tax, Occupancy tax, Room upgrade, Upgrade sales tax and Upgrade city tax. And all this separately for each night. The sums probably are correct, but I cannot see any other reason for listing the prices in this way, but trying to confuse the customer. Then secondly, the hotel was trying to cheat in small things here and there. Example: The lobby bar advertised happy hour with a special price $8 for a beer. I ordered a beer during happy hours and received it without any comments. But then the check asked me to pay double price $16 (plus tax and tip, of course). When complaining, I got the answer: ”the happy hour beer is finished”. Not a big deal, but pathetic and unprofessional - and a small thing made the customer unhappy. Another example: Reservation confirmation quoted that the stay is subject to ”urban fee” of $31 per night. When checking out I was charged $35 per night. The explanation was that the fee had been increased - and the reception person really looked like she felt that the hotel can increase the quoted fees as they like. Again, not a big deal but humiliated the customer. Then finally, after checkout I accepted the hotel offer to arrange a taxi transfer to Kennedy airport. They quoted ”fixed price including taxes, tolls and tips”. But after two blocks of driving the driver said he thinks the traffic is slow in the area of a toll-free bridge, and that he wants to take another bridge instead where the traffic is better - but where I have to pay $8.50 extra toll. After I had just paid $5000 for a stay in the hotel, I would have expected they drive me to the airport for free. But instead, they chose to squeeze an extra $8.50 out of me. This was my last stay in this hotel. But if someone does not care if his bill becomes a thousand dollars more or less, this hotel is a nice choice in NY UWS.

The name is changing from the NYLO to Arthouse Hotel, but the value proposition is still amazing. Our son and his fiancée live nearby, and this location has become our home away from home! Nearby shopping, pharmacy, diners and dining make this a perfect location Hotel staff, including the ever wonderful Jessie make our stay comfortable. I once forgot my shirts at a nearby cleaner and they held them for me until a return trip. The downstairs bar is always a plus, Jazz on Thursday nights. Our favorite perk is that the Beacon Theatre is around the corner; we just happened upon the Steely Dan Band and Donald Fagen performing Nightfly, and Michael McDonald and the guitarist for Saturday Night Live sat in as a surprise! NYC at its best.Many rooms with views and patios!!

We love the UWS and this is a great hotel. Close to subways, great restaurants (Red Farm just next door.) we got a deluxe king overlooking Broadway and were very pleased. The bar downstairs has music some nights. Great place.

We came her for the weekend for a family wedding. We really enjoyed everything about this place. The staff entire were so friendly, efficient and accommodating. I would definitely recommend this hotel with no problem, I have no criticism, except that the shower could have had a little more pressure.

I've stayed at this property numerous times and was hoping with the name change the rooms would be upgraded. The vibe of the lobby doesnt match the rooms. Mine had the same furniture, curtains and lighting. Always stay here because I enjoy being in a quiet neighborhood and they have a terrace!

Heating via Airconditioning is much too loud - especially in the nights; hardly could sleep resp. always woke up by the noise; despite I had to change to a lower level room but did not get back my uncharge for higher level

This hotel is the absolute best, with a friendly staff and lovely rooms. I can’t wait to be back in NY to once again stay at this hotel and hopefully room 1602 will be available because that room has a huge patio with the best view of the Hudson River you have seen in a long time.

Enjoyed staying here so much (July 2018) that I extended my stay to enjoy the UWS. Loved the speakeasy lobby bar, and the staff were so nice. They even upgraded my room for free. The rooms were neat, clean, and well-appointed. Modern styling was great.
user_name:
Janine P B
South Orange, New Jersey

review_body: I realize that different people expect different things from a hotel stay, so rather than hurtle in to an angry diatribe I will keep this bullet pointed and concise as a different type of traveller might have a totally different perspective.The Good:Location on Upper Westside very close to 72nd St subwayThe Not so good:Perhaps this is a new airline pricing model but when I enquired about checking in to room before 4pm after red-eye flight, I was told quite sharply that for $50 they could expedite, that was a first for me but hey maybe in NY that's a thing.Staff:Have to say that in 4 days not 1 person remembered our names or even smiled an acknowledgment, from doorman to reception to bar staff.Bar was not adequately staffed to give anyone good service although the waitress did try her best to serve the 75 people in both sides of the bar at 10pm on a Friday night. Bar tenders were just not helpful.Room:Poorly designed which did not maximize the obviously small NY room size. I had to literally stand on the toilet to get in and out of the bathroom, shower had very little water pressure but was almost as large as the floor space in the bathroom.Bed was very comfortable so points there.Summary:This hotel tried very hard to live up to it's Arthouse name in looks but art without function or substance does not make for a great hotel experience in my opinion. I would never stay here again as there are much better options both locally and in other parts of the city. For an average of $350 per night with $35 "resort" type fee per night we felt cheated and might have been better paying a little more for a more established hotel although I suspect that could be found for less.

If you get a room with a window to the street, good luck. It's extremely noisy. You will hear honking until very late, and hear it bright and early. The bathroom could have been cleaner. The tissue box was full of dust. The amount they charge for parking is not even worth staying there. If you can find street parking, do that! The main entrance to the hotel and the downstairs area is very fun and cool, but I was hardly ever there.

I will definately return to this property. The staff was very friendly, accomodating and professional. The common areas are very condusive to relaxing and enjoying a drink. There are many attractions within walking distance and the subway is nearby if you care to use that type of transportation.

Everything was perfect. Lobby was beautiful, loved the music playing. Complimentary drink a plus. Restaurants in area Serafina and Redfarm both excellent. A short walk to Central Park. Only complaint, not enough light in bathroom!

This hotel is conveniently located in a safe neighborhood near the No.1 train. It is close to Lincoln Center, Columbus Circle, Central Park and many good restaurants. The rooms are clean with very comfortable beds. The staff is friendly and professional. However, the cleaning staff need to be more attentive when they service the rooms. First day, I asked that the floor be vacuumed more thoroughly; The second day they forgot to leave clean towels. The staff was very responsive when I requested for the towels but I really shouldn’t have had to ask. This is not a luxury hotel, but it is nice, clean, comfortable and conveniently located. Great value in Manhattan.

This hotel was great! The staff was friendly and very helpful. It had a great bar and lounge area. The rooms were very nice and the beds were comfy. The commons areas and room was very clean. I would stay here again.

A very nice hotel. Room with good size and a comfortable king size bed. The front desk personnel were very pleasant and attentive specially Ms. Jessie.The restaurant offers a good menu and the food is very good.

We recently stayed at the NYLO / Arthouse hotel for 4 nights . Myself and my partner lived its location only 2 blocks from Central Park. The lobby and bar area was active and had a nice vibe. The staff were courteous and Edmund on the door made the occasion even more special. In hearing that we got engaged that evening he arranged for a celebration of Prosecco and chocolates to be delivered to our room by him personally courtesy of the hotel. He also arranged for a chauffeur to drive us down town to a restaurant he recommended . Holding the umbrella to cover my new fiancé from the rain while she walked to our vehicle. Little efforts that says a lot. On that note we recommend this hotel for his attention to detail.

This was my second time staying here. I stayed many years ago before it switched names. They redesigned the lobby so that it has many seating areas where you can chill, have a drink or work which I loved. The room was ample, quiet and well appointed although no bathrobes. On site restaurant Serafina is a chain and not very good. However the doorman pointed me to several very good restaurants. I have learned to ask doormen for restaurant recommendations rather than hotel concierges. Front desk was consistently a bit clueless. I couldn't understand the man who checked me in and he did not give me the free drink tickets. I also got caught in NYC during an early season snow storm and my flight out was canceled. The front desk said there were no rooms available and didn't even offer to put me on a wait list. However I kept checking on line and rooms opened up which made some logical sense. Incoming flights were also being canceled so at some point logically rooms would open up. When the room opened the front desk wouldn't honor the online rate I got at the hotels' website which seemed silly so I had to book on the site and come back and the rate was extremely high likely to high demand because of the storm. When I came back to the desk the woman kept insisting the room type I booked was not available and i would have to pay for a more expensive room even though I had the confirmation number. I just waited a few minutes and waited online with another woman who found the room. At least this time I got the drink tickets.In spite of the problems I would stay again. Great location and the lobby really makes the hotel. While front desk staff was clueless aside from the man who initially checked me in they all seemed quite nice.

I absolutely love staying at NYLO soon to be Art House. It’s a great location close to the train and near some good shopping, restaurants and movie theater; It’s a quick jaunt to Times Square and the theater district. Great value, awesome service and really wonderful amenities.

This is a very convenient place to stay, close to metro and walking distance to restaurants, shops and the park etcVery comfortable bed - exactly what you want from a hotel Staff friendly and helpful If you are looking for luxury and all that perhaps not your place but if you want a comfortable nights sleep, a place to come back and rest after a busy day it’s perfect

We love this hotel for its location. The area is our favorite in NYC. However, the hotel attracts the kind of clientele who want really nice rooms: great-looking, sturdy furniture, amazing decor, and bright lighting. The rooms at NYLO/Arthouse are in serious need of a makeover. Will the price of rooms increase if they make the rooms more elegant? Probably. But I'm ready to pay more for nicer rooms.

I grew up In NYC, across the park, and I love feeling like I still live here when I stay at this hotel. Totally amazing location in a great residential neighborhood. Rooms are cool, Beds are amazing and the price is so right,

Everyone that works at NYLO was great. The room is okay. Small of course, but we were in town to visit family on the UWS and were not lounging in our room for long. The location is stellar and the bar area in the lobby is great. Will stay again.
user_name:
Eric K
Chevy Chase Village, Maryland

review_body: LOUD! Construction in the hotel, hallway noise, fire station across from hotel, squeaky bed. Good location for what we needed to do in NYC. (We needed to go to the museum of natural history.) Not impressed overall. The staff was nice initially but made no effort after check-in. The bartender on the last night DID give a recommendation for another local bar since the hotel bar was closed by the time we came back from an event. Ultimately we really wished there was a warning or apology about the construction.

Stayed at the NYLO (recently renamed to Arthouse as of 11/20/2018) during a recent trip to New York. Quick takeaways:The location is fantastic. You're within walking distance of two metro stations, one of which offers express service to downtown Manhattan. You're also within reasonable walking distance of Chelsea, Central Park, and the museums/galleries.The condition of the room was alright. Not terrible, not amazing, just... meh. Furnishings look like some sort of funky 80's composite IKEA chic. Stack your clothes in the kindergarten-style cubby holes in the "dresser", then enjoy the vibrating elevator rides if you're staying in a west-facing room.And last but not least: Add at least $40 to the nightly rate. They're pulling a page out of the telco playbook here, dinging you with a "convenience fee" for amenities that other hotels might label as complementary, like the "free cocktail" (spritzer or sparkling wine), 2x water bottles, fitness room, printer, and wifi.

This was a centrally located hotel on the UWS. It's swanky- dark, loungy. An elevator was not working when we arrived. Had to wait a while for others. Room was tiny (to be expected in NY), paint chipping off walls, cracks in bathroom door, smoke/CO2 detector starting beeping at 12:30AM signaling battery replacement was needed. To the hotel's credit, they did issue us a small credit for the middle of the night disruption.

The Upper West Side is our preferred neighbourhood to stay whilst in NYC and this is a great value hotel in the area. The rooms are clean and reasonably spacious (for New York) but the best feature was the bed, a king, and one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on. Downstairs there is a neat little bar and lounge which always seemed to be buzzing. There are some great restaurants nearby (especially in Amsterdam Ave) and the subway is only minutes away. Highly recommended.

Dismissive and inattentive bar service is a real put off. After a long day my wife and couldn’t get service despite politely asking several times. Finally we went across the street and bought our own beer at CVS ...

Most other hotels in the neighborhood are too old with boring decor - everything felt clean and new. One minus point is the very loud lobby (due to proximity to bar) at check in on weekends but fortunately noise does not reach the rooms (yet negative first impression after a long flight)

Staff was friendly and accommodating. Nice clean, comfortable room. Lobby is fun and nice to sit in. Nice location and nice neighborhood. Just love the upper West side. Good restaurants nearby. Two blocks to Central Park.

Always stay at the NYLO when I need to be in upper westside of Manhattan. Folks are always friendly. Last visit, however, I wanted to give a big shout-out to Jessie who helped to check me in. I was in town for a conference and sharing a room with a colleague (yet to arrive) and Jessie was able to get us a corner room which provided more space for us to sit and be comfortable - even to ask for a mini-fridge. Her helpfulness made our stay so wonderful and started our journey and stay on a great foot! I hoped to tell the management about Jessie's service and was asked to write a review here. Hope the management sees this and realizes the gem you have in her! Wonderful stay, clean as always and friendly staff and service. My hotel when in this part of town!

NYLO offers a great Upper West Side location convenient to all subway lines, access to the parks, great coffee shops, bars, and restaurants. Their lobby is very cozy - good for a business meeting or a catch up with a friend. Rooms was very quiet and bed was impressively comfortable and plush. For the value, it is worth it. I have already booked my trip in December and am looking forward to it!

Belatedly, I just wanted to write a few well-deserved words of praise for the staff at the front desk of NYLO, not the least Jessie, who is always beyond helpful and kind and recognizes me as a regular guest. I also want to give a big shout out to Jennifer who, after only a few meetings knows me by name and is extra sweet to my dog, Ezra. I now live in NYC, but off and on go to NYLO for a staycation, a little R & R. And I ALWAYS sleep so well here! Thank you to the entire staff. We love you!

Great location on the upper west side. Near Zabars. Rde Farm - best Chinese in NYC - in the same building. Short walk to the Natural History Museum. Easy to get downtown. Hotel staff was very attentive and helpful. Loved it.

I often stay at the NYLO on business, the staff are friendly and welcoming, the rooms are nice and the beds are extremely comfortable. There are two good restaurants connected to the hotel and the lobby bar is very quaint. For me, the hotel is sufficiently off the beaten track to be quiet while still offering easy access to the rest of the city.

This hotel was located in a great area. Easy to get around A LOT of good restaurants near the hotel. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was small but very clean and well kept up. I would recommend this hotel. When I return to the Big Apple I will definitely check for room availability here.

I was really impressed by NYLO. It was my first time in NYC, and the people at the hotel were friendly and helpful, especially George! George gave us ideas of things to do based on our interests, and he followed that up with directions for how to get there. The hotel was clean, and housekeeping kept our room well-stocked. I will be back!

From entry into the property, where a doorman is stationed to greet you, to the staff at the front counter, and the perfect room, our visit was most wonderful. Ramona at the front counter greeted us with a welcoming smile. Since we have been at this hotel in the past it was really wonderful to see a familiar face. We look forward to returning very soon. - Irving.

Great location, pet friendly, clean room and wonderful staff!Great location on the Upper West Side.Doors were held open, rooms were quiet, staff was friendly and accommodating.I would return if I needed to stay again with a pet.

We stayed for one night and we were extremely pleased with the hotel and awesome staff. The lobby and bar area had a great vibe and awesome place to hangout and relax. We had a room with two queens beds which was large and super comfortable.

the room is nice and the bed is comfortablethe staff is extremely nicei got the room the minute i got to the hotel first time in NYC early morning after long flight.the bathroom is clean but small.see you next year

I have stayed in many hotels and Air BnBs in New York. Places are old and small- that’s what you get in NYC for the price I’m willing to spend. This was the first time taking baby along (10 months old), and I was nervous about tiny space. The folks at the Nylo upgraded us to a suite and I almost cried when I saw that baby could have his own space (in rollaway crib), while our room had a door. The lobby had lots of places to sit and things for baby to look at. The location was blocks from Central Park and the Children’s Museum of Manhattan. Zabars is around the corner. We will definitely be coming back to stay here again! Thank you to everyone at the Nylo for making our trip so special.
user_name:
amywU3309HR
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Well-organized room except for hard-to-open storage units. No towel racks for some reason. Bed a bit high and softer than we like. Very quiet room but no view. Cigarette odor in hall, which we reported. Helpful staff. Good bed reading lights. Short walk to subway.

Im and young Mum in town on a business trip.Need a freezer to freeze my pumped milk during my stay.Milk was put in hotels freezer.Freezer disappeared. Milk disappeared.Extremely rude manager who did not care and said she can not help me.Disgusting behavior.

Really enjoy staying here every-time i'm in the city. Close to the subway, great restaurants and in a quiet neighborhood, which is rare for NYC hotels. Absolutely recommend staying here, especially if you're looking for something different, outside of the Times Square rush.

We stayed at NYLO and found it to be very comfortable and clean. The room was smallish but it fit our needs perfectly. We spent some time in the hotel bar and found the bartenders to be fun and informative. We would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Lucinda S
Ponte Vedra Beach, Florida

review_body: Beautiful spacious room with gorgeous bathroom. Large walk- in shower & extra large sink. Two TVs , sofa & chairs with desk area. Absolutely met all of our expectations! Staff was friendly & very accomodating! Hotel bar was cozy & inviting. Thanks for an enjoyable long weekend!

The location was great However the Staff was very unfriendly. Lobby was nice with a bar and lots of siting areas. The rook was stark with a metal counter and Sink like a jai, never been to jail but I am guessing it was as bad as that. They cleaned the room and did not leave new towels. The room was very tiny.

We visited New York in October to see a few concerts, one of which was at The Beacon Theatre which couldn't have been more convenient. The hotel was also very convenient for Central Park and for other Upper Westside attractions. As for the hotel itself, the reception and bar area has a nice vibe about it. The staff were mostly very friendly although when we complained about the additional and compulsory charge for the valet/business services we came up against a very rude assistant manager. The room itself was okay. We had a superior balcony room but to be honest, it wasn't superior and the balcony was a bit tired and to a particularly pleasant place to be so id save your money and go for the more basic rooms.All in all an average experience, not great but not too bad. A great location though if you are happy to be away from the craziness of Midtown.

I have never worried about my safety when staying at the NYLO. The rooms are clean as is the whole of the hotel. The people and staff are joyful and beautiful. They make me feel welcome and at home. And they seem to remember me despite the fact I only stay with them twice a year.

Great hotel located in upper west side. We had a fabulous time. We stayed at this hotel before and will definitely stay here again whenever we are in the city. It is connected to Serafina Italian restaurant which is so convenient. It was raining when we arrived and we were able to have a nice dinner and not worry about running around in the bad weather. The bar at the hotel was very cozy and relaxing. We spent time there also. Drinks were great and the bartenders were very attentive and friendly. Overall, it was a great stay. The only problem we had was difficulty in parking in front for valet and to check in. They should have an area blocked off in front for vehicles to pull in for valet service. Parking on the street is tough. We had to park in the street while we unloaded our bags and it was not a safe thing to do with cars driving around us.

The NYLO was fabulous--great vibe, clean, great service and value....love the valet pkg for $25 as well.We went down for a concert at The beacon Theatre and it cold not have been more convenient. Would highly recommend.BTW---I never write reviews but this was worthy of it

The prices for the NYLO are absurd for the quality of their customer service and room offerings. The rooms are small, with very little room to walk around the bed. Out of the eight times I've stayed here I've always had a problem with the bathroom - usually is the shower not working, leaking, or too small to fit comfortable into.

The bar is not organized in a way to know if there is table service or not and the bartenders are not helpful in letting you know, they are also not attentive to your needs in a timely fashion if you are sitting in any area other than at the bar.

Great service, super room, bit expensive but its New York. Handy to everything to lots of great places..Easy to walk to many interesting places. Plenty of good meal places close by especially fusion restaurant just around corner. Great help with airport transport. Fantastic in house bar - easy to have meeting there or arrange to meet friends  All round bit of a lesser known gem Has since changed hands but sends emails saying keeping everything the same - hope it does as I will return definitely. Let them know if you get in very early, they may have a room that they may or may not charge you extra - depends on time of arrival I think.

We loved everything about our stay at the NYLO hotel last week. The room was great, the beds were really comfortable. We were on the 4th floor, broadway side, and didn't hear much noise! I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place!Big shout out to Tasha at the front desk too! Her big, genuine, smile and warm welcome most definitely were noticed by us. Any questions we had, she went out of her way to help us out!

I've had many visits to this hotel and enjoy the atmosphere, service and location. But just last week Jessie was so outstanding in her service and attitude I wanted to give a shout out for her and the team. Truly made me feel like a valued customer!

Stayed two nights. Room was nice but no outlet on the desk for plugging in the laptop. Clean. Noisy HVAC so I turned it off and I was fine. (warmish November). Staff are very nice and helpful. A business paid so I don't know about "value" - but a really good neighborhood, close to subway, not an enormous conference hotel which I consider a plus.
user_name:
DCNative61
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The room overall was small, but very clean. It was perfect for me, by myself. If there were more than one person in this room it would be too small. However, there are corner rooms that are very spacious.

Had a great trip. Took our kids ages 7 and 9. Really enjoyed ourselves. Staff responded well to issues with thermostat and we needed coffee pods. Free drinks upon arrival. Close walk to NY Historical Society.

Overall my husband and I enjoyed our stay at the hotel NYLO. The staff was very nice and friendly, the room is clean, it's in a very nice central part of town. However, if you're a light sleeper or you're there on business, I highly recommend you stay somewhere else. This hotel uses paper for walls. We paid for a really nice room, and we can hear our neighbors chatting, the people above us walking, room doors closing, etc. Early in the morning, you can hear cars honking on the road and people yelling outside the hotel. I've never stayed in a hotel where I can literally hear everything. And just to throw it out there, I'm not a light sleeper. For the price we paid, I expected something more. We stayed there for 3 nights, and after 2 nights in our very noisy room, we requested a room change. The man at the front desk was accommodating, but didn't mention that he would have to downgrade us. Which was no big deal, since we did request for a room change. However, he put us right by a high trafficked elevator. We made it clear that the room we were in was very noisy, which was why we requested the room change. but he didn't bother telling us that he was going to move us to an even noisier area. What was the point of us downgrading our room and moving then? It's a very cute and nice hotel. But next time we're in the city, we will stay at our tried and true hotel.

The room is pricey for amount of space and then after you billed my credit card you turn around billed it again for amenities with i didn't use. why billed the card twice? someone else getting paid for your so called amenities. Can't open curtain to look out the window cause it had bird crap all over it. No where to hang towel after use. Keurig inside room was dirty and didn't use.

We stayed here for 4 days and then 2 days in October. The hotel is very nice with a cosy bar in the lobby area. We usually don’t notice this but we used the free drink coupons and enjoyed “hanging out”. This is not typical for us! The rooms we’re very modern, clean and well maintained but our firstroom was so small i felt claustrophobic!
