There was no room for even a chair andonly one person could fit in the bathroom at a time.it didn’t help that the on,y window faced a brick wall so we had no daylight. This was supposed to be a superior king room! We asked if it could be improved upon when we were to return in 3 days and they did “upgrade” us to a room facing broadway st that was slightly larger, with room for a desk and a chair which was a significant improvement for me but my husband wore earplugs to drown the noise. It did not bother me at all however. We usually rent apartments when we stay in nyc as we come for a week or more so our complaints may be standard for nyc. But overall the NYLO is an excellent location and fine if you are not in the room much!

I loved the location of this hotel. The lobby was was very inviting and my favorite restaurant Sarafina was a part of the hotel. I Highly recommend staying at NYLO hotel if you plan on staying in a nice family location.

Rooms are sparse, but they have what you need. There is a fire station on the same street, so you might hear sirens. Fitness Center is small, but has most of the typical equipment. Pull up bar and free weights, but they only go up to 25lbs. Free drink is nice at check in.

Excellent cool place. A little away from the hustle and bustle, but still very close. Like that it's always clean, not as expensive as some of the places in NYC, and that it has a really great vibe. Nice little bar area in lobby for a quick drink or talk.

This is my little secret place to stay in NYC away from the tourist. Three minutes away from the subway, which can get you just about anywhere in Manhattan in a short amount of time. The hotel is cozy and has food, wine, live music, and much more. (Shhhhh!!!!!)

Friendly staff and beautiful lobby! Lobby area is Spacious with comfortable seating and couches also convenient to have a bar and restaurant in the lobby. Jess at the front desk is very patient and helpful with early check in and room upgrade! Comfortable room with a nice view TY!
user_name:
JillG1525
New York City, New York

review_body: Convenient location. We decided we wanted to stay closer to Central Park for this visit so a city friend recommended the NYLO. Close to tons of restaurants and bakeries. Not much in they way of shopping or museums. About 5 blocks to subway, so a little much for the grandma with us. Bar/lounge area very comfortable with live jazz music on weekends. The rooms are basic. Beds were comfortable unless sharing them. Ours dipped in the middle. No robes. Bathrooms fine with tub/shower. Plenty of hot water. Room was quiet on the 9th floor. Serafina, the connected restaurant was awful for breakfast. No pastries because of an oven issue. Granola was not homemade but like 4 granola bars crumbled up. Go to Orwashers or Recolte for pastries/bagels. Go to Red Farm for asian dinner, go to Salumeria Rosi for italian dinner.

I fully pre paid for my reservation, including rooms rates and taxes. At the moment of check out they said I needed to pay 32 dollars. I asked what this fee was about and they didn't know what it was but since it was in the system I had to pay. I didn't ask for room service nor I have had food or beverage in my room. So why pay the 32 dollars at check out?

If you like the upper west side this place is great. The beds are super comfortable and the rooms spacious. Have stayed twice and was very happy both time. Fairly priced, and got a free drink at the bar last time, so that’s a little bonus.

Spent four nights in October. The rooms had a very good size and very comfortable bed. Good view of Broadway (see attached photo of room view).Breakfast at Serafina downstairs is good and convenient. Subway station is two blocks away on 79th st.The most amazing part of the hotel is the staff. Eloy and Vik at reception made everything really smooth, helping with a speedy check-in and with suggestions of places in the neighborhood and in the city. Will stay again for sure and recommend Nylo 100%. Note: while I was there, received a letter saying that starting in November 19th the hotel will change name to The Arthouse.

The beds were extremely comfortable and the room itself was a nice size. The location was excellent for the Upper West Side of Manhattan. Valet parking was a big plus, too -- didn't have to find our own parking or carry luggage a distance from designated parking to the property. Wish the bathroom had more space for putting personal belongings -- the sink was so long and stylish, but it was all basin and no counter, so the only options were to balance things on the slightly rounded toilet tank cover or for things to get wet in the sink! Also, several electrical outlets weren't working in the room...but it was late when we got in, so we didn't call for help. We'll be back!

Everything was great about our stay the NYLO. We had an absolutely amazing view off our balcony which saw both the river and central park. We also took advantage of an upgrade that was only 40 dollars a night that was probably a couple hundred a night in value. Really enjoyed the down stairs lobby area that had a great bar right in the hotel. Would recommend staying here for either work or pleasure if you are looking for a clean room on the Upper West Side.

Great hotel, was there for two nights, room was clean and bed was comfortable, the lobby was welcoming, as was the staff with their friendliness. We would definitely stay here again, Also, public transportation isn't had to get to.

Stayed here for just one night and found it comfortable and clean. Loved the vibe in the lobby and the urban style in the room. Great use of small spaces. Took off a star because it was a bit noisy. You could definitely hear other guests in the next rooms.....clearly. If seeing a show at the Beacon theater, would stay here again.

They constantly mocked me and was extremely rude . They quoted me one price and then charged me another . They are acrivtening group of miserable people who mock the guests . Absolutely horrible and frightening experience

I stayed two nights . I found design to be aesthetically pleasing and functional. It was very close to where I need to be so it was convenient. I liked the place with one exception. It was LOUD. There insulation simply didn’t stop the sound in the hallways. Of course, this is, in part, the consequences of having rude guests. Regardless, it is loud.I would stay there again.

Great location on the upper west side. Close to the American Museum of Natural History and Central Park. Rooms are small but neat and clean. Across the street from a CVS so all the sundries you could ever need are right there. Prices are Ok but watch out for the email offering an upgrade for only a few extra dollars. This is a rip off as the email looks like you get a bigger room when all you get is a different view out the tiny window. Don't fall for this scam!

If you stay, make sure to avoid rooms with cojoined doors. All sound seems to travel between the doors, which made for an unpleasant stay with limited privacy. No one wants to clearly hear other guests conversations and TV (amongst other things). On the positive side the staff was great and the property is well maintained but the sound issue ruined my experience / stay.

near to all activities. Friendly, courteous staff. Close to many restaurants and attractions.2nd time we stayed here. Enjoyed breakfast at Serafina. Ramona was wonderful!!!! Valet service appreciated.

Great West Side location. The rooms are small, but very efficient. Think A-Loft. Can be a bit noisy having a fire station nearby , but not too bad. The common areas are very nice. Comfortable bar and nice sitting areas. From the doorman to the front desk The staff is excellent. Very friendly and helpful, better than you would expect.We had breakfast several times at the Sarafina restaurant. It was very good and the waitstaff was excellent.We did have one unfortunate incident, but it was handled well and we were quite satisfied with the hotels solution.We would definitely stay here again.

I usually stay at a different hotel on the UWS but they jacked their prices way up so we decided to try this one. Great location, clean, wonderful staff, secure... And I got a great night's sleep! Will definitely stay again. Subway is two blocks away, great bakeries and shops around. Super convenient to everything.

Expensive but good for New York - good sized room for 1 or 2 pax. Nice minimalist industrial style that I appreciated for the city. Nice bar in the reception. Well located for Columbia university and other fun on the West side.

Met my son in nyc for a few days of fun. The proximity of the subway made it easy to get to all our activitues- uptown jazz club, restaurant i Harlem, downtown brunch at Buvette, MOMA. Easy walk to the Guggenheim across Central Park. Since my plane arrival was very early I was able to check in at 9 am for only $50. Staff at front desk was couteous and accommodating. Can’t wait to go back to NYLO.

Great location near Central Park, the Natural History Museum, and the subway straight to the theater district. Walk to many interesting restaurants, a comedy club, the cleaners and the cobbler. I always bring my shoes that need repair to Manhattan.

I have stayed at the NYLO several times, most recently in October 2018. I like the vibe of the hotel, and the staff is very welcoming. The rooms are both stylishly decorated and immaculately clean. The location on the upper west side offers a good alternative to midtown and Times Square.

Just checked out of NYLO - stayed here because I needed a hotel within good proximity to Beacon Theatre. Hotel is just 2 blocks north, so it fit the bill as far as that goes. Read reviews on TA about Upper West Side hotels - this one seemed to get good accolades - however wasn’t too impressed - for a $400 a night hotel it fell short of my expectations. See pros/cons belowPROS - beautiful views - centrally located. Clean room. Front desk and manager helpful on hearing my complaints, credited me back for room upgrade and welcome cocktail. Room very quiet. Wood floors.CONS - don’t expect top of the line here in rooms, even in their Penthouse Suite which we had upgraded to. Plastic cups , one bar of small soap, they do have Pure amenities, but no qtips/cotton swabs/etc...had to request extra towels. Very inexpensive furniture. Stayed on a Sunday, doorman non existent or when he was there not friendly. Welcome cocktail voucher never given to us, I overheard someone else checking in being offered vouchers and asked front desk if we were supposed to have been given and she said yes. Concierge not available on Sunday. Checking out today, Monday, different doorman, friendly and helpful. Unable to secure WiFi even with password. Fitness Center had older machines with no TV. One TV in room. Have stayed in many hotels in NYC, wouldn’t return here, but may suit your needs if you need a hotel near Beacon Theatre. I wouldn’t bother upgrading.

Upon arrival our room was not ready. The staff was very accommodating by taking our bags to hold and giving drink coupons to enjoy at the bar while we waited for our room. I felt safe in the hotel due the fact you needed your room key to operate the elevator. The junior suite was very roomy. The beds and pillows were fantastic. Finally, the shower was the best hotel shower I've ever experienced. I would definitely stay at NYLO again!

Very cool hotel, with a great location, decoration, and services. The bar at lobby, the italian restaurant, and the bar at de roof are perfect to have a dinner or clear your mind afetr a business day.

Property was well maintained. Friendly Staff no issues for our 5 day stay. Easy access to the subway only two blocks away. Close to central park on the Upper West side. We would stay here again without hesitation.

Great hotel for access to Central Park, museums, Lincoln Center. First class restaurants nearby. We stayed to attend Aida at the Metropolitan Opera. Hotel decor, rooms, and service all first rate. Rooms well appointed and comfortable

My wife and I were pleasantly surprised by this place. I'm not sure if I would use the term boutique to describe the hotel but it does have a trendy feel and is certainly not bland. I think the location was ideal as we were visiting Columbia University and very easy to get down town on the metro. The hotel is located in what appeared to be a safe and residential area. As I said Central Park is miniutes away and a great place to take time out from the city. I must say that we walked around without concern or hesitation. Indeed, there is an amazing deli come supermarket very nearby where you can supplement your requirements for additional snacks and stuff. The service was descrete and and attentive. In fact all the staff could not have been more helpful. Jessie for example was particularly warm and welcoming and helped us settle in, arranging an upgrade to a junior suite with a balcony. (Upgrade recommended if you prefer more space). From my experience, room upgrades are usually negotiable on arrival and usually worth the extra cost. The breakfast had a wide selection of food with table service which is always nice.My only criticism was the fact that there was no refrigerator in the room but overall not a bad choice.

book early to get the best rooms! great restaurants in the neighbourhood. If you have a problem, contact the reception. They will solve this for you.The only thing that needs to be improved is the gym - with no windows and way too small. but there are gyms in the neighbourhood.

I liked the hotel, but my room could be a bit cleaner (management already apologized, and it's my fault for not complaining on the spot). I had a corner room and could hear every time my neighbors opened their door, which also freaked me out/woke me up several times, as the doors slam shut automatically! Other than that, great convenient location, comfy bed, and cute lounge.

Chose this hotel because of proximity to The Beacon Theater. Easy walk to the theater for shows. Great location for walking to nearby attractions like Central Park and the nearby museums. Had a loft with a beautiful terrace and view across the river. Room was spacious, bed and pillows and linens comfortable. Slept soundly each night with little outside noise. Despite being next to the elevator, never heard it our entire stay. Room was clean and comfortable. No issues with thermostat or interior noises that would disturb sleep. All the appropriate outlets for charging devices. Hairdryer and magnifying mirror in the bathroom. Water was hot, and shower a good size. Would suggest a blanket for bed, and would suggest a mini fridge in the loft. The lobby is cozy and a nice spot for a drink with friends. The staff was super friendly and accommodating. The front desk, concierge and front door were always attended. Serafina is attached to the lobby although closes too early to grab anything after a show. We had only drinks and salads here, so can’t comment on food. Salad was average. Would definitely recommend NYLO NYC for a visit to the UWS.

I was horribly jet lagged and didn't take full advantage of the place. Has a nice bar and restaurant attached for breakfast thru dinner. Staff were uniformly friendly and helpful. Decor was more Modern and Minimalist than is usual in a hotel, and the raw brick from the repurposed building was allowed to remain as well. Spacious room. Hot water that was nice and hot! VERY comfy bed.

Great location, friendly staff, quiet room, comfy bed. We chose this hotel for the proximity to the Beacon Theater (two blocks away). Found good restaurants and fun bars very close by. Two subway stops within blocks as well. Would stay here again for sure.

I was happy to discover the location of Nylo to the Beacon at the last minute. The rate was much better than competition! I was a “walk in” with no time to spare before the show and after a couple of glitches I was able to book room, check in and make it to the show on time. Room was clean, bed comfy, what more could you ask for.

hotel is close to central park the breakfast room is not attractive but there are plenty other options closebythe staff is friendlythe bed is excellenthe cleaning could have been better (floor was not clean)

I was very satisfied with NYLO. My 2 complaints might be that I had trouble using the t v. It might be nice to have instructions by the set for people who are not as savvy as the younger generation. I was finally able to find the channels but it took a while. I also found the coffee pretty bad.

We were really disappointed in this hotel. We have stayed at other NYLO hotels and loved them but this one was not even close to comparison. The bathrooms were gross, mold in tub area, rust and cracks around fixtures, the floor was bubbling throughout the room also. There is no room service and the restaurant that is tied to the hotel was not good at all.

Love staying at the Nylo. This is our third stay. It has a great vibe with an awesome bar downstairs with live Jazz most nights. The rooms are a decent size and the beds are very comfy. The staff are very helpful. Will be staying in 2 years on our next visit

We always stay here when we come to Manhattan and appreciate the warm welcome from staff and the fact that our special requests are already set up in our room when we arrive. They gave us a delightful room upgrade— much appreciated— but in every room we’ve stayed in here, the beds are very comfortable and there is plenty of drawer space. We don’t get to spend much time in the lobby area, but it is cozy and welcoming and looks conducive to sitting and working or relaxing with friends.

This was my first time to NYC. The NYLO was recommended by a family friend. The location was exellent as we were 1 block from the subway and easily travelled all over the city. My room was nice, clean and had a view of broadway. The bed was very comfortable and I always slept like a baby! Even though my room was directly across from the elevator I never was bothered by noise. The staff was always super friendly and extremely helpful when I was having trouble with my keycard randomly not working. Wynona especially always went out of her way to greet me and talk to me when I would be coming through the lobby. All in all The NYLO was a great place to stay as well as a great base to get to all of the sights in NYC. I cannot wait to come back and stay!

Had a hard time looking for the reception counter as it was behind a bar. The entrance of the hotel was not strategically located for customer to find the reception right away as the bar was hindering where it is located and no signs to the reception counter. I had to call the hotel to find the reception. We arrived when the bar was crowded and music was too loud to hear what the receptionist was saying during check-in. The basics are provided. The room is quite small but that is expected in NYC. The bed was comfortable. The only complaint though is the AC and heating is loud and is bothering.Overall stay was alright, nothing fancy or spectacular.

We stayed three nights at NYLO NY for a fall mini-vacation from Nashville. We booked the junior suite for three nights. The night before we arrived they called to say our room was unavailable the first night, but they could give us two rooms instead. We agreed and they more than compensated for the inconvenience. They supplied us with breakfast for four each morning, drink tickets at the bar (Seasonal Spritz was amazing) and delivered candy and wine our first night. The staff is really friendly and the lobby are is super cozy. The location on the upper west side is very family friendly, so close to the Natural History Museum and Central Park. Great places to eat close by, and visit the great little flea market at the school nearby on Sundays! We will for sure make this our hotel next time we visit! Thanks NYLO!

Staff were very pleasant and very helpful. Great rooms that were very clean. Good location for the things that we wanted to do in New York. Would recommend to friends and will stay there the next time we head to the Big Apple.

This is a great little hotel with a professional, courteous staff. We stayed four nights and were so pleased with everything. They have two rooftop areas to enjoy being outside. It is great value for the price.

Comfortable bed, good value for NYC, stylish industrial/Ikea decor with a youthful feel. I have stayed in this hotel three times and always enjoyed it. Quiet rooms. For those unacquainted with NY, consider staying in a neighborhood like the upper west side where this hotel is located rather than the Times Square-type areas.

Great location. Closecto the subway. Close to the park. Close to Lincoln center. Quiet neighbourhood. Very good cafes and restaurants nearby. Large room. Price is high.We will come back to NY and stay there again.

I was so confused reading some of the negative reviews on this hotel! This hotel is beautiful! The hotel lobby and restaurant and bar are so amazing and the asthetic is incredible! The staff were so friendly and got us in our room 2 hours before check in and we left 2 hours after check out! They held our bags the day we left until evening and they were so kind!The room was so big I was in shock! The bathroom was large also! Our room was quiet and super Clean and modern! I def will be back! We loved how it was walking distance to Central Park and shake shack :) Such a great hotel!

Great hotel with great staff good service. Great location for our needs. Would definitely stay here again. Particularly liked the door staff. Very friendly very pleasant and very helpful. Close to the subway which makes getting around very easy.

Nice to find a newly refurbished, very clean hotel in this location that is affordable. Location excellent. Safe, neighborhood feeling on side streets, close to Central Park, Museum of Natural History, and blocks of fun restaurants and bars on Amsterdam St., one block over. Nice small hotel bar and lobby, good restaurant on premises. Mille Fleur pastries across Broadway are excellent.

NYLO was the perfect location for our girlfriend's reunion for a long weekend in the city. It was a 40-minute Lyft ride from LaGuardia beginning at 4:30 PM. I arrived just in time to enjoy a free welcome beverage from the bar which was beginning to fill with 30-somethings about that time. Rooms are a bit on the small side, with very comfortable beds, somewhat limited storage space, but adequate and overall an attractive modern feel with the décor and lighting. The bath is spacious enough and supplied with good quality soaps, shampoo, etc. A single-serve coffee machine got us going in the morning with a choice of coffees.The central location of NYLO at Broadway and 77th allowed us to walk to most places we wished to visit; Central Park a few blocks one way, and the Hudson River Greenway and Boat Basin the other direction. A gazillion restaurants and food suppliers of every sort in every direction, as well as shops, museums, etc. We even managed to park a car on the street for free during our stay.All staff were friendly and helpful. We considered the NYLO to be a good value.

We have stayed at the NYLO now 2 times and have been happy both times. The Staff is fantastic!Our favorite person is Ramona, she is highly professional and is very anxious to please the Guests.Can't wait to return!

We enjoyed our stay at the NYLO in Upper West Side Manhattan. It was clean, modern, and comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful and gave great recommendations. We will definitely keep the NYLO on our list of places to stay in NYC.

I had read a lot of reviews before about the size of the rooms, however we stayed on a standard corner room and had plenty of room. Check in staff was very standoffish which didn’t bring a welcome to the hotel but check-out staff and any other staff I encountered were kind and helpful. I would probably stay here again for the price

We arrived from the Washington train in the early afternoon and were let into the room earlier than the usual 4:00 PM (?) check in which was a nice start. The resort fees covered a welcome beer and then we got into the slow lifts to the fourth floor overlooking Broadway Avenue. There is no fridge, so we ordered a small little beat up bar fridge that arrived promptly. The Kuerig coffee machine was well stocked but I can vouch for the cups being plastic disposables in the bathroom (weird). The shower leaked and the bathroom did seem oddly dated from the loft-style Scandi-inspired LEGO bedroom furniture (you will get it if you stay here). The beds were comfortable and our double queen room had a sitting area with a two-seater lounger. On W77th Street, where the lobby is located we failed to see the fire station (or Ladder Company ##), but they made themselves known to us every hour on the hour, day and night responding to burnt toast alarms in the many surrounding high rises. The Battle of Britain-style wailing moans and horn honks our family started imitating even in our broken sleep over our 6-night stay. OK, it's NY, and a big city - but still annoying if you have children trying to get some shuteye. As other reviews will attest the location of this property near the 79th Street local subway or the 72nd street express service will put you in easy reach of all the tourist spots (Statue of Liberty ferry, 9/11 memorial, Times Square, Theatre District etc etc) and walking distance to the Mus of Nat Hist and Central Park. The attached Serafina Restaurant is underwhelming. The next door Asian restaurant RedFarm is an absolute rip off. And the Viand Cafe (W75-76) or Cafe 82 (W82nd street) were family gems. But there are plenty of options for a range of travellers for food and other amenities.I do have to mention a weird feature of this hotel is that it seems to attract a few well-known people (or maybe it was just that there was a concert in Central Park during our stay) whose private cars block the valet, their hangers-on loiter around the bar and lifts, and sometimes detracts from the appeal of the property. It is an odd feature of American hotels and specifically the NYLO that the door staff size you up quite early in your stay, and if you are not deemed to be a constant source of additional income you are spurned their attention - which might actually be a bonus. However, when you combine the group near the front door who may or may not be actual employees of the property, and the other hangers-on it is a weird feeling to foray past them multiple times a day. I would not recommend this property to family stays but might suit solo business travellers or couples who might not feel the above are detractors...

This our second stay at the NYLO. From the moment you enter it’s lobby/reception area the you feel like you are a part of NYC’s vibrant atmosphere! Red brick walls, plush velvet and leather seating to the fire engine red grand piano...you’ll love it! I don’t know how they do it but they remember you and make you feel so welcome! From the doorman to the front desk reception they are truly accommodating. Ask for a balcony suite and then get a NY pizza delivered...heaven on earth!! We will always return to the NYLO NYC!

This hotel is in a great area, close to Central Park, great restaurants, near the subway, etc. The room is basic but nice, it's clean, and the bed is very comfortable. This last trip we appreciated that we could adjust the AC in the room and make it cooler since it was a HOT DAY in NY! The free drink coupon is a nice touch when you check in (the bar is at the entrance to the hotel). We were welcomed warmly and given a nice room away from the elevator, since we were there 5 days. We always stay here when we visit my sister and friends.

We had a fabulous stay at NYLO New York. We were offered a larger room and it made staying in the city with two kids a dream. The location, value, and upkeep of the hotel are all exceptional! Our bathroom -- which was moderately updated but felt older than the rest of the hotel -- had some leaking from the sink, toilet that clogged, and the shower pressure was very weak. Apart from its performance, it was clean and spacious, which count for a lot! In the lobby, we had a stroller and the only way in and out required a few steps, which was a mild inconvenience. The doormen were extremely kind but seemed to be in short supply. Four stars for the areas that could use improvement, but overall a fantastic hotel to which we will happily return.

NYLO was not much more than a glorified budget hotel. Inattentive staff, plastic cups wrapped in plastic in the $600 room, locker room grade towels, a bathtub shower, and a bellman noticeably absent. Only thing good I can say is the bed was comfortable.

Centrally located to everything we need. Comfy bed and pillows.Easy walk to most places we go, groceries, flowers, family, friends, Lovely bar/lounge, pleasant music, comfortablePeople/staff very pleasant and lovely human beings

I have a personal preference for a boutique hotel. This one did not disappoint. From the warm greeting of Carlos at check-in to the small touches of bottled water in the room daily, not to mention two free drink coupons! The room itself was more than ample in size for the two adults traveling. The bed linens were fresh. Generally I travel with my own linens but this stay they never came out of my bag. The beds were comfortable and the pillows had a variety of firmness. The location is far enough from the madness but close enough to great dining (including the restaurant on grounds). We were able to walk to most locations but the subway is close by at 79th St.Enjoyed the stay so much, I will be booking again later this month!

It was a comfortable stay for sure. The concierge was super helpful in trying to find us places to eat. They were right there to call us a taxi if necessary. I really did enjoy the stay and would recommend it to anyone quite honestly. I wish they didn't use the Keurig because of the waste but the coffee was good. Too much waste I felt.

The hotel is beautiful and our room was attractive with a comfortable bed and nice furnishings. The air conditioning unit is open in the ceiling and very loud, even when the fan is not turned on. They only have one ice machine on floor 12 but that was a minor inconvenience. They sent an e-mail in advance asking for requests and we asked for early check-in. The response was we could have it if room was availalbe (fair enough). When we got there we were told there was a $50 charge for early check in, even though the room was avaialbe. The front desk clerk was very rude -- so rude that after we asked his name (Sosa) he sent chocolate to the room. He must have known that he had gone over the line. There were so many added charges that we didn't expect (normal taxes plus an additional three line items) bringing the room charge from just over $400/night to over $600/night. Very comfortable bed but almost no water pressure in the shower. They also used cheap plastic cups in the bathroom. The main light fixture wasn't working. We reported it but no one ever came to fix it.

NYLO is a great find in the heart of the city. Great food and fun within walking distance or a short cab ride. Fantastic, professional, and friendly staff. Only disappointment was the rooftop bar--pretty much a few chairs with no bartender or real view.

This hotel was a cost effective option (for NYC, if you think you'll ever pay less than $274-$300 in NYC you're nuts)Rooms are large, safety is a focus with requirement to use room key to access floors. Bathrooms are big but there isnt' a lot of shelf space. I had an issue with a smoker somewhere near me during the first night, and sleep was horrible as it wafted into the room through the entire night (had to bag up the clothes that were hanging in my closet as they were unwearable). I did inquire about the rules at the desk and either they took care of it or the person checked out as night two was much better.Make sure to check your bill as there were some hiccups, but easily fixed with a call the next day.

The hotel was great, great location but a little pricey at over $700 per night. Make sure you book in advance and when there is not a special event. The rooms are very small, so prepare for tight spaces. The bathrooms are small as well.

Away from the hustle and bustle of the city, but conveniently located next to the subway station to get around Manhattan. Sophisticated library style lobby. Queen-sized bed room comfortably fits one couple. Keurig available for morning coffee. Levain bakery just around the corner for amazing melt-in-your-mouth cookies! (:

very expensive for the value, not enought cofe and milk. no room service that was a problem for us. Location good, staff ok. clean bed and bed sheets. We some wath liked it. Did not appréciate dogs comming out of the elavator wapping.

We very much enjoyed our stay at Nylo. The location is perfect, close to many great restaurants, excellent shopping, and a quick walk to Central Park. The upper west side has everything you want for a perfect visit. The hotel has been recently updated, the beds are comfortable, and the staff is friendly and helpful. The lobby has a great bar and lots of cozy space to relax, any time of day. This is a great spot to call home base during a stay in Manhattan.

I very much like the upper West side location and the welcoming attitude at the hotel. Staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. There was good food at both of the restaurants attached to the hotel.

we spend a nice time in this great location and we can recommend the nylo new york cityto our friends when visiting new yorkthe room was clean and nice, the service very good and politewe spend happy hollidays

Quiet, modern, clean, artsy room. Great deal when we booked ahead. Location was close to Central Park. Free drink vouchers. Plenty of towels supplied. We will come back again when we need to stay on the Upper West Side.

I really did love the hotel. Great room. Modern design. Nice and quiet for sleeping. And the bonus was the beautiful yoga facility just nextdoor. They have a special rate for NYLO guests!It's my new favorite for work -- a little further away than my meetings but it feels like you're staying in a great neighborhood with good restaurants and everything else you need.

The best part of this hotel is the location - close to Central Park, Levain Bakeries and to the subway. Otherwise for the price, I would look at the James Nomad, the Ace Hotel or others like the Crosby, the Palace, the Empire, the Lexington or the Peninsula. The extra $$$ will be worth it.

This was my 3rd stay at this property and it is still a great boutique hotel. Employees very friendly and accommodating. Placed in a wonderful neighborhood. I can't quite gush as much this time around though. Room large and very clean and Comfortable but there was a musty smell that couldn't be gotten rid of. I feel like it was coming from air conditioning. Throughout my duration of stay at least one of the elevators in the main bank were out of order causing long waits. There is no employee elevator so we almost always shared the tiny elevator crammed in with maid carts and maintenance workers. Speaking of maid carts, one of them was parked outside my door through my stay. I had to maneuver around it every time. At least I always had shampoo and toilet paper close by. lastly I worked approximately 100 hours during the week and had my last morning to sleep and relax after getting a complimentary late check out at 12:30. This however did not stop the maid from knocking on my door and attempting to enter at least 3 times while I was trying to sleep. Frustrating. I'm being a little picky because this is still much better than many options in NYC.

The room was very small but clean and comfortable. The staff was pleasant. Overall decent but not over the top for the price. That being said, NYC prices are very high. The hotel is extremely well located, close to subways, crosstown bus, great restaurants, Museum of Natural History and west side shopping.

Great Hotel, staff is wonderful and accommodating, great location. Reserve a room with a balcony on the Broadway side for a view of the Hudson. Two blocks from the subway, close to Central park. Good restaurants in walking distance.

Very thoughtfully designed lobby, bar, and bedrooms. The balcony on the 16th floor is a bit bland (no bar, not particularly comfortable seating). 5 star bed was a huge plus. Generally the staff was nice except for the gentleman who checked me in who was rude. Not sure I'd stay here again

Overall I really enjoyed our stay at the NYLO. The atmosphere in the bar and lobby area was great with nice lighting, music and comfortable seating. The hotel was very well located near Central Park. It was just close enough to tourist spots if you wanted to visit but out of the way enough not to be too busy. There were some great restaurants nearby Playa Betty’s, Crave Fishbar, Tessa and Serafina next to the hotel. My own complaints would be that the bathroom door was really difficult to open and close and the wardrobe was tiny, especially considering we were in a double double. I was also really disappointed when a friend arranged to have champagne sent up for my 40th birthday but the hotel didn’t include he asked them to send so we didn’t know who it was from. The hotel didn’t do anything for my birthday ☹️ I would still recommend the hotel though as overall we had a great stay.

We were there for a destination wedding. There were multiple pricing issues with over-charging / double charging for different rooms in our block of rooms. The couple was put in the wrong room for one night. There was exposed outlet wires in one room. The rooms were extremely small for the price. The employees were very friendly. GEORGE was the best. BEAUTIFUL view from the penthouse...once the couple had to move themselves to it when they were given the wrong room.

First stay at the Nylo and liked it very much. Jennifer on reception at check in was friendly and helpful. Room larger than expected (standard queen size). Wad a bit dark and faced other buildings but that meant away from traffic noise so no complaints there. Shower could have done with bit more pressure but nice bathroom with excellent hairdryer (not often you get one in hotels). Large very comfy bed. All clean and well equipped. Had couple of drinks in the bar, was quite expensive (but this is New York), suggest you ask price before they start pouring, saw customer charged $19 for glass of merlot. Great location on Upper West Side. Nice neighbourhood,feels safe,close to Central Park,subways and natural history museum. Bit of distance from tourist areas - Times Square etc but we walked it a few times. Amsterdam Avenue good for restaurants, bars, delis. Liked the hotel and would definitely stay again.

We had a great stay at the NYLO on the upper west side. The location couldn't have been better. We were close to Lincoln Center and Central Park. The subway was close at 79th street. The neighborhood had excellent choices for coffee and restaurants. The bakery Eric Kayser was one short block away for excellent breakfasts.Our corner room was huge, with four large windows overlooking Broadway. The king size bed was fantastically comfortable and we slept soundly each day after exploring NYC.Overall, the NYLO is a great choice for your stay in NY. Friendly staff, clean quiet rooms and convenient to the sights of a fantastic city. Management sent up a bottle of prosecco to celebrate my husbands birthday.We can't wait to return.

Funky hotel with cool vibe, nice rooms, convenient UWS location and fun lobby bar. Serafina is attached and is always good. Brunch was delicious! The bed was comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

We've stayed at a lot of places in NYC and keep coming back to this one. Great location for us and near the subway to get everywhere else. We have never had a problem with anything while staying here.

I have stayed at this hotel often and usually find it comfortable, good value (for New York) and the staff is curteous. This time the room was damp and not very comfortable. When I told the person at reception the next day the response was dismissive. Also had to wait ten minutes to find someone to check my luggage.

We had a superb stay at Hotel NYLO. Stayed 12 days, were treated like royalty by the entire staff, enjoyed comfortable accommodations (superior king room), terrific location, easy access to a very good restaurant (Serafina's), and benefitted from the variety of public meeting spaces from various nooks and crannies in the lobby to the "quiet terrace" on the 14th floor. When we needed to move a large party we had planned from the roof garden of a friend's apartment building on the UWS indoors to the "library" area of NYLO's lobby due to inclement weather, the staff was helpful and bent over backwards (including cutting us a decent rate for room rental, etc. to insure our plans would move forward. We'll be back.

... unless you enjoy being woken up at 3AM every night. The NYLO Hotel apparently contracts with a private trash removal service to come at 3AM every day. They bring a large carting truck which makes a load, groaning noise for about an hour from 2-4AM. Management says they can do nothing about it, but you can -- by staying elsewhere.

Nice and big room, quiet area high up on Manhattan. Close to Central Park and subway. 4 people in a big double double was no problem. Calm hotel with a cosy lobby and bar, even with live music and the staff was helpful and nice.I will absolutely recommend this.

The NYLO was in a great location and the staff was very knowledgeable, the room was clean and the bed was very comfortable.We felt safe with this being a mainly residential area but close enough to the Park and New York landmarks, will definitely go back.

This is my second time at the NYLO and I’m planning on coming back next week. The location is perfect! Soul Cycle on the corner, CVS across the street. Lots of cool restaurants on Amsterdam Avenue and an easy walk or ride to everything. Love the room decor and the coffee in room. Housekeeping however could be improved but I’m not taking off a star.

standard rooms are way too small. penthouses are amazing. great location. very comfortable and chic hotel. close to midtown, steps from central park. for the price, this hotel is highly recommended for business or pleasure

Inviting lobby, friendly staff, easy to be there. Besides being clean, modern and very comfortable, we noticed a new security feature. Liked that you needed to electronically flash your room key to go anywhere on the elevator, from the lobby!!!

Very clean and safe. A lot happening in the neighborhood.Cute bar and bistro area downstairs along w a Serafina. Right across the street from CVS and you can easily walk to stores, bars and restaurants.

Great location, friendly staff, very cool lobby and bar, and the best bed I’ve ever slept in! My wife even peeked at the actual mattress and had planned to buy it for ourselves when we got home but, sadly discovered that the mattresses were made “exclusively for the NYLO hotel.”

I was in town for my first trip to the US OPEN tennis tournament. My son lives only 5 blocks away from the NYLO and he chose the hotel I stayed in. It was a peaceful location, perfect for a solo trip. I felt very safe, and I stayed in the room during the day, because I was out late at night, and I received a wellness check from the staff to make sure I was feeling welll. That made me feel very well taken care of. I plan on staying at the NYLO on future visits to NYC!

Very neat vibe, loved the bar and lounge area. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The room was clean and decent sized for NYC. The location was not convenient to my office so never looked at the hotel before. Even with the 25min Uber ride to the office it was well worth it.

This hotel was just perfect for us. The loft apartment style rooms are really nicely done and the beds are so comfortable! The coffee machine was a welcome touch and nice toiletries in the bathroom. The staff on reception and concierge are extremely helpful, friendly and a have a great sense of humour. Serafina restaurant downstairs does the nicest breakfast we found anywhere, including an expensive spot on 5th Avenue!The Upper West Side is a fantastic neighbourhood to stay in, everything you need within walking distance of the hotel without the craziness of downtown. Fully recommend staying at the NYLO!

This place is a little unassuming from outside but once you walk in you're immediately hit by its charm. It's hard for me to describe its style, it's like an industrial, modern and classic mashup. The desk staff is very nice and friendly, the bar on the 1st floor is really cool, and the Italian place on the first floor is not bad. I'd stay here again.

Best UWS hotel. Quick, personable and professional front desk staff. Clean and chic rooms. Downstairs lounge has separate areas with velvet over stuffed chairs to read, relax or people watch. Relaxed yet chic vibe.

Great location. Like the many food options nearby. Very engaging lobby and lounge. TV remote did not work but it was quickly replaced. Our grandchildren who live nearby enjoy visiting us at this location.

We stayed at NYLO while visiting our granddaughter and parents. NYLO is located very close to where they live. The staff is always helpful and rooms clean and enough room for my husbands walker. Front desk staff Jessie was dry helpful when we had to leave a day early due to a sudden death in our family. They also let us store our luggage so we could get a nice breakfast in but be checked out to catch ride to airport. Thanks Jessie and all the staff for making our visit enjoyable.

everything was great, except the water pressure in the shower was horrible! It took forever to get the soap off my body! otherwise, it was really good and the service was top notch. everyone was helpful and friendly and accommodating. No complaints in that department.

Nylo was a great choice for a weekend away. My husband and I traveled to NYC for our anniversary weekend, and did not want to stay in the busy mid-town area so this was a great location for us. We were able to walk to restaurants and central park, and jump on the subway very easily to get downtown. Our room was clean and comfortable. Though our room was not ready by the time we arrived, we were able to store our luggage with the front desk.

We recently stayed at the NYLO for three nights while in NYC to see a couple of Broadway shows and visit museums. The NYLO on the UWS was a great base from which to get to where we needed to go. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and professional. We especially enjoyed chatting with bartender Frank in the lobby bar while we watched the US Open. When it was time to go, Alberto and Jose helped us quickly get a car to the airport and get us on our way. Our room (superior king) was typically on the small side as most NYC rooms are, but quite comfortable and reasonably quiet. So happy that a friend recommended the NYLO. We will definitely be back to stay next time we are in New York.

I’m not in any way associated with this property. I’ve stayed here before and will continue to do so, as long as the property maintains the current standards and reasonable prices. Our neice is attending Columbia and we expect to visit NYC on a more frequent basis.

Clean and comfortable. Only negative is that they charge $50 us to check in early. Check in is 4pm and check out 11am; despite it saying Check in 3pm and Check our 12pm on door of our room. Wish I’d seen that before paying the extra $50Plus the $30+ resort fee/per day.Great location.Cool lobby with live music

Poor customer service, claims roof top bar--- has bar in lobby you can get a drink and carry it up to roof to sit in one for 5 chairs. Floors so dirty made my feet black in room. Think twice before purchasing.

Have stayed at this hotel multiple times over past 4 years. The rooms are new, clean, and spacious. The bed is so comfortable. The location is also great in the Upper West Side. The evening manager, Jennifer, is so professional, friendly, and helpful. Highly recommend the NYLO!

Overall, excellent - price, location, ambience, decor, staff. Great social space and easily assecable restaurant (Sarafina). My only suggestion is to add more room lighting since the room was a bit dark

Excellent stay, friendly staff, neat and clean, fun Friday night live entertainment in the bar area, and amazing Chinese restaurant (Red Farm). Location is excellent on Upper West Side with lots of restaurants to choose from, very close to 1 train (2 blocks), and just a few blocks from both Riverside Park and Central Park (great for running)!

Enjoyed stay at this reasonably priced hotel in upper west side, one of our favorite neighborhoods with lots of restaurants, shops, the park,and close to subway to take you anywhere in the city. The hotel went through renovations and has switched to the “ industrial” look with clean lines, no rugs in room to collect dirt and dust, but bathroom size and accommodations are sacrificed. Bed is extremely comfortable, service was fine. Hotel looks it caters to a younger set, live jazz music in lounge on Friday night was a treat. The only other down size was the dailyurban fee( not optional) which is part of the service charges , and a total waste of additional money. However, eventually, part of the fee was waived by the assistant manager when I voiced my complaint. Overall, I would recommend this hotel

My family stayed here in August 2018. I think this is the fifth hotel we’ve tried in the Upper West Side in this price range, and I think we’ve found a new favorite. We had a very comfortable room — a 2 Queen Junior Suite — and it was very spacious by New York City standards. Super comfortable beds and fairly dependable and fast wifi, and much quieter than the older hotels that we’ve stayed at in the area (Beacon, Belleclaire, Lucerne, Excelsior). Service was friendly and responsive. They lend you free umbrellas at the door, which was a nice touch. I don’t have anything bad to say about the NYLO, actually, and it’s been awhile since I could say that about one of my hotel stays.

A pleasant surprise after the last stay where we were not pleased with the room. THIS time, the room was great and the staff was friendly and responsive. Looks like they take guest comments seriously and made it right. I will definitely stay at NYLO in the future.

Great location for a family traveling to see Central Park, Natural History Museum and all the restaurants on the Upper West Side. Great little lobby zone to hang out in for a cocktail, game of chess or a little music.

We had a room directly above the lobby close to the elevator on the 2nd floor, so this might have been the biggest issue (but maybe not). The room looks very nice with considerable amount of space given a large city's standard hotel room. The king bed was comfortable and the bathroom was recently partially-updated, new shower and sink.The main issues were the ambient noise within and outside of the hotel. Both could be heard easily, although I will say the music from the lobby bar directly beneath us was very faint. The room did occasionally have a slight smell of garbage upon entering the room. This did not occur all the time, so I'm not sure from where exactly it could have been coming. Midway through the stay they did have emergency water heater repair which took 2 hours, which is understandable, but it took an additional two hours of running the hot water to clear the lines of brown sediment/dirt.Other than those issues, the location was great for us. Very close to the museums, Central Park, and red or blue subway lines. Of course, there were ample food opportunities near as well.

This is an adequate hotel in the Upper West Side. Kind of funky, very small rooms, and not a lot of services. A classic renovated old hotel with tiny rooms. No rooms service. A nice, but somewhat incompetent front desk.

If you like the idea of a friendly boutique hotel in NYC, the NYLO is it! Great front desk staff - especially Tasha - who took care of us all week. Loved the open lobby bar area but the bartenders must be locked inside the bar! I never saw them leave or serve a patron. Actually, I’m not sure they had any service in the lobby. That would have improved the experience.The hotel is on a nice quiet street between Amsterdam and Broadway. There are a few little places around but we didn’t find a lot. The Amsterdam Ale House was a close good pub and there was a great French Patisserie on Broadway that does coffee and full breakfast.Rooms aren’t huge but a perfect size for two. Really wish there were COUNTERS in the bathroom and shelves in the shower. Small complaints but I did miss them.Biggest negative is the first floor restaurant - Serafina. I saw at least one other in the city so I think it’s some kind of “Mediterranean “ chain. It totally doesn’t work in my opinion. Everything is geared towards library/pub/sophisticated lobby. The location is good/bad. Right off the park and near the Natural History Museum, but it’s a cab ride to Times Square. It’s up there. Just be aware when making dinner and other plans.I saw a rate for under $100. I’d jump on it! Great find!

The location (blocks from Central Park, major stores and great Resturants), accommodations (very clean rooms), bar (strong drinks) with live music on Friday nights (singer had a wonderful voice).The best part of out repeated visit (we stayed the weekend of August 24-26 only to return the following weekend to explore NYC some more) was Wynona the front desk concierge. She greeted my husband and I with the utmost level of customer service and professionalism. She really was and is one of the reason why we will be returning and recommending NYLO to our friends. Oh and Tim who works the bar area was amazing as well!Thanks again for a great stay!Joe and Ronny

Wish you had a coffee pot in the lobby in the morning for those of us that prefer not to make a cup at a time in our room. Good access to taxi service and close to subway. Several good places to eat within an easy walk.

I have stayed at the NYLO before and I was happy to go back. It has a large, comfortable lobby with plenty of places to sit, plus a bar with friendly bartenders. The rooms are clean and comfortable, the WiFi fast, the location superb, with many restaurants close by, as well as the Natural History Museum, Central Park, and Riverside Park. Highly recommend.

When I arrived at the hotel I was greeted by a nice concierge who gave me a drink voucher, just as a greeting which was very nice. I then asked him after I got my key if robes were provided in the room, he said that they were and if there wasn’t just to call down and one would be brought up to me.When I got up to my room and started to unpack, I searched for a robe and there was not one provided. So I called down to the concierge and he said he would send one up. 25 minutes later after I’m unpacking there is still no robe so I call down again and they said they would send one up. No robe for 20 more minutes.So I decided to just take a shower and forget about the robe because it had taken too much time in the first place. However, when I got to the bathroom I noticed it was filthy, and there was a dirty towel in the tub. And at that point I call down and ask someone to clean the bathroom and also bring up the robe that I had been waiting for. No one came and I had to go down to the front desk to finally have them go up there and take care of that.I decided to use the drink voucher while I was waiting for my room to be cleaned again which should have already been, and it was just a terrible night from there. I do not recommend this hotel
user_name:
MrMeriweather
New York City, New York

review_body: can't beat location, 2 blocks from subway and car rental, lots of kosher restaurants and synagogues, clean, modern, only real drawback was lack of a small fridge in room...otheriwse it was great with great staff and service...cool bar and lobby area, complimetary drinks upon arrival,

We arrived early and were given choice to upgrade to a 14th floor room for $50. The room had a small private terrace which worked out great. Nice walks form Broadway and 77th to central park and to the Theatre District. Drink tickets for Happy Hour also much appreciated. All the staff we met were very pleasant-a most enjoyable visit.

This was my 5th trip to NYLO ! I love this hotel and neighborhood! The staff are very friendly, the hotel is clean and reasonably priced! Always enjoy stopping for a drink at thelobby bar after a busy day or night on the town

This is our third time at NYLO. The hotel itself is beautiful, not your usual big chain hotel, very clean and comfortable and location is perfect for restaurants, parks and subway. Looking forward to our fourth visit!

High quality at a reasonable price, consistently great service, well located (Upper West Side). Restaurant (Serafina) also great. Close to subway, good restaurants on Amsterdam Avenue, two mile walk to Columbia/Barnard campus, nice neighborhood.

Spent 3 nights at NYLO while dropping our son off at Columbia for his freshman year. This is a very cool hotel with friendly staff. Rooms are decent-sized for NYC. Bathrooms are a bit small but this is Manhattan. Everything is clean and well-maintained. The bar off the lobby is really a neat spot. Live music on Friday was awesome, and weather-permitting they open "garage doors" to bring fresh air into the bar area. Nice touch! NYLO will be our go-to place for the next several years for college visits. Already booked another trip in October!

My family stayed at NYLO yesterday until today.Loved the hotel.Great location and such a helpful staff. I wished I had known I could request a refrigerator but it was fine.Ice machine is on the 12th floor.Overall.i was so happy with this place.

The hotel was awesome. Rooms were a nice size, and decor was wonderful. Bed and pillows were incredibly comfortable. Location was great. And the staff couldn't be better. We shared with Jennifer (the woman who checked us in) that we were in NYC to celebrate our anniversary. She arranged to send a bottle of wine, 2 wine glasses, and a cork screw, to our room, and we took the opportunity to go up to the roof deck (on the 16th floor) to enjoy the wine. The staff was all friendly and helpful, from the housekeeping staff to the front desk staff to the door staff to the random staff members we encountered in the elevator. Truly an exceptional experience!

Room size is good, but bathroom is tiny. Also, there is no chair tin the room for relaxing. There is only a small desk chair on rollers. A fee is charged every day for water and coffee in the room - not sure you have a choice as to whether you want it or not.

I have been staying at this property since it was hotel On The Ave. It is conveniently located near the Museum of Natural History and the 1/2 subway line on the Upper West Side. The rooms are well-appointed and comfortable. There is now a beautiful lounge area to sit in the lobby and a bar where you can get a great drink in the evening. The staff is friendly and finds ways to be helpful. I will continue to use this hotel as my go-to when I need to be on the upper west side.

This is a decent place to stay on the upper west side. Much cleaner than the Belclaire across the street but they charge a resort fee and this is not really a resort, it is a small NY hotel. Rooms are small, modern, clean and tidy. Staff is hit and miss. They did have a fantastic Driver available who was helpful and reasonable. It is in a fantastic area with lots of great restaurants walking distance. Subway a few blocks away. They have a fun lobby bar.

This was my second stay at NYLO. Bathrooms are small, hard to move around in and have no practical towel racks. Staff summoned me to the front desk for a breakfast certificate, kept me waiting for 15 minutes, then told me they had notified the wrong person.Location is excellent for the West Side. A cool boutique hotel. Pay extra for room with Broadway view.

Our family of three [two adults, one 10 year old] stayed here on a trip to visit with family who live on the Upper West Side. We wanted a place that was close to our family [check!] and very walkable to restaurants and things to do, such as Central Park and the Museum of Natural History [double check!]. The atmosphere is friendly and hip, so we felt welcomed and definitely a part of the NYC vibe. The bar was decent, the in-hotel restaurant [Serafina] was quite good for breakfast [don't know why it gets so panned on Yelp], and it was a fantastic location for what we wanted. Nicely away from the tourist trap that is Times Square. We definitely felt secure in terms of safety, etc. The only two minor drawbacks - and we agreed that they fell into the "well, we're in the city" - were poor water pressure and that the NYFD station, which was literally across the street, was very active one of the nights we were there. Not much control over either - and yet we thought it was worth mentioning in case folks are particularly sensitive to either.

Wonderful return visit to NYLO and the Upper West Side! Between Central Park and Riverside Park. Easy access to subway on Broadway for trips to midtown and downtown. Plenty of restaurants nearby on Amsterdam and Columbus. Can't miss a visit to the delightful Cafe Lalo of You've Got Mail fame. We will definitely return.

I was very happy with my hotel choice. I was taking a class at Columbia and the location could not have been better. I would recommend this property. It was clean. Good restaurants within walking distance.

NYLO has many positive things to recommend it - location, comfort, spacious room and bathroom. My only criticism is that the Urban fee is simply an add-on for the hotel to make more money and not have it appear as the room rate. Most of what the Urban fee provides is offered by other hotels at no additional cost. The actual room rate is consistent with other NYC hotels.

So we arrive at 6am and I called the front desk to ask the best way to get to the hotel or if they have a shuttle service. He said they don’t but the best he can do is for us to take the Blue shuttle and it will be $18 each. So we went to the airport shuttle area but there was no Blue shuttle coming, contrary to what he said that it arrives every 20 minutes. 40 minutes after there was still no Blue shuttle bus so we book a different way of going to the hotel, had to go back to the terminal and wait for another hour before we can finally leave the airport.I hope this is not how our stay with this hotel will be for the rest of the week.We haven’t gotten there yet and we are already having a bad experience.Least they can do when we get there is let us check in earlier so we can rest after what their front desk made us go through.

From the moment I got to the hotel, I was greeted with huge smiles and friendly faces. Staff were super helpful and accommodating especially Jesse and Alberto!! My boyfriend and I thought the service was beyond excellent! I loved everyone's energy! The rooms were clean..neat..beautifully decorated and spacious. The penthouse we stayed in had teo balconies and well worth it if you are staying for a romantic getaway. If we needed anything from the front desk, we received it immediately. The hotel staff seemed like it was a number one priority to be kind and courteous! Check out Frank and Ben at the hotel bar with great live music on Thursdays. They made great drinks and will have you laughing the night away! UWS is a perfect neighborhood to take a walk..go to a museum and find any type of food to eat especially with lots of outdoor places. Serafina the restaurant in the hotel and it is a must! We highly recommend this hotel and we will definitely go back again!:)

The staff at the hotel were great, the bar downstairs is just the right kind of lively at night, theres live music on thursdays and fridays, Serafina delivers food to your room, the rooms are nice and well maintained, the location is perfect for exploring the upper west side. My only comment is that there are no refrigerators in the rooms, which would have made our stay that much more perfect as we were there for two weeks.

My favorite hotel for now, thet have amazing customer service, so comfortable beds and so we'll descorated. It's just incredible, I will definitely come again and have more time to enjoy this excellent hotel.

I recently stayed for a few nights at the NYLO hotel. I wanted to be on the upper west side, and there aren't many hotels in the area. I absolutely loved this boutique hotel. The rooms were spacious, the bed was the most comfortable that I've ever slept in, and the hotel has an all around cool vibe. They do have a facility fee, like most hotels in New York, but with the NYLO, it included bottled water, great coffee, and 2 drinks, as well as the usual health club and internet. The lobby has a bar in it, and its a great place to have a drink. The staff was really nice, the rooms were quiet. I was right by the elevator and didn't hear a thing. This will be my go to place when I'm in town. Loved it!

I stayed here 16-21 August 2018. It is located around 45 minutes away from JFK airport via car. Staff are very friendly and welcoming, especially the two ladies at reception who were on duty when I arrived. They also received some deliveries for me! The concierge (I forgot his name) was also very helpful during my stay. Lobby was nice and welcoming. Only complaint about the lobby was that there were some insects buzzing around, but no one can be blamed about this really. Everything about the room was clean and neat. Towels and toiletries were replaced every day. Coffee/Tea and water was replaced everyday. The bed was soft and comfortable. Bed linen was fresh and clean. The room I was in was spacious for one person. Wifi in room was good and I dont remember it dropping. USB charging points available on the bedside pedestals, which was very convenient. Elevators worked fine and didn't take too long to get me where I needed to be. There is a bar in the lobby. Complimentary drink vouchers are given when you check in and are valid for a few days after check-in. You can take your drink up to the terrace and get a great view of the surrounding river and city. The hotel and area around the hotel seemed very safe. It is close to two subway stations (72nd street and 79 street), and there is a 20-25 minute ride to midtown, times square and empire state building. Central park is a 10 minute walk away, but if you want to check out the Loeb boathouse and famous statues (alice in wonderland, balto, etc) you will have to walk much further. The natural history museum is also around a 10 minute walk straight up the road from the hotel. The hotel has the Serafina restaurant attached (delivery to your room is possible). It is slightly pricey, but the food/drinks are good. There are a lot of other varied and cheaper eating options within walking distance of the hotel. Another bonus is that there is a 24 hour pharmacy across the road from the hotel which also has some snacks and non-alcoholic drinks. Overall, this is a great hotel and I would stay here again.

Love the decor. Very nice atmosphere. Bed was extremely comfortable. The hotel is in a great location where you have access to restaurants, bars, stores and much more. Staff was great! Check in and check out were nice and easy. Will definitely be back.
user_name:
ralph3six9
New York City, New York

review_body: I have been coming here for the last 9 years. This year I noticed that the special feel of personal service was gone. The room we reserved and paid for in advance wasn’t available. We never were given enough towels or coffee each day. We had to call housekeeping multpile times for things we needed.

We enjoyed our stay at the NYLO. Although the rooms are small, the decor is modern and they were very clean. The staff were all very friendly and there is a nice bar on the first level. The subway is located just around the block, making it easy to get downtown very quickly.

We stayed at the NYLO hotel in June for a trip to New England. We booked the hotel through Hotels.com and were satisfied with the rate and location and indicated we'd like early check-in. A few days prior to arriving in New York city we received a message from Hotels.com asking if we wanted to upgrade our room (with options ranging all the way to penthouse suites). The prices for upgrading were reasonable so we OK'd the opportunity. However Hotels.com did indicate upgrades were not guaranteed. Anyway, the day came and we arrived at the hotel around 1pm. When we got there we indicated we had requested early check in and also about the upgrade. After several minutes we were told rooms were not available nor were any upgrades. To say the least, the offer should not have been made if there were 'No' upgrade available. We indicated our displeasure and the girl helping us said she'd take care of us, find a nice room and get us checked in as soon as possible. Over the next several hours we were told repeatedly that the room was not ready. Even though they called several times to housekeeping. Finally 4pm roled around and we were yet to get a room. At this point we were exhausted, frustrated and starting to get very irritated with unrealized promises. Keep in mind, that 4pm is check in time. At 5pm we finally got our room. We were told we'd be very happy and satisfied and that they did manage to upgrade us a little. We arrived to our room and were in uttter shock. The room was probably the smallest hotel room I've ever seen. Enough room for the bed and a standard bathroom...that's it. A tiny closet and not even any descent storage space other than two small night stands. Having waiting 4 hours plus for the room we immediately trekked downstairs. While waiting for the elevator, I happened to look at the evacuation plan, and I kid you not...we were given the smallest room on the floor and I'd venture to guess possibly the entire hotel. When we got to the front desk we told the desk person of the ordeal. Jennifer spent several minutes looking and then indicated she had one larger room available and that she'd personally walk us up there to view the room. We went up and the room was huge. Two beds, three night stands, a living room, huge closet and the bathroom was giant. The shower could fit up to 10 people comfortably...that's how big it was. We immediately we said we'd take it. Jennifer indicated it would be $60 a day more than what we had booked which kind of ticked us off as it was more than the 'upgrade' special we were offered earlier in the week (and that they didn't have any of). At this point we relented, just to move on with our vacation. We'd already lost a half day of enjoying the city dealing with this fiasco. Had it not been for Jennifer, our NY stay would have been ruined. The new room was great and it was a shame that they did not honor the upgrade, the early check in request, the normal check-in time and any offer for the inconvenience and still charged us for the upgrade (more than what was offered). My wife an I are convinced that they catered to repeat customers and put more effort into pleasing them, than new customers. Although the entire hotel was really nice with a nice restaurant and location, they staff definitely was not very helpful and we feel like the hotel should have bent over backward after all of that to make sure we were at least happy.

My family and I recently stayed at this hotel during our trip to NYC and I was very pleased and would recommend it to others. The staff were helpful and courteous and the rooms were spacious and clean. The lobby area is inviting and comfortable and one evening my wife and I took a break from the kids and played Scrabble there. Most importantly, I really liked the location! its walking distance to Central Park and this neighborhood is not as congested as mid-town and was a welcome respite from the frenetic pace in other parts of the City.

Very large rooms, clean and new, great location and wonderful staff. This is a very nice boutique hotel in the middle of the upper west side. Easy access to the subway, great restaurants in the area, shops and so much more. This will be my regular NY hotel for all my future visits. Great overall experience.The only negative is the Serafina restaurant which is awful. It’s in the hotel’s building but they are not related. Don’t wast your time, money or palet here. Food is below ave and the service, staff and management of serafina are terrible.

Stayed in June 2018.We had a great experience here straight from check in, met with very friendly staff from the very start. Ramona on reception was very welcoming and had a great conversation upon our check in. The bar in the lobby was awesome, had an excellent atmosphere and was always buzzing, live music on dedicated nights was exceptional, some of the talent they had there were incredible! We would quite often be excited to return to our hotel after being out at night because of this, and would sit down on the lounges with a drink to enjoy the atmosphere. Very cool.Close to everything, subway was only a couple of minutes walk from the hotel. Situated in a lovely neighbourhood, felt more like a family neighbourhood than typical city vibe, which we loved.Room was exactly as per the pictures, no view from the window but we didnt expect one. The bed was so so comfortable! We stayed at many hotels throughout our trip in the US and found this bed was by far the best out of all the hotels.The bathroom was the only downside, it was very very small and squishy. Room for one person standing only, definitely couldnt fit more than one person in there at a time. The shower also leaked excessively, had to place numerous towels on the floor to soak it all up. Lighting could have been improved, very low lighting provided from the lamps as there was no overhead lighting. Understand this was a nice atmosphere but at times it would have been appreciated to have slightly brighter lighting to look through suitacases etc. Great service all round from the staff and we will definitely be staying again upon our next visit to NYC. Highly recommend.

I love this hotel because it feels homey. You are greeted by friendly staff, the rooms are nice sized and feel boutique. The beds are amazing. Only place I would stay on the Upper West Side. This was about my 10th time staying.

Everything was nice to stay.Good location, comfortable and clean room and reasonable rate.It was very perfect there was a supermarket opposite to the hotel. I was able to get what I need easily.Another good option was the bar and lounge at the lobby.New York styled jazzy decoration and piano looked very impressive.I’ll definitely stay with you

Room was very comfortable and roomy. Nice restaurant selection and great bar. Very active and fun neighborhood. Would stay here again. Shower was big although bathrooom was a bit small. The terrace room is a real treat in NYC.

Staff is efficient and courteous. The location is great for many reasons. Parking is right across the street. There is a nice bar area and a separate place to see and visit with family and friends. The fire station does not turn on siren until they go onto broadway unlike the first time we stayed there.

I loved staying here. The room was small, but beautiful and perfectly adequate. The bathroom was gorgeous, I loved the shower. The staff were so lovely, (and delighted by my politeness and patience... y’all travellers gotta step it up, be kind!) and very welcoming.Room was very efficiently cleaned and replenished in the few hours I was out between 10-2:30ish. They elevator has keycard entry required, which is inconvienent if you’re looking for late-night food delivery, or having a hookup come through, but it didn’t pose an issue for me during my stay. (And you can always wait in the beaaautiful lounge in the lobby. Doormen were so sweet, and very accommodating. All around great and easy experience with the hotel!I chose it because it was close to the Natural History Museum (2 blocks, and it’s just on the edge of Central Park, which was my original criteria I was hoping to meet). It had a great price, and great look, so I went for it. It’s also close to a subway station going North and South, so it was easy to head a short way to a broadway play, or a bit longer, down to the gay village.My only negative experience was with one of the restaurants (salmon was still cold in the middle, and when sent back, returned still very raw. Got a small bout of digestive issue, I have a weak stomach), but the food was lovely, and servers were kind, and I was glad to have such a great dining area right there.

I think this was my 5th stay at NYLO. Conveniently located, comfy rooms, great service and lots of great eateries nearby. It also doesn’t hurt that there is a CVS right across the street which always seem to come in handy. Service is always good, bar is always lively and the outside seating and bar service was a plus this time too. Love that the doorman will help with catching a cab when needed. This is my go-to spot in NYC now. Great value for the price.

I love this place. I come to New York frequently to visit my family and after staying at other hotels on the upper-West side, this is the only place I’ll ever stay. The rooms are very modern, clean, and the views are gorgeous. The staff is friendly and very helpful and the hotel bar is a great place to get a night cap too! The hotel is also conveniently located across the street from a CVS which definitely comes in handy when traveling.

After a period of reorganization at the NYLO bar, management has hired an excellent bartender who is knowledgeable about wine and cocktails and has a very engaging personality. He really goes out of his way to please the customer. For those in the neighborhood who keep the kosher traditions, there is a wide array of kosher wines and cocktails. To my knowledge, this is the only bar on the Upper West Side that really knows its customers. A shout out to Jeremy bar manager and Connie the GM for putting together this new concept.
user_name:
SariSManhattanFiles
New York City, New York

review_body: The NYLO is a beautiful hotel located on Broadway in close proximity to Columbia College. Just right for a overnight stay and college tour. Valet parking was easy and fast to retrieve our car right in front of the hotel.The room was a 2 room suite on the 16th floor with a very large rooftop seating area. The outside seating area had a table and chairs and a couch and 2 large chairs.The bedroom was separate from a seating/television room with expansive windows overlooking NY City. The front room had a pull out sleep sofa and coffee table, and a desk with an in-room Keurig coffee maker.The two room sink and shower room was clean and spacious. The shower was luxurious.Would stay here again.
user_name:
Thomas S
Webster, NY, United States

review_body: This hotel is fantastic for those who want to stay in a central location near a subway line but away from the noise and traffic of Midtown. You are three blocks from Central Park, great museums and a broad assortment of restaurants.
