The rooms are clean, the staff is wonderful, an adjacent restaurant is handy, and the overall atmosphere was lovely.

The staff at NYLO were welcoming and accommodating throughout my stay- from checking in to storing my luggage after I checked out. The lobby is a lovely gathering place, with a social area and also a place to quietly work. The roof terrace was a nice place to sit and enjoy the city views. The place just has an overall great vibe. I would stay again!

I've stayed at NYLO twice now and I would stay there every time. It is in a great location, just a quick subway/cab ride to any NYC destination. The front desk staff is wonderful, the rooms are clean, and the beds are super comfy. The bar/lobby decor is sleek, sexy, and welcoming.

Nice room, nice staff, fair rate, good location in a city like NY. overall very good experience. rooms could be bigger, big beds, very nice bathroom, good housekeeping. nice restaurant in the lobby, service there can be more useful and quick

Fantastic location near to subway and plenty of good cafes around the corner. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Bed was super comfy and room was spacious. The hotel has very good electic vibe. No hassle and easy.

NYLO is in a great part of the city: great views, quiet area and convenient. Everyone from the doormen to the desk staff are impressive. When you get checked in, be sure to visit the wonderful bar, watch the world go by and let Christian Ortiz pour you some magical drinks -- He's pretty busy, but can always take a break for a little conversation or answer your questions about how to make your time in NYC a better experience. The deck on the 16th floor is also secret -- very cool -- don't tell anyone about that either. The rooms are plush and quiet -- perfect. We've been there maybe four times; will continue to go there in the future...

We had double queen family room which was big in any standards, definitely New York standards. The furniture in the room were so weird, very high beds, unwelcoming sofas, the curtains dusty. It did not feel upgrade at all. The bathroom was new with good shower but some amenities were missing. The location was great and we enjoyed the many cafes in the area. Subway is near and very comfortable to go downtown either from 79, or 72 street. We also walked to the Natural History Museum which is 10 minutes away. The lobby area is very nice. modern cosy decoration - very different from the room.

Very accommodating to room upgrade and early arrival. Beautiful lobby and nice ambiance. Friendly service. Hot water took long and check out time a bit early! Great access to all neighborhoods. Will stay again

The hotel was more than I had hoped for. I am a teacher, and was in the city for a one week conference. My school had booked the hotel for me so I didn't quite know what to expect. However, I was more than pleased when I arrived. From the minute I approached the front doors, I was greeted with a smile and a helping hand. I felt so welcome there. Each staff member I interacted with was kind and considerate. There was always someone there to answer my questions.. After being in workshops all day, I returned to the cozy atmosphere of the lobby bar where Christian greeted me with a smile and a delicious glass of wine. I was able to relax and listen to some great music as well. The NYLO was the perfect retreat after a long and busy day in the city. I will definitely be back!

Great hotel handy for walking to Central Park. Has a very nearby metro station. Friendly helpful staff. Only downsides are the local Fire Department based in the same road whose very noisy engines went out 4 times during our first night! And also the mandatory $35 + tax nightly charge for the “free WiFi” and a couple of daily bottles of water.

This is a great hotel if you need local access to Broadway and surrounding areas. Loved the easy walking up and down Broadway or catching a ride to anywhere in NY. The rooms are modern, clean and very quiet. In NY its great to not listen to sirens when you want to sleep.

Wow. This hotel was excellent. The staff, the location, the rooms = yes! It is perfectly situated on the Upper West Side, and convenient to multiple subway stops that will get you to the theatre district and other favorite destinations. The neighborhood is very safe and walkable. A restaurant downstairs that has fantastic meals, and a bar (that you get a complimentary drink to at check-in). The rooms are great. Lots of options for sizes. Very comfortable. All the necessities, plus a Keurig. The staff was wonderful. My flight got changed very last minute, and they went out of their way to help me get to the airport on time. They really care about your comfort in their hotel and city. Definitely recommend.

Excellent location. Room rates too high and they put very high holds on your credit cards. Upgrades are not free even if you were told you get free upgrade because of bad experience from previous stay. Valet/doormen are great and bar is great.

A very likable and low-key hotel. Compared to London I found the rooms large and good value. The location maybe too quiet for some, but I liked the laid-back feel of the area and easy walk to the park. The rooms are functional and perhaps a little too utilitarian in their design for some. I had a lovely corner room with good air-con. The bar is quite small, but had a decent selection of drinks and fast service. It certainly passes my “would I stay here again?” test.

Stayed in the hotel for the 4th time, this time with the family. Very friendly staff, nice ambiance in the hotel, clean rooms and I like the west-side with plenty of restaurants, shops, markets and musea. There will be a 5th time .

I was looking for a hotel that had 2 beds so we could travel with our kids to the UWS. NYLO was one of the few with this option. In the end the kids didn't come and we switched to another room, which was magnificent. My extended family stayed at 3 other hotels in the area and the NYLO had the nicest rooms, lobby and overall experience by far. Just be prepared when you book that there's a $30/day service charge to cover internet/water/etc. not included in the base price and bake that into your budget for comparison.

This was my first time staying in the upper west side and I loved it! NYLO staff were super friendly and helpful, and very accommodating. In addition to a trendy bar downstairs, they have a great rooftop bar. The hotel is so close to a lot of great bars and restaurants, as well as Central Park and museums. Being in the UWS it gets you out of the tourist madness of midtown as well. The two queen room was really spacious, although the one king room was a typical tiny NYC hotel room.

Feel free to call for help. I requested a soap dish, to fix the phone cable, a refrigerator; all requests were satisfied quickly. There was no towel hook, microwave, or frig, but I received a frig when I asked!

This hotel is a gem. Felt small enough to be personal and the staff couldn’t have been more friendly and helpful. I have some mobility issues and the lift was always at the ready to transport me to where I needed to be. The beds were almost too high for me but all other facilities were perfect. Fantastic on-site bars and restaurants. Thank you NYLO NYC!! I will definitely stay again. Thanks in particular to Victoria, Alberto, Eduardo and all the staff for making my stay so easy and enjoyable!
user_name:
Scholzy21
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Great customer service, staff was very helpful. The bed was very nice and comfortable. Great views of Broadway. I would come back again. Internet connection was good. Great sitting area on the 16th floor.

Upon arrival I was greeted with kindness and respect. This did not change during my one week plus stay. The rooms are modern and very clean. Adjoining restaurants were fantastic! Quick walk to the subway and Central Park. Plenty of restaurants in the area.

The NYLO is in a good location in Upper West Side. Not too close to the busy-ness 5 or so blocks away and not too far to walk to see other sites. It's New York and although we expected the rooms to be bigger it was ok for us in the end. The staff are very friendly and helpful.Locally we had a good choice of restaurants, breakfast and bakeries which was very positive

My husband and I spent two nights in NYC for our 49th Anniversary. This hotel is in a great part of the City and near some good restaurants. The staff was very pleasant and so helpful. The best thing about this hotel was the king size bed. Very, very comfortable! Would recommend this hotel!

Good accommodating staff. Very clean room. Excellent Upper West Side location. Close to many restaurants and wonderful New York historical society museum and museum of Natural Ｈistory is also fabulous. Homemade ice cream At Emack and Bolo’s!!

Consider NYLO is in the upper west side and not in the core tourist mid/up town locations, it provides a quiet and relaxing down time away from the hustle and bustle. We had a room with a balcony and a view of the Hudson river, priceless. Staff are friendly, helpful and our room is spotless. We enjoyed every minute of it!

Very pleased with this hotel, beds are very confortable. Great area with nice restaurants and very close to Central Park. The subway (line 1,2,3) is only a few blocks away. The gym is small and would need a refresh.

We stayed at this hotel years ago when it was On the Ave. Rooms are small, but everything is clean and sparkling. Hotel furnishings are upscale dorm room (dresser with locker room doors, oversized wood wheels on the king-sized bed, huge steel bin decor in the bathroom). Room was surprisingly quiet, especially since there was a fire station directly across the street. My side of the bed was a bit soft, my husband's a bit hard. Huge towel bins in bath are too big for space: banged my head twice! Also, the shower fixture is a hand-held type; got a face full of cold water when I was simply turning on the tap one morning. Welcome drink is a nice feature, and the bill was actually less than quoted!
user_name:
Graustark1963
New York City, New York

review_body: NYLO New York City is a perfect place to stay. The location is central and it is easy to access good restaurants and museums. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and spacious for NYC.

The room is clean and comfortable.I am from China, and my English is not good. The counters are very patient and give me much help.Before I left, They helped me book a taxi, and give some advise. Very Good!

I happen to love regentrified, updated surroundings. NYLO fit the bill and the bill didn't hurt! Great value and terrific people to make our stay easy and comfortable. A particular standout was the Bartender the late evening we were there. It was about 10.30 PM and the bar while lively was settling down, Christian Ortiz the bartender was beginning to close but immediately stopped and welcomed us, gave us ideas for a last drink that evening and engaged in conversation. He was genuine, recently engaged and working out his life. We enjoyed his company and wish him well.

Everything was great, with the exception of a slow shower drain, which was annoying. Additionally, I felt a little mislead by the NYC fees that seemed to grow from the time that I booked to the time that I checked in. But you can't beat the location. Will return.

Nice, intimate hotel on the upper west side. I had a quiet, but small room in the back. Serafina restaurant is adjacent and is very nice. You can request and pay for a breakfast voucher. Take advantage of this. Beware the resort fee . The internet did not work well for me.

The only reason I gave bed comfort 4 stars is because I need a very hard bed for my back. Serafina restaurant which will deliver to your room is a very good Italian restaurant. It does a broad range of choices from breakfast through dinner. Red Farm also downstairs has some of the best dim sum in the city.

This was our first stay at the NYLO, and it may be the first time we ever repeat a hotel when we come back to the city next year. The room was huge & clean. We had a balcony view of the Hudson River. The lobby was inviting - I was able to meet a long time friend in the lobby for drinks. The bar closes fairly early on account of the noise, but the singer / piano was a nice tough. The front desk was superb - long time NYLO people. The location was close to 2 subways if you want to travel cheaply - and a taxi was waiting outside at all times. We were able to get to everything we wanted to - downtown, park, midtown. Sitting outside on our balcony the last night was romantic and peaceful. Truly, NYLO was a gem.

Stayed one night in a king standard room. Room was very clean, a little tight, but expected. Simple, standard. Very boutique. Super cool terrace with beautiful view of the city. Front desk was awesome and extremely helpful with holding our luggage and check-in was a breeze.

The hotel is clean and well-located. The room was small, but comfortable. The bed in particular was very comfortable. However, we had problems accessing the internet. These problems were compounded by the lack of responsiveness of the internet support.

Great UWS location, great lobby. Tiny rooms, zero amenities in the rooms, room showing wear and tear underwhelming for the price. Frankly the hotel has so much potential they just missed the mark. But still the best option and that part of town.

Nylo never disappoints. My room was quiet, comfortable and well appointed. I was able to get a very attractive weekend rate and was able to checkin early. The lobby and bar are perfect for entertaining.

Loved the location of this hotel and the public areas on the lobby level. The room was comfortable and nicely appointed, though slightly smaller than I expected. I adjusted to the room size quickly and found it very cozy and clean. The bathroom was a good size with nice products supplied. Serafina restaurant next door was delicious with great service and very convenient. Everyone on the staff was friendly and welcoming. I enjoyed sitting in the lobby rooms and listening to the great live music in the evenings.

The hotel was nice the the lounge provide great entertainment. It is good for couples, groups and business. I upgraded to a nice room on an upper floor. I am in NYC regularly and avoid Manhattan because of price and noise. This particular visit the room rate was reasonable. If the price stays reasonable, I'll return to this hotel.

Located on Broadway and 77'th street, several meters from Central Park and a walking distance from 72'nd subway station where you can find train to all over the city.The rooms are somewhat small but covers all you need. Very practical for sizes.Room cleaning can be better- did not get new towels on daily basis and had to ask reception for new each day, which was a bit annoying.

Great location, especially if looking for the UWS flavor and feel. Tons of shopping and food options, close to Central Park. Ideal for theater and quiet walks! Great service, cute rooms, clean. I travel alone for business, but if I brought my family, would,need 2 rooms at least with 3 kids.

Incredible hotel! Thank you Jessie for your help!! All the staff care about your needs and make every effort to help! Location is perfect...close to subway and Central Park and all other amenities!!!!

I was nervous about this booking because it was very reasonably priced for a New York hotel but was blown away by how much better it was than I expected. The lobby is a huge lounge area where you want to hang out rather than like most hotels where the main area is designed to make you pass through as quickly as possible. The staff was great. The room was very good. The subway was very easy to access. Tons of restaurants in the area and just a few blocks from the park.

The location of this hotel is simply great! Close to Museums, parks, restaurants and shops. The subway is just two blocks away. The rooms are not too small, modern and clean. They have good options to accomodate families in bigger rooms. The bar downstairs has a nice atmosphere and live music some nights. Unfortunately, there was a big confusion with our reservation, but people at the reception handled it very well. Jessie and Ramona were especially nice and helpful!

Another great visit to the NYLO; Upper West Side is our favorite 'hood. We were met at the front desk by Jessie, very friendly and accommodating. We arrived early on the Red Eye and by the time we had coffee she had found us a room for early check-in! The bar is such a nice amenity and the Thursday night jazz was swinging. Comfortable bed allowed us to sleep in and stay on West Coast time, and I usually have trouble sleeping on hotel beds.

We loved NYC and are so thankful we stayed at the NYLO! We didn’t want to leave and are already planning our next stay! The rooftop lounge allowed us to relax a bit from our day and get us in the mood for the night ahead. Everything was pretty easy to get to from the hotel and taking an Uber or taxi was cheap.

Our stay from 7/23 to 7/26/18 was excellent. Every staff member was very helpful, professional, courteous and friendly, especially Jessie, the concierge, and the director of sales and marketing, whom we met on the elevator. The housekeeping staff were particularly careful and helpful. Thank you for making our stay in NYC truly memorable. Charlie S. Rm 819.

I stayed at this hotel for more than two weeks.The receptionists treated us very nicely, the room is pretty, and the best part is the location - very close to the subway, pharmacy, and many restaurants and bars. A short walk from the Hudson River and Central Park.Highly recommended.

My best friend and I loved our visit at NYLO NYC. The front desk associate, Jessie, was extremely helpful and made our early check in into the Junior Suite with Balcony possible. The downstairs bar and location are prime to the Upper West Side, Chelsea and museums, and this hotel made our trip something to remember. I was overly impressed and will definitely stay here in the future because of the great rooms and generous staff members.

OTA/NYLO was once our favorite UWS hotel, until the buyout. It’s our old neighborhood, close to areas we like. Now prices have gone up, it lost personality, they charge $50 for any early entry to already-cleaned rooms, and the WiFi connection is a pain (with off-site “technical service” help, and the lobby entry always smells a little funny — we may try other options in the area. It used to be our great little secret every time we came to NYC. I

Was in NYC and decided to stay out of midtown this time - and the NYLO is right in the heart of the wonderful upper west side. Fantastic food every block, the park minutes away and subway to everywhere . Price very reasonable for the location and quality. The only glitch for us was also noted by some other reviewers - a super noisy air conditioning system in the room. May not bother all sleepers but was a challenge for us and turned it on and off through the night. Hope the hotel can invest in this issue soon as we plan to be back !Ps we enjoyed the lobby bar open to the the street which was pet friendly ;)
user_name:
traveldreams06
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Exceptional location on the Upper West Side convenient to the subway, shopping, great restaurants, and a short walk to Central Park. It hosts a comfortable lobby and bar. Every hotel staff member is courteous, friendly, and attentive, especially the house keeping crew. The bedrooms are clean, quiet, comfortable, and the modern bathrooms appreciated. This “Gem” in the city, is highly recommended!

Very great room.... very great full service. Near everything downtown!!! Great rooftop drinking/hangout spot. Large food portions. I'd recommend the nylo to anyone. The valet parking was spot on never had problem at the nylo ☺️

The NYLO is located on the UWS just two blocks from the 1 train. I attended an educational conference at Teachers College and I stayed in room 1003. The room was on the small side yet it was comfortable and very clean. The bathroom was spacious. Housekeeping did a wonderful job providing everything I needed during my four day stay. The staff at the front desk were very accommodating also.

I do not normally take time to write reviews- but this I felt compelled, as I was shocked upon arrival. Hotel is a motel. Looks nothing like photos. My room was dirty. Bed had dirty sheets, someone’s change, metro card, ticket, band aide on tv. It was disgusting. They changed me to another room, which was just as terrible. It had hair in the bed sheets. We barely slept, afraid of bugs. Slept covered with a towel. Do not go!!!!

This hotel is in great location but prices are too high. Rates change according to date. Very small room with no counter space in bathroom. Strange floor plan with no sitting area but hallway in front of closet which was wasted space. Rude clerk when I tried to get same rate for third night and she said she could not help. Won’t be back!

NYLO is great hotel in Upper West Side, convenient to Central Park and subway. Upper floor rooms with balcony are worth the extra cost during longer stay. All room balconies are not equal size, some are small and some are very spacious. One of the four elevators does not go to the upper floors, and the one next to it that goes higher does not operate consistently (the other 2 elevators on opposite end of lobby worked fine). Housekeeping does good job overall but may not consistently replace used bath linens. Despite elevators and towels, the NYLO was extremely comfortable place to stay. Lobby area is excellent place to gather. Friendly staff. Would definitely stay at NYLO again!

My wife and I celebrate our one year wedding anniversary at NYLO. Vivek upgraded us from a standard queen to a king suite for a discounted price and sent a bottle of red wine to our room to celebrate our small milestone. He was very friendly and helpful. The room was large, queen, and beautiful. The decor and furnishings have a chic modern look. The bed was great. The two (!) balconies in our suite offered great city views. The bathroom is straight out of HGTV - it looks great. NYLO is perfectly situated near great restaurants, the museum, and Central Park. My wife and I are so glad we chose NYLO!

Was excited to stay here as we stayed here many years ago and loved it but since there new renovation it is well below par. The room was small with two queen beds squashed in and a built in side table against the wall leaving minimal room to walk between bed and table. We looked out the window at a garbage dumpster. The carpet in the main areas looked dirty as well. The bathroom was tiny and when I bent down to get something I found a dirty cotton bud left on the floor. The bar area was noisy but admitedly it was a Saturday night. They did reduce the tariff but honestly to pay $AU 400 plus for this room was absolutely not worth it. Will never stay here again. Maintenance and design of room was impractical.

This hotel tried to charge me $100 for an early check-in when the room rate for the night was $217.00. I found this outrageous and asked to speak to a manager, but was told no manager was on duty. The front desk promised to have a manager contact me about an early check-in, but the manager never did contact me. When I checked out a couple of days later, the front desk stated that they had no record of the notes I watched them type into the file 2 days earlier.

The staff is among the best at any property anywhere, always going above and beyond for the guests. I love the overall feel of the hotel, and the location couldn't be better - close to the subway, in a prime neighborhood, near Central Park, etc.

Having always stayed in Time's Square area, we decided to try a different area. The Upper West Side is gorgeous - with beautiful architecture, great restaurants and cafes - all without all the tourists, noise, fast food and traffic of midtown. You are so close to museums and Central Park and steps away from the subway (and express trains) to get you to Times Square/Broadway in literally minutes. Transit was so convenient and easy to use to get us everywhere we needed to go in a remarkably short time. NYLO is an updated trendy hotel with a great look and vibe and friendly staff. The room was larger than others I have experienced in NYC. The hotel restaurant Sera Fina was so good for dinner. Right across the street is Maison Kayser with authentic French cuisine where we had a street side amazing breakfast - I felt like I was in Paris again! Concierge was helpful with subways and places to eat - must check out Sara Beth's. Also across the street is Beard Papa's with delicious cream puffs! The area is so safe and beautiful with mainly local people here. Will definitely be recommending NYLO and the Upper West Side for a truly authentic New York experience!

Good location near the subway and central park. Nice doormen but apart from that not much else to write home about. We had made arrangements prior to arrival which were not carried out, and I felt they handling of our concerns was poor.

It is pet friendly; however, you should know that the charge is per dog/per day. I paid 80.00 a day for two dogs (ten pounds each). I only stayed two nights so that wasn't a big deal for me especially given that we were only a few blocks away from Central Park and I did enjoy the time with them.

Nice hotel with great bar and restaurants. Very large room with 2 queen beds and sofa area too. Close to Museum of Natural History and Central Park. Great walkable area with lots of good food and easy access to subway.

Room was very clean and also cleaned daily with fresh towels. The bar downstairs is great with also a 24 hour CVS right across the street. So many great places to eat around and also has easy access to the New York Metro.

We have stayed at many boutique hotels over many years in Canada and US. This was definitely one on the top of our list. Everything form guest services, location and room exceeded our expectations. We will be back!

This was an excellent stay.I arrived at the hotel early hours before check-in. I was assisted at the front desk both with an area to refresh myself after a long plane ride and storage for my belongings. Super friendly front desk and excellent room. Beds were some of the most comfortable I've had in a long time. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay

Liked the 10th floor Broadway view. Enjoyed the 16th floor roof deck and lobby bar. If you would like a larger room pay for it but our room was fine for us. A great location if you enjoy walking in Central Park, the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the Museum of Natural History, and Zabars. This hotel is in a relatively quiet, residential neighborhood but of course you can travel by subway, taxi, etc.anywhere!

I just stayed at the NYLO NYC on my first ever visit to New York. The hotel has a tremendous location in a great walking neighborhood on the Upper West Side. The room was beautiful, with a comfortable king size bed, good shower, and a fridge. I really appreciated the complimentary bottles of water each day! The staff was very friendly and helpful during my stay. Lastly, the outdoor rooftop terrace was a great way to end each evening. I highly recommend the NYLO NYC! I will stay here on my next NYC trip! Thank you to the staff!

A terrifically nice hotel! The furnishings were different from the usual stodgy style. There are bright colored cubbies to store your stuff. There are two armchairs and a sofa in the junior suite. We had a crazy, rainy day (the sky opened up and sheets of water came pouring down!) But, the room was so pleasant, we did not mind staying in for the afternoon and reading.

I would consider it as 3,5 stars and overpriced. The room was dark, more lighting in the room is necessary. There is no refregirator in the room. The shower head was not working well, the water pressure was weak. They fixed it with a new shower head after my 2’nd complaint.

Very friendly staff. Clean and cozy room. Great location near to the Central Park and metro station. The only thing is that only one elevator worked when we stayed. We had to wait longer to get back to our room.

Just stayed at the NYLO for at least our fourth or fifth time. Always come back- great rooms, great location, reasonable price (for New York), easy access and in a good location. There are great restaurants in the area, and it's very walkable.

We love the hotel , this is our forth year staying there. The rooms are big and modernly decorated there is always bottles of water available for us in the room or at the hallway free of charge.The hotel has a young atmosphere but it is not noisy.The location is great few steps from the subway and the park. There are many shops and restaurant in the area.

Room was remodeled with plenty of space. Very comfortable. Staff extremely accommodating especially JESSIE! Jessie really helped us out. Thank you!!! Enjoyed a drink at the lovely bar complimentary from the Hotel. Also enjoyed having dinner at Serafina which is next door!

I have stayed in this hotel many times as I like the location and find the quality adequate. This past stay I felt that the pirce was high for a small room, and especially with the facilities fee added on. 30 USD plus a day extra for what? Internet and water which should be free when you are paying this much already. Towels are older and a bit too worrn. Elevators are slow. Cleanliness is good. Location is great and hotel could be better with a little more TLC and less hidden fees.

I always have stayed at the NYLO. This time the bed was horrible. The arriving cocktail was made with very cheap alcohol. When paying 300/night I would expect a better quality of booze. Stayed 3 nights. Last morning there was very little hot water. Staff was great as usual. Will probably look at other hotels next time. Stay there at least once a year.

I have stayed at his hotel previously. I would love to give it 5 stars due to its customer service alone, because they would deserve it, but I must ding it 2 stars due to a lack of cleanliness. Our room and bathroom was in dire need of a THOROUGH and DEEP cleaning. Our shower reflected the remnants of previous guests (hair on the marble floor, product on walls). There were also bugs nesting on the ceiling of our shower. The floor of the room needed to be vacuumed. And the one time I forgot to put my slippers on directly from the bed . . . my feet had dirt and a previously crushed spider stuck to the bottom of them. Still don't understand the use of flat sheets instead of fitted sheets on the mattress, but many hotels go that route these days. So disappointing because this hotel could really be special . . . but they need to train their household staff or alternatively, make them understand that a thoroughly clean room will garner NYLO the attention it should deserve.

My partner and I stayed 10 nights. Our room was small (welcome to nyc) but perfect for us. Bed was very comfortable and we could open the top of the window which was important, as being from Australia we are not phased by a little heat (or noise) and don’t sleep with air conditioning. Nylo is well located and close to a variety of subway stations and attractions as well. A wealth of options for eating and shopping abound. The upper west side is relatively quiet and has a relaxed feel so we started to feel like locals in no time. We were pleased with our choice and would stay again at Nylo in a New York minute.

Love the hotel, and the bar is fantastic, cozy and open to the street. The rooms are lovely, and beautifully furnished. The proximity to Lincoln Center and great restaurants and museums  I just wish they had a rewards program! I travel frequently, often staying in the same hotel when I travel abroad, and a rewards program can definitely tip the scales when it comes to choosing where I can stay. I wish that NYLO would do the same!

Fourth of July vacation room was clean. Wanted to charge for drinks that was complementary. We Requested a fridge. Never got it. Terrace is not all that. Food area is closed to early. We never got to enjoy the bar.

The hotel was perfectly located to go to shows and visit Columbia University. The room was clean, spacious, and comfortable for my family of four. My only complaint was the noise from outside. I have stayed in busier locations in NYC where the outside noise was faint and did not disturb sleep. At NYLO, I was awoken several times each night of our stay by emergency vehicle sirens. We were on the 10th floor; I can imagine the noise on the lower floors would be even worse. NYLO- replace your windows with soundproof glass!

Great hotel making you feel like you are a local living in Upper West Side. Close to Subway station at 79th St and nice, friendly safe neighbourhood. Great option if travelling with kids. Staff really friendly and helpful. Italian restaurant in Hotel has great food too.

Pros: The lobby and bar have a nice atmosphere; the nonrefundable rates were a good deal for New York City; the room (junior suite 2 queen) was clean and fairly spacious; the beds were very comfortable; we enjoyed the location, close to Beacon Theater and Central Park; and the hotel staff was lovely and very helpful.Cons: Our room (#405) looked into a concrete wall, so the room appeared dark and closed off; the sofa mattress (that we had planned to use) was so uncomfortable that it was unusable; and the "urban" fee of $35 per night on top of rates and taxes is excessive.

Great bang for your buck! Very friendly & courteous service from staff. The area is a nice area and fairly quiet at night, many amenities in the immediate area. Very Close to Central Park, downside is that most major tourist attractions are not in the area but there is a train station very close by which takes you anywhere fairly quick!

The check in was unwelcoming, the room was tiny compared to what we paid, the staff was unfriendly, the water pressure was nill. At one point our key cards wouldn't work so we had to go downstairs to the front desk and were told that our keycards won't work because the CC we gave for incidentals was declined. But our room wad FULLY PAID FOR! You won't let a paid customer in their room because of a stupid reason as that???They could have asked for a different card at checkout or call me in my room! Overall negative experience.
user_name:
mosherry4
New York City, New York

review_body: We love to run in the morning and Nylo gives us an excellent option to either choose Central Park or Hudson . But in the end the style, the roof top, the bar and the rooms make us stay in the Nylo. People are always friendly
user_location: Urbar b Koblenz am Rhein, Germany
user_name:
goetzw2014
Urbar b Koblenz am Rhein, Germany

review_body: Excellent and attentive staff and a fantastic location. Housekeeping right on top of guest needs (extra towels, water, etc.) Front desk and valet staff also courteous and attentive. Get a room on a higher floor and at the back of the house to avoid firehouse noise (across the street on 77th).

I really liked this hotel and thought that the staff was wonderful. Only frustrating part was the check-in time of 4pm. I was charged $75 to check in early and that was a first for me considering I've checked in early at other hotels before without having to deal with a fee to do so.

We made a last minute decision to stay two nights in the city with our daughters with the intent of seeing the Met and the Natural History Museum. NYLO was the perfect distance. We woke up, got a coffee and donut at a little dunkin donuts near the hotel and walked across the park to the Met. The hotel was quiet and clean. The rooms were a little tight but they were great for our short stay with the girls. We had a room with two double beds so we had to split the girls up and each sleep with one but honestly it was all good. The location and price really made it for us and we were able to sit outside at night for a drink while the girls worked in their coloring books at the table with us. In the morning we took our coffee up to the upper balcony and had a cool view. We didn't have much interaction with the staff so I can't comment on that but overall it was a good stay.

The assigned room was very dirty, and I stepped on used contact lens. There were many hairs on the floor. The room was changed, but we encountered with another issue with smoke detector. It started to beep every 5 minutes. The hotel staff couldn’t solve the issue, and we had to face this annoying sound for entire night. Towels were old.

This hotel was recommended to us. It proved to be a good recommendation. The location was in a great area and close to parks, museums, subway stations, and wonderful restaurants. The hotel has an industrial, modern vibe which was great. The lobby was welcoming and it has a comfortable bar area. The beds were extremely comfortable. The staff was professional and friendly. The rooms are on the small side, but not uncomfortably so. If you want to get away from the crowds of Times Square, this is the hotel for you....

We enjoyed our stay. Hotel staff were very accommodating and helpful. All the hotel employees were polite and helpful. Our flight was delayed leaving NY and they gave us a late check out for no charge.Room was very clean and plenty of storage space.

Great hotel at reasonable price. Room was comfortable, bed was very comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a place on the upper West side of Manhattan.

I drank some wine at this place. They usually have a jazz band playing, the also have a grand Piano. It’s connected to the hotel so its easy to go upstairs after having couple of drinks. It is around central park, and its close to the 1 and C trains.

We booked a Junior Suite for 10 day family holiday.( Definitely bang for your buck ). As returning guests we were welcomed by the super friendly doormen Lenny and Orlando, and the some of reception staff Ramona, Tasha, and Jennifer who we interacted with. They really know how to make every guest feel special and welcome. Everyone is professional but go the extra mile with the human touch you often don't get in urban hotels. Room was soooo spacious, and beds super comfy. The lobby and living room areas are also cozy and was great for entertaining our city friends who came to chill out with us. The location is wonderful, with subways accessible a block a way, great supermarkets on the street below, restaurants and shopping all in walking distance. This is one hotel you are so happy to return to and kinda sad to leave.... till next time.

Always happy to return to NYLO NYC. Great staff, great rooms, great hospitality! And in the summer, great air-conditioning! Always happy with my visits to Manhattan and the Upper West Side. I always stay there!

Prices match the quality of service you will receive, which is amazing along with amazing views for the city! Very clean and at check-in you receive complementary drinks! If you get real cool with the front desk people they will hook you up with extra free drinks and minimal charges for upgraded rooms! Overall, great experience at New York Nylo - Dallas Nylo's are also awesome!

This is a great hotel!!! Everything is clean the hotel is convenient to Central Park and other tourist areas. The hotel employees were great, everyone is personable and courteous. We had a good time, when we return we will stay here again.

What an amazing hotel! We found NYLO online and decided to give it a try. And we weren't disappointed. The hotel was amazing. The entire staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They went above and beyond to make sure we had a wonderful stay. We ended up driving in, and the valet was quick and easy. There was a great park on the next block that the kids loved, with a play structure, water feature to cool-off, hard court soccer pitch and track.

A nice boutique hotel on the upper westside. It is within walking distance to coffee, bakery, pharmacy, shops & market, and few blocks from Central Park It is across the street from Engine 79-Fire Dept. Occasionally, we would hear the sirens - typical NYC living. The rooms are spacious for NY hotel, clean & minimalist décor. There is Keurig machine & k-cups plus complimentary daily water bottle service. NOTE: there is no refrigerator - which is fine with us as we never use it when it is offered anyway but wanted point that out to those that may need one to store medications & etc. Concierge desk is wonderful and they have car service - if you want rather than take a cab.

We always stay at the NYLO. The hotel is located at the corner of W77th & Broadway. The room sizes are what you would expect for NYC and the price, for the most part, are reasonable. The front desk and other attendants are always pleasant and will to assist you.

This hotel has a cozy and homey boutique feeling. We went on a hot summer day and I can imagine it being even cozier in the winter. We had 5 separate rooms with some complicated logistics and the front desk could not have been more accommodating. Valet was excellent - park right out front and they were waiting. Live music in the evening which was not too loud. Roof top for gathering with friends was great. Rooms were clean, simple but cool and quiet! great location for upper west side restaurants and the Boat Basin which I would also highly recommend for NYC visitors!

This was the best Hotel stay of all times, never has been greeted with a free drink at check in before. Very classy. Thanks for such a wonderful stay. When ever in your city again, I will be staying there for more than a day.

The hotel was very close to the subway and Central Park. We came to NYC to see Central Park and were pleased that it was a short walk. There were many good resturants close by. The bed was very comfortable.

It was a nice place to stay and the rooms were comfortable. People who work there were friendly! Needs refrigerator in all rooms. Perfect place if you are willing to walk a little to catch the subway. Check out the terrace

NYLO. New York city. Upper West side. Very good location, confort and service. Good transportation, decent price. #newyork #upperwestside. Good view .........One of best option if you want to stay out of the tourist traps.

Very comfortable stay. Safe environment.. Very nice staff. Great music. wonderful service ie, computers. Great recreational activities. Rooms very clean. Quiet. No smoking when indicated.Very helpful when needed regarding reservations.

Awesome hotel, Amazing location Incredible staff. I took my 11 year old there to see new York for the first time, she was more excited about the hotel than the city. She loves interior design and thought the hotel was very modern chic

We stayed for our 2nd visit & will ALWAYS return to this hotel. The staff is Beyond Wonderful. We had a little misunderstanding and the Management Made It RIGHT!!! We Love Lenny the door man, who always meets our needs. Metia our room server was Most helpful, and always meet our needs. We just LOVE the quiet area, and the outside sidewalk, were we get to meet some wonderful locals. KUDOS to this HOTEL...We would not stay anywhere else!!!

I booked a room with a Beautiful view and terrace two months in advance in connection with my Daughter's surprise engagement. We arrived at 10:00 in the morning. Check-out is 11:00. At 4:00 we received a call that the air conditioning was broken and we would have to have a different room, no attempt to fix the AC, surely the City that Never Sleeps can arrange to have an AC unit fixed in the middle of Summer within 5 hours. We were given an 'upgraded

Rooms were larger than expexted. Hotel restaurant was very good. Good location, close to Central Park and subway. CVS pharmacy right next door, very convenient. Quiet, safe neighborhood. Hotel lobby has a strong incense smell. That’s the only negative I could find.

I’ve stayed twice now. The rooms clean and modern, and have a feeling of spaciousness. My favorite here is the beds, which are so comfortable. The staff is helpful and welcoming. We got a free drink this last time too, which was quite a nice treat. Good location too.

Rooms were small, but not the smallest I have stayed in in NYC. Bed was comfortable and a true King size. Loved the wooden floors. Internet was reliable and fast. Atmosphere in the lobby was great and was always busy and welcoming. Only a couple of blocks away from 2 subway stations.  Complimentary drinks at check in were also much appreciated!

NYLO is now my go to spot when I wanna het away and psmper myself with peace and quiet... I recommend this hotel to all travelers very friendly staff and the rooms are immaculate and cozy. The bar staff is quite enjoyable.
user_name:
chrismyree
New York City, New York

review_body: This was my second stay while attending a conference at Columbia Teachers College. Perfect location, friendly service, and quiet rooms. Loved getting up and running in Central Park every morning. It is an easy ride on the subway either up to Columbia University or downtown.

The room I booked was not available due to air conditioning problem. The hotel came through with an alternative and took $40 off my bill. I booked a parking special for 25$. We were more than satisfied with the service. Beautiful room on the 16th floor. Restaurant needs updating.

Booked two rooms, one for me and my fiancée, one for my parents, on hotels.com. The hote has rates that were significantly cheaper than any of the chain hotels in Midtown (and also wasn’t located in Midtown...) This place is also much better than the nearby Lucerne, in my opinion, for roughly the same price.Negatives: this hotel does have the dreaded “resort fee.” They do not allow you to check in before 4pm (even if the room is ready!) unless you pay $50/room. The drinks prices in the hotel bar are not listed on the menu and are VERY high. The rooms are small.Pros: the rooms are very comfortable and thought out despite the small size. I had no issues with space or anything. Slept like a baby in the bed. Shower didn’t suck like so many hotel showers often do. The lobby is beautiful and the bar is a great hangout spot. On Thursday night a jazz trio played for a couple hours. The staff is friendly and helpful. The location of this hotel is great (2 blocks to #1 train at 79th, or 5 blocks to 1/2/3 at 72nd). Central Park is very close. Riverside Park is very close. Lots of little cafes and restaurants nearby (try Maison Kayser).

Rooms were much larger than most Midtown rooms. Great location on the Upper West Side. Room wasn’t ready when we first arrived, but was ready at 3pm. This is a pretty typical check-in time for hotels, but it’s alasts nice when the room is ready earlier.
user_name:
svazhar
New York City, New York

review_body: We loved everything about our stay. The roof deck was amazing. We got one complimentary drink at the bar and daily water bottles. Room was spacious and very clean. Staff was friendly and the location could not be better plus the price could not be beat. Will definitely stay again.

My review was generally good except for the spider webs in the shower door area. check in was easy and check out was also. Food in you ajoining restaurant was excellent and we had 2 meals friendly bus boys also
user_name:
vfobar330005
Castleton On Hudson, New York

review_body: Great hotel! Good area and friendly and helpful staff! The hotel was clean. The location was quiet and felt safe. It was located close to the subway and too far away from Central Park. I would stay there again

We loved this location and style of this hotel! Great look and feel. Close to food, close enough to subway. Short walk to the park. We felt safe. We slept great! This hotel has a fun lounge feel to it. Not stuffy. We were taken care of immediately for early check in and they got us a car service for the airport ride. Would love to return here again!

Hi, I'm Ralph Ciaio form USA NYLO New York City this is hotel of newyork has best services and cleaning services id the best hotel i have no words to explain about this hotel but this is best hotel so I'm very enjoyed this hotel,
user_name:
Ralph C
New York City, New York

review_body: Amazing service and doorman. Very trendy vibe in lobby lounge and bar. Perfect location in upper west side cool neighborhood. King room was a bit small though. Shower could’ve been a bit nicer. Exposed brick in bedroom is fake. Overall great experience though.

We booked this hotel for the NYC triathlon and the location was super convenient, much moreso than the host hotel. The staff was all very friendly, but it was the bell hops that put it over the top. I was traveling with a newborn and George & Jose were super helpful upon our arrival and then another bellhop (name escapes me) loaded all of our luggage into our car for us. Just the best!

My third visit. Great location - near the water and a five minute walk to Central Park. I like the location as it's away from the tourist crowds. Subway is minutes away. Would recommend if you like the upper east side.

Wonderful gathering area for couples or large groups. Great vibe and music on select evenings. A pleasant surprise. Also, light menu available at the bar from adjoining restaurant with lots of great selections

깨끗하고 모든것이 너무 만족스러웠습니다. 위치가 타임스 스퀭어에서 먼것이 단점이지만. 아주아주 괜찮은 호텔입니다. I would love to stay again. everything was so great. Very friendly staff and room was clean. I don’t write reviews for hotel reviews but this time I wanted to.

NYC Tri,front desk while courteous did not communicate well and she said the room would be ready by 2 when I called the day before,did not get in until 3..room could have used more closet or drawer. Space

Great accommodations room size was very good for a boutique hotel. We were a part of a wedding block of rooms. Rooms were ready and waiting for us when we arrived. The staff was friendly helpful. The room rate was very reasonable perhaps it was because a part of reserved wedding rooms.

Went to NYC to celebrate my wife's birthday and stayed at the NYLO hotel. We have stayed there several times in the past and have never been disappointed. The NYLO is convenient to a subway station and Central Park and there are several very good restaurants nearby. Highly recommended.

Great value on the Upper West Side. Close to Central Park, Riverside Park and good restaurants. Rooms are in good shape and have enough room to navigate around your significant other. The bar in the lobby can be crowded and overflow into the lobby.

Such amazing service and WAY over delivers for value. Friendly staff, super comfy beds. Cool decor. You just won't find a hotel like this in NYC for this price. Lobby turns into a jazz bar/speakeasy at night which is cool if you want or you can just go up to your room.

We will think about staying there again next year. We hoped that the service would be better and amenities would work for athletes. Also the check in area when it come to parking or valet parking needs work. We asked for a fridge that took 2 hours

We always enjoy visiting the Upper Westside and staying at the NYLO. We are greeted by the friendliest people, especially Jessie, and our stay is always top notch. The location, location, location is prime and the NYLO is #1!

Room was not ready even well after 4PM, we were directed to use the elevator without a room key. We were trapped on the elevator trying to get to our friend's room n time to change for a wedding with buses leaving promptly at 5PM.

I loved staying at the NYLO! I've spent a lot of time in NY but I had never stayed in the Upper West Side. This time I had business on the UWS so stayed at the NYLO for convenience but ended up loving the hotel for its comfortable decor, great bar, wonderful location, and did I mention a terrace with a view of the Hudson River?! Amazing! I highly recommend the NYLO for anyone looking for a great room at a great price in a great location with a great view!

Very nice hotel in Great neighborhood - upper west side. I come for business for 5 days and always stay at NYLO if I can. Very nice staff, clean environment, upscale bathrooms, and nice lounge/bar. Rooms are not huge but I am more comfortable here than in a chain hotel. And the neighbor gives a nice local feel of New York.

The Nylo hotel is one of a kind. The rooms are very modern with extremely comfortable beds and beautiful bathrooms. The lobby area is very cozy and so well decorated. It provides a great atmosphere to work or read a book, as well as enjoy a cocktail at the bar. The staff were all very helpful and kind. I am looking forward to staying here again and would recommend to anyone!

A bit off the beaten path is the NYLO on the Upper West Side of Manhattan. Very cosmopolitan hotel and fabulous service. The rooms are very modern and even though on the small side (this is NYC of course) there is a lot of bang for your buck here. The roof top terrace is great. It's nice to have a cocktail at sunset and the view is great. The hotel is a short walk to Central Park. Cabs & car service is easy to get as well. Highly recommend and I'm a native New Yorker! My apartment was being painted and staying at the NYLO was a pleasure.

I had a wonderful stay at NYLO. I was traveling alone and felt very safe. My room was clean and staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to any one else.

Wonderful room. Great location, lots of restaurants near by. Helpful staff. Great breakfast, try the omelette. Room was small but fit my needs. Balcony view was beautiful Would definitely return and recommend

I've stayed at this hotel at least 5 times - I always find the rooms clean and quiet. Employees are always friendly and helpful. Great locale - close to Central Park, museums, subway and theaters. Can't wait for the next visit.

Good location. The staff were very friendly and nice. Air conditioning system was too loud. Bathroom was fully updated but needed a little more TLC and a towel bar for my hand towel. I would definitely stay there again.

I stayed overnight while my nearby apt was being dried out from a flood caused by my upstairs neighbor. Room was very small almost claustrophobic. The bedside outlet was broken and the coffeemaker didn’t work .Front desk clerk was rude and uncaring. Bathroom was very small also with an ugly stainless steel sink. For $450.00 they could at least seve coffee in the lobby and make sure the room is in immaculate condition

On this birthday occasion, and a repeat visit to the NYLO our initial accommodations request was not what we chose. Very quickly, Jose, who helped with our check in, and Christine , the Front Desk Manager, collaborated on an alternative plan.. After a period of discussion and options, we settled on an an acceptable accommodation. Our NyLO stay on the West Side was superb, as always.

I cant remember their names but all the staff were nice and accommodating...the rooms were nice and clean. I was on a trip with my school and flight got cancelled and they helped e with an additional room. Overall a great place ..again the front office was THE BEST!

The location is ideal. Convenient to Central Park and Riverside Park. Close to Natural History Museum. Easy subway ride to Times Square, but away from its hectic pace. Nice restaurant plus bar on premises. Staff is knowledgeable, friendly and helpful.

The NYLO is an exquisite boutique hotel in the Upper West Side. The Location is perfect on Broadway and 77th street with proximity to nice restaurants, museums and Central Park. The staff mades us feel so welcome, and gave the impression of really wanting to do their best to make our stay as memorable as possible... and they did succeed! One of the best, if not the best hotel experiences we've ever had. A really good hotel, with good location, a really good bar, and two good restaurants in the building, brilliant staff... and a room with a view! 11 out of 10. Thank you NYLO and special thanks to Ramona in the Front Office! We will definitely be back!

Thank You NYLO, always feeling great , feeling like home and this after all this years. Everything is perfect , no one hesitated to help you immediately. It is always a big pleasure to stay at the NYLO. See you next year , promised . This awesome View is Unbelievable , priceless .Special Thanks To the doormen George and Orlando

Chic, modern, stylish and very welcoming. I demand high standards and then NYLO perfectly suits my expectations. Everything I wanted in a jet-set hotel and maybe a little extra. I chose this hotel due to its proximity to the Beacon Theatre and wa more than happy with everything about my stay. I will return when I’m back in the neighborhood.

The UWS brought back memories. Lived on W.87th between West End and Riverside during our first yr. of marital bliss!Took this hotel because Travelzoo had a special for May 31st. Base price was $169...by the time we finished booking it came to $233.We arrived early and Ramona asked if an interior room would be OK for one night. I stupidly said YES. While it wasn't claustrophobic.....we looked out to a brick wall.The size of the room was smaller than stated.....but it was clean and the location was great and so was the front desk staff.We had a complimentary drink at the bar......and wandered.......the following AM meeting brother and wife at their digs on E.55th and 2nd.We DID have dinner at LAND on Amsterdam and 81st. YUM.Would return if the price was right.

As a frequent guest of NYLO NYC due to its location, I can recommend this hotel with one caveat. I will not again stay in a room facing a brick wall. While it is quieter than a street facing location, I found it impossibly claustrophobic. The beds are super comfy and the loft-feel of the space is pleasing. In room coffee is a big plus!

Everything about the NYLO is top shelf. We visit NYC every two months and this is our go-to hotel. The staff is exceptional and always helpful, the beds are the BEST and the hotel is convenient to transportation, museums, Central Park and a wonderful array of restaurants.

My wife and I stayed here for one night last night and really liked the place! The lobby bar was very good with a street view from inside. Got a voucher for a free drink which started a pleasant evening . Staff was very good and friendly both at check in and the bar. We had breakfast in the restaurant attached to the hotel and found it very good too

Pet fee excessive! We take care and train well our family.Very noisy neighbor in nearby rooms slamming doors and loud conversation at 1:30 am two nights consecutive .Cleaning staff provided less face and was clothes on day two of stay

Had to find a decent location to stay in NY for multiple days on a budget. This hotel was very nice and had a reasonable room rate, particularly for NY. Great location and very nice staff. Would recommend to anyone who may be visiting NY for business or pleasure.

We loved staying at NYLO NYC! The room was clean, staff friendly, and the perfect place to hang out after a long day sightseeing. The location was perfect as well! Near great places to eat and so close to the Park. We’ll be back.

The room was clean and comfortable. the bed was Great! the local was perfect. lots of choices easy to get to. the area was safe and beautiful. I felt very comfortable walking around day or night. The UWS has a great vibe!

Our recent two night stay at NYLO was disappointing. I selected the hotel based upon other traveler reviews. We arrived early, our luggage was stowed and we were told that we would receive a call when the room was ready. No call was received while we were out and about during the day. We returned to the hotel mid-afternoon and hung out in the lobby. We followed up shortly before the official 4pm check in and were informed that the room that we were assigned to was not ready but we could take another room - so we did. Our room did not have consistent hot water - nor did we have consistent warm water - so showering was quick. Our room was not serviced on the second say so we had to request service. Staff members were pleasant and cheerful but the front desk staff lacked follow through. I would not refer to this as a quiet hotel - the lobby bar was busy and boisterous with a large opening to the street-fun atmosphere but I would not describe it as quiet. Bottom line, we will not stay here again. There are other options and this venue was not worth the cost nor the hassle factor.

Amazing staff, everyone is helpful and genuinely happy to help. In particular Orlando and George were helpful and kind to my family and always had a smile. The location can't be beat and the rooms are very nice and comfortable.

Overall the Nylo was a good place to stay in New York. We were close to everything we wanted to do and see. Hotel staff were friendly and welcoming. Always happy to give advise on the best ways to get around the city.

Everything was smoothly run and very clean at this hotel. It was in a great location, easy walk to everything including Central Park, the subway and even good restaurants. This was a great and quiet hotel with friendly staff.

This most recent stay with my husband was a combination of business and catching up with neighborhood friends (since we are former UWS-ers and typically enjoy our return visits). Unfortuntely, my husband ended up getting quite ill on the day we were supposed to leave (unrelated to the hotel). When I informed the front desk staff of this, Ramona quickly and efficiently reviewed all of the possible options with me, and managed a way for us to extend our time despite the hotel being busy. Overall, the rooms are clean and comfortable; we found all of the staff to be genuinely friendly with personable greetings and helpful with luggage, housekeeping requests, etc. Beyond this and as decribed, we were especially appreciative of Ramona's understanding of our travel glitch, which I consider to be a permanent 5++ star rating.

Wonderful boutique hotel on the upper westside. Great location, nicely appointed rooms on the smaller side, but very comfortable nonetheless. Terrific lobby with a welcoming bar and lots of comfortable seating areas. Ben, one of the friendly bartenders, was great fun and gave us spot on recommendations for places to eat in the area. Front desk staff was attentive and personable and genuinely seemed to care about your comfort and any needs you might have. This is a lovely, reasonably priced (for NYC) hotel that we look forward to returning to.

Like typical NYC hotels the rooms are small, and the deco at the Nylo is quite contemporary, stainless steal sink, sleek furniture, no carpet or rugs even in the main areas. The staff is very friendly, and I loved the easy access to the subway, shopping, and Central Park. We would return.

Really enjoyed the NYLO hotel. Great staff, fun bar area and awesome location with easy access to Central Park and the subway. Markets like Trader Joe's, Fairway and Citarella are also close by as are some fun restaurants on Amsterdam Ave.

Tiny Rooms but good patios. Ask for a room with a patio if you want the tiny room to feel a bit bigger and want some lounging time in your room. Otherwise the room is for sleeping, showering and changing only.

My friends and I come to NYC 2 to 3 times a year. We always stay at different hotels in the city but this time we decided to stay at Nylo in Upper West Side. We really enjoyed this hotel and the neighborhood especially for it’s close proximity to everything yet away from all the touristy spots. Everyone at the hotel were nice especially Orlando the doorman. I noticed while waiting for our ride how attentive he was to all guests that came in unlike other hotels we have stayed at. Great customer experience starts at the door of an establishment. I believe the Nylo will be our go to hotel moving forward.

This hotel was well-located, friendly, and well-cared for. The staff was attentive and professional. Having a restaurant on-site was very convenient. It has a large lobby and bar area on the ground floor which made relaxing in between trips out into the city convenient and comfortable.
user_name:
Christina L
Saratoga Springs, New York

review_body: It’s quiet, clean, comfortable, very well located, with comfortable, very functional public areas and is an excellent value. Staff is welcoming, helpful and friendly. We moved from substandard accommodations at a different location at 9:00 in the morning. The front desk people immediately found us a room and were a delight to work with. We have reservations to return in the fall.

Great hotel in a great location. The staff are amazing, the food is very good and the beds are the most comfortable that I have ever slept on in a hotel. Central to all that New York City has to offer and only a few blocks from Central Park.

Great hotel, perfect location for exploring New York. Not too far from the subway station and about a 10 minute walk from Central Park. The bar downstairs was really nice and modern, it seemed busy in the evenings. We had a free drink on arrival. Couldn’t fault the rooms, really comfy beds.
user_name:
KateB717
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Clean, spacious king size bedroom was perfect and great size for somewhere in NYC. Enjoyed my stay throughout. You won’t be dissapointed staying here. Lovely staff and a big thanks to the doorman for helping us make our way to the airport super quick after our shuttle being delayed, helpful staff are memorable and made me like the hotel even more! I will be staying here again.

We stayed at this hotel a couple of years ago during our last visit to NYC, and we liked it so much that we decided to stay here again on a recent trip--and we liked it even more this time around. The location is hard to beat if you want to visit museums and Central Park. Transit stops and good restaurants are practically right out the door (in fact, the hotel has a nice bar and two good restaurants on the premises). The hotel staff is friendly and helpful, and the room we stayed in (a corner room) was large enough and appointed simply and comfortably, given that we didn't spend a lot of time in it. We'd definitely come back for a third stay.

As a local, I hit up LOKL for the first time last night with a friend. We had a great time, and our server, Christopher, was very nice and attentive. The ambience was great, it's an elegant, comfortable design, and the food (from Serafina, next door) was delicious. However, we were SHOCKED that we were given cheap plastic utensils. It was pretty hard to eat chicken skewers with plastic. It also takes away a great deal from the overall impression. I think it's time for management to step it up and invest in some real silverware!
user_name:
mjlissandrello
New York City, New York

review_body: Room was very clean and updated. Beds were comfortable as well. Great locatiom with CVS just across the street with many restaurants and shops nearby as well. Would definitely stay here again given location, accomodation and value.

The hotel was very nice and in good location. Had a faff checking in as they couldn’t find a room even with booking 8 weeks in advance. Eventually got checked in, room is cramped but practical, bed very comfy and good shower. Bar downstairs was lively but expensive. Central Park and natural history museum with 10 mins. Subway within 5.

Though the lobby was unique and inviting, the room itself was just ok. It was very small and the bathroom was so tiny it was difficult to move around in. Additionally, everything needed a deep clean as it felt grungy. On the plus side, the bed was very comfortable and the A/C kept the room nice and cold. All in all, if you don't plan to spend too much time in your room this hotel will do the trick.

I love NYLO New York. Friendly staff. Great lobby. Great bar. Great location on the UWS. Comfy rooms and comfy beds. I especially love Ramona who year after year treats our group well and makes sure we have a comfortable stay. Would highly recommend.
user_name:
jberaha
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel services were amazing. The front desk was very accommodating and the valet/Bell man were so helpful. The room is tiny for the price and location in my opinion. The do have a roof top lounge that you can hang out on which is nice! They offer valet parking but it is expensive.

Great place to stay in NYC! Cozy lounge with fun contemporary room decor. Especially nice because it is so different than your standard cookie-cutter chain hotel. Wonderful staff. Nice neighborhood and conveniently located. Because it is NYC, the room rate is more than I am used to (!), but comparable to other places in the city and a better value than some, so it was fine.Highly recommend!

The location of NYLO is an easy walk to two subway stations as well as to the Natural History Museum and Central Park. The room was decorated sparsely, but with a good eye to FUN. Decent water pressure and comfy bed.

I booked the room using Hotels Tonight. It was a small but comfortable room. My only complaint was a design flaw in the bathroom. There were no towel racks, therefore no place to hang your wet towel after a shower. I ended up hanging it up in the closet.If you have to be on the Upper West Side this is a great location with easy access to restaurants, bars, subways and buses. We did not drink in the bar downstairs but the sitting area was decorated like a library with comfortable seating while waiting for friends.

Lax SecurityThe hotel requires swiping of your key to select a destination floor on the elevator.I went out of my room on the 14th floor at 10PM to get ice and saw a man by elevator with no identification, an unmarked padded delivery box, on his cell phone trying to find a room. I asked him what he was doing (in English and tried Spanish) with no response and no idea why he was on our floor.I called security and asked what happened. They told me the person was from restaurant that is NOT owned by hotel and they had an override key. That does not explain why they let someone one without ID, without parking on delivery, not knowing room number, and not being able to respond to simple question in English (The security told me they "don't discriminate"--thats fine but they need to have some ID).I brought this to attend to manager on duty who said that they would talk to restaurant bu NYLO was not responsible-- I pointed out it was their hotel and their elevator--and even I couldnt get up without proper access.I brought up to day manager again with no credible response.This is a serious security concern that would give me pause to ever stay there again

I booked a room for 5 days, on booking.com, the price was really good for what the hotel offerd, but at the check out we were charged a small fortune called "urban taxes" was tottaly unespected,..So when you add this uban fee the price gets really higher for what the hotel offers.

noisy air conditioning machine, no frigo bar. Socket in the bathroom not working properly. Taxi service: we were offered a taxi service 70 usd flat fee including tip and taxes, the driver asked for 80 (maybe due to traffic jam, but we received no explanation and it was not what we were told).

We had to book NYLO at the last minute after our other hotel had no elevator service! I was in NYC on business and on a tight schedule, so we were very grateful for being able to book and arrive within an hour. The front desk was very nice - we were also glad to be upgraded to a King room, which was very roomy and faced the interior of the hotel (less noise) (07 room). This is a boutique hotel and the rooms are not standard hotel furnishings -- kind of industrial styling. The bed was very comfy and quite high off the ground (just warning shorter folks). The bathroom, while not huge, was well laid out and we loved the walk in shower. Full size closet, etc., Like a lot of NY hotels, they charge an additional "amenities fee" -- they told us that up front so we didn't feel misled. The bar is nice and the terrace room with couches, games was lovely (altho it seems to be used for private events sometimes, it was open most of the time we were there). The wifi was excellent. We would most definitely stay there again. There is room for some small improvements -- frankly, our interaction with the reservation number was poor -- the agent was really, really slow, could not ever get our names/info right, and I'd really recommend booking on the web. While the housecleaning was good, it did not clean the rooms until pretty late (in one case after 330) and we gave up asking and just got towels. Later that evening, I got a pop-up on my computer asking about the service -- i answered honestly about the cleaning snafu and got an immediate phone call from the front desk. They asked when they could come to clean the room the next day - and it was done a little earlier that day. After we left, I used the chat to request a soft copy of my bill. Never got it. So I would say the virtual parts of NYLO need a little bit of improvement. But the service at the "real" hotel is quite good, the location is fantastic, and we thought it was a fun place to stay.

The hotel is located close to the Central Park with a safe surrounding. The room was small but enough for a short trip - especially the roof top was very nice! The employees were very kind and helpful. We enjoyed our stay there - I would book this hotel again!

For the price, I was expecting something to be bad—the size, the bathroom, something. But no, we had a good sized room, very nice bathroom, comfortable bed, not too noisy, secure, and great location. Zabar’s deli within two blocks. Subway and bus stops within two blocks.

Very low value for the money, extremely dark lobby, not inviting, very small rooms even for New York City standards, below average service ... positive point, Upper West Side location, no charge fast internet & maid service

This was my second stay at the NYLO when visiting Columbia for academic meetings. I was so impressed the first time that I didn't even consider staying elsewhere for this trip. It's very conveniently located near the subway (1, 2 & 3 lines) and surrounded by enough places to eat and shop that you need not go downtown if your schedule doesn't allow (mine didn't ). The staff are very pleasant and the rooms are very clean. I had some noise from the room next door at 4:30 am one time, but otherwise it was quite quiet.

Tip, do not get the small room. Okay for a man but not enough room in the bathroom to spread out. Last time, we got the smaller room and wife was not happy. We didn't need the room cleaned but did ask for fresh towels each day and they were fine with that.

This hidden gem on the Upper West Side is always my choice when visiting NYC! A great location, close to Museum of Natural History, Central Park, and Subway. It has that warm neighbourhood feel and is away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square, but it's easy to get there on the express Subway in about 5 minutes. All of the hotel staff are amazing and helpful. You are greeted by friendly doormen that make a wonderful first impression upon your arrival. Orlando, Alberto and Lenny are our favourite doorman, the best in the city! They are so professional and always greet you with a smile, they offer assistance and information to make your stay more enjoyable. Front desk staff, such as Vivic, Carlos, Jennifer, Ramona, Jessie, Eloy and Tasha go out of their way to accommodate their guests needs. Maggie the front desk supervisor, and the behind the scenes staff like Johanna and Rose are wonderful too. We've stayed at this hotel many, many times and everyone is treated like a special guest and made to feel right at home at the NYLO. The bellmen, Eduardo, George, Bobby and Danny are always available to assist with luggage and any other requests you might have. The NYLO has a sophisticated and comfy lobby and bar, an overhead garage-like door opens up to the street and lets the sights and sounds of the city in, a great vibe! The bartenders Ben, Chris and Henry treat their guests right, they add an element of fun when visiting the NYLO lobby bar. I have to give a shout-out to Meria in housekeeping who always takes good care of me and does an amazing job on my room. I really can't say enough about the NYLO, you won't be disappointed!

NYLO's lobby feels upbeat and the rooms, though small, are comfortable and fairly well lit. (It's always nice to have the option of more light, even if you choose not to use it.) It's a great jumping-off spot for anywhere on the Upper West Side. Staff were friendly, and the rooms were kept clean. We'll go back.

Can’t say enough about this hotel from check in to check out! This classy hotel has a great vibe. The rooms were well equipped with luxurious bedding. Add in its great location in a beautiful quiet neighborhood and you have a win! Would highly recommend!

Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms immaculate. Beds comfortable. Plenty of room. Security was very efficient. Food in Serafina restaurant adjoining the hotel was wonderful, and service was quick but not rushed.

This is our 2nd time staying at NYLO. It's not cheap, but relative to other hotels in the area, it's reasonable for what you get. The rooms are larger than most hotels, comfortable and the hotel is in a great location.

Excellent service. Housekeepers nice, friendly, and attentive. Nice to be on the Upper West Side. Room clean and well kept; sleek modern look. Good launching point for nearby restaurants, shops at Columbus Circle, and near to subway.

Nylon was a great hotel with funky fun, modern rooms. Our room was a bit small, but fine for our trip. It fronted Broadway and had a view of the Hudson. Front desk service and bartenders were great. My biggest complaint is the “City Fee” snuck in at checkout. $31.00 per day! Plus taxes, adds up to a hefty sum at the end of a fairly expensive trip to start. Just be aware of this change even if booked through Travelocity or Tripadviser. Otherwise a great location with restaurants and subways nearby.

This is an amazing hotel to stay in when in NYC. Our room was wonderful and had a view of the Hudson River. Service and staff are excellent as well.Special thanks to Jessie, she went over and above to make this a special anniversary/birthday trip.Thanks Jessie!

A very clean establishment and very friendly. This location is in the middle of anything you need, shopping restaurants and walking distance to central park! Amazing location. You can walk to just anywhere

I was expecting a much more modern room, I think that there are rooms that have been renovated and rooms that have not. The quality of the room was just average, very tiny bathroom and tiny room for 2 people. The location of the hotel is very good though, in 10 minutes of subway you're in the center of Manhattan.

For the past 4 years, I have been a regular guest at NYLO NYC on Manhattan's fabulous Upper West Side (a neighbourhood all too many people visiting NYC miss). I immediately fell in love with this hotel. I grew in New York City and don’t really like staying in hotels when I’m here, but NYLO is not just any hotel: it has a classy yet low-key feel.
