I feel entirely at home here and enjoy their TLC. I would in particular like to give kudos to the amazing staff, which always treats you not only with professionalism, but with kindness and care. They listen. The front desk is run by many wonderful human beings. Last time I stayed at NYLO NYC my father had just died. After taking care of him for five years, I was a little worse for wear. Because I was stressed before booking my trip to NYC, I had two different reservations at NYLO NYC, for two different rooms. The hotel was jam-packed, but I called ahead to see if maybe they could manage to keep me in the same room for my entire stay. Ramona, one of the stars of the front desk, told me that it would be difficult, but lo and behold, when I arrived at NYLO from Europe that evening, Ramona had pulled out all the stops, juggled things around and managed to accommodate me. I couldn’t have been more grateful. She truly outdid herself, and to boot, she is very sweet. During this stay, my daughter joined me at NYLO for the night of her 21st birthday. I had mentioned this to Jessie at the front desk, and when we arrived in my room late that afternoon, there was a bottle of wine, two glasses and wonderful artisanal chocolates waiting to greet us – with a lovely note from Jessie and her colleagues. I should add that Jessie has assisted me with various issues over the years, not the least keeping me in the same room when I’ve extended my stays. She is a true gem, and very warm. Other wonderful, supremely helpful and friendly members of the front desk are Carlos, Amado and Eloy. They have never greeted me with anything but a smile and a can-do attitude. I would also like to give a shout out to Rosa Carr in reservations, another genuinely helpful staff member who has solved many reservation snafus for me, and to the marvellous Mira, the finest hotel housekeeper I have ever met. Diligent and warm. Now to the rooms… Of course I love the rooms at NYLO NYC or I would not stay here, fabulous staff notwithstanding. I especially enjoy of the rooms facing Broadway, but all the rooms I have stayed in have been light and airy, with a fresh, modern, playful design – and they are always clean. I like their unencumbered feeling. And the beds are heaven! I sleep like a baby here. And I am thrilled that the bathrooms include hand-held shower heads, which is often not the case in NYC. Also, whenever I need a fridge – which is always – I ask for one, and the front desk sends it up right away. I am also perpetually asking for extra hangers, which are always promptly supplied. Not to be forgotten, the lobby is very nice and having a bar on site is convenient. Don’t forget to have a drink on the terrace bar on the 16th floor! I have moved back to NYC now and will likely not be staying at NYLO as often as before, but I know I will book a room once in a while when I need an especially restful staycation. And of course I recommend NYLO NYC to everyone visiting NYC! Thank you to all at NYLO NYC for always making me feel comfortable and welcome. Pina (Helena) Nilson

This was probably the 8th time we stayed at the NYLO. This alone should say enough!Great location, modern homey hotel, excellent service. Near great shops, near subway, restaurants, Central Park. Not cheap but few hotels of this standard in Manhattan are ...

Very nice Upper West Side hotel. Great location and helpful, vWarm staff and cozy lobby. Rooms are modern, but a bit cold in feeling. Floors are fake wood and not carpeted. Bed was very comfortable and clean.

No dressers or fridge in room. Little for my teen age kids to do in the hotel. Placed nicely on the upper west side of Manhattan near central park and Museum of Natural History. Hip bar and lounge but in NYC style expensive and on Fri night standing room only. the double queen suite was spacious and comfortable and priced well at least before the NYS and NYC taxes $400+ for four nights. always felt safe and welcome.

I loved our stay at NYLO. The location is quiet, still in the city but the upper West side, only 2 blocks from the nearest subway and right across from a CVS. The staff was so nice and the room was spacious. The bed was SO comfy. I love the artsy feel of the building and lobby. I would definitely stay here again.

Perfect location for seeing a show in the theater district! Cool atmosphere including the lounge and bar. They gave us 2 free drinks which was nice. Staff was friendly and service was good when we needed it. The room was nice, nothing fancy. Modern but kind of cheaper furniture/decorations. Room was clean, nice cold air conditioning, comfy bed and nice shower, and it was quiet so we were happy! I'd stay again!

If you like a big and very nice Hotel on Broadway this is your Hotel. Great rooms with superb beds and very quite rooms. Great coffee in the rooms and a safe. this was my second time and I'm coming back!

Boutique style hotel, great location, great service. Rooms are on the smaller side but they are clean. No room service. Bar in the lobby.Good atmosphere, will definitely stay here again loved the area!

Poor quality staff. Very unavailable. Nobody at the front desk when arrived to check in. Nobody answers the phone when i called. When i finally did see front desk worker, she was very rude and uninterested in my problem.

I found the hotel through Booking.Com and chose to stay there primarily because of its location. It proved to be excellent choice from the quality of the front desk staff, who sorted out a booking problem created by a technical problem act the hotel, with the minimum of fuss, through the quality of the room , especially the duck and high speed wi fi which was essential for my work, this is an excellent hotel for the business traveler.

We go to NYC several times a year, to visit our children, and the NYLO is, truly, our home away from home when we go. We've become familiar with so many of the staff over the years, and have special shout-outs to Lenny, a doorman who is always eager to help us with luggage, strollers, and getting a cab, and Carlos at the front desk, who always welcomes us back with a happy smile and the best room he can find for us. The others at the front desk are also wonderful and welcoming, but I don't know their names.

Check-in staff was friendly and very accommodating. The door men and valet were beyond helpful as we shuffled family from event to event. The bar is divided into three nice sections so you can find the spot that works best for your group. Rooms are very nice, modern decor but are NYC small-ish, so it is worth it to upgrade to larger room if you have a group.

I liked being out of the hustle and bustle. My only complaint - if I arrive at 1PM don't charge me $50 for an early checkin if the room is available before 4. You don’t refund me for leaving at 630am.

I wouldn't stay at NYLO again. My friend and I were looking for a higher end boutique hotel on the Upper West or Upper East, to enjoy a few days in Manhattan for a girls' trip. This hotel had high ratings and the location is good, so we thought we'd give it a go. At the check-in desk, I was simply handed my key by the front desk attendant. There was no description of any amenities (wifi, fitness center, etc), and no offer to provide a map of the area or suggest a dinner destination. It felt strange to just be handed a key and pointed to the elevators, at a hotel of this type. The first thing I noticed when I entered the standard king-size room was how tiny it was. There's very little room between the bed and the walls, and no armchair or sitting area at all (other than a small desk). I was also very disappointed by the windows - two small windows looked out directly to a plain grey wall about 5-10 feet away. Absolutely nothing else visible, and almost no natural light could make its way into the room. What's more, the windows were covered in pigeon crap. Needless to say, we kept our curtains drawn for the duration of our stay. Another thing I have to mention is the housekeeping staff - first, I left a generous tip the first day of our stay, next to a note politely requesting a few more towels be left in the room (there were two of us staying, and only two body towels were provided when we arrived in the room). Unfortunately, when I came back to the room later that day, there was only one additional towel left for us. I just found that frustrating when I had tipped and requested a FEW more. The second problem we had with housekeeping was their habit of banging on our door BEFORE 9AM to clean the room. I don't know why that would be the standard time to begin room cleaning, it seems earlier than you could expect people to be gone for the day. Should I have to hang the "do not disturb" sign on my door in order to not be violently woken up at 8:30 a.m.? Finally, I have to mention a cleanliness/health concern - on the last day of our visit I noticed there were gross little bugs in multiple places in the bathroom. I've included photos. This is obviously a problem that NYLO should work to remedy. All told, our room was $300+ with fees per night, and I expect more for that price than what we got. Won't return.

Great location, close to the Metro stations, Central Park and Natural History Museum. Lots of good restaurants and shops in the area. The room is very quiet and spacious. Hot water failed on our last morning stay. But they looked after the fixed the issue in a timely manner. Overall great stay!

We checked into the Nylo and were put into a very small and sterile room. The decor wasn't very friendly and we were next to the elevator - which was a bit loud. Luckily, after asking to switch, they managed to find us a new room which was MUCH better, roomier, more distance from the bed to the washroom and also, it had more charm to it - with exposed brick. So, if you can request a larger room, or pay for the upgraded room, it's well worth it.We were a bit worried about the noise, as it's loft-y and you can hear door closing and sirens outside, however, we were pleasantly surprised to have a peaceful night of sleep where we didn't hear any outside noise!The location is good, it's about 35 minutes walking to get to Times Square and there is a lot of shopping close by.

Great Upper West Side experience.Staff team were excellent, particularly Ramona on the front desk who was SO helpful when I left my credit card in a yellow cab.Great hotel, great location and phenomenal service! I will stay here again!

Nearby everything needed. Beautiful room. Bar, restaurant and drugstore nearby. Staff available but not intrusive. Residential neighborhood. Near Central Park. Able to get room away from noise........

Forget Midtown/Times Square/East Side hotels. Stay a couple blocks from Central Park in a residential neighborhood with great restaurants and shops. Two blocks and you're on the subway. Loved the access to the park and the Met. Lincoln Center was steps away as was a whole host of shops, grocery stores, and coffee. Quiet neighborhood which makes you feel like you're part of NYC rather than just and observer.

This hotel is in a great location on the Upper West Side. It close to the subway, Central Park, many restaurants, shopping. The rooms are modern and decent sized for NYC. There’s a nice bar in rhe lobby .

My husband and I have stayed in quite different locations every time we went to NYC, so this was our first in Upper West Side. Service was great: guys on the desk were always nice since the moment we checked in until providing us with a transfer to JFK. The room and bathroom are of regular size, considering local standards. Hotel bar was nice, but nothing you would feel like going back to. We were a bit disappointed with the hotel restaurant, Seraphina: we had dinner there on a Sunday evening after a long day on the road and the food was just ok. There are so many options in the area one should venture out.

Will stay here from now on, when in NYC.The staff was perfect! Very polite! They made our stay comfortable and were very helpful with anything and everything. Housekeeping was also incredible and made our room up every day and were very polite as well.

This is my second time at NYLO.Excellent neighborhood. Regular rooms, silent, clean and comfortable.Subway 2 blocks away.Great offer of restaurants in a 2 blocks radium.Probability to be there a third time is 100%It’s a good deal

Amazing service from Jesse at the front desk. Amazing bar with welcome drinks and because it was my wife’s bday Jesse gave us each another drink ticket for a cocktail AND a bottle of wine was waiting for us in our room! Great job all around and perfect location.

A great location on the west side of New York. The staff were great and friendly ,they couldnot do enough for us. The room was great and our 2 dogs were comfortable. It waqs easy to park our car and cabs from the hotel.

Good/OK hotel with a great location but the late check-in time makes it completely unworthy for short trips. My flight landed at 7AM and I was expecting at most check-in at noon or 1PM, but their check-in isn't until 4PM, that's more than half the day wasted waiting around for a shower and some down time after a long trip.

I was having renovations in my apartment and I had to check in early that morning. The room was ready and the staff was aware and kind. The room was great for me and my dog. The hotel has interesting lobby area with lounge that extends out to the sidewalk.
user_name:
Altontoby
New York City, New York

review_body: Nylo is a great place to stay for the price. It has its flaws but very minimal. I enjoyed the area and rooms weren’t bad. I didn’t like that the curtains didn’t go fully all the way down and I was not a fan of the magnetic locker drawers.

We absolutely loved this hotel. We had a minor issue but it was resolved quickly by the hotel staff. Very quiet. Just a block from the subway. Streets and sidewalks around the hotel were very clean. Highly recommend.

Excellent service cela. Beautiful rooms . Mattress are super comfy and spacious . Bathroom is huge and very neatThe only problem that I had was extra charges for no reason after I have paid the reservation in advance, when I appeal the charges , they said “ late fees” . Did not understood

Wonderful staff, great location and lovely rooms!The bed was especially comfortable - I don't usually sleep well away from home, but I slept great here.We walked to the Met, Central Park and great restaurants - a truly special place :)

I love everything about this property. From its Upper West Side location (close to multiple subway stops and Central Park) to the funky decor and awesome lobby bar, NYLO provides great value and service.

The lobby was very nice. The room was super clean and very safe. The room style is minimalist, so it may not feel like a luxury hotel, but we had everything we needed. The staff is excellent and spoke English and Spanish fluently, and probably several other languages

Though the location of this hotel is ideal for the Upper West Side, the front desk operations are so inefficient, it almost is not worth the hassle of staying here. In the few times I've stayed here over the last month, the room is never ready by 4pm. Their is always a queue at the front desk that is at least 25 minutes. And most of it is because the two people working there are inefficient and slow. Check out is another process that requires you to wait in the 25 min line again only to be berated by the front desk.

We had such a great time at NYLO!! The location is great and the hotel's bar (and the free welcome drinks we got) was super cute and fun!! We will definitely stay here again when we come back to NYC!!

Staff was very friendly and easy to communicate with. They worked to get our family rooms adjacent and for the best price. Hotel bar was comfortable and well used. The complimentary prosecco was a very nice touch. A down side was the elevators. They were either out of service or too crowded... that might certainly be improved. Overall, though, would stay there again.

This is my second visit to NYLO and I love it. It is ideally situated and convenient to public transportation as well and Central Park, the museum and the New York Historical Society. The staff is extremely helpful and knowledgeable.

We stayed in the NYLO, and from the minute we entered the hotel, we loved it. The staff were so friendly and helpful, the first room we got did not have enough closet space for 4 ladies, immediately we were given more hangers then we got moved to a larger room with a large closet. The rooms were of a good size and spotless, with everything you need in them. One hotel worker George really stood out to us, he was friendly and nothing a trouble to him. I would definitely recommend NYLO if you want the upper west side, I'll definitely be staying againLorraine, Liverpool England

Cheap and not cheerful , rooms dark, AC unit goes off like a bomb. Bathroom very sparse.Lobby dirty, dark and noisy. Doors slamming all night. Coffee in the room is terrible, plastic cups in the bathroom like a motel.

There is nothing like the majic and atmosphere of staying in this best kept secret of the upper West Side. May Ann and Christopher have many blessed years of success for helping to create an inclusive, warm and hospitable environment that emotes the Positivity and Shenanigans of NYC at night!!! These two are an integral part of the NYLO experience. Say hello to them at the bar and Cheers from me. God Bless.

Nylo dream vacay in New York disappointment! Manager uses coworker as scapegoat, when she’s to blame and tries to ruin our picnic on balcony. Very embarrassing, because we had guests for the day with us.

We checked in on Saturday night. There was confusion with our reservation and Vivek went above and beyond to help us out! He expended tremendous effort to not only accommodate our space needs, but exceeded our expectations! Great hotel, great location and phenomenal service! We will stay here again!

Fantastic location on the Upper West Side near Central Park. The room was great and the beds were incredibly comfortable. The staff were all gracious and helpful. We easily walked to restaurants, coffee, yoga studio, and soul cycle. Will stay at nylo again!

A boutique hotel with friendly staff and a quiet but convenient location. The glass of prosecco to welcome us was an extra nice touch. The room was spacious for a nyc hotel. Two small suggestions: towel bars in the roomy bathroom would be much appreciated and the window was so filthy we truly couldn’t see the weather outside. We will stay here again. Great value!

We loved the location, within walking distance of Central Park, and the design of the room and lobby. The bed was enormous and very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was a bit stuffy and we would have liked to have had a fridge in the room. Internet access dropped out at times.

We were in the city recently and because of events wanted to be in the Upper West Side. Another hotel recommended this one when they were full and we were delighted with the experience. A fun and welcoming lobby, great treatment by staff, and a spacious room and especially the bathroom. We will stay there again for sure.

Really enjoyed this hotel while in NYC for a long weekend. Great tucked away location in the Upper West Side but conveniently located close to the subway and Central Park. Only negatives are 1)the air vent in the room was extremely loud- I’d recommend bringing ear plugs if you’re a light sleeper and 2) the shower water pressure is less than great. Overall good hotel with a cool vibe- would stay again!

We had a great experience at the NYLO Hotel.Staff were courteous, helpful &efficient.A shout out to Danny & Teddy.Both were excellent.I wish we would’ve gotten the same if one of the bartenders.He was always friendly & resourceful.The beds were super comfortable & the rooms were dark & quiet at night.Our room was cleaned promptly.Thank you for everything!We’ll stay here again.This hotel is convenient to everything!

The NYLO has proven to be the BEST hotel on the Upper West Side of NYC. The property is well located near great restaurants and transportation lines. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Maggie Zambrano is a gem!!

FYI I’m a hotel snob.... This is a clean hotel with great staff. I actually slept very well in my bed which I do not usually do while traveling...The restaurant is a bit pricey, but convenient with good food...Needless to say the location is perfect pending why you are in NY, but hailing taxis and obtaining ride share services were seamless. In general I don’t take the subway.

Perfect NYC spot to stay. A respite from all the busyness and sounds of midtown but accessible to everything Manhattan has to offer. You’ll fall in love with the West Side and see why so many call it home.

We booked here because the wedding we were attending had a block of rooms. We asked for early check in so we could get ready for the wedding. Upon arrival, there was no valet in site to park the car, the front desk staff was rude and said no rooms were available, yet checked others in after us and gave them rooms. They had no information on the wedding even though there was a bus taking guests to the event. The elevators were out of service, the hallways are dark and dreary, the room décor is like dorm room furniture (although the bed was comfy). I assume the price tag was due to the location, but I have stayed in much nicer hotels in NYC for less than the cost of this room. While we were waiting for a room, another guest was complaining about being treated poorly on the roof deck and threatened by staff. The previous day guests were stuck in the elevator for 1/2 hour. From what guests were saying, the hotel appears to be in the process of being sold so the staff is in disarray. The only helpful staff person was the valet, who tried to help us get transportation to the event since the front desk gave us the wrong time to meet the bus so they left without us! There are much nicer hotels in NYC for less cost - save your money and try another hotel!

This hotel is close to everything in UWS in charming NY neighborhood. The staff was attentive and friendly. Fabulous lounge for relaxing in the evening. Rooms were clean and attractively furnished. Would recommend.

Like Vegas, NYC hotels have begun the custom of pumping perfume into the common areas. If you have any sensitivities to scents don’t stay here. Don’t even visit. The wave of scent hits you when you walk through the doors and then your clothes wreak of this for the remainder of your stay.

Let’s start saying that this is a 4 stars hotel. Booked a Broadway View Deluxe King room 4 months in advance and my fiancé and I were put in a room without the Broadway view. The reception said that there was no guarantee as to the availability of the room with a view (incredible). I went with my fiancé and upon check in the reception didn’t ask for her information. After 4 days going back and forth in the hotel, my fiancé arrived at the hotel after a long business day and asked for a new access key and the reception denied saying that I would have to authorize (I don’t recall a hotel that don’t keep record of their guests appropriately). She was only given news keys after crying and providing my personal information (nice way to end a business day). The funny thing is that moments ago the reception handed her a package without asking for her ID. As it was a business trip, I booked one extra night so we could arrive early in the morning in the hotel directly from the airport without having to ask for an early check in and wait for a room, even though we had to wait for my room to be cleaned. The receptionist reacted arrogantly when I asked how long it would take. The rooms - even those of a superior level like mine - don’t have mini bar (4 stars hotel?). No one helped with the luggage when we got to the hotel. Besides that, the hotel is well located and has a good restaurant on the ground level. The cleaning staff and the concierge are very polite. Would never return or recommend. The hotel only seems to be cool and nice, but it is definitely not.

When one is paying an average of 500 dollars for a room, I feel one is entitled to expect a few little extras to enhance the basic levels of comfort one might expect in a cheaper hotel. Fluffy bathrobes, piles of lovely clean towels, a mini-bar or fridge, space for an armchair and a decent-sized desk--all these do wonders for one's overall perception of the hotel. None of these were available to us; we had to ask for extra towels, there were no bathrobes, no fridge, a tiny desk with an office chair and so little space that we were constatntly treading on each other's toes. There was a Keurig coffee machine--with CARDBOARD CUPS!!!!! And plastic disposable beakers in the bathroom. We thought about moving elsewhere but could not face the hassle, especially as it was graduation time and many of the hotels were full. To cap it all, the hotel only has three lifts to serve something in excess of 100 rooms; this in itself is way below what is needed, but during our ten-day stay there were, I think, only about three or four days when all three lifts were working. For a good proportion of the time only one lift was working; we were on the 15th floor and spent many minutes each day either waiting for the lift, or ascending/descending in it at excruciatingly slow speed as we had to stop at every floor to let people in or out. Also, if you are not going to provide a fridge you could at least provide a LARGE ice-bucket and have ice machines on every floor. There appeared to be only one machine, on the 12th floor, and the ice bucket in our room was only big enough to hold one drinks can at a time.
user_name:
Amanda J
London, England, United Kingdom

review_body: I always stay at the NYLO in NYC because my son and his family live right next door. It's a great hotel - convenient to everything! The price is decent and the staff is always pleasant. Don't get too excited about the drink and breakfast coupons the front desk will give you - they are not worth much at the bar or restaurant.
user_name:
Donna R
Oakland, California, United States

review_body: For the most part the hotel met it's purpose. Had agreed to upgrade online for a fee, but upon arrival no upgrades were available. I am use to being able to confirm my reservation online, that was not an option outside of my confirmation email for both reservation and upgrade they could not provide. Too few towels in my room. Room small.

Enjoyed our stay and the opportunity to explore the Upper East Side. Loved the restaurants and the close proximity to a concert at the Beacon Theatre. The bed and linens were above par - very comfortable. Hotel staff was very quick to respond.

We love the location and spaciousness of the rooms at NYLO. They also generally offer good value versus other options on the immediate area. During our last visit, there were issues with two (of four) elevators over multiple days, which made for long wait times and multiple walks down the staircase in frustration, Hopefully, they've gotten it fixed.

The hotel is very nice and well located. Our room was big and confortable, situated on the 16th floor. Amazing view. Don't know how it is with the other rooms but try to avoid the # 1603 : very strong vibrations and noise probably due to the global air conditioning system. For the price (around 400 $) no one is happy to spend the night with the feeling that there are permanently wash machines running behind the walls !

I stayed at Nylo while in town for a conference happening at the Lincoln Centre. The location was extremely convenient for the conference - just a 15 minute walk. It was a little bit further from some of the other main attractions in New York, but still relatively close. The proximity to central Park was amazing. It was easy to stroll over and be in the park within 15 mins. The neighborhood is a little less busy than other spots in New York, but still lots of food options close by. The only downfall was the bed and pillows, which could have been more comfortable. But, it wasn't an awful mattress by any means and still got some good sleep there.

First time at NYLO. Room was great, very spacious corner room with views of Broadway and 77th, and very close to the subway and restaurants. Unfortunately, the room was not very clean. The floor in the bathroom was actually sticky when you walked on it, and the tub was not very clean. Also, the housekeeping service took away a towel and didn't replace it, and there were no extras. Nice lobby and bar area, but bartender not very responsive. May give it another chance but not too sure.

Easy access to Upper West Side and Broadway shows via the #1 subway. Nice live music at the bar area in the evening. Elevators really slow. Otherwise a great little hotel with lots of youthful ambiance.

Staying here for four years and worst stay ever. Stains and holes in towels. Bar staff disappeared for minutes at a time leaving patrons wondering what was going on and thirsty. Asked to have checkout bill emailed still have not received it but got this survey instead

I used to stay in Midtown everytime I visited NYC but the hustle n bustle lead me to look for a more mellow place with the same city offerings. Enter the NYLO... this place has the an eclectic, down to earth crowd that is fun and easy to talk. And as a bonus the NYLO has a great bartender named Anna who adds color to your evenings and is as friendly as all hek. Hang out with the Broadway crowd or TV personalities. Bottom line...fun place to lounge.

I stay at this hotel on frequent trips to NYC. Very convenient location and a friendly and helpful staff. The rooms vary from tiny to spacious but are comfortable. I do prefer the bathrooms with the glassed in shower instead of a tub. I always get a good nights’ sleep on the comfortable beds. A meal at Red Farm restaurant located on the street level of the building is always a stop.

The lounge/bar area was exceptionally nice. The live jazz was a real treat. The room was a corner room which was adequately spacious. The furnishings are somewhat spartan but functional. Staff was courteous and helpful.

I paid almost 500 USD in a room for me and my wife, and it turns to be a noisy room. The room door has half inch space between the way and the door, so you hear everything from the corridor. The check-in time is 4 PM, and I had to expend pretty much the whole day around NY city because of that.

We discovered NYLO because of a referral. The hotel we contacted was full (it was the Columbia graduation week). What a treat it was. We had no real expectations. It was both a fun and comfortable experience. We will gladly tell others about it.

A/c didn’t work and no hot water pressure - thank goodness the bed was comfortable. At check the front desk employee said “sorry about that” but did not offer anything as compensation. I left abruptly and have no interest in going back.

The difference between good and great is in the details. The Nylo is a very good hotel, in a very good location, and Serafina is a very good restaurant. But it was Lenny at the front door, Jessie at the reception desk, Bobby at the bell captain station, and Teddy at the concierge desk with their attention to details concerning my requests that made my stay at the Nylo great!Most Sincerely, Patrick Deehan
user_name:
Patrick D
San Diego, United States

review_body: My husband and I always stay at the NYLO because the management is excellent and accommodates our requests. We have always had an outstanding experience at The NYLO. The rooms are immaculate and very comfortable and the location is excellent.

We stayed in this hotel for a mixed business-pleasure trip. Our business hosts chose the hotel; thus we stayed here on our own dime as well.The location is excellent. Generally the room was comfortable -- the bed was great! -- but the furnishings are chosen for their looks (locker-like storage) not functionality (no backs, so something can slip out the back.) Similarly in the bathroom, the sink has no counter; no place to put your kit bag. And we didn't find the safe until the last day! (In bedside locker.)I loved the workspace in the lobby, high tables with lots of outlets, but the lobby/bar itself was less comfortable. Lighting is too low during the day, it's too noisy at night, and the staff kept rearranging the seating for no perceivable reason. The location and beds were wonderful; I would likely return.

this boutiquish hotel is located in the upper west side, right at the corner of 77th and broadway. great location....nice walk through the park to the met and guggenheim,just up the street from lincoln center and a couple blocks from the subway. the room was clean, modern, very quiet and relatively small. it had everything one could use except space. the staff was very friendly and helpful. seraphina restaurant on the 1st floor was reasonably priced and really good food.

Loved the hotel!!! Seraphina is a great restaurant and the hotel staff was incredibly nice and helpful! I would happily stay here again. Clean and very updated style too! No fridge or microwave, but didn’t need one because you’re in NY!!

Hotel was good. Didn't spend a lot of time here, just mostly slept. In town for graduation and did some sightseeing. Only in town for three nights so we tried to get as much into it as we could and we had a great time.

Booking a business meeting trip attempted to get the group rate for the host org. For whatever reason it wasnt found in their system. Last month I called the hotel directly and got hung up on or disconnected or forgotten about 4 times. Apparently they transfer you to their call center. The call center rep takes your name and number in case of disconnection. After the call center rep put me on hold to gather info or transfer me. The call got dropped or disconnected 4 times. No one called me back. I called the hotel to explain my plight they transferred me back to the call center. That call also got dropped. Finally I gave up and contacted my host organization to have them settle the matter on their end. FF to today.I call the hotel directly to try to settle the matter. Surprise, Surprise! They try to transfer me and the call drops. So I call the reservation number directly, a rep answers, takes my name and number and is about to assist me but that call drops too. And guess what? BINGO No call backIm calling from a landline phone not sure why calls are being disconnected. Anyway finally I reach a rep named Whitney. She also takes my number and name I tell her make sure she calls me back. I also inquire about speaking to a manager--There is none. She says I should call the hotel. (So my call can be dropped again?)
user_name:
kassieme2017
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My husband and I had a very good experience during our weekend stay. it was my second time around...liked the location of this hotel a lot, near to my daughters apartment and close to museums and other cultural venues. We took a long walk in Central Park was such easy access to there and a short subway ride to Bryant Park for lunch. The free drinks are a very nice touch as well. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. No plans to eat at the hotel since there are so many great places to choose from nearby.

I recently was set to stay at NYLO and due to my dog being attacked, I had to cancel. I tried to get a refund on my non-refundable rate and initially the hotel refused. However, after a bad review on trip advisor, the NYLO staff did reach out and did “make it right”. Thank you NYLO. Four star service, since five star service would have been an adjustment when I first inquired.

Good location on Broadway. Tons of stores and restaurants nearby. Convenient restaurant downstairs, a bar in the lobby with original drinks, small business center, rooms are small but comfortable, and super friendly bilingual staff.

Perfect location upper west side New York.Very friendly staff, close to central park, riverside park, many good restaurants such as Red Farm, Serafina. Close to subway stations.The hotel has a nice bar!

A very agreeable and comfortable hotel, with a free drink of champagne at the bar. A lot of happy, prosperous and diverse guests who create a pleasant and lively scene. Particularly attractive bar and lobby area with branches of flowering cherry trees in large vases and pretty lighting. Nice staff, nice guests: relaxed, chic, and cheerful atmosphere. Perfectly located for a walk home after the opera at Lincoln Center.

Nice hotel and nice bright rooms. However noisy traffic (yes I am in NY but better windows would also do it). The doors slammed really hard and that was extremely noisy too as well as noise around the elevator. I was offered another room but did not really want to move all our stuff. Also the room was really bright and we preffered that and ignored the noise. It was a nice area but as our first time in NY it was a bit far away from everything.

We stayed here for 2 nights, arrived early in the morning so our room wasn't ready, the staff kept our bags safe until we arrived back to the hotel later that evening (so we could explore the city). There was amazing WiFi in the hotel for free and our stay included 2 free drinks at the bar in the lobby. On checkout, our flight home was later in the evening, so again they graciously kept our bags safe so we could enjoy as much time as we could in NYC.The staff were amazing throughout the whole trip, the room was comfortable with enough space to stretch out! The atmosphere in this hotel was luxurious, but you didn't have to fork out your mortgage to stay here! I will definitely be staying here again!

A good value for the experience. Serafina Restaurant was a pleasant surprise with excellent food. Sales and marketing staff slow to respond to requests for information. No complaints received from our hosted guests in the hotel.

My sister and I stayed hers with our parents to celebrate our Mom's birthday. Staff went out of their way to accommodate us and make it an extra special stay! Carlos and Eloy as well as Jessie, Ramona and Jennifer made sure we had a great room and all our requests were handled quickly and in a friendly manner! The front door guys are great! Lenny, Orlando, Alberto and Danny great you with a big smile and make you feel so welcome! The hotel is very clean and the balcony on the 16th floor is a gem! We love the proximity to great restaurants and to Central Park and the metro! You can't go wrong at the Nylo!!

Really nice and so close to Central Park. A perfect location for business or tourist stays. A cosy hotel, very confortable. The view from the room I had was unfortunately quite ordinary. No breakfast in the hotel.

perfect location for easy access to Lincoln Center, Central Park and all the upper west side. Our room was very small for a superior rate, but everything else was great. Service was efficient and friendly. This is our third rime here and will come back, looking for a larger room.

Safe and quiet were the key reasons to book. Great on site restaurant and very helpful staff. Room was very clean and the bar is fantastic. Close to subway. Heat spell and they always had the A.C. on in my room. Close to Central Park. The most comfortable bed after a long day!

BEWARE of the urban surcharge. $30 per day for what boils down to Wi-Fi and a complimentary bottle of water. We had coffee and tea facilities but no creamer or sugar for first two days, after asking reception I went to a store and bought my own. Hotel on the whole is fine but please if you need to up your room rates then do so but at least the price would be all in and transparent. The urban fee is just a hidden way to increase room rate. Taking the urban fee into account there are better nearby hotels for the same cost.

NYLO is a small trendy hotel very well located in the Upper West Side. Walking distance to the Central Park, the subway and nice restaurants and shops. Rooms are clean and comfortable modernly decorated. The shower could be better though, the water takes ages to get hot and is never really hot. Staff is kind and ready to help. We stayed for three nights and paying half of the stay we could get a late check out. For NY standards the cost benefit ratio is excellent. Highly recommend.

The staff was wonderful and the concierge very helpful. Was there for my sisters birthday and we were treated very well. Loved the location and restaurants and shops close by were great. Would definitely recommend this hotel in fact I already have to friends and colleagues.

A nice hotel in a wonderful Upper West Side location. The staff is friendly. It is not a huge hotel so you don't spend long periods of time waiting for an elevator. Clean, efficient rooms. The fitness room is small and didn't have mats. The bar on the first floor was inviting.

I'm a frequent business traveler to NYC. I've been coming to NYLO (formerly OnTheAve) since 2007. The staff is great. Shoutout to Victoria, Jessie,& bell staff). Rooms are clean, comfy, & quiet. Service is great. UpperWestSide is great neighborhood. Walking distance to subways, museums, central park etc.. Lots of great local restaurants nearby.

We went as a family of four for a weekend and we ended up leaving because the room was like a closet with no view. Terrible experience. This is a hip hotel in a nice location but stay away if you want a bigger room.

Perfectly located near two subways, Zabars, quick ride to Broadway shows. Very clean, comfortable rooms w/ a boutique like feel. The bar opens onto 77th St and the staff are cooperative and friendly especially Jessie. Excellent choice!

great hotel, the location is amazing and great service, always a smile on all the staff and clean room i love the bar in the lobby and the open space as well, not to forget the roof just a grat place to stay in while in NYC

I often travel to NYC for pleasure and business and am always looking for a good new hotel. Booked a trip to NYC in April and thought I would try out the NYLO Hotel. Unfortunately, my dog was attacked and was badly injured and I had to cancel my trip. I called the hotel and tried to arrange for a refund or credit. I was told that no refund was possible and I could have a credit only if I rebooked the room immediately or within the next 2 hours. Lovely customer service (sarcasm here). I understand their policies, but good service means attempting to understand how to serve a good customer or potential new customer. I certainly will never book a room with the NYLO again. I lost $613.69.

Clean and quiet. Comfortable beds. Service competent if not enthusiastic. Rooms incredibly small. No place to either sit, read or write. Closet lilliputian. No vanity in the bathroom; virtually no room to dry oneself after bathing.

This is a great base for an UWS stay. The short walk to the Metro, Central Park , shopping areas on and around Broadway made it perfect for our situation. I walked to boutiques, grocery stores, restaurants of every sort and was very pleasantly by this area. Hotel open areas were cozy and inviting with a complimentary welcome drink and live music Friday and saturday nights. The hotel staff was friendly staff and accommodation.

We try to make it to NYC at least once a year, and for the past three years have enjoyed staying at the NYLO. Great location, great staff, close to Subway and Central Park, and we appreciate the variety of the many fun restaurants on Amsterdam and Broadway. The rooms are clean, OK size for a New York hotel, and the bell staff, front desk and housekeeping staff are all very professional, friendly and make us feel welcome year after year. We'll be back!

We were a party of three and arrived circa 2 pm not realizing that check-in was at 4 pm. The front desk did offer to hold our bags until 4 pm but we would have liked to have access to at least one of the three rooms to freshen up after travel. These are small things that make a huge difference. (After all, we have chosen to stay at the NYLO for four consecutive years for the exact same business trip to Columbia U.)Other than that I was very happy with my corner room on the 11th floor. It was large-ish and the management kindly sent me up a small fridge after i shopped for some specialty yogurts that I requested them to store.The staff are always friendly and helpful and the guests smile at each other -- NYLO seems to have that kind of ambience.

NYLO NYC is a pleasant, easy, safe walk from the American Museum of Natural History and Central Park. There are lots of uncrowded family-friendly restaurants nearby. CVS is across the street. It's easy to get a cab. Our family prefers not to stay in more touristy areas. The beds are comfortable and we've never had a problem with noise. All of which is why on our annual family trip to NYC we stayed at NYLO for the second time this spring.

Loved the hotel! Great staff, wonderful location and perfect location! I was fortunate enough to have a room with a terrace,which gave me a fantastic view of the Hudson River. Bar in the hotel is a nice way to start your night out or finish your evening. Ben, one of the bartenders, a made sure to get to know the guests and he has a set of pipes to die for and does not hesitate to sing!Fabulous time!!!

I did quite a lot of research before booking this hotel. Overall I’m glad I chose NYLO- the UWS location was great, very close to 79th and 72nd stations on the 123 subway lines. I stayed at a Deluxe King corner room, which had a good view and the room size was plenty for one person. The decor was modern and the king size bed was extra comfy. The room had complementary water and coffee/tea machine which was nice, but I wish they also had a refrigerator. The bathroom was also nice and spacious with a large window. One minor thing was that there was a wet tissue placed on the corner of the window, and it was there until I left. I don’t know why housekeeping hadn’t cleaned that up- maybe there was a leak?One thing that was inconvenient— 4pm check-in time is very late. Regardless of my early check-in request by e-mail and room availability, they told me I had to pay an extra $40. They were able to look after my bags while I was out so it was fine in the end, but it would have been nice to drop off my bags in the room and relax a bit after a 12 hour flight. If I’m already paying over $200 per night, I don’t think they should charge me extra to accommodate for early check-in, especially if a room is ready.With everything considered though, the front desk staff were pleasant and they were helpful when I had a package delivery. Overall I enjoyed my stay and I would choose NYLO again.

Our family gathered for a weekend celebration in the area last weekend. The NYLO was a great selection for our accommodations. Easy to walk to Central Park, area attractions, and terrific restaurants. Regardless of the time of day, the neighborhood felt safe for walking. Our room was inviting, spacious, comfortable, and quiet. Upon arrival, we were treated to 1 drink voucher per guest. A nice way to unwind after a day of travel. I had a difficult time adjusting the thermostat to keep the room cool at night for sleeping. I should have checked with hotel staff sooner to figure out the system. Once I got it, all worked well. The highlight of our weekend, aside from spending it with family, was a Sunday morning run in Central Park and then perusing a local craft market. Yummy food!

This was our second time at the Nylo Hotel and we enjoyed it again a lot. Very friendly and helpful staff. We had a junior suite room, which was really large, especially for New York. Very comfy beds. Enjoyed the surrounding area. When in New York, we will most likely stay again at the Nylo.

Daughter booked & paid for hotel stay May 2-May 4th, however hotel only showed paid for 1 night instead of 2. Thought we had this straight; she used booking site & sent husband to correct, but it was still wrong. We asked for a quiet room; it was ready, we were upgraded to a king bed, & although some reviews indicated it was noisy, we enjoyed a quiet stay. Had to get new room key to get in, since reservations were incorrect. Jessie & Carlos @ front desk were helpful & pleasant. Had breakfast at the attached restaurant, and it was very good.

comfortable hotel and close to the metro. good room services, fast Wi-Fi and daily change of towels. welcome drink and always present staff. coffee and tea machine in the room with water available. recommended

We got a loft room which was huge. It also had a huge terrace overlooking Broadway and the Hudson River. Bed was very comfy - decor modern/urban. Shower was huge, although I wasn't a big van of the sink/vanity area...not much room. Everything was clean - wood floors which I love. Not sure why all the hotels don't take out the carpet. Lobby was dark but nice as well as bar area. The have a restaurant connected to hotel. We had a burger at the bar and it was delicious.

Great hotel off Broadway with really nice staff and close to restaurants in surrounding area. Minor issue with the hot water made for cold showers however was still a good place to stay. Our room was in a corner which was good for less noise both from the street and other rooms. Would definitely recommend and stay again!

Restaurant staff are beyond rude. Terrace rooms are not worth the extra money as views limited & furniture not in a usable state. Cleaning staff are excellent as is doorman. The lobby is very nice and the bedrooms and shower rooms are nice and modern.Beds are very comfortable.

This is a very quirky hotel. I talked with more than a dozen guests and they all agreed. Our first room - for which we paid an upgrade - was so small, there was no room for my wife's and my suitcase. They moved us quickly to a slightly bigger room but the bathroom literally vibrated when the HVAC was on. The wood floors collected dust and we found chewing gum stuck in the shower. The elevators were so shakey, twice a guest got off the elevator early. They made a big deal of the

Upon arrival to checkin, we were informed that the room wasn't ready yet but we did get an upgrade. Sunday nights seem to be great opportunities as many guests depart on Sunday. So we ended up in an awesome penthouse suite, specifically room 1509. Two balconies and a separate living room. Well appointed, this was a pleasant surprise. Our stay was so good that we booked the hotel again for the near future.

I have stayed at NYLO many times and love the location. I still love that about the hotel but felt that the place was sorely understaffed during this visit (at the front desk, no one answering operator calls in the hotel, and to get the temp in my room regulated.

Perfect hotel for our stay. 4 adults, 2year old, 4 month old and a dog to boot :)Rooms are small but the lobby has lots of space to hang out. Weather was cold and a bit rainy so we did eat at The nearby restaurants, Serafina and Red Table, both are great and recommended. Def our new go to hotel on UWS.

A precious address that I strongly advise. The reception on the ground floor stands in cosy spaces with sofas, large bar, armchairs, high tables, a red piano.... The scenery is beautiful and makes you want to seat here to have a drink. Friendly staff. The neighborhood is really charming. It was a very nice Hotel. I keep this address precious.

Great boutique hotel if you want to stay in upper West Side. Very friendly staff and fun bar on the ground floor. Walking distance to Central Park and several great restaurants in the neighborhood. Will definitely go back.

Best customer service, clean, comfortable - fantastic location, good vibes. The staff are all down to earth and lovely and the hotel rooms are pretty spacious and well laid out. The location can't be beat!
user_name:
marywwilli
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Location is perfect. Room are small but the bed was ok. Hotel and room are clean, service was ok. Bar and lobby are cute and cosy. In the hotel, the italian restaurant Serafina was very good. Goog pancakes and avocado toast.

I love NYLO! It is a boutique hotel - quiet, personal service, "where everybody knows your name." I am there a few times a year and would not stay anywhere else!Eloy is the man! He always takes such good care of me! From the bellmen, to the folks in registration, to housekeepers, all are friendly and welcoming. If you ever have even a tiny question, the manager will call or come out and chat directly. They really care!

This is a cool boutique hotel in a nice spot with clean and well designed rooms. I'd definitely stay here again. The staff was very helpful and it was easy to walk to nice lunch and dinner spots. There is also good shopping nearby.

The modern/industrial style was matched by the comfort of the beds and cleanliness, and by the helpful, friendly staff, from the doorman, receptionist to the bar tender. We were welcomed with a bottle of wine and chocolates, The spaces to meet friends on the first floor — a library, a lounge and bar, were inviting and relaxing.
user_name:
Sarah R
Norwich, VT, United States

review_body: Nice big room, great service and amenities. Loved Serefina and the bar area. Great location in the upper west side. Lots of shops and restaurants near by. Will stay at the NYLO again when visiting the upper west side.

This was my second stay at this hotel. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the location is great. Close to subway and Central Park. Great neighborhood restaurants and short cab ride to Broadway.This trip I only rated the hotel 4 stars. Check in was quick but the clerk was not friendly and barely spoke to us. I asked a few questions and got a mumbled response. Her only priority was me signing for the additional daily fee.Each day I left a tip for housekeeping and requested additional regular coffee pods. I only got the standard two. We were two guests in the room who enjoyed two coffees each morning. I also had to call the front desk for our daily bottles of water.Upon check out I mentioned that the last day we were having trouble with the security lock. The response was that the staff was aware of the problem and it would be repaired after we checked out.I really enjoy staying here and hope the level of service returns to the previous excellent level which I had been accustomed to.

I've come to using the NYLO NY Hotel on Broadway and 77th St. for business and get away trips. Location is convenient with 1 stop away from Times Square via subway #2/#3 via 72nd St. station. Hotel located in a good neighborhood with restaurants, bars & all services for local residents in walking area, including rental car outlet for out of town daily trips. Hotel rooms are big by Manhattan standards. Lobby bar has quick bites and Serafina's restaurant has good breakfast selection and seems to be busy in evenings for dinner with locals. First hotel in awhile that I had no problem with an early check-in, when I was prepared just to check my bag and proceed with my business appointments (Thank you, Ramona). No hassle check-in/check-out or catching a taxi out front too. Simply good service all the way around at a reasonable rate. The only complaint, if you can call it that, was that the complimentary welcome drink was limited to a wine spritzer or glass of champagne. Please expand offering to a glass of draft beer. Thanks NYLO. Regardless, I'll be back.

Only spent one night, but this place is a great find. The room was big and had anything I needed. Clean room, super comfy bed, good night sleep.In addition, the small things make it work: two bottles of water waiting in the room, free first drink in the hotel bar.. The only thing they could do better is the shower, which had a slight water pressure issue, but that was really nothing. Still 9/10, great value for money, I'll be back. Btw, the bar and lobby are really cool to spend your evening.

The hotel was in a great location near Central Park, museums and many good restaurants. Close to the subway as well. The staff was attentive and efficient. The room as a good size for NYC standards. We noticed there was a fire station across the street and requested a room on the other side of the hotel. No noise issues at all. We also enjoyed the cozy bar. We will definitely return.

Great place. If you want a quiet room, be sure to check that it is on a larger air shaft with a chance of at least a bit of natural light, and not a narrow shaft with opposite wall of building 5 or 6 feet away. I had to crane my neck to see the sky. Subway 2 blocks away, delis, grocery and liquor stores, shops and restaurants close.

This is a very nice hotel with a great vibe in a great location. 2 blocks from the subway, great restaurants around and super close to Central Park. Room was big and very clean. They have linoleum floors in the room that are attractive and l LOVED the absence of the typical skanky hotel carpet. Beds and pillows were super comfortable. Bad side: it is right across the street from a very active NYFD. Great if you have a fire but the sirens went off 3x our first night and 2x our second. Woke us up each time. The room adjacent to us seemed empty the first night but the second night it was occupied and we could hear a lot from the other room- coughing, laughing, general moving around. Way more than most other hotels. Staff was friendly and we pre- and post-stay checked our bags which was super helpful. They offered early check-in for $50 (check in is 4:00) and free late check out until noon.

This was our second time at NYLO NYC, and we just love it. The location is fabulous and the hotel staff is kind and welcoming. Bartender Christian Ortiz mixes up fabulous cocktails in the lobby bar and made us feel like we were family. We will definitely be looking to stay here next time we are in town,.

Excellent stay. Efficient check-in and check-out. Have stayed previously. Very convenient to friends, museums, and the like. Would recommend. Very good price to quality ratio. Room design seemed slightly updated, and we appreciated the quiet of a corner courtyard room.

i had a fantastic, memorable first visit to New York City and I have to credit NYLO with some of that enjoyment. Everyone whose expertise I enlisted while staying at NYLO were always pleasant and helpful. I want to return to NYC to see and experience even more of this wonderful city and I will most likely again stay at NYLO.

Love the NYLO, rooms are great staff is AMAZING, stay here every trip to NYC Love staying on the upper west side great restaurants shopping everything you need and downtown, broadway just a subway ride or Uber away

Wonderful location on the Upper West Side. Staff was great, bar was spot on and everything we needed was in our spacious and clean room! Right down the street on 77th was a good size open air flea market. Sunday morning we got our breakfast from local vendors and ate it right there, it was delicious. Took a stroll to Museum of Natural History and Central Park both days, we were do close! The Brownstones we walked by on 77th during our strolls were just beautiful.

The hotel is clean. our room was clean & fresh. Bathroom was clean!! extra points for a spotless bathroom. Really quiet rooms.The staff is genuinely friendly. Checking in and out was like a well rehearsed play. Had a great drink at the bar too. Just an overall great experience. Well done NYLO. We'll be back in the summer.

My family and I really liked the hotel. It has tons of gathering places for talking and it's perfect if you are travelling with a group. Having the bar right in the lobby allows for sharing drinks before going out for the night. The location is perfect. There are many excellent restaurants within a few blocks of the hotel and The Beacon Theatre is just two blocks down Broadway. Central Park is only two long blocks away which makes for taking a stroll that much easier. The fitness center is well equipped with ellipticals, treadmills, a stationary bike, and free weights, although the space is somewhat tight in there.

Nylo is a wonderful place to stay. Lots to do within walking distance. Or if you just want to hang in the lobby bar ... it has wonderful food and a great ambiance. If I am ever back in New York I will definitely stay again!

I loved the NYLO. Felt very safe and comfortable. Service staff was excellent and loved the lobby for meetings or catching up with friends. Relaxed and cool vibe. Each room has different layouts and storage space but desk was accommodating in helping me find the right room. Wonderful mix guests and after a week felt like a home away from home.

We drove up for the weekend to visit family. We usually stay 2 blocks further north when we make these trips (8-10 times a year), but NYLO had a good promotion that included parking. We’ve never had a problem w valet parking at our usual hotel, but this time the car was returned with a scuffed right rear bumper. Our fault for not having a “walk around the car” with the valet when we arrived...

we already made several trips to NYC, and as many "hotel experiences", but now we eventually found the hotel we will definitely book again next time(s). the NYLO is perfectly located, the UWS is perfect for a NYC-visit, a "real"NYC-neighborhood, away from the mid-town tourist hustle but only 10 subway-minutes from Times Sq. and 5 walking minutes from Central Park. clean, comfortable, very friendly staff. hotel lobby and bar are stylish and cozy. we upgraded to a Broadway View Deluxe Room (with very friendly email contact to the hotel management, and eventually a personal welcoming note and gift in the room - Thank You, Connie, highly appreciated!), which is more than spacious compared to everything else we had so far in NY, we even had Hudson-River-View (12th FL). windows are, concerning wind- and noiseproof, not "european standard", but that's the way it is all over the place in the US, just keep in mind when booking street view... the price is reasonable (it is Manhattan...), you always get what you pay for, don't expect anything comparable if you spend less, but there is no need to spend more, who wants to spend time in a hotel when the world's most amazing city is right outside the front door :)

Nicely appointed hotel within easy reach of Manhattan. Friendly and helpful staff throughout the hotel. Free drinks tokens on arrival is a nice touch and great to have fresh bottled water in the room every day. Bathrooms are tired and do Require refurbishment but were kept clean and well stocked with complimentary toiletries throughout our stay. When we had a problem with our bath it was resolved whilst we were out and reception always responsive to requests for help. So we were particularly disappointed that on checkout there were 5 valet charges added to our bill in error which if we hadn’t checked our bill carefully would have been taken from our credit card.

Staff was nice, bed was really comfortable and room was nice. Had some deficiencies as stated below that they can work on.1. No hot water in the room in the morning, I had to take a lukewarm shower. I did inform the front desk but by that time there was no chance to fix it. In addition, the piping had a very loud water hammer while trying to get hot water.2. Drink coupons (that we paid for as part of the

Upscale, clean, friendly, comfortable and low price.Rooms were very clean and bathroom huge for nyc. Took 5 mins to check in with very courteous desk. Within 2 blocks for subway. Plenty for food and small shops around the area.

Front reception staff efficient. Customer service when required was excellent.Room clean but felt cold as no carpet or rug on floor.Cafe/ restaurant connected to hotel not great.Close to subway and any a couple of blocks from Central Park

This is a bare brick, funky, loft-style hotel with a warm and inviting lobby for drinks, sitting about or playing chess. Staff are very helpful, location is brilliant - an easy walk to many things you'll want to do. Great bars and restaurants nearby, and the downstairs restaurant is good as well. Comfy bed, good amenities - great price, especially for an Aussie disadvantaged by the exchange rate! What more can you want?

Very nice and trendy hotel. Clean and updated rooms. Great bar in lobby was very good and bartender very friendly. Close to restaurants and other services. Rooms could be a little more sound proof as I could here people in adjacent room.

Nice lobby. Close to the subway (line 1) and Central Park. CVS across the street. Attached to a sub standard restaurant (poor service, okay food). Room was NY small and had a small window. Lighting was good. Appreciated the complimentary bottles of water and coffee, which was surprisingly good. Staff was generally nice. Wi-Fi was complimentary and good. Downsides: 1 of the elevators was out of service for much of our stay making the time to and from our room longer than needed. No hooks for wet towels in the bathroom. Hallways are loud and the noise carries and door to room didn’t close easily, making it impossible to open and close without a loud thud.

The best! We absolutely loved the location, the lobby, the room and the complimentary water! LOVED it! We only wish it was more affordable so that we could go and stay in the city more often! We live in NJ. In fact, I’m picking up my husband at work today (in NY) and take him to NYLO they are having live music at the bar :)

This hotels seems to beckon travelers to come inside. The atmosphere is relaxed and friendly and you have the feeling you come "home" each night. The relaxed lobby are is a book lined room with sofas and small table with chess sets and nooks for curling up with your computer. You don't feel alone as a solo travel. A great hotel in a great location.

I’ve just returned to England after spending three days at the NYLOIt was my first time at this hotel, and hopefully it won’t be the last! Our visit was for business purposes, and it’s location on the West Side was perfect for us. We were also able to walk to Central Park and 5th Avenue from the NYLO. My room was very clean and comfortable, and the bed was to die for! The bathroom was quite compact, but as I was the sole occupant, it wasn’t too bad (my business partner had the next room, and his bathroom was a little bigger) Just luck of the draw, I guess!The biggest downside to my room was the view - or should I say, lack of it! Both windows faced a brick wall about 5ft away - so as a new visitor to this vibrant city, that was a little disappointing to say the least. The staff were excellent, and the Serafina restaurant downstairs provided a superb breakfast. All in all, I’d highly recommend the NYLO to anyone - it makes a great base.

Love the location. The rooms are nice and clean. Staff is friendly. The lobby is a nice place to gather and relax - very comfortable. We have stayed here four times now and we have recommended the NYLO to friends and family.

This place is great, Cody and welcoming. The whole staff is great and actually like the residents. Especially Ramona the receptionist! She’s so positive and helpful and also sweet Orlando the doorman !!

Beautiful clean small hotel with very nice staff, great beds, cool and comfortable lobby. Wonderful location in Upper West side on Broadway. Nice touch to provide a welcome drink in lobby bar upon arrival. Felt very safe and welcome.

Myself, husband and two young sons stayed at NYLO during school vacation to visit the Natural History Museum and Central Park. We stayed two nights in a junior suite with two queen sized beds. When we arrived we were pleasantly surprised at the aroma in the lobby. It smelled so good! Jessie checked us in and was kind enough to put us on the 10th floor for a better view. Our car was parked in valet and the lovely doorman carted our luggage and brought it upstairs. The room was HUGE for NYC. I loved the modern decor. We received two drink vouchers for the nice bar downstairs. Being pregnant, my husband was happy to enjoy both! We were able to control the temperature in the room which was a pleasant surprise since I’m always too hot in hotel rooms. I particularly enjoyed the keurig in the room for hot coffee before everyone in my family woke up. The shower had good pressure and was consistently hot. The beds were too soft for me but that was my only grievance. You can’t beat the location to Central Park and the museum! Great staff and great stay!

NYLO was a great stay for us in mid-april. Its so close to the subway, marshalls is next door and a CVS across the street. Great bar (gotta try the rose), clean room and our cleaning team were the NICEST people. I loved my stay and would gladly go back. Great find!!!!

Overall the hotel was good with a few minor bumps on some service from particular staff members. The stay was nice and in a low-key location. The hotel itself is beautiful and very chiq, the rooms were very comfortable, clean and modern. No fridges or toothbrushes/toothpaste,

The NYLO was perfect. My fiance proposed to me in one of the beautiful loft rooms on the top floor, and it was amazing. The view of the Hudson is gorgeous, and the service was flawless from top to bottom. The bartenders Chris and Anna were awesome and so sweet! We had an amazing time, if you want to be extra fancy in NYC book one of the NYLO lofts, they are gorgeous! (I'm sure the regular rooms are beautiful too!) Also, the beds are crazy comfortable.

Great, boutique-feeling hotel. Modern furnishings. Friendly staff. Bustling lobby with a bar and live music on most nights. While this is recommended by Columbia U, despite being 5 stops south on the 1 subway from the university, it's worth staying here,

The check-in time is 4pm with no flexibility, which threw a wrench in some plans. The bed is very comfortable and the deluxe king had a nice view with a surprising amount of space. However, the bathroom looked a bit like a prison cell and they gave us literally two towels. Would be nice to have additional linens. The staff was a little rude when they put the air conditioning on on a 40 degree day. When I asked them to turn it off in the lobby, they said they couldn't, and furthermore, was rude about it. Service could use some work, as well as amenities.
user_name:
NoraT2010
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Rooms are alright. Soft bed, spacious for NYC, and very clean. Most of the staff was amazing. House keepers to front desk to the door man, all amazing. Had live music in the lobby/bar on Thursday and Friday which was great.But the bar is AWFUL! Rude bartenders who make horrible drinks. I mean REALLY bad drinks! Which is ok, unless you're charging $16 a drink. How do you mess up Scotch and soda?!? I thought you could get that right! I underestimated your ineptitude, my fault.It wasn't that big of a deal until the ice machine (there is only one, it's on 12) broke. Front desk was super nice, said the bar would fill my ice bucket. Bar tender was having none of that! Kept saying "on 12!" Which I already knew damn it. And all 3 bartenders had the same attitude. It was Sunday night, they were dead, and I always tip. So wtf?Anyway, despite the lack of ice, I would definitely recommend this hotel. Great location, clean and 99% friendly. Just go somewhere else for drinks.

I won’t stay anyplace else. The upper west side location is great. Close to Central Park great shopping and VERY comfortable and quiet rooms. I stayed 6 nights for business and had a great experience. The restaurants around the hotel are great plus jazz in the lobby Thurs - Saturday was such a treat! Jessie at the front desk Gave me a late check out on my departure day. Couldn’t be happier w my stay here. Will definitely be back.

Excellent location for the hotel, close to the bus and Subway stations. Friendly and efficient team at the reception (a special thanks to Ramona!)The rooms are big, with a very nice view if you have one at a high floor, excellent beds. Unfortunately, no minibar in the room.The breakfast is not a buffet, you can easily find a tea-room in the surroundings of the hotel instead of eating it at the Serafina (restaurant of the hotel)!

Friendly staff, comfortable beds and a decent sized room conveniently located near Su bway station and Museum of Natural History, made for a great getaway to NYC with family. I would definitely recommemd the Nylo.

Location is excellent. Close to subways and to Central Park. Many good restaurants (different kinds) in the neighborhood, with two in the same building (Red farm and Serafina). Friendly staff, cool bar and very comfortable beds. Will come back again.

Second stay for me at NYLO. First for work in January 2015 and a return stay in March 2018 with my family for a holiday. Love the location - a walk through central park to start the day worked for us. Staff are helpful and friendly. Downstairs the bar has a nice vibe. We had a family room which suited us perfectly. Would recommend.

Have stayed here several times in the past few years. Always reliably clean, fair-priced. Service is excellent and friendly and willing to help very easy and enjoyable 5 block walk to 72nd street express subway station... safe 24/7

My daughter attends Columbia University and I visit her as often as I can. We really love coming to the NYLO!! It is so hip and welcoming in the same time! The beds are super comfortable and the rooms clean and new. The bathrooms are top notch also. We have always had great costumer service. This last time I was allowed to check in early (which at the NYLO is anytime before 4 pm) without having to pay the $40 that early check in requires. I was coming from a terrible red eye flight so I was very thankful to the the lovely receptionist who accommodated me (I wish I remembered her name!!). Location permits access to many cool cafes and restaurants around.

Great bedsVery small rooms, microscopic bathroomsGreat locationDo not pay the ‘resort fee’ you don’t have to!!However, if you do get it waived (and they will waive it) you will get the worst rooms - they do ‘retaliate’

Had a great time with my parents at this hotel. Beautiful balcony in our room, and a great staff. Extremely impressed with the doorman Orlando. He helped us get all of our taxis and recommended restaurants. Cute too!

We love the Upper West and travel in several times a year to visit with family members in the city. Staying at NYLO has become a given. The rooms are spacious, contemporary and private with all new bathrooms and amenities. We love starting and finishing our day in the first floor common room, surrounded by overstuffed chairs and ready work spaces. NYLO s our new favorite resting place in the city.

We appreciate the minimalist nature of this hotel. Feather free policy makes our stay even more pleasant. Best beds/pillows ever! Easy 2 block walk to #1 Subway. CVS across the street. Don't miss Red Farm!

It's hard to find a hotel room in NYC with two Queen beds for a reasonable price. We had an excellent room, plenty of space, and nice service. It was very clean, and the beds were comfortable. A free glass of prosecco in the bar was a nice touch.

NYLO is the only hotel that I would stay or my family - ever! I could tell you about the magnificent rooms, comfortable beds, cleanliness, chic style, excellent ambiance. Truly, what makes this hotel are the employees. The front desk employees are beyond exceptional and so very helpful to every single guest. Patient, accommodating, informative and gracious. Thank you to the few front desk staff that have gone above and beyond with care and a friendly smile, Alicia, Ramona, Carlos to name a few. They are your front line and deserve recognition for making NYLO the place to go!

I loved my stay here. Very comfortable and calming atmosphere! Convenient location to shopping and restaurants. Beacon Theatre extremely close, and Central Park. The staff were very accommodating and helpful!

Perfect except I wish for a firmer mattress! Because of this I only stay here when I only need a night or two at the most. I love the neighborhood and it's near trains. Central Park, museums, delis, quick and easy to get downtown. Very clean and updated, not super fancy but new and clean. Great exercise room, bathroom amenities, helpful concierge. I stay here often with my family, it's a great family neighborhood.

If you want a quiet, affordable and convenient place to stay in NY, look to NYLO. This hotel is very welcoming, comfortable and the people who work there really make it so. It is located next to a few subway stops and is close to Central Park. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and relatively quiet compared to other hotels. There are also a number of restaurants and bakeries in the area for sit down or grab-to-go dining. The are is safe and a VS is just across the street if you forgot to pack something. The people who work at NYLO seem to really like working there - always helpful and friendly. We would definitely stay here again.

Great location for Central Park and Museums. Quiet area with loads of great restaurants on Columbus and Amsterdam avenues - under 5 mins walk from hotel. Hotel is a modern boutique type with a lively bar and comfortable lounge area.

I finally found my "go-to" hotel for NYC. The service is impeccable with EVERYONE happy to help. The most telling example of its excellence is the following: Christina, the day manager, reimbursed me when there was miscommunication about a problem with my otherwise wonderful room. With repeated apologies. I didn't even have to ask. I will absolutely return.

Incredibly friendly and helpful staff.Nice clean modern rooms with comfortable beds, pokey bathroom but ample enough.Decent location with plenty of bakeries and shops nearby.All in all a pleasant stay.

The staff here was friendly & the rooms here were very clean. The bed was especially comfortable! No problems falling asleep. The location was nice, quiet, & close to subway. We would definitely stay here again!

Our stay at NYLO was perfect. We received VIP treatment from the entire staff. The rooms are clean, spacious, quiet and comfortable. Adjacent to the hotel is restaurant Serafina: the food is good, but be able to tolerate electronic dance music.

Our family of four had a great stay at Nylo. We had a queen queen suite and the room was surprisingly large and comfortable. The furnishings were very modern and the beds very comfortable. There was plenty of floor space for us to spread out and we even had a few friends up to the room. The hotel is very nice with a modern lobby with hip bar space. The lobby would be perfect to hang out and rest after a long day of activity in the city, except they use a very strong, musky air freshener that is quite overpowering. It made it difficult to stay down there for any length of time. But that was a very small issue in an otherwise very nice stay. The neighborhood is fantastic... great local restaurants and attractions in a more residential area but easy transportation to more touristy spots.

Very accommodating staff. Hotel has a nice vibe and is in a great location. Rooms have nice amenities and bedding.We particularly enjoyed the jazz duo on Thursday evening. A great lounge for relaxing.

We arrived to a somewhat dirty room and a bathroom with hairs in it. Also hairs in the bed.
