I had to work quite a bit on this trip and was not able to from my room due to the lack of Internet service. The staff was very friendly and helpful and they all did a great job. The website also led me to believe that the room size would be different. There is no where to sit other than an office chair or the bed and it made it tough to want to spend time in the room. Ended up leaving and entire day early due to the Internet factor or lack there of. It was not convenient for me to go work down in the lobby where I may have had service as I was traveling with my child and cannot leave her alone in the room

Everything about the hotel exceeded our expectations. From the doorman to the reception desk to the bellman to housekeeping, each person made us feel welcome and special. The room (king upgrade) was large by New York standards, immaculate and well appointed with an extremely comfortable bed and high class toiletries. An extremely good experience and value. We will return.

Nylo is a really cool hotel, with great staff and located in a very nice area.I arrived on Thursday evening and there was a very good vibe in the hotel, with music and people chilling out and having a drink. The lobby area is fantastic, nice sofas, a piano, a bar; it felt ver cozy and at night becomes very lively, with cool lights.The room (a double room for single use) was big, nice, modern and clean. Plenty of space and a nice bed and bathroom with a bath. Very comfortable.The only point to mention was that the room had no views at all; it was located in an interior part of the hotel and I could only see some pipes, which made it a bit dark. But being in NY, I didn’t spend much time in the room!The area is very nice, with plenty of pleaces to it nearby and a CVS next door. Very close to the Museum of Natural History and Central Park. Subway stations very close too, lines 1,2,3.The staff were really friendly and helpful. In particular Ramona and George.There was a complimentary drink upon arrival.I would definitely recommend NYLO and I hope to be back very soon.

Amazing location off Broadway, close to restaurants, drug stores, subway line. Shockingly large room for NYC (we had a “junior suite” for 2 adults and 2 teenagers). Lovely lobby with excellent bar. Clean and well-thought-out rooms with comfortable beds. Our only complaint? Get new pillows!

We were given a tiny room which was upgraded the second we asked - they clearly knew.The bar is lovely as is the attached restaurant but having to walk through the bar to get to the rooms makes it feel a bit like a posh hostel.The attached restaurant is nice too.The bed was super comfy.

Stayed here for One night . Trendy lobby , v comfy bed with sheets of high thread count ! Bathroom was v small n no counter space at all .Lady at reception was v nice when checking my in .24 hour CVS across the hotel for snacks and any toiletries You need . Wished I discovered the Marshalls And DWS shoe store close to the hotel before I left ! Walking distance to Central Park and Natural History Museum .Nice hotel but if I were staying longer , a bigger room / bathroom would be preferred .

Good, if not plain hotel to stay in the Upper West side. Overpriced generally, but there's special pricing on Hotels.com sometimes. Most of my stay was fine, however booking an extra night turned into a daunting task for the hotel staff. I went down to the front desk and was informed they can't book rooms there, that I needed to go back up and call them from my room. I tried to call, but was on hold for over 30 minutes, all while housekeeping was barging in every 5 minutes to kick me out. I went back down to the front desk and let them know I couldn't get anyone on the phone. They said to try booking via their website, but the price per room was almost $100 more there. I ended up booking one night at the Sheraton Times Square instead, which was cheaper and nicer in every possible way.

I am a returning guest. This is my go to hotel on the West Side. The location can not be beat. The staff is very accommodating, and attentive. On a number of occasions they have gone above and beyond to meet my needs and deliver on my requests

I'll start with the stand-out staff member from our recent stay at NYLO: Christian Ortiz, the bartender. Everyone at NYLO made us feel welcome, but Chris is the man we'll remember. Not just for finding the right balance of warmth and stock NYC cool, but for the personal, real connection he made with us each time we sat down for a drink. The bantz was pitched perfectly, respectfully and in just the right measure. This guy is class.Great stay. Brilliant staff. Cool but warm NYC atmos. Superb location.

If you want a large, impersonal lobby don't stay here. The NYLO is super friendly and a happy place-- from the door staff to the desk staff to the bar..As a result guests, too, are friendly. The lobby is a living room. Staff doesn't turn over and they remember return guests. It is a home away from home. This is a boutique hotel of the best kind. And it is convenient to museums, theater and businesses.

NYLO is a great convenient place close to subway close to park close to plenty of restaurants. what else can you want The people that work there seem to like working there and they show that they are enjoying their jobs. the lobby is great and the bar and the workers there are also great

Loved the Nylo. I paid a bit extra for a king sized loft room and it was worth it. Balcony, afternoon sun, view of the river. It was smaller than I’d hoped for, but still a good size for NYC. Staff were all helpful & friendly ... especially Alberto the concierge. Would love to stay there again when next in New York.

Everything was great: Room, bed, shower, bathroom size, staff, location, and awesome local restaurants, without the tourist feel. Close to the subway which allows one to be anywhere in Manhattan within a few minutes.

We choose this hotel due to near proximity to the natural history of museum and Central Park for 2 nights. It was a wonderful stay with pleasant staff at check in. They held our luggage that morning while waiting till our room was ready that afternoon. It allowed us a full day of exploration nearby at museum and park. Our room was quite spacious for NYC to comfortably sleep 4 people. It also had coffee, free sparkling wine for the adults and water bottles in the room. Our boys loved staying there! Will come back again as we also loved checking out UWS neighborhood. Will return again if we wanted to stay in the neighborhood.

We were visiting NYC for the first time and to celebrate my daughter's 21st birthday. Ramona was so sweet and upgraded our room and sent treats up as well. All of the staff made us feel very special and if/when we visit New York again, we will definitely stay at NYLO NYC!

Stayed at the NYLO because we had stayed at it in its last life, and the location is very convenient. Also, they had reasonable prices and did not surge their rates because it was Easter weekend.Our room was incredibly small -- overwhelmed by a king-size bed. The bed was so high we couldn't sit on it to put our shoes on. Not a big deal except that there was no chair in the room! Also, in order to use the toilet you had to close the door, and in order to close the door you had to stand between the toilet and the vanity. But it had a full-size shower and lovely towels (and sheets and pillows and pillows and pillows).The hallway decor is dark charcoal with beige carpets, and the rooms also have a masculine decor/color scheme. We couldn't have hung out in this room (which looked out on an air shaft), without being in bed, but the hotel does have two nice lounge areas, one with a bar, one without. And a very helpful staff. This morning the doorman sprinted down the block in the snow to get us a cab.A good place to stay for location and price -- especially if you don't plan to spend time in your room.

This hotel is located in the upper west side of Manhattan. It is super close to Central Park and other tourist spots. It has a very sleek exterior that continues onto the inside and throughout the hotel. It has a very well-designed trendy grunge design. The lobby is very cozy and has plenty of seating space for guests. There are computers and other forms of entertainment. Also in the lobby is a bar and small restaurant! They made it easy to relax in this lobby area. It does not have a lobby feel but I will call it a lobby since I don’t have another name for it. When we arrived, we were greeted by a bell man who carried all our luggage in. He was very nice and prompt. The staff on the inside were a little less impressive. Everyone was helpful but they weren’t really forthcoming with offering help or warm for that matter. It also took a long time to check our bags (both my boyfriend and I had time to use the restroom...and then some before someone came) and was annoying especially since we were short on time. We weren’t given instructions on amenities, WiFi, or various food options offered at the hotel. The room itself was amazing. We got the loft with terrace. The hotel staff kept saying “it has the best view” and I didn’t understand what they meant until I saw it. We were on the corner and our terrace offered a 270 degree view of the city. The rooms had multiple tall windows which allowed for tons sunlight to enter. The room had pretty cool furnishings and light fixtures. The room was also huge and had a couch with a pull out bed. I didn’t know what to do with all the space. Ha. Anyway, minor downside is the lack of a refrigerator. Also, we could hear our upstairs neighbor and also some other neighbors through the air vents. The housekeeping cart was also visible at all times, which isn’t horrible, but it seems a little sloppy.

Traveled with friends and found NYLO to be the perfect place to stay. Very spacious and clean room (especially for NYC) with friendly staff. Lots of great food and coffee shops nearby. Proximity to Steps on Broadway (traveled with dancers) and Central Park was absolutely amazing. Friends reported that restaurant Serafina was delicious. Even had a CVS across the street for whatever needs popped up. Would definitely recommend to friends or family and would love to stay at NYLO again.

Have stayed at NYLO a few times over the past couple of years - a great little hideaway on the upper west side - great walking - easy subway availability - great local restaurants and though the rooms have been a bit sparse, they were clean, comfortable and decently sized. And as we had to cut short our trip in March due to a sudden snowstorm, the NYLO accommodated our early departure and reduced our bill without us asking - really nice and very appreciated.

This hotel is located in a great part of the city with nearby attractions. The rooms are clean; the service is great. Rooms could use a little more coziness - a rug or two? The restaurant was $$ but there are nearby eating places.

Had an extremely enjoyable 9 night stay at NYLO New York. The twin double room was larger than we expected from online photos, although not huge. With the addition of a requestable room fridge, our longish stay was extremely comfortable. A short walk to the subway and Central Park means easy access to the rest of the city. There are excellent restaurants nearby and a cosy bar in the lobby. No problem with noise from either inside or outside for the most part, although there were some irritating noises from the plumbing on occasion. Our only complaint would be the lack of attention to detail you expect from a not-inexpensive hotel. No in-room information about hotel amenities. Hotel staff were not rude but were not particularly warm or helpful. Paper and plastic cups are standard. Not enough tea or coffee for two, bottled water (which is part of the room price) not replenished some days, and cleaning cart left in the hall at all times. Even taking these things into account I would still stay again.

After a downgrade for the first night from the best room category to a rather poor and small room (without any pre-information or explanation), I got a lot of assistance from the Front Desk the following day. At the end, it was another great stay at this very convenient situated hotel.

Hello, I just wanted to say that I had and amazing stay at the NYLO Hotel this past July. The hotel was very chic and upscale and I really loved how close the location was to everything. I want to send a special shout out to Jennifer at the hotel. She really made our stay most enjoyable! Thank you so much Jennifer! You're the BEST!!! Recio Y and Stephanie C.

It's been 5 years since my first NYLO review... still our favorite in NYC. They've added a Red Farm restaurant next to Serafina's for more choices just adjacent to the hotel. Our bed was softer than I remember... may be time to replace the mattress in room 1130! Other than that, great staff, location and very comfortable hotel.

We recently stayed at NYLO and we had a wonderful experience. The hotel is in a great and safe location. The decor was very appealing-even to teenagers! We stayed in a Junior suite. We had four people in our room and that provided plenty of space. The front desk staff were very accommodating and pleasant. The only negative was the restaurant. The help was not very courteous and food and drinks were a bit pricey for what you were served. Besides that, I consider it a great place.

Typical New York, taxes are way too high. The city is just exploiting visitors. The hotel was very comfortable, quiet, and very convenient for our stay. I would stay ther again when visiting my son. I may consider staying in New Jersey to save about $100 peer night: especially if it was an extended stay..

The accommodations at NYLO were very good. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The location was handy for my needs. The valet parking was an very useful. I would recommend NYLO to my family and friends.

NYLO is an excellent choice if you need a UWS hotel. Cool urban industrial look in the lobby with a nice lobby bar. Yes, the room and bath were on the small side but actually pretty roomy by NY hotel standards. And the bed was incredibly comfortable. Best of all, the price was reasonable. I’ve already recommended the hotel to several people.

The NYLO is well located and clean. If you can get a discounted rate or special it's well worth it. The furnishings in the room are in excellent condition - the rooms tend to be somewhat dark but they are quiet if you choose a room in the back of the hotel.

Nylo is in great location for a NYC trip. Easy access to highways. Easy ride to midtown. Rooms are small but very quiet and comfortable. Beds are really really comfortable. Staff is friendly and helpful. Only downside: avoid the restaraunt attached to the hotel. Rude servers, overpriced menu. Lots of good places to eat within 5 minute walk.

I always stay at the NYLO on Broadway when I'm in NY for work and pleasure. No hotels are cheap in the big city, but this one offers excellent value for all that I get. From cleanliness of room to courtesy of staff to location of hotel; it is my favorite.

Decent room for the price. Clean room too. Hotel staff was helpful. Location is great if you’re going to the opera! NYC Ballet & Lincoln Center nearby. Can’t ask for more from an NYC hotel at this price!

We live NYLO because of its location. Away from the fray, it’s conveniently located in upper west side neighborhood. Easy access to subway and walking distance to great attractions. Right off west side highway. Good neighborhood restaurants nearby. Makes a trip to NYC very manageable.

NYLO is one of my favorite hotels when I'm traveling to NYC for business. NYLO's chic, well-appointed rooms, friendly staff, cozy lounge and spacious work center make this little hotel score big on guest satisfaction!

I booked a room on hotels.com which included free WiFi in the rate. We checked in, received two vouchers for “complementary” drinks at the bar, got to the room - did NOT even use the WiFi, and at check out the next morning, was charged $31 dollars for the COMPLEMENTARY drinks, the FREE WiFi, and ACCESS to the gym that we did NOT use. I’ll never go back. And oh yes, dogs allowed to sit in the bar area - unsanitary.

Advertised price is not the real price. They don't disclose when you check in that you be charged an extra $100 for a 3night stay for the water bottles in your room, the kuereg in your room, WiFi, and the right to use the gym. This apparently added automatically whether you use these things or not. The hotel was pretty bare bones; concrete floors, worn out carpets, and tiny rooms. Put deceptive advertising on top of that and I say stay somewhere else.

Great “lobby” area feels like a “speakeasy” relaxed atmosphere. Frequent business travelers rather than “tourist” crowed. European feel. Very accommodating pleasant staff. Black car service available for airport return rather than cab. Love the rooftop!

Fantastic customer service. Boutique hotel in fantastic location on upper west side of Manhattan. Walking distance to great restaurants, shopping, museums, central park. Room (and bed) was comfortable, clean.

Great hotel on the upper west side - location great for travel within the city on mass transit. Local restaurants are great for families and couples. Amenities are limited - no shower caps included but hairdryers included as is the keurig coffee pot with cups and water included in the room

Hotel has a nice, warm feel. It even smells good. Rooms are tiny but well equipped. Beds are comfy. Staff is ok. Concierge is not helpful or knowledgeable. It’s near a subway stop. I’d stay here again. They like dogs. Bathroom needs hooks and holders for towels. Courtyard room is dark.

This is a nice hotel with a comfortable and stylish lobby and bar area we hung out in a lot. Felt like being at home. Two blocks to Metro Station and Central Park. I recommend getting the junior suite so you have room to spread out. Our room was off the street, so had no view, but was very quiet, which for me is a major plus in NYC. Highly recommend if you don't feel like you need to be in the center of the action. No trouble getting cabs or subway to all of our destinations in town.

I can’t recommend this hotel. I won’t be back. Budget quality at boutique prices. Plastic utensils, cups, room service also plastic everything and that’s if they decide to answer. Expected more but disappointing.
user_name:
Tnlatte
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: After ironing a Brand New Sweater, I hung it in the Closet. As it was the only thing I hung up in the hard to access closet, I forgot it. As soon as I realized it was gone upon unpacking my suitcase I called, emailed, and spent a week trying to locate or have it replaced, as it was a $170 item I had worn once. Today I was told, it would not be replaced, and that they would upgrade me the next time I stayed there???? Perhaps had my sweater been turned in to the lost and found, or the hotel compensated me for the loss, I would be happy to return. Feeling a bit ripped off, sad for the loss of my new sweater and upset about their lack of concern, over the theft.

I travel to NYC once a month for work. Wanted to try someplace different than a typical Hilton/Marriott chain and this hotel is in a great location for a good price. Unfortunately the recent rash of Nor'easters in the Northeast meant my meetings kept getting bumped. I ended up losing $350 because of their cancellation policy. Would've loved to been a regular there but for flexibility need to stick with the big guys.

I liked the complementary cocktail. The bed was very comfortable. The room decor does remind one of a cargo ship. However, we weren't in town to hang out in the room. The only complaint I have is the noise level - we could hear everything outside and inside. Thankfully, I had another set of earplugs and we slept soundly.

My husband and I stayed here for a family site seeing trip with our 13yr old and 15yr old. This was my husband's and I second time staying there and it was even better than the last. Check in was made easy by very sweet desk agents. It was quick, fully explained and our bags taken up to the room. The hotel lobby and halls are a little dark, but I honestly found it made it more intimate. We loved that we could enjoy the live music in the lobby at night while the kids could enjoy desert at the neighboring restaurant. The bar staff isn't the nicest and the drink selection is sometimes lacking, but overall enjoyable. Most importantly, the room was clean and well kept and stocked by housekeeping. It was nice to enjoy a hot shower and comfortable bed after a long day of walking the city. The weather was miserable the first few days of our trip, but the temp controls for our room worked perfectly. Honestly, the biggest impact of staying here was the doormen. Like any good "old school" hotel, the doormen are THE people to know. Specifically, Orlando, Jose, and Alberto took very good care of us and made us feel like the most important guests in the hotel. They were always available, very helpful, and extremely knowledgeable. If we needed anything, they either had it or knew how to get it for us. We can't wait for our next trip! We've also recommended our family and friends to this hotel so they could enjoy their stay in NYC as much as we enjoyed ours!

Great value. Nice people. Room was very small but adequate. Bed was extremely comfortable. Only issue was a sink that did not drain very well. Forgot to tell them in room 726. There was a charge on my bill from the bar we did not incur the night before we departed. No issue or problem. It was immediately removed which was appreciated

Visited New York with friends. To see the sights and visit Museums. NYLO well located for Subway links to Downtown New York. We enjoy walking and it's walkable distance to Battery Park! Winter weather during the visit - too cold to venture out we were able to use the Restaurant linked to NYLO for a meal, take away to our room. Relaxed easy going atmosphere.

First time staying at the NYLO NYC. The hotel and room (Jr Suite) was very nice and the beds are unbelievably comfortable!! I need to find this mattress. Best sleep I ever had. The concierge Fendi V went above and beyond to service us. She ran out and bought all these trinkets, balloons, cake etc for my sister bday and decorated the room to our liking. She put together places and restaurants to go in our room as well. She did this all on her own time. That is beyond service!!!!!! Then Vivick, Ramonq, Jose and Danny at the front desk were so nice and helpful throughout our stay. I can’t even begin to tell you the service we received. Thank you to all of them and I will be back for sure due to the service I received. Great spot to stay with tons of restaurants, bars and stores to shop

We traveled to New York for spring break with our teens. The hotel put us in adjoining rooms, one king for parents and two doubles for teens. It was perfect for us! Staff was very friendly and lots of great places to eat in the neighborhood which we enjoyed. We liked to modern design and boutique feel. Bar is cozy and friendly. My husband and I enjoyed a night cap while listening to music as well; felt like a date night with our teens safe and happy up in their room. It was a bit uptown for some of our activities in Theater district and downtown but I would still stay there again.

We are a family of four so I was happy to pay extra for a room that was advertised as a "Junior Suite" with two queen beds.But unfortunately, the room we received was not a suite - - it's actually a spacious single room, like a studio apartment, with a sitting area at one end, with a couch and armchair.And the beds were not queen size . They were nice, high, comfortable but regular sized doubles/full beds. I measured them so I am sure! 54" wideIf the room had been advertised and priced as a larger-than-usual hotel room with two regular-sized double beds and a little extra space for a sitting area, I would have been happy.But when I spoke with the hotel reception staff, they insisted that the room was correctly categorized, and no, there were no other rooms available to which we could move.The interaction made me feel like I was not the first person to have this complaint, and that the staff knows that their job is to hold the line, let the customer say what he will.I got the impression that they are given little discretion by upper management.Finally, the view from our windows was a plain gray building wall a few feet across the air shaft between the hotel and the next-door property. Not sunny in the slightest.We had a fine experience oitherwise. The door and bell staff were helpful and welcoming. The lobby bar and sitting area is pretty nice, too.Still, for a room like that at the price we paid, I won't be hurrying back...

I stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel is OK, rooms are tiny, very very small even to manhattan standards, but the hotel was not bad, until I checked out.I was charged $31 per night for the 'urban fee', something apparently was not included in the hotel rate. They said I signed for this when I checked in, but when they made me sign that form they did not say that was for a fee, they said it was just a signature they needed. Actually, the guy said 'no need to fill the whole form, we just need your signature'.Apparently you pay $31 per day for internet, access to the fitness center and a welcome drink. But you cannot opt out of this, there is no way to say 'don't give me internet, but save me the $31'.The reason they do this, is because they can advertise a lower rate, win over competitors in search engines, and then charge an additional $31 per night (20% of their rate) at checkout. So, my advice, do not compare this hotel to other hotels of $150, because the nightly rate is well above $180, and if you take that into account, there are better options. Besides this, the sole fact that they do this is something not nice at all. I prefer to be treated well as a customer, and not to be scammed like this.Having said all this, the rooms are OK and clean, the service is good, and the bars and restaurants at the hotel are also good. If it wasn't because of this bad business practice, i would have ranked them 4 or 5, but this is not the way guests should be treated.

An elegant vintage design boutique hotel with all necessary services for a modern traveller. The staff at the reception and bar very helpful and caring. Amazing bed, wish I could take it home with me... Get a room at one of the top floors and watch the world right from your bed. A lovely Manhattan experience, hoping to be back.

This hotel is great. Our room was small but didn’t miss anything. Really clean, very cozy and great beds! Close to museums, Central Park and subways. Lots of good restaurants nearby and close to Playhouses.

Great bed, location, and service. Live music in the hotel bar — a real plus — with a beautiful red lacquer piano. Hotel saves money on little things, like flimsy plastic cups in the room, but overall it was a good experience.

Great experience! The room was small but nice. We loved the rustic, vintage feel. The shower wasn't completely clean -- there was hair in the shower. Other than that oversight, I would recommend. The lobby had a bustling atmosphere that made us feel welcome. Loved the ambience.

I really enjoyed my stay. The internet was reliable and fast, the room was quiet, and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel is close to the subway. I will definitely look at NYLO on my next trip to NY.

I thoroughly enjoy the location. The rooms are small and the furnishings are minimal but the hotel is comfortable. I do resent the Urban Fee. Just indicate the true price in the cost of the room. When a potential customer is comparing room prices, the costs are misleading.

Hotel Nylo is not a five star hotel but I believe rankings should be five stars if the hotel or restaurant a attraction fulfills its promise to guests and Hotel NYLO certainly did this last week.. Great location, nice room, wonderful price with upgrade under $200 – but the hidden $30 resort fee is annoying if you unaware of it. I had two rooms – the one with an HVAC system that cold wake the dead and the one they found for me the next night without a fuss or muss. Bed was great, room recently renovated, bathroom large by NYC standards, and the WiFi was, without exaggeration, the best we ever had in a hotel. The little bar was reasonable, the restaurant next door, Serafina Upper West Side, was overpriced for lunch and terrific for breakfast. Cabs were outside, when not an Uber took three minutes, a great location. Within a five minute walk are dozens of pubs, bars and restaurants, an express subway stop, yet the neighborhood is far less dense than midtown. Bottom line: my wife had stayed there on business, we were there for family, it is now our go-to hotel in NYC. Consider paying for an upgrade if you plan to spend any time in your room, when I stay there for work I enjoy the extr6a space and desk.
user_name:
Michael S
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great atmosphere, I pick this hotel every two years when I travel to the city for work. Great restaurant connect in case you do not want to travel far for good food. A few blocks from Central Park and if you like walking you can walk to Rockefeller center and Times Square.

Wonderful Stay. Great staff. Good location. Staff was so accommodating. Location was very good. Close to Central Park, Museum of Natural History and the Beacon Theater! 20 minute walk down broadway to the Theater District and Time Square. Parking was easy too.

Great experience. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Rooms were clean and not too small. Great access to theatre district. This was a quick trip. Would love to come back and relax with my husband!!

Great bed, great location, tiny room, no natural light, dim lights, horrible shower- probably wouldn’t stay again. Lobby of the hotel is very nice. Staff are quite ignorant and will not provide recommendations and tips. Cleaning could definitely be improved.

We went here for the price and location. It served it's purpose. Industrial modern look. We received free drink coupons but bar was closed. Bummer. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Not over the top but I would go back.

Stayed there for a week, friendly staff and classy lobby and hall; rooms just ok improvable in the bathroom and A/C heating units performance and noise; the fact that they do not offer the classic buffet breakfast was a bit disappointing. Good otherwise.

One night accommodation provided by employer due to pending snowstorm. The hotel is within a 2 block walk from the 7th Ave line #1 train 79th St station. The entrance was located on 77th street between Broadway & Columbus Ave. The lobby contained a small bar and sitting lounge area. Across from that is the check-in desk and a small area where you could sit & plug-in your laptop or devices. The hotel has a hipster vibe to it and the overall decor tends to drift towards a minimalist modern design (clean lines, dark neutral colors). The hotel itself is pretty large (former early & mid 20th century office or residential building), and the layout of the halls and rooms was quite unusual. Lots of turns, nooks and blind corners. The staff was pleasant, and the front desk concierge was extremely friendly and helpful. A voucher is presented for the guest to receive a complimentary glass of sparkling wine or spritzer upon checking in. A nice touch.The room selection varies and the room I was in was probably one of the smaller ones available. My particular room (#1022), was an interior room with a small single window overlooking an alleyway with a clear view of the other rooms across and on either side of mine. Had to keep the blind drawn as anyone could get a clear view of you inside your your room. There was a full length curtain behind the bed's headboard which was used to conceal a bare wall. Room Amenities included:- A single cup Keurig unit, with a small selection of coffee & tea K-cups. - An Ironing board & Iron- An older generation iPod/iPhone compatible clock radio- Work Desk with chair & lamps containing built-in AC power plugs.- Room Safe- Complimentary Magazines- A Large wall mounted Flat Screen TV (access for RCA connectors only. No HDMI.)- Small storage areas for personal items.- Ice bucket & tongs.- Small area for hanging clothing (shared with ironing supplies)Basic Bath Amenities:- Standard tub w/shower & fabric curtain.- Standard toilet- The usual assorted bath toiletries.Other Niceties- Free Guest WiFi in the common areas and guest rooms- Complimentary check-in drink- Across the street from a 24 hour CVS.- Nearby restaurants and stores.- Close to public transportation.Cons:- Some rooms face an alley way with a lack of privacy from other nearby rooms.- Ice and vending machines are not available on every floor. - Building floor plan is like a maze and halls are kinda dark w/muted colors.- Lack of accessible HDMI inputs for Chromecast or Fire Stick devices.Helpful Hints:- Do not get room #1122 under any circumstances unless you like noise. It is located directly beneath the vending machine room and Ice dispensing unit.- Ask for a room that is not facing the interior alleyway as they are usually small and lack natural lighting (must keep the blinds drawn for privacy at all times). Conclusion?Overall, not a bad place to lay your head. The facility were clean (as far as I could see), and well kept. There are enough amenities in the hotel and nearby to make your stay comfortable and the location is great for getting around town. The staff is friendly and helpful and they do their best to make your stay pleasant. A star was taken off only due to the lack of privacy of the alley facing rooms, navigating the odd layout of the hallways and floors and the fact that you have to go to different floors to get ice.

Everything was great, from check in to check out. Rooms are very clean, the staff is very friendly. I highly recommend NYLO to anyone who wishes to stay in NYC. The price was incredibly reasonable as well, though I did get a discount from an online booking site.

My wife and I stayed overnight before heading out on our honeymoon. Vivek went above and beyond. He upgraded our room, sent us a bottle of wine, and gave us a late check-out on the house. The view was gorgeous and the restaurant downstairs had excellent Italian food. The bed was comfortable and we were able to get a good night's rest before another day of travel. We will absolutely stay here the next time we're in town. It's close to the natural history museum too.

If you don't need free Wifi, no problem. If you don't expect housekeeping to refill your coffee and clean your wine glasses, no problem. If you don't need a 24 hr concierge, no problem. We loved walking to our kids' apartment instead of spending so much on taxis. But we face huge cellphone bills.

The NYLO is convenient to the train and situated in a quiet part of the city. It is conveniently located near restaurants and shopping. It is a short distance from midtown. The staff is friendly and the room is clean and spacious for New York,

we continue to come back for the past 15 years. if you need to be on the upper west side, this is the best in the area. The only criticism, is they should replace the very thin, cheap plastic cups with glasses in the bathrooms.

We had a lovely stay with a clean and large room, friendly staff too, quick walk into the ‘center’ and funky decor. The room was large and very clean and the bed was massive!!!! will definitely return!

We stayed for 6 nights and like every other review I will say that the resort fee is a rip off. What made it more disappointing was that we didn’t even get our ‘welcome drink’. On check in and check out we hardly got 2 words out of the receptionist. No final bill either so had to wait until it appeared on my credit card. BUT..... it’s got a great feel to it, it’s in a great quaint area of NYC and easy access to the subway. Rooms are big enough and continue the vibey feel, however 2 days in a row housekeeing did not leave us any towels. Rectified with a call but shouldn’t have to. Would I come again? Yes for the location and feel of the hotel, but I’d have my fingers crossed for a warmer welcome and plenty of towels!

My partner and I came for a weekend visit and immediately were greeted by Ramona at the front desk. She made us feel welcome, special, and started our visit off perfectly. The hotel is lovely and provides for all you need. It's perfectly situated on the Upper West Side and is a stone's throw from Central Park. All in all, NYLO is a small piece of perfection in the big city. And big thanks to Ramona -- she was worth the trip alone!

Loved our stay at the NYLO, can't wait to return to New York and stay there again. Awesome hotel, clean, modern rooms. Attentive and helpful staff. Good amenities and combine that with a great location, close to subway, Central Park, and some of New York's great restaurants; you can't go wrong.

Stayed here for 6 nights for my partners 30th Birthday! Very nicely decorated large clean room! Room was cleaned every day, towels changed etc. Two bottles of water & coffee/tea and cream & sugar left every day too & we had a king size bed which was SO comfy, just perfect when you’ve walked miles. Apart from the obvious traffic outside which you’ve got to expect in NYC it’s very peaceful. It’s about 30 min walk from Times Square but we liked that it was out of the way of the hustle and bustle. Everywhere was easily walkable or by subway stations nearby. Every staff member was very nice & friendly. I decorated the room with balloons and banners on my boyfriends birthday & we got back at night to find a bottle of red wine, some chocolate and a lovely handwritten note from Tasha wishing him a happy birthday which we thought was so so nice! Would 100% recommend this hotel to anyone.

Oh wow what a fabulous hotel!!! We had a magnificent room - 924. It is a huge room, had a bath (yay - perfect after a day in cold, rainy, snowy, windy weather) and a massive super comfy bed! Oh wow. The service from staff was fabulous too - special mention to the super helpful and friendly Ramona who helped sort out our traveller mistakes. We love Nylo NYC. Will recommend it to others we know.

NYLO is right in the heart of Manhattan, close to plenty of attractions, food and other amenities. The staff at NYLO was friendly and knowledge about the area. There was live music on Friday night and plenty of artists jamming in the lobby, without it being loud and overwhelming. It was a great marriage of art and luxury with out being snobby and stuffy. I will definitely be staying again in the future. And the beds are AMAZING!!!

We booked well in advance. Room was quite small and they moved us to another larger room the next day. Everyone was very accommodating and the bed was super comfortable. I love this location and they’ve taken a lot of trouble to make the Roos very appealing.

Most of the times we needed information at the desk, there was one or no person there. The consierge was wonderful on Sunday... there wasn't one Saturday and Monday she was on her phone and disengaged.

I’ve always liked staying at NYLO, but the tactics they use with pricing need to be addressed. There’s a $31/night hotel fee that is not generally included in the online price if you book with a third party. Sometimes it’s included and sometimes it isn’t. It’s never 100% clear. This past trip, I booked through Hotel Tonight and my confirmation said the $31/night fee was included in the booking total. I called the hotel to confirm and was also told by phone that everything was included, yes, if I’d booked with Hotel Tonight. Then, at checkout, they presented me with the bill for the extra fee for my entire stay and insisted it wasn’t included in my original billing total that was already paid. I had to find the original confirmation from Hotel Tonight and they had to check with a manager, who then decided to not charge me, but they would not have honored that if I hadn’t found that email, and the whole thing leaves a bad taste. They should have clear set pricing no matter where you book. What they’re doing now is a bait and switch and you have to jump through extra hoops or be hit with a surprise charge later. It’s not good business practice and not fair to customers. I hope they change this, and until then I’ll default to staying in other places if I can.

We had a great stay at the NYLO! The staff is amazing! We booked through their site and got a phenomenal breakfast package. We had the most delicious lemon ricotta pancakes. The valet parking worked really well. We loved the location of the hotel as well. It was walking distance to the American Museum of Natural History and central park. Great restaurants on Amsterdam Avenue as well. We will definitely stay again at the NYLO!

NYLO certainly exceeded our expectations. Service was good, room was clean, large and quiet. Amenities offered as described. Checkin/checkout was fast. Location is excellent right on Broadway. Also the price was very good for the hotel level.

Although the room, particularly the bathroom, was a bit small, it was clean and comfortable. The location can't be beat. The hotel was an excellent value and we would definitely stay again. It would be helpful if the hotel had a doorman to help you up the steps with your luggage.

I absolutely LOVED the NYLO hotel. I only stayed for 1 night but the stay was great. No charge late check out and the best customer service. I LOVE Rebecca. I called before my stay to make sure things were in order since I was using a groupon. Everything was fine and when I arrived in the room, Rebecca had gifted me a bottle of wine and some chocolates. My husband and I just needed a night away from the kids and it was Valentine's weekend. Loved it. Oh! And we received two free welcome drink certificates for the bar. And the lobby was very nice. I didn't like that one of the doormen thought I was the help of the person who walked in before me but I didn't let him ruin my night. And the broadway view isn't worth the money. But I loved that king bed. AND THE PILLOWS!!!!! I'm actually ordering them online. Again, LOVE Rebecca. Give her a raise NYLO!! She's awesome.

The hotel has a very beautiful and comfortable lounge. Rooms are new and clean, with modern decoration and amenities like a coffee machine. The penthouses are good, just missed the bar. Very well located near, 3 blocks from Central Park.

NYLO offers comfort and all the basic amenities one needs in a city hotel. Basic furnishings, clean and friendly. Incredible value for money. There's a great. Real fast place next door and the bar is welcoming and well-stocked.

Unacceptable unsanitary room conditions and menacing reception staff, 6pm 24 February Check-in. They wanted to register the full names of the family members that were staying in my TWO rooms - claiming “out of precaution for my safety” (this is after I told them they were members of my family). When I arrived to my room I noticed hairs inside the closet, mold in my shower, an unclean shower glass door with marks of shampoo and other soaps, and a brown mark on my toilet. This is supposed to be a high end hotel in the upper west side, but the standards applied remind me of a motel. Save your money and go to a one star hotel.

Great boutique hotel, close to Central Park and Upper West Side destinations. Nice room, affordable prices, great bar and friendly staff. My only beef would be the concierges, who were remarkably uninformed about nearby restaurants and services.

Great vibe compared to mid-town; beacon theater, Bloomies outlet, many restaurants like Carmines, Serafina, nice urban feel to the lobby, close to Central Park and museums. Quiet room, which is unusual.

I love this hotel and have stayed here often. The hotel lobby/reception/bar have a great vibe and are a perfect gathering spot. I have found the service variable, but it won't put me off staying here again.

Can’t say enough good things. Such a wonderful place if you want privacy or space to engage. Such great staff. Anything you need they will try to help. We ate at both restaurants and they were delicious. Seraphina will deliver to your room.

Our room (410) was huge-junior queen queen, clean, modern. Same with the bathroom. With the size of the room, off that there was no fridge. Unfortunately, it was not well sound-proofed to the street. Our room faced the fire station and was incredibly noisy. I would definitely stay again, same size room, different part of hotel.

I specifically asked for a high floor, in addition I had confirmed a late arrival. We ended up in a small alley view room (222) on the second floor - that I highly doubt was a superior king room vs a regular king. When my wife opened the closet door to hang her coat a large cockroach ran out which I was barely able to kill. The room was noisy from the guests upstairs - zero sound proofing. In addition, there was VERY little hot water at 9AM.

NYLO is a somewhat idiosyncratic hotel. It is not focused on families or kids (although they do show up as guests and appear happy). Most of the guests appear to be singles or couples. It is an easy subway ride (79th St and Broadway) to and from Lincoln Center (on the 1 train), and also to the attractions on and around Broadway in midtown (and as far as South Ferry). The place is well kept and clean, but the rooms are not large, but adequate. Shopping in the immediate area is also idiosyncratic (Zabar's is a few blocks away, for example) but Columbus Circle is a quick ride away (or a decent walk). We have used this as our usual hotel in NYC for quite a number of years, and found that it fits our needs.
user_name:
BobFran_11
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Stayed one night but was very impressed. Clean modern rooms with updated and roomy bathroom. The bed and pillows were unbelievably comfortable. The staff overall was very pleasant and professional. Wish we stayed longer.

A adjacent room had a barking dog which the hotel couldn’t resolve for hours. Apparently they are a dog daycare because after 2.5 hours of barking it was revealed the owner wasn’t in the room. Ruined the night.

Great hotel in the heart of NYC with the crowds of Times Square! Jessie at the front desk was very welcoming and helpful! The lounge in the lobby offers is a nice place to unwind after a busy day. The neighborhood has great shopping and restaurants...WTP Theatre is practically next door. Enjoy NYLO!

Love my stay at NYLONY, it was my third time, this one for a family trip instead of work, but it was great. Staff super friendly and ready to help, and it felt like home. A great place to be with teenager kids, with your couple or for work.

Our stay at NYLO was fine. The location is great, with quick access to the 1 train, reasonable walk-ability to others (B,C,2,3), conveniently across the street from a 24-hour CVS and within a 10 minute walk of many many restaurants. The standard room was quite small, but very clean. New sheets must be requested. My ONLY gripe about this hotel was the resort fee. $31 per day that covers two bottles of water and internet. I wouldn't mind paying it if it covered more.

This is a reasonably priced and brilliantly located hotel with friendly staff. The public areas are not large, but are nicely decorated and include a great bar which has an engaging team of live entertainers including the excellent singer, Nina Blue on Friday nights. My only gripes are (a) the 'resort fee' of $30 plus taxes which include one free cocktail whether your stay is for one night or five, a PC printing facility and not much else (who needs free calls these days?) Come on guys, there isn't even a pool. And (b), the website advertises the basic king room with a picture of a much bigger room. Make no mistake, if you book a basic room you will get a bed and no seating which is very different from the picture. I would have booked the bigger room had I known. Anyway, these are head office issues - local management and crew are great with a special mention for George!

Great place to stay for a night out in nyc. Clean rooms and pretty quick check in at the 77st location. Wish they had a 24 hr cafe but rhen again we are in nyc so that is available just across the street

We stay here often. NYLO is walking distance to Lincoln Center, to Central Park, to the Metropolitan Museum and the Natural History Museum. The location is convenient (2 short blocks to the subway stop). The restaurant on-site, Serafina, has good Italian food. The in-house bar is friendly with a nice ambiance.

I travel to NYC from Nashville each month for work. I always stay at NYLO--this hotel is the perfect location, has the friendliest staff, the most comfortable bed, and an affordable price. I will never stay anywhere else!

Had a great time, stayed for only one night. Didn’t want to go home lol. Excellent staff and room was spotless and comfortable. Maybe the bar could stay open later. When we returned, it was closed....

I would give NYLO a perfect rating if only my room hadn't been on the air shaft at the very end of the hallway. Don't get me wrong -- I will stay there again and again, and it's my own fault for being unwilling to upgrade for a few bucks. Lovely quiet room (small like all NYC hotel rooms), friendly staff and bar, good service. My new favorite NYC hotel.

NYLO was a great location as my office is on the Upper West Side. Clean but basic room but that's all I really need when I'm in town for work. Attached to Serafina and they deliver to the room which is awesome when you are wiped from a long day of work. Will definitely be back.

I have stayed here many times and love it so very time. The rooms are unique and the service is xcellent. Honestly they have the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in too! Live jazz in their very cool lobby. Penthouse rooms with terraces overlooking the river. Good restaurant on the premises and the best neighbor hood too! I feel very comfortable recommending this hotel. It's hip, fun, and a great xperience.

Lovely hotel and wonderful service. Visited in February and very reasonable rates. Queen rooms are very small but fine for one person. i upgraded to a King room and it was perfect. Beds are very comfortable and room was quiet. Excellent housekeeping service. When I called for an extra blanket or towels it came within minutes no matter the hour. Location has easy access to Columbia campus and one block away for Levain Bakery. I have stayed at all the upper westside hotels and this one is the best. I will definitely return.

I just got back from a wonderful stay at NYLO NYC. I have been staying at this hotel for over 10 years and in the past I have found not everyone at the front desk was always welcoming. Not this time. The front desk could not have been more welcoming and helpful especially Amado in the morning and Jennifer in the afternoon. The hotel is a very comfortable and a great location especially if you want to be near Central Park. I definitely recommend this hotel

Excellent staff, location and restaurant. Will return. Rooms lack sufficient lighting and counter space in the bathroom. Plumbing was slow and clogged, requiring several visits by the hotel engineer. Moved to upgraded room but same deficiencies were evident.

Great hotel in an awesome location, a short walk to Central Park and the busier spots. We had a decent size double room with the most comfortable bed. Staff were also very friendly and helpful, great breakfast too.

Very comfortable, reasonably priced hotel on the Upper West Side. This was my second visit. First stay was near perfect. Small comments I’d have about #2 visit - Front desk staff at check-in was a bit smug and not as helpful as on my first trip. Great staff when I checked out. Service in the restaurant on visit #2 was really slow - food was excellent. Overall very good experience at the NYLO

I made a reservation but had to cancel. When I saw I was charged $240+ for a no-show, I contacted them by email. No response. I called and was told I would hear from someone within 24 hours. No response. I filed a dispute with my credit card company. They did respond to them and said I had two reservations and only cancelled one. They also claimed they had contacted me when they did not. Very bad customer service. I’m out $240+. In the future I plan to stay at the Beacon or Bellclaire, both nearby, where I can be assured of good customer service.

Great location! Good amenities! Good shower & nice towels! Coffee was great in the morning! I enjoyed the live jazz on Friday night! Liked the hotel bar! Good restaurant in hotel! Easy access to public transportation!

Came here for business - our CEO won't stay anywhere else while in Manhattan.> Staff - very polite, friendly and helpful. As an example, a colleague asked for the concierge to refrigerate some medication - a few minutes later a mini-fridge arrived at his room.> Location - at 77th and Broadway - enough said> Sitting area and bar - great ambiance. Warm and comfortable. Free drink voucher for each night's stay.> Room - Clean, neat and very comfortable. Large flatscreen, Keurig coffee maker with all the accessories, iron, alarm, safe. Matching furniture. Nice interior design.> Cost - about $100 a night? Wow.

We stayed for a quick weekend trip to NYC, four nights. Pros:- Beautiful lobby- Affordable- King size bed was extremely comfortable- Located close to the red line subway- Walkable to Central ParkCons:- Lots of noise. You hear everyone slamming their doors at all hours of the night. We could hear the room two doors down from us being loud/ having a party during the night. Housekeeping arrives extremely early and are loud. At one point there was even a group sitting in the hallway being loud to which we had to call down to the front desk. This hotel does attract a lot of young “hipsters”. The lobby can also be pretty noisy itself, with people walking around, pacing, loudly on their cellphones. - No water pressure. The shower, while nice, had very low water pressure. Think of the Seinfeld episode. - Bathroom sink – it was either extremely hot or cold, no in-between. - No view – we had a view of apartment windows. - Fake décor – online it looks like you will be staying in a stylish room with exposed brick. The exposed brick is actually wallpaper. Yes, wallpaper of brick. - Hidden charges. Our reservation had an “urban fee” of $27/night to cover water in the room, Wifi, etc. When we checked out, the fee increased to $31/night for all four nights. The weird:- On our last night, we came back and the cleaning staff had emptied all of our garbage into my shopping bag and left it in the middle of the floor. Thankfully none of the items in my shopping bag were damaged, but this was unacceptable behavior. The hotel management sent up a bottle of wine as an apology and two complementary breakfasts for use at the adjacent restaurant. Unfortunately, the breakfast tickets were useless as they refuse to accept them after 11am and our check-out was 11am. The hotel management did not indicate the stipulations on the tickets, nor did it say anything on the ticket itself. The entire apology was null and void given the increase in the “urban fee” covered the bottle of wine they gave us, and the breakfast tickets didn’t work. Overall I would not recommend this hotel unless you are trying to hopefully save a buck, don’t mind noise, and keep your shopping purchases locked up in your suitcase.

Good staff. Typical NYC (smallish) room but decent. Mattress is on soft side (if you like that). No view - unless you like looking into someone’s apartment. Lots of banging doors in hallway which was annoying.

Clean, small room in a great location on the upper west side. Price is very good. I only stayed here one night, but I was very satisfied with my room and the price I paid. Close to subway stop and good restaraunts.

The room was very clean and comfortable. The heater was noisy so kept it off at night. When we asked for another blanket, it was delivered right away. The customer service was great any time we called the front desk from the room phone. Loved the live entertainment in the lobby on the weekend. I was disappointed that the welcome drink voucher was very limiting and was only good for two drink options that I did not care for. Wish it would have covered a simple beer or glass of wine. Serafina, the attached restaurant, has some serious management and customer service issues. Half-way through my stay, the full NY style breakfast service was changed from a 7am start time to 8am. When I arrived for breakfast after this change, there was no explanation or apology offered, just coffee and a croissant. The bus boy delivered the message and said I can speak the manager - the young woman huddled in the corner of the bar with her coat on looking at her cell phone. She reluctantly came to the table and said she was notified that morning via a phone call about the change. All we were offered was coffee and 1 croissant each. After overhearing another customer order the yogurt option (full bowl of yogurt with granola and fresh cut strawberries & blueberries) I had them take back the measly croissant basket in exchange for the yogurt option. If there were other options than just the croissant basket, why didn't the manager offer them? One of the reasons I love this hotel is for the full breakfast option at 7am so I can be on my way to the metro by 8am. The very poor service at Serafina was extremely disappointing.

Found this originally on Groupon, then went on line and found a better price a few weeks before. Upgraded King Suite Broadway view, not sure if the room is bigger than the other king room, but the view was nothing.Bedding very nice, decor, chic.Lobby area very cool, couches to chill, cozyVery nice, and it can with two glasses of Sparking wine, all for about $150, including taxes.Great location, a block from all the bars on Amsterdam

Great location,I have arrived after a very long flight the front desk was super nice , prompt room service helpful concierge fantastic rooms clean classygreat staffloved the wine list on the bar, professional and well planned - enjoy good wines with all kind of price ranges. loved it !

Nice hotel, with good amenities, and a friendly staff! Onsite gym, free wifi, and lounge / bar area for relaxing after work. Rooms were clean, beds are comfortable. Upper west side location has you near multiple subways as well, making it easy to get around.

We have been to the Nylo many times and it is a great hotel in a wonderful location. I specifically want to compliment Kamilla, a manager there. She is amazing, helpful, and available when there is a question or concern. She is an asset to management! Looking forward to our next visit.S.G

I stayed here for two nights on business and it was great. The hotel has a nice vibe and friendly staff. I got upgraded to a suite on a high floor. The view was spectacular and the room was quiet and super comfortable. I stay frequently at higher end hotels and this came close. A few issues - the heat in the room did not work very well so the room was cold. And the heat is noisy. The doorperson was often hard to find. And for some reason they do not supply glasses in the room - only paper cups.

We booked our out-of-town wedding guests at the NYLO, and it turned out to be a great choice for a group. The ground-floor bar and lounge area is much larger and more comfortable than what we found in other hotels in this neighborhood, making it easy for our guests to congregate and visit. We held a cocktail reception for about 50 people in the attractive Library Room. Several of our guests remarked that they thought the beds were comfortable, and they were all pleased with their rooms and the service. The location is very convenient, and there are several good restaurants and bars a short walk from the hotel, including Nice Matin, Jing Fong dim sum, and the venerable Dublin House.

The location and staff of NYLO are always welcome when I return to New York. Beyond that, the beds cannot be beat for comfort and I love the bathrooms (althogh I do have to say the shower pressure in my room was below what the NYLO usually offers). I enjoyed the Sarafina breakfast more than once. And finally, my vacation trip turned into a business trip unexpectedly, so I was loving the hi-speed Internet in my room and in the lobby.

We love NYLO and stay there every time we head to the city. The rooms are comfortable and reasonably sized (for NYC especially!). The staff are helpful, and the location is perfect for exploring the UWS and the rest of NY. We were able to book the room on Cyber Monday, after receiving an email about low promotional rates for the new year, so we stayed longer than usual and had a great time. Thanks, NYLO!

I judge a hotel on 4 things- location, cleanliness, comfort, and hospitality. This hotel checked all of the boxes and I was not disappointed. The rooms aren't fancy but they were certainly comfortable and clean. I would recommend this hotel to all!
user_name:
Karen M
Fort Worth, United States

review_body: watch what u pay for -sometimes its not totally worth it....been there before and was overwhelmed and this time it was not as good, bartenders were a bit not good--talking and ignoring very into themselves but overall I still like the place
user_name:
kevin s
Ocean Beach, New York

review_body: Very pleasant staff ! I couldn’t have been happier as it feels like a family enviorment and the most caring attentive staff I have come across in New York City hotel. The downstairs is charming and very cozy, as is the bar area with great seating!

Clearly a grey location but hotel condition and especially rooms’ require significant attention by management including with regards to: heating system, bed linen, bathroom, cleanliness. It used to be better...

Trip was awesome. Everything was close distance. The food, the subway, the shopping areas. There were plenty of activities to do. It’s in the center of everything. Time square and madison square garden was a blast.
user_name:
Nancy L
West Palm Beach, Florida

review_body: this was my second stay at NYLO - love it here. The location is AWESOME - so much just on the same block of the hotel in terms of restaurants & workouts...and so close to the subway. The hotel is clean, the staff is friendly, and the bed was so comfortable! Will definitely stay here again.

Excellent. Great staff and service. Fantastic beds. I really like the location on the UWS and the new bar and redone lobby really adds a nice touch to a hotel that I've liked for a long time. Strong recommendation.

Bathroom needs a little updating, pretty good location between broadway , columbus and Amsterdam area near a major museum...Cool lobby bar and lounge that seem to attract people to drink and talk...Front desk and bag assist people were very friendly as well...For a mid range price point, NYLO is a good place to stay

NYLO is a very nice boutique hotel with a great bar. The hotel is also in a great location on Broadway and the rooms are very comfortable. Compared to other NY hotels the price is right. We would definitely stay here again.

Excellent King Penthouse stay very comfortable with excellent view of NYC. Staff was friendly and the location a few blocks away from central park and the metro trains 1, 2 and 3 make this a must stay hotel in NYC.

This will be my go-to hotel when visiting Manhattan. The price was great; the suite -- with two balconies -- was lovely; and the service was generous. We were in town for my father's funeral at Riverside Chapel, just one block away. We had a post-funeral reception at Serafina, which is attached to the hotel. Everything was great -- considering the occasion.

We wanted a reasonably priced hotel near the museums and attractions we wanted to see in New York. We lucked out and found NYLO! We were welcomed and cared for during our entire visit. The hotel has a busy, fun lobby/bar/seating area with quiet, restful rooms above. There’s a good restaurant attached to the hotel to make meals easy if you’ve worn yourself out sightseeing. We liked the modern decor of the rooms along with their cleanliness and comfort. Staff members went out of their way to make our stay pleasant.

If you are staying in NYC for business. This is perfect. It's on the upper west side and surrounded by great places to eat. The area is typically beautiful NYC. I love the decor and the lounge is out of this world

First time to NYC for work. The whole experience st NYLO was great. Arrived several hours before check-in but was able to get into my room early. Courteous staff, nice, clean room, and great central location. Will definitely stay here again!

We had an excellent stay! Jennifer checked us in and she was very welcoming and wonderful! Great first impression and the rest was a delight!We highly recommend this property. Nice welcoming drinks too at the trendy bar.

This review is a little late, but with the everlasting memories we have here, we love to share our wonderful experience and give a special thanks to a ‘fancy’ Ramona who went out of her way to make our proposal night even more special. Our stay in Nylo was simply amazing. We loved the part of Manhattan where Nylo is located: the area is less noisy, dirty and crowded than Midtown, but still super central: just a 10 min walk from Central Park and the Museum of Natural History and a 2 min walk from the subway that brings you everywhere. The lobby and bar have a chill vibe, the staff is super friendly, the rooms are clean and the design is fresh, warm and relaxed. We recommend a room with a balcony if you can, for scenic views over the city with a drink at night. Our stay here was wonderful and it made the day of and days after our engagement even more special and unforgettable. Thanks a lot!
user_name:
picitgood
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location. Helpful staff. Some rooms small but all are clean. Quiet too! Great bar and cozy environment. I stay here whenever I can. Restaurant has good food. All very convenient. Can’t wait to come back.
user_name:
elizabethsC5026WC
New York City, New York

review_body: A very nice hotel. We didnt see many families with kids, but the personnel working at NYLO were more than nice and friendly to us in general and to kids in particular. Great room, we had a street view. Requested the fridge upon arrival and got it in half an hour. Jessie at the reception and George, who helped us with the luggage, were very helpful. All doubts resolved. Our package included 2 breakfasts at Serafina, which is a restaurant next to NYLO, you can go straight there without going outside. Great experience. Would definitely come back and recommend it.

Excellent value. Great location close to shops and restaurants. Subway access is close. Clean. Bath products are nice with a fresh, citrus scent. Welcoming lobby. Great bar, great drinks. Awesome customer service! Staff goes out of their way to offer exceptional service.

One of my Favs when coming to NY. Upper West Side has everything you need. NYLO is in the heart of everything. Coming off the streets into a warm, cozy , Like-home -atmosphere with a cool bar, and often piano player and singers. Great to watch a Sports game too!

Step inside this boutique and beautiful enclave and you transcend a harried and loud NYC. I rarely stay UWS. NYLO Hotel, who are you? Searching last minute and you offer an appealing rate. Appealing indeed. Heated outdoor entrance, door man who opens the door with a smile and hello. How you doin NYLO! So I’m early and Ramona greets me with the biggest smile and sweetest hello, “Welcome to NYLO (ni-lo).” She doesn’t know I’m 10 days and now 5 countries on the road. I was snowed in at Boston. The last flight home canceled. Exhausted, sad I missed one night home to hang with my dog before this overnight to NYC. Cold, coughing and feet aching. Ramona granted my wish and saw that I was tucked into a quiet, 12th floor room. The back of the building - no view and quiet. EXACTLY what this weary guy needed. Thank you NYLO, thank you Ramona. I will be back. #guaranteed.

Wonderful stay at NYLO. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Beds were cozy and bathrooms were clean. Drinks at the bar were delicious and bar tender was awesome! Can't wait to go back and stay at NYLO.

This was my first time staying at NYLO and I had a fantastic experience. The customer service great and Carlos went out of his way to help book me a room with a beautiful view. It felt like a quiet oasis in the heart of the Upper West Side with easy access to all of Manhattan. I highly recommend this artistic, modern and customer-friendly hotel!

I booked penthouse suite directly on NYLO website and requested Hudson river view and early check-in. Although I understand response was 'based on availability but will do our best', reality was I had to wait for 30min before check-in (I arrived at 3:30pm and the room was not ready, only 30min before the official check-in time), had to go back to the front desk to check if the room was available at 4pm, only to learn the room was already available but no one had told me. Also the room (1605) was far from what the picture on website had shown. Yes, it was a suite room (but much smaller than what's shown), yes it had Hudson river view (only partially), yes it had balcony (but only small one at the other side from Hudson which can only look at the other building roof, nowhere near the almost 360 degrees view with large terrace shown on the website). The room still had dust in the living room. The wine at the 1F bar (welcome drink) was awful... one sip and had to leave them. The bed was too soft and had hard time sleeping.

We had a wonderful stay here for three nights. Its great value for money, compared with other places we have stayed in Manhattan, and we loved the atmosphere. Our room was clean and attractive, suffering only from a rather noisy heater (which warmed the room quickly enough so that we could leave it off most of the time) and cold floors. It was surprisingly quiet otherwise. Staff were friendly and helpful, and we enjoyed the welcome drink and the bar. There is a library area across from it which is quieter if you want to converse. Will certainly stay here again.

Highly recommended! Great boutique hotel with character and clean/quiet rooms (simple, but everything you need). Perfect location for staying in/around Upper West Side, but also convenient for other parts of Manhattan.

OK, just so cold and business like: as far as human quality well...The bathroom needs some kind of heat in room 719: It was freezing there. And in the bedroom itself, the thermostat was not working and had to be repaired while I waited with my coat on.

An excellent stay for business - the hotel is well-located, many exceptional restaurants nearby. Door staff, bellman, desk staff (Jessie!) and housekeeping are all great. We like 8th floor with Neri who does a great job keeping the room clean.

The Lobby is very inviting and has good spaces to meet up with friends, have a drink, or catch up on social media, play a game etc... The Free breakfast deal is very good. Great Breakfast in the restaurant. The room is underwhelming. It is small and minimally decorated. The only chair was a desk chair and it was broken and would go back to the floor if not careful. We had zero view. Luckily we only slept here and did not plan on a romantic setting. The bed was very comfortable and cleaning and front desk service was good. I have found much better rooms in NYC for similar price. Love the lobby, room not so much

This is a great location for west side activities. Simple hotel - clean, good internet, no room service but this in Y, large tvs, enough outlets in most but not all rooms which is a major plus for it. Beds are a bit high off floor I noticed for the first time so that might be a challenge for some guests... Comfortable enough to work in but not fancy rooms for most part. Rooms vary considerably in size from tiny to large and the layout can be cramped so if you are not happy with first room ask for another. but remember this is NY where most hotel rooms are very small- most rooms are big enough. Some have showers and some have baths. View on street side is better but a bit noisier if that matters to you. Over the years, service has decline a bit -- long lines for front desk, need to request things several times, inconsistent wake up calls but it still is reasonable good hotel in NY especially if you need to be on UWS. Zabars and Fairway are nearby as is a great coffee shop Irving Farms is nearby. Pharmacy across the street etc. The patio in the summer is great. Bar downstairs is noisy and expensive so better to go to nearby bars. I have been coming here regularly for years but over the years the service has been declining. If you want a lot of service and attention this is not the hotel for you.
user_name:
ElanaN19
New York City, New York

review_body: Overall, my favorite hotel in NYC. Great location and vibe. I've stayed at the NYLO many times and always look forward to returning. Even the restaurants around this hotel are good and both the park and Lincoln Center are close by.

This was a wonderful location and hotel. The rooms were clean and no carpet! However it was quite noisy in the morning in the hallways with doors banging and voices. Couldn't hear the outside streets though. Very nice staff, we just like to sleep in a little when on vacation and that was hard to do!

When I tell you this hotel doesn’t lack in quality I’m not lying. The amazing staff made sure the rooms were always clean and reception a massive help went to New York for my mothers birthday and was told local bakery’s which could make a cake in the sort town frame. Rooms have a hair dryer in no need to bring one. Stayed in a double twin room with my sister which meant we both had a double beds whereby so comfy and warm air con loud at night but hotel is next to a fire department and from coming from the uk it sounded like screens the hotels location is a plus at the same time as this though meaning that a subway is close and metro cats are a must for a week travel around the corner from a dunk-in doughnuts and a Victoria secret. Amazing hotel and amazing service would stay again.

A very nice, clean, friendly place, with funky appointments. But they add a $37 charge to use wifi, which is required! So the low price listing is really not true. If I had known that would have kept looking. Was disappointing there was no refrigerator in the room. Very close to Lincoln Center, which is where we were going.

Specifically came because I saw a review online about the Willy Wonka themed cocktails.. walked in, sat ourselves and after ten minutes of no service I walked up to the bar.. stood on one side for five minutes before walking to the other side hoping for more luck - no such luck. Found the waiter who followed us back to the table and took our order (I would have left but we came out of our way to try these cocktails). The man was quite pleasant, however too little, too late. We finished our one and only drink and then left.

Very stylish boutique hotel with spacious rooms (for NYC). Easy walk to subway and short ride to midtown attractions. Modern design in rooms. Double queen suite was nice for the price. Great Italian restaurant (Serafina) connected to the lobby. I’ll be back.

We come to NYC several times a year from just outside in Connecticut. We need to stay connected to the city where we met some 30 years ago. Coming to NYLO offers us a great location, close to subways, the park, museums, superb restaurants, one in particular directly across the street Mille Fuille, is great for that First coffee of the day. NYLO has superb staff in every way. Very cool laid back industrial decor, great sitting areas, nice bar. Rooms exceptionally clean, climate controlled by you the guest. Just overall a great experience. Prices can be a little on the high side at times, but worth every penny. Never hesitate to reserve at NYLO.

We had a great stay. The location was perfect for our weekend activities. We had s superior king room and it was large. The beds were super comfortable. The service was extraordinary. Everyone was kind, helpful and quick to respond. Thank you!

Love it! Location is wonderful. Clean and cozy and cool. Will stay again. Was with daughter for College auditions. Bed was heavenly. Special hotel! Loved the layout and the cozy downstairs spaces. Nice design touches as well.

Spent a long weekend at this hotel. Bar and lobby seems geared to a young local crowd - candy inspired cocktails - and is busy on weekend nights. Front desk staf friendly and helpful as are the floor staff. Rooms are smallish with a modern/industrial decor. GREAT bed and lighting. Reasonable price for a great location.

The staff was helpful and informative. The restaurant Serafina's was alright. We were delightfully surprised that there was no need for earplugs...our room was on the 2nd floor and we heard no street noise. The common rooms on the main floor were quite cold but there was plenty of comfortable seating. We used the Business Center computer/printer for our boarding passes - process went smoothly. Overall, we were very impressed as this is an affordable, well-located hotel in Manhattan.
user_name:
LivingCreatively
Truth or Consequences, New Mexico

review_body: I've stayed at the NYLO twice now, both times were wonderful. Comfortable loft-style rooms and great location away from the madness of Midtown. You can also request a refrigerator be put into your room. Staff goes above and beyond to make your stay pleasant. Higher floors not facing Broadway are quiet. The lofts with terraces overlooking the Hudson River are a special treat, but regular rooms, even the Queen size ones are lovely.

After a long tedious journey we were greeted by a lovely helpful lady on the front desk, not only did we get welcome drinks but also vouchers for complimentary cocktails. That was a lovely touch.The room was absolutely fine, spacious enough and same for the bathroom. We couldn't fault it. Also free wi fi and a coffee machine helps!The hotels location is great and we walked everywhere from it. The staff everywhere were so warm and helpful to our questions, recommending somewhere to eat one evening, advising on how best to get down town for a very early start one morning, even on our departure when we had a panic after our tour operators organised transfer failed to show up and they organised a driver to take us to JFK. Which was a lot more comfortable.Could not fault it it for what we wanted and we will certainly recommend to any of our friends looking for a hotel in NYC.Hopefully we will return one day thank you.

I've already stayed here numerous times and this hotel is in a great location uptown - close to Museum of Natural History & Central Park. Has a great vibe, nice common areas - but keep in mind the actual rooms are small and very minimalistic, if you're ok with that, this is a nice place to stay.
user_name:
Craig K
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband and I were in town for one night to celebrate his 50th!
