NYLO was the perfect locale- and free drinks ( for a pre-event cocktail!), free water, a cozy room with modern appointments, a cozy lobby we settled into the next morning as we had time to kill before a flight. We could see the sunset over the Hudson from our room!

I had a great two-day stay at NYLO. Was in NY for work, arrived very early, and an early room was arranged on the spot, no extra charge. People were great. Loved the cocktail included in service fee! Only issue: loud heater, but I think it could have been worked out--I had to rush, and didn't bother asking about it, didn't keep me up at night. Would definitely stay here again. My room was in back, not on Broadway, so not sure about the traffic noise factor.

In upper west side so convenient and lots of places to eat nearby. Room was not very clean, towels were stained, housekeeping inconsistent, would replace only some towels. Staff were friendly and nice common area.

Overall, Nylo is an excellent choice when visiting the upper west side of Manhattan. Don't miss Serafina, where a terrific breakfast comes with your room. On the downside: the desk staff & the doorman are missing some of the character that was a given when NYLO was On the Ave.

The hotel was located near central park and Subway.This made for an easy run in the am. It was near food and the bar downstairs was lovely. The upper west side is my favorite place to stay in NYC. The staff was so friendly I felt like I was down south!

Great stay at NYLO - pleasant and helpful staff, clean rooms, fun bar/lounge. The beds are comfy but a bit soft for my taste and really that is the only thing I would improve. Close to Central Park, Riverside Park, & Subway stops that take you everywhere else you want to go!

Good hotel in a great area. Only has a basic fit out but at the price is what you would expect. Overall service was good, particularly from the cleaners though bar staff were not overly helpful. Does have a gym but be warned it is the size of a shoe box and not very well appointed. Comfortable and quite and good access to subways, central park and many good places to eat and drink.

This is a great boutique hotel within walking distance to fabulous restaurants, museums, shops, and the subway. It has an eclectic vibe in the lobby and bar area containing everything from a red baby grand to a chess board. The room was a good size for a NYC hotel and the bed was super comfortable. Everything was very clean and well-maintained. The temperature was easily adjustable. Room was quiet and well-appointed. However, the best thing I can say about this hotel is the incredible service. I experienced an issue at the very end of my stay and the manager - Maggie Z - responded quickly and went over and above to address my concern. Would put this at the top of my list for my next stay!
user_name:
Jennifer F
Metro Minneapolis-Saint Paul, Minnesota

review_body: We have been staying at NYLO for years. It’s a great location for Central Park and the Met. Love the Broadway view deluxe king rooms. Everyone at the front desk is so friendly, Ramona especially is really helpful. We’ll be back again soon!

When we first arrived late Saturday afternoon, I felt like I walked into a speakeasy...There was a lively buzz about the lobby including lots of people congregating in the living room-like seating area and the bar was full. The room was more spacious than most NYC hotel stays that I can recall over the last few years. It was modern, cozy and unique. I stayed on the 7th floor and heard absolutely no street noise and minimal noise in the halls (although that is a wild card depending on your neighbors). You can easily hear conversations as people pass by your room. The best part of the stay was the most incredibly comfortable bed....It was heaven on earth and I had the best night’s sleep in ages. I would stay here again without hesitation.

There was nothing I didn't love about this hotel. It's a reasonably large property that on entry successfully manages to create a boutique, cozy atmosphere. Perfectly located between two sub-way stations it's also still a comfortable walk to mid-town (15 to 20 minutes). The rooms are well appointed and comfortable (beds are great), they are a standard NY size - but you're not in NY to sit in your room! I was on a hybrid business/leisure trip and found the desk set up and wifi connection in the room to be sufficient to accommodate a few hours of work. The downstairs bar creates the illusion of being in your upwardly-mobile-friends-loft-equiped-with-bar-and-comfy-sofas, without being in any way pretentious. And there where some pretty creative cocktails coming out of that bar- if Wonka's did cocktails these guys are inventing them. The staff are genuinely friendly and accommodating. It's a great location for experiencing the upper-westside with lots of local bars and restaurants within easy walking distance and the vibrancy of a diverse neighbourhood. I loved it and would definitely stay again.

We stayed here late September early October 2017. With out a doubt this hotel was worth every penny we paid. The decor around the communal areas was fun and quirky. There was also lots of staff around who were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean quite and modern, the bed was sooo comfy it was difficult to get up some days! Ben and Henry at the bar were a lot of fun and had an extensive knowledge about the local area. By far the friendliest person (in a hotel of friendly people) was Chris behind the main desk. From the moment we arrived he was friendly and welcoming and made us feel like we were friends staying over rather than guests. We got married during our stay and returned to the hotel to find champagne chilling in our room, it’s things like this which set this hotel apart. The location of the hotel was perfect, two streets over from Central Park, lots of little eatery’s dotted around and a lazy stroll down Broadway into Manhattan proper. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my family which is the highest accolade I can give it. I have no doubt we will visit New York again soon and I wouldn’t dream of staying anywhere else. Nat & Rach x

Stayed here for 6 days with my daughter and young grandson. The location was perfect for visiting with friends and family and sightseeing. We were within walking distance to Central Park, Columbus Circle and the Holiday Market and the Museum of Natural History. Close to the subway and the doorman was happy to hail a taxi when needed. The rooms were clean and beds very comfortable. Room was big enough to accommodate the crib we requested. The staff was absolutely amazing. Each person we interacted with took customer service to the next level. Always helpful with the toddler and stroller. Only downside was there was no way to warm a child’s bottle but the restaurant next door was happy to help. Also the WiFi service in our room would not work, even with assistance from the tech staff. Jessie did refund a portion of the daily fee to compensate for that.I have already booked this location for a girls trip in the end of April and am looking forward to my return.

While the 4pm check-in time is quite late, the rooms are nice. The wi-fi connection does not work 100% of the time - I had to constantly go into my wi-fi settings and select the connection each time I picked up my phone. The bed was really comfortable and there was more than sufficient storage and hangers in the room.

Great spot on upper west side. Price is terrific, staff super nice, rooms are nice, clean and the beds are so comfortable with great linens! We always stay at NYLO, and feel like they know us when we return!

The reservations and booking process is a scam. Its described as 4-star, more like a 2. The rates show breakfast option, but it's not available, we were told later, if booked on 3rd party website. THis is a boutique style hotel without an ounce of charm, appeal or service. NY at Christmastime is hectic and expensive, we are all aware, but if your hotels don't want the tourists, just say so up front! The hotel is dark, cramped and dirty. Three different individuals at the concierge desk were unfriendly and absolutely should not be in the hospitality business. There is a nice gameroom for kids or leisure board games, etc, but The elevators are very slow, and smelled horribly. A janitor with a filthy bucket got in the elevator along with guests at breakfastime. Worst of all is the complete lack of business and organization, in the check-in/out especially. We received no statement upon checkout, and the rate/fees presented at check-in were not what was charged to my card. No help in resolving over the phone, if you do stay here, beware of the so-called taxes and fees on top of the taxes and fees you see at check-in.

The handle to our shower came off. In the course of trying to attach it, the bathroom flooded - which would have been fixable, but throughout re-affixing the handle while standing in cold water, it became clear that there was actually no hot water. This was not fixed before we needed to check out. We were slightly compensated for the inconvenience of no shower.

The "doorman" stood by the front desk chatting instead of standing near the door. It felt very clear that none of the staff cared about their jobs at all. When I asked about the parking valet (I discussed parking with the reservation staff) the Concierge pointed to a sign that said Concierge and would not help locate a member of staff who could assist with parking. I had reserved a junior suite with 2 queen beds and since I was arriving at 10:00am, I had paid for the room for the night before I arrived. Upon arrival my junior suite was not available and I was given 2 queen bed rooms instead - despite being charged for a suite the night before! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Clean! Friendly! Great location! We were very pleased with our stay. The rooms are smaller than they appear in the pictures but that didn't impede upon the enjoyment of our stay. Lots of great restaurants nearby.

The NYLO hotel is situated at Upper West.Close to the subway stations for trains A , 1,2 and 3. Very practical and close to Central Park and Colombus Circle. The rooms on Broadway side are very calm and comfortable.Service is correct, rooms are clean and the rates are reasonable for NY standards.Highly recommended!

good hotel, near metro and in front a market open 24 hours, beautiful and space room, we was in 4 in deluxe, service and wifi all ok. Near Central Park and two very important museum, in 20 minuts you can go by foot too to Times Square

Came to NYC because we had a wedding to attend in Philly over the New Years Eve. The NYLO cam recommended by some friends. Loved the location of the hotel, because it was far from the tourist part of NYC. Room was nice and clean. The Hotel has a different theme every 3 months I believe. The theme for now was "Candy", etc. they played music associated with candy and made drinks themed from Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory movie. We had no real issues with the room or staff. Our stay was during the Bomb Blizzard of 2018 that ripped through the North East. The hotel was warm as well as the room. Hotel is several blocks from Central Park as well as the American Museum of Natural History, Subway and great restaurants! Not to mention there was a CVS right across the street in case you needed anything. When we return to the city, we plan on staying again!

I've booked this hotel for my winter holidays in New York. The hotel is located in a excellent area, very close to the underground (72 and/or 79 st of the red line). The room wasn't so clean, dust was evident above the bedside table; the radietor for the hot air makes lot of noise, ever during the night; the cleaning service didn't change our towels, even if we left them on the floor, the just folded them. I would reccomend this hotel only for the position.It doens't deserve 4 star.

We arrived extremely late due to a transportation delay (about 2am). Do call if you will arrive that late as they only hold rooms till midnight without notice. Staff was very friendly even when we were cranky on arrival. Check in and check out were fast and simple. Hotel room is very large compared to others I have stayed at in NYC. Convenient upper west side location is quiet and residential and places the hotel two blocks from the red line on the NYC metro. Hotel has several large gathering/relaxing rooms in lobby. No restaraunt in hotel but one is connected that is open 7days a week. Room had toiletries, hair dryer, and safe. Only wish it had a mini fridge to store leftovers. Decor is contemporary and in good repair. Found it more useful that a traditional dresser.

It's a small boutique style hotel with smaller rooms, but you can't beat the location on the upper west side. We asked for a quiet room and they were happy to accommodate. Friendly service, comfortable bed, clean room and all we needed for our stay. Breakfast at the restaurant lacked variety over multiple days, but was excellent otherwise. You're able to walk to museums, Central Park, etc., all with easy access to the subway.

This is my second time staying at NYLO. I like it because it is clean, the beds are comfortable, friendly staff, reasonably priced, and for us, great location. We like that it is on the subway line 1 and easily accessible. We love to walk so walking the few blocks to central park or 30 mins to Time Square is no problem for us. There are great breakfast and lunch spots nearby, local gyms and late night eats. Chirping Chicken was our favourite. The room we had was small, but not unusual for a boutique in NYC. We will stay again for sure!

I have stayed at NYLO many times and the hotel os great! Staff, hotel and location made my stay very enjoyable. Lenny, the doorman is very friendly and helpful as well as others like Orlando, Jose, George and Robert. The front desk staff, Jennifer, Carlos, Ramona are are welcoming and made my stay very comfortable. Thank you NYLo for doing a great job, I will be staying with you again.

We have stayed at NYLO NYC several times and we’re never disappointed. On this trip we arrived at the hotel at 7:30am from overseas; we were exhausted. Check in wasn’t for several hours. Jessie took care of us and we got the sleep we needed and enjoyed a night out in the City. Excellent customer service, thank you Jessie!!!

We were going to a concert at The Beacon and wanted a place to stay near the venue. NYLO was perfect. The rooms are small but we weren't spending much time there (other than to sleep) . The hotel is located near our concerts, the Museum of Natural History and Central Park. There are two restaurants associated with the hotel and both of the are excellent.

It was very cold in NYC when we were there. The windows in the room were very inefficient and cold. However, we purchased lox at Zabars and we able to keep them cold just by leaning them against the window.

This hotel has a nice bar area and lobby- cozy & chic. The rooms are very clean & quiet. There was not any view from our room and the room was a bit small, with only a desk chair for extra seating. We did sleep well, as the bed & room were comfy.

Lovely stay at the NYLO. The bed, the bedding is absolutely wonderful. The staff helpful with restaurant reservations. Convenient location for us as we were visiting family in the upper West Side.We will return.

We were there at the craziest time of the year for NYC - which we’ve been for the last 11 years - I wouldn’t go to another hotel after this!!! From the time we checked in, to the staff at the bar, to the concierge, Bobby, and even to the other hotel guests - a great place to be! Room was spotless and set up as we needed it to be...can’t wait to go back! Happy New Year NYLO and so glad we came back again!

A reasonable choice for UWS Manhattan but watch out for the semi-hidden charges (Urban Fee, really?). Location is conveniently located on bus and subway. Rooms are nice. Service is as expected. Multiple dining options nearby.
user_name:
William H
New York, United States

review_body: I lived in NYC for 2 years and know where to look for deals and what to expect for room size. I was very disappointed in how tiny the 'Superior' Queen Room was (it was advertised at 300 sq feet but was most definitely no more than 150). They also had me sign a service fee paper upon checking in for $32/day for 2 water bottles per day, the use of the Keurig, the use of the internet and the use of the gym and "Continental Breakfast" which ran from 7-8am only (maybe that would be okay if I were on a business trip and had to head out at 8am, but I was in NYC visiting family for Christmas). I now have a $71 charge to my card after already spending $253/night at NYLO. I was incredibly disappointed in the hidden fees and actually emailed NYLO about them only to never receive a response. The hotel has a great location in the UWS and a beautiful lobby but I would not stay there again.

Trendy but comfortable, with an unbeatable location and a great bar! The rooms are nicely decorated and very clean, the bed was very cozy, and Serafina is right downstairs for delicious Italian food! Will definitely stay here again.

Everything about this property is beautiful we will definitely come back soon!!! However we didn’t have breakfast next we will stop in and check te food out!!!!! It was a great experience thanks for having us!!
user_name:
rochelleb2018
New York City, New York

review_body: Great hotel, clean with a different kind of nice vibe. Walking distance to everything and close by to public transportation. Bar and restaurant on site. will recommend to friends and family. Room was small as expected in NYC but all amenities

Upgraded our room, gave us extra vouchers for the bar when they realized we were missing one of our breakfast vouchers. Very friendly and professional staff. Rooms not as big as they seemed but did not make or break our experience.

Where do I start? How about the room with no heat? Or should I start with no available roll-away beds because the beds got taken by other guests AFTER I originally requested one but BEFORE I reminded them I requested one? Or maybe it was the paper thin walls? Or was it the strange noises in the walls or the fake brick walls?This was a $400/night hotel that acted more like a $150/night motel. Not recommended at all!

This was our 5th long stay (over a week each time) at the NYLO. The friendly staff have always gone out of their way to make sure we are satisfied - when there has been an occasional hitch they have generously compensated for it.

Great hotel, easily accessible from the Subway, CLEAN rooms with very few soft surfaces, NO bedbugs and great cleaning service. All staff we interacted with (front desk, concierge, cleaning staff, bartenders) were wonderful. The bed was very comfortable and all the furniture and appliances seemed new and were in good shape. The room was small but laid-out well and comfortable. Tons of good restaurants nearby and just a couple blocks from central park...great place to stay!

The hotel is directly across from one we usually stay at (but was full when we made a booking) so we tried NYLO. The lobby is a dark, depressing space and no doorman was available to help with luggage which requires going up four-five steps schlepping suitcases. Room was adequate in size and very clean. Will not stay here again.

We checked in 4 days ago for holidays. The hotel is very nice and the location of the hotel is excellent. The room is very nice and comfortable. The only problem was when we checked in, there was something going on with the pos system of the hotel and we had to call the bank but the hotel replied that we couldn't make an international phone call from the reception (which is unbelievable). Thank God Vivek was there a receptionist who gave us his mobile phone to make an international call and solve the problem.

This hotel is now my new goto hotel in NYC. Beds are very comfortable, but they are too high and I could use a stool to get in. Bathroom is a good size. The bathroom amenities are good but would love if they added q-tips to the list. Also toilet paper is a bit rough. They have a Keurig in each room so we can have coffee or tea which is nice. Closet is fine, might be a bit small if I was staying for a long time. Rooms have safes which is a tice touch and you can order a fridge to use in the room. They have a good number of electrical outlets and also plenty of lights so the room is not dark. Each room is different so you never know what to get. They are now giving 2 bottles of water each day. They give you a coupon for a free drink but it is never something I want. This time they said it could be a hot chocolate with alcohol but then the bar said that was not true. Lobby is nice and a good place to relax. Really nice in the summer when you can use the roof lounge.
user_name:
Judithh12
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Chic, convenient, welcoming. A perfect place to stay. Makes getting around New York a breeze. Great neighborhood to stay in. Plenty of good restaurants and shopping, easy to get to the theatre district.

The NYLO is well located. It's lobby has a lovely fun atmosphere and character to it that adds to your NYC experience. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are a little small but compared to other NYC hotels they are similar. The best are very very comfortable.

If you want to stay on the upper West side of Manhattan, Nylo is a convenient fun choice. The bar is always hopping and the staff is very friendly. Rooms overlooking 77 street are sinnuendo with a pretty view.

A better than average $200 per night New York hotel, with a great location and a helpful and friendly staff. A complimentary upgrade to the 12th floor put us high above the city noise, and good nights' sleep were our rewards.

Hotel is in a great location making it easy to get around the City. All staff members were courteous and efficient. We received two tickets for a glass of champagne or hot chocolate...very nice. We’d gladly return.

Would definitely stay here againGreat location, staff was most accommodating, room was well equipped, bed was very comfortable, nice bar and public rooms downstairs, the staff was very accommodating!!

Although the hotel and room were very nice the odor in the elevators and hallway made our stay very unpleasant. The hallway smelled like mildew and caused both my husband and me to get stuffed up. It was fortunate the friends who were supposed to stay at the hotel with us cancelled. They would have immediately checked out

The check in experience was horrible as we were told by front service stuff to check in at 4pm but they checked in other customers in front of us prior than 3pm. We left a valuable item in the room after checked out and we called Lost and Found Department multiple times and have never heard them back. Wonder they took it as Christmas gift? The room has no sound proof so you can hear next door laouderly at night.

Stay was amazing, comfortable, staff was very kind and accommodating. 1 tip the lamp on the desk with outlets on it doesn’t charge unless the light is on! Plugged my phone in there, turned out the light went to bed next day had a dead phone. Lesson learned.
user_name:
Christine H
Dallas, Texas, United States

review_body: Clean, safe, comfortable. Great location. Fun lobby to meet friends. Rooms are very small for price.Front desk staff friendly. Concierge staff are not knowledgeable....ask front desk staff for help. Overall very nice

Lobby bar is nice. Serafina’s is convenient. Personnel are nice but you never know what kind of room you are getting - despite paying for a high category room. Bathrooms are uniformly small. Our king room was so tine with no chair to sit on. But a deluxe category supposedly. This has happened before so we will probably try another hotel on our next trip.

Stayed for 5 nights in a penthouse room. Great Value compared to two other hotels we stayed at during our 15 night trip (Beekman and Library Hotels). Large rooms. Cool balconies. Very happy with this hotel. All complaints were minor.

This is a quirky (good) hotel with a comfortable feel to the public areas . You feel you have dropped into a friends place for a drink with the casual and relaxed feel to the bar and common areas.The room I stayed in was clean and had all basic needs .While small ,it was comfortable and ideal for my short term business needs.The front staff while all helpful varied in their competence to meet needs. One helped me print my boarding card while another through his hands in the air about the prospect of contacting JFK lost and Found.I did find it in the end and by myself but there is no evidence of any intelligent life form there!There is a small gym. Always a must in any hotel where I stay.One problem and it was mine not the hotels most of my meetings were about 30 blocks away and the other side of the park

Had a great experience at NYLO New York. This was our first time in New York. My wife and I wanted to stay relatively quiet and out of the bustle of Times Square/etc yet easy to access all the sites. This was perfect. Subway was a block away and a 5 -15 min ride to any site Times Square/Rockefeller/Empire State Building/911 memorial & museum/etc. We would stay here again.

Once again, we found we couldn't beat NYLO's value and service. Unbelievable price for a pre-Christmas visit. Minutes from the subway, from Central Park, from our favorite deli and restaurants. Minor problems were handled with grace.

The room in general was clean. a plastic cover was lying under the bed and a few mosses of dust remained in the corners of the wall. But these are details that have been seen by picking things up on the floor.

This is a wonderful small hotel near Central Park. The staff was very helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Beds cozy and soft. It is a two-block walk to the subway. Free welcome drinks at the bar.

I always stay here when I can as it's very convenient to where I need to be in the area. Very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are a bit small but comfortable. Minimalistic decor. Bathroom also was a little tight but in general adequate.

The ambiance is stylish and welcoming; the reception, lobby and bar area makes you want to stay at the hotel. The rooms are a good size, very clean and new looking. It's only a few blocks away from Central Park and very close to two subway stops. The area is very family friendly. Plus it's right next door to RedFarm, a wonderful Chinese restaurant. And Zabars is close by, as is the Fairway market. We've stayed twice; this time we were there for a December weekend, and our grandchildren and their parents came in from Long Island to stay at the hotel too. The kids, 7 and 9, as well as the parents really liked their room. We walked the few blocks to the Museum of Natural History. We will definitely stay here again.

This is our home away from home! This time we were two families and several rooms. All my friends from Albuquerque are now clients.... The best beds in any hotel I stayed. Great bar... Good space. Best location

The lobby is hip and really cool. The location is awesome if you want to see Manhattan but not stay in the middle of the action. The hotel staff are great. Rooms are SMALL- tough to walk around beds to be honest. We didn't have heat one night which was tough but it was fixed the next night. Only issue is the bar at lobby looks cool but not great service and not friendly.

We stayed at the NYLO right before Christmas as we often do. It’s a great launching off point for visiting with friends throughout the City. We bring our dog and it is easy to get him adequate exercise between Riverside Park and Central Park. Highly recommended.
user_name:
Megan G
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The only good thing was the comfort of the bed, which was very good. The bathroom was cold and did not appear to have separate heating. The stainless steel sink surround had sharp edges on which I cut a toe. The room decor was dismal and the chair uncomfortable. The staff at the Serafina restaurant were borderline rude and clearly unhappy to have to serve a single. Not to be recommended.
It is by far, the best staff I have ever encountered. Went there for a 4 day trip and getting back to the hotel was the highlight of the day.Excellent place to go and again, the staff is the best!!!!

Perhaps the lounge and reception area are a tad run down, but this hotel has the most pleasant staff I've encountered in the city. We arrived before noon, expecting only to drop off our bags until mid-afternoon, but the receptionist insisted she could locate a room...which she did. Extra towels from the chambermaid when requested were a plus. The rooms are good sized and impeccably clean; the bed (a king) was comfortable and well appointed. Definitely a keeper!

This review is more negative towards the lobby bar than the hotel. The hotel itself was ok. Rooms are very small and dark. When we booked we upgraded to a Superior room - not sure we got what we paid for. When I checked in I told them we were there to celebrate my husbands birthday. The gentleman said they'd be sending something special up. It never came and I did not expect/pay for anything but thought that odd. The real problem was the bartender at the lobby bar. She was a polish woman with blond hair. I only mention her being polish as she announced it to another patron and there was another blond woman who was very nice. On at least 3 occasions, my husband and I found her terribly rude!! On one instance the bar was very crowded and I sympathized with her as she was alone. She had a drink order from 4 girls who required id. Long story short she told us it would be 10 minutes to which we all said fine. Then a couple of guys asked for "candy" which she took care of immediately (although it took her 10 minutes) then she went back and stared at cash register as if she didn't know what she was doing. She then came back to our side of the bar and asked if everyone was waiting to order which we all replied yes. One woman said she was waiting to settle (she had just stepped up to bar) so she took care of her first. She then said again, it's going to be 10 minutes but by this time we were waiting nearly 20 and she hadn't even started the 4 drink order for the girls. After another 10-15 minutes of nothing, I walked away and did not bother ordering a drink. This was not one of her rude moments, maybe inconsiderate.

Every detail was well thought out, the staff was friendly, room fairly roomy, there are several community rooms for a drink TV watching, playing chess, just reading. We loved it. Its location is so close to so many things to do in the area - shopping, Central Park, great restaurants. Look for the quirky baggage elevator to get your luggage up the two steps from the entrance to the lobby.

The concept is young, basic and simple. An exceptionally comfortable bed in a very nicely sized room (811) and bathroom for New York standards.They have a very relaxed and fun bar in the middle of the lobby if you don't want to lock yourself in your room and are the kind of person that like talking to strangers in a hotel bar. The lobby is loud though.The restaurant attached to the hotel serves standard Italian/American food. Ok quality, but a real life saver if you don't want to venture out.The neighbourhood is very nice, and although you are in the Upper West side, getting to Midtown is not difficult and you tend to go against the flow of traffic if you're in town for business or a weekend.A few things can be improved though. The service is efficient, but really dry. Very few smiles, security/porter who stand like statues by the check in counter and the lifts (very unfriendly faces...); Reception staff's behaviour don't really match what I perceived the mood of the hotel to attempt to be... Young, modern, friendly. Maybe that's a New York thing, but I have a real problem with it.Also, I arrived early, around 11:30am, and although my room was available to check in, before the receptionist handed me the keys, she reminded me that she was doing me a favour because of the hotel's policy of charging for early check ins. I thought that was a very cheap shot and not a very savvy way of communicating the hotel policy. Don't like that at all...Another unappealing fact was that if the lift stops at the hotel service floor (2nd or 3rd floor, I don't remember), the doors open to the dirtiest floor you can imagine... dirty walls, old carpets, buckets on the floor... not the best impression.So some management action needed in terms of staff and fixing the look of that corridor/wall on the service floor if potential exposure to guests is unavoidable.Overall, I say anyone should consider this hotel.. You get a lot more for your money when compared to Midtown chain hotels where you are fighting for attention, service and comfort with the millions of other tourists that visit New York. You're close to the Park, a friendly residential neighbourhood, Museums and some decent neighbourhood shops. But keep you expectations balanced in terms of how much of a "boutique" feeling it really has... I felt anonymous as a guest, but sometimes, that's what you want...

This is a cool, hip hotel on the Upper West Side of New York City. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are average size for New York and have all of the tech amenities necessary. It was a fantastic value and located near everywhere I had to go.

Great hotel for special occasions. And why LOL is very clean with responsive and attentive staff. The rooms are comfortable and the location is excellent for those who want to see the city. Thank you very much

Great location, fantastic places nearby, near to subways, the staff is amazing. We highly recommed going down the street to Maison Pickle or Polpette, also the downstairs is very lovely and it seems they have a different theme every once in a while.

Unexpected surprise, the lounge is street accessible and really is fun in the evenings. Rooms and staff are very nice. Very close to subway access, food and other amenities if needed. Nice area of town and can walk to other close by eateries and Central Park.

Found this hotel 2 years ago and have stayed about 8 times since. Modern, clean, great location, a bit funky and not cookie cutter. Rooms are always spacious and the restaurant is fab. They can have really great deals online

We were excited to stay here, because of the location. I used to live on the upper West side, so I am very familiar with the neighborhood here. No complaints in terms of location… But!! The inside/ lobby is very dark, nobody greeting us at the door. Decor is a little odd, but looks much better on their website. Our room was tiny! Let me stress… Tiny!! We had an excellent rate, but upgraded to a "larger room". So, did we get the larger room?? I can't imagine any room, being any smaller! We had one window, so the room was also dark. The hallways or gloomy, narrow, and dingy. I am a New Yorker, through and through… So I can tolerate a lot. But the truth is, if you were going to spend very little time in your room, which we did, don't overpay for this place! Honestly, the only strong point was the location.

This boutique hotel has an excellent location. Easy access to public transportation enabling us to visit all points of interest. Proximity to Amsterdam and Columbus Streets with an array of great restaurants. Room spacious and well appointed with plenty of storage space.

This hotel exceeded my expectations in every way ... luxury, convenience, and attentive staff ... Room service was prompt and deliscous ... DOG friendly and wonderful casual meeting areas ... Could not ask for more !

I enjoy staying at the NYLO for many reasons: it's clean, I like the location, the rooms don't have carpet, the beds are comfortable, the service is generally quite good and the rates are, like all properties in NY dependent on the time of year but, usually reasonable.

While we have stayed at this property perhaps a dozen times, I never felt more unwelcome. I recognize it was the week before Christmas, but there were times I approached the desk clerk for something when clearly they weren't busy, and I felt I wasn't the most important thing he was dealing with at the moment.

Got this reservation on the HotelTonight app. Very good rate, convenient location. As expected, rooms are not spacious, but totally what you would expect for NYC. The room was quiet, clean, and would stay again.
user_name:
ZennBD
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location for access to subway, Central Park, Shopping and Plenty of places to eat (if you want to stay near by). Very quiet/clean area with the Uptown vibe. The staff is very Friendly & Helpful with anything you are needing (Direction, transportation, dinning...etc)

Great place to stay for a great price in NYC. It is hard to find a hotel that is priced affordable in the city and when we went the price was great. I will always check this hotel when going to the city

We really enjoyed our stay at Nylo. It was a wonderful location, close to the subway and museums and Central Park. But, away from the busyness of midtown. The room was clean and comfortable, and the staff was friendly and helpful. Really close or some some great shops and restaurants, too. I would definitely stay here again!

Just came back from a stay at NYLO and loved it. Normally, I don't leave reviews, but I had such a wonderful experience that I think it merit's a few minutes of my time to share. First, the location is amazing on the UWS. Second, the mattress was INCREDIBLE. The most comfortable bed that I have slept in. WOW. Third, I want to congratulate the hotel's manager for the incredible level of customer service from your staff. Special shout out to Danielle and Dwayne from security/mail room, who were so incredibly helpful in helping me deal with a package that arrived after I had departed. They went above and beyond in helping get that package returned. The customer service demonstrated from them and the rest of the staff at NYLO, shows that you guys take customer service to the next level. It was beyond what was expected and made a very positive impression from your hotel. I look forward to returning to NYLO NYC and checking out your additional hotels. They have a very lively bar area, chic/stylish decor and helpful for Shomer Shabbat guests.

Please complement me and my fiancé another stay in your suite . This time , please have toilet paper and Q-tips , and fix your sink problem. And open your outside area . For someone who is a news reporter and critique , this experience was aweful and unexceptible . Over $500 dollars ! I’d expect a well managed hotel.
user_name:
vincenzofU7151MC
New York City, New York

review_body: Shower water was cold, on a 20 degree December day. Bathroom smelled like mildew. Room was incredibly small. Layout of the floors is akin to a fun house. The entire hotel at that. Not a great experience, will not be back.

I was traveling for work. The hotel location is in a nice part of New York and has many shops, restaurants, within walking distance. The bathroom needs to have the tile grout/caulk replaced/repaired. The hotel staff were very helpful.

They stole my watch. I left it in safe, and someone stole it. 100% it was a staff member and the NYLO did nothing. My wife bought me a Breitling for my birthday, and now we are out 5k for watch, 5k to replace it, and top it off.... 1100$ for the room. They didn't even offer to take care of room. Wow! Classy guys. Customer service at its worst

Upgraded rooms are great; regular rooms very good value.My upgrade coupon was at first not honored this trip, but after rejecting first room, i was upgraded to a jr suite!One or two staff need re-training, but most were great.

Amazing hotel and love to come during the holidays! I would highly recommend you enjoy a drink at the bar. Check in can be before 3:00pm, which I loved. Great neighborhood and easy to get to everything!

call several times in getting room clean. several times in getting a car to JFK. had to take a taxi. poor food service 2 times. room key would not work. cleaning staff states you have to call several times to get what you want. fix your customer service!!!!!!

Fantastic hotel with great location. Friendly staff and clean rooms. Great restaurants near hotel. Close access to the subway made getting around very convenient. Central Park is a close walk. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for your next trip to NYC.

My daughter, friend and I stayed at the New York NYLO this past weekend. The check-in process was average and the room the same. The room was clean, though decorated kind of odd. Hanging lamps that we kept hitting our heads on... ugly curtains that looked like newspaper print? Very weird... I feel like they were trying to be modern, but maybe missed the mark. That being said, at about 2am on the 2nd night, our neighbors arrived (we had an adjoining room, but obviously, the doors were closed and locked) and I could hear every single sound they made... from footsteps, to the exact words they were saying. A little while later, things got vocally "intimate"... it woke my roommates up, it was so clear and loud! We could hear EVERYTHING so well, it felt like we might as well be in bed with them. It was awful!! I've stayed in many hotel rooms throughout my life, but never experienced such paper thin walls. I don't know, maybe it was just our room (513)?? Either way, we were happy our neighbors had such a fun time (for 2 hours), but would love to have not had to hear it.

Great location and the bar/lounge area is very relaxing! Beds are super comfy. I would stay here again. Very short walk to Central Park and close to 72nd street subway and 79th. Short walk to Columbus street shopping. Also Upper West Side is a great place to stay. If you are in to Soul Cylce it is on the same block!! Also Seraphina is attached to hotel and they deliver to your room.

Upon arrival our reserved room wasn’t available due to a lack of heat in the room. Which was very disappointing for my boyfriend and I. The manager was nice and she did offer us a personal heater but it was 30 degrees in December.

I stayed on business and, during my stay, became extremely ill and ultimately needed to visit an emergency room. For the time I spent at the hotel before returning home, the staff could not have been better. They inquired often as to my well being and even had some liquids and crackers provided to my room unsolicited. They called to check up on me. And on more than one day. They could not have been better about it.And I like the hotel due to its close proximity to five lines of the subway as well as Central Park. Just very easy to navigate around the city from here.Beds in the room super comfortable. Hotel bar area was also kind of active, with a very diverse group from young to old. I like.

If you must be on the upper west side, your choice is limited but try somewhere else. The NYLO room felt like a dorm room, was in fair condition (at best), and was tiny. Our window was taped closed although the draft still moved the curtains. The bathroom is uninspired and the towels are thin. The furnishing are cheap IKEA-esque pieces. The hallway carpet is threadbare/dirty and there is a faint smell of garbage in the elevator. All of this for a price similar to several very nice midtown hotels (e.g. Ink, Iroquois, Lombardy, Eventi, etc.).
user_name:
Malthus500
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great place to stay on Upper West Side.Good size rooms, Clean, Pleasant staff.Bar area busy with good vibe on weekend nights.Pleasant sitting area.Would recommend for location.Valet parking easy as well.

A bar that open only after 3pm .. for the rest you should to to the annex Bar Restaurant (that is not the Hotel s restaurant but maybe same owner. “Simil” chic cool room .. in the reality very poor furniture, extra small rooms, very late check in (many cases 4pm)!!! Only good point a very helpful Staff, but with the Hotel they have...not so much to do!!

It was just an overnight trip, but the service was great. Loved the Willy Wonka themed bar menu. The location was convenient to trains and commute back and forth to Airport. I would recommend for anyone needing to stay on the UWS.

Excellent place to stay. Close to great restaurants, staff are very nice and helpful, rooms and lobby clean. Lobby and bar have very nice decor. Computer access for printing tickets. easy check-in and check-out.

I booked a two-night stay at the last minute. Was thrilled to find a place in a great neighborhood, with adorable rooms and a cute lobby/lounge, that was dog friendly. The staff was very nice and the room was comfortable. Did I mention dog friendly? Truly so - there is a difference between someplace that merely tolerates dogs and one that is actually dog friendly. This one is the latter, and that means a lot! The only quibble is that the pet fee is quite high - $40 per night. In my experience traveling with a dog, that is on the very high end and is the only thing that might make me look elsewhere next time.

The NYLO is reasonably priced and a quiet retreat in the city. Relaxing and fun lobby and bar. Rooms are clean and sleek and beds are luxuriously comfortable. I love the quiet of the West side, but you do have to walk or take a train to get to the action.
user_name:
Margaret B
Fort Collins, United States

review_body: Service is everything. It’s the cherry on top of the cake. It’s the thing you remember in wanting to return or never trying again. My wife and I live locally in Pennsylvania 3 hours away but the past 31 years we lived overseas and traveled the world to or from our jobs. Have stay in your hotel once before on a fly by. I tried to give my credit card which I used to book your hotel the desk person said it was no good (surprising) since we are connected for business. After she tried several times I gave her another card and was charged. On entering my room I called the company who told me exactly what time that card was charged. Problem two cards two charges. The desk person was less than friendly and had no time for us. Sad service award to her.

Is a nice hotel, quite close from Central Park and 79St Subway station. Rooms are clean and spacious. Serafina restaurant, located in the main floor is a perfect option to have breakfast and dinner. It is not the family with kids best option in NY.

We arrived on my wife's birthday and they made sure she was treated like royalty! Ramona at the front desk and George our Bellman took extra good care of us. We had a fabulous view of Broadway and the Hudson

The NYLO. Has been restin on its laurels for some time now. Although the lobby has been updat d in th last few years, front door service has diminished and room quality has gone downhill. The neighbourhood is what draws me back at this point ( and surely there are other properties on the Upper West Side).

We called ahead of time to reserve a pack and play for our baby in our room. When we got there, they didn’t have any available. She had to sleep in our bed while we watched all night and didnt sleep at all.

We had a lovely stay at nylo this thanksgiving. They were giving out cider and cocoa downstairs and gave our daughter a small stuffed animal when we checked in. The view from the skyline suite was incredible and the amenities and service were top notch.

Jesse, at the front desk, made the entire process so easy and was so sweet and personable. She is the type of person you want to be greeted by after a long cross-country flight. She listened and took care of me without hesitation ! Thanks Jesse!!

Visited this hotel for our short honeymoon in NYC. We stayed 5 nights. My wife had e-mailed ahead to arrange for a bottle of Prosecco to be in the room for our arrival for a surprise. When we got to the room she was very disappointed that it had not been delivered as has been arranged and confirmed in an e-mail response. With the 'moment' passed we decided to ask what had happened the next day. The man on reception checked and the request was on the booking but had not been actioned. He said sorry in a perfunctory manner and asked if there was anything else he could help with; nothing was offered to make up for the mistake. Perfectly polite but the lack of attention to detail had spoilt a moment my wife had planned and this could not be fixed. It tinged our opinion of this hotel from the off and they couldn't recover.I also visited the bar once where the barman could not pour my beer of choice (too gassy and it kept over flowing) so poured me another beer that i hadn't requested and charged me for it. Nice enough beer but it should have been the one i ordered. Drank elsewhere on the other nights.The positives. Clean room, smart lobby, great location with excellent restaurants on Amsterdam a short walk away. The negatives. Noisy. Kept awake on our last night with a wedding party running between rooms and shouting. Not hotels fault but their walls are very thin and gave little noise reduction. Our Honeymoon had budget constraints but i wouldn't recommend this hotel for a special occasion. Its in a great location, is clean and functional. Just take ear plugs so you don't hear the other guests and steer clear of their bar.

My family stayed here for long weekend and loved it. Great location near subway and many taxis on Broadway. Excellent and funky lounge and bar. I live near here and rate it the best boutique hotel on the Upper West Side..

The hotel is in a nice location if you plan to visit the Beacon Theatre. There isnt anything exciting near by otherwise. If you want to go to Time Square its about a 35 minute walk. About a 20 min ride from Grand Central. I was told that that I was getting a room upgrade, but I didnt. I got the room that I booked.

I am a frequent traveler who recently stayed at the NYLO New York for a 6-day business trip. I specifically booked a Superior King Room as I had two large suitcases with me. When I checked in, I was given a room, that matched the exact room pictured as a Standard King room on the NYLO website. I asked to switch rooms the next day, particularly as there was a loud rattling from the HVAC in my room which kept me up at night. I was moved next door to a MUCH smaller room with a much smaller bathroom (that had a better but still noisy AC as the system seems quite old). I inquired about the class of room and was told that both rooms were the same class and nothing else was available. Based on my experience and other reviews, I believe the hotel treats all its king bed rooms the same while charging more for 'superior' or 'deluxe' rooms. I wish they had been honest and just apologized and refunded me the difference. On a positive note, the hotel has a cool vibe and great location. It was very clean and the staff were extremely pleasant and willing to help. If you are a heavy sleeper, book the lowest-priced room at NYLO New York (+ be aware of the resort fee) and you will have an enjoyable stay.

The hotel was clean and modern. Staff was friendly and willing to accommodate requests. Lounge was nice. The hotel was a little pricy but worth it. at the end. I would definitely recommend the NYLO to friends and family.

best hotel in upper west side. So much fun. At night, my NYC daughter brought her small dog to hang out with us in the lobby. Bar and live music. Great piano player. Jazz duo. Professionals. Great location.

15th floor has great view. Few blocks to park but fun trendy neighborhood. We had wedding party in lobby that was great. Lobby has area to mix and mingle with open area bar. Rooms decent size but small closet and narrow bath but that’s New York!

We spent 4 nights. Henry the bartender is wonderful and the bellmen are very helpful. That's about it for positives. The room was dirty and not cleaned during our stay. Half the electrical outlets and lights in the room didn't work despite repeated requests. We had to call to have laundry picked up and then again to have it returned. We only got one set of clean towels although there were two of us. Dirty dishes weren't removed from the room for two days. Housekeeping cart sat outside our room for 2 days. I left a scarf at the bar at closing time by accident and by the morning it had disappeared. We were given drink tickets upon arrival but not told that they were only for prosecco - we didn't think to read the fine print, so we ordered drinks and then had to pay for them. Homeless guy wandering around the lobby. I made repeated attempts to contact the manager before writing this review but they didn't bother to respond.

As a long-time UWS'r, I love to go back to my old neighborhood. NYLO has renovated this fabulous boutique hotel and created an ambiance that is just perfect for what I am looking for - bar, atmosphere, great food, event space, rooftop bar. I just love it!

We love staying on the Upper West Side, and this hotel was perfect for us. Rooms are a little small, but very comfortable. The fun bar and decor make the place feel modern and hip. My family of 4 stayed in on one room with two double beds. Though things were a little tight, we were all pretty comfortable. At night, my wife and I could leave the kids in the room while we had a nightcap at the bar. There was a jazz combo playing and the bartender was fun to talk to. We had a very nice time. The nearby Milburn Hotel used to be our go-to, but they are under new management and quality seems to have slipped. So now the NYLO is our new go-to.

had the most amazing time at this hotel. from the minute walked thru the doors you knew you was in nyc!!!!the staff-especially 'jennifer' was more then helpfull. the rooms were perfect and the BEDS OMG the most amazing i have slept in. perfect location for everywhere!

Excellent place to stay to get to everything easily. Staff were helpful and we were pleased the CVS was right across the street. Taxis were easy to get at this location and the subway is a few blocks away. Everything was very close by. The 2 restaurants associated with the hotel are yummy. Red Farm and Serafina.

This is the only hotel I would stay at or any of my friends and family. The property itself is perfect - the employees treat you as you are a VIP and the surroundings are cozy.When you go to New York you don't have to stay in the cookie cutter hotels-NYLO is the place to go.

I arrived at the hotel after midnight and a received a room with a dirty bathroom.When I complained to the from desk clerk all he had to say was that he will inform housekeeping.I woke up at 6 am to terrible noise from the plumbing of someone taking a shower at one of the other rooms. It was so loud I woke up and was unable to go back to sleep. Since the room had no desk or chair I was unable to work comfortably either.At checkout the person at the front desk did not care to hear anything about my (bad) experience at the hotel, asking how my stay was but not listening to the answer at all.

This was my second visit to NYLO NYC. The rooms are clean, crisp and with enough amenities to provide a comfortable experience. The rates are competitive. There is plenty of room to relax in the lobby areas. The hotel is convenient to a number of Upper West Side attractions and restaurants. The service, however, leaves much to be desired - a lack of attention to detail and an annoying aloofness that I don’t find at other NYC hotels.I had scheduled a meeting with potential business collaborator - first meeting - and I checked on opportunities at NYLO because of a bum foot that limits my walking. I chose LOCL, the hotel bar, because it opens at 3.00p and it advertises an “all-day” menu for food. I met my guest and we sat down. We waited about five minutes before I went to up to the bar to ask if it was open. “Yup,” replied the bartender (without looking up from his tray of glasses). “Do you provide table service?” I asked. “Nope,” was the reply, again without looking at me. I asked for menus and rejoined my guest. When I went up to bar to order, the bartender (finally looking at me) said, “We don’t serve food until 5.00p.” I wanted to ask what “all day menu” means at NYLO, but I didn’t think it was worth the effort. My guest and I went to a nearby restaurant. When I checked out, I chose the email receipt option. As I waited for the car to the airport, I noticed that I had not yet received the receipt. The hotel had an incorrect email address. Hours later, at the airport, the receipt had not yet arrived. I called the desk. The associate, who had checked me out earlier in the day, told me that she’d resend it immediately. When I received the receipt, I noticed an odd charge. I called the hotel. Three times. I let the phone ring and ring, but no answer. It was around 10.00a so I imagined that the desk was swamped with guests checking out. A few moments later, I called again. The call was picked up quickly this time by the same associate who had helped me earlier. No hello. No greeting of any kind. The FIRST thing I heard was “Didn’t you GET the receipt?!?!?” I guess NYLO’s caller announce system works pretty well, right? I only wish the staff worked as well. There’s no reason for this kind of exasperated rudeness. Two relatively minor experiences, I know, but in a city full of hotels with competitive rates when ALL THAT THEY REALLY HAVE as a differentiator is GOOD SERVICE, it’s completely unacceptable to NOT have accurate information shared in your promotional materials and NOT have staff who provide relatively warm and professional service. If you have a thicker skin and more patience than I do, NYLO could be a good experience for you. Just be ready for haughty indifference from the staff. Maybe NYLO thinks that visitors to NYC find this to be part of the “New York experience.” That became passé in the 1990s.

Great hotel for value. Jessie at front desk was very accommodating and helped at lot. Italian restaurant attached is also very good. Please visit this hotel if you are looking for good value hotel with nice accommodations.

You better have something to do in town during the day, as rooms may not be available before 3~4 pm. Looking elsewhere for an alternative will end up in NYLO as best in UWS, my favorite part of town. You better have something to do in town during the day, as rooms may not be available before 3~4 pm. Looking elsewhere for an alternative will end up in NYLO as best in UWS, my favorite part of town.

This trip was beyond amazing it was my birthday getaway with my boyfriend and the service was perfect the room was great and the food was just perfection we had an amazing time and would definitely recommend this hotel for any occasion

at the begining of my stay in NYLO this year, I was desapointed by my room which was less confortable than last year ( no table, even no chair it was monastic)after fews days I could get one better when you have regular customers it would be better to take in their wishes The staff is efficent but not very warm welcomingbut many other points are pleasant and satisfactory

There should be grab bars in the shower, especially for older, or tired travelers. The light from the adjoining room shone through the space between the frame and the door. Quite disturbing at night. Surprising to see in a facility of this quality.All of the employees were great...from the doorman to the desk personnel and to any other employee we encountered.

Great great great way to go always stay at Nylo great great great location and value design great staff great location and the location we always come back to the Nylo every time were in New York we go to the NY about the style of the rooms the staff the location everything is terrific if the Nylo we will come back again when we are in New York as I live in California Jane Heymann

We were impressed with the size of the room, hardwood floors, pretty bathrooms. However, the fire station across the street was noisy. The employees were great- helpful, kind and working hard. The reservation system is very frustrating and any modifications cause you to cancel your reservation and start over. You need to keep looking back for better deals. The hotel doesn’t feel as safe as others in nyc as you don’t need a key card to access the floors.

It was a fantastic experience . Some of the staff totally went it of their way . I am soo grateful that I stayed there . Carlos and Jennifer were amazing . They were so kind to me on the pricing and the quality of my room . I can not say enough good things regarding my stay

A very good location. Subway stop 2 blocks away. Fun area by the desk/lobby with a bar. 24 market right across the street and a lovely bakery. Had a great breakfast our first day at the restaurant connected to the hotel

We had a great stay at this centrally located and pristine hotel. We will be back! The food service and hotel staff were all excellent. The bar area and resturant were lovely, and the menu was great. Hotel staff were all very friendly and courteous.

We went to NY to see a concert that was taking place very close to ehe NYLO Hotel. We asked for a room with 2 queen size beds and enough space for 3 people. We got a room with 2 double beds that could pass for twin beds and just enough room to walk. We asked for a change, but wasn't posible. We had to leave the next day to another hotel with more space. The staff is very friendly and the bar is great. Just the room was too small.

NYLO has done a nice job with remodeling an older building. The rooms are good size, laminate wood floors and good size bathrooms. Great location on Broadway and 77th. Couple of blocks from Central Park and nice pubs over a block on Amsterdam St. Metro is a couple of blocks away.
user_name:
Rick L
Rapid City, South Dakota

review_body: I came to NYC on Monday the 20th. After a long day we came to this hotel that we had pre-booked. Apon arrival we were greeted, check in and told where to go to get to our room. Apon opening the door you can tell that they take pride in what they do. It was beautiful we were in room 1405 so if you ever get that room you will know what we mean. The view was amazing and I wanted to bring the bed back to the UK with me. I've never had such a comfortable sleep in my life. Will definitely be back next time I'm in NYC.
user_name:
minnyminx
Royal Tunbridge Wells, United Kingdom

review_body: This hotel is located on the Upper West Side close to everything you could want. It’s friendly and casual, and great for families. However, the service is just okay - and the rooms are tired looking and inexpensively finished. The rooms are very industrial looking and not all that comfortable. The bar in the lobby is quite lovely, but the service is awful. This hotel has such great potential. They are not there yet.

Stayed over the Thanksgiving holiday. Nice location to walk to see the parade balloons on Wednesday night. Close to Hudson River for a nice walk on Thursday. Whole first floor is freezing cold. They need portable heaters.

This property is located in the Upper West Side with easy access to subway, local restaurants and short walk to Columbus Circle and Central Park. The property has a fun vibe. Entertainment in the lobby / bar area on the weekends. This is definitely a NYC hotel that is now on my go to list.

We stay at NYLO whenever we visit NYC. It is not “fancy-schmancy” and we feel comfortable there. The rooms are spacious and the beds have great mattresses. The staff is very courteous and helpful. We will be sure to return there on our next NYC visit.

\The NYLO Hotel with its fine service and welcoming attitude should be your hotel of choice on the UWS. All members of the staff go out of their way to make sure your stay is as enjoyable as possible. Their bar is a fun gathering place as is their large communal space that feels more like a comfortable living room. It is close to museums, restaurants, and shopping.

Booked the hotel and was double charged. Expensive parking and not inform you up front. Calling them to get refund is the most difficult task in my life. Will never stay at Nylo again. There are other better options in ny or Nj

I paid premium rates to stay over Thanksgiving and was expecting a much more upscale hotel. It was perfectly adequate but not worth the $350-$400 per night I paid. Normal rates are lower and probably competitive. The restaurant downstairs is excellent. My room overlooked Broadway and was very noisy.

This was our second stay at this hotel and we were not disappointed. We had a double queen suite for the four of us (my husband, myself and our 2 teenagers) which was huge, especially by NYC standards. Everyone at the hotel, from the front desk staff to the bellmen to the bar servers, was friendly and helpful. We loved spending time each evening in the gorgeous lounge. The location is fantastic - close to shops, restaurants, Museum of Natural History, subway and a 10 minute walk to the Thanksgiving Day Parade! We will definitely be staying here again on our next trip to NYC.

Loved the Nylo. Great modern decor, clean rooms, Keirig coffee maker in every room, easy park access. It’s about 1.5 mikes from Times Square. We took taxis because one of our party couldnt Waldo far. No problem catching them.

Had 2 rooms, told one would have a cot. Not available. Told would change room or provide cot, never happened. No notes and not passed down from shift to shift. Disappointing! Had same discussion multiple times, each time felt like it was new and had not occurred before. Had stayed at this property several times before, never again.

Double deluxe room for myself and husband and mid-twenties son. Two big comfy beds. Cool lobby with bar, and live music. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel is close to the park, restaurants, coffee shops, and subway.

Upon arriving at the hotel, we had to go in to get help with our bags, valet took a while, we ended up bringing our bags to the door by ourselves. No one welcomed us, everyone seemed very unfriendly. Our room was not ready, so we went out. When we returned at 5:00pm, our room still was not ready, so, we went to dinner. When we returned at 6:30pm, our room still was not ready, they said there had been an emergency. We finally got out room at almost 7:00pm, it was ok, the rooms definitely need to get rid of the pastel colored decorative lockers, it reminded me of a 13year olds bedroom. The beds were comfortable. Seraphina was not good, but they were short on staff. The Red farm restaurant was very good. Overall, we were spending over $1000 for two nights over Thanksgiving. We never felt welcome and no one was friendly except George, he was the only person that put any effort into welcoming us, he was a genuinely nice guy. I get that no one wants to work on Thanksgiving, but you are getting paid for it. We were paying to stay there on Thanksgiving. Unfortunately, we can't say we will ever return. We have stayed with Kimpton in NYC many times, they are far superior.

3 rooms for Thanksgiving Week. Despite some concern over some reviews read prior, everything was GREAT as far as all of us were concerned (grandparents, kidS and husbands and grandchildren and dog. Fridge being available on request was great. All staff very cordial, helpful and friendly. Bellmen and valet were great (Danny and others) Arranged car service to JFK (Morales) without a hitch--much better than UBER experience from airport. Easy to get cabs and valet hustled down street if one not right at door. Lobby was comfortable, bustling and friendly--live music on Friday night. Food options both in hotel, Red Farm and Serafina, and surrounding several walkable blocks all worked out well and affordable by NYC standards. Well situated for our wants and needs--park, museums, food, parade, markets (Fairway a block away), Maison Kayser for breakfast. It may not be 5 stars but it was GREAT for us.WE WOULD AND WILL STAY THERE AGAIN!!!

I grew up in New York City, but am currently living abroad. When I visit NYC and don't rent an apartment, I want to stay in a hotel that is off the beaten tourist path, that makes me feel pampered and comfortable but also "at home" and really part of New York (as if I still lived here)! NYLO is ideal this way, located as it is on the residential Upper West Side and to boot perfectly perched between two marvelous parks: Central Park and glorious Riverside Park (my favorite NYC park where I love to go running in the morning)! Moreover, it's close to two subway stations at 79th and 72nd St (where you can catch the express train). It's easy to get anywhere in the city from here on foot or by public transportation. NYLO has a clean, fresh, uncluttered and modern design, extremely comfortable beds and numerous rooms with lots of light and great views of "everyday" Broadway with good stores (check out DSW on 79th St & B'way) and NYC residents going about their business, living their lives. NYLO's staff is fantastic, service-minded and friendly (but never intrusive). Jessie at the front desk is a veritable gem, warm and truly kind and will always do her utmost to accommodate you and make sure you feel cared for and happy. This holds true for the rest of the staff as well, from doormen to housekeeping (I want to especially mention Mira who leaves your room spotless and who is ever sweet and personable). I get a nice feeling of privacy at NYLO, too, which means a lot to me and adds to its comfortable, homey feel. The bar and lounge are very nice and homey, as well. In short, I highly recommend NYLO for it's great rooms and above all for its wonderful staff.

We enjoyed our time at NYLO. It is in a great location for many of the things we like to walk to. The staff was courteous and helpful. Wish the lounge had a better choice of red wines, but service was good.

NYLO is my favorite hotel on the upper west side--stylish, modern, hip, with a convenient location near subway stops. I'd recommend booking one of the larger rooms. And ask for a room with a view. Jessie was especially helpful on my last visit. Thanks again!

Modern, clean, cozy, love this hotel, you don't need to rush to go outside to experince the city, you started to enjoyed at the moment you arrived to this hotel. Service is excellent and is very close to everything .

requests not respected. No magnifying mirror in bathroom which i had previously. Not enough towel replacements. I was disappointed generally. The so-called dressers are ridiculous, no backs, hard to open.

Great place to stay in NYC, and have stayed several times. Larger rooms than most of the hotels, very manageable price. Impeccably clean, good restaurant (Serafina's) connected by a door to the hotel.
user_name:
Mary Ann D
Rancho Santa Fe, California

review_body: Too many issues and outrageous urban fee - will be looking elsewhere for another hotel property. Spotty internet along with hot water shut off for an entire day did not help with respect to this already disappointing stay.

Upper West Side Boutique Hotel!From the moment you walk through the door it’s perfection! Something for everyone...bar-library-lounge-restaurant... best of all “the rooms”! Bed might be too comfortable lol...we’ll be back!

Stayed at the hotel in Oktober for 5 days and it was great. Check inn was swift and the staff, especially Jennifer and Vivek, were extra friendly and helpful. The room was pleasant and the complementary water was a welcome refreshment. The refrigerator we asked for, took a little time to get there , but was a nice extra to have in the room. The location, near the subway and not to far from Central Park is great especially if you're looking for a little bit more peace and quiet than one would get near the 42th area. Nice and diverse in the area.When leaving, you might not want to make use of the service the bellboys offered for an alternative to a regular taxi to the airport. Im sure they mean well, but the price we agreed on did not end up to be the price we had to eventually had to pay ( ＄50 more). But still will definitely use this hotel for a next visit

The location on the upper west side couldn't have been better for my itinerary. Museums, restaurants, and friends were all withing walking distance. The hotel was fine. The front desk was understaffed when I was there and it took me a long time to get checked in. The room was clean and serviceable. My pet peeve is that in the bathroom there is no place near the shower to hang a towel although there easily could be. Also, the side elevator near the entrance doesn't seem to have much security unless there are cameras I didn't see.

Great location to our family's apartment on 73rd St. at Broadway. The staff were polite and helpful, the rooms had everything one needs, and it was in a great neighborhood for restaurants, shopping, subway, etc.

We often stay at NYLO. The rooms are small, and not fabulous, but it is pretty clean and the staff are friendly. The price is often right, and you can't beat the location. Needs to improve wireless though.

Room was clean and neat. Staff were very friendly and helpful.My only negative is the fact that the doors to the rooms are very loud when they close. Kept us up at night and woke us up in the morning every day.

Happy with our stay at NYLO. Bed was very comfortable. Room was small but well appointed. Shower was excellent. Would definitely stay there again. Close to subway (2 blocks to the 1 train) made it easy to get here by public transport from LaGuardia.

The hotel staff was very nice. The complementary drink was really good. The room itself was very comfortable. The only thing I would say is that the bed could have been a little lower for my grandmother. She got into the bed but it took some time.
user_name:
richardkX696UA
New York City, New York

review_body: They go above and beyond every time. The rooms are spacious. The location is ideal. Everyone there s so friendly and goes out of their way to make sure all your needs are met. I showed up last time and forgotten to make a reservation and they took care of me!!!!!

We really enjoyed this hotel. I have stayed multiple times for work and this was for pleasure. The suite was enormous with a huge bathroom. We couldn’t believe how quiet our room was. We never heard traffic or anyone above us. Cannot wait to return.

I'm not sure why this hotel, where I've happily stayed before, has gone down. First, check-in took forever because their internet wasn't working. Then there was no wifi in the room --for our ENTIRE stay of 3 days. Every time we asked at the desk, or phoned down, they would refer us to their online help, even when at one point, they said we had no internet because our credit card didn't go through because their internet was down! Even the manager didn't return our calls. Plus the bathtub had dirt in the drain. And so on.

We have stayed at NYLO before (several times under prior ownership). It continues to be a fine Westside boutique hotel experience. Location is great. Hotel bar/lobby is intimate, warm, comfortable and friendly. Rooms in my experience are nice but small (NY-style). This time we were given a 2nd floor suite which was very roomy (extra sitting room). Room was comfortable. Outside windows need cleaning; easy chairs in suite are a bit old looking and hot water did take time to warm up (but it did). Shower was good as was WiFi. Standard safe in room, plenty of storage drawers and hang up space. All in all, a nice room in a great location. Price is reasonable though not inexpensive (it's N.Y. C. after all)

Studio stay with balcony, room was very clean, comfortable bed, large shower, lots of windows. . My only complaint was the amount of towels you are given (2) regular size and a few smaller ones. Enjoyed the soap and toiletries, Kuerig coffee maker, complimentary water. Being able to borrow an Umbrella during rain was also a nice touch as was our complimentary drinks upon check in. Staff was pleasant and helpful. . They do have a gym with plenty to use for a well rounded workout. Loved the heat lamps right outside the front main entrance. Plenty of food choices and subway stop nearby, CvS next to hotel. I can't wait to go visit and stay at this hotel again. Great comfortable, quiet stay. Serafinas the restaurant attached to the hotel was delicious for breakfast.
user_name:
Lisa R
San Antonio, Texas, United States

review_body: I was very impressed with the hotel; it's got a very trendy vibe to it; well decorated and spotless. The staff were very nice and informative and considering I've stayed at many hotels in the city including more expensive; I feel this hotel was priced fairly.

My wife and I stayed at the NYLO NYC for four nights in November. Upon arrival, we were impressed with the industrial-chic lobby decor; live music was being performed in the lobby lounge. We were fortunate to have a room facing Broadway, with a peek-a-boo view of the Hudson River and NJ. The room was stylishly decorated, and spotless. The bed was great, and double-glazed windows kept us insulated from the sounds of the city. It was a bright and airy room.

Although there were some issues with the electronics at check in and checkout, and a few with logging into the wifi, they were resolved and the room was well designed, and the service was good (as usual). We understand that the issues with the electronics were tied to a system in the process of being changed, and will return in the future.
user_name:
BobFran_11
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: NYLO was at best an average hotel experience from chec in to checkout. The amenities were meager. The staff disinterested. The rooms Spartan. For the money they charge you can do much better in Manhattan with finer service and far more comforting rooms. I have stayed there in the past when it was On The Avenue. I will not return in the future

We booked the skyline penthouse which showed a really nice outdoor terrace. that was supposed to have a view of the Hudson. I booked this specifically as I was traveling with a service dog that would allow her to get some outside air. The first room we got was a suite with a tiny balcony facing the back of the hotel. There was water leaking into the room with big puddles and mold on the ceiling. We were moved the next day to a suite with a small terrace facing the Hudson and balcony on the back. The hotel staff told us the picture are deceiving and when I pushed him he said he would move us the next day. Also, I was traveling with a service dog and he asked for documentation which is not allowed . According to the ADA and NYC gov't you can not ask for documentation only what tasks they perform. I carry a letter from my doctor so I gave it to him reluctantly as this was a violation of my rights. If we did not have this bad check in experience I would of given it 4 or 5 stars. It is a nice hotel in a great location.

Hotel was fun and funky! Very clean. I loved the laminated flooring in our room. No carpeting!! The bed was very comfy and the bath products very nice You should go there it’s near so many things and we enjoyed how easily we could walk to Central Park and unwind

The location is great - away from the craziness of Midtown, but close to the subway. Riverside Drive and Central park a very nearby. The lobby is warn and inviting, the rooms are nicely sized and well appointed, and the staff is the best.
