They greet you by name, take time to talk with you and handle any issues that may arise (although none did). When you stay here its as if you are a part of the neighborhood. I've stayed here many times for both business and pleasure, and I cant wait to come back.

Great ambiance and welcoming staff. I felt right at home immediately. Loved the rooms and the amenities. The lounge was cozy and well-stocked. It was perfect for a Columbia University Conference and Broadway Street is a great location.

They advertised a low rate but take on a 35 dollar resort charge that gets you zip. Room key did not work twice. AC made weird noises all night. Bathtub had things floating in it from the drain backing up. Restaurant next door is not very good.

Spend three nights this week at NYLO. It was very enjoyable with good service, great location and a sort of upscale hip vibe. I had a few small problems to deal with and JESSIE the desk clerk made them all go away. If you stay be sure to stroll east a few blocks for a lovely walk through a NY gem, Central Park. Oh, address listed as Broadway but entrance to hotel is on W 77th.

You can’t get a more convenient location if you’re planning a trip to the city to see something at the Beacon Theatre. Easy to get to, nice cozy, quiet room. Hotel staff somewhat friendly. They were a bit edgy. But all in all a great stay. Will definitely go again. Serafina restaurant on lobby floor excellent for breakfast.

Stayed a few nights in the city to visit friends. This is such a central location with buses and subways close. The bed is super comfy but the room could have used a little TLC. Staff was and has been always great.
user_name:
Besiram
New York City, New York

review_body: This is my second time at the hotel in the last two years. Do not choose the hotel package that includes breakfast. Serafina is attached to the hotel and has the worst service we've ever experienced. We went three times and it got progressively worst. People around us were getting up and leaving. It's a management problem.

NYLO is a trendy hotel, typical of the term “Boutique”.It answers the needs of travelers with an excellent location, fair pricing and onsite amenities that include the usual common area spaces ( internet/bar/live piano & access to a restaurant).Rooms are tiny; the bathroom had zero space to place toiletries so I wheeled in the desk chair to be my shelf.The concierge was excellent ,she knew the city subway inside out and backwards to get me where I needed to go.Other staff members were friendly and helpful,too.
user_location: Palm Beach Gardens, Florida, United States
user_name:
Elizabeth P
Palm Beach Gardens, Florida, United States

review_body: Great location on Upper West Side. Convenient to subway and good selection of restaurants within walking distance. Courteous and efficient check-in staff. Small, but comfortable and well appointed rooms.

As always, NYLO met my expectations...I asked for a 'quiet' room when traveling with my daughter and Jessie accommodated us with an upgrade at a minimal cost...thanks Jessie!If looking for a solid, good quality hotel NYLO will fit the bill!

NYLO is a comfortable hotel in a great location. The rooms while small are well appointed. We were on the 11th floor and insulted from noise from the street. Overall the hotel is well maintained and I am looking forward to return visits.

I decided to take a quick trip to the big apple and searched for a hotel with some service and a perfect hide away on the upper west side and found NYLO!!!Great experience and Jessie sure made my one night stay perfect!!! Thanks Jessie

Great ambience, great location - our favorite NY home away from home. The staff are very friendly and the bar is a very cozy option for a late night drink. Each night of our stay the musical talent was great. Three blocks from the Museum of Natural History. My new favorite museum is also three blocks away - the New York Historical Society Museum.

I have stayed at the hotels many times usually the service is a lot better. I love the great location on the upper west side, it is a way from the noisy midtown , I love walking the neighborhood and all the great restaurants that are usually service locals I may give the hotel another chance and hope that things will improve, especially with the front desk people.

NYLO is a perfect hide-away on the Upper West Side. Great vibe in the lobby/bar area. Our queen room was clean, well-appointed, quiet and nicely sized - especially for NY. We had breakfast plan during our two day and enjoyed the food at Serafina, attached to NYLO. The only challenge was getting an elevator during peak times - but even then, it was only a few minute wait.

We spent two nights at the NYLO in early October to attend a wedding in Central Park. Location was perfect to get to the venue easily as well as near many other great places and gorgeous NYC architecture on the UWS. Our room was not ready right away so we had to wait an hour or so upon checking in. Our first night we were given a room that would typically be reserved for a handicapped individual. It was a bit on the smaller side with no view, no real closet and a massive bathroom that was mostly empty space, not especially useful for us. We asked for an upgrade for our second night and Jessie at the front desk was very helpful in finding another room on the same floor (9th), larger and with a street view which was great. Room was clean and comfortable with all the usual amenities. Breakfast is served at Serafina, connected to the restaurant with three different options along with OJ and coffee or tea, not a buffet but was quite enough for us.

Very pleased with our stay. The staff were friendly and welcoming. And we were surprised when our room had a beautiful balcony. The room was clean and quite and the bed was very comfortable. There are a lot of cute restaurants nearby and its a close walk to the subway. I would definitely stay here and again and recommend it to others.

We were upgraded to a king room which was very comfortable,, and although we didn't have a view it meant the room was very quiet, as we were away from the roads. Bathroom was minute and water flooded the floor from the shower - that would be easily fixed with some silicone sealer around the shower screen. There seem to be an awful lot of extra charges and taxes at this hotel, and breakfast wasn't included. This hotel is in a lovely area and convenient to subway and restaurants. We will not be returning though because apparently there was a "technical error" and US$869.00 was taken out of our account during our stay. We were advised of the error, but the money Roomba week to go back into our account. We were back in Australia by then. It was a big inconvenience for us at the end of our holiday and meant we couldn't buy the gifts and do the shopping we had planned. We weren't even offered a meal or anything as an apology.

Good hotel in a great location. The view was nice but obstructed. The service was fairly typical although the doorman went above and beyond in the morning of my departure to secure a ride to the airport for me. Beware! There are several resort fees associated with this hotel that caught me by surprise at the end of my stay.

I stayed at this hotel a few years ago and loved it. Still love the Upper West Side location--close to Central Park, subway, restaurants, and nice neighbourhood feel in contrast to Midtown hotels. Minimalist, modern room was clean and the bed was comfortable.My main complaint though is that I paid for a Superior King room that on the website looked clearly superior to the Standard King, but there really wasn't anything "Superior" about it. The website had pictures of large windows and nice light. This room had a tiny window, filthy at that, so there was absolutely no natural light in the room. Worse, though, was the customer service that I received when I inquired about my booking. Three separate front desk people, including the reservations manager, couldn't give me the same answer about the difference between a Standard room and a Superior room--one even said there's no such distinction--all the King's are Superior and the Queen's are Standard. Another suggested it had something to do with having a street view vs a brick wall view (but with the tiny, dirty window, I'd hardly have paid a dollar more for the street view). The main thing is that I felt like I was getting the run around--very deceptive feeling---enough to make me not even look at staying here again. Don't trust the descriptions and photos on the website. If you can afford their beautiful upper floor terrace rooms, they are lovely. Anything else, unless you can get a Standard room for a very good price (certainly not what I paid) and I'd shop around for better deals/places--that will certainly be my strategy next trip to NYC. Too bad because I really do love the location, and I tend to recommend this hotel to lots of friends (but not anymore). Also, I paid for the breakfast package--decent value for sure, but the food and service over my four days (at the attached Serafina Restaurant) was hit and miss. Is it that difficult to make poached eggs? It kind of seemed once the servers knew that they'd be getting their gratuity from the hotel, they became pretty indifferent.

We were located on the 11th floor with a street view room, unfortunately this meant we heard everything from the street all night, on top of that we had a connecting room which we could hear absolutely everything in the room next to us. The bed was very comfortable and the location was great!Our only other negative was the urban fee that we were charged on check out. Please be aware of this when booking as it resulted in an extra $125 that we were unaware of. All in all the hotel lobby is lovely and it is situated in a good spot but I was slightly disappointed with our stay.

Simple, clean room. Small. No chair in the room. No refrigerator. Lobby bar and attached restaurant. Experienced staff. Responded well to request when the solo (12th floor) ice machine stopped working. There is a 17th floor patio that we would have liked more if it wasn't so cold during our 5-day stay. Fitness center is modest and small. Two blocks from the subway.

We've stayed here several times. Lately, there is never a door man around! We arrived & it was raining. We had to hunt down a door man to retrieve a cart; he was young & inexperienced...we had to direct him as what to do. Throughout our stay the doormen where never around??? Super busy lobby area; very strong fragrance in entrance (you could taste it!); front desk clerks are not as friendly & helpful as in the past. Rooms did not seem as clean too. We are hopeful they improve because we like the no carpet rooms! Beds are comfortable & great location!
user_name:
Tina S
Saratoga Springs, New York

review_body: Was given the wrong room -not the upgraded room I pre-paid for sadly. It was too late by the time I realized it and moving rooms was too much of a hassle late at night. The room was small and on a noisy street. Lots of building systems noie too... fans etc. Not the NYLO experience I have had at other properties.

Really enjoyed our stay at NYLO. It's a Great price, very cool atmosphere, and a good location! The Rooms are small but are very comfortable and clean. Will definitely stay here again and recommend to others.
user_name:
mereditho659
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location close to the park, nice upper west neighborhood, nice and lively lounge and bar area. Breakfast at Zabars a bonus. Red Farm is a great dim sum restaurant around the corner. Comfortable beds.

I recently used this hotel as our main space for a conference we were having nearby. The staff was wonderful, the space was beautiful, and the location was supreme! I highly recommend it for business, and personal needs! Close enough to city attractions, but also a little ways away to give you some breathing room from the hustle and bustle.

First time as tourist in New York. NYLO New York City hotel was selected based on recommendation of a frend of mine. Excellent location on the corner of Broadway and 77th street. Subway and bus stop just few step away. We also enjoyed the short distance to central park. Hotel as such was a bit dark shade instead of light colors which I expected. Room was large and clean with excellent bed for two. but no daylight due to windows against pritty closed inner court. Some problems with the reception personnel related to payments.

I like the style of the bathroom very much, very minimalistic. Also, I personally very much like the bar on lobby. Since I arrived quite late at the hotel, the bar gave me a safe feeling. The location is great and I hope the check-in time can be earlier. 4pm is kinda late and hard to fit into schedule.

NYLO is a small but not boutique hotel in NYC's upper west side. The decor is modern and clean, the staff efficient and helpful, but perhaps feel that they need to uphold the New York tradition, which excludes warm and friendly. The location is the height of convenience for a visitor, being close to many destinations, including Central Park, the Metropolitan Museum and the American Natural History Museum. Shows and other mid-town attractions are also very accessible, but downtown less so. In the area around the hotel, you will find many markets, delis, restaurants and other servicdes, which is a good thing, since the hotel itself offers relatively little in that way. The cost is very manageable, especially for NYC, and everyone of the many to whom I've recommended the hotel have liked it very much. I'm pretty sure you will too.

My husband and I have stayed at NYLO for years and recently went back after a couple year break after having babies. When we arrived from our early morning flight we were usually always welcomed with a room ready early and the keys to relax before venturing into NYC. This time we asked if our room was ready and were old yes, but if we wanted to access it before the normal check-in time of 4 PM we would half to pay 50% of the daily room rate, or if it was after 1:00 PM a $100 fee! New Management was the excuse coming from a desk attendant that was not very friendly and almost rude.I love the hotel and location and couldn’t be more upset with the service during this trip. Last complaint was at checkout when I wanted to switch credit cards and was told I couldn’t because systems were down and I should of used the correct card at check-in. I️ specifically asked at check-in if I needed to change the card would it be an issue and was told no.

Loved our stay at NYLO for the NYC Marathon. Great staff, cute hotel and the BEST location in NYC. We were welcomed openly by staff upon our arrival and accommodated to get into our room earlier than we expected.

I had 7th floor room that was very quiet. Room was a bit dark, but that is the tradeoff for quiet. Nice design. Great staff. Great value. I would recommend to travelers who prefer the quiet Upper West Side experience to the crazy Midtown experience.

We chose this hotel based on proximity. The Location is excellent for those wanting to stay on the UWS. The room was typically small as expected, which allowed for minimalist furnishings, no drawers but small desktop and counter. The bathroom is a different matter. The stainless steel wash basin, which is reminiscent of a mortuary's sink, was not level, therefore didn't fully drain. There are four 4" square shelves that can barely hold one person's cosmetics, let alone 2. The bed was soft, but comfortable.The staff were very helpful and attended to our needs quickly. If there was supposed to be a full time doorman, there was a definite problem as there was rarely someone attending the front entrance. The small bar and piano lounge were nice additions to this style of hotel. Overall it was a pleasant stay, but very expensive owing to the NYC Marathon being held that weekend.

I travelled to NYC for business for three days and decided to spend the first evening on the UWS before relocating to a hotel closer to my office in midtown. I chose NYLO which is a hotel I stayed in few times when it was called On The Avenue. It has had a remodel since rebranding itself and I noticed the lobby and bar area were pleasantly decorated. There was a lot of dark wood and heavy chairs and furnishing that gave the entrance area the feel of an eclectic, somewhat European living room. It was not busy at the hotel when I arrived and I walked right up to the front desk. The reception was chilly. I mentioned that I had not stayed at the hotel for a few years and complimented the remodel. The receptionist's curt response was that I had "been away at least three years" if I had not seen the remodeled lobby before that day. I then mentioned that I would take any upgrade available as I knew the hotel had nice rooms with balconies on the higher floors. As the On The Avenue, the hotel used to give complimentary upgrades if you tweeted about staying there, but, assuming the management had changed, i indicated that I was willing to pay for a room upgrade if available. "Completely sold out" was the reply, and nothing more. My room was booked by my company's service, so there was some sort of corporate discount applied that made it under $300 for the night. It was a standard king room on the second floor. The view was a brick wall and the HVAC workings of the hotel. While the size of the room was above average, it was clear this was a room used for last minute guests ( which I was not) and was only marginally remodeled. ( I am attaching a photo of how the ceiling looked above my door from the inside) I had breakfast at Serafina, the restaurant attached to NYLO, the next morning. It was pretty good and very much priced for NY tourists. Unless I have reason to be on the UWS again, I don't think a return to the NYLO is in the cards anytime soon. The front desk interaction was bland and perfunctory and clouded any positives of my time at NYLO.

Myself and my two daughters stayed here after our original hotel cancelled our booking a week before we were due to arrive from England Expedia sorted it all out and I have to say it was a god send The Nylo is beautiful The staff were very helpful and the room was amazingBeds very comfortable and the shower room was clean and big If I visit NYC again I would defiantly book to stay here again

We have stayed her many times, but were disappointed this time! Room floors were dirty, on privacy shade on window. We were given and ADA room and bathroom was not functional for folks that are not ADA.

When I checked in there was trash on the bathroom floor and toilet paper in the shower. The room looked significantly different than the pictures. That night I was bit by something and my hand swelled up. I booked the room through Hotel Tonight and got in touch with them. They said they spoke with someone at the front desk and gave me their name. When I got down to the front desk that specific person told me they had not talked to anyone. Overall a big bummer in terms of a hotel experience.

Service is very welcoming especially Jeniffer and Ramona who are very helpful and kind. Rooms are well ample and lit with large windows. Location is great in the upper West Side. Very much recommended.

I really liked the hotel and it's location, really close to the Central Park, 79th st subway and 72nd st for express subway!With a CVS open 24hours just across the street.The bar is really nice and the hole decoration as well.I would definetly stay again in this hotel, even with the small issues I was really well treated.We got welcome drinks and never took them (because we always arrived late night and tired at the hotel).The hotel has a few issues: we arrived late at night and the staff was not so friendly.... The linens were not new, really nicely cleaned but with 2 small holes.And the bathtub was leaking a little bit, when closed you needed to open a bit to stop the leak, nothing disturbing, but they should get this fixed, because the water waste was something if let like this.

Unfriendly staff, disgusting interior- dirty carpets in entry hall, ugly furniture, very small, dark rooms, not very Clean , neighborhood very loud, WLAN did mit work for a whole day, requested a hot water boiler wh ich was never delivered

My hotel room was comfortable, roomy, and impeccably clean. The floors were wood. I appreciate this as I have allergies and hotel rugs can be bad for those. The bed was firm but had a nice pillow top. The shower was pretty and had a good shower head with a generous flow of hot water; much needed after a long day! I had a beautiful view of Broadway. It was quiet. I slept better there than I do at home.

What a great hotel! Small, charming, and great location! Staff was so nice; even got upgraded to a nicer room without an ask!! We also found nice bars and restaurants nearby before and after the show we went to at the Beacon Theatre. Burke and Wills on Sunday late morning was also a great find while walking in the rain - had a wonderful brunch and mimosas! Friendly staff!

The room was a lot big than expected for a NYC. The hotel read very conveniently located. Within walking distance to Central Park, transportation (subway & bus), restaurants. Staff was always friendly.

Gorgeous decor in fantastic location. This was our third consecutive trip to NYC and the location of this hotel was by far our favourite (previous stays had been Plaza and Casa Times Sq) Check in was at 4 but after making a nuisance of myself three times, we were free to check in from 2 - which was great as we’d been awake for 36 hours.

Modern boutique hotel close to Central Park. Overall good experience. Details could be better, but if you are planning a short stay I can recommend Nylo hotel for sure. Serafina restaurant is also worth a visit. Food was delicious.

I enjoyed the hotel because of its location (proximity to Central Park, local feel and being close to town). However, we did run into ongoing problems with the hotel providing us bottled waters as part of the daily Urban Fee. Upon my feedback the GM (Connie) stepped in and made sure we had an amazing experience. As a result we had a great time there and definitely be looking forward to returning next time in NYC.

I chose this location due to the proximity to my daughter's apartment. It was nice to be close to shopping, subway staions and good food. The room was clean and the bed was just wonderful. I truly appreciate a mattress that will allow for a good night's sleep. I was on the 10th floor and there was a fire station right across the street. Although there is not much city noise, the sirens did wake me up several times per night. There is a cute bar in the lobby and on the night I arrived (Friday) there was live music. Unfortunately Friday was the only night for the performance - I would have definitely enjoyed the music on Saturday too. There was supposed to be free wi-fi in the room, however it never worked on any of my devices. I was only able to get it in the lobby.

If you have not tried the NYLO, you have probably never spoken to someone who stayed there. Perfectly located in the upper West Side two blocks from the 79th street 1 train is the nice gem of a NYC base of operation. Pleasant and accommodating staff, good internet, a nice room and a great value.

Things I loved: Huge extremely comfy bed, meticulously clean room, large walk in shower in junior suite with balcony, very responsive and professional staff.What could be improved? I had WiFi connection problems but not sure if it was the hotels fault or not. It wasn’t really that big a deal and the help desk tried to fix but I never followed up with them. Too busy having fun in the GREAT NYC!!!

After having our initial flight cancelled we were unable to attend our first booking... barring in mind that we booked this hotel for two days,Finally landing in NY and getting though security at 12pm we got to NYLO to only be turned down... our room was offered to others for no other reason than the marathon which was running at the time and they could probably get a higher price cause of the low availability in other hotels. We tried on multiple platforms to get in contact with the hotel with concerns about the room. But 0 replies. The receptionist had no compassion or any form of help other than "call the booking agent" and then went back to his own devices- he did let us use the lounge whilst we tried to house ourselves in the mean time (well done. A gold sticker for you) The place looked mediocre, unfortunately wasn't able to judge the inside. I wouldn't recommend this hotel based purely on customer service.

I was promised a credit for the lack of Internet Connection for 2 out of 2 days but have still not received it. No promises were solicited for several cold water showers. The room was small but of for the price if services met expectation. The lobby is cute with a nice vibe. Too bad I wasn't allowed to connect reliably to the Internet.

Had a great time and they were very accommodating towards our Sabbath needs would highly recommend this hotel for the future very nice and trendy and staff is great and very helpful thank you for that wonderful experience
user_name:
moshef282
New York City, New York

review_body: I like the location specially it was just a few blocks away good points of interest. the staff was great and other that some problems with the WiFi, everything was great. I would recommend the NYLO and it is an experience worth repeating,

Very nice hotel, with a few things to improve on, but still pretty nice. I was given a room on the 2nd floor, which was fine except getting hot water. I called when no hot water was coming out, and was told to leave the water running for 10 minutes (!) since I was on the lowest floor. It worked, but 10 minutes...yikes. There was no counter space (at all) in my bathroom, so that was interesting to work with. And there was a used soap in the shower when I checked in. I did get a bit of street noise, but I was on the 2nd floor facing the street. I'm a heavy sleeper so it wasn't a big deal to me. Still, the location was good and the vibe was nice. If the water and bathroom had been better, this would easily be 4-stars. I do recommend this hotel, just on a higher floor.

Overall a very comfortable stay. The bed is outstanding. The location of the hotel is perfect. Near the park, with the metro & great restaurants very close by. We have stayed at Nylo & previously On The Ave (as it was) several times & have recommended it to family & friends alike.

The hotel had a great New York feel to the place rather than the normal chain hotels, i loved the bar area which opens up on to the street when its warm, the rooms were spacious clean and comfortable and the service very good. A good safe area in upper Manhattan near to the subway but times square was only a 30 min walk good local shops and lots of places to eat - the Chinese restaurant red car which was next to the hotel was very good as was insomnia cookies opened to 3 am delicious
user_name:
Alex K
St Leonards On Sea

review_body: Good location and staff friendly and helpful. Bathrooms are a little tired. Serafina restaurant was a little expensive, first day for breakfast service was good, 2nd time poor. Very comfortable beds, good nights sleep.

We have stayed here twice and will be back a third time next week. The rooms are on the small side but very efficient. On our first trip we were upgraded and picked up some more room, which was nice. The bed is dreamy. We were in a wing that was really quiet. The hotel is well run and we never ran into any problems. The location so close to the 1 train means you can get up and down the island really quick. It isn't cheap but it is New York competitive. We stay on the upper west side quite often to visit family. We would rate NYLO alongside Lucerne as our favorites, with the Newton coming in third, although best in price. And when we price shop, NYLO almost always beats the Lucerne. We look forward to our return.

Had a great experience with my initial booking to stay at NYLO for 2 days for a conference and ended up with a great price with my AAA membership. Then, when I went to the front desk to ask about extending my stay one more night, I was told to call central booking. It was stressful since it didn’t seem as welcoming or hospitable and took a while since there was no communication between front desk/hotel and the central booking peolple on the phone. I didn’t feel like a person, just a number at the hotel. Overall stay was still great, but the hospitality was a little lacking. Cool space, just be prepared for a corporate feel.

I arrived here from Nashville to conduct a professional development training with NYC public school teachers. The accommodations, hotel staff, location, cleanliness, and overall vibe were outstanding and I will definitely recommend this hotel. In fact, since I am returning once/month across this academic year, I plan to make reservations and stay here each time.

We have stayed here several times a year since 2012. It has changed names, changed reception and lobby bar and seems even brighter/cleaner this year. Great location, near subway, shopping, bars/dining—housekeeping staff is excellent.

We stayed here for 3 nights with our two kids. The rooms are large for NYC standards and modern. Two queen beds. Comfy mattresses. Bathroom isn’t huge but serviceable. We have friends and family on the UWS, which is why we wanted to stay in this area. It is definitely not your traditional tourist neighborhood like Times Square (we considered this a good thing). There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance (well, come on, it’s NYC...skip the attached restaurant, though. It’s an Italian chain and nothing to write home about), coffee, bars, etc. The hotel itself was great. Staff were pleasant. Rooms were clean. The only issue we had is that they were doing some very noisy maintainance/construction work in the hallway right outside our room. They didn’t start until late morning, but still... we were on vacation and it would have been nice if we’d been notified the night before that we shouldn’t plan to sleep in. It’s a shame, because it marred an otherwise very nice stay.So, if you plan to stay...make sure to ask if they are doing any work inside the hotel and to be put in a room farrrrr away from it.

Good things: friendly staff, clean rooms, convenient location, good restaurants nearbyNot so good things: small room, Keurig coffee maker did not work, usual extras (cotton balls, q-tips) were missing from the bathroom

Rooms are fine but the lobby/bar is great. Easy access to subway. Comfy bed. Wish there was a mini bar. Serafina was good for brunch. Only three blocks to Museum of Natural History and Central Park. Recommended.

Had my Husbands surprise party close to NYLO . The management was wonderful They sent a very nice note + gift for the celebration . The after party came to the hotel bar and they were very accommodating. I would stay here again and again - great location . Great bed . Overall 5 stars from me !
user_name:
jilynrose
New York City, New York

review_body: Loved the vibe & the employees are so accommodating! Close by to the 1,2,3 train and beautiful area of NYC! Serafina restaurant was absolutely amazing, as well. It was rainy on that day so we didn't take a trip to the rooftop, but also have heard that it's wonderful!

We loved our stay at this newly renovated UWS spot. Stayed in a very spacious room with two queen beds. Great fun decor, a comfy sitting area with a sofa and two oversized chairs, cute cubbies for storage, ample floor space. The room never felt crowded, even for four people. Large bath that is not quite up to the décor-standard of the room, but spacious. I was surprised that there was no mini-fridge, which would have been helpful for a family. Plenty of outlets on endtables for plugging in electronics. Serafina's off the lobby is very good, and there is a terrific food market right across the street. Great location for getting to Central Park. Staff was fine, though not overly commendable. Hallways could use some refreshing, and I do wish that the elevator had higher security (no key-card access needed to access elevators, which is surprising). But it was good value for the area and I'd stay again and would definitely recommend, especially for those looking for family-sized rooms - hard to come by in NYC!

We loved NYLO! Great service and an especially professional bartender who made you feel NYLO was home. One concierge was wonderful but another one was the worst I’ve ever experienced in my global travels. She was bothered when you approached and lied to my questions.

NYLO just has a cool vibe to it. Parts of it are very dark (elevator area) and while I didn't really like that, I'm sure plenty of people of love. The bar is very cool. We had a terrace room and I enjoyed coffee out there each morning. It was nice way to start the day. The room was quite small and yet provided plenty of storage. Very well laid out. NYLO is really close to the subway which we appreciated after our many adventures during the day and night. The Birthday champagne was a very nice touch.

We stayed here for three nights, hotel is situated in a very convenient place, close to subway and many good eateries. It is clean, very comfortable beds but room was quite small and the bathroom very very small. One downside is the fact that the staff use the guests' lifts so you often have to wait ages for a lift.

Conveniently located with access to subway lines and great restaurants. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The bathroom was great - industrial/modern look with lots of shelves and counter space. Room was very pleasant and spacious - even accommodated my husband's golf clubs.

I have stayed here many times but this property is now apparently under new management is becoming shabby. Remodel of rooms and systems needed to make it competitive at this price point. Great neighborhood.

Stayed here several times already. The staff is great and accommodated our various requests. Initial room was noisy due to adjoining room door so staff moved us to a better and quieter room. Location is fantastic too. Can't beat the Upper West Side.

Lots of energy in the lobby / social areas of the hotel. The rooms, however, are not high end. Maybe it was the off-set tiling in the bathroom; offset tv mount , off-set electrical panels, bathroom shower curtains that had a foul smell. Upper level loft rooms are better because of the extra space and glass door bath showers. The other problems apply though in upper rooms. GREAT service, however by the front desk!

NYLO isn't what it used to be. The reservations person was rude when I tried changing my trip. The I was promised an corner room twice yet when I went downstairs to confirm, no notation was made. I was told it would be taken care of that next day, have my luggage packed and they'd move my luggage for me. Arriving back at the hotel later in the afternoon, nothing was done! It's the attention to details that's important, this hotel has stopped caring about the little things.

We have never been disappointed when staying at NYLO Upper Westside. We would recommend this hotel to everyone that we know traveling up to the Upper Westside NYC. From the moment we check in we know we will be taken care of and any issues we may have will be handled by the excellent front desk employees. Always very happy to stay here and look forward to our next stay

I stayed at NYLO for the second time in the past two years. This stay was for an entire week and it was fantastic. The staff were great, the room was modern, clean and very comfortable. Location is convenient to the subway and on the UPW!

The staff at NYLO in NYC are professional, friendly, and quick! Negotiating an arrival by car with luggage and a dog on a busy street could be cause for stress but not at NYLO. My room was very nice and I was warmly welcomed. Thank you for a lovely stay. I look forward to returning often.

Loved the vibe of the hotel! Comfortable beds and quiet room assured a solid night's sleep. Location met my needs esp. location to subway, great restaurants and shopping. It helped that the weather was unseasonably warm so NYC was at its finest! In the past I have always stayed in mid-town Manhattan; after this trip, I'll be heading back to NYLO.

Clean hotel with multiple repairs need during the stay. The staff tried to be helpful but the ongoing repair issues in the room are very annoying and on at least ine occasion required a late night technician visit

We have visited NYC many times but this was the first time we have stayed on the Upper West Side. The Hotel is well located in between Amsterdam and Broadway, with plenty of good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel.We booked a room with two queen sized beds for two adults and one teenager and actually thought it was a generously sized room by NYC standards.The Subway station at W72nd is just a few minutes stroll from the hotel and in within 5 minutes you can resurface at Time Square or Macy’s on 34th. The red line will take you all the way through Soho (Canal Street) and all the way down to Battery Park for the Statue of Liberty. For the first time this year we tried out the citibikes, which was a great experience. West, towards the Hudson you will find the bike station and access to the car free bike path all the way up and down the Hudson. Walk a few minutes east and you can pick a bike up on the corner of Central Park, we had a lovely ride on Sunday morning. There was a great buzz in the park, lots of people riding, walking, running and again no cars!I would definitely stay in this hotel again, it’s a nice clean place and a good location however the staff weren’t great. The staff generally don’t seem happy to be working at the Nylo and this is reflected in their general demeanour and the way they deal with customers. They were slow to respond (bar, concierge, reception), they weren’t very friendly and certainly didn’t work together and put the customer first. I asked the lady on concierge if she could retrieve our bags that were being stored for us after check out. She grunted that I needed to see reception, who was busy with a queue of people and returned to messing about with her mobile phone? The receptionist messaged the door staff who were not busy outside. They clearly received his message and ignored the request until the third time of asking. Not a great example of team work or customer service.

The Hotel is situated in a great location close to public transportation,central park and museums.The room was clean but rather small for 2 adults and 2 teenagers.In similar case is advisable to book 2 separate rooms.Nice bar!

There was a connecting door between my room and the neighbors so that was not sound proofed. The guy left his tv on all night and had some ear worm weird music playing all night. The hotel sent someone up when I complained at 5 am - he turned it back on once the security person left. I’ve been in rooms with connecting doors before - but this one was like a regular door you could see the light shining through the edges - and no sound proofing at all.

Great room! Trendy. Great location. Pleasant staff. I was attending a conference and this was a very comfortable choice. Tons of nearby restaurants and groceries. Close to subway (Metro) station. Will be back.

It took over 10 phone calls to speak to someone about changing a reservation. When you ask for a manager they put you on hold and never pick back up. I even called the corporate office and no one called me back! When you ask for STAY AWAY AT ALL COSTS!!!

From the front desk to the Spartan but comfy rooms, this hotel was designed for business travel and convenient to everything up and down Broadway! Find your friends in the inviting lounge layouts and bar. I will stay again!

The Nylo is a really nice hotel. Good location, the subway is really close. Friendly staff. Make sure to visit the rooftop, the view is great. The bar is really animated at night, but you don't hear any noise once in your room. The restaurant (Serafina) serves good meals from breakfast to dinner.

Hotel was clean, room was huge by NYC standards, and bed was comfortable for a good night's sleep. Only downside was that the noise from the hallway was louder than I've experienced at any other hotel. Around 5am the room across the hall sounded like they were in my room having a party. It died down, but it was clear that these walls were super thin. The location is awesome if you're looking to stay on the UWS, and close to the subway and great restaurants and shops. I'd be back, but only if I don't have to be up early the next morning, since the hallway noise is disruptive to sleep.

The location is excellent (Upper West side) close to the Natural History Museum, great restaurants and shops. However, the hotel was disappointing. The room we got faced a brick wall courtyard, it was badly lit, the bathroom tiny and the mattress too soft. Service was ok.

NYLO is a comfortable, delightful hotel in NYC. Located in a perfect location, great bar, and rooms are delightful. Staff were most helpful and friendly for example obtained a shuttle to Newark airport. Great place, Try it!
user_name:
Donna R
Las Vegas, New Mexico

review_body: Very comfortable, stylish hotel on the upper west side. Close to central park, many restaurants nearby. Subway close by, and crosstown bus route as well. The hotel staff are friendly and always helpful.

If it's not convenient, look somewhere else. Tragically overpriced. Perhaps if I booked earlier I would have gotten a better rate but at 400 plus per night we were very disappointed. Will definitely shop around before our next trip.

As there are not many choices on UWS, I struggled to find a good fit when booking, but scored when I grabbed Nylo for a special birthday weekend for my wife. Cool environment and helpful staff. Note: George the bellman was great. Friendliest employee by far (though all were friendly). We had a small suite with terrace and it was great to be able to step out for some air and views in the evening.

The room and floor smelled like cigarettes, there was a used bar of soap in my shower upon check-in, the maids forgot to clean my room on the last 2 days of my visits which is odd considering their cart and vacuum were parked outside my front door for my entire stay.

After four years with good experiences no doubt which hotel to book we returned to stay at NYLO and we were completely disappointed about its conservation. Next year unfortunately I`ll find another location

This was our 6th time staying at the Nylo and it does not disappoint. Conveniently located, easy access to subway, clean comfortable rooms and helpful staff keep us coming back. Looking forward to many more stays at the NYLO NY

Although I booked NYLO directly, requested a large king size bed on a high floor and said that I would be arriving late in the evening, I was not prepared for the surprising reception. The person at the desk, avoiding all eye contact, told me that they had given our room to someone else and that all they had was a room with 2 twin beds on a low floor. Why did they give the room I reserved to someone else??? They had my email address and phone number...couldn't they have confirmed that I would be there? I guess not. I told them that I was not willing to stay in a small room with 2 twin beds on a low floor..... unless they gave me a substantial discount. Suddenly, two people at the front desk went into action on their computers and bingo, they found a room with a large king bed, albeit on a low floor, that was supposedly an upgrade. Why in the world not offer an upgrade from the beginning? What a bad first impression. They don't seem to know a thing about creating good will. The room was pretty but barely above street level and noisy. When I called to reserve they had assured me that there was a magnifying mirror in the bathroom...there wasn't ..just the arm where the mirror had once been...there was nothing they could do about it they told me.So, we're off to a bad start....tried to downgrade the reserved room, no magnifying mirror but there were a few other things that made it an unpleasant stay overall. First of all, no one, not a single individual at the front desk ever smiled! It was like everyone was in his or her own world...whenever I walked up to the desk to ask a question I felt like I was bothering someone! The worst offender in the "don't bother me" category was the so-called concierge. She sat behind her computer screen, only looked up if you could get her attention, had never heard to major museums and galleries, knew nothing about fine dining and gave us wrong directions to a museum (I had to spell Whitney 3 times) which caused us lots of unnecessary walking. Come on now. This is supposed to be a boutique hotel...It has a concierge. A concierge should be in uniform, standing up, smiling, offering information and should look professional. This young woman was ill-informed, not in uniform and in need of ...sorry ...a serious manicure...Ugh!!!!The breakfast at the Serafina was ridiculous. No substitutions. If you wanted yogurt and fruit instead of eggs Benedict (more expensive) it was impossible. No bagels instead of English Muffins...and on, and on. Much better to forgo the "free breakfast" and walk down Broadway a block or 2 for a good breakfast.Nice location, helpful bellhop but that's it!!!

Lovely small hotel in great location in Upper West Side. Comfortable bed and nice bathroom with good shower. Quiet room. The staff was helpful. Nice restaurants nearby, Including Serafina which delivers to the hotel

Marvelous room, great bed,room problems solved immediately, all staff personnel very helpful and friendly. Definitely will recommend NYLO. Location perfect for the subway and for food. Upstairs open lounge was a pleasant surprise.

Jennifer at the front desk was particularly helpful and made us well very welcome! We love the LOCL bar and comfortable beds. The location is fantastic, close to great restaraunts, subway, and museums.

Nice hotel Friendly staff Convenient location. Decent value for New York City. Room was clean and there is a fitness center at the hotel but it is pretty limited. It would be nice if the rooms had a microwave and refrigerator..

It is a challenge to rate my recent stay at NYLO. The room was wonderful, the desk crew was extremely helpful, as were the bell service and the men providing curbside assistance. However.... The two times that I needed help navigating within the city, I chose to seek out the services from the Concierge on two separate occasions and with different women. In order for me to speak to either women, I first had to get their attention. From what? Their cellphones. I stood by the concierge stand for 30 seconds and debated whether or not to interrupt them from whatever was keeping them from performing their jobs. I decided to risk it... big mistake. In both cases my "excuse me, could you help me?" was met with a look of disdain. I'm thinking they were not pleased to see me. My questions were legitimate. I was experiencing NYC for the first time. On my follow up trip? I'm torn. Do I look to Air B and B? VRBO? Try a different hotel? Customer service wasn't consistent across the board.

Excellent place to stay in NY. Funky, fun, clean, stylish. Great location, quiet neighborhood. Had a small bar in the lobby area - great for a quick drink.(Wished it opened earlier, though!) Also, no doorman upon our arrival, so we had to lug our bags up 6 or 7 stairs - no big deal, but after a long flight it would have been nice to have some help.

Nice little hotel - loved the lobby and bar area - and the drinks. And the service --- very friendly and helpful - especially when there was a problem with my reservation....Thought the bar food (beef sliders) left a little to be desired. (My order was delayed I was told while a bigger order was being filled...and the sliders were pretty ordinary --- a little dry and overcooked.)

I came with my boyfriend trying out a new place in the city, and we will definitely be back for more. We were greeted by the bartender Benny immediately before even being fully seated by his bright smile and eager service. He offered great advice as to which drinks catered to our wants most before introducing us to his fellow bartender, Anna, who helped make the drinks to perfection. They both kept us laughing and never without a newly filled glass right as we would get to the bottom of our current drinks. The service was top-notch, while Benny and Anna themselves were the cherry on top of a fantastic gamble of a night out that could have easily gone wrong. Be sure to visit this bar for a refreshing new place to lounge!

Tonight was my first night ever to visit this lounge bar inside the private hotel. Benny behind the bar was very friendly, and the only thing that overshadowed his amazing drink suggestions was the warmth of his smile. He later introduced me to Anna his cheerful sidekick who gave my date and I plenty of laughs and delicious libations. Make sure to ask for Benny or Anna to make you their signature drink the Brooklyn Mule! Will be back soon.

The NYLO is in a great location w/in walking distance to Central Park, Museums and access to the subway. Great staff, rooms clean, quiet and well-sized. Safe neighborhood feel. Would definitely return.

We stayed for a week early October and are glad we chose this hotel.Great location couple blocks from subway, less than 5min jog to Central Park, and plenty of eateries (good ones!!!) around.Comfortable beds ... "very" comfy!There is rooftop garden and in house bar when you feel just to stay in.Top notch very clean room (kudos to the staff)The only gripe was the daily breakfast at Serafina restaurant next door, which was included in the room rate we paid. The food was below average compared to other establishments in the area, but the worse part was the service. Not only the long wait to get your order, we also had to wait a while just to get the staff attention to place the order even though the restaurant was far from full. We ended up having breakfast elsewhere on the last couple mornings of our stay.Very good rating for the hotel, could have been excellent without the breakfast.Tip: don't book for room+breakfast package rate if you can help it. It is not worth whatever saving you think you get.

Very enjoysble. The NYLO is in a great location on the Upper West side.The hotel bar was especially good for a late night drink. Bartender was especially good.. In general all of the staff were very friendly and professional.totally recommend the NYLO and would stay there again,

Love this hotel...close to subway, restaurants, shopping and more. Also delighted that there is NO CARPET! Rooms are big and bathroom is well set up. Nice gym too. Have been here multiple times...Will definitely stay again.

So I specifically booked two beds for this hotel. I called and checked on my room because I wasnt getting in until 1 am. Suprise the upgraded me to one bed infront of the elevator. $30 more a night to get 2 beds but they had me. Not very clean bath had green goop coming out- they allow dogs lobby unpleasant with dogs hoping up on you and furniture. Doorman was awesome not coming back.

My partner and I have just arrived back in Scotland after an amazingly comfortable stay at NYLO. The staff were extremely attentive and warm from the moment we arrived and went completely out of their way to make sure we had an enjoyable stay (this goes for all members of staff including concierge, reception, bartenders and maids). Our room was ready a few hours before expected (good news after a long flight), and we received some 'Welcome Drinks' tokens from reception after checking in.The hotel is conveniently located only a few blocks away from the 72nd Street subway - this made everywhere extremely accessible - as well as only a couple of blocks from Central Park.The hotel is also attached to an excellent Italian restaurant named Serafina, which is accessible from the hotel itself. The food was great, which resulted in us having dinner there twice within the five days we stayed.Our rooms were attended to on a daily basis to an excellent standard and we had no complaints whatsoever.All in all, I couldn't recommend this hotel more. We will definitely be returning on our next trip to NYC!

Very nice boutique hotel in great Upper West Side location. Great Italian and Chinese restaurants. Room was a little small, but 10th floor room was very quiet. Would have appreciated free WiFi. Staff was very accommodating and friendly.

Had a great room, large, with a view of the river last time. This time was in a smaller room on lower floor (for same money!). Some of the odd trendy design choices wore thin this time. Definitely noisier on lower floor.

Our family of three had a fabulous time at NYLO New York. The staff was friendly and helpful; the common areas interesting and comfortable and the location was perfect. We were able to walk to Central Park or jump on the subway to get where we wanted to go. The room was huge by NYC standards and the bed was super comfy. We will definitely stay there again!

Good hotel. Service at the front was a bit slow. Tried calling the desk a few times. Never had an answer. Overall the stay was good and average. Location of the hotel and a previous experience was the reason this place was the choice.

Excellent urban sophisticated vibe with several very plush lounges and working spaces. Very friendly and attentive service. Great rooms, clean, modern, really comfy beds at a great price. The perfect place to hang your hat uptown to see museums, eat at great restaurants, walk the park and see Broadway theater. Loved it. The bar is cool (Free drinks to guests!) and Anna and Chris are very cool. And Chris can sing!

The hotel has nice location. My room was ready after 2 times of asking at 4:45pm. I staid in a room in the top floor with balcony. The lock of the door did not work. At 10 in the morning vacuum cleaning waked me up. Why vacum cleaning at 10:00 if customer has the sign of do not disturb. Why the rush,you deliver the room anyway at 4pm.And the acting of personel at desk was this is a normal thing. No apoligy or any sign of responsible feeling.

The hotel was conveniently located and within a couple of blocks from the subway. View from our room was on W 77 Street. Great location and value for the deal that we got it for. Will look for similar deals in hopes of staying there again when we travel to New York in the future.

Great hotel, specially if you go to see the American Museum of Natural History. Very friendly staff, nice bar downstairs, life music in the evenings. Very clean and practical rooms. If you are looking for good views take the upper floor. Today Ramona at reception deck solved one small problem for me in very efficient and cordial way. Thank you guys!

I returned to this hotel after sampling a few hotels in the neighborhood. I still like this hotel best, both for its cleanliness, wood floors, comfortable bed, quiet air conditioning and superb location. Since one gets prompted for upgrading at a discount, I decided to upgrade to a bigger suite with a view. Unfortunately I ended up with a room which was even less furnished (no chair, no desk) and the same size as what I had before. Granted there was a window and I was no longer "walled in", there was no way the room was over 300 sq ft as advertised in the upgrade. Upon complaint to management, however, I was moved to a bright and spacious room the next day which I was very happy with. Just be sure you're aware of what you are upgrading to if you decide to upgrade. I need to travel to the upper west side frequently over the next few years and intend to keep returning to this hotel.

clean room in a great location. lot's to do around there and it's so close to the subway. Got a free welcome drink which was a nice add on. I do wish the lobby were brighter. It makes a sort of unwelcoming feeling. One elevator which wasn't working in the evening was quickly repaired. I liked that. I'd stay here again.

We visited New York City for the first time and stayed at the NYLO. It was a great experience and a wonderful location. It was walking distance to Central Park and Riverside Park on the Hudson River. We recommend the NYLO to anyone.

like the NYLO very much. This was another enjoyable stay at this very convenient location. Everything is around - subway lines, buses, cabs, food establishments and other necessities. I enjoyed the breakfast at Serafina and the complimentary drink in the lobby in the evening. Thanks also for the bottled water

Great location; room seemed smaller than advertised but nice and quiet facing Broadway. Truly horrible WiFi for which they charged an astonishingly high price. Dark lobby that was mostly a bar. Ample elevators except when one is broken.

This was my first time at this hotel. Excellent location. The hotel is a lovely place to relax, have a drink and get a good night sleep. Rooms are clean, nothing fancy but quite. I would recommend this hotel for your ny stay. The train station is right down the street and Central Park is very close.

Great location and wonderful staff. Jessie on the Front Desk was terrific on check-in and check-out. She gave me a very quiet and rather large room which I really enjoyed. Breakfast at Serafina was quick and delicious.

Great, clean, comfy space!! We keep coming back. Nylo never disappoints!!! The staff is amazing always helpful and friendly! Nylo is in the best location for "Shake Shack", Starbucks,shopping, and shows.

Booked a one night stay to celebrate our 37th anniversary over the Labor Day weekend. Knew of the hotel because we had lived on the West Side for 23 years and watched as the hotel was being built. We had a wonderful one night stay starting right from the point of check-inTasha was so friendly and pleasant - asked about and possibility of an upgraded for the special occasion. Tasha congratulated us on the occasion and within a few minutes had an upgrade that she thought we would like. She was so absolutely right. We were given a wonderful -I think it was a jr suite- on the 14th floor with an amazingly large balcony. The rooms and bathroom were spotlessly clean, with a living room area, a separate bedroom area and bathroom area. Very comfortable, not traditional furniture - not tired, bed was very comfortable but yes a bit high. The lock room cabinets were a bit odd but colorful. Staff and the hotel really made the stay so special - it might of been slow in the city as it was the Labor Day weekend making the extra special upgrade possible, but the staff and hotel went far beyond that when they sent complimentary chocolates and a chilled bottle of very nice white wine to our room. Read a lot of the reviews which made me hesitate a moment in making the reservation. So glad I did make a reservation -the hotel lived up to best reviews and our personal experience far exceeded them! Wouldn't think twice about going back for another stay or recommending it to friends! The Consolini's

Second time we stayed here. Was impressed the first time but this time no so much. Nice friendly staff but I think the place was short on amenities.( The first time we stayed we got a free newspaper, not this time). About the only amenity, not counting soap and shampoo, was a Keurig coffee maker, which was good.The room are all built in, tasteful and modern but there was no easy chair,nor any chair except for a desk chair. There is no carpeting, but wood floors, which is good imo.They offer only one day of free WiFi which these days is sort of taken for granted. The computers in the lounge are abysmally slow.When we arrived we were given a card for a free glass of champagne or a spritzer but all they had to offer was white or red wine. No apologies offered.I like the area. It is truly NYC and away from the heavily trafficked tourist area. It is very close to the red line and bus 79 takes you on 79th street straight through Central Park to the museum area.I probably will not stay here again considering the price and the barebones amenities. They tout themselves as a "boutique" hotel, whatever that means.

Excellent hotel. Rooms are very small but clean. Bed very comfortable. All the amenities there like lots of lighting, desk, etc. Feels upscale. Lots of great restaurants in the area. Close to the American Museum of Natural History.
user_name:
Kathy W
Stony Brook, New York

review_body: Impressive maid service, bell-hops, and check-in desk staff... answered our every question and attempted to meet our MANY needs. We were in NYC to celebrate the birthday of my niece and my daughter ... and a large group of their friends joined us at the bar and storing things, etc. We were, to say the least , a very "needy" bunch!! LOL ! However, we were given cheerful, helpful responses and helpful suggestions at every turn. Thank you NYLO, for valuing good customer service, for maintaining LOVELY surroundings from the floral arrangements, to the library and the comfy well kept lounge area, we felt very very pampered.

This was my first visit to NYC for thirty years, so I may have been expecting too much. The lobby area with its bar and piano was always a hive of activity - fun and noisy. The hotel is surrounded at close quarters by tall buildings so most rooms have no view. I paid extra for an upgrade expecting to have one of the top three floors - all it did was get us moved up from the 6th floor to the 11th on the north wall, three floors below those illustrated in the misleading 'up-grade' advertisement.Service was cheerful but inefficient as housekeeping forgot to replace things every day such as cups, towels, milk etc.The breakfast in the understaffed Italian restaurant next door was not a great experience - the 'American Breakfast' was a disappointment, croissants OR bread, awful eggs Benedict. Coffee OK.At nearly USD500 per night (including taxes and gratuities), B&B for two people, I thought it was pricey for its four stars.

I love staying here. The rooms are great, bar is awesome, staff is friendly and you can't beat the neighborhood. I come into town and commute to Rockland County during the day. The trip in the morning is hassle free.

I found a great rate online and then visited the hotel to check-in. The man checking me in did a very poor job in offering me one thing, then informing me it was not available. This was very frustrating, especially after returning from a trip abroad and just looking to sleep! The beds on the other hand were extremely comfortable. We booked two double rooms - one of which was handicapped and they did not inform us. The room we stayed in was not exactly my version of clean - finding hairs in the sink not exactly a nice welcome! Welcome drink upon arrival is a nice touch!

This hotel in the upper West side was great. I stayed here before it changed to the NYLO and loved the location. The rooms have been updated and are clean and modern. Great lobby bar and Henry did all he could to make the drinks perfect. Serafina restaurant would have gotten high marks but the staff have a little bit of an attitude. Love this hotel !
user_name:
TwoCairns
North Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

review_body: hotel was a great location to the 1 train and surrounding areas. The one disappointment was the so called free vouchers for drinks which ended up on our bill and part of the Urban Fee. It was an extra $31 dollars that we would never have taken part in if we had known.

We stayed at the NYLO as a group of 10 spread across 3 rooms. We booked early, and got our rooms at an extremely competitive price for other hotels on the Upper West Side.The hotel is very nicely appointed in a unique, loft-style. Each of our 3 rooms was different - we had a huge bathroom, while others in our group had smaller bathrooms, but larger living areas. The beds were extremely comfortable, and it didn't take long at the end of the day to fall asleep.We didn't have any problems with hotel noise, but there is a fire station across the street, and, according to other members of our party, there was some road noise.All of the hotel staff were very helpful and worked very hard to make sure our needs were met. The terrace on the 16th floor was a daily hangout for our group, and the bar was a good way to end the day.Great trip, great stay!

We LOVE staying at NYLO! My husband and I actually got engaged here back in 2015, and we returned last week to kick off the first night of our honeymoon before heading to St. Lucia! We were offered champagne upon arrival, and Vivek upgraded our room at check-in because we were newlyweds! We were so excited! We had a beautiful balcony off of our room, and the bed was outrageously comfortable. Vivek even surprised us with a bottle of champagne and some chocolates in our room! We so appreciated these lovely gestures, and they really made our stay so special and memorable. No details are missed here- it's a beautiful spot and we will always return! Thank you!

Had such a great time here, staff was super helpful and gave great recommendations for restaurants in the area. The hotel itself is super trendy and hip and was great for me and my friends that stayed with me.

The bed was excellent. I got the best sleep I have had in a very long time! The staff was courteous and friendly and the hotel lobby was really trendy and fun! I enjoyed my stay thoroughly and would stay here again.

NYLO is a hip and cool spot. From the lobby entrance to the room it is a cool vibe. For NYC the room size is adequate, but like most NYC hotels it is small. The mattress was plush. Very clean and quiet. The location is perfect for everything located in a he Upperwestside.

Í have stayed at NYLO in October 5 years in a row now. without exception my stay has been very comfortable.. the hotel could be more transparant though as far as the amounts it charges your credit card with.. when checking out you are told that you are all set without giving you a specification of the amounts it charges. when home you see your card is charged 5 times and it's not clear what's it all about
user_name:
gerard b
The Hague, The Netherlands

review_body: Staff were fabulous! Took care of all of our needs! We arrived with a lot of luggage and George took care of everything and made sure our room was comfortable and met all of our needs. The staff at the bar were friendly and happy to provide us with a complimentary drink on our arrival. Location was perfect for getting around New York. We would stay there again.

Third time staying at the NYLO. This time the room was small but guest services told us what to ask for next time we stay. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Location is the main reason we choose this hotel and will be back again next month.

Not your ordinary hotel there is a different feeling when you go up to the front desk to register for your room at the NYLO on Broadway - a cozy living room type area with tv, a chess game, a couple of computers and people sitting around. Laughter - A bar, tables and bar seats, I always got the feeling at the NYLO,( I have spent several days there in the past year) that there was a 'nook' for me and to curl up on a comfortable chair or sofa makes it feel like home. And the rooms are very nice.Sooooo much to see from the rooms on Broadway. Brings me back to my first 35 years or so as a native New Yorker many, many years ago

The bed was very comfortable, truly king size, and we both slept very well. The AC was cold enough and didn't adjust on its own overnight. The bathroom worked well for the space that it had, and we enjoyed our stay very much.

I booked the hotel online and was amazed with the pictures of the penthouse. Well when we arrived nothing was like the pictures. The room was small smelled like pot and no terrace just a very small balcony with space for just two chairs. Very disappointed
user_name:
Maria S
San Diego, United States

review_body: NYLO is in a convenient location close to the Upper West side and generally a good "value for money" place in Manhattan. The elevators continue to require an upgrade (very slow especially during rush hour) and the hotel can be a bit noisy inside. Other guests and staff opening and closing doors with a lot of noise.

NYLO New York City is a clean, efficient, super-convenient hotel on the Upper West Side. Reasonably priced and friendly staff make for a great stay. Serafina is a great restaurant for breakfast, lunch, or dinner.

Hotel is located well, near a major subway station (72nd street). Noise is problem, not within the hotel, but from the street. Room is small. Bathroom s small. Overall, just an average room. Staff is friendly and helpful.

This is a fun hotel with a good location. The room was nice. Only issue was the door which stuck so tightly it had to be bumped hard, repeatedly to open. Staff failed to address this despite my requests.

Booked NYLO for one night during recent trip to NYC. Great, cool interior, very helpful staff and lovely room with one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in! Only downside - the air conditioning units in the bedrooms are very loud. I turned mine off in the end.
user_name:
Sara P
London, England, United Kingdom

review_body: The NYLO hotel was a great boutique hotel at a fair rate and in an awesome location. I will definitely return. I visited for business. The only negative was the view. I did not have an exterior view, which made the room feel dark and small.

Really love this fantastic property. It's our home when we travel to NYC. Very friendly and helpful hotel staff, and a great team of bar staff in the LOCL. Especially Anna, Chris and Henry. This property is beautifully designed and a great choice.

I stayed at the NYLO while in New York on business. The location was great, Upper West side, blocks from Central Park, the 1 train and West Side Greenway. The hotel was nice and clean, with a fun bar atmosphere at night and pleasant and professional staff.

NYLO is modern, clean, friendly staff, and in the best part of the upper westside. You can walk to the subway station, walk to Levain's bakery and get a scrumptious cookie, plenty of amazing places to eat. I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else.

Was very disappointed in our room this time. Being a female, there was no sink room. We ended up putting the ironing board in bathroom. Try moving around ironing board for ten days. That's why we didn't use housekeeping. Also no magnifying mirror. One would think there would be the usual shower cap, Q-tips, cotton balls, etc...nothing. Next time I will need to get a larger room and bathroom and perhaps not stay as long.

Great Broadway location in upper West side. Hence price varies from high to very high . There was no much space left by the giant bed.. The bathroom was modern and fresh looking. Room cart left in the hallway most of the time we were there. Room doors not fixed so they don't slam shut.Location is excellent, but definitely would not recommend the hotel.

The Nylo Hotel was a very classy please. With management always on top of things. My bartender Chris really took care of me and my party at all times. I was expecting a real fireplace but happy with my experience. I was treated like a queen.

Great Broadway location in upper West side. Hence price varies from high to very high . There was  no much space left by the giant bed, but by Manhattan standards one could call the room spacious. The bathroom was modern and fresh looking, slow drain in both fixtures was expected and quickly fixed by friendly personnel. Live music in the lobby restaurant was slightly loud but very nice.. Unfortunately, savings on hotel's operators and good phone system turned my overall great experience into an ongoing nightmare. I left a small gadget in the room, noticed only today and tried to retrieve it , They show only 1 hotel number witch supposed to be an operator's or ring at the front desk, right?. Wrong! I spent more than 4 hrs , left 3 unreturned messages and still fail to get any help on locating my device. Lost and found facility is a joke. I am going to continue my quest tomorrow. Wish me a good luck!

Beautiful hotel. Pleasant staff. Great hotel rooms. Extremely clean. I definitely recommend and will stay at this hotel again.We stayed for a Yankees Game. I found it extremely easy to jump on a train and get right to the stadium

My wife and I stayed for more than 2 weeks @ the Nylo last month.First things first – the service that was everything that I could have asked for and beyond. The team immediately recognized us from previous stays and offer to help and make this long stay more comfortable for us and our grandchildren that live close by. In particular I must highlight the service that we got from Mr. Carlos Vidot and Mrs. Jennifer Duran @the front desk. You guys are amazing! The hotel is very trendy and with modern design and the room was very large with nice view to the Broadway. They are playing great music in the lobby, and there is always something going on. I feel like it’s the great balance between being in NYC but enjoy the atmosphere of the upper west side.We intend to come and visit the NYLO NYC Hotel whenever we will arrive visiting NYC..

The noise from next door was so loud because we were given a conjoined room. The only help the staff could give was to send up ear plugs. When I told them the issue upon checking out they said they would make note of it on my profile. Not very helpful.

This is the perfect stay in new York city. Friendly, beautiful, great rooms, wonderful beds, Quiet even if it's in the middle of town. Music night downstairs. It's the real New York but stoll very close to Times Square. I love it and will come back!

This hotel was really cool and modern. The staff was friendly and very helpful, especially Vivek. He gave me another key card when I lost my wallet. The room was comfortable and quiet. The restaurants were very delicious as well. The also stored my bag free of. charge after I checked out so I could walk around the city unencumbered.

My wife and I stayed at NYLO for our honeymoon last year and it was a perfect hotel for us. We had one of the more expensive rooms which was well furnished with our own balcony. The bar area was very stylish and a nice place to hang out after a busy day walking around NYC. Great stay, certainly worth the extra money against cheaper hotels if you’re on a budget, would 100% go back.

Very disappointed to find that the bathroom ceiling was covered in mold. Hotel response was lackluster and just involved painting over the mold. Room was noisy and the beds were too soft. Location and condition other than bathroom was fine.

Jennifer was THE nicest, and the most friendly person I have ever had the pleasure to meet at any hotel - she get's it! The walls are a bit thin; I could hear the lovers in the room next door getting it on.

I recently stayed at NYLO while in the city visiting my grandmother and cousins. This is my favorite place to stay for a few reasons. The neighborhood is super convenient and located right near all the NYC hot spots and the rooms are always clean and comfortable. The bathroom could be bigger, but it's still very modern and sleek. The hotel bar is fun and the staff is lovely. Compared to a few other places I've seen in the neighborhood, this hotel is the best deal all around. Hope they stay that way.

Only one ice machine and when the door is locked for an undisclosed period of time it's a problem because there are no refrigerators in the rooms. Staff response was dull at best and certainly not worth $450 a night.

We picked this hotel for price and booked a standard room. Rooms are TINY. Barely enough room for two adults to turn around. Also, there is a fire station across the street so between hearing that at night and the hotel staff shouting at each other in the hallways in the morning, there was nothing peaceful about it. However, the bed is very comfy, if you can get it to stay on the frame. At $300/night, I expected a little better.

Excellent staff, room and common areas. Excellent price value for the quality of the hotel and the location. NYLO is both innovative and comfortable. i will be back and i am already telling friends that they should stay there.

This was a little gem off Central Park West. Service was great and the bed quality was terrific. Recommend getting the upgraded king room. Others were very small. Noise level of Broadway could be intense as the fire station is just across the street.

Jessie checked me in and since I was staying for 8 days upgraded my room. It was a great size with everything I needed. The room was quiet and clean. There were plenty of restaurants within walking distance and I never had trouble getting a taxi.

We really enjoyed our stay at NYLO. We had booked a loft room with a terrace that had a great view of surrounding buildings and through to the river - a perfect spot for an evening drink. The room itself was spacious with plenty of storage space, a very comfortable bed and a compact but well set-up bathroom. We found the staff to be welcoming, helpful and friendly. The only negative was the lack of a fridge in the room, but apparently they will provide one on request.If you are looking for a place to stay on the upper west side, we can heartily recommend it. You maybe a little out of the main centre,but with a Metro stop two blocks away, it's not difficult to get downtown.

I was one of a group of 16 last evening at the LOCL bar located in the lobby of the NYLO Hotel. This was an outing of class parents from a school here on the Upper West Side. The event was a huge success due in no small part to our superb server, Kimberly. She was a constant, unobtrusive presence in our private area of the bar and kept the tables clear and the glasses filled throughout the evening. When asked, she made thoughtful recommendations from the cocktail menu, and when the same questions were repeated over and over (due to late arriving guests) she answered patiently and with a smile! All in all, a beautiful bar and amazing service! I think I've found a new favorite spot. We'll (all) be back.
user_name:
steveNYC157
New York City, New York

review_body: My room could be also a suite since it shared a door to another room, that of course was locked because it was not been used as a suite but as a one guest room this time. The problem is that the door that divides both rooms is not a noise isolation door. I heard all the crying of two kids next door, their parents yelling and trying to calm them down, and adults speaking loudly until late at night. Those doors need to be sound absorbing to prevent this types of situations

We only stay in the NYLO in New York City. It's close to multiple subway stations, Central Park, the Natural Museum, great restaurants and so much more. The rooms are clean; staff is polite and helpful.

This was my 2nd stay at this property and once again it was a great stay. Close to subway stop and a good walk to Central Park. Good eating options around close. Grocery across the street. Drug store and mid level shopping across the street. Room is nice and modern. Free internet. When I checked in there was a musty smell in the bathroom but housekeeping came immediately and re-cleaned and I didn't have a problem the rest of my stay.
