I can for sure recommend this property if you are visiting New York!

We stayed here a few years ago and had a great time. We had a beautiful spacious room with lots of light coming through the windows. This trip we arrived late at night and were given a 2nd floor room with a tiny window looking on to a flat rooftop with a lot of garbage on it. The room was dark. The king bed took up the entire room, although the bathroom was very spacious. I questioned the "urban fee" charge of $31 per night when we arrived and we were told that this daily charge covers wifi, use of the gym, 2 bottles of water and 2 drinks at the bar on the first night. We complained about the fee and the man who checked us in told us that he had only been working there for 2 weeks and there was nothing to be done about the "urban fee" charge. As it turned out, we never used the gym or the drink tickets and the wifi in the room was painfully slow. On the positive side, the hotel is in a great neighborhood with great restaurants including the Red Farm next door. Its conveniently located to public transportation and also easy to walk to many places.When we checked out we saw that the hotel had deducted $4 a day from our "urban fee" but this did not change my opinion of our stay. We are not sure we will stay at NYLO again. We feel the hotel was not up front about the "urban fee". It was buried in the fine print of our reservation and we are still angry. We ended up paying an extra $27 per day for nothing. There are many nice hotels in NY to stay in. Next time we will look more closely at the fine print.

The location is perfect for getting around the city, 2 blocks from the 79th & Broadway subway station. We stayed here for five days. The front desk service was exemplary. The bed is really comfortable. Weekend housekeeping was inconsistent as far as replacing used soaps and coffee pods.

I definitely enjoy the NYLO hotel as an Upper West Side location. The lounge area has a wonderful decor and energy, and the staff serving drinks and food are always excellent.The only drawback to the hotel is the size of the small rooms. This doesn't phase me at all, but I know it isn't the right fit for some.

it s a pity reallyif people on the front desk were a little more friendly your hotel will receive very good marksyou can t speak like that to your customer we had the feeling that people on the front desk were really not happy to work there

The hotel room doors are very loud when closing and it was difficult to get a good night's sleep with all of the door noises coming from the hallway.Would have also preferred that the cleaning carts not be located in front of elevator at all times of day.

Location: great neighbourhood, not too touristy, just a block from a subway station. Room - spacious by New York standards (i.e. small but not too small), very comfortable bed, lots of electrical outlets, good internet, but an inconvenient "designer" stainless steel sink in the bathroom – where are you supposed to put your stuff? And what's with the "resort fee"? For that kind of money, I would expect flawless service and facilities, sparkling wine every day (not just once), and turn-down service. Ha! Not only was there no chocolate on my pillow, the "business centre" - a single computer in the lobby - didn't work. So I went to see the concierge. Took a minute to pry her attention away from her cell phone. Oh, she said. The computer doesn't work. It needs a software update. OK, I said. How do we get our boarding passes printed? Well you could go to the print shop around the corner, she said. Excuse me? No, I'm not going to the print shop around the corner. I could normally do it for you, she responded, but my printer is out of ink. And went back to her cell phone. We did manage to get a front-desk person to print our boarding passes, but WTH?Other features: a lively piano bar scene in the lobby. (Get out of the hotel, fellow travellers! Expand your horizons! You're in New York!) A lovely, under-used patio on one of the top floors. Lots of food options nearby. I'd stay there again. But maybe next time we'll see a different concierge and a working business centre.

This is a well-run hotel. I like the rug-free rooms; nice and clean. The Ikea style furnishings add whimsy. The bed was very comfortable and stable. However, whenever the a/c or heating unit went on I thought I was behind a jet engine on the runway at JFK. Boom, then the noise continued. This is an issue many hotels have. The noise did make falling off to sleep a bit harder.

Great Location in the Upper West Side. Staff is always helpful. Have stayed there many times. Many good restaurants in the area. Will stay there on our next trip to NYC. Subway is close. Highly recommended.

this has always been a terrific hotel. It's in a great location. On this visit, there were problems with the HVAC that didn't get resolved. The hotel did move me. The staff were wonderful, but there was no offer to make up for the awful first night with no air conditioning. Overall, it's a terrific place to stay. This is the first time I've had a problem

This is not a huge building, more a boutique hotel with a quiter ambience.Staff is great, always available to help. The bar in the lobby is really nice with great cocktails and live music on friday night.My room was not too big but clean and with a nice view of Broadway Avenue.They also have direct access to Serafina restaurant for breakfast and lunch/dinner.Definitely a great choice if you want to be in this area of Uptown.

We had a good room and were well looked after by all the staff. The location is excellent, being just a couple of blocks from Central Park and easy access to local restaurants, subway, etc. Room and bed were made up well each day. Our thanks to Vivek who was very helpful in getting our tickets to Hamilton sorted out.

We booked two rooms for our stay on 9/26-9/28 in NYLO. Although the hotel has a good and modern vibe, I probably won't recommend it for the place to stay for a family trip. We originally requested rooms on a higher floor, but due to availability which we completely understand, we got two room on the 2nd floor. The interior design is unique, but need more attention on hygiene. We found stains on the new towels. Also hot water didn't work properly. We were assigned to room that are quite afar, and both room were having this water issue. It took 10-15 mins literally for warm shower water to come after we turned the faucet all the way to the end. At first we thought maybe they didn't have hot water at all. It's such a big waste to let water run. We've mentioned this to front desk too, but they simply they can't help. The other thing is noise level on the 2nd floor is really high. In the morning when the city's sanitation truck passed by, it's impossible to ignore that noise. Not the kind of wake-up call/noise we expected. In the future, if you add an extra layer of soundproof to the lower-floor windows, that might help. Overall, the hotel is a ripoff for the kind of service and experience we had. They charged a "resort fee" on top of the hotel price but we didn't feel anywhere close to staying at a resort.

The hotel is clean and in a good area near restaurants and central park.The common areas described and shown in pictures arent available unless you are staying in a room with a broadway balcony, they have a small common area on the side street but there isnt much of a view.Theres only one ice machine in the whole building and the computers/printers where down.They only provided water in the maid service 3 days out of a week, gym was small and limited.

This hotel has a resort fee that with the tax can reach as much as $40 per night. There is only one purpose to this fee and it is not to provide you with extra services. It is so the hotel rate shown on internet search engines can appear lower than it actually is. Once they have enticed you to their site they stick it to you hoping you will not notice the fee which is disclosed in small letters slipped into the overall charges. They call it a “mandatory urban fee.” It is not mandatory at all. Direct from the hotel web site, here is what you are supposed to get by paying this fee: “Unlimited local & domestic long distance phone calls (within the USA) - Unlimited WIFI public space and Guestrooms - Unlimited use of Fitness Center 24 hours - Unlimited use of the Business Center with printing, faxing and scanning through the Front Desk - Welcome Cocktail upon arrival - In-room Bottled of water- Replenished Daily - Neighborhood Perks and Special Events.” This is total nonsense! Perhaps you have a cell phone on which you make your phone calls and perhaps you do not use the other services offered. You should refuse to pay this fee! They will say this fee is charged so they can have these services available to you, so you need to pay. Do not pay for what you do not use! The hotel is available to you even if you do not stay there. Do you pay the hotel if you do not stay there? Of course, not! The easiest way to handle this fee is to stay somewhere else! But, if you get caught in this situation, here or at another hotel, refuse to pay, stick up for yourself and the rest of us that resent the rip off!!!

Love the property. Handicap room bathroom was a bit odd. Needs some grout cleaning. Little shelf for soap, etc... I may have accidentally booked it, so that may be on me. Otherwise, main room was nice.

Overall like the hotel style and feel. Rooms are about average size for New York. There was a lot lacking in cleanliness. Bathroom was covered in black mold and air conditioning went out for hours forcing us to leave. Also we were woken up by staff shouting at each either down the hall every morning around 8 am.

I had to take a last minute trip to NYC for business so prices were astronomical for most of the hotels, $700 for a Marriott property! I came across this deal and was surprised by the reasonable price and what looked like a nice property. We arrived at 1pm and I am always reluctant to check in early because most places are stringent with that 4pm check in time but the front desk personnel was very helpful and pleasant. The room was on the smaller side but it’s NYC so I wasn’t that surprised. The bathroom was VERY tight! I had to step over the toilet to get to the shower. Overall, the room was clean and the decor was nice and comfortable. I usually stay in midtown when I travel to NY, but the hotel location in Upper East Side was a nice change. It was away from the tourists and crowds, and cleaner too. The only downside was that it was far from my conference and other points of interests for me. I would definitely stay at this hotel again! It was chic and quaint, and loved that it was away from the crowds plus you get a nice welcome drink when you arrive (much needed when navigating the NY traffic and chaos).
user_name:
Marie N
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great modern hotel fantastic room and very friendly staff. All restaurants around the hotel offer excellent food would definitely stay again FANTASTIC loved it. Short walk to central park and great shops

This hotel was great. Easy access to the subway, in a nice up town neighborhood. Short walk to Central Park and many restaurants.The beds were so comfortable Both restaurants were good - red farm was great but $$$The rooms are small (ours was) but it met our needs. And after all the walking and sightseeing the comfortable bed was the most important part. We were in 1126. We did not find the street noise an issue but that may have been because we were on the 11th floor.The only thing this room lacked was a small fridge, I can't remember the last time I stayed in a hotel with out a fridge in the room.

God location on upper west side in New york city, very nice ambience and good service. Ask for a Broadway side room.Nice place to spend time in the lobby. Nice view from the terrace with photo opportunity

First I would like to thank Jessie at the front desk for her help in immediately rectifying a minor issue with my room, no grief, no attitude just " I understand, I will take care of that" off to a good start.Love the location, conveniently located to the 1-2-3 train, Central Park, Lincoln Center and Time Square. My room was clean, uncluttered and bright, I like the fact that NYLO uses white lines on the bed, not having to worry about what nasty is hidden in a dark bedspread. My room faced Broadway but noise was not an issue. I also like the fact that the nightstands had power outlets and a usb connection. My bed was super comfy and the ladies that provided room service (7th floor) did a real nice job.

The fact that I live in Brooklyn and come to NYLO's bar LOCL after work or just to relax really says enough about this place, but I'll continue. The vibe is really relaxed and cozy for a hotel bar. There is a private-like space in the library, comfy couches in the back by a red baby grand piano, or an open space by the bar with tables and chairs. The real reason I keep coming back to LOCL/NYLO is the service. I always feel so taken care of and actually known and cared about by a couple of the servers-- in particular the short one with the beard, Chris. He makes drinking at NYLO alone feel like a fun hang out, and drinking with a friend feel like a party. His energy is infectious. Whether you're a guest at this hotel or just in the neighborhood, stop by. You won't regret it. They have live music on fridays!!

The price is unbeatable. Neighborhood is fantastic and accessible to everything. You'd think it was a dump for this price, but it's as nice as the Ace. The bed was so comfortable, and the room was quite large, especially for NYC.

Lovely comfortable room. Couldn't beat the price. Will recommend to friends. Centrally located and within walking distance to all public transportation. Great bar and welcome area and near shows and Central Park
user_name:
fridayz
New York City, New York

review_body: Room 205 faces a wall. Windows are shaded out so you cannot see the wall. The bathroom was moldy. This was the complete opposite experience of my corner room on a high floor several months ago. That was a pleasurable experience. This recent stay was a complete let down. The breakfast that "comes with the room" for the breakfast package includes coffee and toast. Don't lie fooled or you will pay out of pocket for the breakfast you order at Serafina

Nice hotel i stayed in a room with balcony on the 15 floor and our freinds stayed on the 16th floor which was nice clean staff were nice also very helpful not far from times square bed was very comfortable.

I was in New York City on a busy weekend so I expected prices to be high. Didn't mind paying the price for a "superior" king room at about $400 per night. However, I got an inside room with absolutely NO light. It was small which most hotel rooms are these days but it had no light and absolutely no frills even the small niceties that good hotels always give you. Location is great. Free wi fi is good. Lobby is very nice. But .. their rooms leave something to be desired unless you can pay for one of their best rooms that face the outside. I felt as if I was in a cave. Too bad but I won't stay there again.

Very charming hotel and perfect location. There was not so much day light coming through the window, but it was compensated by the fact that my guest room was pretty big with nice style. It felt comfortable. Bathroom was also spacious. Quiet at night (great!) I enjoyed my stay and would come back without hesitation.

Our room was clean & quite spacious for NYC; we liked being in a "quieter" neighbourhood. thought the bathroom could use a few towel bars, there was room for a couple under the shelf. Bed was soft & comfy, we didn't use the maid services because we were there for just 2 nites. The AC unit could have been quieter & a TV guide of sorts would have been handy instead of trying to find certain channels while clicking on the TV.

We have stayed here before but this year, we are staying here often due to it's location on the UWS, where we will be in town to go to Columbia University Football Games. The rooms are nice and the location is close to the 1 train. Due to a flight being late, we had some issues with our room being given away (they called when we were mid air). When we arrived, they put us in another room but I was unhappy with the explanation. Upon mentioning this at checkout to a hotel manager, he went above and beyond to remedy the situation, check and guarantee all of our other reservations and gave us a discount off our bill for the trouble. I so appreciate his response and will be a loyal customer.

Completely UNACCEPTABLE! FILTHY, NASTY, DISGUSTING!!!! I was in the middle of my shower when I SEE this DISGUSTING glob of hair on the shower wall. I have NEVER IN MY LIFE experienced something like this at a hotel claiming to be 4+ Stars! I even have an upgraded, terrace view room and it is NOT Clean. I can’t believe this unbelievably horrible experience. AND I just turned down my sheets and they are FILTHY TOO!!!!!!!!!! do NOT book this hotel!

If there was a competition among hotel front desk staff, Nylo would dominate with their hospitality. Vivek and Jennifer are examples to the industry of what service should look like. I'll definitely return to Nylo because of my experience.

My room was small but it was perfect for a single business traveler with access to subway and upper west side businesses. It was quiet and felt like a great little nest so sleeping was heaven. Upstairs lounge area upstairs provided a beautiful view of the city rooftops and a nice place to have a glass of wine and relax with friends. Thanks, NYLO!

Needed to be on the upper west side. This hotel at Broadway and 77th street fit the bill.Though the location near the park is very good, we found the hotel to be lacking in charm and warmth. Our room was very small, no room for an easy chair. The bathroom on the other hand was larger than necessary. All okay if you spend little or no time in the hotel. Nice restaurant Sarafina attached. Very good French coffee shop a block a

Very nice "bouteeky" hotel with better than avg room sizes by NYC standards. No fridge or mw tho. Great location. Quality shopping and restaurants in all directions..Central park is but a few blocks away..you won't be disappointed
user_name:
tgen12_11
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great location -- easy to get to other parts of the city on foot or by subway. Great for Lincoln Center visits and nearby stores are good. But the hotel felt a little less cared for this time around. Cigarette butts on the floor when you walked in. SLOW checkin and no recognition of being a relative regular. TINY bathroom --

Our only real complaint is that most of the rooms are too small for us to tolerate, for a lot of money. Rooms atherwis clean and decent. We can only stay here by getting the larger rooms. We find that staff half the time are not pleasant, and act like you are a burden to them to have to take care of with your stupid problems.

I think this hotel is a great value.I stayed in a studio with a balcony.It was so relaxing to come to the hotel after a full day of meetings and sit out on the balcony!Staff is great. There is a great vibe in the lobby with a "living room" for using wifi and across the hall a bar to sit and enjoy a drink.

Plan an itinerary so you don't waste time use the underground and do research before you go as to what to see and places to eat. Definitely go on the ride which is a coach that takes you through Times Square I had this booked for me and would never have thought of it myself but it was great. The NYLO is in a very good location.

I have just spent a week at Nylo Hotel and whilst the staff were good, my opinion of Nylo was ruined when I was hit with a whopping $240 "resort fee" upon checkout. I will never stay at this hotel again nor would I recommend it because of this underhanded scam they've got going. Why is a city hotel charging a resort fee anyway ? They then tell you that you 'agreed' to it upon arrival when you signed their check in form. My week at Nylo was ruined by this end to my already expensive stay.I was utterly shocked and unfortunately they had me over a barrel as I was in a rush to catch a plane and didn't have the time to argue with them about it.I was looking forward to jumping on Trip advisor and giving a positive review but I just can't get past this now. I would prefer to have been given an honest quote and I still would have stayed there. It's the sneakiness I'm not happy about. Nylo will only trick people once but perhaps they don't care about repeat business.

Been staying at NYLO since it was On The Ave. Great neighborhood - markets, restaurants, bars, easy walks to many attractions and subway lines. Beds are perfect, so comfortable. Rooms quiet and easy to darken but size can be dicey - some are miniscule or very awkward. Lobby has several spaces for gathering, reading, relaxing. Nice small bar. Mixed clientele - kids to grandmas. Love the UWS location and looking forward to a return next year.
user_name:
Jo Ann S
San Francisco, California, United States

review_body: I stayed for two nights in this very nice and trendy hotel. We were welcomed by Jessie, a very lovely and helpful lady that helped us with both the check out and check in/ as we were visiting the city for a sad event as we have to attend a funeral, Jessie found a room for us to do an early check in so we could get changed after a long haul flight. The location is great, the bar at the lobby is very nice -we received a ticket to have a welcome drink for free there which we found a very nice gesture. Attention is great, the room is a good size considering is New York and location makes this a great place to stay both for leisure or business.

Room : panoramic Deluxe. Family Vacation with 1 kid (6 year old) and one baby (4 months). Bed for us ok but the couch for the kid was incredibly uncomfortable. We payed the room way too much for what it is. Even the terrace (which was nice and big by the way) was not safe for our children or us (sharp metal plate on the ground). Let alone the second T.V. with only 4 channels and no remote control. It s been 15 years that I choose this hotel (ex On The Ave) because of his location. Despite a bad experience last year (our room was not available when we arrived and they gave us a lower category room for one night without any compensation), I wanted to give the hotel another chance. Next time I visit NYC, the location will not be enough for me to go back to NYLO.

This was my third stay and the best overall. The room was very cool, great view, nice service And it was nice and quiet. The location is always a bonus as there are many shops and restaurants near by. I will stay again. Thanks to the manager and the front desk staff!

LOVE this hotel! Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was comfortable. Bar was fun. Neighborhood was great. Rates were competitive. Highly recommend to anyone. I will absolutely make this my go to NYC hotel!

Hotel NYLO is well situated for exploring or basing from Manhattan's upper west side. A 3 minute walk from Central Park, a 2 minute walk to the Red Line. Very sleek and modern with an excellent bar, but mediocre Italian restaurant on the premises. Location is great at 77th and Broadway, but fairly expensive.

This hotel was close to Columbia University where I attended a conference. The staff was nice and the complimentary drinks were a plus. The CVS across the street was convenient. Proximity to Central Park is a plus as I like to run in the park in the mornings.The bed was comfy which helped for a overall good night sleep. Only issue was that my internet/wifi connection wasn't strong at times or I was kicked off. Otherwise a very pleasant stay.
user_name:
Sharon F P
New York City, New York

review_body: Rooms are ok. They vary a lot depending on which room you get. This time my room was a handicap room which made for water all over the bathroom due to shower head. The bathroom also had no vanity at all to put your toiletries. Just a sink. The lobby is a nice place to have a drink. Very "central perk" in friends like. We got a few apps but food is nothing special.

I found NYLO through a few websites and saw that it would be the perfect place to experience my wedding at. I stayed with my (now) husband, my parents, sister, and 2 cousins. We did experience a few frustrating mishaps but Christian Ortiz at the bar made it a lot better. Hes a great bartender and makes awesome drinks! His positive attitude and upbeat personality definitely made our long days that much better. The entire NYLO staff was accomandating. We will definitely be back.

the room was Ok, the bed is most uncomfortable!. its high and the mattress caused us pain in the back maybe because it is too soft. Water bottles were give only on our day of arrival although we paid spa fees .God knows for what they charged us, .. . no body lotion , no soap. the very best thing about this hotel is its location.

Arrived on Saturday night and room assigned had windows, looking directly out to a brick wall. I requested a different room which was unavailable. The rate I was quoted included all the extras (water in the room, internet, etc.). $75.00 dollars a day extra boiled down to internet included. No bottled water even in the room. Requested a refrigerator and bought my own beverages. They offered to switch rooms the next day and after being gone all day, although my room was changed, the refrigerator with my beverages was gone. Still no water in the room. Second room TV did not work, but too late to wait for someone to fix it. Said something as I checked out to a clerk who seemed NOT to care at all. Then on walking out of the hotel, a big air conditioning duct was dripping condensation.... ON MY HEAD. Not at all impressed.

Loved location and hotel. Great service at check-in by Jessie. We arrived early and she went above and beyond to find us a room that was ready. We loved the upper west side location too. Great walking area and nice stores away from the loud hustle and bustle of midtown.

Upon my first visit, I loved the hotel-very cute and hip, with a great location. But when I booked the hotel for one night and I called to make room requests, the 'host' was extremely unenthusiastic and acted like she was doing me a favor by answering my call. When I got to the hotel, no staff to help with luggage. Waited 5-10 min for someone to show up. My check in was great, though, by a conscientious, alert, and helpful front desk. However, I found the rest of the staff to be deadbeats, and disinterested in providing great service. I also asked for a quiet room, but they put me in front of the ice machine, which wasn't quiet. Their 4p check in, and 11a checkout not very customer friendly-and when I called to see if I could get a 1p checkout, they told me it would be a half day charge...also by the same unenthusiastic, deadbeat 'host.' Spacious rooms, nice bed, but probably wouldn't stay again!

I've been staying at this hotel for many years although not often I am quite loyal. This time the room was the smallest room I've ever seen in my life outside of Paris. The room I was switch to graciously, was lacking in detail such as box of Kleenex by the bed, the Do not disturb sign was missing, no glass glasses.... I asked to be transferred to another room because my kids were visiting the next day and needed a place for the afternoon. I was quickly accommodated for a small fee. But there was no turndown service that evening. So all in all a mixed bag but to the credit of this hotel the staff is amazingly friendly, accommodating, polite, sunny! so I would still go back there and time and time again.

Rooms are small but clean and nicely furnished. Location is good if you want to be in the Upper West Side. Front desk, bellman and valet car service are slow. Front desk staff had attitude and should have been more helpful and accommodating.

Best hotel in NYC!!!! I have stayed at many in the past and this hotel checks all the boxes!! I shop hotels each time I travel to NYC, and NYLO's prices and value outdoes the competition each time. Best service in NYC!!!

I couldn't help but wonder why they relegated me to a "handicapped accessible" room on the back side of the hotel when I first checked in. A regular room was readily available because they moved me when I asked. This offered a nice shower area with a glass door that separated it from the rest of the bathroom. I imagine that all of the lower rooms are a bit noisy like mine. I got the feeling that because I booked the room with AmEx points that they were inclined to give me the least desirable spaces. Based on the reviews that I read of the hotel, I think there is a nicer experience to be had. Maybe ask for a room on a higher level, and unless you need special accommodations, leave those rooms for people who may actually need them.

Very disappointed. Walls cracking bathroom very small. Not to mention the cleaning lady left the towel from the previous guest. The sink wouldn't drain and the bathroom walls were kinda orange from who know what stains. Bell boys what bell boys they are just there to chit chat. The elevator for stroller was a joke not kid or handicapped friendly at all. Granted great location for families close to Central Park but the hotel was horrible. I was highly disappointed and we paid over 2k to stay there.

My husband and I stay at NYLO every time we visit NY. I lived in the neighborhood before I moved out of NY and it is a great neighborhood hotel. We recently stayed there unexpectedly when we had to evacuate FL due to hurricane IRMA. The hotel treated us amazingly well and really worked with us as we were not sure how long our stay would have to last. Highly recommend this hotel!!

Very comfortable. Lovely stay. Location was convenient to shopping, food and both parks. I have stayed here before and it was just as nice this time. Coming back to NY in a few months and will stay with them once more.

This hotel was extremely disappointing. The staff were not accommodating whatsoever with an early check in and the restaurant inside the hotel was below par. The A/C in the small gym was broken which made the room filled with awful smells, and the room itself was garbage. The sheets were itchy and the pillows offered no comfort. I would suggest people book elsewhere. To have paid $460/night and to receive this horrible experience in return is beyond disappointing.

I was in NYC for business, which is quite different than being on vacation. As I need cabs quickly, Lenny at the door went over and above to get me on my way! I'm grateful for his outstanding customer service!

Our first trip to New York and our expectations were high given the prices of a room in New York.We found this hotel nice and clean with great personnel, however, I would consider this to be an average room & hotel through our other experiences.

Definitely enjoyed my stay at NYLO. Great location, comfortable rooms. Staff was awesome. Anna and Fabio at the bar were particularly lovely: both exceptionally friendly, funny, and professional!! Would go back just for the two of them. Not only do you get complimentary drink tickets upon check-in, but you also get some of the best bartenders around!!!

Bad service, zero transparency, substandard charges. Will not be recommending anyone to stay at hotel. First trip to New York destroyed upon checking out and having to pay charges that wasn't told to us and forced to pay even though we mentioned and did not use any of them. Not even the bottled waters!

Second time staying- great location, lovely rooms, quiet but with a lively bar/lounge scene on weekends. The location is prime; easy walk to the subway, Lincoln Center, Central Park. Staff is gracious and helpful. Rooms are sizable by NYC standards. Will definitely stay again!

I wouldn't stay here unless you want to feel as though you're in the ghetto. No coffee in the morning in the lobby. Concierge that was mentally challenged. An evening bouncer sleeping on a chair that if I saw in the street I'd cross the street. Still trying to figure out why there was even a bouncer to begin with.
user_name:
Gregmarket
New York Mills, New York

review_body: This hotel is always the best choice. great location, always clean, wonderful staff. Always an easy, awesome stay! You can't beat the price for nyc. I've never had a bad experience and have stayed here multiple times.

Stayed at the NYLO for four nights on my own - mostly business trip. Room was ok, not too big but comfortable enough. Bed was v comfy and overall service was good. Room was cleaned every day.Wi-fi is a bit tricky as requires you to re-log every now and then which is not v convenient. However , location is amazing.Will stay again.

The NYLO hotel did have good aspects, with a nice lobby and a comfortable bed. The location was fantastic as well with the hotel in a great part of the Upper West Side. With this said it felt below 4 stars with most aspects of our room feeling slightly aged. I was staying in the hotel for the avoidance first night of my honey moon and what really perturbed me was that despite sending a note to the property, they did no gestures whatsoever for the honeymoon and put us in a room with two beds instead of one. Overall this property was not bad but at the price paid and 4 star rating I do feel that expectations should have been a little higher.

Staff is very nice and professional. Rooms are small but modern and just fine. Clean and with enough space. 2 words for the bathroom, though. Pocket door. Not a big deal but the door does get in the way unless its closed. Very convenient to Central Park, Natural History Museum and the NYC Historical Society. I will definitely stay here again.

Christopher stood out to me and was super accommodating. The service was amazing and the hotel is in such s great spot of the city. Christopher is such a sweet guy, and I will definitely return just to see him!

I love staying at NYLO in the Upper West side. A perfect location, great rooms and two good restaurants connected to the hotel. Price is competitive to other like hotels in the area. I keep coming back!

The hotel is well located, close to shops, has 2 great restaurants just outside its entrance and is less than 2 blocks from the subway station; staff was really helpful (specially when we had to extend our stay due to a hurricane that affected our flight back home) and the room was comfortable and clean.
user_name:
Alessandra S
Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

review_body: Comfortable bed, great shower, excellent location with lots of transit options, for an average of $250 per night in Manhattan: what more could you want! Only reason I didn't give it a five was because of a somewhat indifferent service at check-in and spotty Wifi in the room. Also, though our room rate included free Wifi, the log in page kept saying it was for one day only, which was annoying.

I had such a nice stay initially but unfortunately left a few items in the closet. Upon checkout I alerted the staff immediately and was routed and re-routed to a dead end security voicemail box. Nobody returned my calls, I was not connected to a manger when requested and my items have not been logged or located. Someone at NYLO has my belongings and I expected at least some help and a call

Love the NYLO. It's my go-to hotel for frequent NY trips! Location, rooms are great. But what really makes the NYLO stand-out? The staff! It's good to be greeted by familiar staff, and they always make things easier for a frequent (and usually tired) traveller. I especially commend Carlos and Fannie. Late at night, on deadline, I lost access and documents. Carlos and Fannie rescued the situation. And so tonight I can use the coupon for a free drink and really enjoy the hotel! It has a wonderful character and vibe -- in lobby area, people playing chess, listening to music in the evening. All around, it has a quirky charm one cannot find in a chain hotel!

We loved our stay at NYLO. Great location with good restaurants nearby and just a few blocks from Central Park and #1 train just 2 blocks away. Jesse at the front desk was terrific as she helped us upgrade our room to one we had our eye on next door to original booking. Live music in the bar/ lounge area was a nice touch.

I travel often to NYC and NYLO NYC is my top-choice NYC home away from home. For context, and to the annoyance of some, I am a picky customer, a stickler for cleanliness and customer service. NYLO NYC consistently meets my standards. The staff is professional, attentive and friendly. The rooms are nicely furnished in a modern decor, well-equipped and well-maintained. The location is perfect - close to public transportation, excellent food choices, all sorts of workout options and just a few blocks from Central Park and the Museum of Natural History. The hotel bar and lobby are often full of guests, milling and relaxing in a low-key, comfortable atmosphere. Note that the standard rooms are small, so opt for the larger rooms if you like the space. Terrific choice for work or travel.

Nice, stay, nice room, nice team. This hotel can be recommended, also good reach to main underground but distances to many attractions is walkable as well. Close to Hudson river and Central Park, Supermarkets and other stores around.

Rooms are small but very well appointed, quiet and comfortable. You are easy walking distance to Central Park and the Natural History museum. A Fairway is nearby and Levains cookies (if you are ready to stand in long lines for a cookie). Subway stations are close. The sidewalks are much easier to navigate than in the more heavily tourist prone areas.

My daughter selected NYLO for my first visit to her new apartment because it was just two blocks away. Excellent location, good adjoining restaurant (Serafina), breakfast package, blocks and blocks of nearby shops and restaurants, extremely helpful and friendly staff.....great choice!!! My outside room was a little on the small side, but the comfortable bed and large bathroom made up for its "coziness". NYLO NY City will definitely be my home away from home during my future visits.

The NYLO has a great location and it's very quiet. Beyond that, the rooms, beds and bathrooms are all first-rate. We stay there again soon. The bar downstairs is also quite nice and the public rooms are good places to relax.

This hotel is very close to subway station, Central Park, great restaurants and shopping. Drug store/liquor store at your doorstep. Huge Barnes and Nobles store a 5 minute walk, they have many author signing/readings. Easy car service to airports. The hotel is comfortable and staff are friendly. The rooms are small but they work. They have everything you need. Ask and the staff will make it happen.

This hotel was perfect. I prefer to stay out of the absolute chaos of Midtown, and NYLO's location in the Upper West Side fits the bill. The interior is trendy, but not too trendy. The rooms were super clean. The staff was awesome. And the bar was great. Since I was traveling for work, it was nice to have Serafina next door to deliver on the night I was exhausted.

Hotel NYLO NYC was perfect for our trip to New York. The hotel was a great choice and the location was ideal. The room was clean, modern and spacious. Jennifer on Reception was very welcoming and friendly and helped us a lot with our sightseeing plans!

Great location, convenient and comfortable hotel with an outstanding staff; everyone from the doorman to the front desk and manager. I have been staying at NYLO (previously On the Ave) for years and will continue on my future visits to N.Y.

The hotel was hip, and the staff was friendly. With the exception of check in- our experience was great. The location is great- really close to the subway so you have access to different places around the city. We would stay here again.

Don't let them give you a room in the older 1/2 of the hotel building. The rooms are not the same as the images from their website. We requested a crib twice over email before arrival and it was not in the room (even though we received a confirmation). We were given a smaller room than the sqft listed on the website/our reservation. There is a resort fee of $32 a day for 'free internet'. The internet was so slow, we could not use it.

If you're looking for a nice respite from the hustle and bustle of the city, NYLO is a great place to do just that. The mattress and pillows made the bed heavenly, and it was a great "home base" for our trip - very close to many landmarks and public transportation. We had a great time and would definitely consider staying here again.

We stayed at the Nylo for a week and really enjoyed our stay at this unique hotel. The area is fabulous and you get a real feel of living in New York rather than as a tourist in the madness of Times Square area. There are lots of lovely bars and restaurants just a few blocks away , also subway is easy to get to ( get a metro card and you are never far away from anywhere in Manhattan!)Central Park and natural history museum is a 10 minute walk from the hotel.We had a superior King room on the 11th floor, the bed was amazing!!! Room rather small, but it was lovely and the lighting is great, so is the bathroom.Lovely terraces on the 14th and 16th floor, take your drinks up there and chill out for a while.Don't bother with the breakfast option in serafina, the choice you can have is just too limited! If you don't like eggs, your only other option is pancakes, very disappointed in that to be honest.Nice bar on site, had live music a few nights, have to mention poor service from blonde barmaid, she was not interested in serving us and was actually quite offish when I asked for a small Stella for my husband, she said" we don't serve small Stella's) and walked away?! Very bad service, whether she meant to be rude or not, she certainly gave that impression.Can't praise your front of house staff enough, particularly Jessie and Ernesto, friendly and engaging and made us feel welcome. Also the housekeeper on our floor was lovely, fresh towels daily and left our room immaculate!We would definitely stay here again and I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to experience the upper west side in a small cozy boutique hotel!

We would definitely return to NYLO NYC! It's a hip hotel. We had a lovely room, found the location in the city to be excellent & the staff is friendly, competent and accommodating. Great all-around experience.

Just Checked into NYLO Hotel in NYC. You cant check into your room until 16 hrs! This in not standard check in time... If rooms are available earlier than 16 hrs: you must pay half a day to be allowed into your room earlier than 16 hrs. Beware international traveller!

We had to stay in hotel for a few nights while apartment was under construction projects. The front desk staffs were all very friendly and easy to talk with, especially Jessie who helped us a lot during our stay, would definitely come back just to chat with the staffs. Hotel is at great location and surrounded by decent restaurants, ali very close to the park. If you want some classy NYC experience this is a great place to stay.

I booked a 2 night stay at the NYLO and wanted to extend my stay since my flight was past midnight. Before I checked in I called the hotel number hoping to speak to the Front Desk, I was rerouted to a call center. I was informed that if I wanted to extend my stay I would be charged $150 just for changing my reservation!! I have encountered this policy in airlines but never in a hotel. :( They also informed me that if I wanted to check-in early, there was a charge of $50/hour. Check-in time at the hotel is 4pm instead of the usual 3pm. And check out is early at 11am.It's a good thing that my actual stay was so much better than the experience of dealing with their call center. It was a pleasure to be greeted and assisted by George and Orlando. Special thanks to George for making me and my daughter feel very welcome and at home!Ramona at the Front Desk checked us in as soon as our room was available without mentioning any additional fees. We had requested for a fridge and was given the impression that our room had one but there was none. In hindsight, there was no need for it because there is a 24hr CVS across from the hotel and at least 2 supermarkets within a block or 2 of the hotel. The subway is also 2 short blocks from the hotel and a bus stop around the corner. There are restaurants on all the streets surrounding the hotel and the plated breakfast at Serafina was good. There were at least 3 choices including Eggs Benedict, Choice of Eggs and Pancakes.The room was modern and clean with lots of storage space - cubby holes instead of drawers and outlets. Bathroom was a good size but only has towel hooks behind the door, no other place to hand towels. Housekeeping was spotty - they forgot to replenish our water but when asked, promptly delivered. Good wifi in the hotel.They also have a very comfortable lounge beside the small lobby and a bar with live music at night.I would definitely stay here again because of the staff, convenience of the location and the comfort of the room!

Stayed at the NYLO over labor day weekend for 5 nights. This hotel is truly lovely. It's a small hotel, but offers many of the amenities of larger properties. The staff was always very professional and friendly. I had a superior king with a view of Broadway. While the hotel was quiet and there wasn't much noise from street traffic, there was some rather loud construction noise starting at 7am across the street. You may want to call ahead and ask if there is currently any construction within earshot of the hotel (a good idea for any hotel stay). The room was very clean, comfortable but like most NYC hotels a bit on the small side. The exception was the bathroom, which was huge for NYC standards (but I did have a corner room, which may be the reason). There is a bar in the hotel, and a band played on one of the evenings in the lounge (though you could not hear it in your room). All in all, I would recommend this property and would for sure stay there again!

We got a silent wall-faced room... we had a 'spider' incident that was immediatlly solved by changing our room. I higlly recommend the breakfast at Serafina's restaurant at the lobby and any meal at Red farm!!!

Great location. Close to Central Park. Safe neighborhood. The most important characteristic is that they care. we were booked for a stay lasting the entire weekend. We had tickets to see wicked at the Gershwin. my son came down with abdominal pain/appendicitis. The hotel, after finding out our problems were legitimately real, waived the penalty, and offered maximal assistance with anything I needed with my child. This is what makes it an amazing establishment! NYLO made the right decision by making Ms. Fannie Bauciquot the manager! Because she treated my family like her own, there is only one hotel I will use when I stay in New York. That hotel is and that is NYLO. Thank you NYLO and Ms. Bauciquot for 10 star treatment at a five star hotel!

Have stayed multiple times. Nice rooms, some are quite large, some a tad bit better than average. Really comfortable beds, clean and ok bathrooms. Very convenient location and two very good restaurants on back-side of hotel. Serafina was a BIG surprise! Staff friendly and very helpful but on smallish side. Overall, my favorite upper west side stays!

Stayed here with my husband and another couple to celebrate my 30th birthday. Very impressed with the hotel décor and check in was smooth and offered complimentary drinks on arrival which was a great way to start the holiday!Great central location, walking distance to central Park and a longer walk to times square, but do-able.We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis and had breakfast most days at the adjoining Serafina restaurant.On one day, the kitchen was closed for the morning so we were unable to eat there. We were told to discuss with reception and so we did. One of the staff members told us to eat breakfast elsewhere and then they would reimburse the cost. We didn't go crazy, we each had a breakfast dish and a hot drink, just as we would have at Serafina, but we were made to feel like we were taking advantage by a member of Staff, called Stephanie I believe. She would not reimburse and said she needed to check with the member of staff who told us we could have breakfast elsewhere.This slightly put a dampener on the experience of our stay. Luckily the money was reimbursed after the member of staff she got into contact with confirmed what he had told us.Great hotel otherwise, but I think customer service could be improved a little

Quiet neighborhood, rooms are quiet, bed is very comfortable, hotel and room are modern and trendy. Staff is very helpful, and the bar in the lobby is cute and in an open atmosphere. Love this hotel! Looking forward to staying here again.

Overall great experience with professional and accommodating staff. Looking forward to staying again. Thanks for making me feel at home in a great location. I was close to everything, especially the friends who live right across the street.

Friendly staff---quick check in and checkout----great room---well it bathroom---very comfortable bed------nice lounge and bar----great neighborhood---many restaurants and museums nearby----tucked around the corner from Broadway---easy walk to central park--25 minute subway ride to ground zero

The shower needs to be repainted, a while piece of paint around the drain was gone. The shower head barely worked and the water did not drain. It was pretty unacceptable; I didn't ask to change room because we were in 5 in the room and we didn't have time to change rooms. But how does something get so bad? I mean don't people clean it? Didn't they see???? That's ridiculous. Overall I love nylo and my last stay I would have given you 4 stars but this stay is definitely a 3.

Me and my wife had a very nice stay at NYLO, stayed there for 5 days, smooth check in and a nice welcome drink. Excellent place to stay, very convenient location, comfortable and clean. Do not miss the view from 16th floor.

What a pleasure it was to return to the NYLO. Being greeted by Jennifer at the time of check in "made" the start of my stay, one of the amazing staff at the hotel who sincerely enjoys her work with guests and it shows. The complimentary upgrade made it even sweeter. Yes, they do apparently value their returning guests. The ambience and vibe at the hotel makes one feel so " at home ". Lenny is probably one of the most pleasant doorman I have encountered at extensive stays at hotels worldwide. The " neighborhood " location of the hotel cannot be beat. Subway in very close proximity, shops, Fairway and Zabars and the park 2 blocks away. What more could you ask for.Looking forward to returning soon. Spread the word, it will make your stay in the Big Apple !!

Upon arriving, greeted by doorman, who took my bag and held door. Front desk was pleasant upon check-in. The room was on the small side, and uniquely decorated. You stay here for great price and location, surrounded by great places to eat (including hotel restaurant), and close to subway. There's a bar in the hotel, making very unique drinks, which were great, but I found the prices too high.

This hotel accommodated my husband, myself and our small dog while we were in between apartments. It was a super stressful week, but NYLO made it so much better. It is in a great location, the rooms are big for NYC hotel rooms, the housekeeping was great and the staff is very friendly and helpful.

They said they tried to call me but my call log proved otherwise. They were going to put me up in a cheaper hotel on the other side.of the city. Pretty useless since all our plans were around that hotel. Now we got to add $20 taxi rides with the kids each way and not be able to go back to the room during the day. So much fun.

This is my third time staying at the NYLO--it is a great hotel in a wonderful location. The room was small but the bed was exceptionally comfortable. The hotel is nicely designed with a cozy bar area. I enthusiastically recommend this hotel to visitors to New York.

We've been using NYLO hotel in the last 5 years. It's an amazing place in Upper West Side, close to everything in New York. You can go quickly to Midtown and Downtown from the NYLO. Good subway service only two blocks from it (79th). The hotel atmosphere is amazing and people are very kind and respectful. The cherry of the cake is Serafina below, where you can have good breakfast, lunch and dinne.

My Fiance and I stayed here over the weekend, I will say the lady at the front desk was very pleasant as well as as the bell boy. Our room was comfortable and very clean, no complaints there. I do however, have one complaint and that is with the blonde female bartender who was bit rude and did not exhibit great customer service . She was somewhat rude and only acknowledged who she wanted. I will say the male bartender was more customer service oriented and was good; although I ordered a cosmopolitan and it tasted more like a watermelon martini, but I am will not hold that against him. A word of advise to Blondie, you work on tips and it is your responsibility to acknowledge everyone at your bar.

I absolutely loved this hotel and have told probably a dozen people so far about it. The location was 1.5 blocks from the main subway train to get to just about everything. It was walking distance from Amsterdam street which has many great places to eat (and an amazing bakery - LeVain - for cookies!) and walk around. A quick bus to the MET - seriously a great location - and I have been to NYC several times the past couple of years and loved this place. I stay at a lot of 5-star hotels and resorts and I loved the personal service this place extended. The room was really great - stylish, very clean, and comfortable. Plus my room was really quiet so I slept great. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly, helpful, and kind. I really loved it and was delighted to have stayed 3 nights...would have been happy staying longer!
user_name:
Coach Juli S
Santa Barbara, California

review_body: Our Junior Suite was perfect. It was just the right size and space for three of us! We moved our son back to Columbia for his senior year and there was more than enough space for all the luggage and supplies. It is also pleasing that the staff is always very accommodating and courteous.

I love the NYLO for many reasons. Everyone is kind and helpful. The building is lovely and you can NOT beat the location. I come to NYC frequently for work and try to stay there when I can. I really wish that the rooms came with fridges and microwaves. You have to ask for a fridge but you can't reserve one in advance, which is annoying (though truthfully they have always had one when I've asked). I wish there were at least a communal microwave for guests. I have dietary restrictions (not to mention financial restrictions) and I like preparing some of my own food instead of eating out for every single meal when I'm visiting.

I wanted to be near Central Park during this visit so I could walk over there easily. It was perfect for that. The hotel offers a good ambiance, there was live music when I arrived Fri. evening. My room was spacious enough to get around suitcases, etc. (not always the case in NYC!) and the bathroom was quite large, which was great. The beds are great, you sleep like a baby ... and no noise! So many hotels have noisy cleaning staff, doors that make a bank when closed, etc.

This is now my go-to place to stay when visiting family who live in this neighborhood. I appreciate the understated clean aesthetic of the room decor and the comfortable bar and lounge areas are very places to begin or end your day. Be aware of the additional "urban fee" of $31 tacked onto the room rate that supposedly pays for WIFI (which is free in most other hotels) and water (!!!). This seems to be a gimmick to make the room rate appear to be lower than what is actually charged. I like this hotel and have already reserved my next visit, but wish they used more transparent pricing.

The Nylo is a very nice boutique hotel in a great upper west side neighborhood. We had a junior suite with nice design and views at a decent price. Only issues we had were the web deals that offered "either" free breakfast or valet parking. We took the breakfast - wrong choice - get the parking and forget the breakfast which turns out to be of limited choice in the associated restaurant, Seraphina, which deserves only three stars on its own.

This is a nice little hotel on the upper west side. It is close to many nice restaurants, Central Park, shopping, etc. it is only 2 short blocks from the nearest subway stop. I would definitely stay here again.

Horrible and rude staff, room not as advertised, dirty room, hot and cold water issues the entire stay, unresponsive manager at the hotel, loud room, garbage outside of room that overlooked a roof, and they charge for 'complimentary' internet and bottled water in the room.

This hotel was recommended to me by a previous guest. I would certainly stay at the Nylo when I return to NYC. The hotel is in a great location, staff are very helpful and friendly- - everything about the hotel was great.

NYLO hotel in NYC is a nice surprise. Very bright, very clean, and they have VALET PARKING, although it comes with a "no in and out" policy. Once you park there, you're done unless you want to pay a LOT more for the privilege of in-and-out parking. And it's pretty steep. Take UBER instead. Back to review.... folks at the NYLO are great. Very personable, very friendly, very helpful. Good elevators! The decor and furnishings are first rate and enjoyable. Our king room was spacious and comfortable. Sufficient places to plug in and charge small personal appliances. But interesting to note....you'd figure in a hotel, especially in New York, you'd find a "Places to Go, Things to Do" kinds of brochures and pamphlets....not at NYLO. They also do not have any magazines or newspapers. It's not that the place is clean, it's more like sterile. No "homeyness" if you will. But nice. Also, the bathrooms are laid out nicely and there is space, but they give you no place to put or hang up washcloths and towels. And there is a big beautiful wall in the bathroom with nothing on it...no towel bars or rings or hooks. Nothing. That needs some attention. There is only a hook on the door for a robe. Other than that, it is a nice place and not too hard on the pocketbook, which is helpful. In NYC for a visit? Take a look at the NYLO.

This is an excellent, conveniently located hotel on the beautiful Upper West Side, steps away from numerous restaurants and shops and convenient to 2 subway stops. The 16th floor outdoor balcony is like having your own private outdoor living area. We are repeat customers and will return again.

Nice hotel for the price. No bed bugs, that's a plus. Rooms are kind of small. Shower had mold in tile grout and room service was very slow. Great grocery store across the street. Fantastic bakery down the street. Great location.

We have stayed at the NYLO multiple times when visiting our children who live on the Upper West Side of Manhattan. We have found the hotel to be very clean, the staff very friendly and the location is terrific. Our only complaint it having to pay the "resort" fee. We don't need to use the business center but appreciate using their wi-fi and receiving a bottle of water. I just wish the fee was optional. Other hotels don't charge for their wi-fi service. But the location and hip atmosphere bring us back!

Good location near the Metro, Central park and the American Museum of Natural history.Good restaurants around.The room was comfortable but noisy.There was a communicant door and consequently we heard the room's neighbor...

Nylo hotel was great, very comfortable. Don't get to excited about the stay wonderful perks they come with numerous catches. This hotel has the best Door Man in manhattan, Orlando was a superstar who made our family's stay at NYC that much more special.

Stayed here before, this was a second stay. Hotel is nice and conveniently located to the subway as well as walking distance to museums and great restaurants. There are several nearby choices regarding the subway. Also, if you like YOGA, there's an excellent studio right down the block.

check to see if your room is in the back - quiet OR in the front - street noise. We did both and were very happy with either one.The best was the mattress - we are looking into purchasing one.We appreciated Vivek and other folks at the front desk - and the front door...BTW - thank you for use of an umbrella

Wonderful hotel and staff. Beds are amazing!!! This hotel is 2 blocks from several subway terminals and buses so it is easy to get around. Beautiful area with lots to see and do within walking distance. Ready to go back!

This hotel was recommended by a friend who stays here frequently. It is clean, modern, and in a great location. The rooms are very nice and the shower is great. Very good front desk staff as well. I will definitely stay here again.

All was good except the beds were too high!!Please put lower beds I handicapped room. The restaurant was okay but expensive. The staff was excellent especially George the Bellman who gave us wonderful service!!!

We have stayed in NYLO NYC twice, we liked the location and the rooms. In our most recent trip we stayed for a week and paid more than USD2000 for our stay. We learned at check out that there is an additional $26 bar charge to our room which was obviously a mistake and unknown to us (we didn't even use the bar for the room's complimentary drink). We told the front desk and the lady said it must be a mistake (which they see happen sometimes when bar customers put in the wrong room number) and would cancel the charge. We only paid for the room charge at checkout. Later we learned that the credit card has been charged the $26 and we, no longer in the US, wrote to NYLO reservation and were asked to write instead to the front desk manager, which we did and waited, reminded them twice and waited. It has been 12 days since we informed NYLO about the false charge (last email addressed to front desk, reservation and customer services) yet we have not received a response. In terms of the handling of this matter, I would give a 'terrible' rating but given the rest of the hotel being fine, I think a 'poor' rating is reasonable. Hopefully if NYLO can read this, they can inform their NYC colleagues to look into the matter (Rm 1130, Aug 13) and reply to our email, and let us know they have proceed with a refund.

Great, clean, comfortable rooms. A wonderful bar and incredibly friendly staff. The neighborhood is awesome with all sort of options for shopping and eating. Subway stop two blocks north at 79th st. and the park is a few blocks east--easy, pleasant walk to the Museum of Natural History

Just watch put for he "fees" that get loaded onto the low price advertised on the internet. I'm not talking about the variuous taxes that all hotels charge. Just be prepared to see a string of unexpected "fees" and examine the final cost closely before you hit the submit button to finalize the reservation.

Disappointing experience. Small room with no view. Slow elevator. $37 "urban fee" added each night which actually provides nothing but internet and bottled water. Room was serviced but they left us with no towels. Took 30 mins to get towels delivered. If you come on a Friday or Saturday be prepared for some drunks downstairs. Keep your kids clear of the bar area.

My husband and I love this hotel (except for the "some rooms and patios are smoking areas" policy). It is perfectly located for Central Park, the MET, the Museum of Natural History and various restaurants and cafes. The only drawback is the cigarette smoke that can waft into your room/onto your patio from nearby patios, and smoke in the lobby from outside. It is also a little difficult to know kind of room you will get in advance. Other than that, though, it is wonderful. We've generally had large rooms and large patios, friendly staff, a great experience.

Best choice for families. Very well located and out of the madness of Times Square!!! Would definitely stay her again and recommend to anyone. The staff were amazing and helpful. The room was bigger than imagined

The location was perfect for our needs. The rooms were clean, well laid out and efficient. We need two room for our family. As requested the room adjoined. This gave us a perfect way to be together but not on top of each other. The hotel was clean, the staff was wonderful, and the Red Farm restaurant in the hotel was amazing. I highly recommend NYLO.

We booked a king bed and wereassignd a queen, no reduction in rate AND the guy at the desk insisted the bed was a king. Very frustrating, they did move us to the right room the second night. Have stayed here before but never had this problem in past

Just got back from my second stay at NYLO in the last 6 months. As always the hotel is beautiful, comfortable & spotlessly clean! The staff are warm, welcoming, friendly, professional & super helpful. Shout outs to Jessie, Tasha & Eduardo. Also have to give a special mention to Daniel - I've been staying at NYLO for the last 10yrs (when it was On The Ave) & Daniel is ALWAYS friendly, helpful & nothing is ever too much trouble. A great asset to this wonderful hotel. The boring bits - the location is awesome, away from the crazy Times Square tourists but close enough for easy access to the theatre district. Close to Central Park, museums, movie theatre, Lincoln Center, shopping, restaurants, diners & coffee shops. UWS is a great neighbourhood to make your base.Like I say, been staying here regularly for ten years & would never choose anywhere else! Hope to stay again this winter.

Found NYLO to be an excellent hotel. It's close to the Central Park. It's a bit away from the Times Square but we enjoyed the walk. Having an Indian restaurant close the the hotel was a plus for us. Found the hotel staff to be very helpful, particularly Eloy who was very patient.

The hotel was in a great location, the room design was innovative, and the housekeeping was excellent. Both the front desk and parking staff were wonderful, as well. We enjoyed our stay and will stay there again the next time we come to New York.

We enjoyed our stay! The rooms were clean and nice. Nice touch with the complimentary prosecco or sangria at check in. They gave us no hassle to check in early since our flight got in early or to check out late. It's in a great area of Manhattan. Close enough to the action but quiet enough at night time since it's tucked into more of a residential area than business. Three blocks from Central Park 77th Street entrance. Lots of food places and coffee shops in walking distance as well as 72nd Street subway station. Cute 16th floor deck. Major cons are the deck faces another building so kind of hard to get views of the city. The wi-fi was pretty weak both on phones and through connection. When booking if you get the standard Queen room it will be really small at the back of the hotel facing the other side of building since it's their no frills rate. May have been the reason for the poor wi-fi, it's like being in an alley. Worth it to pay the extra and upgrade at least to the King. All in all I would stay here again. I thought the value was worth my rate.

This was a great value in upper west Manhattan very close to Central Park. It was modern and well designed to provide what I thought was a lot of space considering it's location. There was a little city noise as I was on a lower floor street side. The taxes and fees were quite high, so be sure to budget 60-90 extra dollars per night, depending on the room choice. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean and in good condition. There is a small balcony for all guests which was an added bonus.

Great location, very clean rooms, very friendly staff. The only issue is there is a fire station across the street but besides a few sirens at night, this was a great experience. We would definitely stay here again when visiting NYC. Walking distance to Central Park and lot of shopping makes it an ideal location.

Love this hotel! It has a great location, great rooms, and a great price! Exceptional value in NYC! Will continue to stay here when I return. I highly recommend this hotel. Service was wonderful and it has great restaurants and bars.
user_name:
Catherine C
Waco, Texas, United States

review_body: Every aspect of my stay at NYLO exceeded my expectations. Great value for money. The staff were all well trained and seemed to be enjoying their work which is not something you find in a lot of big city hotels where staff turnover is high. The hotel also had a homely atmosphere which encouraged me to spend more time in the shared spaces rather than just in my room

The nylo is a beautiful hotel far enough away from downtown to rest quietly at night but still close enough to get there easily and quickly for everything NY has to offer. The hotel has a great bar that opens to the outside when the weather is nice. The neighborhood is safe and you can walk to so many places right there for whatever you need or want to eat.

Rooms are clean, bar is chic and comfortable, and the location and overall hotel is great for business trips. During my last trip there was a shortage of towels, I had 2 broken coffee makers, and a luggage transportation issue (they forgot to move my luggage from one room to another after they promised they would) that made this a less than excellent experience. The hotel staff handled it well, however, and thus this is still a place I would try again.

Everyone at the hotel was very accommodating. Especially Jennifer! She was very welcoming and congratulated us on our 5 year anniversary. Such a wonderful overnight stay and the room was gorgeous. Paid an extra $21.00 for the penthouse. Anyone that is looking to stay on the west side should defenitly book here :)!

The NYLO exceeded my expectations again! We had an amazing stay and experience. The location, decor and vibe of the hotel make the overall experience very pleasurable and convienent. The staff are wonderful, all of them, they go out of their way to treat their guests like they truly appreciate them. Notable mention to the doorman & bellmen: Lenny, Orlando, Alberto, Jose, Danny, Edwardo and George! The front desk staff like: Jesse, Ramona, Carlos, Eloy, Tasha, Edwardo, Vivek and Jennifer are amazing and take care of their guests! Ben the bartender is an absolute gem! Anna, another bartender, along with Ben both provide such great service and made our visits to the lobby bar so much fun! I would like to thank the general manager Connie Wang, who always makes time to greet hotel guests when she can, she is often visible in the lobby ensuring that connection with hotel guests despite being a busy lady. She should also be commended on the wonderful staff she has working at the NYLO! Thank you NYLO Hotel for being the best hotel in NEW YOK CITY!

really like the location and the atmosphere of the hotel service was accommodating and room very comfortable. The check in was slower than needed to be because there was only one person at the front desk and a line waiting to check in

Great hotel in great location. Best of all was very quiet in regards to street noise as well as hotel noise. We were 7 minute walk to Central Park. We had junior suite with couch and unbelieveably large bathroom and large hotel room for New York City expectations and standards. Definitely would stay here again.

Great service and very clean. Everything was really good, except our room was quite small travelling with 2 x young children, would be good to clearly know size of rooms prior to booking. Otherwise great location, and staying in the area gave us a feeling of what it is like to live in New York which we really enjoyed.

I've been living in NYC for almost 10 years, so i'm constantly searching for and reviewing hotel options for friends and family. In this particular case my Mom and nephew came for a 5 day visit and stayed at the NYLO. It was hands down one of the best experiences I have ever had with a hotel in the city. The front desk staff was polite, helpful, and quick. The bell staff was EXTRA hands on and endearing (George was an exceptional help). The housekeeping staff was incredible (Mirna helped my mom figure out the complexity of a Keurig and according to her.... the absolute sweetest lady she has ever met)! The hotel's decor and aesthetic is chic! Somehow modern and classic at the same time. You should definitely spring for a terrace room (the city views of the Hudson are like no other).
user_name:
John F
New York City, New York

review_body: Well, the hotel charge me US$ 216,00 as RESORT FEE?? Firsta, it´s not a resort, once resorts has a portolio of service, you are a city hotel with internet and bar, just that.Your RESORTE FEE includee cofee and water in the bedroom (I DIDN´t drink), internet and WELCOME DRINKS??? Come On.. RIDICULOUS!!

The room was clean, large and comfortable. Hotel staff were friendly and efficient. We enjoyed the welcome drink at the bar too. Great location for upper west side visit. Our room package included breakfast and that was a huge disapointment. Terrible service. Didn't go back there second day.

Every staff were really all kind and the best,And the bar was good,Room was good, Location was perfect for get to station,(A fire station across the street was a bit noisy sometimes )I really wish to stay next time again !

Not my best hotel experience. The room was beautiful. Comfortable bed. The front desk service was polite however extremely slow and not very helpful. There was no info in the hotel room in regards to how to reach the restaurant or front desk, so you're forced to make the trips up and down and met with the slow front desk service again. The bar food was good and the hosts very nice, but one bartender/waiter would ask if you wanted room service while another would say they don't provide room service. They didn't even get the food order correct. This all took up more time than necessary when you're paying for your time spent there. They also don't tell you about any of their restaurants or other service hours within the hotel so you have to ask them about literally everything. It was less of hotel service and more of a take a chance on your luck experience. But again, the room itself was lovely so it somewhat averaged out.

I booked this hotel last minute (a couple of hours before arriving) and I was so glad I did. This hotel was amazing! We arrived to the front "garage doors" open and was surprised to see it was actually the bar/lounge area. To me that was a stunning welcome to this hotel. There is an actual front door a few steps away. The front desk staff was very nice. He told us we got a free drink at the bar that we could also take up to the terrace. We were torn, because it would of been so cool to sit almost outside in the bar and watch the people go by. However, definitely go up to the terrace. Beautiful! We also had perfect weather. The room we had was very small, but it's NYC. They also had a back lounge area across from the bar where I saw people playing games. I'm assuming they got them from the hotel. I can't wait to come back to this hotel. You can't go wrong here.

Our experience in the hotel was very nice. The place is near underground, the hotel is in a good location. We can suggest this hotel. Our room was nice with a large bathroom. Barbara e Andrea from Milan, Italy.

Me and my fiancé stayed a couple nights here, Jennifer at the front desk was really helpful and nice to us and we loved it❤️ great service. Beautiful rooms definitely coming back for another visit soon

It was amazing very helpful people and Jennifer was great and very nice to us see thank you Nylo they will help you with everything you need and the restaurant, bar lobby everything is amazing I really recommend travelers to check that hotel before going anywhere else
user_name:
abnar_travels
New York City, New York

review_body: The location of the hotel is good. It is not in the center so there is no noise and also subway is very close. The rooms are nice and comfortable. In details, I would prefer to be more clean. The hotel is value for money.

Great place, the staff was very helpful and friendly.....the room was very clean, quiet, modern, and pretty large compared to standard NY hotel rooms. Enjoyed the stay, will definitely go back on next trip to NY

My husband and I spent two nights in room 1403 which has a good sized terrace. It was really very nice. Especially since we brought our dog with us. The location is perfect, centered in the upper west side, it was super convenient to both Central and Riverside parks. I'd definitely stay there again!

Boutique hotel with impressive large rooms, Wonderful location, great staff, , hip ambience feels like staying at a family run inn. My second stay at the nylo....won't ever stay anywhere else. You will LOVE it!

Nice location, male employees at the front desk were not so friendly! But all the ladies at the front desk were so willing to answer questions and didn't seem annoyed when asked like the men did! We did enjoy our stay and would return.

I knew that there was a kinf og "resort" charge that cost 30 dollar for interntet and gym basically. so i asked to the reception if my booking ws included or not.was said that was included so i used wifi.At check out i got the extra bill of 30dollars per day and that said t was "taxes"...The commercial offer is not clear and charging internet wifi ( without any notice when you login) sound a bit hidden cost

This was my first time staying at the NYLO. Location excellent for my purposes. Room was very nice , but I chose an upgrade, so I am not sure what a regular room would have been like to experience. My room had a very comfortable bed and pillows. Bathroom very clean. Staff friendly especially the cleaning service. Kudos to them. Had a glass of champagne or Sangria option upon check in and that was a nice surprise . My only complaint is that if you choose an upgrade be careful . Check out for me was a huge surprise. I would not do that again. Misleading in the email sent to me from the NYLO. I do not have any other complaints about this hotel. Lovely area with food and shopping near by. I came to visit friends and this was the closest to them. I would definitely go back, sans an upgrade.

This time I had a difficult time at NYLO. The receptionists were not helpful and very slow in checking me in.Further, I extended my stay and asked the front desk if they could take care of it. They refused, telling me that I had to go through reservations by phone, even though I was standing at the desk, the hotel was on the empty side, plenty of rooms, but refused to do it for me.The gym equipment was mostly broken. They did nothing about it, when I advised them.

Excellent location...attentive house-keeping staff...and a really nice room that was spacious with a great view and fantastic bed. But...bad check-in process, neither gracious nor welcoming.
