"Room will be ready around 4, go away." Didn't even ask to hold our bags until the room was ready. At 4:15 I actually threatened to cancel and walk down the street to the Beacon. Left a bad taste in our mouths that's for sure. So if you can stomach the "rude New York" opening, it gets better.

Nice stay but elevator on two separate occasions was broken and bathroom sink was clogged and not repairs after it was reported also found female Russian bartender was rude with a number of customers and publicity berated one of the servers when they returned a drink that another customer did not care for

If one is looking for a hotel on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, the location is good. The room (we had a double-queen) is comfortable with a weird but interesting decor, the bathroom is nice. The room was very clean. However, the service (they called it something like "guest services" was slow to answer. They do not have adequate staff at the reception/check-out, and particularly the bellman needs an associate. We left bags with them when we checked out, and it took awfully long for the bellman to be able to come and take them, and then a while when we wanted to retrieve them. Though the room is nice, the A/C is VERY noisy, and I found it disturbing. Also, our room was adjoining to the one next door, and there is only one door between them, and I could hear the next-door neighbor sneeze, and whatever else. They were not particularly loud people. It sounded very normal, but only one door does not block it out. I could also see the light coming from under the door at night. No excuse for that. If I had to stay on the Upper West Side again, I would try another property.

We had 13 hr stop over in NY and did not realized the hotel we had booked would not check us in as it was really early in the morning hours. We looked on google nearby hotels and found NYLO. Jennifer was super helpful and saved us from literally spending the night on the streets. Thank you!

My husband and I recently spent 4 nights here while visiting family living on the Upper West Side.What a great find in so many ways.The lobby is cool and comfortable, with a guest lounge well outfitted with great chairs, game tables and low-volume TVs. Adjacent is a hip-looking bar with garage style doors that open to the street. I can never give 5 stars to a hotel without room service, but there was a coffee maker in the room and the adjacent restaurant serves a perfectly nice breakfast. The rooms were small but efficient with some clever features -- eg, the bed that was high enough to slip roller bags underneath and out of the way. There was a real closet (not just an open hanging area). The bathroom sink was perhaps too industrial (all metal, looked a bit like prison surplus) but ok space around it and the bathroom was decently sized. A downside to the room was the absence of drawer space -- not an issue for an overnight but for us, staying 4 days, it was a bit of a nuisance. So why not 4 stars? I really wanted to. I liked it, it's an excellent value, and the location is terrific for the upper west side. But Towels! You need towels! and when you don't have them and you call for them, they need to be delivered. the first night our bellman noticed there was only one set so he offered to request a second. It arrived, but hours later. On day 3, we found no bath towels but nicely rolled fresh hand towels. I called guest services, was greeted with warm apologies and assurances, but no towels ever arrived ( I got some from a cart in the hall the next morning). Day 4, they left bath towels, but not wash clothes or hand towels. I didn't even bother to call. I am reluctant to mention this kind of thing, for fear that all that happens is that an overstressed maid gets yelled at. In fact, when a problem recurs that usually means someone up the line isn't paying attention. I should also note that bell service seems very short staffed. They were hard working and courteous, but hard to find. That can be an issue on arrival because you have to navigate two big steps in the entry from the street. Our bellman was great, but I noticed several guests standing around frustrated by the lack of assistance. Will I go back? Probably. The location and value are terrific and the space is good. And everyone is nice. But I may bring my own towel.

Same as usual good service clean room comfotable good price! We made reservation on short notice and still received great rate. We will be going back in near future.. Can't think of one negative thing!

I stayed here with my daughter and a baby - the staff was so helpful - friendly - and kind. One could not ask for any better treatment any where. The room was lovely - the bed and bedding were fabulous - great location - three blocks from central park and the museum of natural history. The neighborhood is filled with good - great restaurants, shopping, people watching etc. 72nd street station is just a short walk and subways are extremely efficient in getting around town. Nice bar for a quick relaxing drink. Above all the staff was truly a pleasure to deal with - we felt welcomed and that our needs were certainly met.
user_name:
Wendy H
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights and had a great time at this hotel. It was very clean and funky and had a real NY vibe. Very nice bar area where we listened to a great live performance on one of the nights. I liked that they had a gym included, although small it was good to be able to have a workout when I desired! Upper West side was a great area, and staff in the hotel were very obliging. I would certainly recommend a stay in the hotel.

OK hotel. Nothing fancy about it. Service is ok in general. You don't feel welcome by the staff but they are available when you ask for help.Location is in uptown. 40 min walk to Times Square and 5 min walk to Central Park. Subway is few min away.Lots of restaurants around.Rooms were clean but the room setup is weird. No place to put toiletry or make up in the bathroom and no dresser in the room. We booked a room with breakfast. You are very limited to only few options on the menu. Service in the restaurant that serves BF was very bad. Will review the restaurant in separate review.

Hotel was clean, service was great and the neighborhood is unbeatable! They offered me a welcome drink upon arrival. Great eateries around the area, close to central park and west side highway. The yoga studio next store is also great.
NYLO continues to be my choice in NYC. Great location and staff.The neighborhood is quiet and well-connected via 7th Avenue subway.Rooms are clean and comfortable but ask for one on the street side.

We came to NYLO for an overnight stay from Boston. Getting to the hotel was a breeze - leave the Amtrak at Penn station, hop onto the No 1 train and get off at 79th street - what could be simpler?The hotel has a good feel, friendly lobby with bar and reading room, rooms are not large but very comfortable and everything is within easy reach.

When we arrived at this hotel we were impressed with the urban feel and location, however we were soon to discover that it was style over substance.The location was close to central park and the metro, the rooms were small with very little practical storage. The main problem was that they were very dark which when staying there for 6 nights became quite depressing.The Wifi was rubbish and when travelling with a 21 and 13 year old is imperative. You had to log in every day and it only really worked in the lobby. Upon checking with the reception desk whether it was working or not I was met with quite a rude answer back that i needed to reset my phone.Apart from the doormen we found most of the staff to be quite offhand, especially the blonde lady in the bar. We only went there once as we found her too rude to go back.It did not detract from our stay in New York but i would not return to this hotel as it certainly was not value for money.

Conveniently located near Central Park and the Number 1 train, NYLO is a great location to stay when exploring the city. The rooms were clean with daily service. They were a bit small and did not come with a fridge; a bit disappointing for the price. The rooms did come with a flat screen tv, small desk, coffee maker and two bottles of water. The hotel was non smoking and offered a balcony to guests on its top floor. Overall it was an adequate home base for my travels in New York City.

Have been to NYC a few times prior to stay at NYLO ... usually stayed in Midtown. Location was excellent ...lots of food and shopping choices. NYLO exceeded our expectations...room was great, far more room than expected with family of 4. Beds comfortable, room/bathroom spotless. Shower was great. Staff were wonderful...helpful and very friendly. Price was great as well.

Would have loved this hotel if the platform bed wasn't so high and they used more high end bedding. This was our second stay and the renovated lobby area is great for socializing or just relaxing. The location is convenient to everything in Manhattan using public transportation.

Very hip hotel, bars and restaurants looked great (didn't go because I couldn't leave dog alone in room). Helpful and friendly front desk, rooms were nice but small, location can't be beat if you are in NYC for vacation. Right in the middle of everything on the UWS.

Wandered in and was immediately feeling a great vibe. The place was filled with music - live music and a warm buzz. The lounge singer, the indirect lighting, the smells of Italian fare from Serafina, family at the chess table in lobby - so far so good then I met Vivek at the front desk. Greeted with a smile and eager to please. Inquired as to my needs and nailed it. My room was on a high floor with city views. King bed, spacious, excellently executed minimalist decor and great light and air. Windows kept the city noise at bay. Will be back and would bring the clan too.
user_name:
J B
New York City, New York

review_body: Very nice location, close to Central Park and the Natural History Museum. Generally good experience that was marred by a couple of low points. The room next to us had a very loud couple and a very poorly insulated connecting doorway. Made it very difficult to sleep for a night or two. Also, disappointed that the Hotel charged an unexpected fee not represented on my Expedia booking.Hotel claims that Expedia should have told me, have not heard back from them. Feels disingenuous.

Great hotel. We enjoyed our stay. I stay at the hotel with my little child. Great location for everything we were looking for. Room was nice. Things that I think need to be fix are Wifi speed and AC noise at the room

I stay at the hotel fequently for work. Unfortunately what used to be my favorite hotel has now become the one I will avoid. Cleanliness has gone downhill. Toiletries are rarely in the bathroom and the staff just doesn't seem to care
user_name:
aprilcc2017
New York City, New York

review_body: Adequate, basic for the price. Nothing more / nothing less. Don't pay extra for the breakfast service at Serafina. Not worth even the $4 add on fee. The best thing about this hotel was its location and convenience.

We traveled to New York City for a few days as a family.. The rooms were small but adequate. Towels not replaced.. Only two towels per room (shower size) Staff not really friendly. we were on the 12th floor- and it was quiet. I guess the biggest issue was the atmosphere, It is not a hotel targeted towards families, I think if you were single, and young it might come off as "funky". But with no pool, small room, terrace we could not sit on, and a window completely open on the 112th floor with no screen etc, not ideal for a family stay.

My husband and I stay at the NYLO whenever we are in the city. The rooms are small but well appointed and the staff is welcoming. The room rates are good by New York standards and the adjoining restaurant is very good. The only thing that makes me rate this 4 instead of 5 , is that they charge a fee they call an Urban tax. It provides you with free Wifi and water. Just think that should be included.

I stay in Manhattan often for business but rarely venture this far north. Loved the neighbor (great dining options and services), excellent subway access made this fabulous hotel even better. I will be back!

We have been staying at the NYLO for years, at the ON THE AVE before the name change. It's centrality in the heart if the upper west side of Manhattan is critical as we know the neighborhood since childhood. The front desk people are helpful as are doormen and cleaning staff; the elevators, halls and rugs need upgrading as well as the King mattresses. The cleanly room maids are to be praised, as we always felt we were returning to our home-like atmosphere.

Highly recommend this hotel. The room was small, so if you're looking for large room, it might not be the hotel for you. But if you're looking for clean modern hotel in a great neighorhood with polite and helpful staff, then this would be a great option.

The NYLO has a lovely lobby and a great roof top bar. The rooms are just great and the front desk staff is helpful as well as the door man is friendly. It's near good shopping and dining and performing arts.

When i got to my room there were no towels, just a rag left from the cleaner. a couple of the newly delivered towels were dirty. the sheets had two spots on them. when i went to get my free drink, the folks behind the bar chatted with each other, served customers who arrived after i did and then got huffy when I asked if they were serving.

I am from New York so I am really picky when it comes to selecting a hotel when I come visit. This place was perfect! It's in the heart of the Upper West Side so it's near a ton of restaurants and shops on Broadway. It's also close to two sets of train lines which made commuting very easy. The bed was so comfortable and the room was clean and modern. My hotel room door wasn't locking correctly so the staff gave me a new room without a problem, They were so accommodating and friendly. I will definitely stay there again for next visit.

Excellent stay. Clean room. Great location. Concierge just fair. Front desk super nice. Windows faced another bldg so room kinda dark but quiet and private. Subway close. Fairway down the block. Cvs across the street. Cafes all around. Great ambience at the bar.

There is nothing more comforting than walking into the lobby of this very chic hotel on the upper west side. It is a beauty and the staff make every guest feel like they are inviting you into their own home.They take pride in the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel in every way.

Loved the hotel, well decorated and clean. The price for the room wasn't bad compared to other luxury hotels. Only downside is that you can hear traffic noise from in the room, However, definitely recommended.

On a lark I stayed here for my kid visited City College of New York. The room was relatively inexpensive and surprisingly roomy for a New York City hotel. The beds were very comfortable, the decor was all new and modern, and the location is very good. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it.
user_name:
LarryC265
Clarksburg, West Virginia, United States

review_body: Excellent hotel in upper west side. Our studio was nicely outfitted with the most comfortable bed ever! Very modern hotel with lots of exposed brick and wonderful design features. Fantastic staff--everyone we encountered in the hotel and the restaurant was polite and professional. Our room had a terrace, which was a nice place to relax with a glass of wine at the end of the day. Room was quiet at night and AC kept us cool the August heat. Hotel is an easy walk to subway as well as to Central Park, with many dining and entertainment options around in this lovely residential neighborhood. Only issues for us were a bit of mold in the shower tile grout and housekeeping consistently failed to provide washcloths even though they were in the room on the first day. Elevators were slow and often crowded, but they worked.

Great location. Nice decor and clean rooms. Comfortable beds. Had glitches with the room, but all were addressed very promptly. Didn't love having to switch rooms at 12:30 am because the A/C wasn't working in our room

Stayed here for my Anniversary with my wifeWas a great hotel. Very Modern and Chic. Room was comfortable and offered a nice viewOverall a decent value for the money in NYCThe surrounding area was great and we ate at the restaurant that adjoined the hotel which was also pretty good. There is a pharmacy across the street which was also convenient.

I had a good experience overall. One negative was that my shower curtain smelt damp and I asked for it to be changed but it wasn't. Also, I asked the concierge to bring me up a parcel that had arrived for me (they offered) but it was never brought up. I felt like they were always too busy. The wifi kept coming and going which was annoying!

The rooms were decorated in a rather stark and modern fashion but were well appointed with a very comfortable bed. No views.Good central location.The people working at the front desk really went the extra mile when we asked for anything. Also want to thank Ramona for recommending a fantastic Italian restaurant just a few blocks away from the hotel as well as getting us a late check-out.The RedFarm restaurant attached to the hotel was very good. And Sarafina was adequate.An overall good experience all around.

Reasonably priced hotel. Good location. Comfortable beds. People friendly, especially Jessie at front desk who was extremely helpful. Lounge on 16th floor a delight to relax on if weather nice. We'll come again.

NYLO made for a great home-base while in the city for the weekend. It was close to many of the places we wanted to visit during our stay and the metro station for convenient travel. It's also conveniently located across the street from a 24-hr CVS.The service was wonderful; they accommodated setting us up with adjacent rooms and manager Fannie and the hotel staff made my friend (the bride) feel so special by leaving her with a gift of wine and chocolate in the room. They also stored our luggage after checkout for a few hours, so we could continue to enjoy the city before departing home without toting suitcases. They also offered car service to the airport (although we didn't utilize this option).The rooms were a good size and we comfortably slept 4 to a room. The beds were soft and everything was very clean. Getting ready was a tad challenging, because there are no counters in the bathroom or convenient places to put hot curling irons/hair straighteners, but we made it work and it wasn't a huge deal. It was also surprisingly quiet. We stayed in rooms 216/217, which overlooked the CVS and a side street. Even though we were on the second floor, we couldn't hear the restaurant/bar below us at all and there was very little street noise. (I live in a city though, so I'm used to some noise). Our recent stay at NYLO was fantastic, and would definitely stay here again.

Was in the city for just a night and wanted something quiet and nice, yet not stiff and boring. This was perfect. We arrived late and were given a room facing Broadway. The room was quiet and beds were very comfortable. We really enjoyed the ambiance. The lobby was old school cozy with a piano bar and speakeasy type feel. Location was walking distance to the park and subway. This was a gem of a find and I'm confident we'll be back.

Great location and experience..looking forward to my next visit to NYLO and New York City. Great Location and great hotel, the bar is lots of fun and the accommodations are very comfortable! I am looking forward to my next stay at NYLO!

I was dissatisfied with my stay at the NYLO. The room was tiny, and wasn't given the upgrade that was promised. I had to fight to remove breakfast charges, even though I paid for a breakfast included room. Lastly, they never changed my sheets during my 5 night stay.

NYLO is in a great location and is a very comfortable hotel. My room was a bit small but comfortable, quiet, and well appointed. The lobby bar and sitting areas are cozy, and the staff is friendly. The subway is only two blocks away.

Loved the hotel and location. Staff was courteous. The restaurant next door m, Serifina was great and the coffee shop/French bakery across the street was awesome. I would highly recommend and hope to return.

I’ve been staying at NYLO for years. The location is ideal, with great shops and restaurants, a short walk to Central Park, and a quick subway ride to the theatre district. What keeps me coming back is the staff, who always greet me with a smile and do their best to accommodate their guests’ needs. Last week I requested an early check-in and arrived to find that my room wasn’t ready. Jessie, who is one of NYLO’s best ambassadors for hospitality and personal service, was able to find me an alternate room with a complimentary upgrade. Problem solved in minutes, and I was treated like a king during my short stay. Thanks Jessie, and thanks NYLO.

I've been staying at NYLO NYC for years and find the staff (particularly the doormen) wonderful. I recently had an experience with doorman Lenny where he went over and above in customer service. I was having a business meeting in the lobby and he went out of his way to come over and ask if I needed anything. I expressed that I would love some water which he promptly delivered. They, the doormen heard it was my birthday and that evening a bottle of prosecco and two glasses were sent to my room. So thoughtful. Aside from this boutique hotel being clean and friendly, it's super affordable, they allow pets and it's in a quite neighborhood.
user_name:
agh989
West New York, New Jersey

review_body: Stayed here numerous times. Great staff, excellent customer service, comfortable and very clean rooms, with an amazingly comfortable bed Fitness room was another plus. Comfortable lobby bar. And the upper west side location was central to park, museums, etc.

Friendly personal, good food in the restaurants. We had a rather small room, which is probably normal for New York. The floor in our room was dusty and dirty. Location near the Central Park and the American Museum of Natural History.

Awesome! Consistence is the bedrock of this classy Hotel. Our 5th visit was a charm. The front desk staff, concierge, bellman staff, housekeeping, and bar staff were superb! As this visit was during the summer months, the air conditioning in the room was fantastic. We opted on a standard room, and was most adequate. Next time we will upgrade to a Suite. There are no drawbacks with this establishment, even though we had to wait until 4pm to check in, it allowed us to relax from our plane trip and taxi ride from the airport. Excellently located, we were able to enjoy all of the sites and relax.

We loved this hotel, the accomodation was gorgeous, with a great location. Would definitely stay there again. A short walk to the subway, friendly and helpful staff, close to Central Park. Our room was super nice.

NYLO is in the heart of town close to restaurants, subway stations just 2 blocks away, bakeries shopping, all around u, no need for taxi or uber. hotel is very clean, one of the most comforable beds i have slept in and most comfortable pillow i have layed my head on. my room was spotless

This place is really beautiful and modern. Great location. The rooms are huge and so is the bed which is very comfy. Jennifer at the front desk was really nice and helpfull. I would definitely stay there again.

The hotel is situated in a perfect location, on the Upper Westside. Easy to get around, and I like the neighborhood. I was given an upgrade to a king size room, the bed was definitely king size and it took up basically the entire room. One of the downsides, is it literally felt like people in the hallway were right inside the room with me. No sound proofing between yourself and all the activity going on in the hallway.

Loved Loved LOVED this place! The decor is decadent, urban chic. The staff is SUPER friendly. The bar in the entry is swank but organic all at once. A CVS across the street is sooo convenient. Amazing European Deli around the corner. Quiet, clean, safe neighborhood. Metro is close. Central Park is so close. Can't wait to return!

No refrigerator or glasses in room. Bartenders and staff unfriendly. Breakfast was less than satisfactory. Welcome drink could only be used for a spritzer or champagne. Restaurant staff was. It friendly.

Very conveniently located - close to everything you need. Restaurants, Central Park, and subway. Hotel is very nice and room was spacious. My daughter lives a few blocks away, so it was perfect. Staff was friendly.

I came with my wife and daughter. The room was big and comfortable, clean . even though the toon was good, it is better to ask for a king bed and one more sufa for the child. Near the train station and near all the important places to be.
user_name:
yonathank809
New York City, New York

review_body: We love this newly renovated hotel on the upper west side. NYLO's large, quiet rooms are different than what I've come to expect from similar hotels in this area. The bar/lounge is always hopping. I was here for business at CCNY, my wife and daughter joined me to do shopping, museums, and shows. NYLO is strategically situated between both. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definitely be back.

An excellent hotel and location. I especially enjoyed the proximity to Central Park. Fabulous staff. Comfortable and spacious room. Could improve its internet service and fitness room facility but generally a worthwhile choice.

I'll start by saying that, of all my travels throughout North and South America, this is my first negative review. I was in an extremely good mood considering I had been on the road since 3 am (with no sleep the night before) and my 1.5 hour flight from Charlotte, NC took almost 5 hrs to reach LaGuardia (bad weather). The whole situation occurred due to a botched booking by Expedia. The room was booked using Expedia points, yet when I went to the counter to check in, the front desk clerk handed me an authorization to sign for over $500.00. I told her there had been a mistake and the room should have already been paid for. I did not sign the paper to authorize the transaction and told her not to check me in until I cleared the issue up with Expedia. Fast-forward 2 full hours and I am still sitting in the lobby with my pregnant wife who is in tears at this point from an extreme headache brought on by the atrocious "fragrance" that is being pumped into the lobby. During my 2 hour phone marathon with Expedia, no one from the property lifted a finger to assist or even asked us if we needed anything. At this point, my wife informs me that NYLO has charged her debit card over $600.00 for the room after I told them NOT to check us in. I went back to the desk to request a reversal of that transaction when I was greeted by a male attendant to insinuated that this was somehow MY fault. At this point I had enough of the rude conduct of the lobby staff, gave up and booked a room across the street at Hotel Belleclaire just to get my miserable wife and I out of the lobby. After 4 days of attempting to get Expedia to cancel the reservation and refund the money, I was informed that the hotel staff would not authorize a refund because the reservation was cancelled within 24 hours of check-in. I didn't even book the room an entire 24 hours in advance and attempted to get NYLO to cancel the reservation so I could re-book a room using my points through Expedia. The front desk staff advised they were completely booked and had no other rooms. For some reason, I could not get them to understand that they did indeed have an available room for me to book if they would simply cancel my existing reservation and allow me to re-book. It was like talking to a brick wall....a brick wall with an attitude problem. I have traveled to 28 US states and 12 South American countries in the past 2 years and THIS is the worst travel experience I have had. Congratulations NYLO....keep up the good work!

I stayed at this hotel while in town for a conference. It was very clean and the bed and pillows were wonderful. The only drawback to the place is the wifi is horrible. Although I was connected, the service was terrible. I had to use my own connection throughout my stay which ate up all of my data for the month. Even in the lobby of the hotel, the wifi was not good.

One or both of our daughters have lived in NYC for over 10 years now and we have made many trips there each year and stayed just about everywhere in Manhattan's lower east and west and upper east and west sides. We just returned from a visit there and staid at the NYLO Hotel again. We decided that will be our Go To hotel from now on. Great location on the upper west side, great facility, great price and first class professional service from all of the well-trained staff. Serafina restaurant and an excellent bar are right in the lobby. Can't beat it...

6 night stay in a double room on 10th Floor.Great location - 10 min walk to Central Park & Museum of Natural History, 5 mins walk to Metro station, in a nice area with quite a few restaurants & bars nearby.Room was reasonably spacious for a NY City hotel and well appointed with all necessary amenities - modern design, comfy bed, good A/C & plenty of power outlets dotted around the room. Good WiFi connection though you need to go through log-in process quite regularly.Plenty of TV channels but a guide to the channels available should be provided to save an awful lot of clicking around !Bathroom was a good size (shower only) & the toiletries & towels supplied were good quality & plentiful.The lobby bar is a nice place to hang out & they have live music some nights which is clearly popular and makes for a busy time. Lobby lounge area is relaxed & has computer & printer available for guests to use. Only thing we didn't really like was the breakfast in the attached diner .... very limited selection got rapidly tedious & we ended up going elsewhere most days .... so would recommend to book without breakfast included & leave your options open.Overall no complaints and we enjoyed our stay at the NYLO New York - would be happy to return.

My family recently stayed here for a week. Great location and very enjoyable hotel. The staff was welcoming and helpful, and the view from our room was beautiful. Loved the decor especially the lobby!

We found this hotel to be very well located. Our daughter lives just two blocks from the hotel. We love the bar. Great bartenders and great drinks. We like that to get to the theater district all we have to do is walk our the front door to get a cab and away we go. Fabulous little restaurants around here also.
user_name:
Cathy S
Corona del Mar, California

review_body: It feels like a fun, boutique hotel. The staff was great and the room was nice. I recommend the splurge for a balcony. And don't miss out on RedFarm while you are in town. The best part is the location. The upper west side is a great place to be and NYLO is close to the subway and Central Park.

Stayed for 5 nights in nylo. Very fast check in and out service. Staff was attentive and the location is great !The room floor were a bit sticky upon arrival but was resolved. Water pressure were low for 1 night but was promptly resolved post highlighting. Overall a great experience and will recommend to friends and family

Great location to much of the city's "happening" things. The staff was helpful, kind, and friendly. The rooms were much bigger then I had expected in NY and have stayed at other hotels when you could not even move in the room because it was so small.

This is a lovely hotel in a good area of restaurants,etc. Everything is low key and well done. Staff imembers are friendly without overdoing it. I thought the complimentary drink at the bar was a nice touch. My room was small, but that's pretty typical in NYC.

Stayed for one night. Small clean rooms in a peaceful neighborhood on the upper West side. Walkable to Museum of Natural History. Friendly helpful staff. Nice lobby with bar and couches for games or relaxing. Nice Italian restaurant in the hotel.

So pleased with this hotel! Excellent location, safe and so much to do right out the door. Staff is kind and helpful! Entertainment in the lobby was fun and inviting on the weekends. Very close to the Metro. Won't stay anywhere else when I return.

Never usually stay upper west side....but needed to and this place was great. Nice size room and great lobby area. Area was quiet. Good restaurants and shopping nearby but definitely having Central Park and museums within walking distance was a plus.
user_name:
John T
San Antonio, United States

review_body: The doorman was excellent. I think his name was George. He was also the gentleman that took our bags to our room. He arranged for a small bar fridge to be placed in our room. Only downside was that the outside area was small since we where a large group. But the roof top patio was great!

It's fun, chic, trendy, free complimentary drink as soon as you check in! Super nice and friendly staff, and just a walking distance from many great restaurants. The rooms are super trendy and have great views of the neighborhood.

Went there a while ago but totally forgot to write about it! I loved the NYLO NYC. Rented the top floor penthouse suite and it was worth every penny. The outdoor seating area was great to have a drink and listen to some music while looking at the Upper East Side buildings. The room was super comfortable - large king bed with floor to ceiling windows. Again, great view.I had to communicate with the hotel staff for a special request before my stay and they were great help.Really enjoyed the decor of the lobby + bar. The vintage yet classy look made it cozy and casual. Board games were a cool addition. Great location - steps from Central Park and the MET.I will be back!

Great modern hotel in a nice quiet are of the upper west side with excellent restaurants and easy access to transportation. Also featured a very nice bar and lounge. We were lucky to get this last minute room.

It was exactly what I needed. The staff was especially attentive, especially Jessie at the front desk. She made sure I had the extra towels I needed, and was kind enough to have the documents I needed copied and printed for my meeting.

I spent three nights at the NYLO in the 2 Queen suite. I highly recommend this hotel for visitors looking to stay in the UWS of NYC. Note that there are a few steps to enter the lobby of the hotel, if mobility is a concern. The suite was a nice size and hotel staff were very accommodating.Bathroom was large as well. If you have preferences (e.g. windows, higher floors etc.) make sure to let them know when you are booking and they will work to meet all of your requests. I had a requested a mini-fridge when I reserved but noticed it wasn't there when we arrived and someone brought one up immediately. Very convenient location, steps to great restaurants, Central Park, Beacon Theatre and more. The terrace was smaller than expected but still had a nice view of the Hudson River. I wasn't bothered by the street noise and was happy that they windows all opened a few inches to get a nice breeze (also AC worked fine). I would definitely stay at the NYLO hotel again. :)

We stayed at NYLO for a week during July 2017. The hotel is in a quiet location on the Upper West Side at the corner of 76th and Broadway just a couple blocks away from Central Park. Love this neighborhood! Just a block away from the subway and two blocks from Zabar's if that kind of thing is important to you. :) It is to us!We loved the staff here...everyone is helpful and wants you to enjoy your time in NYC. Free drinks upon arrival that you can enjoy in the ground floor bar or up on the 16th floor terrace - we sat out there quite a bit in the evening and enjoyed the views over to the park and the surrounding buildings. The room was extremely clean and nicely decorated. Quite small but hey, it's New York! One nice feature was that the bed was lifted off the floor far enough so that our suitcases could easily be stored underneath...if that hadn't been the case it would have been very cluttered and crowded in the room with absolutely nowhere to stow them. Nice little closet, well appointed bathroom. Great amenities - but no in-room fridge which we were a bit bummed about. I don't know where they would put it though! I will say that the bed is probably THE most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in...even better than the Westin Heavenly Bed, which I adore! We really thought that the quality of this hotel was right in line with the price...we didn't feel overcharged like we sometimes do in the city. Fair price and good value.The one thing I will say is to skip the restaurant downstairs, Serafina. It's a chain all over the city and we found the service to be quite bad, even when we just wanted a quick breakfast. Food was OK but with all the choices in the area you can do MUCH better.We'll definitely stay here next time we're in New York.

Excellent location and staff. The room I was assigned is fairly dated compared to other NYLO's that I have stayed in and there was a noticeable issue with cleanliness in the bathroom, but still a good experience. All of the staff were very helpful and friendly, especially both of the door-men that I encountered. I wish I remembered their names so that I could give them a shout out!

Happy to have found this hotel on the UWS -- reasonable rates but a lively, trendy vibe. Negatives: on-site restaurant was pricey and rooms small. But helpful staff&complimentary drink very welcoming.
user_name:
Marie G
New York City, New York

review_body: This was my second visit to Nylo Hotel and it did not disappoint. My room was clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. I love the area and the staff were friendly as well as responsive. Thank you for another great experience...looking forward to visiting again soon!

It was really overpriced--the so called business center wzs in the center of s noisy lounge,not worth the additional luxury fee plus city & dtate taxed. The workout facility was similarly over-hyped. If you are a hip millenial wanna be this is your place. Otherwise there are better deals within walking distance.

Arrived at JFK around 6:30am and headed to the Nylo Hotel via Metro. Arrived to the hotel around 10:30am. Check in time is at 3:00pm, so we checked our bags in and decided to grab some breakfast. The location is centrailzed, close to the Metro stations, Grand Central Park, numerous restauarnts and bars. CVS is right across the street just in case you forgot any toiletries. Shake Shack is 2 blocks away and we took advantage for this. Arrived back to the Nylo around 12pm, we had 3 hours before check- in so we waited in their lounge. The lounge is comfortable, nice leather couches and they have 2 computers available for guests. They also have a nice bar downstairs.  One of the members of the front desk staff really stood out for us. When we arrived at 10:30am, Carlos let us check in our bags in so we could wander around the area. He also informed us that 3pm was the check-in time but we would call us if a room became available before 3pm. Around 12:30pm, Carlos found us in the lounge, asleep and let us know that he had a room ready for us. The entire staff provide great customer service to all of their guests. They make you feel welcomed and they create an easy going atmosphere. I am looking forward to my next stay here.

On 3/31/17, we booked two connecting rooms at the NYLO hotel, 2178 Broadway, NY, NY for four nights, 7/23-27/17. It would be our third stay at this hotel. We received an email that day confirming our reservation. On 7/21/17, we received an email from Rosa Carr (reservations at NYLO) confirming details of our stay--including connecting rooms.On 7/23/17, we arrived at the NYLO to check-in and were told by the clerk that the people staying in the connecting rooms did not leave and had extended their stay. Therefore, we were told, we had been assigned non-adjoining rooms on the same floor. We expressed our disappointment, but we were not given an option. We were promised that the next morning we would be moved from our first rooms into connecting rooms as we had reserved. We were told to repack our suitcases and leave them in the rooms. The luggage would be moved to our connecting rooms the following day. I could not understand how another guest breaking their contract with NYLO would then entitle NYLO to break their contract with us.The next morning, before departing the hotel, we inquired at the desk to ensure a work order had been placed to move us to connecting rooms. We were assured this was the case.That evening we returned to the hotel, stopped at the desk, and were given our new room assignments and keys. It was confirmed we had connecting rooms.Upon entering our rooms, it was obvious they did not connect. Needless to say, we were upset. We returned to the desk with our concerns. The clerk said that we should repack our suitcases the following morning and leave them in the current rooms. We would be moved to connecting rooms the next day. We asked to speak with the manager.Manager, Stephanie, told us connecting rooms were not available, but they would be the following day. She said it was not her fault as she was not on duty when the errors were made. She expressed apologies and offer a night’s free lodging as compensation. We accepted.On the third night of our stay, we finally had connecting rooms.On 7/27, our receipt revealed a total compensation of 15%--15% of the bill for four nights lodging. The stress and frustration of this incident robbed us of much of our enjoyment in our entire NY stay. For two nights, it deprived us of sharing family companionship as we had planned for a year.  We will never again stay at a NYLO hotel and will never recommend it to anyone.London M. HowardArlington, Texas

Solid place to stay, never been let down. Great location, very nice boutique hotel that gives you peace of mind, great service, rooms are very clean and nice, food & bar is solid, and close to central park. Actually one of the nicest spots in Cenral Park along with being ontop of the subways and two great museums.

Biggest appreciation to Jessie. Thank you for everything. The hotel is located in the near of the Central Park - just 5 minutes to walk. The rooms are clean and modern. The staff is very helpful and kind.

We stayed here for our friends wedding in NYC. Great hotel, rooms are smaller than expected, especially from the photographs. Hairdryer, iron all included in the room. We didn't get daily water as stated, and if we left our room later than 9am (which happened after the wedding) the house maid was quite annoyed and made is feel it was our problem she couldn't clean our room. However overall experience was good.

I always stay at this hotel when visiting New York, basically because the staff is so friendly and efficient, especially Jessie at the front desk. The location on the Upper West Side is perfect, close to the Subway and a variety of retaruants.

Spent less than 24 hours here, but the accommodations were great! Nice lobby area. Hotel room was great size for NYC. Loved the location as well. Would definitely consider this hotel for my next trip.

Everything good,but I would avoid the breakfast package,.room good size for NYC and well organized.Lobby very inviting.And best of all was the bed,best hotel bed I ever experienced.77th and Broadway an excellent location..definitely a place to stay in NYC.

4 of us loved our 3-night stay at the NYLO for my big birthday. A unique blend of industrial, yet cozy, space. Staff was more than accommodating at every turn. No hesitations about returning, especially since each of us got the best nights' sleep there!! Thanks, Jessie, for the warm and helpful welcome!

I stayed there twice in a month on different weekends. I was lucky to find amazing deals. Upper west side location is fabulous, far from the madding crowds. The layout of the room is such that the bathroom is between the hall and the sleeping area, making for a quiet stay. Service at front desk is efficient but could be a tad warmer. I would definitely return if I got an affordable rate.Fitness room is small (a handful of cardio machines and some free weights) but effective if not busy.
user_name:
Jacqueline_Cambodia
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We truly enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend to anyone to stay there. The rooms were clean, the staff very friendly. The one person who really stands out is the doorman Lenny, he greeted us with a smile and helped us navigate around the city. I can't wait to get back there.

Very clean, got into the hotel smoothly and timely. Didn't see the need for the resort fee. Not sure what this paid for. Other than this, it was a very nice place to stay. It is in a nice area in the Upper West side.

I don't usually make reservations in trendy hotels as they usually feel quite impersonal and cold, I prefer historic ones with wooden floors or marble. I feel it was quite overrated and expensive for what it was. I wanted to use the 15% off coupon promised by signing up for emails... but of course the site didn't work. The $25 facility fee paid was a bit much.

Wonderful boutique hotel located in the heart of the Upper West Side. Lots of character and conveniences. Very close to Zabar's, subway, and lots of excellent restaurants. Hotel itself was well maintained and honored a request for late check out.

My daughter and I had an extra three days in NYC because of flight cancellations. The hotel staff were so kind. While we were frustrated, they were so kind. Rooms excellent! Staff kind. Hotel close to many restaurants and wonderful market. The staff went out of their way to help us with travel and entertainment arrangements. Loved the cocktail tickets! Surprised by wonderful live music and even Sephora makeup touch ups in the Lobby. A really sweet gem of a place!

Love the NYLO location; it could not be more perfect for walking, subway access and great restaurants and neighborhood shopping. The NYLO bar, LOCL is terrific, very neighborhoody and dog friendly.Request a balcony room and your treat is over the top!

I've been staying at the NYLO for years, but this was the best experience ever. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The beds are so comfortable. The double queen suite is huge!!! The location is convenient. Lots of kosher restaurants nearby. Pharmacy across the street.

Enjoyed our stay at the NYLO New York City. Hotel staff was friendly and courteous - location was perfect! Easy access to Central Park, subway, restaurants and museums. Room was clean, comfortable, and very quiet. We will definitely stay here the next time we visit the city!

It seemed like from the moment I arrived I was greeeted with rude service. I attempted to pull into valet but another car beat me to it so I then parked two cars behind which I didn't now was a fire zone (as its my first time there) I grab my luggage and pregnant belly in tow (hands full) get to valet who then tells me to pull my car up as the other car has left. REALLY? He didn't offer to hold my bags while I did this. But really.... is it THAT hard to do it yourself after you could see I had my hands full. You are Valet after all. I'm a great tipper but because of this, I didn't tip him. Room was clean. That's the only reason I gave this two stars. Then morning comes. When I booked this stay directly through their website I chose the option with breakfast. When I got into Serefina, the Health inspector had arrived and shut off the stove. So I didn't receive the breakfast I was told I'd receive. They didn't even have a plan B to offer me a cold breakfast. I had to ask them for a crossiant. I was supposedly credited $37.00 for that issue but when I checked my card statement, it was only $10. Then lets fast forward to the bar where I tried to use my drink tickets. The INCREDIBLY rude blonde bartender said to us and I quote "what do you want? (Rudely) and make it easy, I'm not even supposed to be here I'm covering for someone else." Then proceeded to veto every drink we selected that was on the drink ticket because she didn't know how to make it???Now listen, I'm a New Yorker and this is my old neighborhood. I chose to stay there for a reason. I know the difference between crass New Yorkers and just rude and these guys were just RUDE.Would I try them again? NO... as decent and clean as the rooms were, I don't like to be treated like cattle at check in and "bothered" when I request to have the complimentary items the hotel told me I would have.I wouldn't suggest this hotel to anyone because it's not even a decent representation of great hotel hospitality.

My room was small but generous in all of the important features. It was immaculate. Great bed, big tv. The hotel has fun and different rooms on the street level, very conducive to relaxing or conversation. I'd definitely return.

What a pleasant stay! Very clean room and professional service. Two blocks away from the 1 line. Stay here, you will not be disappointed. Very close (within two blocks) to several restaurants. Fast food as well as sit down.

Beautiful lobby, the decor and ambiance was stunning. The room was spacious for two of us and then bed was very comfortable. The staff were pleasant and welcoming. The location of the hotel is close to many delicious restaurants especially one of my favorites called Flor de Mayo.

I would definitely stay at the NYLO UWS again. The staff was very helpful and friendly and I love the overall location of the property. Sarafina, the restaurant next door, is a great place to eat and also has avery good staff.

Been coming to NYC for work about 2 times per month for years, and always stay at this hotel. Great boutique hotel on the UWS, close to the subway. Yesterday I arrived early and Jessie not only was able to get me an early check-in, but also upgraded me to a room with a balcony. Thank you Jessie! All the staff at NYLO are very friendly, will keep coming back.
user_name:
gherardomauri
New York City, New York

review_body: My wife and I usually stay elsewhere when heading to the Upper West side, but decided to give the NYLO a try and we were not disappointed. The NYLO has that quintessential boutique feel which can be a nice touch when heading to the busy Big Apple. It provides a unique chic feel without trying to hard, its authenticity gives it a very comfortable feel…like your in on the joke not standing on the sidelines. Check in was excellent and efficient, we were a bit early they stowed our bags and called us to let us know when our room was ready. A very nice touch was upgrading our room to a King size bed, a bonus for me because I am on the tall side. The room was fantastic, it felt spacious which is a rarity in New York. Great bed, comfy cozy, you sink right in but feel supported at the same time. Shower and bath room were great, excellent water pressure and nice selection of soaps and shampoos. Upon check-in we received a complimentary drink which we took advantage of before heading out on the town…excellent bar in the hotel with nice vibe..again a coolness without an air of superiority. Attached was Serafina restaurant (chain of Italian joint which can be hit and miss) but this was an excellent meal at a good price…we grabbed some salads but pizzas did look good and they use a wood burning oven. Location is a bonus also with the NYLO close to Red Line which you can jump on at 79th or 72nd. A little tip my wife and I like to grab breakfast at Bagel Co at 79th and Amsterdam…fantastic bagels with a great selection of spreads…and a fine cup of coffee…you know the place is great because it is frequented by the locals. The NYLO will now be our new Upper West hang out.

Our room was decently large and the beds were comfortable. Main issue is the room smelled very mildewy which seemed to be coming from the AC system. The breakfast was very good and the waiters/service was nice. The fitness center had a few elliptical machines, a few treadmills and a bike. Also some free weights.

Worst front desk service, they didn't care about our needs, our phone was broken and after complaining several times nothing got changed. The bar closes at 12 when they tell you one, the only nice man we encountered our entire stay who was helpful was George the bell man. Great guy and he helped my boyfriend find a safe place to park his evo when he seemed concerned about the wait at the hotel to get your car. Other then that, customer service was a 0. I wasn't feeling well the morning we were supposed to leave so we asked for a late checkout, the front desk agent gave us a very hard time and said there were VIP guests coming into our room (..no VIP guest would be staying in the room we had which was a standard king..) and then said we should have raised our concerns during our stay WHICH we did. I work in the industry and also told them I was writing a review on that property, no one's demeanor changed nor did they care. Which they should have. Oh well, too let now! If you're looking for a boutique style over priced hotel with very plain and over priced restaurant food, horrible service and careless service, this is the place for you. Will not be back!

Hotel bed gets good marks for comfort. The design aesthetics are unique in that there is no carpet (not entirely a bad thing) and the modern design could be considered cold and unappealing to some people. Air quality in the room is highly suspect due to copious amounts of dirt which accumulated in a personal air filter over 3 days.

I was initially put in a tiny box of a room that had no window to the outside. Only a window on an air shaft and exclusively flourescent lighting in the room. I went back downstairs and asked the front desk for a room with a real window. First the clerk told me they were booked for the night and the only room available was on a low floor that would be noisy from the street. He offered that perhaps he could move me the next night. Since I was there for work, I didn't have time for that kind of disruption. Then he peered at the computer and saw that the room was being paid for by a nearby University. He confirmed that this was the case and then switched me to a suite with a balcony and a comfortable bedroom with two windows and a small sitting room. Much more than I needed but I appreciated the upgrade. The room was comfortable -- the furnishings modern and tasteful yet the overall industrial look (bare floors, no carpet) was a tad spartan. But these are quibbles with the design choices. Overall I was comfortable and appreciated the front desk's responsiveness even if it was only because of the University. I would stay here again because it was comfortable, clean and conveniently located near a subway stop.

Very disappointed in the service from front desk. Rooms missing many amenities. Bathroom not clean. Room not clean. At this price point very frustrated. I travel to NYC often. I have family on the UWS and the location is close. Very unlikely to stay again

I will definitely be coming back to NYLO. They upgraded me for free on my first visit, had comfortable beds and a great shower. Staff was also nice and the elevators were fast (a rarity with NYC hotels). Over all I was very happy with my stay

Great place to stay, even though the room was small. Hotel staff not especially warm and welcoming, and yes, I know it's NYC. Great location as there are lots of restaurants and the Park is an easy walk. However, give yourself plenty of time to get to meetings.

Good value for money, even if a bit pricy overall. Nice ambience and a welcome feel through the lobby and reception area. Roons are nice, bog and comfy - perhaps a bit dark when facing the back alley.

Great Hotel! Nice large (for NY) rooms. Very clean, friendly and accommodating! We love the location as well! Upper West Side neighborhood, 4 blocks from Central Park, Subway is 2 blocks away and plenty of restaurants to choose from. Great lobby as well!

I always like to Pro and Con my reviews for hotels! Finding a hotel that was CLEAN and BUDGET FRIENDLY were the MAIN important points for me! PROS:Location! - If you like being on the "quieter" side of NYC, THIS is your place! - close to Central Park (10 minute walk) - close and SAFE walk to Shake Shack (sorry had to add this in there, we would walk over at 11pm-12am without any worries!)- more residential in comparison to other hotels- Friendly, safe, environment Environment- The minute you walk in, the hotel SMELLS AMAZING- You are greeted by amazing staff members and gear you to the right direction- This has a lounge feel to it (beautiful, rustic bar, and comforting relaxing space - THIS IS BETTER FOR MORE MATURE GUESTS - children may not like the look AS much) - Well-lite rooms and hallways (VERY well lit!) - THE BED IS AMAZING (very comfortable!!!)Cleanliness- I love how they have wood floors and the bed is elevated - Very clean countertops, washroom and overall surrounding Staff- The staff is very friendly and accommodating! - Do not hesitate to contact them, our window did not close properly and they sent their 'engineer' right away - very friendly!CONS:Building Structure- We were lucky to be situated at the end of the hotel (corner room) - but that doesn't mean we were removed from any loud noises! There was construction right across from us so if you woke up too early, it may be hard to fall back asleep - NOT THEIR FAULT. (Also - this is a given, but NYC is going to be loud with sirens and honks - after one night you'll be used to it!) Price - I personally found it worth it for the price; however, it wasn't the most cheapest of places either (3/5 on price scale)*** All in all, I WILL stay here again! I am looking forward to when they have sales and promotional offers going on to book my next visit (honestly, this is pricey so look out for those offers to make it worth while if you're on a budget, but still want that luxury!) Room Tip: Try to have an end unit

I have stayed at the NYLO ( ON the Ave ) for the last 9 years on our at least 4 trips per year. always enjoy our room, service. I really need to give a special shout out on this trip to Jennifer, front desk, she went out of her way to make sure all we requested was taken care off. Thanks very much Jennifer, see you again in a couple of months

I am from the aerospace industry and things fail. It is a fact of life. NYLO had a room failure not a major event but ti rendered the room we were in out of order.This is where NYLO really performed. Jessie on the desk just looked at me over her glasses a bit like Whoopi Goldberg and you knew something interesting was going to happen....she shook her amazing hair and went to work. Building engineer first, immediate inspection, yes it needs to be fixed. Cleaning anything needed? Porter help with the bags.Plus a new room fast.Now that is aerospace quality of management, systems and performance.Well done.My favorite are the terrace rooms.

This was my fifth stay (and 13th sleep nite) at this property in the past 15 months -- and I'm sad to see slippage in the quality of the stay and attention to detail. Among other small defects (e.g., missing TV remote, burnt out light in bathroom, sink stopper not working) -- housekeeping missed my room and my request to at least get fresh towels was ... "Yes, we'll send up fresh towels." (No apology for such an oversight.) I'll have to think twice before returning.
user_name:
Greg K
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Vibe in lobby is kind of hip. Rooms are decent, a little offbeat but certainly clean and comfortable. Our first room had no view (airshaft) but a very large bathroom.We moved the second night to a room with a view (the "view" being Broadway), which was fun, lots of light, but the bathroom was a postage stamp. Location is terrific. I'd stay again.
user_name:
hitherandyon2014
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I tried to stay at NYLO whenever I'm visiting the upper west side. I love its location - much quieter than Midtown and yet have all the great shopping and restaurants around. I was a bit disappointed by the check in process though. I called twice prior to arrival asking for an early check in. We arrived at 3pm, and the front desk told us that our room is not ready. I can understand if we arrived at noon or a super early time, but especially since the the hotel is not sold out and that I called that morning as well as the day before to request an early check in, it's very disappointing that they were not able to accommodate this. Having said that, we had an incredibly nice experience with Orlando who helped us with the car, luggage, and everything in between. He was one of the few employees at the hotel who truly made us feel welcome and comfortable upon our arrival, and again when we departed. If it weren't Orlando, I would say that our stay was only so-so. But his service brought this review back to a 4 star rating! Thanks.

We always stay at NYLO when coming to NYC (4+ times per year). Service is outstanding and love the rooms. The suites are spacious and much appreciated when traveling with kids. The lobby and bar area is great and feels like you're in your own living room (but really cool!). Thanks NYLO!!!!

We stayed here for our summer vacation and loved it! The room was spacious and clean, the staff was friendly and attentive, and it was in the perfect spot. We will definitely be staying here again when we return to NYC!

Its very well located, good music at night, cozy, clean. But if you really need internet, its an issue. It doesn't work most if the time. The operator doesnt answer and neither does room service. I stayed for ten days. I kept reporting this, and the front desk was very nice, showed their best intentions, but nothing changed. i go to NYC at least once a month, asked for a special rate, was promised one, but when I tried to make the ext reservation with it, they said it wasn't possible. I would call it "the hotel of good intentions and lousy reality".

Fantastic location, great staff, love this hotel. Always enjoy staying at NYLO. Front desk was very helpful when I needed to extend my stay by a day. My room was very comfortable and clean. I will recommend this hotel to my family and friends for future trips to NYC

This just is not a four star hotel, as they claim to be. Rooms are smaller than advertised and lack amenities. The "views" advertised do not exist The café next door is a disaster in terms of service.

The room size, its cleanness and the bed was Very Good. It also was very good the internet connection and television set, but I think it needs room service and a small refrigerator to storage some important issues.

Do you believe you can find top notch customer service coupled with a hip, clean and spacious, yes that's right, SPACIOUS room all in NYC? Well, dreams do come true if you stay at NYLO - the Upper West Side hidden gem. Hidden gem fits this hip hotel as it is very unassuming and in a quiet neighborhood. However, once you take step up to the bar/lobby area with dim lights and open air feel, you know you are in for a treat. My bestie and I were treated to top notch service by front desk staff member Joanne Brooks. Once she found out we were having a girls night in the city to see John Legend at MSG, she took every chance to make our night and stay memorable. I could not have asked for better service and spacious, clean accommodations! This hotel is a NYC keeper!

The front desk staff never stopped until they made the room completely perfect for my 2 sons and me. Customer service has become a lost art but not at the NYLO NYC! Thank you front desk staff for saving dad's soccer trip!

I only stayed one night but my stay was enjoyable. The rooms are somewhat sparsely furnished but it is done in the modern style and you should be out enjoying NYC!It is close to where a friend lives and I really like the Upper West Side.

Loved everything about this hotel! Except restaurants very pricey. But, it is New York! George was very helpful and made sure we had everything we needed. Even made sure we had an excellent uber driver and car to take us to the airport. Would definitely stay here again.

The Hotel itself is good. It is clean and in a great area. The bar always spoils it for me. I go to have a drink and the bartenders are so NASTY! They are so unfriendly and not accommodating at all. I think I would rather go elsewhere.

I very much enjoyed my trip to this hotel. The GM introduced herself in the elevator and was very friendly and the valet and bell staff were also super friendly. FD staff and bartenders were just OK-there was a long wait at the bar and it took forever to be acknowledged, then another lengthy wait for a beautiful and delicious cocktail with edible wildflowers in the ice that was very good. There was a female bartender who was not very friendly, but the others were smiling once I was being helped. FD was just fine, just not particularly engaging, memorable or friendly-but they were not off putting. The decor of the lobby is great and the Italian restaurant attached to it had good pasta. The value of the price for our midweek reservation was definitely good-the location is truly outstanding and cost less than competitors in the area. The room was small, as you would expect in manhatten, and the bed was very comfortable with a cook industrial vibe to the room. I will definitely stay here again.

It was a very pleasurable experience. Helpful staff. The hotel was very cooperative to my special requests and were more than accomodating. The location was excellent very close to the special event we were invited to attend

Great staff, great location if you are a fan of the upper west side as I am. Rooms however are showing some wear and rear only 4 years after renovation. Please don't let this happen as I am a big fan and want to continue to stay here

First of all, we booked what online was being sold as a room with a possibility of changes / cancellation without fee and it ended up not being the case. We had an emergency (my daughter's apartment flooded and I came to NY from another country to help her move out) and needed to change the reservation and the manager made it extremely difficult and would not understand even what we were asking for. The room was not made twice along the stay, the coffee machine broke and even if we brought it to the manager's attention it wasn't change and the maintenance person was sent to the my daughter's room. He was told it was the other room that had the problem but he never made it to that room or change/fix the coffee machine. The room locked us out twice because the latch behind the door locked itself and when going downstairs to explain it to the person in reception and get it fixed, he not only did not listen or seem to have the ability to understand what we were saying but sent the Security person up, even after me telling him the Security person would not be able to fix it. 30 minutes later the security person came and complained about the person in the front desk to me as well saying he did not explain the problem and that security was not able to fix it. Security person called the engineers. 15 minutes later they came and open the door, delaying my arrival to my commitment by 45 minutes. It also happened again in the same day and the handling of the situation was similar. Overall the staff is not professional, not attentive, they don't listen, they argue with the customer, do not follow up properly on issues and make the stay even worse.
user_name:
Marta S
New York City, New York

review_body: Thank you very much for your hospitality. I liked your building. I liked your staff members. I had a nice meeting thanks to your pleasant room. When I go back to NYC then I'll definitely go back to your hotel. See you again!

I have no words. I paid $900 for the location not the hotel. The room décor was nice but with so many roaches, we were uncomfortable. It was my father's 80th birthday, and I feel especially bad that we had to go through this horrible situation for the entire stay. We went from no hot water to a roach infested room on a higher floor.
user_name:
dionnec492
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Excellent hotel, great location on upper west side. Rooms small but that is manageable. The hotel charges a nightly urban fee of $27 which I think is excessive. I don't want to pay for services that I won't use including gym and use or phone for local and long distance costs. Let Thise who use those services pay and not apply it across the board.

I have to echo most of the reviews: The location is great, the hotel has a nice vibe, the bed was comfortable and the view of the Hudson from the balcony room was divine. However, we also found things to be dirty, drippy, and damp. My husband said "You know, this would be a nice hotel but the bathroom is just dirty enough that it's grossing me out." I was thinking the same thing. We didn't find the staff unfriendly exactly, but they weren't exactly friendly either. We got our key, were pointed at the elevator and that was it. We felt like a commodity, which we are, but it's nicer when you feel like a guest. Oddly, our room was kitted out for one person. Four hangers, one bathrobe, one towel hook, one set of bath towels and a washcloth, one tea pod for the coffee maker. Just kind of strange. It was okay but we'll stay somewhere else next time, especially for the price. Also, it's loud - take earplugs if you're a light sleeper. You'll hear everyone coming in after you, plus the HVAC sounds like an airplane taking off when it kicks on.

Great location! Walking distance from central park and many food joints and shops. Bed was absolutely comfortable. Has a very chick modern vibe. Decoration of this place is fantastic. Cant wait to book again.

Its clean, it all works but the check in staff really need to be way more friendly. Its not cheap and they have charged me $30 for "something" they cant explainIts close to everything youll need many food shops close by

The lobby floor is wet from an A/C unit that is leaking, it dripped on me as I was walking in. The couch and chair arms, backs and cushions were FILTHY and stained with who knows what... it was so disgusting that I didn't even want to get a picture for this review. Some of the staff were great, others not so much. The hallways are used to store the housekeeping carts, and the hallways are a bit tight. There were no washrags in the bathroom. I was also a bit disappointed by the previously unmentioned $59 valet fee (24 hours only... if you go over that they charge you another $59) and the $30 urban fee- whatever that is, on top of the room charge. We had been trying to get info on the valet retrieval time and options to leave the car in valet longer but had no luck getting any info or getting to talk to the manager about it so we gave up and just asked for our car back. On the plus side, the hotel was quiet and in a great location.

This is a great little hotel in a wonderful location. Rooms are spacious and modern. The beds are very comfortable and the staff is friendly and attentive. Easy access to subways and very close to Central Park. If you want to be on the Upper West Side, this is a great find!
user_name:
Jill M
Baltimore, Maryland, United States

review_body: Location is great, as is staff and hotel. We will return! loved the roof top too. Our booking included breakfast at Serafina, which is attached (next door). it was really good and saved money I'm sure. I would definitely recommend on your next trip to NYV. Can't beat the location!

Not sure why I picked this hotel but was glad I did in the end. The hotel is in a great location, plenty to do just by walking around. There are a ton of restaurants all over the place, close to the park and subway.

Generally positive experience at the NYLO New York. It's a good location and everything was generally quite clean. Water pressure was quite low for the shower and air conditioning was very loud, but other than that, everything worked quite well.

Nylo is going down hill! Needs an overhall of staff! Rooms were dirty....lobby was wet from AC condensation and guests were not allowed to sit in lobby because of a movie showing that NO ONE was attending !! Dumb...

I was assigned to a very poor room, however the issues were rectified and my stay was good as a result of the responsiveness of the Front Desk Manager, Christina Verdesca. Because of her responsiveness and resolution of the issues, I will come back.

Far too expensive for what little you get. Not easy to find. Paid for a city view room - that had view of only the larger building across the street. Feel ripped off big time. Won't be returning any time soon.

Had a great stay @ nylo in Manhattan, NYC. Front desk staff, lobby personnel, and housekeepers very friendly. Entertainment was even provided in the lounge @ night! Great location w/in easy access to restaurants, shopping, and Central Park.Only negatives were the price for parking-and waiting 45 mins for car return, and the restaurant next door. Probably not affiliated w/NYLO. Don't eat there! Otherwise, a great stay.

This is my third time returning to this hotel. I love NYLO because of the location, the hardwood floor and the very comfy beds. The location is great and the neighbourhood is safe and has plenty of nice restaurants and a drugstore across the street. If you need to rent a car, there's a car rental next door too. One thing that has bothered me is the EXTRA $30.95 resort fee PER NIGHT which is an extra line item IN ADDITION to the room charge and taxes. Since EVERY room is charged this fee, this should just be part of the room charge so customers know exactly what they are paying for.

Loved the space and interior design of the mini suite. The beds were awesome. Nice upscale feeling to the place. NYLO is in an excellent location on the Upper West Side. It was ideally located for my family. The rooms could have used a few more amenities, such as a fridge, warm towels, robes, and tissue.

Stayed here for a couple of days while attending conference at Columbia, which is directly up subway line about six stops. Interesting renovation. Tight quarters but kind of fun. Room had affordable chic feel. Yeah, the air conditioner was loud, as some others mentioned. Woke me up a few times but I usually figure loud fans block out other noises I'd rather not hear. I spent some time reading down in the lobby-library room. Staff at door were generally helpful. Not as many mid-priced places to eat around there as I would have hoped for a solo biz traveler. The bakery across the street was nice. Some colleagues advised me about NYLO -- said it hit the sweet spot between affordability, location and reliability. I'd agree. No probs. No surprises. Would stay again, but I'm in no way an expert on NYC hotels.

The location is great it's close to lots of stores , walking distance to Central Park and museum of natural history , we also walked to time square , staff were all polite and helpful (English and Spanish speaking) Normal wait time to retrieve car (45 minutes) in NYC they park cars off site so it takes some time for them to get it but I do recommend if it's offered (online) the valet add on

This hotel was wonderful. The staff was entirely professional and kind. The rooms were modern and spacious, and very quiet. I loved the library area, the bar with complimentary welcome drinks, and the fantastic location. I can't imagine a better spot in the upper west side. I am already looking forward to returning to this fabulous spot.

A good hotel overall. But, rude front desk staff takes away from experience. I have stayed at this hotel many times.. Reception staff extremely rude attitude in dealing with me. Air conditioner in room 224 makes noise through the night, interrupting sleep. Avioid until the hotel fixes the problem. Otherwise a good affordable hotel. Other staff encountered all very good.

Had another overnight business trip to NYC. Clean, comfortable, cool hotel, always welcome. Checked in early, worked all day. Only drawback - no desk and chair. Dinner at Serafina next door and a nice bar. Love the place!
user_name:
John C
Albany, NY, United States

review_body: Love the location. A ton of stores,shops and places to eat nearby. Quite on side street. Three or four blocks to Central Park. Very friendly staff..Clean rooms with a nice lobby,bar and restaurant downstairs.

I will most deff book here again, doesn't get any better! Can't find a better room with over sized windows, great city views, and a terrace! The staff was super helpful, friendly, and very accomedating!

The location is perfect, near of the subway, central park, museums, a lot of restaurants and stores, you can walk all the time, the rooms are very confortable and the staff is very kindly, the lobby is perfect to take a drink or to hear a good music.

We stayed at this hotel at the begining of July. We were welcomed by the door staff who helped with our suitcases, which was lovely after a long flight and taxi journey from JFK. The reception staff were very friendly when checking in. we got to our room and were very very happy, very clean, lovely street view of broadway and the most comfortable bed ive ever slept in. we were given complimetry drinks vouchers on arrival and went and had a drink in the very trendy bar area. The location was great, 15 minute walk from Central Park, very close to lots of nice bars and restaurants on Amsterdam. we have been to New York before so didn't want to whole tourist vibe which was great as the Upper West Side definitley gives you a feel of the real New York. There were a couple fo bars on Amsterdam who had Happy Hour's the drinks were extremely cheap. Jake's Dilema and The Gin Mill. nice bars and nice friendly staff. Everyone who worked at the hotel had a smile and was helpful. the roof terrace is an added bonus, after busy days it was nice to sit with a cold beer and listen to the sounds of the city. Overall a fantastic hotel, and we would definitley stay again. loved it.

My second time staying at this hotel and I am still a fan. I love the location most, but the hotel doesn't disappoint. What I like the most is the small boutique feel. This hotel is great value for the price.

The good: large (for NYC) suite room and bathroom; interesting bar and lounge; got a fridge with no problem; very close to market, restaurants, AMNH, and Central Park; great price for what you getThe bad: we were on the 4th floor on 77th, right across the street from an active fire station and construction; inconsistent housekeeping (left us dirty towels but introduced a fresh set of two, little black sequins around the room felt a little un-vacuumed); bartenders can be inattentive (and fat-fingered my CC for $5,155.00 one night)All in all would absolutely return (but be more specific about the room location request and what we need from housekeeping). This is a great find.
