Really loved hotel NYLO. We stayed for a week. Beds were amazing. Staff was wonderful! We enjoyed the free drinks at check-in. We had a small issue with housekeeping not completing their job before checking in, but the management took care of it quickly and gave us a new room.

Stayed here many times while visiting NYC. The hotel is very clean and comfortable. The rooms are modern / trendy, some are downright huge by NYC standards. The location on the UWS is great. It's right near the subway, with many shops and restaurants nearby. It's walking distance to Central Park and the Museum of Natural History. It's also on the subway line that will take you right to Penn Station, Columbus Circle - it's very convenient. A hidden gem of a place to stay in NYC.

Room was clean and comfortable, small. We could walk to both Central Park and the river. Nice little bar and sitting areas in the lobby. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay there again

Right in the heart of the Upper West Side and close to all amenities. I would stay here on my next trip. The room was large and comfortable. The staff was courteous and helpful. They went above and beyond to satisfy our specific needs which were religious based.

A really good hotel, the bedroom are big enough and clean. All the employees are brilliant with a special thanks to Jessie. I will probably come back to this hotel when I'm travelling to NYC. The restaurant Serafina close to the hotel serves fantastic food. The location of the hotel is good with the metro on the 79th street.Every night you will enjoy the bar with some great musicians and a really good atmosphere.

There were four of us, for four nights! The hotel was in a great location, quiet for New York City, lots of lovely restaurants nearby, and perfectly located to get around the city. The hotel staff were very polite and welcoming and George the concierge was very friendly and helpful. The beds were the most comfortable we had ever slept in, heaven, plus as it was quiet we all got our rest after a day of walking miles. The internet was also excellent.

The hotel itself is great for younger travellers who like a bit of quirky style. Rooms are comfortable and not too small as I expected for New York, beds are exceptional for comfort. The area has lot's going on away from the craziness of Times Sq. The only reason I do not give the hotel a higher rating is that the staff in the reception and particularly the bar were not overly friendly. I personally don't like to see staff playing on their mobile phones while customers wait to be served. Would have spent alot more time/money in the bar if this hadn't been the case.

I recently stayed here for six days while my daughter was attending a session at Columbia. The hotel was close to the subway line that takes you directly to the college or Times Square or completely south to Battery Park (Ellis Island, Wall Street, etc.) I was already comfortable with the city, so I didn't need a great deal of assistance from the desk, but they did answer questions when I asked. I agree that they are not a "warm" atmosphere and do not provide information unless you know what to ask. (nothing in the rooms, nothing posted and a stand-offish desk). I had a simple, non-view room, but it was sizable, clean, modern and comfortable. (Laminate floors, stainless sinks, simple lines...) Housekeeping was a bit unpredictable, I didn't have the same towel configuration from day to day and had to ask for towels more than once, but it wasn't a huge deal. Great food is right out the door (two great restaurants or an amazing market across the street) and you really cannot beat the location if you don't want to be in Times Square chaos. Be prepared for your bill--sales tax, city tax, occupancy tax, Javits Tax, Urban fee and urban fee sales tax, urban fee city tax, all listed on top of the actual room fee. Each fee was listed for each night--it's New York, but WOW--straight forward pricing is a better idea in my opinion. Overall, this was a very budget friendly hotel for New York, and I would certainly choose it again.

NYLO is located in the Upper West Side with all the great 'hood amenities. Saw Steely Dan at the Beacon around the corner, The New York Opera down the street, and had cocktails and sunset dinner at the nearby 79th Street Boat Basin. Clean, quiet rooms, great bar, and during summer watching the sunset from the 16th floor terrace was a special treat. We always meet great people and have had very accommodating staff. Room had a nice view of the Hudson River.

The staff at the Nylo hotel are very helpful and friendly. They made my stay so great. I will definitely recommend this to anyone. Great location and easy access the subway - Upper West Side either 72nd Station or 79th Station. Close to shops and very safe neighbourhood.

This was my first time at the hotel. It was WAY better than anticipated. Frankly, it's the best value for a hotel in NYC that I've ever visited. There are better hotels and there are cheaper hotels, but this was the best balance out there.

Excellent hotel, great location. Everything was perfect. We spend only a couple of nights but it was enough to see how great it was. Room was very cosy, not NYC-sized at all. Very comfortable and very clean. Water and coffee were offered. The door did not block the noise from the hall but that was not a problem.

Very transportation, restaurant and market convenient location. Very adequate facilities - clean, crisp/adequate service. There is a funky coziness about the lobby area which is pleasantly subdivided. My room, though not spacious, was quite adequate, very clean and with a climate control system that worked well.

The NYLO is a great hotel, it's located very conveniently on the upper west side and in close proximity to public transportation, great restaurants, central park. The staff are friendly and welcoming.

After a long road trip, the NYLO was a very warm and welcoming stay for my family. Coming from Texas, it is always nice to find places that have those extras that go above a beyond. The staff was extremely warm and welcoming. Alberto and Ben were the BEST. The rooms were very clean and neatly decorated. The price point and location are nothing short of amazing. The concierge helped navigate us through the city via the subway (how much Fun). Thank you NYLO for making my stay an enjoyable one.

Staff was not very accommodating and when a problem with my reservation came up it was almost an entire day wasted trying to get them to understand the issue and find a resolution. Hotel itself is a decent location minus the fact that the only dining within walking distance was cafe style food. Clean rooms but the walls were rather thin. Very cool lobby/bar area

Loved everything about the hotel this trip. Ideal location, great bar with a neighborhood feel, very attentive staff. My room with a great view was marred only by filthy windows...which they were to have started to clean the day I left. I would stay again. [I am a regular there]

We booked our rooms while we were in North Carolina and he told us the room will be ready at 1:00 p.m so we drove at night and only stopped by gaz stations for refills and coffee. We got there at 12:30 p.m and found out the room wasn't ready and the car was not included in our package... even though I was so tired, I took my family to have have breakfast next door and went to town square after that ..... the Hotel reception called me at 3:45 p.m but we were too far so it took us an hour to return to the Hotel. After two nights I asked for a late check out at 4:00 p.m and they told me that they will charge me half a day for that and i must check out by 11:30 a.m otherwise the extra charge will take effect.

The friendly staff and great location is the highlight of this hotel. The doorman was helpful with our luggage, check in process was a little slow; but overall manageable. Hotel employees where very happy to have us there with our dogs.

Great hotel with attentive staff and a great bar and lounge area. A clean, quiet and spacious room on the 6th floor with a bit of a view. Comfy king size bed with heaps of room. Good sized and clean bathroom. A great place to stay

Over the past few years have stayed four times at NYLO, and this is my third review of the same. This time around while checking in I mentioned how this was my fourth stay and maybe we should have a loyalty card and the receptionist just gave me the cold shoulder, no friendliness there or even a smile. The only person who even said welcome to us was the bellman who recognised us and was trying to make up for the receptionists coldness.I noticed that the hotel has become very busy over the years, the small foyer always full of people, like walking through a busy thoroughfare. Also the bartenders seem to be too busy to serve, wrong glasses for wrong drinks etc. the courteousness that I had associated with NYLO no more there. It is on the way to becoming another impersonal, cold NYC hotel.The rooms are still comfortable, small but well appointed, the elevators are now very busy due to the heavy traffic. I like the location as it is near everything that we need to visit.

We had an excellent stay at Nylo. It is in a great location and walking distance to several attractions. There is also quick access to the subway from this hotel. Joann at the front desk was extremely helpful and friendly!

Our room had a balcony... We only left to get food and drink at the excellent market across the street.Classy lobby. Great area in the city. Nice shops and bakeries nearby. Much quieter than one would think in New York City.

Great hotel and staff was very accommodating/ rooms very clean and comfortable/ nice decor throughout/ seraphina restaurant right next door / cvs across street / perfect upper west side location / near parks and museum of natural history .... you will not be disappointed

How much fun this hotel was. Never stayed on the Upper West side before, we loved it. We stayed on the 14th floor with a view of the Hudson on our little balcony. Couldn't have been nicer. Great walking back every night from any place in the city, you're never too far to walk! And both Central and Riverside Park are steps away. But the subway is right there if you prefer. The bed was fantastic, very quiet. And Serafina makes a great cappuccino in the morning! Will be back for sure.

This is a nice pleasant place to stay on the Upper West Side which typically has less than stellar SRO not so great lodging. Reasonably priced, nice bar, and has a Serafina Italian restaurant attached. There is also a Shake Shack a few feet away if you like that type of thing. Minutes to the Park, close to the Museum of Natural History and resonably priced.Rooms more than adequate and of a decent size for Manhattan . I'd definitely stay again. Recommended.

I would have rated this hotel higher, as it was pleasant overall, but the hidden fees hit you at the end of your stay and are very irritating. You will pay $27 extra per night for a small bottled water and use of their fitness center (didn't need) and internet access. Had I known, I would have declined their internet and crossed the street to CVS for a bottled water for the room. There was no fridge in the room, which I also like to have in a hotel. Powdered creamer for the coffee... seems they are cutting corners.

Unexpectedly nice place on UWS. Front desk staff extremely friendly and competent. Great room. Very comfortable. Hotel centrally located so it was perfect for us. Two-three blocks in one direction is Central Park. Two to three blocks in the other direction was Riverside Park and walkway.

I booked rooms for our extended family to stay here, so I was nervous due to a couple of the reviews about lost reservations and customer service (though overall ratings are good). NYLO NYC was great! They welcomed our large group, gave all the adults free drink tickets, were friendly and helpful about storing our bags after we'd checked out for the day; my worry wasn't necessary!! 4 of 5 stars because nobody's perfect (we got inaccurate info from the concierge regarding the Statue of Liberty). The hotel is an easy and enjoyable few blocks walk from Central Park. There's also a Shake Shack around the corner! We would definitely stay here again!!

Hotel facility is nice for the area. Staff is indifferent. Improvements could be made for guests with area info and hotel amenities available. Absolutely nothing in the the rooms to tell about the hotel, I.e. Dining, bar hours, outdoor lounge location - you get the idea. Otherwise the hotel and price are resasonable for the area

Really a fantastic hotel. Great service, nice lobby, fantastic experience. Also, getting to Time Square was a breeze on the subway - very good location - without being in the insanity of time square. Highly recommend this hotel.

I'm a New Yorker who moved to Cali, when visit I want to enjoy the hustle of the city and the comfort of home without being charged an arm and a leg. So I absolutely love NYLO, the lobby has a downtown feel but the rooms are decidedly uptown in size , large windows , views and quiet! The best rooms are off Broadway and the staff is so friendly and helpful if you are lucky and they have space they may upgrade you which Jessie and Viveic were kind enough to do during my stay when I asked. That kind of service is why I love staying here not to mention access to express trains and a killer cookie spot LeVain and a Juice press , yup I'm a faux healthy person! If you want to feel like you have a pied a terre in the city this is your spot!

NYLO Is a great hotel in a great city in a great location. Less than 5 minutes walk to the subway and you can be in Time Square within 10 minutes. Only a 5 minute walk to Central Park and one can explore New York City whether it's your first trip or you've been there multiple times.

Great location and great staff I would recommend NYLO to everyone This was the fourth time I stayed at this hotel So obviously it is a great place for us. The lobby/bar is a great place to meet family and friends

The hotel is located in a great location on the UWS. The staff is pleasant and eager to help you with your requests. The rooms were comfortable, clean and well appointed. The hotel offers plenty of upgrades; highly recommend taking advantage of these offers. We had spectacular view of the Hudson River from our terrace. I would recommend this hotel to others and will stay there again in the near future.

Love NYLO...great location, quiet room, great bar and reataurant. Best hotel experience in NYC! It is near the subway and great restaurants. I will definitely stay here again. Very comfortable bed! Great value in NYC.
Great Room & Great Service ! Definitely enjoyed staying there. The staff was friendly & the rooms were clean, and a Great Location. Would definitely recommend this Hotel to anyone staying in NYC

We wanted a hotel with a relaxed informal vibe close to Central Park, but with easy access to Midtown and everything in south Manhattan. We found it here.Flew into JFK from England for a family wadding in Central Park.Great location on Broadway nad West 77th Street just 2 blocks from Central Park.It has a sprawling ground-floor lounge, complete with bar, to relax in on arrival or after a heavy day of sight seeing. (Every booking gets two complimentary glasses of Prosseco. Bonus.)Our room was on the 10th floor with a city view down onto West 77th Street. The room was a good size. The bed was magnificent, a revelation. It was like sleeping on a huge marshmallow. Soft and enveloping. It was without doubt the best hotel bed we have ever slept in. It was worth the cost for the bed alone.The room was clean, and was cleaned daily with new bed linen and new bathroom towels, etc.The bathroom was a good size complete with bath, overhead shower (fantastic), wc, wash hand basin complete with complimentary bathing & showering toiletries and a hair dryer.A bonus was the 16th floor terrace with seating and views out over the surrounding city blocks towards the Hudson River and over towards Central Park. A great place to relax with a drink from the bar after a heavy day. Surprisingly it seemed that only a few people were aware it was there...Came across the NYLO via Google. Booked direct with hotel. Room rates were much lower than booking via 'comparison sites' such as We can't recommend the NYLO New York too highly. We will be returning to New York and will be returning.Take our advice. Avoid those stuffy hotels or those hotels with small lobbies and no bar or place outside you're room to relax. Pay a little extra and enjoy everything the NYLO has to offer.

Price was $ 319 per night on a sunday for one night single occupancy, but on the bill they had: NY State Tax $28.31 for all nights NYC City Tax $18.74 for all nights NYC Javits Center Tax $1.50 for all nights Urban Fee $30.98 for all nights occupancy tax $2.00 for all nights summing up to 400.53 for one night. Interesting: The "Urban fee" is a house fee for WIFI, welcome dring and other things usually included in every other place. There wasn´t even a Minibar in the room. And the stainless steel sing looked like one in prison.200 ft away across the street is the "Belleclaire Hotel". Similar rooms, but $ 167 total the night before on the same weekend.Other items like bad noise insulation, and a $ 50 "safety deposit" and the inability to check in in person at the front desk not mentioned, this Hotel is definitely not worth ist Money. It is not bad, but highly overpriced.

This is in a great location, customer service is great with exception of the receptionists. I was there for three nights, my card was disabled every evening, super annoying when you get to your room and you do not have access and have to go back down stairs to ask a rude receptionist for a new card. At least on one night our they were stains on pillow cases.

I stayed here while I was taking a week long workshop at Columbia. It was a great location- subway across the street, several bakeries and coffee shops nearby. Others in my classes said they didn't care for their room as it was too close to the street and really noisy. They also didn't care for their handicapped shower they didn't ask for that had no door and was just a drain on the floor next to the toilet.

The hotel was perfectly located in a great area. Steps from 2 subways. The bed was the best. I'm looking to replace my mattress with the one from the hotel. The room was clean and space was useful. Loved the lobby and sitting areas. Will stay here again in any city they have them.

Always amazing, everything perfect, from the beginning until the departure. Driver from JFK-Nylo,perfect ! Room,speechless in all the beauty with a breathtaking View to the Hudson River and Central Park.Only Hotel in Manhattan with this amazing terrace in your room. The staff is gorgeous and helpfull in everything. Special Thanks to Mrs. Cabral and to the Gentleman Doorman George ! Coming back next year , PROMISED

We stayed at the NYLO at the end of June, 2017 and are so happy with our experience. The room design is so efficient and the room is very clean and modern. The outdoor space on the 14th and 16th floor are great places to gather with friends for a glass of wine. The staff are very kind, professional and accommodated our every need. I would stay there again for sure!

The rooms were large and clean. The staff were helpful and polite. This is an excellent location- safe and close to many good restaurants, museums, shopping and transportation. The lobby is spacious and has a place to print boarding passes, a great convenience.

We walked into the entrance of NYLO and were a little confused as to where to go first. We felt like we were walking into a dark restaurant instead of a hotel. After making our way to the concierge, we were greeted by a friendly receptionist. She quickly got us settled and we were given our room key. We stayed in room 1403. Our room "looked" clean but upon further inspection, we noticed the Floor was dirty- found a random pen in the corner of the room, a piece of cereal blatantly in the middle of the room, and a huge hair ball in the bathroom! We were shocked at how the maid could have walked out leaving the floor so gross. Thankfully the rest of the room was okay- just a side note, there is no mini fridge! We weren't expecting this, and were a little disappointed. Also, don't expect a mini bar or room service. Bathroom was small but water pressure was good in the shower. Hairdryer did not work. Bed was comfortable and black out curtains were great. We tried to call Serafina for breakfast in the morning - after calling 3 times and having no one answer, we decided to stop trying and eat somewhere else. Pros: -Nice sized Terrace (not private though)-Bed was very comfortable, black out curtains were great-Water pressure in shower was good-Location (good if you are going to be visiting Central Park, the Museum of natural history and a 30 min walk to the Met)Cons:-Extremely dirty floor-Walls were very thin! Heard neighbors talking constantly next door-No Room Service-No Mini Bar-No Fridge-Lacks personality and service (theres nothing in the room that give you information about the hotel or what services they offer)Overall basic hotel that desperately needs more personality and CLEANLINESS! I personally would not return because we like to have the option of room service and the dirty floors did not make us feel like we were in a clean hotel room.

Great bed! Wonderful staff! Perfect location- loved the fun vibe. The reservation price flexuated depending on the day I called but my final price felt very fair. Loved the simple urban decor.... and you can have insomnia cookies delivered late at night. I had a great stay!

Great location....close to shopping and restaurants. Cool, boutique feel when entering. Lobby has bar service and nice ambience where you can relax or wait for your taxi. Rooms have no rugs which is important to me. Clothes storage is very clean and nice. I have stayed at NYLO during the summer for about a week at a time for the past three years. I always choose NYLO .

My husband joined me during my stay in NYC for a conference. He works remotely and had no problem with wifi for the week. Location on Upper West Side was convenient, loads of great restaurants and bakeries nearby, subway 2 blocks away. Our only complaint was not having a mini fridge in the room to keep leftovers or snacks! (And bed was lumpy!)

Great neighborhood, lots of restaurants and services. Hotel is very quirky in mostly good ways. If you pay for larger room you will be very happy. Staff were responsive to some minor room issues. Recommended.

Front desk help was very helpful and so friendly. Lenny, Jose and Albert were extremely helpful with their service: transportation and answering questions and luggage. They were always ready to assist

This was a great place to stay for the Reading Institute at Teachers College at Columbia University. Getting on the 1 line subway up to the Columbia University campus was very easy from the hotel. I would stay here again for any other trip to New York. The staff was great! The maid service was great. What else can I say?

- Good location- Noisy rooms- Room not what paid for, had to ask for a change, which was made the following day of arrival - the other room was pretty airy and modern;- Laundry always late, you have to request several times;- No breakfast or meals, have to order at nearby restaurant;- Pretty good service at the lobby, if a bit anonymous (big hotel)

Friendly staff. Clean. Rooms are small. No fridge in room. Very close to restaurants, stores and Subway. Minutes walking to Central park. Excellent location. Bar and restaurant in hotel. Very good food. I would go back.

The hotel was ok. It's very minimalistic decor in the rooms. The service was great. The location is ok. I normally stay near central park close to 5th avenue and that is close to everything that I like to do. This hotel is on the upper west side and was not as convenient for me. If you want a quiet more low key area this is your hotel. If you want to be close to the shopping then look elsewhere. It was about a 2-4 block walk to a subway and then a 15 minute train ride to get to the shopping on 5th and madison avenue. The beds and bedding were great. Very plush and comfortable. Cleanliness in the room was average. The room with the balcony was a nice size for an NYC hotel room.The hotel isn't bad but it's not really my first choice.

the staff made us feel welcome and were always happy to answer questions and take care of incidentals. The location is exactly what we hoped for, near to everything we wanted to do in the City. Easy access to Lincoln Center, Zabar's, Central Park and lots of good eateries.

The hotel was edgy, the staff were wonderful, the location was handy, and this hotel has become our favourite place to stay in NYC. The room was clean and looked new. Such a pleasant change to some other places we stayed before.

We were suppose to check into a different hotel but when we attempted to check in they told us our room was canceled. We got the last room at NYLO and it was a blessing in disguise. NYLO had a better location, staff, atmosphere, it was just overall better!

The NYLO is located on the upper west side, near transportation, places to eat, and neighborhood shops. We had a king bed and our room was quite spacious,for New York, good closet space, smallish bathroom, the room aslo had a small desk. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. There is a rooftop area on the 16th floor, with seating a nice views of the city. The lobby area was comfortable with seating and a TV. The bar was cozy but a little pricey. We will most likely stay there again..

Wonderful location, clean rooms and great beds make this hotel a place I have visited for the last 15 years. The rooftop patios are also super -- especially during great weather. For these reasons, I have usually chosen to stay at NYLO when in New York and, this time, recommended the hotel to my friend who was bringing her granddaughter to NYC for the first time. I was disappointed in my room -- compared to other rooms we've had at the hotel, disappointed that the rooftop patio was closed to guests for a private event with no notification and disappointed that some basic aspects of room maintenance were absent.

The hotel is close to the apartment of the family I visited in New York. It was very convenient for me. It is located in a central area on Manhattan from which I could walk or take the underground to all tourist points of interest. Also, it is nice to stay in the area close to the hotel.

I stayed for a week at this hotel while taking classes at Columbia University. Not only was the hotel trendy, comfortable, and friendly, it was in the perfect location to see and do everything on my NYC list. Walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, and short subway rides to every other location... It was a fabulous stay! I recommend it.

An okay hotel but very deceptive in billing practices: Even though we prepaid our stay we were charged with a $30.98 "resort fee" - even though this is NOT a resort. When I mentioned that, the clerk redubbed it an "urban fee." I have stayed in countless hotels in NYC and have never seen this. Bottom line: You can find nicer, better located hotels for the same price!
user_name:
FrequentFlyer513
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The NYLO is a comfortable, conveniently located hotel on the upper west side.As with most hotels in Manhattan, you may store luggage on both sides of you stay. My lower rating is for two reason:First the price quoted origanally and the price that appeared on my receipt I was emailed were not the same. I was charged $10 more for our second night. Also, I was charged an "urban fee" of $ 27 for each night, plus tax on that fee. A reasonable rate than became run of the mill. I travel to NYC frequently. In fact I have reservations at another hotel next month, no urban fee, no additional charge for my second night.Also minor but annoying, the desk took my cell phone number and said they would call when my room was ready, never called.

A hotel thoughtfully designed in industrial-chic style. Surrounded by excellent restaurants, good shopping, a short walk to many attractions. Staff was incredibly helpful. Welcoming if dark central areas. I've been before and will return.

Stayed 4 nights and they gave us a free room upgrade all 4 nights! Also accommodated our early check-in request. Wonderful staff. Location is quiet and perfect for morning walks/runs in Central Park. Many cute cafes to explore just one block away, off Amsterdam. All in all, a great home base for exploring the city by day and returning to a lovely, comfortable hotel at night.

Great experience and wonderful staff. Rooms were clean and quiet. Used the gym a couple of times, which is nice. The hotel is just a couple of blocks from the subway, so easy to get around the city. Will return.
user_name:
tn-mead
New York City, New York

review_body: Ended up at this hotel due to flight cancellation but what a surprise! Love this place, it comes out of the usual hotel chain. Location and guest rooms are great! Very clean, bed super comfortable. Jennifer was awesome!

Peaceful zone of NYC for people who looks a place to rest, having no sirens, ambulances and traffic noises. A absence of a frigobar inside the room, difficult to have a bottle of water close to the hands at night. In general, NYLO deserves a remember in a future trip to the town. Good services and front desk support.

I stayed in the Nylo for a couple of days. After an initial problem with my room I was upgraded to a fantastic room with its own roof terrace with fantastic views of the city. The hotel is conveniently close to Central Park and subway. Staff is friendly and helpful. The restaurant offers great breakfast and the coffee is really good. There are lots of nice small restaurants in the neighborhood. The rooms are decorated in a fresh modern style. I really liked the place.

We enjoyed our stay very much. Location is perfect for events at the Beacon Theater. Included valet parking would've made the stay better, but the staff was friendly and helpful, especially the concierge.

The NYLO is a great boutique hotel with an exceptionally friendly and attentive staff. The location is good, especially if you have business at Columbia University, but still want to head to the Times Square and theater district. There is a subway station very close by.

We only stayed for one night but the hotel was great. The location was perfect since it was close to friends but I liked that the area was not as busy and close to anything you would need (great restaurants, grocery store, CVS, etc). The woman at check in was very sweet and upgraded us to a king room and provided us with complimentary drink vouchers. The rooms are small but that was expected in NYC. They were well appointed and nicely decorated. The lobby/bar area is very nice and comfortable. The only negative was it took 45 mins to get our car from valet after check out. A plus is this hotel is 2 blocks from Levain's Bakery--a must stop while in the area! One recommendation is to check the hotel site regularly even after booking as the prices fluctuated and I was able to get a much lower rate then when I originally booked. I would definitely stay here again.

Really enjoyed our stay here. Central Park and many restaurants close by. Hotel bar opens to the sidewalk which is fun, and there is a roof terrace that is small but nice. Room was nice size for NYC, bathroom nice with good amenities. Only complaints: 2 of the 3 visits to the bar were not good experiences. Bartenders on Friday, both afternoon and night, were not a bit friendly and borderline rude. Thursday night was busy and even with a band and crowd the bartender was nicer. Window in the room was really dirty. Understand they are hard to clean in NY but to the point had to keep the curtains drawn. Otherwise the room was very clean and comfortable.

We had a wonderful stay at the NYLO. We were staying with our one year old and they were very accomadating. They brought a crib and fridge to our room and upgraded us to a larger room to fit everything comfortably. We were very comfortable the whole stay and would love to come back. We loved the location and walked to Central Park and yummy restaurants everyday.

Our stay was simply perfect! The competent and utmost friendly staff merged our bookings with no issues. They made sure we felt like home away from with helping us with a baby bed, a little fridge, etc. We really felt like staying with family. The location is great when traveling with a toddler - close to Central Park, close to supermarkets, cafés, delis, restaurant that are a bit outside of the main touristy spots. The subway brings you everywhere within a few minutes. Highly recommendable!

Great hotel, close to great bakeries, deli, central park, Riverside park, easy access to the subway to downtown and columbia university for conferences. Comfortable and nice for a romantic weekend also.

Professional and friendly service; Rooms standard size for New York standards; very convenient for subway and taxis as well as walkable to Central Park. Fun lounge and bar area. Everyone on staff greets guests and plenty of restaurants nearby. Great location for Columbia University as well as getting to downtown easily.

I stayed at NYLO New York at that last minute due to missing my connection at JFK. I was suspicious of the low rate but was pleasantly surprised at the entire experience! Truly an elegant, delightful hotel! Great staff, excellent bar, wonderful food, great room, great location. You don't have a view, but who cares! Unless you are a top floor of a hotel overlooking Central Park, a view is insignificant anyhow. I would certainly stay at this location again AND recommend to any of my friends and family. Oh, did I mention the rooftop morning yoga??!! Too cool!!
user_name:
Suzie H
Seattle, Washington, United States

review_body: Everything about the stay was easy. My only qualm was the fact that I could hear every conversation in the room next to me that went on into the early hours. Loud snorers, too. Good thing I brought ear plugs.

Had a good week-long stay at the NYLO. Spacious room, small terrace, and probably THE most comfortable bed I've ever slept in! Very close to transportation and many delicious restaurants of many types. Cozy lounge areas. Larger shared terraces existed, but they closed before we could use them at night.

Our experience at the NYLO New York was exceptional. All of the staff were attentive, friendly and genuine. Our room was very clean and comfortable. The location was perfect. I can't wait to come back!

It was cool! The room was very confortable. The hotel is near to a lot of interesting things. The bar has good things too. Breakfast was delicious. Attention was good.We hope we can go any soon and visit you again!

What a hidden gem ! Our third visit to the NYLO and hopefully won't be our last . Staff as attentive and obliging as always when we were unhappy with our original room ( we wanted a room overlooking Broadway ) as soon as one became available they moved us .

Bed was very comfortable. Employees were friendly and efficient. Best place to stay in nyc. I will definitely stay here nest time I come to visit. It is the perfect place to stay on the upper west side.

Great hotel for a few nights in NY. Room is small but very well equipped and tastefully done. Very clean and has a good fitness center. Convenient to subway, and in a fun neighborhood for food, museum, and shops. Enjoy!

Some staff at the hotel like George are exceptional and always made us feel welcome. But the front desk was late checking us in and lacked customer service. AC broke down in our room making for an uncomfortable night. We were still billed full price.

This was the first time we had stayed at this property and it everything was exceptional!!! This was an amazing hotel!!! The location was perfect!!! We will definitely stay here again when traveling to New York!!

NYLO was a upbeat, trendy and comfortable hotel. All the standard rooms are not equal so if you face a brick wall (literally like we did) and if at all possible ask to change your room. Take that complementary drink up to the rooftop outdoor space and relax until check in time. The hotel is also just a few blocks from Central Park so enjoy the walk and the park. Also some museums are also within a few blocks. We did breakfast package which was OK but right across the street are some good places to get breakfast a lot cheaper. We did dinner at the hotel restaurant one night and the food, drinks and waiters were really nice making it a very enjoyable experience. We would stay again but they don't offer any frequent stay program so most likely will go back to a chain hotel in Times Square.

The hotel is great and the staff is so accommodating! The hotel is in a great location- very close to great restaurants, shopping and other attractions. The rooms are very nice and the beds are so comfortable.

The hotel is a smaller boutique hotel, and provides great service. Jennifer at the front desk was extremely friendly and helpful, as were all of the staff. Everyone went out of their way to be helpful. When our daughter asked for a different room for the 3 ensuing nights, Jennifer made sure she was up on a higher floor, which was much quieter than her room on the 2nd floor that she had FM the first night. We had a delicious breakfast at the restaurant next door. The hotel is close to shopping, but you will need transportation to the theater district. The subway is a convenient walk up to 79th street. I would recommend this hotel for adults, business or pleasure.

We where all looking forward to a family trip to NYC and sadly the accommodation was bad, and I mean bad! First of all the service was very slow! The room smelled very musky like BO and the bedsheets had rips in them. Another problem is the paper thin walls, annoyingly the man next to us burped the whole evening! Seeming our room was a supposedly a "luxury" room, it does not live up to the expectation! The website makes it look very spacious with big windows and nice views, in reality the windows are tiny and it does not look that nice. I also did not feel clean in the room, everything seemed dirty. Finally I am very surprised at the 4 1/2 starred rating on Tripadvisor.

Picture on website were miss leading. You can tell what your room is going to look like. Thought I was getting a balcony on the street side and insead it was looking at the garbage and other parts of the building

Great funky hotel in great neighbourhood with everything at the doorstep. Loony offers all kinds of 'scenes' in carefully designed and cosy nooks. Lobby florist is a great touch and complimentary drink gives you a welcoming flavour of the lobby bar. Will definitely stay there again.

The hotel is nicely located. It was wonderful to get a free drink ticket when we checked in. The rooms are a little small, but well done. The staff was very helpful and the rooms were fairly priced. The "gym" left a little to be desired. Small gym with a few running machine and no free weights.

I needed a comfortable nice hotel on the upper west side of the city to be near our son's apartment. I found the NYLO to fit the bill. The room was small but I wasn't looking for a luxury space. Good free internet service and a great downstairs bar and cafe. I'll return.

We really enjoyed our stay in the NYLO (sort of short for New York loft). Each staff member--from front desk to housekeeper--was friendly and helpful. We needed to check in early and the front desk did all it could to accommodate, including calling my cell phone to let us know that a room was ready. Our room was on the small side but nicely decorated in an industrial/loft style. The upper west side Broadway/77th St. location could hardly have been better for our needs. We paid in advance for valet parking, thereby saving a bit of money. We very much liked this hotel and will stay here again when we next visit the City.

Love the price, ambience and, location. We researched quite a bit before selecting NYLO and it is the best value. We have stayed here twice and will be staying here in the future.The neighborhood is great! It is walking distance to Central Park and close to great restaurants and shops. The beds are very comfortable.

My best friend and I met up for a girls weekend and this was just the perfect spot! Out of the hustle of the city, close to Central Park, nice and clean, cute bar and lobby, easy access to metro, bikes and buses. I totally would recommend this place.

Could not have been happier! Everyone was so helpful and guidance we received helped us make amazing dining choices in our free time. We will tell our friends and we will be back.Brian P. DriscollFlorist was great too.

I was travelling for a work conference in the first week of June 2017. I was greeted by friendly door people on my way in and enjoyed the boutique vibe of the hotel (not your typical boring Marriott). The lady at the desk was friendly and made conversation with me about my job. I was immediately sent to my room even though I was early for check-in. This was great. The hotel room itself was average. It was clean but didn't have any extras. There was no climate control in my room that I could see, the first day I was freezing and when the weather got warmer it was really muggy in the room and the windows don't open. The sink had no counter space so my things were always falling off and it was a shower with no bath tub (which I didn't mind very much). The view from the 7th floor was pretty nice but people apparently like to slam doors on their way in/out of their rooms after 11pm and I could clearly hear this. They had live music in the lobby one night that I noticed and it was very enjoyable, except the bar service was very poor and slow. The free drink I was given upon check-in was limited to sangria and some other choice I didn't like. The sangria was not good. Upon leaving, I asked to have my bill emailed to me and I never received it (unsure why). I tried calling to get it emailed and no one answered. I didn't use room service at all while I was there so can't comment on that. The location is great of course. Overall, my stay was ok because work was paying for it, but if I had paid my own money I wouldn't have been happy with the value for $400/night (it would be of more value to find an airbnb in the area).

Charged me 3 more nights after checking-out,finally returned to me after my many calls and emails and still no reply for some problems i asked. it's the worst hotel i stayed in my life!it's really a terrible exprience!!

The staff is friendly and helpful! They are also very honest. I left my cell phone after I checked out and the cleaning service returned it to security. I was able to go back and get it the next day. The rooms very cleaned and views are great! The food from restaurant down stairs is great quality and at a reasonable price! Its my 2nd stay at NYLO and I have been pleased! I look forward to another stay!

Great location, with a friendly staff, and a comfortable room. We were upgraded upon arrival and room was ready for an early check-in. Serafina, at the hotel, was a good place for lunch especially since it was raining.

We had an overall good experience with the NYLO hotel. However on the first night we were given a very small room, it is only after complaining that we got a nice one. Since we were staying 9 nights, it would have been nice to have a good room to start with. One day the towels were not renewed, and in the bathroom the sealings are completely broken and in some place there is mold. For a 3 stars i would have say ok, not for a claimed 4 stars. Also the breakfast at Serafina ist not good. Hard floors are a big advantage. Situation is really good, in a lovely area next to Central Park and easy subway access.

it is a nice boutique hotel in the Upper West Side of NYC. Place to be, to enjoy and to experience a quite feeling of the vibrant city. Only the fact the room is without a refrigerator was negative, as well that the floor hadn't any light.

As a frequent visitor to NY, I'm always looking for a reasonably great deal on a clean, comfortable and convenient hotel. Having tried some different options, NYLO still wins. The rooms are NY compact but very pleasant,well-kept and welcoming. Eloy, Jessie and the staff are always extremely helpful. And the location is convenient to great restaurants, museums and business, without the maddening bustle of neighborhoods further downtown.

Piano bar, community rooms with cozy furniture and lighting wifi. Studious, quietly creative vibe. Of course the rooms are tiny unless you splurge for a suite. Great view of broadway from a balcony. Very grown up. Love.

I always stay at this hotel. Reason I love this part of NYC. Great neighborhood feel. Lots of small restaurants and shops. Just blocks from the Natural History Museum, and Central Park. If you want the hustle of Times Square go elsewhere.

Enjoyed the location and the vibe at NYLO....disappointed with air and water temperatures.Overall -- average! Sleeping and showering is a key factor when staying at hotels for business purposes. Will try a stay one more time.
user_name:
lindacD3534YZ
New York City, New York

review_body: I strongly recommend this hotel for everyone, it has comfortable beds, but pretty high, nice decoration, kind employees. It is far from very crowded Times Square, but close to subway stations. Who wants to wake up late I would recommend to stay at high floor because of building under construction at 77th street.

While traveling to New York after a near fatal car accident 17 months ago, this trip was the dream of a lifetime. The Hotel Is beyond Wonderful. From The Front Desk staff to meeting all of our needs and answering all of our questions. The Roof-top Terrace was wonderful and we were lucky to have seen fireworks that night. Our outside terrace over looking the city was Beyond Beautiful. We WILL be returning and this is the only Hotel we will stay at. Rooms Clean & Comfortable

The staff are really friendly.Room was small as expected in New York.Never got our room upgrade for linking them to LinkedIn,will never fall for that kind of scam again,also disappointed we didn't know there was roof top seating.I found the beds really uncomfortable, too soft and too high.Location is good close to Central Park.The bathroom could use a towel rack and hooks,just to help keep a small space organize.

We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and had a great stay. The hotel was comfortable and good value. The staff were accommodating and friendly. Special mention to Bryan at reception who was very helpful. The hotel is located on the Upper West Side and not far from 79th Street subway station so convenient for travel. I recommend this hotel highly.

Good customer service- great maid serviceClean and comfortable - bed was very comfortable. Excellent bell hop service- always ready to help- one ran down the street to get me a cab. Room could be noisy at times

Don't stay here. This was the worst hotel I've ever visited (and I travel a lot)! Rooms extremely small, with small bugs (gnats or fleas - not sure which). Tried, unsuccessfully to find a new hotel. Had to buy a new airline ticket ($900) to leave one day early to avoid another night there.

A great hotel on all fronts! From the location, cleanliness, staff and quiet room, this hotel is always my top choice when staying in the city. It is always a consistently great experience. Customer service is too notch and the rooms are terrific.

I've stayed at the NYLO NYC several times in the past two years. It's a terrific small hotel, centrally located on the Upper West Side. Not fancy but clean and reasonably-priced. For us, it's a find. Staff very friendly, especially Jessie at the front desk.

Trip was good, staff was great. Would have like to have full bar in order to keep people there and happy. Beer and wine served in rooftop would have been nice, and fridge in the rooms would be great after a long day to have kept my fruit and water cold

Hotel was reasonably priced for Manhattan. The lobby was relaxing, with several seating areas and dog friendly. The rooms were small and minimal, but modern with very comfortable beds. The staff was helpful and friendly.

Ask for the Broadway side, inside/non street side rooms are dark. The location is fantastic, great staff. The rooms could use some soft surfaces, at least fabric chair. Bathroom had no towel racks so towels had to be left on floor after use yet they say they have a green policy? Great access to restaurants, and again, great staff.

Great place to stay, very clean rooms and bathrooms. The staff was great, very helpfull in every way. We meet friends in the lounge twice and had a great. This is a very safe hotel. Thanks for a great trip.Can't wait to come back.

We had a larger room (suite) with 2 queen beds, and a sitting area. It's not easy to find reasonable rates for a room large enough for 3 people in NYC. The entire staff was helpful, and we enjoyed our stay. I'd certainly return.

Perfect for our couples trip :) Our rooms were ready several hours before check-in time, which was wonderful so we didn't have to check our luggage at the desk while we started our sightseeing day. Great hotel for the price!

I stayed at NYLO for two nights in room 1024 with my wife and 5 yr old son. We stayed 2 nights and were very impressed. The hotel was extremely clean, the beds were comfortable and the drinks downstairs at the bar were delicious! The hotel was very modern and updated, not like other rundown hotels. All of the staff at the hotel were great. Orlando the doorman was especially welcoming and helpful. He explained the amenities the hotel had to offer as well as helped us find restaurants nearby. I will definitely be staying here in the near future and will recommend this hotel to my family and friends!

Visited the NYLO last weekend and I must say I was very impressed the doorman Orlando was the nicest and helpful person I've ever met in any hotel I've ever stayed in I would definitely come back please send him a message for me Thank you again very nice meeting you keep up the good work

Clean, elegant, friendly and efficient staff. This was second time staying there (first for nye 2017), and it was just as nice as the first time. Great lobby with lively bar. Patio on roof was perfect. Highly recommend.

Rooms are funky and fun, but small which is to be expected for nyc. The adjoining room door was not well sealed though and I could see light and hear people in the other room very clearly even though they were speaking at a normal volume. I would suggest sealing adjoining room doors better.

Our home away from home! You might want to stay somewhere else if you don't care for clean, comfortable and classy accommodations ;-) Our room on the sixth floor had the most luxurious bed we could have hoped for, and a great view of the city!

I had zero issues. I requested a refrigerator (they're not standard in rooms) and it was in my room upon check in. As others have noted, the Air Conditioning (AC) is on the noisy side, but on the super hot days I was there, I was grateful it worked so well, noisy or not!

NYLO is located in the UWS. Close to subways and buses. Easy access to all parts of NYC. Low key, restaurant and bar attached. Cute roof deck for 10 people on 16th floor. lobby area has computer, tv, games.
user_name:
Peggy C
New York City, New York

review_body: Disappointed with this hotel. Service was subpar. Was not given instructions for Valet and had to wait 45 minutes to get car and was given attitude by staff. Room and bathroom dirty. Room extremely loud - noise from hallway and toilet running water all night.

The Nylo hotel was quite ok. Room decor was quite impressive; nice paintings, with a generally simple yet classy ambiance.The deal breakers for me; unavailability of Refrigerators in the rooms, and no microwave too!

Location can't be beat and it still was surprisingly quiet and peaceful. It is located two blocks away from a subway station and the area is full of restaurants, bakeries, supermarkets and shops. I have stayed at other hotels in the area but this was my favorite so far
user_name:
Cristina D
Weston, Florida, United States

review_body: This hotel was suggested by my nephew who was getting married in NY. We had a great experience. Parking valet was definitely a must. The location of the hotel was ideal. The front desk and other staff were very pleasant and helpful.

Stayed 5 nights in king bed room. Price-wise, this is about as reasonable as you are going to get in the Upper West Side of Manhattan. Rooms are decorated ala Ikea. Halls are grey and dark. One day, morning room service resulted in no towels at all. Had to call that night to get towels. Concierge did not answer the phone and the voicemail was full. Called front desk at 10 PM for the towels; towels finally came at 11:00 PM. Hotel is generally clean, but dirty socks from a previous guest were left in our room closet. No refrigerator in room. Very loud air conditioner; it will wake you up every time it comes on. Room doors stick so you hear everyone going in and out of their rooms with a slam.

We always stay at NYLO whenever we are in NY and that's multiple times per year. Staff is exceptional and suite rooms are spacious and comfortable when bringing the kids. If there is ever an issue the staff handle things really well and work hard to resolve it. We will continue staying here!

NYLO was great hotel in a wonderful neighborhood! All staff was friendly and helpful. The Queen suite was spacious enough for a family of 4. The lobby area was comfortable and had great live music. Didn't get a chance to enjoy the neighboring restaurants but all had great reviews.

We enjoyed a 5-night stay at NYLO in May. We requested a quiet room, which, unfortunately, resulted in a room with all windows facing the alley. The front desk staff was amazing. Despite limited availability, they changed the accommodations to a larger and much brighter room~no charge. On Mother's Day, we walked into the restaurant for our included breakfast 5 minutes after 11 am, and the restaurant manager refused to accept our vouchers because, unbeknownst to us, after 11 it is brunch~not breakfast. The front desk again handled the situation beautifully and took care of the situation. The accommodations are clean and comfortable. Housekeeping staff is gracious. Bar has lovely special events. We will be back!

Wonderful hotel - among my top favorites now after a recent business trip. Classy industrial hotel. Great staff. Spacious rooms and service. And love the neighborhood. Ramona George at the front desk took care of all my needs from recommendations to places to eat, etc. I usually stay at the Refinery hotel in NYC but now this is on my list.

Great location, reasonably priced and well maintained rooms, everything is within walking distance frm the NYLO, definitely my choice fr next stay in the city. I wish they had an earlier bkfst too. Great location, reasonably priced and well maintained rooms, everything is within walking distance frm the NYLO, definitely my choice fr next stay in the city. I wish they had an earlier bkfst too.

For a quick weekend of music and fun in New York, NYLO is a great place to stay. The rooms are clean and well maintained, and the hotel is close to Central Park, music venues The Beacon Theatre and Lincoln Center, museums, and restaurants.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Jennifer L
New York, New York, United States

review_body: The NYLO is a great hotel on the UWS with a boutique ambience. Centrally located on the UWS close to all of the museums and great UWS restaurants. Cozy and quaint bar with prewar feel with modern guest rooms. Excellent staff

Spent a week at The NYLO for our honeymoon. They graciously upgraded us from a standard room to a Junior Suite. Huge balcony added a nice touch to this suite with character. Staff was always accommodating, and the maid service very prompt. The only downside was a dark lobby and bar area, and the quirky oddity in the room of having nowhere at the sink to hang your towel. The Upper West Side location is amazing, right at Broadway, steps from Amsterdam, and less than a 10 minute walk from the beauty and serenity of Central Park.

We loved NYLO and would highly recommend it to anyone!!! It was our first trip to NYC and we were extremely happy with the location and the accommodations at NYLO! We were within walking distance to Central Park and various restaurants. We loved the bar area and the beautiful flower market that was set up over the weekend! We would definitely go back! Huge thanks to the staff at NYLO for all their help navigating the city and getting to our scheduled events!!!

It's si nice and comfortable during stay. Thank you so much! Staffs are perfect and room amenities are clean. During stay, I could sleep very well!This hotel is very near the 72nd and 79th station so that it's useful.

Our room was small, but well appointed. The bar and library were quite nice, especially when the bar walls/windows were open to the sidewalk. Complimentary cocktails were a nice touch! It would have been nice to know about the rooftop lounge earlier, but we found it. The location was perfect for sightseeing. We shall return!

Spacious! Wow, we got a JR Suite for 2 couples. Plenty of room to sit, sleep, get ready etc. Not on top of each other at all. Super easy location. Everything you need is within 2 blocks. Hit all the major spots and a Yankee game. Would definitely stay again.

Great staff, cool design, great location. We fell in love with the place through the photos online and weren't disappointed once we arrived. Rooms are small and don't afford much wiggle room, but we were very comfortable. AC was a little suspect the first couple of days, but cooled down after that and was very comfortable. We will likely make this our NY hotel for future visits.

The location is excellent, the upper west side has numerous restaurants. Feel good experience at the hotel, feels like home, very nice lobby & bar. The bed was excellent.A small complaint was handled efficiently en well.

I was there over a busy holiday weekend, and the customer service reflected as much. Arrival experience was average for what you'd expect of this level of hotel. I had to remind the staff of my breakfast/welcome drink tickets which were included in my booking. I also had a complimentary upgrade that was not honored (of course, that's not guaranteed and I knew that beforehand, but the staff member who checked me in didn't mention that until I spent a good 5 minutes searching for the pass and proving I had one). In the end, she did manage to upgrade the bed size in our room, so that was something. But the overall customer service experience was lacking. The room was a nice size with above average space for NYC and modern décor. I can take there being no bathtubs (I knew that going in as I called beforehand), but I do wish they had - and expected - a hot shower with good water pressure. I wanted more than a room to place my bags in for this trip, and spent the extra money to get it. Unfortunately, that wasn't the case here. I will say the hotel itself has a really nice atmosphere and you can't beat the location!

Small hotel, bathroom small but clean and efficient. Beds are great! Great Lobby for meeting people. I would stay there again without hesitation. I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a place to stay on the Upper West side. Great Value for the cost of the room.

NYLO works hard to maintain friendliness and service in a great real Manhattan neighborhood. The lobby smell is a little sweet but the overall experience is terrific. Avoid midtown at this Upper Wrst side gem -- take the subway downtown for touristy things.

I stayed at the hotel for 5 nights with my wife, for touristing and an event we had in NY. Very pleasant stay. Rooms are clean and bed very comfortable. Rooms are not as big as is shown in the pics, but that is predictable. Would like to highlight that one of the front desk associates was very helpful and nice, she moved us to a better room as the one they gave us when I arrived had no view and that wasn't what I have booked.

NYLO at 77th and Broadway is an excellent location and the hotel is very clean, well serviced and very friendly. We love that section of town and find the NYLO to be the most accommodating in that area.

Loved the location of the NYLO. Lots of great restaurants within walking distance. Easy to get around The staff was very friendly and the room was great except for no counter space within the bathrooms. I did not like the limited WiFi service that was provided. We stayed for two nights and WiFi was only available for one day. Live music in the lobby on the weekend was a nice treat.

We experienced a terrible (Saturday) night at NYLO NYC as the room next to ours was in party mode - the occupants noisy and inconsiderate throughout the night. And when we complained (after midnight) the hotel staff were entirely unhelpful - security came three times and just shared a laugh with the occupants of the room about the people (us) who had complained. After all, it was Saturday night, what did we expect? The front desk even lied to us, saying a manager was a) on the premises [not true] and b) was dealing with the matter [also not true]. The NYLO staff seemed to think it was okay to have a party because the occupants had paid for their room. In the end, we had to insist on being moved to another room (by now it was 3am) so we could get at least a partial night's sleep. We felt abused, mistreated and unsafe. I would warn against having a room with a balcony, as we did, as the party was both in and outside the room on the adjoining balcony. In all my years of travelling and staying in hotels I've never been treated as badly as I did at NYLO NYC. Avoid.

Two comments; one, construction has been ongoing for several years and they start at 7am(?). Two, the hotel has a non-optional extra fee for internet, bottled water etc. The lobby is informal with a bar that opens onto the street and two nicely decorated separate spaces.

Our king deluxe room on the 9th floor was perfect. Totally clean, wonderfully comfortable mattress, room for all of our stuff. The complimentary drinks and continental breakfast vouchers were a very nice touch. We have stayed in the NYLO for many years and will be back.

Great on site bar with fun live music. Beautiful hotel. Fantastic staff - from waitstaff who gave us great bar tips, to the front desk who gave us free drink tickets after a long travel day, to the guy who walked a block to bring us back a cab, they were all just super.

Stayed for a short break, staff were friendly and the hotel is located in what we thought was a great area. However the hotel rooms were a bit tatty and the cleaning left a lot to be desired.We were given a complimentary breakfast which was okay but had I paid $16 dollars for it I would have been very disappointed. There are lots of cafes etc close by to chose from.

The hotel is interesting and lively. The location is very good. The room was relatively small with a very small window! However, all staff were very friendly and the lobby was always lively.I think the only negative point for me was the room had a very small window that is fixed, and no fridge was available. Relatively speaking the size of the room was small compared to the luggage we had.

- Needs better cleaning- Internet more difficult to connect than necessary. - Its been 2 days since I have returned and I still have not received my receipt (email) - First time visitors (sister in law) should be treated special.

I recently stayed at NYLO NYC for a quick visit. The staff is kind and friendly. The location is fantastic - great restaurants within walking distance, easy to get to nearby neighborhoods and attractions. I felt safe being a woman on my own day or night in the neighborhood and the hotel. Like NYC hotels, the rooms aren't big but I was on my own and really only there to sleep and shower so it wasn't an issue. Overall great place to stay and great value for NYC.

The rooms were clean and updated, and the location ideal, with plenty of entertainment, food, and drinks within walking distance. It's also a very short walk to the subway too. However, the best part of staying at the NYLO was the outstanding customer service. The staff is AMAZING!! Highly recommended. For future visits to NYC, this hotel will be my first choice.

I booked a "panoramic" room for our stay - an upgrade from the standard. I was hoping for something a little better than basic, and was disappointed when we arrived. The room did have a balcony with a view, which was great, but it was small and no frills, with blackened grout in the shower and a single robe hanging in the closet, when the booking was clearly for two people. But I figured, oh well, we're here to see the city, not the room, and didn't say anything. However, early in the morning after our first night, we were awakened by a very loud noise that sounded like there was a helicopter landing nearby. The walls were shaking and the windows were rattling - there was definitely no more sleeping. I called down to the front desk, and they said they would send someone up. No one came. So we got dressed and headed downstairs to find some breakfast. On our way out, we asked again. They said they would send someone up, so we went out to get something to eat. When we came back, that's when things got a whole lot better. Turns out it was a broken fan, and not only did they switch us to a new room, they upgraded us pretty significantly - to a suite! It was huge, with a sitting area, balcony, and windows on three sides. And no broken fan noise or mold in the shower. We were so pleased! So the rest of our stay was amazing. Thank you so much for making it a great experience! Other things we loved: The location - we like staying in real neighbourhoods (hate anything near Times Square), and this definitely fit the bill. Absolutely loved the Upper West Side. RedFarm - awesome food, right in the same building. We had lunch there twice. Zabars just up the street. Three blocks from the park. Insanely comfortable bed, with bedding that was the perfect weight and texture. Great pillows, too (I'm picky). We received two complimentary sparkling wines, which we enjoyed in their beautiful lobby bar. Close to two subways stops, so getting around was easy. Warm, responsive service - everyone was friendly and nice.

Always enjoy going back to NYLO NYC! Got off to a bit of a rocky start (not happy with the noise in the first room 1507 - which despite the skepticism by staff needs to be sorted out) but once we were moved we had no complaints.Since our last visit the lifts have been sorted out and the wifi greatly improved. The hotel has a certain charm about it and the bar area downstairs and the lobby have a great feel. Great neighborhood and would highly recommend the hotel.

We really enjoyed our recent stay at the NYLO. The Upper West Side location is great with very convenient access to the subway at 72nd or 79th streets. The hotel is very clean and modern. Our queen-queen suite was very large with a great view of Broadway. Beds are comfortable, too. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We asked about a refrigerator for our room, and the bellman had one sent up for no extra charge. My only complaints: the bathroom was tiny, and they had no bar soap the first day of our stay. Otherwise, our stay was excellent. The bar downstairs is quite good, and we enjoyed the two restaurants that share the building.Tip: The valet package is a good deal. Parking in Manhattan can be quite expensive.

I stayed here for an anniversary evening with my husband. We had a comfortable stay, and a great night's sleep -- so great that we slept through the continental breakfast! I would definitely come back.
user_name:
Inspire620391
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location for reunion on upper west side. Accessible to all locations without the tourist overload. Would have loved access to better coffee at the hotel and cleaner floor in room, but the bed was very comfortable, drinks were good and staff friendly. I requested early check in and late check out and both were accommodated. Had a minor issue with the keys (all 3 at different points stopped working), but overall, a pleasant experience.

A lively bar and quiet rooms near the subway and not far from Central Park add up to an excellent hotel choice for a Manhattan stay. Lincoln Center is in walking distance. The full breakfast that comes with the package of extras is worth every penny.
user_name:
Diana R
Santa Cruz, CA, USA

review_body: The front desk team is excellent. Carlos helped via email even on his day off. Ramona and Tasha greet you every morning with warm smiles and great suggestions. I'm very impressed by the room size, decor, and professionalism of staff.
user_name:
clayton c
New York City, New York

review_body: We recommend this hotel to all of you, it is a wonderful nice and clean hotel and the service is super! The bed was awsome! The metro was just 2 blocks further. Just a walking distance to Central Park.

NYLO was an excellent choice for our stay in NYC. The location was great and close to a major subway station that connected us to the rest of the city quickly. Great restaurants nearby including Levain bakery, Alice's Tea Cup, and the hotel's restaurant and bar were also fantastic. The hotel's lounge, business, and bar spaces were always in use and made the atmosphere very lively. Our room was spacious and a good size for four people. The beds were incredible, especially for my mom and grampa who I was travelling with. Overall, very convenient, clean, and comfortable. Will definitely recommend and would love to stay again on my next trip to the city!

Overall, good deal for the price. Lovely location. Helpful front desk. I don't recommend including the Serafina breakfast with your stay. You are very limited in your options, and they include an odd breakfast green salad.
user_name:
Melanie B
Silver Spring, United States

review_body: I have stayed here more than once and it is a terrific location with a market across the street, CVS and close to subway. When you get a room with no view it can feel claustrophobic not being able to see the sky out the window. It seems clean and functional and the bed was very comfortable. I also like the wood floors. When I tried to clean the TV remote (which I always do because it doesn't usually get cleaned) the wipe turned black... it could be just that one remote. I had a TV not plugged in apparently but they took care of it right away. Service was great - lobby always bustling at happy hour. The room is very small but functional for one person. Bathroom likewise - ok for one person for one night. It's true it's challenging to hang towels in there. I'm trying another hotel in the neighborhood a few weeks from now and I'll see how it compares.

Christine, the conceirge was just so nice and lovely! You know how sometimes it feels like people are nice to you because they have to? Not Christine! Super helpful with any question you throw her way! Thank you =]The location of the hotel made sight seeing petty convenient. The American Museum of Natural History and Central Park is a short 2-3 block from the hotel (as is Shake Shack). We were there on a Sunday so part of Broadway was closed off for famer's market!And for any art/design lovers. One of the pieces that Banksy created during his trip to New York is a 3 min walk from the hotel, on 79th and Broadway. Be sure to check it out!

The location is really good. The room was simple but clean, no frills. The rooms were a good size for NY. Close to a subway station and many restaurantsLoved the lobby. I would definitely stay there again

We have been there every year for few years. Every time for more than a week.Great hotel, great location. A little expensive but at least we know what we get.Rooms are nice. Bathroom a little small but bed so comfortable that you do not care.Go eat breakfast at cafe 82.Do not eat at the restaurant below...

This was my second time here. First time was great but this time our neighbors sounded like they were in our room. I think the rooms were actually a suite. I didn't sleep while I was there. I did not have time during the day to switch rooms but this room isn't acceptable for anyone

I rarely give such shoutouts, but Ramona was super helpful! I was not happy with the first room I was offered (too noisy), and Ramona cheerfully worked to find me an alternative, despite the fact that the hotel was very full. She also helped switch our package to include valet parking. All this with great cheer and efficiency (and she didn't even know it was my birthday!). Thank you, Ramona! A great stay.

Really, really comfortable bed. Nicely decorated with a great lobby bar. Perfect location for visiting the city. Lots of great restaurants and bars nearby. Walkable to Times Square and Central Park. We never stay anywhere else in the city. Great value, great property.

I appreciate the lobby bar, game room, friendliness and location but ask for a hotel to do better at the basics than the NYLO does. I am in a superior king that looks out on the inner walls of the building, with clattering A/C, a weak shower that's very hard to set on a stable temperature, and spartan furnishing. In addition to the bed, for example, there is a desk chair, a table (=desk) and some lockers arranged to look like a dresser. Maybe that's all hip, but as a hotel room it just doesn't work very well. For the money the A/C should not interfere with sleep, there should be a place to sit that is comfortable (and not the bed), and it should be possible to shower comfortably. Oh, and the plastic cups are tacky, the Keurig an environmentally unsustainable way to make pricy and poor coffee. The staff is very friendly and location is great...but there are other, better choices for the money in this part of NYC. Internet is not free because they charge a daily amenities fee....

I highly recommend this hotel. It has a very friendly staff which makes you feel at home. I love the location and having a CVS across the street really helped. It is close to the subway and close to many great restaurants. I definitely will stay here again.

The hotel room was clean with nice bed and good amenities and bigger than many other NYC rooms these days. I loved the bar and the overall vibe of the place. But I dinged it a star for two reasons: 1) valet parking took way more than an hour, when they asked for 45 minutes; 2) I was e-mailed a coupon to upgrade my room and then they acted like I was nuts when I checked in, saying nothing was available. Either grant the upgrade immediately in the reservation (rather than give a coupon), or stop making false offers. Neither of those things would deter me from recommending so long as you don't have a car. And don't take the bait to promote them on social media for a false promise of room upgrade.
user_name:
smmphd
New York City, New York

review_body: I frequently stay at the NY NYLO; it is a good value for a NYC stay. Used a 14th floor suite this time, and the room had views in both East and West directions. Spacious; well-maintained, water in room, updated bathroom with broken shower hose, but usable. Furniture is out of date but definitely serviceable. Staff friendly and helpful.Small bar in lobby, and a Serafina (mediocre) restaurant attached to lobby.Try Red Farm around the corner on Broadway.

Room was clean, staff courteous and helpful. Bell service was helpful. Concierge was pleasant and helpful. Free cocktail was a nice gesture (Sangrai or Champagne) I preferred a free mixed drink rather than Sangria..

A good hotel with excellent staff who responded well to requests for help and advice. Comfortable room. Tea/coffee provision seemed rather mean with just one choice of tea, coffee and de-caf for 2 people. Bathroom had nowhere to hang wet towels.

Just OK. First visit was excellent. This is our second visit and experienced different issues each day from non working amenities, no hot water and non so clean lobby. We considering not returning and explore other properties next time.

Were upgraded from a tiny room to a gorgeous King Deluxe room full of natural light overlooking Broadway, and spacious. A pleasure to come back to after a day's sightseeing. Great neighbourhood, close to 79th St subway. Bed was very comfy. We'll be back.

The room was small with a queen bed but decent. The bathroom was a good size. The sheets were really nice and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel restaurant, Serafina, served really good Italian food. The hotel is about 3 blocks from Central Park and the Museum of Natural History. There's a decent bar that serves food or you can order take-out from Serafina's and eat in the bar area. It's a pet friendly hotel which was important for us. Dogs are allowed in the bar and outside dining area but not the restaurant. Everyone from the bellman to the front desk receptionists were very helpful. I would definitely go back to the NYLO.

I have stayed at NYLO multiple times and have always found the staff to be courteous and attentive to needs. On my last trip there was a bit of a bump in the road but I decided to give it one more shot -- everyone has an off day. On this trip the staff went out of their way to make up for last time with a nicer room, late checkout. I had never been in one of their Jr. Suites and, although it was an internal room (421) it was really large and comfortable- 2 beds, a large bathroom and a comfortable sitting area with sofa and chairs as well as a desk. I guess the other plus is that there are no noises from the street. Kudo to Maria and Bryan, two of the managers, who made sure we will come back again.

Location, coolness and freshness count for a lot, but I got the feeling that there is no one in charge of quality control at NYLO, except after the fact. I was checked into a cute little room with one window whose blackout shade was obviously broken. Engineer when called came quickly and broke it some more, giving me a fix. OK, the price was right, but I still felt abused. The next day I was upgraded into a fairly palatial room without toiletries or bathrobe and slippers from the defective room. When I checked out I complained and got a $27 refund of the city fee that really should be part of the room rate.

Staff were very prompt, helpful and courteous. Room was not as clean as usual. No soap in Bathroom for two days. We had to go to front desk to get some for our room. front desk staff were great, bar staff were great also. Definitely more positives than negatives.We will go and stay there again, though and overall highly recommend the NYLO.

The NYLO staff was courteous and very helpful. One of the staff members at the reception desk spend time explaining to me the way I had to take the subway to arrive midtown for a reception dinner.
