He even draw a map that was perfect! I did not get lost. Great directions! I enjoyed my stay at the hotel very much. The location is excellent.
user_name:
Martha-Lucia S
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This hotel is ok. Very expensive for what you get. Hotel staff not friendly. Rooms ok. Don't expect anything big here just an uncomfortable bed.The ONLY good thing about this hotel is location location location If that is all that you care about, then go for it and accept the rude staff and uncomfortable rooms. Better than sleeping on the street.

My TV never worked. Even after I reported it to the front desk multiple times. But overall it was a pleasant trip. The air conditioning went out at one point but was quickly fixed. There was an issue with a valve .

We stayed over Memorial Day weekend and had a clean and comfortable room and bed. The front desk and housekeeping staff were all professional and friendly. Jessie at the front desk showed wonderful grace under pressure! As we were checking in a very irate, short man who identified himself as Dr. so and so, stormed in front of us, and demanded that Jessie call Christine (manager) immediately. She said one moment, sir, I am serving these people now. He kept ranting and repeating himself. What a jerk! Jessie maintained her composure, finished checking us in, and then turned to Dr. Jerk. We love the NYLO, which is close to our daughter's apartment and close to great restaurants, bars, delis, shopping, museums, Central Park, the subway, etc. One caution, avoid Serafina, the restaurant that is attached to the NYLO. The hostess was a sourpuss who seated us at a dirty table between two tables that had not been cleared, so we left, of course!

Stayed here for 3 nights. The rooms are clean and the location is in a nice and (to be New York) quiet neighbourhood. If you're planning a trip you should be aware of the $27/night urban fee that will apply. What really annoyed me was that when we checked out my card was charged with the fee without the staff telling me and without getting a receipt for it. Unacceptable.

Worthy of every penny spent . Remember to add valet parking in your booking. Savings will be great. Very clean and smoke free rooms. A great bar and diner. Will be spending time there again on July 4 weekend.

Standard room is small, but typical for NYC room size; bathroom is tiny, but the shower is a decent size, however, the shower leaked extensively from the bottom of the door (which is obviously an ongoing problem judging by the state of the bottom of the bathroom door); temperature controls were odd: room was 81F when we arrived and the only way we could cool the room down was to crack a window open and let some of the 38F outside air cool down the room temp. Room decor has an industrial vibe, but looks a little slapdash here and there with lack of attention to detail in trim of paint jobs, etc. Lighting is "moody" and both bedside reading lamps did not work. We had a coupon for a free champagne or "signature drink" from the bar, but they had no champagne. Probably would not return.

Great location and a very clean and comfortable room. I was there on a business trip but would definately return for pleasure. The area is not full of tourists but close enough to attractions and business districts. There are also plenty of good quality restaurants in the immediate area. Staff were also very friendly and efficient. Will stay at the NYLO again when returning to NYC.

This beautifully located hotel has character and imaginative decor. The staff could not be more helpful and cooperative. The rooms are a touch small but not an issue. They are clean and well-appointed. The neighborhood is great.

Stayed Friday and Saturday nights of Memorial Day weekend in 15th floor room with balcony. Saw a lady drop her towel in the building across Broadway, so plus for bonus nudity. Staff were excellent. Room was very clean. Bed was super comfortable. Awesome location close to Central Park, museums and transit.

I am giving one star to this hotel because of the way the handle breakfast topic, which can be - especially in the expensive nyc - something pushing you toward an hotel or another one when breakfast is included.At NYLO breakfast included means 1 choice ot of two inside just one of the menu options. The outcome is a depressive poor breakfast, served by people which evidently are paid by tipping and when you have breakfast included tou don't have a check so you don't tip so you are a second class customer.In a few word NYLO breakfast is well below what you can expect in any average american dinner not in a nyc hotel!That said, the hotel is clean, well organized and run, room are spacious and location great...so I am even more disappointed! Why offering such a poor breakfast? Just to attract other customers? I don't know!

This is the second time we've stayed at NYLO New York and love the hotel and location. Just 2 blocks to subway and Central Park. The staff is professional and friendly. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Will definitely stay again the next time we're in New York.

Twice on Saturday security / cops ( I heard a radio ) knocked on nearby room. Informed front desk. They denied it despite me hearing "miss, miss, are you okay " loudly in corridorI know this is tracked but please tell us all is okayRoom 1002, adjacent rooms are ignored if u complain

Reasonably priced option with a great location. Located about 2 blocks from the 79th street station (Subway 1 line) you can get to pretty much anywhere in the city from here. Central Park is also walking distance and there are plenty of high quality bars and restaurants nearby. The lobby also has live music and drink specials on the weekend. The downstairs restaurant breakfasts are little pricey, but the food is good. Rooms are very comfortable but no frills. Would highly recommend for a stay in Manhattan

This is the third time I've stayed at NYLO. The staff are all very friendly, rooms not posh, but the bed offers a very good sleep. The hotel is connected to a good Italian Restaurant, Serafina, with a nice menu.

We stayed at NYLO for 2 nights while visiting NY last week. Overall, it was a good stay - the location is great - subway is not too far and super close to Central Park. Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. Lobby/bar area was very nice. I think there was a live band one night? We were just heading out for dinner when they were setting up. The room itself was tiny but it didn't bother us too much. Bathroom was small as well - stand shower only. The water pressure was a bit weak (we were on the 8th floor). Amenities basic - no slippers/bathrobes or mini fridge. They tried charging us the Urban fee - explanation given was lame - for welcome drinks (which was suppose to be complimentary), water (which we only got 2 bottles on day 1) and wifi. In the end, they waived it for us - not really sure why though. Overall, great location in Upper West side with nice vibe but rooms on the smaller side. Oh also, the doors slam super loud if you just let go of it. Didn't really like that while trying to fall asleep.

Really enjoyed staying at The NYLO for my daughter's graduation. Large rooms that were clean and comfortable. Danny was terrific at customer service. Also in a great location with many great eateries close by and close to number 1 subway. Loved that there were no carpets in the room - made the room feel really clean.

Before hearing about the Nylo, there was no way we would have stayed on the Upper West Side. The Nylo offers Manhattan-worthy accommodations and service at a slightly lower price. The hotel is well-maintained and professionally staffed. The rooms are bright, well appointed, comfortable and kept clean. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom left nothing to be desired, except for the usual low water pressure, common in most hotels. Fast and free Wi-Fi and a great TV added to our enjoyment. My only serious negative would be no room service, and the hotel's restaurant really isn't the hotel's restaurant, it's a fairly expensive NYC upscale coffee shop. But the hotel bar is terrific. So, if you're doing business or visiting on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, do not hesitate to try The Nylo.

Have stayed here many times and it never disappoints. Good location and value for money. Higher quality than many other hotels in the area. Close to Columbia University and other places on this side of Manhattan.

Location was convenient and the hotel staff were pleasant. The room was tiny and the noise from the construction taking place outside made it difficult to sleep. Also, the housekeeping staff neglected to clean the room one day--super annoying.

The room wasn't ready, it was small, the bag was never delivered to the room...we had to go down and get it ourselves...very short staffed on a holiday weekend! The bed was uncomfortable...we did not stay!
user_name:
Cats813
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed there for 3 nights during our honeymoon trip. Great location in upper Manhattan, and it's easy walking to 5th Ave, Times Square and Central Park. Room is very tiny, found it difficult to moving around between two of us.

For this neighborhood in Manhattan, this is a nice hotel. However you have to be sure to ask for a large room. Some of the rooms are completely tiny.My rating for the for the hotel was a difficult decision. The hotel itself is nice, But the hotel has a resort fee of about $30 a night and it's just not worth it. It's supposed to cover use of the gym, Wifi, And a few other things. Since most hotels now have free Wi-Fi and I don't use the gym The extra $30 adds just too much to what is a an otherwise well priced hotel.

It was a good decision to stay at NYLO this week. With some local help we were able to get a spacious room that looked out onto 77th Street. The room was well appointed with a minimalist theme: locker doors instead of drawers and lots of stainless steel in the bathroom. Shower was spacious but only one hook on the back of the door to hang two thick towels and sides if the sink barely wide enough to balance grooming items. Located between two subway stops, on several bus lines, NYLO is not far from lots of NYC attractions and shopping. LOCL bar is located on the ground floor and lots of great eating is in easy walking distance. Great housekeeping and a rooftop patio. Comfy bed.

We were looking for a hotel on the upper west side where our daughter just moved. Nylo was recommended by friends and we spent 6 nights there . It was a very nice experience and i expect we will be back soon.

Beautiful urban atmosphere. Our room was spacious and easily accommodated all three of us. The lounge is intimate and welcoming. The doorman was courteous and helpful, even running down the block in the pouring rain to hail us a taxi!

We stayed on the 15th floor in room 1506, the room was amazing with an even better view. Our only complaints were the air conditioning was loud and there wasn't any meals included with the stay. Great stay!

The location is convenient without being in the busiest part of Manhattan. The neighborhood is informal. The hotel is reasonably priced and the staff is friendly. We did not eat a meal at the hotel. There are plenty of inexpensive and excellent alternatives nearby.

Nice hotel. Near subways & everything else. Rooms are small. Bathrooms are good & very clean. Bar is great. Staff is very helpful. Good advice from people who either know the answers or ask someone to get you what you need.

I love this hotel. It's exciting as soon as you walk in the lobby. The rooms, while small (but not by NYC standards!) are very nice. The service is exceptional and for my purposes the location can't be beat.

The hotel honored my request for a certain room number.. even though it took longer than expected for the room to be available the hotel offered vou to make up for the delay, which was greatly appreciated. I expect to return to the NYLO.

Hotel is in a great location on the corner of Broadway and 77th on the Upper West Side. We have stayed here multiple times and will continue to do so because of the location. However, the rooms are tiny and I find that it lacked in staff. Rarely was there someone at the door to help with luggage or calling a taxi. Prices can be good at times, just look for the bargains offered. Very modern rooms which, for me, translate to uncomfortable. Wish there was a chair in my room with a desk. Only place to sit is on the bed.

Basic customer service skills need improvement at front desk. Also, when communications are sent ahead of time, please read them! I don't believe anyone appreciates hearing, "there are no other options available" when a question is asked.

The best thing about this property is the location. If you want a room with sufficient light and windows do not pick a deluxe queen because those are in the back of the halls and they face a brick wall. Staff was courteous and rooms were clean.

We absolutely loved staying at NYLO. Perfect location, super comfy bed, quiet and chic room that was spacious for a NY hotel. Jennifer greeted us and was amazing. We love her! We were a bit disappointed by the service at Serafina, but for $5 total for breakfast, we couldn't complain.

There are not a lot of choices for nice hotels on the upper west side but this one at Broadway and 77th is a good one.Our room on the sixth floor was quiet and well appointed with a very comfortable king-size bed. There is a fairly lively bar/lounge seen in the evenings. The staff was friendly and accommodated us with a late checkout. They offered a car for our return trip to LaGuardia airport for $55 which would have been less than the Uber fare we paid.

We stayed at NYLO for a recent trip to NYC. It was our first time staying in this area and in this hotel. We were very pleased. The room was a nice size for a NY hotel meaning that was not large but big enough for two adults to be comfortable. The bed was extremely comfortable, the temp easily manipulated and a nice bathroom and amenities there. No fridge but there was a safe in the room. Maid service was particularly nice and accommodating. Great bar scene (although service was sometimes slow) and terrific night entertainment in the bar area on Thursday and Friday nights. This hotel hosts a flower market during the week and specialty drinks are concocted around flowers. We did not care too much for the drinks we had, but appreciated the effort as they were beautiful at least. Also received coupons for two complimentary spritzers or sparkling wine which was a nice touch. Great location for upper west side - easy to get to lots of good eateries and out of the fray of midtown.

Booked a king bed room @ NYLO from May 7 to May12th so we could photograph our engagement in Central Park, SOHO & Brooklyn. Could not have booked a better hotel if we tried. Literally one block from any cool restaurant, burger joint or breakfast/brunch place in the upper west side. Never visited the Upper west side before and I'm glad I did. Very cool vibe walking into the foyer. Bar area always had people around it and was definitely inviting. The doormen were Top notch! Never had to open the door coming or going. They even ran up a block to Amsterdam to grab a cab for my fiancé & I, when we left for the airport. It was a pleasure to tip them. Had 1 small hiccup with no hot water one morning. Talked to front desk and they had their engineer correct the boiler issue within the hour. I do suggest avoiding Serafina's restaurant. Take my word for it. Thankfully NYLO is not affiliated with Serafina's. Regretfully dined there. Rooms were cool and clean. Bathrooms were full tile. Loved that. Concierge was solid. They were 5 for 5 with recommendations for food and coffee. Very knowledgeable of the surrounding area. Trust them. Would definitely return to NYLO. You can tell the people that work there, care about the hotel. And I value that.

Great boutique style hotel with all the amenities. Location is awesome....away from Times Square, and located right adjacent to one of my faves, Serafina restaurant. Red Farm also right around the corner. Easy walk to Central Park. The complimentary beverage at check-in was a nice touch. Lobby and bar area is cozy...doors open to the outside, so you feel like you are on a patio. The 11th floor outdoor lounge area is awesome. We grabbed a glass of wine and headed up! The room (King) was nice and clean, but small, as with most NY Hotels. Awesome staff...friendly and accommodating. Watch out for extra fees...wasn't aware of the "Urban Fee" that added to the final bill.

I've been staying at the NYLO for several years and it's a wonderful upper west side hotel. Currently undergoing management change, hopefully the new management team will work out the kinks quickly. If there are any problems the most helpful person behind the desk is Jennifer!

The NYLO is nestled in a great neighborhood surrounded by good shopping and easy access to any necessities. The hotel is attached to two good restaurants that have convenient hours. Our room was rather large for the price and they had Friday night entertainment and a lively bar.

I've stayed at this hotel multiple times over the past few years. Nice rooms. Staff is great. Lobby is really nice. Highly recommended if you want a nice neighborhood feel. Much better than staying in Times Square!
user_name:
jberaha
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I have stayed at NYLO twice before and was happy with it. This last stay however was very disappointing. The deluxe double room was very small with a very small bathroom. There was no chair and no desk. The closet had very limited hanging space although there was ample shelving. I called the front desk and complained but I was told that's what the room looks like and no accommodation for my disappointment whatsoever. When I checked in I reminded the front desk clerk that I requested a small refrigerator for my room. I was assured that "oh yes, that's been taken care of. There was no refrigerator in the room although after I called down again one was sent up. I paid a flat rate through Expedia for my flight and the NYLO hotel. I thought it was a good deal but then I was charged an additional "urban fee" of $27 a night plus taxes. That turned into an additional $300 for a four night stay. What this urban fee was for I cannot say. I was given two coupons for 2 glasses of sparkling wine which I don't drink and so I couldn't use them. They didn't even give us a bottle of water in the room! I requested shower caps as there was none in the room. The maid said she would get it for me but never did. There is no night light in the bathroom and the clock in the bedroom is so bright that it lights up the whole room at night so I had to disconnect it. I paid more to stay at the NYLO this trip than I did the last two times and although I liked the king rooms I had in the past I thought this trip was a total rip off. It's a shame because it's a nice hotel otherwise. I love the lobby with the bar and music. They have a nice terrace on the 16th floor. The location is great. I come to NYC about six times a year and I will go back to staying at the Beacon, Milburn, or Lucerne before I will come back to NYLO. Too bad

Accommodations were fine. The staff was most courteous and helpful. Location was convenient, and the on site restaurant facilitated dining choices.The two complimentary beverages at the Flower Shop Bar were unexpected and appreciated. I look forward to returning!
user_name:
Carol Anne N
Assonet, MA, United States

review_body: The NYLO is a very nice, modern hotel. The lobby has plenty of space to hangout and they have a table that doubles as a chess board, which was a nice way to pass some time waiting for other members of our group. The bar area is also very cool with 2 different levels - the upper with lounge seating and the lower level with more typical bar seating. While we were there, they had evening events and special seasonal cocktails. The rooms are spacious for NYC and have a modern, industrial feel.

Excelent Room, Excellent Location, A very nice place to be at New York.I Discovery New York walking from this hotel and I enjoy all the facilities.The personal was kind and willing to help.I recommend Jessie

Our stay there exceeded our expectations. Great location, reasonable rates, amazing bar and a great service (especially thanks to George and Daniel the two doormen, and Chris the bartender).The subway is right next door, Central Park too, as well as one of the best bakeries in NYC (Maison Kayser) which is perfect for the breakfast.We stayed there with a group, and as we were booking it, Angie the manager took great care of us, even as the dates of everyone were changing. We'll definitely come back for romantic weekends as well as with friends!I wish more hotels were able to create such a connection with their guests.

We loved staying here. It was perfectly situated, the staff were very attentive and know the area. They were able to recommend places close by and give us advice on getting around town. We were lucky enough to be there for the opening of the flower mart.

Great location. Close to the subway, Central Park, great restaurants, great shopping. Comfortable room. Loved the mattress! Street side is kind of noisy but that's too be expected in the city. Will definitely stay here again.

We've stayed at this hotel for 3 times now, & it's always consistently great. It's so reasonable for NYC; it's clean, quiet, comfortable & again, relatively cheap, considering it's NYC. It's at 77th & Broadway, so it's very convenient for us, as our daughter lives in the vicinity. But, you can get anywhere easily from there, & it's so close to Zabar's! How can you lose? Our king room with AAA was $149, but, because of all the different taxes, it came to $200. The staff is so accommodating, & everyone seems happy to work there, making it a pleasure to deal with anyone.

Adequate hotel, small room.Bathroom very small and little room for toiletries to be put to use .Room was promptly made up each morning.Four stair entrance could be a problem for those handicapped although there generally was someone there to aid if needed.

Our room was more than pleasant, very quiet, with a small balcony that allowed fresh air and a 14th-floor view of buildings beyond. All staff members - from checkin (with Tasha) to bellhops (several different ones) - were friendly, courteous, and very helpful. It's a terrific location, many good restaurants nearby, a short walk to Central Park and the American Museum of Natural History. We had driven a rental car to the city and were able to return it just one block away. We were too early to check in at the hotel, but they locked away our luggage for us; ditto on our checkout, when we had several hours to kill before our airport shuttle pickup. We would be glad to stay there again.

Great setting and location, The atmosphere was great as was the service and staff. Awesome bar and restaurant . The view was spectacular and walking distance to the Beacon , We had a Great time at the show,Get ready NYLO We will be back , and Thanks again

My wife and I have stayed exclusively at the NYLO every time we've been to NY over the last 5 years. We love it's location, vibe, staff and our rooms have been great. Unfortunately not this last time. In fact, if it weren't for our previous experience at the NYLO and the assistance we received from Jessie at the Front Desk, this review would have a much lower rating. This time, my wife found an online deal for a room and after booking it, she called the hotel to confirm and decided to upgraded to a king bed on a higher floor for an extra $25 per night (this was a 5 night stay). When we arrived, the room we were given was on a lower floor and so small that we couldn't both walk around the bed at the same time. The first woman we spoke to at the front desk was short and not friendly at all. Later, I went down and found Jessie at the desk. She was great. She promised that she would move us to a larger room the next day... which she did but at an additional $50 PER NIGHT. We asked for one of our favorite corner rooms... which weren't available but were given us a large room on the 77th street side of the building. Jessie was wonderful and very understanding and I know she believed she was helping save our trip (which she did) but, the suite (1209) ended up being very strange. Unlike the rest of the hotel, this room seemed like an afterthought. The large bathroom was only half-lighted, the towel racks were on the other side of the room from the tub/shower, there was a lot of unused space that could have made it a really wonderful room but, it wasn't utilized, the sink was very small with a faucet that hit you in the head if you bent over. The layout of the suite was backwards as well. The bed should have been where the sofa and desk were. That way, a room divider would have allowed for a bedroom and bathroom separated from the living room/office.So... yes, we will go back to the NYLO but, only if we're assured at a minimum, the class of room we always had before this unexpected experience.

I made reservations online, got emailed a confirmation. An hour before check in I called and my reservations could not be found. I was not helped to find another room. I had no where to stay for the night

The hotel location on Broadway in midtown a couple of blocks from the 79th Street subway station was very convenient for us. The room was comfortable. Housekeeping could have been better organized and aware. When we arrived there was a single bath towel and no other towels at all for a double occupancy, and we had to call for additional towels. Strangely the situation repeated itself the next night: the additional towels were gone and a single bath towel left, requiring us to call for more towels. We also requested two regular coffee pods for the complimentary coffee pot, and got them one night, but not the next.

This is the third time we've stayed at the NYLO and each time we have found the staff to be extremely accommodating and the room and lobby to be comfortable and welcoming. It is an extremely convenient location. Close to Central Park, the Beacon theatre and a quick walk to Lincoln Center.

Excellent boutique hotel, nice ambiance, friendly staff. Good clean rooms.great view. Nice location, 5 min walk to central park,metrostation nearby.Good bar in the hotel. We could recommend this hotel!!

Very convenient location for overnight stays from southern Connecticut. Easy to get in and out of this location. The lobby associates are very friendly and helpful. Next door breakfast location was really good and also provided a timely in and out experience.

Good location for us. Short ride or 25 min walk to Times Square. Great staff and service. We asked for a quiet room away from street and it was perfect. Several good food places of all types nearby. Look forward to our return.

2nd time here. Love the hotel vibe and the rooms. Weirdly, no rack or hook to hang wet towels in bathroom- so we had to drape them all over our hotel room. Great lobby, with guests hanging about, a nice oasis from bustling Broadway. Would return

The NYLO is an excellent choice if you're looking for convenience in the heart of the city. Close to shopping, entertainment and restaurant this hotel offers it all just a few steps away from the front door. Not a lot of extras but the service is outstanding and what extras are needed when you are so close to everything else.

I loved this hotel. We were upgraded to a penthouse suite with lovely view of the Hudson and a big deck. Easy to walk orTake the subway or get a cab toGet around. Plenty of restaurants and stores nearby to get anything you couldPossibly want. Can walk to Lincoln center, Riverside Park and Central Park.

My daughter and I were in N.Y. for the 50th celebration of the Met at Lincoln Center. We wanted to be close to Central Park and the venues we would be visiting. The NYLO was a perfect fit. It is a beautiful hotel with marvelous accommodations. Ours was a Queen Suite with two very comfy beds, lots of space, a view and a huge bathroom. The employees were very kind, knowledgeable and upbeat. We would definitely stay again. Thank you.

Great great location - my parents stay when they visit. Lobby is chic. Rooms are small but nice. HOWEVER, they are pumping in a horrible synthetic perfume smell - think fake Chanel #5 - that is nauseating. The front desk says it's a vent from housekeeping they cannot control. It's a shame. Cannot bear to be in the lobby for even 5 minutes. They need to fix it or my parents will bail on staying there again.

I love NYLO NYC, it is my go to when doing business in NY and NJ. Easy to get to, convenient location shops, restaurants, entertainment are so close. The staff are always so friendly and accommodating. They have a great little bar onsite for some cocktails to unwind after a long day. Rooms are well appointed, clean and comfortable.

I stayed here one night while I was in the City for business. I would definitely come back. It was clean, in a great location, and I was in and out with ease.The surrounding neighborhood is charming and wonderful too (really close to great food and shopping)!Will be back again.

This was the fourth time I've stayed at the NYLO since 1915. The rooms are smallish but with a hip design vibe, and the common spaces are superb -- varied and vibrant -- wonderful for working or relaxing. When I was there a year ago I thought the management was slipping a little -- broken items in the rooms not addressed when reported, exercise equipment vandalized -- but all seems to have been righted at this point. And the location is superb -- you can get anywhere in Manhattan via the subway or the crosstown, both a two minute walk from the hotel.

We loved being on the upper west side and NYLO provided a wonderful, affordable place to call 'home base.' Walking distance to plenty of good restaurants and bars, Central Park and shopping. The atmosphere is hip and laid back -- just what we wanted.

Modern, eclectic, comfortable. Had one of the larger upper level rooms (floors 14 and above) with nice outdoor seating and great view of the Hudson. Staff is friendly and helpful. This is my second stay. Will return. It is showing a little wear around the edges, so perhaps a little refreshing is in order.

Stayed one night in town for daughter's graduation - great location, room was spacious (was a junior suite on 14th floor) particularly for New York. Check in staff friendly efficient and helpful. only minor quibble is that elevator wait was occasionally a little long

I've stayed at NYLO before and they've maintained their high standards of quality in giving their guests great value. Rooms are reasonably and pleasantly spacious, clean and comfortable and the staff couldn't be more helpful. I plan to stay there again on my next trip.

We stayed at NYLO for my niece's graduation from Columbia University. Excellent location and staff was superb. The hotel lobby has a great bar and beautiful decor. All this at a reasonable price. Highly recommend staying at NYLO.

Amazing hotel with good location, two blocks away from 79th subway station and near central park. Room was very quiet, comfortable and properly equipped. Hotel staff was very kind at all times. My suggestion would be to include breakfast in room fare, but in the overall it's just a great hotel to stay in.

I really enjoyed my stay at NYLO. The staff was super friendly and helpful, and I loved the fact that I was given a sparkling wine when I arrived. There were many guests sitting at the bar and in the cool little "library." Although I didn't bring my pup, I was happy to see that the hotel is dog friendly, and I was able to love on a friendly dog while I was there. I didn't eat at the attached Serafina restaurant, but I have eaten at other Serafina spots in Manhattan, so I feel pretty confident recommending it. The location of the hotel is fantastic: lots of great restaurants and stores nearby.  If you like to walk, you're not too far from many NYC attractions. Subways stops are pretty close, and it's very easy to hail a cab nearby. The room was very fairly priced and -- although it was NYC small -- it was very clean and comfortable. The shower had great pressure, and there was plenty of hot water. Usually hotel towels leave a lot to be desired, but these were large, thick, absorbent, and very soft. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the room was pretty quiet as well. I had a great night's sleep. Obviously, so far this sounds like a five-star review, and it would be except for a couple minor items. First, although there were MANY outlets in the room, there weren't any near the bedside tables. This isn't a big issue, but it would be more helpful to have outlets close to the bed. The other problem was the in-room coffee. There was a Keurig machine and coffee pods in the room, but there were no sweetener packets or creamers. I'm assuming that this was a one-time oversight, but I can't be sure. Overall, I would definitely stay at NYLO again, and if you're looking for a fun, hip place to stay with comfortable, clean, affordable (albeit small) rooms -- this is the place for you! (If you found this review helpful, please click on the "helpful" button. Thanks a bunch!)

The location was outstanding. Proximity to museums, Central Park, restaurants, shopping and -- importantly for our trip -- easy access to the 1,2, and 3 subway lines for travel to Brooklyn Heights, Chinatown and Columbia University. We selected a smaller Queen bed room because we knew we wouldn't be in the room that much. Very comfortable, clean, and as is typical these days -- large bathroom. Friendly staff, relative bargain. We'd stay again.

My husband and two kids (16 and 13) stayed in adjoining rooms this week. We were all impressed with the cozy, big city vibe of the hotel and rooms. Room aren't huge but were fine for our busy trip. Little noisy outside but we all enjoyed a good nights sleep. From the front desk to the bell hop who scheduled a airport transfer, staff is wonderful. Would not hesitate to stay there again and stay longer.

I recently stayed at the NYLO hotel for about a week and I LOVED my experience. Not only is this hotel very clean, new and reasonably-priced, but there are great little touches that I really enjoyed. Keurig coffee maker, very comfortable beds, built-in phone chargers in the side tables, a nice-quality magnifying mirror in the bathroom, plus a very good shower with great water pressure, very hot water and a telescoping shower head to accommodate all members of my family, from my husband who is tall to my son, who is seven years old. Very modern and chic interior. Rooms were a bit larger than I expected.I stayed in room 1203 for the first two nights, which faces the interior courtyard and was at the end of the hall. I'm a freak about noise and getting a good night's sleep, and this room was super quiet and relaxing. A great respite from the hustle and bustle of the city. Clean, comfortable and a touch larger than the hotels I'm used to staying in in NYC. I will stay here again the next time I come up for business and request this room.I then moved into a larger room on the 9th floor, room 904, when my husband and son arrived. This was a larger room that easily accommodated a rollaway bed for my son. It has two windows that face the side of the building, so there is no view, but it was VERY quiet. It also shares a wall with the storage room, which means no noisy neighbors. I really appreciated the cleanliness, large layout and QUIET of this room. My son goes to bed quite early, and he slept great at this hotel. The lobby, hotel bar and "library" are quite chic and provide a nice, relaxing place to catch a drink with a client or to unwind after a long day. The hotel gives you a drink coupon when you check in, which I thought was a nice "extra."We also enjoyed the downstairs restaurant, Serafina, which has pizza, pasta and also offers a continental breakfast. On one day or our stay, it was very cold, windy and rainy, so it was quite nice to enter this restaurant directly through the lobby of the hotel without going outside. I would say the staff at Serafina were a bit rude, but that's to be expected in NY. One night we ordered dinner from Serafina and it was very easy for my husband to just pop downstairs to the restaurant and pick up dinner.We also enjoyed Red Farm, which is next door, although you do have to exit the hotel to get there. Great amenities nearby. We cancelled a reservation at Hotel Wales to stay here with no regrets!

Midtown location on Broadway; buses and taxis very accessible.Get the large King room or live in a postage stamp sized room. Mostly young crowd as staff; medium attentive to guests. We stayed twice; would stay again for value.

This was our first visit to NYLO and would definitely return. Room was spacious, staff friendly and location was good. Enjoyed the live music in the lobby both evenings that we were there. Only complaint was dirty wine glasses left behind by cleaning staff when room was serviced.

Location was great, very convenient. Close to MTA subway entrances and bus stops, restaurants and markets. Also, within 1 mile, walking distance, of Central Park. Our room was a Delux King, with a view. Aside from the bed there wasn't anything very Delux about the room. It was small, sparsely furnished, could have been cleaner, and the bathroom was port-a-potty size and a small frig would have been nice.

Great experience, wonderful staff. My wife and I stayed there for 10 days in several rooms. Location is excellent, we explored the immediate area, as well as hopped on the subway to get to chelsea, the village, and brooklyn. Would stay there again.

I liked the location, and the staff was very helpful. but I didn't like the room and the interior design of the hotel. Very noisy air conditioner/heater. Conditions of the bathroom were poor. Very helpful .

Stayed here last weekend when in the City for a Columbia reunion. The first room given smelled pretty musty and was petite. We asked for a change and were given a brighter, slightly larger Standard room. This was fine. Very comfortable bed, very clean, very quiet, no amenities like robes and slippers. The hotel is walking distance to Lincoln Center and near the 79th St. Metro and the 79th St. crosstown bus to the Metropolitan Museum. Staff intermittently good about getting cabs. $750 for 2 nights, which included all the taxes, etc.

This place is great. I was visiting for business, and this place was perfect. The lobby is lovely with a bar on one side, and on the other was a book lined library to hang out. The front desk staff were nice, and the room was spacious. I read other reviews about people complaining about the size of the room, and I don't know what they were talking about. My room had enough room to walk comfortably around the bed, and the bathroom was an average size for a hotel bathroom. They even let me check in early which I appreciated! They also give you a free drink coupon to use at the bar. The gym was small, but a nice size for a hotel gym. My room was really quiet because I had an inner courtyard room. I didn't hear any street noise at all which was great. The location was fantastic. You are 2 blocks walk to the subway, and 5 blocks walk to the express train. You are very close to central park and riverside park, and there are tons of restaurants to choose from. Seriously this is a really nice hotel, and affordable for the area. Would totally stay there again if I was visiting new york on business again.

We were really impressed with the NYLO..great upper west side location near park, trains & restaurants. Most of all, the exceptional help from Ramona was above and beyond.. we extended our stay waiting for birth of our grandson, and Ramona took care of us like family.. even arranged excellent upgrades that were superb in every way! Thank you for such a wonderful experience.. have already recommended to friends who have booked for June.

I had a lovely stay at the hotel in early May. The room was clean and well-appointed. I found the staff friendly and helpful. The location is ideal with three subway stops within easy walking distance and good connections to Penn Station and the Port Authority.

Have stayed in this hotel 5 or 6 times and it is always consistently clean, great customer service, lovely accommodations. This trip was just an overnight, previously have stayed for up to 5 nights. The lobby offers a bar as well as a separate very large room with different table and chair configurations for visiting with guests or getting work done.

The rooms are clean. There is a funky bar/lounge area downstairs. Location is good for families - near museums, park and restaurants. I would stay here again - but the rates are a bit high. Overall a good experience.

One of the few hotels on the Upper West Side of NYC and it is reasonably priced for a descent hotel in the city. Rooms are small but well appointed and very functional. Might not be great for a long stay but just right for a couple of nights. Hotel has an industrial feel and room furnishings are similar to high end Ikea and it works well. Hotel bar is busy and there is a fair amount of common space with seating, tables and wifi. There is also a restaurant which we did not use.We would stay again.

Upon arriving at the hotel, I got the impression the front desk agent was not all that friendly but I thought perhaps it was simply me. When I got into my room, the window cover was broken and the same front desk agent was very unhelpful and gave me incorrect advice. This led me to have to speak to front desk and engineering multiple times. Turns out the engineering department knew of the problem but the hotel has decided not to fix the problem. The bed was overly soft with depressions which indicated to me it is quite old and could be replaced. However there was live music and a special event on my second night which made the stay memorable but overall the attitude of staff could be improved upon.

One of the best hotel in manhattan,the room was spacious and the staff are friendly.location was also near to central park and just a walking distance to subway stations special thanks to jeff pladevega who recommend NYLO hotel for us to stay in new york.

The NYLO is in a fantastic location. Everything you need is within a couple of blocks, subway, restaurants, bars, 24hr chemist, laundry, all within 2min walk. Staff are very friendly and accomodating, especially Ramona on the front desk. Rooms are a good size and beds & Pillows are great.

I recently stayed at the NYLO for a trip to New York with my mom. We were town for a wedding at the New York Botanical Garden in the Bronx (about 25 minutes away by car). As an avid theatre-goer, I've been to New York many times and usually stay in midtown. I loved staying on the Upper West Side - the location was super convenient to the subway and Central Park, and the neighborhood was lovely and quiet.After a 5-hour flight and a long car ride from Newark Airport, we were immediately greeted at the NYLO by Orlando, who welcomed us and quickly unloaded our bags. We instantly felt at-ease and welcomed - and that continued with Ramona, who checked us in at the front desk. We were upgraded to a queen/queen suite on the 4th floor. The room was spacious and quiet, and the beds were extremely comfortable. George helped us to our room and made sure we were taken care of.All of the staff were extremely helpful, and it was an awesome experience. We had a great weekend at the NYLO, and we can't wait to return soon! Thanks to Orlando, Ramona, and George for your great customer service.

We enjoy our stays here and the kind treatment from all. Daniel arranged our transportation from airport, Eloy at check-in, Ramona, Tasha, Jessie, Jose, and Carlos...all contributed to a good experience. Housekeeping also was excellent. Thank-all of you again!

If there's another place to stay in the area, do it. Rooms are mediocre at best and staff is friendly, although not the smartest or most efficient for guests in town for business. They automatically charge valet for your whole stay, even if it's only for one night, so look at your bill. If you need packages delivered, get tracking and stay on the staff. Had a package delivered that I wasn't aware of until I checked out and was never notified.

I booked one night with breakfast for two, but there was no record to indicate I purchased on the hotel's computer when I was there. I checked in at the midnight, and check out next morning at 9. Of course, I had an original email with breakfast purchased as a record. When the time you were rush for the appointment , you just didn't have time to explain at that moment . (but I did talk to customer service, and also sent an email request with original confirmation after. Still waiting for reimbursement) Anyway this hotel doesn't have dining facilities, and they co-op with the restaurant next door for some voucher system. After totally charge with tax and some service fee, my 9-hour stay was almost $400 from original $270 standard room without breakfast as hotel posted. My room was upgraded as a bigger room, and the people were friendly there too. But I couldn't see myself to stay again. If you stay this hotel, you could easily find a breakfast around neighborhood. Maison Kayser is just few doors across the street on 921 Broadway!

This is a nice, modern hotel in a great location just blocks from Central Park.I had a city view King room. It was small but clean and nicely decorated. The windows are small, so it's not much of a view, so don't get too excited. I earned some kind of an upgrade through their booking system, but by the time I got to the hotel to check in, no upgrade was available. Stayed for three nights and it was very comfortable. My room was close to the elevator, so it felt like people were standing right outside my door and chatting (which was a little disruptive in the early morning and late at night), so my advice is to ask for a room away from the elevator.The bar and restaurant downstairs are very nice and help to make you feel like you are in the midst of things.The bathroom was small but good. The shower had good water pressure and there was no tub.

The NYLO is ideally located for activities in Manhattan. We love that it's close to the Theater District without being in the craziness of Times Square area. You can walk to Central Park and Riverside Park and the subway is just a few blocks away. Customer service is also fantastic!

We stay in Manhattan a few times a year, especially while attending a late night event or concert. My husband and I enjoy the hustle and bustle of NYC, a perfect get-a-way from our quiet, NY Westchester home. This was the first time we stayed in the Upper West Side of the city, and I can tell you, it will not be our last. Family friendly, dog-loving, clean streets with the feel of our suburban life, but mixed in with the fast-paced life of Urban New Yorkers. It was pretty neat to see children on bikes and scooters throughout the city, and many dog walkers enjoying the beautiful weekend weather. The NYLO is a perfect spot to stay to take in the city's excitement. We went to an event at the Beacon Theater, and enjoyed cocktails and appetizers in the NYLO bar and lounge. The wide-doors were open, which made the bar street accessible, and also easy access to have a smoke. There was live-entertainment later on in the evening, and the staff was tentative and friendly. A laid back atmosphere, almost a feeling you were at a friends party. There was no pretentious attitude. It was cool! The bar service was excellent, and the food was provided by Serafina, the Italian restaurant connected to hotel. It took awhile for our food to come, but it was fine, they apologized. Food was decent. There's no room service which is a bummer, but we sacrificed our guilty pleasure to be close to the theater. The rooms are acceptable, but the decor has a "college dorm" feeling. Despite, it was spacious and clean. There was no view from our room, but for one night we didn't mind. We had access to the 16th floor, a rooftop, where you can enjoy a cocktail sitting outdoors in comfy space. It was enjoyable. Over-all I give it 4 stars. There are extra charges for parking and access to Floor 16, rooftop, so just ask about them. We always expect it to be pricey in Manhattan, so these charges do not surprise us.

Upon checking in and going to my room, I found that the cleaning staff had left a dirty rag on top of my clean pillow. Hairs were stuck in the clean bathroom towels. And the hotel charges an outrageous daily fee that was not included in the information provided at time of booking. This extra fee put the room outside of gov't rate since I was traveling on business. Luckily, the front desk staff agreed to waive it or I would have had to find alternate lodging.

Standard business hotel with the approach to meet a NY style. Like: very friendly staff and good bed. Dislike: no information in room or elevator about services such as gym or roof garden. Lobby could be looked after more often.

Good but rooms are too small. The service at the restaurant is bad and their food is lousy. The gym needs improvement in size and quality of equipment. The lobby and bar are very nice indeed. The reception staff are very helpful and kind.

The NYLO hotel is one the best in NYC providing best guest room service and possible accommodations as a pet friendly hotel. My family felt very welcomed. The NYLO hotel has a great sight venue and location closest to nearby transportation. Excellent bar spots to hang out. We truly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting The Big Apple. Vivek and Stephanie are very great hosts. The Tineo Family.
user_name:
jtineo201
New York City, New York

review_body: Nice place to stay i the upper west side. Good proximity to subway. Rooms are small but we don't spend much of our time in the room while staying in NYC. Staff is very helpful and knowledgable of the local scene.

Enjoyed visiting both for business and pleasure recently, and we booked directly with NYLO and took advantage of some spring savings. There are several staff members who made our visit especially pleasant: Ramona at the front desk, and Lenny, Orlando, and George working the door -- really friendly, outgoing, professional. Ramona helped pick a room for my overnight that was truly outstanding, with a great city view and plenty of space. NYLO has an interesting feel, european urban chic is my best description, with lots of raw brick and concrete in the lobby, and simplicity with comfort for the rooms upstairs. Used the gym for the first time -- it also, while compact, was clean and pleasant, a nice change from some hotel workout experiences. Honestly, I think a lot of this hotel. Love the neighborhood, appreciate the friendly staff, like the vibe.

Great price for stay in NYC. Make sure and request room facing Broadway or 77th, if want a view. Beds were soo comfortable. Courteous and friendly staff. Hotel in the middle of it all. Didnt love Serafina's but it was a free breakfast.
Great location(quit and nice niberhood), comefrtabl rooms, very Comfy bad, bad bad, big showers very friendly stuff. Great vibes in the luby :)Nice coffe places around it and very close to the subway

Excellent hotel, convenient clean and affordable. Amazing balcony and the bed was to die for. Overall perfect stay definitely recommend to a friend or colleague. It's hip vibe along with its stunning interior design really sets it apart from other boring hotels.

Staff is excellent, from the front desk to the bell caps to the house-service. The rooms are typically terrific. Next time I will get the upgrade for the Superior room, where nice, had a view of a brick wall (I'm not kidding0 and the bathroom shower was uncomfortably small. But all it did was cause a minor discomfort - I would still not stay anywhere else.

I would recommend NYLO to family and friends and plan to stay again. Many restuarants are right near by, and the metro station ( 79th) is only 2 blocks away. THe rooms are quiet and you will get a restful sleep.

The NYLO is a great hotel on the upper west side. Staff are friendly. Hotel is clean and well maintained. Furnishings reasonably recent.Nice to be able to stay in a neighborhood where residents out number tourists. Close to subway at 72nd where you can catch express train and get downtown very quickly. Have stayed there several times and will do so again.

The NYLO is a great value away from all the hustle bustle. Located in a Lovely neighborhood. Lots of great shopping and conveniences close by. Love that it's close to Central Park and gym options. Convenient to subway line.

Booked a deluxe Queen Queen Suite with sitting area. Spacious room (42m2), view on Broadway. Hardly any noise, we could sleep perfectly on the 4th floor with open windows! Close to subways (Broadway 72th and 79th street and at Central Park). Friendly employees. Excellent stay!!

When we arrived we were given a warm greeted and a very kind upgrade at we were staying for our honeymoon. The room was beautiful, the restaurant and bar were just was inviting! We will return here soon!

the vent grate above the room's hall entrance [room 228] was apparently loose, and in the middle of the night started rattling pretty intensely, thus made a very loud noise and woke us up. otherwise, really liked the hotel. lobby is v chic and neighborhood is great.

Fantastic service, clean room, and staff and hotel atmosphere are very accommodating to different needs (business traveler, family with small children, or social traveler). Would highly recommend this hotel!

Loved the hotel location in the center of the upper ewest side near many great restaurants and very close to Central Park. The lobby area was very pleasant - nice area to meet with friends and gather for a drink. The rooms were on the samll side, but clean and comfortable.

we booked this last minute as we need an extra night in the city, wow!!! I will plan to stay here going forward. Nothing bad to say, beautiful lobby, bar, game area, attached to amazing restaurants, perfect location!

This boutique hotel has a great ambiance. The minute you step inside you know it's not a boring place to stay. Good music, dim lighting, and the lobby / bar is always lively. The staff is great and the hotel features a wide range of room types and they are huge for New York. The bathrooms have a good variety of ammentities and are equipped with modern fittings. Perfect location. A short walk from Central Park and shake shack is just around the corner.

We have stayed at the NYLO when it was called On The Avenue. Always a pleasurable experience. Friendly staff, clean rooms.Was out so much did not take advantage of urban package. Parking option was great.

This was my boyfriend's and my second time staying here. We love the lounge and bar in the lobby and the terrific location of the hotel. Our first time, we stayed in the Queen room which was very tiny but fine for one night. This last time we stayed in the King's Superior room for 2 nights and it was a better fit for us. The only issue we had was that our comforter was a little tattered with a few holes and tears. The sheets were sort of wrinkled. We also noticed a lot of crumbs left behind on the spare chair in the room. Loved the view though. :)

This hotel is well-situated for walking around and seeing the sights. Not far from Columbus Circle or Central Park. Rooms can be small - one person at a time can walk around the bed that dominates the room so consider that if you are a couple who likes to spend a little time in your room. And don't expect a lightning fast internet connection either. The staff is fine and the hotel and rooms are pleasant enough.

The NYLO NYC is best distinguished by the high level of service to and concern for guests that is demonstrated by staff. I loved staying on the Upper West Side, my old neighborhood, and still a unique precinct of Manhattan life. We were upgraded to an outstanding room on the top floor with a balcony and views of the Hudson. My daughter however, who had a standard room, was in an exceedingly small space. In both, the appointments were a bit tired.

Great property, close to shopping, eating and NYP. I've recommended this property to my meeting planner community due to the high level of service shown by the sales manager, Angie Cabral. Front desk staff, concierge and bellman are exceptional. NYLO gets an A in my book.

This is our second stay at this hotel. The location is great for visiting Central Park and surrounding museums. As far as hotel room goes, the floor felt a bit dusty, like half done vacuumed. I highly advise to bring the reservation confirmation and double check the bill at check out. We were over charged and had to find the reservation confirmation to show the overcharged item was in fact an error on their part. The attitude on the hotel side was not so pleasant...

Hotel check in was extremely easy. The rooms were very clean, and dog friendly. The location was great and easily accessible to everything. Very happy!! :) will definitely be returning on my next stay!

We stayed here because it was recommended by the family we were visiting. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The lobby atmosphere was cozy and had plenty of areas to sit and relax. The bar was nice and had doors that opened up to the street which was nice since it was a nice day. The room was comfortable and clean. I was near the elevators and didn't hear hallway traffic at all. The area is perfect if you want be near Central Park. There are plenty of nice restaurants in the area too.

I was on a business trip and spent 3 nights at NYLO (based on a friend's recommendation). The location is superb! You can walk to Central Park (3 blocks away), walk to many museums and, if you want to go somewhere else, the subway is just a few blocks away, Great choice of restaurants minutes away (by foot!) - Seraphina (enter from the hotel) was really REALLY great (I had seafood pasta), and I highly recommend the Red Farm right next door (top notch fresh dim sum and more - try the chicken Lolipops!). Sure, those are on the somewhat expensive side when you add a drink or two, but you can also go around the corner on Amsterdam Ave for the Amsterdam Ale House for a more local bar kind of place (they had wunderbar spinach and cheddar quesadillas - had 'em 2x), and then for a $8 breakfast, there's a diner (Viand Café) at Broadway and 75th (2 blocks away), as well as a Starbucks. There's a CVS right across the street from NYLO if you want a bag of chips or whatever. And the hotel bar is really homey and nice. If you go left on Broadway you gotta check out Citarella, and if you go right on Broadway, check out Zagar's. Why? For someone coming from Detroit (the city, not the burbs), it was like stepping into heaven: both have an incredible array of fish (fresh and smoked), cheese, sausage, bread etc (and kitchen gadgets on 2nd floor of Zagar's!). So, my only "small thing" complaint: I only wish that my room (which I though was quite large for NYC standards and very comfortable) had had a small refrigerator, so that I could have stocked up on some of those goodies to bring back to the D. Oh well - guess you can't have everything.

Nothing special in a crowded market. Under-elevatored. Staff is fine. HVAC with issues. Fact that I had to complain to get a decent room for a 7 night stay leaves the impression that staff just wants to see what they can get away with. We will stay elsewhere on our next trip. Thankfully we were very busy and spent little time in room. And some fitness center equipment was broken for entire stay

This is the second time we have stayed at NYLO. The property is in an excellent location and convenient to transportation, Central Park and great restaurants. We will definitely book at this property for future travels to NYC.

We had an overall great experience but the sheets were wrinkled and the comforter has tears in it which just seemed unprofessional. There were also crumbs all over the chair in the room. We loved the location, the staff, the fitness center and the bar with lounge though.
user_name:
U9625QIelizabeths
New York City, New York

review_body: Great hotel, well placed clean room comfy bed and friendly staff. Our room had a view on the brick wall but they were heavilly booked and we got a good deal so it was understandable. Who stays in his room in NY anyways?

We really enjoyed our stay at the NYLO. It was conveniently located on the upper west side, close to the people we were visiting. Our room was clean and comfortable, and the king-sized bed was especially nice. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel bar was a plus, too.

Very clean hotel, bright rooms with simple tasteful decor. Staff is very helpful and friendly. I don't care for the extra 'user fee' added to our bill on recent visits. The offer of a complimentary drink (included in the extra fee) at the bar is nice but doesn't provide much choice.

Should have been better but did not receive back what I left from lost and found and only luke warm water in the shower. Some staff were nice and some annoyed at the complaint that I wanted to receive what I left in the room which was very value. I was not reimbursed or compensated in any way

We have stayed many time at this hotel because it is close to Columbia where my son is a student. The doorman, Orlando and bellman, George are the best! They are very helpful and accommodating, greeting you with a smile. Rooms can be small but you can sometimes gets upgrades if you ask. The price for rooms is reasonable for NYC. The neighborhood is safe and an easy walk to Central Park. You also get a coupon for a free drink which you can redeem at the bar in the lobby which has a relaxed atmosphere.

The hotel was in a great location, staff generally very friendly and attentive...rooms were very cleaning and the housekeeping staff was happy to accommodate all my requests. The big stars were the bellman...they were lively, hard working, and friendly.

While every thing in NYC is overpriced, this hotel is a good compromise if you have to stay in the city. The resort tax on top of the sales tax is a final insult to fiscal sanity of a city run by out of touch idiots. Some day there will be a reconning and the poor folks who are trying to live and work here will talke the hit for the years of abusive management.Room was basic, clean, excellent bathroom and ours was quiet.I would recommend the hotel and its excellent location

The room sizes are so small, that it's impossible to feel comfortable.I can't see spending this kind of money with a room this size and feeling so closed in.Don't think I will come back.I have nothing more to say. This is not something your hotel can fix. But I would warn everyone else thinking of staying here.

It was the bedding. We could not sleep it was so soft. We have traveled all over the world and have not encountered a bed this difficult to sleep in. Not sure what your interior designers were thinking . Would love to use your hotel as our daughter started college nearby, but will not due to the bedding.

My stay at the NYLO was the best stay that I have ever experienced at the hotel in New York. The hotel itself has a very cozy and inviting feeling. My room was nice and very clean and had a great view on Broadway but it was still super relaxing and quiet in the room. The housekeeping staff was very sensitive about the timing of when to clean my room and I always had everything I needed. Every time I walked back into the hotel or in the lobby, I was greeting by a very kind smile and warm attitude from all the staff members, from the door, the bar (great cocktails btw.) and front desk staff. There was not one staff member who didn't give me this feeling of this kindness, which was so lovely to experience. I stayed at NYLO for a few weeks and everyone who worked at the hotel made it very easy for me to feel like I was at home. I have stayed at many other hotels in NY but seriously never experienced this warmth and kindness at any of the other hotel. I would always stay at the NYLO again!

As most lower- or mid-cost hotels in NYC, at NYLO a standard room is small and cramped. The bathroom closet size. Compared to competitors the basic rate of $276 is fair, but not $404, the price of extending my stay by one night.

Beds are dynamite. Really comfortable.Staff is terrific.Noise from out facing rooms on lower floors is awful. Incredibly loud street noise starts around 4 am and makes it impossible to sleep.Bar is great and fun.

I had a great experience at NYLO. It is located in a great Upper West Side location near Zabars, Harry's shoes and there are a lot of great cafes and restaurants nearby. Great, family friendly, quiet neighborhood

Check in is superb. Jessie is one of the best desk agents I have ever encountered. The rooms are clean, the beds superb, the lobby has action and, most of all, the rates are reasonable. The convenience to the 1,2 and 3 lines makes getting to meetings anywhere in the city a snap. I love this place.

Really nice location to get to Columbus avenue and all the wonderful restaurants there. Beds are really comfortable.Surprising in these times of being green they give you all plastic drinking and coffee cups in the room. You throw away plastic in the garbage your entire stay (a week for us) and they just keep replacing it with more plastic. Should switch to ceramic cups.This is my second stay, each for a week at a time. Both times I have had to switch rooms after the first night due to noise outside. I have made more than fifty trips to NYC and stayed in hotels all over Manhattan. These are some of the noisiest rooms ever. Get a room facing the inside, don't take any room that faces the street, particularly on the lower six floors, you will be sorry at about 4 AM with construction, garbage trucks backing up, delivery trucks running their diesel engines etc. Our party of fifteen or so, all experienced NYC visitors, all complained about it and said they would never stay there again. Get an inside room or stay somewhere else. The gym is small if you like free weights. There are some but no room to use them to speak of. They need to expand the gym to twice the size to have room for yoga, stretching, lifting free weights etc.All the staff is exceedingly friendly and helpful. The lobby bar is great as is the sitting room/library.

Welcomed warmly by a doorman, I entered to the sounds of a seemingly popular social space by the bar. Checking in was efficient - approximately 7 minutes. Having had a taxing trip to NY, walking into the spacious room with King bed relaxed me immediately. The bathroom is smartly constructed and features a standing shower that even a tub-er would find soothing. The room is not overworked. That's important. Modern touches with attention to detail but not so many details that one feels overwhelmed. Everything is in it's right place in the room. When heading out to eat, a meeting, or to take in the city, it felt like I was leaving my apartment. In fact, I wish it was **big smile**. Having to check-out early in the morning sometimes is not a great experience - either takes too long or involves a chaffing interaction with the concierge. Not here. The gentleman greeted me, asked for my room number, typed a few strokes on his keyboard, looked up and said, "You're all set. Thank you for staying with us." I've already booked another stay in August for a longer stay and will be bringing along 3 friends to experience NYLO New York City. It's now a staple.
user_name:
avenupe
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I came in on a red-eye flight from the West coast. When I arrived at the hotel, I expected they would just store my luggage until check-in, but when Jessie found out I had taken a red-eye, she said she would see if she could get me checked in early. She did and I was so grateful to take a nap.

My daughter and I spent 4 nights in this excellent hotel. Well situated close to metro and Central Park, with a remarkable customer satisfaction attitude, it is a very good choice for the ones who want to find a reasonable room size (hard to find in NY) good value for the money and service. We'll come back!

If you love the upper westside of Manhattan like I do then this hotel is perfect for you! The NYLO has a very casual Upper Westside Loft feel and charm to it and is very reasonable. Very nice bar in the lobby and Serafina(the Italian restaurant connected to the hotel) is excellent for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Not to mention you are staying on the Upper Westside near many other great restaurants, a the American Museum of Natural History and the Beacon Theater.

We stayed two nights in April.Pluses: Convenient place in UWS; reasonable price for the area; wonderfully helpful reception staff and concierges.Minuses: typical small room for the area (had to walk sideways around the king size bed), poor "maid service" (no new towels, no fresh glasses, no coffee replacement), drapes didn't work (service man tied them up and said that they were waiting until they had a critical mass before repairing them all), restaurant attached to the hotel did not open for the advertised 7am continental breakfast.

This is a great location for upper-west side walking and amenities. Walk across the park to the Met, or to the park for the Natural History Museum. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. Room was a bit small with a few worn edges, but the bed and bedding were excellent. All was clean.

The staff are all very helpful and willing to assist however needed. My room was clean and not too bad regarding space, especially for a NYC hotel. The price was also quite fair. It has a fun retro vibe. I would suggest this hotel for business travelers and couples in particular. There was some construction across the street but that should be temporary.
user_name:
Nsedu W
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Have been staying at the nylo for the last 4 years due to its upper west side location, boutiquey look and feel. However this year was the first year with an infant and have to say it was a mistake to book this hotel. It is ill equipped with no changing facilities in the main lobby (we had to use the restaurant next door and changed him in a corridor), there is no fridge to store milk and food, no kettle for sterilising and no bath and we had one of the best rooms. If you are a couple then the nylo is a good choice but if you have little ones there have to be better equipped hotels in the city

We enjoyed your hotel. Gorgeous decor and it smelled good. Great location with walking distance to Central Park and many subway stations. The hotel bar was fun and lively. We would definitely recommend this hotel looking for a nice getaway in the city!

My partner and I stayed for four nights and whilst the hotel is reasonably priced, well maintained and in a great location for exploring Manhattan, the service (or lack of it!) we received from the hotel bar staff on two separate occasions during our stay was appalling.I'd recommend the hotel, but go to one of the many local bars for a drink!

Reception registered another guest in our room during our stay. she interrupted us napping. Our room key was also made dysfunctional. However, we were offered nothing in return for our embarrassment and trouble.

A very special place. I stayed here just before Christmas, and the atmosphere couldn't have been more perfect. Rather romantic, actually. The bar/lounge area is particularly enchanting in the evenings.

Love the location of this hotel - convenient to subway, restaurants and the park. The bar scene has a nice vibe. Rooms are clean and well appointed. Will definitely return in the future. Recommend for business, visiting friends and family.

This was our fifth visit to the NYLO, and we have very much liked this hotel for its excellent location. friendly service, and the rooftop terrace with its lovely view. This visit, however, was not up to the standards we experienced on our last four visits. At check-in, we were given a standard room (very tiny) instead of the superior room which we had reserved and confirmed. They did, fortunately, provide us with the superior room which we had reserved. On one of our days, the room was not serviced when we returned mid-afternoon, and after four requests when we were each time assured it would be serviced, they offered to have us move to another room on a lower floor. An amazingly helpful housekeeper who had other assignments generously and graciously offered to clean and make up our room so that we wouldn't have to move all our things during the time our daughter and her friends were awaiting our arrival for dinner. The front desk manager did offer to give us an upgrade on our next visit, and we especially want to acknowledge Lenny, George, and Jean for their exceptional service during our visit.

This is a wonderful hotel - friendly staff who are anxious to help guests. It is a hotel that is very supportive to the solo traveler. There are various seating areas with different lighting - even a chess board available!

Hotel was close to the Beacon. Nice, trendy looking hotel. Rooms aren't quiet. I could hear everything next door and all the banging above me. Bed was comfy. Room was small. Would consider again for proximity to the theatre.
user_name:
Helen O
Long Island, New York

review_body: This is my current go-to hotel when visiting family on the UWS. The rooms are spare but stylish and the public areas are lively. My only complaint is the $30 "urban service fee" added PER NIGHT. This fee - includes basics like wifi, access to a computer to print out your boarding pass, access to a weight room, and a bottle of water on arrival -- which are included in the cost of comparable hotels.It would be a lot easier—and more honest—to include the service fee in the basic room charge.

The room was clean and quiet (we faced 77th Street). The staff was accommodating and courteous. The best feature is the location; near subway stops on 72nd and 79th Streets, short ride to see Broadway shows. Good restaurants and shops are also near.

I like the property, the location and the staff. Rooms are clean but small, even for NYC, and the bathrooms are nice but there is no towel rack in room 1231. We were told the "31" series of rooms are the smallest on the property, so avoid those. they charge an "urban" fee but note there's multiple fitness locations 1/2 block away and plenty of local eateries nearby. The lobby is very comfortable and the bar is very nice. If you can get this for a reasonable price and not a "31" room then I would put this closer to a 4 property. Also, this is very close to the 1 train and central park.

Love this hotel. Very convenient. Would have liked a refrigerator in the room. But that's the only addition I would suggest. Lots of buzz in the lobby. Perfect location to walk in neighborhood. Easy transportation .

This was first stay at the NYLO. We usually stay downtownThe hotel is well located, bedding very comfortable. Staff very friendly and courteous . Kudos to Ms Ramona , Marvelous person , very helpfulDownside : THE ABSOLUTE SLOWEST ELEVATORS I HAVE EVER SEEN . Frustrating

The NYLO is a great choice for staying in the upper west side. The hotel and rooms are very clean and well furnished. We stayed in a double queen suite and loved the extra space of the sitting room. The staff at the NYLO are just wonderful, exceeded all expectations, are so friendly and helpful. They get the highest rating! You will have no regrets staying at this hotel. Book it!

Great hotell With friendly Staff. Great location With The Subway nearby. If you want to stay at a nice hotel, stay here . Great drinks in The bar and free wifi at The hotel. I really liked The atmosphere around The hotel.

My room may have been small, but it was well-appointed and clean. The hotel itself has a lovely, welcoming vibe. The neighbourhood is great with lots of food and drink options nearby. I loved it and will definitely stay there again.

Always my favorite NYC hotel. Convenient location, clean, super comfortable beds. In a world of chain hotels, NYLO still has a boutique urban character all its own. I do wish they had mini fridges in the rooms, because it's a bummer to be across the street from several luxury food markets and have no place to store groceries. The room layouts are a little weird, with these enormous high beds in a tiny space. Well, this time I got a free upgrade coupon by email, probably because I stay there often, and I discovered the secret large rooms! My AC didn't work the first night, so they upgraded me again to an even more palatial suite on the top floor. Thanks for great service, folks.

We enjoy staying on the upper West Side and this hotel offers the perfect blend of hospitality, professional and friendly staff and easy access to major subway lines, Central Park and lots of up and coming / excellent restaurants in the area. Fresh, quiet room, great bed. We'll be back!

On our way backf rom Florida we stayed 4 nights in the NYLO hotel at the upper westside. We enjoyed the neat hotel and the perfect location very much. Our next visit in NYC will be at NYLO again!The WIFI was very fast and always avilable.

This hotel was modern, stylish and hip. Great staff, knowledgeable concierge, subtle decor, hardwood floors in guest rooms, and reliable internet. The restaurant Sarafina (attached) was excellent. Really great location. I will definitely be returning this summer.

From the City originally so try to stay in different places and neighborhoods when we come back for vacations. Lived in the neighborhood but was before hotel renovations so did not know about it before. Love the Upper West Side-nice location. Very pleasant modern rooms and style. Very nice staff. Valet package was well worth it. Will consider staying again and recommend.

The location of the hotel was great and worth the cost. It was booked in part because of a promotion which was never applied to the price. However, it was a very good location from within in walking distance to a lot of what we intended to see.

This was my second stay at NYLO in a two year span, and I'm happy to say it did not disappoint. Nothing beats the Upper Westside as a New York neighborhood, and NYLO puts you right in the heart of that, so you can grab cherry cheese streudel at Zabar's or pop into Central Park for a constitutional that will take you past its most iconic sights: the Great Lawn and turtle pond, the Belvedere, The oak bridge, and Strawberry Fields. For food in the area, Shake Shack, Cafe Lalo and The Szechuan Inn never disappoint. I love NYLO's modern and well-appointed rooms, most particularly their non-carpeted floors...carpets in hotels disturb my inner clean freak, and NYLO is always spic and span. Also appreciated the free welcome drink in the bar which has one of the most welcoming vibes for a hotel bar that I've ever been too. You can walk everywhere from NYLO. They give you wifi, water and coffee and tea. Rooms are a little smaller but hey, it's New York City, they were far from unreasonable. Nothing much more to say about it except, see you next time!
