I traveled from NC to NYC to stay here at the (NYLO)... I felt very taken care of. Clean environment and cool atmosphere! Best cocktail I've had in a long time as well.. Bar is a winner. I plan on staying next time I'm in NYC.

We were very happy with NYLO New York City. We booked 3 rooms for our stay in NYC. Upon arrival we hoped that one room would be available for early check in. To our delight all 3 rooms were ready and check in was a breeze ( 3 hours earlier than their regular check in). The staff was fantastic, very friendly and helpful, they even allowed my 11 year old granddaughter to play their piano (she was thrilled). We really had a great stay at NYLO, the rooms were clean, beds comfortable and bathrooms were well equipped.

Good value at price we paid. Street noise one night but not second night.Heard fire truck siren once each night early for about 3 seconds each time (other review mentioned fire station).Location is really great wrt subway and local restaurants. Definitely would stay again

Really great in all ways possible. Perfect location, nice neighbourhood, close to subway and to the park. Friendly staff (especially Jennifer in the reception), nice and tidy rooms, gym open 24hrs. Highly recommended!

My room had no view. It faced an airshaft BUT it was quiet which was most important. A great bed and a big spacious bathroom. Free wifi and coffee maker in the room were a big plus as I was returning from Europe. The restaurant downstairs offers good food.

Had such a wonderful time. We had a beautiful room upgrade. It was beyond our wildest dreams. The attention to our needs were met and the free welcome drinks were so wonderful. We will be coming back. This is our home hotel.

I did an extensive hotel search before finally deciding to book a room at the NYLO and I was happy with my decision. I was slightly apprehensive based on some of the reviews I read but it was a great place to stay, especially for the price. It's a very cool boutique hotel and the staff was excellent. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. We only stayed one night and just booked a queen room due to lack of availability (because I waited until the last minute to book). The room was a decent size, had a comfy bed and overall was perfect for what we needed. For the price, you cannot beat it! The location was ideal. Very close to Central Park, Museum of Natural History and tons of cool shops, restaurants and bars. It was not an overly congested area and we had a great time just walking around the city near the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again!

From the moment I arrived and was dealt with by Jennife to the warmth and welcoming vibe I got from Chris who works at the bar right up until I checked out with the gorgeous Jessie & Camona. This was one of my best experiences at a hotel, and I am so grateful for the kindness and warmth from the whole place, inside and out. Great location, beds are incredibe, like sleeping on smores, I will definitely be back sometime soon.

We arrived and found a malfunction in the heavy shade in the room's only small window.Vivek at the main desk recognized that I was disappointed in not being able to look out or let any light to come into the room. He immediately scanned the computer for any other available room. He found none so he allowed us to upgrade (at no extra charge) to a lovely and huge studio. He tried very hard to accommodate us and did so with graciousness. We were very pleased. We would recommend NYLO primarily on the kindness and professionalism of Vivek. Our hotel was also very clean and serviced well. I also found the views of rooftops very interesting.

Rooms were great, staff was great and they were so welcoming to our dogs too. They even gave each dog a toy to play with A pleasure! Check in and out seamless. Valet super helpful. Best hotel on upper west side. Location was great.

In the heart of residential Upper West Side, this is a gem in a big city. Great staff and modern rooms. We were spoiled by booking a King Suite with an outdoor patio, and I'm sure some of the other rooms feel much smaller, but the furnishings and bathroom fixtures were modern and clean. And the bed? Amazing. Can't wait to stay here again!

Stayed at the NYLO earlier this month for 19 days. While I was between apartments this is my third stay and it is truly my home away from home. While my room was small it was stylishly furnished and had everything I needed. The king bed and the bedding was particularly comfortable providing blissfull sleep.Attached to headboard was good reading liight, and there were two outlets embedded in nightstand so I could easily charge my phone and computer while I was in bed. There was a small, but servicable gym.Every one is kind and friendly from the bellmen, to the concierge and houseousekeeping.Everyone is eager to please. In particular I want to mention the GM Connie, who is always listening to her guests and truly always works on improving the guest experince. Connie has created some intesting arts and entertainment programing check out the website for these events. NYLO is the chicest boutique hotel on the Upper West Side. Sari SSari
user_name:
SariSManhattanFiles
New York City, New York

review_body: We keep returning to NYLO because we love it. Everything about NYLO is just right. Cool and funky rooms, great bathrooms, wonderful relaxing lobby and awesome bar. Good service too. The hotel always exceeds our expectations. Good value and great location also..

My wife and I have just returned from two fabulous weeks in New York (without our two teenage daughters!) Our base for the two weeks was NYLO Hotel. It is ideally situated on Broadway and West 77th and is only two minutes walk from the Subway and even more importantly just a 5 minute stroll away from the fabulous Central Park. The park is 800+ acres in size and needs daily attention as it is absolutely fabulous from one end to the other. Our room at the NYLO was clean and comfortable whilst the décor was a little "Ikea-esque" for two 50+ adults - I am sure that the younger generations would love it. Bed was super comfortable and shower was ok but not over powerful. Comfy bed is required if you are out walking 10 hours a day in the City. Staff were friendly and attentive and the location of the hotel could not be better. Great restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel

The hotel was clean and well Socrates, our room was very small but got the job done for a one night stay. All the staff were pleasant to deal with and helpful. Room was clean and bed was comfortable. Relatively quiet. Valet service was worth the money Would stay again for sure

I think the hotel structurally is outstanding. I think the decor and mood of the lobby had a cool, easy retro jazzy vibe. And the bellman were quick to help and extremely solicitous.The first night I thought I was maybe in the wrong room, given the photo on booking.com, was for a different level room.The fourth night there was the problem with Visa, given the duplicate charges made by the hotel.And just last night, after returning from Boston -- where I stayed in three separate hotels all without issue -- I returned to NYLO where I had made a new reservation. I wanted to give it a fresh go.However I was not allowed to check-in. Because I only had cash. Since every single card I owned was turned off -- when my SSN and bank information were stolen Friday.And even if the end result had been that I couldn't stay there (which I sincerely completely understand) it would've been nice if the hotel had at least feigned helping me find a solution. But no. Instead it was a steadfast, dismissive no. To a young woman traveling alone in NYC, at midnight, with multiple bags. (I had had a driver see me into the the hotel for that very reason)So, my bags and I stood on the curb for nearly 20mins until I could flag a cab. Incidentally the next 4-star hotel I went to, not only allowed me to check-in, but also upgraded me to a suite and comp'd the mini bar.

I had a very cozy bed and large room size for NYC. Cute hotel by the park! Would definitely recommend and stay here again. Only stayed one night but seems to have a great night scene in the lobby bar and a nice breakfast spot connected to the hotel.

While I liked the hotel lobby and rooms and bar I was disappointed that the wine list was almost non existent. Housekeeping carts on the floors all day long very poor. Doors to guest rooms appeared to have been broken into at one time. The door to our room as crooked.

This is a nice contemporary busy hotel away from the Midtown madness. It has a nice buzzy feel to it and the bar on the ground floor is popular- if a little pricey. $17 for a glass of wine (very limited choice) was a bit of an eye opener- plus, of course, tips! I have some mixed views about the hotel. We booked a double Queen room for 5 nights but on arrival, was told that our room was not available for the first night- despite booking room many months before. We were allocated a upgraded room with a balcony- effectively a double room- with the offer of layaways for the our grown up sons. The room was very pleasant but was somewhat of a tight squeeze to accommodate all four of us. Disappointingly, one of the layaway mattresses was terribly stained- I don't know whether blood or other biological matter but a bit surprised that it was provided in such a state. In fairness, the Hotel offered us breakfast throughout our stay for the inconvenience- and that was appreciated. Theroom we eventually moved to next day was great! Breakfast was served in the Serafina restaurant- a lively venue in the evening but a little bit 'eclectic' on service in the mornings- forgetting to complete our breakfast order more than once- then insisting we needed to pay for 'extras' when we had already done so- and had left a good tip! Minor irritations aside, we found the hotel overall to be good and the staff to be helpful and courteous- but could be great if it nailed a few niggly areas mentioned.

Cute, nice place to stay. Relatively clean. Friendly, helpful staff. Rooms were bright, bathrooms clean and bright as well. Late check-outs not a problem. Cute bar to meet in. Neighborhood is nice, relatively quiet.

Good ubication, close to Central Park, groceries and several stores, subway line 1, American Museum of Natural History, several restaurants, nice neighborhood to walk through, quiet also, makes you feel comfortable.

Hotel was in a great location, near the subway and other amenities. Awesome bar and rooftop. Rooms were small but comfortable, clean, and modern. Beds were really comfortable, and their was a coffee machine which was great.

We loved this quaint boutique hotel in a great neighborhood in NYC. The rooms were spacious, the mattress comfortable, and the staff very accomodating. My daughter and I enjoyed it very much. Glad we stayed there.

My room felt like a dungeon cell. It was so dark and closed in with a super small window. I ended up moving to another hotel before my visit was up. If you're claustrophobic these rooms aren't for you.

I was impressed with the friendly staff and huge rooms! The beds were very comfortable as well! Great location for Natual History Museum, Central Park and lots of good restaurants. Very reasonably priced for NYC as well.

All reservations at NYLO NYC will be subject to a $25 plus tax daily facility fee. We are offering daily amenities to our guests that will require a set daily service fee from all guests.Unlimited local & domestic long distance phone calls (within the USA)Unlimited WIFI public space and GuestroomsUnlimited use of Fitness Center 24 hoursUnlimited use of the video/touchscreen Moncierge workstation with printing, faxing and scanning through the Front DeskWelcome Cocktail upon arrivalTwo Bottles of water in guest room day of arrival

My 7th floor room on the interior was the quietest I ever experienced in NYC. modern decor and comfy.hotel is quaint but comfy with terrific attached italian restaurant. everyone was helpful. will stay there again.

Fabulous hotel in upper West Side. Close to everything. Super Large room with great bathroom and even a coffee machine. Close to Central Park and all the best museums.Will definitely be back for another stay.

A comfortable west d side hotel. Recommend the bar. Good public areas. Location is excellent. French patisserie across Broadway. Midway between columbia and pure station. Quiet clean attentive staff. Good bed
user_name:
Peter P
Las Vegas, United States

review_body: This hotel meets all expectations - I visit the Upper West Side often and even though my destination is 11 streets north, NYLO meets all requirements for a long or short visit. I love the Keurig coffee maker in the room!!! The best thing, however, is the newest restaurant near it's location. Red Farm is clearly one of the best in the neighborhood! It's expensive but worth the wait and the price.

Traveled with extended family. Lounge area and bar as well as attached restaurant added to a fantastic trip!King bedrooms large enough to accommodate small family.Marble bathroom is beautiful. The linoleum floor feels 100% better then carpet for this germaphobe

I enjoy staying at NYLO especially since I lived on the Upper West Side of NY for many years. The rooms are clean and the bed is very comfortable and there are computers available in the lobby for easy use. As a regular visitor I think it would be nice if once in a while I was welcomed back and upgraded. On this visit they "forgot" the water for my coffeemaker every day for a week.

We liked the style of this hotel. The interior is nice ans special - so you get not the common 1000 room hotel feeling. The rooms are spicy and practically.The staff was always kind and pleasant.The location was ideal: you have the subway nearby and a lot of eating and food shopping possibilities in the area. The Central Park is only 10 minutes away - perfect.

I checked in for a one-week getaway. This was my first time using a boutique hotel. The service was perfect. From the moment I arrived I was greeted like a VIP starting at the front desk to getting settled in my room. I can't comment on the service provided for faulty plumbing or a burnt out light bulb because I never needed any of that. Everything worked perfectly when I arrived and I had no glitches to report going forward. The entire staff is wonderful. I truly felt like family during my stay. My room was great. It had every amenity but there was one thing that really stood out. The bed! The bed was so amazingly comfortable I barely got into it planning to watch TV but my hand never made it to the remote. I fell fast asleep. When I awoke, I had to decide whether to get up or spend the rest of the day in it. That was a hard decision. In my view, the bed is the most important aspect of any hotel. I have never had a decent night's sleep in a major hotel chain, many which cost more than the NYLO. If you wake up achy or sleepy, all the amenities and service in the world will not make your stay worthwhile. I've read other reviews where people said their room was too small. I did ask to check out some of the smaller rooms, and while they were a little small, they lacked for nothing. I asked for a larger room because my stay was originally planned for 8 days and I needed room for my clothes, shoes, etc. It was downright perfect in size.As a born and bred New Yorker with 35 years experience living in the city (now living in California) I can say with confidence that the NYLO is situated in what is probably the best spot in the entire city. It's on the upper west side, which is a residential area surrounded by the most iconic buildings and architectural wonders. It is perfectly situated for a short walk to central park, and if you stroll through the park to 5th Ave., you will find yourself at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Also within walking distance from the hotel are The Museum of Natural History, Lincoln Center, the famous Beacon Theater and some of the best shopping and restaurants. It’s also convenient to every major attraction in the city by subway. Across the street on Broadway is a grocery store with fruits, veggies, deli, bakery, appetizing section, international cheeses and your standard fresh, refrigerated and frozen food sections, and it's open 24/7. On the same street are two amazing bakeries, a coffee/bakery shop, and dry cleaners. Across on 77th and Broadway is a huge 24/7 CVS/Walgreen’s in case you forget something. As for the best feature of the hotel, that is a tie between the staff and the beds. I wasn't able to take anyone from the hotel home with me, altho I tried, but I found out that the beds are available for sale. We are in the process of purchasing one for our home. I suggest anyone looking to stay in the city check into the NYLO even for a night to see why everyone raves about the beds.I think it's worth mentioning that my stay at the NYLO was so wonderful, I changed my return flight and extended my stay for an extra 7 days. It just went by way too fast. Whether I was relaxing in the game room (replete with a lovely library and nightly chess wars and comfy chairs and couches), listening to the piano player or just talking to other guests in the bar area, it was an absolute joy to write home about. And just a friendly warning to the staff: I WILL BE BACK. This is now my new home away from home.

Hotel was exactly like advertised. 4 star and very welcoming! Modern feel from as soon as you step into the front door. Bar and restaurant are amazing. The staff is accommodating and the room was clean and perfect for our stay. Will definitely stay there again!!!

First the staff. When we checked in, there was one guest at the counter, and a hotel agent popped out and checked us in. We needed a refrigerator in the room (no mini-bar) and a gentleman named Patrick (call out!) brought it up and was able to find a space for it in the very, very small room by rearranging the furniture. We made the reservation through the hotel web site, but had to call to confirm late arrival. The call center was useless, but eventually we got through to the hotel front desk and they were very accommodating.The room was small - the king sized bed just about filled the entire space. The bathroom failed the "Throne Test" -- can you open and close the door while sitting on the throne? In this case no. However, there was a good amount of shelf space in the bathroom and the shower was decent. Actually, there was a fair amount of storage space in the room, little cubbies and shelves in the closet. Lighting in the bathroom was decent; ambient lighting in the room not so, although there were good reading lights.We asked for a quiet room and they gave us one with a view of the court yard. It was very quiet. Bed was comfortable.The room rate of $134 quickly escalated to $188 on check out with tax and an annoying "Urban Fee". This entitled us to a drink in the bar; internet access; and other things that really should be included in the room rate. However, unlike our last experience on Price Line - Name your own price, the "Urban Fee" was prominent on their web cite. In that case, my bid was accepted by WestHouse and only after it was accepted did I learn that there were mandatory fees. So much for Name Your Own Price!Location - if you want to be on the upper West Side it's great -- not too bad for Broadway, very good for Lincoln Center, Central Park and American Museum of Natural History. Not good if you want the East Side. In NYC there is so much variety that any hotel is well located for something.

The staff, from the front door, to the desk, to maintenance and housekeeping, are unfailingly polite and eager to help. My room overlooked Broadway, which is a treat, no matter the room size. I love, love the beds and bedding. Everything is impeccably clean, love the bathrooms! The Subway is on the next block, my favorite French patisserie is across the street, Luke's Lobster is around the corner, and I can walk to Central Park easily. This hotel is close to my son's apt., close to bus lines, and any number of good restaurants are a short walk away. This hotel is a short cab ride from Sloan Kettering, but so much more fun than staying on the Upper East Side. Staying here makes every cancer care recheck an opportunity for fun!

This was my first time staying at NYLO and I would definitely stay there again. Everyone is so friendly and polite and nothing is too much trouble. The bed was amazingly comfortable and I slept like a baby. We stayed in a standard room which was clean and actually bigger than I expected. My favourite aspect was that it's just a 5 minute walk to Central Park. :D

I was touring colleges with my daughter & we had to spend the night in the city. The hotel was convenient & the room was very comfortable. It was close to where we needed to go he next morning & they happily valet parked the car overnight. I'd stay there again.

Staff should be trained to respect customers, rooms must be cleaned everyday, service should be impeccable.We came to relax and we left more stressed than before.Such a bad experience, we definitely don't recommand it.

I have stayed exclusively on all trips to Ny for the last four years. The rooms atr comfortable, the staff helpful and the location is great. On this trip there was a free continental breakfast at the attached Serafina restaurant. The breakfast (muffin, croissant and coffee) was not particularly good and I skipped eating there the next two days. The place to eat on any stay is Red Farm and I heartedly recommend it.

We enjoyed this hotel very much, the mattress and pillows were wonderful, for me anyway. It has a VERY cool vibe. HOWEVER, on the 3rd day of our stay, a family with 3 small children moved in to the adjoining room. They were up at 6:00am and were VERY loud. We pounded on the door, no luck. We called the front desk, they sent someone up, with no results. We called again, they said whoever answered the door that they were going out. They did, but were back in 10 minutes and continued to be loud. We finally gave up. Two different staff asked me how our stay was, and I told them about the noise. Both of them said "You should have asked for a NON-adjoining room." Who thinks of THAT when making a reservation?? How about not giving me an adjoining room with a family of FIVE with THREE small children who are up at 6am?? And I got no offer of a credit for one of my 3 nights, or even a credit towards another stay. Nothing but advice after the fact essentially saying it was my fault for not being clear on the reservation, which actually was made by our son in law, who certainly wouldn't think of asking for non-adjoining either.

I have be attended by very helpful staff - clean and design hotel . Convenient with outlets and lots of place to have your breakfast around . I have been attended to Amado who has been helpful for my stay at the hotel .

This hotel offers everything a visitor needs with a boutique feel. We just love it. The employees are all very accommodating, gracious, and friendly. The rooms are impeccable and the beds are extremely comfortable. There are so many positives from the pet friendly environment to the best location. It's quiet but yet steps away from all the action. This is our go to hotel always.

Nice property centrally located in the UWS and close to transportation. Great alternative to the hustle and bustle of times square and lower Manhattan. Restaurants are abundant within steps of this hotel

Beautiful hotel in a great location. Love the 16th floor outdoor seating area. The bar in the lobby is cute and the bonus was the 2 complimentary drinks we received upon check in. The staff was so nice and accommodating! Only down side was there was nothing in the room to tell us where the ice machine was. It's located on the 12th floor.

I have stayed at the NYLO, New York City, before & my major complaint is that either the a/c or the heat, depending on the time of the year takes forever to adjust to a temperature that you can live with. If it was not for the engineer who kept coming up to the room to adjust the thermostat & put in new batteries, I don't know what we would have done. Also, I must point out that the Front Desk Manager that I spoke to several times before this stay was nice enough to upgrade us more than just one upgrade in order to make us feel more comfortable. The wood floors in these hotel rooms make the rooms very cold under foot, so I suggest a pair of heavy socks or slippers & a robe(which they do not provide). The hotel is very lively with a jumping bar scene, if that is what you are looking for, but nice large T.V. is helpful if you want to just "chill out" & rest. I will come back here again!!!

Very good hotel! All the employees were very friendly especially Ramona. Thanks for the excellent service. The rooms are spacious for New York. The room was clean, but the floor could be cleaner (especially in the corners). Rooms are not very quite (noise from electricity panel, house keeping, other guests on the same floor). Access to the terrace was not possible which should be fixed.

I've stayed at this hotel quite a few times in the past while visiting family. Great location, staff very helpful, rooms are clean & modern, & the the bathrooms are just what you would want... clean, modern & perfect. Lots of restaurants near by.

We were put on the 2nd floor with one small window that faced the inside of the building. There was almost no natural light. I don't need a big space but this room was incredibly tiny, hard to get around. The "king" bed was a queen. No phone in the room to call the front desk. Cheap wall paper of fake bricks on the wall that was pealing off. The bed looks cool but slides constantly leaving a hug gap between the mattress and the headboard. We asked for a new room, mentioning the lack of natural light, and the clerk argued with me that this room faced the street. Not true. Roof top deck was nice. There are enough other places to stay in NYC. I will not be going back. Disappointed all around.

A still pretty new hotel in a excellent location. Great view over the Hudson River from the upper floors. Good breakfast ( especially the yogurt). Very comfortable mattrasses. Friendly and attentiv employees.

First room was unacceptable and was embarrassingly dirty and filthy. Looks like it was never cleaned and there was no hot water and the pipes banged loudly.. Second room they moved us to was much better and we were quite pleased with it. If it weren't for the first room I would have rated overall stay higher at a 4.

What a great location on the Upper West side! We visited over Easter week and were concerned with crowds and congestion but found getting to and from the NYLO and getting around the city was a breeze. This hotel is funky, hip, cool, clean and very well run!!Jessie at the front desk was lovely upon arrival, she got us in our room at noon and provided us complimentary drink coupons for the bar, as well. Luke at concierge was extremely helpful, he gave us a map with the complete number of stops and transfers to get around on the subway. The entire hotel staff was friendly, professional and willing to assist us at every turn!We will stay here again our return.

This facility, location and service were top notch. the amenities were cozy and situated very well for frequent travelers. I would recommend this location to anyone traveling to NYC on business or leisure. Food and drinks in the downstairs lounge were great too.

Excellent hotel. Would highly recommend it. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The food in the attached restaurant was very good. The hotel was very clean and had everything that you would need to make it a great stay.
user_name:
Stephanie Lynn B
Kansas City, Missouri

review_body: the hotel is very clean and the rooms seemed recently renovated. Rooms are small but modern, new and very clean. Jennifer was very helpful and professional as we were preparing to attend a formal event. Cool lobby bar w/ nice vibe, lots of activity and people hanging out. Nice restaraunt attached to hotel; had a great breakfast the morning after! Several places to park close by. CVS across the street and several nice restaurants and shops across the street. very safe and nice area. Highly recommend NYLO.

Bait and switch room shenanigans at this hotel. There are too many options in NYC- skip it. Paid for one room with balcony and manager tried to force us into standard room. Unhelpful staff. But the hotel is clean

Very good choice for UWS business location and easy to cross the park to the UES too. Rooms are comfortable although on the small side of the equation. The only complaint I have is the noise level of the room air conditioner.

You never know what you are going to get but we stayed here because I knew of someone else, that is SUPER picky, that always booked at NYLO. I got the AAA rate it's still not cheap with all the taxes etc. but unless you can afford the Mandarin at Columbus Circle at 900 a night this is your best option. It is in the perfect location - you can walk to Lincoln Center but if you insist on a cab it's only about $6. Subway also easy and fast. The lobby is swanky and trendy and I am sure a spot for locals . It was usually buzzing and has a really cool atmosphere. We were greeted immediately and our bags were whisked away - so quickly I asked if the guy actually worked there. I thought maybe someone just caught us at the door and took off with ll our stuff! All staff were cordial and classy and dressed well. Most polite and got us checked in as early as possible for our 8 night stay! The room was a double deluxe and faced 77th - I think all of those size rooms face out. Noise level was low minus occasional siren and some construction in the morning but that is normal for NYC. Mostly did not hear our neighbors. Everyone staying there was well mannered and polite as well. There are 2 floors with outside seating areas. Nice to go up at night. We did not have time to try the restaurant but i hear it is good. CVS on the corner and a market across the street. They brought us a small fridge for our extended stay. They also have access to car service if you want a black car to the airport. It's not cheap but is an option. Most times we were greeted by door men as we entered and exited. Even at the elevator they all said hello each time and it seems very secure there. No riff raff trickling in. Smells good in the lobby too! Our double deluxe room was fine - the beds are insanely comfortable. Maybe seem a slightly smaller than a regular queen but 2 people can fit. Closet has ample space and plenty of places to put clothes away. Is a bit narrow but you can't have it all! Room was bright and modern. The bathroom was also modern. ZERO complaints about cleanliness ! This hotel does not feel old or janky in anyway. It feels totally modern and redone. Upon leaving I had left an ipad in the room- we came back a few hours later to claim our bags from storage and the ipad had been left with security by the cleaning crew. PHEW! There was also a safe in the room if you need it. The hotel had business people and families. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Our first interaction with NYLO staff was quite pleasant: the font desk person was very friendly and even (courtesy) laughed at my awful jokes. Check-in was easy and quick, and was accompanied by free drink tickets to the in-house bar.Located on the 6th floor, our room had a 'manhattan view': apartments and a fire station. Despite being across from the fire station, our room was very quiet. And they have really thick curtains (roll down) to block sunlight. The room itself had a queen sized bed, small desk, and a small closet: adequate room for 2. The beds are soft and mold themselves around you-it makes for such an amazing night of sleep! The room also has 'cubbies' for clothes instead of a traditional dresser-it worked just fine for us. The bathroom was equipped with a facial mirror and hairdryer etc...all the typical things one would need (also included in the room: iron, ironing board, coffee maker). The hotel itself is a quick walk to Central Park, the American Museum of Natural History, many cute bars/restaurants, and a CVS across the street. There's a Serafina attached to the NYLO that serves breakfast and lunch. And, don't worry, there's a Starbucks 2 blocks away!Getting to the NYLO is quite easy by the subway - take the 1 to 79th street- also, upon exiting the subway, look across the street for an original Bansky artwork piece..gotta love New York!
user_name:
PostcardPassenger
New York City, New York

review_body: Our stay showed that there are many hotels in this area with larger rooms and less pricey. This room was very small- two people could not pass at the foot of the bed and wall. The bathrooms were spacious, clean, and the towels were of good quality. We had no knowledge of green program, received no information from the front desk on check in.

Small rooms but it had everything. The hotel and rooms were updated and looked fresh. The staff was knowledgable and helpful. I paid under $180 with taxes and fees included. Not bad for New York City.

Really loved this place , close to our destination. Room was not quite as big as we thought it would be from the pictures we looked at on the site , but it was very clean , service was great and we were able to bring our little dog for an extra fee . We found parking that was free on some side streets close to the hotel . The hotel also had a little bit of a night life that was pleasant also , we would definitely stay here again .

Quick 2 night stay in April to visit some family in NYC. Had stayed here about 14 years ago when it was then called "On the Ave." There are not a whole lot of choices if you need to stay on the Upper West Side, but this place is fantastically located, A few blocks from Central Park, a few blocks from the subway, and restaurants and shops everywhere. Even if you don't have any special reason to be on the Upper West Side, this is a pretty ideal location.Not sure sure what kind of vibe the hotel is trying to give off, but I guess it's striving for some kind of hipster/industrial thing. The rooms are somewhat smallish, but they were clean. The bathrooms were smallish too, but again clean. Housekeeping was fine. Not to be nitpicky, but our sheets did have a few small stains on them which was slightly icky, but otherwise the rooms were fine. A little noisy in the morning - and we were on a high floor - but it's NYC and so I can't blame the hotel for that.Now, it seems that the front desk staff have taken the hipster theme a bit too far because they were some of the rudest, unwelcoming, and least interested people I have encountered at a hotel in some time. I'm sorry I had to bother them with a minor detail such a "checking in," or asking about how to get the valet parking, but I thought this was their job. Apparently I was either wrong, or I just wasn't getting whatever vibe they were trying to throw off, because I truly felt as if my mere presence - as a guest checking in - was an imposition to them. (Special shout out, however, to George the Bellman who - in contrast to the front desk staff - was especially helpful, attentive, informative, and pleasant). Overall, the stay was fine and the hotel is fine. I guess I just expect when you are paying this much for a room, the staff could actually act like they care that you are staying with them.

Picked the NYLO because it was about $80-$100 less expensive than other hotels I found, and I couldn't figure out why. I still can't. Everything was perfect, from the staff, to the design, to the room. Location great too.

I was in New York for a conference taking place at the Lincoln Center. NYLO was the perfect place to stay- nearby, easily acccessible to trains and right off Broadway street so plenty of shopping round the corner. The hotel room and bathroom were spanking clean and staff very helpful and friendly. They also give you a complimentary drink. Breakfast can be had next door, but beware - a fulll fledged brekkie with toast, tea or coffee bacon and eggs will be close to $30.Lovely place. I'd come back any time..

The Nylo has smallish but very well appointed rooms which are modern and very clean. Located a couple of blocks from the Natural History Museum and Central Park on the Upper West side it is ideally situated, not right in the middle of the tumult but close enough by either metro or a 15 minute walk through the park to 5th Avenue. This was our second visit and would stay again next time in NYC. Some good Deli's and restaurants in the neighbourhood too.

The staff were friendly and courteous. I was alone but cared for very well. I had a wonderful glass of red wine in the bar. The service for food was a bit slow but other than that, I have nothing to say about the service there. My room was very clean. I would certainly stay there again.

Very nice vibeRoom does however need more light as it's very dark.Gave us early check in and late check out.Nice little bar.Next door to a nice Italian restaurant.Great doorman.Housecleaning had left a dirty hand towel from prior room people - however accidents happen

NYLO New York is a hidden gem on Upper West side. Lovely décor greets you in lobby and lounge areas, while rooms are modern and very clean. It is a great place to stay and very affordable. The staff was generally very friendly and helpful and it is a very quiet hotel by any standard. Additionally, we felt very safe the whole time.

Having a daughter that lives on the Upper West Side, our hotel choices when visiting there are more limited than if we were booking in Midtown, but the NYLO is always a best bet. The rooms are spotless, the staff attentive, and the location excellent. This time we had a free continental breakfast at the adjoining Serafina restaurant and it was more than ample to get our morning off to a good start. My only complaint - and it's not really a complaint - was in regards to the voucher for free champagne or a "signature" cocktail. The signature cocktail was champagne with seltzer water, essentially watered-down champagne! But not a big deal. We'll definitely book the NYLO again and again.

Our courtyard room was so quiet we slept in a little in the morning. The marble bathroom was spa like and surprisingly roomy. Loved the Upper West Side location and convenience to family, subway and shopping!
user_name:
cpk27
New York City, New York

review_body: I just love this hotel! The staff is incredibly friendly, the room is sophisticated and fun and I feel right at home. I love the contemporary feel of the hotel And think the lobby and atmosphere is great. Was able to visit with friends in the lobby and they loved it as well. It's the best!

I stayed at hotel Nylo during March 2017. I was there from a Friday to a Sunday. The rooms are very well equipped for a weekend stay. I also like the on site bar - which was nicely fitted out. The whole hotel is very stylish and this does come at a price. As previously mentioned there is a resort fee which is payable on check out. This was the only thing that detracted from my stay. Lastly, the hotel is very conveniently located for trips to central park and museums

Nice hotel without pretense. I would definitely stay there again. The lobby had a nice bar and meeting area. The room was a bit small but very functional. Staff was nice. Good rates on the hotel website.

This is my third visit to this great hotel. The rooms are immaculate with comfortable and well-executed bedding, pillows, lighting, AC/heat and bathrooms. Staff is very friendly. Location is wonderful, especially if you want to stroll on the side blocks and be a part of a Manhattan neighborhood with brownstones and small restaurants. The hotel is blocks from museums and very close to the iconic Lincoln Center. Hop on the subway with a straight shot to Times Square in just minutes. This hotel provides great amenities in very small spaces- think West Elm decor meets cruise ship. Great value!

Hotel was excellent with clean rooms and nice lounge areas in lobby. It felt safe. Everything was smooth with our stay. We were able to check in early, which was much appreciated. When we needed help, we got service quickly. I highly recommend NYLO NYC.

The hotel is close to Central Park and the museums a short uber ride puts you in the thick of Times Square.... a quaint hotel bar with a sitting room. Don't expect a fantastic view from the room but inside it's great!

Front desk ladies not cordial. Construction going in front of Panoramic view rooms, construction workers watching in the morning, balcony dirty and well maintained, Alarm went off at 6 am (not set up by us)

It was not a superior double room. Too dark (there was a wall inferno of our window), bathroom needs some touch ups. The rest was ok. Desk stuff - not very helpful, door stuff - nice. Great location..............

my experience at NYLO so positive! I was struck by how friendly the staff was (especially AMADO going above and beyond to be helpful!) Room was spacious compared to many NYC hotels and love Serafina for food and bar for relaxing and drinks! Ill be back.

After a long drive to NYC we pulled up to NYLO, greeted by a friendly face and proceeded to check in. Lobby is very dark, bordering gothic but cozy with three area's - small bar, library, and lounge. Check in was quick! Room was standard NYC small - we had a double double meaning two double beds. Since we were rarely in the room to sleep it was fine. Beds were fantastic! On the 9th floor over looking 77th and noise was at a minimum. Did not care for bathroom set up with tiny shelfs and no vanity flat space! Tub showed signs of wear and needed reglazing. Location was fantastic! Subways great and bus on 72nd. Food on Amsterdam heading north was abundant. We usually stay midtown east but I am now converted!!!

Wifi didn't work making it frustrating to make reservations for Urber or dinner , room was small , no chair to relax in only a small bench , no mini fridge , the bed was awesome comfortable , only enough coffee for one cup per Person .

The staff here are very courteous and very helpful. Our room was very nice and we loved the shower. I recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NYC. Very good value for the price. I will be staying here again!

NYLO was clean and comfortable. Good location. Staff was professional and helpful. Check in and out was quick. We were given coupons for free drinks. The room was clean and a good size. Bed was very comfortable and nice, soft sheets.

Lovely hotel and work team always attention. perfect location, close to Columbus Circle and in a quite and local neighborhood. Nice bar at the lobby, good soup from Serafina restaurant and amazing bed. The only issue it was that there is no fridge in the room.

Check-in staff was as usual Rude and not Accommodating except for Romona who wasn't there this visit. Hotel check in staff is terrible. The staff who takes your bags in are very good. Nice bar and Great Location! Hallways & Room was not clean. Hallways had several stains on carpet and just looked very dirty! I have stayed there 6 times because the location is so good! But I don't think I will stay their again! You pay money and staff if terrible!

NYLO is my favorite hotel in NYC. The location makes it easy to move about town on foot and by cab. Very close to Central Park, AMNH and great restaurants. I've busted the city several times and stayed here the last two. It is my favorite hotel. Love the atmosphere and services.
user_name:
Kimberly Alliso... P
Fort Worth, Texas

review_body: NYLO has a very friendly and helpful staff, and very comfortable beds (the beds are wonderful! The sleeper sofa was not wonderful). Rooms with 2 queen beds were sold out so my family stayed in a room with a king bed and sleeper sofa. I will not hesitate to stay at NYLO again. However, I will avoid the sleeper sofa.

Visiting NYC for a week with my Dad and booked him the Loft. Fantastic panoramic views and great clean room with lots of light and fun modern decor. A gem on the upper west side, very close to Central Park and great restaurants, Lincoln Center.

I was charged an extra fee that I did not know of at booking. When I approached the front desk staff for clarification, not only did they not know the information, but they were rude, unhelpful and didn't try to find any solution to help me. My claim was unresolved.

Great location on upper west side near trains. Fantastic restaurants all around. Courteous staff in hotel, greeted by doorman who took bags inside to front desk. Unique setting, with a European feel. Very clean, and comfy beds. Serafina had great food, but the service there (for all the people working) is slow and inattentive, even indifferent. I ordered a fried egg on a roll with ham and cheese and was told I'd be charged separate for each item. Ok I said. They brought out 1 plate with a fried egg, 1 plate with ham (cold), 1 plate with cheese, and then 5 mins later the toasted bagel. Wtf? Small rooms and awkward spaces bathrooms. For the price it's certainly worth it. I would stay again.

Good location with lively lobby bar. I was expecting a cool and modern hotel but once we left the lobby, the rest of the property (rooms, corridors and elevators) was unimpressive and lacking any style or sophistication. I doubt I would return unless I had to be on the Upper West Side.

I have stayed at Nylo NYC several times and have always been pleased. The staff is very nice and go out of their way to offer assistance. The rooms are modern and I feel safe walking to the market late at night. I highly recommend it!

I would like the windows were clean. The room cleaning were very good, people very friendly, but my room windows were very dirty and in spite of a beautiful day, it was difficult to see outside very well.

High quality stay in upper Manhattan, good value overall. Easy access to market, starbucks. Decent neighbourhood. Walkable streets. Easy access to cvs. I don't know if there was a subway but used ride share

Great vibe, Asthetics. Careful thought to design, furnishings. Bar, food and even live music in lounge area -- and there is a separate library for reading, quiet conversation. Convenient location -- close to subway. Very good value

Stayed here on visit from U.K. Although a bit of distance from centre of Manhattan I was really pleased we chose it. Very close to Central Park for a pleasant walk down to midtown or 2 min walk to subway. Loads of restaurants and bars local. Hotel was clean and welcoming with a nice bar area. Staff were extremely helpful and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay

On the upper west side, close to local restaurants and some good shopping, not too far a walk to Central Park. Rooms were cool and trendy (lots of concrete!), but one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever had. For New York sightseeing for a first time it may be a bit far - but as this was my sixth time it was a great location in a fabulous city, and good for a weekend spent mainly in Central Park.Good internet and though not big like most hotel rooms in New York, a decent enough size.

We love New York -- we love NYLO. It's a great location, and every time we enter the hotel, it feels like our home away from home. We are warmly greeted by the staff -- as if we never left. We can't wait until our next stay!

This was the second time we have stayed at the NYLO in New York. The queen queen deluxe suite works perfectly for our family of four. The service from all of the staff was fantastic. We adore the location, restaurants, shopping, Central Park, subway close by and more. When we come back to NYC we will stay here again!

I enjoyed my three night stay with my husband and three teenagers. The staff is friendly, approachable, and responsive. My king sized bed was clean and comfortable, shower warm, and the room had all the amenities I needed. I liked the location, just off Broadway and within walking distance of the 79th Street Metro and the American Natural History Museum. There are numerous eating, entertainment, and shopping options within a 5-15 minute walk, including two French bakeries, a food market, salads, pizza (check out Freddie and Pepper's), Papaya's, Chinese food, juice bar, Marshalls, DSW, CVS, boutiques and more! If you don't mind walking, you can get to Columbus Circle within a 1/2 hour walk. The lobby area is unique and comfortable. We were offered a voucher for an adult welcome drink, a nice touch. There is a restaurant at the hotel, Serafina. My daughter and friends ate there and said it was just okay. It was high for my budget so I was content walking across the street to the French café. They offered a pastry and coffee for $5.00. There was a silent (meaning you wear headphones) movie offered in the hotel's library during my stay. It was part of a series of films, so ask about that if you're interested. If I could change anything, it would be the noise factor. Broadway is a busy street and the hotel is next to a busy fire station. Our room faced Broadway (#628, near elevator) so we got the brunt of the car horns and sirens. Ear plugs remedied this for me once I remembered I had them. If you're sensitive to noise, ask about the location of your room. In addition, I would have liked a mini fridge to store fruit, water, or leftovers. Finally, and this is rather "Goldilocks" of me, but the pillows were too soft! I should have asked if there was a firm pillow option.Overall, I enjoyed my stay and would return.

Your hotel is spacious, comfortable, and affordable! Great location! We were in visiting our daughter, and your hotel is only a few blocks from her apartment. Also, the American Museum of Natural History is within walking distance, which made it very convenient to walk back from the museum. The area that your hotel is located is bustling, and family oriented.

I wanted to stay an extra day because I enjoyed myself so much! The rooms are cozy and modern and for the prime location it wasn't too expensive! I'd definitely stay here again when I mm back in NY!!!

Recently stayed at NYLO for the first time at the recommendation of a friend. Fantastic room and view. Couldn't have been cleaner and the staff was helpful and friendly. Loved it and will be doing back soon.

We came in town to see the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show and decided to try a new hotel that we had never been to before...... and we had a great time! The small bar in the lobby of the NYLO has the perfect ambiance for chilling after a long day walking around the dog show!The staff was very attentive and the bartenders were very friendly - which is a must!We booked this hotel on a whim and how LUCKY we were that we did!We are coming back next year!

We have stayed here for years (;used to be Off Broadway). Staff and facility is terrific. Rooms can be small but comfortable or can get larger rooms that are really great. They serve a continental breakfast on some deals at ajoining Sarabeth restaurant. Location is fantastic. can walk to Columbus Circule. Take subway or bus just a perfect place for NYC.

First rate in all aspects and coming from an Hotel and Restaurant industry professional, that's high.From the moment we got out of our vehicle, we were met with a very competent and gracious staff at every step of the way. They were very helpful in familiarizing us with the location and traveling about.

I visited NYLO with my 2 teenage boys for 4 nights. The hotel itself is chic, the lobby and bar are smart and the rooms are stylish/functional. However, when requesting your room, be warned that the rooms that overlook 77th are opposite a fully functioning 24/7 fire station. I was surprised how little soundproofing all the rooms had - I could hear the conversation in the next door room word for word. I'm not sure if this was because there was the option of adjoining rooms- again, make sure you stipulate you don't want this.It was a nice hotel but I wouldn't say it was 5 star. The location is close to Central Park but still quite far from midtown and the village. We enjoyed our stay but I probably wouldn't return.

In the upper west side it is certainly one of th best choice. Rooms are small but nice, it is not too noisy; you have a good quality rest in a high end hotel. You can get good price on internet. the only caveat would be the breakfast that is part of the restaurant next door; it opens only at 7 and the service and the options are fine, but not great. that should be improved by a buffet style kind of things. I have been to the hotel 6 or 7 times, it was always fine

The hotel is cute and in good repair. Our suite was a bit spartan but did the job. Our main complaints were 1) a quirky shower that was impossible to find a "just right" temperature in, and 2) absolutely no information about costs for things like WiFi. There was also a very strong scent used that not all of us appreciated. But the upside was comfortable beds and the suite had a pull out couch. Note that the queen suite does not have a separate sleeping area, it's just got an added sitting area in a larger room. The price is pretty reasonable anyway. The location was great - our main goal was the natural history museum and it was an easy walk. Also very convenient to the subway to anywhere. This was our first trip to NY and overall I think it was a good choice.

PROS- Cool lobby area and bar. It's almost like walking into an Abercrombie store. - On the whole friendly and helpful staff- Good sized room for NYC and quirky/stylish decor and fittings & fixtures. - Large shower- Good location, about a block away from a subway station, which is served by 1 and 2 trains and can get you to most places directly or via a connecting train. - The room was clean and tidy and the cleaners did a good job at refreshing the room each day. - There is a CVS (a small supermarket to those who haven't heard of CVS) just across the street and a bigger market just across the avenue. CONS- Beware of the mandatory $25 a day facility fee, which is a hefty uplift if you're not expecting it. Other Tripadvisor reviewers have flagged the same issue and the hotel management have responded by stating they endeavour to make the fee clear in all booking channels. Unfortunately it wasn't clear to us at all which is extremely disappointing. As the fee is mandatory, to be truly transparent it should be included in the main advertised price - why have a separate (hidden) fee at all if it is mandatory? Having done some digging, the fee actually covers things like 'free' wifi, a welcome drink and a bottle of water in your room upon arrival. That being the case, guests should have the option of whether to purchase these goods/services and be charged accordingly. This was by far the biggest let down for us and I'm afraid any retort suggesting the charging is transparent is simply not true. - The shower is big but the shower pressure is low. - The quality of the room is generally good, but there are signs of wear and tear creeping in. Hopefully the hotel will keep on top of this. - New York is New York and it's noisy night and day. The Hotel is on Broadway and as you'd expect we heard sirens from time-to-time. The sirens were however somewhat more frequent than you'd expect and we learnt a few days into our stay there was what appears to be a fire station just across the street. Ask for a room at the back of the hotel if you're after some peace and quiet!SUMMARYOverall a good hotel, particularly if you're looking for something a little different / edgey! However, just make sure you take into account the 'hidden' daily facility fee when you're pricing it up, otherwise you may be in for an expensive shock!

The Hotel Trifecta... great location..great price ... great staff..The car service is great too..for airport transfers.. close to the subway....great shops in the area....walking distance from central park and hudson river!

Staff was pleasant. I was charged $80. above quote .. Room was quiet and comfortable mattress. Enjoyed drinks at the bar. Room design was smart. Toilet amenties we're adequate good bedding. And towels.

I have stayed at the NYLO several times. Great location just off Broadway at 77th, easy access to the subway, great lobby bar. The standard room is on the small side, but the beds are unbelievably comfortable! Very stylish place.

I've stayed here about four or five times now. I love the location and used to love pretty much everything about this hotel...until this last stay. The friendliness of the front desk staff was inconsistent this time. I got a couple of wonderful people and also a couple of grumpy and less than helpful workers.

Always enjoy staying there. The rooms are funky but simple. Nice but no unnecessary frills. Location for me is great. I like being in a neighborhood. Grocery store across the street is excellent. Attached restaurant is only ok.

I keep coming back here, this is probably my fourth or fifth time. Brought the dog. Always love it here. Lobby bar is comfy and low-key, room was clean and comfortable. Price was reasonable especially given upper west side.

The NYLO has a very cozy and comfortable seating area and bar near the reception. Warmly designed, it is a welcome departure from the huge lobbies of the other chains. Ideal for a theater night and enjoyment of the street fairs of the UWS on Spring days.

Crazy to spent so much money for thatYou explain the problem and it s normal for everybody It was so simple to say Please M Vieira come next week we make a special price for youIt will be niceBut nothing happenOnly Oh excuse us And if you need s hotel please call our website Like ok our hotel is not good for you please don t come againBut last time it was niceLast year si was in your hotel

Nice hotel friendly staff decent size rooms would definitely recommend to anyone visiting NY. Not bad location lots of bars and restaurants nearby. Takes about 40 minutes to walk to time square from NYLO near to Central Park.

NYLO was everything I could have asked for in a hotel: fun decor, live music in their lovely bar, super comfortable beds, very clean, valet parking, and in a spectacular location on the Upper West Side, right near everything you would need. They even open directly into Serafina restaurant next door, which was super helpful on a cold rainy evening. Didn't even have to step outside! Would absolutely stay here again.

Business travel has twice taken me to NYC, where my hosts put me up at NYLO. Each time, including this past weekend, I loved this boutique hotel. The room, while small, was very comfortable, with a terrific bed and a roomy bathroom with all the plush amenities. The lobby was comfortable and inviting, and the bar was fully stocked, even with my favorite liquor, Drambuie, which can be very hard to find. The staff always is friendly, especially in lining up transportation or pointing me around. Great location near Central Park and along the subway on Broadway.

I was put up in the hotel for a conference and was only there to sleep, so cannot comment on value or the hotel generally. I can say that the hotel in conveniently located two blocks from the subway, the check in and out was quick, and the staff friendly during my brief interaction with them. On the negative, my room was very small and looked out on a brick wall. However, it was clean, quiet, and the bed was comfortable. I wasn't wild about the decor, I found it too busy for such a small space, but then I'm an architect so probably fussier about these things. I did appreciate that it was a laminate floor and not carpeted. There is nothing grosser than hotel carpeting. So overall a good night's sleep at a convenient location in the lovely Upper West Side.
user_name:
ajm2167
New York City, New York

review_body: The location was good and the lobby was great. Lovely bar and music playing every evening.The rooms were clean, but small. The furniture was a bit quirky (reminded us of kids furniture from IKEA). The bathrooms could use updating.

Overall I had a great experience. This was a birthday night on the town, and I had a great night at the hotel. Lovely room, very spacious and clean. The bed was very comfortable and the heating and air conditioning was very accurate. The staff was also very polite and kind, and the waiter at the bar was also very sweet.
user_name:
Ludaa1988
New York City, New York

review_body: This was an 11th birthday trip for my daughter. PROS: This hotel was very clean, the rooms were modern, location was great but the price was a little high. CONS: Some of the amenities that brought me to this hotel were not available. Viewing decks- closed. Restaurants- not family-friendly. I definitely paid for this hotel for amenities such as those and I felt a little cheated when I got there. I felt like traveling with children was somewhat unwelcome here, as I didn't get a friendly vibe towards my family from any of the staff or desk personnel. the staff in the hotel advised me to get delivery to my room or go somewhere else to eat when I asked for a high chair. I won't be back.

Love it! Clean, new, clever. No carpet in guest rooms! Yay!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It's my new go-to hotel in NYC. Watch out for breakfast a Serafina. Don't let them seat you in the back. Ammonia fumes from the pizzeria next door are terrible. Dinner there was good, however.

Very close to the subway and easy to get to from Penn Station. Close by bars are within a short walking distance. We found the walk to the high line and central park very easy. Zabars was within a couple of blocks which is a nice place to eat breakfast and grab a cup of coffee.

I love the neighbourhood, NYLO staff is super friendly, the rooms are small but very comfortable and clean and the bed is super .....the bathroom was large and towels nice and all amenities good. Wifi free and fast ....there is a nice bar in the lobby but otherwise one can use Serafina for b/fast, lunch or dinner meetings and they have a coffee maker in the room.......It's definitely one of my favourite and reasonable hotels in the city.

Nice, comfortable an dclean rooms, well located hotel (by the subway station), friendly staff, quiet Neighborhood.- upper west side, 5 minute walk from central park. Good and reliable WiFi Great place to stay

Daughter had used this hotel when a broken foot kept her from climbing stairs to her apartment. Found it convenient, reliable, clean, with a great bed. Me, too. Very friendly staff. Minimalist decor. Very clean and easy to manage. Valet deal very helpful. Nice location. Excellent access to west side.

Love this place. Great location, pricing, staff. Attached restaurant is good too. Try for higher floor...better water pressure and temperatures. This has been our first choice for hotels for years. Lobby is comfortable with a "happening" bar!

I booked s panoramic deluxe room for a special occasion, I've been to New York a few times I was bringing someone who hadn't been & thought was a nice idea. Room was tiny & well it was a lovely view of the side of the building, asked to move but couldn't move us on the first night but moved for the days after, to a bigger room so questioned whether the first one they was even a duluxe, view was better, still wouldn't call it a panoramic room as view was blocked by another room. Balcony was nice but not much to see unless you wanted to look at a black roof. Staff were excellent and hotel nice, bar didn't open until 3 which confused me and confused me even more that on a Friday it didn't open until 4, bar service was slow that's when someone was actually behind the bar. Kept having to ask reception for a staff member to try and get a drink. Other then that hotel was nice, would I reccomend? I would say it's expensive for what it is and you could most definitely get somewhere bigger and nicer for the money.

We really enjoyed our stay at the NYLO. We were upgraded to a room with king size bed on arrival. It was a great room.,the bed was fantastic, and the facilities spot on. Really clean, and serviced every day. Huge TV, and the bathroom was superb. We were sad to leave.

Staff friendly, room we stayed at (corner one) was very spacious. Internet access was great and bar downstirs chilled. Easy access to metro and shops - next door there is a restaurant red farm which we HIGHLY recommend.

What can I say about this hotel other than AMAZING! We were given a free upgrade when arrived due to my birthday which was a great surprise. The ambiance of this hotel is very chilled, the decor was beautiful and the hotel was clean and very spacious for New York. I've stayed in New York quite a few times and the size of the rooms here are the best I've seen. Great location and subway 5 mins walk from the hotel. The bar serves amazing cocktails and we felt throughly looked after. What a fantastic hotel, we want to come back!! Thank-you for making my birthday such a memorable one.

Such a great hotel in all ways. Location near subway, restaurants, shopping and parks. The room was clean, spacious and QUIET!! I will definitely always stay here when I visit New York City. Don't hesitate to tip the housekeeping and doorman!

About as average a hotel as one can expect. Nothing fantastic. Probably could have referred to our room with 2 Queens as a regular room with 2 Queens, rather than a suite, which it is not. In my experience travelling, suites have a second actual room for sitting, watching TV, and eating. This "suite" had no such second room.

There is a valet for your car however not very helpful. He was busy therefore he told me to park my car at the parking garage across from the hotel. As it turns out, the garage was full and it took me an hour to find a parking garage. I was not happy. The front desk staff was pleasant. The room was average, comfortable. The hotel is centrally located so it was quite convenient. Overall it was fine.

recent stay at Nylo initially picked for location and price. But once there we were impressed with the staff and accomodations. A very short stay but we will be going back there whenever in NYC!! Could not have been happier.

Really nice and clean hotel in a nice and relaxed are! Friendly staff both at the front desk and cleaning! Happy faces everywhere!The room was big for being in NYC. The only thing we missed in the room was a refrigerator. Close to the metro and buses just around the corner. Short walk to Central Park and a lot of nice restaurants in the neighbourhood!

Love, love, love the NYLO! Have stayed here many times and it never disappoints! I look forward to my next visit! Great location, wonderful service, lovely rooms and convenient gym! Keeps the whole family happy!

Nice place & friendly people.The rooms are confortable, clean and well equipped.The restaurant beneath serves also good quality food and has a cordial welcome.I will return gladly for another trip in New York.

The room was clean. The beds were comfortable. It has sort of an industrial motif. The bathroom counters are stainless steel and the dressers are sort of like small lockers. The bar/lobby is cool and very inviting. Everyone was friendly. The concierge and doormen were helpful about arranging car service to the airport. It was in a great location for using the 1 train to get to mid-town and lower Manhattan. Also super convenient for walking to all the great restaurants on the Upper West Side and the Beacon Theatre. It's on 77th between Broadway and Amssterdam, just 2 short blocks from the 79th street station. Very close to Central park and the Natural History Museum. It's ideally situated. Cool little comedy club (Standup NY) just a block north. Would definitely stay here again.

Generally good hotel in great location. Only thing that let it down is their decision to use laminate floors in their rooms. My (professional) estimation is that they have not done this with adequate acoustic impact isolation. In layman' terms - if you have a heavy footed guest above you, then you are going to hear them. The thumper above me was only active in the morning, so it was okay, but it might have been different. Carpets may be harder to maintain, but there's a reason for them in this situation. For this reason I would not return to this hotel. For me, quietness is everything in a hotel.

This is very nice hotel ..clean, everything works, good staff.We stayed 5 days and not one complaint. The room was adequate size, with a decent bed.We liked the location which was across the street from drug store and very good market. Two blocks from the subway

My wife and I stayed over night after seeing Dawes at the Beacon Theater. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The room while small was very clean. We had a couple of drinks at the bar, the bartender Amy was great. Will stay here again in June for Jason Isbell.

The NYLO hotel is beautifully designed and luxurious. All of the hotel staff were very helpful and held themselves with the utmost professionalism. Will definitely be staying here again and look forward to coming back!
user_name:
alexisjaywashington
New York City, New York

review_body: great location a mere 2 blocks from the 1 metro stop. In fact, everything necessary is about 2 blocks from the hotel, including wonderful restaurants, bakeries, a great yarn store, and of course, Central Park and associated museums. The room was typically sized for NYC but clean, bright, and the mattress was exceptionally comfy!

The location is excellent and the hotel is lovely. Our room was perfect and we were facing Broadway as requested. With Zabar's right down the road and Central Park 2 streets away we love to come stay here when in NYC. However, the only disappointment this time was that we were told they would do their best to provide us with an early check in, but in fact, we didn't even get our room at check in time !! We waited for 2 1/2 hours in the lobby after having already ventured around NYC. We calmly expressed our frustration with the manager who then sent us a bottle of wine and his personal note with business card for any future problems or issues. This made us a feel a bit better but very disappointed. However, i would stay there again, they just need to work on their organization skills a bit better i think.

the hotel is one of the best i've been to in a while. the hotel was clean from top to bottom. the staff was very friendly to me. the rooms were very comfortable and made me feel like i was at home. i really recommend this hotel

The NYLO Hotel is in a great conivent location, the staff is friendly, the rooms are clean and my overall experience was great. I have stayed here 3 times before, everytime I have styled my experience has been great.

NYLO is always a fun place to stay when visiting New York. It's in the heart of the Upper West Side so it's a noisy, fast paced area. Easy to get around the city from here with buses, subways, etc. The bar in the lobby is cozy but needs a little more sophistication (like snacks with the drinks,) Nice rooms but usually a typical city view (not beautiful). Some of the front desk staff could be friendlier.
user_name:
Phyllis & Richa... K
Martha's Vineyard, United States

review_body: I loved our stay at the NYLO! I have stayed at a couple chains before but this was my first venture into a boutique hotel stay and loved every minute of it. I must start off by saying that this was by far the most QUIET hotel I have ever stayed at in NYC! I lived in NYC for years and was shocked at how I did not her one siren/taxi/tonk during my stay! The rooms were also very spacious for an NYC hotel! Added bonus - everyone was beyond friendly and they gave you a ticket for a free glass of champagne or cocktail upon arrival! I am already planning to stay here for my next visit in May! I stayed here with 2 girlfriends in the queen suite and they even raved about how nice it was and I did a great job picking the hotel - extra win!
user_name:
Megan M
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I stayed at the hotel on 03/24 and 3/25. The hotel has many good points and some minuses as well. First the downside. Rooms are very small. As in really really small. My room needed a fresh coat of paint as there were skid marks across some of the walls. The bathroom, glass, shower door had a large crack in it. The mattress was way too soft. I think the interior decor of the common areas and the rooms themselves need to be updated. The common areas are particularly dark. On the plus side, the location is ideal for shopping, eating, Central Park, and the Lincoln Center. The staff was friendly and well trained. The concierge was most helpful in giving us advice on how to get around. While small, the rooms were clean and the cleaning staff was friendly and helpful. A real plus is the hard wood floors. We chose a package that included a continental breakfast, which was not a bad value considering New York prices. In fact, the restaurant in the hotel, Serafina, was pretty good. It wasn't the best food I've ever eaten, but the quantity of food was impressive for the price paid, and the service was good.All in all this hotel is more like a 3.5, than a 4. It was not well appointed enough to be on that scale. However, it's selling points are its convenience, staff and overall good value. If you are looking for a weekend in NYC and need access to the upper west side, you should consider this place.

Family of fiveDouble queen room had plenty of space with two queen beds and a pull out couch… originally on lower floor but switched. Ask for a higher floor room with windows that look out onto Broadway! The lobby and bar scene was cozy but lively and fun and my three teenage boys loved the chessboard and the atmosphere. Easy access to subways and everything there is to do will definitely stay here again!

I have never written a review before, but I feel compelled to rave about the wonderful treatment I have received during my stay. A shout out to Jennifer, Vivek, Joana, Jessie, Jelani, Edwardo, Tasha and Ramona! Your kindness and welcoming made the circumstances which brought me to N.Y easier to manage. The room was very sheltered and quiet, which meant no view, but it had a vibe about it. I moved from another room on the 10th floor which had a joint room. NEVER do that! You feel as if they are there beside you. Location was fantastic, very clean room (I'm O.C.D about cleanliness, especially in a N.Y hotel...) and a lovely bathroom.The restaurant that provided our breakfast was pleasant to sit in and I loved the coffee/tea Keurig machine.It was a great combination of a comfortable bed, a quiet room and VERY helpful and lovely staff.It wasn't a financial bargain, but you get what you pay for, especially for Manhattan. I would stay there again in a heart beat if I find a good deal for June/ July.

Definitely recommend this hotel. The room (we had a Queen Double) was surprisingly spacious. I was traveling w/o my family-- but we would have comfortably fit my family of 5 in this room with floor space for my children to play. The decor is very current and the lobby is warm and inviting. I would stay here again for sure. The location was great-- close to a quick bite to eat and close to 2 different subway stations (one at 77W and one at 72W). It was an easy trip from here pretty much anywhere we wanted to go. We were able to check our bags with the bellman before our room was ready and then again after we checked out on our departure day. This was a huge help in that all of that baggage would have been such a pain to deal with in the city. Lastly, the beds were comfortable! And I have back issues--- so the bed is important to me. Great sleep!

Assigned a room with diaper smell and bad stuff in toilet. Hotel not at all speedy in attending to our request to check it out. Ended up changing room to much less desirable size and overall ambiance.

From the entrance and beyond, the hotel was clean, warm, & inviting. The staff was very friendly, but not in a robotic way. My husband & I enjoyed the quality & cleanliness of the room & it's furnishings. We will be back!

Nice property. Clean, well maintained. Rooms a bit small and bed takes up far too much space. Metal bathroom fixtures give it a "prison aesthetic" I don't like. Lobby library sitting area is nice and staff is helpful

Trendy and nice boutique hotel on the upper west side with nice bar and lounge. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The check-in process was excellent and the hotel gives out a voucher for a free at the hotel bar. The bar tender Anna was courteous and pleasant to chat with. Highly recommend the hotel. Reasonably priced.

Hotel is very nice. When you check in sometimes they are not so helpful and not nice and not accommodating. But Romona at check-in was excellent! Romona was accommodating and very nice and makes you feel welcome. The door men are also very good. Location is really the best for me and my family. Upper west side is very good location. Hotel bar has nice atmosphere. I have stayed at the NYLO 7 times and although I wish it was cheaper and wish most of the front desk employees were more accommodating, the hotel is still very nice .

Great location, pleasant and accommodating staff, clean and well maintained, reasonable price. Rooms are small but proportionate to price. We have been many times and are never disappointed. It is our go to hotel.

Very well located and excellent service. Staff was great and helpful.Comfortable beds.Cool lobby and bar with live music.Restaurant offers good options.Breakfast opens at 8am ( too late in my opinion).

No fridge available. Bring your own electric kettle! Staff is friendly with exceptionally good valet parking service. Very quiet and clean room with sunlight. Definitely go back with my dog and family.

I enjoyed my stay at NYLO tremendously. The rooms were clean and modern. The foot and drinks at the on-sight restaurants were great (if a bit pricey). The location was solid - Upper West Side, close to the subway system, close to the Natural History Museum and Central Park.

Nylo is a well-appointed, comfy + clean hotel, reasonably priced, and in a great location, with a kind and attentive staff, and friendly bar. It's very likely that i will return, and will definitely recommend to others.

Stayed just one night while in town for a concert at the Beacon Theater. Two minute walk to the theater. Staff was polite and helpful. Room was quite, comfortable and clean. Would stay again and would recommend.

Friendly staff, nice boutique hotel and animal friendly! They have a cozy lobby and bar as well as a full restaurant. The hotel is located within walking distance of Central Park and several museums. I've been staying there for years, ever since it was the On The Ave. Hotel. Much of the staff has been there for years, so it's always a friendly place to return. I would definitely recommend.

Fantastic from beginning to end. Great rates, comfy bed, great shower. My favorite part - a comfortable upscale lobby where you can hang out with friends, get some work done while having a drink or snack or just people watch. Could not be happier with my experience!
user_name:
Mary G
Los Angeles, United States

review_body: Second stay at the NYLO - staff, especially cleaning staff pleasant and helpful. Nice ambience - a cross between boutique and informal.WiFi could do with a boost - kept getting disconnected. Bed really comfortable! Pleasant atmosphere throughout hotel.
