Lobby area allows for lounging, playing chess, watching TV or setting up your laptop and working in one of the comfortable seating areas adjacent to the small bar with cafe style chairs and tables.

Comfortable beds, nice walk out patio. Air conditioner works. Overall,I was very impressed with the hotel. Staff were great. The ONLY problem is that if you are walking down Broadway, the hotel might be hard to find as it opens up on a side street. Wouldn't have been a problem if my phone had not died.

The common areas and bar downstairs were nice, I just feel the room didnt have much for how much I paid for it, 140-150 a night is really expensive for a room this small, that lacks amenities like a fridge, I've been in way better hotels for much cheaper, my stay here was a bit of a let down.

Hotel was nice location close to subways. Door staff was truly the most helpful. Desk staff, less than helpful. Steafina's restaurant attached to the hotel was very good. We did not find this hotel to be particularly occupant friendly.

NYLo is a modern hotel in a historic building on the Upper West Side. Great location, close to Central Park and Lincoln Center. Lovely open bar in lobby (which also includes a 'library' of sorts). Really great place to spend some time.

Staff communication skills and ability to quickly and effectively resolve major issues were poor. I've never experienced a situation like this where I was made to feel responsible for communicating the issue to SEVERAL staff members who continued to send me to other staff members- I didn't have the time or energy- ESPECIALLY to resolve an issue caused by staff negligence

Great location and easy access to subway. Close to Central Perk and Natural History Museum. Many restaurants and cafes nearby. Try Nice Matin, two blocks away for dinner. Lower floors can be noisy due to traffic, so ask for a room on a higher floor.

Helpful staff, large rooms so we stay here every visit. The beds are very comfortable as well.Location is fantastic, close to shopping and great food. Red Farm restaurant is delicious and right next door.

A better room than last time - there are no real services - furniture is juvenile and not quality - bed is good though - never cleared our terrace of snow - though we requested it - elevators are fast

NYLO was a great price for New York. I booked online beachside if the price and the pictures and was a bit worried about a bait and switch. It was a large, modern,clean, quiet room. The staff was absolutely helpful and professional.

I booked a one night reservation during the snow storm for work. The front desk was helpful. Did not use most of the amenities such as the bar or restaurant due to it being a one night business trip therefore I was unable to give it the full five stars

The facilities are excellent and the location and value is great. Every hotel employee we came in contact with was great and really aimed to please. The room was great and attractive and the lobby and public spaces are really cool, as is the lovably bar. I would gladly recommend this hotel to anyone I know traveling to New York City whether for tourism or business. The lobby restaurant "Sarafina" serves excellent Italian food, including great Pizza.
user_name:
heywardc2017
New York City, New York

review_body: The staff is rude, if you have any problem during your accomodation, its your problem, not them. They wanted to charge me again for and already prepaid night. Also if you want a two beds room, you have to paid a prepaid an upgrade, even if the room is exactly as any other.

Never stated upper west side when in NYC but that will be the destination and NYLO will be the hotel from now on. I'd give the bed a "12" if the rating went that high. Wonderful ambience with sitting and working areas off lobby. Great neighborhood- lots of restaurants, close to park.

I've been in the hospitality business for many years, and on a recent business trip to NYC, I booked a room for two nights at NYLO. The location was close to my office so it worked perfectly, staff was cheerful, considerate and generous. I'd requested a high floor, and Ramona made my trip! She organized a beautiful room for me, and the rest of the staff was just as cheerful and helpful. I will continue to stay here on future trips to NYC. The experience of great service is something that transports a guest to another place. For me, after two 18 hour days on a business trip, Ramona and the rest of the staff, transported me to feel right at home.

Well appointed and welcoming, the Nylo Hotel offers choice accommodations in my favorite NYC neighborhood. The rooms are lovely with well thought out space and light, amazingly comfortable beds, and plenty of common areas in which to gather with friends.

We stayed here for almost a week. The bar was cute and rooms were clean. The only downfall was that we stayed next to someone who lived in the hotel. She smoked and it stunk really bad. Location was great for us. I would stay here again as long as we weren't in the same room.

NYLO IS IN GREAT LOCATION. But front desk people could be nicer and more accommodating. Romona at check-in was the best! They should accommodate people who have stayed there a lot. The location for me is the best. And the door men are also excellent!

NYLO is my favorite place to stay in NYC. I love the location and the hotel itself is fantastic. This is my second time and not my last! Coming back in November and hope to book NYLO again! So much style and great staff!

Stayed for three nights and had a lovely time. Room was very nice. Bed was comfortable. Shower very good. Made extensive use of the public spaces in the lobby, which was a lot of fun. Good atmosphere. Good people watching. We had drinks and played games - scrabble, chess - and people watched. Bar service was friendly and attentive without being intrusive. The public gathering spaces on the first floor were needed, as the room, while very comfortable and nicely appointed, was too small to comfortably entertain a guest. Not a problem for us, but guests should be aware that the rooms are a great place to sleep, but not big enough to hang out with friends. Great location on the upper west side, where it can be difficult to find a nice hotel, and the price was extremely reasonable. No noise from other guests. Could hear street noise, but you're in Manhattan. That's going to happen. If you were wanting to sleep late on a weekday, the street noise might be a problem. Otherwise, it was just local color, part of being in the big city.

Decent hotel in convenient location at Broadway and 77th. They can't control smoking guests, though they promptly put us in new room. New room was nearly twice the first room, and we were pre-paid guests. So that was interesting.

I stayed here for one week in January 2017. The room is tiny, the bathroom just ok, the service pretty good. My room faced Broadway, so there was a lot of urban noise. I would stay here again because the bed was really comfortable and the rate I had then (about $200 per night) was reasonable for its location. Hey--you can't have everything, right? That said, I just looked at booking again for an upcoming trip, and the hotel has decided to add an "Urban Fee" that was an additional $20 per night. This is supposed to be for all of the things that they advertise as "included" (wi-fi, gym, etc), but have now decided to charge for. For a 7-night stay, that comes to $216. With NYC tax, hotel occupancy tax and the Urban Fee, the fees and taxes on this room came out to be nearly $500 for the week. Come on, Nylo! Really?? Your hotel really isn't that great to justify this kind of additional tax. So, I won't be staying there again. A shame, really, because I get to NYC every 2-3 months and really appreciate a comfortable bed.

The hotel rooms are small, but quite functional, and the staff was very helpful and courteous.I was disappointed that my room was not ready when I arrived at 9:30 pm, after a delayed flight. I'd made my reservation several weeks prior. I was told my bill would be discounted for my inconvenience, but it was not. Only other problem was they somehow erased our keys every day, so when we returned of an evening, we always had to get re-keyed. That was a hassle.

Pros: The location of this hotel is awesome. Very easy to walk the UWS, close to subways, walkable to the park; clean room; comfortable bed; good use of space in a city where space is at a premium; on-site bar with ample seating.Not-Pros: Walls are paper-thin. I expect noise when staying in a city (sirens, traffic and what not), but I was kept up all night for three consecutive nights by screaming babies in multiple rooms. I could hear entire conversations through the wall. if you are traveling with small children who cry, this is not the hotel for you. I am a relatively heavy sleeper and could not sleep through this noise. Additionally, management was very unaccommodating to a member of my group who had problems with her heat malfunctioning. She was made to stay in a sweltering room even though 12 rooms did not have occupants checked in as of midnight. I realize these issues were circumstantial and the actual hotel is a great value for Manhattan. But these issues certainly effected my experience and will make me think twice before booking here again.

My partner and I stayed at NYLO for 6 days in September 2016. We wanted to stay somewhere that was away from the hustle and bustle of place like Times Square but also wanted somewhere that offered a bit of character and fun. Hotel NYLO fitted that bill perfectly. The bar staff were all very friendly and only ever too happy to help with tips of where to go/what to do. The hotel room itself was very big - we had more than enough space and the decor was very nice. My only gripe was that there was no mini bar - though I'm sure that was a blessing in disguise!! The rooms were made up every day and we were provided with fresh bottles of water. The location is great if you like walking and exploring. Amsterdam Avenue is a great spot for the evening and just around the corner - as is Shake Shack!!!I can't comment on the food as we only ever drank in the bar but it always looked good!My only gripe is that it was advertised to us as having a rooftop bar - this isn't the case. The bar is on the ground floor but if you ask to have your drink in a plastic cup you can take it up to the roof terrace and enjoy the sunset up there. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and should I visit NYC again I would definitely consider staying here again.

Great location, great room and great deals for Canadians! We stayed for 4 nights and enjoyed every minute. Close to subway, groceries and lovely neighbourhood. I was traveling with 3 children and it met all our needs.

I have never written a review before, today I feel compelled to write one. I met my mom and sister in NYC for a girls' weekend to celebrate my mom's 75th birthday. I emailed and spoke to someone at the hotel earlier in week. I told them it was a special occasion and I gave my sister and mom's names, so that they would be able to check in if they arrived first. When my sister arrived, the woman at the desk refused to let me sister check in and was rude to her. The noise in the hotel was like nothing I've ever experienced. We heard the couple next door as if they were in our room. I mean, every sigh, barefoot step, and more. Very uncomfortable! There was a strange, loud noise that went on and off throughout the night. None of the three of us slept either night. The room itself was clean, the beds were comfortable, but I highly recommend you don't stay at NYLO!

Lived in this neighborhood for years but not until I moved did I learn about the nice little hotel finds like this. The room was clean, the price was right and the bed was super comfortable. Small room (to be expected) the lobby was lively and the staff accommodating. All in all I would recommend NYLO for a trip to the city if you are looking for a reasonable UWS place. Can't go wrong!

The lobby is trendy and fun but it is impossible to sleep in this hotel. The walls are paper thin and we could hear EVERYTHING in the rooms on both sides of us. There is also no carpet so we could heard every movement on the floors of our neighbors. Do not stay here.

Wow! We come to NYC often, but make the mistake of trying to stay close to the theaters. This time, we were in town for a family function and needed to stay on the Upper West Side. We picked Nylo from reviews. This place is great! The room we stayed in was a queen queen suite and was HUGE for NYC. The housekeeping staff was awesome. The bar is good. The two restaurants below are fantastic- I could eat at Red Farm every day. There is a CVS across the street and the subway stations are only a few blocks either way down or up Broadway. Central Park is a ten minute walk. Zabar's is a two minute walk and you can get great and inexpensive REAL NYC deli food there. Overall, we had much more space, much more fun, much better food and a much cheaper trip. I already booked three rooms for a May visit. My only complaint is the room was so large it got cold and we had to hike up the thermostat- how can that be a complaint in this city? Wish they had room fridges though. Excellent stay!

NYLO is in a great location, the rooms are clean and the staff very accomodating ! we've stayed in there twice and are planning our third visit soon ! We really liked the location as is it was walking distance to central park & time square..lots of good restaurants and cool little grocery stores.

The hotel is cozy, with a comforting and entertainment subtle setting. I loved it, they gave slippers, and the beds were large and comfortable. The restaurant next door was delicious and everything is with in reach. Near shopping, restaurants, the movie theater. Also the hotel has activities such as chess and movie nights. I loved my stay.

Good value on quiet street, I would say the hotel is quite clean and modern. It's a rather dark hotel without much natural sunlight but that is quite standard in NYC. Room size good (king suite) and amenities standard.The staff were very friendly helpful and courteous.The only annoyance was the automatic door close mechanisms on the suites. You can really hear them slam so if there is late night / early morning resident activity it will certainly disturb your sleep.I also received $80 in unexplained charges on my visa and no one called back to clarify.

The guy at the front desk was extremely slow, but the real problem was that he did not inform us as he should:1) the room we got was different from what we booked, but he did not even mention it; 2) I asked if i had paid in full, he nodded; but when I was checking out, I was charged "urban fees+taxes"(but I already paid taxes!!!). I hope they can be more honest and open about what the customers are getting and paying!!!

I stayed at NYLO in November. I had a great time with my family. It's a great location on the Upper West Side, just a 5 minute walk from central park where you can enjoy a morning run or walk. Subway station is super close. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were spacious enough, comfortable beds and clean. One of the best assets is the bar in the lobby. Great atmosphere, perfect to get a drink before or after going out to dinner. I had a feeling a lot of locals visited the bar as well, although it's not too crowded, which adds to the loveliness. I'd definitely come here again!

Great boutique hotel with plenty of character! It was even better that it was close to my job as I needed lodging during the snowstorm so that I could get to work. Check in was easy and the ambiance of the hotel was great! The decor was a combination of modern and old school charm. The beds were super comfy!! I plan on staying here again.
user_name:
msingleton2017
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel is nice, good bar, comfortable lobby. My reservation was supposed to include a $25 drink credit; the first staff person I asked about it said she didn't know what I was talking about; the second person explained very poorly how to use it and apparently I paid the bill wrong and thus could not be credited. He argued with me loudly on checkout and essentially told me I didn't know what I was talking about. A not so terrific end to the experience.

We went to NYC for a Bar Mitzvah and stayed for the blizzard. The hotel was warm, rooms comfortable and reasonably priced, and good to have a restaurant attached during to coldest times of day. But why not room service ?The staff is congenial and convivial and accommodating. Missing from the room - a comfortable chair to sit on rather than the bed. Regardless these small issues - we enjoyed our time on the UWS and environs.

We've stayed all over New York City and keep coming back to the NYLO. We tend to stay for at least a week--this was a ten day trip. Moved rooms after the first night--the first one was a "quiet" one--facing two brick walls, I dreamed we were overlooking a brick factory! Asked for something overlooking Broadway for the rest of the trip--If I'm going to be in New York, I want to be in New York!  Fabulous view, great light, minimal noise, spacious room, king bed, great desk, they even give you a little bed-desk. The furnishings are beautiful, a very Scandinavian sensibility. Decent hair dryer, nice PURE products. I got a great deal on an internet promotion from the hotel--$160 a night for the king room with the view. About as much as the air b and b we did last time and didn't like it as much. Really, who wants to cook in NYC? Though we did buy stuff at Fairway and keep it in the room. And rolls from Maison Kayser across the street--yum!Aside from the great guest rooms, the hotel has a happening lobby bar, warm, comfortable, full of interesting people. And the location is fantastic--the Upper West Side is a swell neighborhood, Amsterdam Ave and Columbus Ave. between 71st and 85th full of small restaurants, bars and cafes. Transit is perfect, the 72nd Street subway is an express stop, though there's also a station at 79 if you really hate to walk. Plus the 72nd and 86th street crosstown busses. Fantastic food so close. Maison Kayser, the great Parisian bakery, is right across the street, as is the Westside Market, and Fairway Market is on the way from the subway. Zabar's close by as well. Having stayed here once before, I'm starting to feel like it's "my" neighborhood. One tip, if you have to call and ask for a certain room, location etc., make sure you call the hotel itself and not their reservation line--who knows where that is, and there seems like there is at times a breakdown of communications.

I would definitely stay at NYLO whenever in NYC. Two excellent restaurants were attached to the hotel, as well as a nice little bar. I felt very safe and all of the employees were super friendly. My room overlooked Broadway which was very nice, but it was a little noisy at times. New Yorkers like to blow their car horns. The outside noise was not that bad and the view was worth it. Very comfortable and clean.

Took my wife for first visit to the city and had a great time, NYLO took care of us during the snow storm. Great service, brought us a fridge on request, good price, great location. Floors were a bit dirty that was my only complaint.
user_name:
mnh269
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel location is great with lots of bars and restaurants nearby. Rooms are small but comfortable and staff were helpful. It was frustrating though as machines in the gym were mostly out of order, and when we informed the reception they seemed aware but not willing to do anything about it. Then we checked out got our bill which included a $25 per day "urban charge" for the use of WiFi, gym and other hotel facilities! Half of which were broken! And listed as included in the booking fee. Unimpressed

Great hotel location. The mattress is very comfortable, I asked for the brand to see if we could purchase one for our home. Walking distance to MET, Museum of Nat History, Beacon Theater, Central Park (if the weather is warm) Will return 2017 Summer to experience the city in warm weather. Street noise can be an issue if you are directly on the 77th but that is NY.

It was fairly close to most of the places we went to. Easy to get a cab or uber. Nice warm atmosphere with very nice staff. The room was great, beautiful, spacious, & clean. Only thing negative is no microwave to heat up our food. Overall wonderful stay

From the minute we arrived until we walked out the door to the airport, our experience was amazing! The location is great! Restaurants and shopping are close, and the subway is just a few blocks away!

This was my second time at the NYLO. I liked it the first time, but liked it even more this second time. For the price and location, I don't think you can find a better hotel in NYC. Including fees and taxes, our average per night price was around $285. We booked a couple weeks in advance. That is a great price for NYC. At that price, you can't expect the Ritz, but this is a newly furnished and decorated place. It is not run down, although the furniture in the room is sparse, the rooms are good sized for NYC. This is a pet-friendly hotel, so the rooms have a composite (not carpet) floor. If you like carpet, don't stay here. Despite it being pet friendly, the rooms are very nice. Also, I didn't see many pets (a few small dogs). My only issue with the pet-friendly status is that I checked in at about 1:00 p.m., went to my room, and a dog was down the hall barking. It barked for the entire afternoon. If people have pets, the hotel should have their cell number so that the guest can be contacted if the pet is being disruptive.My only other criticism relates to the quality of beer at the bar. When we were there, they had Blue Moon, Sam Adams, and a Goose Island IPA. That's better than Bud Lite, but not much better. I would suggest some Bass, Harp and Guinness or some micro-brew beers. The lobby/lounge area is great. We spent a lot of time there every night, but I would have spent more time there if they had a better beer selection. In addition to the hotel being great, you can't beat this location. It is one block from the 1 train (79th Street), and about 3 blocks (72 Street) from the 1, 2 and 3 trains. You can get anywhere in the city very easily from this hotel. Times Square is only 5 minutes away. Plus, there is quite a bit of shopping on Broadway (especially around the 72nd Street station) and many, many bars and restaurants along Broadway and Amsterdam and all the side streets. We went to Stand Up NY, which is a comedy club a block away, and the show was better than anything we've seen at the bigger NYC clubs. Fish Tags is a block or two away -- great sea food, and one of my favorite bars anywhere (Fred's) is at 83rd and Amsterdam. There are so many great drinking and eating places within a few blocks of this hotel, and these are not touristy places. Again, will all the competing bars in the neighborhood, the hotel lounge needs to up its game on beer selection.Really though, I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The place fits me, but I can see were it may be too casual for some people. This feels like a homey place to me, it isn't swanky or lavish.

Great location that is convenient to transportation, restaurants, shopping, etc. Very close to where our family lives and we have stayed here several times. Bed very comfortable and very quiet -- at least on a cold winter weekend! Kind of a weird sink in bathroom with very little surface area to use while shaving, etc. Bathroom (shower and floor) could have been just a bit cleaner.

Perfect location and ambiance for enjoying Manhattan. Also, the mattress is sooo comfortable that not only did I sleep well, I am going to buy one of their mattresses too. Subway is a block away and Museums a short walk!

My go to hotel in NY. I've lost count how many times I've stayed here & there's a reason why. Fab location away from the chaos of Times Square. Rooms are decent size for UWS, always spotlessly clean. Staff are always super helpful & polite. Special shout out to the doorman Orlando whose happy, friendly manner no matter what time of day it is makes you feel welcome. Always ready with a big smile & a chat he makes you really feel like you are coming "home". A great asset to a great hotel!

Very nice hotel at a reasonable price by New York standards. The rooms are small but well designed and the lobby has a warm and friendly atmosphere. The west side neighborhood is close to Lincoln Center and easy access via public transportation to other parts of the city. There are many good restaurants nearby and Central Park is just a few blocks.

Also beds way too soft for people w back problems. Initial check in the staff was rude but manager lovely. Smell in room atrocious and had to move after 2 nights of terrible sleep. No accomodation given for inconvenience.

We were asked to share our trip details on social media to receive an upgrade to our room. We did so and were given a suite for the weekend. On the second day, the shower malfunctioned, giving me a scalding shower that I could barely stand long enough to rinse and being unusable for my wife. We were told that we would have to change rooms, but there were no more suites available and we were put in a much smaller room for the rest of our stay. I understand that problems arise, but I don't feel that the hotel did enough to accommodate our inconvenience. The problem with the shower was a malfunctioning mixer valve. This is a very quick fix for any experienced plumber and could have been repaired that day while allowing us to remain in the room. Packing again and moving mid trip and being given a lesser room were not part of a desirable vacation.

Just stayed the the NYLO New York City and it really added to our visit to New York. It is set in a really nice area of the city within a few minutes walk of the subway, so it was very easy to get uptown. Indeed central Park is only a couple of blocks away.The hotel itself was very welcoming with functional well appointed rooms and a large bed. I liked the style of the place - I am not sure but I would describe it as almost industrial with a heart - for and English man it was very "New York". The staff were fantastic and could not have been more helpful and the cost perfectly acceptable. For my budget it is my hotel of choice for all future visits

The hotel was exceptional. Located close to subway access and walking distance to Central Park, River side Park, Museums, etc. Close to Beacon Theater and exceptional restaurants. We would stay again!
user_name:
travelfun997
New York City, New York

review_body: A group of my girlfriends and I headed into NYC from Boston this past weekend and stayed at NYLO. We were super impressed. Although the rooms were a bit small, they were well equipped with everything we needed, clean, modern and beds/pillows were VERY comfortable. Lobby was lively and decor was hip and trendy. Food was great too and staff was super friendly. They even let us check in early (11am) after an exhausting 4 hour drive from Massachusetts. Restaurant next door was delicious "Red Farm", fresh, inventive Chinese cuisine. Add all this the really reasonable room rate and we definitely have a keeper in NYC. We'll absolutely be back!

Stayed at NYLO for 2 days while attending the Colbert show and concert at Beacon Theater. Great hotel that is updated. Comfortable beds good water pressure and friendly staff. Comfortable boutique style lobby and lounge area Restaurant Serfina is attached and great for breakfast and lunch. One block walk from the Beacon Theater.

I just return from a 9 nights stay together with my husband at NYLO.The overall experience was great. The superior room is in a good size especially for New York, it was very clean and quiet. The bed was very comfortable. The decor is a bit strange but that is a matter of taste.Big plus is the hotel bar which is nothing like the usual boring hotel's bars. It has a very cool ambience, it was always busy and there is good selection of wines and drinks as well as tasty food from the neighbor restaurant (which I also recommend by the way)But a few things did bather us; there isn’t a minibar in the rooms and all the glasses ware plastic cups, strange things for a 4 stars hotel. The water pressure in the shower wasn’t great too. However the main reason I give this hotel only 4 stares is because the hotel charges a fee of $25 per night for using utilities like the WiFi and the gym (that’s also includes the pool which is closed during the winter). I found it really rude to ask for such big amount of money for this kind of things even from people that didn’t use this services and especially when the pool is closed. I was actually thinking on refusing to pay but didn’t want to end my vacation on a bad note.

Comfortable cost effective place with a great location just a couple of blocks from the 79th street station on the subway. Reasonably easy to get to even from JFK by subway if one doesn't have lots of luggage and is familiar with changing subway lines with luggage- transfer to Jamaica, then the E to 42nd street and change to the 1 up to 79th street and walk a couple blocks to the hotel.  Rooms are clean, reasonably modern decor and beds are comfortable. Mistakenly left money behind in the room safe in a hurry leaving for the airport but hotel security later worked with us long distance to get it back to us via a friend

The hotel needs to renovate and invest in better quality beds. Terrible back pain. Also only one elevator per wing. Rest not really working. Grt location nice place but the bed and lack of elevators made this my last trip there. Sorry.

This is a really nice, modern hotel which is very happening and in a great location. The rooms are modern and clean, and there are always people hanging out in the very nice bar and lounge around reception - feels very hip and nice. Easy access to the great restaurants on Amsterdam and the subway to anywhere else in NYC.

I was in New York for a wedding on Upper West side and this hotel was perfect location. I was happy and surprised to be upgraded to a suite. The suite was new, clean and quiet. There was a snowstorm the next day so I loved being able to walk into Serafina without going outside to eat.  My only complaint was that I called for a bellman when leaving and he never showed. When I got downstairs, the bellman said no one told him.

Cool, clean and modern hotel. Great location a block away from subway and an easy walk to Central Park and restaurants. The lobby and bar are cozy and inviting. The staff was friendly and helpful. Amazing stay!

This is a wonderful hotel in a great section of NYC. Very clean, comfortable and friendly. I enjoyed myself even though I was there because my 92 year old mom was in a hospital nearby. Coming back to the hotel each night made me feel better. There are also plenty of great places to eat and shop nearby.

The hotel is a lively place with lots of activity in the lobby, bar and sitting areas. The rooms were modern but spare. The rooms were clean and the appliances/technologies in good working order. The hotel staff was not particularly responsive to requests for assistance.

Cozy, clean, hip, elegant. Excellent bed for a good night's rest. Very easy to get a cab. HIGHLY impressed that they let our exhausted selves check in early! Courteous hotel employees. Breakfast staff in Serafina were not so great. Slow service, nobody was friendly, but food was good. Would stay again.

Our recent trip to NY involved plans mostly on the west side of the city. The hotel was a great fit for that. Walking distance to Central Park and Natural History Museum as well as subway. The hotel itself was nice and had a lot of amenities (although we didn't visit the restaurants). One fairly significant complaint was that housekeeping didn't service our room during our 3 night stay. Our daughter napped in the late afternoons which left the room available all morning however no one ever came. After reporting this to an employee on our last night we got all new towels, our trash emptied, etc but it was definitely an odd and annoying service to not be consistent with.

I was in NY on business and the hotel was great! The room was big enough for work and the hotel was centrally located for my work and close enough to everyplace i needed to go to meet people. The staff were kind, helpful and friendly

price point is great (can't wait to try out the penthouse and loft suites), love the Serafina's downstairs attached to the hotel, would love a chance to try room service, gracious when you make booking mistakes, staff are friendly and helpful in person as well as over the phone, fun events hosted by the hotel, gorgeous lobby and perfect location.
user_name:
oling27
New York City, New York

review_body: Great quiet location, cute and hip hotel. Great bar area and casual lounge area. Lots of seating. Great decor. Extremely nice staff and fantastic rate. Arrived last min. Two double beds in comfortably sized room for 180.00 (inclusive of taxes)! Most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in. Recommend highly. Will go back

Repeat trip to the NYLO, great staff, great location and price. Gorgeous common areas at the NYLO. Inviting spaces & functional bedrooms with good beds. Love the connection to Serafina and good shopping nearby.

This hotel is trying very hard to please and it shows..,fun, hip, a lively lobby scene--nice rooms, very light..modern clean....very close to the subway too. All good....the two restaurants were good too.

Very pleasant boutique-style hotel. Room was very functional with lots of drawer and closet space. Have to lie on the floor to use the safe. Great bed. Bathroom quite small. Could hear neighbours like they were in your room. Cozy lobby and pleasant staff. Hotel restaurant is excellent. All in all it is an excellent hotel at a reasonable price. Right near a subway line.

No room service which was a down fall. The bed and sheets were amazing though. The patio of the Penthouse had furniture just thrown about and missing cushions. The fake brick wall in the the bedroom was peeling off the wall and the ottoman in the living room had what appeared to be a cigar burn in it. The shower was okay but the wand shower head was small and nothing amazing about it.

My favorite place to stay. Great location, close to park and museums. Staff is professional and responsive. Elevators can be slow. The rooms are clean and uncluttered. For the area, UWS, it's a good value. Although the rooms are simple the lobby is very cozy and comfortable, great place for a cocktail.

Very cool, chick, trendy hotel. Extremely clean and very nice. The room was smaller than expected but was very comfortable. Would come here again in a heartbeat! If you are in the area this is the place to stay.

I've stayed here before, and it does not disappoint! Great location, friendly staff, and the rooms, what a bargain for the space and the amazingly comfortable beds. Miss the coffee service @ the bar, gotta' say, I'm an espresso lover, and last time I had my fill whenever I wanted right at the cozy bar. Bring it back guys! Thanks, again, for a great stay

Best customer service I've had in any hotel. Incredibly comfortable bed and clean room. Loved my stay. The front desk was sympathetic to my Friday night experience at a terrible hotel and treated me and my guest wonderfully

Lobby is quite dreary and dark - has the feel of an old warehouse. Room was okay. A mix-up on our arrival had us waiting around for several hours, and no one at the desk was much help. A free drink was offered as a kind of smooth-over. Only the location is good. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

From the moment we stepped inside the Lobby we knew we'd made the right choice. Loved our room, bed was super comfortable and it had everything we needed. Bathroom was beautifully designed! Everyone was nice and professional.
user_name:
Elizabeth Y
key west, United States

review_body: I wanted to be close to Columbia University without spending a fortune. The NYLO was perfect. Their access to the subway and being just off Broadway made it incredibly convenient. The staff, from the doormen to the front desk to housekeeping, were attentive, professional and very accommodating. The lobby was hopping with live music on Friday night and a great place to sit and have a drink (AND, the free sangria or champagne coupons were a nice perk). Our room was well insulated and quiet, and the 2 bottles of water provided each day were appreciated. Although the room was on the smaller side, it really didn't matter as we were out and about most of the time. We will definitely return to the NYLO!!

Traveling from Nebraska to see our daughter in NYC who lives on 147th, this location was midway between her and the Times Square area. We stayed in one of the panoramic rooms. Unfortunately, weather was not our friend as our flight was delayed by a day, but our daughter used the room for that first night. It was very windy while in New York, so you couldn't stay out on the balcony other than to see if there was a view. Our room faced North, so if you looked closely to the left (west) you could see the Hudson, but looking east you could not see Central Park. We were in walking distance of the subway as well as the Natural History Museum, (but did not have time to visit it) and Central Park. We had stayed in New York hotels before, so knew they are small, especially the bathroom. The staff was friendly and the room was clean. I would stay there again.

My boyfriend and I enjoyed our two nights at the Nylo last weekend. Check in was easy, the room was clean and a decent size for NYC, the bar is cool. We had drinks and some food there one night. The room was quiet. I would definitely stay here again.

Perfect location for visiting our son on the upper west side. Small but very clean and well appointed room - VERY comfortable bed. Updated, clean and large bath. Lively and comfortable lobby spaces. Attentive and friendly staff.

Stayed at the NYLO for 7 night was great experienced for me. I was traveled NY and this hotel location is absolutely great with quiet town and facility(cvs, pharmacy, market etc.)was all around. Room status was great and housekeeping was perfect. BUT, my room was located right in front of construction site, So I couldn't open curtains because construction workers can see me. There is no privacy. (But they didn't work at night.) When I came back to my country and check my credit card statement, I was shocked about they charged me temporary payment without any notice. (I don't know about this temporary payment called. Maybe deposit. But they didn't actually charged me.) Even if it was deposit, 7 days for over 1200$? That's over than my original room price+resort(service)fee(7 night)! I claimed about it and they respond me it takes few times to solve the problem(because credit card information international interaction.) I can't understand this situation about this uncharged, holding 1200$. At least they notice about it at that time. Because of it, my credit card limit is exceed now(holding is also included my limit.)and my great experience is all gone.

Stayed at the nylo for 7 nights, good situation, good staff, the room was pleasant. The only negative point: the works outside the hotel, in the street, quite noisy. the subway was near and Central Park too.

From the very start my school district was told that you accepted checks from my school to cover the costs of my stay. We have used your hotel for numerous stays and conferences. When I arrived at the hotel on a Friday night I was told that they did not accept checks and had no record of the fact that the check and the tax exempt form were pre approved. I was told that I had to submit a credit card. I did not have one with me . I was told that the would accept the check this time , but needed a card to put on file for any additional charges and that I would not be charged for anything. I hesitated to give my debit card info . , but had no choice. Again , I was assured there would be no fees placed on my card. Unfortunately, that was not the case. I was charged the full amount to my debit card after submitting a check for full payment. I am a single mother with three children and I can not afford to have that money taken from my direct account . I have called three times since my stay and I was assured that the money would be refunded immediately . Three days later I have still not been reimbursed. It is extremely frustrating as our district has been staying at the NYLO for several years and have paid by check on numerous occasions. As much as I enjoyed your accommodations , we are reluctant to book with you again. I have an other conference coming in two weeks and would have liked to rebook with you , but am frustrated over how the situation has unfolded. Please advise.
user_name:
Colleen M
East Hampton, New York

review_body: I am usually greeted here with friendliness and professionalism but my last visit has taken my preference for NYLO when I stay to another level. My feedback and needs were exactly and professionally taken care of by Jesse at the front desk. When I arrive with specific requests because of usually long and tiring business travel Jesse always come through with a quiet and gracious smile and I want to let management know, Jesse, has gone above and beyond front desk attentiveness.
user_name:
JoyceB2486
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at NYLO. The room was surprisingly big for New York, and the bed very comfortable. Because it faced on to a courtyard, it was quiet most of the nights we were there, although the last night (Friday) was much noisier.The staff were helpful, and we enjoyed the complimentary drink on arrival in the nice bar area. However, they encouraged us to their car service to get to JFK airport, which was disappointing - it's about $10 cheaper to get a yellow cab, even taking tolls and tip into account.The hotel is in a great location for the American Museum of Natural History and Central Park. There's easy access to several subway lines, and we enjoyed walking downtown along Broadway too.

Hotel lobby is fun and active. It is suitable for adults and kids. Rooms for clean and fine is size. Employees were friendly and helpful. Hotel close to everything including subway. We enjoyed our visit and will definitely stay here again.

We have stayed at the NYLO many times. The location is fabulous as it is right in the center of the restaurants and shops of the Upper Westside of NYC. It is also close by Central Park and the Museum of Natural History. The rooms are adequate and the staff is friendly.

It's good that they offered to upgrade my room because I was going to stay for a week there. The rooms could definitely be cleaned better.I think they should have a minibar and a kettle in the rooms, too.

Stayed at the NYLO for three nights with my daughter while she visited Columbia. Great Location,Cozy bar and lounge area, Did n't have much extra time ate at the Serephina attached to hotel both nights worked out great.

I didn't know quite what to expect, but we were delighted with our stay. Loved the neighborhood, the staff were delightful, the rooms were great, and the restaurant next door was an added bonus. When we head back to NYC, we will definitely stay here again.

I recently stayed at the NYLO for my boyfriend's birthday - it was my first time booking a hotel by myself. The process of booking a room at the NYLO was very easy, and any time that I called with follow-up questions they happily answered them! When my boyfriend and I checked in the process took longer than expected (it took about 45 mins). I believe the room wasn't ready. However, the concierge gave us a complementary breakfast at a nearby restaurant to thank us for our patience. Later, he sent a bottle of champagne and custom chocolates up to our room. Those gestures are truly what made my experience at the NYLO noteworthy. They seem to genuinely care about the people who stay with them, and try to make everyone's stay as pleasant as possible. We were only there for one night, but I would absolutely stay there again and would recommend this hotel to my friends! A great find in NYC!

Despite excellent location (right on Broadway), poor view (bricks on all sides). There was low level noise in the room, but hallway noise was present (it is NYC). The bathroom had a terrible smell (shower curtain was wet and not dried properly, two other co-workers had the same issue) and the shower curtain had to be removed by me. Overall dirty (wall switches were too filthy to even touch). Free drink upon check-in but waited over 30 minutes for service from the bar, despite three requests. Check in staff and valet parking (65$) were adequate. Beds were GREAT.

A clean comfortable modern and well located hotel on the Upper West Side. The staff was uniformly excellent and Jessie in checking in and out was outstanding with her efficiency, kindness and warm hospitality. Our room upgrade was large,quiet, very clean and comfortable. The one disappointment was the $25/daily " Urban fee" supposedly to cover wi-if , fitness center and sundry other vague details. These should be either charged for on an a la carte basis or included and if necessary added to the reasonable daily room rate.

The room was spotless. The bed was concave. The noise from sirens from the fire station and construction site nearby interrupted our sleep many times each night of our stay. Visually the room was attractive. The staff were genuinely warm and kind.

My daughter and I stayed in the two queen bed suite which also had a sitting area and a large t.v. The beds were comfortable and the room cute and quiet. The black marble bathroom was also a nice size with a huge shower. While the hotel did not have room service, it was connected to Serafina, a delicious Italian which also served breakfast along with lunch and dinner. The location was also convenient to anyone needing to stay on the upper west side (77th and Broadway). Nylo also has a surprisingly lively bar scene (but not too much so) for anyone interested. I consider the hotel and room a good deal for the price (just under $200 per night with taxes, etc. included). My only complaints were: 1) We had two exposures from our windows, both of brick walls - very depressing. 2) When the air comes on at night (in our case it was for heat), it is incredibly loud and woke us up repeatedly. We actually considered turning the heat off altogether and using extra blankets so that we could sleep better. This is a problem that NYLO needs to fix.

I made a reservation with two beds for my parents, but it does not offered the room and gave the room with one bed. Even though I showed my itinerary that clearly says "two beds", it did not changed. I was really disappointed.
user_name:
kazu219
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a good hotel. The service at the bar was terrible. The bartender was nasty. I use this hotel a lot and the bartenders seem to always be mean. Get drinks elsewhere. Rooms are comfortable. Location is great. Employees are nice and courteous.

Very friendly and helpful staff, comfortable room, good price (for NYC!) and very good location; a pleasant bar and comfortable lounges. The associated restaurant, Serafina, was also good value. I ended up here by accident because my regular hotel in the area was full, but will likely return.

Very nice place, quiet and staff is very polite. After booking the room they send a voucher for a free room upgrade. They say it's not available when you try to use it. STOP offering things you can't give to people !! Under promise and over-deliver, don't tease us. Other then that its was great.

I generally stay in SoHo but was visiting a friend on the Upper West Side so I found NYLO. Love the place, and I think I will stay there from now on. The location is great - quiet and residential but still active enough to find anything you need nearby, and to find a taxi at night. It was a great size for me - not too big with throngs of guests, but not too small that you recognize everyone you walk by!The hotel lobby and bar is like a nice cozy living room with lots of different seating areas. Serafina is attached so you can count on good food. I stayed in a junior suite which was nice. The living room area wasn't very comfortable if you were planning on having more than a couple of friends. Decor was retro/modern. Lighting was good, lots of options for different levels of light with cool looking shades. Bathroom was spacious - nice fluffy towels and excellent quality toiletries that smelled so nice and fresh. Would have liked a towel rack. There is a hook on the back of the door but I like to use that for clothing. There is space for a rack but I think it's a design thing - they want it to look clean and simple. My only negative was that the shower tiles needed a good scrub - black tile shows everything.And that bed was the most comfortable I think I've ever slept in at a hotel!

I have seen NYLO often and visited the bar but never stated. This was an unexpected stay and I loved. Great bed! Great price. I will definitely recommend my family stay here when visiting NY. Close to Lincoln Center!
user_name:
leannv2017
New York City, New York

review_body: Spacious rooms and comfortable beds and great furnishings! Service with a smile. Great bar downstairs and jazz trio sometimes too. Great location and convenient to everything! I would stay here again! Italian restaurant downstairs as well. Doormen are great and will hail taxi and get your luggage!!

The staff is always friendly and helpful. I love the vibe of the lobby/bar area and the location - Upper West Side. Rooms are a good size and always clean. I highly recommend this hotel. This last visit, they even offered car service (for a fee) but it was convenient and cheaper than Uber/Taxi.

Very friendly staff and clean environment. Rooms are well appointed and free wifi is always welcome. Great value when compared with comparable hotels in the area. I would definitely recommend NYLO. The location can't be beat

I used the gym 3 times. Another customer noticed that 2 of the treadmills weren't working properly. Everything I used was fine. You should add some heavier dumbbells. No issue with room, other than reading lite on one side of headboard was out. I like the location & bar/lobby layout. This was my second visit. Thanks!
user_name:
Sean S
San Antonio, United States

review_body: This was a very well located, quiet and convenient hotel. The rooms are trim and clean and smartly designed. Naturally, the rooms are not huge, but they are an efficient use of space and fashionable. We were extremely satisfied by the friendly staff and the overall facilities. Even the workout room, while small, was well kept and quite functional.

The lobby of the hotel is really nice; however the room felt like a hostel. The pictures of the rooms on the website and other travel websites make the rooms look much nicer than they actually do. I thought it was overpriced for what you get.
user_name:
Katherine J
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I recently enjoyed the most pleasurable weekend at NYLO New York City. Beginning with the welcoming front door personnel, the entire staff was warm and friendly without being too sugary. Room was clean and comfortable. Bed...luscious. Friday evening lobby performing cover band doing Fleetwood Mac was SO MUCH FUN !! See you all on my next visit to NYC.

I loved how professional and accommodating the staff was! The hotel design is chic, modern and surrounded by great restaurants. I will definitely book again! The best part was that we were two blocks away from Central Park!

First of all I want to thank the great receptionist Jennifer and the doorman George who made our welcome so good after a long flight from the UK. Lovely people and gave us a wonderful start to our holiday.Their service remained fantastic every time we saw them.So onto the hotel itself.A warm and inviting reception and bar area made you feel at ease straight away.The room is small but clean and decorated nicely. The view was a brick wall, but it's new you'll and we were here for the city and not the hotel. The maid service was very good and the only thing missing from the room was a fridge which would have been really useful.The location is exceptional. Easy walk to 72nd or 79th subway and only a couple of blocks from Central Park. Nicely away from the noise of Times Square and alike.The bar is the one let down of the NYLO, expensive and and the service was poor but just a short walk to around 81st and Amsterdam / Columbus finds lots of good bars and food.As for food it was very good in the attached restaurant but again quite pricy. For breakfast take a walk down to 72nd, we loved Cafe 71 but there are other choices. Good value and food.Overall the hotel was exactly what we needed, nice room, good service, clean, good location and well priced.

I really liked the atmosphere at NYLO. The lobby was cozy and the room was cool. I loved the complimentary cocktails. I went with two teens and we really enjoyed the location. I would recommend this hotel highly.
user_name:
DianneMuendel
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel provides excellent accommodations at a great price. The rooms are very comfortable with wonderful beds. Hotel staff, especially in the bar, is fantastic. My second stay and I will definitely be back.

We stayed here for a little staycation and were pleasantly surprised. The staff was friendly, lobby bar pumping and decor great. The only constructive feedback I have is they need to do better with their wine list. I was craving a great glass of wine and I think JOSH was their best. Meh... Otherwise, I highly recommend.
user_name:
prisci9742
New York City, New York

review_body: I live in NYC and my mother has stayed here several times. I have tried to overlook the rude staff in the past, however, this time it was just intolerable. It began with my mother's room being "aired out" because someone had smoked in her room - however, they didn't tell her that and it smelled so horrible that she had to go down and wait in the lobby for hours for the smell to clear. The staff didn't offer to comp a night or give her another room. This was especially upsetting given that my mother is elderly, had checked in at night after a long flight, and was then forced to wait for a room that stank the entire time. The second major issue we had was regarding the charge on the credit card for incidentals. I realize that this is standard procedure. However, it was not clearly disclosed to my mother that her card would have a pending charge of $200 which was the limit on that card (the only one she brought). I paid for the room and I was happy to give my credit card, but they insisted that the card must be swipped in person. I have a 6 month old infant and i could not go to the hotel in person. When I explained the situation they were EXTREMELY rude and insisted that the charge would not be lifted until 5 DAYS AFTER check out. Again, this was not properly disclosed to my elderly mother who was surprised to find this out from her credit card company. Money is not an issue for me, and I understand that this is a standard policy. The issues were: It was not clearly disclosed to my mother AND the staff was EXTREMELY RUDE. Furthermore, nothing was offered to make my mother's stay more pleasant despite her being forced to wait for hours for a smoke-polluted room. The service and attitude of the staff is unacceptable. Absolutely horrible.
user_name:
Shalva W
New York City, New York

review_body: We had the most wonderful stay here. I had been in touch with the hotel to ask what I could get put in the room as a surprise for my partner (it was a big birthday) and the team upgraded our room which was a wonderful start to the holiday! The staff were friendly and knowledgeable and when we had a slight issue with our heating someone was up there taking a look at it within 30mins. The hotel is only two blocks from the subway which takes you right into the heart of everything, so was really easy to get about. The breakfast isn't the best I've had, but we weren't there for the breakfast - there was a great gluten free bakery up the road though and the Europan across the street do an awesome pastrami & swiss cheese bagel! Would absolutely recommend staying here and will do when we come back!

This is the second time I stayed at NYLO for business. My room was spacious, well kept, and my bed was very comfortable. I enjoyed having Serafina connected directly to the hotel. After a long day I could have a wonderful dinner, a nice glass of wine and then a good night's sleep. The location is also wonderful. There is a nearby subway and you can request a taxi right at the hotel. There is also a beautiful lounge and bar area. I grearlt enjoyed my stay second time around as much as my first.

Very clean and affordable rooms. The location is perfect with quick access to the subway. So convenient to have CVS 24 hour directly across the street as well as Serefina restaurant. Both CVS and the restaurant have super friendly employees. The has a cool and modern look with couches and a step down bar that is beautifully decorated and calming. I'm not sure where they get their music from but the playlists are amazing! You can sit in the "library" area where there is additional seating as well as tables if you need to sit and work on your laptop. We had issues early in our stay with amount of noise that we could hear from the adjoining room. Literally we could hear EVERYTHING! I took the matter to the front desk and they immediately searched for another room for us. When they saw they were booked the manager blocked off booking for the room next to us so that we wouldn't have to deal with the noise again!

Modern, clean, very friendly staff. Lobby and bar are fairly dark, but room was surprisingly large and bright. Good location if you're thing upper west side. Close to museums, plenty of dining options. Would definitely stay again

We had a great stay - took our adult kids aged 22,21 and 17. The bar downstairs was a great place to stop and have a drink - didn't feel like we were in a hotel. Really near the subway which we used endlessly.

My daughter and I stayed here on President's weekend. It is a warm and welcoming place with a bar area and piano. The room was renovated, contemporary and the bed was extremely comfortable!! I will definitely stay here again!

Originally booked for 1 night, and went for the Standard Room. I knew the room was very small, but all I really needed was a comfortable bed for the short stay.Arrived at the hotel late evening after a excruciating 15 hour trip, and the very friendly (Italian?) guy manning the desk checked me in, and upgraded me to what turned out to be a fantastic suite, larger than some apartments I've seen in NY. The suite had a nice, subtle modern design, plenty of storage space, a great sitting area, and most important, a large bedroom with a very comfortable bed. I really enjoyed my short stay and will definitely stay at the NYLO again.

This hotel is amazing !! The staff was super nice and the rooms are modern, beautiful and perfect for a weekend "staycation". The bed was very comfortable and overall the experience was great being in the heart of the city.

NYLO is a nice hotel... but good luck if you need a change of towels!It's in an amazing location in the Upper West Side, and is a modern and attractive hotel.The one downside? My wife and I had to call down and ask in person to literally three or four different people before we got a change of clean towels. Somehow we had missed our regularly scheduled room clean/towel change, and as a result we waited for about an hour and a half to get new, clean towels. Not a big deal, but annoying considering the hotel put me back about $900 for three nights...
user_name:
dmegalos
New York City, New York

review_body: While the noise between rooms was loud, the rooms themselves were bright and clean. The bed was very comfortable, to the point of noticing. This hotel is well located on the UWS. The lobby music was too loud, but the public spaces comfy and easy to enjoy.

Loved every minute of my stay including the staff. Very helpful and overall friendly. Got a room upgrade just because and that was fine by me and hotel was quiet, I will stay here again. I love the place.

Johnny Feb 22nd. When we arrived we were told we had to pay an extra $60 for 2 night for an amenity fee but we got a voucher for 2 free drinks at the bar. We used the voucher at the bar and the bartender states its only for sangria or champagne (we had 2 beers). She accepted it anyway, which was kind of her. Our bathtub was plugged and had hair in it. Our sink was plugged. The room was not clean, sticky stuff on the wall by the garbage can. Regarding the amenity fee, the clerk who checked us in stated it was in the contract or email, I looked back and couldn't find any record of it. It's not a lot of money and I'm not cheap, all about the principle of it.

Great place to stay when visiting family on the Upper West Side! Lots of shopping and restaurants close buy. I would stay here again.... room size is more toward a European model but enough space to be comfortable. Bathrooms are well organized and great shower. Best bed ever in a hotel.

They allow early check ins but you have to be there in person, hopefully they'll let us find out in via phone in the future. Location is perfect. Lot's of great places to walk nearby. Style was modern/hipster. Was cool to see dogs chillin out in the lobby while I played chess with my partner.

I really liked this hotel for the price!!! The hotel is in a great location. LOVED my room I had a panoramic king with balcony. The lighting in the room is so cool. Even the bottom of the bed lights up! This room has plenty of space and is on a higher floor. If this isn't available.. I would get the deluxe queens suite. Larger room and the one my friend had was on the corner. It was great. The standard room (which another friend had) was very small!!! Still cool features but not NEARLY as good as the other rooms. Staff is super nice. Lots of stuff nearby, CVS right across the street. It's really cozy and cute in the lobby. The bar is small but busy when it's open. My only complaint is that it doesn't open up in the afternoon and they don't have room service. But--- plenty of places to get food. Serafina is connected to the lobby. Just be aware that they have slow service and you can't order a mimosa until 11am. We were on a fun girls trip... so this was an issue for us when usually it would not be during my travel.

I had not heard of the NYLO when it turned up as a very moderately priced choice on the Upper West Side. It is about 10 blocks north of Lincoln Center, where I was going to the opera, a very pleasant walk in decent weather. The hotel is clean, modern in design (although not over the top). My room was of decent size for NYC. The neighborhood is filled with small places ideal for coffee and croissants or a light lunch. While the pricing was quite good for the quality and location of the hotel, they do impose a $25 "amenity fee," which seems to cover the "free" Wi-Fi and the fitness center, as well as a "complimentary" drink from the lounge in the lobby area. Even with this adjustment, the price was still quite good, but I found the fee concept annoying, especially since it doesn't show up in the online booking service I used, thereby defeating the ability to comparison shop based upon price.

We enjoyed a Saturday evening in a king size bedroom that had windows on both sides of the room. Which had beautiful views to look out the windows. Location of hotel was wonderful also. Would definitely recommend Hotel.
user_name:
cheryl563
New York City, New York

review_body: Room was OK and location is perfect. I was disapointed by the receipt : I was waiting my suitcase, it was dropped to the hotel on Thursday at 7 PM ... and I received it the day after, and only because I insisted...

The location is really cool, close to important neighborhoods , you can take a beautiful walk down Broadway and end up in Times Square. The hotel service has good, I asked for late checkout and they did help, I asked them for additional water and they didn't hesitate , it was an overall good experience

We stayed for two nights while seeing a show at the Beacon Theater. Great location, not only for the show, but for great eating and sightseeing within walking distance. And very quiet too! Hardly heard the streets at all. I usually stay at Hiltons or Marriotts for points addiction, but I'm so glad we tried this hotel. I much preferred staying at NYLO over a mid-town big brand hotel.

NYLO is a great find. Small, comfortable, very clean.Located in residential upper west side. Real neighborhood flavor but so close to the Park, shopping,metro,etc. excellent if you have plenty to do in the city and want a dependable anchor for a great night's sleep .

We enjoyed our stay - the staff were friendly, there's a decent bar and the room was very comfortable. I prefer a hotel which provides its own breakfast area rather than sends you to an attached restaurant. There is a 'resort fee' for which you get practically nothing and you just have to build it in to your costing.

Room at nylo was ok bed was nice but the room had a bad vent when the heat came on the vent rattled ever time .the bathroom was drafty . And the water pressure was really not good at all.this is a good deal for the money but you should still get more

We smoked on the balcony and got blamed for smoking in the room they gave us a warning so we stopped but we ended up still getting charged 250$ extra after we completely stopped. I understand if we were smoking in the room but we never did.
user_name:
P3179PNeduardog
New York City, New York

review_body: Pros: Basic hotel in a relatively quiet section of upper west side, so it was a great location but as far as the decor goes, it was kind of like sleeping over at IKEA.Cons: Paper thin walls, knew way too much about what my neighbors in the next room were up to

I have stayed at this NYLO property 7-8 times and had thus decided to stay there on my latest trip to NY. I had a big and very visible issue with the cleanliness of my room which I had to report to the front desk 4 times (twice in person) before it was taken care of. The people at the front desk were civil, not overly helpful, and felt absolutely no sense of responsibiity or need for compensation. It;s disappointing when a place gets lets its success go to its head and forgets that customers should be pampered not tolerated. I assume this will go unanswered...

The Nylo is on the Upper West Side and well situated if you are site-seeing or working. It is significantly less expensive than most hotels 20 blocks south. My room was quiet, clean and reasonably comfortable, although the mattress was too soft and well worn on one side.The phone in the room didn't work. I only use hotel land lines when I need to communicate with the front desk. I needed to do that several times on this trip so that was inconvenient. There also was not an information card in the room, so simple questions like when is checkout? required me to get dressed and go downstairs to ask (since my phone didn't work).The hotel charges a mandatory "urban fee" of $25 a day. This gets you wifi and a kehrig coffeemaker in the room. The fee is BS. They should just mark up the price.None the less, I would stay there again.

I surprised my boyfriend with 2 nights at at the NYLO for Vday and we both enjoyed our stay. Perfect for a short NYC getaway. The king sized bed was perhaps one of the most comfy I've ever slept on, and I also loved the decor of the lobby. Would consider staying again.

I stay here 4-6 times a year -- always great! It feels like home. Rooms are great -- staff so nice -- and just a nice upbeat lobby. Very convenient to public transportation and just a 10 minute walk to Central Park.

Excelent location. Hotel amenities were really good. Nice room and good service, all people there was kind. Breakfast not included but it's not a big problem. Central park and natural history museum were a few blocks forma the hotel

The hotel was clean and everyone was professional. The room itself was not impressive. It was very small, just enough room for the bed. Luckily that was all we needed for our stay in New York. Overall average.

While Nylo seems to be a little out of the way, there is a lot going on. It is just a couple of blocks from the Natural History Museum and Central Park with multiple restaurants and shops along the way. Great restaurants in the same building, great grocery across the street along with two French bakeries and Beard Papa (best cream puffs EVER!!). I had a room on 14th floor with a terrace which would have been nice had there not been snow and ice. The bed was wonderful and linens very nice. The room was small however, with only a desk chair and the bed for seating. Of course that wouldn't have been a problem if we could use the terrace area. There is no room service; after the fact I found out that the restaurant would deliver up if you ordered. There was also not a mini fridge, but when I asked they brought one up quickly.

The price was low (for New York), the room was large, the staff was friendly, the location was outstanding. Although the room rate was unusually low because it was mid-February, this hotel is now my go-to hotel in New York.

Reserved a stay of 14 nights one month ahead. Upon arrival my room was not available. Transferred in a suite dirty and cold. No newspapers available.Front desk and bar personnel chaotic and ineffective.

Superior rooms are very small. tea/coffee maker in room was nice. The hotel is located on line 1 and Broadway so very convenient. A bit impersonal but staff is professional. For the price, breakfast would have been nice.

I stay at this hotel frequently and am always pleased by the condition, service and location. The location can't be beat and the rooms are spacious and very comfortable--much larger than your usual NYC hotel room.

We loved this hotel. Inexpensive, friendly, cool bar, lovely beds. Rooms on the small size but that's NYC. Great residential neighbourhood - just beware it's not central but the subway links are great. We didn't eat in the hotel as we were visiting family but restaurants looked fun. Ground floor bar/lobby area was popular and busy. Would definitely return.

I stayed at NYLO for 2 nights in February. The staff was amazing, and the room was spotless with a comfortable bed and nice bathroom. I would highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again. Excellent value.

We have stayed st NYLO several times. Were upgraded to a loft from a panoramic room. It was spacious but had some issues. Door handle to balcony was busted and turned in a manner that we couldn't get out onto the balcony. We jiggled it enough and it went back to its right place, but could potentially lock you out there. The heat was erratic in our room and went from super cold to molten hot. There were holes in the window sill that might have had bolts in them originally. Cold air poured thru the holes. We were there during high winds so it was very noticeable, even making the lamp shades move. The last morning we were there, the bathroom sink produced rusty water. The bar in the closet to hang clothes on was not properly installed and kept falling. The loft is pricy and at that much money, these issues should be non existent.Staff were great, check in easy. Still love NYLO and will stay there again, but definitely needs a bit of maintenance on the room we had (1604).

Close to two subway stops making it an easy trip in from out of town. When I checked in, they provided a complimentary drink at the bar which was a nice way to wind down from my travels. My room was modern and clean and more spacious than some NY hotels I've stayed in. The bathroom was compact and definitely only room for 1 which was fine for me. A great French bakery across the street and plenty of shopping nearby. A great neighborhood-- I'll definitely be returning.

Stayed for two nights and was highly impressed. Upon arriving early to drop our bags off my girlfriend asked if we could check in early and we were instantly accommodated. We were also given complimentary drinks at LOCL. Loved the lobby area and the location close to the subway. Slept like a rock in their plush beds. Service was on point as well.

Wonderful hotel on the West Side, near lots of great restaurants and shopping and Lincoln Center. Close to transportation. Rooms are small, but well appointed. Beds are very comfortable Bar and lobby area are lovely, if a bit dark, even in daylight. It took awhile for the hot water to get hot, but once it did it stayed that way. Terrific prices. I would stay there again.

We chose this property based on price, other reviews and location. There aren't many hotels on the Upper West Side. The lobby was very pleasant and inviting, with a lounge and separate bar area. Check-in was effortless. The rooms were nicely done with modern, functional furniture. The bed was super comfortable and the floors were not carpeted, which I strongly prefer. The reading lights weren't working and it took two requests to get them fixed. Other than that, housekeeping was adequate. The value is fantastic and we would stay here again without hesitation. Its right by a subway stop for those people not familiar with NYC.

I have known this property from living in NYC for almost 18 years. Upon coming back to NYC I chose this hotel for location as I did not know the NYLO name, but I knew the building and I knew it was very solid.The NYLO NYC has really stepped it up. Rooms are quite modern, We had a king bed, but the room was a touch tight, but we were there for one night and not in the room that long.Nice bathroom, good amenities and the room was very quiet.Back next week and I have the Lifestyle Loft. We shall see how that works out.

Reliable and large rooms, beds are also comfortable. The reception/lobby area doubles as a popular bar, so it can get quite rowdy on weekend evenings . Street facing rooms can be a little loud at night.

This hotel was amazing, very clean with modern decor. My suite was very spacious and accommodated all my visiting guests to come by and hang out before our event. It was centrally located on the upper west, which was walking distance to my event.

NYLO was a great find. The location is excellent - couple of blocks from subway and Central Park with good restaurants and stores nearby. Cost was very reasonable for NYC and rooms/baths were clean. Double bed rooms were compact, but the rooms with 2 beds and deluxe suites very comfortable for a family. Only problem ( which was not major) was heat comes from ceiling which meant floors were chilly. Staff was VERY accommodating and helpful. Made stay very enjoyable. Would definately stay again.

I have stayed at various NYLO hotels and although the one in NYC doesn't have a rooftop pool like NYLO Southside in Dallas, it is still amazing. I love the rooms at the New York NYLO, and the customer service is excellent; they add to the vibe and experience of NYLO as they keep it cool, smooth and not trendy. Speaking of excellence, during my stay there I was so fortunate to have my needs and expectations exceeded by Jessica at the front desk. She was so knowledgeable and kind-addressing questions throughout my stay-as well as recommending an incredible place to eat (the chirping chicken-oh so delicious btw). New York is one of favorite places in part because of the consistent excellence in customer service I get at NYLO; if you're looking for a fantastic place to stay while visiting, I highly recommend NYLO. Thank you also to Luis, who also provided outstanding customer service during my stay. Until next time....take care ✌

I had a wonderfully relaxing stay here. The bed was fantastically comfortable...I didn't want to get out of it! The desk people were friendly and accommodating. I really enjoyed my complimentary cocktail! Nice touch. Good towels too!

Love the location and value. Nice rooms and bar. Definitely ask for room on higher floor and Broadway, not 77th because of fire station and construction. Do you're own research; concierge not helpful.

My bed had a dirty pillow case and a dirty comforter. There was trash under the bed and the room smelled vaguely like vomit. Not a pleasant room. The staff at the front desk are abrupt and don't smile.

This was a good value, and the room was quiet, and bed comfortable. Staff was helpful. There was a spill that hadn't been cleaned up on the desk, which was off putting, but I cleaned it up and the rest of the room was basically clean.

Checked in Late and was given a room that would make the South Pole look warm. I mean what type of hotel blasts their empty rooms at 51 Degrees. An hour later the heat only got up to 53. Second room was at 68 and didnt get past 70 until the am. They must put a governor on the heat. Second room was much nicer and service has been good.Here's my real beef with this hotel. When I checked in at the lobby, which competes with loud thumping bar music from the bar, the clerk had to scream to be heard. No Welcome to the hotel. No have you stayed here before and do you know about our restaurant. The only thing he did say was to be out be 11am and to give him the credit card. Nothing about using the internet. Or breakfast options at the hotel. Nothing in the room either. Strange. Other reviews confirm this flaw.The location is great. The price can't be beat for NY. But there appears to be a lack of effort to train the front desk team and provide info for their guests. The heating is definitely an issue and it takes about five minutes for the shower to warm up which I guess is typical for an older building.

I have been coming to this hotel for 10 years now. Love it and call it my Home Away from Home in NYC.Neighbor hood location is wonderful and access to all of NYC is just a block away at a subway station.Restaurant and Bar in the hotel is great as well.
user_name:
Barbara P
Chapel Hill, North Carolina

review_body: Our overnight stay was nearly perfect. Rooms were clean, views were great, bed was like a cloud. Didn't get much food but we tried the calamari by the bar and it was delicious. We received a complimentary drink upon arrival. It was limited but a cute was to start the mini vacation. Definitely will consider coming back.

My 1st time @ NYLO and it was very pleasurable. Staff was incredible check in and out a breeze. Location is awesome. There should have been info on the hotel in the room.. Nothing in the room abt hours of different areas in hotel or menus. Had to Google Serafina's menu. Don't waste money on Continental Breakfast.

It was a good location (near central park and the American Museum of Natural History). It is a bit out of the way from downtown Manhattan, however. The room was clean and the little gym was a nice addition.
Excelent place, bar, internetSmall roomBreakfast poorGood hotel, but is not good room and breakfast is poor.Hi technology.Good view!Good place and services is goodBeautifully bar in top building!
