Our luggages have been receptionned by the Hotel on Thu Feb2 7 pm but they have been given to us only on Friday 11 am, without any explanation. It's a big shame, we were really disappointed by the Hotel employees comportment.

The off-season price of $94/night (plus taxes) was amazing for NY, especially considering the fantastic location. Within blocks of the hotel there are countless terrific restaurants and one of the best natural history museums in the world. The room was clean and comfortable, and the front desk staff were extremely helpful. My only complaint is that the lobby scent (an increasingly popular thing these days) is unpleasant and far too strong. Reminds me of cheap air freshener.

the hotel location is amazing and the bar downstairs is also very nice with live music and nice people but the room we got was really really small and theres is no way of knowing it until you enter the room.

Rooms are nice and clean, and location is very convenient. Ever since the big remodel and name change from "On the Ave", the room furniture is too sparse and utilitarian. Also, bathrooms should have "Glasses" and not cheap plastic throw away cups.

This was my second time there. The beds and bedding are so comfortable... the rooms are clean and decorated nicely. I wouldn't stay anywhere else. Great location, great staff , great bar and great vibe.

The hotel was beautiful.dont get me wrong but the little Hispanic lady at the front desk is miserable sounds like she doesn't even like her job made ma and my friends me.uncomfortable like we couldn't afford to stay here at the end of the day her associate which was kind helped us with our credit card issue and got everything resolved with no issues

Generally a good hotel, but something happened such that breakfast was never available until 8 am -- too late! Otherwise things were good -- clean, quiet, good internet. I've stayed twice at this location. First time, the room was very small. This time it was much more comfortable. Overall, I would stay here again, but would sort out breakfast separately.

We were in one of the Skyline Suites, so we had a decent amount of space. There was a small sitting area, master bedroom and bath, plus an outdoor patio with a view of the Hudson River and New Jersey. Unfortunately we were there in February, so we couldn't use the outdoor space. In the summertime this would be a really sweet place to stay.It's a hipster hotel, so not quite my style, but everyone was friendly and helpful. The fitness room was small - I used it in the evening and had no problem, but I imagine it's very crowded at the morning rush hour.The hotel location is great. I like the neighborhood feel of the upper west side. Easy walking distance to the subway, central park, natural history museum, etc. I booked through a 3rd party and got a good rate. Just beware of the $25/day "Urban Fee" that will be automatically added to your bill.

Good Location and value. Nicely appointed hotel a few blocks from natural history museum, central park and subway. helpful staff. Rooms smallish (its NY) but nicely appointed. Busy location but room was quiet.

Im a 30 yr old male who was surprised with everything about this place.Highly recomend for any age and anyone with family. Close to a host of great thjngs the city has to offer. Staff was very helpful

Enjoyed the size of the clean, modern rooms, the friendly service and great location! Fabulous restaurants nearby but no room service which is a minus! Roomy library room for guests to gather but does not serve food.

Problems not resolved despite talking to wtaff several times. Room nice but too small. Called reception several times to fix window shades that were broken. No one came ever. Called to request for water. No one came. Went down to reception to ask for help. They said they would note everuthing down but I had to sleep witj no window shade and no water available.

Clean and comfortable,small but efficient rooms, Great bed. Fun design, Welcoming lobby and bar - fun to hang out in even if alone.Close to everything - shopping, pharmacy, subway - and easy to get an Uber. Staff was helpful and friendly.

NYLO as a wonderful choice. Good localization, near the AMNT Museum and Central Park walking distante. Two blocks from 79th Subway station. Cosy bedrooms, beautiful and clean, with free Wi-Fi. A very warm reception team was there to help. Hope to come back soon. My kids and I loved it!

Great location in the heart of the upper west side. Great restaurants and shopping abound in the neighborhood. Most comfortable beds ever. Cool little bar downstairs. Definitely a must stay in NYC. A block from the Beacon Theater.

Nice location and friendly staff. Housekeeping is super noisy in the mornings by banging the doors on the latch. Try not to get a connecting room because you definitely hear your neighbors through out the night.

The hotel is perfectly located, and a lovely designed chilled ambience. Beds were comfy and room clean. Bathroom a tad small but good enough for its use.Reception staff are a bit on the chilled out vibe, so maybe come across as rude but generally polite

This is our second time using this hotel. It has a great atmosphere, friendly staff, clean, and close to the subway as well as good restaurants, grocery stores, and Central Park. This trip we included valet parking which was worth the extra money.

Pleasant, clean, quality hotel. Close to the center, but just far enough from the hectic part of Manhattan. Worth the decent price tag. Have no complaints whatsoever. Would definitely stay there again.

It's very nice and comfy to stay at this hotel. The hotel and guest room was designed very well. It's very suitable for family or couple vacation to stay here. The location also very close to Central Park

We booked this hotel based on its reviews. However the experience did not meet expectations. The rooms and bathrooms were very small and facing brick walls and no view of the sky (we had to change rooms due to an accident related to first room design). The beds are very uncomfortable and poorly designed. Bathrooms are cramped and with very little space for storage. Reception staff not very attentive or friendly - assume one has to tip them heavily to get their attention. I would reccomend this hotel if on a budget and with limited expectations of a 4 star hotel.

One of the best hotels available on the upper west side...great location, contemporary look, clean, and no complaints The rooms are all nicely furnished and the beds and linens superb there is nothing that you can think of that isn't available in this hotel.

This was our 2nd trip to NYLO and this time we took the kids. We reserved a family suite which was perfect. It had two beds plus a sofa pull out which meant my son and daughter didn't have to share a bed (their least favorite part of travel). The room was spacious (even for non New York standards) and clean. The staff was extremely kind and even greeted my kids with two small stuffed animals upon arrival.Truly made their first visit to New York special. On our last day, my daughter said she didn't understand why we can't just move to New York. An UWS girl already!

Location was chosen for proximity to Lincoln center, we could walk there. Room was dark, faced on a concrete wall and felt stuffy. Staff was courteous and polite, enjoyed the businesses around the hotel.

Stayed while on a business trip for an engagement in the Bronx. Convenient to take cabs or Uber both morning and afternoon. This hotel has nice bar and lobby seating areas. I was in 14th floor and my room and view of the Hudson River were great. Balcony seating area that would be fun in summer. Only wish would be coffee in lobby and earlier breakfast availability but that did not detract from my score. Congratulations on a perfect concept!

We always stay at the NYLO when we go to NYC because it is clean, quiet, ideally located, has good places to eat and grocery stores nearby, and reasonably priced. The beds and pillows are very very comfortable.

This is a cute place in a great neighborhood. The room prices were great and service was prompt. It was very close to convenience stores, great restaurants, subway travel, and Central Park! It also had live music on Friday that was pretty good.

We have stayed at NYLO before and, despite the gazillion hotels available to us in NYC, we returned to NYLO because our first stay was so enjoyable. The location is perfect for people like us who want to enjoy Manhattan without the congestion and insanity of midtown and Times Sq. Just 3 blocks to Central Park, shopping, dining, and beautiful sites are literally right outside the door. The first time we stayed, we were given a decent sized room with a rooftop balcony and city view. This time around, we were given a regular room considerably smaller than our first and our view was of the rooms on the opposite side of the building. Not a big deal since we didn't plan on sunbathing or stargazing! Our only complaint is parking!! We had a Groupon for $38 for Icon parking which is a steal in the city but only 2 Icons were within 6 blocks (not a field day if you travel with lots of luggage). Spot Hero app had a few spots available but VERY pricey - $60/day+. We found one for $35 but 6 blocks away. I believe the hotel has valet service but I had already purchased the Groupon so we went with that. If you are driving in, either confirm with the front desk that they have valet (???) or make sure you have a parking space in the area.....otherwise...GOOD LUCK finding one!! THAT is not on the hotel, but be aware! We have not yet tried Serafina so we can't say anything about them, however we have tried the Meatball Factory on Amsterdam - FUNFUNFUN menu and great food!!! As for the NYLO...??? we will DEFINITELY be back again!!

Lovely hotel, comfy bed, nice people.. all you need for a city break.. but THIS AMENITY FEE? $64 bucks for both of us? charged when leaving, for what using their toilets? It was a little bit huh? If you need the $64 just add it to the original cost of the room and dont sell the room for less then charge this leaving it leaves a bad taste

I love staying at the Nylo. Been there twice and will return. My room this visit was very small. The bed took up most of the room. It was fine. There was still a desk. It served my purposes. I like the modern styling. The bar downstairs is a nice touch. They were also nice enough to hold my bag for the day after I checked out. I will return

When I travel to NYC, I always stay at the NYLO. I do so for many reasons. Firstly, the guys and gals who work there are utterly kind and helpful. Cris, one of the floor managers, helps me in every way; making computer print outs for business, directing me to the best subway station for my trips, even getting tea for my sick daughter. He is a doll and I told him I want him to be my son, since I have 2 daughters and no sons! I also love Danny and Orlando. Everyone who works there really is wonderful!The bar is probably my second favorite thing about the NYLO. It has a nice ambience about it; I love the lighting and how one side is higher than the other. Their cocktails are always good and I eat too many of their delicious little bar snacks. There is something about the bar which has an easy feeling and lends itself to talking to the interesting person sitting next to you.Lastly, did I mention the NYLO accepts dog guests? Personally, I have never brought my beasts, but any place who accepts dogs is okay by me! Dog is Love!
user_name:
Stephanie C
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Only negative is the "resort fee". Not sure what you get for the ~$24 extra a day!! Especially in the winter when you can't even access rooftop. Love location and most comfortable bed in NYC. Staff is very nice. Room size very nice.

We stayed at the NYLO for the second time, and were so happy once again with the clean, simple environment, nights of quiet sleep (on the corner of 77th and Broadway!), and a fabulous UWS location from which we could walk to family and friends, or grab the subway two blocks up. The rates at this time of year were perfect for the visit - honestly don't know if we could afford during high season, which is sad.

We've been here for a week, Saturday to Saturday for my 30th. Booked through Expedia. Stayed in room 821.The pros: good location, 2 blocks from the subway and v close to Central Park. Quirky bar with nice selection of drinks, and seems locals come here to the bar too, so nice to not be surrounded by just us tourists. We were given a token each for a glass of champagne when we checked in which was a nice touch. Under bed lights are cool! Bed was super comfy, good mattress and comfy pillows. (Side note is that the bed is very high up if you're like me and only just 5 ft! I felt like a toddler trying to climb up a mountain to get into it, but totally worth it, slept very well here). Room decor is nice, well lit inside room too. The cons: room was v small and we had 2 tiny tiny windows in the room which faced directly onto a brick wall about 2 feet away so we had no natural light at all while we were here unless you put the lights in the room on. We were suckered by the photos showing big windows on 2 or 3 walls of the room and great views of the city but nope, brick walls was what we got! The floor of the room was dusty and gritty when we checked in, under the bed was fluffy and dusty which we wouldn't have noticed I guess had it not been for the underbed lights. This didn't get any better through the week, though we did get clean towels through the week. Many of the power sockets in the room didn't work (2 on the right-side of the bed, couple by the door, one in the bathroom) but there are others to use so not a huge problem. Food in the bar is brought through from the adjoining Italian restaurant (Seraphina) - and we ate here a couple of times which was a mistake. We ordered calamari and sliders, waited an age for them to arrive and then both were absolutely stone cold. They must have sat on the pass somewhere for 10-15 mins once cooked while the hapless staff forgot to go and get them. I ordered a mojito and that too was a mistake - totally vile. Too tired to challenge it, having just landed from the UK so gave up. We gave the food another chance later in the week but had the same issues. Cold. Redeeming point here goes to Anna the barmaid, who made our cocktails the next time around and knows what she's doing. Overall: we would come back but wish we'd raised the issues. on their own they seemed small but soon stacked up and it spoiled the experience - i was there for my 30th and i wanted it to be perfect.

The location is wonderful and makes you feel as though you are living in a neighborhood. Easy access to subways, eateries, shops, movies, etc. Wonderful bar in the lobby. The staff were welcoming, warm and efficient. Great spot, but don't tell anyone!

Great value, great location ,great beds and great comfortable homey atmosphere. Highly recommended for vacation traveller who is ok being a little outside the hub of things. Just a short taxi ride to Times Square and or 5th and 57th

The hotel was very nice. Staff was great at check in,Door man very friendly and attentive. Near lots of stores and places to eat. NIce decor, loved the bar area. Very quite, great for a getaway, waliking distance of subway.

Nice hotel, decent rates, great location. I try to stay here when I can due to all of those factors, however, they are now sneaking in an additional "urban fee" which is taxed on top of the many other taxes ultimately making the original cost of the room untrue! The "urban fee" they told me covers the free wifi, the 2 waters in your room, and other things (which is not free if they are charging me with the urban fee). This is a new money grab which is disappointing and will most likely make me look for other hotels. I'd rather they be up front and honest about added fees like this than sneaking it in my bill during check out!

It was a long, long flight from New Zealand, a long cab ride from Newark and a wet, nasty night when I arrived at NYLO. I wasn’t prepared to be delighted at what I found, but I was. The bar area is cheery and vibrant and the lounge has nooks and crannies for conversation or playing chess. My room was so spotless and inviting it tempted me to not leave but the friendly atmosphere downstairs called to me. I loved my stay and will definitely go back.

Following a complete re-fit a few years back the NYLO (formerly On the Ave) is now a sleek modern hotel still obviously retaining its fantastic UWS location.Two blocks from 79th St local and five from 72nd St express subway this is a fantastic base to explore NYC away from the crazy amusement park feel of Times Square and surrounds. From NYLO you can still get some local experiences while having all the opportunity to access the tourist hotspots. Three blocks east is Central Park - probably the City's best feature.There's some good eating options close by, but better still, enjoy yourself jump on the subway and explore lower Manhattan or Brooklyn via the handy 2 and 3 trains.This was our eighth stay in this hotel since 2005 and generally we weren't disappointed, although reception staff we encountered could certainly be a little friendlier.

They definitely let you know when booking that the room was small. Not crazy small though. It's NYC after all, expectations should be no different. Clean, friendly, and accommodating. Loved the vibe and the lobby bar. Our room faced 77th and it was noisy (trash trucks were what I thought I was hearing). Overall, good value.

This is a great hotel. I highly recommend it! Rooms are not huge but big enough. Bed was comfortable. Hotel was cute. Received bar voucher upon arrival. Free bottled water! Quiet and clean. Great location.

Great hotel. The location is Upper Westside perfect. Very Clean and spacious- the most comfortable bed I've been in away from home in years! Pet friendly. Wonderful experience. It will be our choice again on our next trip to NYC.

From the moment we step from the cab in front of the NYLO, we are made to feel welcomed. No matter how long it has been since our last visit, we are recognized and greeted as returning guests. We will return ... soon!

We stayed at the NYLO this past weekend for three nights with our 10- & 14-year-old sons. The lobby and bar areas are fantastic, and the location cannot be beat. The rooms could use a little bit of TLC - but not a lot. They're mostly very clean (although there were a couple of stray hairs on the shower curtain) and in good repair (still, could use some paint touch-ups and tile refreshing in the shower/tub). Not a huge room, but not too small, either. Beds were a bit soft for us, but the climate control was great. The exterior windows could use a good washing, but it's NYC in the winter, so dirty windows were not a big surprise. Overall, though, I felt the room was clean and nicely designed. We were happy there. We appreciated the free champagne and the interior link to Serafina for a nice breakfast. The staff was gracious and helpful. We used the valet service, and that was great for us. All in all, a really nice option.

What a great stay, the bar vouchers were cool and the bar was very stylish and fun! The California King bed was the best part of the stay. Extremely comfortable, I fell asleep with the tv on without even noticing!

The hotel clearly has the potential to do better, on almost every level. Great location, lovely bar and door staff, but let down by the connection with the adjacent restaurant, lax cleaning standards, and slow inattentive reception/guest services. Despite all that, I'd be prepared to give NYLO another go, and would be surprised to see it get worse rather than better.

Stayed 3 nights on business at this upper west side boutique hotel. The hotel website promises a list of 'free" amenities including free wi-if, free water, free Keurig, welcome cocktail, etc. Then upon checkout you realize there was a $25.00 per day "Urban fee" which the desk clerk explains is to cover the water, wi-if, Keurig. I also bought a package that included a $25.00 bar credit, which somehow didn't show up on my printed receipt so I couldn't prove it. As a hotel, it is OK if you like tiny rooms, cement floors, gray everything, heat that doesn't heat, no where to open a suitcase, clueless bar tenders, and befuddling light switches, then this is the hotel for you. Beware false advertising and someone needs to alert the attorney general of New York about the deceptive practices.

The staff was extremely pleasant. The hotel is modern and fun. I love the neighborhood, it's quiet for NYC. The price was excellent as well with a welcome drink upon arrival! I will definitely staying at the Nylo hotel again.

I am a Starwood guy - plain and simple. I will go out of my way to stay at their properties anywhere in the world. And when I had to be in New York City for one night, I of course, looked at the Starwood options first. But most of them were either sold out for the night I needed, or were priced starting at $600/night. After doing a bit of research, I saw that the Nylo in NYC was offering an amazing special for $99/night. I'm not terribly price-sensitive, but having stayed at the Nylo in Dallas and knowing the style of the hotel, I couldn't pass up this deal.Arriving at the Nylo, I was immediately greeted by a friendly doorman who offered to take my bags. I didn't need his help, but the quick greeting was very welcome. I made my way into the stylish and hip lobby, with some great sitting areas and a nice bar, and found my way to the front desk. The guy who checked me in was nice and even accommodated a late check out for me. In my few interactions with the front desk during the stay, I felt that the staff were helpful, though, some were more friendly than others. The lobby was pretty busy and looked like a great place to hang out.My room was a standard king room and was pretty tiny with views of the surrounding buildings. Okay, I didn't pay a lot and don't have any status with this chain, so I get it. It felt a bit claustrophobic, BUT the style of the room is very modern and clean. The bed linens were very comfy and the bathroom was modern and well-maintained. It was a style very similar to the W hotels, which is what I'm mostly used to, though a bit less lavish. As it was NYC, I didn't spend a lot of time in the room, so the size wasn't such a big issue. I wished I had had more time at the hotel itself, but NYC is so exciting, it's hard to stay inside. I didn't utilize the gym, dining venue or bar, though the hotel had a great, cozy vibe. And the friendly guy with the beard working the bar was great to look at, as well as friendly, even though I didn't need anything while I was just waiting for my ride to the airport.I would definitely recommend this hotel. It's right in the middle of the Upper West Side, so there are more than enough great bars and restaurants in the area to stay busy. The Nylo is also just blocks from Central Park. Thanks for a nice stay!

Comfortable Rooms, reasonable rate, parking on site not too costly, service is efficient and reliable; this was our second stay- we will be back again. Convenient upper West Side location. Searfina Restazurant is great; my 21 year old daughter and I even enjoyed a great game of chess in the lobby/lounge.

NYLO is a very nice hotel with a great atmosphere and a good location. However, watch out for the "resort amenities" fee. My Expedia reservation clearly stated that the resort fee was included in my reservation, however the front desk tried to charge me the resort fee on checkout. In fact, they did charge it on checkout, over my objections and despite me showing them the reservation printout that said it was included. Expedia quickly refunded me the unauthorized charge, but the hotel's practices left a sour taste in my mouth.

After booking the room, we received an email asking if we would be interested in an upgrade. We decided to go for it and had to wait to see if we got it. In late December, we were emailed we got it and it would be an additional cost per night. The room was not an upgrade. This was my third stay here and the room was no different than any of the others I had been in, in fact, smaller, and the view was horrible, though they marketed it as a great veiw of the city.The week day customer service/front desk/manager was rude and unhelpful. Lots of issues when checking in as well. Will not be back and will spread the word. There are plenty other hotels in this city!

Great location - wonderful service. They allowed me to check in a few hours early without hesitation. We enjoyed the bar and the gathering spaces in the lobby. The room was very clean and quiet! i would not hesitate to stay there again.

I have stayed at the NYLO NYC several times and my experience is always top notch. The hotel is located in a nice neighborhood on the west side, and away from the congestion around the midtown area. There a many nice neighborhood restaurants nearby as well, and conveniently located to the subjway.

My daughter and I chose the NYLO because of the proximity to my sister's apartment. The room was quite small but fine for our needs. The hotel was very clean and the price was GREAT. If you need a bed on the Upper West Side - I would highly recommend the NYLO.

We truly loved the room. Nice, larger spaced room for NYC. Bed was comfy and extra pillows and blankets were promptly delivered upon our request. Nice little oatuobthst would definitely be enjoyable in the warmer months. The bathroom.... it was ok. The worst part of the bathroom experience was that the toilet kept running and running and running. My husband lifted the lid off a couple of things to stop the water running sound. That was quite annoying. The vibe is good in the hotel lobby area. Fun, lively bar. There are 2 restaurants to choose from, Serafina and Red Farm. Red Farm is the most interesting, incredible Chinese food that we have EVER eaten!! We can't speak for Serafina, as we did not have a meal there. For the price, location and size of the room, I would recommend!

Awesome location, hotel was clean, staff were friendly, informative and courteous. This was my wife and I 3rd stay at the hotel and we will return. The location is a good start with the sights that we were looking at.

Would've given them 5 stars if they would have arranged a baby bed for us rather then two double beds in a son called family room.The room should of had one double bed and enough room for a crib and a fridge to be called a family room that's standard especially if you consider yourself a 4 star hotel.Aside from that everything else was perfect!Very friendly staff and nice bar and lobby good for meetings and hanging out,can get a bit noisy on weekends and when there's a football game with loud volume.In general our week here was great would've been perfect with a baby bed!

Good hotel in great location. Nicely designed but it's showing its age. Our room had a leak in the bathroom ceiling that caused us problems, but the hotel accommodated our request for a room change and the new one was better. Take away message: Check the room carefully and if problems develop, ask to change rooms. Staff is great.
user_name:
ghgrubbs
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Moved daughter to NYC for internship. We had excellent location to many restaurants and shopping. We were on the go a lot and bed was great at night. Very clean and excellent staff. Would have loved a fridge and microwave but it worked out fine. Definitely return and stay again.

The hotel lobby is really striking and welcoming, it doesn't depict what the rooms are like as they are very modern in design and basic. The lobby is really quirky and had a nice atmosphere to sit and have a drink. Our room was clean, really comfy bed and had everything we needed for the kind of trip where you just need a room to sleep and shower in. The view was onto a brick wall so would not be somewhere you would want to spend any length of time.We had a few problems with the shower and heating not working properly, the shower pressure was poor and the room was cold until it was sorted out, fairly quickly I hasten to add.Staff were overall okay but not particularly friendly, just the vibe I picked up, if you want a decent coffee and wake early due to time zone insomnia don't expect room service or service in the lobby. You will be advised to go to the all night deli down the road, which I did, it's really not far but I still wasn't enamoured with walking about in the dark at 4 am.Location is good for for getting about.I have put separate review for Seraphina restaurant which is attached to hotel.

Excellent room and service. Comfortable bed, layout, best coffee and wifi. Third time that I stayed there will again. Rate it very high great location and restaurant late at night great pizza and service.
user_name:
omearam3
New York City, New York

review_body: Great bed, normal NYC small room but furnished nicely. Good shower with strong pressure, nice lobby bar, friendly staff and quick check in. Decent gym. NOISY DOORS. It is nice that the lobby is connected to Serafina restaurant. Nice stay and would repeat.

Hotel OK. Just make sure you check the room that they give you on a special rate. Low rate low-quality room . When you see a low rate they will give you the lowest rated rooms they have . You're never guaranteed the selection of the room that you choose . It depends what you're paying

Very friendly and helpful staff. Big room, comfy bed and nice towels. I purchased the valet package for 179 a night which included parking and a welcome drink. Great location with many great restaurants. Will for sure stay here again.

Great hotel which although not central is easy to get around from. Clean rooms with comfortable beds and bathroom. Coffee machine which was easy to use. Natural history museum and Central Park just down the road.

Staff are extremely helpful and accommodating,the location is great and the rooms are spacious,clean and modern.We requested the same room as our last visit and it was all sorted for us when we arrived. Double king deluxe room .

Overall good comfortable stay in great location.Staff were on friendly side except miscommunication when picking up dry cleaning service from front desk.The bathroom toilet seat and room flooring needed cleaning.... but that is the only negative that was able to fix.

Nice hotel, cool bar and lobby area. All the staff were friendly and helpful. The neighborhood was nice and had plenty of restaurants within walking distance, plus Central Park and the natural history museum were only a couple blocks away.

Been to NYLO ) Times in past year. From front desk to housekeeping to bartender to front door personnel, NYLO unsurpassed in quality and friendliness. Great location. A gem of a hotel. Will be back, for sure.

This is a gem, so much so that I'm afraid to share it. The location is great on the upper west side, and the rates are more than reasonable. The rooms are small, but perfectly well appointed, all modern and comfortable, with perhaps the coziness kingsize bed I've ever had in a hotel. The lobbies are also really great to relax in and visit, and the staff were great. Perfectly quiet, and just quite the find. I will stay here anytime I'm in New York.

Loved the NYLO - great location in upper west side. Rooms very nice and reasonable for this time of year. Bar/lounge very nice as well. Would stay again and highly recommend. The staff at front desk were very helpful.

The rates quoted may not be what you pay. Resort fees added an additional 30% to my costs. They call the fees "Urban" fees because all you get are urban myths of a resort. Stop the underhanded games. Hotel is okay but over priced after adding obligatory fees.

The only thing missing for me upon fist inspection was a mini fridge, but it's NYC and the food options were so plentiful in the end I didn't really miss having it. Fun, modern hotel with a personal feel and great staff. Ate at Serafina restaurant twice and it was great. Will stay here again!

It was the worst stay in a hotel in NYC experience. rooms were awful, bathrooms were dated, was no closet or drawer space . the first room I checked in did stink like fried fish!! then the second room, basically had no view and very small, I had to take it or wait another hour for a better room. I would never again make reservation through trip advisor , expedia and hotel.com is the way to go.

This is a really cool cozy and funky hotel on the West Side, a neighborhood without much to offer in hotels. Great bar. Adjacent to Serapin, another good bar, but not god restaurant. And adjacent to Red Farm, which is outstanding! Recently, it seems to be slipping. Doormen are slow to get to your car on 77th street, which is a challenge without assistance. Slow to open the door, even as they are standing there and you are loaded down with bags. I sense that they are just understaffed and maybe a bit under trained. Recently, our assigned room smelled so bad that we had them move us, which they were glad to do. NYLO has now added a $25 "Urban Fee". Simply put, it means that the prices advertised are not the prices at all and the actual price is $25 more. We disputed it purely on principle, and they took it off. We have heard others dispute it, without the same success. It comes across as sneaky and beneath such a good place with good people. We will still go back. But add $25 to any quoted rate and be ready to have your companion watch the car, while you try to find a doorman.

The room was big and clean, staff very friendly and helpful. A great time was had by all! The location is superb with great restaurants and cheap eats close by. Easy to navigate neighborhood close to public transport.

We have a son who lives in NY and he requested that we stay on the Upper West Side so that we were close to where he lives. We chose NYLO. It was a reasonable price. We had read the rooms were small-ish but we didn't mind that. We had 3 people in our room (parents, one 16-year old) and although it was small it was nice and we were comfortable. We were 2 blocks from the 1 Train, which made it easy to go to Midtown as well as to our son's apartment. The hotel is clean. The concierge was helpful. The bar and sitting area was especially nice because it was cold outside and we did sit and use those. Also there are 2 restaurants attached to the hotel, which is very convenient. There is a CVS across the street. The beds were a little too soft, which made my back hurt, but it's hard to complain about a soft bed. It is noisy when emergency vehicles go by, which seemed kind of often, but you don't get street noise. It was convenient, clean and we enjoyed staying there.

Convenient valet parking. Very nice hotel. The bed was very comfortable. Very convenient from the West Side highway. Great restaurant (Red Farm) right around the corner. The bathroom was a little dusty and the stainless steel sink not completely clean.

Wonderful location and funky, lively vibe. Lobby area has nice bar and lots of cozy spaces to relax and spend time. Rooms were not overly spacious but very nice for the city. Would definitely return next time I'm in New York.

It was good. I'm being nit picky, but I just expected the decor to be a bit, shall we say coordinated. But if I'm arguing about the decor, that means everything else that you really look for in a hotel was more than satisfactory. As far as food options, it wasn't many on Broadway, but one block over on Amsterdam it was an abundance all within walking distance.

Perfect hotel for winter weekend. Staff let us check in early after arriving on a red eye flight and extended our check out when we left. Beds are amazingly comfortable. Location was ideal. Would definitely stay here again.

It was our first time at this hotel.We had a great experience. The bed was supper comfortable.The staff was very friendly.The room was clean and neat.Great view to the city.Cannot wait to visit again.

This hotel was very nice...great resturants with excellent food...friendly employees especially at the bar...I would definately return...The bed in this hotel was sooo comfy that I wanted to drag it out with me when I left!!! Very nice rooms even though they were small...still a very good choice for us.

My office recently put me up at this hotel for 3 nights. I hadn't heard of the hotel, but knew the area very well. My room was small and neat with ample space to hold my clothes and toiletries. The lobby area was in a constant festive mode. Added perks like a free drink at the bar, water bottles and a keurig in the room were a welcome surprise. The staff (from front desk to housekeeping) were warm and friendly. I would go back in a heartbeat and bring my family too.
user_name:
DCGirl1973
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Classic and Modern. I could live in this hotel. Style, form and function is the rule and all the staff is ready to assist. The room was great with ample stylish lighting and the furnishings were crisp and modern and comfortable. I wish I could have stayed longer.

Wonderful staff, great lobby vibe, wonderful restaurants connected to the hotel. The rooms are super clean, very comfortable and really well appointed. Totally cool interior design and not a detail missed. We stayed in a penthouse loft and deluxe double. Rooms were big and my 10 yr old loved them!!! An excellent surprise and I am a Four Seasons/ Ritz Carlton regular. Great stay.... you will be surprised by the amazing value!! Great neighborhood, safe, cool and convenient. Modern, fun, and wonderful staff!

I have been coming to NYLO for years but I'm increasingly irritated by the lack of any rewards scheme and now a RESORT FEE! For a hotel on the street in the upper west side of New York! I'm not saying I'll never come back but I am saying I'll be very wary of the hidden charges when comparing the price of NYLO to other perfectly nice hotels in the area. You should be too: twenty-eight hidden bucks a night will be added to your bill.
user_name:
CreditcardandID
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Our family of 4 stayed here and loved it! Loved the cozy lobby bar - it was hopping every night - and the room was decent sized for us. Great neighborhood - we got everywhere we needed to go via Uber. We walked to the Museum of Natural History. Lots of restaurant options. We would stay here again - it's off the beaten path, but easy to get everywhere!

My wife, daughter and I stayed at the hotel for a night last week on the recommendation of a Swiss friend who had stayed there earlier. The hotel is a small, modern one located on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, one of the coolest neighborhoods in the city. It is near Lincoln Center, and within relatively easy walking distance of the Broadway theatre.It is clean and modern, efficiently run, but has few amenities, which is understandble given its very reasonable proces.

Great lobby experience. Friendly and very helpful staff: I had a problem confirming that the property had received my company's 3rd party credit card authorization form, which they initially acknowledged getting but could not find upon my arrival and really would have gored my travel budget had we not straightened everything out. When I arrived, very knowledgeable and kind on-site managers took control of everything and the issue never came up again during my stay. Placing a formal complaint or going up the chain of command was never a thought because the front desk is calm, competent and accommodating. They took responsibility for the situation and made it go away. Thank you!I have to travel to the same part of NYC several times this year, and plan to stay at the NYLO every time, if possible.

Upper West Side location offers an ideal mix of urban energy and residential neighborhood amenities. Hotel is well run, with clean, comfortable, modern rooms and a welcoming lobby bar and lounge. We chose the cheapest room this time; it was small but fine for our purposes.Prices can be high at busy times. When shopping be aware of the obligatory and irritating "urban fee" of $25/night covering one drink and one bottle of water per person for the entire stay, plus wifi and fitness room, which are free to members at, for example, Kimptons.

Great hotel! We were in the city to visit family who didn't have room for us to stay there. The hotel was a perfect location and we were pleasantly surprised with the friendliness of the staff and the cleanliness of the hotel. No complaints whatsoever. Will definitely do it again

LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!! Close to restaurants, markets, shops on Broadway, Amsterdam Avenue, Columbus Avenue; easy walk to. Central Park is three avenues east, again easy walk. Enjoy being on the Upper Westside, than the Theatre District (too touristy and crowded). Our room was spacious and clean, than previous properties I've stayed (small, cubicle like).

The hotel lobby has a lounge feel with LOCL bar situated there. The hotel was an awesome price and not too far from broadway or midtown. There are probably closer locations but couldn't beat this price! We also got two complimentary drink tickets when we checked in which was a nice touch. The room was small but nothing out of the ordinary for NYC. The shower was really nice and the bed was super comfy! Probably not the best hotel for an extended stay but perfect for a couple nights. Stylish decorations and very clear clean.

A very nice hotel, friendly and helpful staff. The bed was my favourite part of my stay to be honest- extremely comfy! Was very nice to stay in Upper West Side as well. Would return for another stay here.

My family just had a wonderful weekend stay at the NYLO.Great Location & wonderful staff really added to our experience.I highly recommend this hotel because it is such a great value and a great experience.William54

I loved the place it was really comforting and i didnt want to leave the staff was very nice, and the over all experience was really good i would gladly come back here soon, and i will recomend it to my frienda

We flew to NYC on the 12th of January, landed to temperatures in the 60's. Come Friday it was 30 and snowing. But it was beautiful. We walked the four blocks to see our new granddaughter, to the Kosher deli and other shops near by. The hotel staff at NYLO were very friendly. The room was clean, comfortable and we had a great view, right on Broadway. I would highly recommend this hotel

Very well presented hotel, the cocktail bar was brilliant. My girlfriend and I will be back again!! Only down side would be the lack of knowledge regarding the roof terrace and getting to it. Great location being only a couple of blocks from Central Park!!!

Location is excellent, lobby is lively and beautiful , staff responsive. Have stayed here at least three times and this is a special location. Superb Westside market and CVS across the street are great. You can walk to Times Square. And the home neighborhood is safe and convenient.But it is the staff and care which is exceptional, which is the real raison d'etre for any hotel. Five star care at three star prices with pet friendly and valet service for vehicle. Decoration is top notch and the deluxe rooms and views are special indeed. Custom mattresses for NYLO are a cut above. Try one of the 15th or 16th floor rooms for a special treat and views.  The lobby and library sitting areas are great and hum with activity through the day and evening. Serafina restaurant in house offers very good breakfast and other meals. Staff will reasonably address issues including pricing and stay overs and are very kind. Thanks for another great stay.
user_name:
cooperwitz
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This hotel has a nice contemporary decoration and is close to many good restaurants. There are nice options for breakfast in the proximity but not at the site. The hotel is near the Museum of Natural History, convenient for families

A very pleasing and appealing atmosphere in an excellent location. Everything was well attended and found the staff helpful from beginning to end. They even arranged a hotel car for us at the last minute when uber was delayed. We had a great overall experience and would highly recommend. We look forward to returning to the NYLO.

A lovely hotel with a great bar and lounge area, very helpful staff and super clean rooms. Took my son for his 21st for a weeks stay and we got a free room upgrade.In a great location near my favourite coffee shop Zabars and a short walk into Central Park. Also very easy to get to by bus or subway. I would definitely stay here again if I get the chance.

The hotel was ok. The entrance has a few steps stair and when I first got in no one was there to help with my laguaje. The room was clean, beds where comfortable as was the bathroom. Staff was polite and helpful.
user_name:
carla r
Capital Federal District, Argentina

review_body: Perfect location, modern, comfortable accommodations, friendly & efficient staff & a great "hang out" lobby! We would definitely recommend to friends and stay again. Thanks for contributing to a great trip!

I found this hotel on kayak.com and it seemed like a good fit for me. I was just traveling to the city from central New York and my usual couch was unavailable. It was a good price for an Upper West Side hotel and a great location to multiple subway stops as well as great restaurants nearby. Simple room, but that's all I really needed. Nice staff. I didn't eat at the restaurant or bar in the hotel but they seemed busy whenever I passed by.

Perfect Location, easy access to everything you need including subway . The staff was beyond helpful and welcoming. The hotel is clean and everything well taken care of. No complaints, I can't recommend this place enough!

We went to NYC to see the Gustav Klimt exhibition at the Neue Gallery and wanted a Boutique hotel that we could stay and we found a winner. This place was everything and more than we expected to the awesome Local bar and comfy seats. the the incredible views from our terrace on the 15th floor. The staff was incredible!

Great location, clean & stylish room, friendly staff, super rates! Felt very safe as a solo female traveller. Easy access via subway/bus to all parts of the city. I loved walking across the park to the Met Breuer. Also the museum of natural history is an easy walk. Good restaurants all around, but the hotel restaurant has an excellent breakfast. Will definitely stay again.

Overall a great hotel. My one major piece of advice for NYLO would be to replace pillowcases with the kind that fully wrap around the pillow. As a hotel guest, no one wants the end of the pillow (which hundreds of people have previously slept on) slightly sticking out of the pillowcase. In my experience, the vast majority of good hotels use either large wrap-around pillowcases or put double pillowcase facing in opposite directions on their pillows. If you are a germaphobe like me, this is a hotel where you might want to bring your own pillow.

A very nice hotel, the location is amazing and only 2 blocks from the subway. Rooms are big and well equipped, the king size bed is amazing. There is a great bar at the lobby that provides you a great option for an evening drink. Would definitely recommend it

Great location, friendly staff, clean rooms, had no issues at all and really enjoyed our stay here. We did book on booking.com so got a great deal, not sure how much full price is but our deal was amaing for what we got.

I have been staying in the NYLO for the last two years and always enjoy it. The hotel has a great vibe with wonderful staff and clean comfortable rooms. The location is great as it is so close to the 1, 2 and 3 trains. Also a short walk from Central Park. I aways request a room on an upper floor with a street view.

We were very satisfied with everything from check in to check out. The only thing that was not that great was the service at the bar. Our waiter disappeared on us. The room and beds and the view from the 11 floor was real nice.

Went to NY for a quick overnight. Had a great stay a NYLO. All staff were friendly and helpful. Got to the city early and even though they were booked the night before, they were able to get us checked in earlier. Great bar/sitting area. Rooms were clean/beds comfortable. Would stay there again!

Super friendly staff, access to good food everywhere. The staff was very attentive and very good at informing me about parking and restaurants. The valet was very kind and helpful with my car. It felt very safe and comfortable.

Service was inattentive, the windows in the room literally allowed high winds blowing in and the vibrating from the HVAC was deafening........AND nothing was done about it. The ambiance at the lobby level was the only acceptable area.

Highly recommend staying at NYLO. The staff are efficient and helpful, the facilities are excellent and the location is perfect - felt very safe walking to/from subway at all hours. I will definitely be back.

King Size bed, big room, quiet location and minutes away from the subway. Great location for reaching all of the major attractions in a reasonable amount of time without staying around the chaos of Times Square or the major Avenue locations.

Quick trip to Beacon Theater . Nice rooms and beds.Great value,location and super nice staff. Although pet friendly neither saw or heard any.Only drawback was a tendency to leave housekeeping carts in the hallway too long. Will recommend and return.

We have stayed at NYLO (77thst.) several times. Check-in has always been much too time consuming. In the most recent instance we waited 10 minutes to be told our room was not ready and, later that day, waited an additional 15 minutes after being told that our room was available. No excuse for that in the middle of the afternoon. The situation at the front desk needs to be improved. More terminals? More employees? Better employees?

Modern, clean, and comfortable. The bar/lounge area is very cozy and the staff was helpful and nice. Room was a good size for NYC and I love that there is no carpet. My only complaint is that we had a terrible view (concrete wall) but we got the room on Groupon, so I didn't expect much. Short walk to park and museums, as well as many great restaurants. Great stay, would stay again.

First time visitor to NYLO which was recommended by a friend. Great boutique hotel. Great vibe. Staff was very accomodating and helpful. Neat sitting areas and bar which we ended up at every night. Walking distance to two subway stops and Central Park (and midtown). It rained pretty hard two days we were there. They had complimentary umbrellas available when we walked out. Nice touch. Rooms were very clean and nice. Typical small NYC hotel rooms. We'll be staying there the next time we visit NYC.

We stayed for two nights and would absolutely not hesitate staying there again. - Location is super convenient to amenities and the 79th street subway. (CVS across street and starbucks a few paces down)- You receive a free drink upon check in (draft beer which they have great choices, champagne, red or white house wine). The only downside is that they only offer Pinot Grigio as their white. Bar is lively and great place to hang out if you get in late. - Our room was big and bed was perfect. We stayed street side and while you could hear the traffic I didn't mind as I like a little white noise. There is a fire station next door so a few times during the night that was loud but not too loud. - HVAC system is loud when it is on but once again if you don't mind white noise it's not an issue. - Desk staff are helpful. The only issue we have which is a good tip - when we arrived to get our car in the morning it takes 45 min to hour. We were hoping to get on the road earlier. So note to yourself to call down for car before coming downstairs!!!!! They didn't mention this when we checked in. For kids they have games you can check out in the lobby which is fun. (or even adults)

My wife an I were excited to take a trip the city and were trying a new hotel. Check-in service was wonderful. The room was small, which was fine but it was very dusty!! All night long you heard doors slamming in the hall. My wife and I were up all night. Door man seemed to be preoccupied every time we were coming in & exiting the hotel. We will not be staying at this hotel again.

Really expensive that for so small that is, not only that but also they moved us three times because they smoked a lot, smoked a lot of marijuana. I wanted to call the police. Very cheeky and did not want to give me back my money.
user_name:
Jeha C
New York City, New York

review_body: This would have been five stars except for an incredibky loud and disruptive HVAC system. Helpful staff, comfortable bar and lounge, perfect location and a great price. I have stayed there before will stay again in March assuming I get a room with a properly functioning HVAC system
user_name:
Michael S
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: big room ,big bedvery active bar in the lobby very quite area and >5 min to subwayeven at level 16 not too much view but nice terance  all spanish restaurant at ground floor and not all of staff speak english

NYLO NY has become our home away from home given that we go often to NY for family reasons. The frequent promotions make it feasible to keep coming back. Its location not only allows us to do most of our things on foot, but is also steps away from a subway station.

We like to come to Manhattan to take a few nights just to enjoy being in the City. The Nylo is one of the loveliest hotels we have stayed at. The atmosphere in the lobby is warm and welcoming. There are lots of cozy spots in the lobby to sit and relax. The staff was incredibly friendly all the way around -- reception, valet, housekeeping. The bed was really, really comfortable. We haven't slept this well in a hotel for a long time. The room was pretty sizeable for a NYC hotel. Upper West Side location is great.

The lobby, bar and business center/game room are all very warm & inviting, making a great impression when you enter the hotel. Room size is good, and the bed was large and extremely comfortable. We also were pleased that there was a gym on the 2nd floor, and it didn't hurt to receive comp drink vouchers upon arrival. Highly recommended.

Having stayed at the Empire Hotel on previous visits to the Upper West Side NYC, we wanted to try the NYLO and were very happy we did, Our room was small but cosy and warm, the bed was very comfortable and the staff at the hotel were friendly. The ground floor bar was always busy and had a great vibe

Great location and fab sized room (the king size bed was amazing). Great to get a comp drink voucher on check in - the bar at NYLO is fantastic and cosy (have been for drinks there many times before). I would definitely stay at NYLO again in NYC. Thanks for a lovely 2 nights!

Excellent location, quiet, clean, good price (but it was the second week in January), drinks and food a bit expensive. it would be nice to have a continental breakfast option, perhaps self service. I'll gladly use it again.

The NYLO is a great find for the money on the upper west side near museums and great restaurants, away from all of the hustle in times square, close enough to Lincoln centerStaff very nice, will stay there again

Very friendly hotel, This was my 5th time in the hotel ( once a year ). I like the proximity to many atractions, The Esat Upper Side is a very quiet and calm place in comparisson to other places in Manhattan. Very good restaurants in the neighbouhood. You find everythin in Broadway Ave in walking distance. I´ll be back this year to NYLO´s again.

This place was decent for my friends and I while we visited NYC for a night! Hotel was clean and staff was friendly. We had a problem with the shower that was resolved quickly. My only complaint was how loud our neighbors were. We could hear everything they were saying and would hear the door slam every time they came in. Overall, had a pretty great experience.

The hotel was very clean and updated. The bar downstairs made for a nice place to sit and have a drink at the end of the day. Getting the free drink cards when checking in made this a plus. The hotel room was small but not bad for New York. Bathroom was nice with tile and stainless steel.

Surprised my friend for her birthday with a decorated room to relax and enjoy, the first room was very small and they moved me to a bigger room. The space was so inviting and had a nice ambience. I would definitely stay again. And, a great price.

This is a dangerous place with a manager who is aggressive, threatening and rude. Stay away! I am a 50 year old woman and have for years recommended relatives and friends to stay at this neighborhood hotel. Recently, I tried to book a room at the hotel. I was told there were rooms but I had to book online and could not do so in person. I had only my smart phone and was having trouble doing so using my phone. Not only wouldn't the clerk or manager help register me by using their computer but the manager began to scream at me in front of other patrons, demanding that I leave and threatening to call security and the police. The manager followed me out, refused to permit me time to put my wallet back in my bag and and was screaming at me so close to me that it appeared he was going to assault me. I am determined to make sure that no one I know in or outside NYC stays at this hotel. There are other better alternatives in this area - for example the hotel on the corner of 79th and Amsterdam and in other areas in NYC where the staff is not threatening to patrons. This hotel is not a safe place to stay.

Very laid back, funky and bohemian in a superb location, with the softest bed we've ever slept on. We wish there had been a bit more info on arrival and there is no Hotel guide in the room, but apart from that its a really good hotel and nice staff and very reasonably priced.

We held a birthday celebration in NYC with friends and family. They have a very flexible group booking policy that allowed us to get the right number of rooms at an excellent rateThe staff helped us in advance of our visit to ensure our group had everything we needed for a pleasant stay.When we arrived everything was exactly as promised. The hotel staff was incredibly accommodating and friendly. The hotel lobby and bar have a great vibe and the location on the upper West side is super convenient.I'd recommend this to individual travels who like a boutique hotel and for groups.

Nice rooms, great location, cool bar, good service. Overall a winner on the lovely Upper West Side. Since the hotel has been renovated, a hip bar has been added which provides a great option for a drink after a long day of sightseeing and shopping. Would stay here again when in NYC.

Smallest hotel room I've ever had--postage stamp sized. Freezing bathroom floor. Wouldn't honor reservation rate on hotels.com. Check out clerk refused to change rate to conform to guarantee rate.Plus---great location.

Stayed here for 4 nights over Christmas break with my gf. The rooms are clean and modern. The bed is huge and very comfortable, there's wifi available and you receive complimentary drink tickets at the bar when you arrive. Compared to other hotels I've seen, it was relatively cheaper. The location is also great, close to subway, pharmacy, and grocery store. Only downside was the shower, the water was either burning or freezing. Overall a very nice hotel

A chic boutique hotel ideally situated in close proximity to Central Park, various museums and upper west sites and shops. Rooms exquisitely appointed, in a minimalist, loft-inspired yet comfortable and stylish manner. Super comfortable bed, though walls are paper thin and neighbouring guests audible. Lobby delightful and cozy. Would have loved to have spent more than a simple overnight in this hotel. Would definitely return and merits my high recommendation. Only quibble was high price of parking.

Welcoming to both me and my pet! The hotel had a wonderful city vibe and was extremely clean and comfortable. Staff was friendly and the location was perfect - right near museums and Central Park. Now the only hotel I'll stay in when in NYC.

I enjoyed my stay at your hotel. It was clean and comfortable in my opinion. I could have used more wash clothes bur it wasn't a big deal. I would recommend your hotel to anyone that plans on visiting the area

We stayed at NYLO in the early days and have consistently recomended it to friends from out of town. Even understanding the demands on you guys on a holiday weekend, the staff was kind and efficient. Our closet wouldn't close: we got a rebate. Bathroom teeny. Was disappointed in food and service in Serafina, they were over-staffed yet seriously under-efficient. Breakfast was only OK.

This was the second time I have visited the hotel and this time I was on the 15th Floor West Side facing the Hudson. Great views from the balcony in the evening and a typical NY skyline in the morning ...We booked a table at the New Years Eve party and for people who usually stay in on NYE, we had a fantastic time being looked after by Chris and partying with other guests.The location is so much quieter than the craziness of midtown hotels and the rooms so much bigger.I have regularly spent time on the Upper West side and think this is the very best solution to size of room, cost and quality of service - well done NYLO.... We will be back ...

Had a great time! Would definitely go back. We were close to everything. It was me and a girlfriend so safety was a factor and we felt very safe. Great experience! Staff was wonderfull and we checked right into our room.

A printed copy of our bill was promised when we checked out and never received. A jacket that went missing from our room was to be investigated and reported on by Hotel Security. No contact has been received despite a written claim document and lengthy interview with the Head of Hotel Security

We enjoyed our stay , it is a good hotel in a good price at good location. Clean, stylish, excellent service, cool vibe, the room was well-appointed and the beds insanely comfortable! Close to great dining and shopping options, too, with easy access to both local and express subway. We might decide to come back and stay here again if we ever visity New York again.

Overall a great hotel had a great time on New Years eve the service was great!!! We arrived early and they even accommodated us with an early check in.We were quite impressed with property and its staff.

Loved the location a nice walk to Cebtral Park. Easy access to subway, able to get cabs when needed.Loved the lobby and bar area of hotel, very social and kid friendly. Having restaurant attached very convienient, there was 10 in our party including four children, all made to feel very welcome.Service staff on seventh floor amazing!

Clean, stylish, excellent service, cool vibe, the room was well-appointed and the beds insanely comfortable! Close to great dining and shopping options, too, with easy access to both local and express subway. NYLO is my favorite place to stay on the Upper West Side!

NYLO is a trendy hotel, with a modern well designed bar, foyer, reception and rooms.Staff were really helpful and even took time to assist in getting Premier League football on for me in bar when they were already really busy.The main plus for the hotel is the location, close to restaurants, deli's, convenience store and central park.Times Square is a 25 minute walk, but if you don't want to walk the subway is only two blocks away on 79th st.Anyone who goes to New York knows you don't spend a lot of time in your hotel, other than to sleep.As a result you just want your hotel to be clean, staff to be helpful and to be well located, the NYLO is all of this.

NYLO has done a very nice job with remodeling the rooms. Only Down side was the heater was very loud. Nice light in the room. Small but adequate bathroom. Bedroom larger than many in New York. Lobby has great space for working or just gathering for a chat with friends.

I spent 3 days at NYLO, and most of my time I spent outside of my room, as there was no natural light. I tried out two rooms, both were devoid of any view or natural light, one of them had a brick wall right outside and so felt like a prison. One would get depressed, claustrophobic. However the bar area is fabulous! It's got a lovely piano and great ambiance. You could either sit at the bar or at the back, in the lobby area, where there are plug points and comfortable sofas. I wouldn't recommend the adjacent Italian restaurant - inexplicably overpriced for mediocre dishes. Just step outside and you'll find numerous UWS restaurants that'll offer fine cuisine and better service at affordable price.
user_name:
Pelhamesque
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel is clean, the staff gives you nice service and it is on a great location also ! 2 blocks from the metro station and really close to Central ParkYou also got 2 really good restaurants on the side.Highly recommended !
user_name:
Rodrigo Q
San Jose, Costa Rica

review_body: We arrived 3 hours before check in and apologetically asked if we could leave bags as my son was exhausted from travel. Instantly given a room. Similar courtesy given on check out to,keep,our bags and arrange travel to airport. Staff were friendly and courteous and nothing too much trouble. Free wi fi useful when travelling with a teenager! Location great for Central Park and Nat Hist museum. Good local diners and shops. Very comfortable bed! Highly recommend a stay here. Oh and chess in the lobby. Nice touch.

hotel was nice and welcoming. Hotel has been consistently of good quality which has led us to return regularly First floor bar and common space was welcoming and alive. staff are very friendly and warm, great location, fun restaurants and coffee shops, close to MTA stations. On a previous visit, our room included breakfast. We have been frequent guests at NYLO, as our children live in city. It would be nice to have some kind of recognition for repeat guests.

Nice spot with cheaper restaurants and bars than the centre. Rooms could do with being a bit larger as we were there a week. Furniture basic but beds very comfy. Bar area was very modern and decorated lovely for Xmas. Bar service was mixed, one night my husband was treated appallingly with preference giving to American customers. However hotel took seriously and gave bar credit. Good value though and would go back.

Very nice, clean accommodations. Would have been nice to have a little more space and a comfy chair. Nowhere to relax except the bed. Convenient, nice restaurant on the premises. Friendly, helpful staff.

My second visit and have been pleased both times. Good room size and large bathrooms. Very comfortable bed and quiet area of hotel. Nice touches like free cocktail on arrival and umbrellas if raining. Unfortunate the construction makes rooms with a view less pleasant. Location is great for getting all around Manhattan and lovely to be so close to the park.

This review is now taking too much time. I just typed my review above but now I have to do it again. You should get rid if this step if you really want feedback from your customers. We had a wonderful time, but I won't fill out any more surveys.
user_name:
Cats813
New York City, New York

review_body: Great area between Broadway and Amsterdam. The location is surrounded by food, coffee, shops and is walkable to Times Square. Quick access to subways makes a long walk a quick ride to lower manhatten.

I was so impressed with the room, lobby bar, service and hotel. The room was beautiful, clean I was so impressed and happy with my stay. Check in and out was such a smooth transaction and the free drink tickets were the icing on the cake. I am very happy with my stay.

I absolutely love this hotel. The location is perfect on the upper West side next to some great restaurants shopping and the Beacon theater. I cannot wait to come back. The staff is Wonderful. I love the new bar and lobby bar area it's simply perfect !!

The downstairs bar area was buzzing, although we did find it impossible to get served at the bar and there was limited seating as it was Christmas. One of the waitresses was quite rude and abrupt and seemed insulted when I gave her a $1 tip when spending $10 on one beer and a complimentary champagne, despite her not having to move as I was at the bar. The room was very nice, the bed super comfy and the maids left the room spotless. However, in our room, we had a door which led to an adjoining room and this meant we heard everything which was being said by the guests staying in the room next-door. The air conditioning was also horrendously loud. Even in December, it was very hot and we ended up wearing ear plugs to block out the AC noise. Unfortunately, throughout our six night stay, we didn't have a single night of decent, uninterrupted sleep.As for location, we loved the fact that the hotel is two blocks away from central park and a 2 minute walk from the Subway which takes you right into downtown Manhattan. There are also some nice bars and restaurants in the area. Red Farm was fantastic. If we return to New York we will stay in the same area, but probably not NYLO. I toyed with rating this 2, but gave it three given that my partner and I are both light sleepers, and it would perhaps be unfair to rate it down on this basis.

My two sisters, a friend and I (all in our early 60's) stayed at the NYLO New York City on December 1, 2016, and were very pleased with the hotel. Originally I made reservations at the Hotel Beacon, where I've stayed several times in the past, for a room with two double beds. When I got the confirmation, though, it indicated no more than two adults and one small child were allowed in a room with two double beds. Truthfully, we discussed the idea of the four of us staying in the room and hoping to get away with it, but decided it wasn't a good idea since we didn't want to be kicked out of the room on a cold winter night - LOL!. The price of a suite where they allowed four people was more than we wanted to spend, so I started doing a search for another hotel on the Upper West Side and found the NYLO, which had no problem with the four of us staying in a room with two double beds.The reservation process was easy and efficient, and the woman with whom I spoke was very nice. When we arrived, we were impressed with the lobby, library and bar. The 12th floor room, while small, was very clean, quiet and comfortable with great mattresses (important after walking around the city all day, or enduring white-knuckle cab rides, particularly the one where the driver vehemently threw the "F" bomb at other vehicles many, many, MANY times!). In the bathroom, the lack of actual towel racks other than the hook on the back of the door was odd, but once again, everything was spotless.All staff members were polite, friendly and helpful, which was appreciated. We would definitely stay at the NYLO again!

The location is great, the room was nice and clean and the bed was amazing. Best night sleep I've had away from home. The only downside was the air con unit was quite noisy and would wake us up clicking on and off and the noise from the corridor was very loud as well.

I surprised my boyfriend for his birthday with a stay here. We both absolutely loved the hotel! The staff was great, the rooms were nice and spacious, we loved the decor and the hotel bar was a great place to hangout. The hotel is in a great location with access to a lot of shops and stores. We also went to the Lincoln center for a show that night and it is only 1 mile away. If you are looking for a trendy hotel geared toward the 20-30ish aged crowd then this is the place for you!

This is the 2nd time I stayed at NYLO and I will not be back. The first room they put us in had coffee stains down the wall. The rooms needed basic maintenance and the staff were apathetic.No bathrobes

Great lobby with coffee & cocktail bar, as well as an area to sit and read or do work. Rooms were clean and staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. Price was extremely competitive and I would definitely stay there again.

Very nice hotel.Convenient to family living in Upper West side but also close to subways going downtown. Bar area is very popular and often crowded. Rooms are larger than most in NYC. Staff is friendly. Only downside was a smell of grease when you first open room door. Probably this is only noticeable in winter when heat is on and it may not be noticeable on all floors. In general a very pleasant and convenient place to stay in NYC.
user_name:
Janet A
Gainesville, Florida, United States

review_body: Great location and welcoming bar scene! My wife and I spent two nights seeing the holiday sights and having visits with family and friends. This hotel was the perfect place to go back to at night. It was fun to have some wine (a glass each was complimentary) at the bar; it fell like being at a cozy family room, with a piano and comfy couches.

Great location, but I couldn't sleep every time the heat kicked on. The rattling of the HVAC system was severe in our room. We received a free drink voucher but there were less than 10 below average options available.

The NYLO is a lovely place to experience! Cocktail lounge and bar area is delightful for meeting with friends and family. Staff is knowledgeable and happy to help. Our stay was clean and cozy, the noise level was at a minimum and it was refreshing to return to after an adventure filled day!

the hotel room was small not like it appeared online, but for the money was good enough, the location was the best and so close to Central park, subway. the urban tax $25 a day seemed a bit much but it is NYC

This was our second stay at the NYC NYLO & our 4th time in a NYLO hotel. Always a great space to come home to at the end of the day. Anytime we called down for something it was promptly brought to the room. The location, just a short walk from Central Park, subway stops and not far from Lincoln Center couldn't be more convenient.

The location could not be beat. We could walk or take public transportation to anywhere in the city. The rooms had ample storage and the bed was very comfortable. Service was excellent and we enjoyed our complimentary water and glasses of wine at the bar. The lobby was very comfortable and conducive for sitting and visiting with family. We would definitely stay at the NYLO again.

We have stayed multiple times in the past several years, and NYLO just keeps getting better and better. The rooms are large and clean, and very, very importantly, the staff make guests feel welcome and as if they are family. The hotel is in a great location on the Upper West Side, very convenient to Central Park, the Hudson Greenway, museums, great restaurants, fun bars and subways. Highly recommended. Will be returning again.

The staff were very friendly and always willing to help.The bar was a great place to have a drink and was always busy. If you have children then there was also a nice area with games available. The restruarant with the hotel was a great for breakfast.We would stay again.
user_name:
Louise M
Greater London, United Kingdom

review_body: Retro feel but so comfortable. The beds were like heaven. We had a fantastic Italian meal at the restaurant that my daughter still talks about. Our complementary drinks in the spacious lounge were unexpected Could not recommend this Hotel more!

Great hotel and great service. Housekeeping ere excellent and very professional. The bar was very nice also and the staff was also excellent and very friendly and professional. We will use this hotel on our next trip.

I stayed here recently for four nights and would highly recommend this hotel. We loved the location....very close to subway, great restaurants, and excellent shopping! Our room was on the backside of the hotel, but that was fine because it was truly the quietest NYC hotel room I've ever stayed in. The lobby had a very trendy vibe, and all the staff were very helpful and accommodating.

Loved staying @ NYLO for 3 nights in Dec 2016. Love the hard floors, stainless steel sinks and EXCELLENT use of space. Spacious, CLEAN, quiet, sooooo comfortable and fabulous. A real joy to stay here.

Our first stay at NYLO and we were pleasantly surprised. We liked the location away from the madness of midtown but convenient to the subway. Four PM checkin MEANS just that, though they were happy to keep our bags while we wandered We upgraded to a panoramic view. I wouldn't do that again because my panorama was but a building across the street. All in all, a great visit and we will be back.

Very comfortable, quiet and comfy. Our deluxe room was the right balance for the busy city. Appreciated the complimentary bottled water. Just off Broadway and convenient to the subway and shopping. Love having Fairway nearby for snacks.
user_name:
cpk27
New York City, New York

review_body: Attentive staff. Friendly and well-used bar. Comfortable lobby with TVs and games. I found the halls, corners in the room, and shower stall bottom to be in need of cleaning. Everyone I encountered was helpful and attentive.

Very comfortable beds, friendly staff, rooms are clean and simple, similar to European hotels. Has a bar and library on the first floor for relaxation and socializing. Great location near subway and Zabars and lots of restaurants on Amsterdam.

Our family stayed at the Nylo this year for our annual trip to NYC around Christmas time. We love the location and have stayed at another hotel in the past that is right around the corner. Easy access to the park, natural history museum, subway etc. Our room fit our needs and the staff was great. The real home run was the bar. It was great and seemed to attract such a great crowd. It was like hanging out with 100 or so of your good friends. The bar had the same great energy on both Friday and Saturday night. Great place- we'd go back again.

All good and nice value. Suggest hotel invest in new ac heating units. A serious dusting would be very too. More than the basics but drapes etc. great location and Very nice staff is a significant consolation.

We love staying on the upper west side. NYLO is a great hotel full of life. It has a cute little bar that even had live music the night we were there. The room with 2 queen size beds was great because it also had a little sitting area with another TV. Plenty of room to spread out and relax.

Great hotel. Fabulous location. Warm staff great restaurants nearby. Clean we really like festive atmosphere. Concierge was great. Bar on site with restaurants nearby. Serafina gm super helpful. Everything was so convenient

A bit pricey, but a very nice room and great atmosphere in the restaurant/bar. Very quiet too, didn't hear our neighbors from our room. Small bathroom but all we needed and soft pillows/bed. Awesome neighborhood - close to food etc and everything we needed. Just don't use the valet! It took us 2 hr to get our car Sunday morning when they said allow 45 min... with several garages nearby, we wish we could have been more in control of this as we had a long drive ahead and didn't appreciate waiting around.
