The other reason for not giving a higher rating is that the guest room elevators are not key-carded so technically anyone can walk in off the street/come from the bar or restaurant and go up the elevators to the guest rooms. They did have a greeter type person there earlier in the nite but not later. We would still stay here again but not use the valet.

i do not beleave i got the room i paid for . dirty windows facing a wall for 600$ per night.when i woke up in the mornning and complained they called security women.than they changed the room without even say sorry

This was our first trip to New York, and if I'm being honest, price did drive much of our decision for choosing NYLO. Compared to other hotels in New York their rates were very reasonable and I couldn't have been happier with our stay. The personnel was very friendly and helpful. The ambience in the lobby was great. The rooms were clean, well thought out, and surprisingly quiet. I was surprised how well I slept while I was there. The location was perfect for us, within walking distance from great restaurants, Central Park, and the Subway. Ultimately, the NYLO had everything we wanted and nothing we didn't. I really look forward to hopefully coming back here again and bringing our kids next time.

The location was in a great neighborhood and very convenient but the only thing I would do all over again is the room size. I had a queen bed but it looked like a full and when you opened the door the bed hit you right when you opened the room door. The hotel had nice decor but would really recommend getting a bigger room next time or a suite.

There is an internal conflict when a reviewer finds something well above average: (1) there is the good side to share positive experiences with others; verses (2) selfishly keeping some gems to yourself.It's the Holiday Season so I'll share.I guess NYLO is fairly new to NYC. The property has been renovated and is clean and well kept. The decor is both efficient and welcoming. Check-in and check-out was a positive experience. The welcoming drink chit was unexpected and added to our fun.Location is good and although we did not take advantage of the co-located restaurant, other guests said it was very good.Our room was small by some standards; yet we had all we needed and enough room for our belongings. Clean and basic. Safe location. Friendly staff.What else do you want?We certainly plan to return!

Fire station over the road. Need I say more? Staff were friendly but there was a lack of contact and care. Didn't know about he very basic "green" room servicing. Just thought they'd forgotten to come. Snappy bar staff overworked and no food available. Not soon service. Kind of neglectful rather than modern and green. Paid a lot for very basic accomm.
user_name:
amandapD8319HO
New York City, New York

review_body: I have stayed at NYLO on trips when I was alone on business and also with my family. Staff has been great. A special note of appreciation to Jessie at the front desk - she made our family holiday stay even better! Thank you Jessie. This is a great location. Food. Shopping. Transportation, all right nearby. Wonderful room. Love the showers. Thoughtful design evident pretty much everywhere. I recommend it.

Enjoyed the Hotel. Staff were friendly. Bar in the lobby is always hopping. Flew Porter to Jersey. Took train to Penn Station, then the tube to Broadway and 79th. $16 bucks each , one way as opposed to $75-$100 for a cab. Way faster I think. Lots of food in the neighbor hood , two blocks to Central Park. Easy walk to Trump Tower if you are so inclined.

The hotel is clean and modern. The staff is very friendly and the location is convenient with subway station at 50m. Beds are comfortable and breakfast at Serafine next door is sublime. On the negative side, it is very noisy at night. There is a fire house just in front and windows are badly isolated (from noise and cold wind)

ABSOLUTELY SUPERB location, staff, design, lobby+public spaces, bar, nightlife in the bar, clientele. Perfectly situated within steps of 2 excellent+affordable restaurants, a market/grocery store and drugstore (CVS). WITHIN A BLOCK: Equinox gym / yoga / studio cycling WITHIN 2 BLOCKS: Starbucks, subway and the Columbus Avenue Strip WITHIN 3 BLOCKS: History Museum and best entrance to Central Park!

Considering we got a "TripAdvisor rate", you'd think the hotel would honor what was included in the rate knowing we would put it on TripAdvisor! So... we stayed here for their bed, which was so comfy. But, we received no robe, no bottled waters (and were told after multiple phone calls that the whole hotel was out of water), no welcome "cocktail" - only a choice of beer or wine. We were so disappointed at how noisy and crowded the lobby was as we were looking forward to relaxing there. But, with a rate as good as the TripAdvisor special, I guess we can't complain too much.

Can't beat the location. It is walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, the Museum of Natural History, shopping, restaurants as well as the subway. It is very clean and friendly.There is a cozy bar and there was live music

As always, we love the NYLO. Great job on the elevators, this was our only complaint in the past. The were upgraded and they work very well. It would be nice if there was a happy hour late in the day when people come back from their day about town and could sip on a beverage and some appetizers.

Great location on the UWS, just a couple blocks down from the 1. We brought our two small dogs. We noticed other dogs in passing but never experienced any disturbances while in our room (and it didn't smell bad or have any detectable pet odors). One of the staff members gave each dog a stuffed toy to keep (it was close to xmas so I'm not sure if this usually happens but it seemed spontaneous and was very sweet of her). The desk and door staff were all exceptional and seemed genuinely friendly, warm, hospitable. We were given a few vouchers for free drinks at the lobby bar, which has a cool atmosphere and is usually busy and lively. The only negative was that the two bartenders were somewhat rude and dismissive when we asked for drinks 10 minutes after closing (it was still full of people and we'd been told the wrong closing time). The concierge said they might have some bottles they hadn't put away yet and they could still serve us. I'm not sure if this annoyed the bartenders but they were visibly unhappy with pouring a couple free drinks. I still tipped them but only because it's the right thing to do, not because they provided good service. We came back the next night and the bartenders were just as nice as the rest of the hotel staff so it might have been situational and a fluke. I initially chose this hotel specifically because it was pet friendly and reasonably priced. Overall, would highly recommend and I'll definitely stay here again, with or without pets!

This is a fantastic hotel with a terrific lounge in a wonderful part of town. A price I couldn't beat for this type of place at this time of year. Value was so good I upgraded to a room with a balcony and a view of the Hudson. Well worth it. Go directly to their site for great deals.

I stayed here for 3 nights and was disturbed by howling dogs each night. This is because the hotel allows dogs in the rooms. The room opposite mine had at least 2 dogs in it and the guests went out and left the dogs alone in the room. When I complained at the front desk I was given no apology but simply told that the hotel is "pet friendly". Well, I like dogs too but when I spend hundreds of dollars a night for a small no-frills room to sleep in I don't expect to have to listen to them howl all night. So goodbye Nylo - there are plenty of other places to stay in New York.

NYLO is our go to for trips to NYC! We enjoy the location due to the subway accessibility, local businesses; florists, restaurants, coffee shops, dry cleaners, pharmacy. On our most recent trip we enjoyed visits to Amsterdam Ale House, Sugar & Plummer confectionery, and Posies. The staff at NYLO is friendly and helpful and the hotel accommodations are comfortable. The lobby and bar were beautifully decorated for the holidays with lots of guests taking advantage of the spacious and welcoming atmosphere.

My husband & I couldn't have had a better experience! Clean, festive cool lobby. Perfect location for walking the park or river and subway. Great restaurants near by. Super comfy King bed in an affordable hotel in NYC! CVS and Marshall's nearby which served us well due to needed items including cute cheap boots!

Booked NYLO at the last minute without knowing much about it because my GF and I were desperate and found an OK rate. It was spectacular. The check in was a little delayed, but they made it up to us with a free voucher for champagne from the bar while we waited (and the bar area is really cool with great decor that makes it a cozy winter spot). They upgraded us to a great, romantic room with a balcony view of the Hudson. And checkout, normally 11, was extended to 1pm.Overall, a surprising and great experience.

We stayed at the NYLO for a week and were very well satisfied. Our room was clean and comfortable, the staff accommodating and friendly. The hotel's location is very convenient; it's close to the 79th street subway stop that makes it easy to get to midtown. There are good bakeries and cafes across the street. We will definitely stay here again.

I always stay here when visiting NYC. Perfect location and great value. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone considering visiting New York. Brought my friend here for the first time and she loved it too.

I paid extra to book a superior room with one king bed and the bed took up about 90% of the room.Except for the very small nightstand that was attached to the headboard, there was not room for two people to turn around & it was a corner room. The bathroom was tiny & clean and my major complaint is that the "wood" floors in the winter are freezing cold!!!! It took so long for the heat to warm up the room in the a.m., that I was out the door and in the elevator before it happened. I love the location of this hotel, but the temp. was below 20 degrees and that floor was like stepping onto a freezer. I can't sleep with the very dry heat on all night, so I wish that they would put area rugs next to the bed just to step out on. No restaurant & the 2 bottles of water that they make a big deal of took over 3/4 hour to arrive and 3 telephone calls to the front desk.

Second time I have stayed at the hotel. Terrific location, room size and condition were great. Staff was very helpful and friendly. No complaints whatsoever. Great hotel, would definitely stay there again.

A brilliant first visit to New York! A lovely hotel with great facilities and helpful staff. Rooms are clean and have comfy beds. Easy access to Central Park and close to subway stations if needed. Would definitely recommend and visit again!

Place is missing a beat. We stayed in the same property two previous times when it was On The Ave and found it to be far more welcoming, friendly and most important CLEANER! The NYLO is a far cry from OTA and unless something major changes here I would sooner sleep in my car.

We enjoyed our stay at the NYLO. Pretty friendly staff. Bar was super crowded the day and night of our arrival. Then closed at 11pm on Saturday night. Waiter said bar had to close due to low inventory! Sad that there was no piano player on the cool red piano and it was only used for coats!! The king room was small but clean. Had poor lighting in bathroom and hall and close up mirror was broken. No promised robes either! I would suggest more hooks ect! Very hard to get dressed in the small space with no lighting! I wanted to order some food to our room but no menu or mention of that service at this hotel but plenty of places to eat in walking distance.

We loved how conveniently located the NYLO New York Hotel was to everything we wanted to see and do. The hotel is very clean and the staff were helpful . The hotel seems like a hotspot for travelers and locals to come unwind and have a drink each evening with live music. Our room was on the small side, but I think that is to be expected when staying in New York. We would stay here again on our next visit, and recommended it to travelers who want to be close to Central Park!

Nylo exceeded our expectations. It's not a Grand Hotel, but for two nights on a reasonable budget, I can't find a single thing to fault it on. We had a great stay at a very reasonable price.The room was not large, but it also didn't feel cramped. It was exceptionally clean and cheery. We found the queen bed to be very, very comfortable. When we checked in the person at reception asked if we wanted a room on the street or in back. We chose the back, so we had no view worth mentioning, but we also had no noise. We slept very well.The wifi was free and good. There was a Keurig machine with a couple of free amulets of coffee for us, and two free water bottles. Reception also gave us each a drink coupon good for champagne, wine, or beer.The bathroom was clean and bright. The shower worked well.The lobby focuses on the bar. And it was crowded and lively both nights we were there. We're old and not that much fun, so it didn't matter to us personally, but, on the other hand, the noise didn't make it up to our room on the 8th floor. Personally, I'd rather stay at a hotel full of life than one that is staid and reserved.The hotel is well-located, depending on what you're doing in NYC, of course. It's between Broadway and Amsterdam. The latter street is full of unpretentious places to eat and shop. It's about three blocks from the Museum of Natural History. Walk 15 minutes across the Park from that museum and you're at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Not too shabby.We didn't have much interaction with the staff, but all of it was friendly, cheerful, and helpful.It suited our needs perfectly. 5/5 would stay again.

If you're looking for tip, top luxury, this ain't the place for you. However, the price is great by New York standards, the hotel is quirky and a bit funky and the bar was rocking on the Friday and Saturday nights I was there. I was upgraded this time so my room was really great with a separate sitting area and a large balcony which I couldn't use as it was snowing!! The beds are large and comfortable but the bathrooms are a bit on the snug side. It's clean and comfortable and very well located (for me) on the Upper West Side - just near the Beacon Theatre. The concierge is very helpful.

Tiny room and not suited for comfort. No real closet, no drawers, just sort of lockers near the floor along with a safe on the floor. Very cramped room, no real chair, just a desk/night table and desk chair. Door didn't close tight so the light from hall came in cause the frame was not straight. Tried to get a better room, but none available when we checked in. Disappointing.

My husband selected this hotel and I am glad he did! The modern décor isn't my style, but it was the best night sleep I have ever had in a hotel. I strongly disliked the metal bathroom countertop (noisy!), and school locker style storage, but the bed was a dream! The staff were super friendly, the lobby festive and the hotel was clean. I would stay again just so I could be certain of a good night sleep!!

Great location, top notch service, clean and comfy rooms, well-appointed but not fussy. There's nothing not to like about this hotel. Any time I've tried another hotel in Manhattan, I've regretted not being at the NYLO. Highly recommend.

looking forward to experiencing the exciting and customer service based new changes the hotel has in store for it's guests. The professional staff deserve it too. The neighborhood needs a boutique hotel guests want to return to and enjoy.
user_name:
Karen E
New York City, New York

review_body: I spent the weekend with my daughter and we had a very nice time. Rooms are a decent size for NYC. Our view was of a brick wall but what can you expect in NYC. Staff was very professional and courteous.

The room was nice but the flooring and walls seemed very cheap for this expensive hotel. There were stains on my bed sheets as well. My husband and I went to the bar to get a drink before we went out but we waited for 15 minutes with only one person ahead of us ordering. We just left and didn't even try because it was ridiculous.

Great location! Very convenient to the subway. Since is not in a mayor hotel area, it is very easy to get transportation on a rainy and snowy day! Friendly staff. Upon arrival I notified last minute change of guest number and we were upgraded to a bigger room at no charge. Lots of security and employees at the entrance and lobby. Feels secure. It would be another layer of security to use elevator key protection. The lobby is great but gets very crowded in the early afternoon and the hotel guests cannot really enjoy it. Should consider to have a section for guests only.

This is my second and not last trip to NYLO. The rooms are great, sure they are not huge but they are perfect for New York. Appointed well and very clean. All the people that work there are very fun. The highlight for me is always the activity in the lobby. it is the place to hang out morning, noon and night. I feel like you are in a very warm ski lodge.

This hotel is located in the upper west side close to subways walking distance to Central Park and in a very cute neighborhood with lots of restaurant options! The beds are extremely comfortable and the views were amazing!

Our family of 4 had a wonderful stay at this gem of a hotel. It was perfectly located for us. Large, clean rooms with comfortable beds and friendly hotel staff. The lobby had a warm, lively atmosphere with people playing board games, enjoying cocktails and food - something we will take advantage of next time. We would definitely stay again and would highly recommend the NYLO to anyone wanting to stay on the upper west side!

We have been staying here for 15 years and have watched all of its transitions. Its the best it has ever been in ever way! And its in a great neighborhood! I would highly recommend this to anyone who wants a true NYC neighborhood experience while being only 2 blocks away from the train which can get you to Times Square in 3 minutes or anywhere you need to go in the city.

Location, location, location. We love the UWS and were thrilled to visit NYLO a second time. This was a special occasion for us and so we stayed overnight in NYC. The hotel lobby has a wonderful ambience and vibe, the staff is friendly, and the room was clean and comfortable. The hotel's location cannot be beat.

Stayed at the NYLO for a second time as I liked it so much...and wasn't disappointed. The staff is helpful and friendly. The room/bathroom is a good size for NYC with super comfy beds. The restaurants and bars are really nice, especially the hotel bar - LOCAL. Worth a visit to try one of their craft cocktails. Location is key as it is a prime Upper Westside spot centrally located to great restaurants, Central Park, decent shopping, and an easy commute to Midtown or lower Manhattan. This allows you to enjoy the crazy when you want and then escape to peace and calm when needed! Only recommendation I have...bathrobes would be nice and daily replacement of bottled water would be appreciated. LOVE IT!

the lobby staff was very impolite and unavailable to accommodate very simple requests as for example a copy of the billing receipt. if not need any assistance from the hotel staff you will be fine... otherwise good luck!!

Very cool lounge area when you walk in. Hotel's definition of a "penthouse" is definitely different than mine, but hey - wasn't a bad room. Our room had a lot of cold air coming from the outside and the heat struggled to get to at least 70. Food at the hotel was ridiculously overpriced for the average food that it was. Got some stuff right (cool vibe) but not the greatest place I've ever stayed.

We have used this hotel from time to time since it was "On the Ave" several years ago. It has improved continuously (although the price has also advanced) so that it is now moved up a few stars worth. It remains clean, well maintained, and a hotel which caters to a world-wide clientele. It has added some luxury touches as well.
user_name:
BobFran_11
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Beautiful hotel quietly tucked away. Large rooms with comfortable beds. Friendly and helpful staff. So much better overall and in price to the large chain hotels. I would definitely stay again and recommend this lovely hotel

The women at the front desk where very rude. Didn't explain or help with any questions.They charge ur charge card the first time they take it.Not happy with the experience.Hallway always smelled of smoke. Room didn't.

Very "cold" rooms. Keep in mind that I was there in mid-December, so my view could change in warm weather. No carpet (which in some ways is good, cause you don't have an old dirty carpet), there is a lot of metal (whole sink and bathroom counter is metal). Very industrial, which i am not a fan of. Bed was pretty comfy- I liked how soft it was. The lobby bar is SUPER cute. I did not have a drink there, but every time I walked by, it looked rather fun. Doorman was always friendly.

We found the staff to be very friendly and accommodating to our needs to a very satisfactory degree and were very pleasant when answering our questions about the surrounding area. We would unquestionably stay here again without any reservation.

NYLO is in a great neighborhood and very convenient to all the places we wanted to spend time in. The beds were super comfy and I didn't hear much noise. While I didn't care for the bathroom, it was clean. The staff was very accommodating and we were especially fond of the bar. Great drinks and awesome hang out area.

Stayed here for a friend's birthday party, only in town for about 24h. Check-in was a bit slow, but staff was friendly. Lobby is very cozy. Elevator was pretty quick for a NYC hotel, and the room itself was very nice (though small, as almost all NYC hotels).We enjoyed a few drinks in the lobby bar, otherwise didn't do much other than sleep in the room, but we had a very nice stay and would definitely stay again!

We are thrilled to have found this treasure! NYLO is located in a safe neighborhood just 2 blocks from the subway station (1 train). We used this as a base for a 4 day visit to Midtown, Little Italy, Central Park, Upper East Side and Harlem. Quick straight shot to Midtown and many easy transfer spots. We found lots of good food and shopping choices nearby, including Serafina adjacent to the hotel. The hotel itself is terrific too. The lobby and bar areas are fun & inviting with a funky flair that is not at all nightclubbish. We were greeted quickly by staff and given coupons for a free drink in the lounge. Needless to say, we made it a habit to end each day with a stop here as it was beautifully decorated for the holidays with lots of seating nooks. We chose the smaller double room and still felt we had lots of space for 3 of us. Floors are not carpeted- which we loved, but you might want slippers in the winter. Bed was so comfortable! The hotel is modern but not stark and severe. It's a very comfortable stay, in a great location with very reasonable rates. Our daughter just moved to Harlem and this will be our go-to hotel.

We stayed at the Nylo hotel with our 6 year old daughter. Knowing that we needed some relax time with the little one in such a big city, I booked a very expensive room category in order to have that space needed. Upon check in, we found our room to be extremely small and very 'uncharming' - nothing like on the pictures on the web. After complaining, the very helpful reservations staff tried hard to help us find a better and bigger room which we only got after two days. They also offered us complimentary breakfast for the remaining days. The new room that we finally got was really nice and spaceous and made our stay there very nice in the end. Most helpful and friendly staff.

Staff was very friendly & welcoming. My bed was also very comfortable. Cleaniness was average at best - the desk chair was full of gunk stuck in the ridges, the top cover of bed did not look clean, and there was a dead bug on my desk the first night I arrived. The window (if you could call it one) was also minuscule and I could barely see out of it. Due to the lack of natural sunlight, the room was also quite dim during most of my stay even during the day.

The staff was welcoming and very helpful in addressing things like making sure that my coffee maker was functioning properly. I also appreciated that when my car service was unable to pick me up on time, NYLO had their own on call. The design of the hotel and rooms was very attractive.

Staff is nice and available, hotel is well located, correctly connected in the upper west side, rooms are clean, quiet and spacious. The lobby including the bar is cosy and agreeable. Definitely a place to recommend

Lovely hotel with great helpful staff. Very nice restaurant attached and everything you could need.Only issue was paid extra for a larger room but there wasn't much difference & the bar was too busy for us to use

Great location updown west side. The hotel is within walking distance to the Central Park, great restaurants, across from CVS store. Only two blocks from the Metro station. So convenient and in great neighborhood.

Great ambiance in lobby and bar. Service was great. The value was great for the location of the hotel The room had an eclectic design and was quite roomy when compared to other New York City hotels I have stayed at. Awesome time merry Christmas

The bar and lobby was always festive and crowded. Shower water was never hot but warm and bathroom was always chilly but the room was nice. Difficult to check out - many people in line. View was not so nice.

The hotel is well located. Overall is a remodeled all property. The upkeep is poor. The common halls need their carpets cleaned and vacuumed. The beds are extremely comfortable and towels adequate. Sizing of the Standard room is very small for the price

Room was small but had everything we needed. Clean. New. Excellent staff. Exciting bar in lobby (if you're interested in a bar, but not intrusive if you're not). Close enough to subways. Lots of restaurants. Great price for a NYC hotel, in December. Didn't try the breakfast...

Nylo is great! Decent location, nice staff and clean rooms. it's on the simple side with laminate hard wood floors and stainless steel bathroom sink, etc. but well decorated. We loved the cozy bar downstairs.

Who knew? NYLO is perfectly situated: 1. 2 blocks to the 1,2,3 subway hub at 79th St which takes you north and south on Manhattan Peninsula.2. 2 blocks to the 79 crosstown bus to east side.3. It's convenient to everywhere on Manhattan!4.Taxis are lined up outside the front door for your convenience if you wish to indulge.5. Lincoln Center is a short walk south. 5. Fairway and Zabars are just a few blocks away!The amenities are terrific:1. Serafina Restaurant is right inside the hotel!2. The bar and lounge are separate, so you can watch sports or news and then step out of the lounge area to listen to music while enjoying a cocktail. 3. Red Barn is virtually next store! Check the reviews: the food is superbly prepared!4. I recommend the king deluxe for singles or couples: it's well appointed with room to roam. 5. The service people are very gracious and helpful....can't ask for more!This is my second stay, and I am now looking forward to my next visit to Manhattan. There is no reason other than a "full house" to stay anywhere else.
user_name:
Judith P
New York City, New York

review_body: Enjoyed NYLO very much. My one complaint is the Urban Fee. Which is simply a way to charge an additional $28. Kind of like the airline incremental fees. Overall it is still good value. The bar was very nice and quite lively.

Staff was so friendly and helpful. I stay in hotels often. This staff was amazing! Had a great time. Will definitely stay here again. Location was convenient. Decor was fun and interesting. Beds were comfortable.

No heating in bathroom led to a very uncomfortable stay. The bathroom was icy, stone floor & marble tiles are stylish, but no good without heating in a New York winter. We paid $400 for a Saturday night, surely a hotel should be able to provide a warm bathroom. The bar staff were surly & unwelcoming. The housekeeping team were excellent. Our room was clean, the overall atmosphere of the hotel was funky & fun, but the icy bathroom was an issue. When we complained, we were given a fan heater! for a bathroom!!!

Amazing hotel in an amazing City. Without a doubt the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! Great location, 2 blocks up from the Beacon Theatre & only a couple of Avenue's away from Central Park.

The hotel was very nice and the room was spacious, with a small balcony and a separate sitting area. I would highly recommend this room and this hotel. The baggage service was very helpful upon check-in and when leaving.

The Nylo is perfectly situated for a New york stay - if you want to do strictly touristy things in the city. Its 3 minutes from Central Park, the subway is a 5 minute walk and gets you to times square in about 12 minutes and you can stay on and get to the financial district in double that time. If you are young and want to party / perhaps visit brooklyn, then dont stay on the upper west. Stay in the east village or anywhere lower east.The staff are ok. They are by no means rude but they're a bit muted and dull. The biggest two problems with the Nylo are the room sizes and unexpected costs. The room was pretty small. You couldn't spend an evening in there without feeling quite suppressed. Granted, our room had two double beds and ensuite - but there wasnt a lot of room to move about (but dont forget you are in NY so you shouldnt be stating in your hotel room a lot anyway!) However, the decor of the rooms and entire hotel is very nice.My biggest gripe was the unexpected costs at checkout! Like all my hotel bookings, I used expedia, so I wasn't expecting any surprising charges. However, for a 7 night stay I was hit with a $200 urban and tax fee. This made up about 25-30% of the cost of staying at the hotel. I would have much rather used this money to stay somewhere else and got a bigger room

I have been visiting NYC at least five times a year for the past 40 years. NYLO delivers the best hotel value per dollar in NYC currently. Very courteous and helpful staff, perfectly adequate accommodation, response in minutes to service requests,

We came to NYC from San Diego for a concert at the Beacon Theater. We were pleasantly surprised by NYLO's proximity to not only the Beacon, but also Central Park, The Met, and world class shopping and dining. Huge plus!The room itself was cozy and beautiful. The furnishings were modern and the bed was fluffy and comfortable. The hotel staff were among some of the nicest New Yorkers I ever did meet. They offered us free drink tickets for the bar and accommodated our requests like professionals.The next time we travel to NYC, the NYLO will be our go-to hotel. I loved every moment of our stay and will come again very soon!

NYLO fit the bill perfectly. It was well priced. It was very well located for me - I could walk to my appointments from there. The room was very pleasant & clean, the bed was comfy, and the bathroom was clean & inviting.Red Farm restaurant was a real good experience.
user_name:
Eugenio M
São Paulo, Sao Paulo, Brazil

review_body: The hotel and our room were very clean. Linens were perfect and the bed was very comfortable. Only issue with the property is that sound travels (due to the wood floors which we love) so a more sound insulating door would be really helpful. The window in the bathroom is single paned and does not insulate against the weather outside, so it was very chilly in there, so a heat lamp on the ceiling would be great.We liked being where the locals live and shop and would definitely consider the NYLO again if the price was right.

I usually stay in the city within a few blocks of Grand Central and come in by train. But this time I needed my car, and needed to be on the Upper West. I travel for a non-profit, so our travel budget is not bottomless. NYLO fit the bill perfectly. It was well priced. It was very well located for me - I could walk to my appointments from there. The room was very pleasant & clean, the bed was comfy, and the bathroom was clean & inviting.

NYLO is a good option for this part of Manhattan. Close to the park, subway, rate was reasonable, comparatively speaking. They gave me a free beer with my stay as well. There was construction across the street which was a little loud in the morning, but didn't disrupt my sleep too terribly.

Our overall experience at the NYLO was excellent, great atmosphere and a fantastic location, close to some wonderful local bars and restaurants. Close access to the subway. The staff were friendly and helpful. We stayed in two different rooms, the first being a standard room which was nice with a large bathroom, but was a little dark as it didn't overlook the outside of the building. We then moved to a "Superior" room with a view which was really nice.We did however miss having a fridge in either of the rooms we stayed in.We would definitely recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Nice place to stay in the upper west side. neighborhood is great full of restaurants and away from the big tourist crowds of midtown. Hotel has a nice bar, nice rooms. red farm restaurant near by is great.

Spend a night in the Upper West Side for our wedding anniversary. Loved the modern, industrial look and we (as well as many other people there) enjoyed the welcome cocktail for the guests at the LOCL bar right at the hotel. I think this is what makes this hotel stand out from the rest. I have to say, the staff are incredibly fun and nice, especially Jennifer, who made sure we are happy with our stay. There was an issue regarding our third-party booking which she immediately resolved with utmost care. She was very warm yet professional, and even made sure that we liked our room by escorting us. Really an amazing person. We had breakfast at Serafina (through our complimentary breakfast vouchers from NYLO), which was really delicious. Overall, loved the experience and the people, and the Christmas vibe was extra special.

Great hotel if you don't want all the crowds, especially during the holidays. The area has more of a neighborhood feel. Nice bar/lounge, busy but not packed like hotel bars in midtown. Bar could stay open a little later . did experience the drafty, dirty windows , no view, but only in room to sleep.

We love the NYLO for the location. Easy walking distance to Lincoln Center, subways, Zabar's, Columbus Circle, Central Park and museums. This was our 7th or 8th visit. The building construction across the street is almost finished. We appreciated the quiet! The staff is attentive and the housekeeping was thorough. Some of the room furnishings are starting to show their age.

Location was great for subway train and Central Park and Broadway shows. Reception was very friendly and helpful. Room was spacious and clean everyday with very polite cleaning ladies. Hotel bar and lobby was very festive and beautiful. Would recommend this hotel and would stay here again

Lovely hotel rooms quite small but where isn't in Manhattan?!! Great use of space though for storage etc. Great power shower and big to and really comfy bed. Good location 2 mins from subway and great bar and restaurants at the hotel.
user_name:
andycarr1971
North West England, United Kingdom

review_body: While the furniture, etc. was nice looking and rather Scandinavian, the rooms need a good updating. There are very few outlets to charge devices, there are no guides in the room, and I even found silverfish in the bathtub. It wouldn't take too much for this to be a stellar property, but... :-/

Good location, friendly staff. Only thing was cold draft from Windows and no view, but didn't spend a lot of time in the room. Close subway access, and many places to explore close by. Love the neighborhood around, it was like being in the small town.

Spent two days in the UWS at NYLO. The hotel is beautiful and beautifully decorated. The decor in the rooms is modern, the lobby and bar area were decked out for Christmas and it was a great place to hang out and relax. My one complaint is that the bar in the lobby closed at midnight, which was inconveniently early. But other that that, I highly recommend this property. I would stay away from the adjoined restaurant RedFarm though. Overpriced, even for the city, and the quality, while good, doesn't justify the price. You can get better Chinese elsewhere for cheaper.

The hotel is nice for the most part. We were put in room 211 which was so loud (from the singer/band a floor below and then the GARBAGE TRUCKS!!! AHH! So loud. Other than that though, the mattress was so comfy and we somehow got some sleep (we were exhausted). The lobby is pretty and very cozy.

Fantastic experience in NYLO NY Great location, excellent staff, confertable beds.Near the subway no. 1 - 2 - 3. In 10 minutes you are in times square. We reccomend a drink at LOCL bar.Cleaning rooms and bathrooms, good amenities

Loved it! Not a bargain but a really nice experience. The extra charges were a bit high and not in the quoted price. Great vibe though and spacious comfortable rooms with a great river view. Would love to stay in that room in the spring!!

NYLO is an excellent location for Upper West Side activities and convenience to all of NYC. Nice neighborhood with great selection of activities and restaurants. Room rate a bit high and (agree with others) that the "urban daily charge" should be included in the rate quote

Hotels should be looking to give their guests the best possible experience. The NYLO really fell short. Our family recently had to emergency move from our upper west side apartment two blocks from the Nylo. We chose the Nylo because of its proximity and because the reviews generally seemed positive. The lack of compassion and warmth from reservations to front desk to management was astounding. When you spend $700 a night on a room - you expect a level of service - and our experience was so undermet, we will never recommend this hotel to any friend, family member or stranger. We strongly suggest you consider other options. Here are just a few of the reasons we were so extremely dissatisfied: - When I first called, I was given a quote for the room rate and I said I'd call back in ten minutes after speaking with my husband. Within that timeframe, the hotel upped the rate by $400+.- When I called to get further clarification on why the rate has changed, the hotel was experiencing phone problems. I spoke to 6 people and got 6 different responses but no one could give us the original lower rate.- When I called reservations and was asking specific questions about how the room was laid out (important for anyone who has ever tried to travel with children), the reservation desk couldn't tell me anything about the room type I was inquiring about, despite its cost. - When I desperately explained our situation and requested an early check in - I was told "sorry - there's a waitlist and maybe we'll call you if you can check in early." I was literally standing at the desk with tears in my eyes and there was ZERO humanity in the conversation. Then, I never got a call - not even when check in time had already passed. - When we walked in with 2 kids, a dog, 4 bags, there was no one to greet us, open a door or help with luggage. - When we finally got ourselves into the room, there was someone else's bag of Chipotle sitting in the room. There were also light bulbs missing from lamps and a window had been left open. - When the manager, who I'd been advised to talk to because she would have the ablity to make rate changes - finally came on duty - and I explained our circumstances - she looked annoyed that I was even asking to have a conversation.

We enjoyed our stay but we're disappointed by the hidden charges which costs us over $125 and this was not resolved by the staff on reception and we were forced to just settle and accept charges we were not told about on check in or on purchase via Expedia.

Great location and standard of cleanliness but disappointed with the hidden urban charge and the lack of view from our room. Poor disabled and buggy access. Lack of hotel information in the room about check out and facilities. Comfy bed but noisey heater kept going off in the night waking us up. We went to stay for our 5th wedding anniversary and emailed ahead - our email was ignored.

Great location, friendly staff, nice interior style. My room was clean, comfortable and astonishingly quiet. I especially liked the atmosphere of the lobby and bar that was created by very friendly staff and relaxing guests; I immediately felt at home and in a good mood when returning from business in the city. Service in lobby could be a little more attentive; you always had to walk to the bar to receive a drink.

Stayed here for one night for a show at the Beacon theater. The location was excellent as the theater was only two blocks away. The rooms were spacious for NYC and very clean/modern. The staff was also very friendly throughout the stay.For the price, I thought this was a steal in NYC.The hotel bar was also a nice and cozy (decorated for the holidays) to have a few drinks after the show.

The NYLO is a great hotel with a lot of charm to it. It's located in a great area and the remodeling is beautiful. The staff was super genuine and nice, I even had some friendly conversations with the housekeepers. The beds were also very comfortable, which is a HUGE plus! The only things I would complain about are the cleanliness and construction. Our room had a bit of dirt on the ground and our sink was a bit stopped up. These were minor issues so I didn't bother to complain about it. The only thing that bothered me was the city was doing construction outside so we would wake up at 6am to it. I know it's beyond the hotel's control, but it was nonetheless annoying. Overall, I think the hotel was great, especially for the price of the rooms in comparison to other hotels in the area.

Upper West Side is not an area where I usually spend time, so I wasn't even aware of NYLO. It turned out to be a very stylish, in a funky way, boutique hotel. The lobby has an interesting design and is affixed to a popular and lively bar. On the three nights I stayed there, they had interesting live music. The room was smallish, but this is to be expected in Manhattan. It was quite elegant with rather quirky design.The location on the corner of Broadway and 77th Street turned out to be very convenient, with a number of restaurants in the neighborhood (one night I ate in the hotel's own restaurant, Serafina, which I must say was very good) and easy access to public transportation.
user_name:
JuhaUitto
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I stayed here recently while visiting family in NYC and would definitely stay again. The hotel is welcoming and even offers a free beer or house wine in their bar when you check in. The rooms are a bit smaller than some properties but were very well appointed and offered an adequate desk for working. The bathroom and shower were very good. Everything was also really clean. I stayed over Thanksgiving, often a time when prices in NYC soar to somewhat ridiculous levels. The value at NYLO was quite exceptional, especially given the holiday.

Clean comfortable rooms with helpful efficient staff. From front desk, baggage storage and greeting each time we entered or exited the hotel we enjoyed our stay. We did go to the 16th floor deck but as it was cold during our stay it was closed. We must come back in the spring.

NYLO is an ok hotel. The room we had (Panoramic Deluxe on 14th floor) was quite small and a little cheap looking (stainless steel sink, plasticky shower head). However, the bed was comfortable. At £400 per night I expected more - think I was short changed on this experience, especially compared to the other hotel we stayed at during our trip that I consider is far more superior, albeit located further downtown in Manhattan.

$80 extra than the original Expedia price and after calling he Hotel, I was not reimbursed, I had to call Expedia and they took care of my problem, sending me a $50 gift card, not happy with this Hotel!

Great experience, friendly staff, helpful, comfortable lobby, nice location, would stay here again. Traveled with someone in a wheelchair and staff was very accommodating. Small elevator from door to lobby

The NYLO hotel was very nice. The rooms are much bigger than some of the other hotels in the city. The bar is very nice and comfortable, as are the community rooms. Great location! It is nice to have a pull out couch for the unexpected visitor!

Awesome hotel. Lobby bar was great - always a place to sit and relax. Christmas decorations were beautiful! Kind of a hip coffee shop feel to it. Rooms were small but oh so nice. Beds were heavenly and I loved all their bath products. We loved the location, away from the hustle and bustle but close enough to walk to Central Park and other places. Plenty of good places to eat within walking distance (try jacob's pickles!). This is our ew go-to hotel in NYC. We have stayed at many nice hotels in NYC and this is our favorite!

My husband and I travelled to NYC on December 2-4. We had never stayed in this part of New York and I was curious based on the website and reviews. NYLO did not disappoint! The bedding and furnishings were fresh and clean, the style was uptown and contemporary with clean lines. Great design. The lobby area was so welcoming and home-like and the service was top rate. I loved the free beverage and the comfort of the whole environment.

my wife and I spent four days and everything went fine. The room was big enough, clean and the bed very confortable. The location is great, beautiful area, closed to central park and we could go everywhere by walk.

Great stay in upper west side. Hotel is in a great neighborhood with a lot of bars and restaurants and an easy walk to Central Park. The hotel has a nice vibe, with a cool area in the lobby for drinks and/or food.

We come to New York a couple of times a year. The last few years, we've stayed at the NYLO because it's convenient to the Beacon Theatre where we regularly attend their holiday programming. We will not be returning to this hotel again.Firstly, this year we planned to stay 3 nights and paid an additional $120 fee for a "higher floor." The first room that they tried to give us was a tiny closet on the 12th floor 3 feet from the elevators. When we asked for another room, a specifically requested that we NOT be placed near an elevator, we were given a room on the 11th floor...right next to the other elevator. Seriously?We have up, and decided to cut our losses and stay in the second room anyway. It's noisy and there is a connection door which enables us to hear every moment of the neighbors next door, in addition to the endless elevator noise.Then we went to the bar. We asked the bartender for a bottle of sparkling wine. She poured two glasses. When we told her that we had asked her for a bottle, not two glasses, she told us that she had to charge us FOR HER MISTAKE because "it was already in the system." How's that for customer service? She then proceeded to charge us for two glasses of wine AND the bottle. This is not a hotel that values service or customers. There are too many other hotels within shouting distance of this place. We won't be returning to hotel NYLO.Update: The connecting door to the next room provided ZERO insulation or privacy. So we were lucky enough to hear strangers arguing then having sex (luckily, neither for very long) making it nearly impossible to sleep.During check-out we learned that the previously mentioned bartender DOUBLE charged us, charging both our credit card directly and then the room. Incredibly dishonest.And to top it all off, NYLO still charged us for the $120.51 room "upgrade" which we never received.We definitely won't return.

Hotel/bar was great! Nice size room with view to street. Clean rooms though unsure of locker drawers. Italian restaurant service not do great. Food not too impressive either and served cold bread as appetizer.

My sister lives close by and we used the NYLO for Thanksgiving week. Great location, comfortable rooms, nice lobby and cozy bar. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. EZ walk to shops and restaurants.

What a great hotel that has top of the line service and spotless accommodations.They have a great location to boot, upper west side! Our front desk agent went above and beyond to accommodate our stay. Wow.Modern style hotel with a cozy vibe. We'll be back next time we are in NYC.

Good stay at the NYLO hotel, stayed 1st -5th of December. We had a wheelchair user with us and they accommodated this very well. On arrival we were greeted by a very helpful doorman who took our bags up to our room, there is a cage lift for wheelchairs and pushchairs that is operated by the doorman, if he is not at the door, someone at reception will help promptly. Our room was 204, it was a very large room with two double beds, large tv with good choice of channels, sofa, arm chair, safe and very large bathroom. Only down point is that there was no view from the windows, they were actually blacked out. Bathroom was a wet room and the shower takes agessss to warm up, but wasn't really a big issue. Staff were friendly and helpful. They offer a private taxi to the airport for $75 dollars, they said this includes toll bridge and tip, yet the taxi driver still asked for a tip?!?! So be careful with that. Also had to pay £200 security fee on a credit card on check in (refundable)Then £145 on check out for "amenities" the room didn't even have a proper kettle just a really bad coffee machine, so paying this much is a big extreme, especially when you're paying $500+ per night! But as they said it's in the "small print" on booking confirmation, however I feel this should be mentioned before booking!!Good points:-mostly clean-great friendly and helpful staff-central location-close to public transportation-great bar and free drink per person-joined onto a very good restaurant which offers takeaway Bad points:-Shower leaks into the room from under the door -hidden costs- under sink dirty-down side of beds very dusty-shower curtain needs to be changedOverall a good stay and beautifully decorated.

NYLO use to be my favorite hotel. I use to stay there on the average once a week. Now they advertise one rate and then tack on an extra $25 Urban Fee. Sure the fee includes the internet, two glasses of house wine, the fitness center, water and a couple other things. The truth is, NYLO gave you all these things except the wine before. This Urban Fee just makes you feel like they are squeezing you for a little more money. Very disappointing and short sited.

Kool place in NYC. Kool Staff. Kool vibes. Frozen Bar Staff...This was my third visit.Good neighbourhood for restaurants.Watch some of the taxi sharks that hang out in front and only take guest going to La Guardia or JFK...

Wonderful three night stay in NYC, great location, great guest services, comfy bar area and fast wifi. Easy walking distance to bars, restaurants, and subways. Best cookies in city just a 4 minute walk away at Levain Bakery!

Great stay at NYLO NYC: adorable lobby, wonderful room, most comfortable beds. Definitely on the top of the list for return visits to NYC. Great location on the UWS - easy access to transit and inexpensive cab rides to all attractions.

We visited the NYLO in December. They hotel was decorated so perfectly for the holidays. The holiday playlist was spot on. We loved hanging out in the lounge after a long day of walking around the city. The room was great as expected. The bed was very comfortable!!! Like the best bed ever!! The staff was kind and attentive. The neighborhood is such a quiet reprieve from the hustle of the city.

$700/night doesn't get you much in NYC these day. This place was terrible. Came to NY With my wife and two kids. No ramp or elevator for stroller. Had to break everything down just to get to the lobby. No one there to help. The room was dirty when we checked in. It was gross. Bathroom was even worse. I did not shower for two days because the shower was disgusting. We didn't want room service while we were there. Why bother, the staff did a horrible job prepping our room I didn't want them in there while our stuff was there. This place gets a big flop. They sell at as urban trendy. Who puts a nasty stainless steel sink as your bathroom sink. It's larger then a typical kitchen sink. who designed this place? The the furniture looks like it was chosen by some designer who was high as a kite to think this looks good or urban trendy as they call it. at these prices im sure here is better value in the city then this place.

NYLO has really transformed itself since the "OnTheAve" days. The new entrance and bar, as well as the living room concept are really cool. The hotel is close to everything and is a hidden gem on the upper west side. It is my go-to-place if i am not in the city on business. This was my 4th time staying there and I would recommend. Note: the ice machine is on the 12th floor so make sure to be placed there if you need easy access. Only 4 stars on the cleanliness measure due to some mold in shower stall; otherwise everything else was fine.
user_name:
jediwisdom
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed during Thanksgiving to be at the start of the parade.What you see in the pics is what you get. It's loft style and has a youthful vibe to it. The room was clean, and when we asked for more hangers and towels, they were brought within an hour. Mira, our room maid, was outstanding. She was personable with a great smile and warm personality. All the staff was wonderfully pleasant. This hotel has a CVS across the street, is 2 beautiful blocks from Central Park, 2 blocks from the subway (use 79th/Broadway), and there are lovely and unique shops along Amsterdam (a street 1 block over). Nice, safe, quiet neighborhood with markets, liquor store, and cafes sprinkled all around. I will be staying here again. I recommend an upper floor, and people were more generally pleased with at least a panoramic deluxe suite. We stayed in the penthouse, with one view of the city and another view of the Hudson...room 1605.
I certainly recommend!If you are looking for a real excellent cost vs quality.Excellent staff...great environment.Modern facilities...interesting happy hour...very good rates compared to other peers!

Located in a relatively quiet part of NYC yet close to Central Park, subway stations and museums. It also had an impressive number of really lovely bakeries within walking distance. The hotel had a funky yet homely feel and the staff were extremely helpful. The bed was incredibly soft - probably the best hotel bed ever. I'd go back just for another sleep.......

The NYLO offers clean, comfortable rooms with great beds. It is convenient to the subway and the rest of NYC. Locally, there are great restaurants within an easy walk. We have stayed here often and recommend it to our traveling friends

Consistent errors in not using cc credentials provided in advance so rooms booked for professionals are taken care of by their hosts. Response was totally unprofessional/unrepsonsible. Never use again.
user_name:
tkr2001
New York City, New York

review_body: Have stayed at NYLO three times over the past year. Room is comfortable, clean, quiet. Location is great! Close to many attractions but far enough away from Times Square. Staff very accommodating. Great value!

I would highly recommend this hotel for the location, service and quality. Rooms very clean, decent size for NYC loved floors no carpet which I believe is a plus! Beds super comfy, nice lounge and attentive service.

I used this hotel for the third time during last two years and I was very happy with it as usual! THe hotel is rooms and bath rooms are always clean and the personal is very friendly. Location is very close to public transport (express). Overall the location is great (walking to Central Park and Hudson River. Next year again!

This is the second time I have stayed here because I enjoyed my first one so much. Same pleasant staff, nice room, and great bar. Rooms are decent sized for price and for being in NYC. Still close to everything, while being a little quieter due to its location on the Upper West Side. Will come again!

We spent a very comfortable 4 nights. The location is very convenient to attractions and transit. Staff was friendly, courteous and helpful. Located within an easy walk to the Museum of Natural History and Central Park.

Inded the best quality of NYLO is the incredible location in the Upper West ; you could go walking to Central Park. Columbus Circle, Lincoln Center. There are several markets very near to the Hotel and you coul get very easy transportation ways by bus or by subway (2 blocks away).Thwe hotel is very cozy,pleasant and the staff has very good attitude.

I've stayed in NYC a handful of times- space is at a premium. However, the NYLO was incredibly spacious and well-designed. My view was amazing. The staff was also very friendly. They were there with a smile and greeting every time I entered the lobby. I would certainly recommend the NYLO!

The Nylo was well appointed business hotel with a cool vibe and fun bar. Service was very good and the price was fair for this time of the year. The hotel is well located and a good choice for business or recreational travelers who want to be on the Upper Westside.

Friendly and helpful staff, great location on the vibrant upper west side offering culture, restaurants and beautiful streets with brownstones, a lovely welcoming lobby and bar, spacious rooms. Optimal choice for all types of guests. A place to return to.

The hotel has a great vibe and style, and rooms are charming. However, heating was not working, several light bulbs were missing and room service was not great. Even with these issues, we will come back.

Hotel very well located. New facility. Beautiful bar. Spacious room, modern clean and nice service. convenient restaurant.Excellent bathroom. Clear.Sizeableb closet.Free wifi. Warm welcome. Gentle people in all areas.

Excellent again. Really enjoyed staying there and we were there for five nights, which is a LONG time for us at any hotel. This was our second time to the NYLO, and we were as impressed this time as we were with our first visit. Will definitely return.
user_name:
George Y
San Francisco, United States

review_body: Any adjacent room noise is easily heard. Pray for good neighbors. Bar area is cute. Location is fantastic. Staff is very nice. Rooms clean, normal small manhattan size. Bathrooms are fine. But if you have any sensitivity to noise, stay somewhere else.

Ok hotel but rooms and bathrooms were very small. Bar in lounge didn't open til 3pm. Not sure if every day but certainly our last day, a Tuesday, we were looking forward to using our complimentary drinks tickets but....

Staff was very friendly. Hotel location is excellent. Right across from a 24 hr CVS. A few blocks from Central Park and the subway. Room was a little small, but to be expected in NY. Highly recommend.

good location to access the whole city. comfortable and quirky in that the bed was so high i had a hard time getting up. only one chair in the room, although i must admit that it would have been more cramped. good reading lights by the bedside. shower floor and walls need a bit more scubbing. was nice to see that pets were welcome.
user_name:
claudel319
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We stayed there before and after Thanksgiving, 2016. Both times we had a king size bed in somewhat small rooms. Everything worked fine, there was enough room to set up two suitcases, the beds were comfortable, there's a small exercise room, the A/C was a bit noisy, and the rooms were clean and well heated. The desk clerks and doormen were polite and helpful. There is a bar in the hotel (you get two chits for free house wine or draft beer) and a restaurant in the building on the Broadway side--the hotel entrance is actually on 77th Street near Broadway. The hotel has recently been renovated in a modern style with stainless steel bathroom vanity and sink, modern lamps and décor, laminate flooring, etc. There are 30 minutes free computer time at a sitting at the business center in the lobby with free printing. There is free WiFi in the rooms. The hotel location is very convenient if you are operating on the Upper West Side. It's near the American Museum of Natural History, as many restaurants as you could possibly want, Trader Joe's at 72nd and Broadway, and the number 1 subway at 79th Street and Broadway and express trains 2 and 3 at the 72nd Street and Broadway station. We checked vacation rentals in the area, the Excelsior Hotel, and several others nearby and found the NYLO to be the best value. With it's amenities and good reviews, we found the NYLO to be an excellent value.

Hotel was very cozy, good customer service, great location, chic lounge, good restaurant on first floor, modern and very comfortable rooms, would recommend to anyone. Red Farm and Zabaars very our favorite nearby restaurants. Hotel has small patio to enjoy as well.

Great location. Clean. Pleasant staff. A bit noisy at night. Lounge nice but found table service slow one evening even though they weren't busy. Better service sitting at bar. All in all, though, a positive experience. We'd come back.

We booked this hotel at the last minute after deciding to kick an item on out bucket list, Macy's Thanksgiving Day parade. Wow, this hotel on the upeer West side is close to the start and where the big ballons are staged the night before. It was a great hotel and experience. Just do it!

We were in search of a nice and comfortable place to stay this hotel was it! Its modern furnishings helped to detract from the lack of scenery from our window. The front office personnel was most personable.

Just love this hotel! Great location and ambiance. The rooms are a nice size, and the linens and mattress are wonderfully comfy. Never disappointed whenever we visit the UWS.Sure there are other hotels in the area, but nothing like the NYLO!

Past visits have been very pleasant, but this trip was a disappointment in multiple ways. Perhaps there was a problem of understaffing due to the holiday (no fresh towels, "no one working in the laundry," no one to check room temperature, no one who seemed to understand issues at front desk).

Don't stay here if you are claustrophobic. My room was tiny; window overlooking solid wall. Bathroom in the wannabe-modern style. The staff was friendly enough. The lobby area is nice though. Location is a bit far from downtown manhattan, but you can easily catch the tube. central park is just a short walk from the hotel.

I was only in town for one night and I need to make it count. I was attending an event at the Beacon Theater (literally right around the corner) and NYLO couldn't have been more perfect. Swank and hip with a great bar, the room itself was outstanding (great closet!), impeccably clean and beyond comfortable. The staff were wondeful and attentive - even the pizza was good! Just a few blocks from the 72nd St Subway entrance within everything you need right there. Found my new New York City staple for sure.

Great location to shopping, Central Park and the Macy's parade. Great food and little bar area. Space to work and hang out. Rooms are basic but large and clean. Bed and bedding super comfortable. Would recommend.

The hotel was very nice. Our rooms were cleaned on a timely manner and always supplied us with clean towels. The bed was very comfortable. We enjoyed the bar and lounge area as well. Everyone was very accomodating.

A good place to stay for a week holiday, the staff was really nice, helpt us very good. The room 'deluxe' was to small for 3 adult people, but when it was possibly to changed to another room we were very happy about the size. Every day good cleaning, the mini-frigde was a plus. The bathroom was very nice and big.The noise outside was in the night sometimes to much, but we get used to it. Grosery, metro and shops nearby. The last day we good stay a little bit longer in the room, so didn't wait to long in the lobby till the transfer arrived. Staff thanks for the good services!!

Our family has moved into NYLO's UWS neighborhood so it seemed like a perfect place to stay for Thanksgiving weekend. Our two nights cost almost $800 for a VERY small room with NO chair and a tiny bathroom. Granted, we understand small NYC hotel rooms and the price for this holiday weekend - but this was ridiculous. Nothing special about the room or hotel. Never intend to stay here again.

Great place..even in winter. Will definately return during the summer . So much to see. So many friendly people. The views were stunning . Wasn't expensive as we thought it would be. Lots of places to choose from to eat. Plenty of shops. All around an amazing place to visit, would recommend everyone to travel there at least once

This is a comfortable hotel in a wonderful location. The Upper West Side has everything: restaurants, shopping, walking, and museums. The hotel is friendly and unpretentious. The guest rooms could use some cosmetic improvements, which would be easy to do.

This is a very comfortable hotel in an ideal location. It's not fancy or super luxurious, but it is comfortable and has a friendly vibe. Everything you could possibly want is outside your door, from Zabars and Fairway to Red Farm and other great restaurants. The best part of the hotel is the lobby bar, which is a lot of fun, although the mixed drinks could use some work!

Excellant uptown boutique in quaint neighborhood, near train and restaurants. I have stayed here for 10 or more years and have enjoyed it every time! The outside construction is a little noisy, but tolerable. The staff is excellent. The beds are comfortable. The neighborhood is fantastic and safe. The train is only a few blocks away.

Great hotel, loved the atmosphere and the location. We will definitely come back to this hotel and recommend it. Rooms were clean and the staff was very accommodating and pleasant to deal with. Great time by all!
user_name:
jennifej
North Carolina Coast, North Carolina

review_body: Great location and a real value for staying on the upper west side. Plenty to do and see, perfect for a show at the Beacon Theatre. Would recommend to anyone from out of town. Great neighborhood and really overall value

Carlos at the front desk welcomed us as return visitors. We loved our corner upper floor room, and find the urban chic styling, the cozy king size bed, and the Upper West Side neighborhood compelling enough to have made this our favorite New York overnight accommodation. Easy metro access. Just lots to love about it, and Carlos helped maked this stay fantastic. ... Should add that we got a Thanksgiving weekend sale which helped make a great room choice more affordable.

Good location for a foreign couple to get a feel of Thanksgiving preparations and celebrations. The parade stars on the same street. Serafina's downstears good place to start your day with hearty breakfast

I like the location of this hotel. It was an easy walk to Central Park and subway. The standard hotel room was pretty small but enough for 2 people. The bathroom is nice except for the weird looking sink that wasn't really user friendly (design and function) doesn't go hand and hand. But overall, it was pretty decent and the rollaway bed was complimentary.

This hotel, nestled on 77th street, is a hidden gem. It has a real hipster vibe, with excellent decor for all ages. They are so friendly and welcoming to everyone including pets. The room was quiet, clean and comfortable not to mention the perfect location. I have high standards and this has met them all.

Great place, buzzing lobby, great for a drink and meet the locals. Bedroom large, good bed, but room 808, needs turning round! Bed was obviously supposed to face with Dow and TV, but some bright spark had change it so don't watch TV unless you want a bad neck!! Also, the lights were far to big for a bedroom - they would loo better in the lobby! Great coffee maker and great coffee.

Hotel is great. Don't take a room on 77 st. Firehouse is down the street. Sirens all night long. Otherwise, hotel is fine. Great little lobby bar and Serafina does terrific pancakes . Great value if you can upgrade to a penthouse balcony room.

I expected a view of the New York skyline. Instead I had a view of a brick wall. Considering the cost of the room and added charges, I really expected more from this hotel. If I ever decide to stay here again, I make sure that I insist on a better view. The brick wall view was not at all expected, and was a huge disappointment.....................................................................................................................

Very clean and spacious room. Everyone was quite nice. Overall, great stay. I stay in NYC quite a bit and was certainly impressed by the NYLO. The beds were really comfy, we were giving a drink voucher and free internet upon arrival. All was easy and pleasant.
user_name:
Jane R. L
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Very.stylish, basic hotel. Simple bath and bedroom with sleek modern touches. The windows were not the best; we heard a lot of city noise from our 7th floor room. Breakfast at Serafina was excellent. The hotel staff was extremely accommodating and friendly.
user_name:
robin m
New York City, New York

review_body: Really liked this hotel, friendly helpful staff, lovely comfortable rooms, spotless. The location is good, plenty of restaurants and cafes nearby, short walk to the subway,Central Park,Broadway, shops. Would highly recommend. Thank you
user_name:
Isobel L
South Ayrshire, United Kingdom

review_body: The room, the service, the location were excellent. The price, a bit high due to the holiday; but, had to do it once for our daughter. The room was large, well organized, and clean. The service was friendly and helpful. Helpful, in that they watch our luggage before and after our night's stay. The price was high, tantamount to price gauging due to the timing of our stay, the day before Thanksgiving. But, so were all of the other hotels in the area. We would do it all over again.

The lobby is cozy and has two areas to relax in. Small comfortable bar area as well. The restaurant Serafina's is adjoining the lobby. Wonderful food. I love the location as it is centrally located in the Upper West Side, a couple blocks from Central Park. It has become my "go to hotel" when I stay in the city. I like that is away from the hussel of activity, yet close to the subway. I can join the fast pace of life in NY when I wish, yet a quick ride back to the peace and calm of the Upper West at the end of the day.

Stayed for 6 nights in October 2016 and have almost only good things to say! Hotel is contemporary, clean, friendly and conveniently located. There is some noise, mostly just because it's in a city, but there is also construction nearby - we didn't find this too disturbing though. Our room was very comfortable, with everything you could possibly need. The hotel is very close to the Beacon Theatre. Being on 77th and Broadway it's not far from Central Park and the Natural History Museum. It's also only 2 blocks from the subway at 79th. Staff were all friendly and helpful. Will hopefully be staying here again!

One family member and one friend recommended this hotel to us. We spent four nights there in late November 2016. The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. Our room was very quiet, well appointed and clean. The ambiance in the lobby is warm and friendly. A good restaurant (serving breakfast, lunch and dinner) adjoins the restaurant. It was easy to get from this hotel to major spots in the city. This is a good value.

It should be 4-star hotel but they have some disadvantages. The staff was generally good but nothing special. It should be boutique hotel but I did not feel any personality. I stayed in superior room what was very small and furniture slightly worn. Bathroom was extreamly small and ugly design. The interior looks like cheap. Only the bed was big and very confortable (as usually in USA). Rooms are cleaned every day but despite this, the floor was dirty. The location is OK (Upper West Side) but not excellent.

NYLO NYC was perfect for us! Had business partners with me and we had a great time. Rooms were large for New York. Jelissa took care of us personally and greeted us upon arrival. We even decided to stay and extra day and they were happy to assist in the last minute change in plans. Recommend highly!

Great value but lots of street construction noise. Stayed here before gave similar review. Asked to come back give them another chance to make things right. So we did. Asked for room facing south or Broadway got room again cc'ing 77th. Told no worries won't be any construction this time. 7:00 am guess what? Yep and no rooms available on south side either day of check in or next. So great value, stupid furniture, room type requested (both catagory - paid for grade - and location of room) not honored. Recommendation remains same - do not pY for any upgrades, expect lots of noise and no frills but you will get clean place to sleep for less than other hotels.

The minute I walked in I felt a very warm welcoming staff. A very cozy and friendly atmosphere. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. I already told my family and friends about NYLO. I live in NJ and I will come back several more times to stay here.

Check in was quick & easy. Thank you Carlos! Clean room,nice tv, comfortable beds. Convenient location. Plenty of places to eat nearby. Rooms well apportioned, ironing board,hair dryer. Plugs for chargers including usb.

Great hotel, lovely staff and good location. The room was very clean and comfortable, the lobby bar was very vibrant and the free printer in the lobby was really useful. Would definitively recommend this hotel.

Room (queen deluxe) was fantastic and staff was excellent. Definitely recommend. (We were on fourth floor, so we could hear some noise outside, but overall was great place to stay). Area has everything you need.

Beautiful place, great location. Worth your trip! Make sure to visit the bar, great and very friendly bartenders!! Especially the one named Ben who was our main server. Such a fun and nice worker. Great time.

We opted for a large room on the high floor, and loved all the light and the view. The room also had light fixtures all along the ceiling and two by the bedside. The service was gracious and immediate. Loved the bar, dripping with old New York ambience, and okay cocktails - more a beer venue. Indoor connection to Serafina's saved our lives in 40 degree, windy weather, for which we were not prepared. We were tired of Times Square, and loved this neighborhood. Small stuff: thanks for the wall-mounted swivel mirror; and the "sleep" switch on the TV remote needs to work.

I have stayed at the NYLO many times, too many to count! I keep coming back to this place because it is the nicest, friendliest hotel on the Upper West Side. The value for your money is excellent. This hotel is clean and nicely renovated, the lobby has a cool vibe and I wouldn't stay anywhere else. The location is awesome, a close subway ride to anything you want to do in NYC! Central Park and Riverside Park are just blocks away, the neighbourhood can't be beat. The staff are excellent! Lenny the doorman is amazing, he genuinely cares about his job and treats the guests with amazing service, he's the best doorman in NYC! Johanna from the office staff is amazing! She takes care of me every time I come to the city and has gotten to know me personally as a guest of the NYLO! She has exceptional customer service and is a true professional. Rosa in reservations is so great, she is always on top of things and makes sure my reservations are handled efficiently and accurately. The entire staff at this hotel are worth mentioning because they are truly valued employees: Cris, Alberto, Gregory, Eduardo, Jose, Daniel are all excellent! Ben is the friendliest fellow and best server in the NYLO lounge- a true pleasure! And the front desk staff from Ramona, Eloyd, Tasha, Jessie who all go beyond to take care of their guests with the superb professionalism! The managers at the front desk are truly exceptional, Matt & Ranata, they are obviously doing great work hiring such fine employees. The housekeeping staff are the best, Saha on the 7th floor and Meria on 14th &16th floors especially, they work hard to make your stay a pleasurable one. People who don't often get mentioned are hotel maintenance staff such as Raul and Mervin, I need to say these fellows are friendly, helpful and a pleasure to deal with! Thank you NYLO Staff for making my stay in November another great experience, I will be back again in December to enjoy another lovely stay. This hotel is a true gem!

Location was great. Easy to get to anywhere in Manhattan with a short walk or subway ride. Helpful, friendly staff especially Ramona at the front desk. Nice little bar in the lobby that was a wonderful place to wind down after a night out

This hotel is hip,chic,affordable and fantastic location! I would definitely return and recommend to all!The lounge was filled with activity and we received a complimentary drink at the bar with a red piano.A fun youthful vibe.

Very comfy & quiet room, welcoming lobby with a nice bar. First time staying in the upper west side & loved the location. Look forward to returning for another visit. The reservation staff was helpful as were the folks at the front desk. A nice place!

Great and very confortable room! Wonderful location, very close to good restaurants, markets, café and subway. Nice staff! The only problem was the shower that was very weak, with no much water - maybe it was a problem in our specific room. The rest was great, I would stay there again for sure,

Stayed for 5 nights in this hotel which is well located just off Broadway and within reach of all the main attractions. A huge choice of restaurants and bars is just round the corner on Amsterdam Avenue

Several problems with room and service. All went unresolved by staff. Very unlikely to return. Extremely long wait and service times in every aspect of our stay, and while service was polite, it did not make up for it.
user_name:
ryangU1727QB
New York City, New York

review_body: Nylo is in a great location and close to the subway station which was very convenient. Lots of good restaurants in the area and places to visit. Nice to have Central Park so close by and close walking distance to other attractions in NYC
