Lousy, no sleep because of ext. Noise. Staff ripped me off for $25, lying, stating it was in the Expedia confirmation. Staff tried to charge me a full stay against Expedia rules. Had to spend an uneasy 2 hours on the phone w Expedia and Renatta of NYLO.

Check In was quick and the staff was very helpful and friendly. They gave us complimentary drink coupons for their bar and wi-fi password. Elevators by the main desk took a very long time for us. Only one of the two went to 14th floor and higher. We found other elevators at the opposite end of hotel (by restaurant) that were much quicker. Booked the Lifestyle Loft for 2 nights. We were disappointed with the view from the room we were given (expected city views from the website room description and photos - instead we looked directly onto a building that was undergoing construction). We called down to the front desk and they were able to move us to another room with a much better view for our second night. Both rooms though were clean and large by NYC standards. Bed was comfy and had plenty of pillows. Both rooms had balconies with chairs outside - but it was too cold and windy to take advantage of the outdoor space. My only complaint about the rooms are the bathrooms are small and need more/better lighting. The rooms could use more lighting too (high hats on both sides of the room would help when you need to go through your bag or suitcase to find something). Check out was fast and the doormen and valet were great. Overall a really nice boutique style hotel. In walking distance to many great restaurants, museums and Central Park. I would recommend NYLO and look forward to returning.

Given a handicapped room on the second floor near the gym! No hot water and no heat. The person on duty (Joann or Jacquie) acted as if she was put out when I called to tell her the problem. The next day the problems were fixed, but you had to let the water run before it got luke warm. I am certain that NYLO was aware of the problem but gave me that room anyway!! Had to ask twice to get a tube of toothpaste. I had forgotten mine. Not a great stay.

Hotel is very nice, in a nice area that is close to the subway, shopping and grocery. The only issue was that the room was very dark because it was beside a tall building. Brighter and more lighting would have helped with this but the room was very nice. We did have to upgrade to a Suite for the space. Nice bar the the rooftop lounge was beautiful.

The location is convenient to the number 1,2 and 3 subway. Great restaurants nearby and close to Central Park. Friendly and professional staff. Great deal for the upper west side. My only complaint was the walls seemed thin as we could hear a lot of the hallway noise, but it wasn't too problematic.

This is my fifth stay at this hotel and it was as good this time as all the times previously. The fact that Serafina is in the hotel makes grabbing a quick but very tasty meal easy and the bar in the lobby always has a cool vibe... wish they had a piano player there at the piano bar

This hotel is definitely recommended. I stayed here for a wedding in November. There is a great downstairs bar + adjoining restaurant.. comfortable rooms and best of all LOCATION! The staff was happy to store my luggage since I arrived early - walked to Central Park and many great things to do nearby. Highly recommended.

good location as it's convenient to central park and other amenities, comfortable lobby, room was small but comfortable, didn't like the 1970's music in the lobby or at least not every day (maybe go a little deeper into this genre instead of the tired old stuff you hear everywhere all the time)

Just a quick overnight stay. Great bed and great restaurant. Highly recommend the filet and/ or the New York strip streak. The staff was very courteous and knowledgeable about local area. The room was relatively small but that's pretty standard for New York.

spacious room, quiet, courteous staff, lively baronly issue was getting a crib, which was finally delivereddoormen were helpful with strollerlocation was convenient with many restaurants and shops nearby

Great hotel, Close to many activities. Cool city vibe, love the lobby and bar area. The friendly staff made our stay very accommodating. We also got two free drink vouchers. The price was hard to beat, We would go back.

Great accommodations at a reasonable price. Would certainly stay again! It was clean and the staff was very friendly. We enjoyed the roof top patio where we were able to have a cocktail, relax and take in the views of the city.

The Nylo is a pleasant modern hotel in a very convenient location . The room was adequate in size, simply decorated, with a very comfortable king sized bed. The lobby of the hotel has a 'cool' vibe with lots of pleasant seating.

Lovely hotel, nice atmosphere particularly the bar. The bed most comfortable I've ever slept on! Would recommend to anyone staying in new York, in good place to reach everywhere with out being too busy

We stayed one night. The room was large with a couch and two beds. The beds were extremely comfortable and the room was spotless. It had a very modern feel and the lobby had great music playing with a swanky atmosphere. Great spot for a staycation or for a regular vacation. Location was fantastic on the upper west side. You are able to get away from all of the tourists and the hustle and bustle. Lincoln Center is a short walk and there are some great restaurants in the area. Perfect hotel for a couple.
user_name:
S9607IKlaurenp
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a nice hotel with comfortable amenities. The room was decorated in modern, somewhat minimalist decor. The lobby has a very comfortable waiting area with comfortable chairs, books and board games. There is also computers and a printer to use. There is also a nice bar in the lobby area and two restaurants attached to the hotel. The hotel is located in a great area with a nice French bakery/cafe and grocery store across the street. The subway station is about 4 blocks away and Central Park is about 8 blocks away. My only complaints about this hotel is the tricky WiFi connections and the cold draft from the windows. The WiFi drops connection to your device after a few hours of use. You need to refresh the WiFi connection on your device to reconnect. As for the draft from the windows, it was a very windy November weekend in which I stayed at the hotel. Since the room has no carpet and the windows seem to need better caulking, the cold chill on the floor and the draft made the room less cozy. Luckily the bed's comforter is soft, plush and warm.One last thought, I wish the room had a refrigerator to keep some milk and snacks for my kids.

Highly recommended hotel , we enjoyed it very much. Rooms are in decent size and well design . Above all great team with amazing hospitality. In particular we must mention Jennifer at the front desk team who was very helpful , generous and has done far and beyond for us .

Clean, friendly, inviting hotel in a wonderful, convenient neighborhood that's not too noisy at night. The staff is consistently helpful. Eating salad at the bar for dinner was affordable. I just wish they served breakfast!
user_name:
Diana R
Santa Cruz, CA, USA

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay. The room was of a good size, the location of the hotel is great and close to a lot of things (restaurants, drugstore, convenient store, grocery) so you can find everything. From a walking distance of the main attractions and theaters. Te staff is very friendly and giving an excellent service to customers.

The best place to stay for location. I have stayed here at least once a year since 2013. Close to subway, the BEST doormen,(Alberto) and serafina is delicious. Enjoyed our trip immensely. Love that CVS is across the street

Outstanding service, atmosphere and general feeling of welcome . We continue to return( 6 years now) and each time are so pleased with our choice.Great and safe neighborhood, wonderful restaurants nearby on Broadway,Amsterdam ,etc.

Got a call while in the taxi on the way to the hotel saying they could no longer honor my reservation because of some "glitch" with the reservation system. Sent me to another lesser hotel (but did cover the cost). Manager promised to follow-up with an email, which never came.

I always stay at NYLO in NYC and I always feel right at home. Staff are amazing, rooms are fairly spacious for NYC esp the suites. Bathrooms are nice and clean. Even the smallest rooms are nice! I love the lobby and the vibe. I will continue staying here time and time again!

The hotel is very clean and roomy. We stayed in a double queen room and it was just fine. The location being on the upper West side was awesome. Close to everything. The staff was nice and friendly and there were a lot to do around the area as well.

The hotel staff was very nice, the room was clean the size of the room ok. The one thing they need to address is the noise. One can hear absolutely everything from the room next door. If you are lucky and have silent neighbors like me you're ok!

Excellent hotel in the Upper West Side. I'll definitely be back. Clean, comfortable, great location, nice amenities, helpful staff. Price is pretty decent too for the location. The bar and restaurants are nice too.

This is a nice hotel with easy access to all UWS attractions. Staff graciously moved us to a larger room when it became available. Lounge bar and restaurants are nice, as was the area to rest, work or surf the internet in the lobby. Not your traditional 4-star hotel, but the location is exactly what we wanted to stay, so we give it our own 4-star rating.

While we went to see Hillary Clinton synch the Presidential win, we still had a very nice stay at the NYLO. They even gave us free vouchers for a drink at the bar below (though we didn't use but hope to use in the future) and everyone was very courteous. The room was just right and comfortable. I would stay here again, no doubt.

The location is great. The staff is very nice and the rooms are clean and comfortable. I stay there repeatedly for business and would recommend it. The lobby is set up for friendly socializing and having a restaurant -- Serafinas attached to it is a good place to eat.

Most reception employees were not helpful or welcoming, with the exception of the baggage claim guys. Bartender never acknowledged our presence so we left after being ignored for over 10 minutes.Lobby painted black adds to unwelcoming, unappealing appearance. Room was dark and needed sweeping.

Great location on the Upper West, away from the busy Manhattan, close to two subway stops and stores/ restaurants around. As for the room, it was on a smaller side - which is ok if everything else is perfect.. But we found a stain on the bedsheet and a dirty toilet seat. We asked for the sheet to be changed, which they did. The house keeping lady changed the entire sheet including the mattress pad.

The hotel's location on the Upper West Side is wonderful. Ideal to have a lounge in the lobby and the hotel's layout of the lobby is a very inviting design. Sarafina's, one of the restaurants on site, has good food and great staff!

The NYLO on the Upper West Side is by no means a "fancy" hotel, but it is very comfortable and a solid option if you're visiting the city. The location is convenient, right in the heart of the neighborhood, and we enjoyed the complimentary drink passes in the lobby bar. Our room was surprisingly spacious (not large by any means, but plenty of room for two people!) and quiet, considering the hotel is around the corner from a fire station. We also appreciated the staff bringing up a mini-fridge for us upon request. Would definitely stay here again!
user_name:
EML1308
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I highly recommend this hotel when in the NYC area! Our room was super clean, ready early, and super comfortable. The beds were so soft and the linens were clean- and I am a germaphobe. I was very happy with our stay and hope to stay there again in the future!

We had a lovely room and view, but I was disappointed in the lack of response when we told the front desk our room smelled like cigarettes. We were told all rooms are non-smoking, so it wasn't possible. Our room had a balcony, so the last guest probably smoked out there and the smell came in. They said they could have someone come up and check, and so I said sure. 15 min later they called back and asked if we still wanted someone to come up and "spray air freshener". We said no thanks.

Took my husband for a weekend trip to NYC for his 50th BDay. Decided on Upper West Side so we could get out of the crowds and wanted to be walking distance to Central Park is it was Fall. Perfect location, right on Broadway...walked everywhere, lots of subway options. Was able to get food at 2am at a local pizza shop. Staff was very nice, bar and sitting areas in the lobby were cozy and great for a pre or post cocktail. We stayed in room 1509 which was a penthouse room. Really nice view and balconies on both sides of the room. Room was a little strangely decorated, I think they were going for an urban industrial feel, which they did, but slightly on a cheesier side. Lighting was a little odd, bathroom sink was cool, but not all that functional. Shower was the boom. We didn't use the sitting room very much (we were out most day and nights), but the furniture was super uncomfortable. No room service. But great location, friendly staff, lots of shopping and food options nearby. I would definitely recommend if you want the UWS.

excellent location.professional staff and vaporclean roomincluding a very pleasent atmosphere.the price was fair.next vacation if the price is reasonable certnaily invite this cozy hotelcan not forget

NYLO is a reliably convenient hotel in an interesting neighborhood, away from the crazy crowds of midtown. It's possible to imagine living in the neighborhood. The basic rooms are teeny tiny but good value. I've stayed there numerous times. It attracts a lively and quite international crowd.

Nice place. We had a room facing a brick wall but it was very quiet. Urban fee on checkout. Ridiculous. They claimed it was for amenities but they could not be more specific. Housekeeping was inconsistent but the room was clean. Nice lounge area.

This is my second time staying at this location. The first time it was the "On the Avenue" and now the NYLO. The location is excellent for the upper west side. The ambience is very positive and lively, with a nice lobby scene and bar. Serafina, the Italian restaurant , is accessible through the hotel and is an excellent place to have some good food. The room was nice but needed a little repair work, but overall it was very comfortable with a good bed.

This is the second time we've stayed here while visiting our son who lives on 80th. We now think the NYLO has passed the hotel we usually stay at! Very hip and busy but excellent value and location. Staff was very friendly and accommodating.

Very pleasant staff from the doorman to the housekeeper and all in between. Specially the doorman that was always attentive and responsive. The lobby decor and the different areas are very enticing. Room bathroom a bit cold on the design.

Our stay was perfectly pleasant. The lobby and bar areas were fun and we were given two complementary drink tickets at check in that we used in the bar. The room itself was small (but probably pretty standard for New York). A lot of things had been done really cheaply, like the faucets and the bedding. Our shower didn't drain well at all. It was very easy to hear anything going on in the hallway, but luckily our neighbors were pretty quiet. A decent price and a great neighborhood close to the park though, which is what we cared about most.

Booked room based on co-workers recommendation. Visiting family on the UWS, location met our needs perfectly. Rooms were large and clean (loved the wood floors)! The bathroom was one of the largest I have experienced in NYC. The downstairs lobby was a perfect place to connect with family and enjoy a drink. Only downside (if this is one) - NYC Fire across the street and they were very busy that weekend. So if you do not enjoy late night fire runs ask for a room that doesn't face 77th.

NYLO New York City great hotel The hotel is in a perfect location - 2/3 blocks from central park.2 blocks from the subway.We visited for Marathon NY 2016 - great location for the finish line.The staff are friendly and eager to help.

It was a new thing for my kids they where invited by there grandfather after 5 months of not seeing him. We had a 15 minute wait, the food was great, alot of variety and good customer service too. Totally recommend it.
user_name:
Babelicious1220
New York City, New York

review_body: I've stayed at the NYLO New York City in both its current and its former iteration. The current management is superior. The hotel staff was helpful. Although our room was dominated by the King sized bed, it didn't feel as squished as many rooms I've stayed in while in New York. For example, I travel with a yoga mat and could use it in the remaining square footage. Around the corner is Red Farm, a very tasty "modern Chinese cuisine" restaurant with noodles and dim sum. Subway stations easily accessed. Central Park close by. Strong wifi, and desk with reasonable chair makes it possible to work from your room, though many travelers were using the shared lobby/working space during the day. Nice bar for evenings. I will stay here again.

All I like in one place, nice size clean room, great bar and a very helpful staff. Jessie at the front desk was very responsive to a problem i had with my schedule and solved it quickly. there are two very good yoga studios nearby

Was beyond our expectations. Arrived early and let us check in right away. Our room was upgraded for free. Received two complimentary drinks and was served by their professional and friendly bartender, Chris, at their LOCL bar.

We paid over $1100. for a 2 night stay at this hotel. While the bed was comfortable, the rest of the room furnishings were extremely poor. There was only one comfortable chair to sit on in addition to a desk chair. The lighting in the room was not adequate. Even on the 9th floor we heard all the loud street traffic and early AM garbage trucks. No counter space or towel racks in the bathroom. There was black mold on the tile grout in the tub/shower.

We had stayed here last year and it seems the quality has gone down a bit. The maids doormen and front desk were all very friendly and helpful, but my sheets were stained (which I only found out at @12:00 the first night) which was upsetting. I was out in a room with two windows (lots of light) but they were doing construction outside the window so we had to keep our curtains drawn the entire trip, the bathroom door refused to stay open, and also the sound in the hallway carries ALOT and doors slamming from 6 am on make a good night's sleep impossible. I came home (and still am) sleep deprived. Love the upper west side and the vibe but overall a much less pleasant experience only a year later. Disapponted because I loved this place.

4 night stay (2 in regular room, 2 in penthouse suite). Can state that the location is great, very convenient to subway (10 mins from Time Square) & walking distance from great museums & Central Park. Bar downstairs, Service, Employees were great the whole time, very friendly & helpful. Internet was great & water was hot in the bathrooms which I like. However the floors seemed not to be swept at all which is a big thing because the floors are wood which led to a lot of dust in the air. I had to shake out the sheets & wipe off desks in room both days I was in the regular room. The Penthouse Suite was better but still had to wear socks the whole time & they were dirty when taking them off. The bathroom in the Penthouse suite had less then the regular room as far as articulating mirror, lights, etc. The lighting was not very good in the Penthouse at all. The closet had no light & the hallway light was dim so the dim bathroom light did not help at all so I used the living room to pack/unpack. Also the suite i was in had 2 balconies (1 looking east, the other overlooking the Hudson River/Broadway street). Both doors were unlocked when I arrived in the room & both had flimsy locks, 1 which opened at some point in the middle of the night & sucked the curtain out.Overall the Penthouse was very nice but I've stayed at $500/night suites (Swissotel Chicago, Trump Vegas) & that's what I come to expect from a luxurious room. However it was very nice stay because of the service & location. However, I wouldn't recommend the Penthouse Suites if you want to splurge.

Great location on the Upper West Side. The room felt dated and really small. A couple of lights were out but I did not let anyone know. I'm sure they would have responded quickly. I paid extra for a high floor and view. I ended up on the 12th floor but the view was non existent.

Room was very spacious and clean. Location is ideal. I use this hotel at least 8 times a year and have only had one negative experience. I would always recommend this hotel because staff are friendly and I know we will get good service.

We began with a booking and we actually upgraded but when we got there, our room was just a bit dingy and dark as the room was an inside room with a window that looked at a wall... making it very dark. We went back downstairs and the manager was able to help us. We did have to wait at the bar area-for close to 2 hours for our new room to be ready, but we just had the rest of our party meet us in the lounge. It was well worth the wait.

Reserved King / Queen, given two double beds. Showed reservation, told nothing could be done. Staff didn't even apologize or acknowledge the error. Later told it was an "upgrade" & staff acted like we should be appreciative.

I really like this upper west side hotel in a nice neighborhood. good spot a bit out of the craziness of Midtown but not too far away. Close enough to Central Park for an early morning run. Good service, pleasant accommodations and solid price/value equation (at least on my recent visit). I will stay here again and enjoyed my visit. higher floors are a bit more quiet than low floors.

If you are heading towards the Upper West Side, NYLO is highly recommended. It is modern, clean and welcoming. The location is convenient for the subway (1 train) and there are numerous restaurants within easy walking distance. Best of all, the price is incredibly reasonable for a good quality NY hotel

I love boutique hotels for their charm and relaxed feel and The NYLO is one of my new favorites. I traveled with my daughter for her 18th birthday and this was our first stop on a 3 week trip. The location is perfect for visiting NYC being able to walk, take the subway or taxi in no time at all to the best attractions. The staff was welcoming and accommodating. The room we had was clean and the bed was like heaven that it made it hard to want to get up and get going. We felt safe at this property and in the neighborhood. Lots of dining options nearby. Only complaint we had was that we didn't stay longer.

Good not great. Had a chance to rise to excellence but missed out for a few details like plastic cups not glasses and powdered creamer for the coffee machine instead of half and half in shelf stable containers

Lots of noise in the hallway outside our room in the morning as well as construction noise outside the hotel. We actually had a harder time sleeping in here than the other hotel we stayed at in midtown. Otherwise it was a nice hotel in a great location.

Not too big, not too small, makes you feel you're known and welcome. Excellent staff. Very close to the park if you want to practice and 2 blocks from a great restaurants like the "Dove tail" ans Sushi of Gery.

I Loved this hotel, but it has declined over the eight or nine years I've been staying there. Rooms are smaller and darker. The service elevator disappeared; now guests ride with full laundry carts. (On the other hand, if you ride w/ people who work there, you can talk w/ them & hear gossip.) The desk clerks do not answer the phone. You have to call the concierge & ask that she find someone you can talk to.

This is my second stay at the hotel. I always choose smaller boutique hotels and this hotel has the feel of a small boutique, but many of the amenities of a larger chain. Great choice! It has a great location very near shopping and only a few blocks from Central Park and the museum.

Room smelled so badly, I had them move me. The first room had no where to set up a computer so not for a business person at all. The drawers are weird and unwieldy. Cut my finger trying one of the drawers. Thank goodness, the service is good.

Love this place - location, lobby, customer service, condition, you name it. I used to live in this area on the UWS and was coming back for a couple of days. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC.

This modern boutique hotel is stunning and well situated on 77th btwn Bway and Amsterdam.We were there for 4 days, 3 nights recently and loved staying there...close to subway, great restaurants, the park.We booked into a jr suite for $370//nt but friends have secured rooms for less.Great bar. Great service.Would absolutely return.

Poor service and the room not per online pictures. Responsiveness to solve very low. It was an upgraded to high floors with a view room and the floor was the 6th. And the reception said it was perfectly normal the 6th was higher floor. Terrace is crap crap, no views

We came to NYC to attend a taping of Live with Kelly and chose NYLO due to its location. It was a short walk to the studio and we were thrilled with our room 204! There were four of us, and our room was rather large for NYC, with a sitting area and HUGE bathroom. The shower was actually part of the room, (no tub) and while there was no counter space for makeup, curling irons, etc...there was another full length mirror in the room that worked just fine for us. We also appreciated the four lockers with cubbies that were perfect for each of us to have our own storage space. The beds and pillows were extremely comfortable...we slept like babies! One draw back...it took the water a while to heat up and when turning on the shower and the pipes first made HORRIBLE noises throughout the room. It lasted about 2 minutes and was pretty aggressive. Alarming actually but it made us laugh and went away.We appreciated the complimentary drink from the hotel bar and would stay here again! It's a cab ride to Times Square and many of the other hot NYC tourism spots but still a great location.

We stayed at the NYLO for the New York City Marathon. The accommodations were very nice and the service was excellent. The staff worked very hard to provide a good experience. We would definitely recommend the NYLO.

Overall a good experience, but the public rooms, hallways,and the rooms themselves -- on the small size -- aretoo dark. Very nice person broke a bill for me, not out ofthe register that couldn't, but out of his wallet.
user_name:
Masashi11
New York City, New York

review_body: I picked NYLO because of its vicinity to things I was doing in the city. Price was okay, not a great deal but affordable for NYC on marathon weekend. The floors are bare but not the cleanest; I picked up dirt and dust on bare feet in a cleaned room. No mini bar, no robe (as promised by hotel), in-house bar closes earlier than normal bars, very little bathroom counter space. Comfy bed, nice staff, good lounge space and business center area in lobby. Some good, some bad....it was serviceable and adequate.

The NYLO has a great location and great staff. The rooms are uniquely set up with "locker room" end tables and thick mattress beds. Flatscreens mounted to the wall, coffee makers with supplies. Bathroom is tight but very functional. The staff in the hotel are very helpful and friendly. We ate dinner in the attached restaurant Serafina's and i was very enjoyable.

NYLO- the hotel? Perfect to get out of the sea of people in Times Square and yet it's a quick 8 minutes away on the subway- lots of good food options around as well. Rooms? clean/ bigger than times square and have always been fairly priced vs. tourist central.What sets the place apart? The Staff: Jessie at the front desk- She's like the Mother away from home- she dotes over her guests with a caring eye. Amado? So nice. Eduardo the Bellmen? The consummate professional always ready to help and to point you in the right direction.Nice location/ Nice hotel/ GREAT PEOPLE and exceptional service make this spot one of my favorites when I have to travel.Keep up the good work!

If working in Manhattan or Touring the NYLO on 77th is a fine choice. Clean, Hip, Efficient, Friendly.Most of the rooms are NY sized but larger spaces are available. Close to the Park, Museums AND the Subway you can get ANYWHERE from here AND the Upper West Side offers a different vibe from the intense Mid-Town Scene while only minutes away. Good Bar, Relaxing Lobby, Connected to Serafina's Restaurant and Red Farm for immediate (but not late night) food options. It's my go to spot when in town.

I really enjoy this hotel. It is a modern feel and in a bit quitter location the those around Time Square. Last time when I stayed there was a construction across the street so it was noisy unfortunately. I really started to enjoy Upper West thanks to staying here and exploring the area. Many great coffee places and small restaurants. Finally, if the weather is great you can walk through Central Park to get to Met and the rest of the museums.

NYC vacation, stayed at NYLO NYC. Pictures are deceiving, the hotel is not worth the amount charged. Location was good, hotel was clean. Service at the bar downstairs was HORRIBLE, the waiter had attitude the entire time. The quality of the room was poor, finishings of the room were terrible, just not worth the money.

I've been at the Nylo in November 2016. The location is great, near the subway, close to Central Park and to many important Museums (MET, Museum of Natural History), with many great places where to eat. The staff is exceptionally prompt , the room was great, with a very comfortable bed, clean and very quiet to be in NYC! There is free WIFI in the hotel and in the guest rooms as well as a gym at disposal of the guests. I'll certainly use this hotel again in my future stayings in NYC.

Arrived early and stayed overnight at the hotel to attend a concert. The hotel was conveniently located in a beautiful area of the city, the room was large and well furnished and the adjoining restaurant was very good, not your normal, bland hotel venue. My wife and I will stay there again.

My first bad review of anything, ever. I'll get to the point & simply.... not clean, not clean, not clean, rooms & hallways. And...44 degrees in NYC and only AC worked, filter was dirty. Found a new hotel and left as soon as I could. Sorry NYLO, you looked good online and from the lobby, then it all went downhill fast. Clean up your act.

Room was clean and spacious for a NYC hotel. Free coffee in the morning from Serafina attached to the hotel. Great piano music in the bar/lounge on Friday night. Plus only 8 blocks to our daughter's apartment.

Location is amazing - nice neighborhood... wonderful restaurants around.The hotel is just awesome - service and appearance. Room is not fancy but, the bed is comfortable and there is much space. Hotel bar/service was lovely - I wish I could stay another day.

I booked this hotel for a one night's stay in the city. The location is great if you are looking to stay in the Upper West Side area. It is very close to the subway and it is not too far to walk to the Lincoln Center. There are many nice restaurants in the neighborhood. The hotel itself, was not as great. Minimal industrial design chic, and the rooms are smaller than the Bellclaire hotel opposite. Small desk and little storage space. Poor customer service too - I accidentally/wrongly booked a different night (not the night I was supposed to stay), and even though I explained to the hotel that it was a mistake, they would not give me a refund, saying it was already prepaid. Quite a dismissive attitude.
user_name:
vivnu
New York City, New York

review_body: Never having been to New York, we wanted to feel we were there at all times. NYLO did not disappoint. Location. Amazing location, away from the madness of Time square, but walking distance to where most tourists want to go. Rooms. Good size room, overlooking other buildings, a busy, buzzing road. Very comfy beds.Atmosphere. Good, cool and trendy bar, urban feel.The only negative was to noise from the outside traffic. But it is the city that never sleeps, and to be honest, we quite liked it. And the lady in the restaurant who appeared to be in charge was very cold and unfriendly, but after being in Florida for a week prior to coming here, we actually quite likes her briskness. ( people in Florida were way too nice and accommodating, it sent us nuts!!!).

I was in town for a work event at the Beacon Theatre. I could not have been more pleased with the NYLO! They accommodated my requests, were professional and welcoming every step of the way. The room was tiny, but that is expected for NYC, right? The only "compliant" I have is that the AC system would make a sound that resembled someone opening the door. That was not fun at 3am, but once I realized what happened, I was OK.The location was prime to all: 20-30 stroll to Time's Square, 5-10 minutes to Central Park, great walkable food options. The bar in the NYLO was always active, so certainly didn't have regret about staying "in" one night.Highly recommended!

Location is perfect for a visit to New York. I have stayed here for 10 years and always impressed. Many of the hotel staff have greeted me on every visit. This hotel is an exceptional value. Breakfast at Serafina's, LOCO bar for cocktail after threatre, exception service and neighborhood feel add to a great experience.

Room was nice, bed very comfortable. Bathroom could be more updated, it revealed it was an older hotel that was renovated to be more modern. Great location if you want to be close to the park or the natural history museum. It's also close to the Beacon theater.

Wanted something a little away from Midtown; upper west side convenient to taxis and subways. Anyway, most comfortable and clean room and great king sized bed. Common area downstairs was quite large comfortable and excellent bartender. I will repeat, good value

After we got used to the cramped quarters, I know we were in NYC, the hotel was fine. A little sloppy getting towels & coffee. The location was great and the restaurant Serafina was fine for breakfast. The staff was always pleasant.

I like this place! Convenient location, nice clean rooms, reasonable price (if you are lucky) and friendly staff.Close to the subway and to plenty of places to eat!When I visit NYC, I try and stay here as much as possible

Like some others who have left reviews for NYLO, I used to stay here a lot when it was On The Ave. In fact, it was by far my favorite hotel in NYC and I would rave about it to anyone who would listen. I gave it two tries after it had been bought and turned into NYLO – both times during its renovations – and was less than thrilled with the new direction. It went "loft" and hip/trendy which did not reflect the neighborhood or give me the warm and fuzzy feeling that originally captivated me.But I am here to say I am back to liking this hotel a lot, and expect to grow to love it again in the future.First of all: the location is perfect. You can have your mid-town and downtown, the Upper West Side gives you the best of both worlds NYC has to offer. It is an actual neighborhood and is, for Manhattan, quiet. The city is not right on top of you, but you can hop in a taxi or subway down Broadway and be where the theaters or whatever are in minutes. Plus, having Sarabeth's, the Natural History Museum and Central Park just two blocks away is amazing.Secondly, the new (to me) lobby is astounding! Maybe the best hotel lobby I have experienced. Besides the front desk it includes a bar (which opens out to the sidewalk when the weather allows), soft sitting area with piano, and a large "library" where you can sit and chat with friends, play chess, use your laptop or one of their two computer stations and printer, have a drink, or watch Game 7 of the World Series, as I did. It truly feels like a very inviting living room that happens to have a hotel on top of it.The rooms are a mixed bag, to be honest. Those facing 77th Street are less desirable than the ones facing Broadway...and the higher the better. But hotel-wide you cannot beat the über-comfortable bed and excellent bathrooms (most with large showers). Lovely hardwood floors throughout, as well. Some of their furnishings are not what I would have chosen, but nothing's perfect.Finally, the people are fantastic. From Lenny the doorman (who has been here for 11 years and honestly remembered me when I first walked in after a 3-year hiatus) to Tasha at the front desk and the other front of the house and housekeeping staff, everyone greets you with a smile and warm greeting, and do their best to assist. There were a couple of communication glitches during this stay that prevent me from giving them an "excellent" rating, but nothing that caused a real problem...and they were quick to remedy the situations when asked.A special comment must be made for the new General Manager of NYLO. There are two types of hotel GMs: those whom you never see and who manage from their office, and those who are out there with the staff every day, making sure the guests and employees know they are being looked after. Connie is the second type and could not have been more welcoming and helpful.The Upper West Side is a special area in New York City. It would take me another 3,000 characters to type in why...so I won't ask for any more of your time. My point is, NYLO is a hotel that is on track to reflect the neighborhood even more than it does at present, and already has the facilities and charm that brought me back so many times in the past 14 years. I am looking forward to my future stays here!

Very friendly staff made for an enjoyable experience. Had a great breakfast at the hotel restaurant. Room was good but had no view. We paid 30 some dollars extra to be on a higher floor but there was no advantage to it because the view remained the same, the apartment buildings in your face. To me that was a rip off. Also the bathroom was not extremely clean.

I'll grant you that this is a really good find on the Upper West Side (77th and Broadway) but I'm also not a huge aficionado of the tragically hip attitude and decor. The only thing saving this Gotham lodging from going completely overboard is the fact that their linens, lamps, and mattresses aren't for sale.One of the issues staying in NYC is always the noise and this trendy abode doesn't do anything to assuage that concern. Not only is the lobby and the so-called library outrageously loud with music, people, and motion, but the rooms are all hardwood floors with ample gaps under the doors so noise from the hallway is pervasive at all hours and there is no door dampening so your neighbor's slamming the door is literally felt inside your room. The bathrooms come in stylish stainless steel which makes for even more noise...more like staying on a Navy submarine at 6 fathoms under than being on the 6th floor of posh. Drafty windows which don't look out on anything but the wall next door were to be expected but again, noise from the street made it's way through them as well. Cheesy plastic cups and a safe for storage which is on the floor making it impossible to see your "secret combination" move you from hipster hotel to mundane motel.Bright spots include a great location to much of this side of NYC and I will say that the waitstaff in the bar and restaurant were affable and helpful. Additionally the shower was a bit better than most NYC hotels, plenty of hot water, a good well lit stall, and a pleasant hand-held wand. Truly, for NYC a good value for the dollar spent (even if the others in my business group got drink coupons in their key holder and I did not...sigh).

I was charged a "resort fee" of $25 per day on check out over and above the advertised daily rate. There was no perceived value for this hotel revenue enhancer. A warning to summer guests: there may be a daily charge for air conditioning!

Very helpful and friendly staff, large room, large bathroom with lots of towels. Location around the Hotel was very nice with shops and restaurants. Central Park was not far away, very nice for a walk. Metro Stations near the Hotel, so you can get easily around the city.

It located in a quiet yet hip area very easy accessible around Manhattanlots of shopping and restaurants,bars,close to subway,very clean nice decor spacious rooms with amenities.Its my second time stay and I will stay again when in NYC in April!!!the pillow top bed is heavenly!!!!
user_name:
Basilica P
New York City, New York

review_body: We just loved the NYLO! The ambience, the modern design and décor made this boutique hotel one-of-a-kind! It felt small and intimate - an escape from the hustle and frenetic energy of NYC, yet our room was very large, clean and quiet with the largest bathroom and shower we have ever seen in a hotel. All we can say is "Wow!" It was fantastic! Perfect for a romantic weekend get-away. It will be hard to stay anywhere else now.

One of the worst superior rooms I've ever seen. Very small and two walls as the best view of NY. Poor service, too. Forgot to replace all towells. Mini fridge (empty) available only upon request. At the arrival (midnight) room was not ready, yet! . Made request for high floor, got the 6th. Will never come back again.

Great hotel, hip, tech vibe. Stafffrom reception to housekeeping all excellent. We needed a minifridge which was brought to the room in less than 5 mins. The room and barhroom were dpotless and the bed was excellent. We'll be back at the NYLO for sure

Amazing hotel very nice and and extremely good value In very nice location the people were very nice very helpful and very nice willing to help with my problems and even managed to keep my luggage all day after I checked out !!

Fantastic hotel, great location, very nice staff, amazing room. Came in to see Dweezil Zappa at the Beacon Theater, awesome show. Got to Central Park for the first time in my life. Also got to do a couple of hours at the Museum of Natural History

It is easy to overlook the property -- it is not at all obvious that the building is a hotel from the outside. The lobby opens onto 77th Street instead of the more traveled Broadway, which can make entering a cab a hassle in the rain. The door men are inattentive as I had to struggle with the heavy lobby doors my self every time I entered or exited the building. The room decor is dark with exposed brick walls and kindergarten-like colorful doors covering cubes to store belongings. You can hang your clothes in the small closet which included an iron, ironing board, and luggage rack. WiFi is free. The bathroom had a shower but no tub. There were no hooks or racks in the bathroom to hang towels or clothes which was awkward. The desk and chair were comfortable for working on my lap top and there were plenty of outlets to charge my devices. I liked the convenience of the Keurig coffee maker -- but all of those pods are hardly green. I asked for a quiet room -- and it was -- but it faced an alley. If you want to sleep late, consider wearing ear plugs -- the room doors are heavy and you can hear doors of your neighbors slam shut as they exit. The hotel location is very good for tourists as the Museum of Natural History, Central Park, Historical Society, etc., are just a short walk away. It is also convenient to 2 different subway lines. There is a Marshall's discount clothing store nearby on Broadway in case you have some time to browse for a bargain.
user_name:
Diane L
New York City, New York

review_body: From the front desk to the walk out patio, I would heartily recommend this hotel to any traveler who doesn't want to deal with the clamor of midtown. The lifestyle suite is chic, clean and welcoming and boasts one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept on. Reasonable rates, great bar scene and restaurants will keep me coming back.

We loved everything-the spacious rooms, the friendliness, the hip bar, the location! This was my first time staying on UWS and it was fantastic. Beautiful walk across Central Park to museums, easy access to subway, a variety of excellent restaurants. We went to attend Steeley Dan concert at Beacon and could not have picked a better hotel.

This place is wonderful. It's in a great location in NYC- walking distance from Central Park and surrounded by a couple of lovely restaurants as well. Plus the rooms are clean and the beds are so amazing to sleep in. The downstairs bar makes it perfect for coming back from a night out and having a drink. Or better yet, head up to the roof top deck to experience the city in a different way. Staff was lovely as well. Only downside is the restaurant in the hotel can be a bit loud in the morning. Go across the street to the French Bakery instead.

Huge room. Comfy Bed -Giant terrace fantastic bathroom - great amenities and cotton robes . Serafina downstairs for pre Broadway cocktails and dinner. Fabulous thirty block walk to theatre wonderful staff quiet neighborhood. An A +
user_name:
n0tamused
New York City, New York

review_body: Wonderful location, fantastic service, large rooms - especially by NYC standards! Shared a queen suite with three friends, and we had plenty of space to maneuver. The staff was friendly and helpful, and we had added the optional breakfast at the adjoining Serafina restaurant to our stay. It was convenient and tasty too.

I do however often wonder if by using bookings.com I get relegated to the smallest room. I expected abut bigger room with panoramic views. I loved the balcony and the staff. Very clean hotel. On site restaurant was good food and good value. Especially loved the neighbourhood.

Stayed here for 7 nights in April for my wedding. The location was really good, a 5 minute walk to central park and a short subway ride to Times Square and mid-town with lots of places to eat nearby. We usually stay in mid-town when we go to New York but decided on staying a little but further out as we had some older relatives as guests at our wedding. It is a much quieter location but still close enough to all of the tourist attractions, and so was ideal for us. We paid for a superior room with a balcony, which was twice the price of the standard room. Whilst the view and balcony were amazing, the room was not much bigger than the standard ones which was a little disappointing. The beds are also huge and really comfortable. The dog-friendly bar downstairs is a nice addition. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel and will hopefully be returning for our first anniversary in April!

I booked this hotel due to the balcony and hardwood floors. It did not disappoint me. I enjoyed my stay. The room was clean; the balcony had a ton of cigarette butts which housekeeping took care of it for me. Clean floor, nice set up. No drawers for clothes bye t a cube tv stand to place items. The air/heat worked well. Staff was friendly. Nice vibe in lobby, bar area. Elevators worked well.

Quirky decor. Friendly and helpful staff. Italian restuarant adjacent, however we did not use it. Great place for breakfast just one block away on Broadway. Good location subway close.Two blocks away from Central park.

Very nice hotel in great location. Room a bit small for 3 of us and my husband emailed customer services prior to our holiday requesting a view but we didn't hear from them or get a view. The bar/foyer area is very nice. We would stay again. Very comfortable beds.

Good place to stay, relatively clean but noisy, because of the construction on site. Employees are very nice and room was nice and quiet (didn't hear the neighboring rooms). Hotel is well located, and easy to walk everywhere.

Lovely hotel in great location. Felt safe and clean and rooms have a quirky, stylish, arty feel. Initial room was not what I expected for a superior room - explained this a member of staff who was very understanding and moved us to a lovely room with fabulous view -much more in line with my expectation of the superior title. Beds were super comfy and the room was very peaceful.

I had stayed in NYLO since it was On the Ave. It has an excellent location for the purpose of my trips because the main purpose of them is to attend opera performances in the MET and as it is two blocks from 79th subway station, it is very easy to go to any part of the city. I will keep returning as long as I have the time and money.

Hotel is great, very well positioned so close to Central Park and far away from NY noises. Rooms at the 12th floor superb and clean, do not ask for any balcony or terrace if you are not a smoker, room dimension is smaller than the ones located at the 12th.Serafina restaurant comfortable and fantastic for demanding tastes of Italian people :-)Overall a very positive experience, we will consider this accomodation for any future visits to NY.

The location is particularly convenient for my purposes and close to public transportation (bus and subway). It is the hotel I have returned to regularly about seven or eight times a year. The rooms are comfortably utilitarian. The service is impeccable.

Really enjoyed my stay at NYLO, the property has a great location on the Upper West Side close to Central Park and far enough away from Times Square. Our room was perfect and a cool view of the river. The staff was nice and helpful when needed I will for sure be returning.

I selected this hotel for its proximity to the Beacon Theater (to see Steely Dan) and see friends nearby. Superb proximity also to two subway stations (closest @ 79th) that offer a straight shot down to Times Square and Penn Station. The welcome cocktail was a nice touch.

I stayed before when it was The Ave but it became a little too funky. Now, renovated and revamped NYLO is nice, clean, comfortable, new walk in showers, good towels, coffee machine, .....everything one needs and having Red Farm next door make it even better. Loved it, recommended it already and definitely will be back. Ina

What a great location for everything we wanted to do on a long weekend. Easy walk to Central Park and MONH, and from there everything that NYC has to offer. Very nice rooms and lobby - NYLO has a great low-key vibe.Special thanks to Ramona and Tasha for letting us check in early and also holding our bags until our car picked us up.Will certainly stay again.

We stayed at NYLO for 8 nights with a king bed. It was such a comfy and spacious bed, which I loved! The location is great if you're looking to stay in the Upper West Side area and it had two subways that were close by. The hotel was convenient as it had a fruit market and pharmacy across the road. Even including Sephora literally right next door, an Italian restaurant downstairs and also a very close walk to Shake Shack and Magnolia Bakery.The only downfall about this hotel is that they didn't have a fridge which is my reason for giving 4/5 score since we were there for 8 nights and it would have made a difference to our experience at NYLO. Other that everything else was great and even the atmosphere of the hotel really does make you feel like you're in NYC!

Thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. Modern, friendly staff and central to the subway, Central Park, Natural History Museum and so much more.Great, safe neighbourhood with plenty of food options and many 24 hour convenience stores such as a market, chemist and also cafes. We hope to come back to NYC again many times, and would definitely check this hotel first as we would love to stay in this area again. One highlight was visiting the Guggenheim Museum on the Upper East Side, and then being able to walk through Central Park, around the lake, to the Upper West Side and this hotel. Felt like total New Yorkers!

Good handy location not far from the Park and a Subway stop a short walk away. Ideal for a short tourist break in the city. Rooms good and clean and staff efficient and friendly. Would definitely use again.

Usually on my trips to NY I stay to sleep at the Hilton on Sixth AvenueI made through the web a reservation for two nights in July.When boarding my flight, I had some problems, and I could not catch the flight, and advise the hotel of my cancellation.I was told that there was a penalty of the first night, which was accepted.What was my surprise when the next day, I get a message to the mobile on the charge of another night.I wrote and called them, and they said it was a system error and that the charge would be returned back to the visa.Find mail from manager admitting the mistakeWe are in November and according VISA are still in dispute with those crooks.Any more details , pls do not hesitate to contact me in jccastano73@gmail.com

We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. We loved the room- which was large, really clean and had a lovely big comfy bed! We thought the decor was cool too- bric-work look pillars and lots of hanging lights around the bed.The breakfasts were fantastic (I had pancakes each morning, but my husband tried the other things on the menu. When he ordered the salmon, a huge plate of smoked salmon came- which he loved!!) The staff were really friendly and happy to help with anything.We loved the library bar with the gorgeous fireplace and candles -we had our welcome drinks there!

great location, lovely rooms and amazing decore, nice lobby, the only thing that can be fixed is the shower which is too small. We came here for our last night which was a pitty we shall certainly come again

$25 for WiFi per day is ridiculous. In the past repeat customers could get free room upgrade,. NOT ANYMORE! Not worth the price. Also going under new ownership and likely to get worse. Once a great bargain for an upper west side hotel but now you can do better elsewhere. Have stayed here baby times in the past but things changed.

Thus was my second stay here ...This is a boutique hipster kinda hotel, with lively local bar scene.. a theater is around the corner which attracts interesting mix of people.Small rooms with an efficient use of space , does have a closet, and modernized baths and fixtures...BUT.. (there is always a but). For $400 plus a night you should try not to be on lower floors facing 77th... due to endless construction and garbage truck. Noises at 2:15?? Really?And there is a fire house across the street as well so if you are facing 77th the fire truck emerges at all hours and punch the lights and sirens before they get onto The main streets.Lastly do not get a 2nd floor room over the lobby bar area there are live bands some nights and you will hear every beat.I would come back but might try something else next time.

Service, cleanliness, safety are all wonderful at the NYLO. I had a room on the 7th floor that didn't meet my needs, I was switched the next day without muss or fuss. I really appreciated that. Chris the bellhop was wonderful in transitioning me from one room to another. Gracious! I've stayed at the NYLO and highly recommend it and for sure I'll return.

Very nice location. Room size a bit small. Missed a refrigerator. Very quiet neighborhood. Fair price. The fact of having a bar with live music by the elevators is a little bit unusual. Definitely would return.

Really enjoyed our stay at the NYLO. Four of us including two children. Very comfortable and handy location near Central Park. Great Upper West Side restaurant options nearby. Easy access to rest of Manhattan via subway.

We had a wonderful stay in Manhattan at NYLO! Our experience was great from start to finish - staff was very helpful and attentive from the check in to the housekeepers to the doormen. I would recommend NYLO to anyone. It was very well located for everything we wanted to visit.

Excellent hotel with friendly staff. Great location with CVS and some discount shopping nearby. Rooms cute but vibe in hotel is great. The bar and lobby are quaint. Great dim sum next door. Great French cafe right across street.

I've stayed at this hotel regularly since 2000 and it was called 'On the Ave' (which was always an odd name because it's on Broadway), mostly for its excellent location near the Park, and subway etc. While the design and overall look of the place is certainly much improved from back then, I was disappointed with my most recent stay overall earlier this week. First, the room was pretty dirty (hairs in sink, bedside table, cupboards), the bathroom was far from clean, and there were food crumbs on the floor and and a biscuit wrapper in the cupboard. I didn't complain at the time because I didn't want to get the cleaner /housekeeping into trouble, and cleaned it up myself. Maybe I was just unlucky with my particular room (which was great otherwise!) But even so, I'd say standards are slipping at NYLO NYC, which is a shame. That said, I'd probably give it one final chance for its location and fairly reasonable prices (by Manhattan standards) alone.

This hotel far exceeded my expectations from design to staff. My tip would be to have the bed pillows available for sale, maybe a note on the bed when you check in. They were amazing, I spent days bothering the staff after I arrived home to find out the manufacturer then research where to purchase.

A nicely renovated facility. Heat in my room did not work and could not be fixed the following morning, but I suspect this was an individual room problem. Lobby is a bit disorienting too in having to carry luggage up 3-4 stairs and difficult to immediately locate reservation desk.

Stayed here for a week for a wedding in April. If it's your first time in New York it may be better to stay in a more central location however this hotel is very close to Central Park and subways if you need to get anywhere else. Rooms were lovely. Beds a very good size. Service and bar all exceptional as well. Would definitely recommend. Shops and restaurants are also near it.

My wife and I chose NYLO because our son and his family live nearby. By chance we were assigned a room that had was on the internal well of the building (rather than on the street). Though there was no view, which we didn't mind, it was wonderfully quiet. Combined with the very comfortable bed this made for a good night's sleep. Great breakfast at Serafina in the mornings!

The hotel was adequate, but the management was quite inadequate. We were treated rudely, and some pretty inappropriate comments were made during our check-in. We actually considered moving to another hotel because the individual we were dealing with was so very offensive. The rooms were small but very clean. The amenities were sparse.

My room was small, but very clean. The location is very convenient. I had to request soap, shower cap, robe and slippers, and an extra wash cloth. These items were brought to my room after my request.

Great staff. A little noisy when sleeping from street level and surrounding guest noise. Convenience to travel was good. Hotel was clean. Rooms were adequate for stay and staff was responsive to requests.

comfy beds...super bar and lounge and great concierge staff. If I needed anything..this( these) were sent to the room right away. The restaurant on site (Serafina's ) ...excellent food. A ca was procured for my by the stay I really appreciated n to taking a cab to JFK

Stayed for 3 nights in a Deluxe Double Room.Spacious for New York - plenty of room and decent-sized bathroom. Ample storage for luggage/clothes etc.Bar downstairs is excellent. Great vibe and quality selection of drinks.Nylo is in a good neighbourhood - much quieter than the zoo that is Times Square. Plenty of shopping and food/convenience stores within a couple of blocks. Thoroughly enjoyed the stay and would definitely stay again should we be in New York.

The outstanding attention to details made up for the tight square footage of the guest rooms. A welcoming and fun bar downstairs with great music and televisions also added to the ambiance. The well appointed "living room" feel to the lobby guest space made things nice too.

Great location! Cool lobby, Library, bar vibe! Rooms were clean and neat. Staff was great. Outdoor terrace on 14th had a great view of the city with comfortable couches to lounge in. Definitely will return.

Enjoyed location and room design. Felt that I needed a kettle and not just a capsule tea and coffee maker. Felt that packaged throwaway cups (with non recyclable plastic) is not with the times and wasteful. Great service from doormen and reception staff. Room service a bit noisy with banging doors if you want to sleep in.

We had gotten the room from Hotwire. We had heard great things about the place. However, at night we could hear EVERYTHING outside, no fridge, no vent in the bathroom and mold growing on the ceiling..

disappointed with service. Details are above. plus no umbrellas left, rain all day. overall the price of $450 including tax i, s excessive. My wife was very disappointed with the overall experience. One positive your doorman went out if his way to get a taxi for us.

The hotel location is perfect, as the surrounding streets is much more quiet than other places in the city. But still close to everything. Our room was of decent size, although the bathroom was a bit small with a very large sink. Overall clean and nice. Very nice and helpfull staff.

For those people who want a great hotel that is chic but quiet. The upper west side is a fantastic location away from the "tourist" crowd. Well seasoned travels will enjoy the charm of the speakeasy loby/bar area.

Our room was spacious and clean! Loved the wood floors and the bed was super comfortable! The location was ideal. Close to Central Park in a family friendly neighborhood. Also enjoyed the complimentary drinks and spacious lobby and bar. The staff was friendly and very helpful. High marks all the way around!! We plan to stay here for future visits!

The hotel is fine, decor is good and rooms are comfortable and ok for size for Manhattan. Bed is extremely comfy.Was a little concerned being on the Upper West side, as it feels a bit up and out of the way, but really enjoyed being there. Much quieter than other places further downtown. Loads of good places to eat, and close to the park. Easy to get to the subway and in minutes you're anywhere you need to be.

I had amazing stay with my partner at the NYLO from October 13-18, 2016.The hotel is a hidden gem on the UWS with the most spacious rooms in the city.Our Deluxe King room must have been about 450 sf with an awesome layout.The staff and food in the restaurant were great too.We highly recommend this place.Jonas&Greg from Toronto, Canada

Great hotel! Family friendly location. Nice decor. Extremely comfortable beds. Large room. Patio with view of city, Central Park and Hudson River. Efficient service. Terrific resturaunts, markets, and stores close by. Will be staying here again next time we are in New York!

Stayed in NYLO - NYC for over a week. The staff was very kind. Location is great (on Broadway and 77th next to subway 1 and pretty close to 2 and 3). The room is modern, big and clean.When I am in NY again will stay there again.

Wife and I stayed here on vacation. We had a death in the family and had to cut our stay short by a night to get home for the funeral. I prepaid for 3 nights and NYLO made it clear when I booked the stay that it was 100% non-refundable as what I booked was a special promotion. Well, when I got there I informed the staff that we would be leaving early and they immediately took the third night off my card. Everyone was extremely pleasant and helpful, I was very impressed with the staff! The room itself was small, but for the price was exactly what I expected. The balcony was a nice spot to relax after a day/night of sightseeing and running around. I would recommend this spot to friends or family for sure!

NYLO was the perfect location. We were going to a conference at the American History Museum - the hotel was only a few blocks away. The rooms were clean. There were some carpet stains on the hall carpeting, but could be overlooked. The water did come out a bit yellow to start, but I figured it was from the pipes or something.

My fiancé and I chose this hotel to stay in for our wedding week in New York. We have been to New York on 3 occasions and stayed somewhere different each time. This is no longer going to be the case. When we return in future we will only stay at NYLO. It is in a great location, close enough to everything you would want too see but far enough out of the chaos that times square can be to be peaceful and a great location to enjoy a drink at the end of the day with lots of restaurants within easy walking distance. The staff are outstanding with nothing being an issue for them, they are always happy to help and advise on ways to get the most out of your trip. We had 17 people with us, some of them very seasoned travellers and every single one commented on how friendly and welcoming the staff were. The roof terrace is a real find and a very pleasant space to enjoy a drink after a long day.All in all NYLO is doing everything right!
user_name:
O8098IBpaulm
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: I've stayed at NYLO a few times. It used to be a hidden gem in the Upper West Side. However, after their renovation they have become more expansive, and rather full. They don't have enough elevators and the wait can be long. Avoid room 522 - dark and internal facing.

Good hotel, much better than the Hudson. Pros: Keurig, Big TV, large room, bed & pillows, wood floors very clean, VERY Quiet for NY hotel ask for a room that is not facing the main streets, very cool common areas, lobby & bar.Cons:bathroom, linens

This is my second stay at this hotel. It has a great vibe and the staff is very upbeat and friendly. Also, the room decor is chic and the bed was very comfortable. The one downside was that it noisy due to the room location near the elevator. Otherwise, this is worth the visit.

NYLO is a pleasant surprise in the middle of Manhattan. We stayed in a large, clean renovated room with plenty of plugs and super comfy beds on the 6th floor. Easy access to other parts of the city with the subway close by. Would definitely stay again.

Enjoyed my stay. Staying on The Upper West side puts you in a real New York neighborhood , away from the hordes of tourists. Hotel is clean, the rooms large. Had a room in back, while no view, very quiet. Nice hotel bar. Large clean room and bathroom.

Great hotel, fantastic staff great location. We stayed at NYLO in October and loved being away from the madness of time square , and the other busy tourist .Rooms were clean and a good size.This might seem a strange thing to say , we have stayed in Hotels around the world and have never slept in a more.comfy bed. After a long tiring day walking the busy streets of New York what a pleasure it was to fall onto the comfiest bed ever.

The NYLO has a good location near restaurants, Central Park, subway, etc. It is a comfortable hotel. Our room was not cleaned with attention, no internet access in rooms. Very business like atmosphere.

My room was tiny, and beat up pretty bad (walls, floor, and bathroom). I've stayed in a lot better places in Manhattan for less than I paid as well. Disappointing overall, but not dreadful. Not exactly a ringing endorsement I know

NYLO. Is a well located modern hotel on 76th and Bway. Close to many small restaurants, shops and public transport. Friendly staff, nice rooms, relatively large considering Big Apple hotel rooms, and very comfortable.

The NYLO is the BEST Stay in town. Comfortable, clean, quiet, reasonably priced, with a gracious and helpful staff! Great views and food at the NYLO and also there's an internal access to Sarafina's restaurant (one of my favs) for breakfast - late dinner. Convenient location in the city, too.The NYLO is my NYC home away from home.

We stopped one week at the NYLO, and apart from a litte refurbishing that the rooms need, the overall experience was good. The location is fantastic, for those that want to stay in a quite but central part of the city.We were in the 4th floor street side and the only disappointing thing was sometimes the noise coming from the street. I know that noise is part of the show in NY, but during our stay a lot of noise came form works in the building in front of the hotel.

This is my first time staying in an upper West Side Hotel. The lobby and bar/gathering areas are lovely. The room was incredibly small, but the bed was quite comfortable. The bathroom is large, but there is no where to put stuff. The first two days I had to call to get regular coffee (not decaf) for the Keurig, but they responded promptly. Also had a small leak in the bathroom ceiling which was fixed promptly. THE BAD: About 2:15 AM Sunday we were rocked out of bed by trash collection. It literally felt and sounded like they were in the room, collecting hotel trash and construction trash for a job across the street. This went on for at least 20 minutes. I went downstairs to complain. The guy at the front desk and some other guy (security?) were very rude, saying that I was the only person that has ever complained. I have been in NYC many times and accept street & trash noise, but not sustained at 2 AM on a Sunday morning. The morning front desk person was at least somewhat concerned and apologetic. I thought management might reach out, but they have not. If middle of the night trash collection is the norm, NYLO at the very least needs to insulate the room windows to cut down on the noise.

We love the UWS of New York and find the NYLO to be a very good home base for our trips there. This time, we were travelling as a group of four (two couples). We enjoy the fact we're close to both Central Park and Riverside Park, close to some great restaurants, pubs, shops, grocery markets and a subway stop that makes it easy to get to other parts of Manhattan. We feel like we're a part of the neighborhood during our stays and often meet local residents in the lobby bar, which has a great vibe. The staff handling the entrance area/luggage/rides etc., is excellent. On previous trips, we found the front desk to be below standard. This trip, they were very good. In fact, one day I had an issue with the printer in the lobby and a person from the front desk was eager to try to help and got it running again in a matter of minutes. Our check-in and check-out was handled efficiently and we didn't experience any glitches. The room isn't anything flashy, but clean and very space efficient with a modern industrial look matching the rest of the hotel. For us, the room is basically where we go to sleep, rest, shower. Otherwise, we're out and about. We pick the NYLO largely because of its UWS location.

Great location in upper west side. Close to Central Park, Museum of Natural History, Hudson River walkway & the boat basin, good restaurants & shopping. Couple blocks from the subway. We love the neighborhood feel. Our room was comfortable & clean. Wifi is included in our room. Definitely will return to this hotel.

Have stayed all over NYC and this is now a favourite! We got a room with two double beds and the size of the room was very generous compared to the standard in NYC. Comfiest bed ever slept in, was quiet once in room, staff were delightful and found great eateries and bars on Columbus near 84th... Would definitely stay again.

Great use of space in room. Bed was excellent, very clean room. Bathroom well appointed except limited space for much of anything. However, better than others where I have stayed. Service was great. Noisy in reception - bar area during afternoon and evening. Price was fair.

The overall experience was great. Good location, clean, very good service. On the day we left the management let us to check out at 2pm without charging us. The only thing that could have done the experience excellent is a little mini bar or a refrigerator in the room, especially in the delux room we stayed in.

Very nice hotel, excellently service, clean rooms and a great location. We had an interior room with no view however it was very quiet considering there is a fire station across the street. Room is somewhat small and no room for a chair. Otherwise, very satisfied.

I paid 300 euros per night and received a little dark room without daylight. the doors are very loud when they close, so you can here, when guests coming back from the night life or when guests leave early in the morning. And the service wasn't interested at all if i enjoyed the stay.

Great hotel, great location. The loft with terrace was simply amazing! Fantastic view of the Hudson and NYC skyline. The staff were very courteous and there is a very good restaurant within hotel. Bar was lively and had a great atmosphere.

We've stayed here many times. The beds are great- nice linens, high quality mattresses. The staff is warm, friendly and always helpful. Only complaint is that it's a bit "no-frills" as in little cupboards for clothing storage, tiny sink with not enough room to stow your consmetics. Even so, it's our go-to spot with easy subway access, great neighborhood restaurants and shops, and a fun bar in the lobby where we've hung out listening to live music and met with friends.

It was nice staying on the Upper West Side as a change of pace. I used to live in NY on the UWS and it was fun to visit all my old food haunts (like Zabar's) up here. Very convenient to transportation. The room decor was a tiny bit dorm-like (metal cabinets) but the room was large and the service was good. I'd go back again- the price was very reasonable also...

Friendly staff but too expensive for the type of room. Very small bathrooms with and old bath instead of a nice modern sower. The hotel didn't look like the pictures that we saw. Also the lounge bar has TV with sports that ruin the relax lounge feeling for cocktails.

Love this hotel. The staff, the ambience, the service were all great. We have no complaints. There is construction going on in the building across the street but that's not Nylo's fault. It didn't bother us anyway as we were up and out the door early every morning during our stay. The Serafina restaurant, attached to the hotel, was convenient and the food was good. We highly recommend this hotel and will stay here again if and when we return.
user_name:
Jim and Bianca G
Calgary, Canada

review_body: Stayed over night to go to a concert. Had a wonderful time. I would go back.we love red farm restaurant. The rooms were great except for noise from the fire trucks all nigh. The staff very friendly a and accommodating.

Nice happy people, and good clean room to come to every day.Restaurant, was short staffed, and got our meals very late. Would use the hotel again but not the restaurant. Good bar service and enjoyed the drinks.

The design of the hotel is very nice although the room was quite small and the staff made no effort at all to make us feel welcomed. None of the staff had a smile and we felt they were going through the motions to get through each day.

I was not impressed. The heat in my room had to be fixed, the bathroom was dirty (and not cleaned even after I complained about it) and my room was noisy (both because it was right over the bar and its loud music, and because the cleaning staff talked loudly in the hall in the morning). The bed was very comfortable though, and I love the location. Still, I will be considering other options for my frequent trips to NY in the future.

Three of us stayed in a room with 2 Queen beds at the NYLO for a long weekend getaway. We were impressed with the size and comfort of the room. The bathroom shower was new and spacious. There was plenty of room for three ladies to spread out their luggage. The hotel staff were very polite and helpful. The upper west side location of the hotel is great. Close to central park and excellent bakeries and food markets near by. We'll certainly be back to this hotel whenever we visit Manhattan again.

the location of this hotel is excellent. friendly staff and the hotel was impeccably clean would stay at the NYLO again! the bar lounge area was very inviting and the food was fabulous that we ordered from the bar.

My husband and I spent the past weekend at NYLO in New York City.The location was terrific; close to Central Park and the Beacon Theatre where we had tickets.We ate twice at their Italian restaurant, Serafina, and the food was very good for both breakfast and dinner. Our upgraded room on the 9th floor was small but fine and the bed was very comfortable. It was pricey for what we got but that's New York.Otherwise only small complaints. We asked for two robes and received one. There was only one coffee pod and one paper coffee cup provided with the Keurig. My husband had trouble sleeping given the traffic noise from the street but, again, its New York.Overall, a decent place to stay in NYC.

All rooms are nice and clean with clean white beds & covered/protected mattresses. Good outlets sine rooms more than others, and coffee machine is nice. the lobby lounge chairs are nice for a sit and drink before going upito the room at night. Not a lot of services and the door, luggage staff in general are harried but still nice.

i've been traveling to New York approximately monthly for work, and stay at the NYLO each time I come due to its proximity to my meetings. The rooms are clean and simple, the beds are extraordinarily comfortable. All in all, it's a great place to stay! Also, so convenient to the trains and there's some great food in the neighborhood!

NYLO was a great hotel at an unbelievable price compared to others in the area. We will definitely be coming back here ! The hotel staff was courteous and helpful from the front desk to the other staff.

This expensive hotel is in the right location if you don't mind a little walking. Surrounded by great restaurants and the service is very good. Nice bar if a little small. Restaurant attached to hotel is good for breakfast or lunch.

Everything about our NYLO experience was excellent. The location is great. The staff was kind and courteous. The room was spacious and clean and nicely furnished. We were pleasantly surprised. I would definitely recommend this property.

I received excellent service when I stayed here by the luggage staff and the doormen. They were extremely courteous and I felt very welcomed by them. They went out of their way to help me and I really appreciate it!Another great thing was the bed. This has got to be the comfiest hotel bed ever. It's definitely comfier than the one I have at home. Even though I was jetlagged, I slept like a baby. It was also a convenient place with the closest subway station being a 5 minute walk. My only complaints would have to be the price and the size of the room but that is the problem with most if not all Manhattan hotels. It is pricey and the room is small.Overall, a great stay and I highly recommend this hotel!
