The hotel is a modern, industrial conversion. It was comfortable, well located, and friendly staff helped to orient me to the city. Would be very happy to return there again on my next visit. Maybe a few more coffees shops in the area would have given it an extra omph

Close to food stores, metro, and many restaurant choices. Near Central Park four blocks away. The only caveat was the wets side elevators but overall the xperience was excellent. Staff is very attentive and the bar and lounge downstairs are a plus to use your welcoming free drink.

I recently stayed here when it was on the ave and I can definitely say they have improved so much.The rooms were spacious. The bar and casual area downstairs was a great bonus. Plus the restaurant attached to the hotel. Easy access to the subway and there is a drug store across the road, which is handy.I would definitely come back for a 3rd time

For context: we only stayed here one night, and it was just two adults. No opinion on kids' experience. That said, this place is awesome. Inexpensive, great location 3 blocks from Central Park and 2 blocks from the subway. Room was clean and modern. Hotel is a great mix of old and modern - great lobby. Service was excellent - they checked us in early and stored our bags after check-out so we could wander the city. Bar service was also excellent, and the food in the Italian restaurant was just amazing. Oh, and a free drink (ticket) to welcome you and free wifi! Our room was small, and had no view (they offered us one with a view, but we declined to pay extra). But... you're in Manhattan! Why are you in your room, except to sleep and shower? The sleeping part is no problem, because the bed was unbelievably comfortable. For what we paid, I would come back here every time I'm in NYC.

Last minute trip to the city for work and found a great rate for NYLO! Compared to some chain hotels that were charging double, this was prime. The staff was just amazing and they were so accommodating to any request. They're the reason I will certainly be back. Can't wait to visit again!

I stayed here for two weeks. I was really happy with the room and that I had a balcony with a view overlooking the Hudson River. Rooms of this size with a balcony in New York City are rare so I was extremely happy. The king size bed was super soft and comfortable. The service was really good. I became ill with bronchitis and had difficultly breathing. The hotel staff were most helpful in arranging for a doctor to come to my room. I was so grateful as it was snowing and freezing outside. The location was great, a little out of the main stream tourist area but an easy taxi ride to where I needed to go. There was also a restaurant next door and a pharmacy across the road which was convenient. The only disappointing thing was that there was no room service for meals which would have been nice. I would highly recommend this place for a short or long term stay. If was clean, very comfortable and roomy. They did also offer limited food in the bar which was great.

We had a lot of issues with broken light fixtures around both beds . I must say when we told the front desk they immediately had someone come up to fix the lights while we were out. We did however have to call two times to request some services. At the price of the hotel, rooms should be checked for broken equipment before a guest checks in. Other than that we had a great stay and the front desk could not be nicer and more helpful

Overall, very good experience. Excellent customer service by staff. Room comfortable; good location in NYC. Large area for waiting for room to be ready with availability for charging phones, computers, etc.

We had connecting rooms, on the second floor, on the side of 78th street. What a mistake. The rooms were loud, and my husband and I could not sleep due to the noise - constructions and garbage trucks. We thought the window may be open, but it was not. In addition, I felt like the rooms were full of cheap furniture, and the bathrooms were not comfortable. When I complained to the front desk, they told me that there was no construction. I actually went outside and was talking to a construction worker who said he was drilling early Saturday morning! I did not find anyone kind or helpful. Im sure there are better options.

We have stayed twice. If you have reason to be on the Upper West Side, this is the place to stay. The deluxe king double is a large room with windows on three sides, far roomier than the queen. The rooms are immaculate and highly functional. The public space on the ground floor is a great place to meet friends for a drink or game of chess. Staff members are friendly and helpful. And they allow dogs!Two complaints: The reception desk gets backed up due to a lack of personnel and there is the inflated "Urban resort fee". It is pricey and practically worthless. As a superior property NYLO should refuse to assess this daily charge. It gouges their customers.

A hotel not run like a box store with lobbies full of noise and crowds. NYLO seems small, staff are attentive and clearly care about the hotel; rooms, if small, are still well-appointed and very comfortable. Very much worth the money.

The room was very small ( typical NYC), bed was probably not king size but queen, and had a bed light that was out. We called the staff who brought up wrong size bulb. He volunteered to go back down to get right one but we said no, tomorrow is fine. The next 3 days no one came back to fix it! The desk people were warm and welcoming as were the doormen. It was a hopping lobby, always lots of action.

We love this hotel, and would stay there again. We especially admired our room's appearance. Every detail of furniture and decoration seemed carefully chosen. The bed was so comfortable that we checked on the brand of the mattress.

This is my second stay at NYLO and I'd come back again. Love the location, the size of the rooms, and the atmosphere. Not a big fan of the restaurant but there are many other options available nearby.

Stayed at the hotel on a three day business trip. The staff were very friendly, the location was fabulous and the amenities were sparse. It's very boutique and fresh. I'd stay here again for sure. Even the NYC traffic and noise didn't seem to bother me.

I recently stayed three nights at the NYLO NYC. I almost walked past the front door, but once inside I was charmed by the cute and cozy feel of the lobby. I received a warm welcome at check in and had no trouble getting my room a little early. The room was small, as most New York hotel rooms are, but was nicely arranged to maximize the space.Usually the struggle for me when traveling to NYC for business is finding a great place to work. Rooms are usually too small and lobbies are either too stale or too noisy. Not so with NYLO. The lobby was made up of several small spaces, each decorated with a homey feel. It was a delightful place to sit after a long day running from one meeting to another and get caught up on emails, etc. I don't usually stay in this neighborhood, but would make an exception to stay here again.

generally very good but bar staff could on occasion be unfriendly, off hand, "superior", the phrase that would be used in ireland would be "snotty" or in england it would be "snooty", that is, I may be a barman but I am a superior being

Well located for my needs but the options are limited in the UWS. I wouild prefer the easy availability of coffee in the morning without venturing into an adjoining restaurant. The bed was very comfy which is a primary consideration!

NYLO is a really cool hotel, at a great location, in a very nice part of NYC. The room was spacious and clean and the employees were friendly and helpful. It is only a block away from the Beacon Theater with plenty of good restaurants in the area. Next time my wife and I go to the Beacon, we'll definitely stay at NYLO again.

I was at this hotel for 3 nights in September. I had gotten used to very tiny hotel rooms in New York so our room was a nice surprise when there was actually room to walk around! I loved the fact that the hotel room had wooden floors instead of carpets that can hold dirt and smells. The bathroom was modern, roomy, super clean. Accoustics were great-- there was construction outside but we didn't hear a thing. Great restaurants in the upper west side neighborhood.

We absolutely loved our stay at the NYLO. The lifestyle loft was so spacious, and the balcony with the Hudson River view really made our vacation special. We loved being in our hotel room just as much as all the incredible activities NYC has to offer. We received 2 drink vouchers at check in, which were so needed after a long days travel. The location was great, so many unique restaurants and bars nearby! We would definitely stay here next time we're in NYC.

We stayed at the NYLO for 4 nights. We are family of 4 and so had a room with two large doubles which was fine, and there was enough space in the room. However, there was no fridge which was a little inconvenient when travelling with children. Our room had no natural light and looked onto maybe the internal part of the building. There was work going on on the sidewalk which started at 7 am. As I am sure they would have been advised of this work, we received no advice that this was going to happen and so hence we were all rudely awakened at 7 every morning. If we had known, we would have firstly not paid the price we paid, but would have looked at alternative accommodation. When we paid the bill the hotel immediately charged my card without letting me view the invoice to check it first. The smoke detector light in the room flashed all night every night. When I called to ask for extra towels as there were only 3 of them, they did not arrive until the following day. Location was good, and the bar downstairs was also comfortable.

I wasn't going to review NYLO but after receiving an email from them asking me to share my thoughts I decided I would.I had one night in Manhattan as due to the cost of the City's hotels this was all that I could afford. As I was treating myself at a total cost of $312 dollars (not including breakfast) I had high expectations. Despite having booked and paid for the room in March I was told on arrival that my room had been cancelled but that they did not know why. I showed the receptionist my confirmation emails and subsequent email to confirm the payment I had made, I was told that they had no record of payment and that I would have to contact the website I had booked it through. I was then told I had not shown up in May even though I was not in the States at that point and was asked if I had booked my room on that date, I had not and again showed the confirmation email, The staff member went and got the hotel manger who when came out was not remotely friendly, She barely looked at me, didn't say hello nor apologise for the confusion. She then said I was due to come to the hotel on 3rd which was in fact that day, She didn't apologise for her error and I was left feeling like I was the one who had made the mistake. Her parting words were that it "should" be ok and that she's let me know if not. Not a particularly welcoming, friendly or reassuring start, to my stay.I'd requested a room on a specific floor but as my booking had been lost this wasn't fulfilled. The room was quite small but I'm not sure if this is standard across the hotel. The iron didn't work properly nor was there a bath - again I'm not sure if this is standard in Manhattan hotels? For the amount of money I paid for one night I felt like I was staying in a budget hotel with a particularly unwelcoming management team. The door staff were lovely and the saving grace of the hotel.

It's a nice hotel and I would stay there again if I thought that reservations could handle ADA laws regarding people with mobility equipment. I was called and told I had to get a more expensive room because of my scooter. I explained this was illegal as it was limiting my access to the hotel. I finally agreed to the surcharge asking for an email confirming the new rate and that I would talk to manager on arrival. Confirmation came with same rates so we assumed the clerk had talked to management and corrected the error. We checked in at the rate given in email. Upon check out, there was a $50/day surcharge for the larger room. It took too long to find someone to take the surcharge off our bill while a car waited to take us to the airport. Other than that, the only problem was that the first night we had to completely flush the hot water through pipes because it started out looking like blood because it was so dirty or rusty or really, who cares. That's the bad, the good is that the beds are comfy, the room clean, staff very attentive. The Serafina restaurant, which serves as the hotel's restaurant, was good but the service was inattentive. Redfarm restaurant, also in the same building as the hotel is fantastic and should not be missed.

This boutique hotel was recently renovated and is within walking distance of shops, the Lincoln Centre and public transportation. Front desk staff is most cooperative and so is the rest of the staff. We have stayed at this hotel over 10 times in the last 15 years, starting from when it was called On the Ave. And will continue to do so.

Having been told by Booking.com that I was getting a super special 50% off this 'amazing' boutique hotel, I was thinking wow, at USD$370/night it must be something amazing given rack rate is $740/night.It was as we say, putting glitter on a turd. There is nothing to this hotel at all to make it worth $740/night. They have no room service, repeat...no room service, you have to go outside the hotel to get anything. When I first asked I was so shocked I went to the front desk just to ask again, nope....no room service. No mini bar in the room, yup, no mini bar or even a fridge to keep what drinks you have to buy outside cool. If you wanted a decent espresso, you had to wait for the bar to open downstairs or again, leave the hotel. The room is tiny, but you'd expect that in NYC. So what exactly was I paying $370/night a night for? I have no idea. I was there for 8 nights for work, nothing special for the time invested here, no upgrade, waters were only replaced in the room when asked, key to the room failed to work every single day at least once. Again....what was I paying for here? I feel totally ripped off and will no longer even use Booking.com as a service. Do your homework direct with the Hotel, otherwise you'll get completely shafted like I did.

If you can afford it I definitely recommend splurging on the penthouse room for a night or two. The view is well worth the expense. Looking over the Hudson river is an amazing experience and if we could have stayed longer, we would have!Staff were very friendly, cute little bar area and the adjoining restaurant was delish!

I've stayed here many times over the years, it continues to be great all around. Location is wonderful,the service first-rate.The Interior Design is gorgeous a unique urban chic cozy Lounge and bar area .The rooms are open, fresh, and the beds amazingly comfortable!
user_name:
Jacquelyn A
Saratoga Springs, New York

review_body: My first stay and I would come again. Very nice neighborhood with easy access to transportation, and easy walking to restaurants and points of interest. Lovely boutique hotel in an area not ripe with tourists. Worked out perfectly for our visit.

I am partial to this hotel since we have family a block away. The location is great and I love getting breakfast at zabars nearby. The deluxe king is spacious and has a great view. The room is always clean and feels new with great amenities and toiletries. Would have been nice if the fridge and crib were in the room as requested originally but they fixed it within a few hours. Also internet didnt work with the provided code the next day so they just gave me a new code but I would definitely stay again in the future.

You can count on a nice bed in quite room and warm welcoming environment in lobby at the end of the day. I stayed there one month for my job there and did not feel isolated at all !! I will like to stay there again.

My stay at the Nylo hotel was great. I stayed there several times before and this time was no different. Great hotel, great service, Great location. I would recommend the Nylo to everyone who wants some peace and quite in NYC

This boutique hotel locates in Upper West which is good location and close to Central Park, there are many great restaurants and bar around and even the bar in the hotel lobby is nice. Room is clean and big enough. Overall I had a nice stay.

The check in was brilliant. The door guys and concierge were really friendly and helpful. Whatever you do, don't expect the cleaners to move anything or replenish you water. We asked for a refrigerator and gave up waiting after a week. On our last night we ordered pizza in as there is no room service. The pizza place didn't slice our pizza so we phoned the helpful NYLO NOW service to see if they had a plastic knife we could use. That woman was beyond useless - we don't provide room service she informed me. We already knew that and that's why we ordered in!!!! If you're happy to clean your own room and never get hungry this is your place. Oh and if you need a shower make sure it is not on a day when they are "fixing" the hot water. These guys take way too many liberties for the price. We especially enjoyed having the housekeeping trolley parked outside our room all day, the lousy breakfasts in Serafino - all good if you only want four options, and basically being told they can't be bothered helping you on the amazing NYLO Now service. Whatever you do don't call for NYLO Now service - all it will do is annoy you at why they even bother answering your call. You would be less frustrated if they didn't even answer your call

Our room was very clean and the mattresses were SO comfortable! The bath products smelled amazing, and the decor was sleek and modern. The staff were all helpful and the ground floor bar was a lot of fun. Great location on the Upper West Side.
user_name:
Julie R
Long Island, New York

review_body: Very trendy hotel in a perfect upper West Side location. Near Central Park, Broadway shopping and Lincoln Center. There are two very good restaurants in the hotel and a very popular bar.The theater district is a short cab ride away.

The hotel has a great location and ovely beds. We tasted a good wine and beer in the nice bar. The lobby and lounge breathe a good atmosphere. The staff is very helpfull and friendly. I would recomment the hotel to family and friends.

Perfect location near all our events. Liked having coffee maker.Shower floor slippery when wet. Pretty quiet. Thought it said free Wi-Fi but wasn't.The staff was great. A bit dark in the lobby/no restroom there.

The lobby is great and the front desk and concierge were very helpful. The elevator was incredibly slow and the floor we stayed on looked dingy. Our bathroom smelled like mildew and I'm not sure the floors were swept after the day we checked in. The room we had was quiet with not much street noise. The location of the hotel is great and the lobby is inviting.

The price is high but aligned with expected in Manhattan. The neighbourhood feels very safe and pleasant and is right next to the Central Park. Good for relaxing away from the hectic Times Square region

We had a super 4 night stay in a Deluxe queen queen suite. Perfect space for a family. Modern clean and spacious ... Really amazing for NYC at this price. VERY comfy beds. Fun bustling lobby with bar and lounge space. Helpful service at front desk and doormen. My only wish would be more storage place for clothes and in the bathroom. We will definitely stay here again.

Great location, comfortable beds, clean, nice atmosphere in lobby and lounge, helpful staff, sleep quality was not a 5 only because fire house is right down the street but this should not be a deterrent as staying in the city does not lend itself to a quiet silent night :)

I have stayed here many times over the years and the place is as good or better than ever. Nice staff, nice room, very clean, excellent location and great price for NYC. You won't regret your stay here.

Modern hotel in a good location, although a residential area it was close enough to tourist sites. Only downside to our room was the lack of any natural light, we only had two small windows which looked onto the brick wall of the neighbouring building. Also the price we were actually charged was way and above the one quoted when booked! Worked out very expensive for a room only, and one were we had to have a light on continually

Price was right. Location was out of the midtown mess. Vintage, library-themed lobby and bar was very cool. Nice to have access to a printer. That's all the positive I have to say for this place. The bellhop was friendly and so was the greeter.The front desk was not accommodating at all. They barely looked up at me at check-in and then again when I came back with a question. The room was very bare and did not seem at all clean. I'm no sure I would stay here again.

Except for not such a nice woman when I arrived the staff was great. The room was tiny but perfect the products were great. The bed was very comfortable the pillows were not as comfortable as they could have been.

Love this hotel. Have recommended on numerous occasions to friends and family and they have all had good experiences there.Not elaborate - but it meets all our needs on short trips to NYC and it is in a great location for almost everything in the city.

NYLO is a sweet small hotel that is comforting and fun in a crazy area of the city. Fun lounge and all the employees are friendly and helpful. Take advantage of the lounge. Hotel is in a great area for shopping and getting all over NY. Near subways, buses, & of course taxis
user_name:
Phyllis & Richa... K
Martha's Vineyard, United States

review_body: The hotel is absolutely nothing special but it's super convenient and has great customer service. It's relatively clean. No Mini Bars or Mini Fridge. No On Demand which I was so surprised by. Very slow wifi, so no chance of watching Netflix on your IPad with the slow connection.

Love this hotel for the location and the simple but very functional rooms. I love that there are no rugs in the rooms- cleaner and healthier! The bar is fun, functional, and live music often present. Great place to meet friends and family.
user_name:
annm3936
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel is far from the center in a nice neighborhood.the Reception welcome and support was very disappointing, very unfriendly The room was basic and it looks like some renovation needs to be made.There is no breakfast in the hotel and the restaurant that is located in the building served very poor breakfast for a high Price

The NYLO is a wonderful place, in a great location with an excellent and welcoming staff. I stay there often. Its a great location, with its proximity to the subway, great area bars and restaurants and not too far from Riverside and Central parks. The place is always warm and inviting.

Ideally situated for our trip in the nice area of Upper West Side. Many restaurants and shops nearby, quck access to Central Park. The rooms were very spacious and quiet in the standards of NYC. The staff was exceptionally friendly and welcoming. We would definitely recommend this hotel and will certainly book again when back in NYC. Not to forget really luxurious and perfectly comfortable beds.

We love this place! Have stayed here many times and it just keeps getting better. The bed is amazing....the mattress, the covers, the pillows as well! The location is the Upper West Side, but it is close to shopping and the subway and surrounded by restaurants. Our room was a little small, but we are never in our room! They have a variety of sizes. One of the greatest amenities to us is the 16th floor which is an outdoor patio! We go to nearby Zabars deli and have picnics up there!

Close enough to walk to Time Square, and the Museum of Natural History, the NYLO is on the historic and charming upper West side. the neighborhood is full of restaurants and bards of all sorts, from tapas to torpedos, Hot dogs to haute Cusine.The NYLO is a fairly new remodel of an old building. Our "upgraded" room was small but adequate, with a good TV, full bath, comfy bed. If you're in New York, you shouldn't be hanging out in your hotel, so who needs a big room. the lobby bar is cozy and with street-side seating, a great place for people watching. The attached restaurant is OK -- nothing special, but close and more than good enough.Subways stations are just a couple of blocks away in three directions, so getting around is a snap. and BTW, when you go to NYC, get a $30-50 metro card if you'll be staying a while, or the multi-day excursion card for a short visit.I'll stay in thew NYLO again. BTW, ask for the WiFi password. We were provided free WiFi just for asking. A nice place, well located, and with a good staff.

Great boutique type hotel. Room was a bit small, but I hear that's to be expected. There's a great roof top area where you can sit and have a drink. It's not advertised anywhere (at least that we could find) but we overheard other guest talk about it. Great views up there. Lots of restaurants nearby & minutes from Central Park via walking

During checkout the reception staff was not pleased that he had to add my companies complete address to the invoice. It took 4 attemps to get it right although I providedprovided a business card with the address on it. They complained about having to do so several times and Said I should Vetter provide the address myself when making the reservations. The reservations were done using booking.com business Account where everything was stored.They were also not pleased when I inquired information about different positons on the invoice which were differet from quote from booking.comI would never recommend that Hotel for a business trip again.

I went to the front desk to book, no help provided, won't even book. I was asked to pick up the phone and book there... no instructions, no place to sit, so much noise that how can one book a hotel, standing there with bags, no assistance provided. I gave up and booked on booking.com. I try to book directly in general so that companies get all the money and don't lose the commission. They just lost 20-30% of the charges to booking.com. After that the guy saw the I just confirmed booking, and saw that I had a confirmation, still made me wait for 15 mins to even provide me with a room. I was still ok. But then after that it went even worse from there... I had booked a superior room with king size bed and a tub. Guess what, my room had none of them. I went upstairs and asked for it... another one ...same issue, third one... smaller bed with tub... At this point I gave up as I got tired of moving my luggage, not even once I was provided any assistance, even when it was their mistake. The hotel staff made no effort to make it up to me or offer any kind of discount. Considering that I didn't get the superior room for which I paid.. I would have expected at minimum a sorry if not even my difference re-imbursed. I had planned to stay longer but after such a cold behavior, I didn't extend my reservation at this place. And no its not a new york thing. I book a hotel in new york every other weekend, I have many great experiences. I can't always pick the same once that I had liked for location convenience or the availability on last minute bookings.

I was fortunate to be on the top floor and got a room with a separate lounge and private balcony, the support from the housekeeping staff was amazing. The overall feel of the hotel is not modern without losing character and the room was quite spacious in relation to other hotels in the area. I visited during a UN event, so the prices were hopelessly out of range, but generally pleased with the service and attention to detail.

This was my second stay at the NYLO in New York City. Both times I stayed a week and have been very satisfied with the location, service, and quality of the hotel. It's nice to experience Manhattan away from the tourists which offers a more genuine feel of the city. The NYLO is conveniently close to shopping, the metro, and Central Park. During my most recent stay, there was an issue with our air conditioning which stopped working. Within 5 minutes, a repairman was sent to our room. Even though the compressor could not be replaced right away, the manager offered to move us to another hotel since all of their rooms were booked. They were very accommodating and confirmed why they are one of the better hotels in Manhattan. We'll be back!

Very clean, cool feel. Great lobby to work in with a nice table and outlets for devices. Also had a nice restaurant, Serafina, for breakfast and lunch next store. The vibe is great there, and the rooms are set up very efficiently.

Location and nearby amenities were great - room was generous in size for Manhattan and staying in a local neighborhood with easy access to 'action' was perfect! Bed was extremely comfortable and towels were nice and thick - much higher quality than price per night would indicate.

I enjoyed my stay at NYLO New York. It is a nicely located property on the upper west side of town. While the public area is rather noisy, with incessant loud music playing, the rooms are quiet and nicely designed.Beware of the billing, however.  On top of the room rate, you will be charged $50 in a service fee for making the reservation. This fee was explained in an email subsequent to making the reservation. It's an outrageous sum for an online booking. In addition, the hotel just implemented a $25 (plus tax) "Urban Fee" for access to Wifi, the workout facilities and terrace, plus two bottles of water and a "complimentary" drink. It's a BS fee that they apparently feel they could get away with, because of the tight hotel space in Manhattan. Upon checking in, the clerk at the front desk gave me a coupon for a "free" drink at the bar. I thought it was for some inconvenience, but apparently I paid for it. The hotel would tell you that all of this is explained on line, when you make your reservation. I discovered it is in the small print in the details of the charges. The "Urban Fee" is charged upon check-out. Buyer Beware.

Great hotel in a good location. Rooms are modern and clean. Lobby has great atmosphere. Staff are very nice. Bed wad especially comfortable. Doorman helped with getting a taxi early in the morning. Recommended.

The room was clean and comfortable.Sparsely furnished but adequate.Great location - close to Museum of Natural History, Central Park and great restaurantsThe lobby was cold and disappointing and the staff at the front desk bordering on rude ( I had to store my bag b/c I arrived early, but when my room was ready, it took 50 minutes to get my bag)

There are lots of positives for NYLO:- near to 79th street subway station - friendly staff- clean rooms- nice but expensive bar- good air conBut a few negatives too:- there is a fire station in this one way street, so you WILL hear them, regularly and at all hours!- small rooms (but normal for NY)- our room had half a wardrobe. Not enough space for 2 people. - very noisy corridors, you can hear doors banging and when someone knocks on doors 2 or 3 away it sounds like yours!So on reflection for the rate we paid it was value, and we used it as a base, so it was OK value. Very ignorant lady on concierge, literally didn't want to help - was more interested in a video she was watching on her screen. But everyone else very happy to help.

My husband and I spent three nights at the NYLO last week-end. The rooms are cute, clean and comfortable. I especially liked the sheets and bedding. It is important to me that everything looks immaculate. I was not disappointed. The lobby/bar area is a great place to spend some time. You will not be disappointed if you chose this hotel for your NYC stay.

In 2 years the service and quality seems to have gone downhill. No one offered me any help of any kind. Employees seemed unhappy and the checkout clerk was just miserable. No smile, thank you or anything. I am an older woman I was alone and was never asked if I needed any assistance. I ended up getting my own cab and dragging luggage up and down front steps. The floor hallway looked dirty to me. I was also woken up by jack hammering and was stuck in a back room where I could barely open the bathroom door. I think this was my last stay here.

This was the third time we have stayed at this NYLO. Each time we were pleased by the great location near the Beacon Theater, a very comfortable bed, clean room/bathroom, nice bar with friendly people.

This hotel would be better if there was breakfast included. There should be a clearer sign at the corner of Broadway and 77th - we had trouble finding the door, which is located on 77th. The doormen were excellent. The room was clean. Too many things normally found in a hotel room were available only by request and even then, they were not guaranteed - which didn't make me happy.

This is a very nice hotel in the upper west side, just two blocks from Central Park. Very easy access to the park for a morning run, several food/fruit markets across the street, and lots of restaurants in the area. Great bar area in the lobby. The rooms are nice, but I am told some are on the small side (just a bit larger than the bed). I didn't have that problem, but then I had a "corner" room, so it was quite large. Some rooms apparently have bathtubs, but mine only had a shower (fine with me) but if this is important, make sure you ask for your choice. Wifi is included.My only complaint: the air conditioner in my room was stupidly loud. When it cycled on, it kept me awake, so I had to turn it off. Alas, it was hot when I visited NYC, so by morning, I was sweating in bed. But when I did turn on the unit in the morning, it cooled the room back to normal within a very short time, so it worked fine, just loud, loud, loud.Overall, a great hotel at a great price point (for NYC).

Lived in NYC UWS for many years, I return to NYC every few months. Staying in my old neighborhood is very important as it is home to me. NYLO makes me feel at home....staff, accommodations and neighborhood is the reason I continue to return.

Horrible noise problem with neighboring guests well past 2am, got no sleep. Notified security multiple times. The next day we were informed two wedding parties and a bar mitzvah were booked and nothing could be done. Left early and will not be back.

This is an excellent property! Nicely redone rooms...not as small as many NYC hotels. Good neighborhood, close to subway stops, shopping, restaurants. Cool, hip vibe. Walking distance to Central Park. Would highly recommend.

Lovely updated hotel with lovely stuff! Just get to this hotel, and everything will be fulfilled.We came to the hotel after a flight that wasn't easy for us and they immediately took our language and offered us a little fridge and got it the day after our arrival. We asked for an extra chair and got it immediately.

We stayed at Nylo NYC for our wedding. We were given the best rooms & all staff were friendly & helpful. Some staff went above & beyond their duties for us & made our wedding very special indeed. I can't recommend it enough.
user_name:
Woodster75
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: The staff was excellent; outstanding level of service. The UWS location was great with many lovely restaurants to try, including the Chinese restaurant associated with the hotel that we liked so much we dined at twice. First floor level felt like a large living room and the bar staff were very responsive. The only let down for the stay was the room itself. PROS: It was clean and perfectly serviceable for a long weekend away. The bed was comfortable but on the small side for two people. CONS: The standard room contains no minibar, or even a fridge. The TV could not get a steady signal (but we were not there to watch TV so for us it wasn't a big deal). The lighting was strange to figure out with many hardwired lights installed and many different switches and it took a bit to figure out which switch controlled each light or power receptacle. CONCLUSION: Worth staying at, but do not expect a high level of luxury in the standard room.

this is a great hotel. clean rooms, helpful staff and overall in the center of what you need. The hotel bar is right where you need it. The attached restaurant had great food. CVS across the way. Market, coffee and other foods are all right next door

The hotel is lockated in a great location, the rooms are really really small.The communal areas look good and inviting, the look and feel in the rooms is several levels below. be aware that the price on the web sites is exluding tax.

I booked the hotel room over the phone. Informed them I had a guest with me but that I was paying for the room and that the room should be booked UNDER my name.The phone rep originally messed up and put it under my guest's name. Informed the phone rep of this mistake and that they would fix it. The room needed to be UNDER my name.Upon my check in the front desk rep asked for my guest's ID as her name was under the reservation. I informed desk rep that this was a mistake and should have been fixed. Provided the front desk rep with my credit to show her that I was paying for it. Desk rep than cocked an attitude and ask again that my guest provide her id since the room was under my guest's name. Again i told them that was a mistake. I told desk rep that her belongs were packed in her luggage and she would have to dig them out which would be time consuming. Eventually my guest dug out her id from her bags and we were able to check and change the reservation under my name.For $350 plus for a one night stay in NY city you would expert service to be top notch and not have such a sucky attitude.

The front desk is slow even when there's a queue, requests are not noted and are unmet, room furniture is missing, miscommunication often happens among staff; in short very lousy service.The location is nice, but hospitality cannot be expected; they don't bother to listen even the simplest of requests.

I made the terrible mistake of booking based on the photos on NYLO's website. The hotel is not up to a 4 star standard at all. The first room I was put in literally had the bathroom sink falling off the wall! I will not stay here ever again.

We have stayed here many times. This last time, I called main reservations and they did not have any rooms for one night (Saturday). I asked to have the number for the hotel and was greeted differently. Polite and willing to make a reservation for one night at discounted rates that were showing on their website. Front desk could use some staff that welcomes guests with a smile. Not easy to find doorman. Rooms are quiet and clean, however, very, very small. The best thing about this hotel is that it is right around the corner from the Red Farm restaurant.

Very noisy and cramped lobby. Service slow, especially for storing and retrieving bags. The bathroom door in the room is bizarrely translucent, so one person turning on the bathroom light at night wakes up everyone. But a nice location, and does indeed have "industrial chic".
user_name:
Barry W
Highland Park, New Jersey

review_body: We stayed 2 nights at the NYLO. My husband had a business meeting and I met a friend for lunch and museums. I would stay there again. Location and size of room were good and restaurant was convenient and good food/service.

The location is ideal if you have friends or family in the area. The rooms are masculine and minimal. Clean. Beds are comfortable. Need more lighting. Need more bathroom space, especially when you have more than one person in a room. Got to be prepared for NYC street noises: bring your ear plugs.

We stayed at NYLO's for a week. I did the reservation at NYLO's directly, I had a better price than in other websites. When we arrived, the first night we stayed in a first floor's room, although when I did the reservation I please asked for I high floor one. They changed us next day, that night they were busy.Our room size was good, the bed was fantastic, very very confortable! Bathroom was good too.I liked the location of the hotel, you have shops and restaurants in the area, the metro is near and Central park in a 10 minutes walk. The hotel is located in a quiet neighbourhood, so you can relax after a hard day.Our room tip included breakfast at Serafinas, which always was good. Nice staff and good food.NYLO's quiet and centric location and the bed where we sleep were what I liked the best.

The Nylo is well located and comfortable overall, with generally good service. There is a nice on-site restaurant and the hotel is within walking distance to many NY attractions. The bed was comfortable but the room is small overall.

This hotel is really well located for exploring NYC. It is very clean with modern furnishings. Our two suggestions for improvement are to get rid of the plastic cups and please provide 2 water glasses, 2 wine glasses and 2 coffee mugs per room. Paying too much to drink out of plastic. Also, need some information to be provided in the room about the hotel (there was nothing), especially laundry and the availability of the great rooftop lounge.

What a great gem on UWS. Small not fancy but well maintained. Staff fantastic and friendly. Loved Ramona at front desk and Jose bellman service. Made our stay in NYC amazing. Rooms were clean. Bathrooms nice size. Quieter street than most.Thank you for such a great stay.

I gotta say I loved the furniture in the lobby and the whole set up. My overall experience was good. The location is fantastic. I would say that I would come back to stay here on my next trip to NYC. Thank you.

Very nice boutique hotel with more than adequate rooms for NYC Located in a nice quite area near the Museum of Natural History. Serafina, restaurant attached. Nice hobby area with bar and sitting area.Would definitely go back.Great for young adults and more "mature" travellers.

Loved the location, the room, the lobby, etc. Nice staff. NO SECURITY AT THE ENTRY AT 12:30 am. Weird incident with security guy coming in the room 9/21/16 11:15 am, despite SHHHH! sign on door, then coming back 5 minutes later and opening the door with his own card without even knocking. Wife was alone and foolishly opened the door initially. A lot of bad things could have happened. It could also have been a guy planting a bomb (he had this handheld device he was carrying and went into the bathroom for far too long with it). I left at least (2) very clear messages for management Friday when I had time to think about what had happened. NO ONE HAS CALLED ME BACK EVEN THOUGH I ADVISED YOU I WAS THINKING TO CALL BOMB SQUAD. WAKE UP, NYLO MGMT! Review your voice mail(s), your staff logs for who was on duty Thurs 21 at 11:15 am and fire the guy who entered the room and talk to the female manager on duty Thursday at noon to figure out how to deal with this type of thing. She was calm and collected but ineffective. Mgmt screwed up big time on failing to return my call(s) and voice mails. Now look what you've done - gone and made me put up a nasty post you'll have to deal with. Otherwise, it was awesome. By the way, I used to manage a large apartment building in the city (just retired) so this review is not from some hayseed dazzled by the big city lights. Nasty stuff happens and no security at the door at night is ridiculous. Good people screw up sometimes, but man.....you gotta do better. You guys failed on all levels on this serious matter. You know who was on duty, figure out what went wrong and fix it. That being said, it wouldn't prevent me from thinking about staying here again. I'll bet you're confused by now, eh?

The hotel itself is lovely and the staff friendly and thoughtful but I had a room with a door adjacent to another room and the first 2 nights I stayed, there were parties happening in the adjoining room with doors slamming and people yelling down the halls to each other from midnight to 4:00 in the morning. I called security and they came up and spoke to them and as soon as security left they started up again laughing and joking about making the security guy chase them through the hotel. I was on a business trip and was exhausted from lack of sleep. The third night the hotel offered to change my room so I had to pack up everything before I left for work and move. They did not offer to refund me anything or have the problem people move or leave. Even without the party going on, I could hear every word spoken in the adjoining room. I could not recommend this hotel despite the things that were good about it.

Retirement,birthdays,anniversary,good reasons to go to NYC. We have stayed in NYLO last year,for less time than this trip. We were here a few days longer, I wanted to stay in a bigger room.We were upgraded to a king deluxe. I loved this room,we had a comfortable space to sit,watch TV,and sleep. The staff were very helpful,the concierge answered a question for me.The front desk staff were helpful,and with a smile. If service staff were on the elevator,they always had a smile,and said have a good day. The location is perfect,not far from the subway. You do hear sirens occasionally.Our room was on the corner,so I'm not sure about other locations hearing traffic. We ate a delicous breakfast each morning. I like being in a neighborhood atmosphere rather than the hustle and bustle of midtown. I liked that in their business center, I could use the computer to do online check in,and print our boarding passes.

Loved the boutique hotel. The lobby was just charming with its unique design. As for the staff, I could not say enough good things about them. The room was delightful along with their large modern bathroom. It made our stay in NY a pleasant experience.

Nylo was very clean - in a great location and child friendly. Restaurant and Bar on site and rooms without carpeting make it safe for those with allergies. I would highly recommend this hotel. Starbucks right down the street and plenty of grocery stores.

I spent 7 nights at NYLO and really enjoyed the friendly staff, a clean, comfortable and ((relative to New York) quiet room. The location is superb for someone who wants easy access to all the city has to offer, and is thankfully outside the tourist crunch.The lobby/bar is like a cozy living room - another plus. I am very pleased to have found this place!

Nice hotel in NYC. Nice rooms and lobby/bar area. Rooms spacious and bathroom clean. Front desk and bartenders were not very warming and friendly. Front desk had no expression and barmaid looked overworked. Besides that, all good.

I had actually come out for a birthday celebration and was booked at another hotel: one overnight at that other hotel left me ready to flee NYC--a city I have had a love affair with for 2 decades since I was a student. As I was venting to a friend, she called the nylo last minute and insisted I move there. I did and it was a pleasure from the first moment to the ladt
user_name:
Amal S
South San Francisco, California

review_body: wonderful stay!! great experience. staff was friendly, helpful, respectful. cozy and nice feel. bed was very comfortable too. room in good condition. bathroom clean. quiet and restful night. thank you

I just recently completed a 7 day stay there. This was my second visit. I find the hotel convenient, central to my activities and close to the subway. I enjoy the Seraphina restaurant very much and it is adjacent and accessible from within the hotel. The hotel staff is very personable and attentive. I really like their hotel bar and lounge and reading room / business room arrangement it is a well designed and attractive area. The hotel has 2 towers and street noise is minimal. I found the corridor noise quite a bit louder in the Broadway street tower compared to the other on this visit and will ensure I use the other tower next visit.Bottom line very good value for the money bearing in mind where and what you want to do in NYC during your visit.
user_name:
Robert M
Indian Rocks Beach, Florida

review_body: Really friendly and helpful staff, let us check in early when asked if we could store our bags until check - in. Room clean, well designed, bed comfortable,hotel very quite. Will definitely stay again. Also had a very nice breakfast at restaurant connected to hotel.

We had 2 crummy nights here. Mattress in our room was worn out and needed replacing. The smoke alarm chirped from 1-3am. Had to get up 3 times to shut it off. Battery was dying..finally removed the alarm from the ceiling = Unsafe!
user_name:
Michael G
Fresno, California, United States

review_body: Fantastic Experience - room, check in, noise levels, sheets, tv. all good But there needs to be some complimentary refreshments and refrigeration in the room. But also, need a much more friendly welcoming staff at the reception area and so tight.

Great location! 2 minutes away from subway station. Service just ok. We have 4 people stayed in a room but only got 3 set of towel. We called twice to reception, says would send it to us but it never happened.

The room was extremely small and did not match the image we were given when we made the reservations. I requested wake up calls twice and never received them. The furnishings were minimal and not very high quality.

we have been staying at this hotel for 20 years and always have a pleasant experience. It's nice to see the same faces year after year and it always starts with Lenny when we arrive. they go out of their way to be helpful. However, the new "urban" ad-on fee is a little hard to take.

Great location, bar was convenient, check in staff forgot to give us our free drink coupons, liked that there was a housekeeping cart left out at all times so that minor items could be refilled as needed without having to wait for someone from the desk to bring the item to the room,

Check in smooth, pic of the room not identical; views not the same as website but close. Only disappointment- booked online, upon checkin stated will pay via cash at check out, was assured its an option & will be done. During check out the latter was declined.

The two winfpdow room was dark because of a new high rise obscuring light. We were advised to keep the shades drawn because workmen could see inside. The shower drain was clogged, the requested refrigerator was not in the room and the one delivered did not cool. The bathroom has no towel hooks, Q-tips etc., robe, and the towels were well worn. No reading chair, or any soft floor surface for morning stretches. Metal lockers complete the cold surfaces but beware they have no back so don't place your clothes too far back. The man at the front desk is a splash of cold water as he deigns to address any complaint.

This is a great hotel in a great location - modern with all the amenities one needs! Very friendly and helpful staff - only slight reservation was the room was a little cramped otherwise fabulous we will come again.
user_name:
cmvsergeant
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Will definitely stay again! Dale at the bar was a warm and friendly face. He made our day. The rooms were clean and very comfy. Enjoyed our stay very much. Hope to return very soon. Subway was in walking distance.

Loved the hotel - extremely comfortable! And loved the little extra things like Keurig in room, bottled water included, and breakfast vouchers for next door. Around the corner from Central Park and could always get a taxi when needed to get to midtown or beyond.

Rooms are clean and trendy. Bathrooms were very nice. Nice lobby with restaurant and nice bar. Great location. The mattress was amazing!!! THe only complaint was the rooms were not that sound proof but over all a great place to be.

I have stayed here several times,I have never been disappointed. There is alot of construction in the area so I would suggest requesting a room in the rear of the Hotel . Staff if friendly and helpful. It's a safe area and a short walk to Central Park. Excellent restaurants surround the hotel,including the incredible Red Farm.

This is our second time staying at NYLO so that tells you something out of the gate. Location is very good at W77th and Broadway with easy access to the Metro 1 stop at 79th and walking distance to C Park etc.We took Subway to the village for tapas and a stroll and later it was a $10 cab to Broadway Theatre for a show. Room was clean and comfy and we took advantage of both the adjoining Serafina and next door Red Farm restaurants which were both very good.

This was my first time staying at the NYLO NYC and I really liked it. The location is great, the staff was kind and helpful and the vibe is hip and trendy. The room i stayed in was very small, but clean and well appointed. One drawback was that there were not mini fridges available and the ice machine is only on the 12th floor which I found inconvenient.

This place is cool, so if that is all you care about, stay here.The a/c sounded like a freight train. No place to hang wet towels. No drawers, just funky IKEA-like shelves with metal doors that wouldn't close.Security is abysmal. Open lobby with unattended elevator and no key card security. Anybody could just walk in.I got major attitude from the front desk when I couldn't get clean towels after housekeeping failed to clean the room and I was in a major hurry to get ready for an event.When leaving I ordered a hamburger at 4 pm; my driver was coming at 5. Had to get the burger to go because it never came until last minute. Ate it in the car! The bartender had to keep leaving the bar to check on it. He moved heaven and earth just to get it, meanwhile leaving the bar unattended and irritating everybody else.

This hotel was very average for the money we spent - not sure if this is just the cost in NYC, or the hotel itself. The rooms were small, but fine. The location was reasonable, but I'd recommend getting a metro card.

Will stay again. location is perfectStaff are lovely the bar area is top notch, the hotel and rooms are spotless very warm and welcoming atmosphere.I highly recommend this hotel if your considering a trip to NYC

Nice boutique hotel however there were a few things that could have made the experience more enjoyable. Upon entering the hotel it was a bit dark. The carpets needed to be vacuumed in the lobby and the hallways. Check in was OK not very welcoming or rude in any way. The loud sound coming from the elevator was very disturbing. Hopefully this has been fixed. Hotel wasn't to far from train station. The room was modern and small which is to be expected. It was nice and clean.The design did feel a little "sterile". If you're not into very modern rooms you may not like this hotel. The roof top area was a little deceiving. Pics online do not look anything like they did in person. There wasn't enough seating. When we first went a couple had this little mean barking dog and the other couple were very inappropriate. They really needed to go back to their room. The city views aren't great from there. They lock the doors to the roof top after 10pm I believe. A security guard advised all of us we had a few minutes remaining. I would stay again at the discounted rate I received through another popular site, however if it was at full price I would not.

Rude staff, dirty, small (standard room is around 15 square meter!) and noisy rooms, dirty lobby, sliding beds, hand painted doors (including room door!), no minibar in the rooms, no room service, not even a drinking water despite complimentary coffee, poor breakfast with very few options, no value ($450/night!), my electronic device accessories disappeared in the room, cheating information (claiming to be a 4 star luxury hotel), no customer service.

Cold minimalism needs to be immaculate. This property falls short. Broken hair drier, broken coffee maker - no apology. Lively bar scene. Price point is high for the neighborhood. Several steps just to enter the building, not suitcase or accessibility friendly.

Like many smaller hotels in NYC, the rooms are small, but the location was great, and the staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is just two blocks away from the subway so it's very easy to get around. That being said, there's plenty to do and see on the Upper West Side, including the Natural History Museum just a few avenues away.

This was my first time here, I was only supposed to stay 1 day but I loved my panoramic view so much I booked it another night. Ramona was so helpful at fixing it so I didn't have to switch rooms. Will definitely be back again V.

I do not have a specific commentary. The room was clean and confortable (not much light). The hotel have a beautiful terrace although a bit narrow. The service was ok. I think good quality/price rate. I will come back.

Service staff are polite and extremely nice. Red Farm is a MUST GO restaurant on your list. However, the hotel was far from luxury. The rooms are (claustrophobic) small. Our bathroom had a strong smell of musty wetness, the vents were covered with layers of dust caked in. The bathroom ammenities are nothing special, plain and ordinary. The beds were comfortable but the pillows are extremely lumpy - have no idea what is in them. Out of 8 pillows I couldn't find one smooth enoughto sleep on. Air conditioning fan was extremely noisy. Windows were crusted with a layer of dirt. A vent by the front door of the hotel leaked on top of people coming in and out of the hotel for 3 days. There was no doorman on duty to say hello when you came in, and to be honest I don't know that I saw a bellman on duty the entire stay - he was always "busy" around the property. But most concerning was the attitude of a manager at Serafina, the hotel restaurant. When we arrived at 2 pm, the room was not ready, so we headed to the restaurant for a couple of hours. The wait staff suggested we leave our bags by a table near the bar in a completely empty section. At one point a manager came in and started yelling toward the couple of occupied tables spread out that the person who left the bags there should come and get them. After we removed our bags he proceeded to sit at precisely that table in an empty section (!) to have a conversation with the barmaid. The waiter was apologetic and offered to remove our bags; I could tell even he was embarrassed. As a manager, he could have asked the waiters who the bags belong to and nicely request that they be removed or simply sit at another table. This hotel is in need of better managers and needs an overhaul: unfinished floors, dark lobby and exposed ducts don't make the industrial "look"!

Although thenlocation is very good, close to central Park and to metro line 1, our stay was unpleasant. We had indeed à lot of noise first from the neighbors next door as the poor insulation of'what should be a communicating door when both rooms are rented as twins I'supposed, letnus hear anything they were saying or even when they were snoaring at night (sic). Then during the week as our window was malfunctionning and was opening to the front street where works were talking place all day long.... We have been waking up by construction noises every week day. Another weak point was the bathroom not all as you'would expect from à four stars hôtel. All in all I'do not even think this hotel deserves three stars.

Spacious room (when booking a higher category) with very good bed. The location is nice as two subway stations are in walking distance, there are many restaurants and shops around. Central park is just a few minutes away, passing the famous Dakota appartment building on the way there. Having a concierge is a cool thing if you are in need.

Super friendly and accommodating staff. Great property. Bed was amazingly comfy. I would definitely return and highly recommend this hotel. I had breakfast in the restaurant downstairs. The food was great and so was the service.

I generally stay at this property when visiting my family. It's convenient walking to the subway and all over the West Side; Although the rooms are generally smallish, they are nicely done, clean, and love the coffee in the room.

We stayed here whilst visiting my brother. We were here for 5 days. The hotel is lovely, rooms are perfectly clean and beds are very comfortable. There is a restaurant on site to. It's also easy to get out and about from, there is a subway station 2 blocks away. And there are often taxis parked outside for you to use at your convenience. Very nice hotel, we will be back.

Nylo is not an average hotel.It is warm and welcoming yet sophisticated and quirky. The hotel is centrally located and easy to accesses from subway lines. You have parks within 2 or 3 blocks and the high line is close! The staff is friendly and accommodating Can't wait till my next visit to NY

Arrived midday to find our room would be ready around 3pm. They would text us when it was ready. Went to eat lunch, came back and 3pm where our Superior room was ready. Upon entering our room, we were right near the lift well. As we were there for a week, I rang the front desk to see if we could have another, quieter room. We waited for 20mins, but there was no return call. Rang them to say we'd wait downstairs in the bar as we did not want to muck up the room. ( only one chair). We were updated by the Manager, Christina, who was delightful and helpful. The only other room available was a late checkout and to be cleaned shortly. She gave us 2 free drink vouchers for the bar. This was now 4:30pm. Still room was not available at 5:30pm. Christina then upgraded us to a quiet deluxe room as there would be more waiting before the other room would be ready. We were very thankful. Very art house style, great bar and lounge area. Clean & comfortable. Rooms fresh and decorated in a contemporary style. Great position with shopping markets and cafes, restaurants all around the Hotel. Would stay again.

This is the second time I have stayed in this hotel. The vibe is cool, international and hip. BUT....there were flies in my room and no way to open a window to get them out, the pillows were dusty and when I sat on the bed, a dust cloud greeted my new pants, and while I was working out in the fitness room a hotel staffer came in and started spraying harsh cleansers around the room and was cleaning surfaces using a pail with ammonia in it....I had to leave! I did complain to the front desk and they did nothing...they said nothing other than they would let housekeeping know. Come on NYLO... for the cost, and the good reviews, you must do better. I will not recommmend this hotel to others.

Service was great. Loved this hotel, everything was great! friendly and very helpful staff. Bed very comfy. Restaurants everywhere. The decor was very cool and the sheets were amazing. The bell hops and front desk very helpful and nice.

NYLO used to be a top notch gem, but it's a bit worn out now. I spent $30 more for an upgrade on my last visit, for a room with a deck. The deck was missing a chair, and another chair was missing its cushion. The bathroom ceiling was in disrepair. The room furniture is looking a bit worn and the beds are well past their replacement date, based on the sloping, lumpy experience I had.

This was my second stay at NYLO. If you need to stay in this location (visiting Columbia Univ,) this is an acceptable option. BE AWARE THAT THE PICTURES ON WEBSITE CAN BE EXTREMELY DECEPTIVE AND your booked room may be quite different. Booked a double queen suite and there were 2 TINY WINDOWS with a building wall about 2 feet away AND there is not a "separate living area" as described . . . it is just a small uncomfortable area open to the beds and felt small. Room was extremely dark and felt like a basement room and lots of loud noise constantly outside. Small wiindows were covered with paint. Spoke with front desk and 2 managers to change my room type to a "brighter" room category and they demanded on charging an extra $75.00/night (the rate was already $423.00)/night. I am a travel agent and immediately checked the hotel website for the upgraded room rate and it was $100.00 LESS than my original room rate. Not only would they not honor that online room rate for the first night, they insisted that my second night was also $75.00 extra.They explained that I should understand as a travel agent that their hotel is a revenue creating business and that they need to make money and were TOTALLY unwilling to provide customer satisfaction as a goal.I have stayed at Fairmonts, Westins, Marriott, Intercontinental and many other hotel chains and they have been thrilled to please the customer and usually will offer a upgrade if room is NOT as described and ALWAYS honor their own hotel website rates. So DON'T EXPECT ANY SMILES OR FLEXIBILITY WITH THIS STAFF AND MANAGEMENT.The regular cheaper rooms are extremely small and cramped often inside view but clean and comfortable bed. Best rooms are the panorama king room type and above. These rooms are not huge but decent size for New York and are clean with great bed. Housekeeping staff were outstanding and could not do enough to please guests. Rooms on lower floor are VERY loud with street construction all around hotel. High floors are great. Least expensive rooms have very tiny and cramped bathrooms.

The hotel is situated in a very good location for Central Park and the major sights. However, we paid extra for the lifestyle loft with balcony and were disappointed to find that the extra money just meant that the neighbouring guests were able to wander in front of our bedroom window. This meant we had reduced privacy and, as the neighbours repeatedly stole our balcony chairs from us, we were unable to use the balcony for sitting out. We reported the issue to the staff and were met with a lackadaisical response. Save your money!

My daughter moved to New York 7 years ago. I visit her 4-5 times a year. Without a doubt I will always be staying at the NYLO in the future. The hotel staff was friendly and very efficient. The lobby was wonderful. The rooms were modern and comfortable. The location was excellent; walking distance to the subway, there is great grocery store across the street, and many affordable restaurants within easy walking distance.

It's well located and the rooms and comfortable. The lobby area with the bar is nice.Staff is helpful but nothing special.The noise bothered us. I know it's NY but we had people doing construction right below our room window in a small confined area - we could literally hear everything. Didn't bother us that much are we were out nearly all day but still.

We stayed at NYLO when we visited the US Open for the weekend, the hotel offered us everything we were looking for, convenience to the train to the venue, location to our family, dining, central park and all the things we like to do when we visit NYC.

A great location with excellent facilities within the hotel. This was our 2nd visit to NYLO. Rooms are great and quite spacious for New York. Staff are on the whole polite but the bar staff could do with manning their area a little more effectively. Anna had a lot of drama to discuss with her co-workers, so had to wait for a good ten minutes to be served whilst she regaled the story to three different people!

Very small and cheaply furnished rooms. The mattress was very saggy. Low price quality ratio. Easy access to Central Park. Resto bar in lobby and lounge area was very nice. Valet staff great front desk staff less so.

Great hotel, valet service is nice and very easy! The beds are almost as comfortable as the one at home. The location is also very nice and safe. Great restaurants within walking distance and easy access to subways.

Not happy at all. Clean service was poor. People on reception was rude, except Ramona. Not helpful. Even though, I love the bar and the people working there; same with Serafina. It is a 4 star hotel, but it works like 2 star. And is not cheap.

Very nice hotel with excellent location just blocks away from central park. Amsterdam Aveneue around the corner was packed with great little restaurants.The room was tiny, but did the job. The bathroom was ok, a bit worn, but everything worked and was clean. The bed was soooo comfortable.Don't miss the nice little roof top on the 16th floor.Would absolutly come back.

Rooms are very large for Manhattan, staff is friendly and competent, the lounge/bar area is very spacious with comfortable chairs and fast wifi, prices are good and the hotel is conveniently located near the park and Natural History Museum. Also, the beds are soft which is rare for a hotel.

A very inviting hotel ambiance. Relaxed, Hip and Chic. Would definitely stay here again.Beds were comfortable and bathrooms were a good size...The Doormen on all shifts were great, and the hotel lobby bar provided a perfect balance to relax.

Having to travel a lot to New York for work is hard to find a good hotel that offers a home away from home feel. I was happy to find this one. Staff were just amazing and really wanted to get to know you. Room was amazing, best views, great bed offered me the best nights sleep I've had in a while. This will now become my go to hotel for any stay in New York Well done NYLO New York

most of the staff is very courteous and helpful (one reception desk person withstanding).our room was ideal (quiet, clean, sunny), comfortable (and the AC worked well.location is very convenient.we would stay here again.

If I came to New York again I would definitely stay here again. The bed was so comfortable. There are no unnecessary frills to the room - just what you need. Love the relaxed urban/jazz era feel to reception and bar. No views from room but I guess they can't all have views!

One week ahead of our check in date and still no help when we arrivedSecond problem was the bedroom was so hot and the a/c was unable to help we had to dress for a memorial service sweating from top to bottom

The room was very minimal in looks, small space in a king room. My husband left with rash from bedding, the management had not much to say about it. My kids were in the room next door only management can control the lock between rooms. Not impressed
user_name:
Brooke S
St James, United States

review_body: Leaking A/C over steps in lobby, untrained service-people who who range from clueless to lazy to rude, dirty floor in room, broken iron and ironing board, scalding hot water crossed in the cold tap and shower. Good sized room for Manhattan, Good location if you like the UWS, good bed, good price (but I would have paid more to have the plumbing work and the floor swept).

We stayed at NYLO because of the location. Nice modern style. Bed was super comfy- only complaint is the floors were dirty so when barefoot, felt the grit on my feet! Wish they mopped the floors and then I would have been happy!

Spacious rooms, comfortable beds and the staff, without exception, werefriendly and helpful throughout our three day stay. Price also reasonable for the upper west side. Will return to NYLO any chance we get!

I was called a liar by security: I had an important package delivered there on a Friday, I called to double check that it'd arrived and was told it was there. I arrive the next morning and a man from security said my package was not there, had never arrived, told me that I was wrong and that I needed to get tracking to prove it was there. Meanwhile, this is Labor Day weekend and no one is at my office to get tracking until Tuesday. I wait, get tracking, tell them that R . Brown signed for the package on THURSDAY and he now looks flabbergasted and walks to the back. 30 minutes later he emerges with my package that had been there the entire time.My coworker also had packages delivered to the hotel and someone from the staff put them in the wrong room...the wrong OCCUPIED room and we could not get them back for some time. Upon checking out, my coworker went to the front to pick up something that another coworker, who'd flown out early that morning, had left with her. The front desk woman said she had been there all morning and had seen no such thing. She argued with my coworker until the point that we asked for the manager on duty. A Hispanic man in a striped shirt walked out and argued, then raised his voice at my coworker, telling her that it's against hotel policy to keep things up front for other guests and they would've never accepted what was left for her (a room key!). Keep in mind, we needed this room key because our other coworker had close to $10k worth of things from a production that we needed to have shipped home. Meanwhile, the women goes over to an accordion folder by the front desk and pulls out an envelope with my coworkers name one it and the room key we were looking for! We all stare in amazement at the manager, waiting for an apology, then his face turns red and he walks away without another word.My coworker walks away and the front desk woman has the audacity to say to me,"all she had to do was say her name and we would've found the envelope." What?! I looked at her and said,"no. She told you both all the information you asked for and more. SHE is the customer and you and especially your manager should never talk to customers like that no matter the situation." THEN the guy working security tells us he can reserve a car service for us to the airport, $75 flat fee including taxes. We reserve, ride to JFK, and he driver ONLY TAKEA CASH. Seriously? Who travels with cash anymore?

I recently had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel located on the Upper West Side. The room decor, bed, and amenities were all significantly above average. The hotel staff was helpful and polite (they arranged for a private vehicle to take us to the airport, which cost about as much as a cab and was much appreciated). Don't forget to check out the observation balcony on the 16th floor.The location is excellent. You are close to the Museum of Natural History and Central Park, and a subway with multiple lines is an easily-walkable five blocks away (there is another stop two blocks away, but only has the 1 line, and there are other lines by the Museum of Natl. History too). There are restaurants nearby (check out Amsterdam Avenue) and the gourmet markets of Zabars and Citarella are both close too. We did not try the restaurant attached to the hotel but did check out the bar; great cocktail menu.If you want to stay in the UWS, this hotel is highly recommended.

I've stayed at the NYLO NYC a few times now and this last trip was a disappointment. The Window shade was ripped of and didn't work and the AC didn't work. The from desk staff did not understand the new fees being included in the room rate and the benefits included. I thing the hotel could use some better management at the property. Oh and I forgot the Bartender had an attitude

2nd time we have stayed here. Convenient to everything with by walking or subway. Helpful staff. One criticism: internet free in the lobby, but $14 per day in the room. Reception staff was totally unconvincing in describing the discrepancy. Apparently NYLO is soon to be sold and re-named. Hope the new owners look at this question.
user_location: Los Angeles de San Rafael, Spain
user_name:
I4169JPstevec
Los Angeles de San Rafael, Spain

review_body: The NYLO is a great choice to experience staying in a hip, trendy boutique hotel. Two blocks from the subway and three blocks from Central Park. I would recommend booking the panoramic view... Worth the extra $$. We loved the neighborhood and would stay there again without hesitation.

I chose the NYLO because it was on the Upper West Side, a neighborhood that I lived in many years ago before leaving New York and where I still have many friends. I wanted to be close to them.The location is in the heart of this area, and I can definitely recommend the NYLO if this is the area you wish to stay in. I had a lovely room with an outside terrace and a very comfortable bed. The staff is friendly and helpful. I would personally like to thank Renata at reception who was very kind in helping me resolve a small problem that I encountered. But the NYLO could be much better if they gave more attention to detail!! Why are there plastic cups in the coffee maker and bathrooms? Why isn't there a little table and some plants on the terrace to make it more welcoming? Why is one given vouchers when one arrives for breakfast? The NYLO seems to aspire to be a "luxury boutique hotel". If they could fix these minor details that are important for the discerning traveler, the NYLO would be perfect. I genuinely liked this hotel, but it could be even better....

I stayed here on business and the location was good (quick access to public transportation) and the service was outstanding. From check in to check out all of the staff were friendly and very helpful. The rooms were a good size and the bed was VERY comfortable.

Loved this hotel! Welcoming from the time we hit the door, great stylish room. Nice bar that has a garage door that opens out to the sidewalk in the evenings for a great NYC sidewalk in/out vibe. Nice lounging areas on first floor. I will be looking to this hotel again. Close to both an express and local train stop on the 1,2,3. Tucked in-between Broadway and Amsterdam AV. This place is way too handy! We liked being away from the Midtown/Times Square non-stop high decibel noise and being in this area with its neighborhood feel, we think you will, too.

I would recommend this hotel to all. My daughter goes to Columbia asks it is a straight shot on the train. 2 blocks from Central Park and close to a handful of fabulous restaurants. I felt safe and everything I needed was in walking distance.

I felt the room was exceptionally small even though we had a Superior room and the guy at front desk made it seem like the room would be nice. This was our third stay in this establishment and we were a bit disappointed. The bathroom (especially the shower) were not as clean as I would prefer.

Booked this hotel via Lastminute.com for a 5 day break, and got a great deal on price.Staff were super helpful, particularly the lady who checked us in. Rooms are good enough as a base for exploring (not sure why anyone would want to stay in the hotel all day in NY anyway!).Top tip - definitely check out Shake SHack, only a few blocks away.

This was our first trip to NYC and NYLO was a great base from which to explore. Room basic but clean and quiet. All great staff but a special thanks to Crystal for sorting our return shuttle transfer to JFK.

I have visited NYC for many years for work and play. This is the best value in the best location that I have ever experienced in a hotel. Highly recommend. We stayed on a Thursday evening of a holiday weekend. Came back through the city on Monday night, planning to stay outside the city. NYLO was so good we stayed again on Monday night. We will return!!

Hotel was in a lovely quieter location however very close to the subway and restaurants, lovely staff throughout would definitely return. Nice that it also had a bar to relax in at night. We booked 3 rooms and all were comfortable, clean and the beds were lovely
