I really liked this hotel. The location is excellent. Local supermarkets, pharmacy & subway all nearby. My room was nice. My bed was comfortable. The A/C was pretty loud though. Good shower pressure, but hot water can take a long time to come through. Room had a writing desk, but no fridge. You did get complimentary bottled water however. Free Wi-Fi. Computers, bar & restaurant all downstairs. There was some construction noise & some plumbing noise from other rooms, but I would definitely stay here again. The staff were a bit hit & miss. Some were great & others didn't want to give you the time of day.

After a dozen trips to NYC, NYLO is the best. Accomodating, convenient, comfortable, welcoming, friendly, & any other superlative you would hope for in a hotel stay. NYLO is the only place we stay. Thank you!

We've stayed at this hotel before and picked it because of its location, cleanliness and safety. Hotel bar is great, with a great staff and the restaurants near by are excellent - close to the Natural History Museum - great local neighborhood.

Little more quality control needed in housekeeping. Hotel of this price should be immaculate. Otherwise great location. The staff was pleasant. Cool lounge and vibe. Sarafina restaurant is OK but lots of better choices in the area.

Close to public transportation and many food options. Lots of families around this hotel. Shopping a couple blocks down the street. Overall no big complaints. Great time in New York. Only three large blocks from Central Park.

I stayed here for 2 nights. Their beds are soooooo comfy. I stayed in the superior room with a king sized bed. It was on the ninth floor. The hotel rooms are a bit small but I expected that because it is new York. Their customer service was excellent. Everyone was very polite and helpful. It's a bit far from the major part of the city but I really liked the area. I had a really lovely stay at the Nylo hotel and would definitely go back and recommend it to a friend.

Stayed for four nights to explore NY and found this hotel clean and welcoming. Two subway stations within 5mins walk and 15 mins walk to Central Park . Good food store opposite hotel selling everything you could require. Stayed in rear room which although had no view was quiet which we liked.

This was a great hotel in a great location! Close to transit, great restaurants and bars and just a few blocks from Central Park! The staff was very nice, always available to answer questions. We would choose the NYLO again!

This was the best hotel in NYC that I have stayed in partly due to the location. I was not looking for any touristy events, so I enjoyed staying in an area that was a bit off the beaten path. It was quiet, clean, and had excellent staff!

Went here for my wedding night and it was excellent! The staff was very friendly and remembered me when I called the day before, so customer service was on point. Very quiet inside the hotel room without disturbances. Very clean. Definitely coming back again!Only thing missing was a mini fridge to keep our drinks and food cold.

We enjoyed our first stay at NYLO NYC and I hope to stay there again. It is super convenient if you want to be a little bit removed from the hustle and bustle of midtown and still be close to Central Park and museums, and by subway to the rest of the city. The express subway stop is located a 5 minute walk from the hotel. It was one stop to Times Square and the theater district. Lots of restaurant, diner, and coffee shop choices nearby. The hotel was clean; our room on the 12th floor was quiet. The room was well lit. Rooms are small, but this is NYC, and we weren't in the room much. There is a large room off the lobby with comfy chairs, desks, and computers, if you need a place to spread out and read, work, or eat a take-out meal. The hotel bar was busy and looked friendly.
user_name:
MMGH_13
Chevy Chase, Maryland, United States

review_body: I have stayed at the Nylo on several previous trips to New York City. It is very convenient to Columbia University where I have my business. This trip the hotel did not deliver. I was supposed to stay three nights but after the first day I was forced to check out early and move to the Regency. I came back from a long day around 5pm to discover my room was never cleaned, no towels, etc. It's really a problem when you need privacy and need to shower and get out to dinner.When calling the front desk, they were not helpful or apologetic at all. It blew me away. They said they would have the room cleaned but offered no apologies or explanations. After asking for the manager he was rude and insensitive. As I was highly agitated at this point, the manager did nothing more than to suggest that I can LEAVE the hotel. Given I had to be at a dinner in midtown, I couldn't leave and the manager threatened to have me escorted by security out of the hotel. I have NEVER ever been treated by a hotel employee like this before. He was totally rude and highly inappropriate. No apologies and no remorse over THEIR problem and THEIR lack of service to the room. I would avoid staying at the NYLO at all costs.

I stay here each time I visit my child that attends Columbia University. Great staff, great rooms, great price. Love this place! Have stayed at the JW Marriott Essex House and Ritz Carlton - this ranks right up there with them in terms of friendliness, cleanliness.

I recently stayed here with my 7-year old son, and was beyond impressed with the experience, especially given prices of hotels in NYC! The room was both comfortable and quiet, which I almost never experience when I stay in Manhattan for work, and on top of that it was clean! In addition, when I went down to the front desk to ask for clarification on a resort fee I thought I'd paid--which I hadn't--the kind gentleman at the front desk ended up giving me the offer as if I had. Truly good customer service is a rare thing these days, and given the price I would recommend NYLO New York City to anyone!.

Friendly Staff particularly house lady Ana. Comfortable, safe and convenient. Definitely will stay again when in New York next. Room was large with comfortable large beds and pleasant pillows. Front staff extremely and so were the concierge and doormen, will highly recommend to fellow travellers to NY

We've stayed several times now at the NYLO. The staff is always super-nice and helpful, and the bar/lounge is always a great place to relax and hang out. Also, we brought our dog, and he loved it too!

Just finished another great stay at the NYLO NYC, and once again it did not disappoint. The staff at this hotel is great--helpful and prompt, but in no way intrusive, and really friendly. The rooms are comfortable, the beds are great! We try to stay here whenever we come through NYC.
user_name:
Hillary D
Santa Fe, New Mexico

review_body: Large room and comfy queen beds in double Queen room though sofa bed was not very comfortable, needs new mattress. Appreciated the later checkout at 1pm, many thanks. Staff friendly and welcoming whenever we left or came back. Amazing location.

We would recommend the NYLO except for the constant errors in bookings, making repeat calls necessary, one agent contradicting another, resulting in double bookings. Arriving late at night, they had neglected to include the car accommodation originally requested, shortening our night's sleep.

I had a 12 dais in the hotel,for a ilness recovering but the lady of the front desk was ver y rude and to ok advantage and charge me more in a interior room totaly dark with any View and very small saying it was a superior room than the one i reserve becouse i extend my staying movimiento

The hotel is in a good spot for Central Park and getting around NY. We didn't really do anything there other than sleep but it was a lovely room, and the beds were really comfy, which was necessary after long days of sightseeing. Close to a subway station, and helpful staff

This is my go to hotel in NYC. Its located on the upper west side on 77th & Broadway and in a quiet great neighborhood. The hotel is charming and there is a Serrafina restaurant connected to the hotel that provides great Italian dishes but also a terrific breakfast menu. Highly recommend.
user_name:
Z7194GMchristianb
New York City, New York

review_body: Outstanding location. Nice size room for NY and well lit. A/C works well. Would have liked an area rug in the central portion in front of the bed. 4 PM official check-in would have been very inconvenient, but they were able to find us a room shortly after noon. First annoyance was the Keurig that didn't work. Second was trying to use the bath at 10 pm, and nobody at the front desk could find a stopper after looking for 30 min.

Just back from a wonderful holiday in New York. The Nylo hotel was great and extremely accommodating. Modern room with very comfortable King size bed. The staff were all brilliant. Easy access to downtown. Would love to revisit.

Great price, fun, funky,very comfy bed, would suggest the more expensive rooms as on a quieter floor.Lots of restaurants, great shops and easy to get into the touristy bit! Near the Lincoln centre, Central Park.

The location on the Upper West Side is really great! The neighborhood is very nice with underground, Central Park and a lot of good retaurants nearby. The rooms are quite spacious, also the bath. The staff is friendly. On the top floor there is terrace with a view of Hudson River (partly).Negativ: The "Green Houskeeping Policy" reduces houskeeping to an absolute minimum and is more a way to reduce costs. On arrival we were confronted with an absolutely unacceptable room, it was change only at the next day.

This was my first stay at this hotel and I will definitely be back. Location was perfect, room was very comfortable. The only thing I didn't like was that internet was not included and the price for it was way too expensive.

Wonderful location,close to subway, great neighbourhood. Hotel entrance is very dark, room is spare in furnishings, 'tech-y'. Bed comfortable, hard to regulate temperature so too cold in the room. Great price.

We asked for the trip to be made special as it was our honeymoon we hardly got acknowledged let alone anything special. We did manage to book a transfer to the airport late notice which was good. Rooms were clean but hotel was well away from anything of note.

Great hotel! Love the lobby, staff, and rooms. This was my fourth stay at the hotel just this year and will be going back again and again! Staff goes above and beyond to make your stay great. Bathrooms on standard rooms are a little small and not as nice as deluxe rooms but they're still ok.

I was very pleasantly surprised by the rooms at this property. They are decorated beautifully and large by NYC standards. I had a King Bed and still had room to walk around the bed comfortably. That says a lot for a hotel in NYC that is still affordable. I booked through Trivago and found the best rate. Great location if you like the UWS like I do. Close to subway stop, Fairway market and Central Park West.
user_name:
ReneeFlorida27
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel is very nice and is in a great location. It is one to which I return and I really like the rooms with terraces which offer great views and lots of light and space. The lobby is very accommodating as well.

The building next to hotel is being renovated. The construction crew worked through the night and I didn't sleep at all! I called the desk in the morning to complain and they offered no recourse. Also, the rooms were worn and the bathroom smelled of urine. Took me a day to recover from lack of sleep.

Boutique hotels in NYC are often not all they are cracked up to be but NYLO is exactly what I was looking for. Not a lot of frills but very modern, comfortable and in a fantastic location 2 blocks from subway and Central Park West. Very friendly staff. No fridge but MAJOR points for offering 2 free bottles of water, which most hotels are stingy about. The restaurant (Serafina) was surprisingly fantastic. Couldn't recommend more.

I loved this hotel. This was a perfect stay for visiting Barnard college and Columbia university. The Hotel room was very clean and modern. The hotel location was conveniently located close to the university and mid town. I would definitely stay here again!

Hotel Room was lovely and the bed was very comfortable, location was also very good. We were supposed to have internet included as we booked via Booking.com however when we arrived we were told this would cost $14 a day. On our last night I enquired into this and was told we could have Internet on our last night. We also had some issues with the air con but this was resolved swiftly. In our booking confirmation it also stated that we were to receive a welcome drink, when I raised this with the Internet issue I was told a drink will be delivered to our room but this never showed up. A mini bar/fridge in the room would be useful. Other than a few small issues our stay was great, staff were friendly and helpful. Will recommend staying here.

Rooms were clean and comfortable. The location was excellent for getting to my conference (at Columbia) as well as seeing sights around Manhattan. The hotel provides everything that you would expect for its reasonable price.

This was the final part of our honeymoon in NYC and although the room was somewhat comfortable, it wasn't 'honeymoon standard.' The room was dark, and there was no natural light thanks to the view of the inner hotel rooms and walls.

My room was on the second floor facing 75th. The firehouse is down the street so the trucks leaving during the night woke me up. There was also some noisy pump going on and off behind the wall which was annoying. Otherwise great hotel, friendly staff and good location.

Comfortable, very clean, friendly staff, great location!! This is our 3rd stay at NYLO and has never had a complaint. The room is larger than any other we have had in NYC, close to the subway and a lot of great restaurants. We will be back

NYLO is located a few blocks from a major subway line, and is in a wonderful neighborhood filled with shops and restaurants. The outdoor rooftop lounge is a quiet, wonderful setting to enjoy a glass of wine. This is our go-to place to stay on our annual trips to NYC.

This was a really great find here in the city! My father had a quick meeting here in NYC, and called me at the last minute about a room - normally when you have a last minute hotel booking in NY; you can expect to spend anywhere between $300-$400/night, or if you aren't willing to spend that amount, you are 'risking it' by ending up in some hotel 'with a lot of character' lolI really liked the design, simple and comfortable..... great for a few nights stay in the big city.
user_name:
steven r
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I've stayed at the NYLO many times when in the city for business and leisure. I'm from the Midwest and love the neighborhood, quiet boutique vibe. The staff is always friendly and the room is clean and comfortable.

Nice updated hotel and good location, but bathrooms were dirty with old soap, toothpaste and hair left in sinks, shelves and tub. Front desk understaffed and bell staff unavailable to help with baggage.

Ok but not great. My reservation got screwed up and it took three conversations with the folks at the front desk to fix. I didn't want asked room cleaning. There wasn't a "do not disturb" sign in the room. I called the front desk and they said they would take care of it. They didn't.

We stayed here last week for 7 nights. The hotel is very good and is in a fantastic location away from the craziness of Midtown. Our room was a good size for two adults (although the bathroom was quite small but manageable) - it was really clean. Our bed was incredibly comfortable - excellent linens etc. When we checked in the lady wasn't all that friendly when compared to the 4 other hotels we had stayed in across the USA however the service improved considerably throughout our stay - the guys on the front door were welcoming and helpful. Our room didn't have a mini fridge which we love when staying in hotels to keep drink cold etc. however we called reception and they are available on request at no extra charge. We had one in our room a few hours later. We love the Upper West Side and loved some of the local restaurants and bars especially those on Amsterdam Ave.

It was a perfect birthday weekend. The entire staff was outstanding and went out of their way to make it a special weekend. We loved the room and the location. Overall great hotel and I can't wait to stay again!

top notch customer service from the bellmen to the bartenders and would highly recommend staying here. Superb location, walking to restaurants, yoga, SoulCycle and Central Park. Room was modern industrial with super high ceiling, great lighting and our room even had a window in the bathroom. Very very nice lobby and bar area for a variety of functions, work, reading the paper hangin at the bar having a drink before dinner. We also had a refrigerator brought to the room for water and other perishables. Will most definitely stay again.
user_name:
JoyceB2486
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great hotel, nice situation in NYC, the bar in the lobby is a lovely place to hang out, too bad that the rooms are a litlle dark if you don't get the view on the street. Would recommend it to anyone interested in staying in the Upper West Side.

nice hotel in a great location. at breakfast you choose from 5 dishes as part of your stay, which feels limiting when you stay more than a couple of days. Like breakfast buffets - stay somewhere else.

I love NY, but the hustle bustle all the time not so much. That's where NYLO comes in upper west side, not so crazy, neighborhoody, ahhhMy only destination to close my eyes at nite in NYC!The staff is the best !

Where to start?! An amazing hotel with fantastic staff (in particular Matthew Schaefer) NYLO is extremely well designed with stylish decor throughout - from the moment we arrived we were made to feel very welcome.Matthew took care of myself & my Fiancé so well, (we were kindly upgraded to a fantastic room due to a special occasion) our stay was simply flawless.The location is excellent, we were able to walk to Central Park in a few minutes.Oh - and forget to try the cocktails in the bar, they're superb! Thank you again NYLO, we'll definitely be back - see you again soon!

A good friend had told us about NYLO and she was right. It's a great hotel on the Upper West Side. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, we loved spending time on the roof top as well as in the bar area. It's very close to our kids' apartment too. NYLO is our new go-to hotel for NYC visits.

The hotel is in the upper west side, very close to the subway so very convenient. The staff is ok, they are helpful but cold, and not very friendly. However we had to ask every day to receive body shower, because they don't bring it to your room, so this is very tiring.
user_name:
Lea M
Canton of Geneva, Switzerland

review_body: Our room was a bit small for a family. We were constantly having to sit on the bed to get out of each others way. The restaurants served food that was very good. Some noise from building work nearby often after 11 at night.
user_name:
Steven John B
South Wales, United Kingdom

review_body: Possibly the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in! The hotel is in a great location, away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square with great transport links with a subway station 2 blocks away. Amsterdam ave with its vast array of restaraunts was a stones throw away and Central Park a short 10 minute stroll. There are 2 fantastic bakery's across the road as well as 24hr pharmacy/grocery store. Rooms were clean and nicely decorated.The only gripes were the external Windows were dirty,shower worked well but took ages to heat up and there no free wifi in the rooms, this is only available in the lobby.

This is the first time I stayed in the upper west side and booked the long weekend at NYLO. My stay was mixed. On the positive side: the room was spacious, quiet, and decently furnished. The bed was comfortable. The location is pretty good and not too far from the subway station at Broadway and 79th. We did not have a drink at the bar, but it was happening. The negative side: Did not like the shower - it was a handheld only and the bar was too short; there was no bar - just a curtain, so water got everywhere; the water took forever to get warm and it never got hot. The floor in the room was kind of dirty. The iron leaked water. Overall it was not a terrible stay, but I will try another hotel next time to compare.

Service is very good. Rooms are very nice - way better than similarly priced alternatives in area. Bathrooms clean - but room a bit dark. Good location on upper West side - plenty of places to dine. Restaurant attached to hotel is good. Have stayed multiple times and still going back - and that really says it all.

Loved this hotel. Great location, very cool interiors. The only negative was: upon arrival, they informed me of a "mandatory" $25 fee for wifi and "complimentary" drink tickets. Fee and complimentary don't go together!! I did not need wifi and did not plan on drinking at bar.

We loved the NYLO, great hotel in a great location!! Clean, contemporary decor & lovely staff! I would highly recommend the NYLO for your stay in NYC. The restaurant next door served tasty food as did the Chinese next to that!

Booked 6 nights here for our belated honeymoon. We liked the look of the contemporary decor and we weren't disappointed. Hotel was lovely. Excellent location we could walk to Times Square but also close to subway as well. We ended up buying a week subway ticket to make sure we could get around a bit quicker and see everything we'd planned. Plenty of great places to eat nearby and cvs pharmacy opposite sells snacks and drinks. This is quite a residential area so there are plenty of food markets on Broadway too. Don't let you put you off though as the quieter location is a welcome rest from the intensity of Times Square and major tourist spots. Only a couple of blocks to Central Park which is great for an morning/evening walk.Hotel was great huge comfy bed and usb charging points at both sides. Safe, hairdryer and machine to make tea and coffee. We were on the 9th floor facing Broadway - quiet with a good view. Our room was right outside the lift but we're not disturbed at all. There wasn't any info in the room but a quick call to reception and we found out there was an ice machine on 12th floor (also vending machine with cold drinks). Big tv in the room which was good to catch the weather/morning news before venturing out. Air conditioning was good but quite loud to have on all the time. It was really hot while we were there but found auto mode adequate (it just coming on occasionally to maintain temp).Hotel staff were very helpful and stored our bags from check out until we left for our evenings flight. We had emailed the hotel who could have helped arrange transport from/to airport but we ended up booking the shared super shuttle from the airport. This was ok but next time we would book private super shuttle or even get the subway. Wifi connection very good and there were also some computers in the lobby although we didn't need to use them. Plenty of places to sit in the lounge (including table with chess set). Locl bar very nice and has a small menu - food from Serafina restaurant next door. Really enjoyed our stay and wouldn't hesitate to book again.

I stay a couple of times in this hotel. the cleanliness is not excellent but the overall experience still good. Personally I like the location and neighborhood the view in the morning and evening is unbelievable. Good restaurants are in walking distance.

I loved the vibe of the hotel, laid back chic, the staff were all amazing and helpful! Love the roll up doorsf acing 77th Ave in the bar andnhow openmit madenit feel the rooftop deckmwasmalso very cool wiangry great view.

This hotel is quaint, cozy, and just a little bit hipster. There are all types of folks staying there: Europeans, older couples, families, even some wedding parties. The bar and sitting area in the lobby are well appointed and comfortable. The bellmen are helpful but not overbearing. It is a hotel in which I will gladly stay again. The ice machine is on the 12th floor, and there are no mini-fridgs in the rooms, but the shower water pressure and temperature are always superior. I wish I owned the place.: )

Our stay at this hotel was amazing as it was a last minute thing as we got stranded in the city, it was relatively cheap for what we got and only booking an hour before arriving. The staff were very friendly to us when we arrived and that made us more comfortable in staying here. The facility was very clean and was well set out.
user_name:
Mike G
Pine Hill, New Jersey

review_body: At the time we checked in, we found out that the rooms hadn't been cleaned. We reported that and they promised will clean them in less than an hour. That was at 3pm, we went out for lunch and came back at 5pm , same situation. We spoke to the alleged manager Christina and she only said she was not aware of the situation and there was not much she can do, other than sending someone to clean the rooms. That was until 7pm!!! we were not able to rest before our broadway show. The lobby looks that has not been cleaned in a long time. They don't have waiters at the bar. Ther is no Mini-bar in the rooms and they do not provide drinking water. Definitely an OVERPRICED hotel.

Our first time to stay at NYLO, and we found it to be clean and comfortable with a friendly staff. Small but well -organized room, and a tiny but functional bathroom. Fair value for the price. Good location, with good restaurants nearby and less traffic than midtown.

The room was excellent. The bed was very comfortable, and the room was very clean. The soaps and shampoos were fine. The coffee provided was great. Everyone was very friendly. When we left and we realized my wife had forgotten a pair of earrings, they were waiting for her with the maid. We had a great stay at this hotel.

We stayed there as it is close the museums we were planning to visit. The Metropolitan, Jewism Museum, MOMA, and the Folk Art Musuem. The rooms were decorated with modern art reproductions and had an industrial chic feel. We took one of the suites, which was on the corner of the fourteenth floor. Spectactular views that would normally cost more than I could afford to shell out for a couple of nights. A great experience. Did not check out restaurants. Parking was expensive to me for this side of town. Fifty five a day. Room lacked a fridge and light bulbs were out on the fixture next to the bed. However this was quickly fixed as was the sofa made up for the second night. However, a great hotel would have had this set since I requested the sofa bed for a reason.

I stayed here for seven nights and loved it. The staff was friendly and helpful, excellent lounge, central location and quiet, comfortable rooms. I am considering staying here again on my next visit to NYC.

NYLO is in a great location, two blocks from the 79th St metro, two blocks from Central Park and is surrounded by good bars and restaurants. Its a trendy, 'hip' hotel with a decent bar, board games and chess in the lobby, and a nice little terrace on the 16th floor. Our room was spacious, enormously comfortable and faultlessly clean (it is worth noting though, there are noisy building works across 77th St so no lie ins!)However, our first impression of the hotel was an awful one thanks to the way we were greeted by the front desk and the fact I was reduced to tears before even checking in.When we arrived, we were told that we could not check in to the room (which we had already paid for) without them putting a holding payment on a credit card. We had not been forewarned about this but presented them with two cards to try, without complaint. They could not use these bank cards however, as our UK banks wouldn't let a overseas holding payment be processed at that time until we completed a standard security check - we could not do this as only checked in guests can access the hotel wifi. The staff member on the desk was rude and unreasonable about this and insisted that check-in was not at all possible for us.Seeing as we had paid for the room in full already, I thought this was ridiculous. How could we, as paying guests, be denied our own hotel room? I even offered two alternatives to the staff on the desk: I could pay a cash deposit or they could take my card details for later reference, once I'd had an opportunity to call my bank and confirm it was me making the payment. He declined both offers and again insisted that we could not be allowed to check-in.How was this resolved? The hotel backed down in the end and let us check-in to our room, but only when the staff member involved realised that a jetlagged, sobbing young woman in the lobby probably wasn't great for their image.This unpleasant experience left us with a thoroughly poor impression of NYLO - what's the point of even existing as a 4* hotel if you make your guests cry?

This hotel came highly recommended by our daughter, an NYC resident who had to stay here for a month when her apartment flooded and was under repair.We stayed 2 nights at the NYLO in a standard room, and my hubby, who is rarely impressed with a hotel, really enjoyed the ambiance of the property and the decor of the room. Booking online through TripAdvisor gave us a better rate than any other booking site. I am very picky about cleanliness, and this hotel was all around clean. I was comfortable in the room, which is an accomplishment for them! I even walked on the floor barefoot, which I almost never do in a hotel (yes, I'm a bit freaky about this).The bedding is all white, which allows them to clean/bleach the light-weight bedspread for each client, and that added to my comfort level.Because we were in town for a visit, we never made use of the outdoor rooftop lounge, or the restaurants/bar but the areas look very pleasant. There is a first floor lounge/library area that is suitable for a relaxing read, as well as a game of chess (provided) or another board/card game.The elevators are fast, the check-in staff were efficient and the bellmen were all extremely friendly and helpful (not typical for NYC service!).We were on the 77th Street side, and either the building under construction across the street, or the fire dept. across the street were doing some kind of work at about 3 AM both nights, which was rather noisy. Try to get a room that is not on the street side if possible.We will definitely stay here again if we need a hotel room in the city.

The hotel is charming and a bargain for NY. The location is easy to access and just a couple blocks from Central Park and the Natural History Museum. Staff was helpful and friendly. However, there is often a line to get assistance during afternoon/evening hours and morning check-out time. Our room was small but simple in decoration and very quiet. Would definitely stay there for my next NY visit.

My only disappointment: no room service available. The jr suite was large and very comfortable.The staff was welcoming as well as helpful since this was my first time staying in this neighborhood. I will definitely stay at the NYLO again.

10 nights at NYLO were great! Close to subway, food, Central Park and residential area.. Rooms were clean and spacious for 4 people. Felt very at home and safe! Little interaction with Staff but were friendly and accommodating when needed. Highly recommend this hotel for long stays.

Small, very quiet room facing Broadway, 7 floors up. We have stayed here quite a few times, both when it was On the Ave and NYLO. A/C system seems greatly improved from then -- much quieter. Good location, thanks to B'way subway, making it convenient to Columbia U. as well as downtown.

I usually stay on the east side but decided to stay on the west this time. Hotel was in a nice neighborhood. Very clean and classy. The front desk lady was was not too friendly but the rest were nice and the bell men are so much help.

Heard a lot about hotel but recently had the opportunity to stay for a few days. Funky, urban, but not snooty property with an industrial motif. Clean rooms, quiet, not large rooms but not tiny either. Was pleasantly surprised and would recommend to family and friends. Terrace on top floor nice place to relax at the end of the day. Staff could be friendlier but overall a good choice for the area.

Quiet neighborhood. Close to Central Park. Small hotel with nice views and comfortable rooms. I have stayed here several times and I will say that this: book one of the nicer rooms. They are worth the extra few dollars!

This hotel was a good hotel to stay in. A restaurant and bar close by and very close to subway trains. The rooms and bed were very comfortable and bathroom was nice. I would defiantly stay here again all the staff were friendly and help was there when you needed it. It's location next to central park was handy for walking and about a five minute walk to 77th or 72 street stations for catching trains downtown. All in all I really enjoyed new York and NYLO made it even better. If youre looking for somewhere to stay then stay here you won't regret it.

Stayed here for 5 nights. Great location short walk to Central Park and subway. Great market across the road and a cvs store opposite. Serafinas's is convenient for breakfast. Room basic but has everything you need. Pillows and bed very comfortable but the bed is a little high, especially if you are short like me! All in all a great hotel for a short stay

Great location, hip lobby and bar, but sub-par rooms. I would only recommend staying here if you received a discounted rate and it was a short visit. Nice staff but the quality of the bathroom in particular was questionable.
user_name:
Y1215ZQjenniferc
New York City, New York

review_body: We booked online the hotel, saw a room with great view, ended up next to a construction elevator shaft in front of a window and the other window gave on another brick wall. Very noisy from the construction starting at 7h am. However the rest of the experience was goos, nice bathroom, clean rooms, very good service. The hotel taxi is more expensive than the NYC taxi.

The hotel was clean, well designed and in a great location. However, we had two rooms on the 7th floor and both had climate control issues- after being gone all day my room was 75 degrees. I reset the temperature and it INCREASED overnight to 86 degrees! On top of that, upon returning from a conference a room door was left ajar despite no one being around. This is a huge security issue. When reported to the front desk, the response given was "that often happens with that room."

First of all, I love the location of this hotel on the Upper Westside. It is so convenient. This was my first stay at NYLO and it will not be my last. My room was quiet and the bed was extremely comfortable. I loved the decor and the pillows and towels were great. The staff is friendly and helpful. I also loved having Serafina right next door and RedFarm a few steps away;two wonderful meal options. You can also walk across the street to WestSide Market(open 24 hours ) and Zabar's is close by too. There are numerous other places to eat and grocery stores and delis close by. Excellent shopping too. Sephora is close and CVS is across the street which is convenient. The only negative was the Wifi was slow at times.The staff was friendly and helpful and the bar area with sofas and comfortable seating is very nice.Mille-Feuille Bakery is also across the street and their pastries are amazing and they make excellent cappuccinos,lattes and coffee.I enjoyed walking/running in Central Park in the morning. The park is a short walk from the hotel.Subway is close too. I highly recommend this hotel. I was there by myself for business but plan on returning with my husband for a weekend.
user_name:
lindakR2180EN
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: When we arrived, we were totally put off by the look of the place. You enter through a black entrance with a man who looks like a bouncer at the front door. The room was small and the furnishings were just hideous: dark, out-dated, and with art on the walls that looked like a first-year art student's work. But surprisingly, that small room won us over. It was clean and quiet with a very comfortable bed and good, hot shower. The staff was polite, accommodating and efficient. When we called the front desk to ask about a fridge, for example, they sent one right up, free of charge. I travel to NYC a couple of times a year and usually stay on the Upper West Side. NYLO will now be added to my list of good places to stay!

My daughter was having some issues in her apt in NY so to give her a break I treated her to at night at the NYLO NY. My husband and I had stayed there before and we liked that the hotel, which is in the middle of NYC but has this small boutiquey quaint vibe. We had excellent service in the past so we had no hesitation booking her there for a night. Unfortunately , there were some problems in her room that night . Ac didn't work, tv wasn't working and it took the staff a while to resolve the situation. They did eventually move her but it ruined her restful night at a hotel! When I called in the morning the manager had already been apprised of the situation and offered us money back. I explained that it wasn't about the money rather it was about wanting to give my daughter a relaxing night at a hotel. She asked me what we wanted and when I told her we wanted her to have that night without any hesitation she booked her into her same room for another night. Coming from the midwest I can say that we don't alway get midwest service in NYC . The NYLO was the exception. That is excellent customer service. We will definitely be staying at the NYLO again in the future.

Great weekend friendly staff small but clean rooms with comfortable beds Fabulous location near museum of natural history and most important Central Park When it rained played chess with my kids in lounge great family time

We had a great stay at NYLO! We would definitely come back! The rooms were a little small but expected in New York and our room was super comfortable and cozy. The staff was accommodating and very helpful!

Nice hotel, conveniently located. Subway just up the block. Room was clean, and when we were there it was quiet. Front desk staff was less than friendly upon arrival. Would definitely stay at this property again, nice having the restaurant, Serafina, downstairs.

Just come back from spending 5 night at NYLO and loved it. The beds were amazingly comfortable, the rooms were surprisingly large and the staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. I would definitely use this hotel chain again. The only down fall was that free wifi was available only on the roof terrace (which should have had a bar on it and it was a beautiful view) and the lobby. You could get 1 day of free wifi in your room but it wasn't worth the $14 a day.

The hotel is very cool and the room very spacious! There was plenty of room for a family of six in the Double Queen suite. We only stayed one night and did not spend time in the bar so I cannot comment on that. Very minor - two of the lamps at the head of the bed did not work because the switches were broken.

This is my third visit to this city but me and my family never get tired to see this place. In this case we were impressed with the new observatory in the 102th floor of the new freedom tower, is an obligation to see this marvelous attraction, since the elevator the experience is very special. The other main attractions still are a must....the Statue of Liberty and time square never loss their magic. Don't forget a pair of comfortable shoes because it's to much time to walk the arounds. Keep with you a bag full of water and any snack. And when you get hungry try one of the many Italian restaurants and enjoy a slice of pizza or a good calzone. If you get tired of walking try the subway is cheap. Or get an Uber is fast and also cheap. Don't miss the church's there are some very old and beautiful but Saint Patrick is the best. Also the central station and the library. I miss to visit the Brooklyn bridge and the Zoo...maybe our next trip. No doubt this is the capital of the word. Enjoy it.!!We stayed at the Marriott downtown very good and excellent location.

We keep coming back to the NYLO (went there when it was On the Avenue). Great location, nice staff, and the rooms, for New York, are large and comfortable. The bed and linens are good quality, and the hotel is in a terrific location, near subway lines, Central Park, museums and more

We had a wonderful first stay at NYLO. Hotel, staff, neighborhood, ease of travel all lent itself to an incredible trip. The 16th floor patio was the icing on the cake! I would highly recommend this hotel!

let people know of your green policies, have housekeeping store their carts out of guests view when not in use and improve valet services. the valet services were enough to make me look at other hotels for future trips.

I've stayed at a lot of NYC hotels in this price range, and NYLO certainly beats the rest of the pack. Do yourself a favor and call ahead of time to arrange any special requests (i.e. higher room, street facing). We were given the opportunity to pay an extra $30 for an upgrade if available, and I'm so glad we did. The staff was courteous and kind.

Since the moment we walked in, we got the impression that the hotel looked not very clean. After we checked in at 3 pm the assigned us our two rooms, which are not very impressive and one of them was not been cleaned. We reported that and they promised us to get it ready in less than 30 min. We went for lunch and made some time all of us in the other room. Obviously we were not able to rest as we had planned and at 6 pm the rom had not been serviced. This is not acceptable when the rates for that night were over 400 dlls. We needed to talk to 3 people in order to be able to real to the alleged manager Christina. She only apologized and said that there was not too much to do but wait to get the room cleaned. Which they finished at about 7 pm. Restaurant Serafina has also a very poor service. We had to ask several time fir our waiter (and the restaurant was not very busy).Bar has no waiters, so every time you need a drink you have to get uff your table and go to the bar. No minibar in the rooms. No drinking water provided. We regret so much giving a try to this hotel.

Stayed at NYLO 2x is 30 days to take son to/fro camp. The location was an ideal location for us because of close proximity to camp bus. We are not fans of the upper west side as there is little to do and good restaurants are scarce. However this hotel is in a good upper west side location ...... Super close to natural history museum, Central Park and Soul Cycle!!!!!!! Rooms and bathroom are small. Service is so-so. Disinterested concierge, cold showers, meh at front desk. Two days of cold showers and horrible construction beginning at 7am on weekday and 9am on weekend

I've been staying at Nylo for 3 weeks now and it has amazing accommodating stuff, clean room great sheets. It's quiet and stylish. Lobby is very cool also. The bell men and housekeepers are the nicest people the whole atmosphere here is just so warm and welcoming
user_name:
nataliakassin
New York City, New York

review_body: During a recent stay at the NYLO in NYC I had the unfortunate experience of being given a room that had a non-functioning A/C unit. Woke in the middle of the night to a room that was 80 degrees F. When I informed the front desk at check-out, no apology or offer was made to accommodate for the major inconvenience. I have unfortunately had a similar experience at another property, and my room was comped, and I received a free breakfast. First and last for me at the NYLO.

Excellent hotel with excellent staff.Everyone was very helpful and attentive, going out of their ay to ensure comfort and helpfulness.Reception team dealt brilliantly with everything and concierges were very helpful and always ahead of the needs.

One particular staff at the welcome counter, Ramona was very friendly and helpful, she provided us with a free room upgrade and also free wifi. The room was clean, there was a safe deposit box, bed was comfortable and the tv channels were aplenty. There was probably only one issue which was probably not the hotel in particular, it's probably more of a culture issue. The service staff were not truthful about services available, they will recommend service that will only benefit them. We asked a number of other hotels, before finding out the real information. In particular, information about the car service to the airport were steered towards company they work with and were overpriced, and then everything else, was not available. We managed to get a cab, with a flat fare to the airport at 2/3 the price of the service they recommended, including fare and toll. So, a word of advise, don't believe everything you hear from the staff at the first time, ask around more, at other hotels even if you don't stay there.

Away from hustle and bustle of midtown Clean, but a bit on expensive side, our room looked on to a brick wall and other window a construction elevator for new building next door, started at 7am every morning !! So forget sleeping in

We have now stayed here two times and both have been very pleasant. This time we were recipients of a complementary upgrade to a larger room and free wifi, but even when we had a regular King room, the space was more than adequate for a short stay. Everyone on staff was very helpful, and I received a rapid response when I inquired by email about parking availability. Since our daughter is now living in New York, it looks like this will be our first choice when visiting.

My brother recommended the Nylo hotel to me. He is a New Yorker who had to get out of his apartment for a couple of nights due to a flood. He liked it and recommended it to me. I was staying with him but had to leave because he had no air conditioning. Great hotel - location, restaurant, bar, computer room, all cool and very comfortable.

We arrived early and asked if we could just store our bags till check in time. They said since we were already there to wait and they would check and see if any rooms were available and we could go ahead and check in early. Not only was there a room available, they upgraded our room at no additional charge. Super friendly and efficient staff. Clean, comfortable, modern room. Neat lobby and bar area with a cool intimate vibe. Will definitely stay here next time we're in NY.

I stay at NYLO several times a year while visiting my favorite city. The staff is friendly, rooms are nice, and the neighborhood is home away from home! There's plenty of easy transportation to midtown with less of the hustle and bustle that comes with hotels there. This place is comfortable and quiet.

Exceptional staff and wonderful beds. Wish the terrace stayed open later and other than a hook on the back of the bathroom door there was no place to hang towels, wash cloths or hand towels. This is a 16 story hotel but only one floor has an ice machine, the 12th.

If you ignore the price tag, the hotel is two blocks away from the subway (local 1), a few blocks from Central Park and Museum of Natural History. It's 4-5 blocks from a regular sized supermarket, various restaurants and take-away cafes. The room has nice decor, the A/C was a little noisy if you leave the bathroom door open, but you can crank up the air during the day and push up the temp in the evening.Some staff seemed to be at the door all the time, and anyway, it felt like a safe neighborhoodI didn't have to pay for this stay, so I would stay at this hotel again if I didn't have to pay myself. : )I would go in the Fall or spring though, travelling by subway is all fine (we went to Rockefeller Center, Columbus circle, the Metropolitan Museum of Art across the park from subway then via 86 bus), but it was too hot to be underground or above ground, for that matter. :0

I would've given this hotel a 5 star rating but we were on the second floor and the carpet on the floor was dated and had a strong cigarette smell. Fortunately, the room did not smell of cigarettes but the shower curtain did have a musty smell. Otherwise, we were very satisfied with this hotel and it is in a very convenient west side location. The bed was very comfortable and there is a safe in the room.

We only stayed one night and I was very sad to leave!! The rooms were a little small, but everything else was amazing!! The location was perfect, close to Central Park and Subway! Most of all it was the best, most helpful, and EXTREMELY friendly customer service from ALL staff!! I would stay again just because the staff attitudes and service!!

nice place would recommend if you want somewhere in that area. Bar area and roof top terrace were very nice. Was very hot in the city when we were there, so we were very glad that the AC worked well in our room.

This is my 2nd stay with NYLO this summer. The special offers are very appealing! I have both times found the staff friendly and very accommodating to my needs. The beds are very comfortable. It is a great location and I plan on staying there again.

Nice hotel well located on the upper west side of Central Park and close to many good restaurants. We felt safe in the neighborhood and had no issues other than the cleaner being too diligent and accidentally discarding our bus tickets!

We stay here on every trip to NY. A short trip to see Barbra Streisand. There was some confusion on the upgrade I asked for but this was quickly straightened out by the front desk staff. On multiple trips to NYC and stays at the NYLO I have found that the front desk personnel are some of the best in any hotel I have stayed at. The room was spacious and the bed most comfortable. I was surprised that the shower was a combination shower and tub since all other rooms have been glassed in shower stalls. I suspect the shape of the bathroom would not allow that installation. All is all it was an excellent stay and I will be returning soon.

This was my 3rd stay since May 2016. Great ambience in the lobby - a small bar, nice soothing seating area.Responsive front desk. The rooms are great size for the price and for NYC. I l-o-v-e the king bed, hardwood floor (no carpet - yay!) and stainless steel sink and vanity (yay!).There is an attached restaurant open for breakfast, reasonable prices, nice wines and dinner entrees. A great option if you need to stay close to the hotel. There are a zillion bars and restaurants within a 10 minute walk. Housekeeping is polite, responsive and took the initiative to come for me on departure because I left my medicine bag in the room. She didn't have to do that.I'm very sensitive to my surroundings and to the location of a hotel. For me I can't recommend this highly consistent professional concern with the guest experience and comfort. I will be back in October. See you there!

The hotel staff was wonderful: very friendly, polite, helpful and efficient. The location is great too and the hotel had a nice ambience with a nice little library/lounge style room. Unfortunately the room we got was like shoebox with almost no room to move around, the furniture looked like building block boxes from an elementary school and we slept poorly because the door shut pretty hard in the hallway and people didn't care about it when coming or going late at night. The fact that the rooms were so small concentrated their doors in a smaller space that much more, making the 'audio' experience that much more vivid. If you are willing to take a sleep-aid, go for it and if you don't care about the tiny rooms, no problem. The staff is the best asset of that place.

Had a fantastic stay at the Nylo,loved the location ,lobby and bar .Room was great ,bed was fantastic.lots of nice places to eat nearby ,all main attractions are only a few subway stops away ....close to Central Park ...

Great place to stay. Stayed here before and will continue to on upcoming trips to New York. Great location- close to the train, shopping, restaurants, Lincoln Center, Museum of Natural History and Central Park. Great accommodations . excellent staff -very helpful and friendly.

Great neighborhood location with many restaurants and markets nearby. Convenient subway to all major attractions/ Would definitely stay on next visit. Very reasonably priced for NY. Concierge services were very helpful.

NYLO is situated close to the heart of NYC theatre district and Central Park yet away from the hustle and bustle of mid-town. Subway station, kids park and many restaurants close to hotel make this an interesting choice. Terrace rooms are amazing and spacious. The lounge and bar area are not impressive and shouldn't be a must on your criteria when choosing this hotel.We have stayed here many times in the last few years...one common observation during our visits at the hotel is that most front desk staff and operator (when they pick up phone) are not welcoming and customer oriented as many other hotels we have visited.The only element that can .

I loved the place. I enjoyed the neighborhood it was relaxing and much quieter than midtown. The staff was very friendly and we had fun in the bar. I used the seating areas for some quiet time reading. I took some nice walks in the morning and discovered some interesting spots close to the hotel.

I needed to escape my apartment filled with summer guests for some piece and quiet. The NYLO I have used to house guests visiting me many times but this time I wanted to be a guest. My check-in was timely and I was greeted by all staff with sincere smiles and a warm welcome for me and my emotional service animal. The room was as clean as a hotel room can possibly be and as a lifetime typically neurotic New Yorker that is a very high compliment. If you want to stay in Manhattan in a place which is peaceful, clean, with communal space and a nice bar area then I highly recommend the NYLO. Doesn't hurt to have Serafina right there as well.Sincerely Karen & my ESA Carson.
user_name:
ka732
New York City, New York

review_body: We stay at the NYLO whenever we visit our son at Columbia. It's the best hotel on the UWS. Conveniently located, clean, good vibe, nice amenities. The lounge area off the lobby is a relaxing environment.. There are computers for web surfing, printing, etc. Overall, we enjoy the hotel and highly recommend it.

The artworks in this hotel are copies of originals which is not what the PR says. I waited 2 hours on Sunday morning for the valet to bring my car. I asked for 3 room changes because the air conditioning was faulty. Not a fun weekend.

Very close to MOMA and Natural History. Everything else requires a subway trip, which has a close station. Not a great area for youngsters, but teenagers on up and especially adults will like the residential feel and area restaurants. Rooms are very small and high priced (just like all other NY hotels).

We recently spent two weeks at the discovery of NYC, and found NYLO location pretty convenient - closest subway just two blocks away.Rooms are really nice, modern and comfortable. Huge and soft bed for wonderful sleeps!We also enjoyed the "common spaces" at the lobby level and at 16th floor terrace.Only the cleanliness of the floors could be amelioraated.

The Nylo is a great hotel located on the Upper West Side. Very nice location- lots of restaurants and amenities nearby (market, drug store, laundry, shopping, close to subway- 10 min trip to Times Square, etc.). This was my second stay for business (one week each time). Service from all was courteous and professional. Room was very neat and nicely made up each day. Disappointed that there are no fridges in the rooms, but other than that it's a good hotel.

Great location! Very clean and friendly staff. I was really impressed with the quality of this boutique hotel. I booked at the last minute and got a great rate and had a wonderful sleep. A bonus was the air conditioning which had the room cool and welcoming on this 100 plus degree day.

The room was very nice, loved the bed, a little too soft for me but overall it was good. The housekeeper was absolutely AWESOME ! Great location, thought it could use a refrigerator in the room. Close to a lot of stores, and restaurants.

Did not sleep at all during my stay thanks to noisy garbage and fire trucks that were active right outside my window all night long. I had ear plugs and a white noise machine and it did nothing to drown out the sounds. They need to invest in sound proof windows or move the hotel.

Modern, quirky rooms. Needs bar fridge in room - drinks cant be kept cold especially in recent heat wave!. Very comfortable beds with soft, soft mattresses. Decor appropriate. Roadwork outside hotel was not appreciated.
user_name:
Miriam A
St Ives Nsw Sydney

review_body: Wonderful service, lovely room. Attentive staff, beautiful rooftop, nice lounge. Near so many of New York's top places to visit. Easy access to Subway. Will book again any time I am in New York! Thank you for a fabulous trip.

This is a superb location in upper Manhattan, just three blocks to Central Park and close to Metro. There were great restaurants all around and a well-stocked Westside Market right across the street. The rooms were well appointed with the most comfortable bed. The staff were very helpful and arranged a ride for me back to the airport when, sadly, I had to leave. I ventured all around NYC and definitely feel this is the best location for staying and as a launching point.

Room was dirty. Would have cancelled my stay if I didn't have work to do with Columbia University. The staff was courteous. The food at the Serfina was tasty. It would take a free night stay before I would ever recommend or stay at the NYLO.

Convenient location in Upper West Side especially for families. Central Park is a few blocks and Soul Cycle is next door. Lots of great shopping and restaurants within walking distance. Quieter part of town but still easy to get to all the action by subway or taxi or a good walk.

This is the second time I've stayed at NYLO and both events have been wonderful. The rooms are wonderful, the front desk is absolutely stellar and friendly. I was allowed to leave my luggage behind so I could take care of some business and personal matters and came back later to pick up, they couldn't have been nicer.

Great location. Staff was exceptionally helpful. We blocked rooms for a wedding. Everyone was completely satisfied. Room deck was a great gathering place. Restaurant on the premises made it easy for families with children. It was close to many attractions and restaurants. Rooms were clean, although a bit small but common for city hotels. We personally used a suite which worked out perfectly for dressing and wedding preparations. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

My group and I came back to The NYLO to stay for a workshop for 5 nights. Check in was very quick and smooth. The rooms were very spacious with comfortable beds and a whole sitting area. If you would like a mini fridge, it can be delivered for 25.00, but is very worth the added cost. The staff were all extremely helpful and welcoming. The downstairs bar and restaurants are also very good places to meet up with friends. The location can't be beat and is close to many NYC attractions.

After reading the reviews and choosing NYLO over other comparably priced hotels, I was underwhelmed after arriving. My initial greetings by the staff were practically nonexistent. There was a doorman who didn't open the door. Then we passed another worker who pointed out the front desk. Neither offered to assist with our bags. We stood at the front desk for 5 minutes before being acknowledged. The concierge was also not very helpful when we asked if there was an oyster bar near. In fact, there was a very good one within walking distance that has an amazing happy hour! The room was fairly standard. There were none of the extra amenities you'd expect in a 4 star hotel. It was clean and quiet. I wouldn't recommend this hotel. I didn't find it to be worth the money. I imagine other hotels in the price range have more to offer and better custom service.

My husband and stayed at the NYLO for 8 nights in late July. Great check in experience, room exactly as pictured. Modern and well organised room with very comfy bed and great AC. Walking distance to two subway stations was handy and lots of choices for food in the area. Definitely recommend the balcony rooms on the Hudson side, nice and quiet and gorgeous sunsets over the river. Overall wonderful experience, would recommend this hotel and would stay again anytime!

The room was extremely Noisy due to the construction on both sides of the building. The room decor was very IKEA -like. Great location. Be sure to check out Redbarn for Asian Fusion food around the corner and papa beards for exquisite cream puffs.

We had reserved four rooms for a special occasion. One room had a serious leak in the bathroom the last day of our stay. One desk agent responded " What do you want me to do about it? ". The manager offered up free drinks and an upgrade next visit. Since I stay often at this hotel, my daughter did not want to get into an argument w her, but they would have much preferred a comp. in my opinion, that should have been immediately offered up by the manager. I tried to speak w the manager about this myself and she was very abrupt, saying " Well, your daughter was happy w this solution, so what is the problem?! "The problem is..... What ever happened to the exceptional customer service NYLO used to have??????
user_name:
leah262
New York City, New York

review_body: I liked the location, which is away from Times Square. Broadway has some great local shops and some name brand stores in short walking distance, e.g. DSW. Also a 24 hour CVS right across the street. Staff was readily available but not overbearing. The water pressure in my shower was GREAT! It allowed me to take a quicker shower. I love the shampoo and soap scent, very nice. The K-cups in the room were not great. I would expect a better quality coffee for a hotel of this caliber. I liked the pull cord hanging lamps by the bed; ;those were unique. Also the small reading lamps attached to the bed. I enjoyed my stay and will consider returning on my next trip....whenever that is.

I just loved this boutique hotel. In addition to a darling room, the lobby, bar and lounge areas are lovely and very inviting. They had music on Thursday evening. It was great fun. Hotel staff are very friendly. Had a great time. Will definitely stay here again.

We wanted to stay in a quieter area of NYC, but still have easy access to the hustle and bustle. The NYLO was perfect! Nice area with just a very short walk to the subway. The hotel itself is nice too. Clean and practical, but rooms are pretty small and ours didn't have a refrigerator which was inconvenient. They do have lender umbrellas by the door which was nice since we forgot ours and it rained one of the days we were there. Overall, I'd say it's a good option for someone looking for a nice place to stay for a decent price. The parking garage across the street will give a discount for parking too of you have your ticket stamped by the hotel doorman. :-)

Everything was clean, modern and pleasant at a good rate. Took my family of three to NYC for a friends birthday party and we stayed here, easy access to the upper west side, plenty of parking, all around a good experience.

I stayed at the hotel 2 days it was perfect location clean good service anything u need it's there go to rooftop u will love it I'm planing to come next week with my friends will stay there again prices are reasonable for 4 star hotel

Perfect room, perfect bed, extremely clean and comfy. Quick access to Central Park, good quality food... Reception desk and front door need a little improvement. Wi-Fi was not included in the price which is a bit annoying. Breakfast was also not included but the price was reasonable and the food is good quality and presentation. Good experience.

I checked in early and got a room upgrade without even asking. The room was clean and fully functional. Great location. The sole downside is the minuscule gym. This is my fifth or sixth stay at the NYLO and I plan to return. Great value and overall guest experience!

No Frills hotel. Pretty good price, nice bar with live music. Location is solid near brunch heaven of UWS. Central Park is a few blocks away. Was able to get street parking east of Columbus regularly. And near the Museum of Natural History.The floors were cement, and finishes were modern. A couple of points off for no dedicated room service and mini fridge, but you could call Serafina for delivery which means I am guessing Seamless might be game as well for delivery. We got a fridge delivered to us for kid's milk and stored our booze there too.Ended up walking a little south of Duane Reade on Broadway to the liquor store for some booze.
user_name:
Kidkong
New York City, New York

review_body: Nice hotel to stay in. We just stayed for one night, but i wish to stay longer. In the middle of the centre of NYC, close to everything. Gym is open for 24 houtsoort. Very Nice bar and restaurant. Parking is just around the corner. Only one thing not positief os that the beds are too soft.

The NYLO- is our absolute favorite place to stay in NYC. The rooms are great, some more spacious than others but well appointed and clean. Service is friendly and attentive. You can't beat the location. Close to everything but not noisy. For those looking for a great city VIBE without the crowds this is the place. Make sure you have the ricotta pancakes for breakfast, worth every calorie!

the nylo is a boutique hotel with a lovely staff and small, but spotless rooms. many terrific resturants, diners and the best grocery store in town just steps away. you are surrounded by great shopping and central park is 3 blocks away.the bus is on the corner and a major subway stop is 1 and 1/2 blocks away. I highly recommend it.

The overall experience was very good. The cab service to go to the airport was excellent, and very easy.More storage in the bathroom will be practical and appreciated. The area is secure, with a lot of facilities around and the proximitie of the Park is very interesting.

NIce size room with king bed. Bathroom was spacious and very clean. Staff is professional and knowledgable. Love the location. Easy walk to subway. Lots of great places to eat within walking distance.

Nice place to stay, great location, staff extremely friendly. The bathroom is small but the rest of the room is very nice. Bar area is great and there is a small fitness center that comes in handy for a workout.
user_name:
Cindy C
Cleveland, Ohio, United States

review_body: Great area...upper west side is quiet compared to the midtown madness but plenty to do nearby..Central Park, Riverside Park, Lincoln Center, museums(Museum of Natural History, The Met, The Guggenheim, Carnegie House)great restaurants and bars..all within walking distance. Doesn't get any better than that!!!

Made fun for asking internet and breakfast for the rate the hotel gave me. The place is noisy acceptable, the room they gave was very small, couldn't even open the suitcase. Bathroom didn't have a steam blower.

Hotel was really funky. We enjoyed the large balcony off our room. The room itself was tiny but we were out and about most of the time. Service was great. There is a roof top bar as well as a bar in the lobby.

Was there for work. Nice and clean. I asked for a quiet room and mine was. Ac was a little loud but it worked well so I am not complaining. Bar was fun. They let my boss play the piano (he's quite good). Don't know anything about price since I didn't foot the bill.

Excellent hotel with very caring staff. We loved our 3 nights there and will return. The hotel has it all, a super location, great accommodations, a terrific friendly lobby and restaurant availability.

Location was great on the 77th and Broadway. Very Easy access to the neighborhoodRoom was cleanStaff was very helpful and patient and KnowledgeableConseige was helpful in location of local restaurants.

From the outside it looks just like all the rest but once you get inside it is much better. The free breakfast with the Texas shaped waffles among much more was delicious. Our housekeeper was amazing and extremely nice and helpful. Loved her. This hotel even let's you bring your dog which I will definitely do the next time. My son starts college next year at Tech so I will be staying at this hotel alot

We spent a week at the NYLO for a conference. It had it's highs and it's lows. It's between 2 very busy streets (Broadway and I think Amsterdam) so there is PLENTY of shopping and restaurants within walking distance. We even walked back on Broadway from the Lincoln Center at night--long walk--but doable for adults. Easy to catch a cab near front door. Highs? Nice beds, AMAZING high water pressure showers, good air conditioning, they store luggage, OK elevators, huge TV's, wifi, housekeeping good. The doormen staff work their tails off to help with luggage and cabs. Sure, tips are involved but they do an amazing job. Lows? Failed wake-up call (late for conference, ugh!), no laundry picked up as promised, ice machine was on 12th floor--not each floor. Overall, good.

Very glad to have discovered this hotel - a great place to stay if you need and/or want to be on the UWS. The place we usually stay when visiting family was booked, and gave this a try since it was the right price and the right location, and had good ratings on TA. Would definitely return, if the price remained competitive (summer is often less expensive than other seasons.) Small but tidy room, nice, roomy bathroom - is all you need. But there is a very pleasant lobby to hang out in with a bar that many travelers will find convenient.

NYLO is comfortable, with attractive rooms in a very good upper west side location. The decor is a bit hipper than your ordinary mid-priced hotel and the staff were all extremely friendly and helpful.

My husband and I visit NYC once a year and we always stay at NYLO (formerly On the Ave). And we have always had a great experience: awesome location in Upper West Side, gracious employees, modern rooms and nice amenities. Overall this hotel still gets my recommendation based on value and location, but I'm sad to say they appear to be making cost cutting measures that show. When we arrived on a Friday, there was no doorman to greet us or anyone to help with our luggage. We had to call twice for a refrigerator when our original request went unfulfilled. There was no literature in the room to explain the hotel amenities (which floor for ice/vending, info on the rooftop bar or hotel restaurant/room service). Calls to guest service were always graciously answered but having this info in the room would be helpful. Finally they are charging $14/day for in-room wifi. In the past we had been given a username and password at checkin but guest services refused to provide it on our recent stay. These small declines in the quality of their services are disappointing for long-time patrons like ourselves. Sadly, we may have to try another hotel in the Upper West for future visits.

Hello, I've stayed here twice. Having lived in the city before, I think the location is great. It's close to the park, theaters, food venues, and the subway. The staff is always kind and helpful. It's totally ideal if your'e going to be out all day, or even if you intend to stay-in.

Excellent location although check if construction outside has finished. Good family restaurant next door. Poor check in and check out service which is slow and needs improving. Good for brief NYC stopover.

Easy commuting with subway lines 1,2,3. Room and bathroom very clean, but little lack of decoration. Personnel excellent. Close to several restaurants and local supermarkets. Feeling of a secure area.

The hotel was a bit loud and parts of the rooms are not as renovated and they appear to be. The rooms are small -and if you just have a queen then you can barely move in them. Comfortable beds and great location though.

I had a great stay..Staff very friendly and helpful..rooms a bit on the smaller side , especially the bathroom, however very clean.Location is the key as subway station steps away from the hotel and all attraction a walking distance away.Will be back...

We were looking for a last minute hotel room in NYC and our usual was sold out. The NYLO was available and we are sure glad they were!. Our room, although a bit on the small side, was nicely appointed with clean, crisp and quality linens. The hotel is conveniently located on Broadway and 77th street with every amenity available at your footsteps. The hotel has a great vibe and a lively bar scene, the staff is friendly and accommodating, and the hotel feel safe and secure. Our family has found our new favorite NYC hotel. If you are looking for a great hotel that wont break the budget - look no further. This hotel is a great value and so much more.

Average to good hotel, very good location, good price, good restaurant, the style of the furniture was too modern for my standards, the personnel was nice and helpful. Does not have carpet on the room floor

PROS: FANTASTIC location. Minutes from subway stations, shops, and eateries on Upper West Side. Taxis readily available. Reasonable room rates for the area. Lobby presents urban shabby vibe. Front desk folks are professional and courteous. Bellmen are professional, attentive, and helpful. Room was clean and bright. That being said…CONS: Dark, narrow hallways. SMALL, minimalist room. Décor: IKEA meets edgy 8th grade locker room. Example: stainless steel counter/sink combo doesn’t have an apron, just a birch-like plank affixed to hang a towel. And: the toilet paper roll is suspended on a bent pipe end sticking out of the wall. Huh; that’s novel.If you’re looking for a functional place to crash on UWS after a long day exploring, and have no intention of spending any time in your room except to sleep and recharge your phone, I would recommend this place.

We went to NYC for my brother's wedding. Although we had worked in Manhattan for many years, we never stayed there. Found the NYLO via TripAdvisor and booked it. It was convenient to the upper west side and midtown. The staff was very outgoing, friendly and most helpful -- interacting with them was a pleasure. Took a deluxe king room. It was spacious, clean and comfortable. Didn't eat at their restaurant but had some drinks in the comfortable lobby bar. All in all -- great stay.

The superior room space was fine and the view wad great. It wad avery good placr to rest aftet meeting with family and walkinh in the city. This is my second time of stayinq at the NYLO and I will probsbly use it again on the future

Upon arrival, very late in the evening, a man blocks is from coming in instead of helping with luggage and greeting guests (us). The desk team barely looked at us when we checked in. The hallways were as dirty as the NYC sidewalks, littered with bits of trash, carpet stains and dirt. They also smelled of smoke and the unshowered. The room was ok but the bathroom ceiling was snowing with white bits of ?? Hitting the floor. Also we had to ask for towels as there were none in the room. It appeared to be a live-in hotel, too. We saw many with pets and didn't seem like guests. Very odd.

Our check in was not Plesant- and unfortunately the overall opinion starts there.Received no wifi info- once we got upstairs- 10th floor- one of the the keys did not work- once in the room- that was tiny- we called for another room- the answer was the room we stayed in before was a "free" upgrade. Not sure how he had this history but if he found it then he could have presented it in a more professional way- call for details!

There was towels on the floor when we came in. It was also very noisy, cleaning staff was talking loudly in the hallway, doors slamming and construction across the street was very disturbing. The front desk staff was very helpful though

I lived in NYC for 20 years, and now that I've moved out-of-state, the NYLO is my favorite place to stay when I need a "city fix." Great location on the Upper West Side close to museums, Central Park and the Hudson River, an eclectic mix of restaurants and (best of all) far away from the maddening crowds and tackiness of Times Square. Rooms are stylish, clean and comfortable and I've never had any noise issues. Yes, the most economical rooms are quite small, but it never bothered me and for a modest sum you can usually upgrade. Fun bar downstairs.

The nylo is a great location and staff will do anything to accommodate guests. Enjoyed our stays there immensely and will book again for this hotel. We travel to NY every other month or so and after many hotels have settled on the NYLO as our home away from home.

We got a discounted deal through a hotel email and really couldn't believe how great the hotel is for the price. The room was very large for New York standards, with plenty of storage space and a really comfy bed. Loved the hardwood floors and cool furniture in the room and all around the hotel. It's in a great neighborhood with lots of shopping and restaurants. We will definitely stay here again next time we're in NY.

The concierge desk was of no help. It seemed like they plucked someone brand new to the city and put them in the position. The front desk staff seemed annoyed they had customers. I will say that the doormen and the two different men that handled our luggage far exceeded expectations. They were always polite and never bothered by dealing with customers. From what we could tell the hotel didn't offer room service and the restaurant attached to the hotel is subpar. The location of the hotel is honestly the best part and makes it worth the stay. We loved our view of the Hudson River through the tall buildings surrounding the hotel. It's a short walk to Columbus Circle which has some of the best city shopping. Plus it's a short walk to Central Park. Take an Uber or taxi to any restaurant you want but don't miss out on the local restaurants near NYLO.

Rooms were big in size and the beds were super comfy. The property was clean and the staff were very friendly. I would have appreciated a mini fridge in the room tho. Otherwise, all in all a good stay.

Very beautiful. clean. extremely satisfying! loved it. the staff was nice. nice neighborhood. comfortable beds, pillows. very quiet. beautiful lights. design was very thoughtful. great job for a hotel

This was my first ever visit to New York and the Nylo was an excellent place to stay. The room was very well appointed, staff were friendly and helpful and the location was excellent. The coffee machine in my room was fabulous - thank you! I would have no hesitation in recommending the Nylo as a great place to stay.

Had to book NYLO due to a flight delay and was very pleased with the room. The staff was friendly and the rooms modern, comfortable, though a little spare.
