Our room on the 2nd floor picked up a lot of noise from the street--choose higher if possible. Great location near Natural History, Central Park, etc.

We stayed at NYLO for 4 nights. Had a wonderful stay. Loved the location. Close to Central Park, walk along Hudson River, subway to all the sights.Hotel was clean. Staff was attentive, friendly and responded promptly to all requests.Loved the piano music on Thursday night.Nice Italian restaurant right at hotel.Relaxing on roof top area.

Very up to date rooms, lounge and overall. Cocktails and appetizers downstairs were great. Staff was friendly and helpful. Bed was comfortable. Slept well! Car was brought around promptly. Only Negative was the construction across the street, hardly their fault. Thanks NYLO!

OK if you are going to the Beacon Theatre - not high end.... so should not have been that expensive.The rooms are tired and awkwardly done, but the beds were clean.Panoramic view balcony - not so panoramic - great view of the top of the roof though, can't see the street (Broadway) - so don't pay for it. Front desk is understaffed - same with the lobby bar. I liked the casualness of the lobby bar and there is a nice sitting room.

The room was not tiny but not large. The closet was a good size and I liked the toiletries. However, there was no dresser or fightable with drawers, but instead re-purposed gym lockers (the short kind) for storing belongings. The safe was at floor level so I could not get to it due to bad knees. The shower was good and there was a bathtub but there was mold around the caulking and no grab bar in the shower. I don't need the grab bar now but I could at some point.

No hot water for our brief stay requiring us to take cold showers. Front desk seemed neither surprised nor concerned when we reported it. Rooftop bar was a joke. It was overcrowded and there was no service.

Rooms are tiny, but I expected that. The lobby is dark and tries to be hip. But it's almost hard to see your way around. Access to local restaurant right from the lobby. Didn't eat there but it seemed busy. So many options for food nearby including Fairway Market, CItarella and Zabars. Service is helpful and friendly.

Ramona was excellent. She was very accommodating and such a pleasure to deal with. I needed help with my reservation and she went out of her way to help me. I travel a lot and don't always find this kind of service. You are lucky to have her.

Fantastic property on 77th street. Centrally located to Central Park, Museum of Natural History and just a few blocks from the express stop of the subway. Everyone has been extremely nice and more helpful than anywhere I've stayed in years. Bar in lobby is perfect for entertaining guests and many restaurant options all around the hotel. Mid week rates are very reasonable; don't be afraid to ask for an upgrade!

We stayed for 4 nights and found this hotel to be a gem. Wonderful friendly staff and efficient service at all times. Room was dark but we had requested a quiet room on the inside. It was comfortable and cool. The bar was fantastic and a great place to relax before exploring the upper west side. Great location in the middle of some wonderful attractions and restaurants. No hesitation in recommending the NYLO.

Hotel was centrally located but was dark, dingy and dirty. The room was small and there was issues with the towel service. One night they failed to replenish the towels and we had to call down 3 times before we got them. The next night there was only one towel between the two of us. Security and the doorman were helpful and pleasant but the front desk were not very friendly or apologetic when we complained about the towels.Overall not a very impressive hotel.

We loved our stay in New York at the NYLO New York City because of its location. The rooms were clean and nice and the staff were super friendly and helpful with everything. I would recommend the hotel to future visitors!

Stayed here for a baseball game at Citi Field. Rooms were clean and nice. Front desk service was horrible. It took me an hour an a half to even get into the room because my friend who had booked it didn't include my name, even though we had checked in earlier. My friend went out after the game, but I'm pregnant so I just wanted to go to bed. It was almost 1:30am before they let me up, and this was after speaking to three front desk attendants--the first of which rolled his eyes at me when I gave him my license but told him the room was under another name.

Scuffed walls, stained carpets, a drink coupon that expired thirty minutes after check-in, and a bouncer? Industrial chic meets brick-patterned wallpaper. For $250 a night... nope. On the bright side, there's a great bagel store a block away.

Nice modern hotel. Easy to access. Clean. Bed was fine. No fridge in room and ice on different floor. No control of AC in room. Staff was very friendly. Rooms were about standard for NYC. 14th through 16th floors have balcony access. No real view but fun and useful. Great location for Upper West side dining and the few bars open past midnight.

This is a lovely boutique hotel in a terrific location, good rates and friendly staff. It's upbeat and stylish while remaining relaxed. We were in the middle of moving so unfortunately couldn't take advantage of relaxing in the lobby much and enjoying the live music on Thursdays but we slept well and emerged refreshed each day. I love this location - it's my hub in the UWS for books, wine, food and entertainment (Lincoln center and cinemas)

Hotel is located in a fantastic area of NYC! Staff very friendly and gave excellent information on sites to see, restaurants, and subways travel. Service was prompt as in asking for additional towels. Facilities clean and updated. Serafina, (cafe attached to the hotel), delicious food and drinks. Enjoyed our stay, will recommend family and friends to stay at the NYLO New York City!
user_name:
Joanne L
Spring Lake, New Jersey

review_body: First, when I arrive in the room, some used towels was in the floor. Ac very difficult to adjust. We have the breakfast included. Seriously the restaurant they are so snob. When they see our voucher, they are not happy. Only few choices, If you ask to swap for something else good luck. Food taste ordinary, Maid service, very ok no extra. Only one bottle of water during our stay. No fridge in the room, bed was ok. I dont think I will go back. Not at this price. Very disappointed. Only good thing the balcony, but who stay in the room when they go to NYC.

Hotel was ok, booked it for location. Our queen/queen suite was not a suite, just a regular room, and had 2 double beds. Rooms were clean. Valet accidentally hit another car leaving marks on my bumper, and did apologize for it. Hotel bar is nice, not a fan of the restaurants.

Clean and modern rooms- "ikea minimalist decor" see web site photos, excellent location, trendy bar and comfortable public lobby areas. Helpful staff . Car service to airport highly recommended, clean new vehicle with safe driver.

All the staff were helpful and extremely pleasant. We were able to find where we were going and how best to accomplish our days. The room was kept clean each day with no problems. The doormen were especially personable and helpful. Would suggest NYLO to friends and family vacation traveled mid week 7/20-27

Worst hotel we've ever stayed at. First we got put in a handicap room that was vert filthy. Then our second room smelled like bleach and have nail clippings on the floor. Never going back there again.

Great stay at NYLO. Everyone connected with the hotel was very friendly and very helpful. We were very surprised at how large our room was, unique in NYC, but most welcome. The 16th floor balcony- open to anyone- is a beautiful respite at the end of the day with amazing views. The one negative- I was unaware of an additional charge for wifi service which is often included in the price in other hotels. Otherwise, I would definitely stay here again.

Would go back but the guy checking people in thought I stole my credit card I was mad. They aren't so friendly, the bellman was super nice but room was comfortable, the bathroom was very neat, bed comfortable

This is my new favourite New York hotel. We visit New York regularly and have always stayed down town. This time we were traveling with a family member and wanted to also try a different area. Having not spent much time on the Upper West Side we decide to give the NYLO a try. Pleased we did. It's not perfect, but what hotel is? But it does the important stuff well. And you feel like you are welcomed, not a necessary inconvenience. Rooms are good, funky, with very comfortable beds. Subway is close by and it's a few blocks to Central Park. Being a more residential area there are good markets nearby and some very good dinning options.NYLO, I'm coming back next time.

I love the NYLO! I've stayed at there a number of times and am always pleased with the service and cleanliness of the hotel. The location is absolutely wonderful - you can't beat the Upper West side, and right around the corner from Zabars.

This hotel is in a great, very safe location. 7-10 min walk to natural History museum and Central Park. Minutes away from subway, Trader Joe and some amazing restaurants! Hotel itself is just ok. Some check-in staff was rude, some simply indifferent ! We had an electrical issue with faulty bathroom light that took 2 days to get fixed! Would recommend ONLY because of location.

Perfect location for us, away from the hustle of downtown but close enough to everything. Nice hotel. Good value. Good service. Good food. Walls and doors were a bit thin and neighbours were loud. So was the AC unit - but not as loud as a jet aircraft but pretty close. Wasn't the BEST sleep but I guess it was the city that never sleeps. Maybe that's why? Because it's too noisy! lol

The room was big and beautiful and unique and worth having to wait for until after 4pm. The staff could have been a bit friendlier, but were helpful. Very comfortable beds and great location. The lobby is a little too dark, but the music was wonderful.

This hotel has it all....except service. No one, and I mean no one, wants to be helpful. We pulled up in our car, started unloading all of our stuff and the two guys at the door just watched us....never even offering help or opening the door. We came in about 10pm for a night cap and the waitress told us she was "going on break and we'd have to get our own drinks"! Wth? Why don't you get our drinks and then go on your break? The location and hotel room itself is very nice.... Service needs a huge improvement for me to come back!

Overall I really enjoyed this hotel. Location is fantastic right between two subway stops and not too far away from central park, and after a few days in midtown it was great to be up on the upper west side. Many restaurants, bars, delis, and fashion stores nearby but still maintaining a more local feel than the more touristic areas. The general look of the hotel is very sophisticated and funky. This wears well in the main areas but the rooms are starting to be a little worn. That said it was a comfortable size, clean bathroom, and amazingly comfortable and huge bed! When you visit NYC I think your expectations of room size are quite low but it was much more spacious than I expected. There is a bar downstairs and a library area with two computers and a printer, not very well known (even by the staff member I asked!) there is a public rooftop area, it's more of a balcony though, not overly busy and I found it a nice place to have breakfast and overlook the west side. Unfortunately the staff come across as very flat and deflated and generally melancholy which is a bit of a downer when you are on holidays. You will struggle to get into your room prior to the 4pm check out time as it seems they struggle to turn over the rooms in time, however they will be knocking on your door right on check out time hoping to rush you along. The housekeeping lady was very polite though when I told her I was just scrambling to finish my packing and would be out in a couple of minutes. I tried asking concierge about an airport transfer and she was super disinterested. All that aside I'd be happy to stay there again, if the staff were a little more engaged it would have been an amazing stay.

We loved our stay at NYLO! When the front desk clerk found out that we just got married she went out of her way to give us free upgrades which were much appreciated! But even without the upgrades we loved this hotel and will be back next year!

This hotel is a great value for the price. The bartender was great and the room was clean and well furnished. My only complaint was the friendliness of the front desk staff when we checked in. Everything else was perfect!

Hotel was nice, great location. My room was small, but nice. Everyone I came in contact with were very friendly and helpful. I look forward to staying there again when my daughter moves to New York for school

I've stayed at this hotel before. I particularly like the location. The common areas are looking a bit worn and the housekeeping could be better. The front door (bellman, valet) were very friendly and helpful.

good location, but poor staff service and poor surroudings. the street outside was so noisy that we cannot sleep at midnight and morning. When we ask the front desk for help, they told us the only thing we can do are waiting. waiting to change a room in the afternoon.

I stayed at NYLO last weekend two nights. The staff from the front desk to the doorman were extremely professional. I had a late checkin and there were no complications. They parked my car for me and retrieved when ready. It did cost alittle money but since we walked or took train everywhere else, it was worth it. CVS right across the street is convenient. I LOVED how the staff always opened the door for me and my family when we entered and exited the hotel. Makes you feel welcomed and special. Price was great! Away from the hustle and madness of the city but close to best restaurants and stores. Def will come back!

I recently spent one night at NYLO. The pros they have a very nice and busy lobby/llounge area. The room was very clean but the service was awful!!! asked for something 3 times from housekeeping finally went down to get it myself. Also asked for a shower cap and they said that they ran out. Our room, though a nice size faces and ally and was so dark that we always needed the lights on at all times. The worst part was that our room was at the side of the hotel that backs up to construction of a building and we could hear banging starting at 7:00 AM

It is so loud in the rooms, from people coming in and out of their rooms you hear everything! So hard to sleep, even with a sound machine! No sound proofing whatsoever.The hallways are so loud, just from people walking in and out and going to and from their room, so hard to have peace and relax, and impossible for us to sleep.

We loved our stay at NYLO New York! We were there to cheer on our sister in the NYC Triathlon nearby and NYLO was very accommodating to our needs of check-in and check-out times. The room was wonderful and the staff was fantastic. I would definitely stay there again.

The people were wonderful and accommodating - this was our 2nd stay here and we will definitely be back! Great location, great amenities close by and very friendly staff, there are king size beds which is rare for a city hotel!

We enjoyed our weekend stay. The staff is very helpful and go out of their way to make sure everything is great! Location is very good. We are looking forward to returning to this hotel. Wonderful experience.

Had a wonderful time at the NYLO hotel. We were there as volunteers at NYC Triathlon and needed to be at Boat Basin Cafe on 78th Street at 4:30 am, so location was key. Hotel was within walking distance to Central Park and Columbus Circle, plenty of diners and shopping within a very short distance. Would stay here again in future!

If you need a place to stay on the upper west side, and hotels are really scarce there, then you may consider NYLO. If you book at the right time, prices can definitely be reasonable. But look out because at least online, I've seen the same room at $600 and &275. Th place is pretty awful top to bottom. They've been renovating for what seems like years, but the rooms are still, at least for me, poorly designed and aesthetically displeasing. It's this new boutique flavor I like to cal "jail cell chic." Everything is metal, cold.. The layout in the rooms I've been in can go from annoying to absurd - in this last one the bathroom was so small that I had to close the door in order to use the toilet or the shower. And that was in the room which on their website is priced just below a suite.Those complaints aside, the customer service is dismal. Nobody seems like they like their job..or people in general. I got there super late after a cross-country flight wanting only to take a shower and get to bed. The bad surprise was that my room had no hot water or a shower drain that worked. I called the front desk, and without an apology or an offer to move me, they said no engineers would be there till morning. So much for a shower. The next day someone did come to fix it, did something and left. Hot water appeared after 10 minutes of continuous running and the drain still didn't work. I took a hostel shower (washcloths over the sink) and got to work, seething. Upon checkout I told them how unsatisfied I was. Again, no apology just a generic business card and a promise that they would adjust the rate by some unspecified amount. That hasn't happened as of yet.Needless to say, as nice is would be to be at a hotel close to where I was working, I'll never go back.

Friendly staff, dark funky large lobby with hang out spaces. There were loads of folks at the bar and in the lounge. Casual, not scene-y. The room is interesting and i felt like I was walking around someone's design project. Great neighborhood. Clean clean clean!!

Trendy and fun boutique hotel. Really enjoyed the atmosphere and the location was perfect. Was upset at first as we were given an adjoining room with strangers (door was obviously locked) but we could hear everything going on next door. When we complained they changed us to another room without a problem.

We spent great days in NYC and the excellent location of NYLO helped a lot! In the heart of Upper West Side, close to commerce and two subways stations. For instance, nearby you find pharmacy, a little market, coffee shops, two great cosmetic stores and more. And within a residential area, which made a ruge different in our trip - to be among newyorkers, not only tourists, as us! The style of the lobby is very beautiful, a kind of techo industrial thing full of personality. They have concierge and service reasonable. No luxury at all, only the basic. About the accommodations. Ours was one of the biggest of the entire hotel, so lucky!! It was stylish, but not so beautifully as the lobby, of course. We had many furniture to set our stuff. The beds were very soft (more than I like, in fact). The bathroom had no appropriate furniture and no hooks to hang clothes and towels. Definitely they should invest on it!The restaurant is very good, but I truly don't recommend you to buy the breakfast in advance. Because usually the hotel sells one specific kind of meal and it's almost impossible to eat something different from this rigid menu. Only eggs (you gotta pay extra to add cheese...), or ricotta lemon candied pancakes (fantastic!) or salmon. Everything is delicious, but if you are planning to stay more than four, five days, it's boring. Unless you don't mind eating the same food most part of the days, that's okay. But if you can afford ( cause it's more expensive), buy the meals each day!

This is a very centrally located hotel. Rooms are spacious and bed is really comfortable. Only problem with the bed is that they are a bit high for short people. There is ample closet and draw space. They also have cubicles under the drawers to store items. They will give you a fridge if you request it. The only bad thing I could say about this room si that there are not enough electrical outlets. Have to unplug different items to use the outlets. They provide bottled water when you check in but do not replenish it. The rooms have a safe and a coffee maker.There is a desk in the room but there is no outlet near it. The bathrooms are nice and spacious and shower is strong. Towels are also soft and good quality. They give you amenities but no cotton or q-tips. My sister did not like that they only had plastic cups in the bathroom. There are plenty of space in the bathroom in the shelves to put your items and thought this was a great feature. Lobby of the hotel is nice and they have a table and computers and a printer to use. There is also an outdoor balcony with tables and couches for relaxing on the 16th floor. Hotel staff were very helpful. The neighborhood is chockful of restaurants and shops. Also there are two yoga studies on the blog and a gym next store
user_name:
Judithh12
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Service and location were excellent, close to everything. We were happy with the size of the room but not the mattress or A/C. Please let guests know of no or partial views before booking. Overall a good value.

Really Beautiful beautiful facilities (clean, well-run, AMAZING Location!) Stayed there after my wedding and my bride was extremely happy with this gorgeous property! We highly recommend it to all visiting NYC!

The best thing about this hotel is the location. Equidistant between Riverside and Central Parks. Great diners and restaurants just outside. The room I had was an upgrade and was a decent size. Communal areas downstairs are nice. Lifts are slow, no room service and felt like a good three star or lower four star. To be honest, over priced for what you get. The location is however fantastic and because I needed to be near upper Manhattan it suited my requirements for this trip.

Excellent location to visit central park and numerous museums. The hotel has great amenities and the view from the 16th floor lounge is great. The staff was friendly and helpful. I can recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city.
user_name:
dstrou_370288
New York City, New York

review_body: The room was comfortable and a good size by Manhattan standard. Great neighbourhood.Hotel staff very friendly and approachable.I wished it offered daily complimentary water – the least it could do for the price point.

The hotel is nice, has a beatiful lobby and a bar in a very stylish design next to reception, but that's all. No more than that. Accommodation is not surprising, and the bathroom, although spacious, it feels it needs to finish building. The furniture beside the sink is tiny and ridiculous. There's no hooks to hang the towels and the clothes. The breakfast in the Serafina restaurant is very limited, specially if you include the breakfast in your daily. Get out of this option! The best in this hotel is the great location. You feel a real new yorker.

My husband and I recently spent several nights at this hotel. Our room was quite big for a big city, was clean, and had a very comfortable bed and attractive furniture. The shower worked well, and the bathroom had adequate space.

NYLO is a good 3 stars hotel. You have to be lu ky to be assigned a good room at check in. Some rooms are spacious, silent and clean. Some are very noisy, not properly clean and dark. The neighborhood is great. Many good restaurants around and not in the middle of the crazyness of Times Square.

Stayed for 1 week. Family of 4 in 2 Double Bedded room. Pretty good size especially for NYC. Very clean, good quality fittings and finishing. Bar downstairs and roof top deck with views.Would have had 5 stars if the reception staff had managed a smile in the week we spent there. However all the door guys, house keeping and bar staff are very friendly. The attached restaurant (serafina) also suffers from miserable staff. I highly recommend Red farm 2 doors away. Great food, service, and friendly efficient staff.

Our stay at NYLO New York was very nice. Our room was spacious with two queen beds, sitting area and desk. The beds were quite comfortable and the room was very quiet even though we were close to the elevator. The staff was so kind and helpful which is probably what I appreciated most. We had never been to NY before and wanted to give our teenage sons an experience in the Big Apple. You helped make it a positive and memorable family vacation.

Excelent location and atmosphere , looby very pleasant, near good restaurants , upper west side is marvelous . The only problem is not to have free wifi in room. Nowadays, free wifi in room is totally necessary.

Beautiful and clean hardwood floors. Feather-free bedding throughout. The mattresses are not encased, however, for protection against dust mites, and they have pillowtops which are very soft, so not for someone who needs a firm mattress. Rooms can be made fragrance free upon request, but the hotel does use air fresheners in the hallway, unfortunately.

I've been staying at this hotel regularly for many years. It's a good hotel in a generally quiet neighborhood. Beats the Times Square area hands down. Convenient to subway. Wide variety of rooms. Ask for a street view.

A lovely hotel - nice room, good bar. Staff at the desk was less than friendly. And significantly, for a business trip and the need to shower quickly, the water pressure in the shower was negligible, and it took 12 minutes for the hot water to cycle in.

Room and hotel was great! Beds were very comfortable and the room was spacious. Would recommend this hotel. Only negative was the car service they booked for us was significantly more than the hotel advised.

Really nice hotel, modern and spacious rooms, love the location in the UWS. Has a great bar and great restaurant in the first floor (Serafina). Have stayed there 3 times already and coming back in a couple of months. Highly recommended if you are not interested in staying close to the crowded touristic sites.

Very nice place to stay. Very convenient to shops and activities nearby. Hotel room was impressively clean. We always check under the beds and was glad to see that it was dusted. Like the fact that there is no carpet in the rooms. Comfortable stay. Will probably stay here again in the future.

This hotel is located in Upper West Manhattan! It is a beautiful location and a short subway ride to Time's Square! It has 2 wonderful restaurant's also. It is a quaint hotel! I would stay there again! Nice to be out of downtown in the evening for a good nights rest!

This is a great hotel & well located for the upper westside of NYC. It was conveniently located to my son, which made my visit great. The hotel was well appointed. The room was decorated in a modern style & the bed was extremely comfortable! The bathroom was also well appointed. All in all, I'd stay their again

Near every thing like subway and restaurants. But no late night room service since serafina was close. Cool.waiting area. But limited wifi. Dark hangout place.. cool for grouos and couples but not for kids. but rooms are small. No.microwave and refrigerator fornguest staying longer. Ice machine all.the way upstairs. And too small.

Great hotel in an amazing upper west side neighborhood, close to central park and multiple subway stops. Our room was a terrace room with our own seating area over looking the city,the beds were so comfortable I didn't want to get up,the hotel lobby was great and the doormen were very professional. I can't wait to stay here again..... LOVED this hotel!!!!

I have stayed on this hotel many times. It used t be called On The Ave. It was redecorated and changed to NYLO a few years ago. It was modern and classy. Now is cluttered with a smaller reception area and not as friendly.After you make reservation, you are getting email about upgrades, leaving you with an uncomfortable feeling that for $300 at night you are getting a low end room. The reception was unfriendly, not welcoming, no eye contact, no enjoy your stay, no info about the hotel or internet service or facilities. I will be looking for a new hotel.

We came to New York to shop for my daughter's wedding dress. When I made the reservations, I asked the desk to give us a nice, superior room with a view. They said they would put it in the notes on our reservation. When we arrived, we were given a room facing a brick wall in the center of the NYLO. I went right back down to the front desk and the rude person at the front desk gave us another room "with a view" facing 77th street and charged us an additional per night fee. When we went to that room, it was shocking. The room WAS facing 77th street but because of construction going on, there was a large wooden structure built outside the window surrounded by a three foot wooden wall blocking any view of the street. On this wooden structure right outside our window, we saw garbage and an old discarded christmas tree (it was now July) lying on the structure. When we called down to the front desk and told them there was NO view and we were paying extra for this room, the front desk insisted that we were facing 77th street. We invited them up to look at what we were seeing outside the window, the gentleman said, "I will tour the rooms when my boss TELLS me to tour the rooms." We went back down to the front desk and asked for the manager who FINALLY gave us a room with a view (even though the original person said there were no rooms available). just a side note, we also had to call housekeeping because we had no shampoo in our room. Not a great visit at this hotel. We used to stay here all the time when this hotel was called On the Avenue but it seems to have gone downhill since becoming the Nylo. They need to work on their customer service!

This hotel has a warm, inviting atmosphere in the lobby and a popular lounge. Tasteful decor and comfortable seating in the bar/lounge make it a nice destination spot.We booked a double-queen room with a couch, which was spacious, comfortable for our family of 4, and absolutely QUIET. It was an off-street room on the 4th floor. No view out the windows except the wall of the next building 12 feet away, but at least they were in the process of painting the building wall a sunny color, and there was some natural light.Quietest room I've had in NYC. We slept until 10:00AM in almost absolute quiet. No outside noise, no plumbing noise, absolute minimal HVAC noise, it was wonderful! The fact that it was 4th of July weekend may have had something to do with the quiet, as NYC's perpetual construction/maintenance may have been on pause for the weekend.Off-street rooms probably aren't good for claustrophobes, btw. And although construction and/or painting next door may have been an excuse, the windows were filthy. The windows could probably use some sheer drapes to let light in and block some of the ugly. Don't recall if they had them. Room furnishings go back maybe 10 years to On The Ave in the 00s, but the beds are comfortable and bathrooms are nice. I get the impression this hotel was at least partly furnished from hotel furnishing secondhand auctions, as you'll find some odd pieces in the room.
user_name:
Mike B
Nevada City, United States

review_body: This is our second stay at the NYLO and it did not disappoint. The upper west side location is ideal. The rooftop terrace was a great find. The rooms are spacious and clean. We look forward to our return in October.

Such a great hotel! The atmosphere is chic and inviting. Check in was a breeze and I like the faceless room keys. All the staff were accommodating and professional. The room was beautifully designed, eclectic and functional. I definitely will recommend this hotel to friends and I will revisit. Thanks for a great stay.

Stayed here for one week. Very good location, good restaurant. Nice atmosphere, local shops around, cosy lounge. Friendly porters, staff at desk could be friendlier. It's a hassle to extend your reservation. The maid Mercedes is super, she is very friendly and makes you feel at home. Nylo: honor her!

My sister and I took this vacation and stayed for 8 nights. The beds were beyond comfortable. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Noise was probably typical NY city life, but took some getting used to. The location was un-beatable. Close to subway, Central Park, restaurants, CVS, starbucks. Quieter than downtown, yet close enough to go to and from.

This was my first time staying here, but I'll definitely stay at NYLO again. Nice hotel, convenient Upper West side location and the staff was great. Decent sized room and really large bathroom for NYC.

Perfect location near subway and Central Park, and neighborhood has everything without being too touristic. Hotel is very hip and not large, cold and anonymous like many of the big chain hotels. We will definitely stay again.

The Hotel itself is very nice, but I would advise checking what type of room you are getting - the one we had was very small, had a small window that looked into the internal parts of the building, no fridge, and the coffee and team making facilities no great. Cloth hanging space was very limited, and there is no where you can put your clothes so you have to live out of your suitcase.

It was a great location for people like me who do not like the hustle and bustle of Times Square. I was next to the museums, Central Park, walked to the movies, stores, great. I would study again, recommend

Hip. Fun. Great location. Bad is cool. Nice areas to hang in lobby. Good service. Will stay again. Rooms a bit small but most in New York city are. Really enjoyed my stay. Lots of good stuff withing walking distance.

The room was okay, the air-conditioning made so much noise. But the main problem was when my card did not work. The reception refused an entry without a card ( inspite of offering to pay them by cash ). Fortunately I had a colleague whose offered to pay for me using his card.

Very well located, staff always with good advice. Nice rooms and comfortable. Lovely rooftop on the 16th floor. Only 5 minutes by foot to Central park, Hudson river and two subway stations. CVs pharmacy opposite to the hotel, PureYoga nextdoor neighbour, lots of restaurants in the area

Request room on upper floors or facing the street if you want a cell phone signal. We booked a suite, but still looked out to brick walls. They charge for WiFi. Minus these issues, we would definitely stay again. Great location.

Great location, great value, and pleasant staff for the most part. Concierge service needs to be improved. Very interesting group of visitors, from all over.Most of the staff is very courteous and friendly.

I was originally booked into the Lucerne but a booking snafu sent me scrambling for another hotel. With the help of Travelocity, I was rebooked into the NYLO. When I showed up, the Travelocity booking had not shown up in their system. Unlike the Lucerne, where the staff was unconcerned with resolving my situation, the NYLO staff could not have been nicer. They gave me free drinks at their lovely lobby bar while I waited and were clearly doing everything possible to get me into my room. The room itself, once I got in, was very comfortable, but it is the helpful attitude of the staff that set the hotel apart.

The first night, 2 double beds room, way too small, just a path around the beds... The next 4 nights in a 2 queen size beds suite... was sweet, lots of room, great sitting room, 2nd tv... So close to Central Park, subway, restaurants, markets, everything...

Great location very near Broadway on upper west side. It's 5 short blocks from the 72nd St. express subway to Times Square (one stop) and three blocks south of the amazing Zabars cafeteria and grocery. The hotel has a hip, loft vibe and though the rooms are a bit minimalist (locker cabinets instead of dressers) the bed is comfortable. There is an inviting lounge area on the 16th floor roof deck... a nice place to relax with a bottle of wine. Construction is going on across the street from 7:30 am until 4 pm.

Loved the lobby ambiance. Kid friendly with board games, chess, lots of interesting books in the lobby area. Would recommend your stay. Good prices for a NY hotel. Very friendly staff. Great restaurants walking distance near good movie theaters.

Great lobby and spacious rooms. The lobby is a fun place to hang out with comfy chairs and tables. The bar is right there and makes a good martini. Enjoyed the upper west side neighborhood and central location.
user_name:
Jodi O
Niwot, Colorado, United States

review_body: The hotel was really Good in all aspects. It is located in a centric location near Natural History museum and Central Park. The room was clean and cozy. It meet our expectations. We went with my six year old son and found activities for him nearby every day of our stay. When I return to NY will stay again in NYLO.

We spent two weeks in New York area and split our time between 3 locations. From the hotel description this seemed like a perfect location to really experience the Upper West side area and it was. Having booked 5 nights we were dissapointed with our first room allocated as there was noisy work going on at an adjacent building. We advised reception who did not hesitate relocating us to a higher floor facing Broadway. Its always reassuring when a 'complaint' is accepted without fuss and acted on in a kind and efficient manner. The hotel has a cool and lively reception/bar lounge area taking up the ground floor which is very attractive. In addition, not wishing to sound cheap. they have a great happy hour every day from 4 until 7. This means the bar is lively and you can relax and have great priced drinks which on a vacation is a real added bonus. Great hotel.

A good hotel close to transport, central park and great food stores, This was my fourth visit to the hotel and all stays have been long - 8 day plus. The room allocated was small and on a lower floor so I asked to be moved. I was moved higher but it was the same sized room, very small. Seems there are no rewards for loyalty at this hotel.

I scored an upgrade to a junior suite which consisted on a living room two beds and two tvs. The NYLO has minimalist, industrial style furnishings - very modern and 'chic'. The standard rooms are quite small (but typical of NYC). I appreciate that they leave bottled water in the rooms and that my room was very quiet. The hotel bar is small but has a great atmosphere and they also have a lounge in the lobby where you can sit and work or people watch from their high table or the comfy couches. I found the service to be quite good, staff were pleasant, efficient and I was in and out very quickly. Also the restaurant Serafina is attached which is a great place for dinner. Ask for a discount coupon (10%) for the restaurant when you check-in. Absolutely fantastic location for anyone wanting to be based on the Upper West Side.

The employees were kind, friendly, patient, understanding and helpful with us. We loved our hotel room because of the space and the view. The food at the restaurant was fantastic, especially the weekend brunch menu.

We loved the location and was perfect for our family of 4! Lots of playgrounds, family friendly restaurants, Central Park and The Museum of Natural History near by. Plus, easy public transportation. We will be back again!

Great location! Bathroom was a bit small/cramped, and we could use one or two additional hangers for towels, but hey:it's Manhattan, New York!... On the other hand, the bed was extremely comfortable...

Wonderful hotel, great value for four friends travelling together. Huge room! Brilliant location. Will definitely stay again if I visit NYC again. Only downside was the terrible shower with uncontrollable heating.. Otherwise faultless!

NYLO is a fancy Hotel and best located between Hudson River and Central Park. You are in the middle of everywhere without having the feeling to stay at typical Tourist spot. For NYC it offers good value for money.

We were very happy with our stay - expected small room in NYC, had spacious queen queen suite including plenty of floor space, huge shower, pullout couch and a couple chairs. Very comfortable. Great location, found easy on street (free) parking, great breakfast in the restaurant & evening drinks in the lobby bar.

Tasha welcomed us at the front desk and eased any concerns I had about trying a new hotel brand. Even though we were 4 hours early, she was able to give us our room upon arrival. This was better than simply storing our luggage. The lounge area was very welcoming. The location was a bit away from the hub of the city, but offered a quiet evening walk. Additionally, the location made it easy for us to make a quick and very easy exit out of town. I would recommend this hotel for those who love to walk and those who want to be near Central Park.

This was a great hotel with cool décor. We got a free upgrade on our room. The room was stylish and comfy. Staff was very helpful with information about the city and how to get around. This is a great place to stay in Manhattan. There were lots of stores and restaurants in the area. It was also a short walk to Central Pak.

This is a gem in the upper west side. Nice size rooms, very nice bathrooms, clean and modern. One quibble - the hallway needed a little vaccuuming. Also the front deak check-in guy was way snootier than he had reason to be. But the room was a great value for the money and I will definitely stay there again.

Great hotel! Make sure if you pay for a higher room - you remember to ask what the room view is like :) we paid extra to be on a high floor and wound up facing a brick wall.The staff was stellar and the hotel super clean. Can't wait to go back.

I had a great stay at the NYLO. The hotel is well located close to Central Park and Lincoln Center. The stuff was friendly and very helpful. The view from my room was terrivble, but it didn't bother me because of the nice curtains and interior. You get what you pay for.

Lovely, spacious and clean rooms in a good, safe location. Easy access to museums and excellent restaurants. Walking distance to Central Park and Riverside Park. Many conveniences such as wi-fi and coffee maker in room.

I love everything about NYLO: location, staff, bed, toiletries, sheets and coffee maker. The hotel is very close to Central Park, to the Natural Musum History and walking distance from Loncoln Center.

Cleanliness a problem in our first room assignment. Immediately changed to a proper room. Quiet for sleeping. Loved the outdoor deck to lounge. Wished we had one more chair in our space. Will request that next visit.

This hotel was perfect for our family. We had a huge room and the staff were so friendly and helpful. The location was great, close to the park and many great restaurants. We will definitely stay there again.

Loved the NYLO. Great location with lots of wonderful places to eat and shop nearby. Only a couple of blocks from subway, Natural History Museum and Central Park. The rooms are small but very comfortable.

The service was great, the room was really really good. I stayed for one week and sometimes they couldn't change my towels or my bed sheets or they couldn't clean the floor from my bathroom. But that do not bother me to much. the room was either way so nice beautiful. The hotel was near to my business; it has everything around the corner that helped me a lot. The persons were so kind and helpfull.

I cannot recommend NYLO highly enough. My partner and I have stayed in many hotels in NYC over the past decade and NYLO was by far the best. Although we asked for a room overlooking the street (rather than the inner courtyard) we were tired and dismayed on arrival to be given a small dark room overlooking the courtyard. As we were staying 14 nights we asked the person at the front desk if anything could be done. She immediately allocated us another room and we were moved the same day. The new room was wonderful, bigger and lighter, and overlooked Broadway. Nothing was too much trouble for the (without exception) pleasant and friendly staff. Checking out was as easy as possible. Storing our luggage was no problem and a cab was called for us. There is a nice bar downstairs, and a lovely space on the roof (no bar), for chilling out. We ate at Serafina once and had a nice (though expensive) experience. The food is lovely. NYLO is brilliantly situated on the Upper West Side, a stone's throw from the Hudson River, and close to 72nd and 79th subway stations, as well as the cross-town buses on 72nd and 79th street.There are cheaper places to eat which are good, such as Chipotle Mexican Grill up on Broadway and 80th. If visiting, don't forget Happy Hour in NYLO bar starts from 3pm! We will definitely be staying here again, on next visit to NYC.

I was here on business and the room was (finally) large enough for comfort and I was given the option of a street facing window which was a nice luxury (for a NY hotel). Everything was clean and accommodating. I wish there were a small fridge for leftovers but that's not high on the list of hotel needs.

Unique boutique hotel unlike chains. Bed very comfortable. Nice room. A few blocks from subway. Inexpensive so was great value for sure! Front desk people not friendly at all but the bell/door men were. Highly recommend if not looking to spend a ton on a room!

The rooms were very clean. Appreciated the complimentary bottles of water in the room. Air conditioning worked very well....had a thermostat in the room instead of the loud hotel box air conditioning units that you find in several hotels. Located in a good area on the Upper West Side.

Great hotel and staff but no fridge and microwave which was a problem. A little too pricy for the location (similar hotels are cheaper).I would stay here again if I was in the city for a short time.It's pretty close to many attractions but awat from the hustle and bustle of midtown. Also, they need room service!
consLocation is a bit too far northSlow internetTV service can be temperamental Room very smallShower in the bath not separateDoor of room did no close properlyRather expensive for what one gets

$50 US per day held for incidentals, so budget for this. Dollars are released post check out. Information given at check in is very light on. Great facilities. Comfortable bed. Excellent television. Room clean.

Check-in staff were extremely bored; not at all cheerful. Did not apologize for making me start the very slow check-in process at one computer, with one agent, then after he fiddled for a while, I had to stand at the other station for someone else to check me in. Liked the cool room decor, though, and the location is great. But why no free wifi? This is 2016.

I loved our stay in this beautifully decorated hotel! The entrance is beautifully arranged, all employees are always super friendly and the restaurant (that we did not get the change to try) looked very cosy and seemed to have delicious food. For me, that would be five stars but the rooms itself are not quite up to date and neither is the shower, which did not always have hot, or even warm, water. All in all I would stay there again though! It seems pretty far off from everything, but you can walk up and down Upper West Side easily and cabs get there extremely quickly.

Loved our stay!! Very nice sized room, industrial streamlined decor. Outside noise was pretty much drowned out by keeping the fan set to on. Lobby is a great little bar surrounded by a variety of chairs, sofas, and end tables. Rooftop deck mostly looks out to other buildings but there is a view of sunset over water - a nice place to gang outside with a drink or a book. Lots of bang for your buck here.

Services: friendly reception Room: Pleasant room, well illuminited, very comfortable bed!Neighborhood: good supermarkets and delicatessen, interesting shops and a very good Chinese restaurant, Red Farm, within the Hotel building.Wifi: not consumer friendly and costs $14 a day!

By far the best place to stay on Upper West Side.Nice staff, great rooms, beds are incredible and so is the a/c. Great bar as well. Have stayed at Hotel several times and have never been disappointed.

Nylo was central to where we wanted to go, good restaurants near by cabs always there. Beautiful trendy, clean rooms. Accommodating our late departure and early arrival! Staff very friendly. All in all. Great place

Hotel was in a great location on upper west side, close to subway and bus stops. Although we walked almost everywhere. Lots of good places to eat close by. Hotel was clean and tidy with nice comfy beds.

The room deco is nice and clean. Love the bathroom as well, except lack of a small table next to the vanity sink to put my stuff and tooth brushes/cups. The location is excellent. Easy to goto any places, by walk or subway.

We booked at short notice after a poor Airbnb experience and we were delighted with NYLO. Great location, very nice facilities, quiet room and helpful staff. Our stay rounded off a very enjoyable week in NYC.

We have always had excellent experiences in the past at NYLO. In spite of paying well in advance with a non-refundable rate, we had a very small room, without even a chair to sit on. Perhaps from the room AC the sheets felt "damp/soggy"--something that usually only happens when camping. The hotel staff continues to be welcoming (hotel was fully booked so our room problem couldn't be addressed). If not for these two items would have given 4 or 5 stars, as in the past.

I've been to New York City on average 3-4 times per year over the past 15 years & this is the only hotel I've returned to. There are so many positives about the NYLO, it's difficult to know where to start. The staff is friendly & helpful, the rooms are clean & comfortable - in fact, the bed is so comfy, you don't want to get out of it! The bathroom is a great size with good lighting. It's situated in a neighborhood on the Upper West Side, so the people in the area are actually people who live there, not a bunch of tourists. It's a quick walk to the Museum of Natural History & Central Park. You have access to great shopping & restaurants on the same block. This was my third visit to the NYLO, & it I'll definitely be back :-)

We had two nights in NYC for our anniversary and NYLO ended up being a perfect location. We like being able to walk and discover neighborhood restaurants, and we were able to do that here. There are plenty of choices heading out in any direction. Handy to Central Park, too, where we spent most of one day. As many have noted, the rooms have been refurbished and we enjoyed the sleek decor. The sound proofing wasn't all there, though -- we could hear too much in the room next door. We found the front desk staff to be helpful. We ended up taking the recommended private car vs. a taxi to the airport and were told the fee included everything including tip, but when we got to the airport the driver said the tip was "optional'' even after we said what the hotel staff had told us. Awkward. That said, we would easily stay at NYLO again -- rooms are large enough and comfy, the location can't be beat, and the price (for NYC) is affordable.

thoroughly enjoyed staying at this hotel. The staff was friendly and efficient. The close proximity to central park and Amsterdam street made it really easy to move around by foot, plus it was minutes from the subway too.

Since we were visiting family on the upper west side it was a perfect location. a few blocks from Central Park and The Museum of Natural History. It is on Broadway, and the Beacon Theater is nearby. French Cafe for breakfast, Zabars a few blocks away, Shake Shack a block away, I would definitely return to this property.

Despite the noise from the construction work next to the hotel, it was an awesome stay at the NYLO Hotel. Very good service. Staff very kind. The room was big enough for 4. It was great experience. I highly recommend this hotel.

Very please with NYLO; great location for NY experience; the service was great and efficient; staff was very friendly and helpful; our room was very clean; overall an outstanding experience; Serafina has great food and I would recommend the restaurant

This was my first trip to NYC, and though I was overwhelmed with all the options out there, I’m glad I chose NYLO.This hotel is super clean! And not to be overstated was the bed. It is really comfortable! Linens and towels were of high quality, too.The people are amazing! My favorite NYLO employee is Gregory who met us at the door. He was SO helpful and kindhearted. But everyone I met was super friendly!The hotel is pretty reasonably priced. I found the best quotes using their app. The app beat NYLO’s website price- not by much- but it did.Location! NYLO is two blocks from the subway and near a myriad of restaurants. You’re within walking distance of Central Park, the Natural History Museum, and the Met. I felt like the hotel was super quiet on our floor. I never heard my neighbors. I was on the 7th floor and had a quiet stay without any trouble.When I completed my reservations, I took advantage of the “internet package”, however, I never received internet service, except when in the lobby where it’s free for everyone. I have a feeling this is due to my company’s payment being put on hold. Plus, even if I’d had internet service, the information from the hotel states that service is only available for one device. I had also asked for a mini-fridge when I booked, but that didn’t happen. However, I happened to pass someone in the elevator, delivering a mini-fridge to someone else & he was happy to deliver one to my room. Keep in mind if your company is paying for part or all of your hotel stay with a check, your company’s check has to be received 2-3 weeks before you arrive. Things were worked out via credit card and the manager upgraded the room for the confusion, which was really great. What’s a bit confusing is the hotel doesn’t have any information in the rooms about the hotel itself. What floor is the patio on? Where’s the ice machine? What’s on the roof? How the heck are you supposed to know that unless there is some brochure in the room? Overall, I LOVED NYLO and would definitely stay there again! I highly recommended it amongst other hotels in the same price range.

This was such an awesome hotel. Clean, great service, balconies!! The room was small but it is NY. The bed was heavenly, slept like a rock. Bathroom, all marble with a removable shower head, and CLEAN!! Nice hot shower. ! Loved the private balcony. Valet service was quick. We had dinner downstairs at Serafina and it was perfect. Great boutique style hotel, highly recommend! (Bring your wallet)

Nylo hotel centrally located for seminars I have attended in the Lincoln Square area [72nd - 65th Streets] Rooms are urban chic with no carpets which is an important health issue for me. Beds are very comfortable. Restaurant, Serafina, has good food with gracious service. Front desk and bag service are efficient, knowledgeable and gracious. I have stayed here three times. Only surprise was the rate. Higher than in the past. I recommend this hotel but the higher rates may be a deterrent for future stays.

I have stayed at NYLO 4 times now and for a wonderful hotel experience NYLO can't be beat! Don't miss it!!!!! The restaurants on site are so good and so reasonable! The entertainment in the lounge is so fun and since I came to New York to visit my family they joined me in the lounge and also on the outside balcony. That was so much fun and we saw the most amazing thunderstorm while sitting on couches all bundled up with a glass of wine! Thank you NYLO

We have looked many years for a well-located and reasonably-priced hotel on the Upper West Side. NYLO is it. The hotel has very recently been refurbished and the rooms are ably furnished and sound proofing is tops!

The best in the area!!! Super attentive staff, nice and flexible. The room is clean and confy, I will go back to NYLO as soon as I can. Those guys supported me all the time (fun fact: including provided me a corkscrew for I can open a bottle of wine, which I bought at the liquor store next to them).NYLO NY is the best option for that area - No Doubts.

Our room was supposed to be a Superior King and although the bed was lovely and large the room was small with a tiny single window that was so dirty you hardly got any light in. There was one chair in the room for two people although this was rectified when we asked for another chair and we also to asked for a refrigerator and this was supplied too too.The hotel bar is nice although the wine choice is not good.It does have a lovely outdoor terrace on the 16th floor which was nice.Building work is also going on adjacent to the hotel so lots of dust.Felt it was a bit overpriced for what was on offer although the location is great on the upper west side. room was also very clean

Location was very nice. The desk staff was too busy for us, ask us to step aside and then helped people who came after us - both check in and check out had difficulties. Refused to address the issue of the non-working coffee machine. The bed was too fluffy with no support. There was very little soundproofing so we heard EVERYTHING from our neighbors and in the hall. Poor quality workmanship in rooms but it was clean. Door so warped we could see hall light out the crack. Very small room but that would have been fine if everything else would have been nice. Bell staff was helpful and friendly. View from top floor lounge was beautiful.

Superbly located with easy access to the subway system and a very short walk from Central Park.Helpful and accommodating staff. Very pleasant decor. Good quality bedding and excellent shower. Quiet.This will certainly be my first choice of hotel in NYC from now on.
user_location: Weston on the Green, United Kingdom
user_name:
JCCMOxford
Weston on the Green, United Kingdom

review_body: Location, location, location + clean!NYLO NYC is located on the Upper West Side just a few blocks from Central Park and the American Museum of Natural History. NYLO is very easy to reach as there are two subway stations close by -- one on 72nd (the 1,2 and 3 lines) and another one on 79th street (the 1 line). The basic rooms are modern but small. However, this probably applies to most NYC hotels. Most importantly, NYLO NYC is clean!One minor downside is that you have to pay for the in-room Wifi. (I think it was around 18 dollars a day which is pretty much equal to stealing -- NYLO, you gotta change this and make the in-room Wifi free.) On the positive side, there are two guest PCs available in the lobby and free Wifi.There are lots of restaurants, grocery stores and small shops in the area. West Side Market on Broadway close to the hotel is highly recommended (although the cashiers might be a bit grumpy at times). Also, walk a few blocks to 83rd and Broadway and have a breakfast or lunch at Artie's Deli (check their website). There's also a 24-hour CVS (pharmacy/supermarket) just across the street from the hotel, so you can easily get some light snacks to eat in your room.Finally, I didn't really need the concierge or any help from the staff. However, everyone seemed nice and friendly enough, and for instance check in was fast and effortless. I actually arrived an hour before the check in time (which is at 4 pm) but got a room immediately. Also, whenever I emailed the hotel before my trip, I always got a quick reply.In short: NYLO NYC is highly recommended.

This is our second time here in as many summers. We loved it last time. While everyone is still very nice (except for one bartender), it does not seem to be well run. A lot of hassle to deal with the front desk. The in room Keurig coffee is terrible. They have a coffee machine at the bar, but it isn't staffed in the mornings when I wanted to sit in the lobby area and work. The rooms are tiny and expensive. I am ok with that in NYC if it's a great experience, but NYLO seems to be relying on the fact that there aren't too many good options on the upper west side and we need them more than they need us.
user_name:
Jim M
Nashua, NH, United States

review_body: As We had been looking for a nice, local neighborhood with no noice but good connections, this hotel was perfect! Near to Riverside Park and Central Park where We went jogging, good Café' s and restaurants along the streets, good atmosphere.

I had a great stay. The location is out of the way and the high floors have a view of the Hudson River. The staff was very respectful and helpful. The only ding I'd say is that there's not many amenities in the room but the bed was super comfortable and in NYC, what else do you need?

Great location. Good service. Rooms are clean but very small. Modern decor. Have had varied experience here. This visit we had room facing cement wall. No natural light from window. Construction noise beginning at 7 am. If you stay and can afford it, get a top floor room with small patio. Much nicer experience.

I highly recommend this wonderful unique Hotel in NY. EVERYTHING IS PERFECT , from the location, to the service, the room and the staff. Rooms are clean and brilliant. The view from the terasse is overwhelming

NYLO is my new favorite NYC hotel. Great location, walking distance to lots of stuff, great restaurants, shopping, jogging... all within minutes of the hotel Nice comfortable quiet rooms. Efficient hotel staff.

NYLO is a convenient comfortable hotel - close to subway stations, Central Park, delis, museums, etc. Great location. Safe area. Good size room with nice décor. Highly recommended. Hotel's staff is friendly and helpful. I would stay here again. Rooms are efficient and clean.

Great location just blocks away from Central Park. I was here on business and only stayed for a night. The bar downstairs had great service and let me set up my laptop and work. The room was SO cute, the bed was comfortable, and I even enjoyed the bathtub. The interior of the hotel is so unique and trendy. I definitely enjoyed my stay!

What a great location with easy access to 2 subway stops (72 and 79).Enjoyed the walk to Central Park. Neighborhood feel and always felt safe. Small eateries, drug stores and restaurants very close by. Staff was always helpful and pleasant. Enjoy the outdoor terrace on the 16th floor.

If you are looking for a good location away from the main City Centre but with easy access to the main attractions then the NYLO in the Upper West End offers a good option. Its approximately a 10 minute walk to Central Park and the Natural History Museum. It also about a 20 minute journey via the subway to the main downtown attractions using the No1 train from the 79th station. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance with quality and prices typical for the USA. The best value for money and quality that we found was at T'he Cottage Chinese Restaurant' which is a 1 min walk away.Overall like most hotels in New York that are classified in this star range, it is quite expensive per night for what is on offer and for the amount of time that you actually spend in the room. However the rooms are clean and basic, beds comfortable, it has a good bar with a laid back attitude and with prices similar to the local restaurants and bar/pub prices and the breakfast is good in the connecting restaurant. The gym is basic but adequate. Wifi is free in the lobby but comes at a cost if wishing to use in the rooms; however we got free wifi as a goodwill gesture. Overall customer Service is good for the States & the concierge was particularly helpful throughout our stay. It is possible to arrange for a shuttle to collect you for the return journey to the main airports for around $23 per person which is worth it. Much better than taking the subway and train and taxi costs were estimated at approx $70 plus to JKF.

The NYLO was amazing! The hotel room was comfortable, modern, and clean. The bar was fun and relaxing. The neighborhood was ideal. It was close to the park, transportation, food, and it felt very safe , day and night. We loved our trip.

I stayed in a king-sized panoramic room with a balcony and a view of the Hudson River. NYLO is located in an excellent upper west side location. . . .convenient to all amenities of the city. This is the 4th or 5th time that I've stayed at NYLO, and my experience is always excellent. I particularly enjoy the West Side Market which is located across the street. The housekeeping department is very responsive to my requests to extras. The outdoor patio located on the 16th floor is great for evening cocktails. . . .very unusual to find a NYC hotel.

This upper West side property is a gem. I've stayed here multiple times and always had a great experience. From the easy check in to check out ,it is a simple and uncomplicated process. The rooms are spacious ,unique and comfy - the staff are friendly,efficient and low impact. I book it for the value and location , but the quality is much better than any of the full service hotels I've stayed in , in the past . If you are looking for an Upper West side base in NY - this is your best value !

Excellent experience! Very clean. Friendly & helpful staff. Comfy & sizable room. Great location. Easy access to #1 subway. Away from hustle & bustle of Times Square, but only about five minutes away. I would definitely recommend to others and stay here again.

Near the subway and central park. The rooms are big for NY and the two tween bens rooms are excelent for 4 propõe.Near Zabars, nice coffee shops and restaurants.There is a library and a bar in the lobby.

We stayed at NYLO due to location and proximity to the Beacon. Great place. Rooms were spacious and the amenities were fantastic. Staff was friendly and helpful to non-New York customers. Expect the usual valet delay.

My daughter and I had tickets to a concert at the Beacon and decided to stay at this hotel. The staff was friendly, the hotel was very cool, and best part was only a few blocks away from the concert. Would definitely stay here again!

We booked an Internet package many months before our stay. By the time we got there, I had forgotten that our stay included internet. Of course, the person checking us in(unsmiling and very unwelcoming, I must add) did not remind us of this and as a result we had no internet during the first 3 days of our 5 day stay. On the 4th day, I needed to check something about our room rate so I pulled up the email. This is when I saw that we had an Internet package. We called reception and spoke to someone called Joanna about this who apologised and immediately offered to refund the amount included for Internet for all days of our stay and gave us free access for the remaining two days(I did not ask for this - only for a refund for the days not used).Later we received a call from one of their front office managers called Matt who point blank refused to refund the amount. He said we must have 'misunderstood' when the check in clerk was giving us the login details. When we told him there was no mention of the Internet package at the time of check in he raised his voice, started screaming, told us to go find another hotel and threatened to hang up. He refused to give us his last name. Very, very unpleasant!Thankfully, the next day, I spoke to Renata, the operations manager. She was very reasonable and promised to take care of the situation which she did by taking off the amount charged for Internet from our bill.We stayed in 917. Room was very small with IKEA style furniture. There was barely any space to open even one suitcase let alone two.Location wise a bit far from the attractions but close to Central Park and lots of good eateries at walking distance.Given my experience, I would not stay here again.

After 4 days staying in a different hotel, I extended my stay 1 night and had to change hotels due to pricing. I found a fantastic deal for NYLO, especially since I wanted to stay in the same location as my previous hotel. After arriving at NYLO, I immediately wished I had known about this great hotel earlier in the week! I received excellent service the instant I arrived and continued on till I checked out. I will definitely book any future stays in the city with NYLO and will recommend to family & friends.

The lobby scene is cool. My son in law taught my daughter to play chess! The rooms are small but who stays in their room in NY? The staff was very helpful and kind. The location was perfect for us.The staff was very helpful.

very nice staff, clean room and perfect location- very close to central park! there si a very nice lobby- perfect for hanging out with friends\ family. I asked for an early check in and late check out and every thing was done.

I stayed at The Franklin on the other side of the park last year for the same or more money, and it is like night and day. NYLO is stylish, the back rooms very quiet, and overall a great experience. Coffee and tea in the room, complimentary water, and a block from the subway and Zabars deli. Only two blocks to the Museum of Natural History and Central Park. I walked back from the Met today across the park and it was easy and lovely. There is a lot of good food around here. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. My room averaged $200/night as I booked about six weeks ago and the value for the money is just amazing.

This is an old Manhattan building that's got an extreme makeover and is one of the best hotels on the upper west side. The folks at the check-in desk were great. The hotel itself is only a couple of blocks from the train station - with a fabulous restaurant, Serafina, on the first floor. Since it's on broadway, you've got Citarella and Fairway for grocery stores and great shopping on Columbus and not to mention Central Park only a few blocks away. If you want a hotel away from the tourist nightmare areas but still in a location that's close to everything, then NYLO is your spot. I highly recommend. In fact next time we've got family in town, we're booking them here!
user_name:
AmyL291
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location on the UWS. Nice rooms - furniture is a bit on the funky side but clean. Housekeeping did a great job - very clean room. Bathroom is spacious and comfortable. We stayed in a deluxe king room on the corner of the 9th floor. Bar and lounge is a highlight - cool place to get a drink.

I stayed this past weekend at The NYLO. Wonderful location on the Upper West Side, near so much. Great coffee shops, restaurants, retail, markets all in walking distance. Pleasant staff. Very nice main floor bar. The room good size for NYC. We'll appointed. And best of all very good price.

NYLO is a very cool, boutique, hotel. Very artsy feel. Staff were very friendly. The lobby sitting room was a buzz of guests hanging out, enjoying the ambiance. I would definitely be happy to stay there again. Oh, and the rooms were well appointed and clean. Loved the wood floors!

Fine. Good value and location. Need to upgrade bathrooms. but not bad. Bar scene is fun. Friendly staff. Good internet. Closest, best hotel near Beacon Theater. Amsterdam Ale House great for dinner and sports viewing. Close to subway. Easy and efficient.

I loved the location of the hotel, and the room was a nice size and very comfortable. I was there for 4 nights on business, and the room/bathroom was barely cleaned each day. I think they just made the bed and emptied the trash. Other than that, a very nice stay.

Excellent stay. Hotel is beautiful, rooms are spotless and comfortable, loved the floors instead of carpeting, bath accessories very nice and plentiful, walk in shower of tile and glass, staff and housekeeping exceptionally accommodating,Very nice lounging area and bar. Fantastic location. Can't say enough nice things

My wife and I stayed ast the NYLO for one night and everything was superb. The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. The room was large and had a great view. Breakfast at Serafina was wonderful and reasonably priced.

The rooms were small but perfect for what we needed, efficient and very hip. I love the location but was noisy because of all the construction on W. 77th. I would highly recommend this hotel. Love the bar and the restaurants near the hotel.

It felt like your front desk was totally disconnected to both your reservation system and your guests. At no time did they even pretend to try and meet our request. In the bathroom the towels were left on the floor

Love staying at the Nylo. I work on LES but I stay on the UWS because I love the neighborhood and I really enjoy the Nylo. The bar is always full of people, rooms are always clean and the staff is friendly and helpful.

Best mattress EVER!!!⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️Where can I get one?! I'm sorry the rooms are more expensive than I am used to paying but it is New York City! Loved the location. Close to subway and on Broadway! But the mattress takes the cake!!

Small but comfortable rooms. Helpful staff. Close to transportation. Anything you need near-by. Just wish they didn't charge for Wi-fi! Trip advisor insists on a longer review and that is all I have to say.

I liked Everything Except the Elevator :o) I am in good shape and used Stairs often from Floor 7 because elevator was Super Slow and I got Stuck once :o) But it did NOT free Fall, so there is that! Getting Stuck for a short time just added to my First NYC Experience.

Confusing upgrade policy, was sent upgrade by email and then not available at time of check in.. Called twice about early check in and was assured there would be not problem getting into the room early around 2:30. Needed to get in early to get ready for an event that evening. Room not ready until after 4pm. General lack of care or apology for their mix up. Will not be staying there or recommending it to my business partners.

This is a very nice hotel, with a great ambience. The rooms are much larger than you would expect from a typical hotel in New York City at this price point.. The room is decorated with higher end modern finishes that give you the impression that you are staying in a much more expensive hotel.. I enjoyed my stay here, and will definitely come back again. I would highly recommend this hotel to guys trying to impress their significant other....

I have sent groups here and wanted to see it for myself. Now I know why they keep coming back year after year. Size of room was huge and so was bathroom. Shower fit my 4 kids and me to get them clean in one shot.

Had my honeymoon stay here and it was amazing best hotel! Great people and very close to alot of site seeing. Will be making this my #1 plcae to stay very affordable an0d convenient. Will recommend to all!

The Hotel is very Clean. Best Beds Everrrr. It was a little far from Time Square and we had to walk a lot. I was also disappointed NO breakfast buffet available. a close by restaurant serves breakfast for those who want. We preferred to walk around.

For the price of the hotel, i expected a little more. But it was clean and the staff was friendly. The location of this hotel is what was amazing. I would have ask to see the room the next time. overall, it was a good hotel.
user_name:
Debbie T
Winston Salem, North Carolina

review_body: Stayed here in June 2016 visiting family. The bed and bedding were very comfortable and the room nicely designed. Our room, however, looked out on a brick wall ( if you opened the curtains over the Windows). Since we were mostly there after dark so that wasn't a big deal. The lobby and bar were "hip".More disturbing, we were woken up at 6:45 am on Saturday by a construction hoist grinding away near our room. The staff reassured us that this wouldn't happen on Sunday but would likely occur 6 days/week till the construction on a neighboring building is complete. I would advise requesting a room away from the construction hoist.

Small hip hotel in Manhattan that pretty much hits all the marks. Find a decent room in Manhattan for under $300.00 and you've scored. The NYLO offers much more than decent. The hotel is relatively new and well maintained. The rooms are on the small side but clean cool and comfortable. Service is excellent. Two good but pricey restaurants on premises. Very hip lobby bar on the street that unfortunately looks out at the major construction project across the street. Still a nice hang. Loved the bathroom and particularly the shower. Nice very comfortable king bed. Great location. I recommend the NYLO get serious consideration if you have a gig anywhere in Manhattan.
user_name:
John T
Hazlet, New Jersey, United States

review_body: i did not like at all since what the price was not according with the price. Location very good but the service was not good. The room was very small and dark. Not even the laundry service worked and I really felt umconfortable.

Great location. Hotel's staff is super friendly and helpful. Would definitely refer people. I would definately stay here again. Rooms are efficient and clean. Excellent shopping and restaurants all around. Safe area. Felt very comfortable.

Great room that I found in an email from NYLO. A beautiful room with a balcony. The only negative we found was that the bathroom, which was very nice, didn't have a tub. Now I know you can't have everything, but some do prefer a bathtub. Other than that minor issue, the experience and room were both great.

NYLO is a convenient comfortable hotel - close to subway stations, Central Park, delis, museums, etc. Good size room with nice décor. Highly recommended. Pity using the wifi in your room is so expensive.

We stayed here for three nights over a long weekend and were extremely happy with our stay. It is a great place to stay for something a little quieter than Times Square. The location is perfect for performances at Lincoln Center (10 block walk or 1 subway stop away) or strolling around Central Park (a few blocks east). There are many shops and restaurants in the area with everything you need located within a few blocks. The rooms and property are clean and comfortable and a great value for an NYC hotel. We paid for the Internet Package to get Internet in the room and the wi-fi was very fast and reliable. The 16th floor has a terrace that has a good view of the UWS and is a nice place to relax after a day in the City. There are also two excellent restaurants at the property, which was perfect for when we checked in late in the evening to grab a meal. I will be staying here again on return trips to NYC and would recommend this hotel to others.

In town to visit my son. Last visit I stayed nearer the "touristy" stuff..times square etc. Big mistake. I decided to try a place closer to my sons home on the upper west side. Nylo is away from the crowds and craziness..but still within walking distance of fantastic dining, shopping, parks etc. And only a quick walk to the subway to get everywhere else! I was greeted by the nicest doorman I have ever encountered...travelling alone can be a little scary (at least for me:)..and I immediately felt at ease and welcomed at NYLO! Check in took about 5 minutes tops. The vibe in the lobby is relaxed and cool...feels like an old timey bar/lounge.
