Plenty of seating areas and the little lobby bar is fantastic...I got a glass of wine later in the evening and just sat and watched people..so comfy! I had a room on the 7th floor (701). If you are looking for a view..this room would not have pleased you. My view was a tall bring wall. Fortunately, a view isnt a big deal for me at all..I'm just there to sleep! But, if you want a view...head up to the 16th floor terrace!! Amazing!!! Take a drink and sit there all evening..so relaxing!! Because my room was in the back of the hotel it was insanely quiet, other than occasional door slams from neighbors. The room was spotless. My first time in a hotel with wood floors..and I love it! So much cleaner than carpet!! In room keurig coffee and complimentary bottled water. Yes please!! The bed was by far the best hotel bed I've ever slept in..fluffy bedding, tons of pillows...ahhh!!! The bathroom was much bigger than the last nyc hotel i stayed in. Big walk in shower, great water pressure and immediate hot water. Only tiny negative was the lack of towel bars, or hooks..would be nice to have a spot to hang your robe etc. The housekeepers are like ninjas! We were literally gone 45 minutes to grab some breakfast one morning and came back to spotless room. Never even SAW the housekeeping staff!! I checked out at 6:15 Monday morning for an early flight back to Michigan. Took two seconds. He even called out to the doorman to start finding me a cab. 5 stars nylo..you are fantastic!!

This was my second stay at the NYLO. It is in a great location on the upper West Side and has a nice lobby. The room we had this time was small, especially the bathroom, and was starting to look tired. The AC system needs work.

We have stayed at NYLO a few times and keep coming back. Unlike many downtown hotels, the rooms are spacious, comfortable and very clean. And, the rates are more affordable. Our family of four stayed in a suite with two queen beds, and a large seating area with a couch and chair. The Upper West Side neighborhood is nice and quiet, and has many good restaurants nearby. Our favorite is Red Farm. We will definitely be returning to NYLO.

I can highly recommend this hotel. Location, cleanliness and service were all excellent. The comfort of the beds and linens provided a perfect night's sleep. The staff were very helpful and attentive to every detail

I absolutely loved the location and atmosphere of this hotel. The lobby/bar/rec area was amazing and lots of fun. More of a young crowd and music needed. Rooms were nicely decorated but small. Window barely had view and very dirty to even see outside. Bathroom ok, did not even have proper toilet paper holder. No mini fridge. Was nice but for price expected a bit more.

NYLO was the hotel where most of the guests stayed for our daughter's wedding. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The only suggestion I have is there should be a full length mirror in every room.

Would highly recommend. Great location, staff , especially front desk.which could not do enough to be helpful. Will stay at NYLO on my next trip to NYC. Others should seriously consider this hotel on their next trip to New York City.

We travel to New York City often and we always stay at the NYLO. It's in a perfect location for us. It's close to the subway and great restaurants. Since they renovated the hotel has a really cool vibe!

We have visited the city previously but were once again entertained by plays and enjoyed the museums and parks. This is an ideal location to get around NYC and in a very safe area. We were out late at night and were most comfortable walking everywhere.

Just one night stay at the NYLO for business. I was upgraded into one of the top floors, with a great view of the river at night. The rooms are very modern but comfortable (hardwood floor, storage cubes, etc.) Easy walking distance to Broadway & the park. It has a really nice lounge/bar area in the lobby as well. Really friendly staff and complimentary water. I would stay here again.

Great location, nice friendly staff and clean room. Hotel is convenient to get to in a great neighborhood. Parking is across the street. You can easily walk to many places of interest! Coming back soon!

Modern clean and funky. Love it. Outdoor patio a bonus. Friendly staff and great location. Cool lobby and bar. Wish they had live music on Friday night. Very nice room good tv. Will stay here again. Restaurant is expensive but convenient.

Our reservation clerk recorded our name incorrectly which made our check in a big challenge and I was freaked out. The check in clerk couldn't have been nicer and calmer. I wish I had her name as she deserves recognition

I normally stay in name brand hotels. I found this hotel by accident and I was pleasantly surprised. The room was huge and the bed extremely comfortable. I was upgraded without asking. I won't stay any where else now.

Bathroom and shower very difficult to use if you use a rollator and need a chair in the shower. However, hardwood floors make it easy to get around with rollator. Staff should be more aware of the needs of the handicapped.

We had a lovely stay at the NYLO. The rooms were way above expectations and the hotel staff extremely friendly! Fabulous location. I have already recommended the NYLO to friends and will most definitely stay there when in NYC.

If you like the look of cheap IKEA furniture then this is your place! Soft beds and lumpy pillows. It's clean and the roof deck is nice. If you go super lux the rooms are nicer. Bigger, but still with the IKEA flavor. The price is fine and the location is great. I wouldn't book again.

The staff was great at the hotel but the cleanliness of the floors in our room was not good. I called down the next morning to inform the front deck that there was quite a bit of food crumbs from the guest before us and they did not respond. This was after we were out for the morning and the maid had already came through for the day. I followed up with management and they took care of it day 3 and gave us free comp drinks at the bar. Don't get me wrong, this was not a bad place but it was nothing special. The location is great for the Upper West Side but the cost of the rooms is not worth it.

loved this hotel. Got the NY experience without the Time Square craziness. Its close to subways and restaurants and its just perfect. Close to Central park, and the Beacon theatre. There was always someone around the lobby that wanted to help. I loved sitting on the 15th floor having a drink and overlooking the city. Beautiful view.

The NYLO has a wonderful location and a definite trendy vibe. The staff is generally very friendly and helpful. However, the rooms are basic at best and I would have gladly given up a little trendiness for comfort. Not a single decent place to sit in the room; poor lighting and a bathroom that was not well-designed.

The rates are too high for what you get. The location was great! Some staff were good but some didn't want to be bothered and not nice. It was very clean but too expensive even for NYC. You can find cheaper rates in NYC.

OK. So I got to the hotel late at night (after a delayed flight). No problem here. However, I expected more from this hotel based on the raving reviews. The design is supposedly modern, which means - bare concrete and metai with a minimalistic design. So was the room. Minimal. And not very clean. There were sticky stains on the table and then some. I paid around $220 per night. Not cheap but not too bad considering I made the reservation somewhat late.And then I asked for a late checkout, as my next flight was at midnight. They explained that free "late checkout" would be at 13:00 at the latest. If I wanted to stay until 15:00, it would cost me $200, and later than that (say 19:00) it would be $400!!! Talk about taking advantage of captive customers.I got the hint, and will find a different place next time.

Because we arrived on a red-eye, I booked the room for the night in advance of our arrival. They put us in a handicap accessible room, no closet, queen size bed, giant bathroom. When I was asked if we could move to another room - one with a closet and a tub, I was met with the rude reply that nothing was available and we would still be charged for the room we didn't want. Eventually, another room was provided and it was very nice. But getting clean towels every day seemed to be a challenge for them. I heard other guest requesting towels as well. Best news - the beds are really comfortable.

We got a free upgrade on arrival to a room with 2 queen beds.. The room was the biggest sized room I've ever stayed in in New York... As was the bathroom. Very modern, hardwood floors,very friendly staff. I will definitely stay here again.

The Hotel has this great location in the Brodway , far from traffic and noise ,the stuff at the reception and the bell men are really helpfull , it also have a balacony in the room where you can smoke :)

This is a very comfortable friendly hotel. Just a few blocks from Central Park - easy walking distance as well as the 72nd street subway station. Great restaurants, bakery's and cafes on Broadway and Amsterdam avenues. Very comfortable bed, room a little small but workable. This hotel as a very nice lobby area to hang out with friends and family as well as a great bar area. The hotel also has an attached restaurant for meals on site.

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the NYLO hotel. I was provided a very clean and functional room, away from the hustle and bustle of NYC. The decor was clean and simple, and the staff friendly and courteous. When the staff learned that I was visiting NYC to enjoy my new granddaughter, they went out of their way to be accommodating. I highly recommend the NYLO hotel for top notch service and excellent location-location-location!

77th & Broadway. Great Location! Just a couple blocks from the subway. Surrounded by great eateries. Personnel a very friendly and helpful. I suggest using their valet. Currently there is construction going on next door and the Fire Dept. is parking their truck out in a special area. So let the good NYLO folks do their thing. Great, (small) bar in the lobby area. Opens at 3pm. Very comfortable waiting area off to the side of the check-in desk. Try out the 16th floor deck area.

Walking distance to Central Park & Museum of Natural History/Planetarium which saved cab fare to two attractions we wanted to visit. Cab fare not expensive to other attractions either. Across the street is a French bakery (Maison Keyser), great for breakfast, lunch and Westside Market for fruits, snacks, etc. Hotel staff great. Enjoyed the King Deluxe room on 12th floor with a nice view of Broadway. Keuric coffeemaker in room. Would stay here again.

This was our second visit to NYLO in a year. The first visit was everything wonderful; this past week's visit was an entirely different experience: there was confusion about the room (we did not want a room facing a cinder-brick wall, of which NYLO has many); the staff was unable to get a vase for flowers I bought to off-set the lack of a view; two requests for extra towels was ignored...and while I apparently left my iPod plugged into the room's speaker when checking out, after both sending an email and leaving a phone message to their "Lost and Found" upon returning home two days ago, I still have heard nothing from NYLO. In sum, the hotel has a great Upper-westside location, but they are coasting on a past reputation. Too bad.
user_name:
JACK S
Metro Minneapolis-Saint Paul, Minnesota

review_body: The hotel was fine, rooms very small. Very good location. Staff needs hospitality training, they do not get the hotel business!!! Stayed for 2 nights, had many rooms booked in our group, everyone had the same mediocre experience

I stayed here with my 4 year old son and we loved it. I just checked out but I can't wait to write about out stay. I am an Expedia silver plus member and as soon as we checked in we had a great experience. We got upgraded to a bigger room and free wifi. The lady who checked us in was very nice and she also put a late check out for us. The room was clean and spacious as well as the bathroom. The hotel has an outside lounge to seat and relax on the 16th floor which was delightful. It is well decorated and has two restaurants. The gym on the 2nd floor is small but nice. The upper west side is my favorite area fo NY with so many family friendly things to do. Kids Parcs, museums, central park and so many restaurants to chose from. Our favorite is Mille Feuille on Broadway in front of the hotel and Maison Kayser. There is a nice grocery store, the west side market on Broadway in front of the hotel.I can't say enough good things about the staff, everyone was so nice. They also held our luggage after we checked out!The only minus was the construction in front of our room on 77th st. If you are sensitive to noise ask a room away from it but NY is not known for its quietness after all. We will be back and we will send people there too.

If you are coming to NYC to see and experience the city, then this is a great hotel. Convenient to many sights: Times Square, Broadway, Central Park, Rockerfeller Center, Museums (The Met, MoMA, Natural History to name a few). Not convenient to the south end of the island (SoHo, East / West village, China Town, Little Italy, Wall Street, Brooklyn). However if you are willing to take the subway (call it a 'train' and sound like a local) you can get anywhere on the island safely and easily from here. No hotel is 'close to everything,' despite what you may read online. The island is 9 miles long and about 3 miles wide. You can't expect to be close to all things no matter where you stay. The rooms are comfortable with nice bath amenities and good TVs but otherwise pretty spartan. The beds are very comfortable. The lobby bar is excellent! Great drinks and atmosphere. (Very NYC). If you want to see the City stay here. If you want a resort with a gym and pool, stay elsewhere. There is a concierge in the lobby, which is nice, but it is really more for tourist info than for scoring hard to get tickets or reservations. The front desk staff is usually over worked and they can be brusque if there is a line. Which is understandable. What isn't understandable is why there is a line so often. If you stay here try a meal at Cafe Piccolo which is on Amsterdam between 74 and 75. About 3 blocks away. Very small and very good, without being very expensive. Also nearby is the 79th street Boat Basin, which is where Will Smith and Eva Mendes get the jet skis in the movie Hitch. There is a nice outdoor bar / restaurant there for a cold beverage on a hot day.

Although the entrance to NYLO put me off (I mistook distressed concrete in entry for worn rugs, but the loudness of the bar was a persistent feature), the staff were welcoming and efficient. The room was small but very comfortable, provided with all the amenities. I was there for business and extended the stay by a few days to see friends and go to museums and some plays. The university where I was speaking chose the hotel. I would certainly return. It's easy to get to Central Park, just walk a few blocks east, the 7th Avenue subway (#1) is two blocks away. And there are lots of restaurants and shopping in the neighborhood.

Great location, loved the lobby areas, adjacent restaurant is great. The room was minuscule...has I known I would have upgraded. The bathroom was too small too. Folks at the desk were courteous and helpful.
user_name:
X X
Palm Beach Gardens, Florida

review_body: NOT Worth Money, location, service,food. No one thing I can mention which may prove this hotel is worth spending a single dollar here. The staff didnt care to listen or to respond to our any requests. Its a 1 star hotel. I would sincerely not recommend this hotel for pleasant stay. New York has better to offer.

Hotel is in a lovely neighbourhood. Not far from the park and close to the Museum. It has a very neat "vibe" - very unique. The lobby and bar are fun. They give off an underground club feel. The room was small (king bed) but that is not unusual for NYC hotels. Dressers have a neat trendy look but are not at all practical - no drawers, only shelves and cupboards. We couldnt get the AC cool enough the first eve - we set the thermostat at 64 and the room wouldnt cool below 69. Hotel would be average for the experience however we had no hot water both mornings. We advised the front desk on the first morning. We were pushed for time and couldn't wait so we had to settle with cool showers. The staff said they would send someone up. We had hot water that evening but woke the next morning again to no hot water. It became obvious to us that this has happened before and there is clearly a problem with the hotel. Our room was over 700 for two nights and they only discounted our bill $100 for the water problem. We think they could have done better than that. It's an upscale NYC hotel. We are in NYC frequently and won't stay here again.

We stay at this hotel whenever we can. The staff is always friendly and it is nice to see the same faces from visit to visit. The hotel has a nice vibe to it and is located in a very convenient on the upper west side. we highly recommend it

This is an excellent boutique hotel in a wonderful location on the upper west side. I plan to stay at NYLO again throughout the year. The room was a perfect size and looks exactly like the pictures on line. The hotel is very clean and staff is courteous.

I kept going back and forth on a rating for this one, but what solidified the "3" for me was the lack of cleanliness of the rooms. Floors were dirty. Good news, linens were clean. Comfortable bed, but a bit noisy with street noise. Would I stay here again? Probably, but it wouldn't be my first choice. That said, it was a solid value for the nightly rate.

Great property, clean room,great staff. Can anyone help me with a reservation 11/5 & 11/6? Need a room for NYC Marathon weekend. Love the property and local very much. Please let me know via email sbrosnan81@gmail.com or 631-291-2306. Thank you!

At the beginning we had room 626 which was extremely small but the front desk were quick to fix it and the next night we had been moved to room 1125 which was much better in fact rooms like 626 should not be

We always stay at NYLO when we visit and time and time again we get the best customer service. Our A/C didn't work in our room and the manager arranged for an upgrade at no charge and an immediate switch. All staff go out of their way and the Queen queen suite or junior suite is the way to go with a family!

Made reservation 3 months in advance, was warned by a NYer to cancel reserv as not same hotel since sold in 2015! 1st room faced massive construction site, we refuse room, saw 3 rooms, stayed in 2 & still never saw the room I booked! I don't mind paying but I want what I ordered. Only lip service from mgmt, I had to work to hard to give this company my money. Over promised and under delivered.

The room was dirty. Half the staff was surly. They ran out of things like washcloths and bottled water with no apology. The concierge didn't answer her phone. There were no drawers and the closet door was very difficult to open. Would never stay there again and neither should you.

Highly recommend the NYLO. Wonderful location, friendly staff, comfortable lobby, bar and hotel. Room was surprisingly large and very comfortable and easily accommodated three of us. I definitely will return.

Comfortable stay, nice room and good staff. Location is nice, close to central park crossway for easy access to east side. recommend it for either business or pleasure. not far from good spots in the city

This four star hotel was very nice. The address 2178 Broadway was misleading as Broadway is a very long road and I assumed when booking that it is right in the heart of the theatre district but it was not. It was still in walking distance to many tourist spots and also close to a metro stop.The room we stayed in was compact but very comfortable. Free guest amenities included a 'pod' machine with filter coffee and tea replaced daily. There is free Wi-fi in the hotel lobby, bar area and library but not free in rooms. There is a lovely outdoor rooftop terrace for guests' use. We had breakfast in the attached restaurant Serafina and found it a bit pricey, especially with tax and tips automatically added on to the bill but well worth the splurge for their delicious smoked salmon and cream cheese bagels. The only negative in this supposedly non-smoking hotel was a constant waft of cigarette smoke in our passage way. We realised that there was a guest in the room next door who was regularly smoking and in spite of bringing this to the Receptionists' attention twice, they did nothing to rectify this.

Wonderful hotel, young, hip energy, comfortable rooms, helpful staff, and the a great location for the upper westside. Some of the rooms and showers were smaller than others so be sure to ask when making a reservation.

this location is perfect to stay is that there is very good area for restaurants, Cidarella ( the food name) on Broadway St.about two blocks and CVS on 77th St. across this hotel plus closer to Central Park!

House keeping completely disregarded "do not disturb" signs, going into the rooms while we were gone though the sign was on the door, and I woke up every morning to them knocking. Also this hotel does not offer room service.

I cannot say enough about this hotel. Very accommodating and clean and just all round best hotel for the money. I mean really how much are you staying in your room in NYC. Loved it, will be back again for another stay. It was perfect, if you don't want to be around the hustle and bustle of Time Square this is the place to be the Upper West Side!!

Excellent location for weekend trip. Valet service and door and bell staff are outstanding. Spacious rooms. Many restaurants nearby, easy walk to Natural History and NY-HS. We would bump up the rating if rooms had mini fridge -- very helpful when traveling with families.

Room is great, location is great, staff is friendly. But the rooms are dirty. Some woman left behind a bunch of hairballs in our bathroom on the bathroom wall and on the shower hose. The floors in the hallways were disgusting and had not been vacuumed in weeks. There was a trail of blood stains on the hall way leading from the stairs to one person's room. I liked the room. Bed was comfy. Love the location. But damn, clean the place up and it would be 5 stars.

Everything is always great about Nylo, except one thing. Some of the "upgraded" rooms have no window views. The windows are frosted and there is a wall behind. But it's an excellent location on the upper west side, a nice lobby with bar and coffee shop, and I like the minimal service, ie they don't bug you about carrying luggage but there is a doorman who will get you a black car to the airport.

Would recommend this hotel. Thought hotel was nice. Had a good number of younger people occupying the lobby/bar area. We only stayed one night and had a good experience. The only complaint would be too soft beds, and you could hear conversations in hallway, even late at night. Sound somehow enforce quiet hours.

Stylish property with flexible and friendly staff attentive to clients need. Great buzz and ambience in lobby offering large areas to browse the net, play board games and socialise with a handy bar for drinks which can also be taken to the rooftop.Super comfy beds to soak into after long day's sightseeing. Room amenities are great with stainless steel sink and bath tub. Modern paintings and large LCD TV. Would definitely stay at NYLO when visiting NYC next.

Great stay. Very friendly and efficient staff. Nice clean rooms. Great bar area and restaurant downstairs. Highly recommend to anyone staying in the Upper West Side. Great and accessible location. Would absolutely stay again.

The hotel was was great and the rooms were a good size. Roof top patios were very nice. Only complaint was service in the bar/lounge was sometimes slow. I would definitely stay at this hotel again when we visit New York

We stayed at the NYLO for our first trip to New York in May. We were really impressed with the hotel and it was perfect for us. It is located 2 blocks from the subway which takes about 15 mins max to get to Times Square, or you could walk to a subway station a little further which has a faster train. The neighbourhood nearby was lovely and we preferred this to staying in the very centre of town - it had a more residential, relaxed feel and we felt at home there. It's close to some great restaurants and opposite a 24 hour supermarket/pharmacy which was great. The hotel itself is very clean and smart looking. The bar in the lobby looked great but we didn't actually use it during our stay. We saw other people taking drinks from there up to the lounge area on the balcony which sounded great, we just didn't have a chance to do it! Compared to other hotels it was possibly a little less welcoming - we were very much left to ourselves which was fine, but there was not quite the level of service I have experienced in other American hotels. The lack of a mini bar and/or room service was a little disappointing but as there is so much nearby this wasn't really a problem.We essentially just used this hotel as a place to sleep as there was so much to do in the city! And for that, it was perfect as the bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! The room was also decorated really nicely and kept very clean. Our coffee and water supplies were not regularly topped up, but again this didn't matter as we were out for breakfast every morning.There were some building works going on on 77th Street (which look quite long term). It wasn't a huge problem but they did start at around 8am every day and were quite noisy at times, so a room on the other side of the hotel may be quieter.I would definitely recommend this hotel to others staying in NYC as a great base, and it was great value for money compared to some of the other hotels we looked at. A special mention to the doormen who were always pleasant and flagged down taxis whenever needed! We would definitely stay again.

I visited NYLO with my two teenage kids and we were very comfortable and happy in our room. It did not feel tight, like usual NYC hotels, and was very clean. The staff were also friendly and helpful. The restaurant downstairs was great and the service was good too. The hotel is in a safe area and easy to access by subway.

Great location, nice room, everything one needs for a trip to NY. Very comfortable room and friendly staff. Walked throughout Central Park and to the Natural History Museum, Lincoln Center and Rockefeller Center. I would definitely stay there again.

spent two nights at the Nylo last week. Quite expensive once state, city, tourist and other taxes are added to room charge. we were given an upgrade to superior room which had most essentials but was dark and both windows faced onto brick walls and close neighbour windows.Food option at hotel is a connected Italian style restuarant next door with limited other options in immediate area.

We had a lovely stay at the NYLO. The room was modern, however a little dark. For NYC, there was plenty of space in the room and the bed was incredibly comfortable (although quite high off the floor). The bathroom was tiny, but the shower was spacious. Staff were friendly and helpfull. We were given a free early check-in and complimentary wi-fi, which was great. We knew and loved this neighborhood prior to this visit. Great restaurants (e.g. Dovetail), a subway station, museums, Central Park... All are just a few minutes away. CVS is right across the street.We were slightly disappointed that there was no breakfast discount for hotel guests at the Serafine. Also their Airport transportation turned out to be more expensive than indicated at the front desk. I was very displeased by this last fact. Also our door that led out into the hallway didn't completely close. We didn't complain, as we were in a quiet part of the hotel and it didn't cause too much inconvenience; but it could have been mentioned while checking in. Overall, we had a pleasant stay and would return to stay again in the future.

We had an INCREDIBLE stay at NYLO NYC. Staff were always helpful, especially desk staff who checked us in, as well as the bell staff/doormen who watched our bags and got us a car to the airport. This place really gave us a home for our 5 days in NYC. We had total of 5 rooms for extended family for graduation, and they made everything very special. Room was clean ALWAYS, bed super comfortable, view onto Broadway great. Best part was the 16th floor rooftop lounge, where we hung out together. Also great the Library area for resting, relaxing and being together. Thanks NYLO NYC.

The hotel was very accommodating and bent over backwards to meet our needs.The location to everything is prime, the restaurant, Serafino's, located in the lobby has excellent food with a variety on the menu.

Great location with easy access to two subway stations and walking distance from the Hudson River and Central Park so it's ideal if you love walking. The staff members were very pleasant and helpful. The bar is also a nice bonus. We had a lovely breakfast in the attached restaurant (Serafina) and there is a lovely French cafe just over the other side of Broadway for croissants and coffee.

My partner and I stayed for a night and it was a very pleasant experience. The Beds were so comfortable and the lady at the front desk was wonderful. Down side: Very thin walls, we could hear everything that was going on next door.

We stay at the Nylo once a year and it is always an exceptional experience. My 86 year old mother and I can walk to Central Park and the museums, or head the other direction and walk along the East River. We are always booked into the room of our choice and the staff always meets any additional needs we might have. We book the Queen Queen Suite and love having the separate living area. The dining at the Red Farm and the Serafina Restaurants is exceptional. We love the residential feel of this area of Manhatten. The Location is excellent, the hotel feels intimate and a calm restful place to return at the end of the day. The Staff always makes you feel like your are returning home. See you in a year NYLO.

For context I've not stayed in NYC previously but I have stayed in 4 and 5 star hotels all over the world. That said the NYLO is just ok. The location is ok (not really near anything, but quiet). The lobby ok (interesting decor but very tight). The hotel bar ok (service at cocktail hour was non-existent and gin selection tiny). And the room ok (small European size, no fridge, no robes, decor a combination of kindergarten cubbies and surgical prep area, wretchedly soft bed). I think the NYLO is shooting for low-key trendy but lacks the high touch details that can make that work with a discerning clientele. Or it might just be the price point. $300 plus/night might just not be enough in NYC for a memorable boutique experience. Maybe $400 gets you there. Was it a bad stay? No. Would I stay there again? No.

Front desk staff was helpful, doormen were always friendly. Nice vibe in the large and very comfortable lounge. Great location between two stops on the 1,2,3 subway line. Front desk arranged for a car to LaGuardia at the end of our stay, which was a reasonable and wonderful way to travel. Hassle-free and no waiting at front desk at check-in or check-out.

We requested a quiet room. It was so quiet we could not hear the emergency vehicles or the rain. Our room was spacious and we liked the size of the bathroom. Service was terrific too. There are several places to hang out on the ground floor.

We stayed 3 nights and had the best time. The bar was great how they allowed dogs, I loved seeing that! The customer service was excellent everywhere. It was so easy to walk everywhere because the hotel is in the best location!

Sixth time there because of the service. This time the premium room was smaller than we were led to believe.No view because of dirty windows and flag pole in front. Room was right outside elevators so we heard alot of for traffic at night. Were there for 6 nights and complained to management. Did they try to fix anything? Instead we were charged an extra $74 for an unresolved, random bar bill charged to our room.

Hotel staff was very courteous and helpful and we enjoyed our stay there. Our request were met and we enjoyed the drink coupon. Although we had trouble finding the hotel at first, we thought the area was great to stay at.Thank you!

We have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Nylo and we had such an amazing time. This hotel is perfectly located for exploring the city with Central Park close by for a nice stroll and subway stations within a 5min walk. We were celebrating a birthday and anniversary while we were on our trip and the hotel kindly upgraded us to a junior suite which was lovely. It was next to the construction site but they did let us know this before we accepted the room and we really didn't hear anything from the builders the whole time we were staying so it wasn't a problem at all. The lobby area is just perfect to come back to after a hectic day exploring, comfy seating and a great selection of drinks make it a very relaxing place to spend a few hours in the evening. I really couldn't rate this hotel more highly and we would definitely choose to stay here again if we are lucky enough to visit NYC again in future.

Great room. I was only there for several hours. Coming in late and leaving early. Because it was memorial day Monday I was upgraded to a Junior suite. I could've lived there! Sorry I only could sleep during that time and not really enjoy the room. The shower could fit six people. It was clean and very comfortable. Great experience.

Our recent stay at NYLO was comfortable and enjoyable. The casual atmosphere was welcoming and the location was perfect for a relaxing NYC getaway. As others have said, it's in a quiet area, convenient to Central Park, museums, subways and taxis, mid-town theaters and restaurants.

I was very disappointed in NYLO this past weekend. I had expected to receive the same superior service I received when I visited last year, but sadly, this year was much different. We flew in on the red eye flight (because I don't believe in losing a day to travel) and arrived at the hotel at 6am. I had called this night before to ask for an early check in, and although I knew there was no guarantee, I was hopeful. We were told the room wasn't yet available, but they would get us in as soon as they could and in fact confirmed my phone number, so that they could call me as soon as it was ready. Perhaps we misunderstood, but that made me feel as though we would be able to check in sooner than the 3pm check in time they told us. So we walked in the park a little, grabbed breakfast. We came back to check on the status of the room, and when my brother went up to the desk, he was brushed aside by the staff, telling him, "we have you right here and will let you know" without asking his name. (Keep in mind it was different staff at the desk than when we arrived at 6am). We were told again that they were trying to get us in before 3pm. We left and tried to make the most of the day despite our exhaustion from overnight travel. Came back around 230, hoping for a miracle of the room being ready. Was told the good news was that the room was vacant (no kidding, check out was at 11am, the room better be vacant) and that they were still cleaning, but to come back at 3pm. 3pm finally comes around, and there's new staff at the front desk again, surprise, who tells me that check in is actually 4pm and they are just starting to clean our room. I asked to speak with a manager because we didn't understand why we were told 3pm all day and brushed off every time we spoke with someone at the desk. We were told the manager would call our room when we got there. I would have preferred to speak with him in person, but apparently that was asking too much. When they finally get us in our room at 4, we are appalled to see that the floors were filthy, there was still soap scum in the shower, crumbs all over the furniture and chewed gum on the floor by the door. We had been waiting for someone to clean our room but apparently the only thing they did was change the towels and linens. I walked downstairs to the front desk and spoke with yet another person about the cleanliness of the room. At least this person was responsive and immediately sent housekeeping back up to our room.

Quiet yet hip small hotel just blocks from Natural History Museum in fashionable Upper West Side, especially recommended for younger adults. Special shout out for the bed, which was one of the best we've experienced. Courteous staff and nice lobby area for schmoozing. Try eating at Redfarm (Chinese) around the corner.

The staff at the hotel from the bellmen to the front desk staff were really accommodating and always very helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay here again - I was traveling with my newborn son and some family members (on a work trip), and they made it so easy.

We enjoyed staying at NYLO. First of all, the location was perfect. We moved around a lot by subway, and the hotel is conveniently located between 2 subway stops. It's proximity to Central Park and the Museum of Natural History made it the perfect starting point for some nice strolls through the city.The room was very quiet; we never heard a sound from the halls, and only a couple of late night sirens were heard, but since we were 11 flights up, even those were distant sounds. The bed was amazingly comfortable, and the shower was delicious. My husband is tall, so often has issues with hotel showerheads being too low, but this one was perfect, with good water pressure and easy to regulate temperature. The lobby and bar were busy at night, though not crazy and noisy, just a nice mellow environment.

The NYLO is in an excellent location close to great restaurants and shops and within walking distance of some of the best museums in the city. The lobby of the hotel is cozy and inviting. The room was very clean and well maintained. The bed was exceptionally comfortable. The room size was adequate and fairly standard for New York. My only complaint about the room was the lack of a small refrigerator to keep drinks cold. I visit the city often and have stayed in many different hotels and would definitely recommend the NYLO.

Too many other choices of hotels to stay here, terrible service, not secure and the noise level is not conducive with restful sleep. Staff is not helpful and I felt it was just not a good experience at all especially at $300 average a night

I am a New Yorker and needed the hotel for an event in NYC. I was put on a floor in the midst of construction. Room was dark and dirty. The staff seemed harassed and understaffed. I feel like since I was a woman traveling with a 13 yr old, I wasn't given the same treatment I would have if I was on business. Not impressed at all.

The hotel was at a very convenient location. The bed and pillows are amazing and we were able to sleep very comfortably for the 12 days we stayed there. Although it was a little over priced, and whenever any change needed to be made to the reservation, drastic change in prices occurred, I would chose to stay there again simply for the location and mattress!

Stayed here for five days and really enjoyed it. The hotel is classy and the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. There is a nearby subway station and good 'bus links too. A very good place to stay, especially if you are visiting the main Manhattan museums. I would certainly go back.

I have had wonderful experiences at this hotel in the past. My recent visit was a total disaster! My advice to fellow travellers is to find another hotel in this area. Do not ruin your vacation by staying here!My room - I had stayed at this hotel several times before so I knew that when I requested a quiet room, away from elevators and not on Broadway Street, I would get a great room. Upon check in, we were given a room right on the corner of Broadway and 77th Street. Needless to say, it was constant noise all night. At 5:30 AM, after a very noisy night, the night front desk clerk assured us that the hotel would be delighted to move us to a quiet room. This did not happen. We were never moved. We were offered a different type of room (at an extra cost) facing the inner courtyard. Upon inspection, we noticed that the room vibrated and hummed because the courtyard was filled with air-conditioning machinery. We were also offered a room few floors up but still right on Broadway and 77th. No other rooms were available as the hotel was full. Getting a good night's sleep at this hotel is impossible because there is construction on 77th street, more construction behind the hotel and there is construction inside the hotel. Do not stay here if you plan on sleeping!Housekeeping - Abysmal is the best way to describe it. The sheets did not fit the King size bed - they were too short and not wide enough. We asked for the right size sheets and only on our last night (out of 5 nights) did they put the proper size sheets. Surprise! They do have them but it takes many requests!One night, after a long day of being out, we came back and there were no towels! After 5 requests to the front desk clerk and to the on duty manager and 2 hours of our time, we finally got the full compliment of towels. How can you do up a room and forget ALL the towels? How hard is it to fulfil this request?The pillows on the bed are small. They are 6" smaller than a twin bed pillow. They arrange a good number of these pillows on the bed making it look plushy but, in the end, they are small uncomfortable pillows! When we requested king size pillows, we were told that all the pillows are the same size.Mechanical - One morning we noticed that the air conditioning was blowing hot air. At 10 AM we told the front desk. When we returned at 8 PM, the room was extremely hot! Back to the front desk where they claimed nobody ever put in a request to Maintenance. Luckily the Maintenance men came right away. We were told to come back in 1.5 hours so that they could fix it properly. Why could they not fix this during the day? After a full day in NY, the last thing we wanted was to be out of our room!The hot water in the sink was terrible. The water flow from the hot side was just a dribble and, after running this dribble for 20 minutes or more, the water would be tepid. Most of the time, the "hot" water dribble was cold. Saving money or just being a cheap hotel?Staff - Words that describe this staff - terrible, surly, non attentive, not helpful, if possible, no eye contact, no smiles, no "what can we do to make your stay better?", no follow through on requests (towels, room change, air conditioner, sheets, hot water), lots of looking at the computer as we tried to tell them about (another) problem. They don't wear name tags or introduce themselves. All the staff, from the front desk to the managers, were the worst in all my travels. Booking Ahead - one word - DON'T! I booked online to get a good rate as I knew the NYLO was a great place to stay. But this was not in our favour! Once we paid, we could not get a refund and we were stuck in this hotel. If I had only booked a reservation, I would have moved after the first night. Boutique Hotel? - NO! It is a substandard hotel trying to be a boutique hotel. Plastic cups in the bathroom, Kleenex that is thin and scratchy, thin rough toilet paper, maids carts left in the hallway overnight, surly staff, short sheets, poor maintenance, dirty hallway rugs and this list goes on..... After this terrible stay, the manager on duty was so "gracious" to reimburse us for one night's stay. Seriously?This being New York, there are many other hotels in the area that have great reviews. This being New York, people will continue to come here and be disappointed! Don't be one of them.

Been in NYC every year for last 15 years and this was the best hotel by far. Location in Upper West side is perfect: quiet enough and close enough to subway, Central Park , etc staff is very nice (front desk, room service, etc) and the room itself was very well decorated, spacious...a really nice hotel!

Since we weren't going to a show this trip, we decided to stay out of the hustle and bustle of Times Sq... picked agreat place. Location felt more like a 'neighborhood', than a tourist mecca. If you're looking for boutique style, this place it is to a T. Trendy but comfortable check in, bar and front desk / lounge areas. If you cokmplain about the size of the room- you havent stayed in a lot of NYC hotels. Its avg- not large. Bathroom takes a hit to make the rest a tad larger than some. For the price, you are definitely getting the right size. You could add a few more sq ft at a place like Andaz 5th Ave, but for a few hundred $$ less- this place is completely appropriate.. If we have the opportunity to stay again for its location, we will definitely be back!

We stay at the NYLO almost every time we are in NYC. We find the staff helpful, the rooms and bathrooms clean and well-appointed, the beds extremely comfortable, and the lobby lively and inviting. It is very well located for our purposes.

Great location for exploring the Upper West Side. Tiny room! Best bed ever had! We stayed three nights on the ninth floor. The first two mornings they were doing some maintenance outside our door. The second day I finally mentioned it to the manager, even though the workmen were sure trying to be quiet. I understood that he would make an adjustment in the cost for those two days. But in checking out, I was frustrated because they only took $75 off for one day. Nothing for the second day. I asked to speak to the manager but of course he was unavailable. I asked that he call our room. That never happened. I also left something in our room and I have called the hotel and left messages for lost and found but no one has gotten back to me. So not so great customer service!

Great location near Central Park and subways, friendly staff, nicely designed lobby. Attractive bar, welcoming social room where people were reading or playing chess. Nicely designed room could use a bit more floor space. Sound proofing of the room certainly can be improved upon.

Spent 4 days at NYLO and would definitely recommend this hotel. We liked to walk each day to and from Times Square but there is subway station nearby. Our room was comfortable - especially the bed. Had large bathroom and the hotel has nice bar and restaurants

Lovely stay at the NYLO New York in upper west side. Booked a hotel room with river view. Visited for New York wedding. Great location and really nice hotel. Close to Central Park to walk and lots of great places to eat and drink nearby. We liked the Amsterdam ale house and George Keeleys which had a great mix of American craft ales and good food too. Neighbourhood is chic, vibrant but not as manic as other areas of the city like Times Square. Main metro stations allowing access to rest of NY within 2-10 minute walk of hotel depending on which line you need to use. You could be in Times Square within circa 15 minutes from leaving hotel. Nice hotel food, clean comfortable room, friendly staff. All round great vacation. The city is dog mad and the hotel bar area is dog friendly too which we liked.

We enjoyed the NYLO hotel very much. The hotel and the rooms are beautifully decorated. Everything is there , what you need for a good vacation tourism. Very good connection to the subway. Very close to Central Park. Many shops and restaurants in its immediate neighborhood.

Housekeeping attitude and unprofessionalism of some members of staff are the reason I won't be returning for another stay. Why should I pay to stay in a place that treat me rudely? Also, what's the point of a Do Not Disturb sign if housekeeping will bang on the door and talk VERY loudly right outside your room all morning???

Writing this from my room at the NYLO, on night 4 of 4.The property is very well maintained. The lobby is clean and inviting and strikes the perfect balance between the guest not feeling overdressed in a tie nor underdressed in a t-shirt. All of the staff is very friendly.Room size is decent for NYC. I've seen both bigger and smaller. A good chunk of the closet space is taken by some cubbies, which is rather inconvenient. Just don't bring your whole house and the room size is fine.The room and bathroom were very clean, save for a few scuff marks here and there that could be taken care of with some elbow grease and a magic eraser. You can tell that this hotel is taken care of, and the room feels welcoming and comfortable. Never heard a peep from any of our neighbors. No maintenance issues to report. Room is nice and inviting. I felt relaxed coming back to the NYLO every day.The in-room Keurig, as opposed to the standard fare coffee maker, is a nice touch. They supply some K-cups, but feel free to bring your own!Great access to the 1 train (2 blocks) and the 2/3 (5 blocks).Only complaint is no free wi-fi. We did get the free wi-fi this trip, but on my previous 3 trips I have not. I am not sure why this is. I think charging for Wi-Fi is a NYC thing, but it is upsetting that a room at the EconoLodge includes free Wi-Fi but a room at a nice hotel such as the NYLO does not.Anyway, this hotel is great. I have stayed here 4 times to visit family in the area and I will continue to do so.

I booked this hotel for an overnight stay and arrived to a less than impressive front desk that was not communicative and operated at the standard of a Comfort Inn but charged like a Hyatt or Marriott. The halls had traces of cigarette smokers and the room was small and unimpressive. For $400+ per night I expect better. Won't be back. Here are better for better rates on upper west side.

We stayed as a couple for 5 days. In that price class the NYLO was the best we experienced in New York City and it's a top location! The hotel is clean, has a nice and attractive bar and lobby, the room was comfortable and bathroom and shower are perfect. We will come back.Jonny Kremer, Switzerland

Everyone was very friendly and helpful. The room was very quiet and the bed couldn't have been more comfortable. We upgraded to a suite and it was a pleasant surprise how lovely the room was. Will definitely come back.
user_name:
pamelap964
Hudson River Valley, New York

review_body: Stayed here for a week with my husband and toddler. Found the double deluxe room a bit too small for an 8 night stay so asked for a bigger room. By paying a reasonable fee we upgraded to a bigger room that made our stay much more comfortable.Loved the neighbourhood, loved the hotel staff, from the doormen to the people in reception. Special thanks to Ramona, who was very kind to us.

Excellent stay with Broadway view. Great location- close to the 1 line and the 2 &3 express. Friendly staff. Great environment, comfortable bed and everything was clean! We would definitely stay there again

Overall a great hotel with excellent service and nice rooms. Great location close to Central Park, the museeum of natural history and only 2 blocks away from the closest subway station. A great place to stay with your partner or friends during your visit to the Big Apple.

We stayed three nights at the NYLO for the second time at the end of April. Having had such a good experience in February we decided to return again for our next trip. This trip we took an upgrade to a larger room for a very reasonable price, and were impressed yet again with the hotel, the location, and above all the staff.We had a corner room on an upper floor overlooking Broadway which gave us all that we required, that being a clean room a comfortable bed, and an accommodating staff. We live in an urban environment so any street noise from below was not an issue for us, but if that is something you may be sensitive to there are rooms facing the interior just as nice but lacking the view.For us the location is a major advantage as it makes it very easy to navigate the transit system to explore the city, and there is no shortage of places to eat and shop whatever your tastes may lean towards.

Great location if you want something a little be removed but still convenient to get to everywhere you need to go, really close to the subway and very friendly staff. We arrived to a room that had not been vacuumed (i.e. visible dirt and hair on the floor and hair in the shower). We had to ask 3 times to eventually have it cleaned. Very disappointing to arrive to an unclean room, makes you concerned about what else isn't clean. The manager did have it done once I asked to speak to him after the 3rd attempt and gave us drink vouchers and slippers.

Our favorite hotel in the Upper West Side. This hotel has the most comfortable beds and the friendliest staff. The lobby has a busy New York bar and also a library with the cosy feel of your own living room. The location is within short walking distance of Central Park, the midtown express train and a good selection of shops, cafes and restaurants. This is our third stay!

The hotel is very modern and nice looking! It is close to a subway station, and also in a safe area. It is near a few good restaurants as well. The rooms were clean too! I would stay here again for sure in NYC!

I used to live in New York City and so feeling at home in New York even without an apt there is important to me. I love this hotel! Great staff. Friendly. Nice lobby. Clean rooms. Great location. I highly recommend staying here! Oh-- and good bar too!
user_name:
jberaha
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Have been staying at NYLO several times this past year and each time is great. Staff is very helpful. Room was an OK size, clean and well appointed. I was on the 12th floor so getting ice was easy (for some reason the only ice machine in the hotel is on the 12th floor - that would be something that they should try to address). I look forward to my next trip and staying at NYLO.

A great place to stay in the city. We arrived well before check-in and were given the option of checking in early to a different kind of room than we had reserved. We took the option (two full beds v one queen) and it was perfect for us . We were on the 11th floor . The check-in process was pleasant and the staff was friendly and accommodating.Our room was decorated in a modern/industrial style that was kitchy ,fun and spottless. The stainless steel bathroom countertop and sink were interesting and provided a large surface for our toiletries . PURE products were provided.Linens were bright white, multi-layered and very comfortable. Our room was not large but a nice size by NYC standards and was more than adequate for two guests. The room was very quiet.We took advantage of the bar on the street level and enjoyed the other rooms on that level which were great for relaxing and visiting with friends . We also had breakfast one morning at Seraphina which is connected to the hotel so was very convenient and good. While our visit was perfect and we will plan to stay there again on our next visit (location is perfect for us), visitors should be aware that there is major construction going on directly across the street on 77th. Our room did not face the street so we heard no construction noise. Also, we spent zero time in our room during the day.

good location for central park and restaurants.easy access to tube for all locations.If you don't like waiking it may be a little far away from main attractions. the beds very comfortable if you have a noisy or small room ask to change no problem'
user_name:
Ann B
English Riviera, United Kingdom

review_body: Hotel clean - no robes or slippers but good size room. Be sure you get a room facing the street. Bell staff and reception staff very helpful. Restaurant attached with good food. Starbucks and Wine store nearby and you can walk everywhere.

Aside from the sweet upgrade, we had a great overall experience with the staff, amenities and location. Traveling with a toddler, NYLO was our last stop on a week long, multi-state trip so the extra room in the penthouse for the little one to run around and drinks on our private terrace when all was quite were very much needed and appreciated. Plenty of drug store and grocery options within walking distance for traveling families that are in need of supplies. The attached restaurant, Serafina, serves breakfast till 11am so there was no need to rush the family out in order to get a bite... the lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious. We would definitely stay again and plan on recommending NYLO to friends and family.

I have stayed here before but things have gone downhill - the rooms and lobby area needs refreshing - no fridge in the room - only plastic cups - no comfortable seating except for the bed.Upside - great location.

Stayed in the hotel for two nights, the staff was pleasant enough, but the room was small and had terrible noise insulation. We could hear our neighbors both nights and mornings. Hotel staff placed us in a smaller room than we had requested with a door to the room next door. Very unpleasant for a hotel in this price range.

New York hotels are notoriously dodgy unless you pay good money. This hotel is good value for money. At $250 dollars for a double room per night, on the upper west side, you will probably not do better. Nicely renovated and stylish in a modern way. Bed big was very comfortable. Mod bathroom is well equipped. Coffee machine in the room. No carpets, which I love. Nothing worse that sticky dirty used carpets. Downstairs has an open plan bar, reception area. Trendy. Staff very helpful.

My first one room was terrible, floor 2, #212, very noisy..next day we were moved to another room, really better, because two persons help us: Amado (front desk) & Edward ( Bell boy). The rest of the personnel wasn't very friendly. The nightly rate is not commensurate.

It's like the hotel is understaffed and they do the minimum upkeeping as possible. The floors weren't washed when the room was given to us, and in the 6 days we stayed the bathroom wasn't always cleaned, the disposables (water bottles, plastic glasses) weren't replenished, the metal shelving in the shower (which was cooked and eventually fell on my foot) was precariously put back instead of being properly repaired. In summary, we feel that the hotel gets away with doing the minimum possible to keep people from complaining and continue to take their money.

I did not feel comfortably at our superior double room....one small window, dark room , metall sink in the bathroom, maybe used to be modern and funky.....Unfriendly staff....Seeing the rooms at the internet I was all excited about staying at the Nylo and than a big disappointment....

My husband and I always stay here a few times a year when we are in town but the last two times our bathroom wasn't clean and there were big brown stains on the sheets. I don't know if they changed management but the quality has gone way down and it is really dissapointing.

Well managed, casual and fun hotel. Perfect for Columbia/Barnard parents, and anyone with business on the upper west side. Great location. Everything nearby. Staff friendly and helpful. Cool lounge, excellent place to meet folks or relax after a day in the city. Many good eating opportunities nearby, close to subway stop.

We found this hotel to be an exceptional location for access to both Columbia on the upper west side as well as tourist attractions in midtown, etc. The neighborhood is excellent for great dining and easy walking distance to Lincoln center. The rooms were extremely small but they were pleasantly decorated with very fine linens and a comfortable bed. If I were here for the luxury of my hotel room alone, I might have chosen another spot, but I was in town for Columbia graduation and it was the perfect choice. Very convenient and stylish.

Good location, nice Italian restaurant, but rooms itself very basic. Definitely not 4* experience. Quite noisy from both outside and inside - mean if someone talking outside you here it like door is open.

I have been staying at this hotel for years (or when it was more SRO and knows as On The Avenue). I love the neighborhood--I lived here for years before moving to LA. And I can deal with the inflated prices ($9 for a draught beer?). For the most part it has been a great convenience. But this last experience included a dock that would not lock, moving rooms and then three days trying to track down lost items--stuff that was left in the first room. That is of course for me, but my phone calls to the front desk, to security and my conversations with the concierge over three days produced exactly NO response. No one got back to me. The 'lost and found" seems permanently lost.

We were recently at NYLO for 3 nights while visiting for our daughter's graduation. The hotel must have been completely booked. We were on the 16th floor, which is nice and quiet. Also the floor with the outdoor terrace. As others have mentioned, the beds are very comfortable. Rooms are sparsely furnished, but very functional.If you want to be on the Upper West Side, the location is perfect and very close to so many things, including a subway station.The main floor is small and somewhat funky, in a good way. A very nice long work table with plenty of plug-in spots and free wi-fi. Always several people there, but even with a full hotel I was always able to find a spot to work. Nice reading chairs, and a small, but pleasant main floor bar with cabaret tables on one side, and upholstered furniture on the other side. Different moods in each spot.The front desk wasn't at its best, but was also overwhelmed with the large number of guests for Columbia's graduation. I have no real complaints, but it was not warm or friendly (even by NYC standards).We did not eat in the restaurant. There is a nice local bagel shop around the corner - fresh bagels, hot coffee, a slice of NYC morning life, at a very reasonable price. One of the doormen gave us the tip.Check it out if you want to be on the Upper West Side. It is worth paying a bit more to be on one of their upper floors.

We were charged more for room 204 than for room 1502. Please explain why? We are challenging the charge with American Express. Room 204 did not have hot water until faucet ran for more then 10 minutes. Room 1502 was rediculously small. Panaramic view advortised changes Webster's definition of the word.Elevator wait for 15th floor took 10 minutes on one occasion, totally unaccetable.

Modern installations, very friendly staff and a spectacular atmosphere in the evenings in a newyorker scenary. Very good cocktails!! The breakfast at Serafina's were another good point. I would return indeed.

I stayed at this hotel for one night for business. At 3:30am, I was awoken by the garbage truck. It seemed I was sleeping right above where they keep the trash container. I could even hear their wheels as they were pulling them out. If it was 6am, I wouldn't have a problem with it but 3:30am is a bit absurd.When I called the front desk to complaint about the noise because I couldn't believe what was happening, I was told that only out of towners have complaint about it and there was nothing they could do. In the morning, while checking out, I asked to speak with the manager and he rudely replied that there was nothing he could do. Furthermore, he patronized me when he tried to convince me that he had no control on the city's garbage pickup schedule as well as fire trucks or ambulances. Unfortu, after paying $450 a night for the room, I at least expected them to be polite, apologetic, understanding and even a bit professional. Some sort of credit / refund might have made me feel better but the manager didn't care about my horrible night and declined to do anything about it.

Great location. Awesome customer service including front desk, concierge, housekeeping and front door. Rooms were a decent size, fairly clean but somewhat cheaply redone. Good action in the common area main floor.

Room was ok, good size nice TV. The view was a construction elevator. Front desk was unable (unwilling ?) to change a king size for twin beds. WI-FI was complicated to connect following their instructions; after talking to three people and two recordings was given a complimentary one day connection. In NYC and with the rates they charge WI-FI should be complimentary for at least three days and they should have better support people.

Whenever I come to NYC to be with my family NYLO is my first choice. I have never been disappointed with the location, price, cleanliness, or customer service. You find yourself in walking distance to so many places. And if you need assistance with finding anything the staff is always accommodating. Each time I visit I see more people enjoying the lounge and library area.

I have stayed at this hotel for the first time since it has been refurbished and both the rooms as well as the lobby area look really nice. This is not a luxury hotel but the quality is good and the room prices (at least during the period when I was there) are reasonable.

First, I paid extra for a room with an 'expansive view' and got a view of a construction site. The room was very small and very very expensive. The concrete floor when you enter the hotel is a tip off. The dark gloomy lobby is another and the long wait to check in is another. This is a very pathetic hotel that charges over $500 a night for a mediocre room. I would spend more just to avoid this dump.

This is a hotel with "modern" room designs, wood floors, . We stayed in a "Deluxe King" room with a very comfortable bed. The check in is across from the bar and the lobby is offset from the bar. While we would stay at the hotel again, they mixed up our reservations. They were not able to fulfill their room confirmation for either the correct night or room that we had booked on either our check in date or the following day. The front desk was helpful if constrained by the mistake. The new room we were reassigned was facing a wall - this room assignment was unbelievable. Luckily, the desk manager gave us the option of staying in the same room. Thank you. The restaurant next store to the hotel is good. The 4.0 rating discounts the reservation problem.

Was there for business again for two nights. Same drill as the last stay a few months ago. Front desk is just rude, management is the same. I requested a quiet room, so was given something that looked out onto a brick wall - no daylight whatsoever. Wouldn't have been a problem if it were not for the fact that the alley acted as an echo chamber for some construction vehicle. When I asked to change rooms because of the noise, I was interrogated with incredibility. The change occurred, but even simple requests of the front desk were met with disdain. It appears to be limited to the morning shift and the desk manager. But as I said in a prior review, it has become a deeper problem. Simple requests that would be routine at a quality establishment are dismissed out of hand. Use only as a fallback (with graduation week many hotels were fully booked) - there are many other hotels in the city that will actually extend themselves to provide a quality experience.

Stayed at NYLO NYC for Mother's Day Weekend and my daughter's Accappella concert at Columbia University. NYLO took great care of me from the moment my cab pulled to the entrance. Beautiful modern design. Very clean rooms and comfortable beds with very soft, high quality linens. Our booking included free breakfast at Serafina, which was an easy and delicious way to start our mornings. Service was a bit slow, but it was free so we didn't mind. Overall, I think NYLO is a great place to start a NYC visit, especially for families visiting Columbia University. Just two short blocks to the 79th St. Subway station and then 3 stops straight up Broadway to the 116th St. Columbia U main gate.

Our stay was fine, and the price is reasonable compared to other hotels in the area. NYLO is a good hotel when you need to be in the upper part of town. The floor of our room was dirty the first day & we didn't get any towels the second (no hand towels, floor towel, nothing, but they took all of our old ones). When I notified the front desk they brought up a set. Overall, we didn't spend much time in the room, but for the price & location, they are nice. We go to visit family, but the location is great if you want to be close to the museums and Central Park. The neighborhood is one of my favorites and it is much more laid back than staying in a more touristy area like Times Square. We will certainly stay here again.

We stayed at the Nylo for the first time when we were in New York for my daughter's graduation from Columbia University and to see her new apartment on West 68th Street. The Nylo was in the perfect location for doing both! Seriously, the Nylo is truly close to everything (or just a short subway, taxi, or Uber ride away). The lobby of the hotel is great, filled with cushy couches, a room with computers and tables with comfortable chairs, and a bar. We had a fairly large queen-queen suite room, with two beds (although I don't think they were queen sized), a desk with chair, and a small couch. The bathroom was huge with a wonderful sink and a great shower. Even though our room faced the street, it was, by New York standards, fairly quiet. My only complaint is about the cleanliness of the floors in both our room and in our bathroom. I had to pick up several strands of long hair (definitely not ours) and a fair number of plastic pieces cut off from clothing tags. I found having to do that rather unpleasant and should not have been necessary. With that being the only negative, however, I would highly recommend the Nylo for its location and overall quality.

It was a nice place, great location. I was disappointed that there were no robes in the room. We arrived early from the airport and we were tired. The check in lady was really rude with an attitude and I knew there was no way we would get a room a minute before 4 pm check in. I could have done without the bad attitude. Other than that, it was a good place to stay and we would keep it in mind.

Pros: It's located in a great area on 77th and Broadway in the Upper West Side of Manhattan. I preferred neighborhood to just about any other neighborhood I went into. Great shops ,street vendors,restaurants and bars. It was for the most part clean and housekeeping came every day and did their thing accordingly. With fantastic views on the upper floors of the Upper West Side and the Hudson River.The bar downstairs was adequate. Bartenders were great.The staff was also nice and accommodating.Good windows that filter out street traffic.And here's a big one ...probably one of the best Hotel Beds I've ever slept on. Fantastic beds and bedding!!! Nelson a hotel driver is awesome, is a local, and has a lot of info on the area. Don't be afraid to use the car service once you're at the hotel; it cost about the same as a taxi but is a lot cleaner and a little faster.Cons: There is no room service!!! None...Elevators are slow.The breakfast package is only for a small part of the menu downstairs at sarafina's. So if you do not like the those items you have to pay for any other items. If you eat a healthy breakfast, then yogurt and berries is all you can really get with the breakfast package. They don't serve oatmeal. Breakfast is only served until 11a in the morning. If you plan to sleep in don't get the package. Your wasting money.The doors on the rooms are thin and you can hear everything down the hallway. The windows however are good and you cannot hear street traffic hardly at all.I spent 5 days there an average of $400+ a night, for a room with a tiny terrace. Prior to my stay wrote the hotel about my birthday an anniversary on a particular day...not even so much as a chocolate on the pillow. Let alone mimosas. So, in my opinion definitely missing the little warm fuzzies that other 4 star hotels I've stayed at have. Also I don't know how the hotel gets four stars it does not have a salon Spa or room service.!!!! Other than that, it was a good place in a great area!!! With great beds!!!

Hallways were dirty. The room I had the first time I stayed was big and comfortable. It felt special. Not so much this time, the room was half the size but cost the I same as the first time. Bathroom was too small

An excellent hotel to feel at home in Manhattan. Besides the ideal location, spacious rooms, incredibly comfortable mattresses and terrific ambiance in the hotel bar-lobby — they allow dogs! I don't have a dog but I do like hanging out with them in the bar-lobby. This was my 5th visit and I will definitely be returning.

Great location safe and near subway and great dining. Hotel beds very comfy, mouse level low, love the common balcony area. Lively bar and guest area. Construction going on on street, but crews were polite and work did not go into the evening. Great access to museums and Central Park.

Very rude managers, small corridors,minimal amenities, poor/non existent assistance, running water only gets hot 20 minutes after. No perks of staying in a similarly priced hotel. Nice decor Though and nice residents here.The Bartenders are friendly, and helpful. Gate staff and cleaning staff are as well.

Most comfortable beds! Great location close to park and subway. We loved the neighborhood. Loved the boutique feel of this hotel. The bar/lounge area was lovely as was the rooftop seating area. Clean rooms, large shower, and did I mention - most comfortable bed?!?

Great beds, amazing location, excellent service. Responsive staff. Be sure to check and doublecheck website for price changes or sales - we saved $200 because we "looked again." Corner room was quiet and comfortable. Thanks, NYLO, keep up the great work!

We stayed on the upper west because we love the easy access to subway and the ambience of the neighborhoods. But, be prepared for very small rooms, and cold furniture that to me felt like a very upscale dorm room. They also put a riduculous high hold on my business credit card that made it hard for me to use it at other places during my stay. In addition the restaurant connected to the hotel is a very expensive breakfast that doesn't allow for any options.
user_name:
Trudy J
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 5 days and 4 nights, we got a discounted rate for staying for 4 nights on their website. We got the smallest room they had which was still more than enough space for the two of us. The shower was really great and the room was very clean. The bed was very comfortable!The location of the hotel is the best part. Just a few blocks away from Central Park, near two good subway locations and across the street from a CVS. We stopped by there for water almost every day. There was some construction going on down the street but it didn't bother us at all (and we're late sleepers). The staff was super helpful and very nice. I highly recommend this hotel and if we ever get the chance to visit again we will definitely be staying here!

Spent the weekend here as an anniversary getaway with my husband. We wanted a place close to the park (very!) with a great bar (delicious!) and a truly restful sleeping experience (no kids!). NYLO delivered on all fronts. The neighborhood is terrific. Away from the insanity of midtown, but close to great restaurants, Central Park and an easy walk to the theatre district. We stayed in a panoramic deluxe room--king bed, MASSIVE patio (probably the same square footage as the room?) and a wonderfully comfortable bed. Was the room tight? Yes. Who cares? It was immaculate, had massive windows and was as quiet as can be. The staff was friendly, valet service worth every penny. We will most definitely return to NYLO!

Great weekend stay for a first trip to NYC. Concierge and staff were helpful and extremely friendly. Hotel is within walking distance to most museums as well as Central Park. We returned to a perfectly cleaned room after every excursion!

This is a quaint hotel in a great area of New York City, away from the crowds. Been there twice, and we have made it our NYC hotel. There's everything you need a few blocks away: restaurants, bars, coffee shops and some shopping. Highly recommend it!

You feel like a "New Yorker" the minute you step into the lobby. The bar opens to the street and you can sit and watch the people parade, Rooms are small,even by New York standards. Best hotel bed I have ever slept on. Wonderful water pressure in their well appointed shower. Hotel front desk staff no the most friendly but very efficient.The offering of breakfast is a little stretched, you get a $10 coupon for the attached cafe.If you need to visit the upper west side give this property serious consideration.

I would give 1 star, however they did give an upgrade to a cute room with patio and view. Too bad it was filthy and even after the housekeeper came back it was still very dirty. The toilet seat was gross. There was a used water bottle on the counter, shower was dirty.

wonderful hotel on the upper west side. lots of restaurants to choose from in the neighborhood. The restaurant attached to the hotel was good too. QuietNice areas to hang out and socialize2 blocks to the subway

I really enjoyed my stay. But it's been 3 days since I checked out and still don't have my 50 dollar deposit back. I usually get my deposit back asap. This little situation is messing up a good experience.

For location and price it is very difficult to beat the NYLO. My son and I try to do weekend trips to NYC every 6-8 weeks and NYLO is our go-to hotel! Rooms are immaculate, roomy, and comfy. Lobby bar and library are favorite places to sit at night after a fun day and read a book and enjoy a glass of wine. Fabulous choice!

This hotel is in a great location. It was easy to get to Central Park, the subway, shopping, restaurants and theaters. The rooms are quiet. I did not stay in the Penthouse or an upper floor though I hear that is the best experience. The staff is friendly and anticipate what you need. I liked the 1st floor bar and places to hang out in the lobby. It blended well with the neighborhood, the best neighborhood in Manhattan! I used to live their so I may be biased.

Great location and very friendly and helpful staff. Hotel has a really lovely vibe and ambiance. There is construction happening across the street which makes it noisy during working hours, but did not detract form the overall good experience. I would stay there again, even with the ongoing construction.

Great location. Room generous and quiet -- views of surrounding walls. No mini-bar (that's fine) or refidgerator. Rather tacky metal cabinets but a real effort put into decor otherwise. No breakfast. Good service although can be a bit inattentive

Great restaurants attached, friendly staff, comfy bed. Have stayed 4 times and it never disappoints. Location is convenient to the best parts of NYC. Have tried other Upper West hotels and keep coming back!
