There was enough space inside the room. Very clean and feels like home. The fact that it separate the bed side from living area caught my attention. The hotel reminded me some kind of Europian style :)

We returned for a 2nd 5 day visit to the hotel. It is a nice hotel. This time we choose a room with a patio. It was awesome to sit outside sipping some wine. The location is mid point on the west side. We enjoy walking, so we loved the extra walk from the NYLO to all points on the Manhattan Island.

Located at upper east side near Columbus circle, easy to find by taxi. Great proximity to Central Park and national history museum. Rooms are small and clean, but nothing out of the ordinary - everything is there but there is a personal touch lacking in terms of style. The bar downstairs and reception area is promising as very funky and upbeat but rooms let down a bit. Service was very average, we often had to open the big hotel doors ourselves as doormen were too busy elsewhere and the check in and check out is relatively transactional compared to other boutique hotels. Overall we had a good stay but in terms of value for money there are better places out there when it comes to boutique hotels in NYC.

Pleasantly surprised. Nice location away from the hustle and bustle of touristy places but close enought to Central Park and subway to get to them. Room was spacious and bed was comfortable. The patio on 14th floor was great.

We went to New York for 4 nights/5days. The hotel was in a great location on the upper west side. Approximately a 25 minute walk to Times Square and only a couple of blocks to a subway station. Our room on the 8th floor was gorgeous and I have to say that the bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! We had a window, however, it looked out onto a concrete wall, although we only slept in the hotel and spent very little time in it, due to being out and about exploring so much, so having a view didn't really matter to us. The hotel itself was modern with an industrial feel to it and in excellent condition. However, unfortunately there were a number of small issues which resulted in us being a little disappointed with our stay. On our first morning we woke up very early due to the time difference/jetlag so we got up to get in the shower around 6am, aiming to get out for an early walk and breakfast. The hot water was not switched on, so we had to delay leaving the hotel. This happened daily. Equally, in the evenings we wouldn't get back to the hotel until gone 11pm (one night it was gone midnight) and If we wanted a shower or even a wash in the sink we weren't able to have one, as the hot water had been switched off. Secondly the hotel staff weren't too friendly. As mentioned we didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel but whenever we did ask the staff a question they weren't very helpful and seemed too busy to help. We experienced fantastic customer service whilst in New York in restaurants etc. But unfortunately our hotel did not match this. Sometimes the reception area smelt like drains too.When booking the NYLO hotel with Expedia, we weren't made aware at the point of booking that there was a skyscraper being built opposite the hotel. The sound of jackhammers began at 7am so if people are looking to spend quite a lot of time in the hotel and want to sleep in in the morning this is not the hotel for you. There was a note in our room on arrival apologising for the inconvenience but this was the first we heard of it. Most of these issues I have mentioned didn't really bother us too much due to the fact that we only used the hotel as a base. It was great for that and purely on that basis we would definitely stay again. The shower issue was particularly frustrating for us and I can imagine that the other issues would affect those guests wanting to spend more time relaxing in the hotel.

Great location, with excellent links into the heart of Manhatten. 5 mins max subway to Times Square. Great bar downstairs and great eateries nearby. Rooms are great big enough for what we wanted and are maintained well

Would recommend to friends and family. Staff was very friendly and always willing to help. Loved the appearance of the hotel. Great value and location. Only two blocks from the subway! CVS across the street made late night snacks and quick runs super easy!

Very convenient location, good value, inviting and comfortable, cozy lobby, very pleasant and helpful hotel staff, had a room with a terrace and nice view, convenient CVS store across the street, great coffee shops near by...had a wonderful stay!

High quality services, industrial building and a vibe based on the New York’s Jazz era. The hotel is located in the Upper West side, outside of the crazy midtown but not far away. Comfortable rooms and excellent bed! Friendly staff. Nice bar at the lobby and good restaurant (open until 11pm).

An incredible hotel in a great location. All of the hotel staff were brilliant especially Matt who, on hearing that my I had proposed to my girlfriend during the trip, made our stay extra special. The hotel bar has a great atmosphere and the cocktails are delicious. Overall an amazing hotel and special thanks to Matt for everything he did for us.
user_name:
Matthew M
St Agnes, United Kingdom

review_body: Our purpose of the trip was Visiting NY. We preferred to stay at the upper west side of NY. We had a pleaent stay at the NYLO and we are recomabding this hotel. The entrance is nice the bar is great and rooms are fair.

The hotel has a very good vibe. From the staff to the bar to the library, everything is very well done! The bed was super comfortable and if you ask for a room in the back, though no view at all, it is very quiet.

My review is best summarised by the following:- Great location: Walking distance to central park / Near subway / Great neighbourhood with lots of fine restaurants- Friendly people at the hotel- Spacious rooms with good facilities

I had to move to another hotel because I hated this one. Staff looked unhappy and did not concern themselves with welcoming guests or making guests happy. Hotel cannot be classed at 4 star while lacking basic customer service. It is also the only hotel that does not allow one to pay for their room upfront. Ridiculous!
user_name:
chinweo291
New York City, New York

review_body: Very comfortable, fresh and tidy room with a superb relaxed location at the airy Upper West Side, within walking distance from Central Park, several museums and opera.The bar is cosy, yet very noisy on a crowdy night. Friendly staff everywhere, quick checkin/checkout. I do not need to think about where to stay next time when going to NYC.2 subway stations nearby, just check out which lines stop at each. All trains do not let you step out at the nearby stations.

I love this hotel - it has atmosphere, nice rooms and a great bar for having a chilled drink. I would strongly recommend it for a short trip to new York if you need to be near Central Park or Upper West side.

My stay at Nylo was lovely. The neighborhood is just perfect and the hotel service is high quality. I would definitely stay again. Front desk staff should be friendlier, but concierge and luggage attendants are great. Cleanness and general environment of the hotel is excellent. Prices --a bit high. But very, very recommendable.

Returned from New York today after a fantastic week, it was my first visit and I was lucky enough to stay at this hotel. The hotel itself is clean and all staff are very welcoming, the bar area is very stylish and always busy with a great atmosphere. The standard room (1012) was perfect for what it was needed for, catching up on sleep and freshening up. The bed however is the standout feature, it's massive and probably the most comfortable bed myself and my wife have ever slept in, I'm not much of a pillow can myself but these pillows you just sink into.Thanks NYLO New York for your hospitality, if I can ever afford to visit New York again I wouldn't hesitate to use this hotel for its excellent value and location.

Location is great, especially if you are into fitness, as there are studios galore within a 5 block radius. Red Farm an excellent restaurant...I would give this hotel 5 stars if room service were available and checkout from TV was an option.

If you want a simple, clean, contemporary no frills place to stay in NYC then it's a good choice. The decor is better than most other hotels in this category. The lobby is not stuffy and caters to a younger crowd with a bar lounge mixed together near reception. Etc. Rooms clean and simple although a small fridge would be nice especially if you stay for more than 3-4 days on your own. Amenities like gym could be better but all in all comfortable hotel.

There was a ring of mold behind the magnifying mirror in the bathroom that was pretty gross. Also there was a bit of gritty dirt on the floor. Not noticeable but could feel it in bare feet. The lobby seemed a bit dirty, as did the outside of the entrance way to the hotel.

NYLO is a stylish hotel on the West Side close to the subway station. Serafina was convenient for breakfast, and the service there was excellent. The bed and room were so comfortable! The gym had working machines but lacked TV screens that would be viewed while running.

I stayed here because a client put me here. It was close to the venue I was working. Like anything, the hotel has a great look, and probably looks great in photos, but customer service was average at best. The doormen were busy talking each other instead of opening doors. They have a lift to get from the ground door to the next level, but it isn't always operational. Nice Bells, but needs a good whistle. The bed was great, rooms were average, to small. For the price that the client was paying, it should have been a LOT better.

This cozy hotel is in a great location if you like the upper West side. The room tho small, was clean, great bed, no carpet which I love , was simple and to the point. The bathroom on the other hand was not so easy to deal with, the sink took up most of the space, a 2 inch deep sink and there was no room at all for even a makup bag or toothbrush. Could have used a simple bench or table with a normal sink and been just fine. They gave us free wi fi to make up for the discomfort.

I pick this hotel based on location and star rating. Overall I liked it and would probably stay again. First the negatives:The room was spartan, not comfortable place to sit, just a desk chair or the bed, The TV was on the window sill so not a very good angle to watch it. There was construction going on the floor I was staying on, a bit noisy but not terrible. There were no instructions or maps in the room for dining or even the ice machine, I still have no idea where it was. The view was of a wall, now that is not a big deal for me you can always pay more for a view if you really want one. The bed was comfortable but the mattress kept sliding off the foundation. WIFI is extra which in this day and age I think is ridiculous.On the positive side:The room was clean and bug freethe bar in lobby is nice and there is lots of lounge type seating which almost makes up for there being no comfortable seating in the room. I felt safe, there was a large security presence in the lobby bar area the public area were also cleanthe restaurant that is attached was quite goodthe staff was great

My boyfriend and I stayed at the Nylo NYC last weekend to celebrate our one year anniversary. Our room was immaculate and spacious (especially for NYC standards) and the service quite nice. Our only complaint was the check-in time: 4 pm! In our extensive travel experience, hotels typically have rooms ready to greet guests at 3 pm - which comes in particularly handy when you've had an early morning flight and have been on your feet walking all day! Despite asking politely at 9:50 in the morning if our room could possible be ready for 3 - the desk staff were adamant about 4 pm. It was the only service I'd recommend to the staff to re-think. Otherwise, the hotel was clean, beautifully located on the UWS and steps to so many awesome restaurants, the park and the museum of natural History. Considering a little stay in New York? Give Nylo a try.

The room was spotless and surprisingly quiet if the HVAC wasn't running. The bathroom was great except for the sole towel bar hiding at knee level under the sink. The staff was pleasant. The lobby and library like bar were cozy and chic. It was surprising that with everything else done so right, that the only free wifi was in the lobby.

Plywood furniture and hanging lights, someone has been watching too much HGTV. Oh, and the toilet was dirty. There was massive construction outside my windows which made it noisy. The location was fabulous.

All the amenities you could want in an ideal location for a city trip. Decor was a little dark for me, but others thought it was cool. Service was fine; I had checked in with a group, but that wasn't noted at registration.

My smallest issue is the smallness of the rooms. I paid a hefty upgrade price but felt cheated by the size of the room. Everything else was very good. It was raining heavily and the hotel ensured there were plenty of umbrellas.

The hotel interior was not very well kept. 2 out of the 3 times I tried to reach a front desk operator they never answered. I was charged extra for a king bed when my booking stated bot Kong and queen where available. Would not recommend this hotel at all!

the location is good but everthing else was average for a high price Service was excellent; good breakfast conceirge was great We would not return we stay at other hotels for better quality and price but firnes were staying here. It was okay to do this

From the moment you enter the cozy lobby and bar area you feel most welcomed.The desk staff is efficient and helpful. The rooms are clean, climate controlled, beds are confortable, sheets lovely, extra pillows to make your stay enjoyable.

everything very comfortable, room, common spaces, bar, working area, restaurant... very good internet connection. Subeway three blocks away, connection to line 1,2,3 what lets you go to anywhere in the city very quck.

Cool and comfy boutique hotel with good vibe and awesome location. Dog friendly, fun lobby and rooftop bars, great location, and modern/eclectic/chic design. Would definitely stay here again. We were able to walk to Central Park and a lot of great nearby shops and restaurants.

The Nylo is New York at its best. The team, unique decor, facilities and rooms exemplify why this city is so special. Thank you all for looking after me so well, your high standards and attention to detail.

This hotel has it ALL. The rooms are perfect- central air- fantastic toiletries, wifi, Kuerig and a view. In the summer there is an outdoor bar on a terrace on one of the higher floors. Perfect for a relaxing drink after a long busy day. There are literally hundreds of restaurants, shops, cafes and comedy shows within seconds of the front door. The theater district is a beautiful 20 minutes stroll down Broadway. The lobby bar is amazing- with plush couches and live music right in YOUR hotel lobby!!! I just LOVE this hotel!!

Very comfortable beds, big shower and a Keurig an instant coffee in the morning. This hotel has a nice bar and restaurant attached and everything is within walking distance. They also gave us a room upgrade when we arrived. Bonus!

Very good very comfortable beds. Excellent lobby & bar area. Great library area where you could have a glass of wine. Close to subway and many great bars and restaurants. Room very comfortable and quiet.

I'm usually a midtown girl. At the request of my colleague, I stayed at Nylo. I loved it! From the hotel stay, food and the lounge, it was a place I truly enjoyed. I will be back again and recommend it to the business traveler and the NYC vacationer. I

I have returned to the NYLO several times over the course of four years and will continue. There front office staff is the best! Don't miss this lovely experience. You can count on the NYLO Hotel to meet your needs.

Hotel is very well located in the heart of Upper West. Very nice lobby and bar downstairs + the convenience of next door neighbor all day restaurant Serafina's. Great room with complimentary coffee/tea, very clean and silent. Super friendly and helpfull staff.

Good West Side location and great bar. Clean lines to the room but really spartan when it comes to storing. The absence of carpeting is great for pets but cold. Plan ahead for your shower unless you like the water cold. It got warm but no kidding it took several minutes to do so. So much for the green emphasis

Love NYLO...this was my 6th visit. Great and welcoming staff. Rooms are comfortable. Lobby and Bar are an inviting space that makes it easy to make new friends! We enjoy the food at Serifina so if you are tired you can relax there! Rates are reasonable on the weekends. Red Farm is next door...excellent restaurant. Lots of construction around the Hotel so it can be noisy.

I love the location of this hotel in that it's out of the theater district and feels more "New York" and less touristy, even though admittedly, I am a tourist. Busses and subways are close by; lots of food choices are handy; and no where is really all that far away it seems. Was particularly impressed with Kiara Kortega who checked us in. We were early check-ins but had had a rather harrowing experience (our cab was rear-ended by a water truck coming in from LGA) and she was more than gracious. She let us change our room to one with a tub which was really what we needed more than a doctor.

Deadbolt on door did not work, construction noise was terrible, previous guest washcloth left in shower, paper thin walls, never received promised complimentary cocktail email. It's a shame because it is really a cute little place.

The hotel is situated in a great place near Central Park and the subway. The interior is decorated well and the two restaurants are convenient and the bar made good and unique drinks. However, I felt the staff was a bit stiff. We were there with our 12 year old daughter and no one ever greeted her. Also our first room didn't match what I had booked and we were told, "Well you pre-paid so this is actually fairly good." I didn't realize paying ahead of time was a penalty nor did I appreciate the attitude that came with it. Also the waitress was unwilling to adjust our order after she placed it as she said it would be too hard to void and re-enter. At Serafina gratuity is included and we felt there was little motivation to provide strong service. That said the rooms were a great size for the city and the terrace was a great place to enjoy the Hudson and views of the Park. I just wish the staff had been friendlier.

NYLO is in a Great location with small rooms, a minimalist bathroom, plush bedding, and paper thin walls. The Lobby/bar area was warm, inviting and lively. The front desk staff was accommodating. Try to find a package that includes wifi. Otherwise you are limited to 1/2 hour of computer time in the lobby. Parking is also ridiculously expensive but you can find street parking in the area if you are willing to walk and move your car in the morning. Consider The Belleclaire hotel down the street. It is quieter and includes wifi.

Although the room was small, it was well appointed and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and well maintained. The hotel is extremely clean. The hotel has a wonderful bar/lounge and a restaurant that was top notch. We has a wonderful night stay and highly recommend NYLO.

My husband and I planned a quick one night trip to NYC to see our son perform in an acappella competition at the Beacon Theater. NYLO was convenient in that it was literally right around the corner from the Beacon...the hotel itself was clean and welcoming. Everyone at the hotel was more than helpful and friendly. Our room was a standard sized room for the city. It was no frills but also very clean ... loved that there was no rug on the floor in the room -- the wood felt much cleaner underfoot. The king-sized bed was very comfortable and the bedding was cozy. I would definitely stay at NYLO again and would recommend.

My wife and I went on a belated honeymoon to NYC and had a great time. Hotel-wise, we spent very little time in the hotel room, except to sleep and get ready for each day. Bed was extremely comfortable but our limited view room was in a bad spot and was interrupted each morning by nearby construction. It happens...not the end of the world. Thought it was odd to not have a mini-fridge and our bottled water was never refreshed. The lounge area would certainly appeal to a certain crowd but offered little to us. Business Center was a nice amenity, even though Kinkos is nearby, as our multiple subway stops. Price-wise...as we got closer to the date, we would have saved several hundred dollars (equivalent of a free night) had we re-booked apart from AAA. Location was great for the plans we had: short distance from Central Park, just a few subway stops until Times Square and close to hop on/off tour buses.

The room was very cool and quieteThe room was very cleanI' ll come back here for sure The people are very kindThe area was very nice and there is a metro at walking distance I' ll recommend Nylo hotel

It has been some time that I have been back to NYLO/OTA as my job has changed however I was glad to see that the things that I enjoy are still present and strong at NYLO. So great to see Lenny, Chris and the rest of the staff there and accommodating as always. I was able to show off NOLA and the Upper West Side to my co-workers like it really is my neighborhood. Thanks for the great stay. Derrick

This was our second stay at NYLO. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are comfortable. The decor of the hotel is chic. The location is great. We were even able to find street parking a few blocks away. We will definitely come back again.

This hotel has a vibrant bar and lounge, but the rooms are quiet. Friendly staff! The rooms are clean, beds are comfortable, and furnishings are industrial modern. The bathroom tiles and finishes are done well. The room and bathroom are small relative to non-urban settings; spacious for Manhattan. The hotel is fairly close to Lincoln Center, Central Park and residential neighborhoods with brownstones. The subway is close and just ten minutes from Times Square. Always ask for upper floors in NYC to avoid street noise. Great value for NYC!

We had our daughter's wedding reception at Columbia University's Faculty House and NYLO is conveniently located to the Faculty House. The after wedding party held in the NYLO Bar area was just a blast and this hotel has a very "hip" feeling to it. Great for the newlyweds and their friends.

My stay was comfortable and pleasant. The maid service was excellent. The room and bathroom were clean and tidy.My one suggestions is that grab bars should be installed in the showers. I am a senior citizen, who is getting a little unsteady on my feet.

My daughter and I stayed at the NYLO last weekend for her 16th birthday celebration weekend. We had a wonderful time. The room was clean and comfortable and the bathroom is newly renovated. We enjoyed eating breakfast in SERAFINA, the restaurant in the lobby of the hotel. Food was great. And the lobby was bustling with cool and hip people. It felt like a happening place. Can't wait to come back this summer!!

it was great the hotel the staff. will be back very soon .the room had a great view of the Hudson River and a nice table for our breakfast in the morning.very close to central park just a great time almost treated us like family

Requested to have room cleaned after we checked in and found dirt and hair all over the floor. Finally after our FOURTH request, 3 days later our floor was cleaned. Very unhappy. We asked the front desk during each request to make sure housekeeping was notified. Never done until day before our departure.

Great location, close to subwaystation(s), friendly staff, great hotel lobby with live musicin the evening, good Italian restaurant, small but modern, clean rooms, expensive and expensive house intern transoprt to the airport jfk

Comfortable room, hip furnishings and helpful staff made our stay at NYLO very enjoyable! We have stayed at the NYLO several times and always enjoy the experience. The hotel is convenient to great restaurants and shops. Serafina, the restaurant in the hotel is a terrific spot for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Request Room 1008! I've stayed at the NYLO several times - but this time we opened the door to Room 1008 and were so pleased to see a large hotel room! There was plenty of room to spread out, use the desk area for work, relax in a reading chair, and OMG - the bathroom was huge! The front desk was also very accommodating in extending my reservation by one night and allowing us to stay in the same room - thank you! We'll be back!

Stayed here for only one night but had a great time. The location is just perfect for exploring the Upper West side. I would have usually stayed in Midtown but wanted to escape the crowds and this hotel hit the spot.Staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was quiet, comfortable with a great big king sized bed, bathroom was huge for a New York hotel. Decor was modern, with a touch of steampunk.Bar was very lively on Friday night, bar staff were very energetic and seemed to be having great fun with the customers. Great range of beers and cocktails.Only minor complaint I'd have would be in relation to the cost of the wifi, $14 a day was a bit steep.

Enjoyed staying at NYLO this trip & the last one in Dec2014. Nice and quiet. Lobby and bar area is friendly and relaxing. Staff was very attentive and helpful. Will definetly stay at NYLO next time I come back to NYC.

I love this hotel, I´ve stayed here a couple of times and the location is perfect if your plans include running and wandering around central park (there is also a couple of subway stations nearby). The neighbourhood is quiet at night so is not much of an option if you are seeking nightlife. The hotel is very well maintained and the staff is always friendly and helpful

Very nice room. The bar is very comfortable as well. The room was extra large and the beds are excellent. There's always a bit of street noise in New York, but that was minimal. We enjoyed our stay a lot.

Great staff - great location. Restaurant in hotel is excellent for breakfast and quite reasonable. They offer a airport pu service for $75. including tips and taxes. Well worth it. Nice big black suburban. It wasn't offer when I booked the room, only upon departure so you should definitely inquire. Uber was $87.

Clean room facing north (77th St.). Unfortunately, due to building construction across the street it was a bit noisy during working hours. When mentioned that, during check out, the desk manager apologized and offered a little price discount. The room was well appointed, but a small small fridge (minibar) would be nice especially in view of the fact that there is only one ice machine for 12 floors. Although, there were a couple of NY city generic magazines, I missed the TV channel list for the 38 or so available channels. The free WiFi in the lobby was fast enough and simple to log in.

I stay here frequently and have a consistently good experience. There's construction around the hotel but it isn't a major issue. The restaurant and bar are quite good. The location is convenient with easy access to subway.

I have stayed at NYLO NYC countless times -- and for good reason -- it's an amazing small hotel in the best neighborhood in Manhattan. And the staff is amazing and the rooms are wonderful! Thank you, NYLO NYC for a wonderful stay! I'll see you soon!

After more than 15 NYLO visits, I will probably not go back. I was happy to be checked in 2 hours early. My Superior room was very small - 921 - with two small windows 3 or 4 feet from a brick building. So, no natural sunlight. The air conditioner did not work. Prompt help could not fix the problem, so I was given a new room - 1028- , somewhat larger and sunnier with nice.Broadway view. But, there was no desk and no chair !! A chair was promptly provided....but my intent to work was quite hampered.

I stated in a loft at the NYLO and it was fantastic. Elevator was a bit scary as it is one of those were you have the feeling it will get stuck at some point but had no issues during my stay. No ice on the floors so you must go down to the bar to obtain. No room service as well and have to go downstairs to obtain. Small nitpicks and would definitely stay agin.

I lived in NYC for ten years and have visited frequently over the years. The NYLO is a friendly, convenient, Upper West-side boutique hotel with a restaurant and bar (that we did not visit) a comfortable public area with printing and computer facilities (that we did use) and a very friendly and helpful staff. We had a standard room which was not large, but the bed was excellent, there was ample room for folded and hanging clothes, toiletries and a decent shower tub. AND - the price was very reasonable! We took the Internet Package which is a great deal as I believe there is an extra charge for in room WiFi without this package. The staff was particularly friendly and helpful and we will return!

We were very impressed with the NYLO and couldn't fault anything. The ambience in the bar and lounge was great and we had a nightcap most evenings to be part of it.The large and comfortable bed ,the design of the room were excellent as was the location. We would stay again and recommend it to anyone going to New York

Enjoyed staying here on a recent holiday to New York. Although the room is small, it is clean and the bed is very comfortable. There is also a subway nearby and a supermarket on your doorstop. Very convenient!

Pros:-THE BED! Holy cow the bed was so comfy!-Staff was welcoming and helpful.-They had an interactive screen near the entrance that helped you find local stuff like food, events, drinks, etc.-Only 2 blocks away from the metro and 3 from Central Park.-We arrived too early in the season to hang out up there but the terrace on the top floors is gorgeous.Cons:-On most of the floors, only 3 or 4 rooms DO NOT have a view of the streets. We would have chosen a different room if we would have known ours was one of 3 (out of 12ish) facing the wall of the building next door.-Overall the room was outfitted rather cheaply. Not a big deal or a deal breaker of any kind but the floor was vinyl and the brick column against the wall was just brick pattern wallpaper.

I always like to stay on the Upper West Side...it's close enough to everything that you can get there easily, but away from the craziness of Times Square and Midtown. NYLO is on a side street right off Broadway. Entering the lobby, you feel like you're entering a trendy downtown hotel - a trendy bar with two levels, a sitting area that feels like the coziest and nicest library/coffee shop you've been to. As I'm walking in, there are not one, not two, but three different people with dogs sitting at their heels. Not sure why, but the place must have a reputation as a dog friendly hotel/bar. But the best part? I go up the checkout counter. Start checking in with the nice woman at the counter. Am scanning the bookshelves behind the check-in counter...WHEN ONE OF THE SHELVES OPENS UP. They have a freaking hidden door built into the bookshelves behind the check-in counter. SO COOL. Rooms are comfortable, well-appointed, and quiet. All in all, a great hotel in a nice neighborhood. Zabars is two blocks away, Viand Cafe is a great little diner close by, there's a CVS across the street and dozens of eating options on Broadway or Amsterdam.

We are now on a vacation in NY. We are staying at Nylo hotel. The location is great, on 77th and broadway. Close tothe subway and all the attractions . the hotel is clean and quiet the facilities are nice .

.. on the housekeeping front. Found hairs in my bathtub that felt quite icky .. and there was no black tea Keurig cup on the second day which made me very cranky. My wake-up includes an immediate caffeine fix via black tea and if that is not sent up to the room even after half an hour of requesting it then it's not a good reflection on housekeeping.Other than that, the room and location were perfect for this visit and the staff (especially front of the house) were as friendly and helpful as I experinced the first time.

Upper West side... Great staff (I mean everyone) that actually looked liked they enjoyed working there.Room was clean, nice upscale feel and the bed was most comfortable after a long day of running around the city. Zabars Deli right down the street. Valet service for our car was excellent. You really don't want to be driving around NYC unless your a native. A most enjoyable place to stay.Costing: $300.00 - a NY value... room, taxes and valet parking. Considering location, a very fine place to stay.

Great location and cool hotel. However there was construction work right across the road and weren't notified of this before our stay.. We did try and talk to reception about this however the man was rude and very short so we just had to put up with it! Overall good experience apart from rude man at reception.

Have stayed here a few times, always good. The rooms at the back are a lot quieter than the front. Showers are a bit quirky; one took a long time to warm up and another was hard to turn on. I left something in the room and Security was VERY helpful.

Returned to NYLO's lovely deluxe king room. Fantastic corner location, relatively spacious room with a nice bathroom. Staff was wonderful as always and the location is ideal for us, close to Columbia, theaters and cozy UWS shops and restaurants. Upgrade was expensive but I was much happier paying more for a nicer room , compared with last visit's experience with the cheapest room which was cramped and uncomfortable.

The location is ideal if you want easy access to the Metro, Museums, Lincoln Center with a great neighborhood appeal. The hotel room was appropriately sized for a family of four and was quiet enough to leave the windows open in the evening allowing us to enjoy a cool breeze and the sounds of the city.

My son and I stayed at NYLO, between mid town and Washington Heights where my daughter and her family live. Perfect location to visit the sites and museums and quickly get up to see the kids via the Westside Highway. Lots of good restaurants nearby - my 14 year old son loves Shake Shack - and easy access to cabs, subway, and clubs. Can't wait till the rooftop bar is ready. Weather was perfect!

Nylo is on the upper west side and its a modern hotel. The bar is buzzing and the staff friendly. The rooms are very comfy. I loved the area, its a stones throw from Zaybars the legedary grocery store with the best bagels in the world. It's also very close to central park and there are nice bars and restaurants close by. Easy 15 minute walk into the Times Square district too or hop on the subway.

Super location to get to museums, central park and other attractions. Easy access to subway and plenty of places to eat or get a coffee near by. Bed was comfortable and wifi was good. No views from the room windows but never was in room long enough to enjoy a view if they had one! Will definitely stay here again when in NYC. Lobby bar has nice warm feel to it for a quick nightcap.

As always a fantastic stay at NYLO. I will be back for sure because it is a nice place, reasonable prices and warm attention. I like that is close to central park and you can relax there and have a nice time.

I stayed here for a conference. It was recommended by Columbia, and I have no idea why. There are better, Columbia-owned places to stay at the same price in Morningside Heights. The two pros of this place are location and price, and I won't argue with those. Also the staff were nice, and the lobby and downstairs bar had a good vibe.But vibe will only take you so far, and ultimately I'd rather have (1) carpet or at least rugs rather than bare flooring, (2) real furniture rather than a cubby made of locker-like metal, (3) a safe in the room, and (4) a mini-fridge that comes standard rather than having to call and ask for one (though they were nice about that). The room felt like a glorified hostel rather than a hotel. I was a mid-career woman at an academic conference who needed to pump and store milk for an infant. This was not the right place for me, and I ended up regretting following Columbia's advice. I would have preferred shelling out a little more for something better. Or, again, staying in Columbia's own housing by the university for the same price.Also, as part of the reservation process I gave my email address, and I have never been spammed so much by a hotel in my life, not even by the major chains.The price and location are right, just know what you are getting (and not getting).

Great hotel, easy to park, comfy bed and clean room. The bar is cozy and live music made the night. Love that pets are allowed although we didn't have our dogs, still nice to see some furry friends. Our room got upgraded to a suite which was super nice!

Affordable. Good UWS location. Renovated over past few years from real shabby to 'Shabby Chic:'Exposed brick walls, cracked cement floors covered w worn orientals, velvet seating, and piano in lobby; Large rooms have exposed brick wall paper, mood lighting and brightly colored gym lockers for clothes storage. Got the picture?

My family if 5 had two adjoining rooms at the NYLO hotel for 6 nights and had a really enjoyable, comfortable stay. The rooms are narrow but clean, have ample storage, and have extremely comfortable beds. The rooms have an "industrial" feel in decor. The elevators are quick, which does not feel typical in NYC. The lobby area in the hotel is fantastic with several comfortable seating/lounge areas, a bar, a large garage door-style window that can be open on a nice day. And the location was so convenient to two subway stops, Central Park, and all that NYC has to offer. Everyone at NYLO was very friendly and helpful, too. I highly recommend this hotel!

Overall stay was very comfortable and accommodating. The concierges were incredibly helpful, professional, and courteous. The atmosphere felt safe, reassuring, classy, and also relaxed. Location was good, close enough to many sites, including 24hr stores. Parking/valet was quite reasonable, compared to other venues. Will likely return here during future trips to NYC; highly recommended.

Awesome location near Central Park, Natural History Museum and Broadway shops/restaurants. Price is reasonable. Staff were very friendly. Nice hotel bar. The room was very clean, other than the wood floor was a little sandy/dirty when I walked barefoot. Bathroom was fine, good lighting, but the shower was one of the best I've been in for temperature, consistent temperature, and pressure! Room lighting was diffused. The bed was extremely comfortable! We had a great night sleep. The only minor drawbacks would be - The walls are thin and door to the hall doesn't do much for blocking sound. You can hear EVERYTHING in the hallways. Had to turn on the room A/C fan all night to drown out noise. But, as I mentioned we slept great. BTW - There was some construction on the street (unrelated to the hotel) that was noisy and dusty during the day. We would highly recommend this hotel!

I have returned to the NYLO for exceptional value and ambience, location, near public transportation, theatres and Lincoln Center, restaurants and nice shops within walking distance. Very close to Central Park, the significant West Side museums, etc. I recommend this hotel to my friends elsewhere when they consider the area.

The hotel was wonderful. The staff was so helpful and very friendly. The room was spotless and the beds were heavenly. I will definitely stay here again the next time I travel to New York City. Thank you very much.

The room, while small, had everything I needed. The hotel was conveniently located on Broadway and 77th with numerous shops and stores around. The hotel staff was friendly and eager to help me with any issues I had. The bed was wonderful. There were 2 windows in my room and plenty of natural and artificial light that allowed me to work as late as I needed.My only issue was that the bathroom in my room was not entirely clean when I arrived which was surprising as there were no signs that housekeeping was working on my room or was perhaps coming back.

We had a very pleasant stay, clean rooms, extremely accommodating, knowledgeable and friendly staff. We pulled up and left the car with valet, our car was returned at the correct time two days later. Great food on the neighborhood, and a quick walk to Central Park. We will be back.

It is loud across the street. Serious building going on. Starting at 7 am. However, if you can get a room away from the hammering it isn't so bad. NYLO is clean, looks great and the staff is very friendly and willing to help.
user_name:
harryl379
New York City, New York

review_body: As a former New Yorker I can say with all honesty this is the GREATEST hotel ! I've stayed here for years , thru renovations and always treated incredibly ! Beautiful, clean rooms with the most comfortable bed and sheets !!

I booked here on Hotwire for an overnight stay after the Metropolitan Opera. The location is very convenient, off Broadway near the 79th Street subway station. The desk clerk who checked me in kindly told me I'd been upgraded to room 1035, a pleasant room on a high floor overlooking Broadway. The clean, quiet room was dominated by the king-size bed, which was made up with good-quality white linens. Not the biggest room, but nicely done in Boutique Hotel decor, and efficient. Afterwards I stopped for a glass of happy hour wine in the stylish lobby, which has lots of cozy seating areas. Post-opera we both enjoyed a good night's sleep and in the morning we picked up awesome French pastries from Maison Kaiser across the street.Pros: Convenient location, quiet, good in-room thermostat controls, comfy pillows and mattress, quiet quick-flush toilet, modern tiled bath with lots of counter space, nice toiletries, ample bedside lighting, plenty of storage and outlets, Keurig coffeemaker, free bottled water, friendly bar area in lobby, nice staff.Cons: Room had just one desk chair plus a little bench for seating, no towel racks in the bathroom, no minibar/fridge in room, annoying live piano music in the lobby late at night, no free coffee in the lobby at breakfast (a standard perk these days), charge for wi-fi.Would I stay here again? Probably. But mostly for the charming UWS residential location and the comfy bed. And only at a competitive rate.
user_name:
Kathleen P
New York City, New York

review_body: The Nylo is a great little hotel if you are looking to avoid the midtown madness. The front desk people are super nice. the rooms are clean although they are a bit small. The wifi was excellent. Great bar and its super convenient to have Serafina in the lobby- excellent restaurant.

Chose this hotel specifically for location but it turned out to be a lovely spot and made my visit to see family even more enjoyable.Clean and nicely appointed rooms and pleasant staff. Lots of choice for restaurants close by and the Serafina Restaurant attached to the hotel was especially nice.

Loved the Nylo! The rooms were nice and spacious for NYC, the staff was friendly, and the location was good for someone who didn't want to stay in Times Square. We were a 5 minute walk from Central Park and a subway station and minutes away from a lot of food and beverage options. The bar inside the hotel- Locl- was also a great place to hang out! My only complaint was that the hallways were rather dark and a little unnerving. Dark gray carpet, dark grey walls, and minimal lighting fit the modern theme of the hotel but left me with a feeling that I was walking through a dark ally late at night to get to my room.

Our first time at the NYLO but definitely not our last. Staff was uniformly friendly and helpful. The bar was congenial, the housekeeping staff prompt, and the ambiance welcoming. We stayed at a nearby hotel in the past, but from now on it will be NYLO!

Nice hotel and affordable for NY. Clean, comfortable and stylish. A good location and near the 1 train. Book a room away from Broadway as those rooms on the street are very noisy- even on the 10th floor!

Travelled with a family member who had never visited NYC so we were after something special. I had stayed here before so was pleasantly surprised to see that nothing had changed over the last year or two. The staff in this hotel are very friendly and make you feel welcome constantly. The lobby/bar areas were always a constantly popular place for folks to congregate as its a warm and inviting spot. Wi-fi is strong here as indeed it is in the rooms. Our's was complimentary as part of the room package. We asked for a twin bed arrangement ans was pleasantly surprised by the size of the room offered. In fact on our last night a third member of our family used the sofa bed. For NY having this amount of size was quite a surprise. The room was keep in great condition and cleaned to a high standard. Very important anywhere but NY has its challenges in keeping up cleanliness but I'm pleased to say that you'll be happy with NYLO's standards. The only reason we didn't rate with 5 stars this time was because across the road and also next to the hotel is a construction site which starts up around 5am. For those first few jet lagged days it was difficult for us light sleepers to get a decent sleep. Also there is a fire station across the road and you had the occasional late night departure with sirens on entering Broadway. So my suggestion is that whilst the construction continues for the next several months by all means stay here BUT ask for a room away from 77th street. If your new to the Upper West Side, this hotel is perfectly located to the 1,2,3 trains at 72nd or 1 train even closer at 79th. Loads of cafes, bars and restaurants plus good quality shops all within a short distance and of course Central Park is literally minutes away.

Lobby level has several cozy rooms for sitting, reading, cocktails (bar/coffee/pastry bar set up)...always lively and filled with conversation. Serafina restaurant (italian) has excellent food and attentive service at brkfst, lunch, dinner. NYLO has an arranged car service to airports which is convenient so you know price (before tip) at time of reservation. room rates do vary a LOT based on supply/demand so careful research required if you are cost conscious. hotel is clean, decor is scandanavian "Zen"...so if you need Louis XIV this place not for you. i stay here 2-3 times a year for a week for business/family reasons.

Luckily came across NYLO through a Google search while the hotel was having Christmas rate special. Got a fantastic deal on the room. It was incredibly spacious for the price, and it easily held 4 girls with large suitcases. The bathroom was a nice size, and we had plenty of space to get ready (and girls need a lot of space for that!). The beds were super comfortable. We had a little trouble with the AC, but the staff was great and got right on it. Always had plenty of fresh towels. It's a fantastic location. Just blocks from Central Park and the 72nd Subway Station. Will definitely be staying here again, and will look into NYLO's other locations as well!

Hip Upper West Side with plenty of awesome restaurants/cafes. Great for families with kids, but not annoying if you don't have kids. And close to Central Park. The hotel had an awesome chill vibe. Loved it!

Very pleasant staff, convenient location, clean and comfortable rooms. Our room had a great view of Broadway. Having Serafnas restaurant attached made dining very easy. Our room wasn't ready for check in until 4:00, but the lounge areas were comfortable.
user_name:
juliebC1374FC
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I have become a NYLO fan over the past year. I stayed at the Ritz and JW Marriott in Central Park and find the staff at NYLO friendlier. It has become my "go to" hotel when I travel to NYC (monthly). I would recommend for anyone - perhaps not small children.

This little boutique hotel is a gem in the Upper West Side neighborhood. The staff is friendly and helpful. The lobby and bar area is inviting with an eye to design but also comfort. This hotel is in walking distance to Central Park. There are a number of excellent small restaurants nearby also. It is very nice to have the restaurant Serafina attached to this hotel as well.

Best service and great personnel.The waiting feels like a members only places.The hotel is closer to the subway station and there is tones of stores,restaurants and supermarkets along Broadway.I will be back...

I highly recommend this hotel, It is very good located, near the subway and many important shops and restaurants and also near the Central Park. I certainly would reserve it again! The room was big and very comfortable and we enjoyed the stay very much

My review is negative due to construction noise across the street from the hotel, and the way the hotel handled this limited issue. This is a temporary situation however, and in the future I'm sure my review would improve dramatically for this otherwise nice hotel.This survey is too long!

I have travelled all over the world and never encountered such unfriendly management. My stay began by pulling up to the hotel and finding nobody at the entrance to help with my luggage nor any luggage carts. In search of a cart, I entered, walking around a bar to the front desk where one woman in particular met my request for a luggage cart with an attitude of contempt. I think she was disgusted that I had somehow failed to follow protocol - she blamed me for not knowing to wait outside with my meter running for someone to return who could help me. The next day, I asked the porter to put my ice packs in a freezer since I needed them to transport my son's medicine the next day. A nice guy, he asked his manager what to do and this is where things went from bad to worse. Right away she starts by telling me it can't be done. Incredulous, I made suggestions which she shot down one by one without so much as contributing one alternative until I pointed this out to her. Then she suggested she would find out where I could buy dry ice - the place she eventually suggested was all the way down in Times Square. The more I thought about it, the more unreasonable it seemed to me that my hotel wasn't taking responsibility for providing a solution given what I was asking for was perfectly reasonable - have they never had guests who travel with insulin?? I went downstairs hoping to find a more helpful individual at the front desk. Instead I was met by the assistant manager who informed me he had "been told" about me - wow, that feels really nice and welcoming! He said the best he could do for me would be to keep the medicine in the frig upstairs until 2pm and that even this he wasnt going to do for me because he didnt like my attitude. Beware, the staff at this hotel is shockingly contemptuous of their guests.

This was our first time staying here, but it was definitely worth going back to!Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, bar/lounge was nice, the room itself was spacious & the bathroom was shockingly spacious! If you're looking to stay somewhere on the Upper West Side, I would definitely recommend NYLO

we were on holiday at New York for 5 days. We have choosen Nylo Hotel, because on fried stay there every year. I have to say that in New York are many hotels, but we made the right decision. We stayed great at Nylo, Subway is very close and for New York the rooms are very quite!

The room was great. The bed was amazing and the room was quiet. The view was great the front desk staff and valet were very helpful and pleasant. We felt relaxed and safe during our stay. The housekeeping wasn't so great she just walked in the room without notice twice. Overall we will be coming back again!

Cool hotel, it was a little boring to get a room with no view to the street whem we specifically asked for one. But overall great stay! Really quiet rooms but cold as hell if you didnt use the AC. Awesome bed.

Loved the Hotel, was super clean and welcoming. The staff was lovely and couldn't do anything more to help us. The use of the Wifi and computer and printer was fantastic. Nothing to fault about the hotel. Super close the the 79 street subway ( defiantly get the metro card) But it was 40 mins walk to the middle of Time Square. There are loads of different place to eat around the hotel and the hotels restaurant was amazing, food and staff. would 100% Recommend this hotel.

Negatives - Ceiling panels in bathroom need replacing. Toiletries low budget and no kettle in room to make hot drinks.Positives - great location, impressive bar area, friendly staff (receptionist less so).

Very disappointed with the noise level, would have liked to be notified of the possible noise. We also noticed that the third floor was possibly a resident and was not kept in good condition.. Molding was peeling off and paint was chipping on the wall.

When I checked into my ridiculously tiny room that didn't even have a chair (it had an uncomfortable bench) I noticed that the ironing board and iron were leaning against a wall rather than on the rack provided in the closet. So I replaced them. Later that evening, lying in bed, I noticed that two of the four drinking glasses were clear and two were amber; on later inspection, the two amber ones were filled with liquor (scotch I think), and someone had sipped from them. The next morning when I went to use the shower I realized that a used towel was draped over the shower rod, and that used soap and a half empty shampoo bottle were on the soap dish. Finally, I discovered business cards and receipts from a prior guest next to the TV. I wonder if the sheets had been changed. Yuck! When I mentioned it all to the front desk at checkout, I was met by what could I can best describe only as studied indifference ("we'll let housekeeping know"). Would never stay there again. Would never recommend to others. It's a dump.

Nice hotel with a nice atmosphere in lobby and bar. Nice and clean room. Sink in the room could be bigger as no place to lay down toiletries.The curtain in the room was not working and closed so there was no daylight in the room and very dark.

I had a great stay at NYLO. The staff was helpful and friendly. My room looked like a cool loft apartment with interesting decor and a super comfortable bed. This is a nice change from the dull chain hotels I usually get stuck at. Great location. Highly recommended.

NYLO is conveniently located, two blocks from the subway, close to restaurants with a great grocery across the street. Blocks from Central Park if you want to get away from the hustle of the city. Property was clean, but they could use thicker Windows. I would stay again

We checked in at about 11:00pm & I was the 1st person to use the bathroom. I immediately noticed the floor was covered in hair and dirt. I notified the front desk, in person, & was told they'd send someone up right away. They didn't, but it was late so I gave them the benefit of the doubt & decided to tell them again in the am. Also, our room with 2 double beds was missing the bedside table that separates the beds so there was no place to put a cup of water or a book. The next morning I told the front desk (in person) about the dirty floors & that no one came last night to clean but that it was late and maybe that was why. Again, I was reassured it would be taken care of quickly. and was told they'll take care of it-I also told them our room was missing the bedside table separating the two beds (I took a picture to show what I meant) and was told, "we ran out of tables." What? For the price we paid, they could go buy more because the tables are those very inexpensive locker-styled tables. At any rate, not only did our room and bathroom floor not get swept or mopped that day, it NEVER was swept or mopped. The last day we were there, they didn't put towels in our room. We stayed here in August 2015 and it was fabulous. This time was as though it was a completely different hotel. Very disappointing.
user_name:
BB W
Amarillo, Texas, United States

review_body: I have stayed at the NYLO many times and it's my favorite place to stay when the UWS is most convenient. The rooms vary greatly and can be small, but the beds are large and very comfortable, the furniture is very industrial modern with lots of places to store stuff, and the bathrooms are well appointed. It's also very convenient to great places to pick up breakfast within only a block or two, and only two blocks to the #1 train. My only complaints this visit were that I got an urequested wakeup call at 6am (for which I received no apology) and there were deliveries to the construction site across the street in the middle of the night, which is a tradeoff for getting a street view rather than a view of an airshaft.

The only negative was that construction started at 6 am right across the street and was a little noisy, but despite the stuff the hotel cannot control the stay was fabulous. We have stayed at the NYLO in Warwick Rhode Island and it was so good that we looked for one in NYC as well. Great Hotel!!!

Great place and great value. We loved the location. It is close to the park and Columbus circle and so many awesome other place. The rooms itself are really simple but yet still comfortable. Highly recommend staying here

Hotel is great, but don't bother going to Serafina Restaurant which is attached, it is a disappointment. The Red Farm restaurant next door is excellent! The 1.2 & 3 line subway station is just two blocks away and Riverside Park & Central Park are just three blocks from the hotel. Lots of good restaurants in the area. Great neighborhood feel.

Hotel was trendy and modern, very clean...beds extremely comfortable. We had a room with two beds and a living area. Very happy with the room. Only one small criticism, the heat was very loud when it came on during the night. Loved having coffee in the room in the morning (Keureg).

Great location, comfortable bed, perfect shower pressure but unmemorable service from the front of house staff. They really can't be bothered whether you stay there or not, which is a real shame. The bar is funky, the area is so easy to get to everywhere in Manhattan and the rooms are bigger than expected. Besides the lack of service, it's worth staying here just for the location and bed.

Visited here on our honeymoon. Excellent hotel, great spacious room and spotlessly clean. Great value. Would highly recommend and wouldn't hesitate in going back. Location is also good, only a short walk to two subway stations and plenty of restaurants in close proximity.

Nice digs -- our room directly faced a noisy construction site and they were accommodating and moved us on our second night. Second room was much better. Great bartenders and signature drinks. Very good location.

My daughter and I stayed one night here - the room was great. We got a fantastic rate to start and they upgraded us to a Jr. Suite. For the value, you can't do better in the city. I'd also take this neighborhood over any midtown or downtown location - you have local restaurants, a shot at street parking (no huge daily parking fee!) and a quick few subway stops or walk to get to midtown for shows. The restaurants and shops here are local so no tourist rip offs. Skip the restaurant downstairs though - kind of pricey and not great. Tons of other options in the area. Their is no bathtub but the shower was huge and luxurious so didn't miss it. Front desk people super nice and helpful.

The room was comfortable, clean and bed was lovely. However, for the cost I would have expected breakfast. I loved the games room. The staff were friendly although I have to say the concierge lady seemed a little clueless. The cost of $220 seemed high given the fact that it was not five star.

There are very limited hotel options on the Upper West Side and we have stayed here twice now. The first visit (Feb '15) really "wowed" us... cool urban vibe, comfy bed, quiet room, friendly people... could not have been better. We were back this past weekend and while we still enjoyed the hotel, we realized some rooms are definitely better than others. The room we were in this time, 222, was very small compared the room we had last year (supposedly same category/standard king room) You could barely walk around to the far side of the bed. (The bathroom was huge however, a real plus!) There were two issues: The door to the bathroom was made of frosted glass, which looked great, but since it was only about 2 feet from the bed when the bathroom was used in the middle of the night, the bright light flooded the bedroom and woke the second person. Our room last year was more of an L-shape, so the bathroom was around the corner, not making this an issue. (A nightlight or bathroom dimmer is sorely needed) Also, the first morning, my husband got up to shower and came out after about 10 minutes saying there was no hot water. He got dressed and went out to get us coffees (as they only give you ONE pod of regular coffee with the coffeemaker!)... he stopped at the desk to tell them of the lack of hot water, assuming either we'd be moved or a maintenance tech advised. Instead, he was just greeted with a shrug and a "yeah you have to let the water run for up to 20 minutes for it to get hot". So for the remainder of our stay, we had to set our alarm for 20 minutes earlier than we needed to be up just to assure we would be able to shower. If this had been my first time at this hotel I would have given it a lower-than-average rating but since our first visit had been so impressive, I am thinking we were just given a dud room. Overall I still like the hotel, but now that I'm aware there are different lay-outs within each room category, I'll be more assertive in asking for one with the L-shape layout so the sleeping area is shielded a bit from the brightly lit bathroom. Also, I'll check the hot water right away so I don't find out at 6 am there is no hot water. Lastly, I'll request a few more pods of regular coffee, so we aren't standing there sharing one cup of coffee again while we wait 20 minutes for the shower to get hot!

We stayed at the NYLO when visiting NYC for a wedding, The hotel was great, the staff was very attentive and the location was perfect for us. We found many restaurants close by and walking to central park was only blocks away. We will definitely stay there again

Our room at NYLO was chic, modern, and well-appointed. Very comfortable bed & pillows and good lighting. Location is great for museums and theater. Our only complaint was that a hotel of this caliber should be offering free wi-fi ... or, at the very least, should tell the customer how much a day of wi-fi would be before clicking to sign on. Seemed like a trap so we didn't do it. Otherwise, a lovely place to stay.

For our purposes great location, great decor and a fun busy informal lobby area; The beds were very comfortable, but a little on the high side . Had some issues with the shower and drawers, and loud heating system, otherwise love the place.

The NYLO has a great location on the Upper West Side. The hotel has a distinct personality, although rooms are not very big.It is close to many restaurants and stores, and the staff is friendly and helpful. The lobby is very welcoming.

We checked in a day late because of complications with our flights so we only stayed for 2 nights instead of the originally planned 3. The hotel is really cute with a good bar and lobby area. Service was quick and pleasant.We stayed on the second floor and were worried it would be noisy after reading other reviews but it was fine. You can hear street noise (because it's New York!) but it didn't keep us up at all.The location is great, you can easily walk to Central Park and to fifth avenue. The bed is huge and SO comfortable, one of the comfiest beds I've ever slept in in a hotel!A few cons: no plug sockets near to the mirror which was inconvenient for 2 girls sharing a room trying to get ready to go out! Felt like there should be a mirror over the desk which would have made things easier for us!Also we had to run the shower for about 5-10 minutes before it got hot enough to get in, then once you were in, if you had the shower on anything other than cold or the hottest, a really loud banging noise came from the walls, I don't know if this was a generator or the pipes or what but it was SO loud. Luckily we're not early risers so didn't worry about waking other guests. But a good stay non-the less, I would go back :)

Stayed in a double queen suite that was spacious and quiet. Plenty of room for me and my three teenagers. Convenient location, friendly staff, lively lobby and bar, room was clean and trouble free with comfortable beds. We really enjoyed our stay. The kids loved the modern room and bathroom. The location is convenient to quick grocery shopping, bakeries, restaurants and subway. Quick walk to Central Park through pleasant neighborhoods. The staff was helpful and inviting. Would recommend to anyone wanting to stay on the upper west side with easy access to everything. We didn't have any problems with anything and had a great weekend stay.

They were very accommodating with our check in times. They new we were going to be late and were having issues holding the room so they ended up giving us an upgrade from the base room to one of their highest end ones. The room was extremely comfortable and a great night's sleep, waking up to an awesome view of the water from the top floor.
user_name:
Craig B
Long Island, New York

review_body: I booked a wifi room and they upgraded me to a "higher floor" which was a view of construction and workers. I paid 31.00 for the upgrade and lost the Internet service package. So I ended up paying an extra $50.00 in total for a terrible view. Not very pleased

For our purposes great location, great decor and fun lobby area; good restaurants.The beds were very comfortable, but a little on the high side . Had some issues with the shower and a loud TV in the fitness center that woke us, otherwise love the place.

Neighborhood is great. Hotel is great. Room is great. Bar is great. Restaurant (not managed by hotel) is not great. Good food but really poor service. I'll definitely stay at NYLO again. I just won't eat at the attached restaurant.
user_name:
Greg G
Rancho Santa Margarita, California

review_body: unfortunately, delays at the airport cut my time at NYLO short. but they were very accommodating of my late-night check in, and even upgraded me to a bigger room. it was a great place to rest quickly before heading out on the next leg of my trip. everything was lovely and very comfortable. i especially like the outdoor spaces. i'll definitely choose the NYLO for future visits to NYC.

Pleasurable experience , excellent location for planned events. Would certainly stay hereagain but I do shop for special deals in the location I want when visiting. Fun shopping in area andalso usually visit Central Park, conveniently located but did not do so this time.

Very clean hotel. Kind staff, everyone was nice to my children. Good security. Walking distance from Central Park and Museum of Natural History. Plenty of great food markets and restaurants within a block or two. Very short walk to a main subway line. Perfect location if you want to tuck yourself into a quieter corner of NYC. Would definitely return.

NYLO factored mightily in the delightful nine nights we recently spent in Manhattan. Although our initial reception was marred by a desk clerkwho claimed the hotel was completely full and we therefore could nothave a better room [we had made reservations several weeks ahead!]after the first night in a not so fine accommodation we were moved to alovely room. If we overlook this glitch, we can now dwell on the manyadvantages NYLO provides. Its location is superb..easy access to thesubway and to crosstown buses, rooms are furnished with very verycomfortable beds and bedding, and bathrooms nice in the lesser accommodations[we had never had a poor room until this unfortunate visit] to actually luxuriousin the better ones. Anyhow, once we had been moved, things changed..I think themanagement needs to be a bit more alert to the daily needs of the actual hotel, At its best, NYLO is wonderful, and we won't quit going there yet but give it another try.Etuaply

We stayed in a standard room on the 11th floor for 4 nights. It was bigger than I anticipated (having heard all the horror stories about NYC hotel rooms). It had obviously been renovated fairly recently as the furniture was new seeming and the walls unscuffed. The bed was very comfortable. I liked the 'style' of the hanging lamps.The bathroom was quite snug and our room had a view of a brick wall. We didn't eat in the hotel as there was so much choice on nearby Amsterdam Avenue and 72St. The lobby does have a bar - quite dark - an attempt at a bluesy/speakeasy aesthetic. We didn't speak much to the lobby staff but they did keep our luggage in storage before we went for our flight and offered help organising airport transport which we didn't need.

Great hotel on upper west side. Very convenient. Staff very helpful and professional. Great value for the money. Beds and bedding fabulous. Walk to many sites and subways close by. Have stayed many times and look forward to our next trip.

Despite a cold welcome by the staff, because of their mistake with my reservation, we succeed in having a nice stay in this charming place. Comfortable bed, cleanness, and enough room amenities have offered us a great time. The site is very well located, close to the metro station and many attractions can be reached on feet. It is noisy, I know, but we are in NYC. I don't understand why free internet is not offered in the rooms.

Modern and spacious hotel rooms well located in upper west side. Right near subway and good range of shops and restaurants nearby. Staff and service was great at the NYLO with a good bar and restaurant in the same building. Will be staying here again during next trip to NYC.

I am a very frequent traveler and I must say, my experience with NYLO hotel is one of the worst, service wise. Upon arriving, I was given a room entirely different from what I booked. It was a queen sized bed (I booked for a king sized bed with a city view) and the windows on both sides were facing a wall. It was like a prison cell. So I went down and complained to the front desk, and he said I will be given a new room by between 2-4pm that same day, I went down again and I was told that the room won't be available until the next day, same time. Next day came, I came down again and this time a female staff was there. Upon following up my request, she said there was no note left about it but said she will help me. She said to go back to my room and wait for her call. By 2pm she called me and said the room is ready and said I should left the safe open before leaving. So I came down and she gave me a key for room 1225. When I got there, it won't open. So I came down again bringing down all my luggages with me and she apologized, saying it should be for room 1025. I came up again with my luggages in tow and alas, it won't open again! So I came down again together with my luggages and she told me she will send someone to fix the doorlock. After sometime it was finally opened, but my requested refrigerator wasn't there. When I told them about it, after several hours and two follow up calls it finally came. Lastly, I requested for a spoon and fork and was given but plastic ones but it was okay, but when I requested for it again the next day, I was told they do had no room service. Wow!

I have stayed several times at this hotel and only ever had a minor issue. This is a wonderful location, close to subway and bus lines and a short walk to good restaurants, Central Park, and Lincoln Center. I don't know if I can stay there anymore though, since they have made some changes, including very soft mattresses that were a problem for my lower back. I asked a manager at the desk if there was a chance of a room with a firmer mattress and she informed me that all the beds were custom made for NYLO and they were all the same. I tried sleeping on it the first night but wound up on the floor (with lots of bedding as cushion). So unless you really like a mushy mattress--or if you plan to stay out all night-- this is not the hotel for you.

A wonderful place to stay in NYC. The staff was on point from the moment we pulled up at the curb until the time we checked out. This included the front desk staff, valet, bartender, bellhop and the maid. Everything was clean and comfortable and the location is great. Easy access to so many things in NYC.

Conveniently located a few blocks from Central Park and the Museum of Natural History the NYLO had just about everything our family needed for our first visit to New York. The room was comfortable, with some great views of the city. We utilized the market across the street as well as the restaurants down Broadway.

I love this hotel for its convenience and because it is located in a residential neighborhood. The rooms are nice - most are bright, large (especially for NYC). Staff is friendly. They have all that you need. I've been staying here 2-3 times a year for the last 5 years.

I loved the hotel and food! It has a great ambiance and the location is perfect! The Sarafina restaurant was delicious! My only problem was that the bed was very soft. It hurt my back. If you like soft beds, then this place is perfect.

When we arrived at the hotel the front desk alerted us that our room wasn't ready and that's ok. We were told that they were going to "upgrade" us for free if we didn't mind waiting. Ok no problem, but 3 hours later when we got our keys our "upgrade" seemed more like a down grade to me. Got into another room where the shower didn't drain and you stood in 5-6 inches of water. When I went to the front desk I was pleasantly told... "I'll let my manager know" I will never go back.

The hotel has a great, welcoming loft feel downstairs. Wonderful atmosphere to unwind after a long day. Valet could do a better job helping to hail cabs for guests. They were no where to be found. Couldn't change heating/cooling control in room.
user_name:
elaineh811
New York City, New York

review_body: My family adored this hotel! Great location – walk to coffee, walk to Central Park, easy walk to the subway, any stores you need, etc. But the real crown jewel of this hotel is the bar in lobby area it is warm welcoming and comfortable! Like a living room for your daily use! This was perfect for our family, giving us a place to relax, get a drink, let the kids play game, even have friends over to visit !

Three blocks from Central Park on Broadway - hard to beat that. The ground floor bustles with good activity and rooms are clean and have option of king beds - a rarity in NYC. Couple of things that could be better - heat/cooling system runs too much at extremes, and the floor decor outside guest rooms is dark black and needlessly unfriendly and depressing. But high marks in general.

I was recommended to stay in this hotel by a colleague. I was in NYC for business and needed a place that would fulfill my budget, needs, and location, while providing a place I could work in my room. This hotel was more than I expected for NYC hotel in this affordable price range.Pros: - LOCATION! This is in the heart of the best of some of NYC offerings and secrets! Great restaurants, Zabars, great bakeries, shops, museums, and ease of transportation. And a quiet place in residential NYC. - The rooms are very clean, no awful hotel carpeting, clean line furniture. The rooms are small, but designed so there is room to move, work, stretch without bumping into things. Very streamlined.- Great comfortable hotel lobbies! The designs of each lobby room is great- providing two big screen computers with a printer, a table for internet laptops. A bright room for social quiet resting places, and another lobby more intimate for socializing or resting. Great ambience.- Fantastic staff!! - a doorman is always there, friendly and helpful. Luggage storing service, very caring and personable. I felt very comfortable and safe about the care they took with my belongings.- Staff tries very hard to accommodate and will call you if your room is ready before check-in.- Great restaurants by the hotel, and top notch breakfast and Zabars, West Side Market in the neighborhood.- Location is tops. A Staples is a block away, shops if you forgot something. Right on the subway.Cons:The only thing is that the doors tend to slam on their own and can get noisy. The clients in the hotel are very quiet, and the hotel is quiet, except for the closing of room doors.Otherwise- I definitely plan to stay at this hotel again. And I will make sure to book early because it is a best kept secret, and it was full the days that I stayed.

Terrific boutique style hotel.Valet service cinched us and it was a perfect fit for our needs. Loved the decor and the vibe.Seraphinas was awesome for breakfast and the lounge area was comfortable and inviting.

No free wifi in room. Cheap Room was nice but getting dated decor wise Upper west side location and close to great restaurants and subway Central Park close byThe hotel itself is dark, trying to be hip without being hip. Elevators slow but not awful

We really much enjoyed our stay at Nylo hotel. Friendly staff, nice lobby and guestroom, centrally located. Direct subway to Times Square in walking distance. We would definitely recommend Nylo hotel to our family and friends.

Super nice staff good location, only tiny thing is that the cleaning lady was a bit confused with the towels changes. 1day she put new ones but didn't take away the dirty ones and an other day she forgot to replace them. But really not a big deal staff were all amazing when I arrived and had problem with my Visa card they did their best to help and even offered me a drink.

Great location, friendly, helpful staff. The room was spacious, clean, the bed was extra comfortable. We needed that after enjoying our days shopping, taking in the shows. We will be back again, highly recommend NYLO.

The room had unique features, lots of lighting options and was pet friendly which was a huge plus. Bathroom was spacious. Lots of closet and storage and cabinet space and great staff always helpful with whatever it was that was needed. Thank you!
user_name:
brandonsF4188FY
New York City, New York

review_body: We loved everything about our stay. The rooms are pretty and clean with cool minimalist decor, the staff was friendly, helpful, and good-humored, the lobby bar was inviting (with a garage door to open it up when the weather is nice) and the location was perfect. Rooms are not large but just fine, especially by NYC standards and especially for the price. Wonderful stay, wonderful experience. Thank you!
