I have never had a bad stay. The rooms are worth the money at each level. I have stayed in a standard and the penthouse. As an ex upper west sides I enjoy staying here as it is a real area of nyc with great places for brunch

From the moment I stepped in the door, I knew I'd made the right decision. Great staff, cool lobby bar, and comfy rooms that were actually quiet! Hard to find all of that for this price in NYC. Highly recommend the NYLO!

Stayed for 3 nights in March. Work was taking place on nearby buildings but at check in we were told we'd been given a room at the back to minimise noise. The room was perfect and exactly what we needed with no external noise. The location was also excellent with some brilliant restaurants and bars just round the corner on Amsterdam. Central Park was a short walk away and we found a brilliant diner for breakfast. Really impressed with the hotel for price and location and would definitely return.

We booked directly with the hotel and were upgraded to a room with a balcony when we got there! Super friendly staff and the rooms were super chic and trendy. Everything is futuristic. The restaurant and bars in the area are great, so much to choose from and do. This is the theatre district on Broadway so walk down the street and catch a show!
user_name:
elCubanito305
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Loved hotel on 1st visit, 2nd visit was disappointing. Great location and convenient in house dining options, drafty, noisy room. Also pricing was substantially more this trip...maybe it's seasonal...but my window which had a draft faced a noisy construction site and trash pick up. Price increase did not seem justified.

A shout out for Jessie at the front desk, who welcomed us back to our favorite Upper West Side New York hotel. This was perhaps the sixth time we've stayed at NYLO. We go back because of the urban chic atmosphere, the great location, the hip bar, and our experience in various of the room types as always satisfactory. When we arrived for our one night stay, getting there around 1pm, our pre-arranged room was not ready, and we were also hoping for just a slight extension of our stay with a noon checkout in order to make the most of our short trip. Jessie found us a better room that was available, and made it work for us. She was pleasant, courteous, efficient, and even friendly. Also liked our car valet experience this trip, so all in all, highly recommended.

Great location and very chic hotel ! A most enjoyable and pleasant stay - highly recommended ~! The rooms are very spacious and the atmosphere delightful - very efficient and friendly staff. A terrific choice for NYC stays !

Flawless. And, actually quiet, which is nothing short of a miracle in New York! Also, conveniently located in the Upper West side between the best cookies in the world (Levain bakery) and the best chocolate babka anywhere (Zabar's)!!!
user_name:
bengo507
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great hotel. Efficient and friendly staff. Minimalist and modern decor. Quiet room with a comfortable bed. Central to upper west side venues. Great bar with a low key atmosphere. Book it now before your only other options are more expensive and less value.

We stayed here on a Hotwire deal in mid-January. This location is so good, very neighborhood-y with lots of great eating options. Close to the 1-2-3 train too which can get you everywhere. Hotel is just right--nice lobby and bar area, small rooms with nice bathrooms. We were upgraded to a room with a balcony, and a nice view of Broadway and the Hudson seen from down 77th St. Beds are comfy, everything was on point. For easy eating options, there's an overpriced (but really delicious) juice bar on Amsterdam, as well as Sugar and Plum which is great for kids or adults with a serious sweet tooth! Also Zabar's for breakfast sandwiches, and bagels, just up Broadway a few blocks. I love this neighborhood!

Great hotel - cool ambiance, friendly professional staff, great bar. Love the Upper West Side location. We travel a lot for business and this is one of our favorite hotels in the world. I's the place we prefer to stay in NYC.

Fantastic location, within walking distance of Central Park and other key attractions. Subway stops nearby too. Friendly staff. Super comfortable King size bed. The Nylo has everything you need for a wonderful holiday.

No free internet. $14 per day. Small room for the price. I had to ask a few times for turn down service. I asked for a late checkout and the desk told me no. It wasn't Motel 6 but it was very underwhelming.

Me and my fiance went for a mini two day trip to nyc. When we arrived in the city it was hard to find nylo. Once we found parking we checked in. The check in prosses was very annoying we booked on line and first the woman who checked us in couldn't find our reservation. Then she said our room was order but they didn't have a two bed room available. We where confused because we order a queen bed room. Then she tried to up grade our room to a king but she found a queen room available. The room was very spacious but the bathroom was very dirty and there was a hole in the shower curtain. The bed and was comfortable. All in all it was not worth the price that was paid.

I was looking for the path of least resistance for a family trip to the Museum of Natural History. This hotel fit the bill. Easy walking distance and ideal location on the Upper West (hello, Zabar's!). It looks identical to the pictures and the service was attentive and very skilled. My only complaint was the lack of soundproofing between rooms. Our room had a door to our neighbor's room (like many hotels), but there was only ONE door. Light poured in from the other room (lots of gaps around the door), as did the sound. We all got to listen to another family's conversation as clearly as if they were standing right next to our beds. And they weren't speaking loudly at all!I complained to the front desk in the morning, and the manager was sincerely apologetic. But he made it clear that this was an architectural issue and nothing could be done. Our second night, we lucked out with an empty neighboring room. Bottom line- it was a great trip and the hotel was just so darn convenient. I'd recommend it, but I'd also recommend earplugs and an eye mask! Oh, and don't miss out on Han Dynasty. Amazing food just a few blocks away.

Nice clean hotel with fun bar and small but well appointed rooms. Only issue was noise from neighbors. Red farm restaurant is expensive and below average food. Nice lobby, good employees, nice doorman

This is a really nice boutique hotel. Rooms are well sized for NYC and are well equipped. The suites with the outdoor terrace offer amazing views over the city and out to the Hudson. Avoid a room on the North facing side of the hotel as there is a large construction project going on which will wake you up at 7am. The door/bar staff/cleaners were very friendly. I thought some of the front desk and telephone reservation staff were a little less welcoming and more 'frosty'. A visit back to charm school required for some of them. There is a computer area with printer allowing you to check in for flights. Print boarding passes, etc. The bar area is a great place to hang out in. Lots of great restaurants and deli's close by. I recommend the signature 'Central Park West' cocktail. The subway is only a few minutes walk away and has the express trains. You can get to Times Square and further downtown in just a few minutes. As long as you can avoid the noise during construction this is a really good choice to call home whilst visiting NYC.

Clean room, courteous staff and great location, but it was the very, very comfortable bed that made my stay great. Walking distance from the Nat Hist Museum, Central Park, Beacon Theater, and Levain Bakery.

Very nice, Clean, good bathroom freshly decorated. Coffee brewer in room , friendly staffWe liked the upper West side area which was a contrast to Downtown hectic NY. Bed was very comfortable. Cleaning immaculate

Great location! Great lobby library and bar the staff is very friendly. The room is tacky the bathroom is gross there is poor water pressure and if you need to take a hot shower forget about it if you need even a warm shower forget about it! Also I don't like seeing the housekeeping staffs cart parked in the hallways constantly.

We were looking for a hotel near the Beacon Theater and this location was perfect. The staff was excellent and our room was quite comfortable. I would certainly consider staying here again when visiting NYC.

NYLO is well located with plenty of good places to eat all around, plus just a very short walk to the park. The lobby is warm and clubby, and guests enjoy relaxing, playing board games, watching TV and meeting other guests as if in a library on a cruise ship.

Really nice hotell: Clean and fresh room, comfortable bed and nice locaction at the upper west side. The hotel lobby is nice and the bar as well. Only thing we liked a bit less was the hotel restaurant.

I have stayed at the NYLO three times when visiting my daughter at college and plan to come back soon. She commented that it is beginning to feel like home! The basic rooms, while on the small side, are clean, sleekly decorated and have all the modern amenities. The location cannot be beat. My only pet peeve is that the hotel charges for Internet service, but the room rate, at least on a Sunday, was so reasonable I really cannot complain. Staff is efficient and the lobby has a great vibe.

Very comfortable and in a good location out of the main busy Time Square where you can sit back and relax. Easy access to shops Central Park, museums and subway. Staff are extremely friendly and go out of their way to assist. Will stay again!

Reasonably priced for NYC standards, the hotel has an edge to the decor, but not extreme. It was clean, staff was nice. Rooms were OK size, again for NYC. Housekeeping was good, friendly, timely. Connecting restaurant? Try somewhere else. Not bad, just not much more than that.
user_name:
richardgI2098CT
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Room was fine, bathroom a little small and shower a kind of dated with a broken shelve. Great location, 2 blocks from the 79th street subway station that'll take you straight downtown. Great options for dining in the neighbourhood, especially on Amsterdam and Columbus Avenue. Close to Central Park. Also has nearby convenience stores.

Loved the NYLO. The only criticism I have is that the shower enclosure was pretty moldy. That was an ick factor. Didn't think the bathroom was ultra clean. Otherwise, the bed and the bed pillows were very comfy.

Superb location in the Upper West Side with an abundant selection of restuarants and activities that are walking distance from the hotel. Also, a short walk to Cenral Park. The price of the hotel room did not match the size of the room and ammentites availabe in the room. For example, a minibar or mini fridge was not provided. Also, I think internet access should have been included in the cost of the room.

Another very positive experience at NYLO. The hotel is clean and cheerful. Service is excellent. The lobby active and fun, with a great bar and music. Serafina Restaurant (attached to the hotel) is excellent, for full meals as well as quick breakfast. The location of NYLO is very convenient, near the metro and other good restaurants on the Upper West Side

I stayed at NYLO for spring break and it was excellent. Great customer service, great room and zero complaints. The bar in the lobby is quaint and the service is very good. I would recommend this hotel for a great stay.

My wife and I stay at NYLO whenever we are in town. This is like our second home. We like the rooms, like the friendly staff and love the neighborhood. It is peaceful, but vibrant at the same time and just a subway ride away from all the hot spots. And we love that the hotel is close to Central Park and on Broadway.

Nice boutique hotel in the middle of New York's Upper West Side. Rooms are nice and comfortable - fantastic bed !! Very friendly staff. Only 2 blocks from Central Park and the subway. The only complaint would be that the room did not have a fridge. This owould bi the first time I have EVER stayed in a hotel without a frif\dge. Very, very peculiar.

Excellent property. Will stay here when in New York without a doubt. Staff was very friendly, helpful, and accommodating. Both restaurants in the property served excellent food Close to subway and Central Park. Wonderful experience!!!

My one night stay at the NYLO was OK. The price is good and the location is fantastic if you prefer a more neighborhood area (which I do) but is still close to everything. The bar area is fantastic and is a highlight of the location. The downside of the hotel is the current construction (though I know it isn't the NYLO's fault) and the front desk staff / hotel amenities aren't the best. The staff are pretty slow moving and not the friendliest of crew and the room didn't have any information about the hotel amenities such as a menu for the connected restaurant. A little more customer service and personalization would help this place out.

Wonderful location. Walk to everything! The room was small, quiet, a nice escape. Spent a little extra for an upgrade...save the money. Wish I could have stayed longer to sample obvious amenities. Location made the stay.

I have visited NYC several times and tried to find a hotel that I love. NYLO is it! I have stayed at NYLO multiple times.Consistent experience, clean and great location...and dog friendly! The rooms have a hip vibe them and the staff is extremely helpful and friendly.

Being a native New Yorker I frequently visit New York City for both business and pleasure. I discovered NYLO about 3 years ago and it's my go-to hotel when I visit the city. Of course with any hotel you have certain expectations - and for me to return back to a hotel multiple times...it has to be something special. Have some faith in this review and I don't think you'll be disappointed. I can tell you about how clean the place is, the fact they stock your room with K-cups every day, the awesome restaurant Serafina downstairs, you can always get a nice hot shower, even that I dig the smell of the soap they use...and on...ALL of these things are true, but to me the people at NYLO are a key element. NYLO's staff is fantastic. From the moment you walk in that door till when you exit - consistent experience every single time.The location is also key for me. It's true Upper West Side...with a 24 hour CVS AND a deli (Europan) right across the street. Yes it's not going to wild and crazy Times Square at night, but that's literally one stop away on the 2 train you can grab in a few minute walk. I highly recommend NYLO to my friends and family traveling to NYC.

Love this upper west side hotel. Convenient to everything and wonderful staff. Our room was well stocked and the housekeeping staff was exceptional. We will stay at this location on our next visit to NYC.

I had a confirmed reservation to stay at this hotel. Coming from California I arrived around midnight local time only to get a call from the hotel while I was in a cab from Newark airport that the room was not available. The official explanation that evening was that there was a leak in the room. This was an out right lie. The next morning the desk clerk said simply that they were overbooked. Instead they put me in a hotel in Times Square, my least favorite part of New York. Since my meetings were near the NYLO on the upper West Side,?Times Square was very inconvenient. In the hospitality industry this is known as "walking" the client but since Times Square was miles away from the upper West side, it was hardly a walk. Checking in the next day I complained and essentially got nowhere. They did say that as partial compensation they were giving me a room on the quiet side of the hotel that did not face construction. At 7:00 AM this morning that proved to be a lie since the construction was no more than 5 feet outside my window. All in all this hotel has no sense of hospitality or customer service and doesn't hesitate to just simply lie to get out of a problem.

The NYLO is our favorite place to stay when we come to New York. Everything from the rooms, service, and food is highly recommended. We particularly love the rooms with a balcony. We hope to stay again this summer when we can sit outside and enjoy the view!

We enjoyed a great stay at the NYLO. The lobby ambience is terrific; we ended each night curled up on a sofa enjoying a glass of wine - perfect! Across the board, the hotel staff was friendly and helpful. And the beds! It always take me a night or two to adjust to a new bed...not this time! The NYLO beds were wonderful! Great stay all around!

This was my second time at NYLO. Great neighborhood location, with easy access to the subway lines. Very nice staff and a great lobby bar. Great wi-fi access for guests and overall a good place to stay. Rooms are a bit on the compact side, but such is NYC, right? I wish the rooftop lounge area was open year-round.

I do love this hotel. The bar is fun, great vibes. The rooms, I find are always just fine. This last visit was a little more different. The construction on the 77th street side of the hotel, woke me a bit early, and frankly, my window was like a porthole, and it made the room feel closed in...small.

Enjoy the ambience and the friendly staff and their attention to details. The bar staff served a great cocktail and our friends enjoyed visiting.The complimentary breakfast at the quaint Seraphina was delicious!
user_name:
Dmarie n
New York City, New York

review_body: Spent the night in the City at NYLO. Fantastic room, great front desk staff. Lots of parking garages nearby. Tons to do on west side, only a few blocks away from subway station if headed elsewhere. Had breakfast at Serafina, good coffee and omelette selection.

Located in a safe, convenient neighborhood only 2 blocks away from the nearest subway station and within walking distance from the MET; many nice little vegetarian/vegan eateries and cafes among others nearby

Great experience for my first time staying in the City! We stayed for one night, all staff was very welcoming and nice. NYLO is very clean, we enjoyed the balcony and the bed was very comfortable! We will be staying again.

The rooms were very small but loved the decor. The employee checking me in was not very nice. I booked a superior room with king bed and I got a queen. I asked her about it and she said it's not guaranteed. I asked her to check for a king which she grudgingly did. She also didn't give me wifi access which was supposed to be part of the package. Loved the lobby and bar right there, very spacious and lots of seating areas.

I took a group of nine (well-behaved) teenagers to a scholastic convention in New York. The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. It was a great stay. I couldn't have asked for anything more.

excellent, comfortable (albeit small rooms) hotel in marvelous upper west side location. near great places to eat and shop and on the bus and subway lines to theater district. interesting area for walking and since it's a half block off broadway, on a side street, a woman alone feels perfectly safe walking alone.

The staff is great! Since we didn't stay long, we opted out of housekeeping but did ask for daily towels, which was given to us. We did not ask for extra soap, etc. but it would have been nice since there was no housekeeping necessary, extra supplies would have been nice, just because.

Booked the Valet parking package for a one night stay on a family visit to NYC. Pleasantly surprised when we were upgrade to a Junior Suite upon our arrival. Room was clean with a great view. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The Serafina restaurant was convenient and enjoyable. We have already booked our next visit.

Easy location - Modern rooms - no rugs, great beds. So pet friendly - even in the lounge. Food absolutely great in the lounge. So fun and so good for the Upper West Side. Only issue is the construction on 77th!

The location is perfect. West Upper side is fantastic!!!!!!Breakfast served in Serafina Restaurant is very good, as well.Just we do not like No have fridge in the room.Bathroom is small, but the shower is good.

I never realized this hotel was pet friendly, it's not something you notice or that is prevelent on the website. I am allergic to cats and dogs and couldn't understand why whenever I stayed at this hotel, my allergies were always a mess. My wife and I were visiting our son and daughter in law this past weekend and were shocked when 4 different dogs started barking at each other in the lobby. When I asked the bartender what was up, his reply was that the hotel was "pet friendly". I finally figured out why my allergies were such a mess. When we inquired at the front desk, we were told that only the tenth floor was pet free. I've stayed at this hotel at least a dozen times, our son lives 100 yards away. I always request down free because of my allergies, not once has anyone ever mentioned the whole pet deal. Needless to say, I was quite disappointed and won't be staying at the Nylo in NYC anymore.

Have stayed at the NYLO several times - and it continues to impress. Nice rooms, great location, helpful and friendly staff and very reasonable (by NYC standards) prices. Have recommended this hotel to several friends - and based on our most recent trip - will continue to do so.

I recently stayed at NYLO New York City. The location is great (77th and Broadway) with plenty of dining options in the area. The hotel has a nice bar scene, relaxed and laid back, but with plenty of activity. The rooms have been nicely redone and are very comfortable. Best of all, we were able to get a very good rate on an upgraded room on a standby basis. All in all, I would highly recommend NYLO for any visit to NYC.

Wonderful boutique hotel . All staff welcoming and helpful. Little way out from Centre but perfect for us, tube/sub 5 min walk then 10 mins to Times Square / Madison square gardens . Funky rooms and restaurant attached did amazing breakfast !

Lovely overnight at the NYLO. Recommend room 1505 with excellent views in all directions including an exquisitive sunset over the Hudson River. Large room was clean, comfortable and furnished in contemporary minimalist style.

Sometimes a hotel can have all the decorative thought of wall-paper there, but this one really has ambience - of noir comfort, welcome habitation and relaxed sophistication. It is right across from central park, which is quite handy and it has cosy, durable and comfortable furnishings. A pleasure to visit.

Noise very loud bar in lobby entrance. Could not even hear the girl at the front desk when I checked in. Very hard time checking in, very hard time fighting thru the crowd to even get to the front desk. Young rowdy crowd, very much out of control. Hotel staff very little help at all. would not recommend to anyone.
user_name:
Reuven Ronnen T
Deal, New Jersey

review_body: Comfortable and roomy hotel in a great situation. Easy subway to theatres and Times Square but only a 30 minute walk if preferred and I mostly did. Museums and Central Park just a short stroll away. I recommend the Boathouse in Central Park or Millefeuille just across Broadway for breakfast. The hotel bar is great for drinks and evening snacks.

First time staying at the NYLO and I look forward to returning. Good sized room, comfortable bed, great location near restaurants, shopping, museums, Central Park and the subway.My only complaint is none of the staff I dealt with except the housekeeper were very pleasant. A smile or kind word would've been nice. Instead there was a lot of 'attitude' from the front desk and door staff like somehow I was inconveniencing them.

I had a great 7 night stay at NYLO New York and have recommended it to all my friends. It's situated In a great location and great service. I enjoyed my stay and definitely recommend it for anyone traveling to New York.

Excellent location, great bar onsite and restaurants and shopping close by. Steps from Beacon Theatre, which is why I stayed here. Rooms are noisy, both external (construction at building across the street) and internal (walls very thin). But we didn't go to sleep all day anyway. Would definitely stay again, but suggest checking nearby construction and actually requesting a lower floor since the activity was directly across from our 11th story room.

The location of this hotel is wonderful. I found it to be very quiet and very convenient to have a restaurant and bar right downstairs. The beds were extremely comfortable. Bathroom had an amazing shower.

you get what you pay for. I was given a terrible room, which was extremely noisy due to street noise, clunky furnace which kept kicking on and off, noise from elevator and strange pounding noise which i believe came from another rooms shower.

Obviously plenty of choice in New York for hotels - I initially wanted to stay in a chain because you know what you are getting but was persuaded to try this hotel - what a result !!Tucked away a little bit off Broadway and 77th but very close to 79th street subway and walking distance of some lovely restaurants and shops. Room was on 6th floor with no view but lovely comfy bed and reasonable sized bathroom with nice toiletries - didnt spend that much time in the room. Lovely sociable bar in lobby area which has the feel of a proper bar not a hotel bar. Lorel the concierge was very helpful and arranged tickets for us and gave tips and advice for other events/locations.Kiara and Eloy on reception also very helpful and willing to have a chat when possible. Construction going on in building opposite but had no impact on us whatsoever.Would I stay here again ? Without a doubt

We haven't returned since the transition from "On the Ave". The staff is friendly. The rooms are not as clean as before. i.e. massive dirt under the bed (check behind the head board) and the floors felt gritty when walking in bare feet. One is offered very limited television station selection. The hotel charges for wifi. Overall NYLO is an okay place to stay if you are looking for a place to simply crash for the night. It is no longer the wonderful experience "On the Ave" offered. Even the linen was a lesser quality than before. I hate using the word disappointed, but we were both quite disappointed. Even when the day was sunny and 65 degrees, the management locked access to the beautiful outdoor terraces claiming it was winter rules. Once again, lack of attention to details. After all, the industry is titled Hospitality. So our search is on for another hotel that has that boutique feel with attention to detail.

The upgrade we requested for a small price was worth it and slept on the most comfortable bed. King deluxe room was very spacious and the requested refrigerator at no charge was a real bonus. It was a pleasure to have a lobby bar with TVs while waiting for check in and checkout.
user_name:
G9964CGcatherineg
New York City, New York

review_body: Nylo is a modern updated hotel on the uws.conveniently located near the subways. And all the best restaurants and attractions. Within walking distance to the best parks .The rooms are so comfortable and the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. .

I love everything about this place. The location is perfect. We were given tickets for free continental breakfast when we checked in and I hadn't even realized we were entitled to it. I asked for a wifi password at check in and was given one at no cost.

What I like most about NYLO is it's location, which is typically quiet. But with construction across the street, I was placed in a low number floor and it was extremely noisy. I was told it was just a trash truck and would stop. It didn't. I barely slept a wink.
user_name:
Stephanie D
Fairfax, Virginia, United States

review_body: We had a terrible night at a different five star hotel and cancelled our reservation for the next night. Called NYLO and got a wonderful upgrade. We've stayed at NYLO several times and have always felt very satisfied with the place. As far as I am concerned, there is no better hotel in NY.

Overall comfortable and clean without frills. Good value. I consider $14/day for wifi too much. Free is better, $5 if a fee needs to be collected. Bed comfortable. Could use a small refrigerator in room and hooks in bathroom. I will be back when needed. Sarafina rest., for breakfast: everything was delicious including the coffee.

I really enjoyed my time at the NYLO. The room I had was small, but well appointed and clean. The bed was really comfortable. Despite having a room that fronted onto Broadway the noise wasn't bad and I slept deeply and for 8-9 hours each night. It made working really easy. The hotel staff I spoke with were all very helpful and not pushy. The hotel is well located for museums on the upper West side as well as great restaurants. I chose it because it was close to where I was working, but I would definitely stay again and I met several folk who were visiting for their 2nd and 3rd times.

The room was simple, clean, and had all it needed for a good night's sleep. It was modern and stark, but overall comfortable. We only spent one night, but I could see spending a weekend here. Parking was included in my package, but was convenient for 24 hrs. Front Desk was able to hold our luggage for the day, just had to pick it back up before 8 p.m. Hotel location was convenient and a pleasant part of town.

My mom and I enjoyed our stay at the NYLO and would definitely return. The concierge was very helpful when we were trying to figure out the subway and which route would be best to take us to our various destinations.

The staff were very friendly when I called to tell them that I would be late because my flight kept getting delayed and that they would hold the room till 12 am, then once I landed got to the hotel via shuttle bus which was horrible then I had to call them back to hold the room till 1 am. Once I got there to check in was horrible front desk was very rude but helped us get the room which I thank him for. The restaurant RedFarm is awesome and very affordable, Serfina not so much overrated and overpriced. Room service would be nice for people getting there late especially when the restaurant are closed, instead of having to wait till the morning to eat.The room is very nice and the bed is amazing, but the shower can be a little bit bigger. Great location convenient to everything. I will be staying here again.

The room was clean and modern and the location was ideal. The staff from front desk to cleaners to bar staff went out of their way to be as accommodating as possible. This will be our go to hotel when in NY from now on.

My husband and I stayed at NYLO NYC for our honeymoon, and it was better than I could ever imagine. The atmosphere was amazing. Chris at the hotel bar made us feel welcome. We have been to many places around the nation, and Chris is one of the nicest people we have ever met. The rooms were contemporary and comfortable. The lobby has relaxing areas with board games available. The bar has a fun, relaxing mood with welcoming genuine people.I highly recommend this place to everyone!

Very convenient location a short walk to Central Park and Lincoln Center. Cute places to eat and big grocery stores nearby, quieter than midtown. Rooms were clean and quiet, a bit spartan in furnishings but everything clean and bathrooms renovated.

We weent to NY last weekend to watch the London Irish v Saracens, we spent 4 nights at the NYLO, rooms clean and tidy, staff very helpful, fantastic beds, no traffice noise, I was in room 605, on the down side no fridge in the room a must!! only one ice machine on the 12th floor, the adjoining restaurants very expensive, two pizzas cheese bread sarter and a side order with %18 tip $90, easy to get to downtown on the 123 metro, fast trian 10 minutes to world trade cente we used the PATH to get to the Rugby at the red bull arena,but all in all hotel very comfortable and a good base to work from and the bar and lobby very comfrotable, give a go

Had a great stay at the NYLO. Clean room and roomy bathroom. Exceptionally clean and crisp bedding. We would definitely recommend this hotel. Also loved the lounge in the lobby. We would recommend this hotel

Very friendly hotel. Staff were courteous and responsive. Our stay was upgraded and not up charged like many other hotels. Overall a great place to stay if visiting NYC. The restaurant down the street TESSA was also spectacular.

This was a return trip to NYLO and a good experience. The rooms are small but nice. The beds are very very comfortable and the coffee machine encourages a return to bed with the newspaper and a hot cup of coffee in the morning. The lobby and lounge area is nice and friendly although were so crowded this trip that we did not spend much time there. We were first told when checking in that our package did not include breakfast but did have wifi and then were given breakfast coupons and did not have wifi in the room. The small breakfast at Sarafina (granola, yogurt and fruit) was surprisingly good as was the coffee and fresh juice. Staff at NYLO are pleasant and helpful and it is a nice place to stay. I couldn't help noticing that the price jumped greatly from the previous visit at the same time of year. And so it goes. Good things are not cheap, especially in New York. I would return to this hotel as it is in a very convenient, safe and nice location with lots of good restaurants nearby.

While the hotel was clean, beds comfortable and location ideal they have a serious issue with water in this hotel. Each day it would take approx 20 mins to get hot water. Also, the placement of the shower in the handicap room meant that water would flow from the bathroom to the bedroom and flood the bedroom.

The hotel was inviting and stylish and our room was beautiful and comfortable. But, a couple of things were surprising turnoffs. There was a giant hairball in the shower we had to remove. Truly. The breakfast "package" we signed up for was a disaster. It was a barebones Continental, but the restaurant was out of most of the items, and so the waiter brought my daughter a huge pile of toast. It took 20 minutes to get coffee, because the staff was "looking for mugs." We had to ask for spoons for our granola, which also took 15 minutes, as they had to "look for them." Huh?? Just a real mess. Go someplace and get a good breakfast. Also, the Concierge could never be bothered to look up from her cell phone, even when accidents happened three feet from her, such as when a guest accidentally spilled beer all over the lobby floor. It might have been nice for her to try to help him in some way, or to find a staff member to help him, rather than standing at her post looking at her cell phone unmovingly.

We hadn't stayed here since the hotel was under different ownership and had a different name - it used to be On the Avenue. NYLO was clean and functional, and the staff was professional, but that was about it. Room with a king bed was so small there was room only for one chair - so a second person had to sit on the bed. The hotel just looked tired and upgrades seemed cheap. Hand held shower head flow was not adjustable - just the one speed, so to speak. Other hotels we have stayed at were helpful in securing a cab on check-out....not NYLO...so we trudged up Amsterdam Ave. in the rain....and luckily a cabbie took pity on us and stopped. The price was right and the bed was comfortable. That's it. Doubt we'll stay again.

On checking in we were told that as we had booked a normal room, and that it was very small. I had read that the rooms in New York were noted for being small, but decided not to upgrade as we only had 5 days there. On entering the room I was amazed, it was MASSIVE, nothing like I had expected, I could have quite comfortably stayed a month in that room and not felt cramped. The bathroom was also very big. Everything worked and was clean, with plenty of hot water. My wife's complaint that we did not have a nice view meant nothing to me as we were in New York for site seeing not looking out of the hotel window.The bed was big and very comfortable, and I slept very well in the room.I would certainly stay at this hotel again it was central to what we wanted, and it came with a very competitive price, all in all I was a very happy customer.

We were in NYLO with my wife for one week at the end of february 2016. This was our first trip to NYC. I chose NYLO because of the good reviews in tripadvisor and also because it seemed to be reasonable price for us. Hotel itself was very nice. Staff brilliant. Atmosphere in the lobby/bar is very smoothing.Room was spacious in NYC-standards (as far as I know) and very clean and everything seemed to be new and good quality. Bed was awesome.We arrived to NYC at Friday evening and because of the time all the construction workers had left already. The reality hit us on the face at Monday-morning. At 6 or 7 am the construction workers started to bang their hammers like I have never heard before just on the opposite side of west 77th street. We couldn't sleep. Fortunately I had my earplugs with me so we could have some sleep after that. The same thing recur everyday from Monday to Friday. And also because of the very poor insulation our room was very cold often and we had to put our bedspread/blanket next to the window so the cold air wouldn't come inside. But I think there is no problem when the temperature outside is bit higher and the construction is over.It is very easy to travel anywhere you want from the hotel with subway because there are 72th (very popular and also express trains stop here) and 79th street subway-stations very near to this hotel.Neighborhood is pleasant and beautiful.

Reservations were handled gracefully and accurately, check in was easy, the room was just as advertised, bathroom was clean and functional, the bed was very comfortable, and the ambiance of the hotel actually made me want to stick around (despite it having to compete with the rest of Manhattan). Lovely all around. I regret that we were so distracted when leaving that we forgot to tip our maid :( But we'll be back! This place was extremely reasonably priced in mid-March — I suspect it's considerably more expensive later in the spring.

We have been staying at the NYLO for 6 years. It is our go to hotel in NYC. Great location; great customer service; wonderful rooms and a great bar area. We love this hotel and highly recommend it. They are always willing to work with you to get the room that is right for you.
user_name:
my2cats75
New York City, New York

review_body: Previous stays at the Nylo have been a disaster (rooms smelling of smoke with Windows that wouldn't open facing a brick wall...staff spraying room with deodorizer that was worse than the smoke). I wasn't sure I'f come back, but I found a great room rate and called the hotel directly. The manager promised me a perfect room overlooking the street and she absolutely stayed true to her word. I booked a double double to have more space and on too of it, the NYLO upgraded me. The room was spacious and exactly what I wanted. A very comfortable stay.

The hotel is in a great neighborhood, very safe, there's a lot of restaurants and supermarkets around. The hotel is good, I got a new room with 2 double beds. The size of the room was good and very confortable bed. Great staff. The only problem in the room was about the windows, they don't seal very well. It was a very cold day when we were there, and there were a lot of wind coming in. Although the heater works perfectly, there should be no wind coming in. And about the breakfast, didn't like do much that the hotel doesn't have one. The do have a restaurant inside, but it's something apart. We had our breakfast there, and it was just ok. Overall, great hotel. Would recomend it.

Love the location, love that the hotel offers valet parking (for price obviously but some hotels in that neighborhood don't offer that) -- comfortable, clean place with friendly staff. One thing I wish is that it would offer free wifi in the rooms -- most hotels do that nowadays.

The room was upgraded to a suite and thankfully so because the suite is smaller than I expected. The front desk was helpful at times but also gave me a lemon scented trash bag to collect ice. I enjoyed Serafina's restaurant!

A most pleasant hotel, friendly staff, lively atmosphere. Most of the standard rooms are small but compact, very nicely designed, and convenient. The attached restaurant, Serafina, has very well prepared food, and good and efficient service. It's a neighborhood restaurant as much as a hotel restaurant. Both hotel and restaurant are very reasonably priced.

My husband and I always stay at the NYLO when we are in NYC. The hotel is clean and in a great neighborhood, close to Central Park and lots of good restaurants. We like that it is not in a touristy part of the city and that there are fun local restaurants and bars nearby. The hotel bar is a great place to meet up with friends and just hang out as well. You really can't beat staying there especially for the incredible price compared to other NYC hotels. Be warned that the rooms are very small....all you need for the city however. Would have given 5 stars but think it's odd that the only way to get upgraded is to pay for it...guess that's NYC prices!

Constrion outside our window started promptly at 7 am ravers morning making it impossible to sleep in. And the bathroom had drainage issues in the sink that would take a very long time to drain, even if you're just brushing your teeth

Convenient, comfortable and affordable. The beds are heavenly and our room was very quiet. We appreciated the small night lights attached to the headboard of the bed, and the nice soft lighting in the room. The price was amazingly affordable for NYC...and in a great location in the neighborhood of the Upper West Side. We enjoyed all the lovely lobby areas, including the bar, fireplace room with games, a long table with lap top outlets, and quiet lounge with comfortable seating. Lots of excellent restaurants are within walking distance, as is Lincoln Center....a 20 minute walk or an easy subway ride. This was our first visit and it will surely not be our last!

Excellent room and service, close to museum of natural history and planetarium. Zabars is 3 blocks away. Subway nearby, On Broadway. Lots of restaurants. Shopping. . central park 3 blocks away 5 min walk
user_name:
Lois C
New York City, New York

review_body: A boutique hotel situated in the perfect area of UWS. Many great restaurants around and easy access to midtown. Cool lobby, awesome staff and the rooms are quite comfy. I am a regular. Highly recommend for a solo business traveler. Don't miss the green juice at Serafina and the PacMan dumplings at RedFarm.

Fine location, courteous and helpful staff.Rooms were clean and well attended to. Space in the one-bed rooms was a bit tight and it was not possible to open two suitcases on the floor. Bathroom and shower stylish and up-todate. Furnishings were tasteful, consistent and appropriate for the space.

From the moment the doorman/valet greeted us to Ramona at check-in (who provided a calming welcome during a moment of crisis)....we knew we made the right choice!!! Our room was perfect, clean and exceeded our expectations. Also, we loved the location of the NYLO and the excellent restaurants and shopping right out the front door. We loved the NYLO so much we cut our trip to NJ a night short to go back to the NYLO before we fly out Friday.

The NYLO is so much apart of our lives and relaxation away from home. If there were more of them we would only stay there The atmosphere. The rooms. The service totally awesome. Best hotel in the business

The staff is wonderful and the hotel is in a great location for enjoying Manhattan. The rooms, public spaces and bar area are excellent. Once again we had a great room and the staff, from the front doormen to the bar tenders were friendly and accommodating. Of special note was Jessie at the front desk. She went out of her way to help us, as our room wasn't quite ready when we arrived. And then throughout our 3 night stay she continued to inquire about our needs anytime I passed the desk. I have stayed here many times but this was my wife's first trip. Her quote, "Why would we stay anywhere else?" Agreed.

i love the bar here and the UPW i have stayed several times always a good experience.the hotel employees are always very helpfull.got upgraded on last visit last visit was 3/4/16 --3/6/16 i will definitely return

NYLO is in a great location and the rooms are spacious, unlike many other hotels in the area. They also allow dogs with was a plus for us. We didn't try the two bar/restaurants but definitely will on our next trip.

I have stayed here many times and will continue to do so! Especially since the complete remodel, the experience is great all around. Great staff, comfy beds and pillows, wonderfully convenient to subways, Central Park, great restaurants etc. All at a reasonable price! Only downside is the tiny bathroom situation.

I have been staying at this hotel since it was On the Ave. I love the location and the price range makes a few trips a year possible for me. When NYLO first renovated the project, it was great. I have noticed over the years that the cleanliness and attentiveness by the staff have gone down. Last weekend, I spent the first night in a room on the 12th floor. Several of the surfaces (the desk and Keurig) were covered in dust. The laminated flier regarding the ongoing construction had dried up food/beverage spots on it. There were also dust bunnies under the bed. Not a huge deal but makes you wonder what else isn't clean that you can't see. I moved to room 626 for the duration of the weekend due to the construction and it was much cleaner. While drying my hair though, I noticed the base of the toilet and it was covered in dried urine, hair, and dust. It was really gross and not something that happened in one or two nights.

we have stayed here for many, many years. previously when it was On the Ave, the staff were much nicer and more accomodating, and always staff at front door. this time, no one at the front door to help with luggage, and front desk staff were rather rude.

Loved that you accept dogs. Great decoration and great bar and service.The beds are very comfortable just too small for a couple. We were 2 adults and our 12 year old son. He was really happy though! Great reading lights for each person.

My husband and I had two beds in our room. One of them was unusable because it smelled so bad like cologne and condoms. Of there was no other bed we would have asked for a room exchange but our circumstances for being in the city had us so exhausted we settled for the cleaner side of the room. I can't believe the bed was not completely and thoroughly changed before the room was rented. As well as the smell of cigarettes, the window was open when we arrived bit the smell was coming from the bathroom that was not really clean either. The sink was clean bit the toilet and shower and floor were poorly looked at.

Had a great stay at this lovely hotel. Staff was great, hailed our cabs and was constantly there to open the door for you. Very friendly. Hallway on our 11th floor was rather dark and the people next to our room were extremely loud and we could hear everything. Overall we had a great stay and will definitely return!

great location, near subway, restaurants, grocery stores, shopping, etc. Only a few stops aways from Times Square. Easy access to museums and Central Park. Nice size and comfortable King room. Great bar and lobby seating areas. Public computers if needed. Very clean, prompt maid service, courteous staff. Definitely my go to hotel for future visits. Enjoy NYC!

My wife and I are four-time NYLO guests and have enjoyed each of our stays at this comfortable boutique hotel. We find the location very convenient--only two blocks from the subway at 79th Street. Taxis are also easy to catch on Broadway and there's a bus stop nearby for those who want to use mass transit. We have enjoyed the many restaurants in the vicinity, including Serafina which is located on the premises. The Amsterdam Ale House and Viand Cafe are particularly good for lunch.

The room was very clean and wide. There are 2 a little disappointments to me,because of no fridge and noisy of the airconditioner.But l like this hotel ,good lobby and pleasant staff.So I'd like to stay here the next visit N .Y.

I had a stylish, well-appointed room, which was a bit larger than your typical Manhattan hotel room (though it was just a standard room). I'm not a big fan of the wood floors, but I'm sure others will like them. The location is absolutely outstanding, and everyone at the hotel was very nice and helpful.
user_name:
Sam B
Ann Arbor, Michigan, United States

review_body: Spring break and college visit with our daughter. Great cafe around the corner and close to subway and Central Park. Safe neighborhood and clean. Easy to use the subway to head to lower or mid Manhattan. Room were surprisingly large and very clean. Beds were very comfortable.

I have stayed at NYLO dozens of time over the past decade. It just keeps getting better! The rooms are great, with the most comfortable of beds and and bedding. The location makes it even better. So handy to Lincoln Center, restaurants and other places on the Upper West Side.

I took my daughter to NYC for a concert at the Beacon Theater. NYLO is 2 blocks away so that was good. The lobby had lots of couches and a cute bar. We got in around 10pm on Friday night. We entered our room on the second floor. Maybe my daughter was used to staying at Kimpton Hotels, but immediately she had a bad feeling about the room. It was very boxy. Comfortable bed but the shower was dirty, the sink had no counter area and there was no mini-bar. I guess I didn't do my homework. I had to order roomservice but that only comes from the Semolina resturant attached to the hotel. And they don't send up a glass of wine. I don't get it.On Saturday before the concert I decided that we would have appetizers in the lobby. We had a full hour before we had to go to the concert. I ordered 2 appeitzers and we just sat there and waited and waited. Meanwhile watching all the other bigger parties of people be served on quickly. Finally I gave up and told the host that we had to leave. She didn't understand that an 8 1/2 year old girl gets hungry and going to a concert like that is not good. I prayed that the theater had food. Dinner was chips, pretzels, popcorn and m&M's. We had to order roomservice again at 11:00pm because my girl was starving for real food. I only stayed here because of the proximity to the Beacon Theatre. I won't stay here again.Only good thing is Semolina's breakfast. Big big breakfasts that satisfy. Food is much better at the resturant than for room service.

Best Kept secret on the Upper West Side. Great service, great location and great price. Easy to book online or to call directly. We love it there. Plenty of places nearby to eat. They seem to always have a room available. Not sure-but after you book-they send you an email asking if you want to upgrade your room for $8? Not sure about that. otherwise fine.

Close to subway, museum of natural museum, Central Park. Rooms a little small but comfortable & very clean.Air condition noisy.Forgot to upgrade online before check in, but managed do so when I arrived.

Stayed here for 4 nights visiting from U.K. And have to say was a pleasant stay all round, the hotel is small but very quaint with great decor, the room was a standard double and you could just manage with the living space, bathroom way on the small side and probably needs updating as it was looking a bit tired, the beds as previously mentioned are amazing and beat any including my own bed !!!! I would highly recommend just on that basis.. Nice welcoming staff great bartenders and the hotel sits in the upper west side which is close to the subway and only 3 blocks from Central Park, highly recommend this hotel as there is many more pluses than negatives l.

We stay here every time we visit the city. The location is close to park and many museums. Staff is always courteous and professional. Currently there's some nearby building projects which caused early morning rises, this is on 77th street. Otherwise the hotel itself is, as always, a pleasurable place to stay.

I had work in Harlem and I chose this hotel because it was close to two places I wanted to visit- one of my favs- The Hummus Place, and SoulCycle, which I've been dying to try. I visited both during my stay and very much enjoyed my experience! The hotel was also less expensive than other hotels in the area of my office. It's a short walk to the express subway so it only took me 20-30min to get to the office. The room is small but all you need. I had a comfy bed, desk, closet and bathroom. I was happy! The gym in the hotel is very convenient. Also small but all you need, up to date cardio equipment, free weights and a multi-task weight machine. Housekeeping/Guest Services were fantastic! This hotel is the epitome of NY efficiency, service and convenience. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone. The ONLY thing that wasn't as convenient is the wifi. It is not free, so I hopped on my phone's hotspot, but just so you know in case that's a factor.

We had a suite on the 14th/15th Floor. a lovely large outdoor area looking over to the hudson and over broadway. The hotel is in a convenient location, located a few subway stops from the hustle and bustle yet in a nice slightly quieter location in NYC if that is possible... close to popular places such as Levain Bakery and only a couple of blocks over from Central Park. I have stayed here 3 times now and will only use this hotel when visiting NY. it is a modern feel with clean facilities and friendly staff. reasonably priced as NY goes, and each time i end up upgrading to a lovely room.

I have no complaints about this hotel. It was very nice, clean, helpful staff and very comfortable beds. We did a lot of research trying to find the perfect hotel for us and I think we found it. I would highly recommend it to anyone. I also had questions prior to our arrival and my emails were quickly answered. Very impressed!

Great location. Room was clean. Bed was comfortable. Facilities were very nice. Modern atmosphere. Nice lobby bar. Close access to subway stations. Only flaw is having to pay for wifi. $15 a day is expensive.

Have stayed here about 5 times, usually on my own, once with my under - 10 kids, who have been in a lot of hotels and thought this was totally cool. Comfortable, easy, excellent location if you want to be in the UWS, pleasant staff, etc.

Great price for wonderful location. I go to NYC about every three months, and although I have tried many other hotels, I find the NYLO is the best hotel for the value. Love the vibe and the location. Rooms are clean and nicely decorated. This is not your cookie cutter hotel say like a Sheraton, it has a small hotel boutique style to it.
user_name:
PawHealer
San Diego, California, United States

review_body: Very nice reasonably priced hotel. Room was nice with big tv and great shower. Only complaint is that they do not provide free wifi ($14/day) and myT-Mobile signal in the room was poor. Nice bar in lobby

I enjoyed my stay very much so! We stayed in room 505, which faced the back of the hotel and although we didn't have a view, the room was so quiet and we got great sleep. The staff was very pleasant during the stay as well. The room as perfect. It had. Everything we needed. The room was clean and had complimentary keurig coffee and two free bottled waters. Unfortunately, my boyfriend was feeling under the weather and when I had a conversation with one of the housekeeping ladies, I mentioned it to her, and she was so sweet and caring. She recommended some soup places nearby and she encouraged me to bundle up more before hitting the streets. I really appreciated her watching out for us. The hotel fit our needs and we would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Check in was quick but when I got to room, there was someone in it. Apparently the room had been assigned to someone earlier. Also, was charged higher rate per night when I changed from 3 night stay to 2, though I informed them three days earlier.

Hotel worked out perfectly for a night at the Beacon Theater. Great staff, cool lobby bar and very friendly staff. Room was great - really comfortable bed and everything you need. Would definitely return.

Excellent value, great staff and amenities. Large room for NY. Very trendy feel. If you don't mind being in the heart of NY, I would definitely recommend staying here. Lot's of cafes & restaurants nearby, plus subway close-by.

NYLO is a great value. Check-in and check-out were both flawless, and the staff was friendly. The room was clean and the beds were very comfortable. The hotel is only two blocks from the theater where my daughter was attending a concert, so it was convenient. NYLO is also convenient to the subway and many places to eat and shop. I recommend NYLO highly.

NYLO offers a wonderful hotel experience and provides a little bit of charm as it's atmosphere gives you the feeling of staying in a loft. This is not the usual bland hotel. And the hotel staff is wonderful. Also a wonderful upper west side location.
user_name:
Barbara I
Fair Lawn, United States

review_body: Clean and friendly hotel. Close to subway and eateries. I was just concerned with safety. On Saturday night I was able to walk right into the hotel without showing idea of guest key. No staff was at the entrance. The lobby was crowded with people socializing and drinking. Staff were at the front desk but they were busy. Anyone could walk onto the guest floors which is dangerous.

The NYLO Hotel is ideally situated on W 77th and Broadway; walking distance from great restaurants, the subway and two of the best museums in the world, not to mention Central Park. The staff is efficient and friendly, the beds comfortable and the price moderate. We will look here first the next time we're coming to town.

I'll start with the reason for my title. For 6 days, every night I was woken up in the middle of the night for different reasons. The most consistent is the noisy AC/Heating Unit. Every time it turns on, it sounds like a lawn mower from the 80s. It's such a loud shocking noise that no matter how hard of a sleeper you are, it will wake you up. Then, one night some of the guests who may have been out partying all night or something came back to their rooms drunk and started slamming their doors. This started some battle between a lady who got upset about them slamming doors and the drunk guests. For hours, back and forth they argued and yelled in the hallway. On two occasions the Hotel staff were notified and came up to intervene. This happened again the next night. I know that the hotel business is tough and sometimes you cannot prevent trailer trash from staying in your hotel, but if you intervene more than once with a disturbance like this you should kick them out plain and simple. The staff were also sometimes very dismissive and rushy when I complained about the AC/Heating Unit they quickly cut me off and said "sir all of our rooms are the same, anything else we can help you with?" - so dismissive and so disappointing. Also, staying here for 6 days I bumped into many hotel staff and not one person once ever asked me "How is your stay with us?" or "I hope you are enjoying your stay with us." Even when I checked out, the lady at the front desk did not ask "how was your stay with us?" and Guess what, if she did I probably wouldn't be writing this review now. On the plus side, the hotel is in a great area (but next time I'll stay at the Hotel Belleclaire) and the restaurant Red Farm is excellent, plus the rooms are clean and the bed is super comfy (which I guess doesn't matter if there's constant noise preventing you from enjoying the bed.)
user_name:
Samson T
New York City, United States

review_body: The location was great for us. We took the Amtrak from Providence, RI to NYC. We took the subway to the hotel - the subway stop is 1 block from the hotel which was super convenient throughout our trip. The staff were nice, but kind of stuffy at the same time. We had the Lifestyle Loft which was so nice. The private balcony was very nice and the room itself was perfect. The only complaint I had is that in order to get to floors 14-16 you had to take a separate elevator - which is fine, except that it was broken throughout most of our trip. There were 2 elevators and both weren't working. I had to use the stairs to go up 14 flights. I like exercise, but when I'm in a rush or forgot something in the room it was pretty inconvenient.

Average overall. The rooms felt like dorm rooms with particle board furniture that was chipped. The floors were a faux wood laminate that looked and felt faux. The bathroom toiletries were cheap. Overall a bit disappointed for the price.

Great stay. Nice location. Convenient to lots of sites and things to do. Great friendly staff. Rooms are modern and nicely appointed. Very clean rooms. Don't think you will be disappointed if you stay here. Nice bar and lounge area and attached restaurant is very nice.

This boutique hotel is a great find. We stay here every time we travel through New York. A bit out of the way from the city activities it is accessible by Subway and has a nice neighborhood feel. We also spent this trip at the Natural History Museum which was a real treat for our son. I would recommend the location and the tight but clean quarters. This place has true value for the money.

The room was perfectly fine, nice even, but I did not expect the noise from the construction site across the street. Luckily I had my earbuds and white noise on my phone going all through the night, otherwise I would not have been able to sleep. There was a housekeeper's Carr parked outside my room all morning. I woke up to two women, presumably housekeeping, talking very loudly. Walls were thin so it felt like they were in my room. If you are a sound sleeper, this hotel is great-- good location, nice lobby, comfortable beds. Had an issue with shower drainage but I was only there one night. Be sure to request a room not facing the construction site if you are a light sleeper.

This New York NYLO Hotel is a great place to stay in the city. Genuine good value with welcoming staff who are genuinely pleased that you have chosen them out of all the hotels available. This was our second time staying at the NYLO and will book with them again whenever we are in the city. Have already recommended them to friends who are thinking of visiting New York.

Just got back from the big apple after 4 night stay. Really friendly helpful people. Stayed at Edison hotel top of Times Square would recommend. Apple jacks dinner for breakfast. 1725 broadway /55th st about 5/10 minute walk. Must do. 9/11 memorial tour centre. Well worth visit.

I purchased 2 rooms with the winter breakfast package and the breakfast was basically a beverage and toast. I went up to the front desk and they reimbursed me for the breakfast which was ok but i was hoping just for an upgrade. The rooms were very compact and tight no where to put your things. No refrigerator or microwave only by request which leaves you with even lesser room. Valet is 55 to 65 per night depending on the size of your vehicle. Location wasn't bad but overall I just figured for the amount you pay you should at least get complimentary breakfast or parking one or the other. Customer service was overall pretty good!

Must have room service if not 24 hours, at least until 11pm. beyond Serafina. And for this type of hotel you MUST put mini bars in each room. Was very shocked and surprised that there was NO mini bar in the room, esp the type of room that we booked. We stayed in one of your nicest rooms, came as a surprise not going to lie.
user_name:
elliots541
New York City, New York

review_body: The NYLO is FAB-U-LOUS. We loved the hotel, excellent price and so close to the subway in Times Sq within 25 mins. The CVS opposite is handy and a short walk to Central Park close to Strawberry Fields (John Lennon) and Tavern on the Green. My first time in NY and I would most definitely stay here again.We were lucky to get a free upgrade to room 421, which was just brilliant, coffee machine in the room and wifi.The bar area was super kool, relaxed trendy vibe, great friendly staff.We just loved it. Thank you NYLO!

Love this hotel. I book using Hotel.com but then extended my stay and the desk staff made every accommodation to keep me in my room. I worked all day and it was very quiet and the cleaning staff cleaned my room during a meeting. I love this hotel and it's location - easy walk to the park and the hotel bar is fabulous and dog friendly!

Room very modern, but bed exceptionally commutable and room quiet. Decor not to everyones taste and bathroom especially so.What lets this place down is the staff.No doorman - and you have 5 steps to struggle up to the lobby with your bag. No vallet - long wait.Front desk - not well staffed. Not friendly. Not helpful. Asked about vallet - instead of taking the keys to the car - said wait 5 - 10 minutes - he will be back. Concierge vanishes about 5.30pm - just when most people would need them. Check-out understaffed and not efficient. No check on whether you had enjoyed your stay. No other extras you would receive in a true boutique hotel, e.g. wine hour, coffee in the morning etc.

The location is fantastic for walking, shopping, and getting around NY. The amenities at the hotel are welcoming and thoughtful. The lobby bar is friendly and the drinks are good. The lounges for meeting or even working in the lobby are very doable. The beds are fabulously comfortable.

This hotel is located in a great neighborhood with fabulous restaurants nearby. It is an easy walk to the park. It has a great lobby and adjacent rooms to all, meet work or just chill in. Definitely worth a look!

Had to make a last minute trip to the upper west side of NYC. Found a great deal on a travel website for this hotel. The lobby is warm & chic and had lots of fun, comfy gathering and work places. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The location felt safe and provided easy access to everything. The only downside was that there was no free in-room internet. Even so, will definitely stay here again.

I love staying on the upper west side and this hotel puts everything right outside the front door. A starbucks and sephora are close by, which helps when you leave your entire makeup bag in a taxi, and there are several other restaurants and shops very close by. The subway station is at the corner and the hotel itself is very updated and comfortable. The staff is helpful and accommodating and the bar/lobby area is nicely decorated and cozy.

Excellent choice. Perfect location. Comfortable bed! Nice atmosphere. Bedside clock/light not working (only criticism)... Also, we think valet ate a pack of crackers we had left in the car...??... Not sure, but kind of odd

We've stayed in alot of hotels and residences in NYC over the years, and I can honestly say this was the best! Everything about NYLO appealed to us. From the very affordable price, with valet parking for a 50$ fee. The room was really a perfect size- and the bed- we forgot to check what make, bc next time we buy a bed- we want THAT one. Seriously!! A nice comb of industrial but friendly decor, not fussy, and not pretentious. Great location- at least for us on this trip. If you want to be near the Park, the Fairway, Natural Hx Museum, and have a very easy in and out from GWBridge- this is the hotel for you. We can't wait to return.

Beautiful and very clean hotel, just a few subway stops straight down Broadway from Columbia U. Great location for college visit. Felt very safe starting city visit here. Markets and good restaurants nearby. Everyone working at the hotel was helpful and pleasant.

Ideal location and great value. The lobby, with library, bar, and lounge is very cosy and lively. Comfortable beds and decent bathroom. Did not like the little metal bins with no backs. Hotel will be much quieter once construction is completed.

Great view of Hudson and nice room with plenty of space. Located in prime location from central park and numerous restaurants and museums withing in walking distance and close to subway station for ease of travel.

Great service from checkin to checkout, wonderful room and very quiet when I was sleeping. The front desk was wonderful about helping with directions and suggestions for things to do.. Loved the lobby and bar. Great weekend get away ! Definitely will be coming back here to stay.

Loved the atmosphere at this hotel & the rooms felt like home with cool up to date style! Everything was very clean & organized well. Front desk was fast and friendly. I wish we had stayed here longer!

I found NYLO to be a great value and a very comfortable place to stay. My bed was really comfortable, there was more room in my room than a usual small hotel in the area, and I loved the soap selection in the bathroom. My towel was also very nice, new, and fluffy. Staff was great, both in the hotel and in the Sarafina Restaurant attached. The food I had wasn't as flavorful as I'd like, but I only tried two items. Would like to try others before drawing a conclusion. Great staff, clean. Just a nice place to stay.

We weere attending a concert at the beacon theater and the location was wonderful, The room was a little smaller than it looks in the picture on the website but that did not deter from the experience we had, we enjoyed the stay very much and would definitely return again
user_name:
J3891CSmichaels
New York City, New York

review_body: I really loved the area in which the hotel is. I liked the lobby which provides for a nice cozy and friendly open area to relax or mingle. It was very close to restaurants, drug store, and even a clothing store. It was also very close to the subway. The staff is very friendly and very ready to help with anything. The only thing I did not like is that there was no refrigerator in the room. Overall I definitely would be staying there again. Thank you!

The hotel has very appealing common areas on the main floor. People gather, hang out, and talk to each other or read, have a drink, etc. Very appealing. However, the maintenance of the rooms has really fallen off on my third visit here. I hope the owners decide to put some money into freshening them up because the hotel otherwise is charming with interesting guests. Also, don't take the car service the hotel offers unless you want to ride in a dirty car, avoiding all toll roads so the driver can pocket the toll money you paid ahead of time.

Stayed here for our Anniversary It's in a Beautiful area by Central Park. It has a nice barStaff were Friendly. Place is trendy and cleanThey have free coffee for guests 24 7 and two on sight restaurants.

This hotel provided a very good value for the Upper West side of NYC. Convenient to everything I needed, close to the subway. Friendly front desk - very helpful. My only recommendation to increase my rating would be the condition of the hallways. Vacuming the grey carpet several times a day would help improve the feeling you experience when stepping off of the elevator to proceed to your room.

Friendly and helpful staff. Has great location, very close to the central park and the natural history museum. Very lean hotel and rooms. Some construction going on close to the hotel but did not bother much. Has a very nice bar at the entrance.

Aside from a little difficulty pulling in for valet on arrival (had to circle the block 3 times before a space to pull in was open), our stay was great. There were a number of great restaurants in the area and access up north to the Fordham University campus was very easy from here. The hotel itself was a nice blend of historic feel mixed with modern. It was very clean and the staff was friendly and professional. I would absolutely stay here again and recommend it to friends.

This is a treasure. Clean, great neighborhood, friendly staff. If you want the basics this is it. This is not plush luxury but that is not what we were looking for. I've already recommended to several people.

This hotel has an Amazing staff!! They are Always there to accommodate you!! Thank you for having me again! NYLO is awesome! Robert, Albert, Eloy Norman, Felipe! Thank you all for the awesome hospitality! Will definitely be back again!

I really enjoyed this place. The bed was spectacular. The room was modestly appointed, but perfectly comfortable. The bathroom showed some age in materials, but seemed clean enough. I prefer to take baths, and there was only a shower stall -- probably not an issue. Great location. I liked that there were hard floors (they say wood, but they are faux wood, which is fine), because I assume carpets have years of dirt buildup in them. There were cabinets rather than drawers to unpack into, which I found odd, but I assume most people don't fully unpack for hotel stays. I happen to like to use drawers.

Our family of 4 enjoyed 3 nights at the NYLO recently. The room (a Deluxe Queen Queen) was surprisingly large - with space on both sides of both beds and a sitting area (oddly configured L-shaped room). Beds were high and comfortable. Furnishings were low-end modern (think IKEA) and definitely gave a loft style to the rooms (different but very appropriate for NYC). We liked the wood floors, but some guests may prefer carpeting. The heating system was very loud and had great difficulty keeping the room at a constant temperature (we were alternately too warm or chilly) so it cycled on and off all night (keeping some of us awake). Great number of outlets, including some USB chargers - so the kids could keep all their devices charged - and the wireless internet speed was acceptable (should be included free in all room packages). When we extended our stay we we were not given the same rate or package - but told we could look up other options online, which was frustrating (and staff was a bit aloof/rude). Bathroom was reasonably sized with large shower (no tub). There were no terry cloth bathrobes as listed not the website, and arrangement of towels/hooks caused our towels (we used 4) to stay a bit wet overnight. Not sure the rooms were very cleaned each day - the beds were made and trash emptied, but sink seemed unwashed and "hello" written in fog on the shower door by previous occupants was still there when we left. (Although the room was not noticeably dirty). The "complimentary water" was two bottles at room temperature. Lack of an in-room refrigerator was a disappointment (no left overs or cool drinks). It was not at all clear where to find an ice machine (12th floor), as the halls are a bit of a maze and there is no information in the room about hotel services or amenities. Breakfast at the attached Serafina's restaurant was expensive but good (lemon ricotta pancakes, yum), but we were frustrated when asked if the hotel gave us "vouchers", which they did not (again, different packages provide different options - and it was all too confusing). Unlike other visitors, we did not have issues with street noise (there is construction directly across 77th street), but that was due to the fact that our room's 4 windows overlooked a brick wall! It was a bit disorienting, as we got practically NO evidence of daylight. The location was great - within walking distance of central park west side museums and such and only 2 blocks from subway. Nice bar & gathering areas.

Cosy hotel, clean rooms and bathrooms. What stops it being a 5 is the fact that there was ice on the inside Of the windows. Short kalks to the Metro, Natural History Museum and Central Park. We will definately consider this hotel when visiting New York

I stayed at this hotel on many occasions when it was under a different name (On the Ave) and stayed once under its current name and ownership, and at a time when I was not yet living in NYC. I now live close to the hotel, so there likely will be no need to stay there in the near future but I will refer friends and family who would like their own space to stay. The staff is very personable and accommodating, including a recent issue involving myself that arose involving a last minute reservation. I appreciated their flexibility and customer care.
user_name:
Lisa B
New York City, New York

review_body: Lobby was cute; room was adequate....a bit small. The staff was friendly. Elevator wasn't working properly and fitness center was feeezing-49 degrees early in the morning. I also had issues controlling the temperature in my room.

It doesn't take a lot to make a guest feel welcome....Totally unpleasant and terrible staff behavior.Dirty bathroom and a very loud heating system.The hotel was not at all busy but we were unable to check inbefore 4. Dreadful coffee in room, bad product, no carpets, and the overall smellof hallway and room was unexceptable.

This hotel was great and everything I would want from a New York Hotel! It's interior design was to die for, with an industrial, loft like design. This is what I always picture when I think of New York so it was perfect to meet my expectations of the city. The location is perfect just off of Central Park, near the Natural History Museum with a few Subway Stations near by. Staff were friendly and knowledgeable of the city. The only down side was that there was no Free-wifi in the bedrooms but all and all and excellent stay and will definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

My partner and I have stayed at NYLO several times. It offers a great location, great rooms with balconies (if you snatch the right one!), , comfortable if not "funky" furnishings and friendly service. An affordable, lovely alternative to other much more expensive properties.Well worth giving it a try!!!

This is a very nice hotel but our room had the loudest heating system. I woke up several times at night. We were facing Broadway so we also heard every single truck that passed by at 3am. It is unfortunate because the bed was so comfortable. Also it would be nice to have a refrigerator in the room. So next time I am in NY I will probably stay somewhere else.

This is an excellent hotel. The location is great- very close to the subway and close to 72nd street, which means you can take express trains on the red line. The upper west side is very pleasant and has plenty of eating options. The hotel has a very nice lobby area with a bar. The rooms are a decent size and the bed is great. The best hotel I've stayed at in NY. The staff are also very accommodating.

bed was extremely comfortable.....staff was very helpful and friendly...overall excellent experience --- and at a great price! this is a great hotel choice for the upper east side area of manhattan. definitely will stay here again!
