I enjoyed my stay and thought the hotel was very clean. I loved the décor of the room and felt very comfortable. I loved the look of the bar and the lobby. The restaurant had good food. The location of the hotel was perfect. Easy to access the subway too. I look forward to staying again.

The room was great! Views are stunning, LOCL is amazing, and some great restaurants and coffee shops in the area. We stayed at the penthouse loft- totally worth the money! It was a little chilly to be outside but it was beautiful. The only negative was the front staff- they weren't attentive and felt if they were bothered when I asked for help

Recently spent 4 nights at the NYLO on a family vacation. From start to finish, it was a great stay. The staff couldn't have been more helpful or friendly. Notable staff included: Kiara & Ramona at the front desk, Josh at concierge, Eduardo at the door, & Angel who drove us to the airport. I can't say enough about the superb customer service we received from each of them throughout our stay. So much so that I consciously took note of their names knowing they deserved a great review. The hotel is trendy, clean, & comfy. Always looked forward to our return after long days on our feet doing the tourist thing. Location was only a little more than a block from the subway, a short walk to the American Museum of Natural History and Central Park, with good places to eat open all hours within a block or two. Would definitely recommend and would definitely stay there again.

I fell in love with the Upper West Side a few years ago when I traveled to NY on regular basis for business. The neighborhood is very approachable with plenty of restaurants, coffee shops, drugstores, grocery stores, etc. nearby. It felt safe and sound for the solo business woman who travels, plus it was a short walk to my then corporate headquarters. I tried the Lucerne and found it out of date at that time and I was quite relieved to find On the Avenue (now NYLO).Late last year I was in New York for business and returned to the location, now NYLO. I was pleased to discover the same great service, some of the same terrific staff as before and an updated hotel overall. It's hip and fun with a lot of positive energy. Note: The hotel rooms are small, but not as small as many other NY hotels.If you have the extra $$ be sure to ask for a corner room. They have the best views. Enjoy!

We arrived early in the day and had been encouraged to check in. The folks at the front desk were friendly and accommodating, recommending a local bagel shop. The front desk called us when our room was ready. Our room was clean, quiet and comfortable; we never heard any other guests nor noises from the street. NYLO was the perfect location for our stay--close to a metro stop, The Museum of Natural History and other sites. We would definitely recommend NYLO to others!

Upgraded to panoramic room. Nice walk out balcony and clean room. Very small, but expected for manhattan. Bed was very comfortable. Good location, two blocks from subway station, some shopping and restaurants pretty close by.

While the room was more than adequate for the price (comfortable, clean and sufficiently roomy,) I was especially happy lounging around in the lobby. It was a great "hang-out" area, offering varied spaces for whatever your needs may be. It was chill and lively at the same time. I'd come back to this hotel for this reason.

good location, good beds, poor streetnoise insulation, shakey bathroom fixtures with loose taps and toilet roll holder, beware nonfunctioning reservation cancellation service and lack of staff knowledge re nearby restaurant locations

Me and my friend stayed in a loft here for a week and it was super clean and the setting was cute. Definately affordable if your travelling solo/friends/couples Transportation was so convenient to get by either by cab or subway. Cafes were only a few blocks away by walking distance and I found having a pharmacy and a fruit store next door was so convenient for us!! The only disappointment that we had was when our housekeeping was forgotten Concierge staff was average but overall I still rate this hotel 4/5

We love staying at the NYLO-the staff is always welcoming, courteous and helpful, the hotel atmosphere is cozy and hip, the bar is a fun place to sit and have a drink. The guest rooms are super clean and the beds are comfy-consistently!!

It was on the modern side. The room was small, but stylized and lovely. Hard floors, but that was nice for me. I could see the Hudson from my upgraded suite. The bathroom was sleek, modern, clean, functional with all the amenities.

As soon as I arrived the front desk agent helped me with my stay, quick and easy. Once I got up to my room, It was small but I could not complain about how nice and comfortable the bed was. Lights everywhere where I could adjust them. Told front desk I would be stepping out for a while and my partner will be arriving before I got back and if was possible to give him a room key, they were very accommodating. Will recommend this hotel and will stay again.
user_name:
karla m
New York City, New York

review_body: We visited our daughter for Valentine's Day week-end. It was our first time staying on the Upper West Side (normally we stay in the Times Square area). This hotel was very convenient to our daughter's apartment. Many restaurants and shopping within walking distance. Visited the hotel bar each night. Some were for a drink after dinner. One night was for drinks and bar food. Bed was VERY comfortable. Great sleep each night.Subway was 2 blocks away.We will definitely use this hotel again on our next visits.

We stayed at NYLO Friday and Saturday night of the "big storm" with near record snowfall they didn't skip a beat. Our room was very comfortable and the cocktails were great. The location is perfect for visiting our family in the Upper West Side.

While I have stayed at this hotel many times and quite enjoyed it, this time was not the same. Room furnishings were not great at all, and bottom open shelves under cabinets were be your dusty. Coffee maker did not work, and it was not repaired while I was there. I did however enjoy Serefina, and they did have excellent coffee.

Great room with walk out balcony. Staff upgraded us to a deluxe panoramic room at no charge. Clean, modern and great big shower. Couldn't ask for more from a Manhattan hotel. Area around is very quiet and has all the stores you would need for anything.

Great Stay Wonderful Hotel Great Location Very Helful Staff Felt Safe I Will Definately Reccomend This Hotel. Stayed was Worth Every Cent Clean Bathrooms and Most of all Comfortable BED Definately come back for a stay SOON

Perfect get away from the world, great for photographers too, nice valentines day get away with the lady. I would come back again of course for the groupon rate that i received. Bathrooom was flawless beds great feel, rooms were modern.

We stayed in a NYLO Superior room for three nights in early February and were very pleased both with the location and the hotel itself. We had stayed on the Upper West Side (UWS) once before in another nearby location and found the NYLO to be a much more pleasant experience. The location is an ideal base from which to take advantage of all that NYC has to offer. The UWS has a very quiet, laid-back and friendly neighbourhood feel about it, yet it is still only one subway stop from Times Square on the #2 or #3 Express train from the 72nd St station. The #1 Broadway local train from 79th street runs the entire length of Manhattan from the southern tip of the island, and to the north up into the Bronx. Using either of these you are able to connect with the vast network that is the MTA which puts all of New York just steps from the hotel. We arrived at the hotel well in advance of the posted check-in time with a view to dropping our bags and returning to complete the check-in later in the day. Much to our surprise we were told that our room was ready we enjoyed a smooth check-in and access to the room right away. The room itself was spacious and clean with a three piece bathroom that contained a shower with the best water pressure that I have ever experienced in any hotel, anywhere. The lack of a bathtub was not an issue for us, but I would advise that if this is a potential deal-breaker to confirm in advance whether there are any rooms where a bathtub is available. The furnishings and fittings in the room were of an industrial-chic design, very minimalist, but serviceable and above all clean. We also found the bed to be comfortable with good quality sheets, pillows and comforter. The room did not have a refrigerator when we arrived, but one was cheerfully provided within hours of our request. Check-out was a seamless as when we checked-in, and the front desk staff graciously offered to store our bags for us without being asked. This was not something that we required as we were flying out within a few hours, but if one were to have a flight much later in the day it would be a useful option. There is an on-site restaurant as well as a very comfortable lobby bar and business centre, none of which we got to fully enjoy given the busy schedule we had planned in advance.  Based on this initial experience at the NYLO we would not hesitate to return, and would be pleased to recommend this hotel to anyone seeking accommodation on the UWS.

I absolutely Love this hotel... There is always Friendly staff, a comfy bed, always clean and the location is perfect. Our stay was worth every penny! Will be booking another night very soon. Keep up the good work NYLO

I booked a 2 night stay over Valentine's Day. Upon check in, we were given the option to choose a "slightly larger" room with 2 beds rather than a queen bed room. This room was on a higher floor so I asked about the construction across the street. We were told there would be no construction during our stay. Of course, we woke up to construction right outside our window the morning after Valentine's Day. Rooms were ultimately trendy and comfortable but cramped. The restaurant at the hotel was average. Hostess was wonderful- she moved our table when she saw how cold the front of the restaurant was getting due to the frigid temperatures. Wait staff was terrible. Gave us the check before we even finished the entree. We still wanted to order dessert it was Valentine's Day after all.Convenient location. Close to Subway stop and CVS directly across the street. They gave out complimentary roses on Valentine's Day which was a nice touch. They ran out quickly though.Check out was the worst part of our stay. I politely asked for a printed receipt and the front desk agent told me to request one from my booking website. I asked to please print me a receipt for my records so that I could see a zero balance for my stay. He refused. I was forced to call my credit card company to make sure there were no additional charges. Concierge was just as bad. We asked them if there were any diners in the area for breakfast. They told us that there were unfortunately no diners in that luckily. Funny enough there were two very crowded diner 2 blocks away.Overall, great location with sub-par service. Would stay again if I wanted to be on the Upper West Side. Trendy and "cool" but not the best.

The rooms were too cold. The space was nice it needed a bit more storage space though. We coudlnt put the heat up like we wanted to and that is our biggest complaint. the front desk could have been more helpful

This was our first time sating at this property. It was very reasonable and the location was perfect for us. We planned on visiting the Museum of Nat. History and do some shopping and dining. The restaurant selection n the area was great.The room was very spacious and clean The furnishings are somewhat barebones, but all you need and very easy to use. The bed was great and perfectly comfortable. I might even buy a mattress like it. The lobby\bar area was very nice and inviting as well as busy at night with a very "hip" crowd (not including me). I will definitely return to this property in the future. Great stay!

Another great stay at the NYLO I was there Dec. 26-28,2015 and Feb 5,2016. The rooms are nice the service exceptional. They have Happy hour at the bar very day until 6:00 p.m. the Serfina restaurant next door has great food and your can charge it to your hotel room.

We were there for a get away trip from Wednesday to Sunday. Everyone was very friendly, there was open communication with the front-desk staff they asked if we wanted the view or if preferred the quiet room. We selected the quiet room and that was one simple way of them valuing our business. Overall, our stay was comfortable, safe, and valuable. Thank you

At the end of a two week road trip honeymoon, we ditched the car at JFK and looked forwards to checking into NYLO with its handy Broadway address and stunning looking photos on the website. We were not disappointed, even if some important building work was going on which meant that one side of the hotel was more of a building site and we were advised to be careful with our curtains in our room for fear of shocking a workman! The entrance to the hotel leads into a tasteful lobby/bar area where we were warmly met and given free wifi as a special treat, which was nice as I think we were weighing up whether it was worth the cost. Our room was cosy and clean and fresh and whilst our view was not to be, the rooftop terrace had a stunning view over the city, especially at night.We stayed for four nights and for the location and quality of room and service, we were extremely happy. Just a short walk from two different subway stations, on the main part of Broadway, just a block or so from Central Park and several museums and just down from Zabar's legendary market store, this was an ideal base for our adventures. Highly recommended.

Enjoyed my time at the hotel. Rooms are modern simple and very comfortable beds. Coffee and tea provided in room with a Keurig machine. Shower and bathroom are again modern and work very well. Shower seemed to have great pressure and the soaps are higher quality "Pure" brand. My favorite part is the location. Only 10 minute walk to Central Park and tons of places to eat and pharmacys close.

I brought 9 girls ages 14-17 to take dance classes and enjoy a Broadway Show. Your hotel was perfectly located to walk to Steps Dance Studio, take the subway down to Time Square and to go uptown for a great family style meal at Carmine's.

I found this hotel by random internet search. We were very pleased with the quality, style and location. The bed was quite comfortable and the bed linens were clean. We will definitely stay there again!

This hotel made my night extra special. Me and my other half loved everything about nylo. From the lighting to the overall atmosphere. If ur in this area, stay at this hotel. It's worth it. Defiantly try eating at the Italian restaurant located in nylo. Genuine Italian cuisine. The food was phenomenal.

The hotel is near by almost all atraction in new york. For a tourist like me was perfect. The background in the lobby is nice with good music. The included breakfast was regular, is only bread and coffee, it can be better.

I've stayed in this hotel many times. Rooms are small but comfy. Location is great. It's nice to get out of the hustle and bustle and retire to a quiet place after a long day in the city. Prices are very reasonable in the winter. In the summer, it's expensive.

this has been my "go to" hotel for most of my trips to NYC. Very convenient location, close to subways and walking distance to Lincoln Center. The room is adequate size with excellent comfort, clean and quiet. The staff is friendly and helpful with directions, recommendations.

The location was terrific: 2 blocks from the American Museum of Natural History. Nice restaurant in the surroundings and great shopping opportunities!We quality/price ratio was the best possible for NYC. We will definitely come back. One little thing though it seems that there were a lot of construction site going on. But it seems to be the case all over NYC.

I used to live on the UWS so it was really nice to be back in the 'hood. I think the room we stayed in may have been bigger than my apartment! It was clean, comfortable and spacious. The hotel lobby was cozy and inviting. I would definitely stay here again!

The NYLO is my favorite hotel in NY. Some hotels have terrific glitz. This is a hotel of great substance. It jas a wonderful ambiance and the entire staff is warm and professional.The hotel can sometimes be pricey during the busy tourist season (like all top notch NY hotels) but during the off season it's a great deal. I give it my highest recommendation.

My husband and I recently stayed at NYLO for an early Valentine's Day getaway. The location, service and price for the hotel were excellent. Room was a good size and was quiet on the 6th floor. It was clean, had shampoo and soap that were not animal tested (important to me), and lots of hot water. It was close to the Beacon Theater (where we had tickets for a show) and is also close to Lincoln Center and museums. The bar in the lobby was fun and we ate at Serafina ... good food, service was just a little slow. The room price was very reasonable. It was less than $300 for two nights including taxes.

Bell and valet were extremely friendly and helpful. Front desk was just so so Service in the bar and restaurant was very slow to the point of feeling forgotten . However the food and quality was very good

Great place, especially for the price. Convenient location near the subway and lots of great eating places. Ask for a courtyard room due to the construction on the street side. Low service, but good beds and comfortable rooms.

Reasonable price and very clean! I stayed during a business trip. The rooms were on the small side but sufficient. I especially enjoyed the hard wood floors and very comfortable bed and linens. Great location as well and very quiet.
user_name:
A B
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Very, very nice place. Recently renovated, and terrifically located. The only problem: noise. There's some noise from outside, but also, some of the rooms have adjoining rooms with thin doors in-between them. Not good.

Value for room saved us $200. Clean, upscale, quiet . Great food reasonably and priced at Serafina. More than willing to hail a taxi for us, which always seems to be a challenge for us in New York. <3

I booked a standard room and upon check-in, the front desk upgraded me to a superior room. The staff at the entire hotel was extremely friendly. Location was great and walking distance to many bars/restaurants.

Really enjoyed our stay at NYLO. Staff was friendly and housekeeping went out of their way to make it a pleasant stay. Location is right by the subway, and lots of action right outside the hotel with shops and restaurants. The only downside was the construction got noisy across the street and the rooms got cold over night since we stayed in the winter time.

Nice and clean hotel but the bed pillows were mushy although numerous. The walls are thin so activity of other guests is bothersome late at night. The heating unit in the hotel was noisy when it cycled on during the night and coupling that with noisy guests meant I didn't get much sleep.

I found that getting a reservation was cumbersome because I hate dealing with oversees people. Trying to get to the reservation desk at the hotel was also cumbersome. I did not think the shower was clean there was mold in the corners. It was too utilitarian for my taste. Seems like a younger peoples hotel.

Booked Hotel because of proximity to the Beacon Theater, also close to museums and central Park. Pleased with staff, very friendly and helpful. Great value, good breakfast at connected restaurant, nice area. Will definitely stay again.

I stayed here for two weeks on business and thoroughly enjoyed the Nylo. The views over the river are great. There was an issue with a window seal that made for a bottle between winter and the heater but the hotel attempted to fix it. Access to restaurants and the hotel bar were plusses.

We have been coming to NYLO for many years (when it was OnThe Ave) and we still like it a lot. The bellstaff is the friendliest and most helpful. The front desk, a bit less so, but OK. I feel they cut some of the rooms in half on the upper floors! The views arent what they used to be! But still an enjoyable stay! Love the location! easy to get around by subway, and lots of good restaurants on the UWS.

Perfect location (located on the Upper West Side) so it's relatively close to all the local hot spots. The hotel accommodations were very good, the staff... Not so much. The check-in process was a pain and the staff weren't very friendly, which made the process more difficult than needed be. I would come back to this hotel again, but only because of where it's located.

Had another wonderful stay at the hotel. I was there in November and we loved it so much that I came back in January. Had a great spacious clean room, the service was wonderful as was the location. Hotel staff very friendly!!

The Nylo hotel was a mixed bag for me. On the upside: VERY well located. The immediate neighborhood has lots of restaurants and shops within walking distance. It's also walking distance to the Museum of Natural History. If you want to go somewhere farther off, the 1 train is just two short blocks from Nylo. And of course you can transfer at 42nd street to a number of other trains, taking you all over the city--other parts of Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens and the Bronx. The room was quite clean and it was not noisy at all. There was also a bar in the lobby quite a bit of comfortable seating, as well as a long table where you can plug in your computer and work.The downside: The room itself was *tiny*. I think they might try having a queen size bed instead of a king size one. As it was, the king size bed took up 80 of the room--seriously, it really did! There was not a lot of room to move around. Also, the bathroom had a frosted glass door through which you could clearly see whoever was inside. :-(That said, I think this hotel is fine for people who are just going to shower and sleep there. So if you're like most tourists, it's great. If you want to luxuriate in your room, hang out and relax there, try somewhere else.

Stayed here with my Wife Super Bowl weekend. Very friendly from valet to housekeeping. In house restaurant and bar very good and convenient. Nice, clean room with terrace. Bed and pillows very comfortable. Only downside was paying for WiFi and walls are a bit thin, we could hear our neighbors. But still a hotel we would stay at again without a doubt.

Quite noisy, thin wall, and next door neighbors who banged things off adjoining door and tried the handle several times.Other neighbors exercising and bouncing around the room at 6:45am on Sat morning, quite annoying!!!

Location, location, location! I'll come back to this hotel for the location alone. Walking distance to the subway and tons of great restaurants and bars! My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights and really enjoyed ourselves. The bed was so comfortable and I really appreciated the modern feel of the place! Chief complaints were the cleanliness of the bathroom and the noise. I'm going to give the hotel the benefit of the doubt and say we were just unlucky on both counts. The hotel itself appeared very clean, as did our bedroom, so it was just our bathroom that seemed overlooked. When we arrived there was no soap, shampoo, or conditioner, and the shower wasn't properly attended (hair in drain). As for the noise, we were placed on the second floor (very unlucky) and construction started right outside as early as 6AM...no sleeping in for us! We did ask to change rooms at check-in, but unfortunately no rooms were available on higher floors. Fingers crossed that next time we get a room on a higher floor!
This hotel is so nice. The staff is very helpful and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. The bar area is a huge plusAnd a perfect spot to grab a snack and nice drunk and rest or meet your friends

This hotel is in an excellent location for those who want to visit Lincoln Center, Julliard, etc. I would also say it is an easy walk to Columbus Circle, Central Park, and even Times Square.I was given a very quiet interior room that was HUGE by New York standards. The bed was comfortable and the black out drapes were effective. I slept really well which I don't always do on vacation. The bathroom was not huge but very adequate. The room was clean and in good condition.I did not make any special requests but the staff were helpful to me with the day to day things.There is a lively bar in the lobby and some good restaurants (such as Red Farm) near by.I highly recommend this hotel. I will definitely return.

if the place had faster elevator service, it would get 5 stars. My wife and I stay here often as we were West Side people. Rooms are comfortable and well appointed in an industrial type decor( bathrooms). Great off season ( Jan 2 to St Pats) rates. Friendly front desk, decent pub/bar in an open setting to hotel. Easy access to local train (#1 at 79th or #2/3 at 72nd). Short walk to museum, Central Park , Lincoln Center and plenty of shopping , bars, restaurants etc etc in a more neighborhood setting than midtown...we love it !

Very good accommodations, friendly and knowledgeable staff, perfect location for us (Upper West Side, where we have family). Offer of good deals normally determine when we decide to spend some time in the city.

This hotel is perfectly situated on the Upper West Side, and you can take advantage of local restaurants, shows and get around easily by subway. I really like the neighborhood, and will use this hotel again.

A bit on the shabby-chic side, but much nicer than anything else on the UWS. Great lobby and bar, generally friendly service and comfortable rooms (some are very small). Serafina is NOT an asset - better to eat off premises. Wish they had a parking deal with a garage but you are on your own there. Good value, overall a comfortable nice hotel.

We enjoyed the location, the vibe and the bar at this hotel. Rooms are modern and sleek, clean and fresh. Noise from adjacent room was our only complaint. Staff friendly and nice. Would definitely recommend for the Upper West Side and proximity to Columbia!! Boutique feel for a great price.

Make sure everyone asks for the free drink ticket! It's available but the management gets to pick and choose !The management is what is making this hotel more like a vibed up truck stop the the "boutique hotel with a neighborhood feel" Buyer beware!!!
user_name:
Karen E
New York City, New York

review_body: Beautiful hotel !!! great rooms with plenty of space, the beds are really comfy,the only issue I would have is the bed is really high so if you have mobility problems it could be a problem. The area is lovely and safe with lots to do and only 2 blocks from the national history museum which is great.The one problem we did have was when we left we were told we had no charges but got home and found out over £100 was taken off but was quickly rectified

Contemporary minimialist clean lines. Great bed!Very comfortable. Second stay there. Lobby area fun and welcoming. Blend of business travelers and tourists. Serafina is adjoining restaurant. Good food.

Booked for 6 nights late November / early December. We decided to pay the extra for a room on the 14th floor with a balcony. To be honest the room was small and would not have said it was worth paying the extra for. Especially this time of year. There is a lovely bar on the ground floor that is we'll worth a visit. The staff were helpful and friendly but not the most talkative. Being our first time in New York we didn't realise that this was the way we found most New Yorkers.The location of the hotel is spot on. Short walk from the subway and Central Park. If you're staying there for a week or so I'd recommend buying a weekly pass for the subway. Saved us money and time having to buy tickets again and again.If the room was larger it would have been a 5star.

My husband and I enjoyed our stay in NYLO for a weekend in December. The room, although small, was very clean and comfortable. Bathroom, though, was very close quarters. People working at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. Lounge and bar area was inviting and many festive holiday celebrants enjoyed the warm ambience. I would stay again!

I've stayed at NYLO three times and it is now solidly my NY go-to hotel. The rooms are simple, but chic, clean, and very comfortable. The public areas are warm and welcoming; hip but not too-cool-for-school. And the staff is friendly without being obsequious. The reasonable rates and low-key UWS neighborhood (tons of restaurants, markets, access to subway, park, museums) are the clincher. NYLO New York feels like a home away from home and I'll be back.

Again I review this place- I just love it!! The rate is absolutely unreal for NYC,(late Jan, I know...lol) and I wont say what I paid, as rates change constantly. The staff if so friendly and welcoming, and the location cannot be beat (for what I needed to do)- but otherwise, the availability of shopping and restaurants nearby is impeccable!!! Oh and by the way, the beds are the best and most comfortable I have ever slept on!

The hotel was fun, full of life, great music, nice staff. Rooms were comfortable and clean. The bedding was excellent. The neighborhood was the best. Great restaurants, movie theaters and easy access to subways and the daily routine of people that live in NY> A great way to experience NY without having to live there.

Enjoyed my stay. Felt safe and secure and loved the lounge area during downtime. Very centrally located to everything in the UWS of Manhattan with only a 20 minute cab ride to downtown during busy times. Staff was very helpful and friendly and accommodating. All conveniences within walking distance. Would stay at this hotel again!

Masses of building next door, starts at 7 am every day. Really noisy.Bar staff great. Rooms modern and clean. Great decor. Limited facilities, but near central park.Reception staff and reservations rude beyond measure. Every time I stay that point is reinforced. The worst I have ever experienced.

This hotel is amazing! Nothing short of! Literally, CVS is across the street. The lobby is amazing. The rooms are very clean. We stayed in a 2 queen room and the beds are more than comfy. The shower is wall to ceiling marble!!!! I will definitely stay here again!

Contemporary without failing at hipness. Comfortable, clean and sufficiently stylish. Pleasant lobby and adequate bar. My sole objection was the attached (but not affiliated) restaurant left much to be desired. But plenty of choices in the neighborhood. Great location and access to Central Park, Museum of Natural History and subways are a couple of blocks away.

NYLO was the perfect boutique hotel AND at a great price. Great location to get anywhere in the city and the beds were so comfortable and super clean!! Highly recommend to anyone who wants a weekend getaway!
nice rooms , great price, bad experience with noiseand as I said before the staff member was less than nice about my concerns. I was not happy with the noise, dusty bathroom shelves and tiny shower!!

Location is great for an uptown stay. Staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and a trendy yet boutique hotel feel. The trip was for business and was affordable and included breakfast and wifi. The Breakfast was great and more than a typical continental meal.

Great stay, very safe, super clean, comfortable, amazing bar area, friendly and helpful staff. Arrived early in the city, and they let me have an early check in at 12, with no extra charge. Loved it. Will surely come back.

Awesome experience at NYLO. We will be returning! The location can't get better. Access to wonderful restaurants, and great overall neighborhood. I agree with other recent review. The bed was comfortable. The only challenge we had was the construction that is going on across the street. This is temporary and would not keep us from rebooking.

Enjoyed my stay. Pleasantly surprised with the room-especially with NYC standards. Nice, clean, contemporary. VERY comfortable bed and pillows. Only complaint I had was the construction at 7:00 AM that woke me up and also that the walls between the rooms are not that sound proof. Manager was very apologetic for the construction (discounted the room) and said that it should be done by October. Overall great service. Cool lobby area. Very nice boutique hotel. Especially hard to find a good hotel in the Upper West side. Highly recommend NYLO!

We arrived at the NYLO early on Friday afternoon. Our room was ready when we got there but when we got to the room, it was horrible and dark. The windows faced the center of the building so all you could see was a brick wall. The room was small, dark and depressing so we went back to the front desk to ask for a new room. The person behind the counter pretended not to understand why we would want to switch rooms and I didn't like his attitude, but finally said he would give us a new room but it would be noisier because of construction outside on that side of the hotel. We didn't care; we'd rather have the noise and the light and the view than to spend our weekend in a dungeon like room. We had to wait almost 2 hours to get the new room. We were very happy with the switch. There really wasn't much noise from the construction and the room was bright and airy. Great to have a coffee pot in the room for morning coffee if you didn't want to go down the block to starbucks first thing. The bathroom was sufficient. Would love to have robes in the room but that would be a perk. The thermostat in the room wasn't working (flashing low battery) but was quickly fixed when we told the front desk. All in all, it was a fine visit in a great neighborhood.

Very nice Broadway location, convenient to just about everything on the West Side. Good value for the price. Very friendly and accommodating staff. Transportation from this location is very easy; subway, bus, cab, etc.
user_name:
X7164SXianc
New York City, New York

review_body: Loved the bed - so very comfortable. Was very impressed with the styling. Great location- walking distance to Central Park and the Natural History Museum. Very convenient market, pharmacy and subway station. Had an excellent stay and would highly recommend.

Very very very noise old air-conditioning system. It goes on and off every 5/8 minutes. I've tried four other different rooms and they are all with the same problem. STAFF COULD BE LESS SNOBBY.!!!!!!!!

We enjoyed our stay at the NYLO very much. The bed was so comfortable it was devine. Everything was good except the walls between the rooms are too thin and disables one to put the TV loud enough for someone who is hard of hearing. Sorry. However, this can be easily fixed with spekers or move the TV off the wall.

It's a nice enough hotel but the billing policy is a deal-breaker. The hotel charged my card an additional $50 per night to cover additional fees WITHOUT making this clear beforehand. Then, three days after I checked out, they have still not paid me back the $300 to my card. I should not have to chase the hotel for my money. They did not have to chase me for theirs.

We had a great experience - wish we could have stayed a little longer! Will be back!Only one thing that wasn't hotel's fault was around 5am someone in room next to us left their room and slammed the door and did it another time a few min later when they returned. Wish the doors didn't slam shut so loud. Other than that -- very pleased overall!
user_name:
Michelle T
Westchester County, New York

review_body: Great location, close to Lincoln Center. Great lobby bar, friendly and clean. Sarafina is a good restaurant on the property in case you want to stay in. Staff is super friendly and helpful, and parking is right across the street.

I recently stayed at the Hotel Nylo in Manhattan for the first time and i was blown away by the experience. First rate location, upper west side of Manhattan. The lobby and lounge are comfortable and has great energy.My room was perfect, even though it faced 77th street and construction. This didn't matter at all. I was never more comfortable. The staff led by Norman Chung were helpful and welcoming. This is one of the great places to stay in NYC.

We were in town for one night to see a special performance at the Beacon Theater. This hotel is a very short walk away. Everyone that we encountered, who worked there, was pleasant and helpful. Our room was clean and peaceful. There is a nice little bar in the lobby, and a large sitting area for just hanging and a good restaurant attached to it where we had breakfast (another good review). I recommend this hotel when you are looking for something in this neighborhood. We would definitely return.

Great reasonably priced hotel central to all the fun spots in New York; we have two children in Manhattan and visit often. Clean, comfortable and quiet rooms. Great bar with crafted cocktails without stuffiness. Entertainment includes pianists, jazz combos, torch singers depending on the night. Adjoining restaurant has nice reciprocity. Dining nearby, laundry, etc.

I have stayed here 4 or 5 times in the last couple years. Great location and very comfortable. Love to walk through the park to the Metropolitan Museum and east side art galleries and museums. Subway is 2 blocks away.

Love everything about NYLO. Our room had an beautiful view of the city and the perfect amount of space for two people. loved that this location was walking distance to just about anything you need. i would definitely use NLYO again.

Really helpful staff small but amazing rooms very comfartable bed and also great airport transfers If I was to stay in New York again it would be at this hotel great location also with everything you need around you e.g 24hr supermarket and pharmacy

Front desk staff at check-in that night wasn't warm and when I wanted to extend they just abruptly said they're fully booked. Room was small and mostly bed but fine overall. Pillows weren't comfortable. Bar was quite nice. Serafina next door was terrible both my partner and I were less than impressed by the food, service and we felt sick after in all honesty.

I recently stayed at the NYLO and yes as previously stated, the beds are good. The water pressure is only decent, and the morning of my departure wasn't really working well at all in the shower. However, the biggest complaint I had was the response from the front desk when I asked for silverware so that I could cut some fruit in my room. This should be easy to achieve, since the NYLO NYC Website states that they have ' 3-onsite restaurants.' Hmmm. Not really.See text copied from website: Trendsetting On-Site DiningNYLO New York City features 3 on-site restaurants and bars.They offered me plastic silverware. And were extremely condescending when i said that I couldn't cut an apple with that and how was it possible that they had no silverware. I went to the adjacent, off the lobby, restaurant to ask for a knife, and was refused, told, "we are not connected with the hotel."So, not only does the website misrepresent what "services" they offer. They need to think about items guests would want that are normal and customary for a 4-star hotel.I suggest the hotel purchase some inexpensive silverware to offer other guests who may want it. It's not uncommon, at all, for tourists, especially when surrounded by the plethora of great gourmet markets in the area, to buy cheese, bread,fruit, snacks and want to be able eat it in a civilized manner. I couldn't even get a civilized response from the staff. They acted as if I had asked for an hatchet. Really! 4 stars?

The Nylo is a bargain in New York City. we have stayed there many times during the past two years. It is located is a great family neighborhood that is very safe. You get a pleasant stay with great service for a very reasonable price. We love the extra attention we get at the Nylo. They are always pleasant and willing to go out of their way for any needs you may have.The Nylo is convenient to the subway and to many local attractions. (Central Park, Lincoln Center, Zabars and Mille-feuille Bakery Cafe and the famous Grey Papaya hotdog place! You must try the croissants at Mille-Feuille Bakery right across the street on Broadway! The Red Farm restaurant next door is also must to try. The bar at the Nylo is excellent and the bartenders are friendly and attentive. This is a great place for couples and families. The rooms are alittle small, but ask for a double queen and the room will be large.
user_name:
Cheryl A
Herculaneum, Missouri, United States

review_body: Small, but very comfortable, clean room. UWS location worked for us - a couple of blocks to the park, the 1 train & 79th St crosstown. Friendly, but unobtrusive staff. Good bar. Only downside - the internet service was spotty, and there was construction going on across the street and they started banging before 8AM. I would stay there again.

Very modern and happening hotel. Looks like it has modern updates, the lobby is very cozy with many sitting areas and an open area bar. The rooms were very nice and clean. They give you 2 bottles of complimentary water. Wi-Fi was good. Beds/pillows very comfortable. Rooms are quiet. Staff is very friendly. Serafina's restaurant attached to the hotel is very nice and the food and bar are excellent! We used the car valet services. Note they do inform you that there is a 45 min wait for the car to arrive back to the hotel.

We were pleasantly surprised with this charming contemporary boutique hotel just a few blocks from the Beacon Theater. Our spacious room overlooked Broadway. The lobby included a comfortable seating area as well as a bar and direct access to Serafina restaurant. All in all a great place to stay.

Lovely boutique hotel on UWS. Friendly and courteous staff, lovely, quiet rooms with great biews off a balcony. Bathrooms were clean and the decor was lovely. Would definitely return again or recommend to a friend.

Value for money! The best location we could emagine. 10 minutes to Central Park, 4 minutes to "72 street" train station, plenty of Zagat rated places around. Room was OK, spacey and freshly renovated. Poor breakfasts - we recommend to go outside any direction to find something nice

We loved our stay here. The rooms were clean and pleasant. The TV was a nice size, the bar was great with big windows to look out onto the street and passerbys.The location was perfect for us, being a block from the Beacon Theater.

We have stayed here many times. Great boutique hotel on the upper west side. Very comfortable bed with a great shower. The staff is always very accommodating. We can't wait to stay here again soon, Mark.

I booked this hotel on Hotwire and was excited to be staying on the Upper West Side.I hadn't heard of NYLO before and was pleasantly surprised with this lovely place. Thestaff was more then welcoming and the room was perfect. Possibly the most comfortable bed I've slept on. I loved the hotel bar. They had a great happy hour and it was a comfortable and cool environment too! I can't wait to book this place again.

Good hotel nice staff, reasonable rates, we had panoramic suite and it was tiny, tiny could not even put down luggage, my friends had loft suites they were big and roomy, but panoramic was a postage stamp, I could chose more expensive loft, or less expensive still tiny regular room, very good bed comfy

While we had high expectations given the location and quality of this hotel, we were more than a little disappointed. The heat in the bathroom didn't work, nor did the bedside lamps. The tv was problematic and we were given the wrong size bed. We were told that it was due to lack of availability, however, we had a reservation. The gym was freezing and as a result, we were not able to use it. There was no do not disturb sign and because of that, housekeeping woke us up in the morning and we didn't get in until very late. The staff was friendly and check in and check out was seamless. We had breakfast at the house restaurant, Serafina, which was very good. The portions were perfect for anyone and the food was gourmet like and affordable. Our overall experience was tolerable, even with all of the issues. However, not only would I not return again, we would not recommend this hotel to a friend or family member.

I'm so happy I found this hotel! It's in a great location on the Upper West Side: Easy subway access. Lots of museums nearby. So many great food choices. Our room was very comfy. Will definitely stay here again!

We were visiting family living on the Upper West Side and thought we'd try something closer than mid-town for a change. This hotel cam recommended by friends and was easy walking distance to our kids. The hotel was very modern and comfortable with great amenities. Our room had only a shower, but it was very well done and worked well and was not cramped. By contrast, the room had a king bed stuffed into it, but was very cramped and small. Still, the furnishings were hip and fun, even if there was hardly room to move about the room. The front desk personnel were friendly and efficient and the lobby bar was hopping. The neighborhood has lots of great places to eat and shop and easy transportation by two different subway lines, plus very easy walking access to the Museum of Natural History and the New York Historical Museum. I will definitely consider staying here again on another visit to my kids if the pricing is reasonable as it was on this trip.

We had to cancel reservations made in October due to the weather.We were very disappointed but are hoping to try to visit in the spring.I would like to commend inhouse reservation for their prompt reply and understanding with our situation.

Great rate. Good location. Helpful staff, lovely lobby areas to read and relax. Room was typical European room size, but lovely. Awesome bed. Great bathroom. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. I would stay here again.

The place is very nice, except for rooms that look like student dorms. Bed was excellent and staff-especially cleaning staff-was very friendly. Big plus is very quiet, big minus is decor of room is dreary.

Hotel - fantastic interior design, excellent location Room - [panoramic deluxe type] great balcony and view of the river even it was full of snow and we couldn't use the chairs. VERY comfy bed and the smell is so nice too. There is no slipper in the room but it is ok bc the floor is not too cold to step on (but it would be great to have slippers so we can also walk on the balcony)Staff - Great service. reservation staffs are EXCELLENT Bar - we had a recommended signature cocktail but it was very strong and very bitter for ladies and it tasted like medicine. we don't like it but the atmosphere of the bar is nice to sit during the night.

Besides being in a wonderful location, the staff members at the NYLO are so accommodating and willing to please!!! The beds are extremely comfortable and everything is clean. This was my second stay after my family had recommended it to me. I'd stay here again in a New-York-minute!!!!!!

From check in, to check out the experience was great. The staff was on it. The room was super cute,stylish and functional. The hotel was 2 short blks from the subway and many food/drink options nearby

Friendly and helpful staff, excellent location (This is our third stay here(). We went for business and brought our kids. Small fridge was brought to the room upon request, and there is a supermarket and 24 hr drugstore in front of the hotel. Elevators are a bit slow. There is no ramp for strollers, although the doorman was always helpful with getting into and out of the lobby. The room and bathroom were very clean and a reasonable size for NY. The only issue was a significant draft from the window.

My sister and I absolutely loved our stay here! Got stuck during Snowmageddon and it couldn't have been more perfect. The staff was friendly, helpful and kept us up to date on the happenings. The bar was constantly busy so I can only imagine how awesome this place is during the summer with the rooftop bar. The location is wonderful (there's a Shake Shack 2 blocks away!), and it was close to Central Park and the 1 line. Rooms were clean, modern and spacious. And the beds! So comfy and nice to climb into after a full day of walking around. I would definitely stay here again - price/location/amenities was totally worth it.

Location of the hotel is decent on the Upper West Side, you can walk down broadway to Central Park and Times Square within 10mins, and the subway station is nearby as well. The lobby of the hotel is also a bar and has a good vibe.The hotel rooms themselves are reasonably modern and clean.Our biggest issue was how loud the room was. There is construction happening across the road from the hotel which starts at 7am on the dot Monday to Friday. We were placed on the second floor, right across from the construction, and it honestly was so loud that it felt like there was a jackhammer in our room with us. Even without the construction, the windows don't seem to be sound proofed as the noise of taxis honking all night carried right into our room. I'm normally a heavy sleeper however we didn't get much sleep in this hotel.I feel like this hotel has the potential to be really great, however no one from the reception mentioned any of the facilities when we checked in, so it was up to us to 'find' all of the amenities such as the surprise rooftop which we were not aware of.If we went back to New York, we would likely try another hotel given how much we paid and the level of hotel competition.

Easy booking. Very helpful staff. Very good winter rates. Excellent location on the upper West Side. Easy subway access. Museum of Natural History only a few blocks away. Great location for food shopping at Fairway and Zabars

We keep coming back. And always will ... a great hotel in a great neighborhood! Proximity to public transportation is excellent. Unfortunately, our stay coincided with a snowfall of historic proportions, so not everything was up an running - which certainly was disappointing, but weather conditions are what they are - and can not be blamed.

First time staying in the Upper West Side. Loved the area. Normally stay in Hell's Kitchen. I will definitely stay here again. The Bar associates were wonderful. Patrick and a few others were Awesome! The room was clean and well appointed. Loved having the balcony.

My wife and I enjoy the neighborhood and the NYLO seems very comfortable to us. We always enjoy our stay. The location of the hotel gives us a neighborhood feel and we like that much better than staying in Mid Town. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance and the subway is just a few blocks away.

I booked this hotel as a surprise for my husband and it turns out we were both very pleasantly surprised. Friendly staff, very clean and spacious room and a bed to die for. Take your slippers though, as though I liked the hard floors for both cleanliness and my infuriating allergies, after a day of pavement pounding the streets of NYC a little comfort underfoot is needed. We were lucky enough to get a room on the 16th (top) floor and the views were fantastic. Only 2 blocks from a subway station on the upper west side meant location was also amazing. The bar looked fantastic and we planned on trying it out but even with 5 nights there we were just too busy to fit it in but we will do on our next trip. Highly recommend!

Stylish hotel, with interesting bar and lounge. Rooms are small but functional. King bed was comfortable. Great spot in Upper West Side, easy walk to subway, Central Park, Times Square, Theater District

Very good hotel on the Upper West Side. Bathrooms and rooms are modern and not drab and old like other hotels in the area. Efficiently run. Friendly staff. Only negative is the food at Serafina's which was overpriced and mediocre. It tasted like low end Italian chain food.

As always, staying at NYLO is a pleasure. The staff greets me by name and goes above and beyond to make my stay comfortable and pleasant. This is the only place I stay when I'm in the city. Kudos on a job well done over and over again!

Trendy hotel decorated in a similar style to the W Hotels. An industrial look with polished concrete floor in the lobby. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was clean, spacious and nicely decorated. The bed was in the shape of a train chassis. Pretty cool. The lobby bar was lively with live entertainment. Beers and wines were pleasant. The gym isn't worth tying up your trainers for, however. Pokey, only a few cardio machines and very little in the way of weights. The room was crowded with just me in it! When 3 halfhearted users appeared, it was positively cramped!Wifi is paid and quite pricey. Location was good and only a few blocks from Central Park. Really liked it here.

Great location and great hotel, but could use some updates in the heating department. I had to switch rooms during my stay due to no heat in my first room. New room was not as nice as my first room. Otherwise, I highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed at NYLO in NYC starting Friday, through the blizzard, and into Monday. While it was snowing, we took the short walk into Central Park and joined everyone else who was there enjoying weather. Then back to the hotel for a drink at the bar, which was hopping, and on the Serafina's, the attached restaurant. Throughout the weekend housekeeping managed to keep up even when short-staffed, the bar was open and Serafina's managed feed most people until they had to close so their people could get home. Our room was nicely sized and quiet. All in all, a great experience.

i spent 12 days here and i've felt myself really pampered...the room was clean and the service was perfect...nice restaurant and very good bar.People was really gentle, the hotel give more than it cost

Great location in the upper west side neighborhood with easy access to all of manhattan but get to stay away from the busy tourist areas. Great, flexible and very helpful staff. Serafina (Italian) and the lobby bar are really nice and good to hang out in.... the only real negative I can see is that while the rooms are nice, stylish and renovated, they don't have minibars or refrigerators. there is a convenience store (CVS) right accross the street which is great, but even if you pick up supplies there's no fridge in the room.

you are the best is the second time we were there and we love it and we return in February ! serafina manager is also great and his team , the valets are the most helpful. happy with our stay despite the stormthanks for everything

There are surprisingly few hotels to choose from on the UWS. I've never been able to get into the Beacon so perhaps unfair to call the NYLO the only choice but I've ended up there at least twice a year since it opened and remain very, very happy with the place. And on Saturday night when Snowstorm Jonas shut down JFK and we were stranded they were very helpful and sensitive to our dilemma. Or course there was probably an element of good fortune but being able to stay an extra night and in the same room was a godsend.
user_name:
Astronomer61
New York City, New York

review_body: The room was not large but it was very comfortable. The king size bed was very comfy.The lobby was nice and all the people working there were quite nice. The restaurant, RED FARM was superb.We actually ate there 2 days in a row. Great Upper West Side neighborhood

Very comfortable, modern hotel with a great lobby/bar area. We chose a deluxe room which gave us a bit more space. Plenty of room to unpack and a very comfortable bed; surprisingly quiet. We have stayed here before and absolutely will again!

Based on my recent stay, I'd definitely recommend the NYLO as a great spot to stay in NYC. The entire staff was warm and friendly, going out of their way to provide assistance whenever it was needed. The property has a cool, low-key vibe that is very welcoming after a full work day. Super comfortable beds, unique room décor, great location offering easy accessibility to transit, restaurants, shops...I could go on... If you're looking for lodging on the Upper West Side, check out the NYLO!

Great place! We had a clean room with double beds. The service was good. The location was desirable. The bar was very happening. All in all, I plan to stay there again and I recommend it to others! Also, it is affordable by NYC standards.

I love this hotel. Certainly the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Great vibe!!! I Have NO Complaints!! I went up for business but then a few friends came up to get snowed in for the weekend. We loved being there.

We enjoyed our stay at the NYLO. The room was very comfortable with all the amenities we needed to make our stay enjoyable! The location was perfect. Due to a snow storm we needed to stay an hour longer than check out and they were able to extend our stay. also when we arrived they were able to give us the room early.

We always stay in the NYLO as it is very close to our daughter's apartment. It definitely has a hipster vibe and is dark in terms of ambience so may not appeal to those who like rugs and a cozy room. The hotel is definitely minimalist. The rooms are clean. Book a deluxe room unless you like being in a shoebox.

Reasonable cost for an awesome location- very comfortable room, it was helpful that we could leave our baggage for six hours after check out as well. They shoveled everything quickly after the blizzard.
user_name:
Alice S
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Love the overall experience but bring a comb and toothbrush. Price was high but worth the money. A tap beer at the hotel bar was $9. That's too much if you're a guest at the hotel if you ask me. Convenient location and easy to find. Would stay there again.

Enjoyed my two nights at NYLO. My bed was super comfortable, staff friendly, and the bathroom spacious. All was clean, warm, relaxing. Enjoyed eating dinner next door at Serifina Italian restaurant, tried both breakfast and dinner.

This hotel is in a great location! Close to museums, Central Park and Lincoln Center. The rooms were not fancy but very comfortable . I am very particular about cleanliness in hotels, I felt like the room was clean, no carpet on the floor in my opinion helps keep it clean. The was very nice. The lobby was a great place to sit, have coffee or a cocktail.I will stay here again!

Had a chance to take advantage of a great rate and stay on the upper west side instead Of commuting. The hotel is top notch. The check in was super easy and the accommodations were very nice. Bedding was super comfy too. The workspace in the lobby is a bonus and the wifi was a great perk. High speed for free made it an even better stay
user_name:
jonscottt
New York City, New York

review_body: I was staying at this hotel during the recent snowstorm. The hotel was very good about informing guests when they should eat at the in-house restaurant because it was running on limited hours. When I went down to the restaurant during the prescribed time, restaurant told me they were closed. When I went to the front desk to ask where in-house guests should eat, the attendant at the desk said "I have no idea that's not the hotel's problem". Thankfully, I ran into another guest who told me about a 24 hour deli down the street. The complete lack of customer service seems to be a pervasive at this property.

Hotel is very clean and friendly workers. Rooftop closes for the winter season...disappointing but make's sense. Overall restaurant within the hotel was very good. Staff was kind to let us check bags in early. Would stay again in warmer weather so we could utilize outside rooftop bar.
user_name:
Lisa T
Saint James, New York

review_body: It is hard to find a hotel in NYC with a terrace. This hotel has suites with the best terrace. Have not stay anywhere else in NY since 2008. The penthouse and loft suites are great with wonderful views. Great couples getaway.

Loved being on the UWS. Close to Lincoln Center... Easy subway accessAlso close to AmericanMuseum of Natural History and Central Park. Good shopping nearby. Good for all theater going as #3 train is just one stop to Times Square.

Quiet neighborhood...one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept on...safe surroundings...close to Natural History Museum & Central Park...quirky boutique hotel...highly recommend! (FYI, you cannot do reservations at the front desk, so go ahead and book online before you arrive.)

Very comfortable accommodations in a great west side neighborhood close to the subway, restaurants and shopping. Very good value in the winter, although the rooms are basic and the bathrooms have an industrial feel

I asked for a double or Queen sized bed. The bed seemed bigger than queen size. It took up almost the entire room. There was no space for an easy chair. Good lighting. Bathroom had no place to hang up a towel.

fabulous hotel, ideal location, great staff, wonderful room, nice staff, fun decor, great bed, great toiletries, great city lots to do New York really really really never ever sleeps and its fun to be part of it!

NYLO New York City is a nice hotel with nice rooms. It was clean and the wifi was complimentary - AND it worked without any issues. Good atmosphere and polite front desk staff. The bar staff was really good and smiled approximately 200% more than they did in the front desk. I had breakfast in the restaurant next door and was happy with both service and quality.

Rooms were funky and fun. Bar area, lobby and friendiliness of staff was great. Would definitely stay again. Make reasevations on line for better price. However, concierge was misleading in selling tickets for grayline tour; I understand that she probably doesn't work directly for the hotel, but beware!

The NYLO stay was a gift for my sister's special birthday. The kind and gracious desk staff upgraded us to a room with a spectacular, cinematic Hudson River view and a private terrace. The room was modern, well-designed, meticulously clean, and super quiet for a great night's sleep. Even the bath products were special! We would absolutely stay here again and recommend without hesitation to anyone considering a stay in NYC and especially the beautiful, civilized Upper West Side. Thank you, NYLO!
user_name:
LouAndreas212
New York City, New York

review_body: We have been going to NYLO since it was "On The avenue" and how this place has transformed over the years is truly remarkable. Stylish, great vibe and very helpful, friendly and knowledgeable staff. The rooms are great and make sure to order the pancakes in the restaurant for breakfast!

Priced well - nice surrounding area - close to a lot of amenities - staff was wonderful and very very accomodating - boutique type setting, cozy common areas in lobby --- rooms can be a little small, bathroom even smaller- but overall experience was wonderful. I would recommend.

Rooms were so much bigger than the last NYC hotel we stayed in. Beds are very comfy. Showers are small. No tub which made it hard for us to bathe our baby. Other than that, we loved it! The location is great.

Great upper west side location, very comfortable beds, fun lobby and bar. A bit noisy from room to room. We come often and always enjoy it, although we have had great and attentive hospitality and sometimes less so. Have had the same doorman the past few visits who is wonderful.
user_name:
H M
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Wonderful hotel and experience. Was able to check in early which was a life saver, and the staff was very courteous and professional. The concierge helped us book a shuttle to JFK for our flight home for a very reasonable price, and also recommended a great restaurant for a quick bite before a show. Absolutely loved everything about our stay!

Have stayed here at least 20 times over the years. My "go-to" hotel in NY. The location is truly the best; convenient to everything by foot or subway yet away from the crazy crowds. Like the choice of many neighborhood restaurants.
user_name:
atirr
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: If you like boutique hotels, NYLO is one to try. It is located in a great neighborhood with easy access to many NYC attractions. The hotel lobby/lounge area is wonderful. Outstanding music and service. Cozy setting. The staff was helpful and friendly. The housekeeping staff was efficient. I would go out for coffee and come back to a clean room. The rooms are on the small side but that is typical in NYC. The beds were comfortable. The rooms quiet and clean. The bathrooms had modern amenities and were clean. My feedback to the hotel was that the bar should open earlier than 3 PM. Otherwise, I highly recommend the hotel.

Absolutely loved our stay and the lovely surprise upgrade upon our check-in to a panoramic room on the 14th floor. It was a gorgeous view!! Being on an upper floor blocked out all the road noise but it unfortunately did not block out the noise of the inconsiderate floor-mates who found it necessary to repeatedly slam their room door every time they went in or out of the room. Seriously people, is it SO difficult to have a little bit of common courtesy?? We visit NYC several times a year and seldom stay in the same hotel twice just so we can experience the variety of accommodations and neighborhoods the city has to offer. NYLO will be an exception to this rule. We WILL return here in the nicer weather and take greater advantage of Central Park, Columbus Circle, explore more of the UWS. Our biggest complaint was the fact that W 77th St. was closed when we arrived and we therefore had no access to the hotel's valet parking. Consequently, we circled and circled for a good hour until we found a garage down on Riverside that could take us. Unfortunately, it meant schlepping several blocks with luggage (battling bitter bitter cold temps and high winds) and after 24 hrs, it ran us $85!!! The only other complaint is having to pay for internet service in the rooms. The only free wifi accessibility is in the lobby (and their FABULOUS gathering/game room). The neighborhood has AMAZING restaurants and bars on even corner! Our favorites were The Meatball Shop and the Amsterdam Ale House. I am still on a search for an amazing NY Style Crumb Cake, so if anyone has any UWS suggestions, please share!! :)

The hotel was great! Staff was very friendly. Parking was not an issue at all. Will stay there again! Walking distance to time square all though we got lost. Rooms were cozy and the bathroom was roomy.

Our family trip to NYLO is becoming an annual event and looking forward to visiting again. It is 2 blocks from the 79th street subway stop and across a few blocks from central park west and museum of natural history. make sure you hit zabars, sweet green and levain bakery while there. the lobby is great for adults and kids to hang out, play some chess, watch the game on TV or just chill. looking forward to going back next year.

For just over $100/night, you can't beat this hotel in NYC. Clean, comfortable, modern. Great location. Quiet room. I definitely recommend the NYLO. The convenience of an attached restaurant adds to the experience.

We stayed at NYLO for the weekend. Our room was on the small side, although it was larger than other rooms at the hotel. However, as the hotel is in New York City, the room was probably of average size for New York. The bed was very comfortable, the room was clean, and the bathroom was modern. The staff was courteous and helpful.

Visitors must realize that rooms are smaller in NYC. Aside from that, the rooms are clean and comfortable and the location well-suited our needs. Since I am very short, I devised a way to use the side of a waste basket (on the floor) as a step to get into bed. It worked for me!

We needed a place on west side near friends and family, and this worked out great. Cute boutique hotel, small, very practical, cost effective, bathroom quite tight, but stylish and functional. Would definitely stay again.

Amazing . Clean .Comfy . Book the loft room for great city view . In book inadvance to try and get a room upgrade if it is not in your budget . Staff was friendly . Minus the check out lady Jessy smhh
user_name:
jaleesaj2016
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a great hotel. Friendly, attentive staff...updated amenities... nice lobby/bar/lounge area. The beds here are extremely comfortable. Our room was spacious, I thought, for an affordable hotel in NYC. Highly recommend the Euro bakery up the street & french restaurant Nice/Matin a few blocks away for breakfast.

Great property and location. Service can be hit or miss, and lobby staff seems to be a bit "distracted" and inattentive. But beds are comfortable, Internet is strong, and bathrooms are functional so great value if room can be had under $200 a night and good value for under $250 a night

The staff was very helpful and accommodating. Our room was extremely quiet.. Bathroom very clean and spacious. Beds extremely comfortable. We would definitely stay there again when we travel into New York City.

Great beds. Great location. Charming interior design. Staff need to work on hospitality. But that said problems were resolved quickly. Had a construction site right next to our window with a leaky window so noise and cold would over take the room. It was fixed very professionaly. Despite the lack of a friendly hello, the staff is very efficient. This is New York after all.

Staff helpful and friendly. First room we were allocated wasn't great (we were travelling in a group so could compare with others). Small and heating sounded like a freight train was rolling through the room. Asked to be moved and were moved without hassle to another room the same standard as others in the party. Had one or two further issues that were dealt with quickly. Foyer / bar area a great place to hang out. Convenient for places to eat and close to subway / Central Park. Would definitely use again. A couple of things to look out for. If you're a light sleeper ask for a room away from the road as there were regular non-traffic as well as traffic noises throughout the night. Also we booked a taxi to the airport for the fixed rate of $75 but were charged $106. If you haven't any special requirements (e.g. child seat) then get a yellow cab!

Me and my new wife stayed with NYLO in early January and there is nothing I can really knock about NYLO. Its a friendly, nice and polite atmosphere for our stay. The room was what I expected, the staff were very attentive, the décor of the hotel brilliant, the location perfect for Central Park or for AMNH and a subway stop close by. All in all I was very pleased with my stay and NYLO helped made my stay in New York and my honeymoon a memorable one.

First time to visit NY and enjoyed it immensely. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. It was close to everything and we felt safe walking around the neighbourhood even if it is late at night. Close to subway, cafes, restaurants and shopping. If you're looking for something different, clean and good value for money, this is the place to be.

Hotel was great location with reasonable rates. Rooms small but on par with other NYC hotels. Staff friendly and helpful. Nice bar and lounge. Convenient to subway. Small problem with room cleanliness that took over 12 hours to resolve.

My stay at the hotel was honestly amazing and comforting. My partner and i both loved it. The bed was so comfortable we honestly did not want to leave . I would most definitely gi back for another stay

Lovely staff- our check in was complete in minutes by a very friendly lady. Lovely room- probably smaller than on the pictures but big enough to accommodate my boyfriend and I and our 2 huge suitcases! It was also VERY clean. Shower was great. AMAZING bed!!!- so high off the ground and it was just the comfiest night sleep I've ever had... EVER!Hotel is a 5 minute walk from 72nd street subway station which will take you just about anywhere and the express will get you to Times Square in minutes.The bar of the hotel has a really cool vibe, we had drinks there a few nights. Bar tenders really polite. The hotel is dog friendly, we saw quite a few pooches on our travels- New York is such a dog loving city! We had breakfast in the attached restaurant, it was really nice- we thoroughly enjoyed it and would recommend giving it a try. On other morning we grabbed a bagel from one of the various bagel places in nearby streets.Would 100% recommend the Nylo NYC for those traveling on a budget who would love to be surprised by all they have to offer :)

Excellent stay! Extremely comfortable bed and the staff was amazing. Room was very clean and up to date. Tv service was great with a good selection of channels will definitely return for business and pleasure.
user_name:
Yaniree
New York City, New York

review_body: Awesome place, recommend it highly. Great bar and lobby area, rooms are small but comfortable and the price was great. Hotel staff extremely helpful and accommodating. Great area as well. I will certainly return.

Really wanted to like this hotel and recommend it to friends and family when they come to visit since I live on the block - but they were UBER rude when I walked in and requested to look at room. Very poor customer service for an industry relying on HOSPITALITY!I initially hung out in the lobby bar / lounge area, which had a warm & fun vibe but was turned off when I glimpsed the elevators that take you up to the rooms - looks like you're going to the morgue - harsh lights + cold / metal interiors. Front Desk Staff & manager on duty (Richard) interaction confirmed my doubts.
user_name:
CleoQueenoftheHudson
New York City, New York

review_body: We liked the hotel, though our room was a bit small. We had stayed there before and had a slightly larger room which was better for two people. For us the location was convenient. It is not in the middle of the tourist areas, but it is easy to commute from there.The room was clean and the people who worked there were friendly but stayed out of the way when we were not looking for them.

This has been our favorite hotel in NY, and may still be. But the check in experience continues to be awful, with very unfriendly service at the front desk. In general, the rest of the staff is very nice. This is not a hotel that seems to care about loyal customers.

Staff was kind, place was clean and comfortable, rooms were stylish we look forward to returning when the construction is done so we can access the balcony.... But area is close to it all and save to walk around!

Heat could not keep up with the cold and was turned off a few hours for maintenance. No view from my room and Halls are a little dark so somewhat gloomy; otherwise everything fine and a decent value for what you pay.excellent location.

Super pretty and clean hotel. Made my stay very memorable and comfortable. Great location near subways and food places too! I will definitely recommend it to my friends and family and come back to stay at nylo when i have the chance to bext time.

My wife and I were between houses so we stayed at the NYLO for 5 nights after we had stayed at the Beacon Hotel 2 blocks south for 5 nights. NYLO has a 4 star rating and the Beacon 31/2 and for the life of me I cannot figure out why the NYLO's rating is higher. While the NYLO rooms have a "hipper design" and the bar scene at the NYLO is a lot more active, there are no dressers with drawers in the room, only cubbies to put you things in and only three or four of those. They only provide you with two sets of towels. There is no chair to sit on in the room other than the desk chair and there are no drinking glasses in the room only plastic cups and paper coffee cups and those are only given out sparingly. Additionally, when you check in they do not tell you that there is extensive renovation going on next to the hotel until you see a construction elevator going up and down in front of your window. Don't get me wrong, this is not a bad hotel, the staff was friendly, and depending on the price differential I might stay here again, but price being equal (and this time it was) the Beacon Hotel is a better deal.

If you're after a boutique hotel in the middle of Manhattan with a roof top bar during the day, and jazz bar at night, this is for you!In the heart of Manhattan, this hotel has everything you're after from such a gorgeous city. The rooms are cleaned daily and the beds sre amazing. Bit small, but what do you expect for a hotel in NYC!Everyone at the hotel was very helpful and friendly, and thanks to the Concierge who recommended places for us to Dine and experience what New York truly is.The subway is located 2 blocks down, and there are buses right outside your door... very convenient to all major destinations in NYC, and definitely a hotel we would recommend to all

I work right around the corner and needed a place to stray after a work event. I have frequented their restaurants and lobby bar, but love my stay in their hotel. I received a surprise upgrade which was a wonderful treat. The room was spacious, clean, and had a lovely, modern design with a super comfy bed. My only suggestion would be to bring your own slippers as there is no rug!

Boutique style is the perfect description for this place. The lobby is quite unique because it's wide open with the front desk, lounge areas, computer use and TV viewing all in the same space. The bar is situated between a lower lounge area and an elevated one. The design works quite well.The lobby is also connected to Serafina's Italian restaurant which is quite good. The only knock on this hotel has to be the sound/acoustics in the rooms and hallways. There's not much carpeting to absorb sound; our room had pergot/laminate flooring. Hearing conversations and door slams were pretty normal. Overall, our experience was good though, you can't beat the price for the Upper West Side.
user_name:
gonzojluis
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I was here on business and pleasure, and found the NYLO an entirely satisfactory place for both. The staff is courteous and knowledgeable, the atmosphere is pleasant and lively, and the rooms are quite good.

No heat in room. Told multiple times when it would be fixed and it wasn't. Front desk never picked up phone calls from us. Told multiple times hotel engineer would visit our room. Never happened. Room was noisy all night as well.

I travel to NY on business several times a year. NYLO is my favorite choice. The neighborhood has Zabars, Fairway and many excellent restaurants. My room was quiet, warm (very cold during my stay) and the bedding soft and fragrance free.

Excellent location on West Side;hotel staff very friendly;Hotel very clean. restaurant staff could be a lit more understanding at times. rooms cleaned daily to a very high tsnadard.Very good value for money and would stay there again.

NYLO has a great location on the UWS. Easy subway access and lots of restaurants, bars, and markets nearby. Rooms are clean, spacious & functional.
