Its not a high design hotel but the rooms have a low key relaxed style. The lobby bar really shines though. It's an open design that still feels cozy and inviting. Staff are pleasant. I can see where it may feel a bit hipsterish but compared to hotels downtown that vibe is very light. NYLO is a smart easy choice to make if the neighborhood is convenient for your needs.

Very near the subway. Walking distance from Central Park and other attractions.Reasonable price given its location, amenities, and hotel interiors. Would definitely stay here again when I am back in NYC.

There are only 2 hotels on the Upper Westside (UWS)- the Beacon and NYLO. NYLO is hip and updated compared to the dated Beacon. The large common area in the lobby is very inviting with various seating options. The hotel room was spacious but not of high quality (fake wood floors, no dresser, no minibar, small bathroom with no counter space). But the room rate offsets the quality of the room. Restaurant options are vast given where it is located. Serafina (attached to the hotel) is a good choice for breakfast.

This was our 12th trip to the city & we rarely stay at the same place twice. We loved NYLO so much the first time we booked it again. EVERYTHING about NYLO is great from the moment we arrive to the time we have to leave.

The heat was not working in our room, we cuddled. I did not call but upon check out was given a discount. Thank you as always to wonderful staff! We stay due to my husbands doctor visits and hospital surgeries. Great sleep night before

We've been coming to NYLO since 2012 and highly recommend it. This last visit was a quick 2 night stay and we were upgraded from a standard room to a loft with an amazing view of the Hudson. I feel like the staff is constantly striving to make every visit better than the last. Great location upper west side...close to the park, museums, restaraunts, shopping without the hustle and bustle of midtown.

As our daughter and son-in-law live on the upper west side, when we visit, we often stay at the NYLO Hotel. It's in a grat location ot far from the 72nd Street subway station. The staff is friendly, the rooms are clean and the bed is super comfortable. We do wish there would be more coffee provided for the Keurig Machine. Each time w've stayed at the hotel, we've had to ask for more coffee as often, there was only 1 regular and 1 decaf in the room which did not work for 2 people in the morning.
user_name:
sailorsandy
New York City, New York

review_body: This was my 4th stay at NYLO New York City, and my shortest stay. I have stayed twice as a couple and twice now as a solo women. I enjoy the atmosphere and kind help, right from the front doorman to the check-in desk. I also enjoy the very comfortable beds. I must say this solo visit was the most disappointing visit yet. The doorman was still wonderful, greeting me at the door and helping me with my luggage to the check in desk. The check in was quick and efficient. After arriving in my room, after 17 hours of travel from the Middle East, I found a dirty bathroom. The tub was grimy and the toilet had urine and hair on it. I called down stairs to inform them that the bathroom in my room was not cleaned and ask if I could be moved. The front desk said they could send up a maid to clean the bathroom. I said I did not want to wait as I was exhausted and wanted to use the bathroom as soon as possible. She then sent someone up with a key to another room. This was all understandable, the disappointment came when I saw my new room, it was the smallest room I have ever been in at this hotel. I did not even have a place to put my suite case except on the floor squeezed by the bed. And it is a carry-on size suite case! At this point I was too tired to complain again, I just wanted a shower. This bathroom was also much smaller, with a small stall shower rather than a tub, and a sink with no space to place items on the side. It did still have shelves and hooks, so it was still useable. The meal in the attached restaurant Serafina, was mediocre. The pasta was suppose to be al dante but was borderline crunchy. My disappointment was in that the room they placed me in was unacceptable due to their fault of a dirty bathroom and I was down-graded to a smaller room when I told them of this mistake. This is poor customer service, especially for a repeating customer. It will make me rethink if I will rebook here again on my return trip at the end of January. Upon check-out at 5:00am, the front deskman did wave my internet charge due to me only being in the room about 10 hours. He also help arrange a ride to the airport. He was very pleasant and helpful. Recap of the positive: Wonderful greeting and front desk efficiency and super comfortable beds. Recap of negative: Dirty bathroom, so downgraded to new room and crunchy pasta.

Nylo has a good vibe for an upper west side hotel, nice rooms, and a friendly lobby bar. Modern but not hip—and that's a good thing. Room upkeep is good, and amenities are stylish if not luxurious....

This was a great stay. From the bellman to the front desk to the restaurant, staff were genuinely helpful and pleasant. The room was lovely, everything worked, and the beautiful lobby was a great place to be. I stay in NY a lot and this is unusual.

Overall this is a very pleasant hotel and a very good value. The location can't be beat. The lobby bar is more like a neighborhood experience that a typical sterile hotel bar. Rooms are small but not bad by NYC standards and well designed to maximize room. Our room at the back was exceptionally quiet, but my sons' room which fronted on Broadway had significant street noise. Two notes on the downside, one regarding service and one the physical plant. First, I had an important delivery sent by UPS next-day. The staff insisted for two and a half days that it had not arrived; when I called the sender I was informed that it was delivered on the day promised and was given the name of the person who signed for it. Armed with that, I demanded that the staff produce my package, and they did so within two minutes; no explanation was offered for why they had been unable to come up with it and in fact had insisted that it was not delivered. The other issue is structural: the windows are very poorly insulated for temperature, and on a cold night in January a column of icy air must be partially blocked with the thermal curtains in place. Fortunately the bedding (on a VERY comfortable king bed) was quite warm and we slept comfortably.

We have stayed there twice over Thanksgiving to see the parade. The hotel is charming, funky and hip and the rooms are spacious and clean with a great layout. We love the vibe in the lobby and the staff is always wonderful. One of our faves...can't wait to return!

I recently stayed at this hotel for a weekend in the city. I had a party to go to and it was a quick trip. The first morning I took my shower and I had luke warm water at best. When I called to share this information, the person who answered the phone told me that I just needed to let the water run for 15 - 20 minutes. Not really acceptable at a hotel, but ok... So the next morning I let the water run for the designed 15 - 20 minutes and I still had a cold shower. I was irritated and when I checked out I shared my experience with the front desk clerk. He was very apologetic about how the previous person handled the situation and made an adjustment for the fact that 2 of my showers were basically cold. I really appreciated this and it gave me a reason to give them another chance on my next trip to NY. I will say the rooms are clean, but very small - since I wasn't really in my room that much it didn't matter. I appreciated that they had a fitness facility. And really appreciated the front desk clerk. Will give them another go on my next stay.

My wife and I stayed at the NYLO NY last month during the Christmas holidays. We originally chose the hotel because of it's Upper West Side location near our daughter's apartment. But now...after five visits...we wouldn't consider staying anywhere else. The NYLO is clean and comfortable. The rooms are pretty large by Manhattan standards, are nicely decorated, and include the normal amenities. There's an attached restaurant and a very nice lobby bar. The hotel is conveniently located near several good restaurants, shops, the subway, and Central Park.The NYLO staff is very professional and hard working. We have always received friendly, exceptional service. Housekeeping is timely and efficient. The bell staff is particularly conscientious and helpful. We have always enjoyed our visits and this latest stay was no exception. I always recommend the NYLO to friends who are traveling to NYC. It is a well run hotel, and we hope to return soon!

Amazing hotel, lovely staff and great location of the city, just a couple of mins walk to the nearst subway, plenty of good restaurants near by as well as the lovely italian located inside the hotel. definitely go again!

NYLO has a great location, and the staff was very helpful. Would definitely stay here again. Subway is close by as is Central Park and The Natural History Museum is are both within walking distance. Bed in the room was Super Comfy!!

Pros: Modern furnishings, comfortable bed, excellent neighborhood. Cons: Terrible WIFI connection. Really surprised most people actually pay $15 a night for it. I'd go back if it weren't for that. WIFI should be a basic utility at this point.

I love the way this hotel looks and the bar area, but the room we stayed in was disappointing. The TV was balanced on the windowsill and seemed unsteady, the visible pipes under the sink had molded insulation, and maid carts were left in the center of the hall permanently. I was unable to reach concierge service at all and there was never a doorman. This hotel looks high end and is gorgeous but the service leaves much to be desired.

Great location, excellent service. Nice bed and restaurant. Staff helpful, music nice. In room choice of tea or coffee. I would stay here again and would most definitely recommend it to others. Go NYLO!

I would definitely reccomend this hotel in NYC.Very nice Staff, nice rooms, amazing view. Shower could be better. The bar is also very good and it is located in a nuce spot in the upper west side. It is close to the subway.

Great hotel! Great price, wonderful ambience, and clean! Comfortable bed as well! Just make sure you don't get a room that is adjoined to another; the walls are incredibly thin and you can hear EVERYTHING between them. Not great when your in the city for day activities, and the 20-year-old-club-frequenter in the room next to you is rocking out to music and talking loudly on her cell phone at 11pm! Then gets back to her room at 3am, and slams her door. They need to fortify the walls and soften their doors closing swing. Otherwise, a gem in uptown

My family and I stayed at the NYLO for one night for a quick weekend trip to NYC. We were all very impressed with this hotel. The lobby area was beautiful. The doormen and the front desk clerks were all very friendly and helpful. The hotel room was very clean and was bigger than most NYC hotel rooms. We did not have time to take advantage of most of the amenities or their restaurants but every thing looked really beautiful. My mom repeatedly said how she was able to sleep like a rock because she felt so safe in the hotel and in the neighborhood. After our stay, we all have agreed that whenever we come to NYC for a weekend trip, we'll be staying at the NYLO.

Hotel was cool, modern, clean, nice bedding - great value for the price! Decor was cool and modern. Common areas were crowded with people having fun. Would definitely stay there again next time I am in the neighborhood.

My stay at the NYLO was amazing!! I wanted to experience Christmas in New York without the excess of Times Square. This hotel was located in a very "normal" part of NYC with Central Park a short walk to the right and the Hudson River a short walk to the left. It was also a few blocks from the venue where Mariah's Christmas concert was held. The room was just the perfect size. And although there was no view to speak of, that was okay because I was out experiencing the Upper West Side most of the time anyway. Although I was awakened each weekday morning with the noise of construction, the bed was DIVINE (had it not been for the construction noise, I would've rated sleep quality a 5). Even though it was unseasonably warm in NY and did not feel like winter at all during my visit, the rooftop terrace was closed for winter which was kinda disappointing. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. The NYLO lobby was exquisite (and where the free Wi-Fi was accessible). Even though the NYLO was close to all forms of transportation, I chose to walk everywhere...to take in the sights. A casual (albeit somewhat long) walk down Broadway led me to 5th Ave and to Rockefeller to see the big Christmas tree. I would highly recommend NYLO to anyone who wants a NY experience without the madness of Midtown. I would most definitely stay at the NYLO again.

What a nice hotel! Great location. The staff went out of their way to accommodate our every need. The rooms were comfortable and very clean. We throughly enjoyed ourselves and would go back and stay again. Highly recommend this hotel!

Try to get a room on the East Side on a high floor. Great views of the Museum of Natural History and Central Park in the distance. I have stayed at this hotel several times, it is pricey, but it is in an excellent location with easy access to all that NYC has to offer, and the Upper West Side is a wonderful neighborhood.

It is the 4th time we stay in this hotel and this last stay was the disappointed one.We stayed in this hotel before (when it was named On the ave.)and we enjoyed it so we returned every time we arrived to Manhattan. but now I believe it is the last time for us. We know this hotel and room size so when we booked it I specifically asked for 2 big rooms for us and another couple, as we come with many luggages and we need a big space for them, i called reservations to make sure that the room is big enough and they assured it to me by phone but eventually we received a room which I think was meant to be a closet.... The other couple received big room however it was on the second floor facing Broadway and it felt like they sleep in the street with all that noise. We asked to move to other rooms in higher floor so after we asked to talk to manager they agreed to move us to bigger room for free but the other couple had to add $50 per night for moving them to higher floor.2 days before our check out we asked the hotel to help us order a transit to the airport and we told them we have about 10luggages and we need a big car like savanna, they send us to the doorman and he ordered small car which could not contain the luggages in a comfortable way, he told us it will cost $120, we asked him to order bigger one and he said he does not deal with bigger cars and he took us to the consigliere, the women at the consigliere ordered us car and she said it will fit for 18 people and it will cost us $175, we asked her several times in front of the doorman to be sure it is bigger than what he offered and she promised this to us.we paid her by cash. At the day of the checkout when the driver arrived we saw that the car she reserved us is exactly the same car as the doorman ordered us and not bigger, but the consigliere was not on duty to talk with and make changes, We asked to talk to the person in charge of the reception and he told us the consigliere is not part of the hotel although no one told this to us when we asked for a big car, he said there is nothing to do at the moment so we did not have choice and we needed to use the car that brought to us, we barely squeezed the luggagesthe driver himself told us it was a mistake to book his car. The manager of the reception promised to talk with the consigliere and ask her to compensate us for paying $55 more for the same car we ordered at the first place, but until now more than a week later no one from the hotel contacted us

I preferred the Nylo hotel since my daughter lives nearby. The room was convenient except the sometimes noisy air condition (which I did not know how to operate....). Also, I enjoyed The breakfast included in the package which was served at the Serafina restaurant.I will probably use this hotel again in the future since my daughter's apartment is too small to host me.

Everything fine. Room prone to being cold-ish. Would be nice if nautical light thing inside door turned off independently of the ceiling lights--those nautical things are cold and hideous in any setting. Staff nice.

The hotel looks very cool, and the bed is one of the most confortables we've ever slept on! Very quiet and spacious room with complimentary tea and coffee (which was a bonus is the morning). Location is great a few steps from Central Park!

We will definitely be back! By far one of our favorite hotels now and we travel a lot. The rooms have a ton of charm and the balconies are worth the extra expense to have views of the water and the Upper West Side. The customer service was fantastic and the bars and restaurants were also great. The hotel was extremely clean and housekeeping took great care of our room each day. Free wifi and family friendly - they made sure the crib and refrigerator we requested as actually reserved for us.The best part was the neighborhood as it felt like we were local New Yorkers hidden away from the biggest tourist areas. Restaurants and the subway are just around the corner, as well as many of the museums and Central Park!

Nice hotel for a short-term stay. The things that was below our expectations: poor sound-proofing. we slept with the ear plugs. Our room had a door to the room near by. Also a cockroach was in the room at the first day of our visit. The management proposed us to change the room however.

The NYLO hotel in Manhattan has staff that was very nice and helpful. I also liked the comfort of the stay (received a restful night of sleep). The modern design of the rooms and hotel was appealing. Good location too, next to lots of food shops and easy to access a cab.

Superb hotel in an excellent location. The staff were very friendly. Upon arrival we were offered a complimentary drink and upgraded to a bigger room. The room was large for a NY hotel and was clean and comfortable. I would definitely stay again!

This is the second time I stayed here, and after two years the doorman still remembered us and the staff was as friendly as ever. The service is excellent, clean comfortable rooms although some might find them on the smaller side, but then this in NYC. I simply love the location of this hotel, it's a lovely neighbourhood with the feel of true New York, not touristy and yet lively, block away from a subway station and lots of fun restaurants and cafes in the vicinity. For sure this is my favourite NYC hotel.

This interesting adaptive renovation has a good bar, adjoining restaurant and quiet rooms. Room decor is quirky Scandinavian Industrial modern. Keurig coffee maker and roomy bathroom with nice shower are among the amenities as well as a capacious safe. Cellophane wrapped plastic glasses are a bit cheap, but other amenities are fine. Staff is friendly and helpful.

If your looking for a nice place to stay on the upper west side you should consider NYLO. I've stayed here a number of times, even before when it was called On The Avenue. It offers a good location close to museums, and central park, and numerous nice dining options. The rooms are very basic, but clean and efficient, so don't expect too much. Nice lounge and convenient for dinning at Serafina, particularly in the cold winter months as its connected to the hotel. They serve an adequate and reasonable breakfast and lunch, don't know about dinner. One thing to watch out for is that while the rates are usually reasonable to start with they always go down at least once if not more before your visit. So keep cheeking back prior to your arrival and you"ll probably able to save some money.

NYLO is a good option on the UWS. The lobby is comfortable but the decor in the rooms was not our style: hardwood floors, locker style dresser and night stands and stainless steel in the bathroom, kind of IKEA like.The bed was comfortable. I think I would like to try other hotels in the area for comparison.

Delightful Hotel, ideally situated for the Subway, very clean, great bar and adjacent coffee shop/restaurant. Free lobby wifi. Very helpful staff.. Little bit noisy on the street side but that didnt really bother us too much nor did the construction opposite. Would definitely stay there again

Excellent. Always enjoy NYLO hotels, and NYC was as great as the rest. Loved location. As a boutique hotel, unique to even NYC, this one will not disappoint. Room size is typical for NYC, price is very good, and service was fantastic. Pleasantly suprised about social guest activity in lobby and lobby bar areas, even as I did not spend time there. Again, location on Upper West Side of NYC was perfect, with CVS right across the street, and walking distance to many restaurants and Central Park. I always enjoys the feel and experience of NYLO Hotels. Kudos.

We stayed at NYLO NYC hotel for two nights - came to the city to celebrate an anniversary, and we had a very good time there: great location (walking distance to Lincoln Center, Central park, Hudson river, bunch of restaurants, etc.); very functional and comfortable room; friendly personnel; welcoming bar downstairs, easy upgrade system - everything contributed to the overall pleasant experience. Be prepared to pay for the Internet use in your room; however, free Internet is available in a cosy library next to the main lobby. Would be glad to be back one day!

We choose this hotel for a birthday getaway based on other very good reviews we had seen. We were not disappointed. It was fun, clean and well staffed. They have some very comfortable common areas for just hanging out also. The street sounds in the room were a bit noisy, but it is New York after all. The only recommendation I would make is there was really no place in the bathroom to comfortably set toiletry/cosmetic bags etc. We had a great time and will definitely consider it for future trips!

Very well located, close to public transport, fairly quiet. Rooms are a good size for NYC. Nice reception. Only thing I didn't like was not a good cleaning of rooms and common areas- below average especially if you consider hotel level and price you pay.

Queen suite awesome. 2 big beds with awesome mattresses. Very spacious even with pullout couch bed. Quiet rooms. Lobby and restaurants chic. Place and people have great vibe. Staff at checkin, room cleaning, door man all very friendly 24x7. Great yoga and spin studios next door.

The renewed hotel is great!!! The room is small but very confortable, a little bit noisy if you get a room near the elevator but in general our stay was very good. The people at the front desk, concierge etc were very nice and helpful. We love that every day they have live music (jazz, blues, etc) in the lobby.

The hotel sits right on Broadway on the upper West with a lot of trendy restaurants,shops and also some museums nearby plus a local feel due to the to the residential neighborhood. The Park and also the Hudson are rather close, hopping on the 1 train is an easy thing just 2 blocks up. For us the area is a must...

We stayed here over the new years eve period and had pretty high expectations after reading some of the reviews.The check in process was very quick - although we were given no further information such as maps or recommended local restaurants or hotel bar options etc. We were left to wonder whether the terrace bar was open and ended up going up to the top floor to find it was not open. The room was quite small, but was clean and served it's purpose. It was extremely noise due to to the construction works opposite and adjacent to the hotel. At 3 am I was woken up by the noise outside from the machines operating! If you want a quiet nights sleep, this is not the hotel for you.The location of the hotel was good, in a good neighbourhood but close enough to walk to the likes of times square still (took us about 30 to 40 mins)

I think this is one of the cutest hotel I've been to in NY. Feels like boutique hotel, not sure if it is. I stayed in a corner suite with natural historic museum and hudson river view. Great location (residential area!) in my fave NY neighbourhood, Upper West Side. Cute lobby bar, I can't remember if we got free drinks. I think we did. Breakfast in Serafina (included), 2-3 different selection of breakfast.

Nylo hotel is located at Broadway and 77th street on walkable distance to nearby Subway station at 72th street. The rooms are full functional with good boxspring bed. Wifi and internet is provided in the room but only with a daycharge of $14. Such service I expect to be part of the room rate.

I have been staying in different hotels in New York City since December 19th 2015. The reason we chose this is because the parking was a lot more conducive to our schedules. Hence we reserved a room at NYLO as it was close to my husbands gigs. We are from Texas and he is making his way through the nightlife in the city. The room was cold, the TV was sitting on the window ledge as if it was a forgotten room or a maids quarter the urban look of the room we had was not appealing at all. What kind of hotel has a room with a TV on the windowsill. Horrifying and dangerous. We were rushing to get him to his gig. However when I CAME BACK i expressed our displeasure with the room and was assured that in the morning we would be moved, we had booked the room for two days. By sunday afternoon we were still in the crappy cold room. At this point we were preparing for another gig that was scheduled for 4:00. By one we were a little annoyed and expressed our displeasure. To top it all off the wifi didnt even work. At this point we decided to check. We did not want free food or wifi, which by the way is $14.00 a day. We requested our money back. The front desk staff were very sincere in their attempt to assist us. However the on duty manager Matt has ABSOLUTELY NO CUSTOMER SERVICES SKILLS. The hotel would do well to train their staff in the seven C's of customer service along with cultural sensitivity. Let me be more specific Matt needs to be trained. As I said the rest of the front end and even the security were great. To make a long story short. Skip NYLO go to the Staybridge Suites, Marriot, Doubletree your regular customer -oriented larger chains. Save NYLO those who just want regular old motel service.

Hotel was in walking distance of Central Park and had fab decor. Our room was very small and had no view but we spent so little time there, it didn't matter. We had great service and staff were friendly. The hotel was in a neighbourhood that was less touristy and had lots of bars, restaurants and cafes nearby.

Great location in wonderful area! The hotel reception & rooms were beautifully furnished & very comfortable. Drank in the bar a few times & ate at the restaurant bar - Serafina, twice - both excellent! Would have had a higher rating, however the check in was awful! Made to wait over an hour an a half (way after check in time) with a very wishy washy explanation. We were only given a room after my boyfriend had to have a very heated argument with the check in staff and demand to speak to a manager, who was also not the greatest help. Other than this I can't complain - the other staff for the duration of the stay were knowledgeable and a pleasure ! Noticed a lot of reviews stating excess noise from the surrounding area and other rooms, but we heard no noise and had no trouble getting to sleep. Would stay again.

Visited this hotel back in September booked it through Thomas cook and paid in full. It's compulsory that you give a credit card when you arrive which we did. Checked out after 3 night and was told by the desk that we had no charges. I've just had my monthly credit card bill and was shocked to see that NYLO New York had taken £722.00 which wasn't authorised by me and we didn't owe. I've called this hotel 4 times from the uk with no response. So beware travellers.

The front entrance has 3 large steps that are inconvenient with heavy bags. We were not offered help coming or going from the door attendant. Rooms are very spacious, clean, and nicely decorated. Lobby has 3 seperate comfortable, trendy lounging areas. Located in a great neighborhood.

This hotel is perfectly located on the Upper West Side. The rooms are beautifully designed, comfortable and spacious. The bathroom is also spacious and provides great amenities. The staff was friendly and helpful. The value is exceptional. i will return!

Upon arriving two hours later than I wanted, at 2am, the front desk staff was alert and welcoming without the crazy eyes for arriving at such an hour. Impeccable timing to check in and out - the free upgrade was only the beginning of this amazing stay in the city. I will most definitely be staying again as my go-to when in the city.

This hotel has a European feel and appeal.The lobby area is cozy and inviting. My room was a suite with a modern quasi Swedish feel to it. Very roomy, comfy bed, with an updated decor. Ideal location for proximity to various things of interest/

One of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. Rooms are sleek and trendy and very clean. Great location within easy reach of The Metropolitan Opera, Central Park and some great restaurants. My fifth time staying at the hotel.

NYLO's location on the Upper West Side was perfect for a few nights. The staff were pleasant and helpful. We used the e-upgrade program and were upgraded to a Deluxe King room. It was huge by NY standards. Even with windows that faced Broadway, it was quiet and we got a great night's sleep. The bed was super comfortable and the sheets were good quality. The room was clean and nicely styled with hardwood floors and modern furniture. The bathroom could use an update, but it was nothing that would stop me from staying there again. All in all, a great stay at a good price.

Had a fantastic stay at NYLO! The staff were great and very friendly and accommodating. The location was perfect for getting out and about in NYC with shopping, lovely restaurants and Central Park nearby. The room was beautiful and a good size especially by New York standards. Really comfortable and safe, perfect for a female solo traveller. Would definitely stay again if I return.

The rooms were nice, but ask for quiet rooms if you like to sleep well. Many of the rooms have no view, but if that is ok for you, the rooms are fine. Some bathrooms are vey cold, no heating at the bathrooms. We received very good service - from the women in the reception. Some of the men did not make us feel very welcome, even if we stayed there many night. The reception area is trendy, nice if you are a group of friends traveling, but with a family it felt more like coming to a bar instead of coming home to your hotel. Could have been much more cosy and peaceful. We did not stay there at all. The terrace was closed the whole time we were there, only open in summer? The location of the hotel is nice, very close to Central park, museums and many nice restaurants ( ask the women in the reception!) Be aware of contruction work outside the hotel winter 2016. Beautiful yoga place next to the hotel. No info at the hotel, found it myself.

overall, excellent!! our home away from home and will be going back soon! perfect neighborhood, friendly staff, and will not be staying anywhere else!!! Would like to buy movies on the room, but love this place!!

NYLO was a great deal for NYC and in a handy location close to the subway. The bar downstairs is great and lobby a good place to relax. The bed was comfy and bathroom good.On the downside, wifi is not free in the rooms, but is in the lobby and bar. Just seems like a rip off. If you can afford to pay more for a bigger room, I would, as our room was tiny and for a couple with one person suffering jet lag, it was not easy.

Hotel was clean and staff were good, but room was a little small. The bar downstairs is a great bar. Location great for what we wanted. Rooms are modern and funky, however lighting for putting on make-up/doing hair was poor outside the bathroom. Overall would use it again.

Neil & Carrie Dec 2015 (visiting from Hull, England)I was fortunate to stay at the Nylo for a 5 night Xmas break in mid December. From the moment we stepped foot out of the taxi and was met by the Nlyo staff we knew we had made the perfect choice. The entrance leads you through the very cool/chic bar and lounge area. Reception where extremely helpful when checking us in. We were lucky enough to be staying in the Penthouse Loft suite which has an amazing view over the Hudson River. The room itself was spacious and well resourced, the bed was unbelievably comfortable which is perfect after a long day exploring New York City. The hotel is located 2mins walk to a subway station OR a scenic 5minute walk to Central Park (not far from the Dakota building). We enjoyed cocktails and beers at the bar every night, and enjoyed the live music that was being played. We also recommend a visit the Amsterdam Ale house which is 1 minute walk away. The staff at the Nylo are always around to help you, always courteous to your needs, and ensure you have a fantastic stay. We enjoyed breakfast in the Serifina restaurant most mornings (eggs benedict were superb). This set us up nicely for the rest of the day. Matthew (general manager) really made our stay memorable from start to finish for which myself and my fiancée will be forever grateful. We cannot wait to come back to New York again and will definitely be staying at the Nylo. We would strongly recommend the Nylo to everyone whose planning a visit to NYC in the near future.Many thanks to all at the Nylo, a trip we will never forget.Neil and Carrie x

The hotel lobby and bar are great, the design sort of industrial chique. There are some really nice places to eat and drink around the corner on Amsterdam.The room and bathroom were a bit on the small side and it would have been good to have free WiFi in the room.

This generally a cute little boutique hotel in a good location on the Upper West Side. It is blocks from Central Park, with plenty of nice restaurants and little markets very close by. The staff is very friendly and the hotel was clean.Aside from some quirks with the heating system in the room and the lack of towel racks in the bathroom, our primary (and major) complaint is that we felt we were pressured into taking a more expensive room when we checked in. The room we had reserved was supposedly not ready, and the front desk claimed that they could guarantee it would be available before 4:00. Since we had to be somewhere at 5:00 we felt that we had no option other than taking the more expensive room that was offered to us. In most other hotels in which we have stayed, if a room is not available at the price reserved, an upgrade is offered at no extra charge. Not here.

Great location at upper West side. Convenient to Metro subway and stores. Lots of activity in the lobby, but quiet upstairs. Very clean room and bath room. We are very pleased to be able to check in early. Desk very helpful. Good value.

We stayed one night and found there were many highly rated restaurants within a block or two. The staff in the lobby and at check in made you feel welcome and safe. The public areas and rooms were clean and the modern hip decoration worked. Small room as expected, but it was functional with an average comfortable bed. Our goal was to see Neue Gallery and the Met and this hotel was an east 20 minute walk through the park.

The stay, staff, bed and bathroom wr soooo good. Location and restaurants around are really good and varied in choice. Walking distance to the Lincoln center, Central park and movie theaters.subway is real close too.

Very nice hotel for the price. Location is awesome. The room was comfortable and clean. Hotel is very nice with great decor and ambiance. The view from our room wasn't the best but very nice for a hotel in Manhattan.

A comfortable hotel with a warm and friendly staff. Clean and inviting roomsCourteous and helpful staffMade our stay a warm and pleasant experienceLocation was very acceptableWould easily stay at this hotel again

NYLO is the perfect place to stay when you want great subway service, easy access to both Central and Riverside Parks, excellent restaurants, quick walks to museums and Lincoln Center, and fabulous shopping options.

The asthma at Nylo was disappointing. Rooms are small and very basic. Upon arrival there were no room available till 17h, no towels once in the room ... Not being warned I ended up wet in my shower, my wife not able to organise a towel with the reception in the next hour. The manager attending (Mr Sheng) was rude. Nylo claims to be pet friendly for 40 Usd per night and with a pet waiver that locks you with your pet into your room for the Reston your stay. Lobby is good, nice atmosphere and served delicous IPA witch helped to flash deception. This all for average 400 USD per night cause of New Year.
user_name:
benoitf338
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

review_body: perfect location, awesome beds, responsive staff, adjustable shower height, lots of good things. Not much street noise- our room was towards the back, but construction nearby starts at 7am. not too loud, but noticeable. We stayed in a superior double queen- and the beds weren't really queen- they were doubles, but really this was the only ding I would point out. Otherwise all was good- elevators were fine and they have three.

Great property! I would stay here again and will definitely recommend others to do the same. Lobby and lounge area very current as comfy. Room was well appointed and warm and cozy. This was a last minute booking and was very glad to have chosen this hotel!!!!!

I've stayed in other Upper West Side hotels ,but more often I stay here because it is the best. I was in town for Gov't Mule at the Beacon Theater on Dec 30th. The restaurants are the best around too. I will never stay at the Beacon Hotel again , once was enough.

My husband and I stayed at NYLO this past weekend and couldn't have been happier. Loved the location on the upper west side, close to the subway and the parking garage on the west side where we park our car. Beautiful lobby area with several places to relax. Cool, nice lighting, sophisticated. Front desk service was extremely friendly and helpful. At first, we were given a room that was adjoining to another room and was not going to work in terms of noise (we could clearly hear the conversation on the other side of the door!). We went back down to the lobby to ask for a different room and they apologized and gave us a suite instead! Beautiful room, spacious, great decor. Super comfortable bed, clean, spacious, modern bathroom. Great experience and an unbelievable rate. Two nights in Manhattan for $350! We will definitely be back and will recommend NYLO to friends.

Nicely appointed rooms conveniently located near subway and bus lines on the Upper West Side of Manhattan. The rooms are standard NYC-sized, although the upgraded rooms are roomier. The hotel provides nice amenities in the bathroom and the bedding is superior. The lobby bar makes great drinks, but is very pricy even by NYC standards. Red Farm, a restaurant in the building (you have to walk out the front door and take a left on Broadway), is incredible Asian fusion which will not disappoint. Excellent food and incredible cocktails. Yummy

Overall good; however, floors were not clean. Some of the doormen were great; one was lazy. Housekeeping left something to be desired, especially on the floors. Lobby is a good gathering place. Will stay again.

The staff (not actually a manager) asked myself and my guest to leave at 3:30am because of "noise complaints". They were being ageist and perhaps racist in their discrimination. The "noise" they complained of were people talking in the room and the frequent opening of the door; there was no music playing or rowdy behavior. It was completely unnecessary and unsafe for them to ask two eighteen year old girls to leave the hotel at 3:30 am, especially under the circumstances. The management handled the situation horribly, and gave no consideration for my input because of my college age. Never returning again.

Another great stay at NYLO, New York. We love this place for its clolseness to happening things. People are friendly and helpful. Missed our favorite bartender, Charles as he has moved on.)>: Subway is 4 blocks away markets and shops nearby for a complete dinner or for getting fixin's for apicnic!

Lovely modernized hotel with comfortably sized rooms and charming decor in the common areas. Staff were friendly and helpful and offered help if they felt you weren't sure about things - directions, transport, where to go. Umbrellas were offered when the weather was questionable. Easy to access public transit to go anywhere in the city...great little shops and eateries close by. Construction noise directly across from the hotel could pose an issue for those wanting to sleep in...did not affect us.

We spent a wonderful week at Nylo for Christmas! The room was large enough for two people, and the bed was incredibly comfortable, it was like sleeping on a cloud after a long day of walking and visiting.All the staff was friendly and helpful, and we really enjoyed having a dring at the LOCL bar late at night. The hotel is really beautiful and we really felt like local, and not tourists in the busy midtown.We would come back without any hesitation.

We've stayed in this hotel several times now - we just love the ambiance of the place! The lobby is a neat place to hang out - good bar as well. The basic room is small - but then again - you don't spend much time in it. The best thing about NYLO is its location - cant be beat!

I stayed during Christmas for one week. The hotel itself offers plenty of comforts in the lounge in the lobby area - decked out with a bar, several cozy and darkly lit areas to relax with friends, plus another comfortable relax area with a TV, bar seats, and two computers. The total lobby lounge are is rather small, but it does the job.The rooms are EXTREMELY SMALL; so small that you could almost bump into the furniture in front of the beds, if you don't move about carefully enough.PROS:ROOM- clean- nice bedding- very stylish- comfortableHOTEL GROUNDS- stylish- convenient lobby living room area with bar and nice amenitiesSTAFF- very helpful and friendlyCONSROOM- smoke drifts into the room through the vents- the AC unit clearly was not working. It stayed close to 80 degrees in the room even once maintenance came by to make adjustments, which should have helped, but did not.HOTEL GROUNDS- the entryway as you approach the lobby is disheveled looking. Cleaning it a couple times of day is probably necessary considering it's a high traffic, carpeted area.

Booked the hotel online after reading the reviews, and frankly speaking the hotel was great. We arrived late at night after a very long flight from Cairo, Egypt and our check in process did not take more than 3 minutes. The front office staff were very helpful and efficient in retrieving our booking and collecting the payment it actually created a very good first impression.Other than the friendly staff "this was the common factor across each and every one that we met during our stay" the hotel is very clean. The rooms are relatively large for New York hotels and well furnished and equipped "the only thing missing was a mini bar or mini fridge in the room to keep yogurt or juice" We did not try the hotels facilities much in terms of restaurants and the bar, just had one drink at the bar and it was nice.The only concern I had was the bed, it is very comfortable, yet I am used to harder mattresses, when I check with the hotel staff they mentioned sadly that they only had one type.I would definitely go back to this hotel, it has a very good value for money, and its location is perfect for shoppers and/or tourists visiting New York given the proximity to the underground

My family and I have stayed at the Nylo before so we were looking forward to staying their for our short NYC holiday trip this year. We arrived early so I did not expect our room to be ready. The front desk held our bags and said they would call us when the room was ready, which they thought would be before 4. Normal check-in time is 4pm (rather late I think since check out is 11). We returned to the hotel at 4 to get settled but were told that our room was not ready. When I asked why the desk clerk tried to call house keeping to find out but got no answer. We sat in the lobby until she called across to us that our room was ready about 20 minutes later. When we got to the room everything was clean and nice but there were 2 bath towels for my family of 4. Also we like extra pillows so I called down to the desk to get towels and pillows. A little later we headed out for the evening. When we came back at 10:30 still no towels and pillows so i had to call again. Then while laying in bed, we realized that every time the elevator was used there was a loud rumbling noise that shook the room. My husband wend down to the desk who offered to send up an engineer. He told her that it was coming from the elevator and not in the room. She offered us breakfast vouchers (which we asked for several times before we got them). She also said tha they had no other rooms to move us to but would pass the info on to the manager in the morning. The manager was very responsive and sent us an email in the morning and offered to move our room away from the noise. We packed everything up and left it to be moved (manager said they would take care of the move and it usually happens between 1 and 4). We were out and returned at 4 but the bags were not moved yet. It was done a bit later and we got settled. They did give us a partial credit for the first night. All in all, I still like the NYLO and they were responsive to fix the issues, but we were disappointed and the experience did put a damper on our short NYC stay.
user_name:
Abbe J
Melville, New York, United States

review_body: Unless you're a lottery winner, finding a decently-priced hotel in New York can be a challenge. NYLO is a great find. The hotel is just off Broadway in the 70s, close the the 1/2/3 subways and yet far enough away from the hordes of tourists that can strangle midtown. The rooms are modern and fresh. The lobby area contains a bar and lounge that is open to the street in warmer months. You'll find many locals using the hotel for casual dining and entertainment. And given the demanding attitudes of New Yorkers, that's a ringing endorsement.

NYLO is a gem. Superb location and easy to get onto the subway - only two blocks up. Trendy, affordable, clean and super comfortable bed. Red Farm Yum Cha Chinese restaurant is so close and other great restaurants including Burke and Wills, coffee like Erving Farm and a Shake Shack. Easy walk to Columbus circle up Broadway or into Times Square if you have the desire to just wander a long and close to Central Park. And while it's modern and chic - the staff are not wankers. They're friendly and they respect their guests. Fast free wifi in lobby (but not room) which is a bit of a pain. Good web deals as well - particularly if you're looking for an upgrade. Overall I rate it a lot and will stay here again and again.

We chose this hotel as it was close to family. Nice hotel with modern touches. The bed was one of the most comfortable beds I have slept in while traveling. Many great restaurants close by and a CVS right across the street. Only negative was we did not have a refrigerator. We will stay again.

NYLO is perfectly positioned to explore NYC. It's on Broadway with lots of options of cafe's for breakfast, restaurants for dinner and the underground station is a 3 minute walk directly left as you leave the hotel. The hotels restaurants (Italian and Japanese) are both fantastic, on separate days we had breakfast, lunch and dinner in Sarfina, Italian and were very happy. The hotel has a big computer screen on the wall next to the lifts, this gives you the chance to search for good restaurants nearby and the weather among other things, this was very helpful. We stayed for 5 nights for my 30th birthday and were lucky enough to be upgraded to a very large bedroom with separate lounge, this made our stay a lot more relaxing. The room was very comfortable, very stylishly decorated, clean and we had a fab view of the Hudson River and Broadway. Our bed was big and amazingly comfortable, it felt like sleeping on a cloud. The complimentry toiletries smelt very fresh, the hairdryer was of a very good standard and the complimentary water was very well received. Thank you for a fantastic stay in such an amazing city, we will definitely be recommending NYLO Hotel to our friends.

We decided last minute to turn a Broadway/day trip into a weekend getaway. Not only were the accommodations clean & comfortable (incredible bed!), but the staff were so welcoming, friendly & hospitable, that we are already excited to visit nylo again. The lobby, lounge & library are the perfect setting to gear up for (or recover from) taking in the city. Forget times square, enjoy the local scene! Thanks, Nylo. C u again soon ;)

I felt like I actually lived on the upper west side, not like a tourist. Took me back to my childhood.The hotel was very accommodating and friendly. I didn't get to the rooftop but I will next time. It must be good because the guest, not the staff recommended it.

I spent two weeks here in December and I could not fault the experience. I'm a regular visitor to NYC and this is easily the best hotel I have stayed in. The decor, atmosphere and lounge/bar area make it a super cool place to stay in my favourite upper west side location. Perfect for transport, Central Park and a slice of NY life in the numerous cafes and bars nearby. Great size room and bathroom. Thank you for nice, flattering lighting! This is rare in hotels in my experience. Fast wifi. The doormen and staff were friendly, helpful and respectful. Thank you NYLO. I loved staying with you. I'm looking forward to my next visit in January.

Location was great...two blocks from subway in a nice neighborhood. Never was disturbed by the sounds of other guests, room was clean, bed was very comfortable, linens and towels were nice. Room was small, but nothing unusual in NYC. Bathroom was quite large though! Only negative...we had to run the shower 15 mins before we actually wanted to take a shower to get a warm shower, never was able to get a HOT shower, and water pressure was a little weak. Requested a room on a lower floor away from elevator and the hotel gave us exactly what we asked for, along with a coupon for a complimentary cocktail. The public areas were nicely decorated and felt very cozy and welcoming. The staff at the hotel were all very nice (front desk, doorman, housekeeper, and waitress in lobby bar). Would definitely stay here again.

We decided to stay at the NYLO hotel because of its location in the upper west side, close to some family members. Hotel room was nice and roomy for 4. Staff was friendly. Great location too. Walking distance to many restaurants, museums and central park and convenient to subway and buses.We all had a great time !

We managed to get a two bed monster-sized room at the NYLO, which as you can appreciate is a challenge to find in NYC. Allowed us to keep our family of four in one room and still with lots of space, including a nice sitting area and a work area (which came in handy). Room was clean. Wifi was fantastic and we hooked up 4 different devices with no limitations. Really liked the lounge on the main floor, particularly the chess board table that we used a number of times during the stay post-dinner for a little relaxation and mental stimulation. Allowed me some time to work a little way through the bourbon menu at the bar! The only thing that was a bit odd relates to the cleaning staff and habits. We stayed 4 nights and the cleaning carts were always parked in the hallways and bags of garbage were seemingly always sitting in the halls waiting to be taken down. Very odd and in need of a service staff chat; public areas should generally be clear of all refuse except during the times when room cleaning is actually occurring. The last thing I want to do every time I come in and out of the room or elevator is look (and smell) at what the neighbour in the next room tossed in the trash the night before.A chat with the service staff would presumably have that resolved pretty quickly.Otherwise; all good.

Enjoyed visiting family and the convenience of this hotel. Everyone at NYLO was friendly and helpful. We enjoy the bar area late at night. The availability of taxis outside added to the convenience we needed.

Great location for a travel break. Away from the Main hustle and bustle and about 5 mins walk from west side of Central park and close to the Subway line 1 service that takes you all the way to the South Ferry Terminal with stops right through the centre of New York. Would recommend catching a taxi back through Times Square at least once for the terrific views at night and not expensive.Hotel bar and lobby relaxing and stylish. There's a few eating places around and about - mostly simple but they give a good indication of the amazing variety New York has to offer.The rooms aren't huge but they are more than adequate. The beds are extremely comfortable and one of the best we've used at any hotel. There is some minor outside noise present as would be in most New York hotels but this did not interfere with sleeping given the comfort of the beds as mentioned.All staff were very helpful at all times and held our luggage securely on the last day when we checked out allowing us to make the most of our final day.
user_name:
Poobey
Newton Le Willows, United Kingdom

review_body: Very clean, comfortable room. Helpful & friendly staff. Ambiance of lobby, bar, first floor lounge is fantastic. Price is very reasonable.My only complaint was that the bathroom was a bit small and the shower drain needed to be snaked, but this was a relatively minor complaint.

The location was excellent, and the room was clean. The furniture was adequate and much like a child's playroom desk. The bed was comfortable and the hotel was quiet at night. I left early in the morning, so it did not matter that the walls were very thin and every noise was heard. The staff was friendly and responsive. Overall, it was a bargain and I will stay there again, but probably only for one night stays.

Travelled with my wife and three teenage children to New York. I have stayed many times in New York, but ruisnisbthe best hotel I have stayed in. Great upmarket location in upper west side, subway, diners, pharmacy, grocers etc nearby. A short walk to axe trail Park (two blocks). Immaculate hotel, very spacious rooms, great bar and attached Italian restaurant. Good value- we will be staying there again!

NYLO NYC is very comfortable and convenient. Stayed here for nearly a week and appreciated the location, onsite restaurant and bar and very friendly staff. Best part was the competitive pricing. I have to be back in the city in January and have booked The NYLO again.

This is a great place to stay if you want something on the Upper Westside. We prefer downtown, but needed to be closer to my parents. We were so pleasantly surprised. It was holiday time, and the place looked festive and felt very cozy. Beautifully decorated, nice rooms, great service - we only stayed for two nights, but it was so nice I wanted to stay longer. Would definitely stay there again.

All facets of the Hotel, the Staff, the Location, were AWESOME!!!!From the onset, the front desk Staff are pleasant and very professional. The Valet and Transportation personnel are remarkable. The Bellman's are the very best, simply put. In the lobby the concierge is the best I have every experienced. Speaking of the best, the bar LOCL is hands down the place to be every evening for cocktails and ambience of the establishment. Fast Eddie Park is "The Man"! Dan, Maria, Emily, and Dale are the proverbial Masters of Mixology, not to mention great conversationalists. Bless them All. I look forward to my next extensive stay at the NYLO.

This hotel has everything you need: clean, comfortable rooms, friendly and helpful staff, location-location-location. The subway is under two blocks away (about a two minute walk) and Amsterdam Avenue has some of the best restaurants and shopping. Everything is either within walking distance or a short subway ride away.

This is a return visit for me, as I travel often to NYC for business. I find the staff here to be so welcoming and helpful. I booked last minute so I was unable to get a higher floor(12 or above) Even though the rooms are clean and well appointed, I much prefer the upper level rooms for they have a lovely view of the river as well as being very spacious with a balcony. The corner rooms are down right huge! There is unfortunately construction going on on the street on one side of the hotel so, when you book, be sure to ask to be on the opposite side from the construction. It starts at about 8AM as I found out on my first day there( not the hotel's fault, that's just NYC). It all worked out in the end however as the staff relocated me to a higher floor on the opposite side of the hotel as soon as I requested a change and and I slept like a baby! There is a lot to commend about this hotel and I would definitely recommend it to travelers. Well done NYLO!!

We have been visiting NYC from Toronto often for pleasure and business for the past 40 years. On recommendation of a friend we booked the NYLO in a neighbourhood we love. The room was perfect, clean, comfortable bed, quality linen, staff was always courteous and helpful. Incredible lobby bar and lounge area. 72nd street subway is close and is an express stop!

Rooms are clean. Staff is friendly (although I've been staying there for the past 4 years!), dog friendly! Great food market across the street. Perfect area of the city for all kinds of shopping. All they need now is a rewards program!Otherwise, I highly recommend it.

This was our first time bringing our kids to New York. The hotel location is fantastic - away from the noise of midtown so was could get a restful sleep each night, but in a quiet, safe neighbourhood.

Booked NYLO and I'm glad that I did. Good neighbourhood, very, very friendly staff, clean sufficient bathroom, comfy bed, and everyone who works there had a kind smile on their faces .Safe upper west side area. 10 minutes from Lincoln Centre. Other eateries near bye.Plus .. a pleasant price for NYC. Its not luxury .. but its nothing less than where decent folks would like to stay.

This is the worst hotel experience ever. To be honest, the room was good, and room attendants were very nice. However, however,, however, when I checked out, there was a front desk staff really disrespecting me. He kept interrupting me and spoke very rudely.

Great hotel and location. Restaurants and shops to walk to and hotel bar/food was great. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were modern and clean. Decent size for NYC. No pool or workout room onsite which would have been nice.

This hotel completely exceeded my expectations. I booked it for the Christmas holidays because of the great price and it was so much more than I thought it would be! Big rooms with a great view! Safe, pretty neighborhood too!

Fantastic local location away from the downtown madness. Make sure you explore Amsterdam avenue for great restaurants and bars. The lobby bar is a great place to start or finish your night. Try the bar at the St Regis for the original Bloody Mary and the roof top bar at the Peninsula...it's awesome. Of course the Brooklyn bridge is a must if you need to do some sightseeing and O'halligans nr to the 9/11 memorial does the best Irish Stew ever!

Amazing stay at the NYLO! Hotel's staff is friendly and aims to please. Be sure to take time to enjoy the sitting area and bar on the first floor. Great place to meet friends and relax. Views of the upper west side and the Hudson River are amazing from the upper floors. Splurge and get a loft room. Can't wait to go back!

NYLO was the perfect place to stay. Close to subway, clean and safe... Great neighborhood! We eloped in Central Park which was only two blocks away...!!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for the stay of a lifetime!

The hotel was the perfect stopping point for a very busy vacation. The location was near perfect as it was close to most parts of town and only 2 blocks from a subway station. Everything was clean and comfortable.

Place was clean, great bar....they forgot to mention that a huge construction elevator was right outside my window and started working at 6AM and sounded like a huge garbage truck every few minutes going up and down. The front desk (Matt) was very apologetic and adjusted my bill which was appreciated. I would definitely come back

Stayed for 5 nights with my girlfriend and loved every single thing about my stay. The upper west side is my kinda place and the hotel lies close to 72nd and 79th street subways aswell as the Beacon theatre and the wonderful Viand Café. The staff is friendly and helpful and look after you. The room was spacious, nice and the bed lovely. The view was the backyard so nothing to look at but that doesn't matter to me. The complimentary wifi was excellent and easy to log on to with no registration needed. This is my hotel from now on. See you next time NYLO!

Stellar customer service from everyone....front door, front desk, bar! I was always greeting with a warm welcome every time I stepped through the doors. Nice that the front door faces a quiet side street, only a few steps away from bustling Broadway. Vibrant atmosphere, while the dim lights evoke a quaint, intimate, cozy feel. Room is compact and efficient. Will definitely stay again if my travels bring me to that portion of NYC.

This hotel is very convenient for us when visiting our son who lives in the neighborhood.we love everything about it. Rooms are clean and comfortable, the staff is great and the bar is a great place to relax and have a drink.

My daughter and I had another great stay at NYLO.From check in to check out everything went smoothly!The friendly staff, super comfortable beds and awesome lobby we wouldn't stay anywhere else in NYC!

Great hotel for the price. Staff is very helpful and upgraded us to a suite when they heard it was my birthday. The rooms are nice and very Hip. Ask for one of the rooms with a terrace facing the river, Great view.

This boutique hotel was a fabulous stay. The hotel was clean and the staff were superb! I really enjoyed my stay!The only annoying situation is that at one point two dogs were going at it at the bar. I get that the hotel is pet friendly, but when multiple patrons are highly distracted at high pitch continuous barking, and the bartender just informs it's a pet friendly hotel, where does that leave the rest of us? We paying for the same hotel/service, and felt completely ignored. I believe at that point, there should have been a solution to fit the need of everyone trying to enjoy themselves. It makes it challenging that dogs outweighed my experience as well.

Excellent location and close to everything. Nice small boutique hotel with a warm feeling and cozy bar. the room was directly across from brick wall but was clean and comfortable. wifi was charged which is criminal but other than that, great stay!

My husband and I stayed here for a week and we had a wonderful experience. I will definitely come back here. The ambiance is a true New York experience and we loved the location. We walked to central park almost every day and the 5th avenue is also within walking distance (some people might consider it far if you are not used to walking much.) The staff is friendly, polite and their professionalism and service was the best! Thank you NYLO for making our first New York experience an unforgettable one!

Convenient location, a friendly staff, efficiently and courteously run. the room is comfortable and quiet. The lounge in the lobby is great and the waiters are friendly and attentive to your needs. Wifi free for return guests. We will be back again.

Quality bedding approved, clean, quiet, located 5 minutes to Central Park and Time Square. Staff friendly and helpful, lounge chill with free jazz band on the week-ends, perfectly located and simply feels like home

I've stayed at NYLO NYC many times--I'm there six times a yer. I've always been pleased with the service, the cleanliness of the room, and the general kindness of my fellow hotel residents. If you want a hotel that makes you feel welcome, you've found the right place. And the upper West Side is one of the most interesting and dynamic areas in the City. Come, you'll enjoy.

Great location. Friendly, helpful staff. Room, hallways and the crusted tv remote could have been cleaner. $15 per day for in-room wifi and 'free' wifi in lobby only worked for my phone not laptop. No refrigerator in room. Location, location, location.

The bathroom of my pent house suite was dirty. Hair in the shower from the prior guest. Normally I would shrug this off but it was everywhere in the shower which makes me think they didn't clean the shower at all.

Always happy to be back! Good vibe, comfortable rooms with quality beds! This residential area is very convenient, quiet, good walks , close to Central Park and Columbus Circle and the subway on a few meters distance. The service is correct and the Italian restaurant next door serves a nice breakfast.

What began as a vacation/conference turned into a tragedy when my NY friend suddenly passed away. I had to fly my kids and wife into NY and increase our stay in NYC and thus NYLO. The staff at NYLO were unbelievably kind and despite being the Christmas season continued my discounted rates on my room and a second room. The doorman watched my rental car while I took care of family business before the funeral. The manager gave me another room after my family left back to Nashville because we refused housekeeping. Note we refused housekeeping and the manager understood why and gave me a clean room for the night.Before the family emergency i found the once On The Avenue now NYLO awesome. It has a great lobby to hang out and people watch and a great bar with friendly bar tenders. It is 2 blocks away from the subway and is surrounded by fantastic restaurants, delis, shopping and of course Zabars. The rooms were clean and the housekeeping team friendly, courteous and helpful. The staff and concierge were wonderful. I highly recommend NYLO.

NYLO was a nice find. Really nice ambience. Modern and eclectic - not so modern as to be cold and unwelcoming. But still pretty minimalist (in a good way) as far as the rooms are concerned. The staff was nice and attentive. The bed was really comfy. The location is perfect for most anything. Even if you want to be downtown, you are super close to the subway. And Riverside and Central Parks are both right there. My only complaint was that the floor wasn't vacuumed super well, which I discovered walking around barefoot. The rest of the room was clean, though. Definitely a good UWS option to stay.

I was there for 5 days, from last Friday to Wednesday. The location is great if you've already been to Manhattan. You get to discover a different neighborhood and you have the Guggenheim, Metropolitan, Natural History and Moma very accesible and close by.Room wise, there were certain things that demerit what they charge. The doors are chipped, the floor under the bed an around the corners were very dusty. We found dust balls beneath the bed.The bathtub, had hairs and wasn't that clean at all. The mirror and the sink in general were with a little filth from the previous guest or the bad cleaning of the housekeeper, hard to decipher. In general it looks like they don't keep up with the maintenance thoroughfully. But the thing that brings my review to average is that we never got real hot water to bathe, only one day we had it, the rest of the days we had to shower with warm water. Fortunately, we had the best weather conditions, considering the time of the year, no real cold at all, if it had been at the normal low temperatures, this would definitely been an issue. In the summer, you will probably not even notice it.Other than that, the bed is really comfortable, mattress and pillows equally good!!! You really get a good rest and nite sleep after the marathonic days you expose your feet to. The room is smaller than it looks in the pictures but nothing you can't manage.The staff is ok, they will solve any questions or troubles you encounter, but won't give the extra mile to rate them as friendly or customer experience oriented.The lobby is great, it has a good vibe and atmosphere! You have a CVS five steps away, which is convenient in case you forget anything or need anything. Subway stations are nearby.There is a great gastronomic offer within few blocks around, but that's just Manhatan, doesn't matter where you stay there are always places and options to eat.

This was a short stay, but I really enjoyed staying at the hotel. The size of the room was not bad for a NY hotel! The room was very nicely laid out and the bed was extremely comfortable. My family lives three blocks away so that was a plus. In addition, the hotel is conveniently located to the 1/2/3 subway line, in close vicinity to some of the museums, and there are nice nice restaurants and cafes nearby. I liked the lobby/lounge/bar area. I wish I had asked the name of the staff who checked me in, but she was friendly and great! I would highly recommend this hotel and I plan on staying there again on my next trip.

The convenient upper westside location is the biggest plus for this hotel. We checked in for a 6-night stay and had to change rooms 3 times. Last change was communicated via email which we got with just 20 minutes to spare before they released the room. Poor customer service on that front and also when our AC wouldn't work. Thumbs up on comfy bed (but no feather pillows available) and lobby bar (with live music) is great!

Great location,great vibe. Small rooms, but very well equipped. Very quiet in room, very comfortable beds. Excellent concierge, excellent bell staff. My second visit, will stay again.Serafina ok, convenient, not special. Red Barn outstanding & not to be missed!

Thoroughly enjoyed the ambience of hotel with Cheers style bar being popular place to be with very attentive staff particularly as this was my first trip back to NYC having becom e a widower after 50 years marriage.The room was fine,lovely king size bed and immaculate ensuite facilities. Only downside was no view out as two weeks windows faced brickwork but luckily I was not in room much in daytime and the room was very quiet at night

Have stayed frequently. Great neighborhood. Very nice rooms. They used to provide courtesy internet access in rooms, now free in lobby but $15/day for in room internet access. Bar used to have better happy hour, with peanuts/snacks. I had to provide my own, bought a can of mixed nuts and gave it to the bartender.
user_name:
Robert I
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Love the UWS, so NYLO is a no brainer - smack in the middle of all that is going on, this hotel offers a great lobby with comfortable sitting and meeting areas, a good, if small, bar and pleasant and helpful front desk staff. The rooms are large, comfortable and have a coffee maker - which for me is a MUST in the AM. I am not an out of towner, just poppped in for an overnight, so I wouldn't know how they handle requests of that nature, but what I witnessed at check in were VERY knowledgeable staff providing directions and suggestions to travelers. I will be staying there again - hopefully soon.

It was good. Good goody good. Like good. I had a good time. I slept good. No noise, which is good. More words, which are good. Good prices. Good ambiance. Good overall experience in the goodness of the Upper West.

Address is right on Broadway, convenient to restaurants and stores. Great walking area. Room is fairly small but well-appointed and clean, though I would have liked a small carpet. Have stayed here many times ... now there is no microwave available as in the past, and no small fridge either. Bathroom has everything needed and a good shower. There is a nice flat-panel large TV. Not all the lights worked. I asked for Queen bed, got a King with a mattress a bit softer than I prefer. Friendly "homey" ambience in the lobby, with a nice vibe in the bar. My package included complimentary continental breakfast at the adjacent restaurant which is quite good. The hotel is not inexpensive but that's Manhattan these days. Good WiFi. Friendly and helpful concierge and also bellman at the door. I found the front-desk personnel blandly efficient but not particularly friendly or welcoming. But I would return to this location.

Nylo is a funky updated Hotel .The staff is Friendly and Helpful and Extremely pleasant to you .The hotel is within walking distance or a short subway ride to all the attractions. There are great restaurants in and near the hotel .

clean, plenty of room for the two of us, great shower, soft towels, very comfortable bed. Fantastic location--loved staying in the upper west side! Plenty of food choices nearby--Fred's, Meatball Shop, EuroPan for breakfast, Cafe LaLo...all great choices

I have been here now four times - each time bringing new friends and family to enjoy the city. I can't fathom staying anywhere else. Love the location and the relative quiet in the area. Wonderful friendly staff-a shout out to Orlando for bringing our bags to our room. Love the fact they hold our bags before we check in. Will be back again soon!!

Great place . Great staf. Lots of help on any questions & directions. Nice & clean . Great value. Would recommend to friends . Nice quiet spot in N Y. Would stay there again . This was a great place to stay for a nice quiet time and a beautiful upscale side of New York. Away from all the over congested down town. Close to Central Park and Museams

This was my first visit to New York and very happy with NYLO! Great location, close to subway and Central Park. The lobby was great. It felt like you were in a very stylish friend's home. The rooms were small but super comfortable beds. The hotel staff were friendly and flexible, even let us check in early! Have dinner at fish tag and breakfast at the fairway market restaurant. Highly recommend NYLO! Try to get a room with a balcony.

The hotel is a great place to have as a base for a few days in NYC. It is very convenient to the Subway on 79th street and only 2 blocks from Central Park. The foyer has a small but pleasant bar and a couple of very comfortable lounge areas which are enjoyable meeting places or just a place to sit and read the paper. I found the reception staff and the door attendants were very friendly and helpful. As to the room, the bed was wonderfully comfortable and although not large the room was comfortable enough.

NYLO is a very nice, intimate, boutique hotel just a couple of blocks from Central Park and in a nice neighborhood. The lobby is very active, with a bar literally at the front door, very nice library / sitting area, and even live music one evening.I definitely suggest you give it a try.

It's a perfect location, and the staff is very friendly. Ambience in the lobby is wonderful. The rooms are very, very small for the price. The Lucerne, 2 blocks away has 3 times the space for much less money, with a higher quality of accommodation.

Great location if you dont like being in the centre of town. Just by park and handy for subway.. lovely clean rooms with very comfy beds and functional but well designed bathrooms. Friendly staff [except for barman who was quite surly], very helpful concierge good front desk and nice cleaners. There's a restaurant attached with great breakfasts run by a wonderful bunch of servers. the gym is good and the foyer are is very gemutlich.. nice in NYC to find a hotel with a cosy space to sit in.

I had another pleasant stay at NYLO New York, this was my second visit at this hotel. The staff is friendly, atmosphere is relaxed cool, location is convenient to subway. All was well with my stay. I arrived early & once again I was able to check in early (11:30 am). It was great to be able to visit my room and freshen-up before heading out for a day in the city. My room was clean & comfortable. My room was quiet & I slept well in my cozy bed. I was feeling pretty happy about my choice of hotel...and then at check out I got an unpleasant surprise. I was charged $110 for valet parking, when I thought I had parking included with my room rate. Long story short: there was some confusion with the parking package booking page on the website that I used to book my hotel (I used the website for the parent company as opposed to that specific franchise's site). I inquired about the charge & the weekend desk person was apologetic, but could not offer a refund. I grumbled about the charge all day & decided to call the hotel & ask someone else. I was connected with Matt who went through the reservation process that I used and discovered the problem. Afterward he reversed the charges and I can now say that I was 100% happy with my second stay at NYLO. I will stay here again.

There are obviously a lot of options and places to stay in NYC, and we've stayed at a few, but my family and I have stayed at NYLO twice now. NYLO’s location on the Upper West side, and accommodations are a perfect fit for my family. The Upper West is close to Central Park and quieter than other sections of town, making it a perfect "home base" for a weekend or longer stay. The Upper West also has a number of great restaurants that we've found very welcoming to families. And, it's less than a 5 minute walk to a subway to get you up and downtown easily. So, no matter where you're planning on going, you can get there quite simply. The hotel itself is very comfortable. The room furnishings are unique, and possess a boutique hotel feel. The two rooms we've stayed in have high ceilings, open floor plans, and are spacious. After a long day making your way around town and throughout the hustle and bustle of the city, it's a nice feeling to come back to the room and relax without feeling cramped. More than anything though, it's the personal service that makes all of the difference to me. It's what brought us back, and will keep us returning. The doorman was polite, friendly, and very welcoming. There is no underestimating how important this very first interaction with a hotel is; he made my family feel immediately comfortable. The woman at the front desk who greeted us was just as pleasant and happy. Honestly, it felt like she was glad to see us! She was extremely accommodating, and had a room available for us, which enabled us to settle quickly and get on with our day.
