She was extremely helpful throughout our short stay, and also when checking out.Interesting additional note; after arriving home, I'd provided feedback to NYLO via email acknowledging some of the staff who made our stay so pleasant. The hotel manager responded to me personally in less than 15 minutes! The rooms are great, the location is perfect, and the service was personal. NYLO has won my business. There is no reason to stay anywhere else.

This a great little boutique hotel in what seems to be an old sand blasted warehouse. Great value in high priced new York and very hip and atmospheric. The bar and lounge downstairs is very dim and moddy but it rocks as the night gets going.

We chose this hotel to be close to the Lincoln Center, Zabar's, and the subway. It's closeby and accessible to anywhere you want to go in Manhattan without having to deal with the crowds in Time Square.

The NYLO is a well presented hotel on the Upper West Side. The foyer/bar area has a nice warmth to it, with a decent bar, though perhaps a bit lacking on the bar offerings (no winter drinks, in mid-December) and service (waited 15 mins at a table on one visit, and then just went to the bar). The RedFarm restaurant attached to the hotel is very good. Bar food was so-so. Wifi was part of our tariff, but understand it is charged for some other tariffs. I wouldn't pay for it; it was OK in the room, but weak in the public spaces.I booked a Queen-Queen Suite. First let me say that, as a "room" it was nicely presented, and quite spacious for NYC. The bathroom was huge, and had a great shower, though strangely laid out (wasting a good deal of space) and lacked some practical touches (what is it with hotel interior designers having fancy sinks with no usable storage on, under or anywhere near them). My major disappointment, though, was that the room was not, in fact, a "suite" - it was simply a large room. We were traveling as a family - self, wife and 6-year old daughter - and having an actual suite is key to us; so my daughter can go off to sleep in the bedroom, and the adults can still have a bit of time to themselves in a clearly separated lounge room. I was happy to pay a premium for a suite, but feel quite taken advantage of to get something of far less use - at least for my needs. For other potential customers, while I think this hotel has a lot to recommend it, I would advise that you carefully check what in fact it is you are getting.

1st time stay and the 1st time we traveled to NY - We decided to choose this hotel based off the reviews and location, when we arrived we checked in, and the female staff at the check in desk did not ask us for a upgrade so we stayed on the 10th floor we were given a room with a view to the back of the property where you can just see inside everyone's apt. (not cool with that) We also were not told where the Ice Machine was. So I had to go to the 1st floor bar area to get ice, and I was told the machines were on the 12th floor. So when we went to the 12th floor you had so many turns and twists. Not very convenient if you ask me. The Concierge was very very helpful,

This is a very cute hotel which has been upgraded from when it was On the Ave. Location is the best thing about it. I would stay here again. Only complaints were the small size of the room for the price, and one morning the housekeeping staff was quite noisy talking to each other in the hall outside my door.

Great hotel in a great location. Clean, comfortable friendly. Very warm and welcoming bar/lobby. We really enjoyed exploring the upper west side of the city. Would highly recommend ithis hotel too friends and family

Very small room made me feel as if in college dorm room. Bath was stainless steel counter with no extras. Other stays at this facility have been more comfortable. Will not return. Staff friendly but room just not comfortable.

Great value, excellent quality, smallish rooms, but PERFECT for a city break. The staff were incredibly friendly, the location was surrounded by every amenity and with Serefina downstairs, what more could I have wanted?

The Hotel is below our expectations, the Windows were not tight, the AC very loud.No lamps at the beds, just the room light, Switch at the wall, not accessible from the beds. The warderobe was to small for 2 persons, no sufficient space for coats, jackets.The bathroom door locking was damaged.Good beds, free coffee (but only one for a double room per day) free Internet.

Stayed at NYLO in the past. Thought it was great. Came back last week. We found the lobby renovations were finished. Very inviting and friendly. Jesse at the front desk helped us secured an upgrade. Much more space with a great skyline view. Every time we found the staff was excellent.
user_name:
den06611
New York City, New York

review_body: My "go to" hotel on the UWS was booked so I thought I'd take a chance on NYLO. When I first entered the hotel I was a bit overwhelmed by the crowd in the lobby bar and thought I would regret my decision. But it turned out to be a wonderful experience with impeccable service. The room was a good size by NYC standards and was virtually sound proof. When I went downstairs in the morning I saw that lobby area was large and very comfortable for relaxing with a morning coffee. I will definitely return

Very nice clean and quiet room. Very comfortable. Not large but a good size - with good internet connectivity. Good value! I would stay there again the next time that I need to be in that part of the city.

My husband and I stay in Manhattan frequently, and this is one of our favorite places to stay now. Friendly staff, and the bar/lounge/lobby was a welcoming and vibrant place to spend time. The room was spacious and the bed/linens were quite comfortable. Enough pillows without having to ask! We will definitely return.
user_name:
stablesitter
New York City, New York

review_body: My wife and I travelled from Australia for two weeks in NYC November / December 2015. Chose hotel NYLO based on TripAdvisor reviews and were not disappointed. Super clean effecient and modern rooms. Loved the "warehouse" feel to the decor. Best ever bed and huge TV. Location is perfect. Central Park , subway, market and coffee shops all so close. Irving Farm Coffee Roasters on 79th our favourite local. Stayed for 2 weeks and will be back. Great staff. Mira our room cleaner was the Best. Effecient and super friendly, always started our day either smile. Thoroughly recommended.

A wonderful experience at this hotel in December 2015. This is my second visit to NYLO, the first being in early 2013, when the hotel was under renovation. The renovations are complete and classy. I recommend this hotel and will stay here again. No problems with a late check in, check out, or at any time during the visit. My room was on the 10th floor and very quiet. The view was of another building, but a room view was not my priority.Spacious bathroom and good size room for Upper West Side New York. Very clean.This hotel is located at the corner of 77th St and Broadway and convenient to the #1 Subway.There is a fee for in-room wifi, but I had no trouble with any slow wifi signals--a rare thing in hotels.I stayed at NYLO while attending an event at Teachers College, so I was on a school budget. I took advantage of the CVS drug store (limited groceries) across the street and the nearby Westside Market. Restaurants are also close by.Room prices are high everywhere during the winter holiday season, but the room prices reflect competitive hotel rates with nearby hotels.

We loved the nylo. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Location was excellent and room clean and comfortable. Only minus was windows looked straight into brick wall and also pity no breakfast option

This is likely my eighth time staying at NYLO NYC. I love the location, the staff are friendly, highly competent and quick to solve problems. Valet parking great. The bar if also friendly and great cocktails. All, all good.

This hotel is well located in the Upper West Side. Love the bar! Rooms are big for NYC standards; beds are extremely comfortable (king room) and the bathroom shower is big! Beware however that NYC hotels room are smalls. Toilet area in the bathroom is very limited. Wood floor panels are very nice touch.
user_name:
Jon N
San Juan, Puerto Rico

review_body: NYLO is perfectly located on 77th Street and Broadway. Just far enough away from the mid-town entertainment bustle to be fairly quiet, but conveniently located near Central Park and the #1 Subway (79th Street station). Superb produce and fine grocery across the street, lots of coffee shops and boutiques nearby. Rooms are comfortable and secure, stylish in a fairly austere way. Hardwood floors with no carpeting. Tiny bathroom even in upgraded room. Water consistently tepid in showers over a 4-night visit. Housekeeping is good, as would be expected for what is a very expensive way to stay in Manhattan, but the floors were not swept each day. The lounge area is just OK in that it's quite bustling, with lots of people streaming through at all hours. Door service is less than premium-attentive, but adequate. Avoid the "Serafina" restaurant adjoining. There are much better dining alternatives in the neighborhood.

I only stayed one night, but NYLO NYC was memorable for its cool and comfortable room and fun ground-floor bar scene. The price was also extremely reasonable and the location convenient. My only complaint is the torrent of emails that seemed to begin after my online booking. That's a big turnoff it is continues.

We spent four nights here over the Thanksgiving holidayTwo blocks from the subway on 79 and Broadway to get to the theater district or five blocks to 72 and get the express all the way downtown.There is a restaurant connected seraphina which is good for breakfast lunch and dinner, reasonable. Nearby there are loads of choices on Broadway, Artie's is just one. Movies on 84th and excellent Chinese Han Dynasty 85th all on Broadway. Three blocks east and Central Park, we only live in New Jersey but avoid bringing a car.
user_name:
John V
Spring Lake Heights, New Jersey

review_body: this is a nice hotel, not too big; friendly staff;the size of our room was quite OK, comfortable beds,, bathroom big and clean;located at Broadway but nevertheless quiet, Underground station is nearby;

We had stayed at a NYLO property in Los Colinas earlier in the year and really enjoyed it. We usually stay at a smaller property in the Village, but decided to check the NYLO out and take advantage of a room with a balcony.The location is great! Its near the subways, Central Park, and in such a cool neighborhood that has everything you need.We booked a suite early and then noticed deals on the internet changing and getting better so we had like 3 reservations going at once. We went from a Skyline Penthouse to the Panoramic Suite. I was on the internet the night before and noticed the rate had been slashed drastically- one room left. I called the Hotel and told them I didn't see why I had to pay much more for the suite I had booked earlier when someone just hopping on line could get it for a steal. It took a little talking, but the Hotel did the right thing and let me change the reservation to the lower rate less than 24 hours of arrival without any cancellation fee. We saved around $700.00 or so. Upon arrival the Doorman greeted us and check in took less than 5 minutes. Our Suite was on the 14th floor. The room is larger by New York standards and the balcony was plenty big with two wicker chairs. The view was towards the Hudson. Not a full view, but between building it was a nice look with Jersey across the river. A little cool in the day, but still nice to able to get fresh air without trekking down to the lobby and outside. The room was adequately equipped. Coffee maker, but no fridge or microwave. Those are available upon request. We didn't. The coffee maker was supplied with one coffee, on decaf, and one tea. I have never understood this. When the room is occupied by two people you would think they would supply it with two of each instead of one. I asked for more at the front desk, but it seems to be a no brainer to make it right the first time or at least ask if you will need more than one each. No big deal, but still its the little things. The room had more than adequate enough room to move around and never felt cramped at all. A comfortable stuffed chair was provided along with the chair at the desk. Lighting is nice in the NYLO'S I have noticed. The bed was very comfortable and had nice linens and comforters as well as the pillows. The bathroom was big enough to get around in easily. It came with all of the usual devices such as hairdryer. The glassed enclosed shower was roomy with a great shower head. The towels were nice weight. Shampoo, conditioner, soaps were all a brand called Pure. The were good quality.The closet had the iron and ironing board and the one robe. I feel about the one robe as I do the one coffee when two guest are in the room. It should have two. It just makes sense.The Bar- First, I would say that I pre arranged for a bottle of Champagne to be in the room upon our arrival. I called ahead and talked with Dan, one of the bartenders. He set it all up with the Front Desk and we arrived a little early before check in by about 2 hours so the desk had it brought up right away and I mean we had not been in the room 5 minutes before it was brought. I also set up another bottle to be delivered through Dan while down at the Bar and again he set it up and took great care of us. Hats off to Dan for taking such good care and being very profession the whole time.Second, the bar area is nice. Its not real big and has two sitting areas on either side. It seems to do good business and we enjoyed drink at the bar two of our three nights. I give the bar 5 stars and Dan 10!We never took advantage of the restaurants so I cant speak about them, but I did notice a number of pizzas being delivered to guest at the bar.I give this NYLO property high marks overall. Very friendly staff. A all you could ask for location convenient to everything by foot, subway, or cab. I would return again without question, but even if I make reservation I would still keep an eye out for price reductions. We are planning a return to NY the end of January and we are planning on staying at the NNYLO again. I like the Panoramic Suite a lot, but would like to try the Skyline Penthouse this time.

We come from VT frequently to visit our children. We have stayed often through this hotels changes. It is very convenient , but often too costly for us. We wonder if it would be possible to get a discount when we stay. Thank you fir making our trip easier.

We stayed on the 16th floor and had a great, large (by NYC standards) room with a terrace and a view of rooftops and the Hudson River in the distance. Staff were helpful and courteous, and the hotel bar has a casual, friendly vibe.

will wait until a few days before I travel to get the best rate....there are hundreds of hotels in New York to choose from.Offerring me a discount for my next visit will not suffice.I should have gotten a better price after complaining to the reservations manager.Last time to stay at NYLO.

enjoyed a great stay at Nylo hotel, perfectly located next to national history museum and central park, close to lots of great restaurant options. Did not enjoy onsite options (serafina restaurant and the very cool bar) just because of lack of time. Bed confort is amazing, bathroom is well designed. i'd just but a mini bar service which is always helpful when you don't wanna go out at 23.00 to find a bottle of water. will be back!

This was a trip of pleasure. Everything was great. Windows did need washing. It was nice to have a restaurant next door to the property, but sorry there was not room service. The front desk people were very helpful. The the bartenders also very good.

The property is located within walking distance of Central Park, Lincoln Center, and, if you must, Times Square. Stayed here for an overnight after a Beacon Theater show (just a couple of blocks away), and brought the family back for a Thanksgiving adventure. At least one friend stayed here on my recommendation. No disappointments, yet. Staff is friendly and helpful, rooms are bright and clean and well-outfitted, the bar is commodious, bringing in street traffic as well as guests. Way cool place. My wife, who is a hotel snob, said she's coming back.

The best place about this hotel is its location. Its upper west side neighborhood is filled with bars and quaint restaurants that cater to both tourists and locals and prices are reasonable for NYC. The subway is just a block away and it is no more than a 5 minute ride to Times Square. Any location in Manhattan is within reach given the close subway connection. You can easily walk to Central Park or the Museum of Natural History. On top of its location, the rooms are modern and all you need for a comfortable stay. The lobby of the hotel has a casual bar and ample space to lounge. The price is unbeatable.

Hotel was clean, though relatively Spartan. We asked for turndown service each night but they never came, Booking included breakfast, but infact breakfast was a role, a muffin and coffee. We were told there were two different breakfast coupons but no explanation why we got the cheaper one . Lobby probably the best part of the hotel. Rooms very small and impersonal!

Lovely stay at NYLO. The rooms were really lovely, well decorated and immaculately clean. The hotel bar was good. Good choice of drinks, reasonably priced and lots of places to sit.Good location. With a subway very close by. Would recommend anyone to stay here

I had choosen to return to NYLO based on the pleasant experience I had there in the Summer of 2014. I regret to say that this time around my experience at the hotel was quite the opposite. To begin with, the staff was short of treating guests with due courtesy, the doormen for instance were arrogant and rude, except for Ms. Ramona, who gave me a warm welcome and checked me in earlier, as I had just arrived from a long overnight flight across the hemisphere. She even scheduled a move to another room with a view as I had requested. To this point, guest service was sharp. Things started to change as I was constantly annoyed by the loud guests in the corridor every morning and night. In addition to the noise, the doors at the hotel were extremely loud and it felt like the whole room was shaken when your next-doors were on their way in or out. Another problem I faced, was that the heating system was very inneficient, I even got sick during the course of the stay because the facilities were very cold and the room did not have a cozy, comfortable feeling. The bathroom is all in tile and has no direct heating system. It was alwasys a challenge whenever I needed to use the restroom because it was too cold to have a relaxed experience. The sink is made of metal and it certainly makes you feel closer to a butchery fridge than to a modern piece of furniture. There are no towel racks, least of all a heated one, so towels always felt cold because they did not dry out enough and remained wet overnight. The cleaning staff was rude and loud as well, I had to get out of bed to request for silence one morning while they discussed about their month's payroll. Honestly, a good staff member should be invisible. A service cart was left day and night in the corridors, and to my misfurtune, right across from my door. I had to deal with the visual and audio pollution everyday as I walked in and out. Another issue, the Serafina restaurant left something to be desired. After complaints were presented, I was offered yet another move to a quieter room in the upper floors. When I arrived in the evening, the move had not been made. I had no other choice than leave. It was honestly a bitter surprise and, to my relief, I decided to check out earlier from an originally long stay, which is quite not common. On top of all of this, the amount charged was very incoherent with the service provided. I moved to another hotel in Midtown, and suddenly New York felt alive. NYLO no more.

We loved the NYLO hotel . It is comfortable, smart and welcoming. The rooms are warm and well designed . Even though we did not need them , facilities are there for disabled guests . Wifi was free , facility for printing boarding passes etc available too . Breakfast was extra ,but we knew that when we booked . Staff were very helpful . Cab booked for return journey to JFK was prompt and comfortable. The hotel bar was a great place to meet up, before or after an evening out. Live entertainment some evenings too. We would return . (Only annoyance was waiting to ask the concierge a quick question about hop-on / off bus stops , and having to wait while she booked theatre tickets for a guest . Staff at reception could not answer our question so sent us back to concierge .)

We visited over Thanksgiving with our 14 & 16 year old kids. The hotel is art deco with a cozylobby/bar that was busy every night. Great crowd and dog friendly. The rooms were clean and fairly spacious.Location had a neighborhood feel about four blocks to Central Park and 1 block to the subway. We will definitely stay here again! Perfect for parade watching. Very friendly staff & cleaning service.

Hotel was all that we expected and More !!! The entire staff was great !!! We started with a problem with the room, but it was handled, corrected above and beyond. It's a great location with, drugstore, market, and coffee on the same block. ( if you want more than a Kuerig in the room). We attended an event at the Beacon Theater, and were a block away.

It was clean and better than many hotels I've been to. However, the wifi cost money and no breakfast is included. They have a bar in the lobby which concerned me a tad. Two blocks from the nearest subway station, so not too bad. I'm not sure if they have disability accommodations but it didn't seem disability friendly. The restaurant attached seemed nice but the breakfast service wasn't the best. However, the lemon ricotta pancakes were delicious. The concierge (a male but I don't remember the name) was definitely helpful, though. It has a cool vibe, especially the lobby. Kinda cool but I don't know that I would stay there again, I guess it depends on the amount of time you're planning on spending actually in the hotel.

Because I have lived in NYC many years on the UWS. Now living on the West Coast I need to come back to NYC for a attitude check, recharge batteries every few months. The only place I stay is NYLO. Not only because of it's UWS location but of the accomodations and great staff.

The Hotel bar is fabulous; probably our favorite aspect of NYLO. The Rooms are very nice; all have been updated. Hotel staff great. We stay here 3 or 4 times a year and love it. We highly recommend this hotel!

We come every year to NYC for a medical conference. We usually stay at another hotel on ;79th Street. I called too late and they were full. I thought we would try NYLO. The location was great, the staff was great, however the room was not worth the price. I felt like I was in a dorm room. The furnishings looked cheap but the bed was excellent.

Checked in early and the front desk gave us a complimentary upgrade to a Superior room so that we would have a room ready. The room was great, only suggestion would be a towel hanger. The lobby bar and restaurant were places you'd actually like going, vs. being typical hotel lobby fare. Very easy access to the 1/2/3 lines from 79th or 72nd stations a few blocks away.

Loved this hotel. Industrial chic done well. Bed was unbelievably comfortable, located by lots of great restaurants, and the personnel are all about service. Wanted to be away from the Times Square chaos and this was perfect. We will stay there again!

No hot water for morning shower. Low floors get street lights and noise, including 4am garbage pick-ups. Not what I expected for a short get-away with my wife despite being a tolerant New Yorker. For the price, very poor value.

I would like to send my sincere thank you for the Hotel NYLO team! The reservation team had upgraded our room to a nice and cosy king-sized room. The room was waiting for us with a hand written note and a bottle of bubbly. I appreciate how much effort you did for us.Broadway was quite loudly present at our room, but then again it is something that goes together with NYC experience. Warmly recommendate staying at NYLO, the best asset is the people! Will return...

great location- wonderful shopping and sightseeing, easy access to theater. room looks like a dorm room with lockers as end tables, etc. TV placement just adequate. Not sure if there isn't turn down service or they just skipped us. only bar soap for the shower- no body wash. no robes. bare wood floor- no rug (we consider this a plus for cleanliness reasons but there are no slippers offered here so bring your own)

terrific location, large room (double double suite), amazing beds and linen. The room was quiet and cozy. Some complementary coffee and tea at the lobby would be nice. Instead we got umbrellas, which were great. Over all - would love to return

We spent 4 nights here. We really liked everything, location was good, bar great, room a good size with a fabulously comfortable bed. All the staff very helpful and friendly. Would definitely recommend.
user_name:
Angela C
New York City, New York

review_body: The NYLO, while being very well decorated, was not highly maintained in the halls. The workout facility was no bigger than a closet. The wifi, while being comped, was almost too slow to stream netflix. Although I enjoyed not hearing sirens and having lights shine on my window, my interior view of a brick wall was not at all appealing.Rooms do not come with a fridge by default. There were private parties in the 'business lounge' during times where guests would use it.However, the overall cleanliness was great, other thin walls, it was quiet, and between two different stops on the 1 subway on broadway and 79/72. Convenient walk to central park and plenty of dining options including the attached bar and Serafina.Even though I was not thoroughly impressed, and do not feel they deserve a 4 star rating, I must say the convenience makes the faults easy to overlook.

Ask for a corner room if you want light . The rooms are spotless but definitely a minimalist decor. The bathroom vanity is a formed industrial looking stainless steel presentation. Odd but it works. Rooms are large. Bar is smallish but cosy with comfortable furniture. Staff is quite friendly. The hotel is sitting on the corner of Broadway and 77th on the westside so the neighborhood is a quite walkable place with restaurants and shops. There is a 24 hour pharmacy directly opposite hotel. Th hotel restaurant Serafina is good for moderate dining .

Comfortable and quiet. Room quite small. Near local subway, great Red Farm restaurant. Difficult non responsive thermostat. Comfortable bed,free wifi, walkable to varied points of interest. We would stay here again.

It was convenient to the theater. I expected the room to be bigger as well as the bathroom. It was very noisy with construction outside, which work us up early. The bathroom had an industrial look to it and the room had a musty smell to it. For the price that we paid, I felt I should not have had to upgrade for a king size bed, which we did to ensure we had a king size bed.

Great location, very helpful staff, excellent housekeeping, super comfortable beds! The lobby lounge with computers and printer extremely helpful when problem with plumbing in first room I was given meant that I was without a room for a few hours till replacement room was ready. All good,no complaints.

Friendly desk staff - a rarity in the city. Really nice digs. Tasty keurig coffee (more regular please :) ). The furnishings were new and contemporary - there was this dope light under the bed. I'll be back here. It's small, but if you're going to complain about small accommodations in New York then you may be out of touch with reality.

On this visit, our daughter was a vocalist in an off-Broadway product of Standard Time. NYLO is in such a fantastic location - close to the theatre district, wonderful restaurants, museums, and Central Part, but in a much less congested area. Accommodations were comfortable and staff members were gracious and accommodating!

Room was fine, except for the all-steel bathroom, which felt very cold. And it took forever for the water to warm up. But the lighting was relaxing and the bed was comfy. The bar area is very welcoming and the front desk receptionists were very nice.

We came to visit our son, who is studying in Columbia University, and chose NYLO for it's proximity and access. The staff were in general helpful and pleasant - Ramona in particular! The place is clean and has a quirky charm that sets it apart. The area itself is a delight with many neighborhood stores and eateries that have a homely feel.

Comfortable, clean accommodations in a perfect location on Broadway. Our room was next to a construction site, so there was some noise during the day, but he value was excellent because we had brought during a sale. Wonderfully friendly atmosphere and helpful staff. Second stay and will return.

Amazing hotel in a fantastic location. Fantastic staff that were on hand to help at any opportunity. Freindly and warm and the Gordon Ramsey restaurant was a joy with excellent food and wine. Close to central park and times square and within 5 minutes for both.

Spent one night at the NYLO the first week of November. Lovely hotel with friendly front desk staff. The room was ultra modern however not user friendly to seniors. The bathroom, although sparking clean, had no grab bar in the tub which is an important feature for older patrons. The bed was very comfortable once I managed to get in. It was so high that this 5'1" little old chubby lady had to take a cushion off a chair to stand on in order to navigate the bed and even then it was difficult. There should have been a stool for the vertically challenged. Wondering why the bed was so high in the first place. We are frequent visitors to NYC and would stay at this hotel again if it were more senior friendly. If you are tall and agile, go for it!

Clean rooms and friendly staff. Great location! We would totally come back! The bed is super comfortable and the complementary coffee (kureg) was a great surprise. The gym was clean with a lot of cardio equipment for a hotel!

Stayed there because I promised to be back in the NYLO after my last less fortunate stay at the NYLO Dallas, where the shooting took place earlier this year. Kept my promise and booked room in the NYLO NY. Close to Central Park and relatively easy to drive to client. Location is nice. Walking distance to downtown Manhattan.Room was small and dark. Rooms very dirty. Can hardly look outside. Construction going on outside. Bed was very short. I realize that the hotel wants to go for a minimalistic construction look, but now the bathroom looks like a prison cell hide out because of all the brushed steel. Feels and looks cold. Checking out was not that good. NY people tend to be very strict. Hello, good bye is something that is very difficult to say. No problem. Seems something everybody has in New York. Think it is an attitude thing. Bottom line - did not get the impression anybody cared I was there or not. My bottom line is: too bad ! Do you have any idea how many alternatives there are to stay in New York? So, I kept my promise, but no more Nylo. Thank you. Despite the request to fill out their survey.

The NYLO shows a Broadway address, but this causes problems when being dropped, and even more so when being picked up. Limo and cab drivers rely of GPS maps such a Google. Twice we could not locate our limo to the airport because they waited on Broadway. Use the 222 West 77th Street address for this hotel.Make sure your room doors close completely. In two different rooms we returned to find the doors not locked.If you log into the Wi-Fi, it shows a charge. Ask at the desk and they will give you a password for free Wi-Fi.

Nice location and a very comfortable stay. I most certainly would stay again and plan to in the future. Plenty of places to eat nearby if you choose to not eat at the hotel restaurant. I'd definitely recommend this to friends and family.

Having spent three Thanksgivings staying near Times Square, it was a pure joy to stay in a quiet and relaxing neighborhood during the same time of year. There are lots of wonderful restaurants, stores with no lines, and close subway connections for the 1,2 and 3 lines. We enjoyed the bar lounge for post-dinner drinks. The panoramic view room provided beautiful sunsets looking out to the Hudson River and New Jersey. The outside patio was well-sized, but there is no privacy between your neighbors' patios. The Deluxe Panoramic room was quiet and large for NYC standards, but you could hear if the neighbors were out on their patio. A pleasant distance from the hustle and bustle of NYC during the holidays.

Had a really lovely 3 night stay at NYLO. Previously stayed here when it was named One The Ave but the new furnishings and styling give the hotel a welcoming and inviting glow. The bar/lobby areas are a series of rooms and one is able to relax and have conversations with friends. As the Beacon Theatre is close by, the bar is a place where not only guests would frequent but local New Yorkers drop in for a pre/post show drink. My room was extremely clean and all the employees were friendly and helpful.

Excellent service contrasts sharply with the indifference of staff in some similar-sized Manhattan hotels. Manhattan. Book a Lifestyle Loft or Penthouse Suite for top floors spaciousness and outdoor access. Surrounding neighborhood filled with convenient shopping for everyday needs. Easy walks, for the fit, to Central Park, Museums, Lincoln Center, Broadway Theaters. Check out the WP (Women's Project) Theater, right next door.

Spent an amazing 10 days at the NYLO. All the staff are really helpful and friendly. The beds are so comfortable you don't want to get out of them but the hotel is in such a great position that you don't want to miss out on the City. The lobby has a wonderful cozy lounge area and an amazing bar with live music.Would definitely go back again!

Terrific hotel with modern décor and amenities. Enjoyed stay and found hotel to meet all essential needs. Would recommend and would definitely stay again. Only comment for management is that room should include bottled water.

Terrific. Just as expected. Great value for a last minute reservation. Bed was insanely comfortable, and nice small bathroom. Fun ambiance in lobby. Dark, edgy, a bit goth. Safe residential neighborhood. True to the "NYLO" brand.

My family of 4 stayed over Thanksgiving weekend. I mistakenly booked one room when we needed two. The front desk staff never blinked; they found another room (without making me feel like a fool) and away we went. The hotel is well kept, nicely appointed and close to everything. We especially like being near Central Park, the 72nd street sub station, a variety of restaurants, and the American Museum of Natural History. This was our second stay. We will certainly return.

They advertised large walk in showers, but when we were put in a room that didn't have that, in fact had a tiny bathroom, we asked for a room that would have the large walk in since my wife is disabled, and we were told that they don't have that type of shower in any of their rooms, when in fact we actually stayed in a room the year before that did have the showers requested and it's clearly advertised on webpages for the hotel. ALSO, A very big problem we had was the fact that they actually advertise "Valet Parking" when in fact it's not valet parking, because they don't allow you to take the car in or out. When you check in, you leave the car for the duration of your stay. One reason may be because without telling you beforehand, they DO NOT HAVE onsite parking and in fact parked our car over one (1) mile away at an undisclosed location without telling us beforehand!! I guess this is why they can't actually deliver on Valet Parking, yet they CHARGE YOU for valet parking. Last but not least, upon checkout we asked them to hold our bags while we ate breakfast in the restaurant. When my disabled wife and I came back after about 45 minutes thinking our car would be waiting and ready for us, they told us it would be at least another 45 minutes before the car would be there. That's when I flipped, and I admit I lost my temper, but this was the first time I was ever threatened by a hotel employee in my life. You don't spend a weekend and 1k dollars in a hotel to be threatened. What ever happened to the customer is always right? This was a horrible experience, and to think I was dealing with the so called manager is obscene. I stayed at this hotel about three times and rest assured, NEVER AGAIN. Apparently the place changed ownership/changed their name, and along with that lost their integrity.

Lobby and bar are eclectic and interesting. Rooms are small and sparse with poor soundproofing which is crucial in NYC, and bathroom sinks look like a hospital and there are no hooks for towels. Somewhat pretentious for price.

On check in, discovered that a/c unit sounded like a truck idling in the room. Engineer was sent up and said there was nothing he could do -- and we could ask to switch room. Told there were no rooms available. Spent sleepless night and in the morning took a shower and discovered that the drain did not work -- so ended up in standing water --

My wife and I decided to stay here for a wedding anniversary get away. We booked through Hotel Tonight and got a great deal booking two nights on the day we began our stay. We let the front desk know we were there for our wedding anniversary and they gave us a few drink vouchers for the hotel bar.

Hotel room was lovely, very hip design, lots of marble in bathroom, and also spacious (we had queen-queen). Lots of great lighting in the room. Lobby noisy, but fun for younger set. Convenient location and very nice doormen. Fitness area was ok, and 24/7. Two areas for improvement. 1) Water in shower never got hot, lukewarm at best both mornings, after running it a long time, wastefully. And 2) desk people were not too helpful. I asked early Friday morning if there was a little store in the hotel to get newspapers and other things. The response was no, but there is a newsstand down the street. I repeated, "but there's no little store in the hotel for other things?" and their response was "No." It would have been really helpful if they had said, "No, BUT THERE IS A HUGE CVS across the street!!" Never mentioned, and since we had checked in the evening before, we hadn't noticed. Was able to get what I wanted after first going back to my room and checking online where to find small items we needed.

NYLO has a very "current" concept. A two level lobby which doubles as a bar/ with high communal tables on a bare concrete floor lets you know that this is not a Four Seasons experience. The rooms are minimally furnished. No annoying min-bars. Storage lockers in place of chest of drawers. I could have used a folding stand for my suitcase. Would have appreciated a bedside light with a switch. As it was I had to get up to the turn it off from the wall switch. Our room was tiny and had a tiny window that looked out on a brick wall we could almost reach. But, the bathroom was great. The bed was very comfortable. And the price was right...about $200 a night, cheap by NYC standards. Very, very well located in a great west side neighborhoods with plenty of restaurants and a block from the #1 (Broadway) subway. There are not a lot of hotel choices in this neighborhood. If planning a stay of more than a night or two, I would opt for a top of the line room.

We enjoyed the stay. The room and service were very good. We arrived early, offered us a room well before check-in. Staff mostly curtious. But avoid Sarafina, their restaurant. Food was ok but found their service poor and questionable in how they tried to slip in a tip on our breakfast bill without telling us.

The hotel was beautiful and the room was very cozy. I absolutely loved the location! (We came for a show at the Beacon Theater and it was literally two blocks away.) we had our friends join us in the lobby bar for drinks Friday, which was awesome! Definitely recommend

Pleasant stay, room was small but quiet. Comfortable bed . Didn't get extra towels requested . Light on one side of bed didn't work. Great location and will stay there again. Good price. Valet parking was fairly priced,

Great place to stay with my family. Clean, comfortable, efficient. Wonderful neighborhood. Convenient to Soho and Midtown so shopping is a breeze but wonderful to "come home" to a relaxing atmosphere. Nice restaurants within walking distance but if you are to tired to walk, Serafina is the answer.

Great neighborhood, great location on Broadway, stylish while playful, great bar in lobby, very spacious room (we stayed in the 2-Queen + sofa bed suite), great staff, reasonably priced. Highly recommended!

I have stayed here on many occasions - approaching 100 room nights in total over the past few years. While there are many shortcomings, it was balanced off by the location and sunny rooms on the upper floors. The lack of quality service was often countered by the reservations manager who helped smooth things over. During this trip he was not available (before or during), while the resulting service was so poor it bordered on offensive. In my attempt to have a polite conversation with the on-duty manager (Matt), his suggestion was that I should not return to the hotel. Stunning... I guess business must be good.

This hotel is a great location on the Upper West Side. Hotel staff are great, and super friendly.The walls are a little thin and you could hear your neighbours, but other than that, i would definitely come back here.

Very effective and clean rooms. It is in a nice location. Kind, smiling and problem solving personnel. Nice atmosphere in lobby. I believe free internet will contribute to the quality of hotel. Happy to stay there.

I'd never heard of this hotel but booked it based on it's location near the Beacon Theater where I was going for a concert. Was extremely happy with the hotel. The employees were all extremely helpful and pleasant. I mentioned that I was going across the street to buy some soda, etc and by the time I got back they had a mini fridge put in my room. The room was a good size for a NY City hotel and very modern and comfortable. The location worked out to be perfect. Would definitely stay there again! Price was reasonable for NY City also.

Enjoyed my stay at the Nylo hotel. Very cute and cool boutique hotel on the upper west side of Manhatten. Would definitely stay here again. I had a great AAA rate. The front desk staff was cordial and helpful.

Perfect! Just a short walk from Central Park and museum mile! Nice shower, really comfy bed, cute bar, very helpful and welcoming staff! Stayed in the basic double room and there was definitely no need to upgrade for a short stay!
user_name:
h0llyalex
New York City, New York

review_body: Charming boutique hotel in ideal location for a family trip to NYC. Rooms were clean and well done, good concierge service. Good value if you pay in advance. I've already recommended the NYLO to friends.

This is a good place where they get the balance between familiarity, cool and service orientation. The place has a nice tone to it making hipsters and oldies welcome. For NYC good sized rooms and shower stalls are spacious, so no feeling of being in a telephone booth

Excellent Upper West Side location. Modern decor. Wonderful lobby bar. Extremely helpful and friendly staff. Nice area for sitting, reading, accessing Internet on hotel computers. Easy hotel wifi connection. First rate bartender. The Red Farm restaurant is suberb! Quiet nicely decorated rooms. Very comfortable beds. Standard rooms have very small bathrooms, but nice showers and toiletries.

We stayed at the NYLO in NYC as part of a block of rooms for an event. The location was safe, clean and although noisy from construction, totally fine. It is important to note however, that once you trade safety and a somewhat calmer atmosphere than the hustle bustle of downtown, you lose the ability to get anywhere easily. There are little to NO cabs in front of this hotel. We are a party of 5 and found it impossible every single time we exited the hotel to find a cab unless we walked south 4 or 5 blocks. That being said, the safety of the neighborhood was a plus. We travelled with 3 kids and there was a lot to eat, see and do around the hotel. You are definitely walking distance from central park and many fun cafes and restaurants. The atmosphere is neat-very chic urban loft sort of feeling. The bar is nice but always packed so we didn't get a chance to sit there. The rooms are TINY. I'm a Chicago girl and am used to sprawling space so perhaps I'm not a great judge on room size but we found it difficult to find a place for our suitcases and the bathroom situation was a joke. * note: we did get two adjoining rooms and the space issue was still a factor* The staff at the hotel was wonderful. We had a few small issues and they were very good about dealing with them appropriately. Our biggest issues however, were upon leaving the hotel. We were not able to get a cab to the airport on the way out and the staff said there is usually a driver with an SUV that we could hire for a little extra-well, he wasn't available that morning and we instead had to arrange for an Uber driver to come get us. Not a huge deal but frustrating when you're trying to get three kids and a load of luggage to an airport on time. The largest issue was incredibly disappointing-upon boarding the airplane I realized that I had left my sons contact case bag in his bathroom on a shelf. I immediately phoned the hotel once I landed in Chicago and was told I would need to leave a message for the security team. I did that and didn't hear from them after 24 hours. I phoned the hotel again and was transferred to the security team-I spoke to a man who told me he "didn't understand me" and proceeded to hang up on me. Now, I am American born and have zero accent-I'm not sure why this man didn't understand me and understand even less why he would hang up on me. At this point I lost all patience and called back and asked for a manager. I again got a voice mail. I left a voicemail there and then emailed corporate online about the missing item. I got a phone call back a few hours later from security and they told me that nothing had been turned in. I explained to them that this is not something that can be resold or is of any value to anyone but my family and that the replacement cost was $1500. The security officer told me he would call the woman who had cleaned our room the day before but ended up finding nothing. Its truly a shame, even though this is ultimately my fault, that the cleaning crew just threw this out. The hotel was OK-location is good for safety but lousy for travelling outside the area, the staff is nice but obviously some a negligent about any "extra" work they might have to do in putting personal items aside for reclamation, the rooms are small but clean. All in all, I would've rather stayed closer to downtown where we went every day and avoided the extra hassle.

This is an excellent and very conveniently located place for a short stay. The hotel staff are excellent very helpful. There very easy access to the many places by walking and the subway. Looking forward to for return visit.

Excellent Upper West Side location, couldn't be better. Checkin ok, a little slow, wasn't told that hold would be put on credit card..I had to ask what it was...total cost of stay plus several hundred for incidentals...should have been told that they were doing that. Lobby areas, library and bar were gorgeous! Lots of comfortable, very pleasant space. Room was fairly plain and quite small, but fine for the excellent price we got by booking a "deal" at the NYLO website. Very good bed and bathroom, coffee maker, good thick towels. All together a very good stay.

NYLO is so clean, accessible, great staff, young and attentive. LOVE the beds and ambiance. Fun lobby. Good drinks. Serafina good restaurant on site. don't nickel and dime for water bottles etc. very soft towels

Stayed at the hotel over the weekend to catch a concert t the Beacon Theater. Hidden gem, rooms were nice size and central to the Upper West Side. Friendly staff and convenient restaurants. Nice atmosphere

Hip, enjoyable, comfy bed,a great location, safe, and clean. We will Return but will request a room that does not have an ajoining room. Valet parking was a bit pricey. Staff was helpful znd friendly. Lobby and lounges were inviting.

Beautiful hotel in a beautiful part of the city.Would definitely stay here again.The 1 train into downtown is 1 block away and central park is 3 blocks away. Very easyVery relaxed9.5/10Thanks for a great stay

We stayed at the NYLO on 77th and Broadway in Manhattan a couple weeks ago. I would definitely stay there again. This was our fourth time. The staff is very pleasant and friendly. The rooms are clean. And it is located near all the shopping and subway stations. The one criticism I have is that there is not enough noise insulation between adjoining rooms that have a door in between the rooms. So I would be careful next time not to get a room that has an adjoining room. Other than that, we enjoy staying at the NYLO.

I am very much satisfied with all the services of the hotel, I fully recommend the hotel for every visitor of the city. I would like to thank hotel management and all the team for the excellent hospitality.

Interesting room décor. Liked the lobby. Could not find an electrical outlet in the bathroom. Has Keurig coffee maker and individual thermostat. This is a pet friendly hotel and they are welcome in the bar lounge. Great location just two short blocks from the 1 train. Good restaurants and shopping in the area. Very pleasant and helpful staff. There is access to Serafina restaurant without going outside. The rooms were a little larger than most NYC rooms. Bathrooms need shelves for toiletries - there is room. Rooms have irons and board. Front desk will provide Wi-Fi free upon request.

If you like modern design that is also welcoming and warm, NYLO is for you. The staff is as helpful and friendly as can be. The lobby/lounge/foyer area is cozy and low-key and appears to be popular with locals as well as guests.Visiting with my 91-year-old mother brought up accessibility issues. Good, is the handicap lift right by the main door, where the doorman is always available to help. Bad, are the trendy super-high beds, ~32" off the ground, that were impossible for mom to get in or out of. The night clerk had no portable step available, so I had to improvise a step from a cardboard box obtained across 77th St at the handy 24-hour CVS.

nice hotel with good staff in good location--room was very small but very well set up. shower was vey small. problem with switch in bathroom was fixed immediately. Would recommend for anyone needing to be in the area.

Easy reservations and check in.Fun lobby, great location, nice rooms with very comfortable beds. Rooms are modern but most are a bit too small unless you get a suite which are fabulous. Internet in the lobby is free but room service is extra. Great chess tables in the lobby and a nice bar

Stayed 4 nights at the NYLO NYC - 77th and Broadway - Great location, you walk into the hotel to upbeat music, relaxing public space with great areas to meet and relax with family and friends before or after touring NYC . Live music some nights Not sure when - but great !!Rooms, generous for NYC standards . we had a standard king room, and it really was spacious (again by NYC standards) - beds were comfortable, great linens, nice touches in the room = coffee maker, 2 bottles of water, Elevator that works great - Helpful staff at every opportunity

A terrific hotel with good to great amenities, strong anti-pest measures in the rooms, great decor, friendly and efficient staff throughout the hotel. The neighborhood is interesting and full of good restaurants and bakeries. Will definitely return.

Wonderful experience from start to finish! Fully recommend to anyone coming to NYC Everyone doing a very fine job and making stay as comfortable and pleasing as possibly. Can't wait to return to NYLO!

Hotel is conveniently located and has a dun, funky vibe. Concrete floors, high ceilings, and mid-centeury touches add to the uniqeness. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever had in. Hotel.

I very much enjoyed my two nights at NYLO. I asked for a quiet room and was given one: spacious, extremely clean and comfortable, though with no view to speak of. The bathroom was fairly dated (tiny, old-looking bath), but had everything I needed and was spotless. There was ample storage space, great lighting (can't stand gloomy rooms that are impossible to read or work in), a truly fantastically comfortable bed with lovely linens, and the coffee machine was welcome indeed.I didn't eat or drink at the bar, but it looked like a great place to hang out. It should also be noted that every single staff member I encountered was truly delightful: warm, friendly, welcoming. Special thanks to Johanna for excellent service when I checked in, and for giving me a code for free in-room wifi (though, let's be honest: all hotel wifi should be free, and that's one improvement I can suggest to NYLO. The idea of having to pay for wifi had almost been a barrier to my booking the hotel at all.) I've stayed in this part of town before so I know the location would be ideal, and indeed it was: Midtown is a comfortable walk or short subway ride away, the glory of Central Park just moments away, and plenty of shopping, eating and drinking options. Overall, a well-priced, extremely friendly and comfortable place to stay, with everything you'll need. Recommended!

The NYLO was a great base for our 10 day stay in New York. The concierge Robert was very welcoming and great with our kids (so much so our daughter picked a rose to give him!). The room was comfortable as was the downstairs lobby. I would definitely recommend it.

NYKI offers one of the few Upper West Side unique new hotels. It is well situated for travel along the Broadway corridor from Columbia University to Mid-Town. The lobby is very nice and attracts a great night crowd with many locals as well as business travelors. The staff is exceptional. The rooms are large adn quiet for New York standards and all of the fixtures are new. I took the opportunity to eat at Serafina which is part of their property and their Italian food was top drawer at reasonable prices. The cost of my stay was very reasonable using an on-line travel site. This will be my new hang out on NYC trips

My wife and I had made day-trip junkets into New York, e.g. from Stamford, NJ, etc., but this was our first time actually staying overnight - albeit only two nights - on the island of Manhattan. We felt so adult! Hey, we're 60, it's about time! We wanted a location convenient to the west side because we knew we wanted to walk around Chelsea, High Line, W Village, etc. So we chose the NYLO and it turned out great. The #1 line is a quick and convenient way to go N and S in Manhattan and we rode it many times, either from 79th St. (local trains) or 72nd (local & express). My wife is artistic with a modern sensibility and I like that style too, so the modern industrial look of the NYLO - with vintage bohemian touches thrown in - was just right. Every night the lobby was jumping because the bar is popular in the neighborhood and with the guests. The hotel staff in the lobby were all either hot, intriguing or both (not just my opinion.. wife said it first). We had a room toward the low end costwise but it was fine. Bed verrrrry comfortable. We faced the street which I recommend - it wasn't too noisy, though ear plugs are always a good idea. One odd thing was that our room had a door adjoining another room and we could hear noises in that room pretty easily. There was a mom and sometimes-crying baby in there. But it didn't turn out to be a problem. Again, ear plugs recommended. The upper W side is a great neighborhood to explore, even if the restaurants, watering holes etc. aren't as well-known as those elsewhere in the city. Zabar's might be slightly overrated but definitely worth a visit for the lox alone. There's a nice, quiet, independent coffee spot in the Apthorp building worth visiting. If you want a neighborhood park feel, walk over to Riverside Park where there don't seem to be many tourists. You can also, of course, walk over to Central Park but at least by the Museum of Nat History there were many many tourists which was a bit of a buzzkill. Can't wait to go back to the NYLO and next time we'll stay for more than two nights! Restaurant tip: for a romantic, stylish dinner, try one of the pocket-size Gabe Stuhlman restaurants in the Village such as Little Owl, Fedora, Bar Sardine.. we went to Fedora and it was a great choice. General tip: maybe we had the magic touch, but in our experience people in NYC were helpful, fun, stylish & friendly. All that walking and interacting must have a beneficial effect!

NYLO is a great hotel to stay at on the Upper West Side, easy access to Subway, Museum of NH & Central Park. Staff at the hotel are amazing and take care of you. Lenny, the doorman is such a professional and welcomes guests with a smile. Johanna at the front desk is awesome, she goes beyond to help out her guests! Love this hotel and have stayed there many times. Nice renovation, clean rooms and a trendy modern vibe lobby and bar. Highly recommend NYLO.

I've stayed at this property several times and was disappointed that at check in the agent didn't recognize my profile as a frequent guest. When I got to my room: former guest's long black hair in the tub, sink, and on bathroom floor. Also: Bedside reading lamps not working. I stay in hotels 150+ nights a year and don't often complain. However, I was very dissatisfied with my room.

What a nice warm cozy place to spend the nite on the UWS.. Great resturants, comfortable beddings , quite rooms free of traffic noise. Rooms are on the small side, would of preferred liquid shower gel vs soap. Otherwise. Perfect place to spend the night. Highly recommend
user_name:
Patricia T
Long Island, New York

review_body: a really BUSY hotel!!! was not happy about DARK room with only outlook onto facing wall!!!! found the height of the bed very difficult. We are both tall but had trouble getting on and off bed.. Everything clean but pity they actually ration 1 coffee each to coffee machine. Hotel is very central .I was unlucky enough to have to deal with an Asian man on reception who suggested I could leave and find somewhere else if I wanted.This 4Star hotel is actually very pricey!!

While the rooms were small they were clean, comfortable and nicely decorated and the bed was EXCELLENT. It's a great central location-near a subway-great value for the money. We plan on coming back next time we come to New York.

The room was matchbox size but tastefully appointed, and the bed was very comfortable. Prices for hotel rooms in NYC are insane, so the $340 price tag ($430+ with tax, fees and parking) seemed like a relative bargain. Every inch of space was maximized and despite the fact that our room overlooked Broadway, and the fact that it was across from an elevator, we had no complaints about noise.Breakfast at Serafina's is always good, with little to no wait.

Things seem to have changed a lot since my last visit. I stayed at this hotel since 2014 and found this stay was most difficult and challenging. I am sure whether I would come back buy for now I am planning to stay other place in NYC.

Love the industrial feel of the hotel and the community vibe. Wished it was in a bit better location for restaurants and nightlife. The concierge wasn't much help, so be sure to ask for recommendations prior to your trip. The bed, however, was amazing. Couldn't believe how great it was. The outside noise was a little much, but there were two buildings under construction adjacent and there is a fire station right across the street. Overall, I would stay here again.

Location was great with ease of subways, Central Park & cafes etc. The hotel interior (bar and reception) is lovely but the rooms leave a little more to be desired. The lighting is too dim, sticky floor & air con (which was needed mid November as the room gets so hot!) was ridiculously loud. I would probably look elsewhere for the same price. Beds comfy though!

Comfortable bed and had good sleep--! My sister and I enjoyed the hotel and would definitely come back on our next Nyc trip! Fairways grocery just across and shops all over the place -- ideal location

We recently stayed st NYLO during our first visit to NY. The hotel is in a great UWS location with several good restaurants, bars and cafes. The vibe of the hotel bar and lobby area is great and was always busy. The rooms have an industrial decor feel and the bed was very comfortable. Wood floors feel clean overall look was bright and hip. The bathroom was adequate, little small and not big on luxury, but was fine. We really enjoyed our stay and all the staff were very friendly and professional. Would stay again for sure.

Overall a great place to stay.. Loved the rooms (very clean, spacious, and comfortable) the lobby bar, the staff and the front desk. My only issues would be the gym, which although clean and sufficiently equipped, had two out of the three treadmills not functioning properly and two out of the three elliptical machines with no incline. Also Serafina, the restaurant connected to the hotel, serves very overpriced small portions of extremely mediocre food. Fairway, one of the most reasonably priced markets in NYC, is within walking distance on Broadway, but there are no refrigerators in the room-- so be sure to shop for either non-perishables or in very small portions. Overall a lovely hotel for a good price.

The NYLO offers a slightly funky hotel experience. A comfortable mattress is easential and ours met the criteria. Enjoyed the decor throughout. Did not enjoy having to go out for morning coffee, however.

Cool hotell on Broadway, Manhattan, close to theaters, museums and Central Park. Nice and very helpful hotellstaff. Serafina, Italian restaurant next door served wonderful Italian cuisin and delicious fresh juices, berries etc. for breakfast.

Spent a weekend at the NYLO for a birthday celebration and was very impressed with the property and staff. The hotel has a great location, near where we wanted to be, and was clean and comfortable (the bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in). Our (small) issue was satisfactorily resolved quickly and we would definitely stay again. Great staff, fast check in/out. Cleaning staff made up room quickly and efficiently.

Although located on Broadway & 77th, it was easy to hope on the express subway at 72nd and be downtown very quickly. It's also just a few mins walk from Central Park. The room was a little quirky but smart and the bed was very comfortable. The bar has a really nice feel and I really enjoyed stopping by after day sightseeing. Definitely worth checking out this place.

Have stayed at NYLO for past few years and its in a great neighbourhood and location. You are away from mad crowds but easy to hop on a tube or get a taxi to where you need to go.Rooms are small but very cosy and comfortable for a good nights rest.

Recently stayed three nights at NYLO NYC on a business/getaway long weekend. Great location and good value for New York (worth the extra few bucks for a larger room, in my opinion). Room was clean and spacious; complimentary wifi a plus. Some construction noise from adjacent property, but one can't avoid that in the city these days. The staff were friendly and helpful but not at all intrusive. Public spaces, including the Library Lounge, are nice. Only complaint involves drinks at the "Locl [sic]" bar: a smallish glass of mediocre red wine for $15? Hey, I know this is New York, but at that price one expects a bit more. Overall, however, the value and location can't be beat. Just plan on having drinks elsewhere.

I have stayed here several times over the past 3 yrs and returned because the experiences have been generally good, but this visit was not a good value, the desk staff seemed to not care about the guest, and bell service was not there upon arrival. When we requested a car for the morning, a price was quoted, but at 5AM the car asked for 50m dollars more. The bell staff was again not there ,the desk could not care less and upon arrival at the airport, the car was unable to process a credit card transaction leaving us with 120.00 cash less for the rest of our vacation. in short, NYLO did not deliver the experience of comfort, helpfulness, value, and assistance I have enjoyed previously and at other hotels. Will evaluate other hotels in the future.

This was my first stay at this hotel. The hotel is attractive, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was small, but very modern and clean. I felt very comfortable in the room. The shower was great. It had good water pressure and was hot.

I have stayed at NYLO quite a few times even when it was called ON THE AVEand keep returning it is friendly comfortable and safe There is a very nice buzz in the evenings it is good for all ages very young to ninety!!!

Took the family (Dad, Mom, two boys, 10 and 7) to the City for a short, one-night stay for dinner and a show, and to see the Natural History Museum and the Historical Society. NYLO Hotel is very conveniently located to see the Museum and the Society (great Superhero exhibit at the Society, btw). Hotel has a great, friendly, helpful staff (shout out to Robert who was great with the kids and helped us get our valet-parked car quickly). The room we had was spacious, which was a great surprise for an NYC hotel. Two comfy queen beds and a separate area for watching TV. The bathroom was also very large - especially against NYC-hotel expectations. Nice walk-in shower, not a tub. Well done, NYLO! We did not have much of a view, but the room made up for it.The hotel has a cool vibe to it, the bar area has a garage door that can be opened to the street, and there is a room off the lobby that has nice loungers and TVs. Great place to watch football, or have a private party.We really enjoyed our stay at NYLO and highly recommend it.

I and my husband stayed at Nylo for seven days. It was everything we expected it to be. The room was fresh, Scandinavian style with a comfortable bed. We have a substantial weight difference and it was no problem in this bed, sometimes it can be such a trampoline experience. Based on the TripAdvisor reviews commenting on the noice from the construction site, as given a choice at the reception desk, we selected a room without a view. It was ok, we didn't really spent that much awake time in the room. The vicinity of the Central Park was nice, we went there for a morning run. Also, the hotel gym was just what I needed to get rid of the jet lag. The hotel lobby bar and library are cute and comfortable with live music 2-3 nights a week. Subway connections are near, both the 72 and 79 stations.There are nice services just across the street, such as grocery stores, cafés and e.g. Lush to buy a sweet bath bomb for the bath tub in the room.

A buddy of mine booked several of us here and told us that we would love it. For a very reasonable rate, we had a first class room (bigger than I usually get in NYC), a great bed and terrific bar with over the top service.
user_name:
Greg B
Mount Pleasant, United States

review_body: I had a great stay at NYLO and I will highly recommend it. The hotel has a high standard, has very nice rooms and the overall atmosphere was great.The first floor restaurant Serafinos is also a very nice place to both have breakfast, lunch and dinner.Subway at 79th street is just minutes away, and can take you to Times Square, Soho, The village and other places downtown Manhattan.

Very good location. Close To metro station, The natural history museum and central Park. It is a confortable hotel. Service ok, it wasnt a bad service but not really good either . We didnt try The food From the restaurant. We missed a frigobar.

You could've fit four king-size beds in the room I had at NYLO, which means that the room I had including just one was much more spacious than a typical New York hotel would have provided – a very nice surprise! What's more, the room was immaculate and well-designed (easy to find outlets, lot of counter space in bathroom, etc.), although the attractive wood floor did seem to make noises from guests passing in the hall a bit louder. There's a nice vibe in the lobby, which includes a bar and meeting room. I stayed at NYLO because I was attending an event at Lincoln Center, an easy 10-minute walk and I wouldn't hesitate to consider it as a base for visiting to see a Broadway show, if the weather's reasonably good. Also worth noting: the hotel's just two blocks away from the #1 subway line.

Very yuppie area and hip staff. Basic service without the added fluff. Lobby was always lively. Staff was always engaged. Rooms a bit small but convenient. Great location for whatever you need. Construction was visible but wasn't a disturbance.

I was very impressed with the response that I received from this hotel's management concerning a miscommunication during a prior visit. That time, my concern was immediately addressed and I was moved to a room that exceeded my expectations. On making my reservation this time, I specifically referenced that incident and asked whether I could be sure that it would not be repeated. I received a written response from the manager in which he assured me that he had personally selected and reserved my room. In deed, the room was perfect. My stay was excellent. I do highly recommend this hotel, as long as you can be sure that your room is not overlooking the ongoing construction on 77th Street.
user_name:
robertadc
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I loved my stay at the NYLO. The bed was so comfortable and had a very quiet room. Front desk, bellman, concierge and housekeeping were so helpful. Will definitely stay at the NYLO again. I would recommend this hotel and the location is great.

I was a guest at jeneenj2015's wedding. Given her experience, I was fortunate not to be the one to book the room or check in, and my one-day experience was great. I got in early after a red-eye flight and a key was waiting for me at the front desk, left by a family member. I walked around the neighborhood and found a great spot for breakfast - Sarabeth's - followed by a great run through Central Park with a few family members, then a late lunch at nearby diner, followed by a great nap in the super-comfortable bed. After the wedding a zonked out and got up early for another flight.The lobby area was very nice - a comfortable bar and seating area, which we enjoyed after the wedding. Plus there is a reading room / business room that was also really comfortable, and it had a couple computers with a printer for printing out boarding passes. The weather was nice enough to run outside, so I didn't try their workout facility.My only complaints are pretty small. The room - with 2 nice beds - was large, but the bathroom itself was really cramped. Also, there was a sliding door between the beds and the sitting area - a great idea to keep light out when someone was sleeping and the other was getting going very early in the morning, except that the sliding door was mostly glass that let the light through!

We stayed here in November 2015. Our room was roomy and fun (if a little noisy from traffic). The hotel and bar staff were great. NIce bar area downstairs. VERY COMFORTABLE BED.We can't recommend Serafina - poor service and food.

Stylish and clean with a great upper west side neighborhood feel. Would recommend as a place to stay that feels quieter and more relaxed than Times Square, yet still very convenient for accessing all the tourist spots. Room was very clean and quiet, appreciated how stylish it was, everything looks new. Great, laid back spot, love the upper west side feel.

This was our first visit to NYLO. It was a recommendation by our daughter and son-in-law. They had seen the bar but had never stayed in the hotel. What a great experience! We will stay again for sure.
user_name:
keiths26
Coastal South Carolina, South Carolina

review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights, the room was lovely, a little smaller than I expected but overall nice. Good location although lots of building work going on behind the hotel, very noisy!

Very clean hotel, nice friendly staff. Our first time to New York and would definitely recommend to others- would stay here again! Good location convenient to Central Park and subway stations and Starbucks!

WORST SERVICE EVER! Just left today and it was the worst experience. You have to call 10 times to the front desk for someone to answer, you have to wait one hour for someone to help u with the luggage, to mention the least!!They have Always an attitude! We call before arriving to ny to coordinate transportation from jfk to the hotel, and i can not even Said here what we were told! You can find so much better, and specially for The price.

All we needed was a place to crash in a bed bug free comfy bed fronting a quiet side street two streets away from the subway so we could chassé about the city continuously while attending weekend wedding activities. Being across the street from the world's greatest delicatessen was a bonus. The next time I need a crash pad in Manhattan I will stay here again.

1) We had problems from the beginning, with guests trying to book rooms and being told there were none available in our block, TWO HOURS after the block had been created. I had to keep emailing and calling the special events lady to individually book rooms. Also the link they gave us, that we put on our invites, only worked for guests booking two nights. And they couldn't change it to work for all guests. 2) When I toured the hotel before we booked it, I was shown a LOVELY terrace bar with gorgeous views of the city that I was expressly told would be open the weekend of our wedding. It was not. It was closed for the season by then. Which put a significant damper on our planned photography.3) I specifically reserved the penthouse suite overlooking central park. Again, when I toured the facility, I was shown a penthouse suite with a very spacious terrace and then upon request was reassured that our room would have such a terrace. It did not. On the day of, we were stuck in a corner suite with a very small terrace. Despite my specific request. Made planned photo shoot tricky. 4) The woman who handled the special event booking was reasonably nice and competent. The people who worked the front desk / check in were neither nice nor competent. They were rude to people that called, totally screwed up even the very simple act of giving one gift bag per room to people in our block, and were utterly unapologetic about any mishaps that came up.5) We had an AWESOME wedding. The restaurant (Isabella's, right down the street) was incredible, and so was everything else about the day. I would literally not change a single thing. Except the hotel. These people suck. 6) The beds are SUPER comfortable, though. So there's that. And they did give us a complementary bottle of champagne.

From when I checked in (early) until I checked out (late) my experience at NYLO NYC was very positive. The staff was friendly, my room was clean, and the facility was great across the board. Just a few standouts, I needed a belt the concierge was so helpful in offering up different options. I went for a walk, but had my book with me, I asked the doorman to hold onto it for me and he was so happy to and very helpful. It's the small things that count.

Absolutely wonderful corner room with views of Broadway. Bed was very comfortable. Serafina dining experience was great. When we checked in we were told our room was an upgrade but the room itself was not what we wanted. The front desk gave us another room that was a huge improvement. Very happy with our experience.

NYLO is in a great location very close to my favorite cookie shop "Levain." It's also close to the subway and a short walk to the park. The rooms were clean and modern. The internet is not free. That always makes me a little sad.

We fullfilled a long dream that I had, visit NYC for XMAS shopping and see all the famous places.We decided to stay at the NYLO as they always have been a wonderful experience and wanted to be The Other Hotel Chain.The drawbacks already started with the checking, first they told us the room was not ready, normally not a problem at all, so we decided to leave our luggage at the front desk. But instead of offering us to bring it to the room when this would be ready, they said, you have to pick it up later and bring it to your room. Well, not customer oriented but what should we do about it. We decided to quickly go for the restrooms and than deliver our rental car back to the rental company. When we came back like 5 min later, they told us your room is ready. Really, you didn't know that 5 min earlier? When we arrive at the room, it was nice modernly equipted and and fine for the stay, the only problem was, that the WiFi was not working or they wanted 14 USD per day. First I booked my room with WiFi in the room and not only free in the lobby and secondly, hello we are in 2015 and every Motel manages it to offer free WiFi. I will continue and call out all the BAD Hotels above 4 stars that want to charge extra for something like WiFi, why?! Because we are your guests, we come on our holidays to your places and want to spend money during that time, we also send beautiful pictures and videos from our stay around the would, use social media, and basically making FREE advertisement form your businesses.All that still doesn't justifies the 2 stars that I am given for that stay but 2 times not cleaning our room, bringen no towels is not exceptable and I don't need anybody to do my room at 9pm when I am back.Also the lace is really noisy so you heard other guest,mleaving their rooms, talking, shutting their door etc.Will we stay again with NYLO in NYC, definatly NOT. Sorry about that and also the 2 free drinks for not doing our room twice ist not exceptable.

Early check in agent gave us any room available which was extremely small the view of the room was terrible,they were doing construction didnt let me sleep at all next day once again woje me up at 7 am

The main advantage of this hotel is its location, very prime spot in the Upper West Side. My room was tiny, very little room on either side of the queen sized bed, it would have been tight for two people.
