Rooms have been recently upgraded, and the bathrooms, lighting and other amenities were very nice. The small bar and common areas downstairs were always very busy in the evenings.

Loved the NYLO for a quick night in NYC after visiting family in the area. My daughter and I love the vibes of the hotel and the neighborhood -- away from the main tourist areas. We had a great run in central park which is just 3 blocks from the hotel. The room was clean and staff was great. I don't usually take time to write reviews but did today because we did really enjoy our stay.

Hadn't stayed at the hotel since it was called "On the Ave" and they have done a great remodel since then. I had a large king room on the 5th floor (507) with a very comfortable. Room was very quiet and my only complaint is that it faced the inner courtyard. They were limited on availability because of the NY Marathon. Staff was extremely helpful, room was clean with a good amount of plugs and USB connections. Bathrooms are small but adequate. It is also in a great area of the city. Definitely will stay there again.

AC system didn't work properly. Staff was slow to respond. had to ask 3 times for a fan to mitigate AC issues.Other than that and the slow bar service, it was a nice hotel with a good feel and good location for the purposes of our trip. Ramona at the front desk was delightful.

I love this hotel, but it is not for the faint of heart due to noise level of outside construction always going on as well as the "thin walls"! LOVE the location however and the beds, pillows, service! The gym is important to me and it is at a minimum but better than nothing! I recommend it for one or two people as the rooms are on the small size, but really all you need!

We had 2 families with 4 boys between us, and we all absolutely loved this hotel. The location was great, staff was fantastic and location was perfect. I would (and have already) recommend this to others.

The location is lovely and I walked to and from Columbia university and enjoyed the fall foliage. Sleeping was, however, a challenge due to the noise. As the song lyrics imply, New York, the city that never sleeps. Neither did I.

The NYLO is lively and fun, with a great bar/lounge atmosphere in the lobby. It's a definite highlight. The staff were super friendly and helpful. The location is great, and there aren't many fun alternatives in the neighbourhood. The rooms are modern, comfortable and clean. No hesitations.

For a quick trip this was an excellent hotel. Location good! Rooms are a bit small, perfect for 1-2 people. Staff quite friendly. Everything was clean and in working order. I would stay here again. Thank you.

This is our third time staying at the NYLO. We had another great experience, with a great room. The NYLO perfectly situated to wonderful restaurants, museums and Central Park. Lincoln Center is a short walk away. The bar and lounge area is lively and fun, and the staff is great.

Nylo is located on the Upper West Side, so away from all the hustle and bustle of areas like Times Square. The service was terrific especially the concierge and bar staff. It is conveniently located near the subway, a short taxi ride from the theatre district and is reasonably priced. My room was reasonably spacious and very clean.

This hotel didn't work for us, but it might for someone else. This is a nice quiet neighborhood with easy subway access and close to the park, museums, Lincoln center, etc. The rate was low for a safe, quiet, clean room in NY, but ...The room was tiny. Also, our room was ADA equipped room, so the shower head was at chest height (but removable) and there were no shelves near the sink, just above the toilet. There was no closet to hang clothes in, just a tiny nook with coat hooks that were too low for a long coat. There was no refrigerator and unless I'm mistaken, in room wi-fi is not complimentary. There was a mixup at check out and instead of charging part of the cost to business, the whole charge was put on Corp. card. A charge reversal is more paperwork to us, so we didn't bother, but this could've been a big problem if, say, we'd gone over limit.

Small, warm and friendly hotel on upper west side. Located in a lively neighborhood, NYLO is a classy and fun small hotel. Attentive service and nice atmosphere. Lobby bar has a good vibe that continues until late evening.

We stayed 4 days at the Nylo. We had a very nice time there. Nice hotel, nice atmosphere. Hotel staff was very kind and efficient. The room was modern with very nice furniture. Very confortable bed. The lobby and bar are nice places to stay for a drink before having dinner at Serafina.

With construction going on both outside and inside, my stay was far from peaceful. Repairs adjacent to my room required sustained hammering. And cleaning staff speaking loudly outside my room added to the noise every day. This is my third and final stay at what was originally a great hotel with great rooms in a great location. The hotel staff remains excellent and understanding, but with a full house they were unable to help resolve my problem.

Just stayed one night and had a great stay. We stayed in room 1408 which was a king room with a balcony. Very nice view of the hudson. Room was a good size. The hotel staff was very kind and very informative.
user_name:
Jonathan H
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The NYLO New York city is probably one of the best hotels I have stayed at in NYC. Friendly staff, very well trained and professional, more than happy to help you find things to do around the area. BUT, some staff seemed to not want to help out, but that was only one staff member. The decor is beautiful, the room was very clean. No dust on floor boards. Spotless. The bar was great - very good drinks, great atmosphere.Overall rating: 4-JF

We have stayed here 3 times and will return. Good location. Courteous staff. Good restaurant options in house and close by. Close to subway. Relaxed atmosphere. Good bar with lots of locals. Predictable.

UWS is my favorite neighborhood in NYC and I have had a problem finding a good hotel in the area. Stayed at the NYLO for the 2015 NYC Marathon weekend and will definitely return. Great location and overall excellent hotel. Nothing but praise for the staff, my room and the hotel in general!

Great vibe, excellent service, and staff. Really close to the New York Marathon finish, and perfect location to get anywhere in the city. Rooms a were a touch small, but the beds extremely comfortable.

Our favorite in NYC. Love upper west side. Convenient to subway but relatively quiet and calm... Good local food and coffee shops in easy walk... Also close to the Central Park and the Beacon Theater.

Second stay at this hotel and it won' t be my last. I love the simplicity of the décor that creates a smart ambience that seems to pull people in. The bar is lively but no obnoxious music playing in the background, rooms are comfortable and provide all of the comforts you need away from home, and the location is great - close to park, museums, restaurants and subway. Can't wait to come back!!

We enjoyed our stay: comfortable, elegant and very well located - one block away from the subway station (1). Frontdesk very helpfull.Good restaurants nearby. Central Park 10 minutes away from the hotel.Good time.

This was our third stay at Nylo!All the staff is friendly and helpful! A special thanks to Ramona for helping us change room, she is a gem!! Only negative is that the wifi is not free in the room.Would stay here again,perfect upper west side hotel!!Is there a loyalty program on this hotel?I have already booked my next stay!

Everything was excellent as always. We have stayed at On The Ave and now NYLO. We enjoy the neighborhood and easy access to the entire city. The value is exceptional. I especially like the longevity of staff. It is nice to see familiar faces from bellman to front desk staff.

Overall, the hotel was good for a boutique hotel. I found the decor somewhat outdated and the beds soft. But the room was spacious (double Queen) and the large TV's were great. The bathroom also had a small sink, but overall was large enough for two of us. The location is very convenient for the Upper West Side.

I was very pleased with our two night stay at the NYLO. We were celebrating my husband's birthday so we go a nice room with a balcony. It was nice to enjoy the city from the 14th floor! Most importantly it was clean and quiet! I rarely heard any street noise which is a common complaint in NYC hotels. Granted the walls were a little thin so I could hear my neighbors somewhat but not to the point where it was a problem. All of the staff were extremely pleasant from the greeting upon our arrival, the drinks at the bar to our departure.The only downside of the hotel is it's distance to the financial district. It pretty much takes 30-45 minutes on the subway. However there is plenty to explore nearby including the Museum of Natural History!

Stayed here four nights in mid-October. Good Upper West Side location - two blocks from Central Park, plenty of nearby restaurants and bars, and just around the corner from the Beacon Theatre. (It's also only one stop from Times Square using the Express Subway to 72nd) Helpful staff and a clean room with a view of the Hudson River.Only negative is wifi charge in room. (free in the lobby / bar) Would stay here again.

The NYLO in New York is a great place to stay - my husband and i had eight nights there and the staff were so friendly and so helpful, the room was spotless and the bed was so comfortable. Locality is excellent - we loved our time here and would highly recommend this Hotel to others visiting New York!

The Nylo is well situated between two subway stations and surrounded by food stores and many restuarants. Upper west side is a great place to stay if you want to escape the madness of midtown but still want to be able to access the city center quickly and easily.Nylo has a funky entrance with very helpful desk staff and a buzzing bar.The doormen can be a bit hit and miss so you might have to carry your luggage up a small flight of stairs yourself.There is an italian restaurant attached to the restaurant which serves fresh made pasta and pizza which you can also take to your room.This is especially nice if your travelling alone and dont want to sit by yourself.My room 1504 was a deluxe double with balcony.The balcony was the biggest bonus for me as to get outside space in Manhattan is unheard of.The room itself is not spacious but thats pretty typical of manhattan and partly the bed is so enormous it takes up a lot of space.That said the room has lots of storage so you can get your cases away and the bed is beautifully comfortable.There is only a shower in this room but it is fast and again the bathroom has lots of storage,The room is a little tired,the paintwork is cracked and peeling on one wall,one light had no bulb and you may have to search for the light switches.The bathroom door was broken but it was fixed very swiftly by the staff.The blackout curtains are great but as always in Manhattan the street is noicy so ear plugs are a neccessity if your a light sleeper.You can also see straight into the aprtments acroos the road which is great for people watching but you have to remember they can also see you!

Room too small. Very confuse layout of aisle. Website doesn't inform correctly size of rooms. People from font desk try to sell upgrades all the time, because room sizes and noise. It was dificult to get a taxi when needed. No one to help us.

We (My wife and I) Loved our week at this hotel! the rooms are fine, the bed was the best we have ever slept in, and we have stayed in some really expensive posh hotels. If you want a pretentious flash snotty hotel, the NYLO is not for you. If on the other hand you want a relaxed friendly laid back hotel, this is for you. All the staff were brilliant, they were warm helpful and did not constantly hold their hand out for tips. The lively bar staff and Aussie barman Dan were just brilliant and cheerful, by the end of the week we had a new friend. The reception guys and girls could not do enough for us. The door guys were not over-dressed flunkys, but they were miracle workers, managing to rustle up a cab in the middle of a thunder storm, We loved the little touches like the coffee machine in our room, the strong Wifi, but above all the staff. Thank you and see you very soon. Peter and Suzy Simpkin from London

As a regular visitor to NY (2-3 times per year), I'm always staying in the NYLO hotel. It feels like getting home, you know all the people and they know you. We always get nice rooms with excellent service.

My Wife and I enjoyed our stay, the Hotel was centrally located for our needs.The Hotel entrance is on 77th street, however the address is on Broadway and our cab driver had some difficulty in locating the entrance.

exlent locatotion -parls,theatres easy to public transportation taxi services very good-many "eateries" shoping,museums,parks-nice bussy NY streetOver all - nice time in NYC.Probably will use all services again

When first walk in, you are greeted with the coolest vibe, somewhere in between a speakeasy and recording studio. It's has a Nashville kind of vibe that I love and I certainly didn't expect it. The rooms are modern and hip, totally opposite from downstairs. Small but functional, very clean. All the services were also great, the doormen were the kindest by far, sort of southern gentlemen with a tough guy vibe. This place has all the makings for being one of my favorites but here's where I fall off the bandwagon. The walls are so thin that not only could I hear the footsteps next door as if they are in my room, I actually felt the vibration of the footsteps thru the floor. They were not heavy foot falls, just normal. Another neighbor had a small dog that barked when it needed to go out. At some late hour I was woken by it. It sounded like it was in the room with me. My room faced the street and delivery trucks and all other of noisy traffic starts up at 4am. Again I felt it was right under my window. When I wasn't disturbed by noise I have to say the beds were extremely comfortable. And even being by the elevator wasn't disturbing. I really wish I could give it a 5.I WILL go back for a drink at the bar and listen to the live music.

My room had a fabulous view of the sunrise over the east balcony and from the west balcony we watched the sunset over the river. Exquisite location just a short walk from Central park - NYLO may be the best boutique hotel option on the upper west side.Creative, large rooms, huge (by NYC standards) bathroom/shower - and most importantly .... IN ROOM COFFEE !! YEAH !!! Was a bit rushed with an early morning meeting the next day - fantastically Serafina was open early and breakfast was delicious.Great staff, helpful, flexible and efficient - what more can you ask for.

we had a wonderful time at the hotel. The only shortcoming was the breakfast bistro. The menu was not precise and waiters were unfriendly. We then frequented the cafe across the street, Maison Kaiser.

I had a nice stay at NYLO when I visited last week. The staff was absolutely great and helpful. My room was nice and comfortable (the bed is a little too high but they can bring in a small stool to step up) I thought the stay (especially Friday and Saturday nights) was very pricey.

This is a cool place and very clean. Super comfortable bed. Awesome lobby vibe. Great location and really helpful staff. I would definitely return. There were heating issues: loud heater in bedroom, cold bathroom.

By far the most modern and functional hotel on the Upper West Side. Not cheap, but good value for the high standard of the rooms. Very good for traveling with family: we had a large room with two comfortable beds. The 1 train at 79th St is two short blocks away, the 2/3 at 72nd is five short blocks away, all within easy walking distance.

Since I haven't been to NY before I don't have other hotels in the area to compare this one to. The negatives were that the bathroom had no place to put anything - very minimal area around the sink - that was it. We found a German roach crawling on the floor in the bedroom and another black bug in the bathroom. The room could have been cleaner.The staff was very courteous. It was generally a nice hotel, but I thought too expensive.

Had a great experience and they treated us well. Little more expensive than other locations in the city but you are really paying for the great location on the upper west side. Cannot say anything bad about the location and trip.

My wife and I just had a long weekend stay in NY at the NYLO. We've been to NYC several times but had always stayed closer to Times Square. We were more than pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hotel and the atmosphere of the Upper West Side. Our stay was much quieter with great restaurants, entertainment, and easy access to Central Park. The overall experience was very relaxing and enjoyable. We will be back!

We spent 4 nights. Room was very nice, location is good, staff were friendly. We were forewarned from previous reviewers about construction noise (a big building in the early stages of going up across the street) so when we checked in we were able to request a quieter room at the back (no view!). Construction begins about 7am so if you like to sleep in this may not be the hotel for you. We could still hear some of the noise but not really a problem. Minor nits like occasional slow wi-fi and no towel bar in bathroom but we would definitely consider staying here again.

Great location for what we wanted. The room was perfect and quiet, bathroom shower could be a little cleaner, other than that perfect room to end or begin a busy NYC day. Great lobby, loved the lounge!

I stayed there for 11 nights during October. There is some construction noise, but it didn't bother me. No view. Tiny clean room (#722) but bathroom was large, being a handicapped room. But nowhere to place toiletries and no closet, just a few hooks! Comfortable bed, friendly and helpful staff. I had to call every night for missing toiletries that were not replenished, but these were brought up immediately. I think it is expensive for what I got in return, but I would stay there again. Great and convenient location.

A room for $500 but no refrigerator, ice machine n/a on the floor. no towel bar in the bathroom?? No extra towels, tissues or TP. 2 plastic cups but none the next night!!The bed was extremely comfortable but beware if you are mysterious upgraded to a Jr. King suite (room 1401) because you can't use the balcony and it's not a good idea to open the drapes unless you want to watch the construction workersYes the location was divine but there are plenty of hotels, boutique and otherwise, that provide amenities in the room and offer an obstructed view!Before we checked out, we spoke with a manager who apologized and offered to take $50/night off our billNot much of an accommodation but I guess better than nothing

My wife and I had been planning this trip for awhile now so were very eager once we arrived to get out and explore. Even though this hotel is very expensive it was very nice and catered to our needs. The only downfall were the elevators being so slow as well as the construction other than that I give my stay two thumbs up. staff was also very friendly especially the concierge on Saturday Alexia who went above and beyond to help me make my wife's birthday extra special. Definitely would recommend this hotel and would stay again -warm greetings Mr and Mrs. Becco
user_name:
samuel b
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: Great spot to walk to the 79th boat basin. Hotel recently reno'd the lobby & added new bar and lounge as it is great spot to relax. We were on the 15th floor facing the Hudson and had a great little terrace where we had a bottle of champagne and enjoyed the beautiful views. It was our 2nd time there and we will be back again.

I have been to nylo ny several times since it so close to Broadway and subways. This time however I had several unpleasant happenings. I hope they are it permanent. Front counter help, noise level in rooms and poor service.

The hotel is very nice and with good design. The service at the front desk are excellent. The restaurant are not from the hotel. And the room service are very complicated to me. But if you won't eat at the room could be an great option

First, great location; 2 blocks from Subway/Central Park and tons of restaurants/shops right around hotel. Second, although room itself was small it was very clean, quiet, comfortable bed, and large flat screen TV. Third, we loved the lobby area with a lovely bar and one night they even had a great piano player. Finally, very friendly/helpful staff. We will definitely stay again!

My husband & I just came to NY to visit friends. The NYLO was perfect for us. The hotel was in a great location: quiet area but plenty of places to eat nearby. Just a couple of blocks from the subway. The hotel bar and lobby were great for catching up! Quiet and intimate setting, but trendy! We went to a couple of bars during our stay but found we preferred going back to the hotel for drinks and conversation. The NYLO had it all! We will definitely stay here again!

I came to NYC to meet a friend I have not seen in 15 years. The Nylo provided the best possible environment for our initial meeting: Classy, Cozy, nice cocktail atmosphere for dinner & catchup conversation. The room was somewhat small but perfectly adequate. The bed was possibly the best bed I have ever slept in in my life. I wanted to take it home with me.The location is perfect for shopping, neighborhood amenities like a 24 hr drug store across the street and LOTS of neighborhood eateries. Perfect headquarters location for a wonderful trip to NYC.

All hotels in NYC involve compromise. We have stayed at the NYLO 6 times in the last 18 months but will probably not stay there in the future. The area construction not only means ongoing noise but the adjacent building has blocked 1/3rd of rooms' windows. Given that another third of the rooms have windows onto the lightless interior 'courtyard', only a minority of hotel rooms offer daylight. I would have thought that a hotel faced with such challenges would respond by amping up customer service-unfortunately this is not the case. They recently changed from a noon check out and 3pm check in to 11am check out and 4pm check in. It also took them until 4pm on a recent stay to change our room. It is impeccably clean with comfortable beds and in a good location.

My girlfriend and I spent a week at NYLO for a birthday vacation, and we honestly couldn't have been happier. On arrival, we were delighted to receive a free upgrade to a King Superior room, which was so great to return to each night. Spacious, clean, and stylish - with super fast wifi. The bed was like sleeping on a cloud, it was honestly amazing! The hotel is excellently placed, just a five minute stroll to Central Park, with some nice bars and restaurants nearby yet not too hectic. Really quick and easy to return to on the subway from midtown if you're going out, and the station is just two or three minutes' walk from the hotel. If you're thinking of going to NYC, just do it, you won't regret it - and stay here!

Very comfortable beds and pillows, clean, upscale. Friendly, helpful staff. Nice area of town-plenty amenities around. Nice bar with music some nites. A little noisy on the 77thSt side during the day due to some construction.

Interesting, very comfortable hotel. Rooms were a great size for a family of 4. Although our room faced Broadway - it was relatively quite. It was a really nice base to explore the city from but cool enough to enjoy a drink in the bar after a long day sightseeing. Enjoyed the location too.

The staff is very, very nice. The location is perfect, walking distance from Central Park and two blocks from the subway. The room was little but enough for us. It was our second time there and for sure we will return. Perfect for some days in New York.

Lovely, hip hotel. Great service, and very comfortable bed. Room was small but beautiful. I would stay here again. Close to many attractions. Room was quiet, and I liked the amenities. Excellent. The restaurant, Serafina, serves a lovely weekend brunch.

My visit to the big apple was made perfect by my stay at the NYLO Hotel! However, being told how many characters to put into my review, which I am taking the time to do makes me irritated. I have had to redo this portion twice, due to not enough characters, that is ridiculous.

I just spent two lovely evenings at NYLO. This is a hotel that seems to improve each time I go. I knew it before as On the Avenue and enjoyed watching the transformation to NYLO. The lobby and bar area is incredibly inviting and comfortable for a drink and visiting with friends. Great terrace and bar on the top floor during warmer weather. Be sure to ask about their rooms with balconies and views of the Hudson.

Great location. Plenty of restaurants close by. The bed and pillows were top quality. Construction across the road spoilt it a little for us, noisy. However this is not the hotels fault. Would definitely stay again

I have been staying at NYLO NY for 4 years on a regular basis and have experienced the great benefits of the conversion from OTA to NYLO and the remodel which created a great community lobby area with a friendly bar scene including live music and great food and drink - including Chicago's Goose Island IPA on tap! The staff from Robert at the front door, Eduardo leading the Bellmen team and Norman front desk manager are best in the business - you are welcomed back by a super friendly greeting recognizing you by name. Clean, pleasant staff, great location, yummy food and beverage . . .what more could you want? Enjoy!! One recommendation - newspapers would be nice!

This hotel is a gem . . . stylish, clean rooms are surprisingly large for a New York hotel. The interior design and atmosphere of the lobby, with a bar and multiple lounge areas, offered great spaces to hang out and relax or work. Also, an added treat was live music one evening during our stay. Although the location was away from the downtown area, it offered everything in the way of great food and shopping within walking distance, including Central Park. The staff was the best, always courteous and very helpful. Can't wait to go back.

While my stay was overall relaxing in a chic setting, there were a few quirks. The room that was advertised as Superior was everything but...it was small, tight and had no view! The balconies were closed for the season, which makes no sense. Smokers would prefer to go out on a balcony rather than all the way down stairs to smoke. I understand the furniture was brought in due to wind but we could stand, yoi have to downstairs. Otherwise the hotel is beautifully decorated and has cool hip westside vibe. Loved it!!

Very comfortable, speakeasy vibe, somewhat industrial feeling hotel. Friendly staff. We have stayed at this hotel for many years, and we love the newer look! Beds too soft for my taste, but I think most people like them. Love being on the upper west side. easy access to subway. So close to the Park! good restaurants nearby.

I've stay here every time I visit the city. Staff is always friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean modern and the beds are crazy comfy. What I like most is the location close to the park and museums but feels like a neighborhood, not "touristy".

We were in town for a show at the Beacon, so location was perfect. Nice staff, beautiful lobby and bar, very nice room. Clean and cozy. We will stay there again for sure. Valet parking overnight was $55.

For those interested in lively boutique experience, this is a great place. Awesome location, super comfy beds and linen, and good showers. Great value being so close to the park. Rooms are a little cozy but you won't be spending too much time in them with all the area has to offer. This was our third trip and we will be back again.

I had requested a quiet room on a high floor. They put me in a room next to the CONSTRUCTION SITE that is next to the hotel. I asked to move. They moved me to a quiet room but it was really dark with no windows with a view except to other internal hotel walls. I then complained again. Finally they moved me to a good room overlooking Broadway phew... But I had left a shirt behind in the previous room. This never showed up. They did give me a couple of free breakfast tokens. Bottom line getting a room on Broadway high up is critical.

We enjoyed a great stay at the NYLO New York, on the upper west side, a couple of blocks from Central Park and lots of great bars and restaurants nearby on Amsterdam Avenue. The closest Subway station just a couple of blocks away which was definitely the best way to travel (10-15 mins to get down to Times Square / midtown etc.) We got a one week pass (metro card) for $31 (unlimited trips) which was brilliant value! Would definitely go again and would be very happy staying at the NYLO again as the upper west side had enough going on, but was much more 'manageable' than the touristy Times Square, which is great to see, but would be very hectic to be sleeping in!

Hotel was trendy, clean and staff was very nice and helpful. it was easy to get around, walk to central park, and always had help hailing a cab. Lounge areas was fun and great food from next door! we will return - Thank You!

NYLO combined a gracious experience with a very updated, modern urban boutique hotel. The rooms were well designed with lots of spces for "stuff" and a very cool modern bathroom. I loved the stainless steel sink. The lobby felt like a living room, with a variety of seating areas, and even live music on Sunday night. Service was readily available, competent and polite.

Excellent. Times square, Central Park, UN Plaza en even South Manhattan not so far by foot or subway. Wonderful view from my room (15th floor) Lot of restaurants near the hotel, for every taste. Highly recommended

Everyone in the hotel was friendly. We liked the room and the over all decor of the hotel. The location was close to shopping, restaurents, the Subway and Central Park. We loved walking the near-by streets.

This was our second stay. We didn't really use any hotel services, although I must say that the doormen were always really friendly and cheerful. The wait for the elevators is frequently annoying, but maybe I am just impatient. The room was clean (love the wood floors) and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was rather basic. I love the location. All-in-all a good hotel in a city that makes good hotels difficult.

Great hotel with a casual and cozy feel yet with an industrial feel. Felt very comfortable and will return! It was in such a great location; close to Central Park, Natural Museum of History, and plenty of phenomenal eateries. Would highly recommend NYLO.

We love staying at NYLO every year for my annual eval at MSK for kidney cancer. It is clean, quiet, staff very friendly and professional. Love the lounge and Sarafina's too! Everyone is always so helpful. Love the location also.

Recently stayed on business and the hotel first impressions were great! Door staff on point - wonderful bar meeting area - locals were in bar area because it's clearly a happening place to be - but not too loud to disrupt the overall hotel feel - rooms were on the spacious side for a New York boutique hotel- complementry water (first night) and a Kurig in room. Will definitely stay again for business or pleasure!

Hotel Staff was spectacular. Biggest highlight: 16 th floor balcony!!! Loved the neighborhood! The concierge was especially helpful and friendly, loved the decor and the pet friendliness. Had a blast!

Great location near Beacon Theater. Modern sleek decor with cool lobby space. Rooms were nicely done with excellent bed. Missing some amenities like robes in room. Bar service was horrible. Ordered 2 cappuccinos at 4:30pm on Saturday which wasn't a particularly busy time. Server asked where we were sitting and I pointed to the table. After 20 minutes I found the coffees virtually cold sitting on the bar. The server said that there wasn't table service and he "got busy". Really? Serafina is the Italian restaurant in the hotel. It really tastes and feels like an upscale chain restaurant. Food was mediocre. Not worth it. Even with the above negatives I would give them another chance if I was going to a show at the Beacon. Much nicer than the Hotel Beacon. Will go to Starbucks and eat at another restaurant.

Other than needing to switch rooms, our multi night stay was very good and very convenient. We have stayed here numerous times over the last two years. However, the continued rise in it's room rates,now above the national brands (Starwood, Choice, Hilton, Marriott etc), this bare bones boutique hotel' by not being affiliated with a national brand makes it harder to value multiple stays.when there is not a reward program.

We stayed for five nights at the Nylo Hotel,I booked a room on the 15th floor which overlooked the Hudson river with balcony,it was great!After hard and enjoyable days sightseeing it was a joy to get back to the upper west side to relax.Lovely area, felt quite at home there.easy to get around using the subway.

The NYLO is a modern and sophisticated property (without being stuffy) in an excellent location. The rooms are large by NYC standards and very cool. The lobby bar was OUTSTANDING. Excellent atmosphere, excellent service and drinks. Easily the coolest hotel bar I have seen. Comfortable and intimate yet energetic. Many local New Yorker's hit the bar for happy hour which made it nice to interact with the locals and get tips on sightseeing or other activities.

I spent five nights at NYLO. The room was very comfortable, excellent bed, everything absolutely clean... the only problem is that in front of NYLO there is a building in work, and it makes an unbearable sound from seven am...

Did not have a great experience the first time we stayed, but the hotel redeemed itself on our second complimentary stay. They did everything possible to improve our our first visit. Commendations for that.

My partner and I stayed 6 nights at NYLO in September 2015.The upper west side (UWS) is a great location (not too busy or touristy) and the hotel has plenty of transport, food, and entertainment options nearby.The downstairs bar is charming but expensive. A few drinks (from the local liquor store) on the rooftop terrace was far more enjoyable!We chose the breakfast included rate and were not impressed that, although the room was booked for 2 adults, we were only given 1 breakfast voucher per day. The breakfast restaurant's food and service were pretty average so we looked forward to our alternative breakfasts in the end!The hotel service was not very personal and we felt the only time the hotel showed much interest in us was at check in and check out.Our room was on the 77th street side, directly opposite a large construction site. No advice, apology, or even mention was made of this. The very loud noise started about 7am each weekday morning but we just put up with it. In hindsight we should have requested another room as it appeared there were many others to choose from. There is no refrigerator in the room and you need good directions to find the only ice machine (it's on the 12th floor!).In summary, it's an expensive city and we paid a little extra to stay at NYLO. I suppose we got our money's worth because there are lots of much crappier looking hotels around. It wouldn't be too hard to improve the hotel but I doubt that will happen. If we stayed in NYC again we'd consider other options but would go back to NYLO if we didn't find anything better. We wouldn't take the breakfast option and would make sure we got a quieter room.

We stayed at this hotel for two nights in the penthouse suite this past weekend for our wedding in Central Park. Right at check in staff greeted us ready to help with bags and super friendly. The hotel lobby and bar "boutique" looking and such a cool space. Reaching our room the suite again very cool space and modern furniture. Our bed was like sleeping on a cloud and so quiet! Our balcony overlooked the city, such a great space again. Friday night we dined in both restaurants and bars were service and drinks were great. Food service was slow from the kitchen as they were extremely busy, but without even asking our server gave us items complimentary which we were happy with. On Saturday night there was live music in the lobby/lounge area which was fantastic! We hung out all night there drinking with friends and enjoying the music. Service again was great and the musician was so personal. The hotel staff had sent us champagne to our guest room compliments and a congrats for our wedding which was so nice to receive and we certainly enjoyed. Normally I do not post such long reviews however for a NY hotel the staff went above and beyond for us and we just loved this place!!! Anyone staying on the West side this is the place to be. Great location, great space and room, fantastic service, accommodating and happy staff, such a cool place!

Fantastic location, excellent service and value. And pet friendly not just on paper. One one my very favorite places when staying in NY. And I stay there often. It feels cozy and the staff is very attentive to accomodating guests' need. And so close to Central Park.

Unique modern hotel in a great location. Friendly and helpful staff. Stayed there several times and always treated well and enjoyed my stay. Rooms are clean and modern. Nontraditional decor. Comfortable and clean. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Great Location! Just a few blocks to Subway or Central Park! Clean, upscale lobby and rooms. Very good value per $. Friendly staff. Ultra helpful and congenial concierge (Karina, 5 stars ++!!). Will return.

Stayed two nights while visiting son, a new student at Columbia. Loved the neighborhood, the vibe, the Italian place attached to the hotel for a late night pizza, the quirky, yet very comfortable room. We had a corner king room with an interesting view. Although we did not partake this time, the bar and hotel bar area felt inviting and was fun to pass through on the way in. Close to Central Park, the Met, Columbia, etc., all of which we walked to. My wife accidentally left her wallet in the unopened safe. We called the next day and Security said they would look. Early the next morning we received a call telling us it was found. Loosing this would have definitely dampened an otherwise great weekend. So glad it didn't. Thanks NYLOS!

We stayed here only for a total of 12 hours. We were going to an evening show and needed a place to stay overnight and then we left early the next am. Despite the short stay our accomodations were very nice. Based on some other NY hotels I was expecting a small room with minimailized furniture and a tiny bathroom. I was wrong. We had a nice-sized room with a king bed with enough room for us to move around. The bathroom was also very nicely-sized and not crammed as we have experienced in other NY hotels. We had everything we needed and were quite comfortable with made our very short stay a very nice one.

Arrived at midnight after a long flight, only to find my room reeked of cigarette smoke, and had a connecting door and no view. I called the front desk and they told me the hotel was full and they'd take "10%" off the first night. And they'd have someone spray it. The spray made it worse (horrible odor), and window only opened 3 inches. I went down to front desk (now 1 am) and got them to comp that night...was told I'd be moved in the morning. Morning arrived and family in connecting room having a screaming fight so loud, you'd think they were in MY room. Connecting door was thin! Called front desk and they didn't know anything about moving me. Had to start from scratch. Very nice desk manager named Jessie put me in a much better room. If this was the diet time I'd had a problem with this hotel, I might be kinder. But this is the third time I've had a serious issue with them. As they say, three strikes you're out.

I prepaid for 2 nights at NYLO. Unfortunately I was not able to come the first night and did not notify the hotel. I did arrive for the second night. However, there was no room available -- the hotel had canceled the reservation -- but kept the payment for both nights.

I have stayed at NYLO (and OnTheAve its previous incarnation) many times over the past decade or so, and I am heartbroken at the decline in the quality of the hotel. The carpet in front of our "deluxe double double" room was worn and dirty, and worst of all our bathroom was shockingly dirty as well: hairballs (!!!) and grime on the floor. There was a large, sticky smear on the night stand and dust in every corner. In addition there is a daily charge for WiFi which seemed awfully cheap considering the rates for the rooms. The staff are very friendly but the emphasis at this point seems to be on the public spaces (bar and restaurants) with hotel guests playing a poor second. Farewell, NYLO.
user_name:
dralixj
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: everything just fine. We enjoyed our holiday i New York i a lovely fall weather. Many fine restaurants i the neighborhood and a room with no noise in the evening.The staff was nice and kindly to us all the time.It would be nice to have the possibility to order breakfast together with ordering the room

We spent a week with our three kids in the NYLO Hotel. It is close to subway, central park (Jogging) and within walking distance to columbus circle. Staff is very friendly. Also Kids feel welcome. Restaurant Serafina has good food (breakfast), the Pizza is supposed to be the best in town. :) :) :)

the bellman is great, the beds very comfortable. go for the double room--the single rooms are really small. When the staff isn't overly busy, they are friendly. Serafina restaurant, next door, has inconsistent food. Don't order any of the potatoes for breakfast! And the restaurant can get very noisy.

Great hotel and the location is awesome, near the subway always is very important and comfortable. You can stay with the family, friends or your couple. Feel the experience in a cozy hotel in the bestest city of the world.
user_name:
garolg
Province of Buenos Aires, Argentina

review_body: The perfect hotel in new yorkGreat great location quiet neighborhod , very close to undergrouinds close to central parkwe could walk at night no problemswe ask for a quiet room & they gave it to usany question we asked we get answers Best place to have in NY

All hotels in NYC are expensive for what you get, and this is no exception. NYLO is in a good location and is just fine - nothing fancy or exceptional, but everything was fine. The room was simple and clean, much like a good European hotel.

Nice hotel in a great location. Modern decor, with great lighting even on bed. Two great restaurants around the corner. Wonderful stores all around. Coffee/tea shop across the street open late as is the market.

This NYLO hotel fit the bill for us. Our room was immaculate. There is plenty of storage space for luggage. The champagne welcome was a very nice touch, and the staff is very friendly. Its location is very convenient to the 72nd St. subway station.

Very friendly staff,very good service,beds are very confortable,great e location..will definitely come back,i loved the quietness of my room,the atmosphere of the hotel is very lively,music wonderful,you feel at home.

We loved this hotel. My only complaints are that my room "upgrade" was not ready at check in and we were still charged. We ended up with construction outside our window that woke us up very early! They had said they would buy us a drink and not charge the upgrade- neither happened.

Great value uptown near the Beacon theater and lots of restaurants and shops. Terrific lobby bar and lounge with areas for anything you need from hanging out to working on laptop. Convenient Serafina restaurant right off lobby. Red Farm restaurant next was delicious!
user_name:
N4737FLannm
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This is a good hotel, rooms could be a bit cleaner. Construction outside the entrance was mildly annoying, but not too bad. Great location and very helpful doorman. I have stayed here many times and the hotel improves more and more every year.

Very friendly hotel in great location - easy walking to Central Park and other West side streets in New York. Many restaurants close by offering a variety of ethnic foods. Rooms are clean and easy to access.

My family stayed here during 3 non sequential weeks over the past two months, stayed in 3 very different queen queen suites.. is really luck of the draw as to the quality of the room even in the same room category.First, the nice things: Speedy wifi (can get for free with certain rate plans, I recommend "A special deal just for you" on their websitePrice is fairly reasonable unless there is a big event in town (UN general assembly for example) - however, pricing is highly dynamic and changes day to day, make sure to check back for lower rates frequentlyBeds are very comfortableLocation - if you have to be on the UWS, there really aren't many good options, so nylo wins on thisThey will provide a mini-fridge for no charge if you askAs mentioned before, there is at least one very nice layouts in the "Queen Queen Suite" category - room 421 (has actual doors between the bedroom and the living area - most of these rooms are open plan). The bathrooms range from quite spacious to not at all.. real luck of the draw. The bad Construction noise was very present in two out of the three rooms we were in (421 was nestled in the middle of the hotel facing a courtyard - very quiet, though obviously no view). Not much the hotel can do about this, but it is going to be an issue for the next 12-18 months + as one of the sites across the street is just starting up. There is a second site that is much more advanced adjoining the hotel.Luck of the draw with rooms - I prefer to know approximately what I'm getting when I book.. Service - while the staff is generally friendly, they really won't do anything special for you... no particular recognition from their "Club Nylo" despite staying there multiple times in a short time period.. for instance wouldn't let me know if a specific room was going to be available for my next stay in a couple days, citing privacy concerns - I didn't really care who was in the room, just if the room was booked or not.. Hallway noise is pretty substantial - the doors do little to block it outGenerally minor quibbles in any hotel claiming 4 star status - wrapped plastic cups vs. glasses, no umbrellas in room (they were available at the door), robes, etc. Got the feel that the trendy claim was an excuse to cut back on services.. I really feel like the construction noise colored my opinion of the hotel - if you need to be on the UWS and are willing to risk being woken up around 630-7 every morning, it is really a decent spot. However, there isn't a ton of good competition in the area either..
user_name:
Jay A
New York City, New York

review_body: Security staff found and kept my mom's wallet safe. They were very helpful. Ernest Mciver did a great job. Would highly recommend in the future! Also the hotel lobby is fantastic for working on your laptop. Great access to public transportation if needed.

The lobby was very inviting and had a vibe. The rooms are small and the bathroom was tiny. If you are more than one person and staying more than one night, it is not that comfortable. The location is great.

I'll start off on a positive note. The location of the hotel is brilliant. In the Upper West side, the subway a short walk and central park a block or so over. A lot of eateries and shops nearby. The beds - super comfy! The overall appearance of the hotel was different, modern and quirky! Even though on closer inspection it's wallpaper, the rooms have a cool New york vibe with the red brick panel. Most staff we encountered were pretty friendly too.Unfortunately for us, the negatives outweighed the positives. I must be completely candid because I really hope the hotel takes this review on board to spare future travellers the same problems.We stayed for 9 nights at this hotel. Upon check in, we were told we were not allowed to use our travel MasterCard to pay for incidentals. We offered a range of different options as we did not have our regular credit cards with us. We suggested cash, using my credit card on file that I'd already paid with (hence no security issues as it's my card that I'm authorising) or having a parent pay over the phone with my credit card that would match up with the one on file etc etc... These were all bluntly rejected as they were not in accordance with 'hotel policy' as they could not 'manually enter the credit card'... they 'needed to swipe the card physically and cash was not accepted'.This was extremely exasperating because we were essentially left option-less. The only option given to us was completely impractical and cumbersome. Our (computer illiterate) parents, late at night in Australia, were emailed a 'credit card authorisation form' which they had to print out, fill out, scan back onto the computer, and attach a photo of their credit card and ID and send the email back. (Which defeats the original 'policy' of not being able to 'manually enter credit card numbers' which they would have had to do in this instance...?) After 2.5 hours of back and forth, we were allowed up into the room and as sorry given complimentary wi-fi. In my humble opinion, that situation could have been handled a lot better to avoid unnecessary drama and a subsequent negative impression of the hotel we were so looking forward to staying in.What would the hotel have done if we didn't have someone back at home to do that for us? Then what? Would we have been refused entry into a room we had already paid for? I'm just not sure what their policy would have been for that...The walls of the rooms are extremely thin. You can hear (loud) conversations occurring in the next room and in the corridors. And on top of that there is loud construction work Monday through Saturday (which I understand the hotel cannot really control) but I'm sure is a common complaint amongst guests so surely something (anything) can be done.Basic cleaning was not up to standard either. There was hardly ever any bottled water left for us, no coffee, and surfaces were never wiped down.Unfortunately, a lot of these things probably wouldn't have been such a big deal. We're pretty chilled people who like to see the good. But because of the extremely frustrating check in altercation, the rest of the stay was left on a sour note. Some feedback which I sincerely hope the hotel takes on board... change these inflexible/unnaccommodating payment methods. You need to understand, travellers only carry travel cards because a) every other hotel seems to accept them with no problems and b) the whole point of a travel card is that you expect it to work/be accepted overseas, hence you not having to bring your regular credit cards incase you lose them. You need to offer practical workarounds for your guests who invest a lot of time and money into accommodation and service (which plays a huge part into the overall trip) to be exceptional.

NYLO is a great hotel in Upper Westside - comfortable rooms, helpful and friendly staff and a great location from which to explore all of New York. I have been staying at NYLO for business trips for over 10 years - I will certainly be back whether for business or pleasure.

This was our third stay. Friendly staff. Clean, beautiful room. They finally put some towel hooks in the bathroom. Drive in from out of state, they store your car while in town, when you are ready to leave you get your car back. No fuss, no hassles, no stress about dealing with your car, it's great. Three blocks from Central park, three blocks from Zabars. As for anyone that complains about the room size....you don't vacation in NY city to see the room. The room size is comparable to any inner city hotel. Be it Paris, London, NY, etc. Definitely a great place to stay.

What a fun hotel! Although I was there for business, I was wishing my husband was there to enjoy it with me. It would be great for a girls weekend as well. I liked the cool, modern, industrial design of the rooms and the bar scene was great. I love that area of the city and if you are comfortable in NYC, it is an easy walk to everywhere.

Stayed at the hotel for several days in Oct. 2015. Found staff extremely courteous, helpful and pleasant. Questions answered eagerly. Centrally located in NYC for uptown or downtown visit. CVS right on the corner to purchase anything. Lots of good restaurants, fast food, take out along Broadway. Nice fresh fruit stands. Room comfortable, clean.... high floor, windows looking out on street. Was warned about noise level because of local construction but never disturbed us as we left early and came back late ... workers were finished for the day. Rates reasonable. Certainly would return for a future visit.
user_name:
Alese and Mort P
Delray Beach, Florida

review_body: If you are interested in music, opera and museums this is the perfect location.10 blocks of a nice walk to Lincoln Center (if snows or rains a short ride by subway works). You pay what you get, although prices have increased steadily. The bar is sometimes noisy and overcrowded, but decent. I consider it perfect for my needs

Excellent Hotel near Subway, 2 blocks to Central Park, attentives employees,beautiful bar, next American Museum Natural History, close drugstore, the backery and Marshal Store. There are many restaurants near in Avenue Amesterdan.

The beginning of our journey started out a bit frustrating, due to the lack of a printer to print a confirmation and my transposition on my email address. After 3 calls to the NYLO front desk, eveyone extremely polite, I still did not get a confirmation of my reservation. I decided to send a short but cordial note to the front desk manager, Richard Kim. Whitinin a day he replied with a nice response and offer a complimentary cocktail for our I inconvenience. Once we arrive at the hotel, Ramona was greated us with a warm smile, apologized for the confirmation issue and managed to get us a suite on the 16th floor (with Richard's approval). The accommodations were great! The bar staff, Chris, Maria and the very entertaining Shannon were fabulous. The entire staff from the door man to the kind gentleman that reset our safe and the attendant the brought us a tooth brush kit were top notch! Will definitely star at the NYLO again.

The staff was fine. Very friendly. But ultimately not responsive to needs. The room was not fine. Weird lockers instead of drawers for clothing. NYLO takes the urban, edgy theme a bit too far. No free wifi. No fridges in the room. The bed was fine. We had to ask for additional towels every day. We would use 4 towels, and they would replace only 2, making me go out and get another couple towels as a daily ritual. The ice machine? On 12. Which is great if your room is on 12. But for the rest of the hotel to troop up, or down, to 12 for ice is another inconvenience. The fitness room was very modest, but the 3 elliptical machines had TV's that never worked. I brought this to their attention on day 1, and they said they had someone on it. As of day 4 it wasn't fixed. In sum, the dark and edgy décor would be less of a distraction if the hotel's amenities were more accessible or extant.

We had a great stay at the NYLO. love the bar area that is friendly to kids and animals as well as usual guests. the rooms are compact but cleverly set out to accommodate luggage. really comfy beds. the lifts were slow, but you cant have everything. we would definitely stay again.

Hotel in the very reach of Mid-Manhattan, but in a quiet and not overcrowded surrounding. Metro 2 streets away. Lincoln Center in walking distance. Two houses being rebuilt next door noisy during daytime.

terrible hotel.I will never stay at this hotel.I will not recommend anybody.our room has stink of sweat. i could not get in the room.I did not understand why this hotel is high score and good review.I really really did not know.

We have visited many times in the past and always were more than satisfied. This time we were given a room overlooking a building construction with jackhammers from 7 AM until evening, We asked to be moved the next day to a more quiet room and were given a tiny room directly across from the elevator. So that wasn't much improvement. We will not be staying again until the construction is finished.

We stayed at NYLO on a girls trip to the city and it could not have been better. The whole staff was so friendly and helpful. I was added as the fourth lady on the reservation and they were prompt at adding towels, coffee and everything else we needed. Anything we requested they acomodated us with no problem. The gentlemen that greeted you at the front door were so helpful with anything we needed including directions, cabs, even umbrellas. If you are a dog lover or traveling with a dogs this is the place to stay. They loved hanging out at the bar. I can't say enough about how great our stay was.

Nice hotel in quiet area. Misleading hotel information about room size on website, however, Management helpful in rectifying issues. Walking distance to subway, Columbus circle, and Central Park. Will stay again.

Love the location. They have renovated in the last few years. Lobby is really nice with a nice bar but rooms now have cheap furnishings. HATE the pastel lockers in the rooms. Looks like a daycare. The rooms are also dark and at night you can barely see. Also they did away with the desks, and put in the childish lockers, so there was no place to sit and work. Staff is always lovely and helpful.

Loved our stay at the Nylo. Perfect location for those who want to run in Central Park, and live the neighborhood.We got upgraded to two beds, it was just perfect. The most comfortable bed I've ever slept in away from home.Apart from the relatively high price I strongly recommend and will come back!

Having been to NYC a few times and staying in the tourist epicentre that is Times Square we decided to stay a little further out for our 7 night visit in New York this September.This Upper West hotel has a real boutique feel when you walk in with comfy sofa's and chairs in an internet/chill area and a quirky bar.Staff were very helpful and welcoming and the bedrooms are a great size with a HUGE bed. The bed was possibly the comfiest I have ever slept on.The hotel has it's own little rooftop where you can enjoy a drink from the downstairs bar up until 11pm.The great thing about this hotel is the location. You are far enough out of midtown for it not to be too crazy and close enough that it only takes a half an hour stroll and you're in Times Square. Central Park is a stone's throw away as are a choice of two subway stations on different lines.Free wifi access in bedroom as well as lobby areas. Along with two computers where you can print off any bookings/boarding passes needed.Thanks for a great stay Nylo!

Its a great location if you don't like the craziness of midtown. Close to the 1,2,3 lines and in a nice area of town. Plus the staff is great, the rooms are nice size and the lobby and bar area is very warm and inviting.

This is our third stay at the NYLO and we have enjoyed each visit. Because we drive into the city, we take advantage of their Valet Package. For this occasion, we booked only two weeks in advance and the rate was way more than we've typically paid. We emailed the hotel to see if we could get a lower rate but that didn't happen. Three days before our stay, we noticed the room rate had significantly dropped and contacted the hotel while on the road and asked if we could get the reduced rate. We did. Thank you! Staff, as always, was friendly and very helpful. Rooms are small, but we're there for the location (close to friends and Zabar's) and to enjoy the city. Highly recommend!

Once you head north of Columbus Circle, one could argue there are no hotels - at least compelling ones - to choose from. On the country, the NYLO is a great option... it's not better than you'd expect for the Upper West Side, it's about as good as it gets anywhere in Manhattan (and not for nearly as much as the more well-known boutique hotels). The vibe of the lobby is intimate but still lively, the rooms have a great loft-like feel, the TV has HBO (a bonus for John Oliver and GOT fans), and you're around the corner from Fairway and Citerella - two of the best gourmet grocery shops in the city.
user_name:
ernest l
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed at one of the rooms with terrace on 15th floor. Quite a privilege in NY! Downstairs, staff very friendly, nice crowd visiting the bars, excellent drink selections... couldn't have asked for a better place for my NY comeback!

We've stayed here many times and just returned from a weeklong visit that was the best yet. We used to live on the UWS, so it is our perfect go-to place. We were upgraded to a wonderful corner room w/river view, everything is clean, pristine, contemporary, just perfect.The staff is the nicest I have ever encountered. With the 1 subway and the 79 bus, you have all the transportation at your doorstep, and great markets and restaurants abound. Highly recommend1

Great location. Friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are clean and comfortable but a bit noisy. I could easily hear persons next door and in the hallway. The concierge gave us a great recommendation for Sunday brunch and the front desk arranged for s seamless transfer to the airport. We will definitely go back to NYLO Hotel!

To start, I wasn't even welcomed here. The morning staff of the front desk couldn't be worse. They told me they would call when the room was ready, but they didn't. Had to keep coming back to ask and watch they roll their eyes.The hotel itself is just ok. It is a pretentious hotel trying to be something it is not : cool. The rooms are pretty average, nothing special.The beds are good, that I can tell.Speaking about rooms, we found a cockroach and all that was done by the so called manager, was take off US 100.00 of our account, which is pretty lame.There are two construction sites across the street, making it impossible to be in peace in the room.The location is fine, though.So, think twice before coming over here. I'm about to leave now.
user_name:
Leo D
Rio de Janeiro, RJ

review_body: Nice hotel and location . Easy to access to Metro' and breakfast places all around .Nice hall ,terrace and rooms. Everything is well cleaned. Good restaurants and reasonably costing are not easy to be found around the hotel. Unfortunately beds are to small for 2 adults (over15th years). The Parking service is ok but the cost is heavy, 60 USD /day. To much.

I asked ahead of time for a quiet room. So was dismayed they put me next to the building works which start up early every morning except Sunday. I told them I was majorly tired and sensitive to noise but reception effectively said tough there are no other rooms free. Why would a hotel put a light sleeper in a room like that? Door staff were polite, as were bar staff in restaurant. Room was spartan, no shower caps, noisy aircon and limited space. Will never go there again.

Terrace view room was a little over stated in the pictures as a opposed to the web sightOn the second night at around 11 pm I attempted to return to my room and went to the front desk THREE times to get a key that worked. On the fourth attempt I was told that the room key "had to be re-programmed". and I was told to wait in the lobby . After 1 hour and 5 minutes (after midnight)I was handed a key and told "this one will work". No apologies, no "here, have a drink on us"..nothing. Just "here you go". Reminded me of a Super 8 at best There were other problems but I doubt it will make any difference so I will stop here.One word of advice to anyone who cares: There are a lot of $500 rooms in NYC....don't take the business for granted. I doubt I will ever return

Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the NYLO. The hotel was clean and the staff was very courteous. Our bed was very comfortable. They have a terrace up on the 16th floor that is wonderful. We would get our drinks from the bar and go up there to unwind. Lovely views of the city. I would skip the breakfast at Serafina, very expensive and once they brought you your food, it was like you disappeared. We thought we were going to have to tackle someone to get a refill on our coffee. Evening was different. The RedFarm was delicious and had great service. I would definitely stay there again.

Big rooms by NYC standards. Comfy bed. Quiet except for street noise- could not hear neighbors. There is a hipster crowd in the bar, but it is easy to avoid them if you choose to. I would stay there again.

Located in the upper west-side nylo is a great location to catch the subway, to get the New York feel, and still not be in the hustle and bustle of Times Square. It is an ideal hotel for all travelers

NYLO hotel is located on the upper east side, within walking distance (around 10 mins) of either 72nd street or 79th street subway station. It has a great location, and you can access major attractions e.g. Times Square, Central Park, easily from there. Quick check in and out process, and the staff were friendly, polite and helpful. The room was small (I presume it's average size in New York). The mattress and the pillows were too soft. Also, I found blood stains on the bed sheets and hair on the floor. Thanks to Ms. Rose Carr for her patience in answering all my questions before my arrival.

I recently stayed at NYLO for a fun reunion with friends and had a great time here - a big part of that is because of the excellent customer service provided by the hotel manager, Matthew. We had a few issues with our room initially, but he resolved them immediately, with sincere professionalism. He ensured that we were more than satisfied during our stay here. It's people like Matthew that make the NYLO brand impressive and stand out amongst the ranks of hotel options.Additionally, the location of NYLO is perfectly situated in the upper west side, close to shopping, bars, and restaurants. This will be my home base for all my upcoming visits to New York!

The open downstairs bar and lounge area is very inviting, with a library, and glass doors that are open to the outside (weather permitting). The staff was helpful, getting me into a room even though I arrived at 9:30 am. The room is fine, though the industrial-themes appointments are not really to my taste. Great location for anywhere from Lincoln Center to Columbia.

Spent two nights at this boutique hotel on the upper west side. Perfectly nice stay. Lobby area seemed like a nice area to hang out, with a pretty lively bar and lots of couches etc. for seating, as well as a separate area with computers, chess tables, etc. Design is kind of comfy industrial chic. Area is somewhat quiet residential, though on Broadway, so easy access to subway (2 short blocks), restaurants, etc. Very convenient. Standard room was small, but about what you would expect for NYC. Again, nicely designed and comfortable bed/linens. Soundproofing wasn't great, as I could hear a good deal of sound from the hallway and some from next door, but not too bad. All and all, a good option for the upper west side.

The Hotel is in an excellent location! Great restaurants within a block, and close to a subway station with convenient routes to the surrounding areas. The size of the room is what you would expect with a hotel room in NY. I was impressed with how clean and tidy the room was. It appeared to have been renovated recently. Hotel staff was very helpful and courteous! They are an energy friendly hotel so there are some things you have to ask for, but its no big deal. Great atmosphere!

A friend and I came to nyc for a night out, unfortunately the only time we could do it all area hotels were on average 200 more per night than the next week or another day that week. Even though the markup was ridiculous NYLO was is a great location for museums, Central Park, top tier restaurants and an overall non-touristy experience. I would recommend this hotel to anyone but to try to be flexible in your travel dates to save possibly a large amount of money per night on the overall room cost.

We always enjoy our stays here. This time we lucked out into an upgraded room with a balcony which was wonderful during the unexpectedly good weather we had during our September trip. Good late night drinks at the bar.

Stayed here for 5 nights mid September. The staff and service was excellent and the bar area in the lobby was nice and as expected.However, the rooms were a bit underwhelming. There were dusty drapes in the room behind the bed, the furniture was a bit basic. The shower was poor, a little basic shower head on a rail. However, the bed was Super King or even bigger and I slept well. One thing to note (although nothing they can do about it) is there is building work going on all around the hotel so we had to move rooms once as the noise was unbearable.The location was good- Upper West side and v near Central Park and public 'Boris bike' type system. If you are there make sure you go to Hummus for a meal. Superb.Overall I probably wouldn't return to this hotel- it's ok not amazing but also as a 30 year old married couple, would have preferred to stay in either Meatpacking, Greenwich, West or East village as more going on. This area is centrally located but more like Chelsea whereas we'd have probably wanted more of a cultural vibe. However, wouldn't have known that before we visited.

The NYLO is a lovely boutique hotel located close to the subway and close to Central Park. We had a deluxe queen queen room which was spacious and accommodated the four of us. The bar area is certainly a happening place in the evenings! We would not hesitate to stay at the NYLO on our next visit to New York.

Great lobby and bar! The room was a bit sparse but the bedding very comfy.Breakfast at nearby Serafina was great. We enjoyed our time at NYLO but at that rate would have expected a little more service. Then again, this is NYC!!!

Excelent location, very good service, Big and very nice rooms, it is a very nice place. Near to subway stations and also near to good restaurants and shops. The restaurant downstairs is also very good.

Our room could not have been more efficient. Windows closed; silence. Open; Not so much (upper west side). Staff & service was great. Wifi is paid only (half an hour free)view is great from the bar area. The hotel has an industrial design and looks trendy.

We stayed at the NYLO New York hotel for three days before moving to our vacation rental in New York City. I chose for its very good price and laudatory comments as a boutique hotel in New York city´s Upper West Side.I had asked for an early checkin, when we arrived at about noon we were offered ( and accepted) a small dark internal room at the second floor, with absolutely No view and really dark. Hot water was barely warm and the shower had very low pressure.The hotel management seems to think that "boutique" means very low lighting in the common areas and cheapo furniture and fake wood floors in the rooms.Besides all these issues, we asked at the front desk if they would receive packages sent to us AFTER we checked out of the hotel, as some had been delayed due to logistics issues.They specifically answered "YES, OF COURSE"When I passed by to pickup the packages after checking out, I was told that they had been rejected by security, as "HOTEL POLICY WAS TO REJECT ALL PACKAGES RECEIVED AFTER CHECKOUT".When I complained to a manager, the only answer I got was " YOU SHOULD HAVE ASKED SECURITY, NOT AT THE FRONT DESK", and no apologies whatsoever.

NYLO means NY Loft . That is what they told me. Contemporary hotel in the west end.Can walk to Central Park where we had lunch at Tavern on The Green..Also walked to Museum. Of Natural History which is a must if you are in NY.Goggle 10 things not to be missed in the museum , because you could be there for days.
user_name:
Sandra P
Hilton Head, South Carolina

review_body: We were in town visiting family and stayed at NYLO. The location was really good, close to the subway and restaurants. The staff was great, not just helpful but also cheerful. The outside terrace and the bar downstairs were a plus. The room was spacious, needed some TLC, though (wallpaper coming undone, chipped paint, bathroom needed caulking. Plus the floor was not that clean when we got there but house keeping did a good job the rest of the stay). Our main complaint was the noise from construction next door. They started really early in the morning but fortunately stopped pretty early, too, and they didn't work on the weekend. We will most likely stay there again the next time we are in town.

I get ti NYC about 7 times a year and have made NYLO my hotel stop. A very convenient location near subway and bus lines and many good restaurants close by. One I always go to is Red Farm which is street level to the hotel. I always get a good nights sleep as I find the mattress very comfortable. The staff are helpful and friendly. It is NY and the rates are high but I look for internet room rate specials which do keep the cost down.

Chose this hotel after seeing the fantastic reviews here, and first hand accounts from friends who have previously stayed here.The room I was assigned was very small, even by New York standards. It was located right next to the elevators (more on that shortly), so it was very noisy. In addition, I could hear the occupants in the room above walking around in their room.Unfortunately there is a lot of construction adjacent to the hotel, which starts early in the morning. I appreciate that the hotel can't do anything about this - but they need to adjust their prices to account for this fact.I noticed other problems others have raised - trash bags kept for days in the hallways and stairwells. Cigarette smoke could be smelt on the first level. And a rude security guard who asked to see door keys, if you were entering the hotel late at night/early in the morning.The worst part of my stay was the elevator issue. One bank of elevators was out of service (apparently for many weeks), so it caused major bottle necks, and delays at all times of the day. It was often quicker to use the stairs. For a hotel that is in this price range, this problem should have been fixed as a priority (I never saw any maintence/repairs being done).The one positive of my stay - the door men. Helpful, and always super friendly.Would I come back - no. I was very disappointed.

Convenient for sightseeing in NYC. Rooms rather small, but clean. Best feature of the hotel is the comfort of the beds! Unbelievably comfortable, but rather high off the floor. Close to subway (two blocks) but in a quiet area of upper Manhattan.

Stayed two nights in September 2015. Really enjoyed the hotel. Its a relatively small hotel which was what we wanted. Nice lobby and bar. Good friendly service at reception. Great room and very clean. Location is also really good (Central Park / Subway etc). Highly recommended.

We arrived at the hotel around three, every one was very friendly and greeted us upon arrival, we were offered an upgrade but we couldn't take it as the room wasn't available until four and we had to be at the Lincoln Centre for five thirty, hopefully next time, we were given our room straight away. Th room itself was a reasonable size, large bed (which was amazingly comfortable) and a small terrace with a view to the hudson, a first in all my visits to NY. The bathroom while being compact had everything we required, the decor was ok, I think on the next refurb the brick wallpaper might need to go and an upgrade on the bits of furniture ( the different coloured doors could go to ) would elevate this hotel. I read about construction and it is going on next to the hotel but I heard nothing, lucky draw with the room. Very pleased with our short stay which was one night but gave me a flavour of the hotel and loved the location and we are looking forward to returning for a longer visit soon.

The beds are wonderful, clean and comfy. I stayed at NYLO for a week on a business trip. The staff was very friendly. There was a mishap during my trip and the staff took care of me as best they could. I was moved rooms and was offered a free night stay, which living so far away I won't use and told them that, but they still sent it anyways.

Almost a 5! Bar, lounge, lobby arrangement very cool, hip, connected to the street - which is Broadway Upper West Side! At 77th, close to local sub (79th) and 5 short blocks to express (72nd). Great restaurants all around. Hotel gym is small but clean, in great shape and has all you need for a good workout. Lighting in rooms is the best. So many options, rheostats, etc. even those nice adjustable reading lights attached to headboard on both sides of beds. Plenty of outlets to plug things in. Good storage in rooms. Beds were exceptional! I say beds, because I changed room after 2nd night as there was construction outside my window when I wanted to sleep in Mon am. Hotel helped me move to a nice room on the same floor in the back that was tucked away, nice and cool and dark. Slept in tues am with ease. Love their cocktails! Coco Locl was my fav. Staff very friendly and helpful. I'll go back for sure.
user_name:
Sean S
San Antonio, United States

review_body: I've expected more. I stayed once at NYLO DALLAS Las Colinas and that hotel was much better! Small bedroom and the bathroom had a broken ceiling and light. The cleanliness was ok. The location is good but not special.

Nice staff, great lobby. Bathrooms uncomfortable, art bad, nice bed/bedding. Metal sinks - not so nice. Finishes in rooms and decor need upgrade. Wifi shd be free. Lobby bar has really nice buzz, and overall lobby decor is well done. Serafina not an asset as nearby restaurant. Cant rely on valet parking.

An excellent hotel which was to be expected based upon images, reviews and price. It's near a subway stop which is great. What wasn't good was the building works surrounding the place. Due to these works it makes the stay less enjoyable. Clearly the builders wait until 7am as they start hammering at 7am sharp and its very loud. It seems louder first thing and we could barely hear the TV without turning up the volume high.Admittedly it's not the fault of the hotel, yet the inability to acknowkedge there is an issue to the guests makes it very frustrating. It's a bit like a crying baby in a restaurant; it's not their fault but after a while it's irritating. A discount at the bar would be nice, but even just a curteous note in the room from management about the works would be something. In the end we slept ok once we bought ear plugs. Why on earth management don't supply ear plugs in the rooms complimentary (let's face it, they cost nothing) just makes me feel they are out of touch and should maybe try and see if they can sleep in a room after 7am.Sadly, was glad to be home and have a lie in which was such a shame as the bed was very comfy.
