This is my favorite hotel in NYC, the front desk staff is very nice, specially Mr Amado who with his kindness and professional attitude makes sure your stay is beautiful and smooth. The staff in rooms and concierge are also very nice. Location is perfect, few blocks away from the Museum of Natural History and two blocks away from a subway station. Unfortunately right now (September 2015) there is a lot of construction on a building in front of the hotel and you can feel the noise of the excavators. But this is a temporary problem. This hotel is great.

This place is one of the nicest I've ever had the privilege of staying at. And for what you are getting I guarantee it's worth the price. Me and my girlfriend had a wonderful trip. The restaurant right next to it is wonderful as well. A really great aria of New York to be in if you are visiting

The decor in this hotel is super funky, from the lobby all the way to the rooms. Staff was friendly and helpful. Location is great for first-timers in NYC - easy access to Central Park, public transport etc. Worth upgrading your room for the added space of you have the opportunity.

Wonderful place to stay. Everyone was extremely friendly and couldn't do enough for you. Rooms were great and the bed was unbelievable! The area was in the heart of the Westside. Couldn't ask for anything better.

We booked this hotel last night very last minute. I was a bit nervous because I've never stayed at this hotel before and considering we booked the hotel quite late, I didn't think they would have any nice rooms available. As soon as we arrived, we were greeted by the lovely Ramona. As she was checking us in, she gave us a lovely smile and told us she was giving us a nice treat. We were expecting something mediocre, or just an upgrade to a king size bed which I would have been soo grateful for, but when we arrived upstairs we were in awe. The gracious Ramona upgraded us to a penthouse suite. We were so shocked, grateful, and appreciative. We were only staying one night and she made our simple night into a great one. The room was spacious clean and most of all there was a balcony with a spectacular view. The bed was amazing and the decor was beautiful. Considering we work all the time, we just wanted one night for ourselves to spend time with one another. Ramona may not realize it, but she gave us more than just an upgrade; she gave us a memorable experience. We will never forget that our long stressful day turned into a romantic night. If you're reading this Ramona, we want to say thank you so much from the bottom of our hearts. You were such a pleasure to meet and we hope we see you and that beautiful smile again very soon. All the best!
user_name:
travelgirl115
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel was really lovely. Very modern and stylish. Always clean and tidy. Prior to arriving we had contacted the hotel requesting to be on a "pet free" floor due to my allergies, this request was made which was very much appreciated. The staff were always friendly and willing to help.Location wise it was a short walk to the nearest subway station, so perfect for traveling around!!If returning to new York I would definitely return to the nylo!

I booked this hotel for near 6 weeks, and I have to say the employees really seem to have a chip on there shoulder. They are rude, arrogant and very ill-mannered. All I can say is there are plenty of other hotels in New York and around this area.

A great hotel, not center location but have every thing near : shops , restaurants, coffee… subway station is less than 1 nim walk and the river side park is 5 min walk.The staff is friendly and we were upgraded , it was definitely a pleasant surprise.The room was clean , very spacious bathroom equipped with everything, large and comfortable. We will return again

Overall, the room we stayed in was comfortable, clean and the doormen and cleaning staff were incredible! I found the hotel fell short in terms of doing anything special for my friends for their wedding. Other hotels I've stayed at which were similar in price have provided a bottle of complimentary champagne to the bride & groom or something along those lines. Especially, as NYLO offers its guests free champagne between 4-6pm, you'd think they would have at least provided the wedding party with complimentary champagne after the ceremony. Since it was after 6pm, it couldn't be done. Furthermore, I found we had to ask a few times to get wine glasses up to our room when we were getting ready for the wedding. All in all, these really aren't big issues but make the difference between a good vs an outstanding experience. On a more positive note, the hotel's location is great, the beds were soooo comfortable and the wifi was really fast. I only used it in the lobby as it was free there. Personally, I felt that it should be free everywhere but there was a daily charge to use it in the rooms.

we woke up to construction trucks every morning at 7am despite being told that the side we were on had very little noise. And to top that off we always had a problem getting hot water for our showers!! The cleaner cleaned our room the first and never replaced the towels, we had to call down for towels at 1am when we got back to the hotel and then had to wait almost 30 mins for someone to get is towels!!

I haven't found it so easy to find a decent hotel on the north of Columbus Circle that are convenient to Columbia. This place fills the spot. It's not too big, so getting in and out is easy. It's clean and the rooms are a good size for New York City. The decor is modern and the air conditioning worked great when I wanted it on. The staff was helpful without being obsequious. Altogether I was very pleased.

The hotel is conveniently located near the subway station and walking distance to Central Park and the Museum of Natural History. The Metropolitan Museum of Art is just across Central Park as well. The bar downstairs is nice and cozy and the rooms are adequately sized.

NYLO got our attention from the curb: its dog-friendly, lively bar/lobby opens onto the street. Was a great meeting spot before going out and had such a fun, retro band one night. We had the suite, which was super comfortable for our family with teens and was big enough to have New York friends hang.

NYLO New York City staff and rooms are excellent for folks on business on the Upper West Side! Really enjoyed and had a productive stay. They went out of their way to help me work efficiently and then rest when done.

I absolutely loved my stay at NYLO! The hotel rooms are fantastic and the beds are so comfortable, you could sleep for days. Also enjoyed the surrounding area- it's not a far walk from Central Park or the Museum of Natural History

Nice hotel in a vibrant residential neighborhood. I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks and would stay here again. Rooms are spacious, modern and well-decorated. Window sizes and views vary, but my room facing Broadway was perfect. Beds are the most comfortable ever. Nice-sized desk in my room, Wifi worked well and computers and printer in the lobby - so good place to work. Staff is very responsive and chamber maid worked around my schedule without being asked. Lobby bar is quite social with live music some nights.Price is reasonable for the accommodations. One issue at the moment is two buildings under construction next to the hotel which can cause some daytime noise in rooms on the north side of the hotel. The staff switched me to a quieter room upon my request and I was fully satisfied.
user_name:
Carolyn L
New York, United States

review_body: This was a very nice hotel, Compared to other hotels in New York, i found this hotel to be cheaper, and decent. the price. There is always somebody at the hotel entrance, so You feel safe. The neighbourhood is also quite Nice, with 5 min walk to central park.Very close to the subway, which takes You directly to 5th avenue. The best thing about the hotel must be the employees who was so friendly, helpful and smiling all the time. I would definitely stay there again!Also, we had a transport from the hotel to the Airport by a guy named Mitch, who was awesome by the way!He made the long trip through the rush traffic very pleasant :-)

All was great! It was everything we hoped for and more! Looking forward to to our return trip! Our son lives nearby. Our favorite restaurants are close by. The train access was convenient. Having the park in such a close proximity was wonderful!

Place was great. Service terrific. Valet parking with doorman who was quick and welcoming. Location awesome, convenient. Construction was really loud in the am..that was my only complaint...and on the pricey end.

I stayed at NYLO for two nights with my husband and we really had a great time. The room was clean and charming as the whole property. We loved the balcony with a nice view from NY. We did not try the food but the service was good. I highly recommend NYLO and would stay at the hotel again in another visit. It is located in a calmer neighborhood which for me is a plus. But it is located near metro stations so it is easy to go around the city.

I have stayed at NYLO 5 times or so- always clean, bedding is expensive and perfect, upper floor rooms facing Broadway are great. The staff is always appropriate. Elevators are a little crowded but this NYC. Neighborhood is my favorite in NYC, residential near both Central and Riverside parks.

Love staying at this hotel and I love the location on the upper west side. The prices are always the most reasonable for this type of boutique hotel. I love the feel of the lobby, the elevators need some work but other than that I would recommend staying here.

We stayed 4 nights at the NYLO on a short break in New York. The reception staff were pleasant and efficient when we checked in at 1.30am. The concierge was extremely helpful when we asked for advice as was the doorman. All the other staff we came into contact with we found to be friendly also.Our room was on the 2nd floor and had two Queensize beds which were the most comfortable I have ever slept in! There was a sitting area with a chair and couch and a large screen TV. It was spacious and very clean. Automatic blinds that came down over the windows ensured the room was dark. The bathroom was huge as the room was for a handicapped person. The only disadvantage of this was that there was no vanity to put toiletries on, just a hand basin.The rooftop patio area on the 16th floor is perfect for consuming your own alcohol while watching the New York skyline in the evening.The location in the Upper West Side was a lovely local neighbourhood away from the general hustle and bustle of NY. There are 2 subway stations within minutes walk, although we enjoyed walking to many places. Very close by there are two markets....Westside and Fairway, both with everything you could possibly want. The Mille-feuille café with yummy croissants and good coffee is across the road.We ate in the Serafina restaurant attached to the hotel which is Italian and we both had exceptionally good pasta meals.We highly recommend the NYLO as an oasis to retreat to at the end of busy days exploring New York!

Superb location. Stylish lobby interior. A little pricy. Room a little small. Certain staff are very friendly but the rest are not. Would be great if include breakfast. Roof top terrace underwhelming.

7 nights and not a single bad thing I can say about this hotel. Room and service both perfect!! Restaurant (KTCHN) really good. Very nice indoor terraces to enjoy a book or just relax. 2 Sts away from Times Sq!!

The hotel is your average decent hotel for New York City. The rooms are comfortable and the price is right if you get your room through one of the hotel discount sites. I would never pay full price for a room here though. Most of the rooms are decorated with "cheap Ikea-type" furniture and unless you are in a suite you dont even get real glasses in your room.The day staff is helpful in general, the night staff however was a different story. They gave me such a hassle when checking into my room. My friend who I was staying with booked the room but I arrived first. I was told at the front desk that checking in to the room would not be a problem as long as my friend called the hotel and gave permission for me to check in. After about 2 hours of locating my friend and having him call the front desk, I returned to the hotel (all my bags in tow since the hotel refused to let me leave them there while trying to do what they said they required of me) thinking I would now be able to get up to my room, only to be told that the phone call wasn't good enough and that my friend had to be there in person in order for me to check in; something that wasn't going to happen for about another hour at least. All of a sudden the rules are being changed in the middle of the game. Keep in mind that it is now 2:30 AM and I am exhausted and about to climb on top of the front desk to lay down and go to bed. Long story short, we didn't get into the room until about 3:30 AM and I got to the hotel around 11PM. Any other hotel Ive ever stayed in, especially one I've stayed at a number of times, would have extended me a courtesy and let me check in especially if I had been told that all that needed to be done was have my friend call. Hands down one of the most annoying exhausting check-ins I've EVER experienced!Oh yea, and wifi is free if you are sitting in the lobby but in your room, forget it. $14.99 per day.

I found the hotel good to stay in. Reception staff were lovely and helpful. The rooms clean and the bed is by far the comfiest bed I have ever laid on!The lifts were broken for the entire stay (I stayed for 6 nights!) which meant waiting for a lift to the 11th floor very frustrating as long lines were nearly always there so often took ten plus minutes.However fantastic location!! In a great neighbourhood, shops/bars/cafes nearby as well as the subway lines direct to downtown.I do feel the hotel need a variety of food available, as it was mainly all Italian which I'm not fond of.Above all :Pros- the bed!!!-friendly staff-fantastic location-clean-in room safeCons-broken lifts-not a great variety of food/not fond of seraphina restaurant -room deco wasn't my taste particularly- I asked in advance of my stay for a room with a view and I did not get this, even though the staff emailed back to say it had been sorted-building work going on opposite which meant everyday (regardless of weekend) often got woke up at around 7-8amOther then the above, I'd recommend Nylo and would stay here again if I was back in NYC.

The hotel is very clean, well located (actually two blocks to the subway) and staff careful and attencious.The room were very good and the bed excellent, the best I ever tried. Wi fi was free and they offer minibars if requested.

This is my favorite hotel at the Upper West Side NY, now with a new brand and a renovated lobby. Very good service and excellent location. Many options of restaurantes and the 1-2-3 lines just two blocks of the hotel.

We have been staying here every year when we come to NY for the US Open for the past 8 years. Love the location in Upper West side away from the tourist and down town crowds. Enjoy all of the local culture in the "hood" and find the NYLO comfortable and stylish... little noisy this year because of construction but otherwise gray place to stay...

Once the construction next door knocked off for the day, my husband and I enjoyed a most comfortable evening and a terrific nights sleep in a well thought out, large room at NYLO.We have stayed at NYLO often but never had this room type before. 2 double beds, new linens, large sitting area with a couch, desk and chair. After a hectic day, it was a welcome respite.
user_name:
Myreviewjune20
New York City, New York

review_body: Had 3 days to spend in the city with my girlfriend. It is a great location in that it's 2 blocks from a subway station (Red lines 1,2,3), a few blocks to Central Park and the Museum of Natural History, and is in a neighborhood (not a noisy, bright touristy area). Even though our room was on the second floor facing Broadway, the noise was not bothersome. The room was very clean and I love the wood flooring. We had a King superior room which was adequate for the two of us. The 16th floor terrace/balcony is public and a nice place to relax (bring your own choice beverage). The service was great from the doorman, to the reception desk, and the gentleman that brought us a complimentary mini-fridge. Nearby, eat at Vive La Crepe for a snack/lunch and Jin Ramen for dinner. All just a few blocks away. A 24-hour CVS is right across the street and was convenient for toiletries and snacks. I would stay here again.

The hotel was very nice. It had a European feel We will definitely come back. The front desk and doormen were very helpful every day. We enjoyed the open air bar also. The concierge helped us get tickets to Caroline's Comedy Club. My only complaint was that there was no complimentary WiFi.

It was a great hotel not to far away from things but far enough away we weren't right in all the crowd ! Everything was great about my stay except I prepaid my room , confirmed it was paid in full at check in and they took an additional 350.51$ from my bank account 4 days after we checked out !

could not sleep with the construction and the firefighters. The manager a Asian guy was very rude and stock up who he thinks he is . He is just a worker. Good service from the bag man . Terrible location.

Great service with excellent location. Very friendly front desk receptionist, especially impressed by their conceige. Katrina is great , very knowledgeable, nice, patient . Bellman always there helping guests get transportation they need.
user_name:
Qing L
san diego, United States

review_body: The hotel is nice and very well located. The bar with, three times per week live music, its a plus and make you feel really enjoying new york life. The reception people are nice and always tried to assist. Our room was wide and with a nice vew over the hudson river ( we booked a loft ) but minibar was missing and cleanliness was less than average.

I've been traveling to NYC on a monthly basis or so for four years and have truly enjoyed staying at the NYLO. Everyone from the gentlemen greeting me at the door to when I check in welcome me back. They are incredibly accommodating, especially when I forgot to book my room every once in awhile. It is always my first choice to stay in NYC and the first place I will recommend to my family and friends. Also great neighborhood and so near to Central Park for a morning run. Can't wait to go back!

Booked NYLO on 'spec' and so pleased we did. Having visited Manhatten on a number of occasions this was the best hotel for value, comfort and service we have stayed in. It's stylish but unpretentious. The rooms are larger than average for NYC and the facilities were excellent with just about the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in.Led by Curtis Kim, ALL the hotel staff from room staff to Management were unfailingly courteous, professional, friendly and very helpful. A particular mention for the concierge, Karin and all the staff who helped us out when our flight was cancelled. Their response to our problem was swift and very efficientNYLO is in a great location on the Upper West Side and a short walk from Central Park. It's an upmarket, more residential area with great local restaurants. So if you're looking for somewhere to stay away from the 'chaos and hustle' of Midtown then you will do no better than NYLO for value, comfort and service. Nothing was too much trouble and a great comfort to a couple of 'oldies' visiting from the UK.

This was a good hotel and I would stay there again. Prices were very reasonable - borderline cheap, particularly for a hotel with such great location, shopping and restaurants nearby. Just two short blocks to the subway station. But if you see a low price advertised, take it because they don't last long. Some of my colleagues checked a couple days after me on the site and the hotel had run out of the rooms at the lower rate. The hotel felt full while I was there - nice clientele, mostly European.There is construction right opposite the hotel, on 77th Street. Not the hotel's fault, and there is nothing they can do about it - so just be aware of this prior to booking your hotel room. The construction started at 7am - again keep that in mind. I was in New York for business, and was awake by 6:30 every morning, so the construction work did not bother me. By the time I returned in the evening, the noise was gone. Because the construction didn't interfere with my sleeping schedule, and because the hotel rates were inexpensive - this was a great hotel to stay in.The rooms are minimalist industrial, and the beds are very very comfortable. The room was clean, the sheets changed every 3 days - the only thing was that the complimentary water was not replaced after the first day. Bathroom towels changed ever day. Also they missed my wake up call one morning - so make sure to have a back up alarm on your phone!The hotel provided me free wifi in the room because it was my first stay at the hotel - that was a very nice touch, and very much appreciated.Front desk and concierge were very friendly, helpful with questions and luggage. The bar / lounge area and restaurants were always busy - it didn't feel like an empty hotel, had great atmosphere - but I didn't get to try them. It did look fun though - and different from your usual touristy or business hotels. It felt like a funky hotel that people who live in the neighbourhood actually visit.Rooms didn't provide slippers, so bring your own. Floors are not carpeted - which is actually better, less dusty!

Arrived on a Saturday evening checked in they offered a free up grade I thought excellent was not until Monday morning that the problems started due to the construction across the street you get waken up by jack hammers etc due to having another booking for the hotel I went down to the desk and ask for the next booking can we have a room not facing the construction the lady on the desk was quite rude saying we wouldn't get the upgrade if we change rooms I did not care about the upgrade just wanted some sleep without the noise of construction she said ill but a note on the booking. We checked out that room when it was time to check into the other room even though it was smaller it felt biger than the last room we stayed in Another downfall is there inly 2 lifts working at the moment so waiting for the lift takes time the hotel is clean close to the subway natural history museum the park the restaurant at the hotel is great and well price and used the hotels car to the airport which was a great price

Really great hotel, with very nice and helpful staff. When we arrived we were assigned a room on the 4rd floor which had the windows looking out on a wall, which I did not like at all, however the staff was very kind and changed our room right away for a really nice room with views on Broadway/77th street. So when you book assure you request a room with a view on the street. The room itself was really spacious and beautiful. Great comfy beds. We had the big family room with two huge beds, nice sitting area, etc. Downstairs there is a very beautiful bar and lounge area. On the top floor, there is a nice terrace where you can sip a drink with the sun going down on NY. A big compliment to the "decorators" as they have great taste.

Staying at the NYLO hotel has been great during our holidays in New York. The hotel is very central and very closed to the main subway stations so that you can get easily everywhere. It is also 500 metres from Central Park making it the perfect stay for all runners!

I had an excellent stay 2 weeks ago and have been meaning to sit down and write a good review. The facilities were excellent and exactly as described if not better! It was a relaxing stay and the staff was genuinely welcoming and warm to my daughter and I. They were extremely helpful pointing out the fridge availability upon request and helped us with luggage and taxis with such aplomb and grace, that I definitely would stay here again just on that alone. The location was excellent and will recommend it highly to those who want to be away from the craziness in downtown or midtown and close to Central Park and the museums. We strolled over daily and had a great walk. Subway, restaurants, and shops were so close and convenient it made our stay extremely comfortable. Thanks again for a great stay and will definitely stay again.

We will continue to return to the NYLO. The rooms are clean and the staff is helpful and courteous. The location of the Hotel is close to restaurants, shops, stores and the neighborhood is wonderful. The lobby bar is always active and the employees are friendly.

This hotel is very well located; the prize is good and the employees very kind. The room was really small; the door opens directly to the bed and there's a few space to move. The other negative point is that there's construction just beside the hotel. You cannot sleep after 7:00 am.

I recently (Sept 2015) booked a stay in a Penthouse Suite for a special occasion. I made my choice based on the hotel's website which shows very enticing photos of a penthouse suite. The reality however was a smallish two room suite with a very small patio area with room for two chairs facing forward and one small chair-side table - maybe 2.5 ft by 6 ft at the most. . The view was of the interior space between our hotel and several surrounding apartment buildings - no skyline, no street view and definitely no view of the Hudson River. Beware of what you book and know that you get may not be what you are expecting. Also be aware (this is on their website) check-in STARTS at 4:00 pm so plan your first nights activities accordingly particularly if the need a little preparation time.My wife and I visit New York once or twice a year and like the Upper West Side bit we will not return to this hotel.

Labor Day Wknd stay. Hotel is very well located for both Central Park and Hudson River visits. Two blocks to the subway and plenty of Uber/Taxis up and down Broadway. Room was well organized including very comfortable bed and nice bathroom. Lobby and bar were always well attended and had a great atmosphere with bartenders who knew how to take good care of their patrons. Our concierge went the extra mile on a couple of requests including locating a Black and White cookie! She was fantastic. Construction across the street on 77th but it was never an issue for us. Would definitely stay there again.

A 5-day staying at NYLO New York City was a great experience; room was recently renovated with a modern look. The room was also very clean and comfortable. A great accommodation to stay in for a week, very close to Central park to have a walk after a long tiring day.
